impact: The score was Davis' first of the season. He was left uncovered on a 22-yarder. Davis will pop up for the occasional big play but won't see enough volume for fantasy relevance in the Redskins' Alex Smith-led offense.
report: Vernon Davis caught 3-of-3 targets for 48 yards and a touchdown in the Redskins' Week 6 win over the Panthers.

impact: Odd. Even without Jamison Crowder and Paul Richardson Sunday, Davis didn't even see one target. Jordan Reed tied backup RB Kapri Bibbs with a team-high 43 receiving yards. Davis will undoubtedly pop if Reed misses time, but should remain on waivers until that day comes.
report: Vernon Davis failed to record a single target in Washington's Week 7 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Davis dominated Sunday's game for short stretches and significantly outproduced Jordan Reed (34 yards) on the same number of targets.  Davis' week-to-week usage has been far less stable, however; Davis had one catch combined over Washington's previous two games.  Next Sunday's cupcake matchup against Tampa Bay does put Davis onto the streamer radar for Week 10.
report: Vernon Davis caught 5-of-6 targets for 62 yards in Washington's Week 9 loss to the Falcons.

impact: The two teams combined for 19 points.  Davis should have caught a 59-yard touchdown on his target, but Alex Smith badly missed him running wide open down the field.  He could have walked into the end zone.
report: Vernon Davis failed to catch his lone target in the Week 10 win over the Bucs.

impact: Davis' 53-yard touchdown in the second quarter was the Redskins' best play of the day. Colt McCoy delivered a perfectly-thrown dime and a still-blazing 34-year-old Davis was off to the races. With McCoy adopting a more-aggressive — if also more mistake prone — mindset than Alex Smith, Davis will remain in the TE2 mix as a big-play specialist.
report: Vernon Davis caught 2-of-4 targets for 73 yards and a touchdown in the Redskins' Thanksgiving loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Smith was already a starter, but with Delanie Walker on IR, he's going to see a larger rest of season target share. A 92nd-percentile SPARQ, there's breakout upside for Smith on an offense built around high-percentage throws. Smith is stepping into a role that produced 74 catches in 2017. He has a streamable Week 2 matchup with a Texans defense that's coming off 123 yards and a touchdown to Rob Gronkowski.
report: ESPN's Turron Davenport expects TE Jonnu Smith to see "plenty of opportunities" in Sunday's game with the Texans.

impact: Smith was reportedly expected to see "plenty of opportunities" without Delanie Walker. In his first post-Walker outing, he was out-targeted 2-0 by Luke Stocker. The Titans won't always have to start their backup quarterback and third-string tackle, so all hope isn't lost for Smith just yet. The 92nd-percentile SPARQ monstrosity will have another week to prove he can produce on a full-time basis.
report: Jonnu Smith didn't receive a target in the Titans' Week 2 win over the Texans.

impact: Smith is a promising talent in theory, but the dysfunctional nature of the passing game in which he plays strips Smith of any streamer appeal in re-draft leagues.
report: Jonnu Smith caught 1-of-2 targets for nine yards in the Titans' Week 3 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Smith continues to play the majority of snaps, but he now has just two catches on seven targets this season. One of his missed connections in this game was a bad drop on third down. He is not an option in redraft leagues.
report: Jonnu Smith did not haul in either of his targets in the Titans' Week 4 win over the Eagles.

impact: Smith has been targeted five times by Marcus Mariota this year, catching none.
report: Titans TE Jonnu Smith was held catch-less on two targets in Week 5.

impact: Smith was tackled just short of the end-zone on one of his catches. He had only three targets, but he's been more involved the last few weeks. The Titans are on a bye in Week 8.
report: Jonnu Smith caught two passes for 11 yards in Week 7 against the Chargers.

impact: Smith entered Week 9 with five catches for 44 scoreless yards despite being the starter since Delanie Walker's Week 1 injury.  Smith's score was from seven yards out on a shovel pass after Marcus Mariota faked the handoff to Dion Lewis.  Smith will not be a fantasy option next week.
report: Jonnu Smith caught both of his targets for 33 yards and one touchdown in the Titans' Week 9 win over the Cowboys.

impact: He still hasn't topped three targets in a game all year, but the Titans are designing plays for Smith in scoring position, and he now has red-zone TDs in consecutive weeks.  Even in a plus Week 11 matchup against the Colts, Smith will remain a touchdown-or-bust streamer option on low volume.
report: Jonnu Smith caught 3-of-3 targets for 45 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' Week 10 win over the Patriots.

impact: The catches were a new career high, while the 44 yards were his second-most after last week's 45. Finally becoming a part of the Titans' offense, Smith will offer TE2 appeal down the stretch. How useable he is in Week 12 will depend on who is under center after Marcus Mariota re-injured his throwing elbow against the Colts.
report: Jonnu Smith caught 6-of-8 targets for 44 yards in the Titans' Week 11 loss to the Colts.

impact: Smith caught his first target for a gain on two then was left completely uncovered in the middle of the field, caught a short pass and ran virtually untouched straight up the middle for a 61-yard score in the first quarter.  He curiously wasn't heard from again.  Smith has seen his role increased in recent weeks with Taywan Taylor (foot) out, but he's still very unreliable as a TE2.
report: Jonnu Smith caught both of his targets for 63 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' Week 12 loss to the Texans.

impact: The TE2 will get the Jaguars next week.  He went 1-9 on two targets against them in Week 3.  Smith has touchdowns here and there, but they're unpredictable.
report: Jonnu Smith caught 2-of-3 targets for 29 yards in the Titans' Week 13 win over the Jets.

impact: This was usable PPR production, but the Skins have been able to get nothing going to Reed on throws down the field, leading to poor yardage outputs each week.  Nevertheless, Reed should stay locked into fantasy lineups versus Atlanta's injury-ruined defense in Week 9.
report: Jordan Reed caught 7-of-12 targets for 38 yards in Washington's Week 8 win over the Giants.

impact: Known for being among the most injury-prone players in football, Reed has yet to miss a game this season. Unfortunately he hasn't been very productive, averaging a pedestrian 43.7 receiving yards per game with only one touchdown. Luckily he gets a favorable draw Sunday against an injury-ravaged Falcons secondary.
report: Jordan Reed (neck) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Reed started the week as a limited participant at practice but returned to full work on Thursday and Friday. With Washington running its offense through Adrian Peterson, Reed has been a relative disappointment this year, managing a tepid 29-306-1 receiving line through seven contests. That said, he gets an enticing matchup Sunday against an injury-decimated Falcons secondary. That alone is enough to keep him in the TE1 conversation.
report: Jordan Reed (neck) wasn't listed on the Redskins' final injury report for Week 9 against the Falcons.

impact: He's now finished below 40 receiving yards in five straight games.  Reed had an early catch negated by a penalty, then was kept quiet in a game where Alex Smith completed passes to nine different players and targeted only Maurice Harris (12) more than six times.  Reed still looks like a plus athlete on the field, but his rapport with Smith remains a work in progress even after eight games.  Reed draws a best-case-scenario matchup at Tampa Bay next.
report: Jordan Reed caught 4-of-6 targets for 34 yards in Washington's Week 9 loss to the Falcons.

impact: It's a new issue for Reed after he was limited by a neck ailment last week.  Still, Reed has been incredibly healthy this season and doesn't seem to be ind danger of missing Week 10.  He'll be a mid-range TE1 against the Bucs.
report: Jordan Reed (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Miraculously, the oft-injured tight end has yet to miss a game this season. Unfortunately he's been a relative non-factor, clearing 60 yards receiving just once. He'll take a seven-game touchdown drought into Sunday's game in Tampa Bay.
report: Jordan Reed (back) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Reed's status for Sunday's game was never in doubt. Tampa Bay's defense has been nonexistent all season, so this is probably as good a matchup as Reed will ever see. The 28-year-old didn't show much during the first half but at a thin fantasy position, he's still in play as a starter in most leagues.
report: Jordan Reed (back) wasn't listed on the Redskins' final injury report for Week 10 against the Buccaneers.

impact: Reed's six targets led the team while his yards were one behind Maurice Harris for the Redskins' high.  Reed has remained healthy all season but has shown zero upside in the Alex Smith-led offense.  He gets the Texans in Week 11.
report: Jordan Reed caught 4-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Redskins' Week 10 win over the Bucs.

impact: "I feel like I’m starting to come over the curve," Reed said. "[But] I’m still dealing with the pain."  Reed has managed to stay healthy through 10 weeks, not missing a game, but that doesn't mean he feels 100 percent.  Reed is seeing a healthy 6.5 targets per game, up from last year, but those targets are of lower quality with Alex Smith compared to Kirk Cousins.  Reed has yet to top 65 yards in a game and hasn't scored since Week 1.  Smith is more to blame than Reed.
report: Jordan Reed admitted he's still feeling the effects of offseason surgery on both of his big toes.

impact: Reed caught just his second touchdown of the season on Colt McCoy's first throw of Sunday's game.  McCoy replaced Alex Smith, who is almost certainly out for the year with a Theismannian leg injury.  (Joe Theismann himself compared Smith's probable leg fracture to his.)  Reed's 11 targets were easily a team high.  Reed will remain a quality TE1 when Washington faces Dallas on Thanksgiving.
report: Jordan Reed caught 7-of-11 targets for 71 yards and a touchdown in the Redskins' Week 11 loss to Houston.

impact: Reed was heating up even before Colt McCoy's insertion under center, but McCoy helped key his best yardage effort of the season. Reed has now cleared 50 yards in three-straight games and 70 in two-straight. He is re-establishing himself as a top-five TE1 for the stretch run of a disastrous tight end season in fantasy.
report: Jordan Reed caught 6-of-8 targets for 75 yards in the Redskins' Thanksgiving loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Reed may just be resting the back issue he had in Week 10. It's always a concern when Reed shows up on the injury report, but this shouldn't impact his status for Monday night's game.
report: Jordan Reed (back) was limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Reed was limited in practice after his back issues resurfaced this week. There hasn't been any concern over him, but Reed's status can't be taken for granted. Reed is a top-five TE1 if he plays.
report: Jordan Reed (back) is questionable for Week 13 against the Eagles.

impact: Reed was limited all week with a back issue, but he's good to go and is the odds-on favorite to lead the Redskins in targets this evening.  Chris Thompson (ribs) and Jamison Crowder (ankle) are also active after long absences.
report: Jordan Reed (back) is active for Week 13 against the Eagles on Monday night.

impact: Reed was nowhere to be found for much of the first half, catching his lone target for seven yards.  He was a tad more involved after the break, but the Redskins were simply horrible as a team and did nothing of note besides get their heads beat into the dirt.  Reed will be tough to trust with Mark Sanchez under center.
report: Jordan Reed caught 4-of-5 targets for 21 yards in the Redskins' Week 13 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Quinn ankle bent awkwardly on a tackle early in the third quarter. He was carted to the locker room, which is not an encouraging sign. The seventh-round rookie returned two punts for 12 yards prior to exiting. With Quinn done for the day, the Redskins are down to just Jamison Crowder, Josh Doctson and Paul Richardson at receiver.
report: Trey Quinn left Sunday's Week 1 game against the Cardinals with an ankle injury and will not return.

impact: So has fellow WR Cam Sims. Coach Jay Gruden is unsure if Quinn requires surgery. It sounds like the special teamer is headed for a stay on injured reserve.
report: Redskins WR Trey Quinn has been diagnosed with a high-ankle sprain.

impact: Quinn suffered a high-ankle sprain in Week 1. He could return later this year if he avoids surgery. The Redskins promoted Jehu Chesson from the practice squad to replace Quinn.
report: Redskins placed WR Trey Quinn (ankle) on injured reserve.

impact: Quinn went down with a high-ankle sprain in Week 1. This practice opens the 21-day window for Washington to activate him. With Paul Richardson on injured reserve and Jamison Crowder struggling to get healthy, Washington could use help at receiver.
report: Redskins WR Trey Quinn (ankle, injured reserve) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: Quinn was designated to return last week. This year's Mr. Irrelevant, Quinn was a hyped late rounder that generated some training camp buzz. With the Redskins down Paul Richardson (shoulder, IR) and Jamison Crowder (ankle), Quinn is worth a look in dynasty leagues.
report: Redskins activated WR Trey Quinn (ankle) from injured reserve.

impact: Quinn will start in three-wide sets with Jamison Crowder (ankle) sidelined. He'll get most of his snaps from the slot, with Josh Doctson and Maurice Harris playing outside. Quinn had some training camp hype before going down with a high-ankle sprain. He's a Dynasty league flyer.
report: Redskins WR Trey Quinn will start in Week 11 against the Texans.

impact: This year's Mr. Irrelevant, Quinn is a much better prospect than his draft status after dominating his senior season at SMU for a 114/1,236/13 receiving line.  He got the Week 11 start at slot receiver, replacing Jamison Crowder (ankle) with Maurice Harris moving outside.  Quinn will be an intriguing, low-cost DFS punt in Thanksgiving-Day lineups against the Cowboys.
report: Trey Quinn caught 4-of-4 targets for 49 yards in Washington's Week 11 loss to Houston.

impact: Quinn did not practice on Saturday because of an ankle injury, and an Instagram post from the team showed him walking to the plane wearing a boot. At this point, he looks like a long shot to play Monday night against the Eagles. This injury is a concern considering Quinn spent most of the season on injured reserve with an ankle issue. On the bright side, Jamison Crowder appears on track to return Monday night.
report: Trey Quinn (ankle, questionable) was spotted wearing a walking boot on Sunday.

impact: Quinn scored his first NFL touchdown on Thanksgiving and busted out "The Scarn" dance, made famous by Michael Scott aka Michael Scarn from The Office.  Quinn has an ankle injury.  Jamison Crowder will return to slot duties, active for the first time since Week 5.  Dunbar has a shin injury.
report: Redskins declared WR Trey Quinn, CB Quinton Dunbar, RB Samaje Perine, RB Byron Marshall, OT Austin Howard, and DL Matt Ioannidis inactive for Week 13 against the Eagles.

impact: The last pick in April's draft, Quinn appeared in three games as a rookie due to recurring ankle issues.  It's his second time on injured reserve this season after being activated from I.R. last month.  Quinn caught nine balls for 75 yards and a touchdown.  He'll compete for slot duties next summer.
report: Redskins placed WR Trey Quinn (ankle) on injured reserve, ending his season.

impact: Walker appeared to dislocate his ankle, or at very least break his leg.  Being the warrior he is, Walker waved to fans as he made his way to the locker room on the cart.  Walker finished the game with four catches for 52 yards.  We don't expect to see him back on the field anytime soon.
report: Delanie Walker was carted off the field with a gruesome ankle/leg injury in the fourth quarter of Sunday's Week 1 game in Miami.

impact: As expected.  Walker had his ankle rolled up underneath a defender, bending it unnaturally, requiring an immediate air cast.  Walker is a warrior but simply can't play through this one.  Walker is signed through 2020 and will be 35 the next time he steps on the field.  Jonnu Smith figures to take over at tight end for the Titans, but Corey Davis is going to gobble up pass-game targets.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Delanie Walker has been diagnosed with a dislocated ankle along with a fracture and is "almost certainly" done for the season.

impact: The Titans have since made it official. Walker will undergo surgery. Essentially, Walker wrecked his ankle. There's a lot of bad stuff going on in there. It's a brutal blow for the Titans, who must adapt to the loss of their No. 1 passing game weapon as they try to sort out the depth chart in their receiver corps. Promising second-year pro Jonnu Smith will step into Walker's void at tight end, offering immediate TE2 streamer appeal with the upside for more. Walker will be 35 when he's next on the field.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirms Delanie Walker is dealing with ligament damage in addition to a dislocated ankle and will miss the remainder of the season.

impact: "In the back of my mind, if I can get healthy earlier where I can come back and play, I’m going to do that," Walker said. "But right now, I’m just worried about taking it day by day just to get healthy and be able to come back next year. But if I can play this year, I will." Walker's fantasy season is over, and it sounds like returning in the playoffs is a bit of a pipe dream considering he just recently began walking with crutches. That said, Walker would be a big boost to an ascending offense if he is able to make it back.
report: Delanie Walker (ankle, injured reserve) is holding out hope he can return during the playoffs if the Titans make it.

impact: Doctson got stepped on in Wednesday's session. It's not a good development for a player with a history of Achilles' issues. Doctson has made zero fantasy impact with Alex Smith as his quarterback, but he has been close to an every-down player thus far.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) missed Thursday's practice.

impact: Doctson has an extra day with the Redskins playing on Monday night in New Orleans, but he's looking doubtful for that one at the moment.  Michael Floyd could be elevated, but neither player is a fantasy option.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: It suggests Doctson is unlikely to be active this week, though walking boots can be precautionary. The Redskins play on Monday night, so Doctson has an extra day to get ready. We'll know his official status Saturday.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) was in a walking boot on Friday.

impact: Doctson was in a walking boot Friday. He's on the wrong side of questionable, with most beat reporters not expecting him to play. Maurice Harris will start if Doctson sits.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) is questionable for Week 5 against the Saints.

impact: Doctson was in a walking boot all week, so this isn't a surprise even though Doctson was listed questionable.  The Redskins will start Maurice Harris in Doctson's place opposite Paul Richardson, with Jamison Crowder continuing to work in the slot.  Harris won't be a fantasy factor.  Also out for the Redskins are S Troy Apke, RB Samaje Perine, CB Adonis Alexander, DL Geron Christian, LG Shawn Lauvao, and DL Caleb Brantley.  LT Trent Williams (knee) is active.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) is inactive for Week 5 against the Saints on Monday night.

impact: Doctson saw out Monday night's loss to the Saints, but he could return this week following a limited week of practices. Even if he does, he is not a fantasy factor right now.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) is questionable for Week 6 against the Panthers.

impact: Doctson's return comes with Jamison Crowder (ankle) sitting. Doctson, Paul Richardson and Maurice Harris will be the Redskins' three-receiver set against the Panthers. Doctson has predictably shown zero chemistry with Alex Smith and is not an appealing WR4.
report: Josh Doctson (heel) is active for Week 6 against the Panthers.

impact: Doctson was playing through a questionable tag for a heel injury. The first-round bust has 68 yards this season.
report: Josh Doctson caught 3-of-6 targets for 20 yards in the Redskins' Week 6 win over the Panthers.

impact: His 42 yards were a season-high, but it doesn't make him any more fantasy relevant than he was prior to kick-off. Doctson is a candidate to fade away completely once Jamison Crowder and Paul Richardson return.
report: Josh Doctson hauled in 3-of-6 targets for 42 yards in Washington's Week 7 victory over the Cowboys.

impact: The five catches were Doctson's single-game career high.  He still does not have a touchdown on the season.  Doctson will be a WR4/5 in Week 9 vs. Atlanta.
report: Josh Doctson caught 5-of-5 targets for 49 yards in the Redskins' Week 9 win over the Giants.

impact: Doctson opened the game with back-to-back drops, then beat Falcons rookie RCB Isaiah Oliver for a short touchdown on a fade route.  Dating back to last season, Doctson has been held below 50 yards in 12 of his last 13 games.  Doctson will be a touchdown-dependent WR4/flex option in Week 10 at Tampa Bay.
report: Josh Doctson caught 3-of-6 targets for 31 yards and a touchdown in the Redskins' Week 9 loss to the Falcons.

impact: He has a touchdown in back-to-back games, even if the volume isn't there.  Doctson's short score in the red zone was the only touchdown of this game.  He'll be a WR4 next week when the Redskins host the Texans.
report: Josh Doctson caught all four of his targets for 46 yards and one touchdown in the Redskins' Week 10 win over the Bucs.

impact: Doctson hasn't gotten to the 50-yard plateau in a single game all season, so he has only been relevant whenever he has caught touchdowns.  He caught a touchdown in Weeks 9 and 10, but otherwise has gone scoreless in eight of Washington's ten games.  With popgun-armed Colt McCoy at quarterback, Doctson's fantasy outlook will stay the same on Thanksgiving against the Cowboys.
report: Josh Doctson caught 3-of-7 targets for 32 yards in Washington's Week 11 loss to Houston.

impact: The targets, catches and yards were all new season highs for the third-year pro. Colt McCoy does not exactly have a big arm, but like nearly every NFL quarterback, he is more willing to pull the trigger than Alex Smith. Doctson might finally have some WR4 appeal down the stretch. The Eagles are an attackable Week 13 matchup.
report: Josh Doctson caught 6-of-10 targets for 66 yards in the Redskins' Week 12 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Doctson's yards and targets led the team on a day Mark Sanchez completed 13-of-21 passes for 100 yards and no scores in relief of Colt McCoy, who broke a leg in the first half.  McCoy was 4-of-4 for 50 yards before leaving, including a 32-yard hookup to Doctson.  Doctson will go back to irrelevancy the rest of the season with Sanchez starting Week 14 against the Giants.
report: Josh Doctson caught 3-of-5 targets for 51 yards in the Redskins' Week 13 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Floyd spent training camp and preseason with the Saints but was an easy cut for them after catching one ball in exhibitions.  Now 28, the former first-rounder is running out of chances in the NFL and is unlikely to be a difference-maker in D.C.  He's not a great fit with Alex Smith at quarterback.
report: Redskins signed WR Michael Floyd.

impact: Rookie second-round RB Ronald Jones will replace Wilson (healthy scratch) in his first regular season game action of the year. Incumbent starter Peyton Barber has mustered just 124 yards on 43 carries (2.8 YPC) this season and will likely now be thrusted into an underwhelming timeshare. With third-stringer Ryan Griffin inactive, the Bucs have no choice but to turn to Jameis Winston if Ryan Fitzpatrick struggles early against the Bears' terrifying pass rush.
report: Bucs declared RB Shaun Wilson, DT Beau Allen, G Alex Cappa, QB Ryan Griffin, OL Michael Liedtke, DE Noah Spence, and S Jordan Whitehead inactive for Week 4 against the Bears.

impact: No surprises in this group.  Tampa Bay remains severely shorthanded on defense.
report: Bucs declared RB Shaun Wilson, DT Gerald McCoy, DE Vinny Curry, QB Ryan Griffin, DE Demone Harris, OL Michael Liedtke, and OL Alex Cappa inactive for Week 8 against the Bengals.

impact: Taylor had a bad drop on what would have been a 20-plus yard catch. He's been a non-factor over the last couple weeks and is behind Tajae Sharpe for targets. Taylor is just a dynasty stash.
report: Taywan Taylor one pass for eight yards in Week 7 against the Chargers.

impact: Taylor caught both of his targets for 24 yards but was hurt on the second grab.  The cornerback landed on the back of his leg, pinching and flexing his foot with the turf.  Taylor was able to walk to the sideline but never returned.  Cameron Batson came on in Taylor's place following the injury.
report: Taywan Taylor exited Week 9 against the Cowboys with a foot injury.

impact: Taylor got his foot stretched awkwardly on the turf in Dallas last Monday night and had to limp to the sidelines.  We'd be surprised if he plays this week against New England.  Cameron Baston filled in last week.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: As did Tajae Sharpe (ankle). Taylor seems in greater danger of sitting against the Patriots, as Sharpe played through his issue against the Cowboys.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Despite being listed as questionable, we don't expect Taylor to play given that he's missed practice all week. Tajae Sharpe also drew a questionable tag but was at least able to get in a limited session on Friday. If Taylor's out, Darius Jennings would soak up snaps as the team's third receiver.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) is questionable for Week 10 against the Patriots.

impact: He missed practice all week after injuring the foot in last Monday night's loss to Dallas.  The Titans' three-receiver set will be comprised of Corey Davis, Tajae Sharpe, and Cameron Batson versus New England.  The rest of Tennessee's Week 10 inactives are RT Jack Conklin, OL Aaron Stinnie, DL Matt Dickerson, S Dane Cruikshank, OLB Derrick Morgan, and FB Jalston Fowler.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) is inactive for Week 10 versus the Patriots.

impact: Taylor hasn't played or practiced since bending his foot awkwardly in a Week 9 win at Dallas. If Taylor can't go Sunday at Indianapolis, it would open up targets for Corey Davis and Tajae Sharpe.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Taylor hasn't seen the field since injuring his foot in Week 9 and seems like a long shot to play Sunday at Indianapolis. Corey Davis and Tajae Sharpe will both see more opportunities in his absence.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) remained sidelined at Thursday's practice.

impact: Despite his encouraging listing on the team's injury report, it's hard to imagine Taylor plays after failing to practice for two straight weeks. Teammate Tajae Sharpe (ankle, questionable) was also surprisingly added to Tennessee's injury report Friday. Their pending absences are moot for Corey Davis, who should continue to thrive as the team's focal point against the Colts.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) is questionable for Week 11 against the Colts.

impact: This was expected despite Tennessee listing Taylor as questionable. Taylor hasn't practiced the last two weeks, so there's no guarantee he returns in Week 12. With Tajae Sharpe (questionable, ankle) up in the air for Sunday, the Titans could be down to Cameron Batson and Darius Jennings behind Corey Davis.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) has been downgraded to out for Week 11.

impact: Normally back-to-back limited sessions are worrisome, but it's actually an upgrade for Taylor since he was unable to practice at all the last two weeks. He's trending towards being active Monday night, though incumbent No. 2 Tajae Sharpe is still fully expected to work ahead of him.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) was limited in practice on Friday.

impact: Taylor was limited all week. He'll likely be a game-time decision but should return this week. Taylor will slot in behind Corey Davis and Tajae Sharpe.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) is questionable for Week 12 against the Texans.

impact: Taylor was listed questionable after a week of limited practices, but he needs another week off after getting hurt three Monday nights ago in Dallas.  Cameron Batson and Jonnu Smith will pick up the slack behind Corey Davis and Dion Lewis.  Also inactive for the Titans are S Dane Cruikshank, RB David Fluellen, RB Dalyn Dawkins, OG Aaron Stinnie, OT Tyler Marz, and DE Matt Dickerson.
report: Titans declared WR Taywan Taylor (foot) inactive for Monday night's Week 12 game against the Texans.

impact: Taylor was close to returning last week. This puts him on track to play Sunday but his role figures to be limited after missing so much time. Corey Davis and Jonnu Smith are the top targets in Tennessee's offense.
report: Taywan Taylor (foot) is practicing in full for Week 13 against the Jets.

impact: Taylor had been sidelined since getting hurt in Week 9 and immediately came back to notch a 100-yard game.  Taylor beat Morris Claiborne for a 55-yard grab down the left side.  Marcus Mariota actually missed Taylor earlier in the game for what should have been a long touchdown after Taylor got wide open behind the defense.  Taylor will be a WR5 next week against Jacksonville.
report: Taywan Taylor caught 3-of-5 targets for 104 yards in the Titans' Week 13 win over the Jets.

impact: James suffered a back injury in the third preseason game, but he is good to go for the season opener. With Vance McDonald (foot) out, James should be the primary option at tight end against the Browns.
report: Steelers TE Jesse James (back) is not listed on the Week 1 injury report.

impact: James drew the start and opportunity with Vance McDonald still sidelined with a foot injury. He will only be a fringe TE2 option in Week 2 against the Chiefs if McDonald remains inactive.
report: Steelers TE Jesse James caught 3-of-5 targets for 60 yards in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Browns.

impact: James also drew a defensive holding penalty in the end zone. The 100-yard game was the first of James' career, and came in spite of Vance McDonald making his 2018 debut. James was left completely uncovered multiple times by a Chiefs defense preoccupied with stopping Antonio Brown and JuJu Smith-Schuster. Today won't be the last time that happens, but especially with McDonald now involved, James' big days are going to be too difficult to see coming to consider him an appealing TE2 streamer.
report: Jesse James caught 5-of-5 targets for 138 yards and a touchdown in the Steelers' Week 2 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Roles were reversed in Week 3 as it was Vance McDonald (4-112-1) who shined in the Steelers' passing game. James had benefitted as Pittsburgh's sole pass-catching tight end to start the year, but he'll likely fall back to the end of the line with McDonald now healthy. James can be dropped in every format.
report: Jesse James caught his only target for seven yards in the Steelers' Week 3 win over the Buccaneers.

impact: The Steelers continued their game of tight-end seesaw with James winning the prize over Vance McDonald this week. Nearly all of James' yardage came on a 51-yard deep heave from Ben Roethlisberger early in the fourth quarter. That marked the longest play of his career. It was also the longest play the Ravens have given up this year. The Penn State product will have a big game every now and again, but he's not someone fantasy owners can realistically rely on a week-to-week basis. He'll be back at it Thursday night against Carolina.
report: Jesse James pulled in two grabs for 53 yards on three targets Sunday in the Steelers’ Week 9 victory over the Ravens.

impact: It appears the UDFA out of Alabama needs surgery to repair a severe high-ankle sprain. Sims was working on special teams.
report: Redskins placed WR Cam Sims on injured reserve with an ankle injury.

impact: Richardson doesn't seem particularly close to 100 percent but will be heavily needed with Jamison Crowder (ankle) on the shelf. Even with Crowder and Chris Thompson sidelined, Richardson is not an attractive WR4 against the Panthers.
report: Paul Richardson (knee, shoulder) is active for Week 6 against the Panthers.

impact: Richardson added a two-yard rush. Richardson's score came as he got loose at the back of the end zone as Alex Smith scrambled around for time. The high-dollar free agent addition has 13 catches for 212 yards through five games as a Redskin. That's not going to cut it in fantasy leagues.
report: Paul Richardson caught 3-of-5 targets for 31 yards and a touchdown in the Redskins' Week 6 win over the Panthers.

impact: Neither is Jamison Crowder (ankle), but it was already known he'd be sidelined until at least Friday.  Richardson has battled numerous injuries through his first five games with the Skins, but he should be okay for Week 7.
report: Paul Richardson (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: This is actually the routine Richardson followed last week before suiting up against the Panthers. As of Thursday, we have not seen evidence that his status is in doubt against the Cowboys.
report: Paul Richardson (knee, shoulder) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: If there's good news, it's that an MRI was not required. "We’re trying to get to the bottom of it," coach Jay Gruden said. "We’re being extra cautious right now." Richardson's Week 7 availability appears genuinely up in the air. The Redskins promoted WR Jehu Chesson from the practice squad on Thursday.
report: Paul Richardson had his ailing knee re-examined on Thursday.

impact: Richardson went to the doctor to have his knee re-evauated on Thursday and it doesn't sound like he got good news. With Jamison Crowder (ankle) already ruled out and P-Rich likely to follow suit, look for the Redskins to roll with Josh Doctson, Maurice Harris and Brian Quick in three-wide sets against Dallas.
report: Paul Richardson (knee, shoulder) is doubtful for Week 7 against the Cowboys.

impact: The Redskins will be extremely thin at wideout Sunday and will be forced to start Josh Doctson, Maurice Harris, and Michael Floyd in three-wide sets. Brian Quick will mix in as depth. Without Thompson available, third-down back Kapri Bibbs will play behind Adrian Peterson (who initially came into Sunday questionable, too). Expect more multiple tight end sets from Washington's offense.
report: Redskins declare WR Paul Richardson, CB Quinton Dunbar, WR Jamison Crowder, RB Chris Thompson, S Troy Apke, OL Geron Christian and C Casey Dunn inactive for Week 7 against the Cowboys.

impact: After missing the entire practice week and being inactive against Dallas, this is a step in the right direction for Richardson.  Signs are positive he'll be able to return against the Giants.  Jamison Crowder (ankle) remains sidelined.
report: Paul Richardson (knee, shoulder) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Richardson sat out last week's game with knee and shoulder injuries but has practiced on a limited basis this week and looks on track to play Sunday against New York. P-Rich hasn't made much noise this year, delivering just 16 catches for 212 yards and two touchdowns over five appearances. Even with several teams on bye, Richardson won't be of much use to fantasy owners this week.
report: Redskins coach Jay Gruden said the team is "hopeful" Paul Richardson (knee, shoulder) will return for Week 8 against the Giants.

impact: Richardson has been a limited participant since initially returning from injury in Week 5, but has still mustered 7/81/1 in the Skins' hapless passing offense over the last two games. He's fully expected to play alongside Josh Docton and Maurice Harris. Jordan Reed remains the likeliest candidate to break out of his rut with Jamison Crowder (out, ankle) missing his third consecutive game.
report: Paul Richardson (knee) is questionable for Week 8 against the Giants.

impact: With Alex Smith at quarterback, none of Washington's perimeter pass catchers have fantasy value in a low-volume passing attack.
report: Paul Richardson caught 2-of-5 targets for 34 yards in Washington's Week 8 win over the Giants.

impact: P-Rich likely isn't 100 percent but he's healthy enough to play. He saw his usual snaps against the Giants in Week 8 and we suspect that will be the case again Sunday when the Redskins host Atlanta. With Washington running its offense through Adrian Peterson, none of the Redskins' pass-catchers offer much fantasy appeal.
report: Paul Richardson (shoulder, knee) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Richardson's been ailing the past few weeks but has still managed to take to the field. Even so, his reps haven't led to any significant fantasy production. We expect he'll play Sunday, but Adrian Peterson remains the true beneficiary sans Chris Thompson (out, ribs) and Jamison Crowder (out, ankle).
report: Paul Richardson (shoulder, knee) is questionable for Week 9 against the Falcons.

impact: He saw an end-zone target in fourth-quarter garbage time but Alex Smith's pass was essentially uncatchable in heavy traffic.  Richardson has been a complete dud in fantasy, yet next week's matchup with Tampa Bay will at least put him on the WR4/flex radar.
report: Paul Richardson caught 2-of-6 targets for 16 yards in Washington's Week 9 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Richardson needs surgery to repair an injured AC joint. Coach Jay Gruden's players were dropping like flies against the Falcons, but Richardson's issue is one he has been playing through all season. It ends a disappointing first Redskins campaign for the $40 million free agent. Richardson caught just 20 passes for 262 yards and two touchdowns in seven games. He's an extremely poor fit with Alex Smith's arch-conservative "skill-set." 2019 will be Richardson's age-27 season. Maurice Harris is now locked into three-receiver sets regardless of Jamison Crowder's (ankle) health.
report: Redskins placed WR Paul Richardson on injured reserve with a shoulder injury, ending his season.

impact: Jackson was the intended target on Ryan Fitzpatrick's second interception. It was essentially an arm punt. One week after reportedly requesting a trade, Jackson watched Mike Evans and Adam Humphries dominate targets. Playing mostly good ball with Fitz this season, D-Jax will try to bounce back as a WR3 against the Redskins in Week 10.
report: DeSean Jackson caught 2-of-4 targets for 32 yards in the Bucs' Week 9 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Jackson got up for this one against his former team but didn't do much of anything notable while also dropping a pass.  Ryan Fitzpatrick took one deep shot to Jackson, but it didn't have a prayer and was well covered.  Jackson has seen his playing time dip and is a boom-or-bust WR3/4 ahead of a date with the Giants.
report: DeSean Jackson caught 5-of-8 targets for 67 yards in the Bucs' Week 10 loss to the Redskins.

impact: His seven targets encouragingly tied Mike Evans' for the team lead. It was ultimately a bust day, though, as Jackson failed to cash-in on his normal deep targets. He'll be a boom-or-bust WR3/4 against the Niners again next week whether it's Jameis Winston or Ryan Fitzpatrick who's throwing to him.
report: DeSean Jackson caught 4-of-7 targets for 38 yards in the Bucs' Week 11 loss to the Giants.

impact: D-Jax must have picked up the injury in Sunday's loss to the Giants. Barring a setback, he should be ready when the Buccaneers return home to face the Niners in Week 12. Jackson has fared worse with Jameis Winston under center, but still belongs in the WR3 discussion.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Jackson played through his thumb issue last week and got in two full practices, so there's not much concern over his status. With Mike Evans running most of his routes against Richard Sherman, Jackson has potential for a big Week 12.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) is listed as questionable for Week 12 against the 49ers.

impact: There wasn't any doubt over Jackson's status after he practiced fully most of the week. Jackson has fared better with Ryan Fitzpatrick starting, but he's in a good Week 12 spot with Mike Evans likely to see a lot of Richard Sherman. We like Jackson as an upside WR3.
report: DeSean Jackson (questionable, thumb) is expected to play Week 12 against the 49ers.

impact: Jackson was listed as questionable with a thumb injury, but his status was never in doubt.  He will draw the start opposite Mike Evans with Chris Godwin and slot man Adam Humphries rotating in, as usual.
report: DeSean Jackson is active for Week 12 against the 49ers.

impact: Mike Evans (116 yards) did the heavy lifting in Tampa Bay's Week 12 passing game, as no other Bucs pass catcher topped 54 yards.  Still, the eight targets were promising for Jackson, who draws a burnable Carolina secondary next.  The Panthers may be without No. 2 CB Donte Jackson (quad) in that game.
report: DeSean Jackson caught 3-of-8 targets for 19 yards in the Bucs' Week 12 win over the 49ers.

impact: Jackson injured his thumb in Week 11, and it evidently did not get better against the 49ers. Jackson caught just 3-of-8 targets for 19 yards. His status will be updated no later than Wednesday, when the Bucs must issue their first Week 13 injury report.
report: DeSean Jackson is visiting a specialist in New York to seek a second opinion on his hand/thumb injury.

impact: It puts Jackson on track to play against the Panthers, though he'd be less than 100 percent and is practicing with a brace on his thumb.  That would seem to make it more difficult to catch passes.  Chris Godwin and Adam Humphries would get a huge boost if Jackson sits.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Jackson didn't catch any passes during Thursday's session. He was also spotted wearing a cast on his injured left thumb. Jimmy Graham played through a similar injury for Green Bay last week but we wouldn't consider D-Jax a lock to suit up Sunday against Carolina. If he sits, it would open up looks downfield for Chris Godwin.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) practiced again on Thursday.

impact: Jackson was present at Wednesday and Thursday's practices, but he was wearing a brace on his thumb and unable to catch any passes.  Can't play wideout if you can't catch.  This is a huge boost to both Adam Humphries and Chris Godwin who are solidified as WR3 plays behind Mike Evans in a game with the week's highest projected points total.  Godwin can be started everywhere.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) is out for Week 13 against the Panthers.

impact: Jackson was an early rule out. The rest of the Bucs inactives are CB Carlton Davis, OT Demar Dotson, QB Ryan Griffin, CB Brent Grimes, DT Rakeem Nunez-Roches, and CB M.J. Stewart.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) is inactive for Week 13.

impact: Fantasy footballers can only hope that's the case, as Chris Godwin explodes any time he's given starter's snaps.  Godwin just had a 5-101-1 day against the Panthers on a season-high 80% of the snaps last week and has long been deserving of that role.  Jackson isn't part of the future and remains "frustrated" in Tampa Bay, according to Laine.  He's likely to be released in the offseason now that the guaranteed money is up on his deal.  Godwin's arrow is screaming upward.
report: ESPN Bucs reporter Jenna Laine believes it's "quite possible" the Bucs hold DeSean Jackson (thumb) out the remainder of the season.

impact: It's the same routine Jackson followed last week ahead of missing Week 13 against the Panthers.  He's able to run, obviously, but catching passes is a problem.  Word is the Bucs could shut Jackson down the rest of the season.  Chris Godwin has league-winning upside for the fantasy playoffs.
report: DeSean Jackson (thumb) was not catching passes at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Sharpe worked behind Taywan Taylor in the first game without Rishard Matthews, but he made his presence known with an 11-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter on which he ran a great route. Even so, he is not a redraft option outside of deep leagues.
report: Tajae Sharpe hauled in 2-of-3 targets for 27 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' Week 4 win over the Eagles.

impact: Sharpe is a low-upside possession receiver in a struggling passing offense.  We wouldn't bet on him becoming fantasy relevant anytime soon.
report: Tajae Sharpe caught 3-of-4 targets for 30 yards in the Titans' Week 5 loss to the Bills.

impact: Sharpe just won't go away, leading the Titans' struggling pass offense in receiving Sunday. Second-year pro Taywan Taylor, who's seemingly been blocked by Sharp's presence, caught just one ball for 13 yards. Sharpe shouldn't be owned in fantasy, but still remains the Titans' No. 2 wideout behind Corey Davis (1/24) for whatever reason.
report: Tajae Sharpe caught both of his targets for a team-high 33 yards in the Titans' Week 6 loss to the Ravens.

impact: It's a career high in yards for Sharpe, who also paced the Titans with nine targets. He's now led Tennessee in receiving in consecutive weeks. Sharpe has a strong rapport with Marcus Mariota going back to their rookie seasons. He's worth stashing through the Titans Week 8 bye.
report: Tajae Sharpe caught 7-of-9 passes for 101 yards in Week 7 against the Chargers.

impact: Sharpe appeared to get hurt in pregame warmups, but he managed to get the go-ahead to be active.  He did nothing and may have aggravated the injury, as Cameron Baston and Darius Jennings seemed to be getting more run, combining for 57 yards on three grabs.  Sharpe is off the fantasy map.
report: Tajae Sharpe caught his lone target for no gain in the Titans' Week 9 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Whatever the tweak was, Sharpe played through it for 54 snaps. He was targeted only one time in the passing game, posting a zero-yard reception.
report: Titans coach Mike Vrabel confirmed Tajae Sharpe tweaked something in pre-game warmups Monday but expects him to be fine for Week 10 against the Patriots.

impact: Sharpe was hurt in pregame warmups Monday night in Dallas but played through it to catch just one pass for no gain.  He's been a low-level, no-upside fantasy option in the Titans' mostly-broken offense this season.
report: Tajae Sharpe (ankle) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: This would be a downgrade for Sharpe, who was limited at Wednesday's session. With Taywan Taylor (foot) also hurting, the Titans could be short-handed at receiver Sunday against New England.
report: Tajae Sharpe (ankle) wasn't seen at the open portion of Thursday's practice.

impact: As is backup WR Taywan Taylor (foot). Unlike Taylor, though, Sharpe returned to practice on Friday (albeit in a limited session) and is expected to play. Sharpe has played ahead of Taylor for a majority of the season, so whomever steps in as the team's third wideout will do so in a limited role. Corey Davis is the only fantasy viable receiver in the Titans' offense.
report: Tajae Sharpe (ankle) is questionable for Week 10 against the Patriots.

impact: Sharpe was a full participant all week but suddenly got in limited work Friday. He's questionable, as is teammate Taywan Taylor (foot). Cameron Batson and Darius Jennings would receive extended reps if either are ruled out Sunday. Corey Davis remains the only Titans receiver worth starting with any amount of confidence.
report: Tajae Sharpe (ankle) is questionable for Week 11 against the Colts.

impact: Sharpe popped up on Friday's injury report, but it was just a scare. With Taywan Taylor (foot) remaining sidelined, Sharpe will be needed for major snaps against the Colts' soft defense. Joining Taylor as inactive are LB Will Compton, RB David Fluellen, CB Kenneth Durden, OG Aaron Stinnie, OT Tyler Marz and DL Matt Dickerson.
report: Titans WR Tajae Sharpe (ankle) is active for Week 11 against the Colts.

impact: The yards were Sharpe's first in four weeks. His touchdown came in the deepest recesses of garbage time. Even if Taywan Taylor (foot) remains sidelined for Week 12, Sharpe will not be a compelling WR5.
report: Tajae Sharpe caught 5-of-7 targets for 37 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' Week 11 loss to the Colts.

impact: Sharpe has been nonexistent in recent weeks as he battles an ankle injury.  He went 5-37-1 last week in Indianapolis but otherwise has been a ghost the last month.  Sharpe appeared to get rolled up from behind at the end of a Corey Davis 39-yard run in this one but he quickly returned before checking in and out of the lineup.  Sharpe has no business being owned in 12-team leagues.
report: Tajae Sharpe wasn't targeted in the Titans' Week 12 loss to the Texans.

impact: Sharpe has been at less than 100 percent for the last few weeks. He should continue to play Sunday but isn't on the fantasy radar.
report: Tajae Sharpe (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Sharpe seems to be over the ankle injury that has plagued him the past few weeks. He's logged one catch or fewer in three of his last four games and won't be a preferred fantasy option when the Jets come to town in Week 13.
report: Tajae Sharpe (ankle) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Davis insisted his hamstring was "fine" throughout the week and he responded with full participation in practice on Friday. He's no longer listed on Tennessee's injury report. Davis commanded 13 targets in last week's opener but will have to make due with both Marcus Mariota (questionable, elbow) and Blaine Gabbert sharing reps at quarterback.
report: Corey Davis (hamstring) was removed from the Titans' injury report and will play in Week 2 against the Texans.

impact: Davis led Tennessee in targets for the second consecutive week, already putting him at the 20-target mark for the year. Though they weren't efficient targets, Davis used his athleticism to catch-and-run for additional yards throughout the day. His ceiling is much lower with Blaine Gabbert under center, but as long as Davis remains the focal point of Tennessee's passing offense, he'll stay a low-end WR2 for the rest of the year.
report: Corey Davis caught 5-of-7 targets for 55 yards in the Titans' Week 2 win over the Texans.

impact: Tennessee's passing game was nonexistent, managing 108 yards from Marcus Mariota and Blaine Gabbert combined.  Davis' 34 receiving yards actually led the team.  Davis gets a good Week 4 matchup against a beatable Eagles cornerback unit, but the state of this offense always renders him a high-risk WR3/flex option.
report: Corey Davis caught 2-of-4 targets for 34 yards in the Titans' Week 3 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Consistently getting targets, Davis always seemed likely to break out once Marcus Mariota returned to full health, and that is exactly what happened against the Eagles. He had already set a new season-high in yardage by midway through the second quarter, and that was with Mariota missing him for what would have been a long gain. Mariota found him for that long play in the fourth quarter, but that was not the end of the action. Following an Eagles field goal, the Titans needed a touchdown to win, and Davis delivered with a leaping grab with just five seconds left. With Mariota looking healthy, Davis will be a top-24 option next week against the Bills.
report: Corey Davis hauled in 9-of-15 targets for 161 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' Week 4 win over the Eagles.

impact: The Titans got Davis matched up with other defenders at times, but he mostly squared off with Bills top CB Tre'Davious White, who handily won their one-on-one draws.  As Tennessee's passing game has gone, Davis' box-score production has gone.  He gets an even tougher Week 6 matchup against Baltimore's shutdown pass defense.
report: Corey Davis caught 4-of-6 targets for 49 yards in the Titans' Week 5 loss to the Bills.

impact: Davis fell victim to the Titans' miserable pass protection, hauling in just one catch from Marcus Mariota, who was on his back 11 times throughout the afternoon. The only positive to come from this is that four of Mariota's 15 attempts were directed at Davis. As the Titans' O goes, Davis goes, and both went nowhere in a hurry Sunday. He'll remain a low-end WR2 in Week 7 against the Chargers' secondary.
report: Corey Davis vacuumed just one of his four targets for 24 yards in the Titans' Week 6 romping to the Ravens.

impact: It's another rough game from Davis, who was led to 24 yards last week. Davis was out-targeted by Tajae Sharpe and had couldn't come down with an end-zone look in the fourth quarter. He hasn't been on the same page with Marcus Mariota over the last few weeks. Davis will be a WR3 when the Titans come out of their bye in Week 9.
report: Corey Davis caught 3-of-7 passes for 10 yards in Week 7 against the Chargers.

impact: Davis has a history of soft-tissue injuries, though it doesn't sound like his latest one we'll prevent him from playing Monday against Dallas. Even in the absence of Delanie Walker (ankle), Davis has made little impact this year aside from a random, 161-yard blow-up against the Eagles in Week 4. RotoPat has him as his No. 32 wide receiver for Week 9.
report: Corey Davis (hamstring) was limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: It's the second straight day Davis has been limited. Given the extra 24 hours he has to heal, we expect he'll play. The Cowboys have quietly produced one of the league's best secondaries this season, and Davis will likely garner Byron Jones' airtight coverage. Consider Davis a low WR2 in Week 9.
report: Corey Davis (hamstring) was limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Davis was limited throughout the week but promptly removed from the team's injury report on Saturday. He'll be on the field, but he arguably has the toughest individual matchup on paper against Byron Jones, PFF's No. 2 CB among 117 qualifiers. Consider Davis a low-end WR2 in a six-team bye week.
report: Corey Davis (hamstring) will play in Week 9 against the Cowboys.

impact: The 10 targets were easily a team-high as Davis saw 34.5% of the target share in this one.  He's been dominating the looks all season for Tennessee, but the quality of those passes have been all over the map.  Davis should have had a 10-yard touchdown, but Marcus Mariota missed him wide open in the end zone on what was maybe one of his two bad throws on the night.  He also missed Davis for a short gain on his first pass on the game.  Davis will get the Patriots next in Week 10.  He went 5-63-2 against them in the playoffs last year.
report: Corey Davis caught 6-of-10 targets for 56 yards in the Titans' Week 9 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Held to 65 yards or fewer in seven of the Titans' first eight games, Davis owned this matchup from start to finish.  Stephon Gilmore entered Week 10 as the hottest cornerback in the league, but he couldn't hang with Davis' physicality and acrobatic in-the-air prowess.  Davis even drew three defensive pass interference flags against Patriots defenders.  With Davis dominating targets and Tennessee's passing game finally turning a corner, Davis will be an upside WR2 play in Week 11 at Indianapolis.
report: Corey Davis caught 7-of-10 targets for 125 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' Week 10 upset win over New England.

impact: The Titans' offense appeared derailed from the opening snap, with the Colts scrambling Marcus Mariota, especially on third down. Mariota then re-injured his throwing elbow late in the first half. It was game over for Davis' fantasy prospects once laughingstock Blaine Gabbert checked in. Davis' Week 12 prospects against the Texans will depend on who is under center for the Titans. If it's Mariota, Davis will maintain upside WR3 appeal despite his up-and-down season.
report: Corey Davis caught 2-of-4 targets for 30 yards in the Titans' Week 11 loss to the Colts.

impact: He added 39 yards on an end-around rushing attempt, giving him 135 total yards on the night.  The Titans were working it to Davis early and often, as he was smoking Johnathan Joseph in coverage while also drawing a 33-yard DPI penalty on another DB, but the offense mysteriously went away from him much of the second half.  With one of his two second-half looks, Davis roasted Joseph for a 48-yard TD grab down the right side.  One of the most unpredictable players in a totally unpredictable offense, boom-or-bust Davis will be a WR2 next week against the Jets.
report: Corey Davis caught all four of his targets for 96 yards and a touchdown in the Titans' 34-17, Week 12 loss to the Texans on Monday night.

impact: Davis' 11-yard touchdown with 36 seconds left on the clock on 3rd-and-6 in the fourth quarter proved to be the game-winner with the Titans trailing 22-19.  Davis has scored in three of the last four games and continues to pace the Titans in targets.  He'll be a WR3 next week against the Jags.
report: Corey Davis caught 3-of-7 targets for 42 yards and one touchdown in the Titans' Week 13 win over the Jets.

impact: Not only did Brate put up a goose egg, but he was also out-snapped 43-24 by teammate and fellow tight O.J. Howard. Dating back to last season, the Harvard alum has totaled an embarrassing 186 yards over his last 10 games. Even at a thin fantasy position, the 27-year-old doesn’t carry much weight.
report: Cameron Brate failed to catch either of his two targets Sunday in the Buccaneers’ Week 1 victory over the Saints.

impact: Catch-less through two weeks, Brate lacks fantasy value behind O.J. Howard.
report: Cameron Brate was held catch-less in Week 2 against the Eagles.

impact: O.J. Howard saw eight targets and surpassed 50-yards receiving for the third consecutive game, but it was inevitably Brate who was utilized in the red zone and found pay dirt. Brate was still held catchless in the Bucs' first two games and can't be trusted over Howard (or another streamer) unless an injury to his aforementioned teammate occurs.
report: Cameron Brate caught 3-of-4 targets for 34 yards and one touchdown in the Bucs' Week 3 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Brate has either been Jekyll or Hyde through the Bucs' first four games, being held catchless in Tampa's first two contests only to cross pay dirt in the next two. O.J. Howard (knee) did get knocked out in the second quarter Sunday and wasn't able to return. Brate has historically performed much better with Jameis Winston under center, and he'll arguably be a TE1 against the Falcons' ailing secondary if Howard remains out after the bye.
report: Cameron Brate caught 3-of-4 targets for 29 yards and one touchdown in the Bucs' Week 4 loss to the Bears.

impact: Even with Howard back, Brate did his fantasy backers proud by catching a touchdown on the opening drive. Jameis Winston showed a lot of trust in his tight end on the throw, and Brate made it count by going up over De’Vondre Campbell for the score. Brate now has a touchdown in three straight games. Unfortunately for his value moving forward, that was his only target as O.J. Howard went for 62 yards. He will be just a TE2 next week against the Browns.
report: Cameron Brate hauled in his only target for a 15-yard touchdown in the Bucs' Week 6 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Brate lost a fumble on one of his three catches that the Bucs were fortunate to not have come back to haunt them. Brate has just 15 targets on the season and only has true fantasy value if something were to happen to O.J. Howard.
report: Cameron Brate caught 3-of-4 targets for 23 yards in Sunday's Week 7 win over the Browns.

impact: Brate is never a fantasy factor as long as O.J. Howard is healthy.
report: Cameron Brate caught 1-of-2 targets for 13 yards in Week 8.

impact: Brate could only watch as O.J. Howard scored two touchdowns. Brate has not been phased all the way out of the offense, but he is now merely a TE2 touchdown hope/prayer in fantasy.
report: Cameron Brate caught 3-of-3 targets for 15 yards in the Bucs' Week 9 loss to the Panthers.

impact: He dropped one of his other targets on a third down in the red zone before the Bucs then missed the field goal.  The Redskins stamped out the Tampa Bay tight ends, holding O.J. Howard to one catch for 15 yards.
report: Cameron Brate caught 1-of-3 targets for 14 yards in the Week 10 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Over the past four games, Brate has totaled seven catches for 58 yards. Yes, you read that right. Unless Jameis Winston is announced as starter and O.J. Howard sits out, we're one week away from not having to discuss Brate in this space for the remainder of the season.
report: Cameron Brate caught 2-of-3 targets for 16 yards in the Bucs' Week 11 loss to the Giants.

impact: All of his production occurred in the first half, including a first-quarter score from six yards out.  Brate's lone missed target was a pass from Jameis Winston to him in the end zone that fell incomplete.  Brate will remain a touchdown-or-bust streamer when Tampa Bay hosts Carolina next.
report: Cameron Brate caught 3-of-4 targets for 26 yards and a touchdown in the Bucs' Week 12 win over San Francisco.

impact: It appears McDonald will make his season debut Sunday against Kansas City after sitting out the opener with a nagging foot injury. Jesse James filled in for him last week, logging three catches for 60 yards in a tie with Cleveland. Going against a vulnerable Chiefs secondary, McDonald should have a chance to return TE2 value this week.
report: Vance McDonald (questionable, foot) is expected to play Week 2 against the Chiefs.

impact: McDonald's biggest impact came when he was called for an illegal block in the back penalty. He got soundly out-produced by Jesse James, though both players drew five targets. Per Pro Football Focus, James out-snapped McDonald just 45-37. For now, James and McDonald are going to cancel each other out as TE2s in fantasy.
report: Vance McDonald caught 3-of-5 targets for 26 yards in the Steelers' Week 2 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: McDonald ran more routes than teammate Jesse James in Week 2, but it was the latter who still finished with better receiving numbers (5-138-1). That wasn't the case Monday night as Ben Roethlisberger hit McDonald in-stride during the team's third possession and watched him bulldoze (literally) his way through Bucs S Chris Conte and scamper down the sideline for a 75-yard score. Although James is technically considered Pittsburgh's blocking tight end, McDonald quietly graded better than James in run-blocking (per PFF) just last year. McDonald was talked about highly throughout offseason activities and training camp and, barring health, could easily emerge as an every-down tight end.
report: Vance McDonald caught 4-of-5 targets for 112 yards and one touchdown in the Steelers' Week 3 victory over the Buccaneers.

impact: McDonald carried over his strong Week 3, tying Antonio Brown for the team lead in receiving. He lost a fumble on the Steelers' first drive but rebounded with a couple of nice catches over the middle. McDonald's physical play has been a trigger point for the Steelers offense. He's a back-end TE1 for a matchup with the Falcons in Week 5.
report: Vance McDonald caught five passes for 62 yards in Week 4 against the Ravens.

impact: McDonald got out-produced by Jesse James as Ben Roethlisberger focused on getting Antonio Brown going. McDonald has had some monster games but has also yet to draw more than five targets in a contest. He will be a volatile TE1 in a down year for the position.
report: Vance McDonald caught 1-of-2 targets for six yards in the Steelers' Week 5 win over the Falcons.

impact: McDonald did almost all of his damage in the first half, catching five balls for 67 yards.  Jesse James then got most of the looks in the second half, catching five balls for 26 yards.  McDonald has big games here and there and is long on talent.  He'll be a TE1 Week 8 against the Browns after the bye.
report: Vance McDonald caught 7-of-8 targets for 68 yards in the Steelers' Week 6 win over the Bengals.

impact: McDonald's highlight of the day came on a 22-yard reception in the third quarter in which he ran over Derrick Kindred. McDonald was victim of the Steelers not being forced to pass in the second half of the game. McDonald will be fringe-TE1 option in Week 9 against a Ravens defense that has allowed an opposing tight end to score in back-to-back games.
report: Vance McDonald caught all three of his targets for 47 yards in Sunday's Week 8 win over the Browns.

impact: It was an innocuous day for the tight end, though McDonald was involved in one bizarre play. Tavon Young recovered a fumble after stripping McDonald late in the second quarter and took it all the way for a touchdown, though replay showed that McDonald was down by contact. The 28-year-old hasn't found the end zone since Week 3, but remains a streaming consideration at a weak fantasy position. He'll look to bounce back Thursday when the Steelers host Carolina.
report: Vance McDonald contributed three catches for 25 yards on six targets Sunday in Pittsburgh’s Week 9 win over the Ravens.

impact: McDonald cashed in a plus matchup for his second score of the year. He made a lovely, diving catch in the back of the end zone, though it seemed unclear if he actually possessed the ball. The replay booth did not see enough to overturn the call. McDonald will be a boom-or-bust TE2 for Week 11 against the Jaguars.
report: Vance McDonald caught 4-of-4 targets for 44 yards and a touchdown in the Steelers' Week 10 win over the Panthers.

impact: The highlight of the day for McDonald was skying over Jaguars defenders in the end zone for an 11-yard touchdown to pull the Steelers within a field goal late in the fourth quarter. McDonald hasn't reached 50 yards in a game since Week 6, but will still find himself a passable tight end option Week 12 when the Steelers head to Denver.
report: Vance McDonald caught 3-of-6 targets for 27 yards in Sunday's Week 11 win over the Jaguars.

impact: McDonald had a fine first half, but it could have been much better if he did not allow a touchdown to slip through his hands just before halftime. Unfortunately, that was his only real opportunity at a big fantasy day as he went without a target after the break. McDonald did leave for a bit with a hip injury, but he was able to reenter the game. Assuming he avoided a major injury, McDonald will be a back-end TE1 next week against the Chargers.
report: Vance McDonald hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 27 yards in the Steelers' Week 12 loss to the Broncos.

impact: McDonald suffered the injury in the loss to the Broncos, but he was able to return to the game. It does not sound like he is in real danger of missing Sunday night's matchup with the Chargers, but the injury is one to monitor throughout the week.
report: Steelers coach Mike Tomlin said Vance McDonald will be limited by a hip injury early in the week.

impact: McDonald tweaked his hip in last week's loss to Denver, though he was able to return. If he can't go against the Chargers on Sunday night, it would open up reps for Jesse James at tight end.
report: Vance McDonald (hip) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: McDonald sat out Wednesday's session but it was probably just for rest purposes. Obviously this puts him on track to play Sunday night against the Chargers. Going against one of the league's better secondaries, McDonald won't be a recommended streaming option this week.
report: Vance McDonald (hip) returned to a full practice on Thursday.

impact: The targets were there for McDonald, but he didn't do much with them. McDonald’s pass game role has been in decline with fewer than 50 yards in six straight games. He’ll be a streaming option for a matchup with the Raiders in Week 14.
report: Vance McDonald caught 4-of-7 targets for 28 yards in Week 13 against the Chargers.

impact: Godwin was shockingly uninvolved in the blowout loss before the bye, but he bounced back in this one. He had two catches on Tampa's opening touchdown drive, and he finished tied for the team lead with nine targets. His touchdown came from nine yards out on a play he was left open just short of the goal line. With four touchdowns in five games this season, Godwin will be a FLEX option next week against the Browns.
report: Chris Godwin caught 6-of-9 targets for 56 yards and a touchdown in the Bucs' Week 6 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Godwin did most of his damage in the first half, catching four passes for 36 yards before the break. Afterwards, he received just two targets as he's still running behind all of Mike Evans, Adam Humphries and DeSean Jackson. Godwin remains a touchdown-or-bust fantasy option Week 8 against the Bengals.
report: Chris Godwin caught 5-of-6 passes for 59 yards in Sunday's Week 7 win over the Browns.

impact: This was his highest snap share since Week 1. It is notable considering Godwin had been splitting time with DeSean Jackson while Adam Humphries dominated slot snaps. Humphries was limited to 57 snaps in this contest, and Jackson played just 43. Despite the playing time, Godwin still finished fourth on the team with six targets. Godwin's inconsistent target share will make him a volatile fantasy option, but he has four touchdowns in six games as a prominent red-zone threat in a good passing offense. He will be an upside WR3 this week against the Bengals.
report: Chris Godwin played 66-of-95 snaps (69 percent) Week 7 against the Browns.

impact: Godwin is one of the most touchdown-dependent receivers in the league as a rotational player averaging fewer than 50 yards per game.  He needs the Bucs to make good on DeSean Jackson's trade wish in order to become a reliable WR3.  Mike Evans' late-game leg injury is also worth monitoring for Godwin's outlook.
report: Chris Godwin caught 2-of-7 targets for 32 yards in the Bucs' Week 8 loss to the Bengals, adding a two-point conversion.

impact: Godwin was not really heard from as Adam Humphries gobbled up eight targets behind Mike Evans and DeSean Jackson. Averaging just 48 yards per game, Godwin has settled in as a low-end WR4.
report: Chris Godwin caught 2-of-3 targets for 40 yards in the Bucs' Week 9 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Godwin was the intended receiver on Ryan Fitzpatrick's first interception, but it didn't register as an official target as it sailed well over his head at the goal line and into Josh Norman's hands.  Godwin has been super touchdown-dependent much of the year and will be a WR4 next week against the Giants.
report: Chris Godwin caught all seven of his targets for 103 yards in the Bucs' Week 10 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Godwin appeared to injure his ankle on one of the last plays of last week's loss to the Redskins. Coming off a season-high in yards, Godwin should be in the WR4 mix if he suits up against the Giants Sunday in East Rutherford.
report: Chris Godwin (ankle) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Godwin is beginning to look doubtful for Sunday's showdown with the Giants. His absence would make Adam Humphries a Week 11 target hog.
report: Chris Godwin (ankle) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Godwin was a full participant at Friday's practice after sitting out Wednesday and Thursday. Despite the questionable listing, he should be fine for Sunday's game in East Rutherford. Adam Humphries would have been an interesting DFS flyer had Godwin sat out, but it looks like that ship has sailed.
report: Chris Godwin (ankle) is questionable for Week 11 against the Giants.

impact: Godwin created some concern after missing two practices early in the week, but he got in a full session Friday. It's possible the Bucs cut back his snaps at less than 100 percent, giving Mike Evans, DeSean Jackson and Adam Humphries all higher floors. Godwin is a risky FLEX.
report: Chris Godwin (questionable, ankle) is expected to play in Week 11 against the Giants.

impact: Godwin will play through his questionable tag, as expected. Despite splitting reps with DeSean Jackson as the team's third receiver, Godwin has continued to leverage his athletic prowess into efficient fantasy production and red zone targets. He remains a boom-bust WR3 proposition in Week 11 given his limited on-field usage compared to that of Mike Evans or Adam Humphries.
report: Chris Godwin (ankle) is active for Week 11 against the Giants.

impact: He secured all three of his targets for 50 yards playing through the injury in last week's loss to New York. Godwin is our No. 38 wide receiver for Week 12.
report: Chris Godwin (ankle) is practicing in full for Week 12 against the 49ers.

impact: This was expected with Godwin practicing fully all week. Godwin is healthy after playing through a Week 11 questionable tag. He's our No. 38 ranked wideout for a matchup against the 49ers.
report: Chris Godwin (ankle) was removed from the Week 12 injury report.

impact: It was a quiet game for Godwin, who operates as a rotational receiver in the Bucs' deep passing game. Godwin is plenty capable of turning in big box-score games, but he doesn't always get enough opportunity to convert competing for targets with Mike Evans, Adam Humphries, DeSean Jackson, and Cameron Brate, among others.  Godwin will be a fringe WR3/flex in Week 13 against Carolina.
report: Chris Godwin caught 4-of-4 targets for 42 yards in the Bucs' Week 12 win.

impact: Godwin got half his yards on a wide open 40-plus yard catch and run. His TD came on a broken play in the red-zone. It’s the first touchdown for Godwin in last seven games. Godwin will be on the WR3 map if DeSean Jackson can’t return next week
report: Chris Godwin caught 5-of-6 targets for 101 yards and a touchdown in Week 13 against the Panthers.

impact: Switzer’s career-high was just 32 yards heading into Sunday, but he was a big part of the game plan early in this one. He recorded 57 yards on four catches in the first half including a 24-yard gain just before halftime to help set up Pittsburgh’s first touchdown. Things obviously slowed down in the second half, and it seems unlikely he is able to carve out a real role behind Antonio Brown and JuJu Smith-Schuster. Still, he is a name to watch in deeper PPR leagues.
report: Ryan Switzer hauled in 6-of-8 targets for 67 yards in the Steelers' Week 12 loss to the Broncos.

impact: He's a healthy scratch for the third straight week. The rest of the Steelers inactives are CB Mike Hilton, S Morgan Burnett, QB Mason Rudolph, S Marcus Allen, OT Zach Banner, and DE L.T. Walton.
report: Justin Hunter is inactive for Week 4 against the Ravens.

impact: He was shut out in the first half, but was more effective after halftime, chipping in with three catches on four second-half targets. Humphries took a screen pass from Ryan Fitzpatrick 65 yards to the house late in the second quarter, but the play was called back for an illegal block by left tackle Donovan Smith. In a busy Bucs’ receiving corps, Humphries is unlikely to be a major fantasy factor next week against the Eagles.
report: Adam Humphries supplied three catches for 27 yards on five targets Sunday in the Buccaneers’ Week 1 win over the Saints.

impact: Humphries only ended up with four targets, but he made the most of them. His biggest play came on a 51-yard catch-and-run early in the third quarter. Despite that big play, Humphries is not a viable fantasy option outside of deep leagues.
report: Adam Humphries hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 82 yards in the Bucs' Week 6 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Humphries continues to work as the Bucs true WR2 in terms of snaps and routes and Sunday he was only out-targeted by Mike Evans (10) and O.J. Howard (nine). Humphries is the worst kind of player because he is not valuable for fantasy purposes on his own merit while remaining a thorn in the side of the fantasy ceilings for the members of the Tampa Bay passing game. He is not a viable fantasy option Week 8 against the Bengals.
report: Adam Humphries caught 4-of-8 targets for 37 yards in Sunday's Week 7 win over the Browns.

impact: The Bucs' slot receiver entered this game with just one TD over his last 25 appearances, and Humphries remained scoreless after replay review showed he was down at the one-yard line following a 17-yard reception.  Humphries is a useful real-life player who lacks fantasy football value.
report: Adam Humphries caught 7-of-10 targets for 76 yards in the Bucs' Week 8 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Open at will as the Panthers focused on shutting down Mike Evans, DeSean Jackson and Chris Godwin, Humphries tied for the fourth-most yardage of his career. The touchdowns were his first since last Week 15. Humphries has been more involved in recent weeks, clearing 40 yards in three-straight games. He will be a desperation WR5 for Week 10 against the Redskins.
report: Adam Humphries caught 8-of-8 targets for 82 yards and two touchdowns in the Bucs' Week 9 loss to the Panthers.

impact: After seeing at least eight targets in three straight games, Humphries took a back seat to Chris Godwin (7-100) in this one as the No. 3 receiver.  Humphries will be a WR4 next week against the Giants in Newark.
report: Adam Humphries caught 2-of-3 targets for 53 yards in the Bucs' Week 10 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Humphries was on his way to another pedestrian outing before phoning a friend and hauling in another touchdown from Jameis Winston. The two had shown rapport in Winston's last stint as starter, and it showed again in the (slightly less than) two quarters he was in for Ryan Fitzpatrick (benched). It's hard not to consider Humphries a low-end WR3/FLEX against the Niners next week if Winston is again declared starter.
report: Adam Humphries caught 3-of-5 targets for 60 yards and one touchdown in the Bucs' Week 11 loss to the Giants.

impact: The Bucs' slot receiver has now caught a touchdown from Jameis Winston in back-to-back games.  Humphries' week-to-week usage is never reliable, but his outlooks have been betteer when Winston plays than with Ryan Fitzpatrick.  Humphries will be a volatile WR3 option when the Bucs host Carolina next.
report: Adam Humphries caught 6-of-6 targets for 54 yards and a touchdown in the Bucs' Week 12 win over the 49ers.

impact: It is ultimately positive news given what MRIs can reveal, but it is still a tough break for a player who started the season hot. The good news is the Bucs are on bye this week, so Howard might end up missing just one game. Cameron Brate will be a back-end TE1 if he gets the start against the Falcons in Week 6.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports O.J. Howard is out two-to-four weeks with a sprained MCL.

impact: It is not a surprise considering Howard was expected to miss two-to-four weeks with an MCL sprain. Cameron Brate should start and be a back-end TE1 against the Falcons this week.
report: O.J. Howard (knee) did not participate during Monday's practice.

impact: Howard sprained his MCL in Week 4 ahead of last week's bye, so the week off apparently did him a lot of favors.  He was in a brace on Wednesday, but it's an encouraging sign.
