impact: Winston is eligible to return from his three-game suspension, but it does not appear as if a starting job is waiting for him following Ryan Fitzpatrick's hot start. "Jameis is a member of our team and anxious to get him back," coach Dirk Koetter said after the game on Monday night. "And I know Jameis, whatever role he ends up in, I know Jameis will embrace that role and give it everything he's got." The last line tells the story, and that tale is one in which Fitzpatrick remains the starter for at least another week. It would be a surprise if that is not confirmed on Tuesday.
report: The Tampa Bay Times' Rick Stroud wrote it "seems unlikely" Jameis Winston starts this week against the Bears.

impact: All signs have pointed toward red-hot Ryan Fitzpatrick staying under center for Week 4, but coach Dirk Koetter has yet to publicly disclose his plans. He has told Winston and Fitzpatrick. Fitzpatrick has been receiving more first-team reps, and will be a QB1 if he's indeed the starter against Chicago.
report: Bucs activated QB Jameis Winston from the reserve/suspended list.

impact: Trailing 38-3 during the first half due to Mitchell Trubisky's career performance, the Bucs had no choice but to turn one dimensional and telegraph their play-calling. Fitzpatrick, who threw for 126 yards and one interception before exiting, didn't stand a chance against the Bears' pass rush. Winston will finish the game under center.
report: Jameis Winston replaced Ryan Fitzpatrick to start the third quarter.

impact: An 80% completion rate is actually impressive given that Winston was suspended and away from football during the first three weeks. He replaced Ryan Fitzpatrick, who tossed an interception in his own right, at the half and will seemingly stay under center (barring injury) for the remainder of the season. Winston will have the entire bye week to become acclimated to football again and will return in Week 6 as a sneaky low-end QB1 against the Falcons' injury-riddled secondary.
report: Jameis Winston completed 16-of-20 passes for 145 yards, one touchdown, and two picks in the Bucs' Week 4 loss to the Bears.

impact: Ryan Fitzpatrick saw to that against the Bears, erasing the remaining goodwill he built up in Weeks 1 and 2. Winston will be returning against the Falcons' perpetual-shootout machine defense. The matchup could not be more gorgeous. Forward-thinking fantasy owners should add Winston now with an eye toward streaming him in Week 6.
report: The Bucs have confirmed Jameis Winston will be their starting quarterback when they come off bye in Week 6.

impact: Winston made a couple mistakes in this game, but he delivered the big fantasy performance everyone was expecting. He was sharp early, completing four of his five passes on the opening drive including a good throw to Cameron Brate for a 15-yard touchdown, but the offense fell into a lull after that. Following an interception in the second quarter, Winston bounced back to lead a big touchdown drive he capped with a 10-yard throw to O.J. Howard, and the offense was in sync from that point on. Winston did throw an end-zone interception on the first drive of the second half -- a forced pass was tipped into the air -- but he led three straight scoring drives after that to make it a game. He got Tampa in position for a potential game-winner, but a wild final play in which he took a draw up the middle before attempting a lateral fell short. Winston faces a tougher matchup next week against the Browns, but he should be in the QB1 conversation the rest of the season.
report: Jameis Winston completed 30-of-41 passes for 395 yards, four touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Bucs' Week 6 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Winston is dealing with a minor hip injury though it shouldn't impact his status for Week 7. Coming off a dominant performance Sunday in Atlanta, Winston should be in the QB1 mix against Cleveland.
report: Jameis Winston (hip) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Browns.

impact: Winston turned in one his specials where he showcased all of the positives that made him the first overall selection in the 2015 draft and all of the mistakes that keep his status as a franchise quarterback in question. Winston threw two telegraphed interceptions and a lost a fumble on a scramble, but also shook off multiple sacks and extended drives in the run game consistently all afternoon. The highlight of his day was a 14-yard touchdown run where he sacrificed his body and dove for the end zone in the second quarter. Winston has now turned in games of 395 and 365 passing yards in his two starts. 300-yard passing games are just about something we should expect weekly in this Tampa Bay passing game. Despite his propensity for turnovers each week, Winston will be a high-floor fantasy option in Week 8 on the road against the Bengals.
report: Jameis Winston completed 32-of-52 passes for 365 yards with an interception while rushing 10 times for 55 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 7 win over the Browns.

impact: And all four of the picks were on him.  The fourth did in Winston, as it was pick sixed by Bengals rookie S Jessie Bates to put Cincinnati up 34-16.  Winston has been continually careless with the ball, and at this point coach Dirk Koetter had only one choice which was to hold Winston accountable.  The Bucs will have to decide this week whether to go back to Jameis for Week 9 against Carolina.
report: Jameis Winston was benched for Ryan Fitzpatrick after throwing his fourth interception of Sunday's Week 8 game against the Bengals.

impact: It's a seismic move for a Bucs organization that owes Winston no guaranteed money beyond 2018. His 2019 team option is guaranteed for injury only. That creates a huge incentive to keep him on the bench for the remainder of the season. For his part, embattled coach Dirk Koetter insisted he's taking the situation one week at a time. "We’re just looking at this week," Koetter claimed. Fitzpatrick is no one's idea of a long-term answer at quarterback, but he has unquestionably been better than Winston in OC Todd Monken's air raid attack. There's a non-zero percent chance Winston has played his final Bucs snap.
report: The Bucs have benched Jameis Winston and will move forward with Ryan Fitzpatrick as their starting quarterback.

impact: Winston came off the bench in the second half and engineered four consecutive touchdown drives, including a long 41-yard bomb to get Mike Evans on the board. His only offensive possession that didn't result in the Bucs hitting pay dirt just happened to include his game-ending interception -- his only turnover on the day. Fitzpatrick began with 167 yards and three picks before promptly being benched, so one has to think this is probably Winston's job moving forward (or at least until he rides the pine again). Whomever gets the nod in Week 12 gets an extremely juicy matchup against the Niners' leaky secondary.
report: Jameis Winston completed 12-of-16 passes for 199 yards, two touchdowns, and one pick in the Bucs' Week 11 loss to the Giants.

impact: It's hardly a surprise after Ryan Fitzpatrick threw seven interceptions in 2.5 games in place of Winston. Winston is going to turn the ball over a ton, as well, but he does so in a slightly more dignified fashion than FitzMagic. In a pass-heavy offense locked into weekly shootouts by the Bucs' terrible defense, Winston will be a QB1 more weeks than not. That includes Week 12 against the 49ers.
report: The Tampa Bay Times reports the Bucs will go back to Jameis Winston as their starting quarterback for Week 12.

impact: He added seven carries for 24 yards.  Most importantly, Winston avoided turnovers in a high-efficiency effort, also taking just one sack and finding Adam Humphries (28 yards) and Cameron Brate (6) for scores.  Winston's ups and downs have been maddeningly frustrating all year, but this is the kind of performance he is capable of when on his game.  Winston will remain a high-upside Q1 play when Tampa Bay hosts a burnable Carolina defense next.
report: Jameis Winston completed 29-of-38 passes for 312 yards and two touchdowns in the Bucs' Week 12 win over the 49ers.

impact: The accuser, known only as Kate P. in court documents, claims Winston grabbed her crotch while they waited in a drive-thru in Arizona back in 2016. The NFL suspended Winston three games after their investigation found the accusations "consistent and credible." The terms of the settlement are not known, but the original suit was for more than $75,000 in damages.
report: Jameis Winston has agreed to a settlement in a sexual battery lawsuit filed by an Arizona Uber driver in September.

impact: Winston also led the Bucs with 48 yards rushing. It's the second straight turnover-free game from Winston, who's managed consecutive wins since retaking the starting job. Both of Winston's touchdowns were short red-zone throws to Adam Humphries and Chris Godwin. Winston get another great matchup in a likely Week 14 shootout with the Saints.
report: Jameis Winston completed 20-of-30 passes for 249 yards and two touchdowns in Week 13 against the Panthers.

impact: In a game James Conner left early, Samuels saw five carries and four targets against the Panthers last Thursday night. That usage is unlikely to continue with Conner fully expected back this week, but it does make Samuels something of an interesting handcuff, especially since he has tight end eligibility in Yahoo leagues.
report: Steelers coach Mike Tomlin said the arrow is "continually pointing up" for fifth-round RB Jaylen Samuels.

impact: This makes sense considering Jaylen Samuels has 12 career carries to his name and Stevan Ridley has carried the load before, most recently Week 17 of last season. Even so, Samuels is the better fantasy bet and the top waiver add of the week.
report: Steelers coach Mike Tomlin said the Steelers' "intention" is to use a running back by committee.

impact: While Samuels will make the start, he said Stevan Ridley is expected to get the second series, and the two backs will rotate throughout the game.  That may be the plan for now, but it can change Sunday depending on how Samuels and Ridley look.  We still like Samuels as an upside RB2 play.
report: Jaylen Samuels said he'll be the Steelers' starting running back Week 14 against the Raiders.

impact: It was the rookie's regular season debut. With Tampa Bay trailing 38-3 at the half, Jones and teammate Peyton Barber never stood a chance on the ground. One positive takeaway is that Jones out-touched Barber 11-8 and led the Buccaneers in rushing yards (29). He'll likely be the first man up when the Bucs return from their Week 5 bye.
report: Ronald Jones handled 10 carries for 29 yards in the Bucs' Week 4 loss to the Bears.

impact: The total was 11 fewer than Peyton Barber, but the rookie out-touched Barber 11-8 and led the team in rushing, albeit with a measly 29 yards. Barber has not shown much of anything over the first month, so it would not be surprising if Jones emerges from the bye week as the lead back.
report: Ronald Jones played 20-of-63 snaps (32 percent) Week 4 against the Bears.

impact: There was some hope Jones would emerge from the bye with a bigger role, but that did not happen. Peyton Barber both started and worked as the clear lead back. Jones appeared to be the back of choice in passing situations throughout the game, but Barber was in late and ended up with a receiving score. Jones is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Ronald Jones rushed once for three yards and hauled in all three of his targets for 16 yards in the Bucs' Week 6 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Jones was hardly used until Peyton Barber appeared to suffer an injury in the third quarter. After that, he tallied five of his six touches in the game, including a 2-yard rushing score set up by a long O.J. Howard reception. Jones may get an uptick if Barber is indeed injured heading into Week 8, but he is only a FLEX option at best when the Bucs head to Cincinnati.
report: Ronald Jones rushed six times for 13 yards and a touchdown while catching his lone target for 15 yards in Sunday's Week 7 win over the Browns.

impact: Peyton Barber didn't practice with an undisclosed injury.  That left Jones and Shaun Wilson along with special-teamer and pass-pro specialist Jacquizz Rodgers.  If Barber is unable to play Sunday, Jones would enter the RB3/FLEX mix, but the Bucs' way to move the ball is obviously through the air as one of the most pass-heavy teams in the league.  It's a situation to monitor.
report: Rondald Jones handled the "majority" of the first-team reps at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He had one yard on three touches before departing.  Jones has struggled mightily throughout his rookie year and is droppable in all fantasy leagues.  The Bucs will move forward with Jacquizz Rodgers behind Peyton Barber.
report: Ronald Jones (hamstring) is done for the day in Week 8.

impact: This narrows Tampa Bay's three-man backfield to two, which should help the fantasy stock of Peyton Barber a bit.  Jacquizz Rodgers has been working as the Bucs' primary passing-down back.  Jones is droppable in all season-long leagues.
report: Bucs rookie RB Ronald Jones (hamstring) is expected to miss "a few weeks."

impact: Jones is week to week with a hamstring issue.  Curry has an ankle injury.
report: Bucs declared RB Ronald Jones, OG Alex Cappa, DE Vinny Curry, QB Ryan Griffin, OG Rakeem Nunez-Roches, OG Evan Smith, and CB M.J. Stewart inactive for Week 10 against the Redskins.

impact: Jones expects to play Sunday after missing the last three games. He'll be part of a three-back committee with Peyton Barber and Jacquizz Rodgers if he returns.
report: Ronald Jones (hamstring) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Jones is tentatively on track to return after missing the past two games. He would not be a FLEX option behind Peyton Barber and would likely be No. 3 on the depth chart behind Barber and Jacquizz Rodgers.
report: Ronald Jones (hamstring) got in another limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Jones was expected back this week after resuming limited practice, but apparently the coaching staff didn't feel he was ready yet. Without him, the Bucs will feature Peyton Barber with Jacquizz Rodgers filling in the gaps on passing downs.
report: Ronald Jones (hamstring) is out for Week 11 against the Giants.

impact: It's a surprise with Jones an early rule out last week. Jones will return after missing the last three games, but he's not more than a low volume change-of-pace to Peyton Barber.
report: Ronald Jones (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 12.

impact: It would be a surprise if Jones sat after getting in a full week of practice. Assuming he plays, the second-round rookie would serve as a change-of-pace for lead back Peyton Barber.
report: Ronald Jones (hamstring) is questionable for Week 12 against the 49ers.

impact: With Jones still sidelined due to hamstring woes, Jacquizz Rodgers will main the primary backup to Peyton Barber against San Francisco.
report: Bucs declared RB Ronald Jones, LB Lavonte David, DL Rakeem Nunez-Roches, QB Ryan Griffin, S Josh Evans, CB M.J. Stewart, and S Donald Igwebuike inactive for Week 12 against the 49ers.

impact: Jones has been sidelined since Week 8 with a hamstring injury, but he is good to go following a full week of practice. That said, he is unlikely to have a big role behind Peyton Barber.
report: Bucs coach Dirk Koetter said Ronald Jones (hamstring) will be active Week 13 against the Panthers.

impact: Barber was not targeted in the passing game, where Jacquizz Rodgers came off the bench to make four catches. Barber was fortunate to score his goal-line touchdown after Adam Humphries was ruled down at the one the play before. Ronald Jones' hamstring injury does narrow the Bucs' backfield from three to two, raising Barber's floor as an RB2/flex option entering Week 9 at Carolina.
report: Peyton Barber rushed 19 times for 85 yards and a touchdown in the Bucs' Week 8 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Barber played through the injury last week. With Ronald Jones sidelined, it's a concern to the Bucs' running game. Barber should be fine for Week 9 but may not be at 100 percent.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The lead back who won't go away, Barber will be ready for an 18-20 touch day in what should be a high-scoring game with the Panthers.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Barber appeared to weak his ankle injury late, but there were no words of injury alarm after the fact. His practice status will be worth watching during the week. The Redskins are extremely stout against the run. With negative game script always a risk, Barber will not be a recommended RB2 for Week 10.
report: Peyton Barber rushed 11 times for 31 yards in the Bucs' Week 9 loss to the Panthers, adding two receptions for nine additional yards.

impact: The injury has bothered him for a few weeks, though Barber has yet to miss a game because of it. That should be the case again Sunday when the Bucs host Washington. The Bucs' offense is as pass-centric as any in the league but Barber still warrants consideration as a workmanlike RB2/3 in most formats.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: There's no concern over Barber's status for Sunday's home game against the Redskins. The third-year Auburn alum hasn't done much to move the needle this year, producing 422 yards from scrimmage on 112 touches for the 3-5 Bucs. He comes in at No. 32 in RotoPat's Week 10 running back rankings.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: He finished the week with a full session after being limited on Wednesday and Thursday. Despite his starting role, the third-year plodder is just an RB3 in fantasy.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle) wasn't listed on the Buccaneers' final injury report for Week 10 against the Redskins.

impact: He caught his lone pass-game target for five yards.  Barber had a couple runs of 12 and 13 yards back-to-back but did little else as the Bucs failed to score a touchdown.  Barber is a weekly TD-or-bust RB3.  The Giants are up next.
report: Peyton Barber rushed 13 times for 61 yards in the Bucs' Week 10 loss to the Redskins.

impact: The shoulder injury appears to be new, though we're guessing it's nothing serious. Barber hasn't moved the needle much this year, averaging an underwhelming 3.7 yards per carry with two touchdowns (one rushing, one receiving) in nine games for Tampa. He'll be a touchdown-dependent RB3 when the Bucs visit the Giants in Week 11.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle, shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: There's been no indication Barber's Week 11 status is in question. Even if Ronald Jones (hamstring) manages to return, Barber will remain a volume-based FLEX play against the Giants.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle, shoulder) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Barber was taken off the injury report after getting in a full practice on Friday. He'll again function as the Bucs' lead ball-carrier, though he could lose passing-down reps to Jacquizz Rodgers, who broke out for 102 receiving yards in last week's loss to Washington.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle, shoulder) wasn't listed on the Buccaneers' final injury report for Week 11 against the Giants.

impact: He nearly scored a second touchdown on the goal line, but fumbled it forward into the cradling arms of Mike Evans. The Giants had actually been stout in the trenches despite trading away run-stuffing NT Damon Harrison at the deadline, so this outing is a bit of a shock. His 18 carries without rookie Ronald Jones (hamstring) available were certainly encouraging. Whether it's Jameis Winston or Ryan Fitzpatrick under center in Week 12, consider Barber a usage-based touchdown-dependent RB3/FLEX against San Francisco's front-seven.
report: Peyton Barber rushed 18 times for 106 yards and one touchdown in the Bucs' Week 11 loss to the Giants.

impact: He out-touched Jacquizz Rodgers 20 to 9, earning more work as Tampa Bay operated in positive game script while protecting their lead in Sunday's 27-9 victory.  Not flashy or capable of ripping frequent big plays, Barber will remain a touchdown-dependent, volume-based RB2 option when the Bucs host the Panthers' swiss-cheese defense next.
report: Peyton Barber rushed 18 times for 47 yards and a touchdown and caught 2-of-2 targets for 16 yards in the Bucs' Week 12 win over the 49ers.

impact: It's a downgrade for Barber, who was listed as a full participant on Thursday. Regardless, he should be good to go Sunday when the Bucs host Carolina. He's RotoPat's No. 31 running back for Week 13.
report: Peyton Barber (ankle, shoulder) was limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Barber had good volume early but wasn't effective with his carries. He didn't make any notable plays, with his touchdown coming on a goal-line conversion. Ronald Jones saw just four carries behind Barber and remained a non-factor in his return from injury. Barber is a touchdown-dependent RB3 for Week 14.
report: Peyton Barber rushed 16 times for 45 yards and a touchdown in Week 13 against the Panthers.

impact: Fitzpatrick wasn't listed last week so it's a new "injury." There's been zero indication Fitz will be slowed against the Steelers, where, inexplicably, he can be fired up as a QB1 streamer.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick is listed on the Week 3 injury report with a knee issue but is practicing in full.

impact: The Bucs listed Fitzpatrick with a knee injury earlier in the week, but he practiced fully. Fitzpatrick is our No. 9-ranked quarterback for Monday night's matchup with the Steelers.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick was removed from the Week 3 injury report.

impact: Fitzpatrick became the first quarterback in league history to pass for 400 yards in three consecutive games. The night started slow for Fitzmagic and the Bucs' offense, who went into the half trailing 30-10. Tampa Bay rallied and scored the final 17 points of the evening, though, falling just one Ben Roethlisberger scramble-and-heave to JuJu Smith-Schuster away from getting the ball back and potentially pulling off the comeback win. Fitzpatrick has been absurd through three games, totaling 1,230 passing yards, 11 touchdowns, and four picks. With Jameis Winston set to return, only time will tell whether the record book's newest member will have a starting gig in Week 4.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick completed 30-of-50 passes for 411 yards, three touchdowns, and three interceptions in the Bucs' Week 3 loss to the Steelers.

impact: This has been expected for awhile. With Tampa coming off a short week, Fitzpatrick is in line to make at least another start. It's his job to lose after three straight 400-plus yard games. The Bucs plan to use their roster exemption on Jameis Winston, so there might not be anything official until later in the week.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports "all signs point" to Ryan Fitzpatrick starting Week 4 against Chicago.

impact: Though the Bucs haven't made an official decision yet, all signs point to Fitzpatrick keeping his job for at least another week. It makes sense with Fitzpatrick off to the best start of his career and Jameis Winston coming off a three-week absence. The Bucs also have their bye coming up in Week 5, which would give Winston another week to get up to speed. FitzMagic's Week 4 matchup against Chicago poses a difficult challenge, though we said the same when the 35-year-old went up against the Saints and Eagles earlier this year and look how that turned out.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Ryan Fitzpatrick received a majority of the reps at Wednesday's practice.

impact: As expected. Fitzpatrick received a majority of the Bucs' first-team reps at practice this week, a telling sign he'll be under center at kick-off. The decision to roll with "FitzMagic" makes sense given that Jameis Winston is coming off a three-week absence and Tampa Bay's bye is right around the corner in Week 5. The Bearded Wonder is tasked with an incredibly difficult matchup versus the Bears' daunting pass rush, but he did slice up the Eagles' and Steelers' secondary earlier in the year. The 35-year-old could legitimately land the Bucs' starting gig with another terrific outing Sunday.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick is expected to start in Week 4 against the Bears.

impact: Koetter strongly considered benching Fitzpatrick for Ryan Griffin (seriously) after his third interception in last week's Monday night loss to Pittsburgh. Fitzpatrick recovered after that and eventually wound up throwing for over 400 yards, but it's clear that he'll be entering Week 4 on an extremely short leash. With Fitzpatrick at risk of an in-game benching, don't be surprised if the recently-activated Jameis Winston sees action Sunday at Soldier Field.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Buccaneers coach Dirk Koetter was "one or two plays away" from benching Ryan Fitzpatrick in Week 3.

impact: Fitzpatrick was reportedly only "one or two plays away" from being benched in Week 3, too. Coach Dirk Koetter pulled the trigger in Week 4 as the Bucs went into the half trailing 38-3. Fitzpatrick totaled 126 yards and one interception before riding the pine.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick was replaced by Jameis Winston to start the third quarter in Week 4 against the Bears.

impact: He added an 18-yard scramble and a two-point conversion to Chris Godwin.  FitzMagic rallied the Bucs back from a multi-score deficit after Winston threw four interceptions, but it wasn't enough as the Bengals held on with a game-winning field goal in overtime.  We have to believe the Bucs will stick with Fitzpatrick as their Week 9 starter at Carolina.  Winston has simply been too careless with the football,  and Fitzpatrick has shined in Todd Monken's offense.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick replaced Jameis Winston in the third quarter of Sunday's Week 8 loss to Cincinnati and completed 11-of-15 passes for 194 yards and two touchdowns.

impact: "We’re just looking at this week," coach Dirk Koetter claimed. Considering the ramifications it has for Jameis Winston — his 2019 contract is guaranteed for injury only — that's hard to believe. Fitzpatrick, though uneven as usual, has been demonstrably better than Winston in OC Todd Monken's air raid. Stunningly, Fitzpatrick has cleared 400 yards in all three games he has played from start to finish this season. He will be in the QB1 mix against the Panthers.
report: The Bucs have announced Ryan Fitzpatrick as their Week 9 starter at quarterback.

impact: In true Fitz fashion, he kept throwing touchdowns and attempting deep bombs but also tossed a pair of ghastly interceptions. The first was air mailed 10 feet over Mike Evans' head in the first half. The second was a fourth quarter arm punt. Fitz found each of O.J. Howard and Adam Humphries for a pair of scores. He completed just five total passes to Mike Evans, DeSean Jackson and Chris Godwin. Fitz was bad enough in the first half that coach Dirk Koetter was asked if he considered going to Jameis Winston. His response was a succinct "no." He also confirmed Fitz will remain the starter for Week 10, where he will be dealing with the keepaway Redskins.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick completed 24-of-40 passes for 243 yards, four touchdowns and two interceptions in the Bucs' 42-28, Week 9 loss to the Panthers.

impact: He added 35 rushing yards on eight scampers.  The Bucs moved the ball with ease all afternoon, but the offense fell totally apart once it got deep into Redskins territory.  FitzMagic lost a fumble on a sack on 2nd-and-goal from the two-yard line late in the fourth quarter after missing a wide-open Mike Evans on the previous play, spiking it at his feet.  His first interception was an overthrow at the goal line over Chris Godwin's head, and the second was thrown right to the cornerback deep in Tampa's own end.  The yards were great for Fitzpatrick, but nothing else went right.  The Bucs will head on the road to face the Giants in Week 11.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick completed 29-of-41 passes for 406 yards, no touchdowns, and to interceptions in the Bucs' 16-3, Week 10 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Fitz had another turnover-marred debacle in Sunday's loss to the Redskins, but the Bucs believe he gives them their best chance to win. They may be right. The Bucs do not want to risk injury to Jameis Winston, whose 2019 team option is guaranteed for injury only. Fitz will have to go all the way off the rails for Winston to be re-inserted, which, let's be honest, is not a far-fetched scenario.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick will remain the Bucs' starter for Week 11 against the Giants.

impact: Fitzpatrick tossed three picks, including one grenade that might as well have been handed to a defender, before being benched Sunday. Fitzpatrick may have started his final game for the Bucs this season.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick was replaced by Jameis Winston in the second half Sunday.

impact: The final straw was Fitzpatrick's duck he threw in the back of the end zone to DeSean Jackson while the receiver was being triple-teamed. Fitzpatrick did rush one in from the goal line, salvaging what would've been an even worse day, but the magic had clearly run its course. Jameis Winston came off the pine and threw for more yards (199) in less than two quarters, likely signaling the end of Fitzpatrick's (second) stint as starter.
report: Ryan Fitzpatrick completed 12-of-16 passes for 167 yards and three interceptions before being benched in the Bucs' Week 11 loss to the Giants.

impact: Dalvin Cook played every snap of the first two series before Murray opened the third series and then handled much of the clock-killing work in the fourth quarter.  Neither back found the end zone, while Murray wasn't targeted in the pass game.  Murray is little more than a handcuff to Cook owners.
report: Latavius Murray rushed 11 times for 42 yards in the Vikings' Week 1 win over the 49ers.

impact: Murray was stuck on two carries before Dalvin Cook left with a hamstring injury in overtime. That issue is reportedly minor -- Cook described it as a cramp -- but it is enough to keep Murray on fantasy rosters for now. That said, he is nothing more than a handcuff.
report: Latavius Murray rushed four times for 19 yards in the Vikings' Week 2 tie with the Packers.

impact: Oof. What initially appeared to be the perfect game script situation for Murray turned out to be an absolute nightmare for the Vikings' offense. Minnesota's offensive line was a travesty throughout the afternoon, allowing Kirk Cousins to be blindsided and fumble on the team's first two offensive possessions. By the time the Vikings got the ball back for their third possession, they were already staring down the barrel of a 17-0 deficit. Minnesota's backfield received a paltry four carries on the day, totaling 12 rushing yards (3.0 YPC). Murray's five catches fortunately salvaged what could've been an even bigger disaster of an outing. Dalvin Cook is expected to return on Thursday against the Rams.
report: Latavius Murray rushed two times for one yard and added five catches for 30 receiving yards in the Vikings' Week 3 loss to the Bills.

impact: Even with lead back Dalvin Cook on a pitch count in his return from a hamstring injury, Murray failed to make an impact. Minnesota essentially abandoned its running game playing from behind in the second half, which obviously didn’t help matters. Murray’s biggest contribution came when he converted a two-point conversion on a screen pass from Kirk Cousins late in the third quarter. Latavius has managed just three yards on four carries over his last two games and won’t be an appealing fantasy option against the Eagles in Week 5.
report: Latavius Murray collected just two yards on two carries while adding two catches for 16 yards on two targets Thursday in Minnesota’s Week 4 loss to the Rams.

impact: It was yet another disappointing affair for a player who is now averaging 3.53 yards per carry. Ominously, Murray ceded both a red zone target and goal line carry to "Roc Thomas." If Dalvin Cook (hamstring) can ever get healthy, Murray might have a hard time carving out a role. For now, Cook seems unlikely to play in Week 6, leaving Murray in the desperation FLEX mix against the Cardinals.
report: Latavius Murray rushed 11 times for 42 yards in the Vikings' Week 5 win over the Eagles, adding two receptions for 14 additional yards.

impact: With Dalvin Cook out, Murray rebounded from his disappointing Week 5. He ripped the Cardinals for three 20-plus yard runs, with his touchdown coming on a highlight 21-yarder where he stiff-armed into the end-zone. Murray came into Sunday averaging just 3.5 YPC, but he made a case for a role when Dalvin Cook returns. Cook would be a plug-and-play RB2 if Cook isn't back for Week 7.
report: Latavius Murray rushed 24 times for 155 yards and a touchdown in the Vikings' Week 6 win over the Cardinals.

impact: He added two catches for 14 yards on a pair of targets.  Murray's first score was an 11-yard scamper up the middle, and the second was an untouched run through the left side from 38 yards away.  With Dalvin Cook still struggling to get healthy, Murray has emerged as a strong RB2 with reliable workloads.  If Cook sits again, Murray will again be in play Week 8 against the Saints.
report: Latavius Murray rushed 15 times for 69 yards and two touchdowns in the Vikings' Week 7 win over the Jets.

impact: Murray converted a goal-line carry after a pass interference set up first-and-goal from the one-yard line. He was stuffed on his only other goal-line chance. Murray didn't have much of a second half impact with the Saints dominating time of possession. He's scored a touchdown in three straight games with Dalvin Cook sidelined. Murray has played well enough to have a role even when Cook returns.
report: Latavius Murray had 13 carries for 56 yards and a touchdown and caught 5-of-6 targets for 39 yards in Week 8 against the Saints.

impact: He caught his lone target for 16 yards.  Murray made the start for the Vikings, but Dalvin Cook came in on third down the opening series and eventually ended up out-snapping and out-touching Murray.  Cook had a 70-yard run in his return from a hamstring injury and totaled 109 yards on 14 touches.  The Vikings are now headed into their bye, Cook is healthy, and Murray will now go back to 8-12 touches as the clear No. 2 back.  His RB1/2 days are over unless Cook gets hurt again.
report: Latavius Murray rushed 10 times for 31 yards and one touchdown in the Vikings' Week 9 win over the Lions.

impact: Murray took a backseat to a healthy Dalvin Cook this week. He had a few carries after Cook lost an early fumble, but wasn't able to do anything with his limited touches. Murray isn't more than a touchdown-dependent change-of-pace.
report: Latavius Murray rushed four times for five yards in Week 12 against Chicago.

impact: Murray had more carries and yards than Dalvin Cook, but most of them came in clock-killing mode late in the fourth quarter. He remains a distant second in line for touches behind Cook. Murray is just a short yardage change-of-pace.
report: Latavius Murray had 11 carries for 33 yards in Week 12 against the Packers.

impact: Murray converted a crucial fourth-and-one opportunity in the fourth quarter (barely) but other than that, he didn't have much impact on Sunday's proceedings. Lead back Dalvin Cook out-touched Murray by a convincing 17-6 margin while out-producing him by over 90 yards from scrimmage. Unless you're stashing him as a handcuff, Murray is probably best left on the waiver wire.
report: Latavius Murray chewed up 11 yards on four carries while securing both of his targets for an additional three yards Sunday in Minnesota’s Week 13 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Rudolph is a healthy scratch. LB Bud Dupree (illness), OT Marcus Gilbert (knee), QB Ben Roethlisberger (finger) and CB Coty Sensabaugh (toe) are ready to roll for Sunday's game in Baltimore.
report: Steelers declared QB Mason Rudolph, CB Brian Allen, S Marcus Allen, OT Zach Banner, OT Marcus Gilbert, WR Justin Hunter and DE L.T. Walton inactive for Week 9 against the Ravens.

impact: Washington went under the knife in mid-August. Doug Martin and Jalen Richard will back up Marshawn Lynch against the Rams. Washington will be returning to No. 3/4 duties whenever he finally gets healthy.
report: DeAndre Washington (knee scope) has yet to resume practicing.

impact: It's his first practice since mid-August surgery. Washington figures to be moved back slowly after the extended layoff. He isn't needed behind Marshawn Lynch, Doug Martin, and Jalen Richard.
report: DeAndre Washington (knee scope) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Washington returned to practice for the first time this week. He only got in limited reps, so it would be a surprise if he was active. The Raiders have no reason to rush Washington with Marshawn Lynch, Doug Martin, and Jalen Richard all healthy.
report: DeAndre Washington (knee) is questionable for Week 2 against the Broncos.

impact: Washington is healthy enough to return, but that does not mean he will be active with Marshawn Lynch, Doug Martin, and Jalen Richard all ahead of him on the depth chart. He can be left on the wire in redraft leagues.
report: DeAndre Washington (knee) is not listed on the Week 3 injury report.

impact: The 12 carries doubled Washington's previous season total. He was involved because Doug Martin injured his ankle late in the first half. Washington will be in for plenty of work if Martin misses Week 12, but he will not be a recommended FLEX option against the Ravens' lockdown defense.
report: DeAndre Washington rushed 12 times for 32 yards in the Raiders' Week 11 win over the Cardinals.

impact: With the Steelers down 21-0 after 13 minutes, Roethlisberger had nearly an entire afternoon of comeback mode/garbage time. The Steelers were unwatchable early on, beginning the game with two three-and-outs. Ben then got cooking, targeting Antonio Brown and JuJu Smith-Schuster a combined 36 times. He also consistently found TE Jesse James for big plays. Rookie big-play threat James Washington was heavily involved early after a Week 1 mothballing. The Steelers actually came close to pulling off the comeback, but the early deficit was too much to overcome on an afternoon where Patrick Mahomes piled up six touchdowns. Roethlisberger has an attackable matchup in the Bucs for Week 3.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 39-of-60 passes for 452 yards and three touchdowns in the Steelers' 42-37, Week 2 loss to the Chiefs, adding a rushing score.

impact: Roethlisberger and the Steelers' offense shook off a quick three-and-out and interception during their first two possessions to eventually take a 30-10 lead into the half. Big Ben's first touchdown was a YAC-filled 75-yard touchdown pass over the middle to emerging starter Vance McDonald, followed by touchdowns to Antonio Brown and Ryan Switzer before heading to the locker room. Pittsburgh was shutout in the second half, but Roethlisberger did enough damage early on to finish as the week's QB10. The Steelers have a divisional showdown next Sunday night against a Ravens defense that could be without both CB Jimmy Smith and LB C.J. Mosley.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 30-of-38 passes for 353 yards, three touchdowns, and one interception in the Steelers' Week 3 victory over the Buccaneers.

impact: Roethlisberger had a solid first half, but the Steelers' offense went in the tank over the final two quarters. His only touchdown came on an extended play to Antonio Brown from 26 yards out. It's the first game of the season Roethlisberger hasn't passed for at least 300 yards. Roethlisberger is on pace for 32 touchdowns and  21 interceptions through the first month of the season. He'll get a matchup with the Falcons in Week 5.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 27-of-47 passes for 274 yards with one touchdown and an interception in the Steelers' Week 5 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Roethlisberger was on track for a disappointing day before he finally got his Antonio Brown connection going in the second half. After entering the break 2-of-8 for eight yards and an interception targeting his No. 1 wideout, Ben found Brown six times for 93 yards and two scores over the final two quarters. The second was the highlight. Brown got a step on Robert Alford down the left sideline and Roethlisberger hit him in stride for a 47-yarder. Roethlisberger gets the Bengals on the road for Week 6.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 19-of-29 passes for 250 yards, three touchdowns and an interception in the Steelers' 41-17, Week 5 win over the Falcons.

impact: Big Ben had a clean pocket all day, not getting sacked at all, and was pretty unlucky to only have one touchdown pass.  JuJu Smith-Schuster was ruled down at the one-yard line on a play where it appeared he actually did score.  The Steelers also failed to convert a 1st-and-goal situation from the one-yard line, settling for a field goal.  Ben's lone score was a 31-yard quick slant, game-winner to Antonio Brown with 10 seconds left.  The Steelers now head into their bye week.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 32-of-46 passes for 369 yards and one touchdown in the Steelers' Week 6 win over the Bengals.

impact: Roethlisberger found Antonio Brown for both scores in the second quarter. The first was a 43-yard play in which Roethlisberger climbed the pocket and Brown got behind the Cleveland defense. The second was a 1-yard screen right before the first half came to a close. With the Steelers up big, Roethlisberger wasn't asked to do much in the second half as the Steelers ran wild after the break. Roethlisberger will find himself in a tough road matchup against the Ravens in Week 9.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 24-of-36 passes for 257 yards and two touchdowns with one interception in Sunday's Week 8 win over the Browns.

impact: Even on the non-throwing hand, that is far from ideal for a quarterback, but coach Mike Tomlin did not seem concerned at his Tuesday press conference. Big Ben will undoubtedly get in some limited practices this week. He will be a lower-end QB1 against the Ravens' elite defense.
report: Ben Roethlisberger has a fractured left (non-throwing) index finger, but the Steelers do not expect him to miss any time.

impact: Roethlisberger got the day off on Wednesday but returned to a full workload at Thursday's session. He's dealing with a broken finger, but it's on his non-throwing hand. Big Ben doesn't have the easiest matchup this week, but he'll still be in the QB1 conversation.
report: Ben Roethlisberger (finger) returned to a full practice on Thursday.

impact: Roethlisberger is dealing with a broken finger but it's on his non-throwing hand. He finished the week with full practices on Thursday and Friday after sitting out Wednesday's session. Roethlisberger has struggled in Baltimore throughout his career, which lowers him to back-end QB1 status for Week 9.
report: Ben Roethlisberger (finger) wasn't listed on the Steelers' final injury report for Week 9 against the Ravens.

impact: Ben was sacked once for a loss of 10 yards. Roethlisberger looked more tentative than usual playing through a broken finger on his non-throwing hand but still managed a pair of touchdowns including one to Antonio Brown, his ninth of the season. He took an enormous hit from Darius Smith after taking off on a fourth-quarter scramble, coming down hard on his right shoulder. Roethlisberger looked to be in serious pain but returned after missing just one snap. Believe it or not, this was actually Roethlisberger's first career three-touchdown game in Baltimore. The veteran will probably be feeling it after this one, so don't expect him to practice much ahead of Thursday night's showdown with Carolina.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 28-of-47 passes for 270 yards and two touchdowns while adding four yards and another touchdown on two carries Sunday in the Steelers’ Week 9 win over the Ravens.

impact: There was never any doubt over his status. The Steelers also removed James Washington (knee) and Ryan Switzer (ankle) from this week's injury report.
report: Ben Roethlisberger (finger) was left off the Week 10 injury report.

impact: For the fourth time in his career, Roethlisberger finished with a perfect passer rating. He set the tone with a 75-yard touchdown to JuJu Smith-Schuster on the Steelers' first play from scrimmage. He also found Antonio Brown for a 53-yard score. The rest of the scores went to Vance McDonald, Jesse James and Jaylen Samuels (yes, really). The performance was extra impressive since Ben was playing banged up on a short week. Roethlisberger is not going to fare as well in Week 11, where the Steelers are venturing on the road to Jacksonville.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 22-of-25 passes for 328 yards and five touchdowns in Pittsburgh's Week 10 game against the Panthers, taking a seat with the Steelers winning 52-14 in the fourth quarter.

impact: Roethlisberger also added the game-winning 1-yard touchdown run with five seconds left to give the Steelers a come from behind victory after being behind 16-0 with 2:09 left in the third quarter. Things got off to a disastrous start as Roethlisberger had just 53 passing yards at the half with two interceptions. He found Antonio Brown on a 78-yard busted coverage to get the Steelers on the board and then added an 11-yard score to Vance McDonald late in the fourth quarter. Roethlisberger will be a QB1 option next week on the road in Denver.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 27-of-47 passes for 314 yards with two touchdowns and three interceptions in Sunday's Week 11 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Pittsburgh moved the ball almost at will in the first half, but they just could not find the end zone. Their first drive ended with a blocked field goal, their second ended with a fumble at the goal line, and they needed a fake field goal to score just before halftime. Those miscues had nothing to do with Roethlisberger, who finished the first half with 221 yards. Ben’s best throw of the day came in the third quarter. Standing in his own end zone, Roethlisberger managed to find JuJu Smith-Schuster despite pressure in his face, and the receiver took it 97 yards for a touchdown. It was mostly downhill from there. Ben allowed the Broncos back into the game with an interception, another drive ended with a fumble, and he threw a terrible interception in the end zone to end the game. Despite giving the game away, Roethlisberger topped 450 yards for the second time this season. He will remain a solid QB1 despite a tough matchup against the Chargers on Sunday night.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 41-of-56 passes for 462 yards, a touchdown, and two interceptions in the Steelers' Week 12 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It’s another mixed game from Roethlisberger, who now has six interceptions over three weeks. The Steelers rolled the Chargers in the first half before blowing their lead in the final two quarters. Roethlisberger rallied for a tying touchdown late, but it wasn’t enough to avoid another loss. The Steelers are now just a half-game ahead of the Ravens in the AFC North. Roethlisberger gets a cupcake matchup with the Raiders in Week 14.
report: Ben Roethlisberger completed 29-of-45 passes for 281 yards with two touchdowns and an interception in the Steelers' Week 13 loss to the Chargers.

impact: This was expected after Cook was held out of Thursday's practice. Cook's had multiple setbacks with his hamstring injury, so he's not a lock to be back next week. Latavius Murray will make another start in Cook's place.
report: Dalvin Cook (hamstring) has been ruled out for Week 7 against the Jets.

impact: No surprises in this group.  Latavius Murray will get the nod at running back against the Jets and is a locked-in RB2 play.
report: Vikings declared RB Dalvin Cook, S Andrew Sendejo, DE Everson Griffen, DT Linval Joseph, OT Riley Reiff, LB Devante Downs, and QB Kyle Sloter inactive for Week 7 against the Jets.

impact: It's been a lost season for Cook after last year's ACL tear.  He's battled an ongoing hamstring injury suffered last month against the Rams.  Cook has tried numerous times to practice, but he's seemingly aggravated it each time.  The Vikings appear ready to just sit him down through the bye week in hopes of having Cook for the stretch run.  Latavius Murray will continue to carry the load in the meantime with rookies Roc Thomas and Mike Boone as the backups.
report: ESPN Vikings reporter Courtney Cronin reports multiple league sources have indicated Dalvin Cook (hamstring) will be out through the Week 10 bye.

impact: ESPN's Courtney Cronin had previously reported that Cook would be out at least through the Vikings' bye in Week 10. That might still be the case, though the 23-year-old is probably anxious to get back on the field after missing so much time. Even if Cook returns Sunday against Detroit, he'll likely be on a strict snap count. Cook's return would obviously be bad news for Latavius Murray, who has been a weekly RB2 throughout his absence.
report: Dalvin Cook (hamstring) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Cook, the shrug emoji of running backs, has now taken part in both practices this week. The belief had been that Cook would be out through the Vikings' bye, but now it's anyone's guess. If he somehow suits up Sunday against the Lions, it would come at the expense of Latavius Murray, who has seen workhorse usage throughout Cook's absence.
report: Dalvin Cook (hamstring) practiced again on Thursday.

impact: Cook did say he "feels great." Per SiriusXM's Adam Caplan, the general feeling is that Cook is still more likely to return following the Vikings' Week 10 bye than this Sunday. Cook has gotten in back-to-back limited practices. The Vikings probably want to see him go "full" after he returned too quickly earlier this season.
report: Dalvin Cook (hamstring) is unsure if he will return from his four-game absence against the Lions.

impact: We're not sure why the Vikings plan to rush Cook out there with the bye next week, especially with Latavius Murray producing like a top-10 back the last month, but it is what it is.  Ultimately, we expect Murray to remain the lead dog with Cook mixing in to knock some rust off and feel good heading into the open date ahead of the stretch run.  Murray is still an RB2.  Cook will be desperation RB3/FLEX.  Murray owners can remain confident in starting him.
report: The Minneapolis Star-Tribune's Ben Goessling reports the Vikings "plan" to have Dalvin Cook (hamstring) active and play "limited" reps Week 9 against the Lions.

impact: The plan is for Cook to see limited snaps against Detroit. It's a surprise given that Cook was expected to be out through the Vikings' bye in Week 10, but obviously he's recovered sooner than expected. Given his restrictions, it will be hard to trust Cook as anything more than a last-ditch RB3/flex. His return is a slight downgrade for Latavius Murray, who should now be regarded as a lower-end RB2.
report: Dalvin Cook (hamstring) is questionable for Week 9 against the Lions.

impact: This differs slightly from the number given by Ben Goessling of the Minneapolis Star-Tribune, who heard that Cook will play 15-20 snaps "at most." Either way, Cook won't see anywhere close to a full workload in his first game back from a nagging hamstring injury. Latavius Murray will see a slight workload reduction upon Cook's return, though it probably won't be enough to take him off the RB2 map.
report: According to ESPN Vikings reporter Courtney Cronin, Dalvin Cook (questionable, hamstring) will be on the field for around 8-12 plays against the Lions in Week 9.

impact: ESPN Vikings reporter Courtney Cronin expects Cook to get 10-20 snaps, but who really knows how much work he'll truly get.  We still like Latavius Murray as an RB2 play.  Cook is expected to just knock off the rust ahead of the bye.  Inactive for the Vikings are Stefon Diggs (ribs), S Andrew Sendejo, LB Anthony Barr, LG Tom Compton, RB Roc Thomas, QB Kyle Sloter, and DE Tashawn Bower.  Only Sloter and Bower are healthy scratches for the injured Vikes.
report: Dalvin Cook (hamstring) is active for Week 9 against the Lions.

impact: Making his return from a five-week hamstring injury, Cook didn't get the start but did out-snap and out-touch Latavius Murray, who managed 47 yards on 11 touches but also scored a goal-line touchdown.  Cook looked good on his big 70-yard run before getting dragged down at the five-yard line.  He now has the bye to get even healthier ahead of Week 11 against the Bears.
report: Dalvin Cook rushed 10 times for 89 yards and caught all four of his targets for 20 yards in the Vikings' Week 9 win over the Lions.

impact: Cook was supposed to be limited during his first game back before the bye, but he ended up playing 57 percent of the snaps and gaining 109 yards on 14 touches. Following the bye week, it sounds like he will be given even more work moving forward. This week's matchup with the Bears aside, Cook is looking at a pretty good schedule the rest of the way. He is a good bet for a late-season surge assuming he is able to stay healthy.
report: Vikings OC John DeFilippo said Dalvin Cook (hamstring) is a "full-go" at this point.

impact: He also lost a fumble in the first quarter. The Vikings run game was completely shut down by Chicago and they were forced to go pass heavy in the second half. Cook looked over his hamstring issues coming off Minnesota's bye and likely would have been more involved if not for gameflow. Cook has a get-right matchup with a Packers defensive line that will be without DE Mike Daniels in Week 12.
report: Dalvin Cook had nine carries for 12 yards in Week 11 against Chicago.

impact: Cook didn't do much on the ground, but he got the Vikings' scoring start on a screen he took for a 26-yard touchdown. It was his best receiving effort since Week 1. Cook was held in check last week, but he's had over 100 total yards or a touchdown in two of the last three games. He'll be an RB2 for a matchup with the Patriots in Week 13.
report: Dalvin Cook had 10 carries for 29 yards and caught three passes for 47 yards and a touchdown in the Vikings' Week 12 win over the Packers.

impact: Cook made things happen whenever he touched the ball, particularly in the first half when he picked up 73 yards on 10 touches. Unfortunately, he wasn't called on much with the Vikings playing from behind in the second half. Cook's eight catches represented a new career-high, though he averaged a lethargic 2.6 yards per reception with a long of only 10 yards. On the bright side, Cook out-touched backfield-mate Latavius Murray by a convincing 17-6 margin. Cook can be comfortably employed as an RB2 against the Seahawks in Week 14.
report: Dalvin Cook rolled to 84 yards on nine carries while supplying eight catches for 22 yards on 10 targets Sunday in the Vikings’ Week 13 loss to New England.

impact: Cousins came out peppering Dalvin Cook with early targets, beating an aggressive Niners defense for chunk gains.  He later threw a dime over the top of CB Ahkello Witherspoon to hit Stefon Diggs for a 22-yard touchdown down the left sideline.  It was a perfectly-placed ball.  Cousins' second score was an 11-yard hookup to Kyle Rudolph.  He was also cooking with Adam Thielen, who had 102 yards on six grabs, killing the Niners out of the slot.  Cousins' debut couldn't have gone much better.  The 1-0 Vikings will head on the road to Green Bay in Week 2.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 20-of-36 passes for 244 yards and two touchdowns in the Vikings' 24-16, Week 1 win over the 49ers.

impact: It was a tie, but Cousins did everything he could to win this game despite facing an underrated defense. He threw a laser to Laquon Treadwell for his first score of the day, and his third was a beautiful pass to Stefon Diggs for a 75-yard touchdown, almost all of that coming in the air. He was even better with the game on the line. Despite an interception which went right through Treadwell’s hands, Cousins was able to lead the Vikings back with an eight-play touchdown drive he finished with an outstanding tight-window throw to Adam Thielen and a two-point conversion to Diggs to tie the game. He led what should have been two scoring drives in overtime, but Daniel Carlson missed both field goals including one as time expired. With Buffalo up next, Cousins will be a locked-in QB1 next week.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 35-of-48 passes for 425 yards, four touchdowns, and an interception in the Vikings' Week 2 tie with the Packers.

impact: The Vikings' offensive line didn't help matters, allowing Cousins to be blindsided and strip-sacked on the team's first two possessions. Minnesota's passing offense was playing catch-up from that point forward as Cousins was forced to attempt 55 passes under duress for the remainder of the afternoon. Cousins' lone touchdown came in garbage time when he found Kyle Rudolph in the end zone down 27-0 with less than two minutes to play. The Vikings have another tough test on the road against the Rams Thursday night.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 40-of-55 passes for 296 yards, one touchdown, and an interception in the Vikings' Week 3 loss to the Bills.

impact: Cousins lost 30 yards on four sacks. Coming off an embarrassing loss to Buffalo on their home turf, the Vikings came out firing on their first drive with Cousins completing 6-of-8 passes for 68 yards and a touchdown pass to Aldrick Robinson. Cousins followed that up with another touchdown strike to Robinson in the second quarter. Kirk’s longest completion on the night came on a 45-yard touchdown pass to Adam Thielen on a play where Cousins looked off the safety before hitting Thielen down the seam for a wide-open TD. Cousins’ night ended in disappointment when he coughed up the ball on a strip sack by John Franklin-Myers with 1:29 remaining in the fourth quarter. The Vikes haven’t been the juggernaut they were billed as going into the year, but Cousins has still been extremely productive, topping 400 yards in two of his last three outings. We’ll see what he does for an encore next week against the Eagles.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 36-of-50 passes for 422 yards and three touchdowns while adding a team-leading 28 rushing yards on four carries Thursday in the Vikings’ Week 4 loss to the Rams.

impact: Cousins also lost a fumble on a botched sideways pass. As has become a theme, Cousins was attempting and converting heat check throws in the first half. His touchdown was a three-yarder where only Adam Thielen could catch it in the end zone. Cousins has made as many "wow" passes as anyone in football so far this season. The Vikings' offense was far less effective after halftime but got back into rhythm in time to close the game out in the fourth quarter. Cousins is making hay with his elite receiver duo of Thielen and Stefon Diggs. He'll be a high-end QB1 for next week's home date with the abysmal Cardinals.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 30-of-37 passes for 301 yards and a touchdown in the Vikings' 23-21, Week 5 win over the Eagles.

impact: He added a touchdown on a seven-yard run. Cousins fumbled on a sack that was returned for a touchdown, but he was sharp in this one, completing 71 percent of his passes. Cousins' only passing TD was a perfect throw over the middle to Adam Thielen. He's now led the Vikings to consecutive wins after losing to Buffalo and the Rams. Cousins gets a matchup with the Jets in Week 7.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 24-of-34 passes for 233 yards with a touchdown and an interception in the Vikings' Week 6 win over the Cardinals.

impact: It was a struggle much of the day as both offenses really had trouble moving the ball.  At one point, both teams were a combined 0-for-12 on third downs.  Cousins, however, did throw a 34-yard touchdown to Adam Thielen on the opening drive before then hitting Aldrick Robinson for a second 34-yard score in the fourth quarter.  Both were dimes from Cousins in tight coverage.  Cousins will look to get back on track with big numbers next week against the Saints at home.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 25-of-40 passes for 241 yards and two touchdowns in the Vikings' Week 7 win over the Jets.

impact: Cousins got off to a fast start with a touchdown to Stefon Diggs. He put up huge stats despite the loss, but the Vikings couldn’t overcome a pair of turnovers. Cousins threw a game-changing pick-six in the second half and had multiple passes knocked down at the line of scrimmage. He salvaged his night with a late touchdown to Adam Thielen. Cousins will remain a QB1 for Week 9 against Detroit.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 30-of-40 passes for 351 yards with two touchdowns and an interception in Week 8 against the Saints.

impact: Cousins was without Stefon Diggs (ribs) and really struggled, forcing his interception into double-coverage trying to go to Adam Thielen.  Cousins also was credited with a lost fumble deep in Detroit territory, but Dalvin Cook was to blame who dropped the pitch on a run play.  Cousins hasn't had big numbers on the stat sheet in weeks really but now gets the bye for the Vikings to try and get healthy before going to Chicago in Week 11.  Cousins will be a back-end QB1.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 18-of-22 passes for 164 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Vikings' Week 9 win over the Lions.

impact: This was a rough game for Cousins, who played worse than his stats. He had just 57 yards and an interception at halftime, but salvaged his night with a touchdown on the final drive. One of Cousins' interceptions was a late fourth quarter pick-six that crushed the Vikings' comeback attempt. Cousins has had a downswing the last two weeks, but he's in a rebound spot against the Packers in Week 12.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 30-of-46 passes for 262 yards with two touchdowns and a pair of interceptions in the Vikings' Week 11 loss to Chicago.

impact: Cousins had his way with an injury-ravaged Packers secondary, throwing just nine incompletions. He hit Dalvin Cook and Stefon Diggs for long touchdowns, with his final one coming on a red-zone strike to Adam Thielen in the third quarter. Cousins had been under some heat after a rough three-game stretch, so it's a needed bounceback. The Vikings get a matchup with the Patriots in Week 13.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 29-of-38 passes for 342 yards and three touchdowns in the Vikings' Week 12 win over the Packers.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of 18 yards. Coming off a stellar performance in last week's win over Green Bay, Cousins fell apart Sunday, averaging a dismal 4.6 yards per attempt in the loss to New England. Cousins delivered his lone touchdown on a five-yard strike to Adam Thielen with time winding down in the first half. His interceptions were both of the desperation variety. Cousins targeted Aldrick Robinson deep in the fourth quarter but couldn't connect as the ball deflected off Jonathan Jones before Duron Harmon collected it in the end zone. His second interception came on a pass intended for Thielen with only a few seconds remaining. Next week's game in Seattle will be a must-win for the Vikings, who sit at a lackluster 6-5-1 with four games left on the schedule.
report: Kirk Cousins completed 32-of-44 passes for 201 yards with a touchdown and two interceptions Sunday in the Vikings’ Week 13 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Richard finished second on the team in targets only to Jared Cook (12-9-180). It was admittedly a favorable game script for the third-year pro, who primarily played behind both Marshawn Lynch (11-41-1) and Doug Martin (4-20). He's worth stashing if only for his receiving prowess, but don't expect coach Jon Gruden to lean on him unless need be (despite his talent over the rest of the backfield).
report: Jalen Richard rushed for 24 yards on five carries and hauled in 9-of-11 targets for 55 yards in the Raiders' Week 1 loss to the Rams.

impact: Richard was a hot waiver name after seeing 11 targets in the season opener, but that usage was clearly script driven. Behind both Marshawn Lynch and Doug Martin in the pecking order, Richard could have some spike games, but they will only happen when the Raiders are down big. On the bright side, that could be the case often this season.
report: Jalen Richard played 8-of-65 (12 percent) snaps Week 2 against the Broncos.

impact: Backfield mate Marshawn Lynch handled just nine carries since the game was out of hand early. Richard was involved late, finishing second on the team in receiving yards. Richard has shown a propensity to produce when involved — the issue being he's never involved. If Lynch ever misses time, there's no doubt Richard will sneak into strong RB3/FLEX consideration.
report: Jalen Richard caught all six of his targets for 53 yards and one touchdown in the Raiders' Week 5 stomping to the Chargers.

impact: When the Raiders play from behind, Richard's usage spikes as a frequent checkdown target for checkdown-loving Derek Carr.  The team's leading receiver in Sunday's blowout loss, Richard will remain a negative-game-script-dependent, PPR-only flex option when Oakland emerges from its Week 7 bye.
report: Jalen Richard caught 7-of-8 targets for 48 yards and rushed twice for three yards in the Raiders' Week 6 loss to Seattle.

impact: With Marshawn Lynch (groin) sidelined, Doug Martin earned most of the Raiders' early-down work while ceding passing-down reps to Richard. Martin is the favorite for goal-line work in Lynch's absence, though Richard's receiving role should keep him on the flex radar in PPR leagues. He gets an enticing matchup Thursday against San Francisco.
report: Jalen Richard tallied 14 yards on two carries while pulling in all eight of his targets for 50 yards Sunday in the Raiders’ Week 8 loss to the Colts.

impact: Richard led the Raiders in targets, receptions, and yards in the 31-point loss. With Doug Martin, who actually ran quite well tonight, dominating the Raiders' ground work, Richard needs the Raiders to be trailing for him to receive extended looks. With the Raiders playing like one of the worst teams in the league, Richard should have some weeks where he catches five or more passes, which puts him in the mix in PPR leagues. The Chargers will be the favorites over the Raiders in Week 10.
report: Jalen Richard caught all four of his targets for 45 yards while rushing twice for four yards in the Raiders' Week 9 loss to the 49ers.

impact: Richard was quiet for most of this game, but as is usually the case, he padded his stats late in the loss. Four of his targets, three of his catches, and 37 of his yards came on a failed drive in garbage time. The good news is the 1-8 Raiders should provide plenty of those opportunities, keeping him in the FLEX conversation.
report: Jalen Richard rushed three times for seven yards and hauled in 5-of-6 targets for 52 yards in the Raiders' Week 10 loss to the Chargers.

impact: With Doug Martin nursing an ankle injury, Richard took over as the Raiders' lead rusher after the break, though DeAndre Washington also mixed in for 12 carries. The three receptions were actually Richard's fewest in six games, which was highly surprising because of how thin the Raiders are at wideout. Regardless of Martin's Week 12 status, Richard will be a FLEX against the Ravens' stout defense.
report: Jalen Richard rushed 11 times for 61 yards in the Raiders' Week 11 win over the Cardinals, adding three receptions for 32 additional yards.

impact: Gruden has been living in the past since the moment the Raiders guaranteed him $100 million over ten years, more notably comparing Amari Cooper to Sterling Sharpe and Tim Brown before trading him.  "He might be the MVP of this team," Gruden said of Richard.  "He could run for 1,000 yards and catch for 1,000 yards someday.  He is tough, hard to tackle.  And he can line up in the slot or outside."  Richard is the favorite to lead Oakland's backfield in touches down the stretch.
report: Speaking Monday, Raiders coach Jon Gruden compared Jalen Richard to Charlie Garner.

impact: Even with Oakland in catch-up mode in the second half, which is usually when Richard shines, the third-year receiving back was mostly a non-factor. That was probably to be expected playing on the road against one of the league's better defenses. Richard will hope for better results when the Chiefs come to town in Week 13. Fantasy owners can employ him as a PPR flex in that matchup.
report: Jalen Richard rushed for a yard on his lone carry Sunday while adding two catches for 15 yards on four targets Sunday in Oakland’s Week 12 loss to Ravens.

impact: One of Goedert's missed connections was in the end zone. Despite the Eagles' depth issues at receiver and lots of summer talk of continued two-tight end sets, Goedert played fewer than 20 snaps in his NFL debut. He was also the intended target on Nick Foles' interception. Foles dropped a pass in late. Goedert got his hands on it but was immediately blown up, sending the ball into the air. Goedert won't be a realistic TE2 streamer against the Bucs in Week 2.
report: Dallas Goedert caught 1-of-3 targets for four yards in the Eagles' Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: A standout all preseason, Goedert has barely been involved in the Eagles' passing game so far in real games.  It was concerning that he played behind Josh Perkins in this one.  Perkins caught four passes for 57 yards.
report: Dallas Goedert was held catch-less in the Eagles' Week 2 loss to the Bucs.

impact: After getting benched a week ago, Goedert was a huge part of the offensive game plan in Week 3. He started the game off with his first career touchdown, a 13-yard score in which he was uncovered. Despite the promising game, Goedert will not be a fantasy option heading into Week 4 against the Titans.
report: Dallas Goedert caught 7-of-7 targets for 73 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Colts.

impact: There was always a chance Goedert's break out performance in Week 3 was something of a fluke, and those chances grew once Alshon Jeffery was cleared to return. Goedert was not targeted in the first half of this game, and he only played around half the snaps. Goedert should have some a couple more big games this season, but predicting them will be difficult while Zach Ertz is healthy.
report: Dallas Goedert hauled in both his targets for 13 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Goedert now has four catches for 29 yards since Alshon Jeffery's healthy return. He is off the TE2 radar until further notice.
report: Dallas Goedert caught 2-of-2 targets for 16 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Goedert’s involvement in Philly’s weekly game plans has been inconsistent, but he was a big part of this week’s. The Eagles got him rolling on an early 21-yard screen pass Goedert nearly took to the house, and the second-round rookie did find pay dirt later in the second quarter from one yard out. Goedert is merely a volatile TE2, but he would be a locked-in TE1 if Zach Ertz were ever to miss time.
report: Dallas Goedert caught 4-of-5 targets for 43 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to Carolina.

impact: Goedert was not a focal point of the offense by any stretch, but he made the most of his opportunity. With the Eagles hunting for a touchdown just before halftime, Goedert came open across the middle of the field, and a bootlegging Carson Wentz found him with a laser. The rookie did the rest, avoiding a tackler and scampering into the end zone. Goedert now has a touchdown in back-to-back games, but he will not be a trustworthy fantasy option while Zach Ertz is healthy.
report: Dallas Goedert caught his only target for a 32-yard touchdown in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Jacksonville has lost Austin Seferian-Jenkins (groin, IR) and Niles Paul (sprained MCL) in the last two weeks, so they needed help. Bell will offer depth behind James O'Shaughnessy.
report: Jaguars signed TE Blake Bell.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins suffered from awful touchdown luck last season in New York, and it seems to have followed him to Jacksonville. ASJ got open for a 10-yard touchdown early in the second quarter, but the play was called back on a penalty. It is a tough break, but such is life with a touchdown-or-bust fantasy option. That is what Seferian-Jenkins will be next week against the Patriots.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 25 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: ASJ played through his core injury last week against the Giants, totaling 25 yards on three catches. Even if he's listed as questionable, expect the tight end to suit up against New England in Week 2.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins has been limited at practice the past two weeks while battling a core injury. He played his usual snaps in Week 1 and will gut it out again Sunday versus New England. ASJ comes in at No. 17 in RotoPat's Week 2 tight end rankings.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins practiced on a full basis Friday after being a limited participant on both Wednesday and Thursday. He was targeted five times in last week's opener but only managed three catches for 25 yards and no touchdowns. ASJ will be a weak TE2 against New England.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) wasn't listed on the Jaguars' final injury report for Week 2 against the Patriots.

impact: The rarest of rarities — an ASJ touchdown that was not called back. ASJ was freed by a pick play in the end zone on his four-yard score in the second quarter. The catch-and-fall specialist is averaging eight yards through his first six Jaguars receptions. He's a low-end TE2.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins caught 3-of-5 targets for 23 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: ASJ's core muscle injury isn't going away, though it hasn't kept him from playing the past two weeks. Coming off a touchdown in Week 2, Seferian-Jenkins will remain in the TE2 mix for Sunday's home matchup against the Titans.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: It appears as if Seferian-Jenkins' practice reps will be limited for some time as he works his way back from a core muscle injury, but it would be a surprise if he misses any game time. The tight end will be his usual touchdown-or-bust self against the Titans.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) returned to a limited practice Thursday.

impact: ASJ returned to a full practice on Friday after being limited earlier this week. Seferian-Jenkins is RotoPat's No. 20 tight end for Week 3.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) wasn't listed on the Jaguars' final injury report for Week 3 against the Titans.

impact: ASJ never logs big yardage numbers and is always a touchdown-or-bust streamer option. He will draw a "revenge" matchup in Week 4 against the Jets.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins caught 3-of-5 targets for 18 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins has been dealing with a core muscle injury all year but hasn't missed any games. He's on the streaming radar for a Week 4 matchup with the Jets.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: His status was never in doubt. Seferian-Jenkins has been playing through a core muscle injury all year. There's some narrative to his matchup with the Jets this week as a touchdown-dependent streamer.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) was removed from Jacksonville's injury report.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins wasn't much of a factor playing against his former team. He's been an afterthought in Jacksonville's offense this year, failing to go over 25 yards in any game. Seferian-Jenkins gets a matchup against the Chiefs in Week 5.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins caught 2-of-4 passes for 24 yards in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins began the week with a DNP before being upgraded to limited practice on Thursday. He closed out the week by getting in a full session, prompting the Jags to take him off their injury report. ASJ hasn't been of much use to fantasy owners this year, though the potential for a big week does exist against a subpar Chiefs secondary.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core) wasn't listed on the Jaguars' final injury report for Week 5 against the Chiefs.

impact: Seferian-Jenkins could not come up with the pass on a fourth-and-two target in the second quarter. That was his last involvement in the game, and he did not play many snaps if any at all in the second half. Seferian-Jenkins has been struggling with a core-muscle injury all season, and it is possible that issue flared up against Kansas City. Niles Paul, who finished with 65 yards on seven catches, would be next up at tight end.
report: Austin Seferian-Jenkins did not catch his only target in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Coach Doug Marrone said it is possible Seferian-Jenkins returns this season. ASJ has been dealing with a core-muscle injury all year, but he appeared to aggravate the injury against the Chiefs on Sunday. Niles Paul caught seven passes for 65 yards filling in for Seferian-Jenkins in the second half. He is worth a look with tight end as thin as ever.
report: Jaguars placed Austin Seferian-Jenkins (core muscle) on injured reserve.

impact: Carr was awful in Week 1, solid in Week 2 and adequate today. His first interception was an end zone arm punt on a play where he had a miscommunication with Amari Cooper. His second was an inadvisable throw to a blanketed Martavis Bryant in the end zone late. Carr would have had a bigger fantasy day, but a Jared Cook touchdown came off the board when it was revealed he was down at the one-yard line. Cooper also committed an inexplicable drop. It has not been elite stuff from Carr, but he has put his brutal opener behind him. He's playing solid enough football. The Raiders just don't have much talent. The Browns will be a tough Week 4 opponent.
report: Derek Carr completed 27-of-39 passes for 345 yards, one touchdown and two interceptions in the Raiders' 28-20, Week 3 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Carr made a questionable decision to target Martavis Bryant in the end zone late in the game, and Xavien Howard came away with the interception. "I think at times he is trying too hard," Gruden said of his quarterback. "I’m really excited about the way he has played and improved and mastered this offense. We are getting closer. That was a painful turnover. We will address that, and we will make the corrections." Carr has quietly played well the last couple weeks, but he has just two touchdowns and two interceptions to show for it in those games.
report: Raiders coach Jon Gruden thinks Derek Carr was "too aggressive" late against the Dolphins.

impact: In a barnburning 45-42 shootout, Carr turned in his best game of the Jon Gruden era with red-zone scores to Amari Cooper, Jared Cook (two), and Jordy Nelson as Oakland shredded Cleveland's previously-stingy pass defense.  Carr has thrown for at least 288 yards in each of the Raiders' first four games, although this was his first big-time fantasy performance.  The Raiders go on the road to face the Chargers in Week 5.
