In another potential shootout, Carr will be a solid two-quarterback league play with some low-end QB1 streamer appeal for fantasy leaguers in bye-week binds.
report: Derek Carr completed 35-of-58 passes for 437 yards, four touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Raiders' Week 4 overtime win over the Browns.

impact: Carr had less than 200 yards and one pick with 10 minutes remaining in the fourth quarter. A 47-yard completion to Martavis Bryant (3-91) and eventual touchdown toss to a wide-open Jordy Nelson (due to a complete breakdown in the Chargers' secondary) allowed Carr to turn an outright miserable day into one that was simply miserable. Carr has undoubtedly been poor in engineering coach Jon Gruden's otherwise efficient offense this season, but his weekly fantasy finishes are still that of a low-end QB2 with QB1 streaming appeal. The Raiders host the Seahawks in Week 6.
report: Derek Carr managed to complete 24-of-33 passes for 268 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Raiders' Week 5 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Carr took six sacks and lost two fumbles, and he suffered an apparent left-arm injury in the fourth quarter.  The Raiders opted to let A.J. McCarron finish out the game down 27-3.  Carr has had one productive fantasy performance out of six so far this year while repeatedly earning the ire of first-year coach Jon Gruden.  As the Raiders head into their Week 7 bye, Carr has long been droppable in 14- and even 16-team fantasy leagues.
report: Derek Carr completed 23-of-31 passes for 142 yards and rushed four times for 31 yards in the Raiders' Week 6 loss to Seattle.

impact: It's not surprising.  Carr's injury was never feared to be severe, and the Raiders have a Week 7 bye forthcoming.  It will be at least a few weeks before we see A.J. McCarron replacing Carr as Oakland's gunshy checkdown specialist.
report: Despite leaving Sunday's loss in London early with an arm injury, NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Derek Carr is not in danger of missing time.

impact: "He is the strength of this football team," Gruden said. "He is on my watch. I said it when I got here, if he doesn't play well, I've failed." This goes beyond a normal coachspeak vote of confidence. Gruden seems completely sincere. Plus, the Raiders don't have a legitimate option behind Carr. Gruden has actually managed to dramatically increase both Carr's completion percentage and yards per attempt, but Carr has been a turnover machine and seemed to lack confidence at times. He was unspeakably bad in the Raiders' London loss to the Seahawks. The duo has two weeks to draw something up for the Colts in Week 8.
report: Speaking Tuesday, Jon Gruden gave Derek Carr a vote of confidence as the Raiders' quarterback.

impact: With Khalil Mack and now Amari Cooper out the door, there have been rumblings the Raiders want to move on from Carr as well, and Thompson reports Carr's play and a perceived lack of toughness -- an absurd notion given how quickly he returned from a transverse fracture in his back -- have cost him the locker room. "The belief in him has deteriorated, perhaps to irreparable levels," Thompson writes. "It’s hard to see how Carr can lead this team again." Carr has four years left on a five-year, $125 million extension, but the Raiders can get out with a relatively minor cap hit after this season.
report: The Athletic's Marcus Thompson reports Derek Carr has a "fractured relationship" with his teammates.

impact: With their season going down the tubes, the Raiders have begun cleaning house, which led to rumblings that Carr could be moved ahead of Tuesday's 4 PM ET trade deadline. There were also reports that teammates were questioning Carr's toughness, leading to tension within the locker room. Despite all the noise, coach Jon Gruden has double-downed on his quarterback while shooting down any and all trade rumors. Carr's current contract runs through 2022.
report: According to ESPN's Adam Schefter, the Raiders are committed to Derek Carr as their long-term starter at quarterback.

impact: Carr rushed twice for no gain. It's been a turbulent week for Carr, who has been the subject of trade rumors and has also had the media question his toughness (not to mention the Raiders traded away his top receiver, Amari Cooper, on Monday). But none of those distractions had any bearing on Sunday's outcome as the 26-year-old went out and had arguably his best game of the season. He distributed touchdowns to three different receivers (Jared Cook, Brandon LaFell and Seth Roberts) while also adding his first career rushing touchdown on a quarterback sneak. Carr was so accurate that at one point he strung together 17 straight completions. He'll get another favorable draw Thursday at San Francisco.
report: Derek Carr completed 21-of-28 passes for 244 yards and three touchdowns while rushing for another touchdown Sunday in the Raiders’ Week 8 loss to Indianapolis.

impact: This is a new low for the 1-7 Oakland Raiders. Tom Cable's offensive line wasn't able to give Carr a lot of time, but Carr also kept stepping into pressure, which led to six sacks. After three quarters of bad football, Gruden stepped in and replaced Carr with backup A.J. McCarron, who also did nothing. The Raiders offense is built to be high completion, but the Raiders don't have the weaponry to pick up consistent yards after catch, so Carr is prone to some ugly games. The Raiders get extended time to develop a game plan for the Week 10 game against the Chargers.
report: Derek Carr completed 16-of-22 passes for 171 scoreless yards in the Raiders' Week 9 loss to the 49ers.

impact: As has been the case most of the season, Carr's stat line actually looks fine, but it is nothing but empty calories. The offense did not really move outside of a fake field goal in the first half, and their production in the second half came in garbage time. On one of those late drives, Carr threw the ball away on fourth-and-five. He also should have been intercepted on an ill-advised throw near the goal line. The quarterback has now thrown one or fewer touchdowns in seven of nine games. He is unlikely to do much better next week against the Cardinals, who will be a great streaming defense.
report: Derek Carr completed 24-of-37 passes for 243 yards in the Raiders' Week 10 loss to the Chargers.

impact: It can hardly be said that the Raiders played well, but the Cardinals were measurably worse, especially as they attempted to close things out late with a 21-20 lead. Carr nearly tossed a ghastly pick from his own end zone that would have essentially ended the game, but the Cards dropped the pass. Playing with a no-name receiver corps — even Brandon LaFell failed to finish the game after injuring his Achilles' — Carr took four sacks and was in frequent disagreement with coach Jon Gruden. The duo had to be separated by TE Lee Smith at one point. The low point was when Carr called back-to-back first half timeouts, drawing a penalty. But Carr made just enough throws for the Raiders to eke out an ugly road win. Playing with laughably few weapons and struggling in his own right, Carr will remain outside the QB2 range for next week's trip to Baltimore.
report: Derek Carr completed 19-of-31 passes for 192 yards and two touchdowns in the Raiders' 23-21, Week 11 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Carr was sacked three times for a loss of 12 yards. Playing one of the league's toughest defenses on the road with a depleted receiving corps, Carr's afternoon was doomed from the start. Carr was checked for a concussion late in the first half and also tweaked his ankle in the fourth quarter, though neither injury was serious. The five-year vet lost a costly fumble, which Terrell Suggs scooped up for a 43-yard touchdown with just under six minutes remaining in the fourth quarter. On a more positive note, Carr has now gone six straight games without throwing an interception. The Raiders could be in for another rough game when the 9-2 Chiefs visit in Week 13.
report: Derek Carr completed 16-of-34 passes for 194 yards and a touchdown Sunday in Oakland’s Week 12 loss to the Ravens.

impact: In the midst of a miserable season, Carr converted an excellent matchup. He locked onto top targets Jared Cook and Jordy Nelson and also managed to find Marcell Ateman and backup TE Lee Smith for scores. Carr could have had a bigger day had his running backs not killed three separate drives with fumbles. The good feeling is unlucky to last long, as the Steelers will provide a much stiffer test in Week 14.
report: Derek Carr completed 29-of-38 passes for 285 yards and three touchdowns in the Raiders' 40-33, Week 13 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Filling in for Austin Seferian-Jenkins, who appeared to aggravate his core-muscle injury, Paul racked up five of his catches in the second half. If ASJ is forced to miss time, Paul would get into the TE2 conversation at a desolate position.
report: Niles Paul hauled in 7-of-9 targets for 65 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Paul caught seven passes for 65 yards against the Chiefs in Week 5 filling in for an injured Austin Seferian-Jenkins. He was expected to keep that role moving forward, but he suffered a knee injury after just three snaps against the Cowboys. He will likely miss a couple of games at least. James O'Shaughnessy is next up on the depth chart, although the Jaguars could add some help.
report: Jaguars TE Niles Paul suffered a sprained MCL Week 6 against the Cowboys.

impact: Good luck.  Martin hasn't done anything notable since 2015 and is averaging a foul 2.99 YPC over his last 309 attempts spanning the 2016-18 seasons.  He has six touchdowns on the ground in 25 games over that span.  But the Raiders have nowhere else to turn really; Jalen Richard is more of a pass-game back than featured runner.  Whenever the Raiders are competitive, Martin could flirt with 15-18 carries, and that may be the case this week at home against the 2-5 Colts.
report: Coach Jon Gruden said Doug Martin is "ready to go" as the Raiders' "feature back" with Marshawn Lynch (groin) on injured reserve.

impact: Martin has been one of the league's least effective ball-carriers in recent years, but he actually looked decent in his first start of 2018, particularly in the second half when he contributed 55 yards on nine carries. Unfortunately the ex-Buc lost a fumble at the worst possible time with Oakland trying to mount a fourth-quarter comeback. He was also stonewalled on each of his two goal-line carries during the third quarter. Martin lost passing-down reps to Jalen Richard but still out-touched him 15-10 on the afternoon. The Muscle Hamster should continue to lead the backfield in Marshawn Lynch's absence. With six teams on bye, he'll be an acceptable RB2/3 next week at San Francisco.
report: Doug Martin collected 72 yards on 13 carries while also snagging two catches for 17 yards on two targets Sunday in Oakland’s Week 8 loss to the Colts.

impact: Martin was the lone bright spot for the Raiders offense tonight but that is not saying a whole lot. After starting the game with a big run, it looked like Martin and the Raiders were set for a quality game, but the 49ers jumped out to a big lead and the Raiders offense went stagnant, which put Martin in negative game script. The Muscle Hamster needs the Raiders to be in the lead (or at least staying close in games) to have RB2 weeks, and the Raiders will be underdogs against the Chargers in Week 10. Martin will be an RB3 in that matchup.
report: Doug Martin rushed 49 yards on 11 carries and caught 1-of-2 targets for 20 receiving yards in the Raiders' Week 9 loss to the 49ers.

impact: Martin injured his hip early last week in the blowout loss to the 49ers but played through it and should be fine for Week 10 against the Chargers.  The Raiders have to keep things close in order for Martin get volume.  If they start falling behind, it gets away from Martin and Jalen Richard takes over.
report: Doug Martin (hip) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Martin will be out there against the Chargers. With the Raiders' offense devolving further into anarchy, Martin will be a high-risk FLEX.
report: Doug Martin (hip) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Martin will suit up Sunday, as expected. Even so, the Raiders have to stay competitive in order for Martin to receive volume — something they haven't been able to do since they're, you know, bad. Jalen Richard offers more upside as Oakland attempts to match the Chargers point-for-point Sunday.
report: Doug Martin (hip) wasn't listed on the Raiders' final injury report for Week 10 against the Chargers.

impact: Martin was a bright spot for the Raiders in this one. He kept the offense moving for 50 yards on the ground in the first half, and he came up with a 23-yard catch-and-run after the break. Unfortunately, he took a back seat with the Raiders chasing the game late, something which will be a problem for the rest of the season. Martin has quietly looked pretty good the last several weeks, but the offense makes him just a FLEX play even in a good matchup against the Cardinals.
report: Doug Martin rushed 15 times for 61 yards and hauled in all three of his targets for 31 yards in the Raiders' Week 10 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Martin also caught a six-yard pass. All 11 of Martin's touches came before the break. The veteran was not injured. Coach Jon Gruden told the CBS booth he simply wanted to see what Jalen Richard and DeAndre Washington could do in the second half. Martin took the benching in stride, enthusiastically chest bumping Gruden after the Raiders' last-second victory. Richard was effective in Martin's absence, but the Cardinals are a soft run matchup. Only Richard will have any FLEX appeal for Week 12 against the Ravens' elite defense. Martin's 2018 fantasy future is uncertain.
report: Doug Martin rushed 10 times for 52 yards in the Raiders' Week 11 win over the Cardinals but was benched at halftime.

impact: Coach Jon Gruden told the CBS booth that Martin was not injured but admitted afterward he "had to be shot up at halftime." The Raiders never announced Martin with an injury, which is highly unusual. It will likely warrant a look from the NFL. Jalen Richard ran well in Martin's absence. His status will be updated no later than Wednesday when the Raiders issue their first Week 12 injury report.
report: Updating an earlier item, Doug Martin was absent for the second half of Sunday's win over the Cardinals because of an ankle injury.

impact: "I think he'll be okay," said Gruden.  Gruden later conceded the real reason Martin was benched at halftime was because he wants to get DeAndre Washington more touches going forward.  The Raiders' backfield has devolved into a three-man committee with Martin, Washington, and Jalen Richard all sharing work.
report: Coach Jon Gruden admitted Monday that he's not concerned with Doug Martin's ankle injury.

impact: Jon Gruden downplayed Martin's injury earlier this week. His prompt return to practice confirms the injury isn't serious. Martin will be ready to roll Sunday at Baltimore. He'll be a stay-away RB3 in a tough matchup.
report: Doug Martin (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Martin sat out the second half of last week's win over Arizona, but was cleared to play after getting in a limited week of practice. He'll remain the Raiders' go-to ball-carrier with Jalen Richard mixing in on passing downs.
report: Doug Martin (ankle) wasn't listed on the Raiders' final injury report for Week 12 against the Ravens.

impact: Martin staked the Raiders to an early lead with a one-yard touchdown scamper in the first quarter. The play was originally ruled a lost fumble, but replay showed Martin crossed the plane before coughing it up. That touchdown was Martin's first since Week 14 of last season. Game script was Martin's undoing as the Muscle Hamster was held to just one second-half carry with Oakland in catch-up mode. The 29-year-old was limited by an ankle injury at practice this week but didn't show any ill effects in Sunday's defeat. Martin and the 2-9 Raiders will host Kansas City in Week 13.
report: Doug Martin contributed 51 yards and a touchdown on 11 carries while adding three grabs for 21 yards on four targets Sunday in the Raiders’ Week 12 loss to Baltimore.

impact: Martin was one of
report: Doug Martin rushed 18 times for 61 yards and a touchdown in the Raiders' Week 13 loss to the Chiefs, also losing a fumble.

impact: That would explain the signing of C.J. Anderson on Tuesday.  If Martin sits, Anderson will take his place in the rotation alongside Jalen Richard and DeAndre Washington.  None of the three are recommended fantasy plays.
report: Doug Martin has a knee injury and is uncertain for Week 14 against the Steelers.

impact: Wallace did manage to draw a defensive pass interference penalty. He also didn't quite deserve the doughnut, but a putrid Nick Foles couldn't find him on a gimme deep ball in the second half. Wallace will have a decent shot at getting going against the Bucs' rippable defense in Week 2, but he is little more than a WR5 for fantasy purposes.
report: Mike Wallace was held without a catch on three targets in the Eagles' Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: Wallace was held without a catch in Week 1. He got open on a few deep shots but couldn't get on the same page with Foles. Wallace should see more the three targets he had against the Falcons this week, but he's not going to have a high-volume role behind Nelson Agholor and Zach Ertz.
report: Nick Foles said he wants to get Mike Wallace more involved.

impact: He was quickly ruled out for the rest of the game.  Wallace caught one pass for no gain and appeared to suffer a potentially severe injury on the play.  Wallace had a towel over his head and appeared distraught as he made his way on the cart to the locker room.  The Eagles are already without Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) and Mack Hollins (groin, I.R.).  They're down to Nelson Agholor, DeAndre Carter, Shelton Gibson, and Kamar Aiken at wideout.
report: Mike Wallace was carted off in the first quarter of Sunday's Week 2 game with an ankle injury.

impact: It seemed like he was dealing with a serious injury after being quickly ruled out on Sunday, and this confirms it. It would not be a surprise if he heads to injured reserve. With Mack Hollins (groin) already there and Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) still at least a week away, the Eagles are dangerously thin at receiver.
report: NFL Network's Mike Garafolo reports Mike Wallace (ankle) will be out for "a while."

impact: Wallace will not be placed on injured reserve at this point, meaning the Eagles expect him back in the next eight weeks. Even so, he is going to miss at least the next several games. With Alshon Jeffery looking unlikely to return this week, the Eagles are extremely thin at receiver.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson said Mike Wallace suffered a fractured fibula Week 2 against the Bucs.

impact: Wallace went down early in the loss to the Bucs, forcing the Eagles to roll with Kamar Aiken, Shelton Gibson, and TE Josh Perkins as the top options behind Nelson Agholor and Zach Ertz.  Wallace didn't catch a single pass in his game-plus of action for Philly and turned 32 last month.  There's a chance Wallace could return late in the year.  Jordan Matthews takes his roster spot.
report: Eagles placed WR Mike Wallace on injured reserve with a broken fibula.

impact: "Hopefully, Mike's progressing and we get a chance to get him back here this season," Groh said. Wallace suffered a fractured fibula in Week 2 and was placed on injured reserve. He is not eligible to return until Week 11, and it is unlikely he is even ready to go then. Wallace can be left on the wire.
report: Eagles OC Mike Groh hopes to get Mike Wallace (broken leg, IR) back this season.

impact: Wallace lost the boot on Tuesday. He hopes to return next month. Wallace would play a valuable real-life role as a situational deep threat if he can get cleared to come back this season.
report: Eagles WR Mike Wallace (broken leg, injured reserve) has shed his walking boot but has yet to resume running.

impact: The second-year UDFA has now caught at least two passes in four-straight games, clearing at least 20 yards every time out. That's not fantasy relevant, but Arnold has been out-producing Ben Watson for almost a month now.
report: Dan Arnold caught 2-of-2 targets for 20 yards in the Saints' Week 13 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: His longest catch went for 21 yards. Three of Watson’s four grabs came after halftime as the Saints did their best to chip away at a 24-point deficit. The veteran carries mild streaming appeal as a proven pass-catcher in a high-scoring attack, though most weeks, the Saints will run their offense through Michael Thomas and Alvin Kamara.
report: Ben Watson corralled all four of his targets for 44 yards Sunday in New Orleans’ Week 1 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Watson's overall line was a disappointment, but he had a wide open touchdown opportunity in the first quarter in which he was overthrown. Through two games, Watson has just nine catches for 63 yards and is only a desperation TE2 option in Week 3 versus the Falcons.
report: Ben Watson caught 3-of-5 targets for 19 yards in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Browns.

impact: Watson made a number of contested catches including a 19-yard grab that set up a Saints field goal late in the first half. Even at his advanced age, Watson remains a physical presence and a tough matchup for opposing defenses. Still, with so many mouths to feed in New Orleans, he’s best viewed as a TE2 for fantasy purposes.
report: Benjamin Watson nabbed five-of-six targets for 71 yards Sunday in New Orleans’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: Watson dropped a seven-yard touchdown on one of his missed connections, and the Saints had to settle for one of their four first-half field goals.  It was a step back for Watson in a glorious spot.  He'll be a fringe TE1/2 next week when the Saints go back home to face the Redskins at the Superdome.
report: Ben Watson caught 1-of-3 targets for 23 yards in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: Watson has taken a step back over the last two weeks, catching just five balls total for 53 scoreless yards in that span after nabbing 12 passes Weeks 1-3.  He's still going to remain on the TE1 fringe for the foreseeable future at a position that has been totally ravaged by injuries.  The Ravens are up next in Week 7.
report: Ben Watson caught all four of his targets for 30 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: Both the grabs and targets were Watson's most of the season. The score was his first of the year. Watson is averaging just 38 weekly yards, but that is more than enough to make him a weekly TE2 in a down campaign for the position.
report: Ben Watson caught 6-of-6 targets for 43 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: Coming off a disappearing act in Minnesota, Watson made his presence known early in this one. He got open for a 17-yard grab on the second drive, and he went over Cory Littleton for a 32-yard catch along the sideline in the second quarter. His fantasy day got even better when Drew Brees found him from 13 yards out for a touchdown just before halftime. The offense fell into a bit of a lull after the break, preventing Watson from adding to his stat line. Watson has now scored in two of his last three outings, but he was not even targeted in the other game during that run. He will be a streaming option in a good matchup against the Bengals next week, but he has a concerning floor despite the Saints’ high-powered offense.
report: Ben Watson hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 62 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 9 win over the Rams.

impact: Watson has now failed to record a stat in two of the last four games, and he caught just one pass in another game during that run. Losing snaps and targets to Dan Arnold and Josh Hill, Watson is not a fantasy option right now.
report: Ben Watson was not targeted in the Saints' Week 11 win over the Eagles.

impact: Watson dropped one of his targets in the back of the end zone for what would've been a sure touchdown. He was still out-targeted by Dan Arnold (4/45), though, and continues to lose peripheral reps to Josh Hill. Watson can't be used at this time.
report: Ben Watson caught 1-of-2 targets for 20 yards in the Saints' Week 12 victory over the Falcons.

impact: Watson now has just two catches for 21 yards over his past three games as second-year UDFA "Dan Arnold" has gotten much more involved. Even ahead of a juicy Week 14 matchup with the Bucs, Watson is safely droppable in all formats of fantasy.
report: Ben Watson was not targeted in the Saints' Week 13 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Jeffery had been expected to play this week after finally being cleared for contact, and there's a still possibility that he will, though an illness has slowed his progress. Considering he only practiced once this week, the Eagles may play it safe by waiting until Week 5 to unleash their star wideout. Another absence for Jeffery would be good news for slot receiver Nelson Agholor, who has drawn 27 targets in the early going.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Alshon Jeffery (questionable, shoulder/illness) will be a game-time decision Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery's shoulder is fine, but he was a game-time decision after battling an illness all week. At less than 100 percent and coming off an extended layoff, the Eagles may ease him back with situational and red-zone snaps. Owners should wait another week before inserting Jeffery into lineups.
report: Alshon Jeffery (questionable, shoulder/illness) will play in Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery missed time late in the week with an illness, but he was always expected to make his season debut this week. Coming off a long-term injury against a team which has played better defense since Week 1, Jeffery is a risky WR3 option.
report: Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) is active for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery's first catch did not come until the second quarter, and he appeared gassed after the 31-yard gain in his first game action this season. Tired or not, that was just the start of a big game. He had a great box-out catch on third-and-goal for his touchdown, and he earned a first down on a late game-tying drive with a catch-and-run on a screen. Now healthy and with his quarterback rounding into form, Jeffery should be considered a back-end WR2 in a suddenly promising matchup against the Vikings next week.
report: Alshon Jeffery hauled in 8-of-9 targets for 105 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Reports out of Philly are the injury is "nothing serious."  Jeffery just played his first game in nearly eight months last week and went 8-105-1 on nine targets.  He's ready to roll as a WR2 this week against the Vikings.
report: Alshon Jeffery (chest) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Jeffery's status is not in doubt for Week 5. Set to square off with shadow corner Xavier Rhodes, Jeffery will be a boom/bust WR3. Rhodes has gotten off to a shaky start by his standards.
report: Alshon Jeffery (chest) returned to Eagles practice Thursday.

impact: Alshon got a maintenance day on Wednesday before returning to full practice on both Thursday and Friday. Jeffery impressed with 105 yards and a touchdown in his season debut last week at Tennessee, though he'll have his work cut out for him Sunday against All-Pro corner Xavier Rhodes. He's RotoPat's No. 26 wide receiver for Week 5.
report: Alshon Jeffery (chest) wasn't listed on the Eagles' final injury report for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Jeffery nearly had a third catch on a late third down but could not hold on after taking a colossal shot to the back. It did not feel like Jeffery was getting erased by Xavier Rhodes, but the box score certainly reflects that. Jeffery figures to see more shadow treatment (Janoris Jenkins) in Week 6 when the Eagles venture to New York to take on the Giants for Thursday Night Football. He'll be on the WR2/3 borderline for that one. Jenkins is having a tough year.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 2-of-8 targets for 39 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: It was an easy night at the office for Jeffery, who benefitted from Carson Wentz's play-making ability on the run. Jeffery had few issues with Janoris Jenkins' coverage. The Eagles' No. 1 receiver is up to three scores in three games since making his 2018 debut. He'll be a back-end WR2 for next week's date with the Panthers.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 8-of-12 targets for 74 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: Through no fault of Jeffery’s, the Eagles wound up losing this game despite building a 17-0 halftime lead. Jeffery dominated his matchup against Panthers CB James Bradberry, frequently looking like a man among boys and whipping Bradberry for an early 11-yard touchdown on an inside move. Alshon has been an elite producer since returning from his shoulder injury. He will face a talented but downward-spiraling Jaguars defense next.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 7-of-10 targets for 88 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to Carolina.

impact: As expected, Jeffery did not have a big game while drawing shadow coverage from Jalen Ramsey, but he by no means disappeared. He was able to get open for two catches in the first half including a third-down conversion where he bullied his way to the sticks after the catch. His third catch was another conversion on third down to help extend a touchdown drive, but that was about it for Philly's No. 1. He should have more success against Dallas following the bye week.
report: Alshon Jeffery hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 35 yards in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Jeffery wasn't much of a factor in this one. This could have been a worse game, but Jeffery got half of his yards on a 17-yard catch late in the fourth quarter. His only red-zone opportunity was a dropped touchdown after a hard hit in the end-zone. Jeffery is trending down after getting held to 35 yards last week. He's in a rebound spot against the Saints in Week 11.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 4-of-8 targets for 48 yards in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Jeffery went down with the ship in a game Carson Wentz managed just 156 yards, and it is yet another down game for the Eagles' No. 1. After starting out strong, Jeffery has four catches in each of the last three games and has failed to top 50 yards in any game during that run. The good news is the Eagles get to face a Giants defense which Jeffery dominated for 74 yards and two scores in Week 6. He will be a back-end WR2 for that matchup.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 4-of-5 targets for 33 yards in the Eagles' Week 11 loss to the Saints.

impact: Jeffery has had back-to-back quiet games with just seven total grabs for 72 scoreless yards against the Saints and G-Men.  Jeffery hasn't topped 48 yards in four-straight games.  He'll be a WR2/3 next week against the Redskins, who just got torched by Amari Cooper for two scores on Thursday.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught all three of his targets for 39 yards in the Eagles' Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: Jeffery has seen five targets or less in four of the last five games and three of the four since the Golden Tate trade.  He hasn't scored since Week 7 and hasn't topped 48 yards since then.  Jeffery has been the biggest loser since the Tate deal.  He's a tough sell as a WR3 next week at Dallas.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 3-of-5 targets for 31 yards in the Eagles' Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: It was a tough night for Ertz, who committed multiple drops. He didn't help out a struggling Nick Foles. The Bucs wouldn't seem to be a daunting matchup for Week 2, though they did allow the third fewest tight end fantasy points in 2017.
report: Zach Ertz caught 5-of-10 targets for 48 yards in the Eagles' Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: He led the team in targets, just ahead of Nelson Agholor (12).  Ertz has been the Eagles' most-targeted pass catcher with Nick Foles under center dating back to last season.  Carson Wentz (knee) is tentatively due back for Week 3 against the Colts, however, and Wentz's return would boost Ertz's touchdown probability.  Ertz has yet to reach pay dirt on 23 targets through two games.
report: Zach Ertz caught 11-of-13 targets for 94 yards in the Eagles' Week 2 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Ertz and Wentz more than less picked up where they left off as Ertz lead the Eagles across the board in targets, receptions and yards. Despite failing to score through three games, Ertz leads the Eagles in targets (33), receptions (21) and receiving yardage (215). He will be a set-and-forget option next week against the Titans.
report: Zach Ertz caught 5-of-10 targets for 73 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Colts.

impact: It is about what we have come to expect from Ertz, who now has at least 10 targets in every game this season. The Titans simply had no answer for him as he consistently made plays across the middle on the way to his first 100-yard game of the season. With Wentz looking better every week, Ertz will remain a high-end TE1 as long as he is healthy.
report: Zach Ertz hauled in 10-of-14 targets for 112 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Ertz has now caught 10 passes in 3-of-5 games this season. He's on pace for 1,398 yards after entering 2018 with a career high of 853. His production has come with both Nick Foles and Carson Wentz under center and withstood the return of Alshon Jeffery. Ertz will jockey with Rob Gronkowski and Travis Kelce for the TE1 rank going forward.
report: Zach Ertz caught 10-of-11 targets for 110 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: The nine targets were actually Ertz's fewest of the season. That's how consistently he's been used. The score was his second in as many games. He dusted Janoris Jenkins in the end zone. Ertz will be a cinch top-three tight end for Week 7 against the Panthers.
report: Zach Ertz caught 7-of-9 targets for 43 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: Ertz was legitimately unstoppable, relentlessly beating the Panthers’ linebackers and safeties on slants and exploiting every hole known to man in Carolina’s zone coverage. Ertz came oh-so close to a second-quarter touchdown, but he was tackled just short of the goalline.  As the NFL’s premier route-running tight end, Ertz has also been fantasy football’s most-consistent TE1. Even against the Jaguars in London in Week 8, Ertz will be a top-three option at the position at worst.
report: Zach Ertz caught 9-of-11 targets for 138 yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Ertz was having a quiet day, especially by his standards, entering the final quarter, but he took care of his fantasy backers in the final stanza. With the Eagles up by just two, Ertz ran a good route to get a step in the end zone, and Carson Wentz found him for the five-yard touchdown. This was Ertz’s first game of the season with fewer than nine targets, but he has now caught a touchdown in three of his last four games. He will be a high-end TE1 against the Cowboys after the bye week.
report: Zach Ertz caught 4-of-6 targets for 26 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: It was the best game of a dominant season for Ertz. The Cowboys left Ertz wide open down the seam for a 15-yard touchdown in the third quarter for his first touchdown, and he scored his second TD on a goal-line throw from Carson Wentz. Ertz has been one of the most consistent tight ends in the league with 70 yards or a touchdown in 8-of-9 games. He'll be a top-five play for a matchup with the Saints in Week 11.
report: Zach Ertz caught 14-of-16 targets for 145 yards and two touchdowns in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: This was easily Ertz's worst fantasy game of the season -- he at least caught a touchdown when he went for just 26 yards against the Jaguars. Like every Eagles pass catcher, Ertz was seemingly unable to get open, and he went for just eight and seven yards on his two catches. He should find more success against the Giants next week.
report: Zach Ertz hauled in just 2-of-3 targets for 15 yards in the Eagles' Week 11 loss to the Saints.

impact: After his 2-15 day on three targets against the Saints a week ago, Ertz rebounded in predictable fashion against a bad Giants defense.  The eight targets tied Golden Tate (4-30) for the team lead.  Ertz has easily been the best tight end in fantasy along with Travis Kelce and gets the Redskins in Week 13.
report: Zach Ertz caught 7-of-8 targets for 91 yards and one touchdown in the Eagles' 25-22, Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: He was the best player on the field once again, leading the team in catches and targets.  Golden Tate and Jordan Matthews happened to be the red-zone beneficiaries in this one, however, catching short touchdowns from Carson Wentz.  Ertz did set the new single-season franchise record for catches and has four games to add to it.  He'll be a top-three TE1 next week at Dallas.
report: Zach Ertz caught 9-of-10 targets for 83 yards in the Eagles' Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: Hollins is recovering from sports-hernia surgery. It's a disappointing development for a second-year pro who could have had a bigger role while Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) is sidelined. As it is, Hollins will be a candidate to return in the second half of the season. He remains worth holding onto in Dynasty leagues, but his star is dimming. The Eagles are suddenly very thin at wideout.
report: Eagles placed WR Mack Hollins (groin) on injured reserve.

impact: Agholor was holding Jarvis Landry's beer in this one, though he did add a 15-yard pass to Nick Foles. As a passer, Foles seemed incapable of thinking vertically, with his long pass for the night checking in at 18 yards. It's encouraging for Agholor's fantasy outlook that he was Foles' primary safety valve. With Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) expected to miss another game, Agholor will be a solid WR3 against the Bucs in Week 2.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 8-of-10 targets for 33 yards in the Eagles' Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: Agholor has double-digit targets in each of the first two weeks, and there is some belief Carson Wentz (knee) could return for Week 3 versus Indianapolis.  With Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) slated to miss at least one more game, Agholor will remain a volume monster.  He's earned WR2 treatment for the foreseeable future.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 8-of-12 targets for 95 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 2 loss at Tampa Bay.

impact: For the second time in three games, Agholor received all of his targets near the line of scrimmage and failed totally tangible receiving yardage. Through three games, Agholor has 20 receptions for a 145 yards (7.3 yards per reception). With Alshon Jefferey nearing a return, Agholor may quickly find himself third in line for targets. As for now, Agholor is a WR3/FLEX option in PPR formats in Week 4 against the Titans.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 4-of-5 targets for 24 yards in Sunday's Week 4 game versus the Colts.

impact: It was a day to forget for Agholor. He dropped at least two passes including one which would have converted a third-and-long, and he committed a bad fumble which luckily for him rolled out of bounds. On the bright side, he still saw 12 targets in Alshon Jeffery's first game back and had a couple chances at big plays. He will look to bounce back against a scuffling Vikings defense next week.
report: Nelson Agholor hauled in 5-of-12 targets for 22 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: The four targets were a new season low. Agholor is sitting on one touchdown and has cleared 50 yards once in five games. Since Carson Wentz's return, he is averaging seven targets. Agholor will be a low-end WR3 for Thursday night's game against the Giants.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 4-of-4 targets for 45 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: The yards were Agholor's most of the season but came in fluky fashion. His first catch was a 32-yarder that came on a batted ball. His second was a 58-yarder where the defense failed to account for him as he kept running a route as Carson Wentz escaped pressure. The three grabs were Agholor's fewest of the season, while he's now drawn five or fewer looks in 3-of-4 Wentz starts. Agholor will be a low-floor WR3 for Week 7 against the Panthers.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 3-of-5 targets for 91 yards in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: This is what happens when you start the game with -1 yard on your first four targets. Quick hitters to Agholor simply did not work in this one, as the Panthers’ speedy linebackers tracked him down quickly each time. As a slot receiver, Agholor will theoretically have the Eagles’ best Week 8 pass-catcher matchup against Jacksonville, but his usage and production warrant WR4 treatment at this point.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 6-of-7 targets for 20 yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: With Alshon Jeffery being shadowed by Jalen Ramsey, Agholor saw heavy usage the first half. He was able to come down with a 39-yard catch, and he was just inches away from what would have been another long gain and potentially touchdown. Unfortunately, he disappeared in the second half with his only catch coming on a screen late in the fourth quarter. Agholor has failed to top 50 yards in five of his last six games and has not found the end zone since Week 2. He is not a must-hold through the bye week.
report: Nelson Agholor hauled in 3-of-6 targets for 49 yards in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: It breaks a downward trend for Agholor, who was held under 50 yards in six of the last nine games. Agholor missed a few plays with a stinger but was able to return. Most of his damage came on a 51-yard catch late in the fourth quarter. Agholor has a decent target share, but he's going to lose some targets when Golden Tate gets up to speed.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 5-of-7 targets for 83 yards in Week 10 against Dallas.

impact: Agholor turned seven targets into five catches and 83 yards in Golden Tate's first game with the Eagles, but he was more of an afterthought in this one. Agholor also appeared to injure himself on his final target, but nothing was announced. With Tate's role growing -- he led the team with eight targets -- Agholor will struggle for consistent fantasy value.
report: Nelson Agholor did not catch either of his two targets in the Eagles' Week 11 loss to the Saints.

impact: Agholor has been a non-factor the last two weeks with Golden Tate taking on a bigger role.  Agholor is not a fantasy option ahead of Week 13 vs. Washington.
report: Nelson Agholor caught his lone target for 12 yards in the Eagles' Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: It was his best game in three weeks.  The eight targets were more than everyone besides Zach Ertz (10), and his 56 yards were more than Alshon Jeffery (3-31 on five targets), who flopped again.  Still, Agholor's production has been real spotty since the Golden Tate trade and isn't a fantasy play.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 4-of-8 targets for 56 yards in the Eagles' Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: Westbrook did not get the start, but he looked like Blake Bortles' No. 1 option for stretches of this game including on back-to-back big catches in the second quarter. Westbrook's six targets were the second-most on the team and the most among the receiving corps. It is only a matter of time before he jumps Donte Moncrief on the depth chart.
report: Dede Westbrook hauled in 5-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: Westbrook also lost six yards on a rush. It would have been a lost day for Westbrook, but he managed to turn a fourth quarter dumpoff into a 61-yard touchdown. Westbrook shed a tackle, found the sideline and was off to the races. Those are the kinds of plays he's capable of. Westbrook's upside is tantalizing, but the Jags' receiver rotation currently has him stuck in WR4 land for fantasy purposes.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 4-of-5 targets for 83 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: Westbrook has been expectedly inconsistent in the early going as a rotational receiver on a run-first team.  He will get a better matchup in Week 4 against the Jets, who have struggled mightly to contain slot receivers.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 3-of-4 targets for 31 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Westbrook started fast, racking up six catches for 89 yards in the first half. He led Jacksonville in targets, ahead of both Keelan Cole (3) and Donte Moncrief (5). Westbrook did most of his damage on short passes but was explosive in the open field and picked up most of his yards after the catch. He's now went over 80 yards in two of his last three games. Westbrook will be a WR3/FLEX for Week 5 against the Chiefs.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 9-of-13 targets for 130 yards in Jacksonville's Week 4 win over the Jets.

impact: Held off the box score in the first half, Westbrook opened the third quarter with a 30-yard catch and converted a third down with a great 23-yard grab on the next drive. That was about it for the receiver, however, who still served as the No. 3 despite his breakout game last week. Westbrook will be a weak WR4 dart throw next week in Dallas.
report: Dede Westbrook hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 55 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Like the rest of Jacksonville's sluggish offense, Westbrook was mostly held in check, though he did find an opening in the Cowboys' defense during the third quarter when he scored on a 34-yard touchdown pass from Blake Bortles. Even with Sunday's clunker thrown in, the second-year wideout is still on pace for over 1,000 yards receiving. He'll get the Texans at home in Week 7.
report: Dede Westbrook secured three catches for 38 yards and a touchdown on five targets Sunday in the Jaguars’ Week 6 loss to Dallas.

impact: Westbrook got loose for no big plays as the Jaguars switched quarterbacks, benching Blake Bortles for Cody Kessler early in the third quarter. Donte Moncrief, T.J. Yeldon, Keelan Cole, and rookie D.J. Chark all drew more targets than Westbrook, who will be a dicey WR4/flex option when the Jaguars head to London to face the Eagles next.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 4-of-4 targets for 17 yards in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: There was not much to go around in the first half as Blake Bortles attempted just seven passes, but Westbrook made his mark after the break, using a great double move to get open in the back of the end zone for an 11-yard score. It was his second touchdown in the last three games and third of the season. He earned another end-zone target on the next drive, but the pass was batted away. He later added a 20-yard gain in which he cooked the defensive back on the line of scrimmage, but he gave most of it back with a taunting penalty at the end of the catch. With Keelan Cole struggling, Westbrook could see his role expand following the bye.
report: Dede Westbrook hauled in 2-of-6 targets for 31 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles.

impact: He added two carries for 13 yards. Donte Moncrief made the big play, but Westbrook was Blake Bortles’ favorite target on Sunday. He easily led the team with five targets in the first half, and he saw four more than any other Jag on the day. Unfortunately, he struggled to do much with the work. His fantasy day would have looked much better if he had found the end zone, but he was tackled at the one-half-yard line in the third quarter. He also could not come up with what would have been a long gain along the sideline. With a tough Steelers defense on deck, Westbrook will be nothing more than a WR4 next week.
report: Dede Westbrook hauled in 5-of-10 targets for 30 yards in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Westbrook was second on the team in targets on Sunday, but the Jaguars threw a season-low 18 times. Westbrook has now been held under 40-yards receiving in five straight games. Now that we are through the heavy bye weeks, he is not truly on the fantasy radar. The Jaguars head to Buffalo in Week 12.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 2-of-4 targets for 19 yards in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Westbrook has been the Jags' lone semi-consistent pass catcher, and he was one of the team's few bright spots in this disappointing loss.  His touchdown did come in what amounted to fourth-quarter garbage time, narrowing the deficit to 24-21 with Buffalo already up two scores.  Westbrook draws a plus Week 13 matchup against Indianapolis, where he will be a WR3/flex option.
report: Dede Westbrook rushed once for 43 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 44 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 12 loss to Buffalo.

impact: He also rushed once for a loss of one.  As Cody Kessler threw for just 150 yards in the Jaguars' 6-0 upset of Indianapolis, no pass catchers on the team so much as cleared 50 yards.  All Jacksonville pass catchers will remain difficult to trust on Thursday Night Football against Tennessee.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 3-of-5 targets for 25 yards in the Jaguars' Week 13 win over Indianapolis.

impact: The Niners promoted TE Ross Dwelley from the practice squad on Monday, causing a bit of concern about Kittle's status for Week 6.  But it sounds like he's good to go after a week of limited practices.  Perhaps the Niners will dial back Kittle's snaps some and give Garrett Celek a bit more run.  Schefter adds both Matt Breida (ankle) and Pierre Garcon (shoulder) are also expected to play.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports George Kittle (knee) is expected to play Monday night against the Packers.

impact: Matt Breida (ankle) and Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) are also active.  Kittle could have his snaps scaled back some but remains a lock-and-load TE1.
report: George Kittle (knee) is active for Week 6 against the Packers on Monday night.

impact: The targets actually tied Pierre Garcon for the team lead on a night C.J. Beathard attempted just 23 passes but was dropping dimes over the top of the defense to Marquise Goodwin (4-126-2) while averaging a robust 10.7 YPA.  Provided he didn't suffer any setbacks with his knee on a short week, Kittle will be a TE1 next week at home against a leaky Rams defense.
report: George Kittle caught 4-of-6 targets for 30 yards in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers.

impact: Kittle was legitimately questionable for Monday's game in Green Bay, but he played and didn't show any ill effects, seeing the field on 53 of the Niners' 57 offensive snaps. Among tight ends, only Zach Ertz and Travis Kelce have gone for more yards than Kittle this year. The second-year Iowa product will be safe to employ as a TE1 Sunday when the 49ers host the undefeated Rams.
report: George Kittle (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The 49ers are managing Kittle's reps. He's proven to be a high-end TE1 regardless of who is at quarterback.
report: George Kittle (knee) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Kittle played through a questionable tag in Week 6. There's no concern over his status this week. Kittle is a top-five tight end play against the Rams.
report: George Kittle (knee) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: Kittle was the offense for most of this game. He sparked the only scoring drive of the first half with a 23-yard gain in the second quarter and finished the drive with a 10-yard touchdown catch. He had 77 of C.J. Beathard’s 106 yards at the break. The offense's futility limited him in the second half, but he still got loose for a 21-yard gain in the third quarter. Kittle has now topped 75 yards in five of seven games and has two touchdowns in his last four. He will be a high-end TE1 next week in Arizona.
report: George Kittle hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 98 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: Kittle's targets, catches, and yards all played second-fiddle to Kendrick Bourne's surprising 7/71 performance. Kittle's day may have been even better had he not been forced to exit early to check for a potential concussion. Kittle's now seen at least seven targets in five of his last six games and at least six targets in every outing since Week 3. He remains an every-week TE1, and top-four option at his position for the rest of the season.
report: George Kittle secured 5-of-8 targets for 57 yards in the Niners' Week 8 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: There were questions surrounding the 49ers offense with undrafted QB Nick Mullens starting in his first NFL game, but Mullens played like a polished vet. After an injury scare that momentarily sent him to the locker room, Kittle made a sick one-handed catch over the middle that he ended up taking for 71 yards before he finished the drive with a five-yard touchdown. Kittle now has a seven straight games with at least four receptions, and he's always a threat for a long catch-and-run, which makes him a top-five fantasy TE from here on out.
report: George Kittle caught all four of his targets for 108 yards with one touchdown in the 49ers Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: This would appear to be a new injury for Kittle, though there's nothing to suggest it's anything serious. On pace for over 1,000 yards receiving, Kittle will be a top-five tight-end play against the Giants on Monday night.
report: George Kittle (chest) was limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: He was limited to non-contact work for the second straight day. Despite his light workload at practice, we're guessing he'll be out there against the Giants on Monday night. Among tight ends, only Kansas City's Travis Kelce (741) has produced more receiving yards than Kittle (692) this season.
report: George Kittle (chest) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: The 49ers limited Kittle in practice this week but there was never doubt over his statue. Kittle is our No. 3 ranked tight end for Week 10.
report: George Kittle (chest) was removed from the Week 10 injury report.

impact: Kittle has emerged as a top 3-4 tight end in the league as a sophomore and has really steadied himself as a weekly difference maker.  He's the main vein of the passing offense, and the nine grabs and 10 targets set new season bests.  Kittle was cooking in the first half with 5-66 on five targets.  He later had a catch called back on a penalty.  Kittle will get the Bucs in Week 12 after the bye.
report: George Kittle caught 9-of-10 targets for 83 yards in the 49ers' Week 10 loss to the Giants.

impact: Nick Mullens entered this game 13-of-14 when targeting Kittle on the season.  As Mullens took a significant step back with happy feet and inaccuracy, so too did Kittle's box-score production.  Kittle will remain a TE1 when the 49ers visit Seattle next, but his quarterback play is becoming a concern.
report: George Kittle caught 6-of-12 targets for 48 yards in the 49ers' Week 12 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Coming off something of a down week, Kittle bounced back with a solid if not spectacular showing in this one. His biggest play of the game was a 28-yard grab in the third quarter. Kittle will remain a solid TE1 next week against the Broncos.
report: George Kittle hauled in 6-of-9 targets for 70 yards in the 49ers' Week 13 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: James started and was on the field for 24 snaps last week. With Trent Taylor out, he'll move to the slot after playing the X-role for in place of Marquise Goodwin. James could have some staying power given Taylor's history of back issues. His dynasty stock is trending up.
report: NBC Bay Area's Matt Maiocco expects Richie James to have an expanded role this week.

impact: James took a short pass upfield for a 53-yard gain, and he dropped a would-be touchdown grab later in the game. Undrafted quarterback Nick Mullens and James have some chemistry if Mullens gets another start, but James remains off the fantasy radar even if slot receiver Trent Taylor is a healthy inactive once again.
report: Richie James caught 2-of-3 targets for 60 yards in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: "He’s one of the guys that people have asked about and we have talked about, but nothing is going down right now," Shanahan said. "We’ll see how these next two days play out with Pierre and a lot of people." Garcon did not play on Sunday because of knee and shoulder issues, but it seems like the 49ers were just protecting a potential trade asset -- Shanahan expects Garcon to be available for Thursday's matchup with the Raiders. Any team that acquires Garcon would have to pick up the rest of his $6.625 million salary for this season.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan confirmed the team has had trade talks about Pierre Garcon.

impact: He's been battling through the injuries for weeks and should be able to give it a go Thursday night against the Raiders.  The subject of trade talk ahead of Tuesday's deadline, Garcon remains put and will be a no-upside WR4.
report: Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) was limited in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Garcon sat out Sunday's game with knee and shoulder injuries but has practiced on a limited basis this week and should be available against Oakland on Thursday night. Even with six teams on bye, the veteran won't be of much fantasy interest this week.
report: Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) is questionable for Week 9 against the Raiders.

impact: Garcon missed last week with knee and shoulder injuries, but he was able to practice and get cleared on a short week. With UDFA Nick Mullens starting, Garcon is not a recommended fantasy start.
report: Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) is officially active for the 49ers Week 9 game against the Raiders.

impact: Garcon was left wide open over the middle, and quarterback Nick Mullens found him for his first touchdown as a 49er and first touchdown since Week 14 of 2016. The 49ers offense was rolling against the Raiders defense, and they get another easy matchup with the Giants at home on extended rest, but Garcon doesn't see enough targets or score enough touchdowns to warrant a fantasy start.
report: Pierre Garcon caught 3-of-5 targets for 56 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: We imagine this is just a veteran's day for the 11th-year wide receiver. Coming off his first touchdown in almost two years, Garcon won't be someone fantasy owners can count on against the Giants in Week 10.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) didn't practice on Thursday.

impact: Garcon will likely have to get in at least a limited practice on Saturday if he wants to suit up against the Giants on Monday night. Regardless, the 32-year-old hasn't been a difference-maker in the fantasy realm for quite some time.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: This was expected after Garcon missed practice all week. Garcon has been battling knee issues for most of the season but this is just his second missed game. The 49ers will go with Kendrick Bourne opposite Marquise Goodwin in two-wide sets. Garcon's absence opens up even more targets for George Kittle.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) has been ruled out for Week 10 against the Giants.

impact: Garcon was ruled out for Week 10 after not practicing at all leading up to the game, but coach Kyle Shanahan said he will practice ahead of the Week 12 game against the Bucs. Even with Tampa Bay playing porous defense, Garcon will only be a WR5 since he doesn't have a single game with over 60 receiving yards this season.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) is expected to practice when the 49ers return from their Week 11 bye.

impact: Garcon was expected to practice, so this isn't a good sign for his chances of playing coming off the 49ers' bye. His status will be updated Thursday.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Garcon was ultimately unable to practice ahead of Week 12, forcing him to be sidelined in a juicy matchup against the Bucs' swiss-cheese secondary. His absence should open up more opportunities for George Kittle. Even without Garcon, Nick Mullens is considered a low-end QB1 given the tasty matchup on paper.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) is out for Week 12 against the Buccaneers.

impact: Garcon has missed the last two games. This puts on track to return after he was an early rule out last week. With Marquise Goodwin's status up in the air, Garcon could see a decent target share if active.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Garcon has made just one appearance since Week 7 but seems to have a legitimate shot at returning against the Seahawks. With the 49ers' passing attack in disarray, Garcon will be a barely-there WR5.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Marquise Goodwin (personal) has already been ruled out, too. Nick Mullens will be tasked in fending off Seattle's swarming secondary with Dante Pettis, Kendrick Bourne, and Richie James as the team's starting wideouts. George Kittle is the only must-start option in San Francisco's offense.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) is out for Week 13 against the Seahawks.

impact: Garcon didn't play despite being limited all last week. In a Nick Mullens offense, Garcon won't be a fantasy option even if he returns Sunday.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The 49ers' slot receiver, Taylor's six targets were tied with Pierre Garcon for second on the team behind George Kittle (9).  However, Taylor is more of a Cole Beasley type who will have a big game here or there but isn't fantasy-relevant outside of deep PPR leagues.  Leave Taylor on the wire.
report: Trent Taylor caught 4-of-6 targets for 28 yards in the 49ers' Week 1 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Even with Marquise Goodwin (quad) on the shelf, the second-year slot man failed to make an impact. Taylor had his moments as a rookie but is off to a quiet start this year with just four catches for 28 yards on eight targets. Outside of dynasty leagues, Taylor doesn’t offer much fantasy appeal.
report: Trent Taylor came up empty on both of his targets Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 2 win over the Lions.

impact: Two words: garbage time. Taylor snoozed through the first half, securing his lone target for a two-yard pickup. But with San Francisco behind in the second half, the young slot receiver feasted with six catches including four on the Niners' final drive. Taylor was also the recipient of a one-yard touchdown, which capped a 14-play, 82-yard drive in the fourth quarter. That play came on a successful fourth-down conversion. Taylor entered Sunday's action with 64 yards all SEASON, so this isn't something fantasy owners should grow accustomed to. The second-year La Tech alum gets the Packers on the road in Week 6.
report: Trent Taylor delivered seven catches for 61 yards and a touchdown on eight targets Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Hopefully the 49ers are just managing Taylor's reps ahead of their Monday night game with the Packers. They can ill afford any more receiver injuries.
report: Trent Taylor (back) was held out of 49ers practice on Thursday.

impact: Taylor and Pierre Garcon have been held out the last two days. It's possible the 49ers are resting them given their wideout depth. Kendrick Bourne and Richie James are next up if one of Taylor or Garcon sits.
report: Trent Taylor (back) didn't practice Friday.

impact: Taylor hasn't practiced this week, but there was hope the 49ers were managing his reps. He's now looking on the wrong side of questionable for Monday night. Richie James will play the slot if Taylor sits.
report: NBC Bay Area's Matt Maiocco "would be very surprised" if Trent Taylor (back) plays in Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Taylor missed practice all week with his back injury. He's coming off season highs in Week 5, but it's not a huge loss. Taylor had offseason back surgery so this could be more than a one-game absence. Richie James will pick up Taylor's slot snaps.
report: Trent Taylor (back) is doubtful for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Taylor was doubtful to play because of a back injury.  Pettis has a knee issue.
report: 49ers declared WR Trent Taylor, WR Dante Pettis, OT Shon Coleman, OG Josh Garnett, DT Julian Taylor, TE Cole Wick, and DL D.J. Jones inactive Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Taylor missed Monday night's game with a minor back injury, though his presence at Wednesday's practice would suggest he's on track to return this week. The second-year slot receiver has yet to make a dent in fantasy, totaling just 16 grabs for 125 yards and one touchdown this season.
report: Trent Taylor (back) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Taylor has a chance to play after getting in limited practice. His back injury is likely going to be an issue all year.
report: Trent Taylor (back) is questionable for Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: Taylor is joined by S Jaquiski Tartt, DB Antone Exum Jr., LB Reuben Foster, OL Erik Magnuson, DT Jullian Taylor, and OT Shon Coleman as inactives. With Pierre Garcon and Dante Pettis healthy, Taylor is the odd man out.
report: Trent Taylor is inactive for the 49ers Week 9 game against the Raiders.

impact: Cole got off to a great start with a 31-yard catch on the second play of the game, but he was mostly quiet as Blake Bortles struggled the rest of the way. He did lead the Jaguars with 54 yards, but Dede Westbrook paced the receivers with 6 targets. Cole will remain an upside WR4 play next week against the Patriots.
report: Keelan Cole hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 54 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: After a quiet Week 1, Cole delivered on his summer hype, giving him three 100-yard games over his past five regular season contests. The highlights were in the first quarter, where Cole made a one-handed, Odell Beckham-esque 22-yard catch on Eric Rowe down the sideline. He finished the job by dismantling Rowe for a 24-yard score three plays later. Cole is simply a born playmaker down the field. The Jags' receiver rotation will make him uneven in fantasy, but he's earned the right to be treated as an every-week WR3.
report: Keelan Cole caught 7-of-8 targets for 116 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: Cole led the Jags in targets, but Blake Bortles' wild inaccuracies returned, and Jacksonville got nothing going in the downfield passing game.  Cole has an abundance of talent, but this offense is simply not worthy of trust for him to be viewed as anything more than a volatile WR3/flex option in Week 4 versus the Jets.
report: Keelan Cole caught 5-of-9 targets for 40 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: It was a quiet game for Cole with Dede Westbrook and Donte Moncrief both going over 100 yards. Cole made both of his catches in the first quarter and was a non-factor in the second half. He's now been held under 40 yards in back to back games. The Jagaurs spread it out offense is going to be dificult to predict on a week to week basis. Cole will just be a low-end WR3 for Week 5.
report: Keelan Cole caught 2-of-3 passes for 15 yards in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Cole played a big role in the Jaguars' only good drive of the game, hauling in a 32-yard pass to help set up a touchdown on the next play. He also drew a deep target at the end of the first half, but it was a non-descript game for Jacksonville's 1A receiver. He will be just a WR4 play next week in Dallas.
report: Keelan Cole hauled in 4-of-10 targets for 70 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Three of his grabs came with Jacksonville down big in the second half. Cole was stripped by Jaylen Smith in the third quarter, resulting in a turnover. It's been a quiet stretch for the second-year wideout, who has topped 50 yards just once during his current four-game touchdown drought. Cole is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Keelan Cole collected four catches for 41 yards on five targets Sunday in the Jags’ Week 6 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: It was an inefficient day for Cole as the Jaguars benched Blake Bortles and turned to game-manager backup Cody Kessler for 30 second-half pass attempts. Even in a favorable matchup, Cole will be a low-floor WR4 option as the Jaguars head to London for Week 8 to face the Eagles.
report: Keelan Cole caught 2-of-7 targets for 21 yards in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: Cole appeared to be the receiver of choice early in this one, catching two of Blake Bortles’ six first-half completions. He fumbled after securing the second catch, however, setting the Eagles up for a touchdown just before the half. He was not heard from much after that mistake. Battling drops and fumbles, Cole could see his snap share shrink coming out of the bye. He is droppable in redraft formats.
report: Keelan Cole hauled in 2-of-3 targets for 18 yards in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Cole was the target on two of Blake Bortles' six first-half completions, but he lost a fumble on the second and appears to have been benched following the mistake. Second-round rookie D.J. Chark ended up playing 48 snaps as Jacksonville's No. 3 receiver. Cole has struggled with mistakes the last several weeks, so it would not be surprising if Chark emerged from the bye with a bigger role. Cole can be dropped in redraft formats.
report: Keelan Cole played 15-of-64 snaps (23 percent) Week 8 against the Eagles.

impact: After being benched before the bye, Cole was an absolute non-factor in this game. He can be dropped in all redraft leagues.
report: Keelan Cole was not targeted in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Cole only played extensively because D.J. Chark was inactive due to injury.  Cole has been off the fantasy radar for several weeks.
report: Keelan Cole went catch-less on two targets in Week 12.

impact: Cole has lacked fantasy value for several weeks.
report: Keelan Cole caught 2-of-2 targets for 16 yards in Week 13.

impact: Moncrief got the start and actually saw one more target than Keelan Cole, but he was easily the least productive member of the receiving corps. Moncrief should remain involved because of his red-zone ability, but it would not be surprising if Dede Westbrook jumped him on the depth chart.
report: Donte Moncrief hauled in 1-of-5 targets for 14 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: There's a Moncrief line if we've ever seen one. Moncrief's four-yard score was a nice grab against tight Stephon Gilmore coverage in the end zone. Moncrief was announced with a knee injury in the second half but ended up playing through it. Despite the team-leading nine targets, Moncrief was fourth in yardage. He's a touchdown-or-bust WR4 for fantasy purposes.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 4-of-9 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: Moncrief is a rotational receiver on a run-first team with a highly inconsistent quarterback.  He is barely roster worthy in 12-team leagues.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 2-of-3 targets for 16 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Moncrief got behind Jets CB Trumaine Johnson for a 67-yard TD. It was his only real highlight, though Moncrief saw the second most targets behind Dede Westbrook. Moncrief didn't have more than 34 yards in any game prior to this week. This will likely go down as one of his best games.
report: Donte Moncrief caught five passes for 109 yards and a touchdowin in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Moncrief led the team in receiving, but there was nothing particularly impactful about his performance. He had 15 yards at the half, and 25 of his yards came on a meaningless catch deep into garbage time. That said, he remains at worst the No. 2 option in a passing game which has created a lot of yardage with Leonard Fournette sidelined. He will be on the desperation WR4 map next week in Dallas.
report: Donte Moncrief hauled in 6-of-15 targets for 76 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Moncrief entered Week 6 with 11 catches for 185 yards and a touchdown over his previous two outings, but that all went out the window against Dallas. The ex-Colt blew a fourth-down conversion with an ugly drop in the fourth quarter, not that it mattered much with Jacksonville getting boat-raced. Moncrief's goose egg Sunday serves as a reminder that he'll always be a boom-or-bust fantasy player. We'll see how he fares against Houston in Week 7.
report: Donte Moncrief came up empty on his three targets Sunday in Jacksonville’s Week 6 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Moncrief led the team in targets and receiving in a game where Blake Bortles was benched for losing multiple fumbles, and Cody Kessler wound up attempting 30 passes in a half as the Jaguars played from behind. The week before, Moncrief went catch-less on three targets. Although Week 8 against the Eagles poses a favorable matchup, Moncrief’s wild week-to-week inconsistency will render him a boom-bust WR3/flex option.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 7-of-10 targets for 76 yards in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: Moncrief took a commercial flight across the Atlantic and was on the practice field Friday.  It doesn't sound, at this point, like there will be any repercussions for Moncrief,  but it's notable in case the Jaguars "punish" him for the mishap.  Moncrief is on the WR3/4 map this week in an exploitable matchup.  He's cleared 75 yards in 3-of-4 games and leads the team in air yards.
report: Donte Moncrief missed the Jaguars' team flight to London due to a "passport mishap" but rejoined the team on Friday.

impact: Moncrief was a non-factor in the first half, failing to see a target as Blake Bortles attempted just seven passes. Things quickly changed after the break. He caught a 24-yard pass on the opening drive of the second half, and he came down with two more passes on a touchdown drive the next time the offense was on the field. Moncrief has started to look like Jacksonville's No. 1 receiver, but that is not a high-upside job. He is not a must-hold through the bye.
report: Donte Moncrief hauled in 4-of-7 targets for 54 yards in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Moncrief made his presence known quickly against his former team, breaking the offense out of an early rut with an 80-yard touchdown in which he shed a couple defenders on his way to the end zone. That was basically it for him until the fourth quarter, when he came up with a big third-down conversion. Moncrief now has at least 75 yards in three of his last five games, but his matchup next week against the Steelers is not worth attacking.
report: Donte Moncrief hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 98 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Moncrief hauled in an 11-yard slant on the opening drive and then went dark the rest of the day as the Jaguars threw just 18 times on the day. Moncrief had at least 50 yards receiving in each of his previous three games and in five of the previous six. A boom-or-bust option, Moncrief is only an option for the deepest of leagues and will only be a WR4 option next week against the Bills.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 1-of-2 passes for 11 yards in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Moncrief's reception initially was ruled a 30-yard touchdown, then overturned by replay as reviews showed he was tackled at the one-yard line.  A brawl ensued after that very play, and Leonard Fournette was appropriately ejected for throwing several haymakers.  Moncrief remains one of fantasy's most boom-bust wide receiver plays.  He will continue to be in Week 13 against the Colts.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 1-of-4 targets for 29 yards in the Jaguars' Week 12 loss to Buffalo.

impact: He was out-targeted by T.J. Yeldon (8) and Dede Westbrook (5).  Game-managing fill-in QB starter Cody Kessler attempted just 24 throws and passed for 150 yards.  We wouldn't expect much more passing-game production in Week 14 at Tennessee, rendering Moncrief a low-floor WR4 option at best.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 3-of-4 targets for 40 yards in the Jaguars' Week 13 win over the Colts.

impact: Chark’s role has been growing in recent weeks, and that continued in this game. The rookie only caught one pass in the first half, but he came down with three catches on the Jaguars’ first two scoring drives after the break. He also got open in the end zone in the fourth quarter, but he could not come down with a pass which was thrown slightly behind him. With Keelan Cole struggling, Chark could start to see more work following the bye.
report: D.J. Chark hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 41 yards in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Even with Keelan Cole out of the picture, Chark was not able to make anything happen in the passing game. He did have a couple nice returns, but he is not a viable option in redraft formats right now. He remains a hold in Dynasty.
report: D.J. Chark did not catch either of his two targets Week 10 against the Colts.

impact: Chark led the team in targets on Sunday after failing to catch a pass in Week 10. The second-round pick this year has surpassed Keelan Cole on the depth chart, but is not a fantasy option on his own merit at this time.
report: D.J. Chark caught 2-of-5 targets for 15 yards in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Chark has run as the team's third wideout ever since Keelan Cole lost a fumble prior to Jacksonville's bye. Cole should re-enter three-wide sets, but it's admittedly a terrible matchup for all against the Bills' secondary. Blake Bortles will also be tasked in getting all the ball without LT Josh Walker (foot/ankle) protecting his blindside.
report: Jags WR D.J. Chark (quad) is out for Week 12 against the Bills.

impact: It's not a good start after Chark was held out of Week 12. He's likely looking at a multi-game absence.
report: D.J. Chark (quad) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Chark also sat out Wednesday's session, making it likely he misses his second game in a row. Keelan Cole should see more snaps with Chark sidelined, but he is not a realistic fantasy option.
report: D.J. Chark (quad) did not practice Thursday.

impact: The second-round pick hasn't played since Week 11.  In Chark's absence, Keelan Cole was reinstalled into three-receiver sets but has made no box-score noise.
report: D.J. Chark (quad) was held out of Jaguars practice on Monday.

impact: This will be his third straight absence. The second-round rookie has had a rough go of it this year, securing just 14-of-30 targets for 174 scoreless yards over 10 appearances. He's not even remotely relevant in redraft leagues.
report: D.J. Chark (quad) is out for Week 14 against the Titans.

impact: After missing time during camp, Meredith was a healthy scratch the first two weeks of the season. Payton said New Orleans will see if they can get him in the game plan this week. It is not a ringing endorsement, and Meredith obviously should not be in any fantasy lineups. Still, it is a step in the correct direction.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said Cameron Meredith could be active this week.
