impact: The Saints plan to work Meredith into their gameplan after making him a healthy scratch the first two weeks. It's hard to see Meredith having much of a role, but this is a step in the right direction. Meredith will push Tre'Quan Smith and Austin Carr for snaps.
report: Cameron Meredith is active for Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: Active for the first time this season, Meredith made the most of his lone target. Meredith’s 11-yarder staked New Orleans to a 23-21 lead with just over six minutes remaining in the third quarter. The 26-year-old cleared one hurdle by recording his first catch in over 20 months, but he’s still not worthy of fantasy consideration. Meredith will try to take another step forward against the Giants in Week 4.
report: Cameron Meredith registered an 11-yard touchdown on his lone target Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: It was his first game on the active roster, but that did not stop Meredith from out-snapping Tre'Quan Smith (26) and Austin Carr (13). Despite a touchdown on his only target Sunday, it is questionable how large a role Meredith can carve out behind Michael Thomas and Ted Ginn, but it looks like he is on his way to the No. 3 job. He is a fine speculative add.
report: Cameron Meredith played 34-of-79 snaps (43 percent) Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: The Saints may just be managing Meredith's reps after he made his season debut last week. Meredith outsnapped Tre'Quan Smith and scored a touchdown on his only target against the Falcons, but the Saints' No. 3 job looks like a week to week role.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Meredith caught his lone target for an 11-yard touchdown in his Saints debut last week against Atlanta. Until his volume increases, Meredith won't be much more than a deep-league bench stash.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Meredith caught his lone target for an 11-yard score in his 2018 debut last week and was more involved this Sunday.  The stat line isn't sexy, but Meredith should continue to push for heavy snaps behind Michael Thomas.  He'll again be on the WR4/5 map next week at home against the Redskins.
report: Cameron Meredith caught 3-of-4 targets for 32 yards in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: He caught all five of his passes in the first half when Drew Brees threw for 250 of his 363 yards.  Meredith has steadily improved his numbers each of the last three weeks after missing the first two games.  He's been a mainstay in three-wide sets and should only keep getting better after the Week 6 bye.  Meredith will have up-and-down games but needs to be owned as a WR4.
report: Cameron Meredith caught all five of his targets for 71 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: Meredith had the bye week to heal his injured knee. He should be all systems go for Sunday's game in Baltimore. Meredith hasn't made his fantasy presence felt yet in 2018, but he still warrants ownership in most formats.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Meredith was limited Wednesday coming off the Saints' bye week but he was back to full work on Thursday. Obviously he'll be ready for Sunday's game in Baltimore. Meredith hasn't made much fantasy noise yet but that could change now that Ted Ginn (knee) is on I.R.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Meredith practiced fully the last two days. He's healthy coming off the Saints' bye and is in line for an expanded role with Ted Ginn on IR. Tre'Quan Smith will start opposite Michael Thomas, but Meredith should see snaps in three-wide sets.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: It's a step back for Meredith after he went 5-of-5 for 71 yards in Week 5. Drew Brees' volume has been down during that span — coinciding with Mark Ingram's return — and Tre'Quan Smith has looked like the biggest beneficiary of Ted Ginn's absence. Meredith isn't much of a WR5 for the time being.
report: Cameron Meredith was not targeted in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: It's the second straight week Meredith was held without a catch. With Tre’Quan Smith the No. 2 wideout behind Michael Thomas, Meredith isn't worth stashing in fantasy leagues
report: Cameron Meredith wasn't targeted in Week 8 against the Vikings.

impact: Meredith has been fighting the knee seemingly all season and hasn't been right since signing with the Saints.  He hasn't caught a pass in three weeks, and the Saints just signed Dez Bryant, pushing Meredith further down the line.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Meredith needs a knee scope on the same knee in which he tore his ACL last season.  It's an obvious concern.  Meredith's season is over.  He played six games his first year in New Orleans, catching nine balls for 114 yards and one touchdown after signing a two-year, $9.6 million deal to leave the Bears as a restricted free agent.  He may be one-and-done in New Orleans.
report: Saints placed WR Cameron Meredith on injured reserve with a knee injury, ending his season.

impact: Ginn's knee injury may explain why he played just over half of the Saints' snaps against the Browns. It's not a threat to Ginn's Week 3 status, but this is a situation to monitor going forward. The Saints have exciting rookie Tre'Quan Smith behind Ginn.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ginn was a limited participant at Wednesday's practice and that may very well be the case again today. An absence, however, would signal a setback and could threaten his availability for Week 3. Ginn played through the injury last week, totaling 55 yards in a win over Cleveland.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) wasn't seen during the open portion of Thursday's practice.

impact: Ginn has been limited in practice, but the 33-year-old was adamant he'll be out there come Sunday. Ginn has gotten off to a productive start this season, delivering nine catches for 123 yards and a touchdown through two games.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) told reporters Thursday that he expects to play Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: G Andrus Peat and OT Terron Armstead were also removed from New Orleans' injury report. Although Ginn appears healthy and will start on the outside, Cameron Meredith is expected to be active against the Falcons. Tre'Quan Smith notably started in Week 2 but still ran fewer routes (and logged fewer snaps) than Austin Carr. All could rotate around Michael Thomas.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) wasn't listed on the Saints' final injury report for Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: Hopefully you took the over in this game, because it was a slugfest. Ginn got off to a strong start, capping the Saints’ opening drive with a four-yard touchdown on a play-action pass from Drew Brees. Aside from that play and a 20-yard rush on an end-around in the fourth quarter, the veteran was mostly held in check. Ginn dropped a pair of passes in the first half, which may explain why he wasn’t targeted after halftime. He’ll look to get back on track next week when the Saints travel to East Rutherford for a date with the 1-2 Giants.
report: Ted Ginn absorbed three-of-six targets for 12 yards and a touchdown while amassing 20 yards on his lone rushing attempt Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: Ginn has been battling knee issues the last two weeks. The missed practice time hasn't stopped him from playing. Ginn should be fine for his normal snaps against the Giants.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: We imagine he'll be removed from the injury report altogether on Friday. Ginn has scored in two of his first three games while contributing 12 catches for 135 yards on 19 targets. He's RotoPat's No. 48 wide receiver for Sunday's matchup against the Giants.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: He rushed one time for one yard.  Ginn almost had the Saints in serious hot water late in the fourth quarter when he botched a kickoff ahead by eight points, setting the offense up at their own three-yard line.  But Alvin Kamara ended up scoring from 49 yards out to alleviate any concerns.  Ginn is a boom-or-bust WR4.
report: Ted Ginn failed to catch any of his three targets in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: The Saints have been managing Ginn's reps of late. He will be active for Monday Night Football against the Redskins. Ginn has 12 yards over his past two games.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was held out of Thursday's practice.

impact: It's the second straight missed practice for Ginn. The Saints have been limiting his reps, so it's not yet a cause for concern. We'll know Ginn's official status Saturday.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) didn't practice Friday.

impact: Ginn has been playing through knee issues the past few games. He didn't practice all week, so it sounds like there's something more serious going on. It's possible the Saints' Week 6 bye played a role in Ginn sitting. Ginn's absence will open up targets for Tre'Quan Smith and Cameron Meredith behind Michael Thomas.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) has been ruled out for Week 5 against the Redskins.

impact: Ginn was already previously ruled out with a knee injury.  Cameron Meredith, Tre'Quan Smith, and Austin Carr will gobble up snaps behind Michael Thomas.
report: Saints declared WR Ted Ginn, CB Demetri Goodson, LB Manti Te'o, C Cameron Tom, C Will Clapp, DE Mitchell Loewen, and DE Trey Hendrickson inactive Week 5 against the Redskins.

impact: Ginn missed the Week 5 win over the Redskins before the bye and still isn't ready.  Tre'Quan Smith filled in admirably in Ginn's place, catching a pair of long touchdowns, including Drew Brees' 67-yard record-setting score.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ginn hasn't played or practiced since injuring his knee in Week 4. A missed practice Friday would likely signal another absence for the veteran. If Ginn sits Sunday at Baltimore, it would open up snaps for rookie Tre'Quan Smith.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) remained sidelined at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ginn injured his knee in Week 4 and apparently did not make enough progress during the Saints' Week 6 bye for the team to stick it out. We would assume the 33-year-old deep threat will be a candidate for return after missing the required eight weeks. In the interim, third-rounder Tre'Quan Smith is going to be the main beneficiary. Smith already rained hellfire on the Redskins in Ginn's Week 5 absence. He's worth a flier in all leagues where he remains unowned.
report: Saints placed WR Ted Ginn (knee) on injured reserve.

impact: Njoku technically was targeted once in the game as he drew a pass interference in the end zone, but it was the lone pass that came his way on the afternoon. Prior to Sunday, Njoku was tied for second among all tight ends with 22 receptions over the previous four weeks, so Sunday's total disappearance was a surprise. Sunday was a reminder that the floor for any player in the Cleveland offense is subterranean. Despite his empty stat sheet Sunday, Njoku will still be a lower-TE1 option in Week 9 against the Chiefs, who have allowed a tight end to score in each of the past two weeks.
report: David Njoku was held without a catch or target in Sunday's Week 8 loss to the Steelers.

impact: He was limited last Wednesday and Thursday before playing Sunday and going catch-less on zero targets against the Steelers.  Njoku should be able to bounce back this week against the Chiefs with the Browns playing catchup.
report: David Njoku (knee) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: The Browns are just limiting his practice reps. Njoku is looking to bounce back from a zero-target performance last week, but he should have more opportunities this week against the Chiefs.
report: David Njoku (knee) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: The Browns have limited Njoku's practice reps the last two weeks, but his status was never in doubt. After getting held without a catch in Week 8, Njoku should rebound against the Chiefs.
report: David Njoku (knee) was removed from the Week 9 injury report.

impact: After failing to register a mark in the box score last week, Njoku bounced back to have a modest day, but he was fourth on the team in targets. Njoku's highlight of the day was a 19-yard catch and run in the first quarter that set up the first score of the game for the Browns. Njoku now has at least four catches and 50 yards receiving in five of his past six games, which more than usable at a depleted tight end position. Njoku will enter Week 10 as a back-half TE1 in Week 10 against the Falcons.
report: David Njoku caught 4-of-5 targets for 53 yards in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: The rib injury is new, but Njoku has been playing through his knee issue for weeks. The Browns are just getting him some maintenance. Njoku is a back-end TE1 for Week 10.
report: David Njoku (knee, ribs) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Njoku has cleared 50 yards in all but one of Baker Mayfield's starts. He's a mid-range TE1 for a solid matchup with the Falcons.
report: David Njoku (ribs, knee) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Njoku has been limited this week in practice, but there does not seem to be much concern about his availability. He will be a name to watch on Sunday morning, but he should be good to go as a mid-range TE1 against the Falcons.
report: David Njoku (ribs, knee) is questionable for Week 10 against the Falcons.

impact: Njoku saw his workload scaled back at practice this week while battling knee and rib injuries, though there was never much doubt about his status for Sunday. The second-year tight end hasn't exactly been Mr. Consistency, but at a thin fantasy position, he's still in play as a starter in most formats.
report: David Njoku (questionable, ribs/knee) is expected to play Week 10 against the Falcons.

impact: Njoku's status was never in doubt. Inactive for the Browns are QB Drew Stanton, WR Da’Mari Scott, DB Juston Burris, OL Desmond Harrison, TE Pharaoh Brown, DL Chad Thomas and DL Carl Davis.
report: David Njoku (ribs, knee) is active for Week 10 against the Falcons.

impact: It was a beautiful day for the Browns' offense, but Baker Mayfield was spreading the ball around as Nick Chubb dominated on the ground. It was just the second time in seven Mayfield starts that Njoku was held below 50 yards. Njoku will be a risky TE1 against the Bengals when the Browns come off bye in Week 12.
report: David Njoku caught 1-of-1 targets for 18 yards in the Browns' Week 10 win over the Falcons.

impact: He's been limited on Wednesdays and Thursdays for the last few weeks and remains so even out of the bye.  Njoku's production has slipped in recent games, but he remains on the back of the TE1 map against the Bengals.
report: David Njoku (knee) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Njoku has followed the same practice regimen the past few weeks — limited, questionable, active. He'll play Sunday. Although he's seen just a 10% target share since OC Freddie Kitchens took over, Njoku's on-field usage deems him a  TE1 against the Bengals' injury-riddled secondary.
report: David Njoku (knee) is questionable for Week 12 against the Bengals.

impact: Njoku did nearly all of his damage on one drive, catching three passes for 51 yards on the third drive of the game that was a capped with a 6-yard touchdown. On his score, Njoku attempted to leap over a defender from the 5-yard line, but was caught in mid-air, only to not go down. His teammates then shoved him into the end zone for his third touchdown of the season. Njoku will enter Week 13 as an upside option at tight end against the Texans.
report: David Njoku caught all five his targets for 63 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 12 win over the Bengals.

impact: Njoku has been tough to nail down as of late, having games with zero, 18 and eight yards receiving over the past five weeks to go along with games of 53 and 63 yards. Njoku does have six games with at least 50-yards receiving, but only a season-high of 69 yards on the year. Despite his down game and lack of showing a high ceiling this season, Njoku will still be a option at a depressed tight end position to take a chance on in Week 14 against a giving Panthers defense.
report: Davis Njoku caught 3-of-6 targets for eight yards in Sunday's Week 13 loss to the Texans.

impact: The Browns' No. 3 receiver now has nine catches for 117 yards through three games. Baker Mayfield's insertion under center could make Higgins worth a second look in deeper (14-team) PPR leagues.
report: Rashard Higgins caught 3-of-3 targets for 32 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: Higgins led Cleveland in receiving yards in a game where Baker Mayfield spread the ball around.  David Njoku's five catches led the team.  Higgins has a secure role in three-receiver sets alongside Jarvis Landry and Antonio Callaway but lacks fantasy value outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Rashard Higgins caught 4-of-5 targets for 61 yards in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: Higgins was having a productive day, catching 3-of-4 targets for 66 yards and a touchdown. His 19-yard touchdown before the first half put the Browns up 6-3 at the half.
report: Rishard Higgins suffered a knee injury in Sunday's Week 5 game versus the Ravens and his return is doubtful.

impact: Higgins was on his way to a good game against the Ravens before going down, catching 3-of-4 targets for 66 yards and a touchdown. With Antonio Callaway struggling, the Browns are suddenly shaky behind Jarvis Landry. Derrick Willies and Rod Streater should be the next guys up, but someone like Dez Bryant or Rishard Matthews could be signed to help out.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson said Rashard Higgins is week-to-week with an MCL sprain.

impact: It means he will miss games against the Chargers and Bucs. The Browns host the Steelers in Week 8. The Dawg Pound needs reinforcements at receiver.
report: Rashard Higgins (sprained MCL) is expected to miss at least two games.

impact: He's working off to the side with the training staff.  Higgins sprained his MCL in Week 5 and should be nearing a return.  The Browns could use him with Damion Ratley and Antonio Callaway not offering much behind Jarvis Landry.  Callaway in particular has been a colossal disappointment thus far.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He needs a third game off with a sprained MCL.  The Browns will continue to roll with Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, and Damion Ratley in three-wide.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Steelers.

impact: He's been out since Week 5 with a sprained MCL.  Higgins should be getting close.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Higgins has been out since spraining his MCL in Week 5. This practice gives him a shot to play this week against the Chiefs. With every receiver struggling, Higgins could step into the No. 2 role once he is healthy enough to play.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: Higgins practiced Thursday and Friday, giving him a decent chance to return from his sprained MCL that has kept him out since Week 5.  Antonio Callaway rolled his ankle Thursday and sat Friday; he's also questionable.  Higgins probably has the better chances of the two to suit up against the Chiefs.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) is questionable for Week 9 against the Chiefs.

impact: Higgins will make his first appearance since Week 5. He'll be the No. 3 wideout behind Jarvis Landry and Antonio Callaway.
report: Rashard Higgins (questionable, knee) is expected to play in Week 9 against the Chiefs.

impact: He was fully expected to play after returning to practice this week. Higgins will resume his role in three-wide sets behind Jarvis Landry and Antonio Callaway.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) is active for Week 9 against the Chiefs.

impact: Higgins was absent since Week 5 as he dealt with a knee injury. Five players received more targets than Higgins in his return. He is not a fantasy option in Week 10 against the Falcons.
report: Rashard Higgins caught 3-of-4 targets for 19 yards in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Smith was always the most likely option to take over for Ted Ginn, and that is exactly what happened as Cameron Meredith was limited to just 18 snaps and zero targets. Smith only managed 44 yards on three catches in the tough matchup, but his rest-of-season outlook is strong. He needs to be rostered in all formats.
report: Tre'Quan Smith played 52-of-71 snaps (73 percent) Week 7 against the Ravens.

impact: It was another quiet game for Smith after getting held to 44 yards last week. Smith continued to outsnap Cameron Meredith, but there wasn't much volume for him in a game Drew Brees threw for only 120 yards. There’s still a lot to like with Smith’s ROS outlook. He’s in the WR4 conversation for a potential Week 9 shootout with the Rams.
report: Tre'Quan Smith caught 3-of-4 targets for 18 yards in Week 8 against the Vikings.

impact: Smith has disappointed a bit following Ted Ginn’s season-ending injury, and he did not have the break out many were hoping to see in this one. That said, he did manage a good fantasy day with his two catches. The first was a nice back-shoulder grab in the first quarter which went for 19 yards, and he got open at the goal line for a four-yard score in the second. He was targeted down the left sideline in the fourth quarter, but he could not come up with a slightly overthrown pass. Next week’s game in Cincinnati could be another shootout, but Smith has not seen enough targets to be considered anything but a risky FLEX.
report: Tre'Quan Smith caught 2-of-3 targets for 23 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 9 win over the Rams.

impact: In four games since catching three passes for 111 yards and two touchdowns in Week 5, Smith has totaled eight catches for 85 yards. Even on the high-powered Saints offense, Smith is not a reliable fantasy option.
report: Tre'Quan Smith was not targeted in Sunday's Week 10 win over the Bengals.

impact: Coming off a zero target game against the Bengals, Smith exploded in this matchup. He was not able to come up with an end-zone target in the first quarter, but he corralled three quick catches on the next drive and just kept building from there. He got the two-minute drive started with a 22-yard catch, and he capped that drive with a gutsy 15-yard touchdown in which he absorbed a big hit. He kept things going after the break, working back to the ball on an 18-yard grab on the opening drive of the third quarter and closing out the period with a spectacular diving catch for 38 yards. Smith could not build on his last breakout, but he will have a better chance this time around with the Falcons up next. He will be an upside WR3 on Thanksgiving.
report: Tre'Quan Smith hauled in 10-of-13 targets for 157 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 11 win over the Eagles.

impact: The Saints didn't actually practice and will do almost nothing this week, but they are forced to issue would-be practice reports based on estimations.  Smith is coming off a breakout game with ten catches for 157 yards and a touchdown on 13 targets.  His participation reports will be worth monitoring all week.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) was listed as a DNP in Monday's practice.

impact: This puts Smith on track to suit up Thursday night against the Saints. Boom or bust this season, Smith will have a good chance at booming against the Falcons' sub-par defense on the Superdome's fast track.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) returned to Saints practice on Tuesday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Previous reports had Smith listed as limited, but it was corrected Tuesday evening.  Smith has now been sidelined both Monday and Tuesday and is looking awfully uncertain for Thursday night's showdown with the Falcons.  If he misses it, Keith Kirkwood and Austin Carr are next up at wideout.
report: Updating a previous item, Tre'Quan Smith (foot) did not practice Tuesday.

impact: Smith returned to a limited practice on Wednesday, putting him on track to play Thanksgiving night. Coming off a career-high 157 yards in last week's win over the Eagles, Smith should have a field day against Atlanta's bottom-rung secondary.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) is questionable for Week 12 against the Falcons.

impact: It's surprising Marshall was healthy scratched since Smith was unable to go. That now leaves UDFA Keith Kirkwood, Austin Carr, and Tommylee Lewis as the team's receiving options behind stud Michael Thomas. If behind or stuck with a dud in your Thanksgiving DFS lineups, Kirkwood would be the optimal last-minute pivot.
report: Saints declare WR Tre'Quan Smith, WR Brandon Marshall, LT Terron Armstead, LB Manti Te’o, DL Mitchell Loewen and G/C Will Clapp inactive for Week 12 against the Falcons.

impact: Even though it wasn't "full" participation, Smith being able to practice this early in the week is a good sign for his chances of playing Thursday night against Dallas.  With Smith sidelined on Thanksgiving, Keith Kirkwood worked as the Saints' No. 2 receiver.  Tommylee Lewis was No. 3, and Austin Carr No. 4.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) was limited in Monday's practice.

impact: Getting in back-to-back practices bodes well for Smith's odds of returning Thursday against the Cowboys. The Saints will issue their final status report on Wednesday. Even if Smith ends up a game-time decision, owners will easily be able to swap. Smith will be an upside WR4 if he takes the field.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) remained "limited" in Tuesday's practice.

impact: All of Smith's big games have come at home in the Superdome, but this one will be played in a similar dome environment at AT&T Stadium.  The upside is there, but the floor is just as low.  Treat Smith as a boom-bust WR4.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) was removed from the Week 13 injury report and will play against the Cowboys on Thursday night.

impact: Smith was removed from the injury report on Wednesday, so it is not a surprise. The electric rookie ended up missing just one game. He will be an upside WR4 in Dallas. Inactive for the Saints are WR Tommylee Lewis, WR Brandon Marshall, LB Manti Te’o, DL Mitchell Loewen, LT Terron Armstead, C Will Clapp and DL Trey Hendrickson.
report: Tre'Quan Smith (foot) is active for Week 13 against the Cowboys.

impact: Yikes. That is going to leave a mark if you forced Smith into your lineup for the final week of the fantasy regular season. There wasn't much Smith could do against a swarming Cowboys defense on an evening where Drew Brees completed just 18 passes for 127 yards. Smith and the entire Saints offense has a perfect Week 14 bounce-back spot in the Bucs.
report: Tre'Quan Smith was held without a catch on one target in the Saints' Week 13 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: The Packers reportedly shopped Davis before final cuts. He played zero offensive snaps in the opener. He should be cut loose with an injury settlement once he gets healthy.
report: Packers placed WR Trevor Davis on injured reserve with a hamstring injury.

impact: Even with the Packers' injury issues at receiver, third-year pro Davis should mostly contribute as a return man on special teams. He is not worth a flier in fantasy leagues.
report: Packers activated WR Trevor Davis (hamstring) from injured reserve.

impact: Goodwin was injured in last week's loss to the Chargers in the second half.  Goodwin was able to return, but he didn't catch a ball after the break.  Kendrick Bourne would be in line for heavy snaps should Goodwin miss time.
report: Marquise Goodwin (hamstring, quad) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Goodwin is now on track to play against the Chargers. He's a low-floor WR4.
report: Marquise Goodwin (hamstring, quad) returned to 49ers practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Goodwin re-injured his quad last week but looks on track to play. The 49ers may continue to scale his snaps at less than 100 percent. Playing with C.J. Beathard and not fully healthy, Goodwin is a low-floor WR4.
report: Marquise Goodwin (questionable, hamstring/quad) is a game-time decision for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: Goodwin is out after re-injurying his hamstring in last week's loss to Seattle. His absence will open up targets for Pierre Garcon and tight end George Kittle. Matt Breida (shoulder), OT Mike McGlinchey (knee), C Weston Richburg (knee), Richard Sherman (calf) and OT Joe Staley (knee) are all active for the Niners.
report: 49ers declared WR Marquise Goodwin, OT Shon Coleman, OG Josh Garnett, DT D.J. Jones, WR Dante Pettis, DT Juliann Taylor, CB Jimmie Ward inactive for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: It appears the Niners will have their deep threat back for Monday Night Football. Hamstring and quad injuries have limited Goodwin to just three games this year. Fantasy owners would be wise to use a "wait-and-see" approach before slotting the 27-year-old back into lineups.
report: Marquise Goodwin (hamstring/quad) is practicing in full for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Battling quad and hamstring issues much of the first five weeks, Goodwin entered Monday with a combined five catches for 54 yards and one score in three games played.  This game came out of nowhere, but Goodwin can do this anytime he steps on the field when healthy.  He ran right by CB Kentrell Brice for a 67-yard touchdown in the first quarter before then beating veteran Tramon Williams for a 30-yard score nine minutes later.  Where Goodwin was dropped in fantasy, he needs to be picked up immediately.  He'll be a WR3/4 next week against the Rams.
report: Marquise Goodwin caught 4-of-5 targets for 126 yards and two touchdowns in the 49ers' 33-30, Week 6 loss to the Packers on Monday night.

impact: Goodwin left the game briefly with a lower-leg injury, but he was able to return and catch two passes deep into garbage time. It was a disappointing follow up to his 126-yard, two-touchdown explosion on Monday night, but it is promising he easily led the receivers with five targets. The matchup next week in Arizona is not great, but Goodwin will be worth a look as a WR3.
report: Marquise Goodwin hauled in 2-of-5 targets for 24 yards in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: Goodwin salvaged his one-catch day by showing off his olympic speed and taking his only reception to the house on a 55-yard touchdown sprint through the middle of Arizona's secondary. The results have been boom-bust, but Goodwin's at least showed consistency in seeing four targets in every outing since Week 3. He has a chance to boom against the Raiders' shaky secondary in San Francisco's quick turnaround on Thursday.
report: Marquise Goodwin hauled in just 1-of-4 targets for a 55-yard touchdown scamper in the Niners' Week 8 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: That's back-to-back games with one reception on four targets for the speedster. Goodwin was unable to join the scoring party led by undrafted quarterback Nick Mullens, who threw for three touchdowns and 262 yards, and he will continue to be boom-or-bust no matter who the 49ers' quarterback is. Goodwin has a winnable matchup in Week 10 against the Giants at home, but he's just a WR4/5.
report: Marquise Goodwin caught just 1-of-4 targets for 11 yards in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: Goodwin's longest catch went for 26 yards on a deep crosser on the third-to-last play of the game with the 49ers down 27-23.  The Niners clocked the ball with one second left at the 21-yard line before then having an incomplete pass in the end zone.  Goodwin's bigger concern was a pair of helmet shots in the third quarter that had him off the field in the medical tent.  He has a lengthy concussion history.  The Niners are now on bye before Week 12 against the Bucs.
report: Marquise Goodwin caught 4-of-5 targets for 69 yards in the 49ers' Week 10 loss to the Giants.

impact: Goodwin is considered doubtful due to a personal matter. With Pierre Garcon out, the 49ers will go with some  combination of Dante Pettis, Richie James, Trent Taylor, and Kendrick Bourne against Tampa.
report: Marquise Goodwin isn't expected to play in Week 12 against the Bucs.

impact: Goodwin missed last week's game due to a family matter and remains away from the team. Kendrick Bourne and Dante Pettis worked as the Niners' top receivers Sunday against Tampa Bay.
report: Marquise Goodwin (personal) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Goodwin did reportedly meet with team officials. It's possible the speedster could end up playing without practicing.
report: Marquise Goodwin (personal) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Goodwin remains excused from the team for personal matters. Without Pierre Garcon (knee) available in Week 12, too, the Niners leaned on second-rounder Dante Pettis (58 snaps, 91%) and Kendrick Bourne (56, 88%) as their top-two wideouts. Pettis is a terrific speculative add and arguable PPR WR3 sans Goodwin given his elite route-running and high floor.
report: Marquise Goodwin (personal) is not expected to play in Week 13 against the Seahawks.

impact: Goodwin was gone from the team for two weeks while dealing with a personal matter. He practiced fully on Wednesday and should be active for Week 14 against Denver.
report: Marquise Goodwin (personal) returned to practice on Wednesday.

impact: Perriman worked out for the Bills and Jets last week, but he did not find a deal. The Eagles could use some receiver help with Alshon Jeffery still sidelined, but they are likely just doing their due diligence on the former first-round pick. Philly is also working out Kamar Aiken.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports free agent WR Breshad Perriman is working out for the Eagles.

impact: Perriman has visited the Jets, Bills, and Eagles already, and there were reports he had a visit scheduled with the Giants. It is possible he is looking for a 53-man roster spot which is just not available.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports free agent Breshad Perriman is working out for the Redskins on Monday.

impact: It's a no-risk flyer pickup as the Redskins look to add speed to the perimeter of their offense, where Paul Richardson and Josh Doctson have struggled to get open.  The 26th overall pick in the 2015 draft, Perriman flamed out in Baltimore due to injuries and persistent drops.  He's a long shot to make any noise.
report: Redskins signed WR Breshad Perriman, formerly of the Ravens.

impact: Paul Richardson (shoulder, knee) remains questionable for Sunday, but even that wasn't enough to keep Perriman in Washington. The Redskins took a no-risk flier on him just last week that clearly didn't work out. We expect he'll still find a home elsewhere soon.
report: Redskins waived WR Breshad Perriman.

impact: With both Rashard Higgins (knee) and depth wideout Derrick Willies (shoulder) out Sunday, the Browns had no choice but to add a veteran off the streets. The No. 26 overall pick in the 2015 draft, Perriman never found success with the Ravens due to nagging injuries and consistent drops. It's unclear if he'll be active Sunday. Cleveland will have Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, Rod Streater, Damion Ratley, and Perriman available in Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: Browns signed WR Breshad Perriman, formerly of the Ravens.

impact: Perriman was signed on Saturday after the Browns lost Rishard Higgins for a few weeks due to a sprained MCL and placed Derek Willies on injured reserve with a shoulder injury. The Browns will enter Sunday with Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, Rod Streater and Damion Ratley available in Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: Browns declared WR Breshad Perriman, QB Drew Stanton, CB Tavierre Thomas, LB Tanner Vallejo (concussion), OL Earl Watford, WR Rashard Higgins (knee) and DL Carl Davis inactive for Sunday's Week 6 game versus the Chargers.

impact: Perriman will make his Browns debut with Rishard Higgins (MCL) still sidelined. He'll be at best the No. 4 wideout behind Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, and Damion Ratley. Inactive for Cleveland are QB Drew Stanton, WR Da’Mari Scott, CB E.J. Gaines, MLB Joe Schobert, and DL Carl Davis.
report: Breshad Perriman is active for Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: Thomas did lose a fumble for the second straight game, but that was his only blemish on a nearly perfect day. Thomas scored both of the Saints' touchdowns, catching a 2-yard score in the third quarter to pull the Saints within a score and then catching a 5-yard touchdown over Denzel Ward to give New Orleans a lead with 2:40 left in the fourth quarter. Thomas now has reeled in 28 receptions through two weeks, which is the most for any player through two weeks in NFL history. Thomas will be a set and forget WR1 option next week when the Saints head to Atlanta.
report: Michael Thomas caught 12-of-13 targets for 89 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Browns.

impact: Thomas set the tone with a 35-yard gain on the Saints’ first play from scrimmage. He never managed to find the end zone but was always there when Drew Brees needed him. Thomas played a pivotal role in overtime, moving the chains with three catches for 38 yards on the game-clinching drive. Sunday’s 10-spot gives Thomas 38 catches for the year, an NFL record through the first three games. He’s also been incredibly efficient, absorbing an impossible 95 percent of his targets this year. Even with Janoris Jenkins likely to shadow him in Week 4, the red-hot Thomas will remain an appealing WR1 against the Giants.
report: Michael Thomas pulled in all 10 of his targets for 129 receiving yards Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 victory over Atlanta.

impact: Thomas tallied at least 10 catches and/or one touchdown in each of the first three games entering Sunday.  His four targets were tied with Cameron Meredith for second on the team behind Alvin Kamara's nine, and Drew Brees didn't throw a single touchdown as Kamara rushed for three.  Thomas should bounce back no problem back at home against the Redskins in Week 5.
report: Michael Thomas caught all four of his targets for 47 yards in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: After seeing 40 combined targets Weeks 1-3, Thomas has been targeted a total of nine times the past two weeks and hasn't scored in either game.  He was obviously never going to continue at that ridiculous three-week pace, but there are so many talented players in this offense with the emergence of Tre'Quan Smith (3-111-2 tonight) and return of Mark Ingram that the Saints can spread the ball around.  Thomas will get a difficult matchup on the road against the Ravens in Week 7 when the Saints come off their bye.
report: Michael Thomas caught 4-of-5 targets for 74 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: The catches were Thomas' most since Week 3, while the score was his first since Week 2. Surprisingly, Thomas has failed to clear 10 targets or 75 yards in each of his past three games. He has a tough Week 8 matchup in Xavier Rhodes and the Vikings, though Rhodes could end up missing the game with an ankle injury.
report: Michael Thomas caught 7-of-9 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: Thomas got over half his yards on a 44-yard catch from Taysom Hill on the opening drive. He fell victim to gameflow in the second half with the Saints going run heavy. Thomas has at least 70 yards or a touchdown in 6-of-7 games this year. He'll remain a WR1 for Week 9's matchup with the Rams.
report: Michael Thomas caught 5-of-6 targets for 81 yards in the Saints' Week 8 win over the Vikings.

impact: It's a new injury for Thomas, though there's nothing to suggest it's anything serious. The Saints are likely just limiting his practice reps. Thomas has slowed down some since his preposterously hot start, but he's still an every-week WR1 in all formats. The third-year stud gets the Rams at home in Week 9.
report: Michael Thomas (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Thomas was limited at Wednesday's practice, but this shoulder injury was never considered serious, and the Saints are likely just limiting his reps. Thomas remains an every-week WR1 in all formats, especially with a home game against the Rams on Sunday.
report: Michael Thomas (shoulder) was a full participant at practice on Thursday.

impact: Thomas was limited early in the practice week. His shoulder injury was never a real concern. Thomas is in a blowup spot for Sunday's likely shootout with the Rams.
report: Michael Thomas (shoulder) was removed from the Week 9 injury report.

impact: Thomas has been nearly unstoppable all season, and it was not any different in this game. He got things started with a great contested catch for 12 yards against Marcus Peters, who shadowed him to absolutely no success, and just made play after play after that. He finished the first half with six catches for 69 yards on eight targets, was at 10 catches for 121 yards at the end of the third quarter despite the offense falling into a bit of a lull, and iced the game by burning Peters for a 72-yard touchdown with four minutes left in the fourth. That catch broke the Saints’ single-game record for receiving yards and featured a great callback to Joe Horn's cell phone celebration, flip phone and all. Halfway through the season, Thomas is on pace for 140 catches with an absurd 88.6 catch rate. He will be a must-start next week in Cincinnati.
report: Michael Thomas hauled in 12-of-15 targets for 211 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 9 win over the Rams.

impact: Thomas got the game started with a 7-yard touchdown on the opening drive and then added a 17-yard strike with two seconds left in the first half to put the Saints up 35-7 at the break. Thomas is on his way to having the most efficient receiving season in NFL history. Through nine games, Thomas has reeled in 78-of-87 targets on the season with seven touchdowns. Thomas gets the Eagles at home in Week 11.
report: Michael Thomas caught all eight of his targets for 70 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 10 win over the Bengals.

impact: With Tre’Quan Smith dominating, Thomas was limited to just four targets, but he made the most of them. He got loose for two long gains on each of his two first-half catches, the second of which put him over 1,000 yards for the season. He did even better after the break, coming down with a pinpoint throw from Drew Brees for a 23-yard touchdown, his eighth of the season and fifth in the last five games. By catching all four of his targets, Thomas once again bumped up above a 90 percent catch rate for the year. He will remain a no-doubt WR1 on Thanksgiving against the Falcons.
report: Michael Thomas caught all four of his targets for 92 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 11 win over the Eagles.

impact: His 38 yards were a season-low mark. Thomas' team-high six targets were encouraging, but Brees ultimately attempted only 22 passes as the Saints rolled to an easy win behind a dominating defensive effort. Thomas has admittedly cooled off of late due in part to New Orleans simply routing teams out of the gates the past three weeks. Assuming their upcoming Thursday night showdown against Dallas' surging offense stays competitive, Thomas should return to being a strong WR1 in Week 13.
report: Michael Thomas caught 4-of-6 targets for 38 yards in the Saints' Week 12 destruction of the Falcons.

impact: Thomas was also drawing penalties left and right, but that does not show up in the box score for fantasy owners. Although he's in the midst of a monster fantasy campaign, Thomas has cleared 100 yards in just 3-of-12 contests. He's hit the century mark once since September. He has a safe, even floor but ceiling has been unpredictable. Thomas does have a circle-the-calendar Week 14 matchup with the Bucs. Thomas ripped Tampa to shreds for 16/180/1 in Week 1.
report: Michael Thomas caught 5-of-8 targets for 40 yards in the Saints' Week 13 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Thomas didn't show any ill effects in last week's loss to Dallas, seeing the field on 51 of the Saints' 52 offensive snaps. He may just be getting a breather, though obviously it's situation fantasy owners will need to monitor closely throughout the week. Thomas went absolutely bonkers against the Buccaneers—his Week 14 opponent—when he faced them earlier this year, securing 16-of-17 targets for 180 yards and a touchdown in an opening-week loss.
report: Michael Thomas (ankle) did not practice on Wednesday.

impact: The prize of first-year GM Brian Gutekunst's free-agent class, Graham was injured in his return to Seattle on Thursday night after catching one ball for 13 yards.  He's been limited to one catch in back-to-back games and has 21 yards or fewer in three of the last four and four of the last seven.  Overall, Graham has topped 50 yards just four times this year with only two touchdowns.
report: NFL Network's Mike Silver reports Jimmy Graham's thumb injury is "feared to be serious."

impact: The injury was discovered during Friday's testing. Graham figures to miss significant time, though the Packers are still determining his exact timeline. It's another blow to a Green Bay pass-catching corps already missing Geronimo Allison (groin) and Randall Cobb (hamstring). Lance Kendricks is next up at tight end for Green Bay.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirms Jimmy Graham has a broken thumb.

impact: A Friday MRI confirmed a broken thumb for Graham. He may potentially need surgery, putting his rest-of-season status in question. Graham hasn't been a huge factor this year, but losing him is another hit to the Packers' offense. Lance Kendricks will start until Graham returns.
report: The San Diego Union Tribune's David Chao expects Jimmy Graham (thumb) to miss 4-6 weeks.

impact: McCarthy wasn't entirely committal on Graham being able to do so, however, explaining that Green Bay's medical staff will work with "different splints and protections" to try to get Graham game ready.  Losers in three of their last four, the Packers are in must-win position ahead of Sunday's date with Minnesota.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Monday that Jimmy Graham will "try to play" through his broken thumb in Week 12.

impact: Graham will allegedly "try to play" through his broken thumb, but we have no idea how that's going to work.  Graham can't catch passes if he has to wear a club-like cast, and he won't be able to block with a broken thumb.  Graham is likely going to miss weeks.  If ruled out, Graham can be dropped in redraft.
report: Jimmy Graham (knee, thumb) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Graham wants to play through his broken thumb, but to do so he will need to be able to block and catch. McCarthy said Graham has an "attachment" for his cast he will test out on Thursday to see if he can do those things. We will hopefully have a better idea of his availability following Thursday's practice.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Jimmy Graham will test out his injured thumb during Thursday's practice.

impact: Graham appears to be giving it a go with his broken thumb.  It sounds like he'll be out there Sunday night against the Vikings.  Graham hasn't produced in weeks and has just two touchdowns.  He's a borderline TE1/2.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy said Jimmy Graham (thumb) "looked good" at Thursday's practice.

impact: Graham resumed practice on Thursday and looks on track to play Sunday in Minnesota despite breaking his thumb in last week's loss to the Seahawks. Supposedly Graham looked fine catching balls at practice this week and will play with an attachment on his injured thumb. He'll be a risky TE1 in a tough matchup.
report: Jimmy Graham (thumb) is questionable for Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: He'll play "barring any complications" to his broken thumb. Graham is also dealing with a knee injury. The veteran was expected to miss 4-6 weeks after his injury last week, but with the struggling Packers facing a must-win, Graham will attempt to play with an attachment on his thumb. At risk of an injury setback and playing in a tough road matchup, Graham will be a shaky TE1 against the Vikes.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport confirms Jimmy Graham (questionable, knee/thumb) is "on track" to play Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Graham will play with an attachment on his thumb. His effectiveness is a concern, but Graham should have a decent target share and red-zone role. The Packers inactives are QB Tim Boyle, WR Randall Cobb, OL Alex Light, DE Mike Daniels, CB Kevin King, CB Bashaud Breeland, and S Raven Greene.
report: Jimmy Graham (knee/thumb) is active for Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Graham was active but didn't start. He played limited snaps until the final drive, where he caught all three of his passes. With the Packers out of playoff contention, Graham isn't a lock to play at less than 100 percent next week.
report: Jimmy Graham caught 3-of-4 passes for 34 yards in Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Graham was active Sunday but didn't start and played only 22 snaps. He could be held out now that the Packers are unlikely to make the playoffs. Lance Kendricks would be on the streaming radar on if Graham sits.
report: Jimmy Graham (thumb, knee) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Graham is going to practice even less than usual as he guts out his thumb issue. Graham caught three balls for 34 yards as he played through the injury in Week 12. He will be a mid-range TE2 against the Cardinals.
report: Jimmy Graham (thumb, knee) returned to Packers practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Jimmy Graham was limited mid-week and promptly removed from Friday's injury report. He fought through his current thumb injury for a 3/34 receiving line in Week 12, but is still a viable low-end TE1 against the Cards given his inevitable on-field usage.
report: Jimmy Graham (thumb, knee) will play in Week 13 against the Cardinals.

impact: It was Graham's best game in a long time; the 32-year-old tight end has recently battled thumb and knee injuries.  Graham will draw another plus matchup in Week 14 against the Falcons.  Despite his inconsistency, Graham remains a low-end TE1 play each week.
report: Jimmy Graham caught 8-of-11 targets for 50 yards in Green Bay's Week 13 loss to Arizona.

impact: Kessler replaced Blake Bortles a little after halftime following Bortles’ second lost fumble. A weak-armed game manager, Kessler engineered just one touchdown drive. Kessler’s pick came on a dropped pass, which deflected to Texans S Tyrann Mathieu. Kessler will presumably get the Week 8 start against Philadelphia in London, although he won’t be more than a low-end two-quarterback-league play.
report: Cody Kessler completed 21-of-30 passes for 156 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Jaguars' Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: It's clear Bortles is going to be on a short leash after his Week 7 third-quarter benching following two lost fumbles.  The Jaguars want their quarterbacks to stop turning the ball over, and if Bortles continues to do so Kessler would enter Sunday's game against the Eagles in London.
report: Despite turning back to Blake Bortles as their Week 8 starter, the Jaguars will give Cody Kessler practice reps with the first-team offense.

impact: A textbook game manager, Kessler will be tasked with handing the ball off and avoiding turnovers for the Jaguars' final five games. Kessler has some intriguing options at receiver, but the Jags' run-heavy emphasis and inability to establish the wideout depth chart will make Kessler a low-ceiling fantasy option. He will struggle for QB2 value, including this week against the Colts.
report: Cody Kessler will be the Jaguars' starting quarterback going forward.

impact: It means Marquez Valdes-Scantling, Equanimeous St. Brown and J'Mon Moore will ride again behind Davante Adams. The absence will be Allison's second straight. The Packers are on bye for Week 7, so hopefully Allison will be ready to roll against the Rams in Week 8. Valdes-Scantling is a plug-and-play WR3 for Week 6.
report: ESPN's Lisa Salters reports Geronimo Allison (hamstring) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) are expected to remain sidelined for Monday's game against the 49ers.

impact: Allison figured to have the best chance to return this week, but he shed his concussion only to come down with a hamstring issue.  With both vets out, it'll again be rookies Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Equanimeous St. Brown likely benefitting most in three-wide sets behind Davante Adams.  Both rookies have been well ahead of fellow rookie J'Mon Moore on the depth chart.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) are inactive for Week 6 against the 49ers on Monday night.

impact: Allison appeared close to playing before the bye, so it is not a surprise he is ready to practice following the off week. Barring any setbacks, he should be ready to face the Rams on Sunday.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Geronimo Allison (hamstring) will practice Tuesday.

impact: It puts Allison on track to return coming off the Packers' bye, though he'll likely need to get in a full practice to play. Randall Cobb (hamstring) also returned to limited practice.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is also expected back. Allison was able to produce even with Cobb active early in the season, but that production came on a limited target share. He will be a risky WR3/FLEX play this week.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy believes Geronimo Allison (hamstring) will play Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: As did Randall Cobb (hamstring), putting both on track to return following the Packers' Week 7 bye. Allison has cleared 60 yards in all four of his 2018 appearances. He's in the WR3/4 mix for what should be a high-scoring contest with the Rams.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Note that Randall Cobb (hamstring) still came out of the bye listed as questionable for Sunday. If he's ruled out, rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling would stay running from the slot with Davante Adams and Allison on the outside. All including Cobb (pending health) are tremendous options against the Rams' struggling secondary Sunday.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) will play in Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: Finally over his hamstring issue, Allison was making his first appearance since Week 4. Although he was a ghost in the box score, Pro Football Focus charted Allison as playing as many snaps as Marquez Valdes-Scantling. Of course, a dead heat with MVS would be bad for Allison's fantasy prospects. With Randall Cobb also back, Allison is looking like a WR4/5 in the Packers' crowded receiver corps.
report: Geronimo Allison caught 1-of-1 targets for 14 yards in the Packers' Week 8 loss to the Rams.

impact: Allison played through his hamstring injury last week but was held to one catch. Marquez Valdes-Scantling started over Allison and should remain the better bet for targets going forward. Allison is just a WR4.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Allison should be fine for Sunday night's game in Foxboro, though it's hard to guess what his role will be in a suddenly crowded Packers receiving corps. He's No. 46 in our Week 9 receiving rankings.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring, groin) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: The groin was a new addition behind Allison's name on the injury report, joining the previously-listed "hamstring" issue.  It's been one injury after another for Allison this season.  If he's unable to play Sunday night, the Packers would lock in Davante Adams, Marquez Valdes-Scantling, and Randall Cobb as their three-wide sets.  Equanimeous St. Brown could get snaps as the No. 4.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy said Geronimo Allison injured his groin in Thursday's practice and is uncertain for Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is additionally listed as questionable for Sunday. Allison has dealt with a hamstring injury since Week 8, but the 'groin' tag was sprung on everyone mid-week. Even if Cobb suits up, the Packers will likely use Davante Adams and rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling as their primary two receivers, with Cobb/Equanimeous St. Brown getting involved in three-wide sets. Feel free to tweet Valdes-Scantling's name with a rocket emoji next to it, because his value should skyrocket sans Allison.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring, groin) is doubtful for Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: Allison wasn't expected to play after popping up as doubtful Friday. Whether Randall Cobb (hamstring, questionable) suits up or not, Marquez Valdes-Scantling should still work as the team's No. 2 receiving option behind Davante Adams. Consider MVS a safe WR3 across from Stephen Gilmore's inevitable shadow coverage on Adams.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring, groin) won't play in Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: Coach Mike McCarthy called it a "big" and "significant" injury that sounds like it could threaten the rest of Allison's season.  Allison recently visited Dr. William Meyer in Philadelphia, a known expert on groin and core-muscle matters.  If Allison does require a procedure, Marquez Valdes-Scantling would be further locked in as Green Bay's No. 2 wideout behind Davante Adams.
report: Geronimo Allison may need core muscle surgery.

impact: Allison is undergoing core muscle surgery. He could return this season but not before the playoffs. The postseason, of course, is looking very dicey for the Pack. It's a huge blow for a third-year UDFA who had a golden opportunity to soak up snaps and targets and post big numbers. Now Allison's offseason will be riddled with question marks. He's an exclusive rights free agent, Marquez Valdes-Scantling has been excellent in Allison's place the past few weeks. Allison should be back with the Pack in 2019, but his role will be up for debate.
report: Packers placed WR Geronimo Allison on injured reserve with a groin injury.

impact: Pettis dusted Teez Tabor for a 35-yard gain in the first quarter but wasn’t heard from again. The rookie was expected to play an important role with Marquise Goodwin (quad) sidelined this week, but obviously that didn’t come to fruition. Even with a likely shootout on tap next week at Kansas City, the rookie will be difficult to trust in fantasy.
report: Dante Pettis was limited to one catch for 35 yards on two targets Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 2 win over the Lions.

impact: With Marquise Goodwin healthy, Pettis disappeared from the game plan. He can be dropped in redraft leagues.
report: Dante Pettis was not targeted in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Pettis was met by multiple Chargers directly after catching a punt, but he quickly went down in an odd play that left Pettis without one of his cleats. The 49ers training staff checked the stability of his knee on the field before taking him to the sideline. With Marquise Goodwin healthy, Pettis was not targeted last week.
report: Dante Pettis suffered a left knee injury in the 49ers' Week 4 game against the Chargers and is questionable to return.

impact: Pettis suffered a knee injury on a punt return and he needed assistance from the training staff to get off the field. The timing of the injury is bad with Marquise Goodwin (leg) in the locker room. The 49ers only have Pierre Garcon, Trent Taylor, and Kendrick Bourne at receiver at the moment. The 49ers have also ruled out LT Joe Staley (knee) for the remainder of the game. Finally, RT Mike McGlinchey is questionable to return.
report: Dante Pettis has been ruled out for the remainder of the 49ers' Week 4 game against the Chargers.

impact: Pettis was forced from Week 4 after suffering a knee injury on a punt return. He needed assistance to get off the field, but Maiocco reports he did not suffer any damage to his ACL. Even so, the receiver could still be looking at a multi-game absence. We will know more after his MRI on Monday.
report: NBC Sports Bay Area's Matt Maiocco reports Dante Pettis' knee injury is not believed to be serious.

impact: Coach Kyle Shanahan said Pettis will be week to week after the game against Arizona.  Pettis was hurt on Sunday against the Chargers on a punt return.  He can safely be dropped in any redraft formats where he's owned.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) has been ruled out for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: Being ruled out this early in the week once again doesn't bode well for Pettis' immediate future.  He's possibly looking at missing a number of more games.  The Niners' receiver corps is really banged up with Marquise Goodwin (hamstring) missing Week 5.  Pierre Garcon hasn't scored in 16 games.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) has been ruled out for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Pettis has missed the last two games with a knee injury, but this limited practice gives him a good shot to return this week. Behind at least Marquise Goodwin, George Kittle, and Pierre Garcon in the pecking order, Pettis is just a Dynasty stash right now.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) got in a limited practice Wednesday.

impact: Pettis' Wednesday return must not have gone well. If he sits against the Rams, it will be his third-straight absence.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) was downgraded to "DNP" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Pettis was able to return to practice Wednesday, but he apparently suffered a setback and missed the rest of the week. He is only a hold in Dynasty formats.
report: 49ers declared Dante Pettis (knee) inactive for Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: Pettis is trying to get back from a three-week absence. With Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) expected to sit, Pettis would see serious snaps against the Cardinals if he can get cleared.
report: 49ers Dante Pettis (knee) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Pettis will return after missing the last three games. With Pierre Garcon doubtful, he's in the mix for three-wide snaps with Richie James and Kendrick Bourne. Pettis isn't on the Week 8 streaming radar.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) was removed from the Week 8 injury report.

impact: Ugly numbers for six targets.  Pettis saw more action with Pierre Garcon sitting this one out.  The Niners now have their bye, giving time for Garcon to get healthy ahead of Week 12 versus Tampa Bay.  Pettis is merely a Dynasty stash.
report: Dante Pettis caught 4-of-6 targets for 12 yards in the 49ers' Week 10 loss to the Giants.

impact: Pettis was the 49ers' biggest passing-game bright spot, showing elite route-running chops as he created separation at will against Tampa Bay's overmatched secondary.  Pettis quietly now has 13 targets over the last two games, although Marquise Goodwin (personal) and Pierre Garcon's (knee) absences have helped his volume.  Their statuses are uncertain entering Week 13 at Seattle, as is struggling quarterback Nick Mullens' job security.
report: Dante Pettis caught four passes for 77 yards and a touchdown on seven targets in the 49ers' Week 12 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: The 49ers were blown out in this one, but they were actually able to move the ball in large part because of Pettis, who flashed his great after catch ability on both of his touchdowns. On the first, he was able to escape a tackle attempt, utilize a great block, and dash into the end zone. On the second, he was able to skip out of a tackle attempt and outrun everyone to the end zone for a 75-yard score. With Marquise Goodwin and Pierre Garcon out indefinitely, Pettis is worth an add in most leagues.
report: Dante Pettis hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 129 yards and two touchdowns in the 49ers' Week 13 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: The second-year UDFA was sprung into extra snaps with Marquise Goodwin and Dante Pettis both leaving the game with leg injuries. Bourne was able to convert the extra looks into a two-yard touchdown for his second touchdown of the year. He will return to his backup role once Goodwin and Pettis return to action.
report: Kendrick Bourne caught 3-of-4 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Bourne started in place of Pierre Garcon (knee) and responded with a team-high 71 receiving yards on 10 targets. The second-year UDFA has quietly pieced together a WR3-worthy performance when given the opportunity, most recently finishing with 3/34/1 in Week 4 when thrusted into surprise reps with both Marquise Goodwin and Dante Pettis hobbled. With trade rumors suddenly circling Pierre Garcon leading up to Tuesday's deadline, Bourne is worth a speculative add in season-long leagues in the event Garcon is shipped out.
report: Kendrick Bourne trapped 7-of-10 targets for a team-high 71 yards in the 49ers' Week 8 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Bourne predictably took a backseat with Pierre Garcon returning to game action, but Bourne was still able to find the end zone to save his fantasy line. With the 49ers holding onto Garcon despite some trade deadline speculation, Bourne can be dropped in almost all redraft leagues.
report: Kendrick Bourne caught both of his targets for six yards and one touchdown in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: He saw all of his targets in the second half, and the seven looks were good for second on the team behind George Kittle's 10.  Bourne did virtually nothing with them as the starter in place of an injured Pierre Garcon, but the end-result volume is somewhat promising.  The Niners now head into their bye, giving Garcon time to get healthy for the Week 12 date with the Bucs.
report: Kendrick Bourne caught 4-of-7 targets for 33 yards in the 49ers' Week 10 loss to the Giants.

impact: He was unable to take advantage of Marquise Goodwin and Pierre Garcon's absences, as Dante Pettis and George Kittle did the heavy lifting in San Francisco's passing game.  Bourne is a complementary role player in an offense with major quarterback question marks with Nick Mullens getting worse each week.
report: Kendrick Bourne caught 2-of-3 targets for 27 yards in the 49ers' Week 12 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Even with Leonard Fournette leaving with an injury, Grant did not see much action against the Giants. Perhaps that changes if Fournette is forced to miss time, but T.J. Yeldon is the back to add.
report: Corey Grant rushed once for three yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: Despite Leonard Fournette leaving with an injury, Grant only received one touch in the season opener, but that could change if Fournette is forced to sit out this week. "I think if we knew that early in the week [we'd be without Fournette], during the course of the game I think that’s a little bit different scenario for us," Marrone said. "At the end of the day, looking back we should have gotten him in there a little bit more." Marrone did caution it would not have been "much more," but the comment is still a bit of a concern for T.J. Yeldon's workhorse chances, especially since Grant caught three passes for 59 yards when he faced the Patriots in the playoffs.
report: Jaguars coach Doug Marrone said he wants to use Corey Grant more moving forward.

impact: Grant ended up forming a near-even committee with T.J. Yeldon in Leonard Fournette's absence. The Jags worked hard to exploit Grant's play-making ability as a pass catcher. He was a spark plug who picked up a number of key first downs. Despite his big-play ability, Grant will be a low-end RB3/FLEX if Fournette remains sidelined for Week 3 against the Titans.
report: Corey Grant caught 6-of-7 targets for 56 yards in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots, adding four rushes for 13 additional yards.

impact: Grant started the game in place of Leonard Fournette (hamstring), but the Jags wound up going with T.J. Yeldon because Grant was so ineffective.  Grant was barely even seen in the second half, while Yeldon finished with 13 touches to Grant's 7.  All in all, it was an abysmal offensive effort from a Jaguars team that played so well versus New England the week prior.  Fournette was close to playing and figures to return in Week 4 against the Jets.
report: Corey Grant rushed six times for 11 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for a combined loss of one yard in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Grant had his lower leg caught underneath a tackler at the end of a second-quarter run. He was not able to put weight on his left leg as he was helped off the field, and he was pretty quickly ruled out. With Leonard Fournette inactive, T.J. Yeldon should get as much work as he can handle against the Chiefs. Brandon Wilds is Jacksonville's other active running back.
report: Corey Grant exited Week 5 against the Chiefs with a foot injury.

impact: Grant had to be carted off the field Sunday.  He was hyped up over the summer as someone the Jaguars wanted to get more involved in the offense, but it never really happened as Grant got 13 carries and turned them into 40 scoreless yards.  Grant nabbed nine catches for 67 yards.  He'll be a 27-year-old free agent next March coming off one of the most serious foot injuries.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Corey Grant suffered a Lisfranc injury Week 5 against the Chiefs and is expected to miss the remainder of the season.

impact: Grant suffered a Lisfranc injury against the Chiefs in Week 5 and is done for the season. He should be healthy once free agency opens next spring.
report: Jaguars placed Corey Grant (foot) on injured reserve.

impact: Yeldon was a DNP Wednesday but practiced the last two days. With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) not a lock to return this week, he could be in line for another start. Yeldon would be a FLEX play against the Jets if Fournette is held out.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) was removed from the Week 4 injury report.

impact: Yeldon replaced an injured Leonard Fournette in the second quarter.  He went untouched on a 31-yard screen for his first touchdown, and added a one-yard goal-line TD in mopup time. With Fournette dealing with a setback, Yeldon could be in line for another start this week. He'll be a plug-and-play RB2 if Fournette sits.
report: T.J. Yeldon had 18 carries for 52 yards and a touchdown and caught three passes for 48 yards and a receiving touchdown in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Yeldon was limited on both Wednesday and Thursday before being upgraded to full participation on Friday. He might cede some passing-down work to Corey Grant, but otherwise Yeldon should see close to a full complement of snaps Sunday at Arrowhead. Leonard Fournette's injury keeps Yeldon in the weekly RB2 mix.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) wasn't listed on the Jaguars' final injury report for Week 5 against the Chiefs.

impact: With Corey Grant exiting early, it was all Yeldon in this one. He looked great early in the game, consistently gaining big yardage on the ground. That stopped with the Jaguars down big in the second half, but he kept things going in the passing game. He caught Blake Bortles' only touchdown pass when he easily beat a linebacker on a wheel route from 14 yards out. With Leonard Fournette looking doubtful for Week 6, Yeldon will be a high-end RB2 against the Cowboys.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed 10 times for 53 yards and hauled in 8-of-10 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: The Jaguars did some shuffling in their backfield since the Week 5 loss to the Chiefs, losing Corey Grant (foot) to I.R., waiving Brandon Wilds, signing David Williams off the Broncos' practice squad, and then inking Jamaal Charles on Tuesday.  Yeldon remains the constant and is probably the only one with any real idea what the offense is, leaving him a strong RB2 this week in Dallas.
report: NFL Network's Tom Pelissero reports T.J. Yeldon will remain "the guy" in the Jaguars' backfield while Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is out.

impact: Yeldon never had a chance with Jacksonville playing from behind almost the entire game. With the Jags in catch-up mode, Yeldon saw just three carries in the second half. The 25-year-old has served as Jacksonville's workhorse during Leonard Fournette's absence. If Fournette (hamstring) can't get the green light in Week 7, Yeldon would draw another start against Houston.
report: T.J. Yeldon contributed just 41 yards on eight carries while turning five targets into three catches for 29 yards Sunday in Jacksonville’s Week 6 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is also idle on Wednesday.  Yeldon touched the ball just 11 times last week in the blowout loss to the Cowboys and had previously been listed with an ankle issue back in Week 4.  The foot thing is new.  Jamaal Charles and David Williams are the Jaguars' healthy backs.
report: T.J. Yeldon (foot, ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Wednesday was likely just rep management. Like the rest of the Jaguars' offense, Yeldon gets a mulligan on last week's disaster against the Cowboys. He will be an RB2 against the Texans.
report: T.J. Yeldon (foot, ankle) returned to Jaguars practice Thursday.

impact: With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) still out, Yeldon will be a volume-based RB2.
report: T.J. Yeldon (foot, ankle) was removed from the Week 7 injury report and will play against the Texans.

impact: Yeldon operated as Jacksonville’s feature back for one last week; Carlos Hyde will likely take over as the Jags’ primary ball carrier in Week 8 against the Eagles in London. Yeldon should continue to dominate passing-game work until Leonard Fournette (hamstring) returns, but he has devolved from an every-week RB2 to a low-end flex option going forward.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed 12 times for 28 yards and caught 5-of-7 targets for 40 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to Houston.

impact: As we saw last week when the Browns listed Duke Johnson as the starter over Nick Chubb, these designations mean little. That said, Yeldon is not going to disappear even with Carlos Hyde ready to make his debut, especially in a matchup which favors the pass. Both Yeldon and Hyde are risky FLEX options this week.
report: Jaguars listed T.J. Yeldon as the starter in place of Leonard Fournette for Week 8 against the Eagles.

impact: With the running game going nowhere, Yeldon was the only back who made anything happen early, although 15 of his 18 first-half receiving yards came on a third-and-long screen. He was even more involved after the Jaguars opened up the passing game in the second half, however, and he set up a field goal with a 37-yard catch on a wheel route in the fourth quarter. His 83 receiving yards actually led the team on Sunday. Leonard Fournette is expected back after the bye, but Yeldon should keep at least some of his role in the passing game.
report: T.J. Yeldon hauled in 7-of-9 targets for 83 yards and rushed twice for seven yards in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Yeldon was an afterthought for most of the game with Leonard Fournette back healthy. His only carry of the first half came on a give-up third down, and his two catches came during the two-minute drive. He did add a couple long receptions late, but his touch total will be difficult to predict as long as Fournette is healthy.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed three times for 12 yards and hauled in 5-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Yeldon has now touched the ball seven and eight times since Leonard Fournette returned to the lineup. He only has marginal value when the Jaguars are chasing points, something they can't be counted on in Week 12 at Buffalo.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed five times for 23 yards while catching 2-of-3 targets for nine yards in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: He was the Jaguars' leading receiver in a game where Cody Kessler passed for just 150 yards, operating as a game-managing checkdown specialist.  Nevertheless, this was a reminder Yeldon has just as much fantasy value as Carlos Hyde if not more if Leonard Fournette misses any time going forward.  Yeldon out-touched Hyde 15 to 14 and outgained him 65 to 37.  Hyde also lost a fumble.  Fournette is due back for Week 14 at Tennessee.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed eight times for 16 yards and caught 7-of-8 targets for 49 yards in the Jaguars' Week 13 win over the Colts.

impact: Gates is feeling a little under the weather, but he should be fine for Sunday's showdown against the Rams. The 38-year-old has been a non-factor with just two catches for 16 yards through his first two games.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Gates played just 11-of-56 snaps in Week 2. It's fair to wonder if he makes it through the entire season on the Chargers' 53-man roster.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) remained sidelined Thursday.

impact: Travis Benjamin (foot) is also questionable for Sunday. Players rarely sit out because of an illness, so it would be surprising if Gates does not play. That said, he played only 11 snaps at full health in Week 2, so he'll make little impact for Los Angeles whether he's available or not. Virgil Green was notably in on 41-of-56 snaps.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) is questionable for Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: Gates missed practice time this week due to an illness but he's going to gut it out on Sunday. The veteran has played limited snaps this year and is unlikely to be a factor against the Rams' elite secondary. The 38-year-old no longer carries any fantasy significance.
report: Antonio Gates (questionable, illness) is expected to play Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: The Chargers inactive list confirms Adam Schefter's report that Gates is available to play against the Rams. The Chargers, however, will be without WR Travis Benjamin (foot), LB Emmanuel Ellerbee, C Cole Toner, RT Joe Barksdale, G Forrest Lamp, DT T.Y. McGill, and DE Joey Bosa, who is expected to miss multiple weeks.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) is officially active for Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: The five targets are a season-high for the veteran tight end. Gates' red zone ability could lead him to a few touchdowns this year, but the 38-year-old is off the fantasy radar with how little volume he has seen.
report: Antonio Gates caught 3-of-5 targets for 45 yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: That's back-to-back games with five targets, but he was able to score a touchdown this time around when he escaped to the corner of the end zone without a defender in sight. Gates is a touchdown-dependent TE2, but there should be a couple touchdown opportunities next week against the Raiders.
report: Antonio Gates caught 2-of-5 targets for 26 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Gates remains a touchdown-dependent streamer as he's posted just 7-90-1 in the Chargers' last three games. With his weekly snaps continuously getting eaten into by fellow tight end Virgil Green (1-13-1), Gates can stay on the wire until the utmost perfect matchup presents itself.
report: Antonio Gates caught both of his targets for 19 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 win over the Raiders.
