impact: Gates has yet to practice this week, putting him on the wrong side of questionable for Sunday's home matchup with Denver. The 38-year-old is a surefire Hall of Famer and arguably the most prolific tight end of all time, but his days of being a fantasy asset are long over.
report: Antonio Gates (knee) is questionable for Week 11 against the Broncos.

impact: Gates was held out of practice all week. The Chargers will take his status to game time, but he's still on the wrong side of questionable. Virgil Green will see more snaps if Gates sits.
report: Antonio Gates (questionable, knee) is a game-time decision for Week 11 against the Broncos.

impact: It is a bit of a surprise considering Gates sat out most of the practice week. Even so, Gates is not a fantasy option right now.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Antonio Gates (knee) is expected to play Week 11 against the Broncos.

impact: DE Joey Bosa (foot) is also active for the Bolts. DT Justin Jones, OG Forrest Lamp, DE Chris Landrum, RB Detrez Newsome, OT Trent Scott, C Cole Toner and CB Trevor Williams round out L.A'.s Week 11 inactives.
report: Antonio Gates (knee) is active for Week 11 against the Broncos.

impact: The 80 yards were as many as Gates had in his previous six games COMBINED. Gates has spent much of the year fighting a losing battle with Father Time, but on Sunday, the aging tight end turned the tables with a throwback performance. The 38-year-old was on the receiving end of a six-yard touchdown dart from Philip Rivers early in the third quarter. That was his first end-zone visit since Week 4 and marked his 12th career touchdown against Denver. Gates nearly sat out this week due to a knee injury, but obviously he didn't show any ill effects on Sunday. It was nice to see a living legend strut his stuff, though we wouldn't expect a repeat performance from Gates when the Chargers host Arizona on Thanksgiving weekend.
report: Antonio Gates contributed five grabs for 80 yards and a touchdown on seven targets Sunday in the Chargers’ Week 11 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It's a step back after Gates blew up for 80 yards and a touchdown last week. Even in a plus matchup with the Steelers, Gates should be avoided as a Week 13 streaming option.
report: Antonio Gates caught one pass for 18 yards in the Chargers' Week 12 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Gates had just one catch last week. It continues a downward trend after his 5/80/1 line in Week 11. Gates isn't more than a touchdown-dependent streaming option for a matchup with the Bengals.
report: Antonio Gates was held without a catch in Week 13 against the Steelers.

impact: Adams had a good preseason, but he just missed out on making the initial 53-man roster. His signing could mean concern for Jay Ajayi, who missed most of the first half on Sunday because of a back injury, although he was able to return in the second half. It also could mean other teams were sniffing around and the Eagles did not want to lose Adams.
report: Eagles signed RB Josh Adams off their practice squad.

impact: With the running game struggling, it made sense for Adams to get more opportunities, and he made the most of them on Sunday. He was fine on four carries in the first half, but he exploded for a 21-yard gain after the break to help spark a touchdown drive before going for 17 to set up another score in the fourth. The rookie has a scare when it looked like he fumbled with the Eagles attempting to run out the clock, but he was ruled down on review. Looking like the best runner on the roster, Adams has a good chance to see more work coming out of the bye. He is an add in all formats.
report: Josh Adams rushed nine times for 61 yards and caught his only target for six yards in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Adams was the Eagles' leading rusher and saw more carries than Wendell Smallwood and Corey Clement. After outplaying Smallwood before the bye, he's cemented his role ahead of Smallwood as the primary early-down back. Adams is worth picking up in leagues where available. He has an attackable matchup against the Saints in Week 11.
report: Josh Adams rushed seven times for 47 yards in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Adams has averaged 6.25 yards per carry over the last three games, but he only has 20 attempts over that span including just seven against the Cowboys on Sunday night. Adams is clearly Philly's best option on early downs, and they need to get him some more carries. He is the only Eagles running back worth rostering in shallow redraft formats.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson confirmed Josh Adams will get more carries going forward.

impact: He added 19 yards on three catches. Adams was the lone bright spot in a pitiful display from the Eagles, consistently gaining yards against one of the tougher run defenses in the league. His 28-yard touchdown run was Philly's only score of the game. Adams now has 178 yards on just 27 carries (6.6 YPC) over the last four games. His role should continue to expand down the stretch.
report: Josh Adams rushed seven times for 53 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 11 loss to the Saints.

impact: The Eagles are expected to ditch their three-back committee, with Adams getting the majority of carries moving forward. Adams has earned a larger role after averaging 6.6 YPC over the last four games. Locked in on early downs and the favorite for red-zone work, Adams should provide RB3 value down the stretch.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports the Eagles plan to use Josh Adams as their feature back.

impact: Adams had a 52-yard touchdown run called back on the opening series due to a Jason Kelce holding penalty.  Adams then hurt his shoulder and missed the second series, going into halftime with four carries for four yards.  He dropped his lone target in the pass game after seeing six looks a week ago.  Adams got rolling after the break, however, as the Eagles overcame a 19-3 deficit.  Adams had some long runs in the second half and converted his goal-line carry for a one-yard score before then adding a two-point conversion.  Corey Clement pitched in 76 yards on seven touches.  Adams will be an RB2 next week against the Redskins in a must-win.
report: Josh Adams rushed 22 times for 84 yards and one touchdown in the Eagles' 25-22, Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: Adams has worked as the clear lead back the last two games and saw 22 carries against the Giants, so there is not much more room for his role to expand. Even so, this comment shows Adams' spot atop the depth chart is secure. Adams will be a solid RB2 on Monday night against Washington.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson wants to get Josh Adams more work each week.

impact: "It’s still a running back by committee. It’s all about the hot hand," Staley told reporters after Wednesday's practice. This may be coachspeak. Adams has taken the lead in the Eagles' backfield the last two weeks, though Corey Clement has remained involved in a passing role. Adams is the touch-favorite going forward, but his job security is week to week.
report: Eagles RB coach Duce Staley said Josh Adams is still part of a committee.

impact: Adams was injured Saturday after practicing fully the last two days. Late week setbacks are never good, so this is a concern for his playing status.  Wendell Smallwood and Corey Clement will see more early-down snaps if Adams can't get cleared. The Eagles are also expected to get Darren Sproles (questionable, hamstring) back this week.
report: Josh Adams (hip) is questionable for Week 13 against the Redskins.

impact: Adams landed on the injury report after tweaking his hip at Saturday's practice, though the Eagles are confident it's nothing serious. The undrafted Notre Dame alum has led Philadelphia in rushing yards in each of his last four games. He'll be employable as a solid RB2 for the final week of the fantasy regular season.
report: NFL Network's Mike Garafolo reports Josh Adams (questionable, hip) is "on track" to play Week 13 against the Redskins.

impact: NFL Network's Mike Garafolo has repeatedly reported Adams is "good to go," and Adams "got fist bumps" from GM Howie Roseman and coach Doug Pederson during Monday evening's pre-game warmup.  As a home-favorite running back with 20-plus touch upside, Adams is an upside RB2 against a sagging Washington defense.
report: Josh Adams (hip) will play on Monday Night Football against Washington.

impact: It was reported earlier in the evening that Adams would play; this makes it official.  Adams is an upside RB2 play as a home favorite against a defense that has struggled of late and plays much worse on the road.  The return of Darren Sproles (hamstring) should have minimal effect on Adams.
report: Josh Adams (hip) is active for Week 13 against the Redskins.

impact: Adams was stonewalled on a pair of first-half carries on second- and fourth-and-goal from the two-yard line and then never got another chance to score in this one, with Jordan Matthews catching a short touchdown and Darren Sproles running one in from 14 yards out.  Adams' volume has been really nice of late, but he offers nothing in the pass game as a TD-or-bust RB2.
report: Josh Adams rushed 20 times for 85 yards in the Eagles' Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: Adams was questionable for Monday night's game with a hip injury, but played through it. This would seem to be a new injury for Adams, though his presence Wednesday would suggest it's nothing serious. The undrafted rookie will be an acceptable RB2 against Dallas in Week 14.
report: Josh Adams (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The sixth-round pick from Texas A&M was forced to step up into a large role in the Cleveland passing game with all of the injuries the Browns have sustained at the wide receiver position. His productive game came in game in which Jarvis Landry caught just two passes, so it should be taken with some degree of salt. That said, the Browns will still be without Rishard Higgins for a the short term and Antonio Callaway has proven to be an unreliable option. Ratley is only an option in the deepest of leagues, but the Browns face a terrible Tampa Bay defense on the road in Week 7 for those that must dig that deep.
report: Damion Ratley caught 6-of-8 targets for 82 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Willies was a late addition to the injury report after landing awkwardly on the shoulder on Friday.  An UDFA rookie out of Texas Tech, Willies was thrust into duty last week after Rashard Higgins left with a sprained MCL.  He played 26 snaps, catching 3-of-5 targets for 61 yards.  If Willies has to sit with Higgins already out, the Browns will be down to Rod Streater as their third wideout.
report: Browns WR Derrick Willies (shoulder) is questionable for Week 6 against the Chargers.

impact: Willies fractured his collarbone in Friday's practice. He's likely headed to injured reserve. The Browns are also down Rashard Higgins this week, locking Jarvis Landry and Antonio Callaway into a heavy target share.
report: Browns WR Derrick Willies (shoulder) is out for Week 6 against the Chargers.

impact: The team signed WR Breshad Perriman Saturday morning and were forced to make a corresponding move. With Willies out the picture and Rishard Higgins additionally out for Sunday, Cleveland will enter their matchup against the Chargers with Jarvis Landry, Rod Streater, Antonio Callaway, and Perriman as the primary receivers.
report: Browns placed WR Derrick Willies (shoulder) on injured reserve.

impact: Landry was limited all week in practice, but it always seemed like he was just getting some rest on a short week. Certain to get targets in a good matchup, Landry is a solid WR2.
report: ESPN's Dianna Russini reports Jarvis Landry (knee) is expected to play Thursday night against the Jets.

impact: Landry just needed some maintenance during the week. He will be his usual, highly-targeted WR2 self against the Jets. Inactive for the Browns are QB Drew Stanton, WR Rod Streater, LB Christian Kirksey, TE Seth DeValve, DL Emmanuel Ogbah, DL Ifeadi Odenigb and DL Devaroe Lawrence.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is active for Week 3 against the Jets.

impact: Landry committed a drop but was helping Baker Mayfield move the chains for the Browns' transformed offense after Tyrod Taylor (concussion) was forced from the game. Landry was the lone Brown getting his numbers while Taylor was under center, but his fantasy fortunes should improve with Mayfield taking over. Landry has a soft Week 4 matchup in the Raiders.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 8-of-15 targets for 103 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: Landry's ten targets led the team, but he was part of the problem in Cleveland's drop-pass fest and failed to get loose for any big plays.  Finishing with four catches snapped Landry's streak of catching five or more balls in 20 straight games.  Still, Landry has been targeted 18 times in roughly six quarters by Baker Mayfield, by far most on the team.  Keep rolling him out there in Week 5 against a Ravens defense struggling to slow slot receivers.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 4-of-10 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the Browns' Week 4 loss to Oakland.

impact: Landry was on the injury report with a knee issue in Week 3 and has played through it since then; we wouldn't expect any different this week.  Landry should be back on the practice filed Thursday and Friday at the latest.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: He was officially limited. It appears as if Wednesday was just a maintenance day for the Browns' No. 1 receiver. He should be fine to face the Ravens on Sunday.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: Antonio Callaway (knee) was also taken off the injury report.  Both are good to go for a tough home matchup against the Ravens.  Landry will be a borderline WR1/2 who obviously gets a bigger boost in PPR leagues.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is not listed on the final Week 5 injury report and will play against the Ravens.

impact: Landry was held in check by a Baltimore secondary. He had just one catch for 10 yards in the first half and needed receptions of 27 and 17 yards on the final three drives of the game to turn in a respectable line. Landry has had two 100-yard game surrounding three lackluster games, but is averaging a career-high 13.0 yards per catch with at double-digit targets in four of the first five games. He is strong WR2 in Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 5-of-10 targets for 69 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Landry was stymied by the Chargers secondary all afternoon. His two receptions were the fewest he's had in a game since Week 14 of the 2015 season. Landry has struggled in the transition over to Baker Mayfield catching 11-of-29 targets for 114 yards over Mayfield's three starts. Despite those lowly numbers, Landry will be  in a spot to bounce back against a giving Tampa Bay secondary in Week 7.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 2-of-9 targets for 11 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: After just 11 catches for 114 yards over Baker Mayfield's first three starts, Landry had a season-high 10 catches on Sunday. Things started slowly as Landry had just four catches for 23 yards at the break, but then came on strong in the second half, securing 6-of-8 targets for 73 yards and a score. Landry found the end zone for the second time this season, a 16-yard score in which he made a diving catch and extended the ball over the goal line on his way to the ground to tie the game with 2:28 left in regulation. Landry has double-digit targets in every game this season and heads to Pittsburgh in Week 8 after already having a 100-yard game versus the Steelers in Week 1.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 10-of-15 targets for 97 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Landry led the team in targets and catches, but was only able to catch targets near the line of scrimmage, an ongoing problem. Over Baker Mayfield's five starts, Landry is averaging 11.6 targets per game but just a lowly 4.3 yards per target. He has been held under 40-yards receiving in three of those games. With his low weekly floor, Landry is creeping down to WR3 status as the season moves along. The Browns host the Chiefs in Week 9.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 8-of-12 targets for 39 yards in Sunday's Week 8 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Landry opened the game with a 17-yard catch on the second play of the game, but then was quiet the rest of the afternoon as he failed to gain yardage after the catch on his targets near the line of scrimmage. Landry has been nondescript with Baker Mayfield under center, averaging 50 yards per game over those six games with just 5.3 yards per target. Despite the pedestrian output, Landry will find himself as a lower-end WR2 in Week 10 when the Browns host the Falcons.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 6-of-7 targets for 50 yards in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Baker Mayfield was on fire, but Landry ended up having his second-worst game of the season. Mayfield was spreading the ball around, finding nine different players for completions. The Browns were also riding their run game, rolling up 211 yards. Landry now has just eight grabs for 72 yards in two games since Freddie Kitchens took over as offensive coordinator. He will return from the Browns' Week 11 bye as a mid-range WR2 against the Bengals' burnable defense.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 2-of-5 targets for 22 yards in the Browns' Week 10 win over the Falcons.

impact: Landry was a victim of not being a part of the Browns offensive explosion in the first half and then buried by the team attempting just four passes in the second half. Landry has now received just 17 targets over his three games since the Browns coaching shake up, catching just 10 passes over that span for 102 yards. Landry has now posted 50 or fewer receiving yards in 6-of-8 starts by Baker Mayfield. He has to now be treated as a lower-end WR3 option moving forward. The Browns play at Houston in Week 13.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 3-of-5 targets for 30 yards in Sunday's Week 12 win over the Bengals.

impact: After being held to 50 or fewer yards in four straight games, Landry led the team in targets, catches and yards on Sunday. His overall production wasn't entirely aided by the Browns in catch-up mode in the second half as he caught three passes for 45 yards in the first half. Landry has has an up-and-down first season in Cleveland, but is still a WR3 option based on target potential each week. He gets another matchup in Week 14 against a struggling Panthers secondary, but still comes along with a pedestrian floor paired with a marginal ceiling.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 6-of-9 targets for 103 yards in Sunday's Week 13 loss to the Texans.

impact: Callaway had a rough Weeks 3 and 4 and may have his snaps dialed back due to his mistakes.  He can't be trusted as anything more than a WR4.
report: Antonio Callaway (knee) was removed from the Week 5 injury report and will play against the Ravens.

impact: After a dreadful performance a week ago, Callaway once again struggled on Sunday, dropping a crucial pass. Callaway entered the week dealing with a knee issue and the coaching staff mentioned dialing back his workload, which they did after he received nine and 11 targets over the two games prior. Callaway now has four or fewer receptions in every game this season and is still only a bench stash at this stage of the season. The Browns host the Chargers in Week 6.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 3-of-5 targets for 22 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Callaway once again struggled with missed opportunities as he lost a potential 45-yard touchdown in the sun in the first quarter and then had another straight drop on a potential long-gainer in the second half. He did secure a two-point conversion after the Browns' lone touchdown on the day. Callaway will continue to be force-fed targets as Cleveland has limited healthy bodies available at the wide receiver position, but he has caught just 8-of-24 targets over the past three weeks for 85 yards. Callaway will be an all-or-nothing option against a giving Tampa Bay defense in Week 7.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 2-of-10 targets for nine yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: The two targets were the fewest that Callaway has received in a game since Week 1. He now has three or fewer receptions in every game on the season but one. Callaway has now reeled in just 9-of-23 targets for 99 yards over Baker Mayfield's four starts. Callaway is not a fantasy option heading into Week 8 against the Steelers.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 1-of-2 targets for 14 yards in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Callaway managed to find the end zone for the second time this season, catching a 1-yard touchdown in the third quarter as he battled through a defensive pass interference. Callaway has had an up-and-down rookie season, catching 21-of-48 targets for 236 yards and two scores through eight games. Callaway is not a fantasy option heading into Week 9 against the Chiefs.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 5-of-6 targets for 36 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 8 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Callaway wasn't on the injury report on Wednesday, so this is a new concern for the rookie receiver. It's unclear when the injury happened or the severity of the injury, so Friday's report will be telling on his status for the Browns Week 9 game against the Chiefs on Sunday. The Browns are thin at receiver behind Jarvis Landry, but Rashard Higgins (knee) did return to the practice field today getting in a limited session.
report: Antonio Callaway was added to the injury report on Thursday with an ankle issue, getting in a limited session.

impact: Callaway rolled his ankle Thursday and was limited, so this is a downgrade for the disappointing rookie.  We doubt he plays against the Chiefs.  The good news for Cleveland is Rashard Higgins (knee) should return.
report: Antonio Callaway (ankle) did not practice Friday.

impact: Callaway rolled his ankle in Thursday's practice and was unable to practice Friday.  We'd guess he's more doubtful.  Rashard Higgins (knee) is also questionable, but likely has far better chances of suiting up Sunday.
report: Antonio Callaway (ankle) is questionable for Week 9 against the Chiefs.

impact: Callaway was a late addition to the injury report after getting his ankle rolled in Thursday's practice. He'll have to make it through pre-game warmups without setbacks, but the Browns think this is something he can play through. Rashard Higgins (questionable, knee) is also expected to return this week.
report: Antonio Callaway (questionable, ankle) is expected to play in Week 9 against Kansas City.

impact: Callaway was cleared after making in through pre-game warmups. He's not 100 percent after rolling his ankle in practice this week, so it possible Callaway will  have a scaled back role. Rashard Higgins (knee) is also active for the first time since Week 5.
report: Antonio Callaway (ankle) is active for Week 9 against the Chiefs.

impact: Callaway was tied for fourth on the team in targets and his 51 yards were the most he's had in a game since Week 4 in Baker Mayfield's first career start. The bull of Callaway's yardage came on a 38-yard sideline grab when Mayfield found him in stride. Callaway has now caught 17-of-38 targets for 186 yards and one touchdown over his six starts with Mayfield.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 3-of-5 targets for 51 yards in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Callaway looked healthy playing through his ankle injury last week. This confirms he didn't have any setbacks. Callaway has been trending up with the last two games. He gets a matchup with the Falcons in Week 10.
report: Antonio Callaway (ankle) is practicing fully for Week 10.

impact: Callaway also made his presence felt with some down-field blocking on Nick Chubb's 92-yard touchdown. With the Browns expanding the target tree under new OC Freddie Kitchens, Callaway's WR5 value is even more tenuous.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 2-of-2 targets for 39 yards in the Browns' Week 10 win over the Falcons.

impact: Callaway's 62 yards were his most in a game since Week 2. He was a popular target of Baker Mayfield when on the move, with Mayfield finding him on a 13-yard score on the second drive of the game when Mayfield bought time moving to his left and then finding Callaway driving across the back of the end zone. Callaway has improved his efficiency over the past few weeks in a reduced role, catching 14-of-18 targets for 188 yards and two scores over his past four games. The Browns head to Houston in Week 13.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 4-of-5 targets for 62 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 12 win over the Bengals.

impact: Callaway had an adventurous series of plays in the third quarter, having a 77-yard touchdown reception called back due to a holding penalty and then two plays later, catching a pass in traffic down the field and then taking it 71 yards only to be stripped at the 1-yard line and lose the fumble. After sitting out all 2017, Callaway has shown positive signs over the back half of his rookie season. Over his past five games, Callaway has caught 17-of-24 targets for 272 yards and two touchdowns. He is still not a viable fantasy option when the Browns host the Panthers in Week 14.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 3-of-6 targets for 84 yards in Sunday's Week 13 loss to the Texans.

impact: Washington was cut by the Lions ahead of Week 1 after spending two seasons with the team as a seventh-rounder.  He can help on special teams.
report: Saints signed RB Dwayne Washington off their practice squad.

impact: Ingram is eligible to return from his four-game suspension today, and he did not want to waste any time. Alvin Kamara will continue to command a large workload, especially in the passing game, but Ingram returning is a concern for both his carry total and red-zone work. Even so, Kamara will remain a locked-in RB1 moving forward while Ingram could develop into a top-24 option.
report: NBC Sports' Peter King reports Mark Ingram met the Saints at the airport early Monday morning.

impact: "It'll be good for us offensively to have (Ingram) back," Payton said. Although not very expansive, they are Payton's first comments on the matter since Ingram's return. Kamara has been the No. 1 overall fantasy running back through the season's first four weeks. Ingram is going to cut into his workload but probably not to the degree he did in 2017. Ingram averaged 18 touches per game last season. He might start out more in the 10-14 range in 2018. He's best treated as a low-end RB2 for Week 5.
report: Speaking Tuesday, Saints coach Sean Payton said "we'll figure out the balance" between Alvin Kamara and a returning Mark Ingram.

impact: Making his 2018 debut after serving a four-game suspension to open the season, Ingram got the start and out-touched Alvin Kamara 18-9, adding two catches for 20 yards on three targets.  It was evident right from the get-go that coach Sean Payton wanted to get Ingram involved and keep him involved after sitting out the first four weeks.  It was also an opportunity for Kamara to get some extra rest heading into the bye.  Moving forward, we expect Kamara to be used much more than he was tonight, but there's obviously some serious concern here with all the weapons and mouths in the New Orleans offense.  Kamara is unlikely to match his 22.75 touches per game mark from Weeks 1-4.  He's going to need big plays to maintain elite RB1 status while Ingram is very much a mid-to-high RB2 the rest of the way.  The Saints get the Ravens on the road in Week 7.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 16 times for 53 yards and two touchdowns in the Saints' 43-19, Week 5 rout of the Redskins on Monday night.

impact: Ingram out-touched Kamara 18-9 in his Week 5 debut, but Kamara had a 19-14 upper hand in Baltimore. Ingram received carries from the Ravens' six- and five-yard line but could not cash either in. Kamara found the end zone from two yards out in the fourth quarter. This is more how we were expecting the Saints' backfield to look following Ingram's return but nothing is settled after only two games. Ingram will be a touchdown-dependent RB2 for Week 8 against the Vikings.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 12 times for 32 scoreless yards in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens, adding two catches for 10 additional yards.

impact: Ingram took a backseat to Alvin Kamara for the second straight week. He got almost all his work in the second half with the Saints running the clock. Ingram played behind Kamara in red-zone situations — a concern to his going-forward outlook. With a matchup against the Rams in Week 9, Ingram will be a touchdown-dependent RB3.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 13 times for 63 yards and caught three passes for 29 yards in Week 8 against the Vikings.

impact: Ingram’s game did not start as well as his backfield partner’s. He was limited to just five yards on his first three carries, and he coughed up the ball on the last of those attempts, although the Rams bailed him out with a failed fake field goal. Ingram might have been able to save his day if the Saints had held their lead in the second half, but he ended up touching the ball just four times after the break. Ingram has not scored since finding the end zone twice in his first game back, and he has averaged just 57 total yards since the bye. He will be back-end RB2 despite a good matchup next week in Cincinnati.
report: Mark Ingram rushed nine times for 33 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for three yards in the Saints' Week 9 win over the Rams.

impact: Sunday was Ingram's first 100-yard rushing game since Week 11 of last season as he found gaping room all afternoon against a non-existent Bengals defense. Ingram found the end zone on a 28-yard screen pass in which is almost appeared as the Bengals defense was trying to let him score. Ingram still took a back seat to Alvin Kamara at the goal line. Ingram's big day was largely a product of the opponent and game script, leaving him as a sketchy fantasy option next week against the Eagles strong rushing defense.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 13 times for 104 yards while catching three passes for 58 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 10 win over the Bengals.

impact: Ingram set the tone on his opening carry, going for 38 yards to help spark a field-goal drive, and continued to eat until he was pulled from the blowout in the fourth quarter. His first touchdown came on a 14-yard rush early in the second quarter, and he scored from one yard out in the third. Ingram's carry totals are a bit of a concern, but he has now topped 100 yards in each of the last two games. He will be a solid RB2 on Thanksgiving against the Falcons.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 16 times for 103 yards and two touchdowns in the Saints' Week 11 win over the Eagles.

impact: Ingram's now handled double-digit carries in three straight contests since the Saints have dominated their opponents in that stretch. His last letdown obviously came in a competitive match against the Rams' high-powered offense in Week 9, when he rushed for a lowly 33 yards on nine carries. Assuming New Orleans' next contest against the Cowboys stays close, Alvin Kamara should take back his hierarchy usage across the board. Consider Ingram an RB3/FLEX in that one.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 11 times for 52 yards in the Saints' Week 12 posterizing of the Falcons.

impact: The 28 yards from scrimmage were Ingram's fewest of the season. The Saints' offense was simply stuck in neutral against an inspired Cowboys defense. Mired in a three-game fantasy slump, Ingram will have an excellent chance at breaking it in Week 14 when the Saints take on the Bucs in Tampa Bay.
report: Mark Ingram rushed seven times for 27 yards in the Saints' Week 13 loss to the Cowboys, adding two receptions for one additional yard.

impact: This marks Garoppolo's first career loss after opening 7-0 as a starter.  Garoppolo tried to lead a comeback with the Vikings up by 18 deep into the third quarter, but the red-zone offense left a lot to be desired Sunday.  Garoppolo missed a wide-open George Kittle on a would-be four-yard touchdown and earlier overshot Kittle on a deep ball after he beat Harrison Smith.  Garoppolo also had a possible 80-yard TD dropped by Kittle.  His touchdown was a beautiful 22-yard hookup with rookie Dante Pettis after Garoppolo spun out of a sack.  He missed too many throws in this one, however, though it was a very tough road date with one of the league's best defenses.  The Niners will host the Lions in their home opener next Sunday.  Garoppolo will be a back-end QB1.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo completed just 15-of-33 passes for 261 yards, one touchdown, and three interceptions in the 49ers' 24-16, Week 1 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Jimmy G also took six sacks for a loss of 50 yards. Garoppolo dialed up a sideline pass to a wide-open Kendrick Bourne for his first touchdown of the day early in the second quarter. He added to his touchdown tally with another score in the third quarter, this time connecting with tight end Garrett Celek for 11 yards. Garoppolo narrowly avoided disaster in the fourth as a Tracy Walker interception was negated by a holding call on Quandre Diggs. That interception would have set the Lions up with first-and-goal and a chance to take the lead with just over two minutes remaining. As his six sacks would attest to, Garoppolo often held on to the ball too long, though all in all, Sunday was a much better performance than his last one against the Vikings in Week 1. Now 8-1 as an NFL starting quarterback, Handsome Jimmy will head to KC next week for a shootout with Patrick Mahomes and the 2-0 Chiefs.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo completed 18-of-26 passes for 206 yards and two touchdowns while contributing four yards on three carries Sunday in the 49ers’ Week 2 win over the Lions.

impact: Garoppolo decided to stay in bounds at the end of a fourth-quarter run and ended up taking a big hit on the sideline. Trainers appeared to be examining his left leg -- not his head -- on the sidelines, and that leg was extended straight out in front of him on the cart. Garoppolo had an up-and-down game before exiting, but he led the 49ers back in the second half. He finished the day with 251 yards and two scores.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo was carted to the locker room with a knee injury late in the fourth quarter Week 3 against the Chiefs.

impact: Garoppolo took a big hit along the sidelines late in the fourth quarter of San Francisco's Week 3 loss. It originally seemed like he could be dealing with a concussion, but he ended up being carted to the locker room with his left leg extended straight in front of him. If it is actually an ACL, Garoppolo will be the second offensive star the 49ers lose to an ACL tear after Jerick McKinnon suffered the same injury in the preseason. Brutal.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said the team is "fearing" an ACL tear for Jimmy Garoppolo.

impact: It is the same thing coach Kyle Shanahan said after the game. "Our [medical] guys say they’ve been wrong before and so they need to do the MRI, obviously," Lynch added, but it would be a shock if Garoppolo is dealing with anything less than a season-ending injury. C.J. Beathard should be the 49ers' starter the rest of the way.
report: 49ers GM John Lynch told NBC Sports' Peter King "all indications" suggest Jimmy Garoppolo suffered a torn ACL.

impact: Garoppolo is also believed to have MCL damage, but that's yet to be confirmed. That would threaten to delay his surgery. It's the worst news the 49ers could have gotten this season. Garoppolo's play was a little shakier than it was in 2017, but he was still performing at a high level with obvious room for improvement. His loss essentially pauses the 49ers' rebuild. 2018 is going to have a hard time not feeling like a wasted year in San Francisco. 2017 third-rounder C.J. Beathard will finish the year under center. When he's next in the huddle, Garoppolo will be 27 years old with just 10 career starts.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports an MRI has confirmed Jimmy Garoppolo's initial diagnosis of a torn left ACL.

impact: Garoppolo tore his left ACL late in the Niners' Week 3 loss to Kansas City. He'll miss the rest of the year but should be back for the start of next season. With Garoppolo out of commission, quarterback duties in San Francisco will fall to 2017 third-rounder C.J. Beathard.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo underwent surgery to repair a torn ACL on Wednesday.

impact: "I’m hoping he’ll get into OTAs and do some non-contact stuff," Shanahan said. "It’s always a little bit better when you’re dealing with a quarterback as opposed to other positions because you can get them in 7-on-7 drills, which helps those guys get involved a lot faster." Garoppolo tore his ACL in Week 3. He'll be eight months removed from surgery for the start of OTAs. The 49ers will move Garoppolo slowly, but barring setbacks, he should have a chance at getting in some limited offseason reps.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan thinks Jimmy Garoppolo (knee) could be ready for OTAs.

impact: Cobb was downgraded to limited on Thursday after getting in a full practice Wednesday. These comments suggest Cobb suffered a setback and was not just getting some extra rest. He is looking legitimately questionable to face the Dolphins.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Randall Cobb was limited Thursday because of the same hamstring which has bothered him since Week 3.

impact: Cobb had a setback Thursday and was limited the last two days. He may come down to a game-time decision for Sunday's matchup with the Dolphins. Cobb likely isn't going to be 100 percent if he plays.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is questionable for Week 10 against Miami.

impact: Without Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (groin, injured reserve), expect Davante Adams and rookie Equanimeous St. Brown to play primarily on the outside. Rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling arguably has the best matchup in the slot away from premier CB Xavien Howard, who'll likely shadow Adams. Start MVS with confidence as a high-end WR3. King will continue being replaced by CB Bashaud Breeland.
report: Packers declared WR Randall Cobb, QB Tim Boyle, CB Kevin King, CB Will Redmond, S Ibraheim Campbell, and OL Alex Light inactive for Week 10 against the Dolphins.

impact: It's a new injury for Adams. The Packers like to rest their veterans early in the week, so this doesn't look serious. Adams is a locked-in WR1 for Week 5 against the Lions.
report: Davante Adams (calf) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Cobb reportedly won't make the trip to Seattle, meaning he will miss his second-straight game Thursday after suffering a setback last Thursday. Equanimeous St. Brown is the Packers' fill-in No. 3 receiver behind Davante Adams and Marquez Valdes-Scantling.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) remained sidelined on Tuesday.

impact: Cobb wasn't healthy enough to even travel with the team. He'll miss his second straight game after his latest hamstring setback. Cobb's absence upgrades Davante Adams, Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Jimmy Graham's target share.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is out for Week 11 against the Seahawks.

impact: Cobb is without a timetable for a return. Equanimeous St. Brown is taking Cobb's place in three-receiver sets.
report: Packers declared WR Randall Cobb, QB Tim Boyle, CB Kevin King, S Kentrell Brice, OLB Nick Perry, OL Lucas Patrick and OL Alex Light inactive for Week 11 against the Seahawks.

impact: Cobb is coming off a mini-bye after Green Bay played on Thursday night in Week 11. His presence at practice is a good sign for his status, though he'll likely need to get in a full session to get cleared. Cobb will slot in as the No. 3 wideout behind Davante Adams and Marquez Valdes-Scantling if he returns this week.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Cobb hasn't played since Week 9 but remains iffy to suit up Sunday night. Even if he's active, his lingering hamstring ailment is concerning for how much he would actually be involved. He would still take the place of Equanimeous St. Brown if cleared. Davante Adams and Marquez Valdes-Scantling will continue to work as Green Bay's primary receiving options.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is questionable for Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Mid-week injuries are always a concern, and they are even more worrying when followed by a missed practice. It is possible Adams returns Friday and is ready to face the Lions this weekend, but he has to be considered questionable at best. It is not the news the Packers need with Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) looking unlikely to play. Green Bay's rookie trio of Marquez Valdes-Scantling, J'Mon Moore, and Equanimeous St. Brown could be forced into action this week.
report: Davante Adams will not practice Thursday because of a calf injury he suffered during Wednesday's session.

impact: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is out, and coach Mike McCarthy said there is "hope" Geronimo Allison (concussion) can play.  Adams seems the most likely to play of the three, but it's still entirely possible none of the three vets play against Detroit.  It's a situation to monitor into the weekend.
report: Davante Adams (calf) will practice on Saturday.

impact: Adams got in a limited practice Friday and is expected to practice Saturday. He looks likely to play after some early-week concern over his status. With Randall Cobb (hamstring) out and Geronimo Allison (questionable, concussion) still not cleared, Marquez Valdes-Scantling is the next man up opposite Adams.
report: Davante Adams (calf) is questionable for Week 5 against Detroit.

impact: No surprise here.  Adams suffered a minor calf pull in practice this week, but he will be out there against Darius Slay.  Adams is coming off back-to-back eight-catch games against Xavier Rhodes and Tre'Davious White.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirmed Saturday night that Davante Adams (calf, questionable) is expected to play in Week 5.

impact: Cobb was close to playing after a limited week of practice but will miss at least another week. It's good news for the target shares of Davante Adams, Marquez Valdes-Scantling, and Jimmy Graham. Equanimeous St. Brown will continue to replace Cobb in three-wide sets.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is inactive for Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Cobb was limited all last week before getting held out. He has a better chance to return Sunday, but it's far from a lock. With the Packers out of playoff contention, Cobb could be phased out of three-wide sets in favor of Equanimeous St. Brown.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Cobb got in a slate of limited practices last week before sitting out again. It stands to reason he will be closer this week, but his status cannot be taken for granted. If Cobb does suit up, he will be a WR5 in what will be a noncompetitive game with the Cardinals.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Cobb was limited throughout the week and remains a true question mark for Sunday. Marquez Valdes-Scantling continues to work as the team's primary No. 2 without Cobb, but has seen just five targets and 2/11 receiving the past two weeks. If Cobb musters the strength to suit up, he'll still be nothing more than a WR5 with all receivers now done with bye weeks.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is questionable for Week 13 against the Cardinals.

impact: Cobb was held out despite a round of limited practices last week. He's on track to make his first appearance since Week 9. In a contract year with the Packers all but out of the playoffs, Cobb isn't a lock to return ahead of Equanimeous St. Brown.
report: Randall Cobb (questionable, hamstring) is expected to play Week 13 against the Cardinals.

impact: As expected.  Geronimo Allison (concussion) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) are both out, so it'll be Adams, Marquez Valdes-Scantling, and a combo of fellow rookies J'Mon Moore and Equanimeous St. Brown filling the void.  Adams, despite the balky calf, is a locked-in WR1 as a big-time target hog.
report: Davante Adams (calf) is active for Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: What calf injury?  Adams was a late addition to the injury report during the week but looked no worse for the wear as he chewed up chunk gains all day against Darius Slay and others.  The 12 targets led the team on a day Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison were out and injured.  Adams seemed to be the only target Aaron Rodgers could trust fully on a day he attempted 52 passes.  Adams should work over Richard Sherman and the Niners next Monday night.
report: Davante Adams caught 9-of-12 targets for 140 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' 31-23, Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: Adams made a quick recovery. He will be a high-end WR1 for a gorgeous matchup with the 49ers.
report: Davante Adams (calf) is absent from the Week 6 injury report.

impact: Adams has been on a tear the past couple weeks with Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison sidelined with injuries.  In the two games, Adams has reeled in 19-of-28 targets for 272 yards and three touchdowns against the Lions and Niners.  Things didn't really pop off for him until the second half when Adams scored a 16-yard touchdown to tie the game at 30-30 with 1:55 left.  He then made multiple catches on the final drive to get the Packers into field goal range for the win.  This all came after he caught a nine-yard TD in the first quarter.  Cobb and Allison should be back after the Week 7 bye, but Adams will remain an obvious WR1 the rest of the way.
report: Davante Adams caught 10-of-16 targets for 132 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' come-from-behind 33-30, Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: With the Packers back to full strength at receiver, Adams drew fewer than 10 targets for the first time since Week 3 but still managed to post his third-straight 130-yard game. Adams was routinely left completely wide open by the Rams' struggling secondary. The Pack should be headed for a shootout with the Patriots in Week 9, though Adams will likely find himself shadowed by Stephon Gilmore.
report: Davante Adams caught 5-of-7 targets for 133 yards in the Packers' Week 8 loss to the Rams.

impact: It will be Cobb's first action since Week 9. With Marquez Valdes-Scantling scuffling, Cobb could step back into the No. 2 role, but he was not playing well himself before going down. In a game the Packers should be able to ride the running game, Cobb should be avoided in most formats.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is active for Week 13 against the Cardinals.

impact: Cobb caught a flare pass in the second half for a 20-plus-yard gain, but it was negated by RT Jason Spriggs' holding penalty.  In a timeshare with Equanimeous St. Brown, Marquez Valdes-Scantling, and perhaps Jake Kumerow behind Davante Adams, Cobb will be tough to trust even as a WR4 in Week 14 versus Atlanta.
report: Randall Cobb caught 3-of-5 targets for 25 yards in the Packers' Week 13 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Adams got open in the end-zone on a broken play for his touchdown. It was mostly a quiet night for Adams after that, though he still paced the Packers with nine targets. Adams has over 80 yards or a touchdown in every game this season. Even in a matchup with Xavien Howard, he's a top-10 play against the Miami next week.
report: Davante Adams caught 6-of-9 targets for 40 yards and a touchdown in Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: It was an all-around lowly day for the Packers' passing game, partly because it wasn't needed. Aaron Jones pummeled Miami's front-seven for 15/145/2, allowing Aaron Rodgers and Co. to sip Mai Tais throughout the afternoon. Adams still made the most of his seven targets, crossing up Fins' top corner Xavien Howard for one score, and beating backup DB Bobby McCain off the line on a slant for his second of the day. There's no denying the Packers still have a lot to sort out as it pertains to their aerial attack, but Adams remains one of the safest WR1's in the league no matter game script.
report: Davante Adams hauled in 4-of-7 targets for 57 yards and two scores in the Packers' easy Week 10 win over the Dolphins.

impact: The 166 yards were a career high. Adams' mind meld with Aaron Rodgers was on full display this evening, never more so than on his 57-yard reception in the fourth quarter. With the rush in his face, Rodgers unleashed a perfectly-thrown dime to hit Adams in stride. With six games to go, Adams is now just 47 yards shy of his first 1,000-yard campaign. The Vikings are on tap for Week 12.
report: Davante Adams caught 10-of-12 targets for 166 yards in the Packers' Week 11 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Adams beat Vikings CB Xavier Rhodes in a one-on-one red-zone matchup for a 15-yard touchdown. He went without a target for a long stretch, but salvaged his night on the Packers' final drive. Adams went over 1,000 yards on the season and has at least 80 yards or a touchdown in every game. He gets a matchup with Cardinals CB Patrick Peterson in Week 13.
report: Davante Adams caught 5-of-8 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Albeit in a losing effort, Adams overcame yet another bad cornerback matchup, something he's made a habit of all season.  He was shadowed for the majority of the contest by Patrick Peterson, yet put on a clinic with an early 13-yard touchdown on a fourth-and-four play, and a 19-yard toe-tapping sideline catch in the fourth quarter to set up Aaron Jones' eight-yard TD.  One of Green Bay's precious few 2018 bright spots, Adams will remain a high-floor, high-upside WR1 when the Packers host the Falcons next.
report: Davante Adams caught 8-of-13 targets for 93 yards and a touchdown in Green Bay's Week 13 loss to Arizona.

impact: St. Brown made the start as the No. 3 wideout with Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison out.  He made a sliding 17-yard grab for his first NFL catch and had a late 54-yard pickup to pad the stats.  St. Brown will head back to the bench when Cobb and/or Allison come back, maybe as soon as Week 6.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown caught 3-of-5 targets for 89 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: He made the target count by making a critical sideline grab on the game-winning field goal drive at the end of the fourth quarter.  With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison expected back after the bye, ESB will go back to the bench.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown caught his lone target for 19 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: It's a surprise with the Packers coming off a bye. With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison likely to return this week, St. Brown isn't a lock to be active even if healthy.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He was limited in practice all week. With Geronimo Allison back and Randall Cobb (hamstring) questionable, St. Brown won't have a role even if he's active.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (knee) is questionable for Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: St. Brown was never in danger of sitting out after playing through his knee injury last week. With Geronimo Allison (hamstring, groin) doubtful, he'll see snaps in four-wide sets.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (knee) was removed from the Week 9 injury report.

impact: The Packers' fill-in No. 3 receiver turned in a dud in Randall Cobb's absence. Cobb now has 10 days to heal up from his hamstring injury for Week 12 against the Vikings. Even if Cobb remains sidelined, St. Brown can't be trusted as a WR4.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown caught 1-of-4 targets for 16 yards in the Packers' Week 11 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: St. Brown was leading the Packers with 53 yards receiving before going down. He returned for a play before leaving. With Randall Cobb sidelined, the Packers are running thin at wideout.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown left Week 12 against the Vikings with an elbow injury.

impact: St. Brown briefly returned from his elbow injury in Sunday night's loss but couldn't finish the game. Barring setbacks, he should play in Week 13. St. Brown's role will be tied to Randall Cobb's status.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (elbow) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: St. Brown suffered the injury in Sunday night's loss to Minnesota. With Randall Cobb (hamstring) seemingly on track to return this week, St. Brown won't see enough work to warrant fantasy consideration against the Cardinals, assuming he even plays.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (elbow) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: St. Brown is good to go after getting in a limited week of practice. He'll work in three-wide sets if Randall Cobb (questionable, hamstring) isn't cleared.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (elbow) wasn't listed on the Packers' final injury report for Week 13 against the Cardinals.

impact: He went from starter to backup in Randall Cobb's (hamstring) return.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown missed his lone target in Green Bay's Week 13 loss.

impact: Valdes-Scantling was a preseason leader after some early training camp struggles. He's behind Geronimo Allison in three-wide sets, and with Trevor Davis returning kicks, there's not a ton of snaps for him. We like Valdes-Scantling as a sleeper to overtake Allison this year. The Packers may also continue to shop Randall Cobb leading up to the Week 8 trade deadline.
report: The Wisconsin State Journal doesn't expect Marquez Valdes-Scantling to have a Week 1 role.

impact: He's replacing Randall Cobb (hamstring) in three-wide sets. Cobb was playing 90 percent of snaps before going down, so Valdes-Scantling is going to get some serious run.  With Cobb potentially looking at a multi-game absence, Valdes-Scantling's dynasty stock is on the rise.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling will start in Week 4 against Buffalo.

impact: McCarthy said he has "great confidence" in the other rookie WRs J'Mon Moore and Equanimeous St. Brown, but Valdes-Scantling will "have a role" and was named by the coach.  It's been pretty clear through four weeks fifth-rounder Valdes-Scantling is ahead of the other two rookies.  MVS played 54-of-76 snaps last week as the starting slot man, catching a 38-yard pass on three targets.  He'll be in line for a bigger role if Cobb and Allison are unable to play.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy singled out rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling as the next man up at receiver should Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) sit Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: With Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) inactive, Valdes-Scantling and fellow rookie Equanimeous St. Brown got the starts next to Davante Adams. MVS scored a three-yard touchdown on the opening drive of the third quarter after the Packers were shut out in the first two frames, and he had a second touchdown called back as it was ruled he was down at the half-yard line. Lance Kendricks scored the next play.  Valdes-Scantling's 10 targets were third on the team behind Adams (12) and Jimmy Graham (11).  Allison will likely be back Week 6, but Cobb may have a multi-week injury.  Once both are back, MVS will be irrelevant in redraft leagues.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 7-of-10 targets for 68 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison out again, MVS made another start and was third on the team in targets behind Davante Adams (16) and Jimmy Graham (9).  Valdes-Scantling started the Packers' night off with a 60-yard catch-and-run as he was left wide open down the left side.  Ty Montgomery eventually scored three plays later.  With the Packers going on a bye, MVS is likely to head back to No. 3 or 4 duties with Allison and Cobb likely to return versus the Rams.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 3-of-6 targets for 103 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison were both back from injury, but Valdes-Scantling remained heavily involved. He out-targeted Allison 5-1, though Pro Football Focus charted the two in a snap dead heat. MVS' score came after he beat press coverage on the inside on a go route. Even with the jumbled picture behind Davante Adams, MVS remains worth holding onto as an upside WR5 in fantasy.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 2-of-5 targets for 45 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 8 loss to the Rams.

impact: Valdes-Scantling led the Packers in receiving despite getting shutout in the first half. He got most of his yardage on a pair of impressive contested catches late in the third quarter. The Patriots shadowed Valdes-Scantling with Stephon Gilmore after that, but this is another encouraging game. Valdes-Scantling has over 100 yards or a touchdown in four straight weeks. He's locked in as the starter opposite Davante Adams for the rest of the season.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 3-of-6 targets for 101 yards in Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: Aaron Jones' breakout 15/145/2 performance overshadowed (and took away from) the Packers' passing game altogether on Sunday. MVS actually tied Davante Adams (4/57/2) with a team-high seven targets, but Adams was the primary beneficiary since two of his catches hit pay dirt. Rodgers clearly trusts the rookie, though, and he'll undoubtedly have much better performances when game script calls for it. Even when Cobb returns, consider Valdes-Scantling a high-end WR3 the rest of the way.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 6-of-7 targets for 44 yards in the Packers' Week 10 romping of the Dolphins.

impact: That's going to leave a mark. It was the first time in seven games MVS failed to post at least 38 yards. Aaron Rodgers was laser focused on Davante Adams. Aaron Jones was also gobbling up touches. The entire Packers offense went off the rails in the second half, limiting opportunity for everyone. MVS will look to bounce back as a WR4 for Week 12 against the Vikings.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 1-of-3 targets for eight yards in the Packers' Week 11 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: He had only two targets. There wasn't much opportunity for Valdes-Scantling on a night Aaron Rodgers threw for only 198 yards. Valdes-Scantling is in the midst of a bad two-game stretch, but still has value as the No. 2 receiver on the Packers. He'll try to rebound in a Week 13 matchup with the Cardinals.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught one pass for three yards in Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: Valdes-Scantling had an early drop, and the rest of his missed targets were off-the-mark throws from Aaron Rodgers on a day where Green Bay didn't complete a single 20-plus-yard pass.  Valdes-Scantling's usage has been all over the map lately.  He will be a boom-bust WR4 play in Week 14 against the Falcons.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 2-of-7 targets for 19 yards in the Packers' Week 13 loss to Arizona.

impact: It'll be another week of Corey Clement and Wendell Smallwood. Sproles has yet to practice since going down in the season opener. There's no timetable for his return.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) has been ruled out for Week 7.

impact: Sproles has been out for well over a month.  He should be getting close, but Sproles has still yet to practice in weeks.  With Wendell Smallwood also having an injury, it could be Corey Clement and Josh Adams against the Jaguars.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He won't be making the trip to London. Sproles hasn't played or practiced since injuring his hamstring in the season opener. In the absence of Sproles, the Eagles will continue to employ a backfield committee featuring Corey Clement and Wendell Smallwood.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is out for Week 8 against the Jaguars.

impact: He did not even make the trip to London. Sproles has not practiced since suffering a hamstring injury in the season opener, but perhaps he will be able to make a return following the bye. Philly also declared S Corey Graham (hamstring), LB Nathan Gerry (ankle), CB Sidney Jones (hamstring), QB Nate Sudfeld, OT Jordan Mailata, and OT Matt Pryor inactive for Week 8.
report: Eagles declared Darren Sproles (hamstring) inactive for Week 8 against the Jaguars.

impact: Sproles hasn't played since going down in the season opener. With the Eagles on a bye, it won't be surprising if he gets some practice reps next week. Sproles will be part of a three-back committee with Wendell Smallwood and Corey Clement when he returns.
report: ESPN's Tim McManus reports Darren Sproles (hamstring) could return in Week 10.

impact: Sproles practiced Wednesday for the first time since Week 1. He looks on track to return coming off the Eagles' bye. Sproles will be part of a three-back committee with Wendell Smallwood and Corey Clement. He should get the majority of passing and third down snaps over Clement. Sproles is on the RB4 radar in PPR formats.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson expcts Darren Sproles (hamstring) to return this week.

impact: Sproles practiced on Wednesday for the first time since injuring his hamstring in Week 1; he promptly hurt it again and is week to week after coach Doug Pederson expected him back this week.  It's been a totally lost season for the 35-year-old after tearing his ACL last year.  Sproles delayed his retirement to play this season after missing last year.  It's a tough way to go out.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Darren Sproles aggravated his hamstring injury and is now expected to miss Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Sproles was expected to return this week, but he suffered a setback on Wednesday. The veteran has been sidelined since Week 1 because of the injury. Pederson's optimism would seem to rule out injured reserve, but that might be how this situation ends.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson still expects Darren Sproles (hamstring) to return this season.

impact: The veteran had been hoping to return this week but obviously that didn't pan out. While the Eagles haven't given an exact timetable for his return, one source told Rapoport that Sproles is likely facing a 3-4 week absence. With Sproles unavailable, Wendell Smallwood, Corey Clement and Josh Adams will continue to work as part of a three-man backfield for the Eagles.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Darren Sproles (hamstring) is expected to miss "multiple weeks" with his latest injury.

impact: Sproles has been out since injuring his hamstring in the season opener. He looked on track to return in Week 10, but a setback kept him out until this practice. It is possible Sproles is ready to play Monday night, but he will not be a fantasy option behind Josh Adams.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson said Darren Sproles (hamstring) will practice Thursday.

impact: It appears Sproles is finally on the mend after missing most of the past three months with a nagging hamstring injury. Even if he's active for Monday night's home game against the Redskins, it's unlikely he'll carve out much of a role with Josh Adams taking over as the Eagles' lead back.
report: Updating an earlier report, Darren Sproles (hamstring) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: When asked if he'll play Monday, Sproles casually responded, "That's the plan." He also mentioned "we're going to see" what his eventual role will be. It's worth noting Sproles received all running back targets and 50% of Philly's red zone rushes in his only available three quarters this season. We still expect Josh Adams to handle the load as a confident RB2.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is expected to play in Week 13 against the Redskins.

impact: Sproles is expected to return after a limited week of practice. He hasn't played since the season opener but may be needed for heavy snaps with Josh Adams (hip) questionable. Sproles will be on the FLEX radar if Adams sits.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is questionable for Week 13 against Washington.

impact: It'll be Sproles' first game since Week 1 after multiple setbacks with the hammy.  We doubt he has much of an affect on Josh Adams' workhorse duties, but Sproles could push Corey Clement for touches as the change-of-pace.  Inactive for Philly is MLB Jordan Hicks, CB Avonte Maddox, OT Jordan Mailata, CB Jalen Mills, OG Matt Pryor, QB Nate Sudfeld, and OG Chance Warmack.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is active for Week 13 against the Redskins.

impact: He wasn't targeted in the pass game with Corey Clement keeping those duties.  Sproles scored from 14 yards out as he walked into the end zone on a perfectly-blocked play.  It was the 35-year-old's first game since Week 1 due to hamstring issues.  Sproles won't be a fantasy option the last four weeks.
report: Darren Sproles rushed four times for 22 yards and one touchdown in the Eagles' Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: Pederson said Sproles' recovery might take a "little longer," but it doesn't sound like Ajay has yet to be considered out or even a long shot for Week 3.  We'll continue to keep a close eye on this situation the rest of the week.  The Eagles promoted UDFA rookie Josh Adams from the practice squad.
report: Coach Doug Pederson labeled both Jay Ajayi (back) and Darren Sproles (hamstring) as day to day.

impact: Neither did Darren Sproles (hamstring), leaving Corey Clement, Wendell Smallwood, and Josh Adams as the team's healthy running backs.  Coach Doug Pederson labeled Ajayi as day to day in his media session Wednesday.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Ajayi will probably have to get in at least a limited practice Friday in order to suit up Sunday against Indianapolis. With Ajayi (back) and Darren Sproles (hamstring) looking questionable at best for Week 3, Corey Clement needs to be picked up in all formats.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) remained sidelined at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ajayi hasn't practiced all week. He'll likely have to be a limited participant Friday to have even a chance to suit up against the Colts in Week 3. With Ajayi and Darren Sproles (hamstring) looking highly doubtful to play, Corey Clement needs to be picked up across all formats.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) is still day to day.

impact: Ajayi has been sidelined throughout the week, making it highly doubtful he plays Sunday against the Colts. The Eagles signed rookie Josh Adams from their practice squad, but Corey Clement should receive a bulk of the work with Wendell Smallwood mixing-in as backup. Clement is Roto Pat's No. 18 running back.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: This was the expected outcome after Ajayi was unable to practice this week. With Darren Sproles (hamstring) also out, the Eagles will turn to Corey Clement as their workhorse. Clement is a plug-and-play RB2 in all formats.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) is out for Week 3 against the Colts.

impact: Pederson originally said he expected Ajayi to play this week, but he clarified he was actually talking about practice. Even so, Ajayi will almost certainly return to the field if he is able to get in even a limited practice on Wednesday.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson expects Jay Ajayi (back) to return to practice this week.

impact: Ajayi has been shut down since picking up his back injury in Week 2. Coach Doug Pederson expects Ajayi to practice this week, but he's not off to a good start. Darren Sproles (hamstring) was also held out Wednesday.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: That doesn't necessarily mean Ajayi will officially be labeled a participant, but it is a step in the right direction. Ajayi's practice usage hasn't always been instructive as to his Sunday status. "Game-time decision" would be an unsurprising designation for Sunday's 1PM ET tilt with the Titans.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) was spotted in uniform and stretching at the beginning of Eagles practice on Thursday.

impact: He seems to be over the back injury that kept him out last week against the Colts. Corey Clement will revert to backup status with Ajayi likely to return Sunday at Tennessee.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) was a full participant at Thursday's practice.

impact: The injury hampered him in Week 2 and led to his absence last week against the Colts. Despite this, Ajayi returned to full practice on Thursday and expects to suit up for Week 4. Ajayi said playing with his ailing back will come down to "pain tolerance." None of it sounds promising and Ajayi will certainly be at risk of re-injury when he takes the field Sunday at Tennessee. With that in mind, he'll be difficult to employ as anything more than a back-end RB2 this week.
report: Jay Ajayi said he's been dealing with a back fracture.

impact: The Eagles removed him from the injury report on Friday. Ajayi is coming back from a back fracture suffered early in Week 2.  He missed roughly 1.5 games with the injury but is ready to roll.  However, it's tough to gauge how much Ajayi is going to be able to handle.  There's still pain there, and the Eagles have Wendell Smallwood coming off a strong game as insurance.  Perhaps they scale back Ajayi's snaps, making him a risky RB2.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Jay Ajayi (back) is "good to go" for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Ajayi did not show any ill effects from his back injury in this one, running hard and consistently creating yards after contact. He did briefly leave the game with trainers in the fourth quarter, but he was back on the field after a couple plays. His health will remain a concern, but Ajayi will be an RB2 as long as he is healthy.
report: Jay Ajayi rushed 15 times for 70 yards and hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 11 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Ajayi also lost a goal line fumble early in the third quarter as the Eagles were trying to get back into a 17-3 affair. To top it all off, he was announced as questionable with a knee injury, though he did remain in the game. Wendell Smallwood out-gained Ajayi 71-34 on the afternoon. Yet to see truly elite usage or eclipse 81 yards from scrimmage, Ajayi is settling in as a low-end RB2. His health will be worth monitoring for Week 6, as the Eagles are playing in the Thursday night game.
report: Jay Ajayi rushed eight times for 29 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings, adding a five-yard reception.

impact: The injury came almost entirely out of thin air; Ajayi missed a few snaps with a knee injury on Sunday but returned to the game.  It's possible he played on a torn ACL in the second half.  The Eagles' backfield is all sorts of banged up; Corey Clement has missed two weeks with a quad strain, and Darren Sproles has been out with a hamstring injury.  It's possible Wendell Smallwood will have to carry the bulk of the load in Thursday night's game against the Giants.  UDFA Josh Adams is the Eagles' only healthy alternative.
report: Eagles placed RB Jay Ajayi on injured reserve with a torn ACL, ending his season.

impact: Smallwood's usage increased because Jay Ajayi missed almost the entire first half and Darren Sproles (hamstring) was out.  Unfortunately, Smallwood lost a fumble and Ajayi returned.  Smallwood shouldn't have a Week 3 role versus the Colts.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed seven times for 28 yards and caught his lone target for a gain of two in the Eagles' Week 2 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Smallwood drew the start and out-gained Corey Clement despite receiving just 13 touches. His 4-yard touchdown rush with 3:02 left in the 4th quarter put the Eagles up for good. If both Jay Ajayi and Darren Sproles remained sidelined in Week 4, Smallwood will be in the mix as a FLEX option next week against the Titans.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed 10 times for 56 yards and a touchdown while catching 3-of-5 targets for 35 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Colts.

impact: With both Corey Clement and Darren Sproles sidelined, Smallwood served as the No. 2 back behind Jay Ajayi. It was not always pretty -- he missed a blitz pickup in the two-minute drill -- but he was able to provide a couple nice runs. With Clement's and Sproles' availability up in the air, Smallwood is worth a look in deeper leagues.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed five times for 39 yards and hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 15 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Corey Clement (quad) was announced as active but ended up playing zero snaps. Smallwood drew Jay Ajayi to a playing time standstill and out-gained him 71-34. He did have a first half lowlight with a red zone drop. Smallwood has shown signs of life the past three weeks but is still an uninspiring FLEX option in PPR leagues. He's a bye week "if you must" play.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed three times for 27 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings, adding three catches for 44 additional yards and a touchdown.

impact: NJ.com's Mike Kaye expects the same thing but for it to "favor" Clement due to his "red-zone upside and receiving ability."  Both backs have been good when given their chances this season, but we tend to also lean in preferring Clement to Smallwood.  Both players need to be added in all formats.
report: The Philadelphia Inquirer's Zach Berman expects a Wendell Smallwood-Corey Clement "mix" Week 6 against the Giants on Thursday night.

impact: Smallwood failed to record a gain on his lone reception. He also fumbled but managed to recover it. Smallwood got the start and out-touched Corey Clement 19-14, but Clement out-gained him 69-51. Clement also tallied the Eagles' lone backfield score. Clement certainly looked like the better player. Smallwood won't be much of a FLEX when the Eagles host the Panthers in Week 7.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed 18 times for 51 yards in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: Smallwood’s 11 touches led the Eagles’ backfield; Corey Clement logged 10 and Josh Adams 4. Smallwood had multiple big plays nullified by penalties, including a monster screen pass of 50-plus yards that came about partly because of RG Brandon Brooks’ holding flag. Entrenched in a three-man backfield, Smallwood will be a sub-par Week 8 flex option against the Jags.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed nine times for 32 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for five yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Smallwood could not get anything going in the first half, but he made his presence known after the break, taking a perfectly executed screen pass 36 yards for a touchdown on the Eagles’ first drive of the second half. Most of his damage was done in the passing game, but Smallwood had his best run of the game to pick up a game-ending first down just before the two-minute warning. It seems likely Josh Adams takes on a bigger role coming out of the bye, but Smallwood is a better bet to keep his spot than Corey Clement, making him a hold in most formats.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed eight times for 24 yards and caught 2-of-3 targets for 42 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Smallwood got most of his snaps in the two-minute offense. He’s been passed on the depth chart by Josh Adams. Smallwood is droppable in standard leagues.
report: Wendell Smallwood had two carries for four yards in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is also still sidelined.  Both players were inactive last week against the Titans.  The Eagles rolled with Jay Ajayi, Wendell Smallwood, and Josh Adams in the backfield.  Clement is day to day.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Clement is hurdling toward his second-straight inactive. Wendell Smallwood did not do enough behind Jay Ajayi in Week 4 to earn Week 5 FLEX consideration.
report: Corey Clement (quad) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Clement didn't practice all week and is likely headed for another absence. Assuming that's the case, Wendell Smallwood would fill the void behind starter Jay Ajayi.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is questionable for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Clement did not practice all week but will be up as Jay Ajayi's change-of-pace. Even in what should be a high-scoring affair, Clement is not a compelling FLEX option. Inactive for the Eagles are DE Derek Barnett, RB Darren Sproles, DT Haloti Ngata, OT Jordan Mailata, OL OL Matt Pryor, OG Chance Warmack and QB Nate Sudfeld.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is active for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Playing through a quad injury, Clement was announced as "active," but it was evidently only on an emergency basis. Clement will enter Thursday night's game against the Giants having not touched the ball since Week 3. Wendell Smallwood has been holding down the fort in his absence. Clement will need Jay Ajayi to go down to become truly fantasy relevant.
report: Corey Clement played zero snaps in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: The Eagles play the Giants on Thursday night, and Philly just lost Jay Ajayi to a season-ending ACL tear, putting Clement and Wendell Smallwood squarely in the crosshairs of fantasy owners.  Clement should be back this week.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is practicing in full for Week 6.

impact: It is not a surprise considering he was listed as a full participant on Monday. He will likely be listed the same on Tuesday's report and be ready to face the Giants on Thursday. He will be a FLEX play in that matchup.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is participating in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Clement has missed the past two games but is coming back at the right time with the Eagles down another body after losing Jay Ajayi to a torn ACL.  The Eagles figure to have a split committee backfield approach between Clement and Wendell Smallwood, but Clement is our favorite and worth a play as an RB2.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Corey Clement (quad) is "100 percent, good to go" for Thursday night's Week 6 game against the Giants.

impact: Rosenblatt notes the Eagles have already played a game without Jay Ajayi this season, and Clement played 55 percent of the snaps while finishing with 16 carries. Wendell Smallwood played just 35 percent of the snaps on his way to 10 carries, but he did score a touchdown. Clement has been sidelined since that game, so it is possible Smallwood gets a little more work Thursday night. Even so, Clement is the better fantasy bet. Both are worth a look as an RB3/FLEX.
report: NJ Advance Media's Zack Rosenblatt expects Corey Clement to lead the Eagles' backfield Thursday night against the Giants.

impact: Coming off the bench behind Wendell Smallwood, Clement got out-touched and out-snapped but out-gained Smallwood 69-51. Clement continued to look like the better player. The Eagles' backfield usage might have better reflected that had Clement's health been more certain. Now having avoided setbacks with his troublesome quad issue, Clement has 10 days to heal up for the Eagles' Week 7 matchup with the Panthers. He will be the preferred fantasy play over Smallwood.
report: Corey Clement rushed 11 times for 43 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants, adding three receptions for 26 additional yards.
