impact: He finished second on the team in touches behind Wendell Smallwood’s 11, and Josh Adams mixed in for 4. Clement’s on-field play has been wildly inconsistent this year, and his usage isn’t much more bankable in a three-man backfield that could soon add Darren Sproles (hamstring) to the mix. Against the Jaguars in Week 8, Clement will be a low-end flex option.
report: Corey Clement rushed eight times for six yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for 16 yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Clement struggled to get anything going last week, and he did not do any better in this game. He had a total of three yards on four touches in the first half, and he was limited to one carry in the second half. With Josh Adams looking good and taking on a bigger role, it would not be surprising to see Clement fall out of the rotation. He is not a must-hold in redraft formats.
report: Corey Clement rushed four times for six yards and caught one pass for negative-one yard in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars.

impact: His only catch went for negative yards. It’s another nondescript game from Clement, who hasn’t had more than 30 total yards the last three weeks. Even with Darren Sproles not close to returning, Clement is just a low-volume third-down back.
report: Corey Clement rushed five times for 13 yards in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Clement was the change-of-pace to Josh Adams, who had 22 carries and dropped his lone target.  This was one of Clement's better games of the season.  He's settled in behind Adams and doesn't have standalone fantasy value.
report: Corey Clement rushed five times for 45 yards and caught both of his targets for 31 yards in the Eagles' Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: He now has 150 yards on 15 touches the last two weeks, solidifying himself as the pass-game complement to Josh Adams, who again went catch-less.  Darren Sproles returned to handle just four carries, turning them into 22 yards and a touchdown, but wasn't targeted in the pass game.  Clement is not a fantasy option but offers real-life value, though he's had a down year.
report: Corey Clement rushed five times for 27 yards and caught all three of his targets for 47 yards in the Eagles' Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: Juszczyk was on the field for 68 of San Francisco's 98 offensive snaps. He showed well as a receiver, nabbing three catches for a team-leading 56 yards in the first half. This game was sort of a perfect storm for Juszczyk with Matt Breida (ankle) injured and the Niners playing from behind. Fullbacks have grown almost extinct in today's NFL but Juszczyk continues to play a prominent role both as a blocker and a pass-catcher. In fact, he may be the best receiving back the Niners have at the moment.
report: Kyle Juszczyk nabbed six catches for 75 yards on seven targets while adding one rush for 12 yards Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: He didn't carry the ball on the ground and lost a fumble at the end of a 21-yard catch.  Juszczyk doesn't have any business being owned in fantasy.
report: Kyle Juszczyk caught all three of his targets for 30 yards in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers.

impact: There was speculation Fournette may be headed to IR after Jacksonville traded for Carlos Hyde. The Jaguars view Hyde as insurance in case Fournette suffers another setback, but this doesn't change his timetable. Fournette looks on track for a Week 10 return.
report: ESPN Radio's Hays Carlyon expects Leonard Fournette (hamstring) to return after Jacksonville's Week 9 bye.

impact: Fournette's return date is still up in the air, though we know for sure that he won't be available Sunday when the Jags host Houston or next week when Jacksonville travels to London for a game against the Eagles. After that, the Jaguars will have a bye in Week 9. Jacksonville's recent trade for Carlos Hyde is an ominous sign for Fournette's recovery, though there's still optimism he'll be back at some point this season. The 2017 first-rounder hasn't played a full game yet this year.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirms Leonard Fournette (hamstring) will sit out through the Jaguars' bye week.

impact: Fournette has played just 45 snaps this season because of a lingering hamstring injury, but there is some hope he will return following the bye week. Newly acquired Carlos Hyde and T.J. Yeldon will handle the backfield work with Fournette sidelined. Jacksonville also ruled out CB A.J. Bouye (calf), TE James O'Shaughnessy (hip), CB Tyler Patmon (neck), CB D.J. Hayden (toe), DT Eli Ankou, and DE Dawuane Smoot.
report: Jaguars declared Leonard Fournette (hamstring) inactive for Week 8 against the Eagles.

impact: That's after Jacksonville's bye in Week 9. According to Schefter, the Jaguars envision Fournette and newly acquired Carlos Hyde both getting work, suggesting Fournette will be eased in following a four-game absence. In that scenario, T.J. Yeldon would be downgraded to a change-of-pace/pass-catching role. Fournette has already suffered multiple setbacks in his recovery from a nagging hamstring injury, so despite the team's optimism, his availability can't be taken for granted.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is expected to return against the Colts in Week 10.

impact: Week 10 has been the target for Fournette's return, and this practice puts him on track to make that happen barring any setbacks. Yet to finish a game this season, Fournette will carry some injury risk even if he is active, but he also has a good matchup against the Colts. He will be a risk-reward RB1.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) participated in individual drills during Monday's practice.

impact: This was expected after Fournette participated in individual drills Monday. Fournette has been targeting a Week 10 return and looks on track to play barring setbacks. He's likely to be eased in coming off a four-game absence, with Carlos Hyde splitting early-down work. Fournette will be the touch favorite if he suits up.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) returned to practice Wednesday.

impact: It puts Fournette on track to return from a four-game absence. It's unclear if he'll be eased in after missing so much time or if the plan is for Fournette to go full throttle in his first game back. The risk of a setback also exists, though Fournette is still worth firing up as a starter in all fantasy formats. Carlos Hyde and T.J. Yeldon will lose most of their fantasy significance upon his return.
report: Updating an earlier report, Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 10 against the Colts.

impact: Fournette practiced in full all week, so it is not a surprise he avoided any injury designation. A setback cannot be ruled out given what has happened to this point in the season, but Fournette appears to be back at full health. He will be an upside RB2 in a good matchup against the Colts.
report: Leonard Fournette was removed from the final injury report for Week 10.

impact: Fournette will return from a four-game absence Sunday at Indianapolis and it doesn't sound like he'll have any limitations. The second-year bull-dozer practiced in full all week coming off the Jaguars' bye. With Fournette back to assume his usual workhorse responsibilities, T.J. Yeldon and Carlos Hyde won't be of much use to fantasy owners.
report: According NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is expected to see a "full workload" in Sunday's Week 10 game against the Colts.

impact: Jacksonville set out with a clear plan at the start of the game, and Fournette was the centerpiece. He had six carries in the first quarter, and Jacksonville kept feeding him even after the Colts jumped out to an early lead. He repaid the faith with a one-yard touchdown in the second quarter which he helped set up with a 31-yard gain on a screen. He kept the good times rolling on the opening drive of the second half which he capped with a one-yard touchdown catch, and he helped keep the offense moving with four catches after the break. Most importantly, he emerged from a game healthy for the first time this season. He faces a much tougher test next week against the Steelers, but he will be a back-end RB1 in that matchup.
report: Leonard Fournette rushed 24 times for 53 yards and a touchdown and hauled in all five of his targets for 56 yards and another score in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Fournette started off hot, rushing 14 times for 74 yards in the first half, but then was bottled up on the ground after the break. He still found a way to maximize his touches in the second half, adding receptions of 26 and 21 yards while finding the end zone on a leaping 2-yard touchdown run that put the Jaguars ahead 16 points. Fournette now has 29 and 30 touches in his two games since returning from injury, securing his role as a bellcow fantasy option. The Jaguars head to Buffalo in Week 12.
report: Leonard Fournette rushed 28 times for 95 yards and a touchdown while catching two passes for 46 yards in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Donte Moncrief caught a 29-yard pass to the one-yard line.  Bills CB Levi Wallace wouldn't let go of the ball, and several players on both sides jumped in and began to fight.  In addition to Fournette, Bills DE Shaq Lawson got kicked out of the game.  Fournette may be subject to further discipline in Week 13.  Fournette finished Week 12 with 108 total yards and two rushing TDs.
report: Leonard Fournette was ejected in the third quarter of Sunday's Week 12 game against the Bills for throwing punches.

impact: Fournette was initially expected to avoid a ban, but the league is cracking down on him after he came off the sideline to attack Shaq Lawson, throwing punches.  Fournette and Lawson continued to fight into the tunnel following their ejections.  Fournette will almost certainly appeal this, but for now he's going to miss the home game against the Colts.  In his absence, Carlos Hyde and T.J. Yeldon would handle backfield duties.  Yeldon is the preferred play in all formats.
report: NFL suspended RB Leonard Fournette one game for violating the league's unsportsmanlike conduct and unnecessary roughness policy.

impact: Fournette was suspended for his role in an altercation with Bills DE Shaq Lawson last Sunday, coming off the bench and raining haymakers down on Lawson in a fight.  The NFL can't allow that.  In his absence, the Jaguars will roll with a Carlos Hyde-T.J. Yeldon duo.  Yeldon is the better fantasy play.
report: Leonard Fournette's appeal of his one-game suspension was denied, and he's out for Week 13 against the Colts.

impact: They cut undrafted rookie DB Dee Delaney to make room.  Fournette was banned from Week 13 for fighting the Bills in Week 12.  Fournette will be all systems go as a workhorse RB1 entering Thursday night's date with Tennessee.
report: Jaguars reinstated RB Leonard Fournette from suspension.

impact: None of his catches resulted in a touchdown, of course. It was the third time this season that Williams has seen just three targets, which now puts him at just 19 on the year. If searching for positives, it was his first 50-plus yard outing of the year and he did manage to finish second on the team in receiving yards. At this point, The Gazelle should only be owned in deeper leagues.
report: Tyrell Williams hauled in all three of his targets for 66 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 victory over the Raiders.

impact: Williams did all of his damage in the first half. His day got started on a two-play, 85-yard drive in which he caught a 40-yard pass over the top of the defense and then a 45-yard touchdown pass in which he took the ball from Damarious Randall on a simultaneous reception in the end zone. Williams then added a 29-yard touchdown strike with 51 seconds remaining in the first half to put the Chargers ahead 21-6 at the half. Williams entered Sunday with 192 yards and one touchdown, so he won't be an option next week when the Chargers head to London to face the Titans.
report: Tyrell Williams caught 3-of-4 targets for 118 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Williams roasted Logan Ryan for a 75-yard touchdown on the Chargers’ first play. He had a quiet second half with the Chargers losing the time-of-possesion battle. Williams is a one-trick deep threat, but he's had a high floor this season, with at least 40 yards or a touchdown in 6-of-7 games. Williams gets a matchup with Seattle in Week 9.
report: Tyrell Williams caught four passes for 118 yards and a touchdown in Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Williams' 12-yard score came as the first quarter expired. Unfortunately, it was not the harbinger of a big day. Williams' 23 yards were his fewest since Week 3. Williams offers plenty of big-play appeal, but it can be all he offers. He will have a chance to tap into it against the historically-bad Raiders in Week 10.
report: Tyrell Williams caught 2-of-3 targets for 23 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 9 win over the Seahawks.

impact: It was not a big game for Williams, but his usage was promising on Sunday. The six targets are actually the most he has seen this season, and he has clearly vanquished Mike Williams in the battle for the No. 2 receiver job. He will face a tougher test next week in Denver, but Williams will remain the FLEX conversation.
report: Tyrell Williams hauled in 4-of-6 targets for 46 yards in the Chargers' Week 10 win over the Raiders.

impact: The six targets matched a season-high for Williams, though obviously he didn't take advantage of his increased workload. Tyrell came down with a 19-yard catch off play-action to begin the second half, but was leveled by Darian Stewart on the play. Williams went to the sideline after that, but would eventually return. He was the intended receiver on the first of Philip Rivers' two interceptions. The 26-year-old enjoyed back-to-back 100-yard games earlier this year, but has slumped recently, averaging just 30.3 yards over his last three outings. We'll see how The Gazelle fares next week when the Chargers host Arizona.
report: Tyrell Williams was held to two catches for 22 yards on six targets Sunday in the Chargers’ Week 11 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Williams picked up the injury in Sunday's loss to Denver, but was able to play through it. We're guessing Williams will be ready for Week 12, but if he can't suit up against the Cardinals, it would open up targets for second-year deep threat Mike Williams.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: He was absent at the start of the week but was upgraded to limited participation at Thursday's practice and should be ready for Sunday's 4:05 PM ET start. Williams could see a bit of Patrick Peterson in Week 12, which is obviously a downgrade for his fantasy prospects.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) is questionable for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Williams will work out pregame, but he's trending toward sitting out. The Chargers don't want to play Williams unless he's fully healthy in a matchup they can win without him. Mike Williams will have a larger target share if Williams sits.
report: Tyrell Williams (questionable, quad) is a game-time decision for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Williams was a game-time decision. He showed enough in pre-game warmups to get cleared but clearly isn't fully healthy. Williams should be avoided against the Cardinals underrated secondary.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) is active for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Williams wasn't targeted over his nine snaps in Week 12. He's clearly not 100 percent, though we're guessing he'll be out there Sunday night in Pittsburgh. Fantasy owners should be looking elsewhere for wide receiver help.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Williams gutted out his quad injury in Week 12 and should do so again against the Steelers. The big-play dependent is a risk/reward WR4 in fantasy.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: He barely played against the Cardinals last week, seeing the field on just nine offensive snaps. Williams isn't close to 100 percent, but it looks like he'll continue to grind it out. He's an easy fade against the Steelers.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) is questionable for Week 13 against the Steelers.

impact: Williams was also active last week but played just nine snaps. He shouldn't be in fantasy lineups. The Chargers inactives are RB Melvin Gordon, CB Jeff Richards, DE Chris Landrum, C Cole Toner, OT Joe Barksdale, OG Forrest Lamp and NT Brandon Mebane.
report: Tyrell Williams (quad) is active for Week 13 against the Steelers.

impact: He was targeted twice. Williams remained a non-factor after being limited to just nine snaps last week. Even with a matchup against the Bengals, Williams can't be trusted in the fantasy playoffs at less than 100 percent.
report: Tyrell Williams caught one pass for 14 yards in Week 13 against the Steelers.

impact: It looks like Breida will give it a go after closing out the week with a full practice on Friday, though he'll likely be on a snap count. He'll form a committee role along with Raheem Mostert and veteran plodder Alfred Morris. Even in a favorable matchup, Breida's workload concerns make him a risky fantasy bet this week.
report: According to ESPN's Adam Schefter, Matt Breida (questionable, ankle) is expected to play but will likely see limited snaps in Week 8 against the Cardinals.

impact: Breida will reportedly play "limited" snaps, though there's been no indication as to how many that'll be. He'll still start and play ahead of Raheem Mostert and Alfred Morris among the Niners' three-headed committee. Breida's workload concerns make him an extremely dicey RB3 in Week 8.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) is active in Week 8 against the Cardinals.

impact: Breida played through his questionable tag and was reportedly "limited" in this one, then went and out-touched Alfred Morris, Raheem Mostert, and Kyle Juszczyk by a combined 16-10. Oddly enough, none of the lot were involved in the Niners' passing game. Breida deserves credit for toughing through these last few weeks, but he still averaged only 2.6 YPC Sunday due in part to his ailing ankle. Despite leading the backfield in carries, Breida's status should be monitored given the Niners' quick turnaround in Oakland on Thursday.
report: Matt Breida rushed a team-high 16 times for 42 yards in the Niners' Week 8 heartbreaking loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Continuing to battle through an ankle sprain, Breida rushed 16 times for 42 yards last week against the Cardinals and appears ready to go back at it on a short week Thursday against the Raiders.  At less than 100 percent and without his speed and agility, Breida is more of an RB3 rather than RB2.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) was limited in Tuesday's practice.

impact: The smart thing would probably be for Breida to sit this one out, but we know he's not going to do that. Breida has struggled while playing at much less than 100 percent the past several weeks, but until the Niners tell him not to, he'll keep fighting through the pain. Even against one of the league's worst defenses, he'll be tough to trust.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) is questionable for Week 9 against the Raiders.

impact: Quite literally nothing could keep Breida out of a game. The Raiders have one of the league's softest run defenses, but the 49ers' entire offense could go off the rails if second-year UDFA Nick Mullens is forced to start in C.J. Beathard's (wrist) place. Breida is on the RB2/3 borderline.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports both Matt Breida (ankle) and Raheem Mostert (ankle) are expected to be active for Thursday's game against the Raiders.

impact: Raheem Mostert (ankle) is also suiting up, but C.J. Beathard is not. The 49ers will trot out UDFA Nick Mullens, who has not thrown a pass in the NFL before, as the starting quarterback, so expectations for the San Francisco offense need to be limited. Breida is on the RB2/3 borderline even with a good matchup tonight.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) is officially active for the 49ers Week 9 game against the Raiders.

impact: Breida was able to play through his nagging ankle injury, but the 49ers pulled him in the second half with the 49ers out to a huge lead. Breida's outlook is slightly more promising with Raheem Mostert likely out for the season with a broken arm, but even if he sees a few more touches per game with Mostert out, Breida is still a low floor RB2/3 for the 49ers' Week 10 game against the Giants. Breida hasn't eclipsed 65 rushing yards in six straight games.
report: Matt Breida rushed for 41 yards on 12 carries and caught his lone target for three yards in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: The 20 touches marked a new season-high for Breida.  After having 11 days to rest his ailing ankle between games, this was as healthy as Breida has looked since Week 3 when he suffered a knee injury only to hurt his ankle in Week 5.  Breida dominated the backfield work with Raheem Mostert (arm, I.R.) out of the picture, ceding nine ineffective carries to Alfred Morris.  Breida was limping at times in this one but showed way more burst than we've seen from him over the last month or so.  He'll now get the Niners' bye to get fully healthy before hosting the Bucs in Week 12.
report: Matt Breida rushed 17 times for 101 yards and one touchdown and caught 3-of-4 targets for 31 yards and a second touchdown in the 49ers' 27-23, Week 10 loss to the Giants on Monday night.

impact: Breida opened the contest with a 33-yard burst and ripped off chunk-yardage gains all day long, but the 49ers fell behind and never caught up as Nick Mullens struggled, throwing two picks for the second straight start.  The good news is Breida's health has largely returned after he battled myriad early-season injuries.  Breida will remain a quality RB2 play in Week 13 at Seattle.
report: Matt Breida rushed 14 times for 106 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 34 yards in the 49ers' Week 12 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: If Breida's ankle is bothering him, it sure didn't show Sunday against Tampa Bay as the second-year ball-carrier topped 100 yards rushing for the second straight game. As long as he stays healthy, Breida should become the Niners' first 1,000-yard rusher since Frank Gore in 2014. Fantasy owners can treat him as an RB2 against the Seahawks in Week 13.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Breida will be fine for Sunday's game against the Seahawks. Essentially the only functional member of the 49ers' offense right now, Breida is a high-end RB2 for Week 13.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Breida was upgraded to a full practice Friday after opening the week limited. He's in line for a heavy workload with the 49ers missing top wideouts Pierre Garcon and Marquise Goodwin. Breida is a locked-in RB2.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) was taken off the Week 13 injury report.

impact: It explains why Jeff Wilson worked as the lead back most of the game against the Seahawks. Breida was forced into action when Wilson briefly left for the locker room, but he aggravated the ankle again at the end of a long catch and sat out the rest of the way. Breida finished the game with 57 yards on eight touches. His status moving forward is uncertain. Wilson should be added in all leagues.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Matt Breida aggravated his ankle injury during pregame warmups Sunday.

impact: Breida aggravated his preexisting ankle injury in pregame warmups ahead of Sunday's game in Seattle and touched the ball just eight times while Jeff Wilson worked as the lead back.  Breida has been playing hurt much of the year, but it finally caught up to him.  Wilson will be an RB3/FLEX play.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) has been ruled out for Week 14 against the Broncos.

impact: Morris only had four yards on three carries in the first half as the 49ers' offense was sabotaged by penalties, but he helped jump-start things in the second half with steady, consistent gains. He also confirmed his goal-line status with a three-yard score in the third quarter. Unfortunately, touchdowns might be more difficult to come by moving forward with Jimmy Garoppolo dealing with a potential ACL tear.
report: Alfred Morris rushed 14 times for 67 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Morris' addition comes as Matt Breida (knee) was upgraded to "full." We, obviously, don't like mid-week additions, but it's probably just maintenance for the veteran Morris. He will be in the RB3/FLEX mix if he's active against the Chargers.
report: Alfred Morris was added to the 49ers' injury report on Thursday, getting in a limited session with a knee issue.

impact: Because he was added to the injury report mid-week, Morris would seem to be in greater danger of missing Week 4 than teammate Matt Breida (knee), who was upgraded to full practice on Thursday. However, as of now, both are expected to be available for Sunday's game in Los Angeles. Morris and Breida have been used in roughly equal capacity this year, though obviously Breida has been more productive than Alf. The 29-year-old will be a low-end flex if he suits up.
report: Alfred Morris (knee) is questionable for Week 4 against the Chargers.

impact: Matt Breida (knee) is also expected to play. Added the injury report mid-week, there was some real concern Morris would sit out. He will apparently give it a go, however. A somewhat touchdown-reliant fantasy asset in an offense likely to scuffle without Jimmy Garoppolo, Morris is shaping up as a low-end FLEX option.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Alfred Morris (knee) is expected to play Week 4 against the Chargers.

impact: Morris was added to the injury report mid-week, but he's going to play through his knee injury. Morris will be a low-end FLEX option with C.J. Beathard starting at quarterback and Matt Breida (knee) active as well.
report: Alfred Morris (knee) is officially active for Week 4's game against the Chargers.

impact: Even though it didn't show up in the stat sheet, Morris was subbed in for Matt Breida on the goal line early in the game, but he failed to convert it for a touchdown. The Butler will need to convert his goal line opportunities if he's to have any fantasy value moving forward. Those opportunities could be few and far between with C.J. Beathard as the quarterback. Morris' fantasy owners are only hoping for a touchdown against the Cardinals next week.
report: Alfred Morris rushed four times for 14 scoreless yards in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Morris came out of Week 4 without a setback. What was once a 50/50 backfield split is now moving more toward Matt Breida, who has vastly outplayed Morris through the first four weeks. At this point, Alf would probably need Breida to get hurt to have any real fantasy significance and even then, he'd likely lose passing-down work to fullback Kyle Juszczyk.
report: Alfred Morris (knee) is practicing in full for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: Morris took over as the lead ball-carrier after Matt Breida left with a sprained ankle. Alf didn't do anything particularly notable, though the five targets were surprising as the 29-year-old has never been much of a pass-catcher. Breida's ankle injury doesn't appear serious, though it could keep him from suiting up next week at Green Bay. Morris would be a volume-based RB2 if Breida can't get the green light.
report: Alfred Morris went for 61 yards on 18 carries while also securing three-of-five targets for 30 yards Sunday in the 49ers’ Week 5 loss to Arizona.

impact: Morris played one offensive snap.  When he did touch the ball, Morris had an eight-yard run called back on a hold.  He remained stationed on the sideline as the Niners went with a Matt Breida-Raheem Mostert tandem in the backfield.  And those two shredded the Green Bay defense, combining for 148 yards and a score on 26 carries.  Mostert led the way with 87 yards on 12 carries (7.25 YPC) and likely stole Morris' job in doing so.  The offense was just so much more explosive with speed guys Breida and Mostert rather than slug Morris slowing the unit down with his three yards and a cloud of dust.  Morris can be dropped in all formats.
report: Alfred Morris didn't touch the ball in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers on Monday night.

impact: Even with Raheem Mostert once again stacking big gains, Morris led the team with nine carries as Matt Breida struggled with his ankle injury. Mostert would seem to have earned an even bigger role moving forward, especially if Breida is forced to miss time, but it does not seem like Morris is going away. Even so, he is not a fantasy option right now.
report: Alfred Morris rushed nine times for 25 yards in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: For the first time since Week 6, Morris worked ahead of supposed backup Raheem Mostert, out-carrying the latter 6-2. Mostert's 9.0 YPC (albeit on only two touches) still led San Francisco's backfield. There's clearly no projecting who works behind Matt Breida (16/42) as the team's No. 2 when healthy. Mostert should remain stashed for his athleticism and pending opportunity, but can't be started at this time. Morris can still be cut bait from given his nonexistent run in the Niners' passing game.
report: Alfred Morris rushed six times for 28 yards in the Niners' Week 8 nail-biting loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Morris didn't receive a carry until the second half, but he will get more run moving forward with Raheem Mostert likely out for the season with a fractured arm. The 49ers backfield still belongs to Matt Breida, who had a team-high 12 carries tonight, but Morris is a worthwhile waiver wire add with Breida dealing with a multitude of injuries.
report: Alfred Morris rushed seven times for 13 yards in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: The nine totes matched Morris' most since Week 5.  He'd been getting phased out of the offense of late but was back part of it after Raheem Mostert broke his arm in Week 9.  Morris did nothing with his carries and is irrelevant in fantasy.
report: Alfred Morris rushed nine times for 19 yards in the 49ers' Week 10 loss to the Giants.

impact: Morris' absence solidifies Matt Breida with a 20-touches projection.  With Garcon and Goodwin sidelined, the 49ers will look at Kendrick Bourne, Dante Pettis, Richie James, and Trent Taylor as their top-four wideout options.
report: 49ers declared RB Alfred Morris, WR Marquise Goodwin, WR Pierre Garcon, OL Shon Coleman, DL D.J. Jones, OG Josh Garnett, and LB Reuben Foster inactive for Week 12 against the Bucs.

impact: It is the second week in a row he is a healthy scratch. Jeff Wilson should once again backup Matt Breida. San Francisco also ruled out Marquise Goodwin (personal), Pierre Garcon (knee), DB D.J. Reed (chest), OG Josh Garnett (thumb), OL Shon Coleman, and DL D.J. Jones.
report: 49ers declared Alfred Morris inactive for Week 13 against the Seahawks.

impact: Bortles had a first half to forget. Despite some good throws down the field including a 36-yard pass to D.J. Chark, the early part of his game was marred by turnovers. He lost a fumble the play after the defense picked off Patrick Mahomes, had a horrific pick-six on an attempted screen pass the next drive, and threw an end-zone interception off his lineman's helmet. He made several great throws on a touchdown drive in the third quarter, but he came back with a bad interception overthrown to a double-covered tight end on the next drive. He added another meaningless interception at the end of the game. On the bright side, he threw for 430 yards and added a long rushing score deep in garbage time to pad his fantasy stats. Always a threat for a big game when Leonard Fournette is sidelined, Bortles will be on the streaming map next week in Dallas.
report: Blake Bortles completed 33-of-61 passes for 430 yards, a touchdown, and four interceptions in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs, adding four carries for 34 yards and a touchdown.

impact: He took three sacks for a loss of 10 yards. Bortles threw for just 35 yards in the first half, which may explain why the Jags went into halftime with a 24-point deficit. Even with the benefit of garbage time, Bortles never got anything going, struggling all day against an underrated Cowboys defense. His lone touchdown came on a 34-yard bomb to Dede Westbrook early in the third quarter. Bortles has thrown five interceptions over his last two outings with both resulting in losses. He'll try to do better next time out against Houston.
report: Blake Bortles completed 15-of-26 passes for 149 yards with one touchdown and one interception while adding 22 yards on four carries Sunday in the Jaguars’ Week 6 loss to Dallas.

impact: The Jaguars made a splash by acquiring Carlos Hyde from Cleveland on Friday but it doesn't sound like they're interested in bringing in a quarterback to compete with Blake Bortles. Nick Foles, Eli Manning and Tyrod Taylor have all been linked to Jacksonville at different points in time, though the Jaguars have yet to pursue any of those options. Bortles has fallen on hard times recently, throwing five interceptions with  just two touchdowns over his last two outings.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Jaguars have no plans to acquire a quarterback at next week's trade deadline.

impact: Bortles failed to move the ball at all, completing just 6-of-12 passes for 61 yards with two lost fumbles that directly led to Texans touchdowns.  Put simply, it was time.  Bortles has been as erratic as ever this season, showing no signs of progression, taking too many sacks, and turning the ball over far too often.  Kessler is a weak-armed game manager, but he is a better option under center for the Jaguars at this point.
report: Losing 20-0, the Jaguars benched Blake Bortles for Cody Kessler in the second half of Sunday's Week 7 game against the Texans.

impact: This should mean the Jags are making the switch to Cody Kessler, as you do not draw out the process if you're sticking with the usual starter. It's certainly time. The Blake Bortles era has run its course. Bortles has been worse than ever this year, giving the Jags little shot on offense.
report: Jaguars coach Doug Marrone said he has decided on his Week 8 quarterback but is not ready to make a public announcement.

impact: The Jags benched Bortles early in the third quarter of Sunday's loss to Houston after he lost two fumbles and failed to move the offense.  Cody Kessler didn't separate himself, however, leading just one second-half touchdown drive and averaging 5.2 yards per attempt.  The Jags face the Eagles this week in London.  Bortles will remain at risk of performance-related, in-game benchings.
report: Coach Doug Marrone announced Monday the Jaguars will turn back to Blake Bortles as their starting quarterback.

impact: A week after getting benched, Bortles appeared hesitant to let the ball go early. At one point in the second quarter, he had more carries (4) than passing attempts (3), and he threw just seven passes total in the first half. The offense opened up after the break, and Bortles was able to move the football. He completed seven of nine passes on a 75-yard touchdown drive in the third quarter including a great touch throw to Dede Westbrook for the touchdown, and he led a couple field goal drives the next two times the Jags had the ball. A couple of better throws could have earned him a touchdown on both of those possessions, however, and he was not able to lead a comeback drive despite picking up one fourth down with his legs. Bortles played well enough to keep the starting job against the Colts coming out of the bye, especially since he did not commit any turnovers, but he will remain on a short leash.
report: Blake Bortles completed 24-of-41 attempts for 286 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles in London, adding 43 yards on the ground.

impact: The Jaguars ultimately didn't make a quarterback move, but Graziano mentions teams -- not specifically the Jaguars -- were inquiring about quarterbacks Ryan Fitzpatrick, Josh McCown, Tyrod Taylor, and Nick Foles. All four of those quarterbacks weren't moved in the end, and Jacksonville remains hopeful that Bortles, who was benched in Week 7, will have more success when Leonard Fournette (hamstring) returns after the Jaguars' Week 9 bye.
report: According to ESPN's Dan Graziano, the Jaguars "poked around" for a quarterback before Tuesday's NFL trade deadline.

impact: He has the bye to get right, whatever "right" is in Bortles' world.  As insurance, the Jaguars signed Landry Jones on Wednesday.  He'll likely handle some practice reps next week, so Cody Kessler doesn't have to do it all.
report: Blake Bortles has an injury to his left (non-throwing) shoulder but is expected to be fine for Week 10 against the Colts.

impact: Bortles has a non-throwing shoulder injury, but had the bye week to rest up. He's not in danger of missing Sunday's game with the Colts.
report: Blake Bortles (shoulder) is practicing Wednesday.

impact: Bortles’ day started on a high note. He threw a great pass to Donte Moncrief on their second drive of the game, and the former Colt broke a couple tackles on his way to an 80-yard score. He was limited to handoffs most of the rest of the first half, but he got things going a bit on a two-minute drive for a field goal just before the half. He kept things going after the break, throwing for 59 yards and a score on the opening drive and keeping the offense moving despite Jacksonville’s near insistence on putting him in third-and-long situations. He drove the offense down the field for what at worst should have been a game-tying field goal, but a Rashad Greene fumble ended the game. Bortles played well enough for the Jags to win this game, but he will have a tougher time next week against the Steelers.
report: Blake Bortles completed 26-of-38 passes for 320 yards and two touchdowns in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Bortles added 17 yards rushing on the day, but was also sacked six times. The 18 pass attempts and 104 passing yards were season-lows for Bortles in a complete game this season as the Jaguars largely tried to keep the ball with their run game on the afternoon. That game plan could be something in play next week as Bortles and the Jaguars head to Buffalo in Week 12. Bortles will only be a lower-end QB2 option in that game.
report: Blake Bortles completed 10-of-18 passes for 104 yards with no touchdowns or interceptions in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: When asked if Bortles was losing confidence, coach Doug Marrone said you would have to ask Bortles. Scintillating. Marrone has clearly lost all confidence in his quarterback. The Jaguars only let him attempt 18 passes in Sunday's meltdown loss to the Steelers. Already benched once this season, Bortles will surely be benched twice, though the Jags' campaign is in the gutter, perhaps lessening the urgency. It appears the Jags will finally move in a different direction this offseason.
report: The Jaguars will not bench Blake Bortles for Week 12.

impact: He rushed six times for 28 yards.  The Jags' passing game was a nightmare with Bortles as the biggest culprit to the extent we were slightly surprised he didn't get benched for Cody Kessler.  Jacksonville has now lost seven straight games.  Even against the Colts, Bortles will remain a high-risk QB2 in Week 13 at risk of in-game benchings should he continue to give the other team the ball.
report: Blake Bortles completed 12-of-23 passes for 127 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the Jaguars' Week 12 loss to Buffalo.

impact: Bortles' play had left the Jags with little choice. Running a risk-averse offense the past two weeks, Bortles was allowed to convert just 22 passes. Even with the emphasis on avoiding mistakes, he still tossed two interceptions in Sunday's narrow loss to the Bills. Aside from a fluky 35-touchdown campaign in 2015, Bortles has never shown any signs of progress. His throwing motion is the worst in the NFL. Bortles' Mark Sanchez-esque extension is looking like a major blunder for GM Dave Caldwell. Bortles is due a $1 million roster bonus in March, and $6.5 million of his $14 million 2019 salary is guaranteed. Cody Kessler will start the final five games of 2018 before the Jags begin the search for a franchise quarterback in the offseason.
report: The Jaguars have benched QB Blake Bortles.

impact: Nearly all of Williams' production came with the Chargers in fourth quarter comeback mode. That was also after Tyrell Williams and Travis Benjamin burned the team with horrible drops. If nothing else, the Chargers are going to need Williams in the red zone. Today did nothing to change his status as an upside WR5 you can start in a pinch. Hopefully that pinch comes later in the season.
report: Mike Williams caught 5-of-6 targets for 81 yards in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: He finished with fewer snaps than both Travis Benjamin (47) and Tyrell Williams (62). On the bright side, he did not drop clear touchdowns like each of them did, and he was much more efficient with his work, turning six targets into five catches for 81 yards. It would not be surprising if he saw more work next week in Buffalo. He remains a stash in redraft leagues.
report: Mike Williams played 44-of-82 (54 percent) snaps Week 1 against the Chiefs.

impact: Williams stayed involved on offense after playing 54 percent of snaps in the season opener. His touchdown came on an opening drive red-zone strike from Philip Rivers, but he faded over the second half. With Travis Benjamin dealing with a foot injury, Williams should continue to see his role grow.
report: Mike Williams caught two passes for 27 yards and a touchdown Week 2 against Buffalo.

impact: Williams took advantage of Travis Benjamin's absence by securing two touchdown grabs. The first score came on a beautiful 42-yard diving catch in the end zone where he showed why the Chargers selected him with the No. 7 overall pick in 2017. Williams appears to be over his back issues that plagued him all last year and his role should continue to grow. Even if Benjamin returns next week, Williams has earned WR3/4 status with his performance today.
report: Mike Williams caught 4-of-7 targets for 81 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Williams came crashing down back to earth after a career-best game last week. He tied for the sixth-most targets on the team even with Travis Benjamin (foot) exiting the game early in the first quarter. The No. 7 overall pick will have his ups-and-downs, but the talent is there if he can put it all together. Williams has a golden matchup against the Raiders next week, but he is just an upside WR4 until his usage levels out.
report: Mike Williams caught 1-of-3 targets for 15 scoreless yards in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: After flourishing through the first three weeks of the season, Williams has recorded just 4-60 and no touchdowns on seven targets in his last two games. There will be better days ahead, but Philip Rivers' touchdowns tosses have seemingly been spread out this year due to the added layer of Melvin Gordon's and Austin Ekeler's usage in the passing game. Williams will remain a WR3 in Week 6 versus the Browns.
report: Mike Williams caught 3-of-4 targets for 45 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 win over the Raiders.

impact: Williams added one rush for 10 yards Philip Rivers missed Williams wide open on his first two targets and then he was hardly involved afterwards. Despite having three touchdowns on the season, Williams is a clear ancillary option in the Charger passing attack. He has totaled five catches for 64 yards over the past three weeks on 11 targets. He is a touchdown-dependent WR4 next week versus the Titans.
report: Mike Williams caught 1-of-4 targets for four yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Williams scored his touchdown on the Chargers' first drive of the second half. He had two end-zone targets, but couldn't come up with either of them. Williams briefly exited after getting shaken up late in the fourth quarter but didn't miss any time. He'll have the Chargers' Week 8 bye to get healthy.
report: Mike Williams caught a 55-yard touchdown in Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Williams' fifth score of the season was his second in as many games. He destroyed Tre Flowers on the sideline. Williams was actually quite lucky, as replay seemed to show him conclusively stepping out of bounds. For whatever reason, the call was not overturned. Although he's scored in back-to-back games, Williams has done so on just two catches. The Raiders are the softest of matchups for Week 10.
report: Mike Williams caught 1-of-3 targets for a 30-yard touchdown in the Chargers' Week 9 win over the Seahawks.

impact: He did not gain anything on one carry. Philip Rivers attempting just 25 passes did not help, but Williams made almost no impact in this game. He has now seen four or fewer targets in six straight contests, and he has caught one or fewer passes in five of those. He is not worth rostering in redraft formats.
report: Mike Williams was not targeted in the Chargers' Week 10 win over the Raiders.

impact: The WR5 will likely play through it, but it is something to monitor if you've been forced to use Williams during this week's six-team bye week.
report: Mike Williams (groin) was added to the Chargers' injury report on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Williams was downgraded to limited participation at Thursday's practice but obviously his groin injury wasn't enough to keep him out this week. The 2017 first-rounder has only amassed 18 catches this year, though five of them have gone for touchdowns.
report: Mike Williams (groin) wasn't listed on the Chargers' final injury report for Week 11 against the Broncos.

impact: Williams' biggest contribution of the day came when he beat Tramaine Brock for a 29-yard reception on third down, setting up a first-and-goal from the four-yard line. That was about it for Williams, who continues to function as a boom-or-bust deep threat. The 2017 first-rounder has drawn a combined nine targets over his past four games. He won't be of much use to fantasy owners next week against the Steelers.
report: Mike Williams collected two catches for 56 yards on three targets Sunday in the Chargers’ Week 11 loss to Denver.

impact: Williams caught both of Philip Rivers’ first half TDs. He didn't have a huge role despite Tyrell Williams playing injured but was a factor in the red-zone. Williams could be on the WR3 radar if Tyrell has a setback this week.
report: Mike Williams caught four passes for 25 yards and two touchdowns in Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Williams was only targeted three times, but is was more than both Travis Benjamin and Tyrell Williams. He was the Chargers' second leading receiver behind Keenan Allen. Williams quietly has at least 50 yards or a touchdown in four of the last five games. He's a touchdown-dependent WR3 for Week 14.
report: Mike Williams caught three passes for 52 yards in the Chargers' Week 13 win over the Steelers.

impact: Hyde added three yards on one catch. He ran just nine times for 26 yards in the first half before having a positive drive in the 3rd quarter where he carried four times for 30 yards a touchdown. The Browns offensive line appears to be a real problem for generating consistent yardage, but Hyde handled 22-of-30 Cleveland rushing attempts to open the season. Hyde will be an RB2 option next week on the road versus the Saints.
report: Browns RB Carlos Hyde rushed 22 times for 62 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Steelers.

impact: Hyde added one catch for seven yards in the passing game. It was the second-consecutive game where Hyde struggled on the ground, but was bailed out by a 1-yard rushing score, this time following a pass interference in the end zone. Hyde has now rushed 38 times for 108 yards through two games. He will remain a fringe RB2 in Week 3 versus the Jets.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 16 times for 43 yards and touchdown in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: Aka, Hyde is going to have a police escort to the stadium. Hyde's significant other was reportedly induced last night, so it has been a long day for the Browns' feature back. As any new parent can attest, the adrenaline should be enough to get him through the game against the Jets. We are not adjusting his Week 3 rank.
report: NFL Network's Omar Ruiz reports Carlos Hyde is awaiting the birth of his child on Thursday evening but is expected to make it to FirstEnergy Stadium just before kickoff.

impact: He added two receptions for five yards. No joke: Hyde then had to rush to the hospital for the birth of his child. Best wishes to the Hyde family. As for the game, nearly all of Hyde's damage, including both his scores, came after Baker Mayfield checked in for Tyrod Taylor (concussion). The Browns' offense looked reborn with Mayfield under center, complicating the defense's thinking and freeing up running lanes. Hyde took advantage with his trademark power running. Hyde will be an upside RB2 for a tasty Week 4 matchup with the Raiders.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 23 times for 98 yards and two touchdowns in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: He has at least 17 touches in all four games and 22 or more in three of them.  Hyde's touchdown came from a yard out following Antonio Callaway's 51-yard catch.  Hyde drew just one target, however, and Nick Chubb broke off 63- and 41-yard touchdown sprints, potentially earning the explosive rookie more work.  Until the Browns make a tangible playing-time adjustment in the backfield, however, Hyde will remain a high-volume RB2 play.  Cleveland hosts Baltimore next.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 22 times for 82 yards and a touchdown in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: Hyde found little to no room against a strong Baltimore defense. He had a 17-yard run early in the game but was still held to 3.7 yards per rush on the day. Hyde has been living off of touchdown production early in the season, but still has amassed 17 or more touches in every game this season. That kind of usage is nothing to scoff at, making Hyde a volume-based RB2 in a better matchup Week 6 at home against the Chargers.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 17 times for 63 yards while catching 2-of-3 targets for 14 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Hyde has now failed to score in back-to-back games and it has exposed the low floor he carries weekly. Hyde has rushed for 4.0 yards per carry in just once game this season and has rushed 31 times for 97 yards over the past two weeks. His biggest obstacle for maintaining a fantasy floor is he has just six catches on the season and was not even targeted in the passing game on Sunday. Hyde will enter Week 7 as a touchdown-dependent RB2 option in Week 7 on the road in Tampa Bay.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 14 times for 34 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: And just like that, trade season has begun. With Leonard Fournette's recovery from a hamstring injury taking much longer than expected, the Jaguars decided they simply couldn't wait any longer. Once he learns the playbook, Hyde should fill a committee role alongside T.J. Yeldon, who has filled in throughout Fournette's absence. With Hyde out of the equation, second-round rookie Nick Chubb should immediately slot in as the Browns' lead ball-carrier, though Duke Johnson will continue to be involved on passing downs. Obviously Chubb needs to be picked up in all fantasy formats.
report: Jaguars acquired RB Carlos Hyde from the Browns in exchange for a fifth-round pick in 2019.

impact: Hyde has only two days to learn Jacksonville's playbook. His presence shouldn't impact T.J. Yeldon's role much this week even if he's active. With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) expected back after the Week 9 bye, the Jaguars are taking on a lot of salary with Hyde for what could be a one-game cameo as the team's featured back. Hyde is going to struggle for snaps when Fournette returns.
report: Carlos Hyde isn't expected to play in Week 7 against the Texans.

impact: It's been a whirlwind 48 hours for Hyde, who arrived in Jacksonville around midnight on Friday, passed his physical Saturday morning, then attended the team's walkthrough later that afternoon. Hyde reportedly got a "crash course" on the team's playbook, though obviously if he sees the field Sunday it won't be for more than a handful of snaps. T.J. Yeldon is still safe to fire up as a borderline RB1 in all formats.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Carlos Hyde has a "chance" to make his Jaguars debut against the Texans in Week 7.

impact: Despite Sunday morning reports to the contrary, Hyde was never going to suit up two days after being traded from Cleveland.  T.J. Yeldon will remain the Jaguars' bellcow back against Houston.
report: Carlos Hyde is inactive for Week 7 against the Texans.

impact: He did not catch either of his targets. Hyde operated as the lead back early in the game, but he could not get anything going. He gained just eight yards of five carries in the first half, and things did not get any better after the break. With Leonard Fournette expected back after the bye, it is fair to wonder how much work Hyde will see the rest of the season. That said, Fournette has already suffered a setback once when trying to return from his hamstring injury, so his status cannot be taken for granted. That makes Hyde a hold through the bye week despite this poor showing.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed six times for 11 yards in the Jaguars' Week 8 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Hyde got his first carry of the game near the end of the third quarter, and he finished the game with just three touches. He is just a handcuff with Leonard Fournette back healthy.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed three times for five yards in the Jaguars' Week 10 loss to the Colts.

impact: Hyde was part of the Jaguars rushing attack in the first half, carrying six times for 37 yards before the half, but then was not heard from in the second half. Hyde is only a handcuff to Leonard Fournette at this point of the season.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed eight times for 44 yards in Sunday's Week 11 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Hyde was a predictable bust filling in for suspended Leonard Fournette, doing his best to keep the Colts in the game.  The Jags wound up winning with defense and T.J. Yeldon, who led the team in receiving.  Hyde will go back to the bench when Fournette returns for Week 14 against the Titans on Thursday Night Football.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 13 times for 36 yards, caught his lone target for a gain of one, and lost a fumble in the Jaguars' Week 13 win over the Colts.

impact: Benjamin's health takes on increased importance with Keenan Allen (knee) turning in back-to-back DNPs. Even if Allen sits, Benjamin will be little more than a WR5 dart throw against the 49ers. That's if he himself manages to get cleared. Benjamin sat in Week 3.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) remained limited in Thursday's practice.

impact: Benjamin would seem to have a better chance of suiting this week after getting in limited practice time. If he sits, it would obviously come as great news to Mike Williams, who has been a monster with Benjamin sidelined the past two weeks.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is questionable for Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin has been a game-time decision the last two weeks. He’s yet to get in a full  practice, so he’s not a lock to return. Even if he plays, Benjamin is behind Keenan Allen (questionable, knee), Tyrell Williams, and Mike Williams for targets.
report: Chargers coach Anthony Lynn said Travis Benjamin (questionable, foot) is a game-time decision for Week 4.

impact: Benjamin has sat the last two weeks as a game-time decision. He's made enough progress to play, but his snaps figure to be limited. Benjamin will be returning behind Mike Williams in three-wide sets.
report: Travis Benjamin (questionable, foot) is expected to play Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin lasted ten minutes before the training staff had to take another look at him. He had been testing his foot the last couple weeks in pregame warmups but wasn't able to see game action until today. Even if he's healthy, Benjamin has been passed up by Mike Williams.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is questionable to return in the Chargers' Week 4 game against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin left the game just minutes after kickoff after hauling in his first target of the game. He slammed his helmet on the sideline in frustration, as he knew he re-injured his nagging foot injury. Benjamin can be safely dropped with his foot injury and Mike Williams working against him.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) has been ruled for the remainder of the Chargers' Week 4 game against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin first suffered the injury in Week 1.  He missed Weeks 2-3, then returned against the 49ers and went down again.  Benjamin's absence locks in Keenan Allen, Mike Williams, and Tyrell Williams as the Chargers' top-three wideouts.
report: Travis Benjamin aggravated his foot injury in Week 4 and is out indefinitely.

impact: Benjamin is likely to miss multiple weeks after aggravating his foot injury in Week 4. Mike Williams and Tyrell Williams will continue to see the majority of targets behind Keenan Allen.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Benjamin aggravated an ongoing foot issue in Week 4. The field-stretching role player could end up being sidelined beyond the Bolts' Week 8 bye.
report: NFL.com's Ian Rapoport reports Travis Benjamin (foot) will be sidelined 2-3 weeks.

impact: Benjamin remains week-to-week and is likely out beyond the Chargers' Week 8 bye. Los Angeles will also be without both starting tackles against the Raiders in Week 5. UDFA Trent Scott is expected to play a large role, as will Sam Tevi. OL Forrest Lamp, the Chargers' second-round pick in 2017, is active for the first time this season and could be tasked to fill in at times.
report: Chargers declared Travis Benjamin, LB Kyzir White C Cole Toner RT Joe Barksdale, LT Russell Okung, WR J.J. Jones, and Joey Bosa for Week 5 against the Raiders.

impact: Benjamin hasn't played since aggravating a foot issue in Week 4.  Benjamin is part of the fight for targets behind Keenan Allen and Melvin Gordon.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: He also got in a limited session Wednesday, putting him on track to return this week. Benjamin's return could put a dent into Mike Williams' and Tyrell Williams' target shares.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) was limited in Thursday's practice.

impact: Benjamin practiced in full Friday, so we'd expect him to return this week in London after missing the previous two games.  Benjamin is off the fantasy map.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is questionable for Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Benjamin hasn't played since re-aggravating his foot in Week 4. Although he's off the fantasy radar, his presence alone plummets Mike Williams' usage. Williams played just 53% of the Chargers' offensive snaps in Week 1, but hasn't played less than 63% since Benjamin's been out. Williams is a boom-bust WR4 in this particular matchup against the Titans' secondary.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is expected to play against the Titans in Week 7.

impact: Benjamin will make his first appearance since Week 4. He's unlikely to have much of a role, but it's a hit to Mike Williams' playing time. The Chargers inactives are RB Melvin Gordon, K Caleb Sturgis, LB Kyzir White, C Cole Toner, OT Trent Scott, OG Forrest Lamp, and DE Joey Bosa.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is active for Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: The Packers will have to make a move to get him on the active roster, but it would be a surprise if he is not on the field Sunday. That is a concern for Jamaal Williams, who has operated as the clear lead back the first two games, but Williams is more reliable in the passing game and has a two-week headstart. Jones is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Aaron Jones is eligible to return from his two-game suspension this week.

impact: "Jamaal and Ty have played good football," McCarthy said.  "I know what Aaron gives us, but his role will be secondary.  Jamaal and Ty will be in the first slot."  Jones is off a two-game ban and will not be handed anything off the bat.  He's not a fantasy starter right now and remains nothing more than a bench stash.  Jones is long on talent, but Williams and Montgomery have reliability.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy said Aaron Jones will play behind both Jamaal Williams and Ty Montgomery in his return from suspension this week against the Redskins.

impact: Jones didn't see the field until late in the first quarter, but he immediately piled up 18 yards on back-to-back carries. The sophomore back led the Pack's three-man backfield in both carries and rushing yards. He is clearly going to be a factor. If Jones can improve his pass protection, he could make a decisive move ahead of Jamaal Williams. He needs to be 100 percent owned in fantasy.
report: Making his 2018 debut, Aaron Jones rushed six times for 42 yards in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins, adding a five-yard reception.

impact: "He's definitely got some explosiveness, some twitch and some play-making ability," was Philbin's exact quote. "There were a couple runs where he definitely made some things happen on his own." Philbin's assessment of Jones' Week 3 play is accurate. He provided the Packers' running game with a badly-needed spark. Now a full-blown three-man committee, the Packers' backfield is tough to forecast for fantasy. We would give Jamaal Williams the slightest of Week 4 edges over Jones.
report: Speaking Thursday, Packers OC Joe Philbin praised Aaron Jones' "explosiveness."

impact: Jones once again came off the bench behind Jamaal Williams. His first touch did not come until the final play of the first quarter, but Jones proceeded to easily out-gain Williams 82-27 while out-touching him 12-11. It was Jones who scored the Pack's lone ground touchdown, running over a defensive back at the goal line. Jones has now out-produced Williams in each of his 2018 appearances. Each of Jones, Williams and Ty Montgomery will continue to see work, but only Jones is currently worth FLEX consideration. The Pack travel to Detroit for Week 5. The Lions have been getting destroyed on the ground.
report: Aaron Jones rushed 11 times for 65 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills, adding a 17-yard reception.

impact: He also caught two balls for 19 yards.  Jones didn't get a second-half touch until there was less than 30 second left in the game.  He fought hard for extra yards on his seven carries, but Jones was mothballed with the Packers in catchup mode.  It was pretty much all Ty Montgomery in the backfield after the break.  Jones should get more work next week against the Niners as an RB3.
report: Aaron Jones rushed seven times for 40 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: "He's dynamic with the ball in his hands," McCarthy said. "But there's more to the position than just running the football. We have diversity in our attack with three guys. All have excellent attributes." The fantasy community continues to be more in love with Jones than his coaching staff. Jones has run circles around Jamaal Williams the past two seasons, but McCarthy is obsessed with Williams' "little things" skills. Per Pro Football Focus, Jones has been called on to pass block on just four of his 68 snaps. Jones' usage limits him to FLEX status for the time being, though the Niners are an appealing Week 6 matchup.
report: Speaking Monday, Packers coach Mike McCarthy said he would "love" to get Aaron Jones more work but that "there's more to the position than just running the football."

impact: The good news is Jones started for the Packers.  His first run was a 16-yard scamper on the game's second play that was initially ruled a 17-yard touchdown before getting reversed.  Jones got the call from the one-yard line on the next play but was stuffed for a one-yard loss before Ty Montgomery then scored on second down.  Jones was targeted once in the pass game but dropped it, leading to more frustration for him.  He's not going to get more looks in the pass game if he does that.  Jamaal Williams rushed six times for 29 yards as this thing remains a total timeshare.  Jones simply isn't getting enough carries and isn't taking advantage of pass-game spots to be trusted in fantasy lineups ahead of the Packers' Week 8 game against the Rams after the bye.
report: Aaron Jones rushed eight times for 41 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Jones caught two passes but gained zero yards. Jones' score was a 33-yarder on a delayed handoff. Jones exploded through a monstrous hole once he got the ball. Jones also took a safety on an ill-advised, packed-in run call from the Packers' own one-yard line. Jones continues to run laps around Jamaal Williams, but stubborn coach Mike McCarthy refuses to phase him out of the Packers' offense. Jones will be a risk/reward RB2 for next week's likely shootout with the Patriots.
report: Aaron Jones rushed 12 times for 86 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 8 loss to the Rams.

impact: Jones continued to start but lost a few series to Jamaal Williams. His night was overshadowed by a costly fumble to open the fourth quarter with the Packers driving. The Packers went away from Jones after that, but he's clearly ahead of Williams going forward. Jones is an RB2 for Week 10 against Miami.
report: Aaron Jones had 14 carries for 76 yards and caught 2-of-4 targets for 10 yards in Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: Jones dropped a pass on the team's first play, but it didn't matter. He stayed on the field and still got four touches for 54 yards on Green Bay's opening drive, paving the way for his monstrous two-score afternoon. Jones was averaging a league-high 6.0 YPC heading into Sunday, and yet somehow increased that mark to 6.76 YPC at the end of the day. He didn't even step onto the field for the Packers' final possession and still out-touched Jamaal Williams 18-3. Consider this game an official passing of the torch as Jones should receive RB1 usage (and flourish with it) for the remainder of the season.
report: Aaron Jones handled 15 carries for 145 yards and two touchdowns, tacking on three catches for 27 yards in the Packers' Week 10 victory over the Dolphins.

impact: Rodgers has been advocating for Jones all season, and there is no reason for him to stop after the running back broke out for 145 yards and two touchdowns on 15 carries against the Dolphins. Jones is already the clear No. 1 in Green Bay, and it sounds like his role could continue to grow. He is almost a must-start this week against the Seahawks.
report: Aaron Rodgers believes the Packers "need to continue to give [Aaron Jones] more opportunities."

impact: Jones was running completely wild in the first half, at one point taking over a drive with receptions of 15, 22 and 24 yards, the third of which went for a score. Jones made an excellent 1-on-1 catch on a corner route in the end zone. His rushing touchdown was an eight-yarder on a toss play on the Pack's opening drive. The second-year pro now has four scores over his past two games and has rendered Jamaal Williams a distant memory. Jones is going to be in the RB1 mix from here on out. The Pack get the Vikings in Week 12.
report: Aaron Jones rushed 11 times for 40 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 11 loss to the Seahawks, adding five receptions for 63 yards and an additional score.

impact: Jones continued to be a bright spot for a Packers offense that's taken a step back the last couple weeks. He went untouched from six yards out on his touchdown, but most of his yards came after contact. Jones remained involved in the pass game with 21 yards on three catches. Jamaal Williams barely saw the field behind Jones, getting just one carry. Jones will be a locked-in RB1 for Week 13 against the Cardinals.
report: Aaron Jones rushed 17 times for 72 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 12 loss to the Vikings.

impact: The entire Green Bay offense bombed in what looked like a great spot for them to get on track at home against Arizona.  Jamaal Williams got way too many touches (11, for 27 yards), and Jones only turned in a usable fantasy performance because of his late-game touchdown from eight yards out, set up by Davante Adams' toe-tapping 19-yard sideline catch on the previous play.  Jones will remain a quality RB1/2 when the Packers host the Falcons next week, but coach Mike McCarthy really needs to get over his obsession with weekly black hole Williams.
report: Aaron Jones rushed 11 times for 36 yards and a touchdown and caught 4-of-4 targets for 16 yards in Green Bay's Week 13 loss to Arizona.

impact: Brees was sacked once for a seven-yard loss. Even though it came in a losing effort, the 39-year-old was absolutely brilliant, slinging touchdowns to Michael Thomas, Ted Ginn and Alvin Kamara in Sunday’s slugfest. Brees and Thomas were nearly unstoppable together, connecting 16 times for an incredible 180 yards. Neither defense showed up on Sunday as the two teams combined for an insane 1,004 yards of total offense. We’ll see what the future Hall of Famer does for an encore when he faces the Browns in Week 2.
report: Drew Brees completed 37-of-45 passes for 439 yards with three touchdowns and no interceptions Sunday in the Saints’ Week 1 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Despite completing 80 percent of his passes, Brees got off to a slow start in the first when he rushed a throw to a wide open Ben Watson in the end zone and underthrew a wide open Ted Ginn for potential scores. He bounced back in the second half to connect for two touchdowns to Michael Thomas and lead back-to-back drives for scores to give the Saints the lead in the 4th quarter. Brees will have his first road game in Week 3 visiting Atlanta, but will remain in the QB1 mix for fantasy.
report: Drew Brees completed 28-of-35 passes for 243 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Browns.

impact: He lost five yards on his lone sack. Brees got off to a blistering start, completing all four of his passes for 55 yards and a touchdown to Ted Ginn on the opening drive. He never took his foot off the gas, connecting on all 10 of his throws to Michael Thomas while also completing an exhausting 15 passes to running back Alvin Kamara. As he often does, Brees saved his best for last. The 39-year-old tied the game on a rare rushing touchdown, beating two defenders on a spin move for a seven-yard score with 1:15 left in the fourth quarter. He sealed the game in overtime with another rushing TD, leaping over the pile on a QB keeper. Brees passed Brett Favre Sunday to become the NFL’s all-time completion leader. He should keep the train rolling next week against a burnable Giants secondary.
report: Drew Brees completed 39-of-49 passes for 396 yards and three touchdowns while also adding three carries for seven yards and another two touchdowns Sunday in New Orleans’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: It was the Saints' first game outside of a dome this season, and we've seen this pass offense struggle in these outdoor environments over the years.  It continued on Sunday, but Brees being removed at certain times in the red zone in favor of gadget QB Taysom Hill was mind-boggling.  There's no reason Hill should be playing over Brees in those situations, and the Saints did it more than once.  At the end of the day, they still won easily.  Brees will head back home next week for a date with the Redskins on Monday night.
report: Drew Brees completed 18-of-32 passes for 217 yards and no touchdowns in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: Brees entered the night in third place on the league's all-time passing yards list.  He quickly passed Brett Favre for the No. 2 spot and then eclipsed Peyton Manning at No. 1 with a 62-yard touchdown pass to Tre'Quan Smith late in the second quarter.  There was nobody within 10 yards of Smith on a blown coverage, and Brees picked apart this little-league pass defense all night, as evidenced by just the three incompletions and 12.5 YPA average.  Brees' other two scores went to Josh Hill and a second to Smith.  The Saints are now heading into their bye before traveling to Baltimore in Week 7.
report: Drew Brees completed 26-of-29 passes for 363 yards and three touchdowns in the Saints' 43-19, Week 5 blowout win over the Redskins on Monday night.

impact: The scores were Nos. 500 and 501 of Brees' Hall-of-Fame career. He is just the fourth member of the 500-touchdown club. The Saints were methodical in the road victory, rushing 39 times while trying to gobble up clock. No. 2 quarterback Taysom Hill remained extremely involved as a red zone gadget player. Hill is little more than a nuisance, though he is curbing both Brees and Alvin Kamara's ultimate upside. The Saints are headed on the road to Minnesota's dome for Week 8.
report: Drew Brees completed 22-of-30 passes for 212 yards and two touchdowns in the Saints' 24-23, Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: The Vikings did a good job of limiting Brees to check downs and short throws. His only TD was a shovel pass to Alvin Kamara on the opening drive. Brees threw his first interception of the season but was highly accurate —completing 78 percent of his passes. He wasn’t asked to do much with the Saints protecting a two-score lead in the second half. This will likely go down as one of Brees’ worst statistical games of the year. Brees will be one of  the top quarterback plays for a Week 9 matchup with the Rams.
report: Drew Brees completed 18-of-23 passes for 120 yards with a touchdown and an interception in Week 8 against the Vikings.

impact: Brees did not do much of anything wrong in the first half. He got some help with some great catches by Michael Thomas and Ben Watson, but he was exceptionally sharp in his own right. He found Alvin Kamara for a touchdown late in the first quarter, hit Tre’Quan Smith for a short score in the second, and found Watson for his third score from 13-yards out just before halftime. At one point in the first half, he was 15-for-18 for 194 yards and those three scores, as many touchdowns as incompletions. The offense fell into a lull in the second half, allowing the Rams to tie it up, but Brees was able to hit Thomas for a 72-yard score, his fourth touchdown toss of the day, to put the game on ice. Brees' attempt total could be a concern in non-competitive games, but that should not be an issue next week in Cincinnati. He will be a rock-solid QB1 in a great matchup.
report: Drew Brees completed 25-of-36 passes for 346 yards and four touchdowns in the Saints' Week 9 win over the Rams.

impact: Brees also added a 1-yard rushing touchdown for good measure. Against the league's worst pass defense, Brees found no resistance on Sunday. He started the game off with a 7-yard touchdown to Michael Thomas and never looked back, completing passes to seven different receivers. Brees has now thrown 21 touchdowns to just one interception on the season while completing 77 percent of his passes. Brees will be at home against the Eagles in Week 11.
report: Drew Brees completed 22-of-25 passes for 265 yards and three touchdowns in Sunday's Week 10 win over the Bengals.

impact: Spreading the ball around, Brees hit five different receivers on his first seven completions including a bullet to Austin Carr for a touchdown near the end of the first quarter, and that was just the start of a spectacular performance. Facing very little pressure, Brees picked apart the Eagles’ undermanned secondary all game. His 15-yard touchdown to Tre’Quan Smith was a pinpoint throw into a small window, and he threw a beautiful pass to Michael Thomas down the sideline for his third touchdown. Brees capped his day with another great throw to Alvin Kamara for a 37-yard touchdown early in the fourth quarter. Playing as well as any quarterback in the league, Brees will have an argument to be the overall QB1 next week against the Falcons, who he dusted for 396 yards and three scores in Week 3.
report: Drew Brees completed 22-of-30 passes for 363 yards and four touchdowns in the Saints' Week 11 win over the Eagles.

impact: His total yardage wasn't too impressive, but Brees hit four different UDFAs (Tommylee Lewis, Dan Arnold, Austin Carr, Keith Kirkwood) for touchdowns Thursday as the Saints stayed efficient on offense throughout the night. Brees' lone flaw of the evening occurred because Kirkwood slipped at the end of a route. Even Michael Thomas (4/38) essentially had the night off as New Orleans forced five fumbles and coasted behind stellar defense and explosiveness up the middle from Alvin Kamara (14/89) and Mark Ingram (11/52). Brees tied an NFL record by hitting 13 different receivers for pay dirt this season, all but securing his late-season run as league MVP. He'll be an easy QB1 despite having his work cut out for him against Dallas' stout pass rush in Week 13.
report: Drew Brees completed 15-of-22 passes for 171 yards, four touchdowns, and one pick in the Saints' Week 12 rout of the Falcons.

impact: Brees entered halftime 7-of-13 for 39 yards and was scarcely better after the break. His touchdown was a 30-yarder to Keith Kirkwood in a crowded part of the end zone. His pick was a truly inexplicable miss to Alvin Kamara. Brees unloaded the ball behind his running back as pressure was in his face. It ended up being the Saints' final play of the night. The Cowboys played absolutely lights-out defense, but Brees needed to be better. He undoubtedly will be in Week 14 when the Saints travel to Tampa Bay to take on the Bucs' barely-there defense.
report: Drew Brees completed 18-of-28 passes for 127 yards, one touchdown and one interception in the Saints' 13-10, Week 13 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Allen got in just one limited practice this week, though we're guessing he'll give it a go against San Francisco. An already vulnerably Niners secondary will be in even worse shape this week with Richard Sherman (calf) sitting. It's a potential smash spot for Allen, though the injury risk lowers him to back-end WR1 status. RotoPat has him at No. 10 in his Week 4 receiver rankings.
report: Keenan Allen (knee, tooth) is questionable for Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: Allen got in just one limited practice this week but it doesn't sound like it'll matter for his availability. The Niners will quietly be without both Richard Sherman (calf) and starting S Jaquiski Tartt (shoulder), essentially becoming vulnerable against the Chargers' explosive pass and rushing attacks. He's undoubtedly a low-end WR1 in this matchup. Although Allen will play, second-year pro Mike Williams should carry over his sudden rapport with Philip Rivers and be considered a confident WR3/4 at home. Travis Benjamin (foot) remains questionable.
report: Keenan Allen (knee, tooth) is expected to play in Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: That means Keenan Allen (knee, tooth) and Travis Benjamin (foot) are officially active.
