The matchup for Allen is fantastic with Richard Sherman (calf) and S Jaquiski Tartt (shoulder) both inactive for the 49ers. Travis Benjamin's usage will be something to watch with Mike Williams breaking out for the Chargers. Joey Bosa (foot) is expected to be sidelined until the second half of the season.
report: Chargers declare LB Kyzir White, C Cole Toner, T Joe Barksdale, G Forrest Lamp, WR JJ Jones, DT T.Y. McGill, and DE Joey Bosa inactive for Week 4's game against the 49ers.

impact: Allen missed some practice time this week with knee and tooth soreness, but he was able to play through it. The 49ers were down two starting players in the secondary, but Allen was held in check in a game that featured Melvin Gordon. Allen is still on pace for a 96-1,128-4 season receiving line on 144 targets despite three straight average games. Look for Allen to return to low-end WR1 form against the Raiders next Sunday.
report: Keenan Allen caught 7-of-10 targets for 63 scoreless yards in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Allen has now seen at least seven targets in every game, and at least nine in three-of-five. Although he's recorded just one touchdown on the year, his massive volume (nine targets per game) will inevitably lead to more fireworks-style outings for owners in the near future. His red zone usage has admittedly taken a hit with Melvin Gordon so heavily involved out of the backfield this year, but Allen's weekly floor still makes him one of the safest plays going in fantasy. He's on pace for a usage-hog 102-1,190-3 season, and remains a safe WR1 in Week 6 against the Browns.
report: Keenan Allen vacuumed 8-of-9 targets for 90 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 rout over the Raiders.

impact: Allen got his day started off strong with two catches for 33 yards on the opening drive of the game. The Chargers took the air out of the ball in the second half, but his rushing performance made his day a respectable one as his four carries were a career-high. In fact, for his career, Allen had just three rushes for 11 yards entering Sunday's game. Allen hasn't been the WR1 fantasy owners drafted to begin the season, but got off to a slow statistical start a year ago before turning it on over the back half of the year. Allen will be a high-end WR2 option Week 7 when the Chargers face the Titans in London.
report: Keenan Allen caught 4-of-6 targets for 62 yards while rushing four times for 41 yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Allen didn't get a ton of volume with Philip Rivers only attempting 26 passes. He had an on-field outburst after not getting targeted in the end-zone late in the fourth quarter. Allen has hit his floor all year but has only one touchdown. He's due for some positive regression in the second half.
report: Keenan Allen caught five passes for 72 yards in the Chargers' Week 7 win over the Titans.

impact: The 100-yard day through the air was Allen's first since Week 1. Allen had little issue separating against what has been a fairly-sticky Seahawks secondary this season. Allen has a dream matchup in the sub-expansion level Raiders in Week 10, but the risk will be that things get out of hand too quickly. That seems to be the way Jon Gruden's tanking team wants it. Either way, Allen will be a locked-in WR1 in the ranks.
report: Keenan Allen caught 6-of-10 targets for 124 yards in the Chargers' Week 9 win over the Seahawks, adding two rushes for 28 additional yards.

impact: Allen did not catch a pass until there was less than a minute left in the second quarter, but he finished the first half in style. With the game tied, Allen got open in the end zone, and Philip Rivers hit him for an 11-yard score right at the end of the half. There was not much to do after the break, but Allen added another four catches including an 18-yarder to help set up a field goal. He will face a tougher test next week in Denver, but Allen will remain in the WR2 tier.
report: Keenan Allen hauled in 6-of-9 targets for 57 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 10 win over the Raiders.

impact: Mike Williams (groin) was also added, getting in a limited session. Mid-week additions are one thing. Mid-week additions with two separate injuries are another. It's not what you would like to see, but there is zero indication Allen's Week 11 status is in doubt. Allen has a tough matchup with Denver's Chris Harris.
report: Keenan Allen was added to the Chargers' injury report on Thursday, getting in a limited session with hip and finger issues.

impact: Allen showed up on the injury report Thursday, but there was never much concern about his status for Week 11. This isn't an ideal matchup for Allen, who figures to see a fair amount of slot corner Chris Harris (No. 2 in PFF's cornerback grades) on Sunday. Allen has lined up in the slot on 42.3 percent of his snaps this year.
report: Keenan Allen (hip, finger) wasn't listed on the Chargers' final injury report for Week 11 against the Broncos.

impact: Allen came out firing on all cylinders, delivering three grabs for 38 yards on the Chargers' opening drive. A week after ending a seven-game touchdown drought, Allen returned to the end zone Sunday by scoring on a four-yard strike from Philip Rivers with 2:39 left in the second quarter. He celebrated that score by putting on a championship belt provided by a fan, which predictably drew a flag for unsportsmanlike conduct. The 26-year-old saw plenty of Chris Harris on Sunday, but it didn't matter as Allen delivered yet another big game. He'll face another tough assignment next week against Cardinals stud Patrick Peterson, though Allen is still good enough to warrant WR2 consideration in all formats.
report: Keenan Allen tacked on nine catches for 89 yards and a touchdown on 12 targets Sunday in L.A.’s Week 11 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Allen showed no ill effects playing through the injury last week, absorbing nine of 12 targets for 89 yards and a touchdown in a loss to Denver. The sixth-year wideout has followed up a seven-game touchdown drought by scoring in back-to-back weeks. Consider him a high-end WR2 for Sunday's home matchup against Arizona.
report: Keenan Allen (finger) is practicing in full for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: The yards were a team high, but Allen saw fewer targets than Austin Ekeler. With Tyrell Williams not fully healthy, it's a slightly disappointing game from Allen, though he made a highlight-reel sideline catch in the end-zone for his TD. Allen will remain a high-end WR2 for a likely shootout with the Steelers in Week 13.
report: Keenan Allen caught seven passes for 72 yards and a touchdown in Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: He also caught a two-point conversion. Allen's touchdown came on a deflection off Steelers CB Joe Haden in the middle of the end-zone. It's the fourth straight week with a touchdown for Allen, who's now up to 996 yards on the season. Allen has another attackable matchup against the Bengals in Week 14.
report: Keenan Allen caught 14-of-19 targets for 148 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 13 win over the Steelers.

impact: Acquired in late August, Bridgewater has already learned the offense well enough to be the top option behind Drew Brees. "He's a quick study," Payton said. "I think right away, you can tell he got comfortable with what we're calling things, protections." Brees has missed two games since joining the Saints, but having someone like Bridgewater ready behind him is good insurance.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said Teddy Bridgewater is the No. 2 quarterback.

impact: An UDFA out of Tulane, Hilliard rushed 30 times for 82 yards (2.73 YPC) during the preseason. If he sees the field, it will be on special teams.
report: Browns promoted RB Dontrell Hilliard from the practice squad.

impact: He was not targeted in the passing game and got out-touched by Carlos Hyde 22 to 3, but Chubb made his workload count with two monster touchdown runs from 63 and 41 yards out.  Plays like that are capable of earning Chubb more playing time going forward, although Chubb's to-date usage keeps him out of the flex-starter discussion. The Browns have stayed very committed to Hyde as their bellcow.  Chubb is a handcuff until further notice.
report: Nick Chubb rushed three times for 105 yards and two touchdowns in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: "(Carlos) Hyde is playing well, but this guy is scoring touchdowns from long ways away," Jackson said. "We have good backs. We know that. Sometimes it is going to be hit and miss where some other guy is making it happen and then the other guy goes in and does it." Chubb is a freak athlete big-play threat who could certainly change the pace for the better in the Browns' offense. It's still extremely unlikely he comes into standalone fantasy value as long as Hyde is healthy. Hyde, of course, has an extensive injury history. Chubb is a must stash in all formats.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson said Nick Chubb "has to get some."

impact: After the Cleveland staff spent most of the week suggesting Chubb's role would expand after turning three carries into 105 yards a week ago, he remained an afterthought in the game plan. Chubb is only a bench stash as Carlos Hyde has dominated backfield touches in Cleveland.
report: Nick Chubb rushed three times for two yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Chubb once again showed off his explosion with a 19-yard scamper which would have been longer had there not been a holding downfield, but once again the Browns failed to use him in the game. Chubb has now carried the ball three times or less in every game this season. He is only a bench stash at this point and needs an injury to have fantasy relevancy.
report: Nick Chubb rushed three times for 25 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: "We do need to get Nick Chubb more carries," was Jackson's exact quote. He said the same thing two weeks away and has proceeded to give Chubb the ball six times over the past two games. With Carlos Hyde averaging just 3.35 yards per carry, perhaps Jackson means it this time. Chubb remains worth holding in 12-team leagues.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson once again claimed he would work to get Nick Chubb more carries.

impact: With Carlos Hyde traded to Jacksonville, Chubb takes over as Cleveland's early-down back. This should be an upgrade for the Browns' run game, as Hyde was averaging just 3.4 YPC. Chubb has a blowup ROS outlook in a Baker Mayfield offense. He's an RB2 against a Bucs defense that will be without DT Gerald McCoy this week.
report: Nick Chubb will start Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: With the trade of Carlos Hyde on Friday, Chubb drew the start and out-touched Duke Johnson 18-to-5. Chubb saw two targets in the pass game, but neither one was catchable. After just 24 yards on eight carries in the first half, Chubb ran 10 times for 54 yards after the break. His touchdown was a 1-yard plunge after a pass interference in the end zone.  Chubb is now firmly on the radar as an RB2 option for fantasy next week against the Steelers, but he will still be a touchdown dependent option most weeks just as Hyde was.
report: Nick Chubb rushed 18 times for 80 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Chubb started the day well, rushing 10 times for 53 yards in the first half including a 20-yard jaunt on the first drive of the game. The second half was a much different story as the Pittsburgh defense clamped Chubb to 12 yards on eight carries. The two receptions were Chubb's first of the season. Chubb finds himself in a similar position that Carlos Hyde; he's going to need to find the end zone to overcome his low-reception totals and the Browns consistently trailing. Chubb will enter Week 9 as a RB2 option at home against the Chiefs.
report: Nick Chubb rushed 18 times for 65 yards while catching 2-of-3 targets for 10 yards in Sunday's Week 8 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Chubb ran hot in the first half while the Browns were in the game, rushing 14 times for 56 yards and a score in the first half. His long gain on the day was only 12 yards, but helped set up his own touchdown a 3-yard stop/start run where he picked out the correct hole. Chubb now has 18, 20 and 23 touches in his three games as the starting running back despite the Browns playing from behind in all three games. He still is partially a touchdown-dependent fantasy option since he has just three catches on the season, but Chubb's volume and big-play upside will keep him as a viable RB2 for the rest of the season. The Browns host the Falcons in Week 10.
report: Nick Chubb rushed 22 times for 85 yards and a touchdown while catching his lone target for five yards in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Chubb was already having a big game before he took a stretch zone handoff from the Browns' own eight-yard line midway through the third quarter. Chubb hit the hole, received some nice blocking from Antonio Callaway and then out-ran the Falcons' entire defense for a 92-yard score. Chubb has more than justified the Browns' decision to trade Carlos Hyde, averaging 102 yards rushing in four games since becoming starter. He is a big-play machine who can handle big workloads. Chubb will be an RB1 against the Bengals when the Browns come off bye in Week 12.
report: Nick Chubb rushed 20 times for 176 yards and a touchdown in the Browns' Week 10 win over the Falcons, adding three receptions for 33 additional yards and a second score.

impact: Chubb got the day started with a 1-yard score on the ground on the opening drive of the game. He then added a 14-yard touchdown catch to put the Browns ahead 28-0 in which he ran a wheel route and pinned the ball to the back of the defender for his second score of the game. Chubb now has scored in four of his five games as a starter. He will enter Week 13 as a high-end RB2 on the road against the Texans.
report: Nick Chubb rushed 28 times for 84 yards with one touchdown while catching all three of his targets for 44 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 12 win over the Bengals.

impact: With the Browns falling behind by 23 points in the first half, Chubb received just 12 touches, his fewest in a game since taking over as the starting running back. Despite the circumstances of playing catchup, Chubb still managed to find the end zone for a 2-yard touchdown run in the second half and out-touched Duke Johnson 12-2 in the game. Chubb has worked his way into the top-portion of the weekly RB2 options and will once again be a starting option in Week 14 against the Panthers.
report: Nick Chubb rushed nine times for 31 yards and a touchdown while catching three passes for 41 yards in Sunday's Week 13 loss to the Texans.

impact: Johnson had his second disappointing game in a row to start the year as he managed just five touches, his fewest in a game since Week 1 of last season. Through two games, Johnson has totaled just 35 yards on just 11 touches. He's not even worth consideration in fantasy at this stage until his opportunity expands heading into a Week 3 matchup versus the Jets.
report: Duke Johnson rushed three times for three yards and caught two passes for seven yards in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: Johnson has touched the ball just 11 times on offense through two games. Jackson said the running back is one of their best playmakers and needs to touch the ball more, but it is tough to trust that will happen. Johnson needs to be relegated to fantasy benches for the time being.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson said Duke Johnson needs to get more touches moving forward.

impact: Coach Hue Jackson said Johnson needed the ball more, but his four touches were actually a season low. Johnson's next hope for improved fortunes is Baker Mayfield's insertion under center. If Johnson has been dropped in your PPR league, he's not a bad flier ahead of a Week 4 matchup with the Raiders.
report: Duke Johnson caught 2-of-2 targets for 24 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets, adding two rushes for nine additional yards.

impact: Coach Hue Jackson said Johnson needs to get more touches, but responded by handing him a season-low four touches for 33 total yards. Carlos Hyde was in on 45-of-77 (58 percent) snaps with rookie Nick Chubb (5, six percent) continuing to see minimal work. There's still hope for Duke in PPR leagues assuming Baker Mayfield is named starter for the rest of the season. Pick Johnson up if he's been dropped.
report: Duke Johnson played 29-of-77 (38 percent) snaps Week 3 against the Jets.

impact: He has finished with six touches or fewer in each of Cleveland's first four games.  Johnson did convert a two-point conversion on run around the edge of Oakland's defense, but he also dropped a pass and was out-touched by Carlos Hyde 22 to 6.  Johnson is waiver-wire material outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Duke Johnson rushed twice for 11 yards and caught 4-of-6 targets for 45 yards in the Browns' Week 4 loss to Oakland.

impact: Johnson was again was a non-factor in the offensive game plan for the Browns. After averaging 4.6 receptions a year ago, Johnson now has 10 receptions on the season through five games. He is not worth holding onto in fantasy formats outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Duke Johnson rushed five times for 35 yards while catching one pass for seven yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Johnson had to receive a pep talk from Tyrod Taylor on Wednesday. "He told me to just be more positive," Johnson said. For his part, Johnson said he is not going to formally lodge a complaint. "I've just never been a big fan of going up to coaches and demanding the ball." Johnson is right to be frustrated. Even with the Browns hurting for weapons, Johnson is averaging just five touches per game after that number was 10 in 2017. OC Todd Haley needs to find a way to get his playmaking change-of-pace back more involved.
report: The Cleveland Plain Dealer reports Duke Johnson is "frustrated by his lack of chances."

impact: This was by far Johnson's best game of the season, adding three plays of over 20 yards on the day with the highlight being a 32-yard catch and run. Despite the big day in producing yardage, Johnson still only managed six touches, giving him six or fewer touches in every game this season. Johnson is a risky-FLEX play Week 7 against the Buccaneers with his current volume levels.
report: Duke Johnson rushed twice for 36 yards while catching 4-of-5 targets for 73 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: We wouldn't read much into this. Johnson is listed ahead of Chubb out of seniority but may not start depending on what formation the Browns open in. Chubb remains the favorite to lead Cleveland in Week 7 carries.
report: Duke Johnson is listed as the starter for Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: With hopes that Johnson would gain usage after the trade of Carlos Hyde, things remained the same as always for Johnson as he was out-touched by rookie Nick Chubb 18-to-5. The touch total is especially discouraging as the Browns trailed the entire game. Johnson now has six or fewer touches in every game this season and is not a fantasy option until usage truly changes.
report: Duke Johnson rushed one time for -4 yards while catching all four of his targets for 23 yards in the Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: The more things change, the more they stay the same with Johnson's usage. He caught two passes on the opening possession of the game and then was never heard from again. Johnson has now had six or fewer touches in every game this season and is not a fantasy option until he begins to see tangible volume.
report: Duke Johnson rushed two times for zero yards while catching 2-of-3 targets for 16 yards in Sunday's Week 8 loss to the Steelers.

impact: With running backs coach Freddie Kitchens promoted to offensive coordinator this week in the wake of Todd Haley's firing, Johnson was noticeably used more than at any point this season. After having now more than six touches in any game this season, Johnson led the team in targets, receptions and yardage while catching scores from 19 and five yards out on the afternoon. Johnson and the coaching staff took advantage of a weak linebacking unit in coverage which was encouraging for further use when the matchup dictates Johnson being a focal point of the offense. Cleveland will have a chance to prove that becoming a trend as Johnson plays the Atlanta Falcons in Week 10, who are the league's worst team defending backs out of the backfield on the season.
report: Duke Johnson caught all nine of his targets for 78 yards and two touchdowns while rushing one time for eight yards in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Johnson's 11-yard touchdown in the third quarter was a third down checkdown from Baker Mayfield. Johnson now has 17 touches over Freddie Kitchens' two games as offensive coordinator. His previous two-game high for 2018 was 11. Johnson will have an excellent Week 12 matchup in the Bengals when the Browns come off bye.
report: Duke Johnson caught 4-of-4 targets for 31 yards and a touchdown in the Browns' Week 10 win over the Falcons, adding three carries for 15 additional yards.

impact: With the Browns controlling the game from the opening drive, Johnson was hardly needed on the day. He now has just seven and three touches over his past two games after receiving 10 touches in his first game under Freddie Kitchens as offensive coordinator. Johnson will likely find game script more in his favor in Week 13 at the Texans, but will only be a lower-end FLEX play.
report: Duke Johnson rushed two times for 16 yards while catching 1-of-2 targets for 23 yards in Sunday's Week 12 win over the Bengals.

impact: Even with the Browns trailing by 23 points, Johnson wasn't used at all, managing just two touches. Johnson now has just 12 touches over the past three games and is an afterthought in the weekly game planning for the Browns.
report: Duke Johnson caught 2-of-3 targets for 12 yards in Sunday's Week 13 loss to the Texans.

impact: Taylor added 77 yards and a touchdown rushing on eight carries to make up for a nondescript passing performance in the heavy rain. His fantasy day is a reminder that even when Taylor is a lackluster passing option, he's still a high-floor fantasy option due to his rushing ability. Taylor will be a popular streaming option Week 2 against the Saints.
report: Browns QB Tyrod Taylor completed 15-of-40 passes for 197 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Steelers.

impact: Taylor added 26 yards rushing on four attempts. Taylor was largely nondescript for the majority of Sunday, but connected on a 47-yard bomb to Antonio Callaway that tied the game on 4th down with 1:16 left in the game. Taylor will still remain a high-floor streaming option Week 3 when the Browns host the Jets on Thursday.
report: Tyrod Taylor completed 22-of-30 passes for 246 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Sunday's Week 2 loss versus the Saints.

impact: It will be hard to do this one justice in a blurb, but Taylor's night went as poorly as possible even before he was evaluated for a head injury. With the Jets showing zero respect for his arm, they teed off on the box, making life miserable for Taylor as the crowd chanted for Baker Mayfield. Taylor was one for his first seven, and things never got better. He took three sacks, all three coming on first down. He missed Antonio Callaway on what should have been a wide-open 75-yard touchdown and committee intentional grounding in the end zone. It was painful to watch. Even if Taylor gets cleared, Mayfield will finish the game under center.
report: Tyrod Taylor completed 4-of-14 passes for 19 yards in the Browns' Week 3 game against the Jets before leaving with a potential concussion.

impact: It makes for a cruel end to an extremely ugly night. Especially with the Browns having 10 days to prepare for Week 4, they will go ahead and make the switch at quarterback. Baker Mayfield will start against the Raiders with Taylor backing him up. That's if he can clear the concussion protocol in time. Taylor was going to be benched regardless of his health. His play was that poor through his first 2.5 starts.
report: Tyrod Taylor has been diagnosed with a concussion and is week to week.

impact: It looks like Taylor will be healthy enough to play against Oakland next week, though it would be a surprise and likely a mistake if he drew the start. First overall pick Baker Mayfield dominated against the Jets on Thursday night and gives the Browns a much better chance to win than Tyrod, who was dreadful prior to exiting Week 3. Handing the reins to Baker should be an easy choice, though we can't take anything for granted with Hue Jackson calling the shots in Cleveland.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Tyrod Taylor is expected to clear the concussion protocol this week.

impact: Taylor is expected to be cleared before this weekend, but he will not be returning to a starting job. Baker Mayfield is fully expected to be named the starter Monday afternoon.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion) did not practice Monday.

impact: He remains in the concussion protocol. Drew Stanton will back up Baker Mayfield if Taylor doesn't get cleared for Week 4.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion, back) didn't practice Wedneday.

impact: Baker Mayfield will start at quarterback for the Browns this week. Taylor is reportedly dealing with a back injury as well, but he appears on track to dress and back up the rookie this weekend.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion, back) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Taylor was limited in practice all week. He's still in the concussion protocol, but coach Hue Jackson expects him to be available behind Baker Mayfield. Drew Stanton will back up Mayfield if Taylor doesn't get cleared.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion, back) is questionable for Week 4 against the Raiders.

impact: Tyrod Taylor has cleared the concussion protocol, but he's still feeling the effects of a back injury. Taylor practiced, albeit in a limited capacity, throughout the week, suggesting he'll be active for next week's game against the Ravens. Coming off a masterful debut in Week 3, Mayfield will be the Browns' starter until further notice.
report: Drew Stanton will back up Baker Mayfield against the Raiders in Week 4.

impact: Taylor cleared the concussion protocol but is still bothered by a back injury. Without him, the Browns will turn to Drew Stanton as the backup to Baker Mayfield. FS Damarious Randall, who had been questionable with a heel injury, is active for Sunday's tilt in Oakland.
report: Browns declared QB Tyrod Taylor, LB James Burgess, OG Austin Corbett, TE Seth Devalve, DT Devaroe Lawrence, WR Damion Ratley and CB Tavierre Thomas inactive for Week 4 against the Raiders.

impact: Taylor is over the back injury he suffered in Week 3 but with Baker Mayfield installed as the Browns' starter, he no longer carries any fantasy relevance. He'll hold the clipboard for Mayfield Sunday against Baltimore.
report: Tyrod Taylor (back) is practicing in full for Week 5 against the Ravens.

impact: At least not yet. Taylor acknowledged the possibility of being dealt prior to the October 30 trade deadline, but it doesn't sound like an opportunity he's actively pursuing. "There’s nothing to be angry about," said Taylor when asked about being benched for No. 1 pick Baker Mayfield. "Right now, I’m focusing on getting healthy and continue to keep getting better and what I can do for the team, and that’ll do it." Despite being passed over on the QB depth chart, coach Hue Jackson insists Taylor "isn't going anywhere." Headed for free agency after this season, the 29-year-old will surely be playing elsewhere in 2019.
report: According to ESPN's Tony Grossi, Tyrod Taylor has not asked for a trade.

impact: The Saints are just rationing his practice reps. Kamara has been spectacular this year, totaling 611 yards from scrimmage with six touchdowns in the early going. He remains a top-three option in all formats, even with Mark Ingram due back from suspension this week.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Kamara was limited for the second straight week, but the Saints are just managing his practice reps. With Mark Ingram back, Kamara's touches are going to take a hit, but he's still a locked-in RB1.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) was removed from the Week 5 injury report.

impact: Mark Ingram returned from his four-week suspension to make his 2018 debut and made the start for the Saints.  He went on his way to out-carry Kamara 16-6 and out-touch him 18-9 overall.  Ingram also scored two goal-line plunge touchdowns in the first half.  Kamara owners are going to be seriously concerned after this one.  Kamara averaged 22.75 touches per game Weeks 1-4 but took a major back seat to Ingram tonight.  Perhaps coach Sean Payton was just overworking Ingram to get him up to speed and possibly getting Kamara some extra rest after the big workloads the first four weeks with the Saints now heading into their bye.  But Kamara is highly unlikely to come close to his Weeks 1-4 usage the rest of the way.  He's going to need big plays to maintain elite RB1 status, and those didn't come Monday night.  The Ravens are up next in Week 7.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed just six times for 24 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 15 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: Kamara took a backseat to Mark Ingram in the latter's first game of the season, touching the ball just nine times. Payton said Kamara was meant to have more touches, but big plays and a Taysom Hill keeper changed the game flow. "It just changes how the game unfolds. Alvin’s nine touches, I think is a little bit of byproduct of a 60-yard scoring strike, another 40," Payton said. "Those change kind of the pitch count, if you will." Kamara should be more involved coming out of the bye in Baltimore, but Ingram's presence is a real threat to his high-end RB1 status.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said long plays were to blame for Alvin Kamara's limited touches Week 5.

impact: Kamara got the start and out-touched Mark Ingram 19-14 one game after Ingram out-touched Kamara 18-9 in his 2018 debut. Both players received goal line looks, but only Kamara cashed his in. We would expect today's touch distribution to be closer to the norm than Week 5's going forward. With Taysom Hill emerging as a bigger nuisance, however, Kamara will remain a mid-range to low-end RB1 for Week 8 in Minnesota.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 17 times for 64 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens, adding two catches for 11 additional yards.

impact: Mark Ingram played just four fewer snaps but was out-touched 19-to-14 by Kamara a week after winning the touch battle 18-to-9. The usage against the Ravens is more in line with expectations, but it is too early to draw any firm conclusions. Kamara will be a mid-range RB1 this week against the Vikings while Ingram will be in the RB2 group.
report: Alvin Kamara played 39-of-71 snaps (55 percent) Week 7 against the Ravens.

impact: Kamara scored on a shovel pass on the Saints’ opening drive. His second TD came on a goal-line carry in the final seconds of the first half. Kamara dominated snaps early and out-touched Mark Ingram for the second straight week. He looks to have reestablished himself as the clear feature back going forward. Kamara has a blowup spot in Week 9 in what should be a high-scoring game with the Rams.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 13 times for 45 yards and a touchdown and caught 7-of-8 targets for 31 yards and a receiving touchdown in the Saints' Week 8 win over the Vikings.

impact: The initial reason for Kamara's absence was unknown. An illness will not keep him out for Sunday's shootout with the Rams. Kamara is ready to go as a mid-range RB1.
report: Alvin Kamara was held out of Saints practice with an illness on Thursday.

impact: Kamara was under the weather on Thursday but there was never any concern about his status for Week 9. Coming off a two-touchdown explosion last week in Minnesota, the reigning Offensive Rookie of the Year will be an upper-echelon RB1 Sunday when the Saints host the undefeated Rams.
report: Alvin Kamara (illness) returned to practice on Friday.

impact: His status was never in doubt. Kamara is our No. 7 running back for Week 9.
report: Alvin Kamara (illness) was removed from the Week 9 injury report.

impact: Kamara was cooking early in this game. Elusive as always, Kamara totaled 50 yards on the first two drives, capping both with touchdowns. The first was an 11-yard run in which he broke multiple touchdowns, and the second was a 16-yard catch in which he put a nice move on Lamarcus Joyner to get open. He added another one-yard score just before halftime, finishing the first half with 84 total yards and three scores. New Orleans’ offense fell into a lull in the second half, allowing the Rams back into the game, but Kamara got things back on track with a hurdling 17-yard gain to spark a field-goal drive in the fourth quarter and finished things off with a fourth-down conversion to run out the clock. Even with Mark Ingram back, Kamara now has six touchdowns in his last three games. He will be a high-end RB1 next week against the Bengals.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 19 times for 82 yards and two touchdowns and hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 34 yards and another score in the Saints' Week 9 win over the Rams.

impact: Kamara had rushing scores from four and one yard out, giving him his fifth game this season in which he's scored multiple touchdowns. With the Saints coasting, he and Mark Ingram shared more opportunities than previous weeks, but Kamara till dominated the snaps when the Saints where in scoring position. With 12 touchdowns now on the season, Kamara will be a set-and-forget option in Week 11 at home against the Eagles.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 12 times for 56 yards and two touchdowns while catching 4-of-5 targets for 46 yards in Sunday's Week 10 win over the Bengals.

impact: The Saints dominated this game, and Kamara certainly did his part on the ground, but his biggest play came on his only target. With the game already well in hand, the Saints decided to go for it on fourth down at the edge of field goal range. Lined up out wide, Kamara got a step on Malcolm Jenkins, caught a perfectly thrown pass from Drew Brees, and fought through a tackle attempt to get into the end zone. The score kept Kamara's now five-game scoring streak alive, and he has nine touchdowns over that span. He will be a good bet to add to that number against the Eagles on Thanksgiving.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 13 times for 71 yards and turned his only target into a 38-yard touchdown in the Saints' Week 11 win over the Eagles.

impact: It was the second straight week Kamara's seen just one target. This performance ends his previous five-game scoring streak as he failed to hit pay dirt for the first time since Week 5. Much like Michael Thomas (4/38), Kamara's volume has suffered of late since the Saints have dominated early in their last three games. With the Cowboys playing well since dealing for Amari Cooper, both of New Orleans' studs will likely return to form in what should be a competitive contest indoors against Dallas next Thursday night.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 14 times for 89 yards and hauled in his only target for another nine yards as the Saints steamrolled the Falcons in Week 12.

impact: The 72 yards from scrimmage were Kamara's fewest since Week 5, though the eight receptions were his most since Week 3. The Saints' offense was gasping for air against a Cowboys defense that came out swinging. There was a scary moment in the fourth quarter where Kamara took an obvious, unflagged helmet-to-helmet hit from Jaylon Smith. He was woozy but was ultimately cleared to return. Kamara should bounce back with a Week 14 rampage in Tampa Bay.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 11 times for 36 yards in the Saints' Week 13 loss to the Cowboys, adding eight receptions for 36 additional yards.

impact: Montgomery played close to the same amount of snaps as Jamaal Williams but saw 11 fewer touches. He wasn't higher than the No. 5 pass game option, with Geronimo Allison out targeting him. Montgomery could have some big weeks when the Packers are playing from behind, but he's hard to trust as a weekly fantasy option.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed two times for seven yards and caught 2-of-3 passes for 21 yards in Week 1 against Chicago.

impact: It was an improvement on the four touches Montgomery saw in Week 1, but he still has been mostly uninvolved through two weeks. More worryingly, Aaron Jones is due back from suspension in Week 3. Montgomery is not a must-roster player in standard scoring.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed five times for 31 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for nine yards in the Packers' Week 2 tie with the Vikings.

impact: With Aaron Rodgers' receivers struggling to make big plays, TyMont finally got involved as a pass catcher/outlet. Both his 10 touches and 64 yards led the Packers' three-man backfield. Especially with Randall Cobb struggling, the Pack figure to work on getting Montgomery more involved on a weekly basis. The Bills are an appetizing Week 4 matchup.
report: Ty Montgomery caught 6-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins, adding four carries for 16 additional yards.

impact: Most of Montgomery's yardage came when he got a free release down the left sideline for a 43-yard catch in the first quarter. The Pack's backfield remained a three-man rotation this afternoon, with Aaron Jones winning both the touch and yardage battles. Montgomery will continue to struggle for value outside of PPR leagues.
report: Ty Montgomery caught 2-of-3 targets for 56 yards in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills, adding five rushes for 18 additional yards.

impact: Montgomery got a ton of playing time in the second half with the Packers in catchup mode.  He has no fantasy value outside of deeper PPR leagues.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed four times for 15 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions, adding a 23-yard catch on three targets.

impact: He added two catches for 10 yards on three targets.  Montgomery capped the opening drive with a two-yard touchdown that originally credited as a passing score but later ruled a lateral.  Therefore, Montgomery got the "rushing" score.  Montgomery doesn't belong on fantasy rosters right now.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed four times for 12 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Montgomery's presence was only felt on special teams, where he committed what amounted to a game-ending fumble on a late kick return. Montgomery has only 14 offensive touches over the Packers' past three games, removing him from the fantasy radar.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed twice for six yards in the Packers' Week 8 loss to the Rams, adding a two-yard reception.

impact: The sometimes receiver has one of the league's most versatile skill-sets for a running back but was seeing limited work in the Packers' backfield, touching the ball just 41 times in seven contests. Montgomery had a few monster games over the past three years in Green Bay but also had trouble staying healthy. He will add a new element to a Ravens backfield that has traditionally had a receiving threat but not this season. TyMont is a massive upgrade on Buck Allen. The move comes just two days after a Montgomery special teams fumble cost the Packers dearly in Los Angeles. It also clears the deck for Aaron Jones in Green Bay.
report: Ravens acquired RB Ty Montgomery from the Packers in exchange for a 2020 seventh-round pick.

impact: Montgomery arrived earlier this week in a trade from Green Bay. It may take another week of practice reps before the Ravens are comfortable enough to insert him into a game setting. OG Bradley Bozeman (calf), RB Alex Collins (foot), CB Marlon Humphrey (thigh), S Tony Jefferson (hamstring), OG Alex Lewis (neck) and LB C.J. Mosley (thigh) are all active for Baltimore's Week 9 grudge match with Pittsburgh.
report: Ravens declared RB Ty Montgomery, QB Robert Griffin III, RT James Hurst, WR Jordan Lasley, LT Ronnie Stanley, TE Maxx Williams and OLB Tim Williams inactive for Week 9 against the Steelers.

impact: Montgomery was inactive after being acquired from the Packers on deadline day, but he has now had a bye week to learn the system. Even so, Harbaugh wants to see him on the practice field before he makes his decision. "I’m very confident he could go in and play, and play well, and he might," the coach said. "The next three days are going to be really important that way, because these are three specific practices toward actually what we’re going to run in the game, and I want to see what he looks like with that stuff." When he is up to speed, Montgomery should take over as the No. 2 back behind Alex Collins, a role which Javorius Allen rode to some fantasy success earlier this season.
report: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said practice will determine if Ty Montgomery is active this week.

impact: Sunday will mark his Baltimore debut. TyMont was a healthy scratch for Week 9 after the Ravens acquired him from Green Bay days earlier and Baltimore was on bye last week. He'll work as a receiving complement to early-down hammer Alex Collins. Montgomery's arrival in B-More will likely come at the expense of Javorius Allen.
report: Ty Montgomery is active for Week 11 against the Bengals.

impact: Buck Allen got one touch.  The Ravens took an extremely run-heavy approach and wound up settling on undrafted rookie Gus Edwards as their lead back.  Montgomery is unlikely to develop into a fantasy option down the stretch.
report: Ty Montgomery did not touch the ball in his Week 11 Ravens debut.

impact: Nearly all of TyMont's production including all eight of his carries came in the second half. His biggest gain of the afternoon came on a 15-yard burst, which set up a five-yard touchdown dash by Lamar Jackson early in the third quarter. Montgomery impressed as a change-of-pace/passing-down complement to power back Gus Edwards on Sunday, though his role will probably be scaled back when Alex Collins (foot) returns from injury. TyMont and the 6-5 Ravens will travel to Atlanta for a date with the Falcons in Week 13.
report: Ty Montgomery delivered 51 yards on eight carries while also securing three catches for 13 yards on three targets Sunday in the Ravens’ Week 12 win over Oakland.

impact: Montgomery's 55 yards from scrimmage were a new Ravens high after he gained 54 in Week 12. Kenneth Dixon mixed in for nine touches in his return, making Montgomery further volatile as a potential PPR FLEX option going forward.
report: Ty Montgomery caught 5-of-7 targets for 42 yards in the Ravens' Week 13 win over the Falcons, adding three carries for 13 additional yards.

impact: It was a nondescript night for Williams. He had a long run of 11 yards and fell out of the gameplan with the Packers airing it out in the second half. Williams is locked in as Green Bay's featured back for at least another week with Aaron Jones suspended, but he's going to face competition for carries when Jones returns.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed 15 times for 47 yards in Sunday night's Week 1 win over Chicago.

impact: Williams did not get much going against a tough defense, but he once again worked as the clear lead back ahead of Ty Montgomery. That could change moving forward, however, with Aaron Jones due back from suspension. Williams is a more reliable option in the passing game who had a two-week headstart on Jones, so he will likely retain the lead job. Even so, he will be a risky FLEX play next week in Washington.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed 16 times for 59 yards and hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 12 yards in the Packers' Week 2 tie with the Vikings.

impact: Williams got the start, but Aaron Jones drew as many touches in his 2018 debut. Jones out-gained Williams 47-45. Ty Montgomery out-produced both (64). Jones looked cannon shot whenever he was asked to change the pace. Williams' pass protection is going to keep him on the field, but the Packers — who need play-making targets — figure to start looking Jones and Ty Montgomery's way more and more. Williams' RB2 candidacy is on thin ice. The Pack host the Bills in Week 4.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed five times for 29 yards in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins, adding two receptions for 16 additional yards.

impact: Williams wasn't targeted in the passing game. Williams once again got the "start," but was once again out-gained by Aaron Jones, this time handily (82-27). Jones scored the Packers' lone ground touchdown. Williams is now averaging 3.44 yards per carry compared to 6.29 for Jones. The Pack like Williams' pass protection, but that production gulf can only go on for so long. Williams won't be a recommended FLEX against the Lions in Week 5.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed 11 times for 27 yards in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills.

impact: He added two catches for 19 yards on four targets.  Williams and Aaron Jones (seven carries, two catches) essentially split the run-down work, but the Packers fell behind big on the scoreboard and were down 24-0 at halftime.  It was mostly Ty Montgomery after the break.  Williams has been a big disappointment through five weeks.  Jones should get more chances to earn increased snaps moving forward.  Williams will be a low-upside RB3 next week against the 49ers.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed six times for 33 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: He caught a 10-yard pass on three targets.  Pedestrian as they come, Williams is good for a handful of carries for about 30-40 yards per week.  Nothing more, nothing less.  He's averaged 29.5 yards with no touchdowns the last four games and shouldn't be owned in any format.  Aaron Jones started in this one but didn't set the world on fire with his eight carries for 41 yards.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed six times for 29 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Williams was once again comprehensively out-played by Aaron Jones, but he cashed in a one-yard goal line look on the Packers' second drive. Williams has just 127 yards rushing in five games since Jones came off suspension in Week 3. You need to do better than chasing Williams' one-off touchdowns in fantasy.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed four times for nine yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 8 loss to the Rams.

impact: Williams was the distant No. 2 back behind Aaron Jones. He got a few series, but Williams continues to get outplayed by Jones. He's just a touchdown-dependent change-of-pace.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed seven times for 34 yards in Week 9 against the Patriots.

impact: Williams took a backseat to Aaron Jones, who was finally let loose for 15/145/2. Williams' three carries were a season-low in what appears to be a passing-of-the-torch moment in Green Bay's backfield. Drop him if you haven't already.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed for three yards on just three carries in the Packers' Week 10 win over Miami.

impact: Aaron Jones was a near every-down player, further cementing his hostile takeover of the Packers' backfield. Williams has four touches over his past two games. He is safely droppable across the board.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed once for five yards in the Packers' Week 11 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Williams' touch counts were 1, 1, and 3 over his previous three games, so to say this came out of nowhere would be an understatement.  Williams has been a black hole nearly all season, and Aaron Jones has been on absolute fire.  In the end, the Packers got exactly what they deserved in an embarrassing 20-17 home loss to a terrible Cardinals team.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed seven times for 13 yards and caught 4-of-4 targets for 14 yards in Green Bay's Week 13 loss to Arizona.

impact: Foles fumbled, but the Eagles recovered. He also caught a 15-yard pass in a sequel to the Super Bowl's "Philly Special." Beyond that, Foles was completely unwatchable, but the Eagles somehow eked out a victory. Foles had no one to throw to but undershot a few deep balls. His interception was a late pass Dallas Goedert couldn't hold onto as he was immediately hit. Foles looked disturbingly similar to the pumpkin he was down the stretch last season before suddenly morphing into Steve Young for the NFC Championship Game and Super Bowl. With Carson Wentz (knee) looking unlikely to be cleared for Week 2, Foles will have an easier matchup in the Bucs.
report: Nick Foles completed 19-of-34 passes for 117 yards, zero touchdowns and an interception in the Eagles' 18-12, Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: OC Mike Groh said the team has already made their decision, and most reporters expect Nick Foles to once again get the nod. Foles struggled in the opener, throwing for just 117 yards while completing 56 percent of his throws, but he gets an easier matchup this week in Tampa Bay.
report: Eagles will announce their Week 2 starter at quarterback on Wednesday.

impact: Not a surprise at all, as Carson Wentz (knee) still has yet to be cleared for contact.  Foles was dreadful in the opener, going 19-of-34 for a measly 117 yards and an interceptions, but the Eagles still escaped with a win.  This is a good on-paper matchup, but Foles can't be trusted as more than a QB2.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Nick Foles will start Week 2 against the Bucs.

impact: Foles' efficiency looks decent on paper, but he gripped the ball too long in the pocket, took six sacks, and needed an entire half to get the offense moving against a bad defense.  Foles remains a high-end NFL backup, but he's obviously a severe downgrade from Carson Wentz.  ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Sunday that Wentz will have a real chance to return for Week 3 against the Colts.
report: Nick Foles completed 35-of-48 passes for 334 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 2 loss at Tampa Bay.

impact: It was a disappointing loss for the Eagles, but Wentz performed well in his second game back despite his receivers letting him down a few times. He consistently threw lasers from the pocket including on Alshon Jeffery's touchdown catch and looked healthy when on the move. With Minnesota's defense scuffling, Wentz will be in the QB1 conversation next week.
report: Carson Wentz completed 33-of-50 passes for 348 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles' Week 4, overtime loss to the Titans.

impact: The Eagles have opened the season slowly including a loss to the Titans in Wentz's second start last week, but the quarterback does not blame his surgically-repaired knee. "Physically, I feel great," Wentz said. "I feel I'm picking up [where I left off] on the field last year." Wentz did play extremely well in the loss, and he connected several times in that game with Alshon Jeffery, who was making his season debut. With those two healthy, the Eagles' offense will be just fine.
report: Carson Wentz said the "knee thing" is behind him.

impact: Wentz added five carries for 26 additional yards. Wentz's second quarter fumble provided the difference in the score, as a scarily-fast Linval Joseph housed it for a 64-yard touchdown. Otherwise, Wentz took another incremental step into the season, producing 300 yards and two scores for the second-straight game while posting an 8.89 YPA after entering the week with a 6.93 mark. Wentz could have had a better day but was hurt by some drops. Wentz is passing both the eye and box score tests. He will be a borderline QB1 for Thursday night's game with the Giants.
report: Carson Wentz completed 24-of-35 passes for 311 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles' 23-21, Week 5 loss to the Vikings, also losing a fumble.

impact: This one was an extended scrimmage for the Eagles, who dominated an overmatched Giants team from the opening whistle. The three-score effort was Wentz's first in four 2018 starts. Wentz showed excellent mobility, especially on his first touchdown. Wentz vacated the pocket and rolled to his right before throwing across his body to Alshon Jeffery in the end zone. After some rusty play in Weeks 3 and 4, Wentz has started to resemble his would-have-been-if-not-for-injury 2017 MVP self over the past two weeks. He has 10 days to rest up for a Week 7 matchup with the Panthers.
report: Carson Wentz completed 26-of-36 passes for 278 yards, three touchdowns and zero interceptions in the Eagles' 34-13, Week 6 demolition of the Giants.

impact: Wentz is working through a back injury, though it shouldn't prevent him from playing Sunday when the Eagles host Carolina. Coming off ACL surgery in 2017, the third-year signal-caller has played well this season, topping 300 yards passing in two of his last three games. He's worth firing up as a QB1 in Week 7.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Wentz was limited by a back injury to start the week but returned to full participation only a day later. He'll be in the QB1 discussion Sunday against Carolina.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was upgraded to full practice on Thursday.

impact: Wentz was very nearly perfect, but Cam Newton could not be stopped in the second half, and Philadelphia’s defense melted down after Doug Pederson’s offense built a 17-0 first-half lead. Wentz has played at a QB1-level in four straight games. Although his Week 8 matchup looks difficult on paper against Jacksonville in London, the Jaguars appear to be a crumbling team. Wentz will be a fringe fantasy starter.
report: Carson Wentz completed 30-of-37 passes for 310 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Wentz followed the same routine last week. He'll be fine for Sunday's game in London. Wentz will be in play as a back-end QB1 against Jacksonville.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Wentz was limited to start the week but he was back to full work at Thursday's session. Going against a suddenly vulnerable Jacksonville defense, Wentz will be in the QB1 discussion Sunday at Wembley Stadium.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Wentz had an eventful opening drive. He caught a batted-down pass and scampered for a third-down conversion, he converted another third down with a circus throw to Jordan Matthews, and then he lost a fumble on the very next play. The up-and-down play continued on the next drive when he marched the Eagles down the field only to throw a bad interception in the end zone, his first since Week 3. He settled down after that on his way to a big game. He found Dallas Goedert open deep down the middle of the field for a 32-yard score just before the break for his first score. His second touchdown was a much-easier screen pass to Wendell Smallwood, but Wentz converted two third downs on that drive. His final touchdown was a laser to Zach Ertz from five yards out to put the game out reach. Fully recovered from his injury, Wentz has been on fire over the last month. He will be a solid QB1 against the Cowboys following the bye.
report: Carson Wentz completed 21-of-30 passes for 286 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Eagles' Week 8 win over the Jaguars in London, adding 28 yards on the ground.

impact: The Eagles didn't even try to run in this one, with the 44 attempts Wentz's second most of the year. Wentz rebounded from an early pick, but couldn't rally the Eagles to a fourth quarter comeback. Both of his touchdowns came on red-zone throws to Zach Ertz. Wentz has been locked in with at least two TDs in six straight games. He gets a likely shootout with the Saints in Week 11.
report: Carson Wentz completed 32-of-44 passes for 360 yards with two touchdown and an interception in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Wentz entered this game on a hot streak, completing 71.6 percent of his passes with 14 touchdowns to just two interceptions over his previous six games, but he was completely shut down in this one. With the Saints blanketing his receivers, Wentz struggled to move the offense all game, and all three of his interceptions were essentially give-up throws deep down the field. Wentz should have better luck next week against the Giants, who he tossed three touchdowns against in Week 6.
report: Carson Wentz completed 19-of-33 passes for 156 yards, zero touchdowns, and three interceptions in the Eagles' Week 11, blowout loss to the Saints.

impact: Wentz hasn't looked limited since his return, but it's not a surprise he's still dealing with some lingering issues. Despite a career high completion percentage, Wentz's mechanics have been a little off. It's nothing to be concerned about, but Wentz may not be fully back until 2019.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Carson Wentz still isn't fully recovered from ACL surgery.

impact: Wentz connected with Zach Ertz for a 15-yard touchdown in the second quarter to start the comeback from 19-3 down.  Wentz hasn't done much for fantasy owners the last two weeks against the Saints and Giants in cupcake spots.  He'll be a back-end QB1 next week against the Redskins after Dak Prescott just lit Washington up for his best game of the year on Thursday.
report: Carson Wentz completed 20-of-28 passes for 236 yards and one touchdown in the Eagles' Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: This was as easy a win as they get in the NFL.  The Redskins were...wait for it...forced to turn to never-was and never-will-be Mark Sanchez at quarterback in this one after Colt McCoy broke his leg in the first half.  This was a game most were begging to just end.  Wentz's first touchdown was a short hookup to Golden Tate for the duo's first TD connection in four games.  The second passing score went to Wentz's BFF Jordan Matthews.  The 6-6 Eagles travel to Dallas for a must-win against the 7-5 Cowboys for the top spot in the NFC East next week.
report: Carson Wentz completed 27-of-39 passes for 306 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the Eagles' 28-13, Week 13 win over the Redskins.

impact: A dream fantasy scenario unfolded once the Chargers fell behind 14-3 in the first quarter. Rivers is a legendary comeback-mode predator. He did not disappoint despite the best efforts of his receivers, who committed some truly horrifying drops. Tyrell Williams and Travis Benjamin both bungled certain touchdowns, while Rivers missed Benjamin on another. It was a thoroughly Chargers game, from the mistakes to the garbage time. Rivers gets the Bills on the road in Week 2. That's a long road trip.
report: Philip Rivers completed 34-of-51 passes for 424 yards, three touchdowns and an interception in the Chargers' 38-28, Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: It was a near-perfect game from Rivers, who didn't face any resistance from an injured Buffalo secondary. Rivers threw a touchdown to Mike Williams on the opening drive, with his other two coming on checkdowns to Melvin Gordon. This was another cupcake matchup for Rivers after shredding the Chiefs in the opener, but he's been locked in to start the year. The Chargers have a matchup with the Rams in Week 3.
report: Philip Rivers completed 23-of-27 passes for 256 yards and three touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 2 win over Buffalo.

impact: Coming off a three touchdown performance against the Bills, Rivers had a tougher matchup with the Rams this week, but he was still able to put together a respectable fantasy performance. Both touchdown passes went to Mike Williams who appears to have taken a second-year leap after being sidelined with injuries as a rookie. Rivers and the Chargers have an opportunity to get back in the win column next Sunday at home against the 49ers.
report: Philip Rivers completed 18-of-30 passes for 226 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Rivers passed John Elway for the eighth-most career passing yards in league history during the close home win. All three of his touchdown passes went to non-receivers, which will frustrate Keenan Allen and Mike Williams' fantasy owners, but Melvin Gordon and Austin Ekeler's receiving production is helping Rivers fill the stat sheet. Through four games, Rivers is averaging 289 passing yards and 2.75 touchdowns. He will be a QB1 next week against the Raiders.
report: Philip Rivers completed 25-of-39 passes for 250 yards, three touchdowns, and one interception in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: It was an extremely efficient afternoon for Rivers, who totaled just five incompletions en route to his second 300-plus yard performance on the year. Both scores came on throws out to the flats, including one in which he bobbled the snap, quickly regrouped, and side-armed a laser in the direction of Austin Ekeler (7-59-1), who shuffled his way past two defenders and into the end zone. Keenan Allen's touchdown toll has taken a hit this season, but Rivers has still stood upright as a strong QB1 due in part to the added involvement of both Melvin Gordon and Ekeler in Los Angeles' passing attack. Rivers is currently averaging 299 yards and 2.6 touchdowns through five games this season. He'll be a strong QB1 again in Week 6 against the Browns.
report: Philip Rivers completed 22-of-27 passes for 339 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 5 victory over the Raiders.

impact: The 11 completions were the fewest in a game for Rivers since Week 16 of 2012. With the Chargers up big, he just wasn't needed as he attempted just five total passes in the second half on Sunday. Both of Rivers' scores went to Tyrell Williams in the second quarter. Rivers is having a tremendous start to the season with 15 touchdown passes to just three interceptions and will be in the lower-end QB1 mix next week in London versus the Titans.
report: Philip Rivers completed 11-of-20 passes for 207 yards with two touchdowns and one interception in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Rivers hit Tyrell Williams on a 75-yard bomb on the Chargers’ first play from scrimmage. Both of his touchdowns were 50-plus yards, with Mike Williams beating the Titans deep to open the second half. Rivers attempted only 26 passes but he's been a lot more efficient this year with a 17:3 TD/INT ratio. The Chargers are on bye next week, but Rivers will be in the lower-end QB1 mix against Seattle in Week 9.
report: Philip Rivers completed 19-of-26 passes for 306 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 7 win over the Titans.

impact: It was another low-volume day, but Rivers compensated by averaging at least 8.77 yards per attempt for the fourth-straight contest. Rivers has not attempted 30 passes in a game since Week 4 but has still managed to produce at least two scores every week out. His offense is outfitted with playmakers and running threats. Despite his light throwing workloads, Rivers will be a QB1 for Week 10 against the Raiders' expansion-level defense.
report: Philip Rivers completed 13-of-26 passes for 228 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' 25-17, Week 9 win over the Seahawks.

impact: This was not a highlight-reel game for Rivers, but he did enough against the Raiders’ barely-there offense. At the end of a quiet first half, Rivers led a quick scoring drive capped by an 11-yard touchdown to Keenan Allen to give the Chargers the lead. He had little to do with his next score as Melvin Gordon took a dump off, avoided two tacklers, and beat everyone down the field for a 66-yard touchdown, but it still counts. From that point, Rivers mostly turned around and handed off the ball. Rivers will face a tougher test next week against the Broncos, but he should also be asked to throw more.
report: Philip Rivers completed 18-of-26 passes for 223 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Chargers' Week 10 win over the Raiders.

impact: He took three sacks for a loss of 17 yards. Sunday marked the veteran's first multi-interception game of the season. His first pick came on a pass intended for Tyrell Williams while Von Miller came up with the second and almost took it back for a pick-six. Rivers' touchdown throws went to Keenan Allen and veteran tight end Antonio Gates, who had his best game of the season by far with five catches for 80 yards on seven targets. The 37-year-old NC State product made an inexplicable mistake late in the fourth quarter by throwing the ball away on third down instead of taking a sack, which would have kept the clock running. The incompletion essentially gave the Broncos a free timeout and allowed them to drive down the field for a game-winning field goal in the closing seconds. The loss snapped a six-game winning streak for the Bolts. They'll try to get back in the win column next week against the Cardinals.
report: Philip Rivers completed 28-of-43 passes for 401 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while losing four yards on his lone carry Sunday in the Chargers' Week 11 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Rivers has shown no signs of slowing down at age 36, delivering a career-best 112.1 quarterback rating over his 10 starts this year. The Chargers plan on picking up his $5 million roster bonus for next season and expect to have Rivers as their starter at least until the team moves into its new stadium in 2020. The Bolts are open to drafting a quarterback, who would likely sit until Rivers is ready to hang up his cleats. Rivers will make his 203rd consecutive start Sunday against Arizona.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, the Chargers envision Philip Rivers as their starter for the foreseeable future.

impact: Rivers had a perfect first half, completing all 19 of his attempts for 187 yards and two TDs. He tied an NFL record with 25 consecutive completions in style on a four-yard score to Keenan Allen. Rivers could have had a bigger game but was rested early in the fourth quarter. He's now had multiple touchdown passes in every game this season. Rivers gets a matchup with the Steelers on Sunday night in Week 13.
report: Philip Rivers completed 28-of-29 passes for 259 yards and three touchdowns in Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Rivers stayed hot after throwing 25 straight completions last week. He hit Travis Benjamin on a 46-yard bomb for his first touchdown, and later found Keenan Allen on a pass that was deflected in the end-zone. Rivers has shed his turnover-prone ways this year, throwing for 3,418 yards and a 28:6 TD/INT ratio through 12 games. He'll be a top-five quarterback play against Cincinnati's barely-there secondary in Week 14.
report: Philip Rivers completed 26-of-36 passes for 299 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 13 win over the Steelers.

impact: The 49ers had enough faith in Mullens to carry only two quarterbacks for a few weeks after Jimmy Garoppolo's injury, but they signed Tom Savage (lol) this week. It's apparently just an emergency measure. Mullens completed 31-of-43 (72 percent) for 396 yards (9.21 YPA), one touchdown and three interceptions during the preseason.
report: Second-year UDFA Nick Mullens remains the 49ers' No. 2 quarterback following the signing of Tom Savage.

impact: C.J. Beathard (wrist) is active, but he is only serving as the backup since he has had struggles gripping the football ahead of tonight's game. Mullens is a second-year UDFA out of Southern Mississippi, who's never thrown a pass in an NFL game before. In limited preseason action, Mullens completed 31-of-43 (72 percent) for 396 yards (9.21 YPA), one touchdown and three interceptions. All 49ers receiving weapons need to be slightly downgraded.
report: Nick Mullens will start in the 49ers Week 9 game against the Raiders on Thursday.

impact: Mullens came out of nowhere -- he wasn't even verified on Twitter before the game -- to throw three touchdowns while averaging 11.9 yards per attempt in his first NFL game. The 2017 undrafted quarterback out of Southern Miss found a wide open Pierre Garcon for his first career touchdown pass, but he then followed it up with darts to Kendrick Bourne and George Kittle for two more scores. Even if C.J. Beathard (wrist) is able to grip a football next week, it's fair to wonder if the 49ers stick with their secret weapon. San Francisco will have another easy matchup with the Giants on Monday Night Football in Week 10.
report: Nick Mullens completed 16-of-22 passes for 262 yards with three touchdowns in the 49ers' Week 9 win over the Raiders.

impact: "Yeah, definitely we’ll consider it," Shanahan said when asked about switching to Nick Mullens permanently. "Definitely not thinking about that right now, but our whole team played very well. Nick definitely did." Mullens wasn't verified on Twitter and had just two blurbs at Rotoworld prior to Thursday night, but was impeccable in his 16-of-22 performance and forced the Niners' hand at re-thinking their starter under center. C.J. Beathard has trended down of late, averaging a miserable 52.3% completion rate and scoring just two touchdowns in his last two games. Even if Beathard (wrist) is able to securely grip a football by Monday night, Mullens could logically receive another start (and thrive) under the lights given his 11.9 YPA in his debut.
report: Coach Kyle Shanahan isn't ready to name his starting quarterback for the Niners' Week 10 game against the Giants.

impact: The 49ers plan to wait until next week to announce their starter. Mullen had one of the better debuts in league history Thursday night, but it came against a barely-there Raiders defense. With C.J. Beathard trending down before his injury, the 49ers seem likely to stay with Mullen for another game. In a plus matchup with the Giants, Mullens is on the Week 10 streaming radar.
report: The Press Democrat reports Nick Mullens will "most likely" start Week 10 against the Giants.

impact: Let Mullens Mania commence. It will be the second-year UDFA's second-consecutive primetime start. We would caution that Mullens could not possibly be as good against the Giants as he was vs. the embarrassing, tanking, unwatchable Raiders, but the G-Men are almost as packed in as Oakland. With coach Kyle Shanahan calling the plays, Mullens will be worth a QB2 dice roll. We would consider the 49ers' quarterback situation week to week for the foreseeable future.
report: Nick Mullens will be the 49ers' Week 10 starter at quarterback against the Giants.

impact: Things didn't go nearly as swimmingly as they did for Mullens in his NFL debut last week against the Raiders.  The league got some tape on him, and the Giants, unlike the Raiders, got some pressure, even though Mullens wasn't sacked.  Both of Mullens' interceptions were on tipped balls by LB B.J. Goodson, so they weren't entirely the quarterback's fault.  He still was able to move the ball with decent success, but Matt Breida on the ground was the star of the offense in this one.  Mullens' score was an 11-yard hookup to Breida, who made a nice grab at the goal line.  The Niners head on their bye week and will host the Bucs in Week 12.  We'd guess it'll be Mullens again.
report: Nick Mullens completed 27-of-39 passes for 250 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the 49ers' 27-23, Week 10 loss to the Giants.

impact: That means Mullens will be the starter coming out of the 49ers' Week 11 bye when they visit Tampa Bay. The second-year UDFA took advantage of the tanking Raiders in his debut two weeks ago, and he played well enough on Monday to keep the job over C.J. Beathard. In total, Mullens has completed 70% of his passes for 512 yards with four touchdowns and two interceptions.
report: Coach Kyle Shanahan said Nick Mullens will continue to be the 49ers' starting quarterback until he says otherwise.

impact: Taking four sacks, Mullens continued to have the same happy feet in the pocket he showed in San Francisco's pre-bye loss to the Giants.  This contributed to Mullens' inaccuracy, and he committed multiple turnovers for the second straight start.  We would not be surprised if coach Kyle Shanahan reconsidered his quarterback situation entering Week 13 against the Seahawks.  The 49ers invested a third-round pick into C.J. Beathard and nothing into Mullens.
report: Nick Mullens completed just 18-of-32 passes for 221 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the 49ers' Week 12 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Mullens completed just 18-of-32 passes against the worst defense in the league and led the offense to just one touchdown. It is his second lackluster start in a row, and it is possible this one results in C.J. Beathard returning to the starting role. "I evaluate it every week, honestly," Shanahan said of the quarterback position. "There’s no difference with that and I’ll continue to do that with every position on our team for the next five weeks." Even if he keeps the starting job, Mullens will not be a fantasy option this week in Seattle.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Nick Mullens did not play "very well" Week 12 against the Bucs.

impact: Mullens figures to have a much tighter leash this time around after regressing in back-to-back starts against the Giants and then at the Bucs after his coming out party game against the Raiders in Week 9.  Mullens 45-of-71 (63.3%) for 471 yards (6.63 YPA) with two touchdowns and four picks the last two weeks.  C.J. Beathard is healthy and ready to roll should Mullens again flop in Seattle.
report: Coach Kyle Shanahan announced Nick Mullens will start Week 13 at the Seahawks.

impact: A week after busting against the Bucs, Mullens was able to consistently move the ball in Seattle even if garbage time helped pad his numbers. After hooking up with Dane Pettis for 77 yards and a touchdown last week, Mullens found the rookie for 129 yards and both of his touchdowns in this one. Pettis did much of the hard work on both scores, but Mullens threw a nice pass on the 75 yarder. He did throw a pick-six when the 49ers looked headed for a touchdown in the fourth quarter, but this was overall a solid display. Despite this surprising showing, Mullens will not be anything more than a two-quarterback option next week against the Broncos.
report: Nick Mullens completed 30-of-48 passes for 414 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the 49ers' Week 13 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: The Niners are grasping at straws after losing Jimmy Garoppolo (ACL).   One of the least-mobile quarterbacks in modern NFL history, Savage failed to make the Saints' 53-man roster in training camp.  C.J. Beathard will be the 49ers' starter for the foreseeable future, unless of course he plays his way out of it.
report: The 49ers are working out free agent Tom Savage.

impact: The 49ers were already working out Savage, so this isn't too surprising. Garafolo and NFL Media's Jim Trotter believe a veteran quarterback won't be signed this week, however, because the 49ers need the roster spots to fill other positions. Whoever ends up signing will be C.J. Beathard's backup to start. Savage has more career interceptions than touchdowns and has a 5.7 adjusted YPA. There's no way that Savage is the best free agent quarterback available.
report: According to NFL Network's Mike Garafolo, free agent Tom Savage is considered the "favorite" of veteran quarterbacks to sign with the 49ers.

impact: C.J. Beathard has played well since taking over the starting job, but the 49ers would like some more insurance behind him with Nick Mullens currently filling the No. 2 spot. According to Maiocco, Tom Savage is the favorite for the job, but Matt Simms is also in the mix.
report: NBC Sports Bay Area's Matt Maiocco reports the 49ers want to add a third quarterback to the roster.

impact: Considering the reckless nature of Beathard's game, Savage could certainly see snaps. Second-year UDFA Nick Mullens is the other quarterback on the roster.
report: 49ers signed QB Tom Savage.

impact: Savage lasted four days with the 49ers. It's possible he'll be re-signed after this week. With Jimmie Ward (hamstring) doubtful, the 49ers promoted DB Tyvis Powell to the active roster.
report: 49ers waived QB Tom Savage.

impact: Savage returns as depth behind C.J. Beathard.
report: 49ers re-signed QB Tom Savage.

impact: It means C.J. Beathard (wrist) will be good to go against the Raiders on Thursday evening.
report: 49ers waived QB Tom Savage.

impact: Savage has been cut twice in the last two weeks. The 49ers had an open roster spot after placing Raheem Mostert and CB Emmanuel Moseley on IR. Savage will continue to serve as the No. 3 quarterback
report: 49ers re-signed QB Tom Savage.

impact: This is a potentially bad sign for Andy Dalton's (thumb) chances of starting against the Broncos in Week 13.  If Dalton can't go, athletic but erratic Jeff Driskel would get the start.  Driskel is basically a poor man's Josh Allen.
report: Bengals claimed QB Tom Savage off waivers from the 49ers.

impact: Beathard did not officially record a stat, but he threw a beautiful pass to George Kittle in the end zone which was negated by a spurious offensive pass interference call. With Garoppolo likely looking at an ACL tear, Beathard is in line to take over the 49ers' starting job. He averaged 237 yards with three touchdowns and five interceptions in five starts last season.
report: C.J. Beathard replaced Jimmy Garoppolo (knee) in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Beathard wasn't so bad in the game with Kyle Shanahan only asking his quarterback to attempt two passes 20+ yards down the field. The 49ers might be able to dink-and-dunk their way down the field like they did today, but it's tough to imagine this offense being explosive with Beathard and a below average receiving group. He averaged 237 yards and only had three total touchdowns in five starts last season.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 23-of-37 passes for 298 yards, two touchdowns, and two interceptions in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Beathard was also sacked four times for a loss of 49 yards. After playing surprisingly well in last week's loss to the Chargers, Beathard took a noticeable step back against the Cardinals. He was a turnover machine, throwing a pair of interceptions while also losing two fumbles. One of those fumbles was returned for a 23-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter, which essentially sealed the victory for Arizona. The 24-year-old benefited from garbage time, logging over 200 passing yards with San Francisco trailing in the second half. His lone rushing score came on a one-yard QB sneak. Outside of two-quarterback leagues, Beathard won't be someone fantasy owners can rely on next week at Green Bay.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 34-of-54 passes for 349 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while adding two carries for seven yards and another touchdown Sunday in the Niners’ Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Beathard played so well for 58 minutes of this one.  He had a near-perfect passer rating and was carving up a banged-up Packers secondary, but a late interception with 1:07 left and the game tied at 30-30 set Aaron Rodgers up at his own 10-yard line.  The magic then happened, as Rodgers dropped dimes for 46 yards passing with a 21-yard scramble to finish the comeback.  Beathard's game can't go overlooked, though.  He threw 67- and 30-yard touchdowns to Marquise Goodwin, who roasted Kentrell Brice and Tramon Williams on each.  Beathard also showed big guts and toughness with 21 rushing yards, diving headfirst for first downs.  This was one of the most entertaining games of the year.
