Beathard will do battle with the Rams in Santa Clara in Week 7.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 16-of-23 passes for 245 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the 49ers' 33-30, Week 6 loss to the Packers on Monday night.

impact: Beathard had a rough first half, turning the ball over twice including a lost fumble and failing to complete a pass to a receiver. He did find George Kittle for several big plays, however, including a 10-yard touchdown with just 10 seconds left to at least give the 49ers a chance. Unfortunately for San Francisco, he could not build on that drive in the second half, and he tossed another interception on a pass thrown slightly behind Kittle in the third quarter. Beathard has to take some blame for the showing, but he was constantly under pressure and ended up taking seven sacks. The road will not get any easier in Arizona against an underrated defense next week.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 15-of-27 passes for 170 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: It's the second consecutive game Beathard's failed to eclipse 200 yards, and he's done so in cush matchups (Rams, at Cardinals). He's only trended down since exploding out of the gates in place of Jimmy Garoppolo due in part to constant injuries among the Niners' receiving corps and offensive line. With trade rumors circling Pierre Garcon, Beathard could take to the field Thursday with Marquise Goodwin, Kendrick Bourne, and Trent Taylor in three-wide sets. He'll still be a serviceable streamer in Week 9 against the Raiders.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 14-of-28 passes for 190 yards and one score in the 49ers' Week 8 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Per coach Kyle Shanahan, Beathard is struggling to hold the ball. Shanahan believes Beathard would be ready were the 49ers playing on Sunday, so it's not a major injury, just an ill-timed one. Second-year UDFA Nick Mullens would get the call if Beathard can't go. Tom Savage is the nuclear third option.
report: C.J. Beathard (wrist) is uncertain for Thursday's game against the Raiders.

impact: He's been listed as DNP the last two days and is in real question for Thursday night against the Raiders.  If Beathard is unable to play, second-year UDFA Nick Mullens would likely draw the start over Tom Savage.
report: C.J. Beathard (wrist) did not practice Tuesday.

impact: If Beathard is unable to go, it'll be Nick Mullens under center for the Niners.  Beathard hasn't practiced this week and was struggling to grip the ball due to the injury.  If Mullens starts, the Niners don't have a prayer.
report: Coach Kyle Shanahan said C.J. Beathard (wrist) will be a game-time decision for Thursday night's Week 9 tilt against the Raiders.

impact: Coach Kyle Shanahan called Beathard a game-time decision. Beathard was limited in the 49ers' walkthrough on Wednesday, putting him on track to play despite the short week. The 49ers would be forced to start Nick Mullens if Beathard sits.
report: The Athletic's Matt Barrows expects C.J. Beathard (questionable, wrist) to play in Week 9 against the Raiders.

impact: Gordon steamrolled what had been a stout run defense to the tune of 7.06 yards per carry. Gordon was breaking into the open field on nearly every rush. The hamstring issue that held him out in Week 7 was ancient history. Gordon has now cleared 100 yards from scrimmage in 5-of-7 appearances. He has the sort of matchup dreams are made of in the embarrassing, tanking, given-up-on-the-season Raiders in Week 10.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 16 times for 113 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 9 win over the Seahawks, adding a 10-yard reception.

impact: Gordon looked like he might bust in a great spot early in this game, but he started to get things cooking in the second quarter before blowing the game open on the first drive of the second half. After catching a dump off from Philip Rivers, Gordon made two defenders miss and beat everyone else to the end zone for a 66-yard touchdown. He was mostly unstoppable from that point on, and he stacked rushing yardage as the Chargers ran down the clock late. With a great matchup against the Broncos on deck, Gordon will remain a high-end RB1.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 18 times for 93 yards and hauled in 5-of-6 targets for 72 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 10 win over the Raiders.

impact: Gordon was mostly stymied in the run game, averaging a meager 3.8 yards per carry on his 18 totes. He excelled as a pass-catcher, however, topping 80 yards receiving for the second time this season. Gordon did his best Beast Mode impression on a spectacular 32-yard catch-and-run during the second quarter, shedding multiple tacklers en route to his biggest gain of the afternoon. Sunday snapped a seven-game touchdown streak for the fourth-year ball-carrier. He'll look to start a new streak next week when the Chargers host Arizona.
report: Melvin Gordon chipped in with 69 yards on 18 carries while also producing six catches for 87 yards on six targets Sunday in Los Angeles’ Week 11 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Gordon injured his hamstring about a month ago, but it's not an issue anymore. Coming off a 156-yard outburst in Week 11, Gordon should shred against the Cardinals on Sunday.
report: Melvin Gordon (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Gordon got in a limited week of practice. Despite the questionable listing, he's not in danger of missing Sunday's home game. He'll be a top-shelf RB1 in a great matchup.
report: Melvin Gordon (hamstring) is questionable for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Gordon's hamstring issues resurfaced this week, but coach Anthony Lynn suggested his knee injury is the bigger concern. The Chargers limited him in practice the last two days, putting his status up in the air. There's a chance the Chargers hold him out in a game they don't need Gordon to win. Austin Ekeler will be a plug-and-play RB2 if Gordon sits.
report: Melvin Gordon (questionable, hamstring/knee) is a game-time decision for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: There was some thought Gordon would sit out for maintenance purposes against an inferior opponent, but apparently he convinced the coaching staff to let him play. Even at less than 100 percent, Gordon will be a must-start in a can't-miss home matchup against the Cardinals. Austin Ekeler would have been an enticing RB2/low-cost DFS play had Gordon not played, but obviously it wasn't in the cards.
report: According to ESPN's Adam Schefter, Melvin Gordon (questionable, hamstring/knee) "plans" to play Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Gordon isn't 100 percent but was able to convince the coaching staff to let him play. He's in a great spot against the Cardinals but could be at risk of in-game resting if the Chargers pull away early.  The Chargers inactives are CB Trevor Williams, CB Jeff Richards, DE Chris Landrum, C Cole Toner, OT Trent Scott, OG Forrest Lamp, and NT Brandon Mebane.
report: Melvin Gordon (hamstring, knee) is active for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Gordon was leg whipped by Cardinals DE Robert Nkemdiche on a third-quarter reverse. He came into Sunday's game with knee and hamstring injuries, so it'd be surprising if the Chargers let him back in. Gordon totaled 66 yards and two touchdowns before exiting. Austin Ekeler should close out the rest of the game.
report: Melvin Gordon left Week 12 against the Cardinals with a knee injury.

impact: Williams did not report if it is a tear or a sprain -- we know, a sprain is a tear -- which will significantly affect the timetable. That said, it is unlikely Gordon will be ready to face the Steelers next Sunday night. That would leave Austin Ekeler and Justin Jackson to carry the load in the Chargers' backfield.
report: ESPN's Eric Williams reports Melvin Gordon suffered an MCL injury Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: It is certainly not the worst-case scenario, but it is a tough blow for fantasy teams which have ridden Gordon into the playoffs. MCL sprains are usually at least two-week injuries, and it would not be surprising if the Chargers gave Gordon extra time to make sure he is ready for the playoffs. Austin Ekeler should be added in the around 30 percent of leagues he is available, and Justin Jackson is worth adding in deeper leagues.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Melvin Gordon will miss "the next few weeks" with a Grade 2 MCL sprain.

impact: Gordon will miss this week's game trip to Pittsburgh and almost certainly Week 14 against the Bengals. It's entirely possible he's sidelined for the remainder of the regular season, though that does not appear to be the most likely outcome right now. Austin Ekeler will lead the Chargers' committee in Gordon's absence with seventh-round rookie Justin Jackson mixing in.
report: The Chargers have confirmed that Melvin Gordon is dealing with an MCL sprain and is week to week.

impact: Gordon didn't get in any practice work this week and was always a long shot to suit up after sustaining an MCL sprain Sunday against Arizona. Austin Ekeler will lead the backfield in his absence and makes for a solid RB2 play across all fantasy formats. Consider Gordon week-to-week.
report: Melvin Gordon (knee) is out for Week 13 against the Steelers.

impact: Gordon is viewed as "truly week to week." Getting cleared for next Sunday may be a stretch, but the Chargers expect him to return no later than Week 15. Austin Ekeler will start for however long Gordon's sidelined, with rookie Justin Jackson mixing in.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Melvin Gordon (knee) could return for Week 14 against the Bengals.

impact: Gordon is still nursing a sprained MCL he suffered in Week 12. We're not expecting him back for Sunday's game against Cincy. Austin Ekeler drew the start in his absence last week but was vastly outplayed by seventh-round rookie Justin Jackson. It should be closer to an even split in Week 14.
report: Melvin Gordon (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: They cut Detrez Newsome in a corresponding move.  The Bolts will move forward with seventh-round rookie Jackson and Austin Ekeler behind Melvin Gordon.
report: Chargers promoted RB Justin Jackson from their practice squad.

impact: Jackson was held without a carry in the first half. He stole the show after halftime, helping fuel the Chargers to a comeback win. Jackson's night was highlighted on an explosive go-ahead 18-yard touchdown late in the fourth quarter. Melvin Gordon has a chance to return against the Bengals, but Jackson should be this week's top waiver add.
report: Justin Jackson rushed eight times for 63 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 13 win over the Steelers.

impact: It suggests Melvin Gordon (hamstring) is on the wrong side of questionable. Newsome would be the No. 3 back behind Austin Ekeler and Justin Jackson if Gordon is ruled out.
report: Chargers signed RB Detrez Newsome from the practice squad.

impact: The 126 yards from scrimmage were a new career high. The Chargers were intent on featuring Ekeler and Melvin Gordon as pass catchers against the Chiefs' suspect linebacker corps. The mission was accomplished. Ekeler is still little more than an RB5/handcuff for fantasy purposes, though he would be an instant RB2 were Gordon to go down with injury.
report: Austin Ekeler caught 5-of-5 targets for 87 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs, adding five carries for 39 additional yards.

impact: Ekeler was heavily involved for the second straight week. His touches were inflated with Melvin Gordon checking out with an injury in the fourth quarter, but it's becoming clear the Chargers have a role for Ekeler in their weekly gameplan. Ekeler is on the radar as a PPR FLEX for Week 3 against the Rams.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed 11 times for 77 yards and caught three passes for 21 yards in Week 2 against Buffalo.

impact: The Chargers have given Ekeler a small, defined role in the offense, and he is certainly making the most of his opportunities. Through three games, the change-of-pace back is averaging 8.15 yards per carry and 12 yards per reception. Ekeler is a weak PPR FLEX for Week 4 against the 49ers, but he would be an instant RB2 if Gordon ever misses time.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed four times for 44 yards and caught all three of his targets for 24 yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: The Chargers have been giving Ekeler some looks every week behind Melvin Gordon, and he's been able to make the most of them. Today, Ekeler hauled in a 22-yard touchdown on a beautiful pass from Philip Rivers to save his fantasy day. It's nothing special, but Ekeler is a low-end FLEX option during the bye week season in 12-team leagues.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed eight times for 25 yards but caught 2-of-3 targets for 31 yards and touchdown in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Ekeler continued his 70-30 timeshare with teammate Melvin Gordon Sunday, being out-touched 23-7 on the day. Ekeler's carries primarily occurred in the team's final drive with the game already put to bed. His lone score was a terrific effort from both he and Philip Rivers, the latter who quickly recouped after bobbling the initial snap, looked to his right, and fired a laser to Ekeler, who broke ankles on his way into the end zone, in the flats. This performance puts Ekeler on pace for a standalone valuable 108-649 rushing and 44-662-9 receiving year.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed six times for 15 yards, additionally scampering for a 44-yard touchdown catch in the Chargers' Week 5 win over the Raiders.

impact: This was the first game in which Ekeler wasn't targeted in the passing game, but the Chargers threw just five passes in the second half. Ekeler is now averaging a gaudy 6.4 yards per carry now on the season in relief of Melvin Gordon. He will enter Week 7 as a FLEX option when the Chargers face the Titans in London.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed seven times for 60 yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Ekeler got the start with Melvin Gordon out. This was one of his worse games of the year despite the expanded role. The Chargers scored both of their touchdowns on deep shots, so there wasn't a ton of red-zone opportunities for Ekeler. With Los Angeles on a bye, Ekeler looks destined to resume a change-up role in Week 9.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed 12 times for 42 yards and caught 5-of-7 passes for 26 yards in the  Chargers' Week 7 win over the Titans.

impact: The 34 yards from scrimmage were Ekeler's fewest of the season. Ekeler is usually going to get more than four touches, but he has plateaued behind Melvin Gordon, struggling to offer standalone FLEX value. He does have a gorgeous setup for Week 10, when there should be quarters of garbage time against the Raiders.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed three times for 21 yards in the Chargers' Week 9 win over the Seahawks, adding a 13-yard reception.

impact: After not touching the ball in the first half, Ekeler looked like he had saved his fantasy day with just one play, but his 42-yard touchdown was called back because of a holding call. Ekeler has now touched the ball just seven times in the last two games. He is just a handcuff at this point.
report: Austin Ekeler carried the ball three times for 19 yards in the Chargers' Week 10 win over the Raiders.

impact: Ekeler saw 16 fewer touches than teammate Melvin Gordon, but obviously he made the most of his limited workload. Both of his catches came during the fourth quarter. Ekeler didn't re-enter the game after suffering a minor injury on special teams, though he remained on the sidelines with his helmet, suggesting he could have gone back in if needed. Assuming he's healthy, the second-year Western State product will face the Cardinals at home in Week 12.
report: Austin Ekeler rolled up 29 yards on six carries while also snagging two catches for 40 yards on two targets Sunday in Los Angeles’ Week 11 loss to Denver.

impact: Ekeler suffered the injury while playing special teams in last week's loss to Denver. His presence at Wednesday's practice, albeit in a limited capacity, suggests he'll be ready to go Sunday against the Cardinals. The 23-year-old is one of the league's better handcuffs, but with Melvin Gordon working ahead of him, his fantasy prospects are limited.
report: Austin Ekeler (neck) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ekeler was limited to start the week but was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice. His status for Sunday was never in doubt. Melvin Gordon (hamstring) is expected to play through his questionable tag, but in the off chance that he doesn't, Ekeler would be employable as an RB2 in all formats.
report: Austin Ekeler (neck) wasn't listed on the Chargers' final injury report for Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: It's a monster game from Ekeler, though most of his rushing production came in the second half. He scored a goal-line TD after Melvin Gordon left in the third quarter. Ekeler wasn't limited by the next injury that cost him practice time this week. He would have plug-and-play RB2 value if Gordon misses time.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed five times for 35 yards and a touchdown and caught 10-of-11 targets for 68 yards in Week 12 against the Cardinals.

impact: Ekeler played through the injury last week and totaled 103 yards (35 rushing, 68 receiving) in a win over Arizona. With Melvin Gordon (MCL) slated to miss Sunday night's game in Pittsburgh, Ekeler will be a worthy RB2 play for the final week of the fantasy regular season.
report: Austin Ekeler (neck) is practicing in full for Week 13 against the Steelers.

impact: Ekeler got the start with Melvin Gordon sidelined. He had just eight carries for one yard in the first half but found some success in the pass game. Ekeler was outplayed by Justin Jackson, who totaled 72 yards and a touchdown. Even if Gordon doesn't return next week, Ekeler figures to take a backseat to Jackson.
report: Austin Ekeler had 13 carries for 21 yards and caught 5-of-8 targets for 21 yards in Week 14 against the Steelers.

impact: Rodgers has been critical of the Packers' offense this year, calling the team's play in last week's win over Buffalo "not acceptable." There have been rumblings of a rift between Rodgers and his head coach, but Murphy isn't buying it. "I think they've had a great relationship," said Murphy. "The most important thing, they both want the same thing—they want us to win and obviously score as many points as possible." Part of the problem for Green Bay is that their receiving corps has been running on fumes with injuries to Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion, hamstring), among others. Luckily Rodgers' health has improved significantly as the two-time MVP was finally removed from the injury report this week after struggling with knee issues early in the year.
report: Packers CEO and president Mark Murphy downplayed the tension between Aaron Rodgers and coach Mike McCarthy.

impact: He added 10 rushing yards on three attempts and also lost a pair of fumbles on strip-sacks.  The Packers fell in a huge hole early in the game and pretty much had to abandon the run game by the second quarter.  With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison out and injured for this one, Rodgers was working with Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Equanimeous St. Brown behind Davante Adams.  The rookies had some trouble getting open and staying on the same page with Rodgers, who was visibly frustrated at times.  Adams piled up 140 yards and a touchdown as the lead dog.  Rodgers gets to feast on the 49ers at Lambeau Field next Monday night.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 32-of-52 passes for 442 yards and three touchdowns in the Packers' 31-23, Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: The Pack are resting Rodgers as much as possible. He will be an elite QB1 against the 49ers.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) was held out of Thursday's practice.

impact: Rodgers had a setback with his knee injury, but it was never going to keep him out this week. He's one of the top quarterback plays for a matchup with the 49ers.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) was upgraded to a full practice Friday.

impact: To borrow the words from ESPN analyst Jason Witten, Rodgers pulled a "rabbit out of his head" in the incredible fourth-quarter comeback.  (Yes, Witten said head.)  Rodgers and the Packers came out piping hot to open the game, with 60- and 54-yard completions to Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Jimmy Graham, respectively.  49ers DC Robert Saleh started dialing up the blitzes the rest of the way, causing Rodgers serious problems much of the second, third, and fourth quarters, but Rodgers turned it up and absolutely diced the Niners in the final two-plus minutes with a 16-yard touchdown strike to Davante Adams to tie the game at 30-30.  (Witten used the rabbit reference here.)  Rodgers then got the ball back at his own 10-yard line with 1:07 left and threw for 46 yards and added a 21-yard run to give Mason Crosby a walkoff 27-yard field goal for the win.  The Packers are now on their bye ahead of a gargantuan Week 8 date in L.A. with the Rams.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 25-of-46 passes for 425 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' 33-30, Week 6 comeback win over the 49ers on Monday night.

impact: Rodgers came up a bit slowly after one sack on Monday night, but he otherwise has not looked troubled by his injured knee the last couple games, suggesting he is nearing full health. The brace has not been a hindrance for Rodgers, who has thrown for 867 yards with five touchdowns and zero interceptions the last two games.
report: Aaron Rodgers told reporters he hopes to shed his knee brace following the bye week.

impact: Rodgers is as healthy as he's been all year. He's a top-three quarterback play for Sunday's projected shootout with the Rams.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) is practicing in full for Week 8.

impact: Rodgers should have had a 300-yard day, but a devastating Ty Montgomery kickoff fumble with 1:56 remaining robbed him of a comeback attempt. Rodgers had the two minutes and a timeout to work with as the Pack eyed flipping a 29-27 Rams lead. Rodgers also should have had a two-score day, but Jimmy Graham was narrowly taken down at the one in the first half. Even as he's battled knee issues and receiver injuries, Rodgers has played genuinely elite football all year. The Packers are headed to New England for Sunday Night Football in Week 9.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 18-of-30 passes for 286 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' 29-27, Week 8 loss to the Rams.

impact: Rodgers has been playing through the injury all year. There's no concern about his status for Sunday's game in Foxboro.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: This will be our last Rodgers practice blurb until something changes. He's a top-three option for Week 9 against the Patriots.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Rodgers played without a knee brace for the first time since Week 1. He struggled to move the offense for most of the night, with his touchdowns coming on goal-line throws to Davante Adams and Jimmy Graham. Rodgers is on pace for 5,084 yards and a 30:1 TD/INT ratio at the season’s halfway point, so he's due for some positive touchdown progression. He’ll remain a locked-in QB1 for Week 10 against Miami.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 24-of-43 passes for 259 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' Week 9 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Both touchdown tosses went to Davante Adams, who's now tallied nine scores on the year. The Packers' passing attack admittedly appeared shaky at times, but it wasn't needed on this day. Aaron Jones led the way with 15/145/2 on the ground, allowing Rodgers and crew to coast for most of the afternoon. There will be better days ahead for Rodgers, who's now on pace for 4,872 yards and a 30:1 TD:INT ratio. He remains a matchup-proof QB1 in Seattle in Week 11.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 19-of-28 passes for 199 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' Week 10 walk in the park over the Dolphins.

impact: Rodgers played a perfect first half — the highlights, including a 54-yard, cross-body touchdown to "Robert Tonyan," are worth checking out — but the Packers fell apart after the break. Coach Mike McCarthy was dialing up truly awful play-calling, with long-developing third down plays that resulted in sacks the favorite. Rodgers also made a few decisions he will want back. The talk will be McCarthy's job status. Struggling more than ever this season, McCarthy was straight bad this evening, botching play calls, wasting timeouts and choosing to punt back to the Seahawks with four minutes remaining even though the Pack's defense was injury ravaged and running on fumes. At 4-5-1, the Pack are in grave trouble in the NFC North. They are headed to Minnesota for Week 12.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 21-of-30 passes for 332 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' 27-24, Week 11 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: This was the worst game of the season for Rodgers, who was under countless pressures and took four sacks. The Packers' play calling continued to put them in bad spots, and Rodgers rarely had time to go through his progressions. Rodgers' only touchdown came on a timing route to Davante Adams in the first quarter. The Packers are out of playoff contention with the loss. Rodgers will look to rebound against the Cardinals in Week 13.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 17-of-28 passes for 198 yards and a touchdown in Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: He rushed three times for 20 yards and averaged an anemic 4.7 yards per attempt.  Rodgers took only one sack, but he faced consistent pressure from Arizona's underrated pass rush and got nothing going in the deep passing game.  Despite Rodgers dropping back to pass 51 times, the Packers didn't record a single 20-yard reception.  In a stumbling offense, Rodgers has been among fantasy football's biggest 2018 disappointments.  Even in a Week 14 home game versus Atlanta, Rodgers must be downgraded to a boom-bust QB1 throwing to day-three rookie receivers in an archaic offense with come-and-go pass protection.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 31-of-50 passes for 233 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 13 loss to Arizona.

impact: His decision will be Baker Mayfield.
report: Coach Hue Jackson will meet with the team Monday to announce his decision on the Browns' starting quarterback.

impact: This has been the expectation all along. The decision for coach Hue Jackson was a fairly easy one as the reigning Heisman Trophy winner looked miles better than Tyrod Taylor in Thursday's victory over the Jets. It appears Taylor will be able to clear the concussion protocol in time for next week's game at Oakland but he'll be holding the clipboard for Mayfield. The No. 1 overall pick is ready to slot in as an every-week starter in two-quarterback leagues, with room to grow in standard.
report: Mary Kay Cabot of the Cleveland Plain Dealer reports Baker Mayfield will be named the Browns' starting quarterback on Monday.

impact: "Baker understands there's still a lot of work to do," Jackson said. "But I think he can handle it. He's demonstrated that." He would have been able to handle it Week 1, but better late than never. Mayfield getting the nod is a big upgrade for the entire passing game. Tyrod Taylor (concussion) will serve as the backup once he is healthy.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson named Baker Mayfield the starting quarterback.

impact: He added four rushes for ten yards.  One of Mayfield's picks was innocous, getting inercepted by Raiders S Reggie Nelson at the end of regulation.  Otherwise, Mayfield consistently kept Cleveland's offense on the move despite getting very little help from his pass catchers.  Antonio Callaway committed multiple drops, and Jarvis Landry, David Njoku, and Duke Johnson all dropped passes as well.  Mayfield will be a two-QB-league starter in Week 5 against the Ravens.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 21-of-41 passes for 295 yards, two touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Browns' Week 4 loss to Oakland.

impact: Mayfield added 23 yards rushing on two attempts. He connected with Rashard Higgins for a 19-yard touchdown with 40 seconds left in the first half for the only touchdown of the game. Mayfield was at his best in overtime, connecting on 4-of-7 passes for 80 yards, including a 39-yard catch and run by Derrick Willies to set up the game-winning field goal. Mayfield has brought excitement to the Browns organization, leading the team two wins over the past the three weeks, but those real-life results have not translated to major fantasy success. Mayfield will enter Week 6 as a lower-end QB2 when the Browns host the Chargers.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 25-of-43 passes for 342 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Mayfield added eight yards rushing on two carries. Sunday was the first game in which Mayfield looked like a rookie as he threw two interceptions on late throws. He was under constant pressure, taking five sacks in the game and was constantly moved off his spot by the Charger pass rush. Mayfield's lone touchdown came on a 1-yard cosmetic score to David Njoku in garbage time. Despite his struggles today, Mayfield will be a popular streaming option Week 7 on the road versus the Buccaneers.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 22-of-46 passes for 238 yards with one touchdown and two interceptions in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Mayfield suffered a nasty looking ankle injury against the Chargers, but he played through it the rest of the game. He will need "treatment" this week, but he is expected to be fine for Sunday. In a great matchup against the Bucs, Mayfield will be a back-end QB1.
report: Baker Mayfield (ankle) is expected to play Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: "Baker's fine," Jackson said. Mayfield could get a "limited" tag or two in practice, but he will be out there for his dream Week 7 matchup with the Bucs. The problem is not Mayfield's health but his supporting cast. Mayfield has precious few weapons to throw the ball to. Even still, he's very much on the streaming radar this week.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson confirmed Baker Mayfield's ankle injury won't affect his Week 7 status.

impact: Mayfield added a season-high 43 rushing yards on four carries on the ground. The day overall was a disappointment for fantasy owners as the Bucs had allowed a 300-yard passer in every game to date prior to Sunday. Mayfield and the Browns were invisible in the first half as he threw for just 62 yards through the opening two quarters. In the second half, Mayfield found David Njoku for a 15-yard score to open the half and then connected with Jarvis Landry for a 16-yard score to tie the game with 2:28 left in regulation. Mayfield was under constant duress once again, taking five sacks, the third straight game in which he was sacked at least five times. His one blemish on the day was when he rushed for a clear first down deep in Tampa Bay territory on fourth down, but then fumbled the ball backwards out of bounds behind the sticks, costing the Browns at least a field goal attempt. Mayfield will only be a QB2 option Week 8 when the Browns head to Pittsburgh.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 23-of-34 passes for 215 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Mayfield added nine yards rushing on his lone carry. He struggled on the road in this one as his 5.0 yards per pass attempt were his lowest in a start this season. He threw both of his touchdowns in the second half, a 1-yard score to Antonio Callaway in the third quarter and then a 24-yard cosmetic score to Seth DeValve with six seconds left in regulation. Mayfield will enter Week 9 as a QB2 at home when the Browns host the high-powered Chiefs.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 22-of-36 passes for 180 yards and two touchdowns with an interception in Sunday's Week 8 loss to the Steelers.

impact: The Browns fired Hue Jackson and ex-OC Todd Haley for not building their offense to Mayfield's strengths. Cleveland plans to incorporate some of the Air Raid schemes Mayfield ran at Oklahoma with their move to Kitchens, who comes from the passy-heavy Bruce Arians tree. Mayfield's ROS outlook is slightly up after the Browns' coaching shuffle. There's high-scoring potential in Mayfield's Week 9 matchup with the Chiefs.
report: Browns OC Freddie Kitchens is expected to use more spread packages with Baker Mayfield.

impact: Despite the loss, there were positives to draw from Mayfield's sixth start. His 7.1 yards per pass attempt were his most since Week 5 while his 69 percent completion rate was the highest rate he's completed in any start this season. Mayfield threw multiple touchdowns for the third straight game, with both going to Duke Johnson on Sunday. Mayfield will once again find a favorable matchup in Week 10 at home against the Falcons.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 29-of-42 passes for 297 yards with two touchdowns and one interception in Sunday's Week 9 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: After a promising outing in new OC Freddie Kitchens' Week 9 debut, Mayfield had his best game of the season against the Falcons. The No. 1 overall pick completed his first 13 passes as the Browns got out to a 21-10 third quarter lead. The Browns were using some exotic formations, including three-back, full-house backfields. Mayfield really spread the ball around, with nine different players catching passes. He was accurate and decisive. The Browns go on bye for Week 11 before returning against the Bengals' sieve-like defense in Week 12.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 17-of-20 passes for 216 yards and three touchdowns in the Browns' 28-16, Week 10 win over the Falcons.

impact: Mayfield came out of the gates blazing, completing 6-of-6 passes of 71 yards on the opening drive and went on to complete 17-of-22 passes for 245 yards and three scores in the first half. Up 35-7 early in the third quarter, the Browns took their foot off the gas, but Mayfield had already done his damage. Mayfield has now thrown multiple touchdowns in five straight games, the first Cleveland quarterback to have such a streak in the same season since Frank Ryan in 1967. Mayfield will enter Week 13 as a high-end QB2 in Week 13 on the road versus the Texans.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 19-of-26 passes for 258 yards and four touchdowns in Sunday's Week 12 win over the Bengals.

impact: After a strong stretch that was aided by soft opponents, Mayfield played like a rookie Sunday. His passing yardage was a season-high, but the bulk of those yards were of the empty-calorie variety playing from a self-induced hole in the second half. The Browns trailed 23-0 at the half with Mayfield completing just 5-of-13 passes with three interceptions prior to the break, one of which was returned for a touchdown. Mayfield will look to get back on track at home against a reeling Panthers team in Week 14.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 29-of-43 passes for 397 yards with one touchdown and three interceptions in Sunday's Week 13 loss to the Texans.

impact: Rogers entered Sunday with eight catches for 49 yards on 10 targets.  He was far more active in this one after T.Y. Hilton had to leave multiple times with chest and hamstring injuries.  Rogers' 11 targets matched Nyheim Hines for the team lead on a day Andrew Luck attempted 62 passes.  With Hilton expected to miss Thursday night's Week 5 game against the Patriots, Rogers will again be relied upon.  He may have some WR5 appeal in deeper leagues in a likely catchup-mode game.
report: Chester Rogers caught 8-of-11 targets for 85 yards in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: Both the targets and catches matched new career highs Rogers set four days ago. Rogers also had a lowlight with a bad third quarter drop. Rogers' uptick in usage has coincided with T.Y. Hilton's hamstring injury. Hilton is looking no better than 50-50 to return in Week 6 against the Jets.
report: Chester Rogers caught 8-of-11 targets for 66 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Rogers got off to an excruciating start with multiple dropped passes.  He salvaged his fantasy bottom line on a 17-yard garbage-time touchdown with Indianapolis down multiple scores.  Nevertheless, Rogers is suddenly in prime fantasy position as the Colts lost several more pass catchers to injury on Sunday, including Ryan Grant (ankle).  With double-digit targets in three straight games, Rogers will be a fantasy starter in Week 7 versus Buffalo.
report: Chester Rogers caught 4-of-10 targets for 55 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: The bulk of his yards came on one catch, a 29-yard grab on a play where the defense forgot about him during the second quarter. That was the Colts' longest play from scrimmage. Rogers couldn't take advantage of Ryan Grant's absence, though that was mostly because the Colts stopped throwing after getting ahead early. The 25-year-old could be in play as a DFS dart throw if Grant remains sidelined for Week 8 against the Raiders.
report: Chester Rogers came down with four catches for 40 yards on four targets Sunday in Indianapolis’ Week 7 win over the Bills.

impact: After drawing double-digit targets in three straight games between Weeks 4-6, Rogers has vanished, seeing just five looks from Andrew Luck over the past two weeks. The 24-year-old hasn't moved the needle much, even with Ryan Grant (ankle) sidelined. Even as a cheap DFS punt play, you can probably do better than Rogers.
report: Chester Rogers came up empty on his lone target Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 win over Oakland.

impact: Engram returned to practice this week, but the short week with a Thursday night game wasn't enough time for him to return from his sprained MCL.  Engram should be good to go next week against the Falcons.
report: Evan Engram (knee) is out for Week 6 against the Eagles.

impact: Engram appeared close to playing last Thursday, so it is not a surprise he is back on the practice field early this week. Engram said he is very optimistic about playing Monday night against the Falcons.
report: Evan Engram (knee) participated in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Engram appeared close to a Week 6 return, so we fully expect him to be out there for Monday Night Football after 11 additional days of rest. Engram will be returning to a crowded, dysfunctional offense. Sterling Shepard and Saquon Barkley have been soaking up checkdowns from a washed Eli Manning. Hopefully Engram can get back in on the action. He will be a low-end TE1 for Week 7.
report: Evan Engram (knee) is practicing in full for Week 7.

impact: This was expected after Engram practiced fully. He was close to playing in Week 6, so he should be close to 100 percent coming off a mini-bye. Engram is in a great spot against a bottom-three Falcons pass defense that gave up touchdowns to O.J. Howard and Cameron Brate last week.
report: Evan Engram (knee) has been removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: It was Engram's first game back from a sprained MCL suffered in Week 3.  His four targets were a distant fourth on the team behind Odell Beckham (11), Saquon Barkley (10), and Sterling Shepard (8).  Engram has better days ahead and will remain a default TE1 next week against the Redskins.
report: Evan Engram caught 2-of-4 targets for 16 yards in the Giants' Week 7 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Engram's TD came in what amounted to garbage time of New York's 20-13 loss; the Giants were down two scores with :17 left when Engram hit pay dirt.  Both of Engram's touchdowns this year have come in garbage time.  Engram will remain a fringe TE1 when the Giants return from their Week 9 bye.
report: Evan Engram caught 5-of-9 targets for 25 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' Week 8 loss to Washington.

impact: He did all of his damage in the second half after catching one ball for no gain prior to the break.  Engram's longest gain of 31 was a shot down the sideline where he was tackled inside the 10-yard line late in the fourth quarter.  Engram has been a distant third or fourth option when healthy this season but does get a promising Week 11 date with the Bucs and will be a locked-in TE1.
report: Evan Engram caught 4-of-5 targets for 46 yards in the Giants' Week 10 win over the 49ers.

impact: He only saw two targets on the day, but Engram made one in particular count 54-yards downfield. Typically the Giants' third receiving option behind Odell Beckham and Saquon Barkley, Engram is at least slated with another good matchup against the Eagles' ailing secondary in Week 12. Lock him in.
report: Evan Engram hauled in both of his targets for 66 yards in the Giants' Week 11 victory over the Bucs.

impact: The Giants didn't announce the injury until the first quarter started, saying he was questionable to play.  He never did, and Rhett Ellison piled up a 4-77 receiving line on six targets.  Engram had been getting his snaps scaled back of late in this run-heavy offense since he can't block.  Engram is a TD-or-bust proposition heading into a Week 13 draw against the tough Bears defense.
report: Evan Engram suffered a hamstring injury in pregame warmups and didn't play Week 12 against the Eagles.

impact: Engram did not play Sunday after injuring his hamstring in pregame warmups. It sounds like he is at best dealing with a multi-game injury. Rhett Ellison caught four passes for 77 yards with Engram out against the Eagles, but he will not be an exciting streamer against the Bears.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur said he does not know how long Evan Engram (hamstring) will be sidelined.

impact: Engram also said he could have played in an emergency on Sunday. It sounds like Engram will miss some practice time before being a possible game-time decision vs. the Bears' league-best defense. Even if he gets the green light, Engram will be a low-upside TE2.
report: Evan Engram (hamstring) is "optimistic" he will be ready for Sunday's game against the Bears.

impact: Engram was present for the morning walkthrough but just rode the stationary bike at practice.  Engram said he's "optimistic" he'll play Week 13 against the Bears, but that's looking in doubt.
report: Evan Engram (hamstring) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Engram also sat out Wednesday's practice, making it highly unlikely he is ready to face the Bears on Sunday. Rhett Ellison will get the start in his place, but he is not a great streaming option.
report: Evan Engram (hamstring) will not practice Thursday.

impact: Engram was optimistic earlier in the week that he'd be able to return this week after missing Week 12 when he injured his hammy in pregame warmups, but players are to never be trusted on their own injury outlooks.  Rhett Ellison will get another start at tight end but isn't a recommended streamer.
report: Evan Engram (hamstring) remained sidelined at Friday's practice and is out for Week 13 against the Bears.

impact: It's the first time he's practiced since injuring his hamstring in warmups prior to Week 12. Even if Engram is available for Week 14, he won't be more than a fringe TE1 against Washington. Injuries have limited the sophomore tight end to just seven games this year.
report: Evan Engram (hamstring) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Might have been easier to list what Ebron isn't listed with on the injury report.  But this is good news after he sat Wednesday and Thursday.  Expect Ebron to be out there teaming with Chester Rogers and Nyheim Hines as the Colts' offensive playmakers.  Ebron is a locked-in elite TE1 play while Jack Doyle (hip) sits.
report: Eric Ebron (shin, quad, ankle, knee) returned to practice Friday.

impact: Ebron was a full participant in practice Friday but is still listed as questionable due to the numerous injuries still ailing him. The Colts did suspiciously sign TE Mo Alie-Cox from their practice squad, hinting that Ebron could be limited even if active. If he suits up, he's still a strong TE1 given the (lack of) landscape at his position.
report: Eric Ebron (shin, quad, ankle, knee) is questionable for Week 6 against the Jets.

impact: Ebron barely practiced, but Colts beat writers expected him to be a go all along.  He leads all NFL tight ends with 36 targets over the last three weeks.
report: Eric Ebron is active for Week 6 against the Jets.

impact: Ebron wasn't targeted quite as heavily as usual in this one -- he came in averaging 12 per game over the previous three weeks -- but he hit pay dirt for the sixth time in six games and continues to produce as top-five fantasy TE1.  Ebron's hot stretch will be threatened whenever Jack Doyle (hip) returns, but there are no indications Doyle is close.  The Colts host the Bills next.
report: Eric Ebron caught 4-of-7 targets for 71 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: Sunday erased a three-game touchdown streak for Ebron, who also tallied his fewest receiving yards since Week 2, which was the last time he shared the field with Jack Doyle. Ebron wasn't really needed in this one as the Colts got ahead early and coasted to an easy win behind a career day from running back Marlon Mack. Despite Sunday's clunker, Ebron should remain in play as a TE1 next week in Oakland, assuming Doyle remains sidelined.
report: Eric Ebron absorbed three-of-seven targets for 31 yards Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 win over the Bills.

impact: Ebron has now had to back-to-back quiet weeks, though he salvaged the day somewhat by scoring his seventh touchdown of the year. That ties him with Kansas City's Tyreek Hill for the league lead. Ebron will likely see fewer looks now that Jack Doyle is back from his hip injury, but at a thin fantasy position, he still merits starting consideration. He'll have the week off before facing Jacksonville after the bye.
report: Eric Ebron gathered three catches for 37 yards and a touchdown on three targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 victory over Oakland.

impact: On the opening drive, the Jaguars simply lost Ebron down the field, and Luck hit him for an easy 53-yard touchdown, although Ebron flashed his athleticism by tip-toeing the sideline before diving for the pylon. That was just the start of a big game. A couple drives later, Ebron took an end around, got the edge, and waltzed into the end zone from two yards out for the second rushing score of his career. He was left wide open again for a 12-yard score in the second quarter to cap his massive day. With Jack Doyle back, volume could be a concern for Ebron, but he plays for a coach and with a quarterback who both like to target tight ends in the red zone. That keeps him in the TE1 mix.
report: Eric Ebron hauled in all three of his targets for 69 yards and two touchdowns and rushed once for a two-yard touchdown in the Colts' Week 10 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Ebron was an every-down player while Jack Doyle was out, but he has averaged just 22.8 snaps per game with Doyle in the lineup. He has been impactful on limited work, however, catching three touchdowns and rushing for another over the last two weeks. "I knew that they would allow me to make plays, allow me to be me and do what I do best," Ebron said about joining the Colts. "It was one of the reasons why I came here, and I knew Andrew (Luck) would facilitate it all good enough. That way, I’d be open." Ebron could be hit-or-miss given his limited role and target share with Doyle around, but his weekly touchdown upside keeps in the TE1 conversation.
report: Eric Ebron said he is "ok" playing limited snaps.

impact: The only time Ebron touched the ball was a on trick play pass attempt. He and Andrew Luck could not quite hook up in the end zone. Ebron's role-player usage finally caught up to him in fantasy today. He is wholly dependent on his red zone targets, and Luck was looking elsewhere inside the 20. Ebron does have a lovely Week 12 matchup in the Dolphins, who have gotten absolutely gutted by tight ends this season. He will be a top-16 option.
report: Eric Ebron was not targeted in the Colts' 38-10, Week 11 win over the Titans.

impact: Coming off a zero-target game against the Titans, Ebron rebounded against the Dolphins' embarrassingly-bad tight end defense. The seven targets were by far the most he has drawn in four games since Jack Doyle's return. Doyle did also manage to find the end zone this afternoon. Although highly volatile, Ebron is Andrew Luck's go-to target in the red zone. Week 13 opponent Jacksonville has been bleeding tight end fantasy points.
report: Eric Ebron caught 5-of-7 targets for 45 yards and two touchdowns in the Colts' Week 12 win over the Dolphins.

impact: It's a new injury for Ebron, but he played through multiple ailments earlier in the year when Jack Doyle was out and still crushed in the box score.  We'll have to keep an eye on Ebron the rest of the week, but this could be a vet day.
report: Eric Ebron (back) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: It puts him on track to play Sunday at Jacksonville. Ebron went for three touchdowns when these teams met in Week 10. He'll be an elite TE1 play against the Jags.
report: Eric Ebron (back) returned to a full practice on Thursday.

impact: Ebron got in two full practices to finish the week, completely clearing him for takeoff against Jacksonville. With Jack Doyle (kidney, injured reserve) and Mo Alie-Cox (calf) both out, Ebron should dominate on-field usage from kick-off to the final whistle. He's an indisputable TE1 in Week 13.
report: Eric Ebron (back) will play in Week 13 against the Jaguars.

impact: Unfortunately, Ebron also lost a fumble and nine yards on a rushing attempt to cost him nearly three fantasy points.  He was a PPR machine, though, pacing the Colts in targets and never coming off the field with Jack Doyle on IR and Mo Alie-Cox sidelined.  Next up is a Week 14 matchup with the Texans, who have been the weakest team in football in tight end pass coverage.
report: Eric Ebron caught 10-of-15 targets for 81 yards in the Colts' Week 13 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Ebron was listed with the same injury last week and played almost every snap in the loss to Jacksonville. He's not in danger of missing Week 14 at Houston. Ebron has averaged 11 targets per game without Jack Doyle this season. He's a must-start in all formats.
report: Eric Ebron (back, illness) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: We will give you a second to look him up. A fourth-round rookie, Dissly was expected to be more of a blocker in the NFL, but he opened the scoring with a 15-yard touchdown on play action and bounced off several defenders on a 66-yard catch-and-run to end the first quarter. He did not do much damage after that, and it is likely this is easily his biggest game of the season. Still, he is worth a look in deeper TE premium leagues with Ed Dickson out at least five more weeks.
report: Will Dissly hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 105 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Dissly did most of his damage and caught his short touchdown on the meaningless stat-padding final drive.  But, hey, they all count the same in fantasy.  He's now turned 10 targets into a 6-147-2 line through two games.  Dissly is locked in as the Seahawks' top pass-catching tight end for the foreseeable future and gets a decent matchup at home with the Cowboys in Week 3.
report: Will Dissly caught 3-of-5 targets for 42 yards and one touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: The rookie has predictably come back to Earth, managing a mere four catches for 46 yards in the two games since his breakout Week 1. Even against the lowly Cardinals, Dissly makes for a poor streamer in Week 4.
report: Will Dissly secured one-of-three targets for four yards Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 victory over Dallas.

impact: Dissly suffered an injury to his right knee on a 5-yard catch. The injury appeared to potentially serious as he needed to be taken off the field. The rookie has had a promising start to the season, catching 8-of-14 targets for 156 yards and two touchdowns.
report: Seahawks TE Will Dissly suffered a knee injury and has exited Sunday's Week 4 game versus the Cardinals.

impact: Dissly's rookie season comes to an end catching 8-of-14 targets for 156 yards and two touchdowns in just three-plus game's worth of action. Nick Vannett will take over as the lead tight end for the Seahawks for the remainder of the season.
report: Seahawks TE Will Dissly suffered a torn patella tendon in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: It's one of the most serious injuries a football player can suffer. Dissly should be considered questionable for Week 1 2019. Although he's still only 22, Dissly can be safely dropped in Dynasty leagues.
report: Seahawks placed TE Will Dissly on injured reserve with a torn patella tendon, ending his season.

impact: The long buzzed-about ex-basketball player was active in Week 1, catching one pass. The Colts just haven't seen the development they need, and snaps and targets were going to be sparse behind Jack Doyle and Eric Ebron. Now 26, Swoope might not be a candidate for the practice squad. DT Jihad Ward has been promoted from the practice squad in a corresponding roster move.
report: Colts waived TE Erik Swoope.

impact: The Colts will have Eric Ebron, Swoope, and Ryan Hewitt (primarily a blocking tight end) available Sunday with Jack Doyle (hip) out. Swoope’s 2017 campaign was derailed due to a nagging knee injury, but he finished top-five among all tight ends in yards per catch (19.8) when healthy the year prior. Sunday still sets up terrifically for Ebron, who should seamlessly replace Doyle in a full-time role. Doyle has quietly run the most routes (81) among all tight ends so far this year, giving Ebron a high floor (if only for his inevitable usage), as well.
report: Colts added TE Erik Swoope from their practice squad.

impact: Even with Jack Doyle (hip) absent last week, Swoope was targeted just once on eight snaps in the loss to Philadelphia. With Swoope out of the picture, the Colts will go with Ryan Hewitt behind Eric Ebron, who will draw another start at tight end with Doyle out for the second week in a row.
report: Colts waived TE Erik Swoope.

impact: Swoope nearly had a second score in the dying moments of garbage time but was ruled down at the one-yard line. Yo-yoing on and off the 53-man roster, Swoope is miles from fantasy relevance.
report: Erik Swoope caught 3-of-3 targets for 44 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Swoope played behind Mo Alie-Cox in the Colts' backup tight end timeshare with Eric Ebron out in front.  Swoope is a Dynasty stash but nothing more.
report: Erik Swoope caught 1-of-2 targets for a two-yard touchdown in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: This is only notable with Jack Doyle sidelined. Mo Alie-Cox will handle No. 2 tight end duties if Swoope is held out.
report: Colts TE Erik Swoope (knee) is questionable for Week 7 against Buffalo.

impact: Swoope was questionable for this game with a knee injury and may have aggravated it. He caught his lone target for a 17-yard touchdown off a play-action pass from Andrew Luck before exiting in the second quarter. With Swoope banged up and Jack Doyle (hip) inactive, the Colts are looking thin at tight end behind Eric Ebron.
report: Colts TE Erik Swoope (knee) left Sunday's Week 7 game against the Bills and is questionable to return.

impact: He wasn't able to practice this week after injuring his knee in Sunday's win over Buffalo. With Eric Ebron playing well and Jack Doyle back from his hip injury, Swoope doesn't carry any fantasy significance.
report: Erik Swoope (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: With Jack Doyle back prior to the team's bye, Swoope had been used sparingly, anyhow. Eric Ebron will continue playing behind Doyle in multiple tight end sets.
report: Erik Swoope (knee) is out for Week 10 against the Jaguars.

impact: There are no surprises here. Ridgeway was not given a designation after full practices Thursday and Friday, but the other six were out or doubtful heading into the weekend.
report: Colts declared TE Erik Swoope (knee), OT Denzelle Good (illness), CB Nate Hairston (ankle), S Mike Mitchell (calf), DE Kemoko Turay (neck), and DT Hassan Ridgeway (illness) inactive for Week 10 against the Jaguars.

impact: Swoope remains week to week, as does Hooker.
report: Colts declared TE Erik Swoope, G/T Denzelle good, CB Nate Hairston, TE Ryan Hewitt, S Malik Hooker, CB D.J. Killings and DT Hassan Ridgeway inactive for Week 11 against the Titans.

impact: Swoope remains week to week with a knee injury.
report: Colts declared TE Erik Swoope, TE Mo Alie-Cox, TE Ryan Hewitt G/T Denzelle Good, C Ryan Kelly, DT Hassan Ridgeway and RB Jonathan Williams inactive for Week 12 against the Dolphins.

impact: Swoope has been sidelined since Week 7 with a knee injury, but he was able to get in two limited practices this week. With Jack Doyle on injured reserve and Mo Alie-Cox sidelined by a calf injury, Swoope should see snaps if he is able to play.
report: Colts TE Erik Swoope (knee) is questionable for Week 13 against the Jaguars.

impact: Samuel has not played or practiced since being diagnosed with an irregular heartbeat prior to Week 1. Rivera said, "So far, so good" when asked about Samuel's recovery, though it doesn't sound like the second-year wideout is close to returning. With Samuel and Greg Olsen (foot) both sidelined, expect Devin Funchess and Christian McCaffrey to continue racking up targets.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera said there's no timetable for Curtis Samuel's return.

impact: Samuel remains without a timetable for return after a heart procedure.  Olsen is still out with a broken foot, and Turner is sidelined with a concussion.
report: Panthers declared WR Curtis Samuel, TE Greg Olsen, RG Trai Turner, WR Damier Byrd, DE Bryan Cox, DE Efe Obada, and LB Andre Smith inactive Week 2 against the Falcons.

impact: Samuel remains out indefinitely with an irregular heartbeat.  Olsen is "month to month" after breaking his foot for the second time in the last two years.
report: Panthers declared WRs Curtis Samuel and Damiere Byrd, TE Greg Olsen, RT Trai Turner, LT Matt Kalil, DE Marquis Haynes, and CB Lorenzo Doss inactive for Week 3 against the Bengals.

impact: Samuel underwent a procedure to correct an irregular heartbeat prior to Week 1 and has been sidelined ever since. It is not a given he will be able to return this week, but practicing on Monday is a great sign.
report: Curtis Samuel (heart) is practicing on Monday.

impact: Samuel turned a simple Cam Newton screen into a 25-yard touchdown, which gave Carolina its first points of the afternoon with 4:38 left in the first quarter. He broke multiple tackles on his way to the end zone and also got a great block from teammate Devin Funchess, who leveled Janoris Jenkins at the line of scrimmage. That play marked the first touchdown of Samuel’s two-year career. The 22-year-old was making his season debut after missing the Panthers’ first three games with an irregular heartbeat. Samuel isn’t in the fantasy discussion yet, but he’ll be a name to monitor on the waiver wire throughout the season.
report: Curtis Samuel grabbed two catches for 37 yards and a touchdown on four targets Sunday in Carolina’s Week 5 win over the Giants.

impact: He scored a 14-yard touchdown on an end-around, but lost five yards on his other rushing attempt and was only targeted once. A low-volume gadget player, Samuel’s fantasy value is limited to deeper Dynasty leagues.
report: Curtis Samuel rushed twice for nine yards and a touchdown and caught a 16-yard pass in the Panthers’ Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: Samuel and D.J. Moore picked up more reps with Torrey Smith (knee) out, but it was Moore who did the bulk of the damage with a team-high six targets and 129 total yards on seven touches.  Samuel isn't on the redraft map.
report: Curtis Samuel caught all three of his targets for 28 yards in the Panthers' Week 8 win over the Ravens.

impact: Coming off a complete dud of a Week 8, Samuel surprisingly had the most impressive game of his career. Samuel's winding 33-yard rushing score covered an astonishing 103 yards of turf. Samuel got the ball on a double reverse and ended up completely reversing fields. It was something to see. Highly volatile and fighting for gadget targets with D.J. Moore, Samuel remains off the re-draft radar.
report: Curtis Samuel caught 2-of-4 targets for 25 yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 9 win over the Bucs, adding a 33-yard rushing touchdown.

impact: Samuel also committed a costly special teams turnover, losing the ball deep in his own territory. Samuel has been heavily involved on offense during Torrey Smith's (knee) three-game absence but has not made enough big plays for it to translate to fantasy value. Smith's health for Week 11 is uncertain.
report: Curtis Samuel caught 4-of-4 targets for 18 yards in the Panthers' Week 10 loss, adding a one-yard rush.

impact: Samuel was mostly a non-factor early, and he was unable to wrestle the ball out of Tracy Walker’s hands on Cam Newton’s interception at the end of the half. Following a quiet third quarter, Samuel got things going in a big way in the fourth. All five of his catches came in the final period including a spectacular, leaping catch for a 12-yard touchdown to tie the game. After the Lions retook the lead, Samuel helped keep another touchdown drive alive with a catch along the sideline. The seven targets were a season-high for Samuel as were the 55 receiving yards. Even so, Samuel will not be an option outside of deep leagues next week.
report: Curtis Samuel hauled in 5-of-7 passes for 55 yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 11 loss to the Lions.

impact: Samuel did not do anything early in this game, but he announced his presence by gaining 25 yards on a well-designed end around midway through the second quarter to help set up his seven-yard touchdown catch two plays later. He was limited to just one catch the rest of the way as D.J. Moore and Christian McCaffrey dominated targets, but Samuel has consistently flashed his playmaking ability when given a chance this season.
report: Curtis Samuel rushed once for 25 yards and hauled in both of his targets for 17 yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 12 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Samuel had hamstring issues last summer ahead of his rookie season, derailing his first season.  He's managed to stay healthy all year after having an irregular heartbeat problem early in the season.  Samuel's status for Week 13 against the Bucs is up in the air.  D.J. Moore is a locked-in WR2.
report: Curtis Samuel (hamstring) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Samuel sat out on Wednesday, but it looks like that was just a maintenance day. A playmaker who has produced when given opportunities, Samuel would be an interesting DFS play against the Bucs if Devin Funchess (back) sits.
report: Curtis Samuel (hamstring) returned to a full practice on Thursday.

impact: Samuel was a DNP on Wednesday but upgraded to full on Thursday, so this is no surprise.  Samuel will slide back to No. 3 duties with Devin Funchess (back) expected back this week alongside rookie D.J. Moore.
report: Curtis Samuel (hamstring) was removed from the Week 13 injury report and will play against the Bucs.

impact: The 11 targets were a season high. Samuel also led the Panthers in receiving with Greg Olsen (foot) leaving early and Devin Funchess not playing full snaps. Samuel would be in line for a larger role if Olsen misses time.
report: Curtis Samuel caught 6-of-11 targets for 88 yards in Week 13 against the Bucs.

impact: It's a nice rebound after a down Week 2. The Giants got better pass protection from their offensive line with RT Ereck Flowers benched, allowing Shepard and Odell Beckham to get open. Shepard's touchdown came late on a short seven-yard pass in the fourth quarter. His red-zone role could be expanded if Even Engram misses time with a knee injury. Shepard is a WR3 for Week 4's matchup with the Saints.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 6-of-7 yards for 80 yards and a touchdown in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: He also nabbed a two-point conversion following a Saquon Barkley touchdown run.  Shepard beat CB Ken Crawley with ease on his short touchdown in the first quarter.  This was a prime spot for Shepard, and he answered with his best game of September.  Shepard has touchdowns in back-to-back games but will find tougher sledding next week on the road against the Panthers.
report: Sterling Shepard caught all 10 targets for 77 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: Shepard had a cyst removed from his back on Tuesday, and coach Pat Shurmur expects him to be back on the practice field Thursday.  As of now, the full expectation is Shepard will play Week 5 against the Panthers.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: We won't know his participation level until the Giants release their injury report later this afternoon, though ESPN's Jordan Raanan noted that Shepard appeared to be practicing "in some capacity." Getting in a limited session Thursday would bode well for his Week 5 status. Shepard will take a two-game touchdown streak into Sunday's matchup with Carolina.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) appeared to be practicing on Thursday.

impact: Shepard's Week 5 status is no longer in doubt. Shepard took advantage of Eli Manning's check-down tendencies and a plus matchup to post 10/77/1 in Week 4. The Panthers won't be as forgiving. Shepard is a mid-range WR3.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) was officially "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: As expected.  Shepard's status was never in doubt after he needed to miss practice Wednesday after having a cyst removed from his back.  He brings a two-game touchdown streak into Week 5 and will be a WR3 for this one.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) was removed from the Week 5 injury report and will play against the Panthers.

impact: The bulk of his yards (54 of his 75) came with New York trailing in the second half. Shepard was visibly frustrated on Sunday, throwing a trash can in anger during a third-quarter sideline tantrum. It’s just been that kind of year for the Giants, who have now dropped four of five including two straight. Shepard has done his part, however, eclipsing 70 yards in each of his last three contests. He’ll be in play as a WR3 Thursday against the Eagles’ funnel defense.
report: Sterling Shepard contributed four catches for 75 yards on seven targets Sunday in the Giants’ Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: It was a disappointing night for Shepard in a game where the Giants did not have a legitimate tight end and Eagles slot CB Sidney Jones departed early with an ankle issue. Of course, none of the Giants' pass catchers had much of a chance at a big game with Eli Manning once again lowering the bar under center. Shepard has a better outlook for Week 7, when the G-Men will be taking on the Falcons' injury-ravaged defense on Monday Night Football.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 3-of-7 targets for 37 yards in the Giants' Week 6 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Shepard had monster gains of 53 and 58 to aid his huge evening against this porous defense.  It was Shepard's first 100-yard game of the season and the most of his career after topping 100 yards just four times his first two seasons.  Shepard will be a solid if unspectacular WR3 next week against the Skins.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 5-of-8 targets for 167 yards in the Giants' Week 7 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Redskins rookie RCB Greg Stroman knocked a would-be monster gain out of Shepard's hands in the first half, and the Giants' slot receiver was quiet the rest of the way.  Shepard's fantasy owners need the Giants to stay with Eli Manning and not turn to rookie Kyle Lauletta during their forthcoming Week 9 bye.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 4-of-8 targets for 34 yards in the Giants' Week 8 loss.

impact: If not for the touchdown and the long gain on the ground, it would have been an extremely disappointing night for Shepard in a plum matchup. He was able to somewhat save things by catching the game-winning three-yard score with 53 seconds left to put the Giants up 27-23.  Shepard will be a WR3 in another plus spot against the Bucs next week.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 2-of-3 targets for nine yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 10 win over the 49ers, adding 27 yards on his one carry.

impact: Much like the rest of the Giants' receivers, Shepard wasn't needed on a day that saw Saquon Barkley carry the load for 27/142/2. Odell Beckham actually led with a relatively low four targets. Shepard and Beckham will be called upon in Week 12 against the divisional foe Eagles. Consider Shepard a low-end WR3 in that matchup given that he's still coming off consecutive letdowns in what were actually plus matchups against the Niners and Bucs.
report: Sterling Shepard caught both of his targets for 22 yards in the Giants' Week 11 win over the Bucs.

impact: The five targets were a three-game high but Shepard continues to do very little on the stat sheet.  The 34 yards were actually the most he's had in that span.  Shepard has devolved into a WR4 ahead of Week 13 against Chicago.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 3-of-5 targets for 34 yards in the Giants' Week 12 loss to the Eagles.

impact: This has become the new normal for Shepard in this broken passing offense.  Saquon Barkley and Odell Beckham are the only players this scheme can support heading into a Week 14 division game at the Redskins.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 4-of-6 targets for 28 yards in the Giants' Week 13 win over the Bears.

impact: He was sidelined briefly with the injury on Sunday, but returned later in the game. Shepard went for X-rays and a CT scan the following day, with both tests coming back clean. We're expecting him to suit up at Washington in Week 14.
report: Sterling Shepard (rib) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It doesn't sound promising for Doyle's Week 6 prospects against the Jets.  The good news is Eric Ebron has been terrific this season, turning 12 red-zone targets into four touchdowns and being one of the top fantasy tight ends.
report: Coach Frank Reich said Jack Doyle (hip) remains week to week.

impact: Doyle hasn't seen the field since Week 2 and doesn't seem particularly close to returning. Eric Ebron has settled in as an every-week fantasy starter in his absence.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Doyle and T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring) have both been ruled out for Week 6. Barring any setbacks, both LT Anthony Castonzo and Marlon Mack are expected to return Sunday. Without Doyle, Eric Ebron should remain an every-down player and top-shelf TE1. Erik Swoope will fill-in behind him in multiple tight end sets.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) is out for Week 6 against the Jets.

impact: Doyle hasn't played since Week 2 and doesn't seem close to a return.  Eric Ebron has been dominant in his absence, leading all tight ends in red-zone targets.  Ryan Grant (ankle) also missed Wednesday's session.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He'll miss his fifth straight game. Eric Ebron will continue to dominate snaps with Doyle out, with Mo Alie-Cox and Erik Swoope splitting time in two tight end sets.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) is out for Week 7 against Buffalo.

impact: This will be Doyle's fifth straight absence. He remains week-to-week with a hip injury. Eric Ebron will again start in his place. TE Erik Swoope (knee), WR T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring), DT Margus Hunt (knee), LB Darius Leonard (ankle) and CB Chris Milton (hamstring) are all active for Sunday's game in Indy.
report: Colts declared TE Jack Doyle, DT Denico Autry, S Clayton Geathers, OT Denzelle Good, WR Ryan Grant, CB Arthur Maulet and RB Robert Turbin inactive for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: Coach Frank Reich said Doyle will have a chance to play this week in Oakland.  Doyle hasn't played since Week 2.  In the meantime, Eric Ebron leads all tight ends in red-zone targets and have developed into a very useful fantasy asset.  Doyle's return would pose a bit of a drain on Ebron's usage, though he would still be heavily involved in the scoring area as a big body.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Coach Frank Reich has said Doyle has a "chance" to return against the Raiders. It's possible the Colts are easing Doyle back in with an eye toward having him return following the team's Week 9 bye. We should have a good idea as to Doyle's status by Friday afternoon. He would not be fantasy viable, though he would downgrade Eric Ebron.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Doyle resumed practicing on a limited basis this week and should be on the field Sunday when the Colts travel to Oakland. His return is bad news for Eric Ebron, who was dominating in Doyle's absence.
report: Colts coach Frank Reich expects Jack Doyle (hip) to play against the Raiders in Week 8.

impact: We assumed this would be the case after he was upgraded to full participation at Friday's practice. Doyle is ready to make his return after sitting out the past five games with a hip injury. A wait-and-see approach might be the best course of action with Doyle coming off a long absence. His return is an obvious downgrade for Eric Ebron, who has already totaled a career-high six touchdowns this year.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) wasn't listed on the Colts' final injury report for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: This was Doyle's first appearance since Week 2 after missing five games with a hip injury. Doyle did almost all of his damage on one possession, catching four balls for 52 yards and a touchdown on a six-play drive during the fourth quarter. His 10-yard touchdown grab broke a 28-28 tie, putting Indy ahead for good with 5:28 remaining. There was some concern that Doyle would take a backseat to Eric Ebron, who dominated during his absence, but it looks like both players are going to have a role in the Colts' offense. The Colts are off next week but return against the Jaguars in Week 10.
report: Jack Doyle registered six catches for 70 yards and a touchdown on seven targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 win over Oakland.

impact: The Jaguars could not keep track of Colts tight ends early in this game, and Doyle got loose for a 20-yard catch of his own on the first play of the second series. Unfortunately, he could not get in on the tight end scoring spree in the first half. He came close when he was tackled at the one-yard line in the second quarter, but Mo Alie-Cox got the score on the next play. Doyle should have better days moving forward, but Eric Ebron will be a touchdown threat all season.
report: Jack Doyle caught all three of his targets for 36 yards in the Colts' Week 10 win over the Jaguars.

impact: It was a disappointing day seeing as the Colts scored 38 points and Eric Ebron was not targeted. Doyle did have to watch as Mo Alie-Cox drew a red zone look. Doyle has the occasional mindmeld with Andrew Luck, but Luck is spreading the ball around as much as any quarterback in football. Doyle will nevertheless remain a TE1 for Week 12 against a Dolphins defense that's been routinely embarrassed by opposing seam stretchers.
report: Jack Doyle caught 4-of-4 targets for 43 yards in the Colts' Week 11 win over the Titans.

impact: The score was Doyle's second in four contests since returning from his hip injury, though he got out-targeted 7-4 by Eric Ebron, who had yet to draw more looks in a game since Doyle's return. Ultimately, Doyle should continue to see heavier usage even if Ebron is the preferred target in the red zone. Doyle will maintain TE1 appeal for Week 13 against the Jags' leaky tight end defense.
report: Jack Doyle caught 4-of-4 targets for 16 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 12 win over the Dolphins.

impact: He was hospitalized after Week 12's win over Miami and underwent a "prodecure."  Coach Frank Reich did say Monday that Doyle's prognosis is "good" to resume playing in 2019.  This locks Eric Ebron back in as Indianapolis' primary tight end.  The injury will hurt the Colts more in real life than fantasy box scores; Doyle is a far superior blocker to Ebron and plays over 80% of the team's offensive snaps.  With Ebron taking over the No. 1 tight end role, Mo Alie-Cox will move to No. 2.  No. 3 TE Erik Swoope hasn't played since Week 7 due to a knee injury.
report: Colts placed TE Jack Doyle (kidney) on injured reserve, ending his season.

impact: He'll be fine to face his former team in Week 2. Grant set a career-high with eight catches in Sunday's opener.
report: Ryan Grant (chest) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the Redskins.

impact: So much for Grant’s #RevengeGame. He wasn’t even targeted until the fourth quarter. A week after securing a career-high eight catches, Grant was pretty much an afterthought in this one, drawing fewer targets than teammates T.Y. Hilton, Jack Doyle, Eric Ebron and Chester Rogers. Grant can be avoided in a tough matchup next week at Philadelphia.
report: Ryan Grant delivered two catches for 30 yards on two targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 2 victory over Washington.

impact: Grant scored the lone touchdown for the Colts and 5-yard fade route which he won a contested catch. After receiving nine targets in the season opener, Grant has totaled just six targets over the past two weeks despite finding the end zone Sunday. Grant now has 13 catches for 124 yards and a touchdown through three games.
report: Ryan Grant caught 3-of-4 targets for 35 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Grant also dropped a couple balls on quick slants.  His seven targets were fifth-most on the team as he's far down the totem pole in Indy.  Grant will not be a recommended fantasy play Week 5 on the road against the Patriots, though he'll be forced to play a ton with T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) likely to sit.
report: Ryan Grant caught 5-of-7 targets for 64 yards in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: With T.Y. Hilton sidelined, Grant matched his season high for targets, though Eric Ebron and Chester Rogers both drew more looks. Averaging 49 yards, Grant's usage has been consistent, but it is not translating to anything more than WR5 fantasy value.
report: Ryan Grant caught 6-of-9 targets for 58 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: He had two catches for 25 yards on five targets before exiting in the second half.  The Colts are already missing T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) and Jack Doyle (hip), so they're leaning heavily on Eric Ebron, Zach Pascal, Chester Rogers, Erik Swoope, and Marcus Johnson in the passing game.
report: Ryan Grant left Sunday's Week 6 game against the Jets with an ankle injury and will not return.

impact: Grant had to leave in the second half last week after catching a pair of balls for 25 yards.  The good news is T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is pushing to return.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: He's still feeling the effects of an ankle injury he suffered in Week 6. With Grant shelved, look for Chester Rogers and Zach Pascal to see more involvement this week.
