report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is out for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: Grant missed Week 7 against the Bills.  With Jack Doyle (hip) nearing a return, T.Y. Hilton healthy, and the rest of the Colts' skill players on the field, Grant is no longer a fantasy option even if he was healthy and practicing.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Robert Turbin (shoulder) isn't expected back until Week 10 and was also quickly ruled out. The good news is that the Colts are expecting Jack Doyle (hip) to suit up for the first time since Week 2 against the Redskins. T.Y. Hilton, Eric Ebron, Chester Rogers, Zach Pascal, and Doyle will work as the Colts' top receiving options against the Raiders' lowly secondary on Sunday.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is out for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: Grant was injured in Week 6 and missed the two games leading up to last week's bye, which appears to have done him some favors.  With the Colts now as healthy as ever, Grant is well off the fantasy radar.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Grant appears poised to return after missing the past two games. Grant has proven to be a last-gasp WR5 in the Colts' crowded offense.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Grant is on track to return after missing the last two games. It's an upgrade to Andrew Luck's supporting cast. Grant will slot in behind T.Y. Hilton and Eric Ebron for targets.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is questionable for Week 10 against Jacksonville.

impact: Grant returns after missing the last two weeks. He's not on the streaming radar, but Grant should draw some attention away from T.Y. Hilton and Eric Ebron.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is expected to play in Week 10 against Jacksonville.

impact: It is his first action since Week 6. Grant should take back over as the No. 2 receiver, but he could be fourth in the pecking order behind T.Y. Hilton, Jack Doyle, and Eric Ebron. Grant is only an option in deep PPR leagues.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is active for Week 10 against the Jaguars.

impact: It's the last thing the Bengals need after losing Tyler Eifert. Kroft's absence locks C.J. Uzomah into an every-down role.
report: Bengals TE Tyler Kroft left Week 5 against Miami with a foot injury and is questionable to return.

impact: Kroft's absence forced the Bengals to sign Matt Lengel off the Texans' practice squad.  He'll back up C.J. Uzomah, who should play 90% or more of the snaps and is very much on the streaming radar for fantasy.
report: Tyler Kroft (foot) is out for Week 6 against the Steelers.

impact: It's odd wording from coach Marvin Lewis, as Kroft has not been placed on injured reserve. It would appear Kroft is more "out indefinitely" than week to week. C.J. Uzomah is holding down the fort in Kroft and Tyler Eifert's absence.
report: The Bengals expect Tyler Kroft (foot) to return this season.

impact: His roster spot will be absorbed by practice-squad LB Brandon Bell. The Bengals were holding out hope Kroft would return this year, but it was always a long shot. With Tyler Eifert (ankle) also on I.R., C.J. Uzomah will play out the stretch as Cincinnati's primary tight end.
report: Bengals placed TE Tyler Kroft (foot) on injured reserve.

impact: His seven targets were tied for third on the team behind A.J. Green and Tyler Boyd, confirming Uzomah's place as a key piece of the offense without Tyler Eifert (leg, I.R.).  Uzomah will remain a TE1 streamer next week against the Chiefs.  Tyler Kroft was in a walking boot this week with a foot injury.
report: C.J. Uzomah caught 6-of-7 targets for 54 yards in the Bengals' Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Uzomah's shoulder injury isn't thought to be serious. At a thin fantasy position, Uzomah will have streaming appeal Sunday night against a bottom-rung Chiefs secondary.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He was limited again, but two practices in a row to start the week suggest he will be fine to face the Chiefs on Sunday night. In a great matchup, he will be a back-end TE1.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) is practicing Thursday.

impact: He was upgraded to full participation at Friday's practice after being limited earlier in the week. Uzomah drew a season-high seven targets in last week's loss to Pittsburgh and should continue to play an active role in the Bengals' passing game sans Tyler Eifert (I.R., ankle). He'll be an intriguing streamer Sunday night against Kansas City's Swiss cheese secondary.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) wasn't listed on the Bengals' final injury report for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: Uzomah's status wasn't in doubt after he was removed from the injury report. The Bengals inactives are CB Darqueze Dennard, RB Giovani Bernard , C Billy Price , LB Nick Vigil, TE Tyler Kroft, WR Josh Malone, and DT Josh Tupou.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) is active for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: Uzomah caught Andy Dalton's only touchdown on a play that capped off a 77-yard second quarter drive. It was his only notable play of the night. Uzomah has been a plug-and-play TE1 since Tyler Eifert went down. He has a plus matchup with the Bucs in Week 8.
report: C.J. Uzomah caught two passes for 13 yards and a touchdown in Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: Uzomah tweaked his shoulder early in the game on an injury that looked like a stinger, and he was a non-factor the rest of the way.  Uzomah has flirted with TE1 viability this year, but he isn't a must-hold during Cincy's Week 9 bye.
report: C.J. Uzomah went catch-less on four targets in the Bengals' Week 8 win.

impact: According to Pro Football Focus, he also ran 31 routes, tied for fifth among tight ends for the week heading into Monday night. Uzomah failed to come down with any of his four targets, but usage was not the issue on Sunday. Even if Tyler Kroft is able to return, Uzomah will once again be a streaming option following the bye week.
report: C.J. Uzomah played 63-of-65 snaps (97 percent) Week 8 against the Bucs.

impact: Uzomah tweaked his shoulder in Week 8 but should be healthy coming off a bye. In an offense that's missing A.J. Green, Uzomah is a back-end TE1 for Week 10.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The Bengals appear to simply be managing Uzomah's reps. With A.J. Green (toe) on the shelf, Uzomah is an upside TE2 for Week 10.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Uzomah got in a full practice Friday after being limited the last two days. He's healthy coming off Cincy's bye. With A.J. Green sidelined, Uzomah should see heavy Week 10 targets.
report: C.J. Uzomah (shoulder) was removed from the Week 10 injury report.

impact: With A.J. Green out of the lineup, there was hope that Uzomah would have a larger role in the Bengals offense, but that didn't happen. Uzomah now has three of fewer catches in every game but one on the season and has just five catches for 36 yards over his past three games. Uzomah is a low-level TE2 as the Bengals head to Baltimore in Week 11.
report: C.J. Uzomah caught 3-of-4 targets for 23 yards in Sunday's Week 10 loss to the Saints.

impact: Despite the losses of A.J. Green (toe) and Tyler Eifert (ankle), Uzomah has barely been playable in fantasy leagues.  He will remain a low-floor streamer when the Bengals host the Browns next.
report: C.J. Uzomah caught 3-of-5 targets for 41 yards in the Bengals' Week 11 loss to the Ravens.

impact: On one hand, Uzomah's 13 targets are a positive, but turning them into just 3.0 yards per target is disgusting. Uzomah has had lackluster results since forced into the starting lineup, catching 29 passes for 283 yards and two touchdowns on the season. Uzomah is a TE2 option at best in Week 13 against the Broncos.
report: C.J. Uzomah caught 6-of-13 targets for 39 yards in Sunday's Week 12 loss to the Browns.

impact: Per usual, Uzomah saw a lucrative number of targets but did absolutely nothing with them. He's somehow turned 20 targets into a bumbling 72 yards and no scores in the past two games. He'll stay a suck-it-up usage-based TE1 for those looking to stream next week against the Chargers.
report: C.J. Uzomah caught 5-of-7 targets for 33 yards in the Bengals' Week 13 loss to the Broncos.

impact: With Jawill Davis (concussion) and Cody Latimer (hamstring, injured reserve) already ruled out, Giants will likely make a corresponding move even if Shepard suits up. If Shepard is ruled out, WR/KR Quadree Henderson or recent practice squad signee Corey Coleman could get the nod as the team's third wideout behind Odell Beckham and Sterling Shepard.
report: Giants WR Russell Shepard (neck) is questionable for Week 7 against the Falcons.

impact: Nothing has been confirmed, but Greg Olsen (foot) is believed to be dealing with a serious injury. If that is the case, Thomas should be the next man up at tight end. While he cannot be expected to command the same target share as Olsen, Thomas earned nothing but praise for his work during training camp. He is worth a look in deeper leagues.
report: Fourth-round TE Ian Thomas is expected to replace Greg Olsen (foot).

impact: Olsen has yet to be officially ruled out, but he appears likely to miss significant time. If that happens, Thomas would be the next man up. "There are some things obviously that he still has to learn," Rivera cautioned, "and he’s got a long ways to go in terms of that natural feel that Greg has, having that rapport that Greg has, so we’ll see." With the Falcons up this week, Thomas could provide immediate fantasy value in deeper leagues.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera said rookie TE Ian Thomas is "pretty well prepared" to replace Greg Olsen (foot).

impact: Thomas and Chris Manhertz split tight end duties without Greg Olsen (foot) in the lineup.  Thomas' lone misconnection was a brutal drop of a would-be 17-yard touchdown.  He rebounded to catch a ball on third down on the same series to set up Torrey Smith's three-yard score.  Thomas is not a fantasy starter.
report: Ian Thomas caught 2-of-3 targets for 10 yards in the Panthers' Week 2 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Thomas continued to play a ton of snaps in Greg Olsen's (foot) absence, but still isn't doing much with them.  Over the last two weeks, Thomas has 30 scoreless yards on eight targets.  He is a TE2/3 entering Carolina's Week 4 bye.
report: Ian Thomas caught 3-of-5 targets for 20 yards in the Panthers' Week 3 win over the Bengals.

impact: This backs up Ron Rivera's comments on Olsen's status. Olsen hasn't had any setbacks and remains on track to start after missing the last three games. He's a huge setback risk, but Olsen is a back-end TE1 for Week 6.
report: NFL Network's Tiffany Blackmon reports Greg Olsen (foot) will play in Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: Olsen will be at extreme risk of re-injury, but he's worth a roll of the dice for tight end desperados in an awful year for the position. Inactive for the Panthers are DE Marquis Haynes, CB Corn Elder, WR Damiere Byrd, LB Andre Smith, OG Brendan Mahon, DE Bryan Cox and RB Cameron Artis-Payne.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) is active for Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: Making his first appearance since Week 1, Olsen appeared to be an every-snap player. He looked no worse for the wear, finding plenty of cushion in the Redskins' defense. Olsen will be at risk of re-injury going forward but acing today's test was a huge step in the right direction toward earning every-week fantasy trust. He does have a tough matchup for Week 7. The Eagles have been vulnerable to the pass but stout up the seam.
report: Greg Olsen caught 4-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Panthers' Week 6 loss to the Redskins.

impact: It was Olsen's first game since reinjuring his foot in Week 1, but the Panthers did not take it easy on him. He also notched seven targets on the day. He will be at risk of an in-game setback all season, but he will be a solid TE1 when he is healthy.
report: Greg Olsen played 59-of-60 snaps (98 percent) Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: The Panthers limited Olsen in his first practice since his return last week. He made it through Sunday setback-free but Olsen remains a second half injury risk. Olsen should have a near every-down role for his Week 7 matchup with the Eagles.
report: Coach Ron Rivera said the Panthers plan to manage Greg Olsen's (foot) practice reps all season.

impact: Panthers coach Ron Rivera recently said the team would manage Olsen's practice reps all season. The veteran played 98 percent of Carolina's offensive snaps in last week's loss to Washington. Olsen is RotoPat's No. 8 tight end for Week 7 against the Eagles.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) remained limited at Thursday's practice

impact: Olsen got lost in a brutal first half by Cam Newton, who went 4-of-9 passing for 24 yards in the first two quarters. Devin Funchess and Torrey Smith did the second-half heavy lifting until Olsen’s goal-line score that proved the game winner. Week 8 opponent Baltimore has shown vulnerability in the middle of the field, so Olsen will have a better matchup next week than Carolina’s wideouts.
report: Greg Olsen caught 2-of-5 targets for five yards and a touchdown in the Panthers’ Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: His touchdown was from 11 yards out and has scored in 2-of-3 games since coming back from his broken foot.  This was his best game of the season.  Playing every down, Olsen will be a locked-in TE1 next week against Tampa.
report: Greg Olsen caught all four of his targets for 56 yards and one touchdown in the Panthers' Week 8 win over the Ravens.

impact: The catches and yards were both new season highs in what was easily Olsen's best game of 2018. Olsen continues to look 100 percent healthy even as he plays on a foot that is expected to require offseason surgery. Still a critical part of the Panthers' offense, Olsen will be locked and loaded as a TE1 for Thursday's short-week matchup with the Steelers.
report: Greg Olsen caught 6-of-6 targets for 76 yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 9 win over the Bucs.

impact: Olsen had a quiet night as the Panthers got boat raced. He came into the evening with a score in three-straight games and having cleared 56 yards in back-to-back contests. Olsen continued to look spry in the open field, belying his tenuous foot health. He will be a mid-range TE1 for Week 11 against the Lions.
report: Greg Olsen caught 4-of-6 targets for 40 yards in the Panthers' Week 10 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Olsen’s touchdown streak was broken last week against the Steelers, but he quickly started a new one in this game. Olsen was left wide open on play action at the goal line to cap an easy opening drive for the Panthers. That touchdown proved important for his fantasy day. Olsen did not catch any other passes in the first half, and he was limited to just one eight-yard catch after the break. He should find more success next week against the Seahawks.
report: Greg Olsen hauled in 2-of-3 targets for nine yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 11 loss to the Lions.

impact: Olsen also caught just two passes last week against the Lions, but he managed to save his fantasy day with a touchdown. He came close to doing the same thing in the fourth quarter, but he just could not come up with the goal-line target. His usage the last couple games has been troubling, but Olsen will remain a TE1 option in a great matchup against the Bucs next week.
report: Greg Olsen hauled in 2-of-4 targets for 11 yards in the Panthers' Week 12 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: He was immediately ruled out. Olsen had been playing through a re-fracture in his foot, so this has potential to be a season ending setback. Ian Thomes will take over as Carolina's passing-down tight end.
report: Greg Olsen left Week 13 against the Bucs with a foot injury.

impact: Olsen suffered a new foot injury, but it was likely from overcompensating his exiting one. He was on crutches after the game and looks headed for IR. Olsen lasted eight games before his foot finally gave out. Ian Thomas will close out the year as Carolina's receiving tight end.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) is expected to miss the rest of the season.

impact: He will be placed on injured reserve later this week. That's just a formality. The question is 33-year-old Olsen's football-playing future. He has now suffered three major foot injuries since the start of last season.
report: Greg Olsen (foot surgery) is out for the season.

impact: He's week to week. Latimer has three catches for 56 yards as the Giants' No. 3 receiver this year. Jawill Davis was promoted from the practice squad with Latimer out.
report: Cody Latimer (knee) has been ruled out for Week 4.

impact: Latimer was active last week against the Panthers, but he didn't play a single snap because of his knee injury. After getting in a full practice today, the Giants' No. 3 receiver should get back to his typical 45 snaps on Thursday night against the Eagles.
report: Cody Latimer (knee) was a full participant at practice on Tuesday and will play in Week 6's game against the Eagles.

impact: Latimer was injured covering a fourth quarter punt. The Giants' No. 3 receiver had caught 3-of-4 targets for 52 yards before going down. With Nos. 1 and 2 tight ends Evan Engram and Rhett Ellison sidelined, Latimer set a new season-high for yardage in his three quarters of play.
report: Giants WR Cody Latimer was forced from Thursday's game against the Eagles with a hamstring injury and will not return.

impact: Latimer suffered the injury covering a punt in Thursday's loss. Latimer opened the season as the No. 3 receiver, but he caught just six passes for 108 yards in four games. He will be a free agent in the spring. Bennie Fowler was added in his place.
report: Giants placed WR Cody Latimer (hamstring) on injured reserve.

impact: Penny was on the Cardinals' practice squad. ESPN Giants reporter Jordan Raanan hints Penny will be taking FB Shane Smith's roster spot outright after Smith struggled against the Cowboys. Judging from how the Giants looked on Sunday night, switching fullbacks will be tantamount to re-arranging deck chairs on the Titanic.
report: Giants signed FB Elijhaa Penny.

impact: Extremely thin at receiver, New England also added Corey Coleman on Tuesday. It is unlikely Fowler earns redraft fantasy value this season.
report: Patriots signed WR Bennie Fowler.

impact: The Patriots need the roster spot with RT Marcus Cannon (calf) questionable. Cole Croston was promoted from the practice squad as Cannon insurance.
report: Patriots released WR Bennie Fowler.

impact: Beckham could have had a much bigger day despite facing Jalen Ramsey on most of his snaps, but Eli Manning overthrew him twice in the end zone. Beckham made his presence known in the fourth quarter, however, getting loose for two long catches. Unfortunately, that drive ended on a failed fourth down, and a special teams turnover prevented the Giants from mounting another drive. Nevertheless, Beckham looked as good as ever in the season opener, and it is only a matter of time before he turns one of the many short catches he will see in this offense into a big play. He is going to be a fantasy monster all season long.
report: Odell Beckham hauled in 11-of-15 targets for 111 yards in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Beckham was held in check with two catches in the first half. He added some yards late with the Giants airing it out, but pass protection issues prevented Beckham from getting anything going downfield with Eli Manning. The Giants offensive line is a concern for Beckham's week to week consistency, but there's not much reason to downgrade his ROS outlook. Beckham will match up with Texans CB Johnathan Joseph in Week 3.
report: Odell Beckham caught 4-of-9 targets for 51 yards in the Giants' Week 2 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: The Giants got Beckham involved early with five of his catches coming in the first half. He wasn't needed with the Giants protecting a lead late, and added just 34 yards over the final two quarters. With Even Engram dealing with a knee injury, Beckham could see his target share rise in the coming weeks. He has a blowup matchup with the Saints in Week 4.
report: Odell Beckham caught 9-of-10 passes for 109 yards in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: Beckham has yet to score a touchdown this season in an offense really struggling through the air.  Beckham went into halftime on Sunday with two catches for -4 yards on five targets.  He also rushed one time for 10 yards and had numerous sideline flare-ups as frustration might be mounting for the star receiver.  OBJ will be a WR1 next week on the road against the Panthers.
report: Odell Beckham caught 7-of-11 targets for 60 yards in the Giants' Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: "How come we can’t throw the ball for more than 20 yards?," Beckham wondered aloud.  "How come we don’t attempt or try to throw the ball for more than 20 yards?  Those are questions that we have to figure out."  Eli Manning's longest pass play last week in the first half against a miserable Saints defense went for 11 yards, and he missed a wide-open OBJ on a couple occasions.  OBJ didn't stop there.  "A lot of it has to do with the energy that we have, that we don’t bring every single day," he continued.  "And you know me, I’m a passionate, energetic person.  We just need to play with some heart."  Frustration is mounting and started to boil over on the field a bit last week as OBJ remains without a touchdown and the Giants sitting at 1-3.
report: Odell Beckham voiced numerous concerns with the offense and the Giants' "energy" as a whole.

impact: It was a day of peaks and valleys for Beckham, who committed a brutal drop on fourth-and-three in the first quarter, then botched a punt that led to a fumble recovery and a Carolina touchdown (OBJ was attempting a block when the ball caromed off his leg, leading to a scrum in the end zone). Beckham shrugged off those mistakes later in the first half when he unfurled a 57-yard touchdown pass to a wide-open Saquon Barkley. That stands as the Giants' longest pass play of the season through five games. Odell added another touchdown in the fourth quarter, beating James Bradberry on a 33-yard deep heave by Eli Manning. In doing so, Beckham became the first Giant to both throw and catch a touchdown pass in the same game since Hall of Famer Frank Gifford in 1959. That was OBJ's first receiving score since Week 5 of last season. Beckham and the Giants will take a 1-4 record into Thursday's NFC East showdown against the Eagles.
report: Odell Beckham pulled in eight-of-14 targets for 131 yards and a touchdown while also throwing for a 57-yard touchdown Sunday in New York’s Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Visibly frustrated all evening, Beckham left the field before the first half was over. He was in the locker room as the G-Men lined up for what would have typically been a Hail Mary attempt.  Instead, they threw a screen. Speaking after the game, coach Pat Shurmur claimed Beckham needed an IV. Beckham was amongst the last out of the locker room for the second half, and was soon spotted screaming at a cooling machine. The reason for his frustration was evident to anyone watching the game. Eli Manning simply could not get him the ball on anything but the shortest of passes. The one time Manning tried to find Beckham down the sideline he laughably under-threw the ball. Beckham will look to take out his anger on the Falcons' bottom-tier defense in Week 7.
report: Odell Beckham caught 6-of-10 passes for 44 yards in the Giants' Week 6 loss to the Eagles.

impact: "I wish he would create the headlines by his play on the field as opposed to what he says and what he does off the field," Mara added. It is good Mara has identified Beckham as the Giants' real problem and not Eli Manning's ever deteriorating skill set.
report: Giants owner John Mara thinks Odell Beckham "needs to do a little more playing and a little less talking."

impact: Beckham had a relatively quiet first half with three catches for 57 yards, but he beat the defense for a 51-yard strike on a double-move in the third quarter then caught a pair of sideline passes in the fourth quarter to set up a Saquon Barkley touchdown run.  With the Giants then trailing 23-12 with five seconds left in the game, Beckham caught a meaningless-to-the-game one-yard touchdown.  But that score likely swung a lot of fantasy matchups and also allowed the Giants to backdoor the +4 spread for bettors.  OBJ has four 100-yard games this year and gets the Redskins at home in Week 8.
report: Odell Beckham caught 8-of-11 targets for 143 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' 23-20, Week 7 loss to the Falcons on Monday night.

impact: The Giants have a distinct inability to execute in the red zone beyond garbage time, but Beckham continues to churn fantasy points with monstrous sums of targets and Air Yards.  Beckham enters the Giants' Week 9 bye with five 100-plus-yard games over the first eight weeks.  Even for as poorly as Eli Manning has played, OBJ fantasy owners should be hoping the Giants don't turn to Kyle Lauletta.
report: Odell Beckham caught 8-of-11 targets for 136 yards in the Giants' Week 8 loss to the Redskins.

impact: It wasn't a very efficient night for Beckham, as he had a bad drop on the first play of the game, but OBJ was able to make his catches count.  His first score came from 10 yards out as he was left wide open on the back line of the end zone, while his second was a 20-yard connection over the top of CB Ahkello Whitherspoon.  Beckham has 100 yards and/or one touchdown in all but three games this season.  He gets the Bucs at home in a mouthwatering Week 11 spot.
report: Odell Beckham caught 4-of-11 targets for 73 yards and two touchdowns in the Giants' 27-23, Week 10 win over the 49ers on Monday night.

impact: Four targets may not seem like much, but it was actually a team-high in what was ultimately Saquon Barkley's penultimate display of athleticism. Barkley led the way on the ground with 27/142/2 as the Giants got the rookie steamrolling and never looked back. Although divisional games the second time around have historically been tougher for quarterbacks, Odell Beckham is talented enough to pick Eli Manning up on his own and turn in another WR1 showing against the Eagles' makeshift secondary in Week 12.
report: Odell Beckham vacuumed all four of his targets for 74 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 11 victory over the Bucs.

impact: The nine targets led the team, but Beckham was held in check by his standards against an Eagles secondary that was missing four of its top five cornerbacks to injury.  Philly was using multiple defensive backs to keep OBJ in check, giving up catches down the middle to TE Rhett Ellison and failing to cover Saquon Barkley a couple times.  OBJ gets the tough Bears in Week 13.
report: Odell Beckham caught 5-of-9 targets for 85 yards in the Giants' Week 12 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Eli Manning was horrendous in this one, averaging 4.9 YPA in the face of heavy pressure.  He threw behind his receivers, including OBJ on multiple occasions.  Beckham had to take matters into his own hands and dialed up a 49-yard TD bomb to Russell Shepard on a trick play.  He later caught a blind heave into the air from Manning for a one-yard score on 4th-and-goal.  Beckham is obviously being held back by Manning, but he remains a WR1 for Week 14 at the Redskins.
report: Odell Beckham caught 3-of-9 targets for 35 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' 30-27, Week 13 overtime win over the Bears, adding a 49-yard touchdown pass.

impact: Dickson sat out all of training camp with a quad strain, but it was still a surprise when he landed on the reserve/NFI list to open the season. With Will Dissly (knee) out for the season, the Seahawks need him back, and it sounds like he will be ready to go once the Seahawks return from their bye in Week 8. He could provide some much-needed fantasy depth at tight end once he gets up to speed.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll expects Ed Dickson (quad, NFI) to return when first eligible in Week 8.

impact: Speaking Tuesday, coach Pete Carroll apparently sounded more optimistic about Dickson's status than K.J. Wright's. With Nick Vannett dealing with a bulky back, Dickson's return would be a boost for the Seahawks' undermanned offense. Dickson would start out as a low-end TE2 in fantasy.
report: Ed Dickson (quad, NFI) will practice when the Seahawks come off their bye in Week 8 and could return against the Lions.

impact: Dickson is fully expected to be activated to make his Seahawks debut this week.  Coach Pete Carroll says Dickson has a chance to play "quite a bit" in his return.  Dickson could become a streaming option at a weak position.  With Will Dissly (knee) out for the year, Dickson's competition is Nick Vannett.
report: Ed Dickson (groin, NFI) returned to practice Monday.

impact: It puts Dickson on track for his Week 8 return. Coach Pete Carroll expects Dickson to have a significant role despite missing the last seven weeks. Dickson is on the TE2 radar in deeper leagues.
report: Ed Dickson (groin, NFI) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It means Dickson is on track to make his 2018 debut. Dickson could immediately be in line for 3-4 receptions, putting him on the TE2 radar.
report: Ed Dickson (groin) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Dickson was removed from Friday's injury report and will make his season debut against Detroit this Sunday. The Seahawks have been clamoring for more inline help since the team lost Will Dissly to start the year. He'll likely morph into a deep-league TE2 given the team's lack of competition at that position.
report: Ed Dickson (groin) will play in Week 8 against the Lions.

impact: This was expected after Dickson practiced all week. With Will Dissly out for the year, Dickson isn't going to be eased in despite missing the last six games. Dickson is on the streaming radar against a Lions defense he torched for 175 yards last season.
report: Seahawks activated TE Ed Dickson (groin) from reserve/NFI.

impact: Dickson should catch a few passes right off the bat. Inactive for the Seahawks are CB Neiko Thorpe, S Maurice Alexander, LB Emmanuel Ellerbee, C Joey Hunt, OG Jordan Simmons, DT Nazair Jones and DE Rasheem Green.
report: Seahawks TE Ed Dickson (groin) is active for Week 8 against the Lions.

impact: Dickson was making his 2018 debut. Dickson memorably went 5/175 in Detroit as a member of the Panthers last season. This wasn't as dramatic, but the Lions seemed to once again forget he existed. Dickson will catch some passes and score touchdowns, but with Nick Vannett still in the picture, Dickson is merely a last-gasp TE2.
report: Ed Dickson caught 2-of-2 targets for 52 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 8 win over the Lions.

impact: It was his lone target. Dickson has two scores but only five total targets through four games. He is miles from fantasy relevance.
report: Ed Dickson caught a 15-yard touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 11 win over the Packers.

impact: He saw all of his targets in the first half.  Marshall was really the only one to produce any offense for the Seahawks before the break, accounting for 44 of Russell Wilson's 68 pass yards.  Marshall is going to need touchdowns to be a fantasy producer.  He has 90 yards receiving through two games.  Marshall will be a TD-or-bust WR4/5 next week at home against the lowly Cowboys.
report: Brandon Marshall caught 4-of-6 targets for 44 yards in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: Marshall tied for the team lead with six targets but obviously he didn’t make the most of it. He beat Chidobe Awuzie for a 27-yard grab in the third quarter, then celebrated by doing pushups. Even with Doug Baldwin sidelined the past two games, Marshall has yet to establish himself as anything more than a deep bench stash in fantasy.
report: Brandon Marshall snagged two-of-six targets for 30 yards Sunday in Seattle’s Week 3 win over the Cowboys.

impact: With Doug Baldwin returning to action, Marshall was relegated to an ancillary option in the offense. He now has 10 catches for 125 yards on the season. He is not worth rostering in fantasy leagues moving forward. Seattle hosts the Rams in Week 5.
report: Brandon Marshall caught 1-of-3 targets for 5 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Carroll said Moore will be "mixing in" more.  Marshall has dropped four passes over the last two games and has shown very little on the stat sheet, catching a total of three balls for 35 yards the last two weeks.  He's yet to top 50 yards on the year.  Moore is long on talent and deserves a closer look.
report: Coach Pete Carroll hinted Brandon Marshall's playing time may be cut in favor of sophomore WR David Moore.

impact: Marshall's lone target came on a deep shot down the sideline in the second quarter. Quickly falling behind David Moore on the depth chart, Marshall can be dropped.
report: Brandon Marshall failed to catch his only target in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Marshall played fewer snaps than Doug Baldwin, Tyler Lockett, David Moore, and Jaron Brown. He can safely be dropped in all formats.
report: Brandon Marshall played 7-of-60 snaps (12 percent) Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: Marshall somewhat surprisingly made the 53-man roster after a strong summer, but the Seahawks began to phase him out after Week 3. Marshall's demotion coincided with second-year pro David Moore's rise. Moore just put on a show in Week 8 in Detroit, a game in which Marshall played only two snaps. Now 34, Marshall has had a long, strange trip career full of monster seasons, but he is near the end of the line.
report: Seahawks released WR Brandon Marshall.

impact: Marshall was released by the Seahawks last week.  The Lions traded Golden Tate to the Eagles on the same day Marshall was released.  In their first game minus Tate, the offense was horrendous.  Marshall has little to nothing left in the tank, however.  We're not sure he'd even be an upgrade on what's there.
report: Free agent WR Brandon Marshall worked out for the Lions on Monday.

impact: Fellow free agents Kamar Aiken and Dez Bryant are also working out. NFL.com's Mike Garofolo reports it's more than the Saints doing due diligence, and that one of the wideouts will be signed.
report: Free agent WR Brandon Marshall worked out for the Saints on Tuesday.

impact: The Saints signed Dez Bryant over Marshall earlier this week. With Bryant out for the year, they may circle back to Marshall as a veteran flyer. Marshall was a non-factor in Seattle the first seven weeks, but he could push Austin Carr and Ben Watson for targets.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Saints could have interest in free agent Brandon Marshall.

impact: Marshall will take Dez Bryant's spot. The Saints worked out Marshall last week and were considering adding him even before Bryant's injury. Marshall didn't show much with Seattle earlier this season but gives the Saints a veteran red-zone presence. He'll push Austin Carr and Ben Watson for targets.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Saints are expected to sign free agent Brandon Marshall this week.

impact: This move was expected following Dez Bryant's season-ending injury. Marshall did not appear to have much left in the tank during six games with the Seahawks earlier this season. He can be left on the wire in shallower leagues.
report: Saints signed Brandon Marshall to a one-year contract.

impact: Marshall has only been with the Saints five days. He's healthy but may not be in game shape after sitting the last three weeks. Marshall should be a scratch Sunday before making his Saints debut in Week 12.
report: The New Orleans Times-Picayune doesn't expect Brandon Marshall to play in Week 11 against the Eagles.

impact: Marshall joined New Orleans earlier this week and is still learning the team's offense. It's likely he'll make his Saints debut Thanksgiving night against Atlanta. With Marshall unavailable, Austin Carr will join Michael Thomas and rookie Tre'Quan Smith in three-wide sets against the Eagles.
report: Brandon Marshall won't play Week 11 against the Eagles.

impact: Signed earlier this week, Marshall was not expected to play. He could get his first action against the Falcons on Thanksgiving night. LT Terron Armstead (shoulder), DE Marcus Davenport (toe), LB Manti Te'o, DL Mitchell Loewen, C Will Clapp, and OL Chaz Green were also ruled out.
report: Saints declared Brandon Marshall inactive for Week 11 against the Eagles.

impact: Byrd has just one catch this season, but he has been a fixture on special teams. Byrd also ended last season on IR with a knee injury.
report: Panthers placed WR Damiere Byrd on injured reserve with a broken arm.

impact: Lockett did not do much in this game, but he was able to get open deep where Russell Wilson hit him for a 51-yard touchdown. That kind of play makes Lockett an interesting dart throw every week, but he needs to produce more consistently to be a reliable fantasy option. With Doug Baldwin dealing with a knee injury, he might get his chance moving forward. Lockett should be added in most leagues.
report: Tyler Lockett hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 59 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Lockett now has 3-59-1 and 5-60-1 lines to open the season.  Both touchdowns took big plays to score, as Lockett made a near-impossible grab draped in CB Kyle Fuller's coverage in the back corner of the end zone from 19 yards out in this one.  Fuller should have been flagged for interference but it didn't matter.  Lockett is very boom-or-bust-ish but gets a tasty date with the Cowboys at home in Week 3.  He'll be on the WR4 radar for that one.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 5-of-7 targets for 60 yards and one touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: He did most of his damage on one play, breaking off a 52-yard touchdown late in the first half on a play where Kavon Frazier blew his assignment. That was about it for Lockett, though the long touchdown may have been enough to push fantasy owners over the top. Lockett should remain Russell Wilson’s top receiving weapon in Doug Baldwin’s absence, though a tough matchup against Cardinals All-Pro corner Patrick Peterson awaits him in Week 4.
report: Tyler Lockett collected four catches for 77 yards and a touchdown on six targets Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Lockett was second on the team in targets with Doug Baldwin returning to action, but led the team in receiving yardage on Sunday. After scoring in the opening three weeks of the season, Lockett failed to reach the end zone for the first time this season. With Baldwin returning, Lockett will be a WR3/FLEX option Week 5 when the Seahawks host the Rams.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 5-of-6 targets for 53 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Lockett made the most of his opportunities in a game Russell Wilson completed just 13 passes. His touchdown was a 39-yarder on which he ran right past Marcus Peters, and he ran a great route to get the safety turned around on a 44-yard gain in the fourth quarter. With the Seahawks running a run-heavy, deep-shot offense, Lockett might end up being their most valuable fantasy receiver. He will have a good shot at some more big plays next week against the Raiders in London.
report: Tyler Lockett hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 98 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Lockett has now scored in 5-of-6 games.  Unfortunately, he was otherwise quiet in a game where the Seahawks leaned heavily on their rushing attack, and Doug Baldwin was Seattle's lone player to exceed four targets.  The Seahawks have a Week 7 bye forthcoming.  Lockett has earned every-week WR3/flex treatment.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 3-of-4 targets for 13 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 6 blowout win over the Raiders.

impact: Lockett has now scored in three-straight games, and 6-of-7 on the year. He beat sticky Nigel Lawson coverage for six. Lockett was lucky to find the end zone in Detroit, as Russell Wilson attempted only 17 passes. He will hope for more volume in what should be a higher-scoring game against the Chargers in Week 9.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 2-of-2 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 8 win over the Lions, adding two rushes for 13 additional yards.

impact: It was the fourth-straight game Lockett drew four or fewer targets. Unlike the first three, he did not find the end zone. Lockett will still remain in the WR4 mix for Week 10, as the Seahawks are going to have to up their passing volume to have any shot at keeping up with the Rams.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 3-of-4 targets for 22 yards in the Seahawks' Week 9 loss to the Chargers.

impact: The 85 yards from scrimmage were Lockett's most in four games. Lockett's 23-yard score was a thing of beauty against tight Troy Hill coverage. Hand fighting, Lockett won a tough battle and caught a perfectly-delivered Russell Wilson pass. It was his seventh touchdown of the season. Weekly target volume is difficult to predict in the Seahawks' run-heavy offense, but Thursday against the Packers could be another high-scoring game, raising Lockett's floor.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 5-of-6 targets for 67 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 10 loss to the Rams, adding an 18-yard carry.

impact: Lockett also drew a 48-yard DPI on a bad Russell Wilson underthrow. One of Lockett's five grabs looked like it could maybe be overturned on review, but a timeout-poor Mike McCarthy opted not to challenge. The 71 yards were Lockett's most in five games. Lockett has been visiting the end zone with regularity but has drawn more than six targets only one time all season. He will be a high-risk WR3/4 for Week 12 against the Panthers.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 5-of-5 targets for 71 yards in the Seahawks' Week 11 win over the Packers, adding a one-yard rush.

impact: Like the rest of the pass catchers, Lockett did not see many targets in the first half, but he made the most of them including a 27-yard catch-and-run to help spark a touchdown drive late in the second quarter. He scored himself after halftime, finding the end zone from 12 yards out to cap a long scoring drive. That score was his eighth of the season, and he has now scored in all but three games this year. His most impactful play was not a touchdown, however. With the game tied, Lockett worked open down the right sideline, and Russell Wilson found him for a 43-yard gain to set up the game-winning field goal. Seemingly scoring every week, Lockett will remain an upside WR3 next week against the 49ers.
report: Tyler Lockett hauled in all five of his targets for 107 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 12 win over the Panthers.

impact: It was a game of big plays for Lockett. His only catch was a 52-yard touchdown in which he did a great job shielding off the defenders and creating space for the catch in the first half. It was Lockett’s ninth touchdown of the season, and he has scored in all but three games this year. He made a splash again after halftime, taking the opening kick 84 yards to set up a Rashaad Penny touchdown run. He added a long defensive pass interference later in the game for good measure. The matchup next Monday against the Vikings is not great, but Lockett has earned weekly upside WR3 status with his touchdown prowess this season.
report: Tyler Lockett hauled in 1-of-2 targets for 52 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 13 win over the 49ers.

impact: His 10 targets were tied with Eric Ebron for third on the team behind Nyheim Hines and Chester Rogers, who each had 11, on a day Andrew Luck attempted a career-high 62 throws.  Pascal got the scoring started for Indy, beating CB Shareece Wright for a four-yard touchdown.  The second-year UDFA out of Old Dominion played heavy snaps early and late after T.Y. Hilton had to leave with chest and hamstring injuries.  With Hilton sitting Week 5 this Thursday night against the Patriots, Pascal should again get plenty of run in three-wide sets.  At 6'2/219, he's a big body in the red zone for Luck.
report: Colts WR Zach Pascal caught 6-of-10 targets for 56 yards and one touchdown in the Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: A second-year UDFA, Pascal was solid in Week 4 but a liability this evening. He committed a comical fourth quarter drop that resulted in an Andrew Luck "interception." It was the sort of play you usually only see in the preseason. Even if T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) remains sidelined for Week 6, Pascal will not be a recommended dart throw in either re-draft or DFS.
report: Zach Pascal caught 1-of-7 targets for 12 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: His seven targets tied for second most on the team.  Pascal's on-field play has been poor, but he has a real chance at a huge role in Week 7 versus Buffalo.  T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) and Jack Doyle (chest) haven't seemed close to returning, while Ryan Grant (ankle) and Marcus Johnson (undisclosed) exited Sunday's loss injured.  Pascal has seven or more targets in three straight games.
report: Colts WR Zach Pascal caught 5-of-7 targets for 35 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: Pascal only got in a limited practice Friday. The Colts are listing him with a head injury and not a concussion. With Ryan Grant out, Pascal should see a decent target share if he plays.
report: Zach Pascal (head) is questionable for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: Erickson buoyed his stellar play on special teams into a two-year extension with Cincinnati. Unfortunately for fantasy, he remains buried behind Josh Malone, Tyler Boyd, and other young standouts. He's now signed through the 2020 season.
report: Bengals signed WR Alex Erickson to a two-year, $4.68 million extension.

impact: We don't care about Smith for fantasy, but him missing practice will keep D.J. Moore locked into a starting job after playing a season-high 71% of the snaps last week and piling up 129 yards on seven touches against Baltimore.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: He also was out Wednesday. Smith looks set to miss his second game in a row, opening up a big role for D.J. Moore in a great matchup.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Fire up your D.J. Moore shares.  Moore is again expected to start after playing a season-high 70% of the snaps last week against the Ravens and piling up 129 yards on seven first-half touches before the Panthers sat on the ball in the second half.  The Bucs are No. 32 in points allowed to wideouts.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) is out for Week 9 against the Bucs.

impact: The Panthers enter Week 9 as one of the healthiest teams in the league. Smith's continued absence makes D.J. Moore an upside WR3.
report: Panthers declared WR Torrey Smith, OG Brendan Mahon, CB Josh Hawkins, DE Marquis Haynes, OG Amini Silatolu, RB Cameron Artis-Payne and LB Andre Smith inactive for Week 9 against the Bucs.

impact: Smith also sat out Monday's session. On a short week, it is unlikely Smith is ready to face the Steelers on Thursday night. D.J. Moore will continue to fill in as the No. 2 receiver.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) did not practice Tuesday.

impact: Smith will miss his third straight game. He'll have a chance to return coming off Carolina's mini-bye in Week 11.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) has been ruled out for Week 10 against the Steelers.

impact: Smith remains week to week. D.J. Moore and Curtis Samuel will continue to see increased run in his absence.
report: Panthers declared WR Torrey Smith, OG G Brendan Mahon, CB Josh Hawkins, DE Marquis Haynes, OG Amini Silatolu, RB Cameron Artis-Payne and LB Andre Smith inactive for Week 10 against the Steelers.

impact: It is a disappointment coming off the mini-bye, but Smith still has time to practice ahead of Carolina's date with the Lions on Sunday. D.J. Moore will continue to serve as the No. 2 while Smith is sidelined.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) did not practice Tuesday.

impact: D.J. Moore and Curtis Samuel have been filling in during Smith's three-week absence, but Moore had one big game and Samuel another while being quiet in the others.  They're still better playmakers than Smith.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: D.J. Moore played a season-high 86% of the snaps last week against Pittsburgh and will be in the WR3 discussion against Detroit's pitiful secondary.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) is out for Week 11 against the Lions.

impact: Smith did not practice this week and does not seem particularly close to returning. D.J. Moore will continue to fill in as the No. 2 receiver. Carolina also declared OG Brendan Mahon, RB Kenjon Barner, OG Amini Silatolu, DE Efe Obada, RB Travaris Cadet, and LB Andre Smith inactive.
report: Panthers declared Torrey Smith (knee) inactive for Week 11 against the Lions.

impact: Smith hasn't played since Week 7.  In his absence, first-round rookie D.J. Moore has taken off as a quality playmaker.  Moore needs to keep playing over Smith, but we'd bet the veteran mixes in for snaps out wide.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) returned to practice Wednesday.

impact: Despite being slapped with the questionable tag, coach Ron Rivera said he felt "pretty confident" Smith would suit up and play Sunday. Devin Funchess (back, doubtful) will likely be out, though, keeping D.J. Moore and Curtis Samuel involved as integral pieces in Carolina's explosive offense. Though he's not a fantasy option himself, Smith's downfield presence should open the field for Moore.
report: Torrey Smith (knee) is questionable for Week 12 against the Seahawks.

impact: This will be Smith's first game action since Week 7. He'll be needed Sunday with Devin Funchess (doubtful, back) unlikely to play. The epitome of a boom-or-bust deep threat, Smith will be a risky fantasy proposition against Seattle. Even with Smith back, D.J. Moore and Curtis Samuel should be enticing pieces for DFS players looking to save money at wide receiver.
report: Torrey Smith (questionable, knee) will play Week 12 against the Seahawks.

impact: Smith got the start, but he ended up playing limited snaps. There was no injury announcement, but perhaps he suffered a setback. Smith will not be a fantasy option even if he is able to play next week.
report: Torrey Smith was not targeted in the Panthers' Week 12 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Hilton appears to be over the hamstring injury that has sidelined him the past two weeks. His return is great news for Andrew Luck, who has had to make do with a depleted receiving corps the past two weeks. Hilton will return to a tough matchup against Bills corner Tre'Davious White, but he'll still be worthy of WR2 consideration.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: Hilton said his hamstring responded well after a full session on Wednesday. "Feeling good," Hilton said. "Taking it one day at a time. There's no need to rush it." Hilton looks on track to face the Bills.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is expected to practice Thursday.

impact: Despite the downgrade, both Hilton and the media were positive on his Thursday participation. It's sounding like Hilton will be full go against the Bills after missing Weeks 5 and 6. Hilton's main concern for Week 7 is likely shadow coverage from Buffalo's Tre'Davious White. Hilton is an upside WR2 for his return.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) was downgraded to "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Hilton had a mid-week downgrade but remains on track to return after missing the last two games. It's an upgrade for Andrew Luck and a Colts offense that's been getting by with a weak supporting cast. Coming off injury, Hilton is a Week 7 fade in a shy-away matchup with Tre'Davious White.
report: Colts coach Frank Reich is "optimistic" T.Y. Hilton (questionable, hamstring) will play in Week 7 against Buffalo.

impact: Hilton returned to full practice on Friday, prompting the Colts to remove him from the injury report. He'll tangle with Bills corner Tre'Davious White in his first game back from a two-week hamstring injury. Hilton is RotoPat's No. 25 wide receiver for Week 7.
report: T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring) wasn't listed on the Colts' final injury report for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: This was Hilton's first game back after missing the previous two weeks with hamstring and chest injuries. CBS analyst Adam Archuleta may have put it best when he said Tre'Davious White was on Hilton like a pair of skinny jeans. Despite the tough matchup, Hilton still gave fantasy owners a lift with his two touchdowns including a five-yarder with time winding down in the second quarter. His other touchdown was even shorter, coming on a one-yard strike from Andrew Luck with Indy up big in the fourth quarter. Sunday marked the 28-year-old's first multi-touchdown game since Week 9 of last season. Hilton will try to keep the train rolling next week against a leaky Raiders secondary.
report: T.Y. Hilton contributed four catches for 25 yards and two touchdowns on four targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 victory over the Bills.

impact: He took a goose egg into the fourth quarter before finally coming up with his first catch. Hilton has largely been a non-factor since coming back from a hamstring injury, managing just five grabs for 59 yards over his last two outings, though he did find the end zone twice in last week's victory over Buffalo. Hilton will face the struggling Jaguars at home when the Colts return from their upcoming bye week.
report: T.Y. Hilton was held to one catch for 34 yards on five targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 win over the Raiders.

impact: Hilton did not have much to do early with the Colts’ tight ends dominating, but he did get wide open for a 35-yard catch in the first quarter. That was basically it for Hilton for most of the game, but he showed back up when it mattered most. With the Colts clinging to a three-point lead, Hilton again got wide open for another 35-yard gain to help run down more clock. He should have an easier time next week against the Titans.
report: T.Y. Hilton hauled in 3-of-7 targets for 77 yards in the Colts' Week 10 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Hilton entered the afternoon with just eight catches in three games since returning from his hamstring injury but proceeded to go bonkers for his biggest game of the season despite a tough matchup with Adoree' Jackson. The highlight was Hilton's 68-yard touchdown in the second quarter. Hilton got a step on Jackson and Andrew Luck delivered a perfect deep ball in stride. Hilton's second score was "only" 14 yards but was nearly as impressive thanks to some fancy sideline footwork. Hilton will have a chance to get a hot streak going in a mouthwatering Week 12 home matchup with the Dolphins.
report: T.Y. Hilton caught 9-of-9 targets for 155 yards and two touchdowns in the Colts' Week 11 demolition of the Titans.

impact: Just like that, Hilton has now posted back-to-back 125-yard games after he entered Week 11 with a 2018 high of 115. Hilton was the intended target on Andrew Luck's first interception, essentially having his route run for him by Xavien Howard. Otherwise, he was the player we came to know before Luck's shoulder woes. Although he's once again locked in as an every-week WR1 at home, Hilton will have to contend with Jalen Ramsey on the road in Week 13.
report: T.Y. Hilton caught 7-of-10 targets for 125 yards in the Colts' Week 12 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Eric Ebron (back) was also absent.  With Marlon Mack (concussion) also sidelined, it's a bad start to the week for the Colts.  This could easily be a sort of veteran's maintenance day for both Hilton and Ebron ahead of a date with the Jaguars.
report: T.Y. Hilton (groin) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Wednesday was a maintenance day. Coming off back-to-back 125-yard games, Hilton is headed on the road to face a Jaguars defense that could be missing top cornerback Jalen Ramsey (knee).
report: T.Y. Hilton (groin) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: He got the day off Wednesday but was removed from the injury report after getting in limited sessions on both Thursday and Friday. Hilton's Week 13 outlook will improve if Jalen Ramsey (questionable, knee) sits.
report: T.Y. Hilton (groin) wasn't listed on the Colts' final injury report for Week 13 against the Jaguars.

impact: Hilton had his fair share of wins, but this was an epic battle against Jalen Ramsey that Ramsey ultimately won in the Jaguars' 6-0 shutout upset victory.  Hilton got shaken up on a tough fourth-quarter catch in Ramsey's coverage but only missed one play.  Hilton will get a better Week 14 matchup against the Texans, who lost CB Johnathan Joseph to a neck injury on Sunday.
report: T.Y. Hilton caught 8-of-13 targets for 77 yards in the Colts' Week 13 loss to Jacksonville.

impact: Eric Ebron (back, illness) was also sidelined for Wednesday's session. It's a new injury for Hilton, who has previously battled chest, hamstring and groin issues this year. The Colts are known to give their stars maintenance days, so we wouldn't read too much into this. Still, Hilton's health will have to be monitored throughout the week. Hopefully he'll be ready for Sunday's game versus Houston, who he dominated earlier this year (four catches for 115 yards on six targets in Week 4).
report: T.Y. Hilton (shoulder) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: The Chiefs romped, but Kelce continued his recent trend of quiet games against the Bolts. He has just two catches in two career games in "StubHub Center." The Chiefs have so many weapons that down weeks are bound to happen for Kelce, but he will be back out there as a top-three TE1 against the Steelers in Week 2. Patrick Mahomes has the looks of a quarterback who is going to get all of his studs big plays.
report: Travis Kelce caught just 1-of-6 targets for six yards in the Chiefs' Week 1 win over the Chargers.

impact: One week after he was held to one catch against the Chargers, Kelce erupted for just the third two-touchdown game of his career. Kelce split CB Cameron Sutton and LB Jon Bostic on his first score, corralling an absolute laser from Patrick Mahomes. For the second, he caught a low throw near the goal line for a 25-yarder. Kelce will get the 49ers in what could be a high-scoring Week 3 affair.
report: Travis Kelce caught 7-of-10 targets for 109 yards and two touchdowns in the Chiefs' Week 2 win over the Steelers.

impact: Patrick Mahomes spread the ball around in this one, but he kept coming back to Kelce, who was seemingly open on every play. The tight end finished the first half with 93 yards including a great one-handed grab in the two-minute drill, and he could have had a bigger day if the Chiefs were forced to throw more in the second half. He will remain a top-two tight end option next week in Denver.
report: Travis Kelce hauled in 8-of-10 targets for 114 yards in the Chiefs' Week 3 win over the 49ers.

impact: Kelce went catch-less on three targets in the first half but became Patrick Mahomes' go-to option after the break.  His touchdown came on a short pop pass to the right from two yards out in the fourth quarter.  Later in the same quarter, Kelce was drilled in the stomach and ribs area on an end-zone target and buckled to the ground before leaving the field with trainers.  It's possible he simply had the wind knocked out of him.  After catching one pass for six yards in the opener, Kelce has 22 catches for 301 yards and three touchdowns the last three weeks.  He gets the Jaguars in Week 5.
report: Travis Kelce caught 7-of-12 targets for 78 yards and one touchdown in the Chiefs' Week 4 win over the Broncos on Monday night.

impact: Kelce continued to look like the best tight end in the league in this one. He shook Telvin Smith to get open for a 15-yard catch on the opening drive, and he left Barry Church in the dust when he put on the brakes and changed direction on his 40-yard catch-and-run in the second quarter. He should have had a touchdown on that drive, but he dropped the pass. Kelce now has at least 100 yards in three of his last four games. He will be the top option at tight end next week in New England.
report: Travis Kelce hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 100 yards in the Chiefs' Week 5 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Kelce did all his damage early in this one. He was held without a catch in the second half with Tyreek Hill putting on a show. The Patriots took away Kelce on third downs and in red-zone situations. Kelce will remain a locked-in TE1 for a potential Week 7 shootout with the Bengals.
report: Travis Kelce caught 5-of-9 passes for 61 yards in Week 6 against the Patriots.

impact: Kelce got most of his yards on a 44-yard third down catch in the first quarter. He led the Chiefs in receiving, but was faded in the red-zone in favor of Kareem Hunt and Demetrius Harris. Kelce has been held out of the end-zone in three straight weeks. He's due for some positive regression in Week 8 against Denver.
report: Travis Kelce caught five passes for 95 yards in Week 7 against the Bengals.

impact: Four of Kelce's catches came in the first half. That's also when he scored his lone touchdown, finding the end zone on a nine-yard strike from Patrick Mahomes early in the second quarter. Sunday erased a three-game touchdown drought for Kelce, who has now eclipsed 70 yards in six of his last seven outings. He's been a thorn in Denver's side, scoring in each of his last five games against KC's division rival. Kelce and the Chiefs begin the second half of their season next week at Cleveland.
report: Travis Kelce corralled six-of-10 targets for 79 yards and a touchdown Sunday in the Chiefs’ Week 8 win over Denver.

impact: The Northeast Ohio native played in his first game in Cleveland of his career and did not disappoint. Kelce  repeatedly found holes in the Browns offense all afternoon. His scoring strikes came from 11 and 13-yards out, the latter which was an all-hands spear in coverage to open the second half and put the Chiefs up 28-15. Kelce is on pace to set new career-highs across the board and will be the top fantasy option at tight end in Week 10 when the Chiefs host the Cardinals.
report: Travis Kelce caught 7-of-9 targets for 99 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 9 win over the Browns.

impact: It breaks a two-game scoring streak for Kelce. Kelce finished behind only Tyreek Hill in targets and yards, but there just wasn't much volume for him with Patrick Mahomes throwing for only 249 yards. Even if Sammy Watkins returns, Kelce should rebound in a potential Week 11 shootout against the Rams.
report: Travis Kelce caught 6-of-7 targets for 46 yards in Week 11 against the Cardinals.

impact: The crazy thing was Kelce was stuck on one catch for three yards on three targets before the final drive of the second quarter where he picked up three-straight catches to set up an eventual sort Chris Conley eight-yard touchdown.  Kelce's 15 targets ended up being a game-high, and he found the end zone as well, scoring from four yards out in the third quarter to tie the game 30-30.  Kelce was wrecking the Rams over the middle but also had a couple untimely drops.  The Chiefs head into their bye before going to Oakland in Week 13.  Kelce is THE TE1.
report: Travis Kelce caught 10-of-15 targets for 127 yards and one touchdown in the Chiefs' 54-51, Week 11 loss to the Rams on Monday night.

impact: He was used as a part-time player, but it was nice to see him out there nonetheless considering his injury history.  Eifert's playing time figures to rise as he shows the coaching staff he can be trusted from a durability standpoint.  Eifert will be a touchdown-or-bust streamer in Week 2 versus Baltimore.
report: Tyler Eifert caught 3-of-3 targets for 44 yards in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: Eifert had an uneventful game on a night where Andy Dalton tossed four first half scores. Eifert got out-gained 45-23 by reserve TE C.J. Uzomah, though he did draw an end zone DPI, setting the Bengals up at the one-yard line. Eifert now has just five catches for 67 scoreless yards through two games as the Bengals stick to their pledge of rationing his snaps. There's still massive touchdown upside here, but Eifert is appearing best treated as a touchdown-or-bust, low-end TE1.
report: Tyler Eifert caught 2-of-4 targets for 23 yards in the Bengals' Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: After drawing only three and four targets in the first two games, Eifert was a much bigger factor in this one, making his trademark tough catches in traffic and helping Andy Dalton move the sticks on third down.  A.J. Green (groin) went down at the start of the third quarter and never returned.  If Green can't play in Week 4 at Atlanta, Eifert's passing-game role will further expand.
report: Tyler Eifert caught 6-of-8 targets for 74 yards in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to Carolina.

impact: The injury appeared to be a gruesome leg break, and trainers quickly put an air cast on Eifert's right leg. It would be shocking if the news is anything but a broken right leg or ankle. It is terrible luck for a player who had just fully returned to form following a series of back injuries. Eifert had four catches for 38 yards and a touchdown before exiting. Tyler Kroft and C.J. Uzomah will look to replace him.
report: Tyler Eifert exited Week 4 against the Falcons with a lower leg injury.

impact: That is exactly what it looked like on the field. It is terrible luck for a player who had just rounded back into form after losing two seasons to back issues. He should be placed on injured reserve this week. Tyler Kroft and C.J. Uzomah will handle the majority of the tight end snaps moving forward.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Tyler Eifert suffered a broken ankle Week 4 against the Falcons.

impact: Vontaze Burfict, who is back from a four-game suspension, was activated in the corresponding move. Eifert broke his ankle in devastating fashion last week against the Falcons. It's been a frustrating few years for Eifert, who has logged just 14 appearances since his breakout 2015 campaign. C.J. Uzoma will likely serve as the lead tight end in his absence, though Tyler Kroft will also see snaps.
report: Bengals placed TE Tyler Eifert (ankle) on injured reserve.

impact: It was a quiet day for Funchess as the Panthers bludgeoned the Bucs on the ground. D.J. Moore and Curtis Samuel also stole yardage on gadget plays. More uneven since Greg Olsen's healthy return, Funchess will be a mid-range WR3 for Thursday night's game against the Steelers.
report: Devin Funchess caught 4-of-5 targets for 44 yards in the Panthers' Week 9 win over the Bucs.

impact: Funchess' targets were as many as D.J. Moore and just one more than Curtis Samuel. He has now been held below 50 yards in back-to-back games and is trending toward back-end WR3 status. The Panthers are traveling to Detroit for Week 11.
report: Devin Funchess caught 3-of-5 targets for 32 yards in the Panthers' Week 10 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Funchess’ day got off to a good start when he got loose for 23 yards on the opening drive, but it could have been better had he held on for what should have been a short score on that drive. That was just the start of his struggles. Funchess could not come down with a beautifully thrown deep pass on his next target and dropped what should have been a big gain the next drive. After halftime, he failed to come down with what would have been a tough catch on third down, and he dropped another pass on the opening drive of the fourth quarter. He did convert a long third down late, but this was a disappointing outing. Funchess will look to turn things around next week against the Seahawks.
report: Devin Funchess hauled in 2-of-8 targets for 39 yards in the Panthers' Week 11 loss to the Lions.

impact: It's a new injury for Funchess after he went down late in last week's loss to the Lions.  Funchess was terrible last Sunday, dropping multiple passes.  He's yet to have an 80-yard game this season.  If he plays, Funchess is a WR3/4.
report: Devin Funchess (back) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: It is his second missed practice in a row, putting his availability for Sunday in serious doubt. Torrey Smith (knee) does look on track to return, but Funchess sitting would be a blow to Carolina's offense. On the bright side, it would give D.J. Moore a better chance to build on his breakout.
report: Devin Funchess (back) did not practice Thursday.

impact: He's been sidelined all week and is a long shot to play against the Seahawks.  Torrey Smith (knee) should be back to pick up some slack, but D.J. Moore, Greg Olsen, and Christian McCaffrey would do the heavy lifting.
report: Devin Funchess (back) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: Funchess missed practice throughout the week, all but ensuring he's sidelined Sunday in Seattle. Coach Ron Rivera mentioned he felt "pretty confident" Torrey Smith (knee, questionable) would be back in the lineup. Funchess' absence still leaves a direct path for rookie D.J. Moore to stay on the field, with Curtis Samuel continuing to mix in behind him. Moore is a low-end WR3 in this rough matchup.
report: Devin Funchess (back) is doubtful for Week 12 against the Seahawks.

impact: It's hardly a surprise as Funchess didn't practice all week and was listed as doubtful on Friday's injury report. Greg Olsen and Christian McCaffrey should both see heavy workloads while impressive rookie D.J. Moore will also benefit from Funchess' absence.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirms Devin Funchess (doubtful, back) is not expected to play Week 12 against the Seahawks.

impact: Coming off a disastrous game last Sunday, Funchess was not able to practice at all this week. He could be looking at a multi-week injury. Torrey Smith is back in the lineup, but D.J. Moore figures to serve as the primary receiver while Funchess is out. Carolina also declared OG Brendan Mahon, OG Amini Silatolu, DE Efe Obada, RB Kenjon Barner, RB Travaris Cadet, and LB Andre Smith inactive.
report: Panthers declared Devin Funchess (back) inactive for Week 12 against the Seahawks.

impact: Funchess didn't play last week and isn't off on the right foot this week.  If he sits, D.J. Moore and Curtis Samuel will continue to be the Panthers' top wideouts with Jarius Wright in the slot.  Moore would be a firm WR2 against Tampa.
report: Devin Funchess (back) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Funchess sat out Wednesday after missing all of last week. He was officially limited Thursday. It at least gives him a shot to suit up against the Bucs. Funchess playing would be a downgrade for D.J. Moore.
report: Devin Funchess (back) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: We expect Funchess to be out there against Tampa Bay after getting in limited practice work the past two days. Coach Ron Rivera said Funchess would have been listed as probable if that injury designation still existed. Curtis Samuel figures to see fewer reps with Funchess back in the lineup this week.
report: Devin Funchess (back) is questionable for Week 13 against the Bucs.

impact: Funchess' back injury only cost him one game. He'll be active against the Bucs, though it sounds like the fourth-year receiver will be on a strict snap count. With Funchess being eased back, D.J. Moore and Greg Olsen should see increased roles in the passing game along with exciting sophomore Curtis Samuel. Moore in particular carries huge upside for Sunday's shootout at Raymond James.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Devin Funchess (questionable, back) is expected to play Week 13 against the Buccaneers but only on a limited basis.

impact: Funchess was expected to play despite not getting in a full week of practice. His back injury will only end up costing him one game. Carolina's inactives are OG Amini Silatolu, DE Marquis Haynes, RB Travaris Cadet, OG Brendan Mahon, CB Lorenzo Doss, LB Andre Smith, and DT Vernon Butler.
report: Devin Funchess (back) is active for Week 13 against the Bucs.

impact: He saw just three targets. Funchess played limited snaps but managed to find the end-zone after having an earlier touchdown called back. The Panthers didn't push Funchess in his first game back form a neck injury, but he should be back to his normal role for Week 14 against the Browns.
report: Devin Funchess caught a 10-yard touchdown in Week 13 against the Bucs.

impact: However, coach Marvin Lewis said Green will practice later this week.  Whether that's Thursday or Friday remains to be known.  Reports over the weekend were than Green has a "good chance" to play against the Browns.
report: A.J. Green (toe) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Coach Marvin Lewis had said Green would practice later in the week. Friday will now be his only option. As of Thursday afternoon, it appears Green will miss his third-consecutive game.
report: A.J. Green (toe) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Everything had been positive on Green leading up to the holiday, but he didn't practice Wednesday or Thursday and declined to talk to the media on Friday.  He said he'd talk if he was playing, so beat writers are reading the tea leaves here.  We should have an official designation on Green in a couple hours.
report: The Athletic's Jay Morrison reports "it doesn't look like" A.J. Green (toe) will play Week 12 against the Browns.

impact: Green hasn't practiced at all this week and remained idle on Friday.  Lewis said he could practice Saturday and will be reevaluated tomorrow before the team makes a decision on Green for Sunday against Cleveland.  Still, we doubt Green ends up playing.  It sounds like it'll be at least another week.
report: Coach Marvin Lewis refused to rule out A.J. Green (toe) for Week 12 against the Browns.

impact: It's an upgrade from last week when Green was doubtful vs. Baltimore and didn't end up playing, but he still hasn't practiced this week.  Coach Marvin Lewis said Green will "work" on Saturday and be reevaluated then.  We may find out more on Green in the next 24 hours, but he sounds truly 50/50.
report: A.J. Green (toe) is questionable for Week 12 against the Browns.

impact: This doesn't come as a surprise after Green didn't practice all week. The Bengals may still work out Green pre-game, but he didn't show enough in Saturday's walkthrough to get cleared. Tyler Boyd and C.J. Uzomah are in line for another week of increased targets. Green looks on track for a Week 13 return.
report: ESPN's Josina Anderson reports A.J. Green (questionable, toe) isn't expected to play in Week 12 against the Browns.

impact: Green will miss his third straight game. He's targeting a Week 13 return.
report: A.J. Green (toe) has been downgraded to doubtful for Week 13.

impact: This was expected after Green didn't practice and was downgraded to doubtful. Green is reportedly getting close to playing, so he should return next week. Tyler Boyd and C.J. Uzomah are strong plays against the Browns with Green out.
report: A.J. Green (doubtful, toe) has been ruled out for Week 12.

impact: He out-targeted John Ross 5 to 2.  Boyd is unlikely to be a fantasy factor behind A.J. Green, Joe Mixon, and Tyler Eifert, but he has a more secure role than the Bengals' hyped sophomore wideout as Cincy's locked-in slot man.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 3-of-5 targets for 26 yards in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: The 91 yards tied a career high, as did the targets. Running comfortably ahead of John Ross behind A.J. Green, Boyd was creating cushion for his catches. He now has nine grabs for 117 yards and a score through the Bengals' first two games. He could be coming onto the WR5 radar in fantasy.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 6-of-9 targets for 91 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: "He understands running routes," Dalton said. "He’s versatile. You can move him around. He’s had a lot of production in the slot and we’ve been able to move him around too." Boyd is having quite the turnaround after a lost 2017. He's already halfway to last year's yardage total. He's miles ahead of John Ross on the depth chart. Boyd could have some WR4 appeal once bye weeks kick in.
report: Speaking Thursday, Andy Dalton said third-year receiver Tyler Boyd is "so good."

impact: Green seemed to be close last week against the Browns, and the Bengals badly need him after going 0-3 with Green on the sideline.  The playoff hopes are likely dead with Andy Dalton (thumb) done for the year, but Jeff Driskel has shown some playmaking ability in limited NFL action.  Green will be more of a WR2 with Driskel until Driskel proves he can consistently get him the ball.
report: A.J. Green (toe) participated in Wednesday morning's walkthrough and said he's "back to play" this week against the Broncos.

impact: A "full" session on Friday would be nice, but Green is fully expected to return from his three-game absence against the Broncos. He will be playing with backup QB Jeff Driskel, rendering him a risky, but upside, WR2.
report: A.J. Green (toe) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: With Jeff Driskel tossing him the ball, Green needs to be ticked down a bit, but he'll be a strong WR2 with upside as he likely avoids slot CB Chris Harris most of the afternoon.  Green needs to be in all season-long lineups.
report: A.J. Green (toe) was removed from the Week 13 injury report and will play against the Broncos.

impact: The All-World talent hit the ground on a non-contact injury and immediately pointed to his foot. Having been held out since Week 8 with a toe injury, it's likely Green's season is now done. He's officially been ruled out for the remainder of Week 13 against Denver.
report: A.J. Green (foot) was carted off Week 13 against the Broncos.

impact: Green's season appears to be in danger after he was carted off against the Broncos, but the Bengals are not ready to make any public pronouncements. The latest his status will be updated is Wednesday, when the Bengals return to practice.
report: A.J. Green (foot) was spotted in a walking boot on Monday, though coach Marvin Lewis declined to update his status.

impact: Boyd was a monster in Week 2 against the Ravens, and he stepped up to become Andy Dalton's favorite target on Sunday as A.J. Green (groin) exited early in the third quarter and never returned.  Dalton hit Boyd for a spectacular 27-yard rollout touchdown, then found Boyd open off a broken play in the second half for a 49-yard gain.  Dalton is looking for Boyd when he's in trouble.  Boyd has earned WR3 treatment entering Week 4 at Atlanta, and could push for WR2 value if Green can't play.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 6-of-7 targets for 132 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to Carolina.

impact: An established factor in Cincinnati's offense at this point, Boyd was one of Andy Dalton's favorite targets all game, but he was spectacular on the game-winning touchdown drive, converting a third down and two fourth downs. He now has two 100-yard games in a row after zero in the first 28 games of his career. With Dalton playing great and Tyler Eifert likely out for the year, Boyd should return at worst WR3 value the rest of the way.
report: Tyler Boyd hauled in 11-of-15 targets for 100 yards in the Bengals' Week 4 win over the Falcons.
