impact: It's a step back after Boyd went over 90 yards the last three weeks. The Bengals went run heavy against Miami, leaving just seven targets for Boyd behind A.J. Green. With Tyler Eifert on IR, there's a lot to like with Boyd's ROS outlook. He'll be a WR3 for a plus Week 6 matchup with the Steelers.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 4-of-7 passes for 44 yards in Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: His nine looks were second on the team to A.J. Green's dozen.  Boyd was the recipient of both of Andy Dalton's touchdowns, from two and 14 yards out, and Boyd had to make a diving catch on the two-yarder.  He made a number of difficult grabs in this one on a day Dalton was off the mark.  Boyd has been a steady WR2 for weeks and will stay that way next week against the Chiefs.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 7-of-9 targets for 62 yards and two touchdowns in the Bengals' 28-21, Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Boyd was invisible in the first half, getting held without a catch. He managed to get some targets late with the Bengals airing it out, but it's a disappointing game. Boyd has been held under 50 yards in two of the last three weeks. He'll be a low-end WR2 for Week 8 against the Bucs.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 2-of-4 passes for 27 yards in Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: Green returned from his foot injury this past week after missing three games and promptly was re-injured, costing him even more time while needing to go under the knife.  Green will be 31 next season and has one year remaining on his contract.  He'll be a candidate for an extension, as this shouldn't deter the Bengals.  Tyler Boyd and John Ross will hold down the fort at wideout.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports A.J. Green will undergo season-ending surgery for torn ligaments in his toe and will be sidelined 3-4 months.

impact: Green has an interesting offseason ahead.  He has one year left on his contract through 2019 and may not want to play out next year on a one-year deal.  Green turns 31 next summer.  The Bengals and Green will have to decide if they want to stay together, and if they do, then Cincinnati will have to try and find common ground on dollars.  Green has finished two of the last three years on IR.
report: Bengals placed WR A.J. Green (toe) on injured reserve, ending his season.

impact: Boyd pulled a disappearing act in last week's loss at Arrowhead.  He rebounded in a major way on Sunday, repeatedly dusting the Bucs' leaky slot coverage and scoring from seven yards out in the second quarter.  Boyd has had some ups and downs, but he has also developed into one of the NFL's premier slot receivers.  He will be a WR2/3 when Cincinnati returns from its Week 9 bye.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 9-of-10 targets for 138 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 8 win over the Bucs.

impact: In his first game without A.J. Green, Boyd matched season lows in targets and receptions as he was torpedoed by the inept Cincinnati offense, something we've now seen happen twice over their past three games. Boyd started off on the right foot, catching a 23-yard pass on the second play of the game, but the Bengals offense just fell apart after that opening drive. Despite the down day, Boyd will still be a WR2 option in Week 11 against the Ravens.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 3-of-4 targets for 65 yards in Sunday's Week 10 loss to the Saints.

impact: The Ravens used numerous double teams to deal with Boyd, explaining his inefficiency.  He did deliver gains of 29 and 32 but is getting no help from Cincinnati's lack of alternative weapons.  Still a volume monster, Boyd will remain a playable WR3 with WR2 upside when the Bengals host the Browns next.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 4-of-11 targets for 71 yards in the Bengals' Week 11 loss to Baltimore.

impact: Boyd bounced back in a loss with his most catches and yards since A.J. Green was sidelined. Boyd managed just two catches for 23 yards in the first half, but then was peppered with opportunity in the second half with Cincinnati trailing huge. Boyd caught a 26-yard score from backup quarterback Jeff Driskel to make the score 35-14 in the third quarter. Boyd will enter Week 13 as WR3 option if Driskel is forced to start next week against the Broncos.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 7-of-8 targets for 85 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 12 loss to the Browns.

impact: A.J. Green (foot) was carted off mid-game, allowing Boyd to finish with a team-high 97 yards through the air. He nearly tripled-up Cincinnati's next closest receiver in yardage (C.J. Uzomah, 33). Even with Green presumably out for the rest of the season, Boyd's ceiling will be extremely limited moving forward as long as he's catching passes from Jeff '6.2 YPA' Driskel. He'll still be a usage-based borderline WR2 next week as the Bengals attempt to keep pace with the Chargers.
report: Tyler Boyd soaked up 6-of-8 targets for 97 yards in the Bengals' Week 13 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Ross was limited at last week's practices before sitting out against Pittsburgh. He should be available this week, though the 2017 first-rounder isn't someone fantasy owners can count on yet.
report: John Ross (groin) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: This is the same injury that sidelined Ross the last two games. Ross is likely to miss more time with his latest setback.
report: John Ross left Week 7 against the Chiefs with a groin injury.

impact: Ross aggravated an existing groin ailment in Week 7. The No. 9 overall pick of the 2017 draft simply cannot stay healthy. Ross has seven career catches.
report: NFL.com's Mike Garofolo reports John Ross (groin) will be sidelined "a few weeks."

impact: Ross is out indefinitely again following his latest groin setback.
report: Bengals declared WR John Ross, CB Darqueze Dennard, RB Giovani Bernard, C Billy Price, LB Vontaze Burfict, LB Nick Vigil, and TE Tyler Kroft inactive for Week 8 against the Bucs.

impact: It is not clear how much Ross will do, but he was on the field with his helmet in the portion of practice open the media. The Bengals do not have to release an injury report until Wednesday. With A.J. Green (toe) questionable at best, the Bengals could use a healthy Ross.
report: John Ross (groin) returned to practice Monday.

impact: Ross is on track to return coming off Cincy's bye. With A.J. Green out, he's in line for an expanded role. Ross should start in three-wide sets.
report: John Ross (groin) is practicing fully this for Week 10.

impact: Despite, catching just two passes, Ross led the Bengals in targets in their first game without A.J. Green. Ross provided the lone touchdown for the Bengals on their opening drive of the game, securing a 2-yard touchdown when he came across the back of the end zone. He added a 37-yard catch and run later in the game, but suffered the same fate as the entire Bengals offense as Cincinnati did next to nothing for the rest of the game. Ross has just nine catches on the season, but will be needed to step up with Green expected to miss at least Week 11 at minimum. Ross will only be a desperation option next week at Baltimore.
report: John Ross caught 2-of-6 targets for 39 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 10 loss to the Saints.

impact: It's a downgrade after Ross practiced fully last week. We didn't see Ross suffer any setbacks in Sunday's game. The Bengals are likely managing reps.
report: John Ross (groin) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ross played through the injury last week and should be fine for Sunday's game in Baltimore. With A.J. Green (toe) likely to miss another game, the second-year speedster could be relied on more heavily this week.
report: John Ross (groin) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ross practiced all week, so we'd expect him to be out there in Baltimore.  He caught a short touchdown last week, but Ross has just nine grabs on the season and is more of a score-or-bust WR4 with a scary-low floor.
report: John Ross (groin) is questionable for Week 11 against the Ravens.

impact: The second-year speedster is all systems go after getting in a limited week of practice. With A.J. Green (doubtful, toe) likely to sit, Ross should see an added workload Sunday at Baltimore. That said, the 2017 first-rounder makes for a risky fantasy bet in a tough matchup.
report: John Ross (questionable, groin) is expected to play Week 11 against the Ravens.

impact: There are no surprises Cincinnati's inactives group, which consist of WR A.J. Green, CB KeiVarae Russell, LB Preston Brown, LB Nick Vigil, OT Cedric Obguehi, WR Josh Malone, and DT Adolphus Washington.  Last week, Ross operated as the Benglals' No. 2 wideout behind Tyler Boyd with Cody Core and Alex Erickson sharing third receiver duties.
report: John Ross is active for Week 11 against the Ravens.

impact: The stat line is similar to last week's, when Ross managed 2/39/1 against the Saints. On Sunday, Ross beat Ravens CB Marlon Humphrey on his 22-yard score. Ross has been highly inefficient all season, he has found the end zone just often enough to be fringe WR3/flex worthy.  Ross will be the likeliest Bengals to draw impressive Browns rookie CB Denzel Ward's coverage in Week 11.
report: John Ross caught 2-of-7 targets for 27 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 11 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Ross found the end zone for his third consecutive game, but once again his touchdown anchored his day. Ross has now secured 7-of-20 targets for 97 yards over the past three games with A.J. Green sidelined. While his touchdown streak is a positive to build on, Ross is still only a WR4 option in Week 13 against the Broncos.
report: John Ross caught 3-of-7 targets for 31 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 12 loss to the Browns.

impact: Even with A.J. Green (foot) being carted off mid-game, Ross wasn't able to overcome Jeff Driskel's inability to escape Denver's pass rush. With Green in and out of the lineup over the last four games, Ross has hauled in 9-of-20 targets for 110 yards. He's not a viable option in the fantasy playoffs.
report: John Ross vacuumed 2-of-3 targets for 13 yards in the Bengals' Week 13 loss to the Broncos Sunday.

impact: Moore played just 17-of-67 snaps against the Cowboys, drawing zero targets. Despite Rivera's words, the sense of urgency probably does increase with Greg Olsen sidelined indefinitely. That doesn't make Moore worth a re-draft hold, but he could still come onto the radar in short order.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera says the team won't rush D.J. Moore's development.

impact: Moore has played just 17 snaps each of the first two games of the season, but he flashed with a 51-yard touchdown against Atlanta in which he made a few defenders miss on his way into the end zone. Cam Newton seems to like Jarius Wright, but Moore simply gives the offense more upside. He needs to be used more moving forward.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera said the team "has to put more on D.J. Moore's plate."

impact: Coach Ron Rivera promised more playing time for Moore entering Week 3, but he continued to play behind Devin Funchess, Jarius Wright, and Torrey Smith.  Carolina's coaching staff will have its Week 4 bye to consider increasing Moore's usage.  Moore remains barely roster worthy in 14-team leagues.
report: D.J. Moore managed one catch for three yards on two targets in the Panthers' Week 3 win over the Bengals.

impact: Moore finished the game with just one catch on two targets, but it was a step in the correct direction for his playing time. He actually out-snapped Jarius Wright by seven, and he was just 11 plays behind Torrey Smith. His role will hopefully expand coming out of the bye.
report: D.J. Moore played 33-of-67 snaps (49 percent) Week 3 against the Bengals.

impact: Moore made the most of his limited opportunities, especially after halftime when the rookie pulled in three catches for 45 yards. He flashed impressive wheels on his lone carry, chewing up 18 yards on a double reverse. Moore saw as many targets Sunday as he had in his first three games combined. He’s not fantasy-relevant yet, but he’s getting there.
report: D.J. Moore corralled each of his four targets for 49 yards while gaining 18 yards on his lone carry Sunday in the Panthers’ Week 5 win over the Giants.

impact: Moore is lucky he saw as many targets as he did, as his first half giveaways were the difference in the game. He muffed a punt that set the Redskins up at the Panthers' 22-yard line. The Redskins scored one play later. He then let the ball get "Peanut punched" out in the second quarter, setting up three more Redskins points. To coach Ron Rivera's credit, he did not bench his first-round pick and he was productive the rest of the game. Moore will be a boom/bust WR4/5 for Week 7 against the Eagles.
report: D.J. Moore caught 4-of-5 targets for 59 yards in the Panthers' Week 6 loss to the Redskins, adding 18 yards rushing while losing a pair of fumbles.

impact: The rookie lost two fumbles in the first half, but his coach stood by him. "We’re trying to develop a football team," Rivera said. "I’m not too concerned about punishing players for making mistakes as much as we are about developing them and making sure they’re learning and growing and being able to go forward with them." Moore continues to play fewer snaps than Torrey Smith and Jarius Wright, but his role is growing. He is a fine bench stash in deeper leagues.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera did not consider benching D.J. Moore.

impact: Carolina’s first-round pick also committed a penalty and continues to struggle with mental errors, but Moore’s explosiveness on the field is evident. Moore could end up with more Week 8 playing time if Torrey Smith can’t go after requiring X-rays following Sunday’s thrilling comeback win. Either way, Moore won’t be a fantasy option against the Ravens. Moore is just a Dynasty and deep-league stash for now.
report: D.J. Moore caught 3-of-5 targets for 29 yards in the Panthers’ Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: Moore added 39 rushing yards on two attempts.  He recorded all seven of his touches in the first half, picking up 72 of his total yards on a second-quarter possession that ultimately ended with a six-yard touchdown catch for Christian McCaffrey.  With Torrey Smith (knee) out, Moore got the start and tied with McCaffrey for the team lead in targets.  The Panthers need to make the move permanent and boot Smith from the starter's group.  If Moore keeps the job, he'll very much be on the WR3/4 map next week at home against the Bucs.
report: D.J. Moore caught 5-of-6 targets for 90 yards in the Panthers' Week 8 win over the Ravens.

impact: Moore was expected to get more snaps with Torrey Smith sidelined, but it was extremely promising to see both he and Curtis Samuel play ahead of Jarius Wright. After Moore came up huge in a tough matchup, it will be difficult for the Panthers to send him back to the bench. He is a great upside add in most formats.
report: D.J. Moore played 46-of-65 snaps (71 percent) Week 8 against the Ravens.

impact: Moore's rushing yardage came on a beautiful reverse. Like last week, Moore lost three touches to Curtis Samuel. Unlike last week, Samuel produced, finding the end zone twice. Although Torrey Smith (knee) will likely remain sidelined for Thursday's game against the Steelers, Moore will be a risky WR3 after Samuel's big Week 9.
report: D.J. Moore caught 1-of-2 targets for 16 yards in the Panthers' Week 9 win over the Bucs, adding a 32-yard rush.

impact: For the second-straight week, Moore was splitting looks with Curtis Samuel behind Devin Funchess. Moore has followed up his Week 8 blowup with just 73 total yards across two games. The big-play potential will always give Moore upside, but he's probably not going to tap into it all that often. He will be a WR5 for Week 11 against the Lions.
report: D.J. Moore caught 4-of-5 targets for 20 yards in the Panthers' Week 10 loss to the Steelers, adding a five-yard rush.

impact: Moore came out of the gates hot, catching two passes for 42 yards on the opening drive. He looked to be headed into the end zone on the second of those catches, but he was pulled down from behind inside the five. He did even better in the second half. With the Panthers facing a third-and-long deep in their own territory, Moore went up high along the sideline to pull in a pass and sprinted down the field for an 82-yard gain before being chased down. It is the third-longest play from scrimmage in the NFL the season and the longest non-scoring play so far. Moore finally found the end zone with a toe-tapping catch late in the fourth quarter to seemingly tie the game, but the Panthers made the questionable decision to go for two. Moore now has two big games sandwiched around two lackluster outings. Likely to be up-and-down all season, Moore will be a risk-reward FLEX play against the Seahawks.
report: D.J. Moore hauled in 7-of-8 targets for 157 yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 11 loss to the Lions.

impact: Christian McCaffrey was the main target in the passing game, but Moore operated as the No. 1 receiver with Devin Funchess on the sidelines. That did not result in much work in the first half, but he caught six passes for 54 yards after the break and continued to look dangerous with the ball in his hands. If Funchess sits again, Moore will be an upside WR3 in a great matchup against the Bucs next week.
report: D.J. Moore hauled in 8-of-9 targets for 91 yards in the Panthers' Week 12 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: It's a step back after Moore went off the last two weeks. Devin Funchess was active but didn't play a full complement of snaps. Moore takes a hit with Funchess healthy, but the potential loss of Greg Olsen (foot) is a boost to his target share.
report: D.J. Moore caught 4-of-8 targets for 44 yards in Week 13 against the Bucs.

impact: Wright went 3-23 on five targets in Week 1 and seems to have carved out the slot job for the Panthers.  Cam Newton really had an affinity for him on third down, especially with no Greg Olsen (foot) in the lineup.  Wright's touchdown came on third down from five yards out.  There are worse players to roster in deep PPR leagues.  The Panthers get the Bengals in Week 3.
report: Jarius Wright caught 5-of-7 targets for 62 yards and one touchdown in the Panthers' Week 2 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Jones also drew a 56-yard defensive pass interference penalty. The targets, catches, yards and touchdowns were all new season highs for a player who entered the game the owner of a 19/270/3 line on the year. Jones' first score came after Tedric Thompson gave up on a play where Matthew Stafford appeared sacked. For the second, Jones split the corner and safety and made a nice sliding grab in the end zone. The huge game was nice to see, but Jones will follow it up with a tough matchup in the Vikings. He's a risk/reward WR3.
report: Marvin Jones caught 7-of-10 targets for 117 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' Week 8 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Per ESPN's Adam Schefter, the Lions saved $2.2 million against the cap, likely by converting some of Jones' $7 million 2018 base salary to a pro-rated bonus. In the midst of his age-28 season, Jones is signed through 2020.
report: The Lions have restructured Marvin Jones' contract.

impact: Jones' eight targets and the catches and yards led the team in the first game without Golden Tate after his trade to the Eagles.  Theo Riddick also saw eight targets, essentially taking Tate's place on third downs in the slot, but the offense failed miserably all afternoon, scoring just three field goals.  Jones' usage was encouraging, however, and he out-targeted Kenny Golladay 8-4.  Jones will be a WR2 next week when the Lions travel to take on the Bears.
report: Marvin Jones caught 6-of-8 targets for 66 yards in the Lions' Week 9 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Jones departed after taking a hit from Bryce Callahan late in the third quarter (Callahan was flagged for illegal contact on the play). It looked like trainers were checking out his right knee. Jones totaled three catches for 55 yards on seven targets before his injury. With Jones out and the Lions trailing, look for Kenny Golladay to pour it on in garbage time.
report: Marvin Jones left Sunday's Week 10 game against the Bears with a knee injury and is questionable to return.

impact: An MRI revealed that Jones' ACL and MCL are undamaged. With the Lions facing a quick Week 12 turnaround for their annual Thanksgiving game, it would not be surprising to see Jones held out against the Panthers in Week 11. His status will be updated no later than Wednesday.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Marvin Jones (knee) is day to day with a bone bruise.

impact: It's not an encouraging sign for Jones, who sat out the final quarter of Sunday's loss to Chicago due to a bone bruise on his right knee. With Detroit's annual Thanksgiving game coming up next week, the Lions may err on the side of caution by resting Jones in Week 11. If the Lions pursue that course of action, Kenny Golladay would be in for a gigantic workload against the Panthers.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Jones also missed Wednesday's practice because of a bone bruise in his knee. Two missed sessions in a row is obviously a bad sign, but he could still practice Friday and play against the Panthers. If that does not happen, Kenny Golladay would be in line for a massive target share.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: That's a week of DNPs for Jones, making him extremely unlikely to play against the Panthers. It will be Kenny Golladay as the main vein of the pass offense, with Theo Riddick No. 2 in line as the slot man. Behind those two, it'll be a hodgepodge consisting of T.J. Jones, Brandon Powell and Bruce Ellington.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: He wasn't able to practice this week after injuring his knee in Sunday's loss to the Bears. With Jones sidelined, Kenny Golladay should see as many targets as he can handle against the Panthers. Receiving back Theo Riddick will also get a boost from Jones' absence.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) is out for Week 11 against the Panthers.

impact: Jones was held out all week because of an injury reported to be a bone bruise. According to ESPN's Michael Rothstein, however, Jones is getting a second opinion on the injury, suggesting it could be more serious than originally believed. Kenny Golladay should vacuum up targets as long as Jones is sidelined. Detroit also declared TE Michael Roberts (shoulder), DT A'Shawn Robinson (ankle), WR Brandon Powell, DE Eric Lee, OT Andrew Donnal, and LB Kelvin Sheppard inactive.
report: Lions declared Marvin Jones (knee) inactive for Week 11 against the Panthers.

impact: The Lions didn't actually hold a practice, but they must issue a would-be injury report ahead of Thursday's bout with the Bears.  Jones seems unlikely to play at this point.  He remains "week to week" with a bone bruise on his knee.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) was listed as a non-participant in Monday's practice.

impact: Jones is looking likely to miss his second-consecutive game when the Lions host the Bears on Thanksgiving. With Kerryon Johnson (knee) also sidelined, the Lions will be severely short-handed against a team looking likely to start Chase Daniel at quarterback.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) remained sidelined on Tuesday.

impact: As expected.  Jones has missed the last two games, and the Lions will also be without Kerryon Johnson (knee) for this one.  Kenny Golladay has seen 27 targets the last two weeks and should again flirt with 13-14 in this one.
report: Marvin Jones (knee) is out for Week 12 against the Bears.

impact: Jones sat out last week and will not play on Thanksgiving because of a bone bruise in his knee. Kenny Golladay will continue to vacuum up targets while Jones is sidelined.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Marvin Jones (knee) "has a chance" to play Week 13 against the Rams.

impact: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reported four days ago that Jones had a "chance" to return in Week 13 but instead the Lions are ending his season. Jones had already missed Weeks 11 and 12. In the third year of a five-year deal, Jones was having an inconsistent campaign in the Lions' once-crowded receiver corps. His 56 yards per game were down 13 from 2017. Jones' loss coupled with Golden Tate's trade leaves the Lions embarrassingly thin at wide receiver behind Kenny Golladay. Expect some #BruceEllingtonSZN down the stretch. Golladay, meanwhile, will find himself on the WR1/2 borderline. Going on 29, Jones should be back at his $6.5 million salary for 2019, though coach Matt Patricia fancies himself a ground-and-pound maestro.
report: Lions placed WR Marvin Jones on injured reserve with a knee injury, ending his season.

impact: Jones would seem to be the obvious next man up, but the Detroit Free Press has pegged UDFA Brandon Powell as the "heir apparent" in the slot. It's interesting the Lions' own website is hedging Jones. Jones caught 30 passes in 2017 and is probably the safer add for bye week desperados in exceptionally-deep leagues. Powell is well worth an add in Dynasty leagues.
report: The Lions' official website believes WR T.J. Jones could "potentially" have a bigger role following Golden Tate's trade.

impact: Even with Marvin Jones out, the other Jones was a non-factor behind Kenny Golladay and Bruce Ellington. He can be left on the wire.
report: T.J. Jones turned his only target into two yards in the Lions' Week 11 win over the Panthers.

impact: Tate came back to earth after his 8-132-2 day in Dallas last week.  Matthew Stafford attempted just 26 passes with the Lions smashing the Packers 24-0 at halftime.  Tate didn't get his first catch until late in the second quarter.  A borderline WR1/2, Tate and the Lions are off until Week 7 at the Dolphins.
report: Golden Tate caught 5-of-7 targets for 42 yards in the Lions' Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: Tate had the most yards from scrimmage of the Lions' "big three" at receiver. It was a quiet day for all involved with the Lions gutting the Dolphins on the ground. The Lions had their biggest rushing day since 1997. With just 78 yards receiving over his past two games, Tate will look to get cooking again as a mid-range WR2 against the Seahawks in Week 8.
report: Golden Tate caught 4-of-6 targets for 36 yards in the Lions' Week 7 win over the Dolphins, adding a 30-yard rush.

impact: This appears to be a new injury for Tate, who delivered a season-low 36 yards in last week's victory over Miami. In all likelihood, the Lions are probably just limiting his practice reps. If active, Tate will be in the WR2 picture Sunday versus his former team, the Seahawks.
report: Golden Tate (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It confirms Tate's Week 8 status is not in doubt. Mired in a bit of a slump, Tate will be a mid-range WR2 against the Seahawks.
report: Golden Tate (ankle) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Tate started the week as a limited participant at practice but got in full sessions on both Thursday and Friday. There was never much concern over his status for Week 8. The ironman wide receiver hasn't missed a game in over six years. He'll be in the WR2 mix against his former team.
report: Golden Tate (ankle) wasn't listed on the Lions' final injury report for Week 8 against the Seahawks.

impact: Tate's seven catches were his most since Week 4, though he's now been held to 50 yards or fewer in three-straight contests. With Matthew Stafford's volume unpredictable so far this season, Tate will be a low-end WR2 for Week 9 against the Vikings.
report: Golden Tate caught 7-of-12 targets for 50 yards in the Lions' Week 8 loss to the Seahawks, adding a three-yard rush.

impact: Ian Rapoport added that "a few teams" have inquired about Tate.  In his age-30 season, this is also Tate's contract year, and it sounds like the Lions are leaking this information to drum up trade interest with no intentions of keeping Tate in Detroit long term.  If Tate were to be dealt, the Lions could turn to T.J. Jones at slot receiver between Kenny Golladay and Marvin Jones.
report: NFL Network's Tom Pelissero reports the Lions' asking price would be "at least" a fourth-round pick in exchange for Golden Tate.

impact: Now this is a big-time move. Although now 30, Tate remains one of the league's best after-the-catch receivers and is a perfect fit for what the Eagles want to do on offense. He also addresses a drastic need for the defending Super Bowl champions. The Eagles will no longer have to run Jordan Matthews out there for 30 snaps per game. It is interesting that each of Tate, Nelson Agholor and Matthews are best utilized in the slot, though Tate is capable of playing outside if need be. Tate's arrival is unequivocally bad news for Agholor, who has had a poor season since Carson Wentz's return. As for the Lions, T.J. Jones will now slide into three-receiver sets alongside Marvin Jones and Kenny Golladay. #GolladaySZN is back on. Tate will be a free agent at season's end.
report: Eagles acquired WR Golden Tate from the Eagles in exchange for a third-round pick.

impact: Tate was mostly limited to the slot in Detroit, but the Eagles plan to use him all over the field. He's picked up the offense quickly over the bye week and will have an immediate role in three-wide sets. Tate is our No. 24 ranked wideout for Week 10.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports the Eagles plan to line up Golden Tate in multiple spots.

impact: Tate didn't have much of a role despite having the bye week to learn the Eagles' playbook. He barely saw the field in the second half. Tate should see a larger role as he becomes more acclimated in the offense. He’ll be hard to trust despite a potential Week 11 shootout with the Saints.
report: Golden Tate was held to two catches for 19 yards in Week 10 against the Cowboys.

impact: Tate was in on just 29% of the snaps in his Eagles debut last Sunday night against Dallas, catching 2-of-4 targets for 19 yards.  Highly disappointing for sure, but Tate will be tough to sit in New Orleans on the fast Superdome track in what is expected to be a big-time shootout.  Tate is a WR3.
report: Coach Doug Pederson said Golden Tate is "much further along this week" and will have a bigger role Week 11 against the Saints.

impact: Tate actually led the team in targets, catches, and yards in a pitiful display from the Eagles' offense. That said, it was promising to see Tate heavily utilized after playing just 29 percent of the snaps in his debut. With his role growing, Tate will be in the FLEX conversation next week against the Giants.
report: Golden Tate hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 48 yards in the Eagles' Week 11 loss to the Saints.

impact: Despite a bye week following the trade, Tate's career in Philadelphia has started off slowly. He did see a big bump in playing time against the Saints, however, and ended up leading the team in targets (8), catches (5), and yards (48). Even so, this trade is looking like a mistake, especially with the Eagles falling out of the playoff race.
report: Eagles OC Mike Groh said incorporating Golden Tate into the offense has been difficult.

impact: The eight targets tied Zach Ertz for the team lead, but Ertz did far more with his at 7-91-1.  Tate had a brutal drop as well.  Tate has seen 16 targets over the last two games but isn't doing anything downfield or breaking big plays.  Tate will be a low-end WR3/4 next week against the Redskins.
report: Golden Tate caught 4-of-8 targets for 30 yards in the Eagles' Week 12 win over the Giants.

impact: It was easily Tate's best game with the team after totaling 97 scoreless yards on 20 targets his first three contests since the trade.  Tate's score was a scramble effort by Carson Wentz, who barely snuck the ball pass the diving cornerback in the corner of the end zone from a few yards away.  The Redskins just offered zero resistance in this one.  Tate has been getting heavy usage at the expense of Alshon Jeffery and Nelson Agholor.  Tate will be a WR3 in Dallas next week.
report: Golden Tate caught all seven of his targets for 85 yards and one touchdown in the Eagles' 28-13, Week 13 win over the Redskins on Monday night.

impact: Jalen Ramsey's shadow should be Hill's toughest test of the season, but that did not stop him from making big plays. He opened the game with a 40-yard run on Kansas City's first offensive play, although it was reduced to 21 yards because of a penalty. He added a 36-yard catch in the third quarter on a great throw by Patrick Mahomes. Always a threat for a big play, Hill should have a much easier time next week in New England.
report: Tyreek Hill hauled in 4-of-7 targets for 61 yards and rushed twice for 26 yards in the Chiefs' Week 5 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Even the huge stats don't do justice to how good of a night Hill had. Hill’s first two touchdowns came in the red-zone, and he smoked the Patriots on a blown assignment for a 75-yard TD to tie the game with under four minutes. Hill got most of his yardage on chunk plays, but his speed was too much for New England's zone schemes. It’s a needed breakout for Hill after he'd been held to 166 scoreless yards over the last three games. Hill is in a great spot against the Bengals in another Sunday night matchup next week.
report: Tyreek Hill caught 7-of-12 targets for 142 yards and three touchdowns in the Chiefs' Week 6 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Hill was featured heavily but didn’t break any huge plays. He should've had a 35-yard touchdown but dropped a wide open pass in the end-zone. Hill made up for it a few plays later with a goal-line TD. He's now scored touchdowns in consecutive games after a three-week scoring drought. Hill has a matchup with the Broncos in Week 8.
report: Tyreek Hill caught 7-of-10 passes for 68 yards and a touchdown in Week 7 against the Bengals.

impact: Most of his output came on a 40-yard catch-and-run during the second quarter. Aside from that highlight, it was a quiet week for Hill, who mostly took a backseat to teammates Sammy Watkins (8-107-2) and Travis Kelce (6-79-1). Hill left the game with a groin injury during the fourth quarter and didn't return. There wasn't much time left, so maybe the Chiefs were just playing it safe with their star receiver. Obviously his health will be something fantasy owners need to monitor ahead of next week's game at Cleveland.
report: Tyreek Hill absorbed three-of-four targets for 70 yards Sunday in KC’s Week 8 win over the Broncos.

impact: Hill didn't return after going down late in the fourth quarter. Groin strains can be multi-week injuries, so this is a concern for Hill's Week 9 status. Chris Conley would be bumped into two-wide sets if Hill misses time.
report: Chiefs coach Andy Reid said Tyreek Hill suffered a groin strain in Week 8 against the Broncos.

impact: Hill pulled his groin in the Week 8 win over the Broncos but didn't seem any worse for the wear afterward.  Expect him to suit up this week against the Browns, though soft-tissue injuries are always prone to aggravation.
report: Coach Andy Reid said he expects Tyreek Hill (groin) to practice in full Wednesday.

impact: It's great news after Hill went down late in Week 8. Hill will play in Sunday's game with the Browns, but any soft-tissue injury comes with going-forward setback risks.
report: Tyreek Hill (groin) is practicing in full for Week 9.

impact: It's notable but far from reason to panic. It is possible this was the Chiefs' plan all along. It's also possible Hill's groin didn't respond as expected to Wednesday's "full" session. The matter will likely be cleared up with Friday's injury report. For now, fantasy players can keep Hill locked in as their WR1.
report: Tyreek Hill (groin) was downgraded to "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Hill's week of practice has been a roller coaster, going from full to limited then back to full again, but it's possible this was always part of the process to ensure he's ready for Sunday. He's expected to play against Cleveland's new regime this upcoming weekend. Fantasy players can keep him locked in as a true WR1.
report: Tyreek Hill (groin) fully participated in practice Friday.

impact: Hill pulled his groin late in last week's win over Denver but obviously the injury wasn't anything serious. The third-year speedster could see a bit of Denzel Ward on Sunday, though that won't deter him from being a WR1 in all formats. Only Pittsburgh's Antonio Brown has gone for more receiving scores (eight) than Tyreek (seven) this year.
report: Tyreek Hill (groin) wasn't listed on the Chiefs' final injury report for Week 9 against the Browns.

impact: After dealing with a groin injury throughout the week, Hill was largely quiet outside of a 40-yard reception in the first half. Hill now has 70-yards or fewer in six of his past seven games. Next week, Hill heads home, where he has averaged 62.5 yards per game over four games. Despite his dip in yardage and home splits, Hill is still a locked-in starting wide receiver option in Week 10 against the Cardinals.
report: Tyreek Hill caught 4-of-5 targets for 69 yards in Sunday's Week 9 win over the Browns.

impact: He also had a 20-yard run. Hill was forced touches with Sammy Watkins sidelined, going for 75 yards on Kansas City's opening drive. He later added a 14-yard score, but wasn't needed much after that. It's a nice rebound for Hill after getting held to 69 scoreless yards last week. With Watkins not a lock to return in Week 11, Hill will be a top-10 receiver play against the Rams.
report: Tyreek Hill caught 7-of-10 targets for 117 yards and two touchdowns in Week 10 against the Cardinals.

impact: The Rams opted to stick soon-to-be 31-year-old Sam Shields on Hill most of the night, sliding Marcus Peters away from him and into the slot on Travis Kelce.  Safe to say that it didn't work.  Hill whooped Shields all night long, getting open at will, and had his first-ever 200-yard receiving game.  His big play was a 73-yard touchdown strike where Hill was wide open downfield, stopped and stood still after catching the ball before walking in the end zone when Shields fell down early in the route.  Hill is already well over 1,000 yards on the season heading into the bye and will get a tasty draw with the Raiders in Week 13.  Hill is an elite WR1.
report: Tyreek Hill caught 10-of-14 targets for 215 yards and two touchdowns in the Chiefs' 54-51, Week 11 loss to the Rams on Monday night.

impact: Hill has averaged 12.3 targets with Watkins hurt and 7.1 targets in Kansas City's other eight games.  Although we can't expect this small-sample split stat to carry over directly to Week 13, it does suggest Hill has an elevated target expectation with Watkins on the shelf.  (Watkins is ruled out for Week 13 at Oakland with a foot injury.)  You can read more splits and game-specific tidbits in Evan Silva's Week 13 Matchups column, accessible at the link below.
report: Tyreek Hill has drawn double-digit targets in all three games in which Sammy Watkins has either played fewer than 15 snaps or missed entirely.

impact: If you were watching live, this was quite a tilting experience. Hill committed two drops, one of which was stunningly bad on what should have been a 52-yard touchdown late in the third quarter. The next period, Patrick Mahomes had Hill for a 57-yard score, but he underthrew the pass. Hill still had a chance to corral it but could not make the necessary mid-air adjustment. Hill was so close to a monster day in the final week of the fantasy regular season and just could not convert. He has a tough Week 14 matchup in the Ravens at home.
report: Tyreek Hill caught 1-of-6 targets for 13 yards in the Chiefs' Week 13 win over the Raiders, adding two rushes for 37 additional yards.

impact: Signed as an UDFA out of Florida in May, Powell led the Lions in catches and receiving yards in the preseason and was taken under Tate's wing all summer.  "I’m going to teach Powell everything I know that I can possibly teach him to succeed in this league because I think he’s a great talent," Tate said last month.  "He excites me when I watch. He actually reminds me of a young me, but even better."  Most have pegged T.J. Jones as the natural fill-in with Tate gone, but perhaps Powell will get a look.  Powell needs to be added in deep Dynasty leagues.
report: According to the Detroit Free Press' Dave Birkett, UDFA Brandon Powell has been "pegged as the heir apparent" to Golden Tate as the Lions' slot receiver.

impact: Golladay did most of his work well before this one got out of hand in the third quarter.  At one point, he was leading the Lions with eight targets before Golden Tate ended the night with 15 and a touchdown.  Golladay also made one of the best plays of the night for the Lions, decking CB Trumaine Johnson after an interception, forcing a fumble and recovering it on his own in Jets territory.  Unfortunately, the Lions did nothing with it.  Golladay played a career-high 65 snaps (hat tip to PFF's Nathan Jahnke) and needs to be added where he's available.  Golladay will head into Week 2 at San Francisco as a big-play threat WR3/4.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 7-of-12 targets for 114 yards in the Lions' 48-17, Week 1 loss to the Jets on Monday night.

impact: He caught Ahkello Witherspoon napping on his 30-yard touchdown in the first quarter, which accounted for the Lions’ first points of the afternoon. Golladay didn’t score again but he was a consistent presence in the Lions’ passing game, just as he was a week ago when he registered a career-high 114 yards in a loss to the Jets. The 24-year-old showed flashes as a rookie but struggled to stay healthy. Now he’s in the midst of a sophomore breakout and has risen to must-start status in all formats. Look for Golladay to keep the train rolling next week against New England.
report: Kenny Golladay finished with six catches for 89 yards and a touchdown on nine targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 2 loss to San Francisco.

impact: Golladay continued to start over Golden Tate in two-wide sets. He scored the Lions' first touchdown of the game, extending the ball across the goal-line on a play where he was tackled at the one-yard line. Golladay has at least 100 yards or a touchdown in every game this season. He's a WR2 for Week 4's matchup with the Cowboys.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 6-of-7 passes for 53 yards and a touchdown in the Lions' Week 3 win over the Patriots.

impact: Even with Golladay seeing his lowest target total of the season, the second-year wideout was still reasonably productive in the loss to Dallas. While Golladay’s shrinking volume is somewhat concerning, the 24-year-old has established a nice floor for himself, topping 50 yards in all four games this year after reaching that mark just five times all of last season. He’ll be safe to employ as a WR3/flex against the Packers in Week 5.
report: Kenny Golladay came down with four catches for 74 yards on four targets Sunday in Detroit’s Week 4 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Golladay caught a 47-yard touchdown in the first quarter, but it was called back on an illegal hands to the face penalty.  He then went 60 yards down the sideline on his first official catch, stiff-arming a defender to the ground before being tackled inside the 10-yard line only to see LeGarrette Blount score a couple plays later.  Golladay eventually found the end zone from five yards away in the second half, and his nine targets led the team on a day Matthew Stafford attempted just 26 passes with the Lions holding a commanding lead much of the afternoon.  Golladay has seen at least nine targets in 3-of-5 games and is a locked-in WR2 heading into the bye.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 4-of-9 targets for 98 yards and one touchdown in the Lions' 31-23, Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: Golladay also drew a 15-yard DPI. Golladay drew zero first half targets in what ended up a nightmare fantasy day. Golladay nearly saved it with a 13-yard score in the second half, but it was called back by a Lions penalty. The Dolphins' secondary did an excellent job on each of the Lions' "big three." Golladay now has just 10 catches over his past three games. He will look to heat back up in Week 8 against the Seahawks.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 2-of-2 targets for 37 yards in the Lions' Week 7 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Golladay now has just three catches for 49 yards over his past two games. Lack of volume was to blame in Week 7, but Matthew Stafford uncorked 40 throws against the Seahawks this afternoon. 10 of them were directed Marvin Jones' way. With only 11 catches in the past month, Golladay is trending toward WR3 territory. His upside makes him difficult to bench, however. A Minnesota road trip is in the offing for Week 9.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 1-of-1 targets for 12 yards in the Lions' Week 8 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Golladay was stuck on one catch for 15 yards on two targets before picking up a couple grabs on the final meaningless offensive possession.  It was a really discouraging day in the first game without Golden Tate following the trade.  Matthew Stafford was sacked 10 times, and the offense was terrible much of the afternoon.  Golladay's four targets were tied with Michael Roberts for fourth on the team behind Marvin Jones and Theo Riddick, who each had eight, and Kerryon Johnson with five.  The Lions go to Chicago in Week 10.  Golladay will be a WR3.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 3-of-4 targets for 46 yards in the Lions' Week 9 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Golladay came alive late, drawing 10 second-half targets from Matthew Stafford. He benefited from game-script—most of his receiving output came with Detroit in catch-up mode—as well as an injury to lead receiver Marvin Jones (knee), who bowed out late in the third quarter. Golladay dusted Kyle Fuller for his lone touchdown, scoring from five yards out with 8:30 to go in the fourth quarter. He was targeted on a two-point conversion attempt later in the quarter but was ruled down just shy of the goal line. The 13 targets were a career-high for the 25-year-old. With Jones hurt, Golladay could be in for another huge workload next week when the Lions host Carolina in the Motor City.
report: Kenny Golladay corralled six catches for 78 yards and a touchdown on 13 targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 10 loss to the Bears.

impact: Golladay was expected to be a target hog with Marvin Jones out, and that is exactly what happened. He recorded two catches on the opening drive including one which he took out of the hands of Panthers CB James Bradberry. He finished the second quarter with a slightly disappointing 34 yards on four catches, but he was targeted seven times before halftime. He did more with the work in the second half. He made a nice play to break a tackle and get a first down in the third quarter, and then he converted a third-and-long with a 36-yard catch in the fourth. He topped himself a couple plays later, laying out for a 19-yard touchdown which amounted to the game-winning score. Golladay now has 27 targets in the last two games. He will be a high-end WR2 even in a tough matchup against the Bears on Thanksgiving if Jones is forced to sit again.
report: Kenny Golladay hauled in 8-of-14 targets for 113 yards and a touchdown in the Lions' Week 11 win over the Panthers.

impact: Golladay nearly had a sixth grab for a late touchdown but could not quite get full extension. Golladay is lucky he got the numbers he did, as the Lions' offense was embarrassingly horizontal. Golladay has re-proven himself in Marvin Jones' (knee) absence, but Jones could be back for Week 13 against the Rams. Even if he is, Golladay will be an upside WR2/3 in a game where the Lions will have no choice but to go more vertical.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 5-of-8 targets for 90 yards in the Lions' Thanksgiving loss to the Bears.

impact: Two of his three grabs came before halftime. Even with shutdown corner Aqib Talib on a strict snap count in his return from ankle surgery, Golladay was unable to find daylight. Golladay nearly came down with an incredible touchdown during garbage time, but much to the dismay of fantasy owners, he couldn't keep both feet in bounds. The second-year receiver will have his work cut out for him going against shutdown corner Patrick Peterson next week in Arizona.
report: Kenny Golladay managed three catches for 50 yards on seven targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 13 loss to the Rams.

impact: Golladay looked healthy while playing 70-of-72 offensive snaps in Week 13. The Lions are likely just limiting his practice exposure coming off another big workload in Sunday's loss to the Rams. Golladay gets a tough matchup against Cardinals All-Pro Patrick Peterson this week.
report: Kenny Golladay (quad) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Gallman was working as the clear No. 2 running back behind Saquon Barkley, but he picked up a knee injury in the third quarter. Jonathan Stewart, who has not lost a step, will serve as the backup while Gallman is out.
report: Giants RB Wayne Gallman (knee) is questionable to return Week 1 against the Jaguars.

impact: Gallman left Week 1 against the Jaguars with a knee injury, but he said that was just precautionary. The sophomore was working as the No. 2 back before going down.
report: Wayne Gallman (knee) expects to play Week 2.

impact: Stewart got some run after Wayne Gallman left with an injury, but he was the clear No. 3 back before that. Even if something happened to Saquon Barkley, Stewart would not be an enticing fantasy play. He does not need to be rostered in any format.
report: Jonathan Stewart rushed twice for eight yards in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Stewart has just six carries this year. He's buried behind Saquon Barkley and Wayne Gallman as the No. 3 back.
report: Jonathan Stewart (foot) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Stewart is nowhere near fantasy radars.  Wayne Gallman is the Giants' No. 2 back.
report: Jonathan Stewart (foot) is out for Week 4 against the Saints.

impact: Stewart's Giants tenure has been an utter mess, resulting in just six carries for 17 yards (2.83 YPC). Wayne Gallman has seamlessly transitioned in as the Giants' backup and should stay there for the remainder of the year even if Stewart returns.
report: Giants placed Jonathan Stewart (foot) on injured reserve.

impact: The coach says Stewart will be sidelined eight weeks by a foot injury, a timetable which conveniently fits with the time he must miss after being placed on injured reserve last week. Even if Stewart is healthy enough to return later in the season, there would be little reason to bring him back unless something happened to Saquon Barkley or Wayne Gallman.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur said Jonathan Stewart (foot, injured reserve) could return this season.

impact: Stewart is eligible to come off injured reserve this week, though the Giants haven't indicated whether he'll play Sunday against Tampa Bay. Even if J-Stew is activated, he'll just be fighting for scraps behind rookie workhorse Saquon Barkley.
report: Jonathan Stewart (I.R., foot) has resumed practicing.

impact: McKissic is eligible to come off the injured reserve, but Pete Carroll wants to give his running back/wide receiver hybrid at least one more week to get ready before the Seahawks activate him to the active roster. When McKissic is activated, he will push C.J. Prosise or Tre Madden off the active roster.
report: J.D. McKissic (foot, I.R.) is still at least one week away from a return.

impact: McKissic practiced for the first time since going on IR this week. Even when healthy, there's not going to be a role for him in a crowded Seattle backfield. McKissic may see some time at receiver when he returns.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said J.D. McKissic (foot, I.R.) is at least two weeks from returning.

impact: It took him roughly three months to recover from a broken foot. Coach Pete Carroll said McKissic will suit up against the Niners in Week 13 as long as "everything works out right at practice." Even if he's active, McKissic's role will be limited with Chris Carson entrenched as Seattle's lead ball-carrier.
report: Seahawks activated RB J.D. McKissic from injured reserve.

impact: Baldwin was promptly removed from Seattle's injury report on Friday and is good to go on Sunday against the Rams. Teams have typically exploited the Rams' defense on the outside, which spells a better afternoon for Tyler Lockett and David Moore. Even so, Baldwin should garner volume if this divisional tilt becomes a high-scoring affair. He's a high-end WR3 in Los Angeles Sunday.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) will play in Week 10 against the Rams.

impact: Baldwin could only watch as Tyler Lockett once again found the end zone. Baldwin remains scoreless on the season as Lockett and David Moore find the painted area with regularity. If there's good news, it's that Baldwin has cleared four catches in 3-of-4 games. He will find himself on the WR3/4 borderline for Thursday's short-week matchup with the Packers.
report: Doug Baldwin caught 5-of-5 targets for 39 yards in the Seahawks' Week 10 loss to the Rams.

impact: "It’s been a long time since I felt like myself," Baldwin told 710 ESPN Seattle. "Last week was the first day I woke up in the morning and didn’t feel pain. I’ve been dealing with this for four months, and I forgot what it felt like to not have pain." Baldwin was listed with a groin injury last week, but this confirms his knee issues are behind him. Now that he's fully healthy, Baldwin has potential for a second half rebound.
report: Doug Baldwin said he's over his knee issues.

impact: Baldwin finally scored his first touchdown of the season, but it was not easy. Baldwin was wide open for a 21-yard score in the first quarter, but Russell Wilson flat missed him. The two then narrowly failed to connect in the end zone on a six-yarder in the second quarter before finally getting it right on the next play. Tonight was Baldwin's first 10-target game of the season. That won't happen often in the Seahawks' run-heavy offense, though Baldwin has now cleared five catches in back-to-back games. He will be a WR3 for Week 12 against the Panthers.
report: Doug Baldwin caught 7-of-10 targets for 52 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 11 win over the Packers.

impact: It's a concern coming off Seattle's mini-bye, but this may be rest related. Baldwin also missed practice time with his groin issue leading up to Week 10 before getting left off the injury report. We'll have a better feel for Baldwin's status when the Seahawks return to practice Thursday.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Baldwin is suddenly on the wrong side of questionable for Sunday's game against the Panthers. He will need to get in at least a limited session on Friday to have a realistic shot at suiting up. Baldwin's absence would make David Moore a viable WR4.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Baldwin didn't practice throughout the week, but an in-the-know Hawks beat writer speculated he was closer to probable. It's still a shame as Baldwin was finally over his lingering knee issues last week and buoyed that freshness into a 7/52/1 receiving line. If active, rank him as a serviceable WR2.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) is questionable for Week 12 against the Panthers.

impact: It's not a great sign for Baldwin, who didn't practice all week. Baldwin is working through a setback with the same groin injury he dealt with earlier this year. It'd be a surprise if he plays, but the Seahawks will take him up to pre-game warmups. We'll know Baldwin's status early Sunday.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Doug Baldwin (questionable, groin) is a game-time decision for Week 12 against the Panthers.

impact: There was some concern over Baldwin's status after the Seahawks promoted Keenan Reynolds from the practice squad, but it looks like the veteran slot receiver will be active for Sunday's game in Charlotte. Baldwin has endured a frustrating season to this point, though he did post a solid 7-52-1 receiving line in last week's win over Green Bay. He's our No. 21 receiver for Week 12.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Doug Baldwin (questionable, groin) has a "good shot" to play Week 12 against the Panthers.

impact: Baldwin didn't practice this week but showed enough in pre-game warmups to play. The Seahawks promoted WR Keenan Reynolds from the practice squad, so there was legit concern over his status. It's possible Baldwin's snaps are scaled back. At less than 100 percent, Baldwin should be treated as a low-end WR2.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) is active for Week 12 against the Panthers.

impact: Baldwin entered this game nursing a groin injury, but he appeared to be healthy in this one, getting a deep target on the second drive. He should have had a wide-open touchdown in the second quarter, but Russell Wilson missed him in the end zone for the second week in a row. Baldwin did tack on four catches in the second half, but he gained just 23 yards on them and is now averaging just 7.6 yards on his last 17 catches. Just a touchdown-or-bust option at this point, Baldwin will be just a FLEX option next week against the 49ers.
report: Doug Baldwin hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 39 yards in the Seahawks' Week 12 win over the Panthers.

impact: Baldwin played without practicing last week. Coach Pete Carroll said Baldwin "felt good'' after making it through Sunday's game with no setbacks, so this is likely for rest purposes. Baldwin should be closer to 100 percent for Week 13 against the 49ers.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Baldwin said he's as healthy as he's been all season. He's a solid WR3 for Week 13 against the 49ers.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) returned to Seahawks practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Baldwin returned to limited work on Thursday after sitting out to start the week. He hasn't been 100 percent all year and it's shown as Baldwin has averaged his fewest yards per game since 2012. Luckily for Baldwin he gets an enticing draw Sunday against a struggling Niners squad. Considering he sees most of his snaps in the slot, Baldwin should avoid his former teammate Richard Sherman for the most part.
report: Doug Baldwin (groin) wasn't listed on the Seahawks' final injury report for Week 13 against the 49ers.

impact: There were not many targets to go around in this one, but Baldwin made his count. After drawing a defensive pass interference penalty to set the Seahawks up at the one, Baldwin lost his defender in traffic and hauled in a short touchdown. It was his second touchdown in three games after failing to score in the first ten weeks. Baldwin has not flashed much yardage upside this season, but hopefully he can regularly find the end zone down the stretch.
report: Doug Baldwin caught 2-of-4 targets for 22 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 13 win over the 49ers.

impact: He'll face a Bengals run defense that is missing WLB Vontaze Burfict (hamstring) but remains largely stout up front.  Of more concern for Wilkins' fantasy outlook is his RBBC with Christine Michael and Nyheim Hines.  New Colts coach Frank Reich was a committee-backfield proponent during his time in Philadelphia.
report: Jordan Wilkins will be the Colts' starting running back in Week 1.

impact: The good news is Wilkins led Indy's backfield with 17 touches compared to Nyheim Hines' 12 and Christine Michael's two.  The bad news is the Colts continued to struggle to run block, and Wilkins struggled for effiency on his opportunities.  Marlon Mack (hamstring) could also return as soon as Week 2, which would further muddy up the running back distribution.  At best, Wilkins will be a low-end flex option at Washington in the second game.
report: Jordan Wilkins rushed 14 times for 40 yards and caught 3-of-3 targets for 21 yards in the Colts' Week 1 loss to the Bengals.

impact: He went down about midway through the second quarter. Wilkins delivered 25 yards on five carries along with one catch for no gain upon exiting. With Wilkins banged up, Indy's backfield reps will be split between Marlon Mack and Nyheim Hines.
report: Jordan Wilkins left Sunday's Week 2 game against the Redskins with an ankle injury and is questionable to return.

impact: Wilkins left briefly after tweaking his ankle in the second quarter but the injury didn’t seem to bother him in the second half. The fifth-round rookie failed to impress in last week’s debut against Cincinnati (2.9 yards per carry) but he did a nice job of moving the chains in this one. His 18-yard scamper with under five minutes remaining in the fourth quarter essentially sealed the win for Indy. Wilkins out-touched teammate Marlon Mack by a slim 12-11 margin, though he held a decisive edge in yards from scrimmage (64-36). The Colts seem committed to using a timeshare at running back, so we’d expect similar usage for both players next week against the Eagles.
report: Jordan Wilkins tallied 61 yards on 10 carries while collecting two catches for three yards on two targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 2 win over Washington.

impact: Wilkins started in place of Marlon Mack, but found little room to run as the Eagles dominated on the defensive front. Wilkins now has rushed 30 times for 120 yards with seven catches for 25 yards through three games. He is not a starting-caliber option heading into Week 4 versus the Texans.
report: Jordan Wilkins rushed six times for 19 yards while catching two passes for one yard in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Wilkins got another start with Marlon Mack injured, but he again did nothing of note.  Over the past two weeks, Wilkins has 35 yards on 14 carries.  Wilkins wasn't active in the pass game, either, failing to catch his lone target against Houston.  Wilkins doesn't belong in fantasy lineups Week 5 at New England.
report: Jordan Wilkins rushed eight times for 16 yards in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: Wilkins got out-touched 22-8 by Nyheim Hines. He marred what could have been a promising night with a soft second half fumble as he fought for extra yardage. Regardless of Marlon Mack's health, Wilkins simply has not been able to make it happen behind the Colts' banged up offense line. Mack now has 10 more days to get healthy for Week 6.
report: Jordan Wilkins rushed six times for 39 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots, adding two receptions for nine additional yards.

impact: Even as Marlon Mack and Nyheim Hines both made major miscues and Robert Turbin left with a potentially severe shoulder injury, Wilkins was not used by the coaching staff.  Wilkins is safe to drop in 12-team season-long leagues.
report: Jordan Wilkins did not touch the ball in Week 6.

impact: With Robert Turbin (shoulder) sidelined, Wilkins saw his first touches in three weeks. He got the last series all to himself with Indy up big in the fourth quarter. Wilkins had some fantasy relevance early on, but now that Marlon Mack is back from his hamstring injury, he's no longer worth rostering.
report: Jordan Wilkins collected 46 yards on six carries while securing his lone target for an eight-yard gain Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 win over Buffalo.

impact: Wilkins' score was an 18-yarder where he took a toss and found the seam. It was the first touchdown of his career. Wilkins is providing some big plays off the bench, but he is not cutting into Marlon Mack's workload. Wilkins lacks standalone fantasy value.
report: Jordan Wilkins rushed four times for 30 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 11 win over the Titans.

impact: Wilkins was held without a rush. That won't be the case in Week 13 if Marlon Mack is forced to sit with his concussion. If Mack is out, Wilkins will have FLEX appeal as a committee mate to Nyheim Hines.
report: Jordan Wilkins caught 3-of-3 targets for 32 yards in the Colts' Week 12 win over the Dolphins.

impact: All are healthy aside from Smith, who has a hamstring issue.
report: Panthers declared RB Cameron Artis-Payne, OG Brendan Mahon, OG Amini Silatolu, DE Marquis Haynes, DE Bryan Cox, LB Andre Smith, and CB Corn Elder inactive Week 7 against the Eagles.

impact: He finished second among Indy backs in touches behind Jordan Wilkins (17).  Hines was used heavily on screens and also gained 17 yards on a route where he lined up at wide receiver.  Even when Marlon Mack (hamstring) returns, Hines has a chance to carve out PPR flex value in this catch-first role.  The Colts are playing dink-and-dunk passing offense, and Hines' game suits that style of play.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed five times for 19 yards and caught 7-of-9 targets for 33 yards in the Colts' Week 1 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Hines impressed with a spinning, eight-yard touchdown dash in the second quarter but was a non-factor otherwise. All but two of his touches came in the first half. Hines spent most of the afternoon working behind Jordan Wilkins and Marlon Mack and that will likely be the case again next week against the Eagles. The fourth-round rookie is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Nyheim Hines contributed seven yards and a touchdown on four carries while catching his lone target for a loss of two yards Sunday in the Colts’ Week 2 win over the Redskins.

impact: Hines "led" the Colts backfield in Week 3, but hardly was noteworthy. Through three games, Hines has carried 14 times for 44 yards while catching 13 passes for 56 yards. He is not a fantasy option Week 4 against the Texans.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed five times for 18 yards while catching 5-of-5 targets for 25 yards in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Hines' 11 targets tied with Chester Rogers for the team lead on a day Andrew Luck uncorked a career-high 62 pass attempts.  With no Jack Doyles (hip) and T.Y. Hilton in and out of the game with chest and hamstring injuries, Hines became Luck's most trustworthy option.  Both of his scores were red-zone successes, from 14 and nine yards out.  The 14-yarder was an incredible leaping catch over the top of Tyrann Mathieu.  With the Colts having zero run game, Hines is essentially the extension of their nonexistent rushing offense.  He needs to be owned in all formats.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed four times for 10 yards and caught 9-of-11 targets for 63 yards and two touchdowns in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: The 15 carries were a new season high by 10, though as you can see, Hines struggled to do anything with them. Jordan Wilkins was more involved in the second half but marred his night with a soft giveaway. Things change fast in a backfield this injured and ineffective, but Hines figures to remain the only Indy runner with any fantasy appeal for Week 6 against the Jets.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed 15 times for 45 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots, adding seven receptions for 45 additional yards.

impact: Hines dropped an early would-be touchdown on third-and-goal to force a field goal, and he wasn't heard from much after that.  Marlon Mack led the backfield in Week 6 touches and sparked the rushing attack with 89 yards on 12 carries.  In a multi-headed RBBC, Hines is suddenly back in the shaky PPR-flex-option mix.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed three times for 14 yards and caught 2-of-3 targets for 21 yards in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: Hines played well when called upon, which wasn't often with Marlon Mack in the midst of a career game. Mack wound up out-touching Hines by a substantial 21-6 margin while also losing the snap battle 38-17. Hines will continue to have a role, especially when Indy is playing from behind, but he's now a distant second to Mack in the Colts' backfield pecking order. The fourth-round rookie gets the Raiders on the road in Week 8.
report: Nyheim Hines tallied 47 yards on five carries while adding one catch for -5 yards on two targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 victory over the Bills.

impact: The Colts have been among the league's pass-heaviest teams this year but they abandoned that strategy against the Raiders, running it 40 times while attempting just 31 passes. Marlon Mack handled the lead role but Hines performed well in a change-of-pace capacity, setting a career-high with 78 rushing yards in the win. Hines benefited from positive game script Sunday against a one-win Raiders team, but that's not something he can count on every week. The Colts get Jacksonville at home after their bye.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed for 78 yards on 11 carries while adding two catches for seven yards on two targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 victory over the Raiders.

impact: This game did not set up well for Hines as the Colts jumped out to an early lead, but he still did not take advantage of his opportunities. As well as averaging one yard per carry, Hines dropped what would have been a long gain in the third quarter. Hines should have better days -- he ran for 78 yards on 11 carries before the bye -- but he is not a must-hold in shallower leagues.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed three times for three yards and hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 19 yards in the Colts' Week 10 win over the Jaguars.

impact: The Colts won going away, but it was a rough game for the rookie change-of-pace back. He committed a brutal drop and later put the ball on the ground. Thankfully, the Colts managed to recover. Hines has failed to provide PPR FLEX value since Marlon Mack got rolling, though the Dolphins will be an appetizing Week 12 matchup.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed five times for 14 yards in the Colts' Week 11 win over the Titans, adding a 20-yard reception.

impact: The eight touches were Hines' most in three games. Hines could have some Week 13 FLEX appeal against the Jaguars if Marlon Mack (concussion) can't get cleared, though Jordan Wilkins would be the favorite for early-down work.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed nine times for 28 yards in the Colts' Week 12 win over the Dolphins, adding two receptions for 22 additional yards.

impact: The Colts got nothing going on the ground and resorted to short passes, an approach that favored Hines over lead back Marlon Mack.  Andrew Luck wound up with 52 pass attempts.  Hines now has averaged nine touches per game since the Colts' Week 9 bye. He will be a low-end flex option specific to PPR leagues when Indianapolis travels to Houston for Week 14.
report: Nyheim Hines rushed four times for five yards but caught 9-of-9 targets for 50 yards in the Colts' Week 13 loss to Jacksonville.

impact: Mack missed two practices with an ankle injury this week but he didn't look hurt Sunday as the Colts rolled to their second straight win. He ripped the Raiders for 132 rushing yards, bettering the career mark he set against Buffalo in Week 7. In doing so, he became the first Colt to rush for 100 yards in back-to-back weeks since Joseph Addai in 2007. Both of Mack's touchdowns came in the fourth quarter as Indy out-scored Oakland 21-0 in the final frame. He's been an absolute boss, contributing 401 yards from scrimmage with four touchdowns in three games since coming back from a hamstring injury. Mack has benefited from workhorse usage, averaging 20.3 touches during that span. At worst, the second-year USF alum will be a high-end RB2 when the Colts return from their upcoming bye week.
report: Marlon Mack blew up for 132 yards and two touchdowns on 25 carries while also grabbing two catches for 17 yards on four targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 win over Oakland.

impact: Mack only practiced once because of an ankle injury in the lead up to Week 8 before shredding the Raiders for 132 yards and two touchdowns. It is possible the Colts plan to limit his practice reps the rest of the way to keep him fresh. The Colts do not have to release an injury report until Wednesday.
report: Marlon Mack (undisclosed) is working with trainers to the side of Monday's practice.

impact: It's a little concerning to see Mack limited coming off last week's bye, though his foot injury doesn't appear to be serious. Mack has been dominant when healthy this year, especially over his last three games (6.19 yards per carry, four touchdowns). The second-year USF alum will be a borderline RB1 if he suits up against Jacksonville in Week 10.
report: Marlon Mack (foot) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: A "full" practice on Friday would be nice, but we have to see anything to suggest Mack is in danger of missing Week 10. Mack has been an RB1 since returning from his hamstring injury.
report: Marlon Mack (foot) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Mack was limited earlier in the week but got in a full session on Friday. He'll be available with no limitations against the Jags' front-seven. Mack has undeniably been a strong RB1 over the last three weeks, averaging 18.7 carries and 115.7 rushing yards in that span. It's a tough matchup on paper, but Mack still needs to be treated as an RB1 against Jacksonville given his usage.
report: Marlon Mack (foot) will play in Week 10 against the Jaguars.

impact: The Colts' passing game shredded the Jaguars early in this contest, but the rushing attack struggled to get anything going. That was especially true in the second half, where Mack went for just two yards on three carries. This was easily Mack's worst game since returning from injury. He will look to get back on the right track next week against the Titans.
report: Marlon Mack rushed 12 times for 29 yards and caught both of his targets for nine yards in the Colts' Week 10 win over the Jaguars.

impact: With the game a laugher from the early going, Mack ceded 10 touches to Nyheim Hines and Jordan Wilkins. Mack has now turned in back-to-back pedestrian performances after the schedule tightened up with the Jaguars and Titans, but the Dolphins will provide a Week 12 breather. Matt Burke's defense has been straight up dismantled by the run of late. Mack will be a high-end RB2.
report: Marlon Mack rushed 16 times for 61 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 11 win over the Titans, adding an eight-yard reception.

impact: Mack was ruled out late in the fourth quarter. He was having a strong game before going down, rushing 15 times for 85 yards while adding two receptions. He will have the full seven days to get cleared for Week 13 against the Bills. Jordan Wilkins would be the next man up on early downs.
report: Marlon Mack was forced from Sunday's game against the Dolphins with a concussion and will not return.

impact: Mack had 15 carries for 85 yards before getting concussed last week against the Dolphins.  The injury-prone back won't practice today and will be up against it to be ready to face the Jaguars.  If Mack can't go, Nyheim Hines and Jordan Wilkins would figure to be ahead of Jonathan Williams for touches.
report: Marlon Mack remains in the league's concussion protocol.

impact: Mack is now on track to suit up against the Jaguars, but it is not guaranteed he will gain final clearance. We should have a good idea as to Mack's Week 13 status by Friday.
report: Marlon Mack (concussion) returned to Colts practice on Thursday.

impact: Mack has made a shockingly fast recovery from a concussion he suffered last week against Miami. He's now on track to play Sunday at Jacksonville. Mack struggled when these teams squared off in Week 10 (just 38 yards on 14 touches), but he'll still be in play as an RB2 for the final week of the fantasy regular season.
report: Updating an earlier report, Marlon Mack (concussion) was a full participant at Thursday's practice.

impact: Mack has one more step to go before he clears the concussion protocol. We're guessing he'll be active for Sunday's game in Jacksonville after getting in a full practice on Thursday. Mack has settled in as a weekly RB2 in fantasy.
report: Marlon Mack (concussion) is questionable for Week 13 against the Jaguars.

impact: Mack always looked on track to play after getting in a full practice Thursday. He struggled his last time out against the Jaguars, gaining just 29 yards on 12 carries, but script should work in his favor in this spot, making him a volume-based RB2.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Marlon Mack (concussion) is expected to play Week 13 against the Jaguars.

impact: Mack suffered a concussion last week but made it through the protocol quickly, returning to full practice on Thursday. It's not an ideal matchup for the second-year back, though Mack is still usable as a volume-based RB2 in most formats. TE Mo Alie-Cox, OT Le'Raven Clark, C Ryan Kelly, S Corey Moore, DT Hassan Ridgeway, TE Clive Walford and RB Jonathan Williams are inactive for Sunday's game in Jacksonville.
report: Marlon Mack (concussion) is active for Week 13 against the Jaguars.

impact: He got out-touched by Nyheim Hines 13 to 9 in a game where the Colts played from behind and couldn't run efficiently, resorting to short passes to move the chains.  In that approach, versatile Hines is a superior option to Mack, who primarily focuses on early-down rushing.  Mack has settled in as a low-end RB2 entering the Colts' Week 14 date with a stout Texans run defense.
report: Marlon Mack rushed eight times for 27 yards and caught his lone target for six yards in the Colts' Week 13 loss to the Jaguars.

impact:
The Colts did not stretch the field -- just one of Luck's 39 completions gained more than 20 yards -- but Luck looked mostly comfortable against a talented Bengals pass rush and picked apart the defense at times in Frank Reich's up-tempo, no-huddle attack.  He absorbed only nine hits and two sacks among 61 total dropbacks. 
 Luck showed enough in this game to be viewed as a locked-in QB1 going forward.  He gets a softer Week 2 matchup in Washington.
report: Andrew Luck completed 39-of-53 passes for 319 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Colts' Week 1 loss to Cincinnati.

impact: He was sacked once for a two-yard loss. Luck got off to a hot start, completing four-of-five passes for 40 yards on the Colts’ opening drive including a seven-yard touchdown strike to tight end Eric Ebron. He had his most success throwing to T.Y. Hilton, connecting seven times for 83 yards and a touchdown. That touchdown came on a two-yard bunny with 7:32 remaining in the fourth quarter. Luck endured his share of struggles despite the victory. He was intercepted twice, both by safety D.J. Swearinger. The first pick was on a ball tipped at the line of scrimmage but the second came on a pass Luck never should have thrown as Swearinger read his eyes the whole way. Sunday marked Luck’s first win as a starter since Week 17 of 2016. He’ll try to make it two in a row next week when the Colts travel to Philadelphia to take on the reigning World Champs.
report: Andrew Luck completed 21-of-31 passes for 179 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while adding two yards on four carries Sunday in the Colts’ Week 2 win over the Redskins.

impact: Luck struggled through the rain and continued to fail to push the ball downfield on his throwing attempts. He had just 80 yards passing before the final two possessions, the latter closed with him being pulled for Jacoby Brissett on the Hail Mary attempt to win the game. Luck's yards per pass attempt have progressively dropped each week, going from 6.0 to 5.8 to 4.1 this week. Luck's athleticism is still prevalent and he added a 33-yard run down the sideline, but his limitations driving the ball through the air have turned him into a dink-and-dunk passer. Luck will enter Week 4 as QB2 against the Texans.
