report: Andrew Luck completed 25-of-40 passes for 164 yards with a touchdown in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Eagles.

impact: The Colts are almost never challenging defenses in the vertical passing game, and they pulled Luck for Jacoby Brissett to attempt Sunday's last-gasp Hail Mary pass against the Eagles. "What I've seen is he makes all the throws," Reich insisted. "There's been plenty of throws down the field, in my mind ... (What) I've seen is a guy who is extremely accurate.  I have no concerns about velocity."  The Colts return home to face J.J. Watt's Texans next.
report: Colts coach Frank Reich insisted Monday that the team is not concerned with Andrew Luck's arm strength.

impact: He's practicing in full, so it's not a concern to his status. Luck has a rebound matchup with a Texans secondary that allowed Eli Manning to complete 86 percent of his passes in Week 3.
report: Andrew Luck is listed on the Week 4 injury report with a groin injury.

impact: Luck is averaging just 5.1 yards per attempt through three games, and his average depth of target is all the way down at 5.2 yards, a full three yards fewer than in 2016. Much of that is by design as the offense looks to hide a shoddy offensive line with quick passing, but it was telling the Colts decided to sub in Jacoby Brissett for the Hail Mary at the end of last week's game. Perhaps his arm strength is simply a work in progress following so much downtime, but it is a concern right now.
report: Andrew Luck said he "can make all the throws" and has his "full arsenal."

impact: The 62 attempts and 464 yards both set new career-highs for Luck.  At one point, the Colts trailed by three possessions in the second half.  But Luck rallied the team back as the Texans tried to give it away to the Colts, who were able to force overtime.  Luck entered the day at the bottom of the barrel in yards-per-attempt, but he unleashed more downfield throws in this one, hitting T.Y. Hilton for a pair of 40-plus-yard grabs.  Hilton eventually pulled his hamstring in the fourth quarter, leaving Nyheim Hines as Luck's top target.  The two hooked up for two red-zone touchdowns, with the other two going to Zach Pascal and Eric Ebron.  Luck's arm figures to surely be a bit tender this week ahead of a Thursday night date in Foxboro with the Patriots where he'll be a volume-driven QB1.  The Colts have zero running game.
report: Andrew Luck completed 40-of-62 passes for 464 yards and four touchdowns in the Colts' 37-34, Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: Although Luck's 6.18 yards per attempt was once again shaky, tonight was nothing but positives. Luck's spiral continued to tighten as he showed feathery ball placement in the short-to-intermediate parts of the field. Luck's deep ball is still not all the way back. He is lacking his pre-injury drive and appeared to lack feel the few times he really uncorked it. That should not bury the lede that he was confident and commanding with what was essentially an entire second-team offense thanks to injuries. His only real mistake was his first pick, a forced throw under pressure. The 29-year-old quarterback is firmly on the comeback trail. He has 10 days to rest up for a road trip to New York to face the Jets.
report: Andrew Luck completed 38-of-59 passes for 365 yards, three touchdowns and two interceptions in the Colts' 38-24, Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Luck survived countless drops and pass-catcher injuries for a monster fantasy performance, even in the face of defeat.  Throwing to the likes of Mo Alie-Cox, Erik Swoope, "Marcus Johnson," and "Zach Pascal," Luck kept the Colts in the game even as their defense collapsed.  Performances like these are a testament to Luck's legitimate greatness.  He may have lost deep-ball prowess, but he is a surefire every-week fantasy starter.  The Colts host the reeling Bills next.
report: Andrew Luck completed 23-of-43 passes for 301 yards, four touchdowns, and three interceptions in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: He wasn’t sacked. Sunday ended Luck’s streak of three straight 300-yard passing games, though he still had a productive week with four touchdowns, a total he’s now reached in three of his last four outings. Two of Luck’s TDs went to T.Y. Hilton, who returned this week following a two-game absence. Luck took it easy with Indy up big in the second half, attempting just eight passes after halftime and ceding the final two drives to backup Jacoby Brissett. The 29-year-old’s only real slip-up came when he let a high snap go through the back of the end zone, resulting in a safety. The former first overall pick will look to stay hot next week when the Colts travel to Oakland for a date with the 1-5 Raiders.
report: Andrew Luck completed 17-of-23 passes for 156 yards and four touchdowns while adding three rushes for five yards Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 victory over Buffalo.

impact: Luck continued his recent touchdown binge by dishing out another three scores on Sunday. He's now delivered at least three touchdowns in each of his last five games. Even with T.Y. Hilton held in check (one catch for 34 yards), Luck still found success in the passing game, peppering his tight ends with targets while also showing strong chemistry with newcomer Dontrelle Inman (six catches for 52 yards). Luck has attempted passes at a prolific rate this year but that wasn't the case Sunday as the Colts actually attempted more runs (40) than passes (31) while riding Marlon Mack to victory. Luck and the Colts will take a two-game winning streak into their bye week.
report: Andrew Luck completed 22-of-31 passes for 239 yards and three touchdowns while losing two yards on two carries Sunday in the Colts’ Week 8 win over the Raiders.

impact: Luck’s first touchdown could not have been much easier. The Jaguars just lost Eric Ebron on the opening drive, and Luck hit him for an easy 53-yard score. Jacksonville kept leaving pass catchers wide open after that, and Luck kept punishing them, hitting Jack Doyle for 20 yards, T.Y. Hilton for 35, and Mo Alie-Cox for 27 all before the end of the first quarter. He kept things going in the second, connecting with an again wide-open Ebron for a 12-yard touchdown before finding Alie-Cox for his third score of the half. Things ground to a halt in the second half, however. Luck’s interception was not his fault – it bounced off Alie-Cox – but he struggled to move the offense, allowing the Jaguars back into the game. Luckily for him, the defense stepped up late, and the Colts held on. Luck faces another divisional test next week when the Titans come to town. He will be a solid QB1 in that matchup.
report: Andrew Luck completed 21-of-29 passes for 285 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Colts' Week 10 win over the Jaguars.

impact: The three-touchdown effort was Luck's seventh straight. Only 2007 Tom Brady and 2004 Peyton Manning posted longer streaks. Luck was a little more old school Luck in this one, getting cookin' with T.Y. Hilton down the field. The highlight was a 68-yard touchdown strike against Adoree' Jackson. Hilton got a step and then Luck delivered a perfect deep ball in stride. Luck is playing like an MVP candidate after his arm looked rusty the first few games of the season. He could easily extend his three-touchdown streak to eight against the pathetic Dolphins in Week 12.
report: Andrew Luck completed 23-of-29 passes for 297 yards and three touchdowns in the Colts' Week 11 blowout of the Titans.

impact: Luck is now just the third player in NFL history to throw for at least three touchdowns in eight-consecutive games. With another three-score day in Week 13 against the collapsed Jaguars, Luck can join 2007 Tom Brady as only the second player with a nine-game streak. Although he was sacked for the first time since Week 5 today, Luck was perfect outside of throwing two picks in 14 seconds near the end of the first half. He once again featured his tight ends in the red zone, finding Eric Ebron for two more scores. Luck has begun to look scarily good in recent weeks, combining his 2018 efficiency with his pre-2018 big-play ability.
report: Andrew Luck completed 30-of-37 passes for 343 yards, three touchdowns and two interceptions in the Colts' 27-24, Week 12 win over the Dolphins.

impact: He added 16 yards on a pair of scrambles in a game where Colts pass catchers struggled to get open and Jacksonville's previously-dead defense came alive for its best performance all year.  Luck took three sacks and was hit nine times, with Yannick Ngakoue particularly standing out as a pass rusher.  Luck entered this game with three or more passing touchdowns in eight straight contests.  Expect him to get back on track in Week 14 at Houston.
report: Andrew Luck completed 33-of-52 passes for 248 yards and an interception in the Colts' Week 13 shutout loss to Jacksonville.

impact: Conley's score was a bullet on a first quarter post route. Conley got the inside track on Artie Burns. It was a nice play, but Conley has just three targets through two games. Patrick Mahomes is working miracles, but he can't make Conley fantasy relevant.
report: Chris Conley caught 2-of-2 targets for 17 yards and a touchdown in the Chiefs' Week 2 win over the Steelers.

impact: Watkins had initially seemed like a long shot to play. Even limited participation is an encouraging sign for his trending availability against the Cardinals come Sunday. He'll be a boom-bust WR3/FLEX if he's on the field, with Chris Conley being downgraded in his usual role.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) returned to practice Friday.

impact: Watkins returned to practice on Friday (albeit on limited participation), suddenly making it possible he suits up. If active, he'll be a boom-bust WR3/FLEX in his usual role. Chris Conley would need to be downgraded as he'll be on the field, but used sparingly.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) is questionable for Week 10 against the Cardinals.

impact: Watkins was never likely to play this week. His foot injury isn't considered serious, so it sounds like this may only be a one game absence. Chris Conley will start opposite Tyreek Hill in Watkins' place. Hill is going to see a lot of Patrick Peterson with Watkins out.
report: Sammy Watkins (questionable, foot) is not expected to play Week 10 against the Cardinals.

impact: This was expected, but Watkins looks on track to return in Week 11. The rest of Kansas City's inactives are S Eric Berry, OL Kahlil McKenzie, DL Justin Hamilton, DB Josh Shaw, LB Frank Zombo, and OL Mitch Morse.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) is inactive for Week 10 against the Cardinals.

impact: Watkins seemed close to suiting up for Week 10 and will have an extra day to get healthy for Week 11 with the Chiefs playing on Monday Night Football. They will then head on bye, giving Watkins almost two weeks for any further healing. Watkins will be a WR2 for what should be a guaranteed shootout with the Rams.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) is expected to return for Week 11 against the Rams.

impact: He was officially limited. NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Watkins is "expected to play," and this practice certainly puts him on track barring any setbacks. In what could be the highest-scoring game of the year, Watkins will be an upside WR2.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) will practice Thursday.

impact: Watkins was limited on Thursday, so this is a concerning downgrade ahead of Monday night's showdown with the Rams.  It could very easily be a maintenance day for the veteran, but we now need to monitor him Saturday.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) will not practice Friday.

impact: Watkins wasn't spotted during the early portion of Kansas City's practice. He was downgraded Friday, so this isn't a good sign for his availability ahead of Monday night. Chris Conley was in on 91.5% of the Chiefs' offensive snaps without Watkins in their last game, but saw just two targets on the day.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) will not practice Saturday.

impact: Watkins is trending toward missing another game after not practicing the last two days. Coach Andy Reid said Watkins is only dealing with soreness, but it would be a surprise if Kansas City pushed him before their Week 12 bye. Tyreek Hill and Travis Kelce would see an uptick in targets it Watkins, with Chris Conley starting opposite Hill in two wide sets.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) is questionable for Week 11 against the Rams.

impact: Watkins missed Week 10, returned to practice on Thursday, but then sat out Friday and Saturday.  The Chiefs even promoted a receiver from the practice squad, as everything suggested Watkins wouldn't play.  He's apparently good enough to go against his former team, which may have played a role in Watkins' active status.  He's hard to trust, but this game total is 63.5 points.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) is active and will start Week 11 against the Rams on Monday night.

impact: Watkins was active despite being listed questionable with a foot injury; he made the start and caught Patrick Mahomes' first pass before then disappearing to the sideline the rest of the game.  He stayed there in uniform, so we're not sure it was an aggravation.  But it looked like Watkins wasn't anywhere close to full health and may have only gotten the token start against his former teammates.  He was a high-risk fantasy play.  Watkins will now get the Week 12 bye to get right before likely being out there for normal snaps Week 13 at Oakland.
report: Sammy Watkins caught his lone target for four yards in the Chiefs' 54-51, Week 11 loss to the Rams on Monday night.

impact: It's not a good sign with the Chiefs coming out of their bye week.  But maybe Kansas City is just playing it safe with their highest-paid wideout in hopes of having him completely healthy for a playoff run.  The offense hasn't needed him to keep putting points on the board.  If Watkins plays, he'll be a WR3 against Oakland.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It is the second missed practice in a row following a bye week. At this point, it would be surprising if Watkins is active. Tyreek Hill and Travis Kelce should dominate targets against the Raiders.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Chris Conley has played 118 snaps (90%) with Watkins hobbled/out the past two weeks. He'll continue to work as the team's No. 2 receiver against Oakland's comical pass rush and secondary. You can do worse if looking for help help in must-win season-long situations, or simply trying to create room in DFS cash games. DeMarcus Robinson will play in three-wide sets, but likely won't be called on much.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) is out for Week 13 against the Raiders.

impact: It's a step in the right direction after Watkins was an early rule out last week. The Chiefs want to avoid rushing  Watkins back given his history of foot issues. He'll likely need to get in a full practice before returning.
report: Sammy Watkins (foot) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Team reporter Geoff Hobson expects Bernard to miss another game Sunday against Kansas City, which would be his third straight absence. Gio was playing well before his injury but with Joe Mixon occupying close to an every-down role, he'll just be a handcuff/change-of-pace option upon his return.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He also sat out Wednesday's session, and it would be a shock if he is ready to return this week. With Bernard out, Joe Mixon is a workhorse back in a great matchup against the Chiefs.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: It'll again be Mark Walton in the lightly-used changeup spot behind Joe Mixon.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) is out for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: He continues to work on a side field and appears doubtful for Week 8.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He also sat out on Wednesday. Bernard appears headed to his fourth absence in a row.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: This will be his fourth straight absence. Lead back duties will again fall in the hands of second-year stud Joe Mixon. Gio will aim to return after the Bengals' bye in Week 9.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Buccaneers.

impact: It is his first practice since Week 4. Getting in work this early suggests Bernard will return this week, but nothing can be taken for granted following a long layoff. Even if he plays, Bernard will struggle to return fantasy value behind Joe Mixon.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) returned to practice Monday.

impact: Bernard also got in some work on Monday. It's a good sign for Bernard's chances of returning this week. Bernard is unlikely to have much of a change-up role in his first game back.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Bernard remains on track to return, but it would be nice to see him get in a "full" session on Friday. If Bernard does return, he could immediately see a number of targets in the passing game for an offense missing A.J. Green (toe). Bernard's return would not downgrade Joe Mixon from RB1 status.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Bernard has practiced all week, so it would be a shock if he is not active, especially since the Bengals have already ruled out seven players. Bernard could see a few more catches than usual with A.J. Green sidelined, but he is nothing more than a handcuff in standard-sized leagues.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) is questionable for Week 10 against the Saints.

impact: He'll be returning from a four-game absence. Bernard will cede early-down work to second-year stud Joe Mixon, but he'll be needed in the passing game, especially against the high-scoring Saints. As an RB3/flex, you could do a lot worse than Gio.
report: Giovani Bernard (questionable, knee) is expected to play Week 10 against the Saints.

impact: Bernard has been sidelined since Week 4 with an MCL injury. He and Joe Mixon have played just two games together on the season, with Bernard totaling just 12 touches for 51 yards in those two games while playing 40 percent of the offensive snaps. Bernard could be a part of the game plan in the receiving game against the Saints, but he is a risky RB3/FLEX option.
report: Giovani Bernard (knee) is active for Sunday's Week 10 game versus the Saints.

impact: This was Bernard's first game action since Week 4 after dealing with an MCL injury. In his three games played with Joe Mixon, Bernard now has totaled just 16 touches for 87 yards. Bernard is only a bench-stash option in the event Mixon were to miss time.
report: Giovani Bernard rushed two times for six yards while catching 2-of-3 targets for 30 yards in Sunday's Week 10 loss to the Saints.

impact: Bernard now has just five carries for 21 yards and seven catches for 62 yards over his three games since returning to the lineup. Bernard is nothing more than a handcuff and not a fantasy option in Week 13 against the Broncos.
report: Giovani Bernard rushed one time for 10 yards while catching one pass for 12 yards in Sunday's Week 12 loss to the Browns.

impact: Unlike previous weeks, Bernard was actually involved over teammate Joe Mixon down the stretch. Mixon still led the Bengals with 12 carries to Bernard's five, but Gio quietly tied Tyler Boyd with a team-high eight targets as Cincinnati went into catch-up mode early. It would make sense the Bengals utilize both Mixon and Bernard against the Chargers next week, but the latter is still just a handcuff at this point of the season.
report: Giovani Bernard rushed five times for 14 yards, tacking on six catches for 32 yards in the Bengals' Week 13 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Thomas re-fractured his leg at Thursday's practice. It's the same injury that ended his 2017 season. Thomas doesn't need surgery, but he's headed for IR.
report: Chiefs KR De'Anthony Thomas is out indefinitely with a leg injury.

impact: Thomas suffered his second leg fracture in two seasons in practice this week. He doesn't need surgery but isn't going to be back this year. Tremon Smith will take over as Kansas City's kick returner.
report: Chiefs placed KR De'Anthony Thomas (leg) on injured reserve.

impact: It's a needed rebound after a rough two-week stretch for Manning. The Giants' offensive line stepped up with  RT Ereck Flowers benched, allowing Manning to completed 86 percent of his passes. Manning's touchdowns went to Sterling Shepard and Rhett Ellison in the red-zone. It's a small step for Manning, but he remains one of the shakiest quarterbacks in the league. Even with a plus Saints matchup, Manning will be hard to trust as a Week 4 streamer.
report: Eli Manning completed 25-of-29 passes for 297 yards and two touchdowns in the Giants' Week 3 win over the Texans.

impact: Manning played it safe all day, as evidenced by his horrid yards per attempt.  The Saints have been getting torched over the top of their defense all year, but Manning opted not to challenge them deep, instead opting for short, chain-moving passes that never threatened this defense.  His longest pass of the first half went for 11 yards.  Manning is barely even a two-quarterback league fantasy option heading into a road date with the Panthers in Week 5.
report: Eli Manning completed 31-of-41 passes for 255 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: Manning lost a yard on his lone sack. Eli got off to a painfully slow start, completing just 12-of-20 passes for 119 scoreless yards in the first half. He didn't fare much better after the break, at least initially. Manning threw a costly interception in the third quarter on a pass intended for Odell Beckham, then committed another pick on his very next pass (Mike Adams got him both times). The 37-year-old rebounded nicely after that, however, leading a pair of late touchdown drives to give the Giants a one-point lead with 1:08 remaining. His best throw of the day came on a 33-yard deep strike to Odell Beckham, which was caught for a touchdown. Despite their efforts, the Giants eventually lost on a 63-yard, walk-off field goal by Graham Gano. New York will look to improve on its 1-4 record Thursday night against the Eagles.
report: Eli Manning completed 22-of-36 passes for 326 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while adding one yard on his only carry Sunday in the Giants’ Week 5 loss to Carolina.

impact: Manning stunk the joint up, with the vast majority of his yardage either being tacked on after the catch by Saquon Barkley or coming in garbage time. His pick was an inexcusable force to a blanketed "Scott Simonson." Manning, of course, was under siege behind the Giants' putrid offensive line, though the zero-mobility 37-year-old line probably makes his line look even worse than it actually is. Manning's play has become a dispiriting series of quick outs and check downs. Amazingly/hilariously, coach Pat Shurmur called a screen on what should have been a first half Hail Mary. For all his struggles, Manning will have an attackable Week 7 matchup in the Falcons' hollowed-out defense.
report: Eli Manning completed 24-of-43 passes for 281 yards, zero touchdowns and an interception in the Giants' 31-13, Week 6 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Manning had a huge second half, but the offense really struggled in the red zone.  Manning didn't throw his touchdown until he heaved a prayer for a one-yard score to Odell Beckham with five seconds left on the clock after Manning failed to score on consecutive QB sneaks from the one-yard line.  Earlier in the game, he missed OBJ on an open nine-yard touchdown before the Giants had to settle for a field goal.  Manning's 399 yards mark a season-best, but this offense is still broken.  Manning won't be a recommended play next week against the Redskins.
report: Eli Manning completed 27-of-38 passes for 399 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 7 loss to the Falcons.

impact: In other words, even though they are tanking, the G-Men won't bench their quarterback. Of course, you could easily argue leaving Manning in augments the tank. Coming off his best game of the season, Manning will be a low-end QB2 against the Redskins. Washington likes to dominate time of possession and keep the opposing offense off the field, limiting plays.
report: Speaking following the Giants' trade of CB Eli Apple, coach Pat Shurmur said the team has no plans to bench Eli Manning.

impact: He took seven sacks.  Manning is completely devoid of athleticism at this stage of his career, and his slow-twitch pocket movement is a terrible combination with New York's swinging-gate offensive line.  Manning's touchdown was a two-yarder to Evan Engram in what amounted to garbage time of Sunday's 20-13 loss.  The Giants will have to consider turning to rookie Kyle Lauletta during their Week 9 bye.  They began the tank last week by trading two starters.
report: Eli Manning completed 30-of-47 passes for 316 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the Giants' Week 8 loss to Washington.

impact: Shurmur answered, "We'll see," when asked if Manning will start following the bye. "I know what you’re all trying to tease a headline," the coach continued. "We’ve got to do what we can to help him be better. There’s a handful of plays where he needs to be better. That’s obvious." It is notable the coach left some wiggle room, and the rebuilding Giants offloaded two defensive starters via trade last week. It would not be shocking if they turned to fourth-round rookie Kyle Lauletta during the bye week, but it seems more likely Manning will get the nod.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur said, "At this point, Eli [Manning is] our quarterback."

impact: This was the expectation after coach Pat Shurmur called him "our quarterback" last week, and any plans the Giants might have had to start Kyle Lauletta certainly went out the window following his arrest. Manning has a good matchup on Monday night against the 49ers, but he is not an exciting streaming option.
report: Eli Manning was working as the first-team quarterback during Tuesday's practice.

impact: This was the expectation after Shurmur called Manning "our quarterback" during the bye week, and but the coach was careful not to promise anything beyond this week. "He’s starting Monday. You guys roll with that how you want," Shurmur said. "The idea is he’ll get on a run here and there’s no decision to be made." With Manning's time in New York almost certainly coming to a close, it makes sense for the tanking Giants to see what Kyle Lauletta can do at some point this season.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur confirmed Eli Manning will start Monday night against the 49ers.

impact: The yards-per-attempt (6.1) is pretty hideous, but Manning got the job done with a big second half.  He had 63 yards on 15 attempts before the break, but found Odell Beckham and Sterling Shepard for touchdowns in the third and fourth quarters after the Giants fell behind 20-10.  Beckham caught two of Manning's three scores, totaling 4-73-2 on 11 targets.  Shepard's three-yarder came with 53 second left to give the G-Men a 27-23 lead.  The Giants will head back home to face the Bucs in Week 11.  It's a prime matchup for Eli, but he's still nothing more than a mid-range QB2.
report: Eli Manning completed 19-of-31 passes for 188 yards and three touchdowns in the Giants' 27-23, Week 10 win over the 49ers on Monday night.

impact: Eli Manning and the passing game as a whole grabbed some popcorn and watched as Saquon Barkley led the way with season-highs in carries (27), rushing yards (142), and total touchdowns (3). Even so, it was a tremendously efficient performance for Manning, who primarily relied on YAC to build up his total yardage. He'll be asked to do more in what is actually a plus matchup on paper against the Eagles' ailing secondary in Week 12.
report: Eli Manning efficiently completed 17-of-18 passes for 231 yards and two touchdowns in the Giants' Week 11 victory over the Bucs.

impact: Manning was cooking early, guiding the Giants down the field for four-straight scoring drives, including a touchdown pass to Saquon Barkley on a 13-yard screen.  But the Giants did nothing after the half, with Manning throwing for just 58 scoreless yards the final 30 minutes.  Barkley got just five touches in the second half.  Manning won't be a fantasy option next week against the Bears.
report: Eli Manning completed 25-of-36 passes for 294 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Giants' 25-22, Week 12 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Manning was being harassed by the Bears' pass rush much of the day but was also terrible even when he did have time to throw, missing receivers.  His interception was thrown right to CB Kyle Fuller.  Manning's score was a blind heave into the air from the on-yard line in the face of pressure, and a wide-open Odell Beckham was able to run under it in the end zone.  Manning is a bottom-five fantasy option heading into a road date against the Redskins in Week 14.
report: Eli Manning completed 19-of-35 passes for 170 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Giants' Week 13 win over the Bears.

impact: This was the likely outcome after the Giants pulled an overtime upset of the Bears on Sunday. Manning did not play well in that game, however, and it continues to make sense for the Giants to see what they have in fourth-rounder Kyle Lauletta, who Shurmur said will remain the No. 2 quarterback moving forward. That change is unlikely to happen before the Giants are mathematically eliminated.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur said Eli Manning will start Week 14.

impact: This looks like a healthy scratch after Walton was removed from the injury report. Walton doesn't play special teams, so this doesn't change anything with his depth chart standing.
report: Mark Walton is inactive for Week 1.

impact: Walton was a healthy scratch the first two weeks. He doesn't play special teams, so it's not a sign of his standing with the Bengals. Walton started the fourth preseason game over Tra Carson and is listed ahead of him on the depth chart. A fourth-round pick, Walton had some Day 1 hype before missing most of his junior year to ankle surgery. The Bengals could pair Walton in a committee with Giovani Bernard until Mixon returns.
report: Bengals rookie Mark Walton is expected to be active in Week 3 with Joe Mixon (knee surgery) sidelined.

impact: "Giovani [Bernard] and Mark Walton will shoulder the load for the next few weeks," Lewis told SiriusXM's Ross Tucker. The quote could be read as the coach promising a timeshare, but it would still be surprising if Bernard did not handle the majority of the work. Even so, Walton is worth stashing on the bench to see how this situation shakes out.
report: Bengals coach Marvin Lewis confirmed Mark Walton will be the No. 2 running back while Joe Mixon is sidelined.

impact: Walton was more involved than last week before exiting in the third quarter, catching two passes for 28 yards and taking four carries five yards. With Walton out, Giovani Bernard is the Bengals' only active running back. This injury will be a concern if Joe Mixon is not ready to return next week.
report: Bengals RB Mark Walton exited week 4 against the Falcons with a possible concussion.

impact: Walton played sparingly behind Giovani Bernard the last two weeks but made a few highlights with his touches. With Joe Mixon coming off knee surgery and not in great conditioning, he's in line for his biggest workload of the year. Bernard's MCL sprain likely locks Walton into the No. 2 role for the next month. There's handcuff value with Walton if Mixon suffers another setback.
report: The Cincinnati Enquirer reports the Bengals are counting on Mark Walton to "fill in on more snaps."

impact: The Bengals were expected to get Walton more touches this week. He played sparingly behind Joe Mixon, failing to get a single carry. Walton has flashed when given chances, but he's just a handcuff until Giovani Bernard returns.
report: Mark Walton caught 2-of-3 passes for three yards in Week 5 against Miami.

impact: All four of Vernon, Apple, Latimer, and Engram are hurt and were previously ruled out.
report: Giants declared OLB Olivier Vernon, CB Eli Apple, WR Cody Latimer, TE Evan Engram, QB Kyle Lauletta, CB Antonio Hamilton, and C Evan Brown inactive Week 4 against the Saints.

impact: No surprises here.  Davis, Omameh, and Shepard are all injured.
report: Giants declared QB Kyle Lauletta, OG Patrick Omameh, WR Jawill Davis, S Kamrin Moore, WR Russell Shepard, CB Mike Jordan, and DT John Jenkins inactive for Week 7 against the Falcons.

impact: No surprises in this group.  Despite the Giants' tank job, they are rolling with Alex Tanney rather than fourth-rounder Lauletta as Eli Manning's top backup.
report: Giants declared QB Kyle Lauletta, WR Jawill Davis, LB Alec Ogletree, DBs Tony Lippett, Kamrin Moore, and Mike Jordan, and C Evan Brown inactive for Week 8 against the Redskins.

impact: There are not many details, but Zeitlinger reports Lauletta failed to obey a police officer's direction while driving to the practice facility on Tuesday morning and, in the process, almost struck an officer with his car. This sounds minor, but it is another disappointing development for the cratering Giants. There was some hope Lauletta would take over as the starting quarterback following the bye, but that seems unlikely at this point.
report: NJ Advance Media's Ron Zeitlinger reports Giants backup QB Kyle Lauletta was arrested after almost striking an officer with his vehicle Tuesday morning.

impact: Lauletta was arrested for allegedly almost hitting a cop with his car last week. Shurmur said the team handled the situation internally. With Eli Manning seemingly headed out the door, the Giants could give Lauletta some starts down the stretch.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur said QB Kyle Lauletta will not be suspended by the team.

impact: They're all healthy scratches, as the Giants had an empty injury report.  Lauletta's deactivation means we won't be seeing him at all in Santa Clara.
report: Giants declared QB Kyle Lauletta, WR/KR Jawill Davis, CB Tony Lippett, C Evan Brown, DT RJ McIntosh, DT John Jenkins, and S Kamrin Moore inactive for Week 10 against the 49ers.

impact: No surprises here. With Lauletta inactive for another week, the Giants once again have no choice but to hope Eli Manning keeps their offense afloat by any means necessary. It's a terrific matchup for Saquon Barkley at least as the Bucs are without stud LB Lavonte David (knee) and DE Vinny Curry (ankle), among others.
report: Giants declared QB Kyle Lauletta, CB Tony Lippett, C Evan Brown, S Kamrin Moore, DT R.J. McIntosh, DT John Jenkins, and WR Jawill Davis inactive for Week 11 against the Buccaneers.

impact: Wynn has a concussion.  He's the only injured one of the bunch.
report: Giants declared QB Kyle Lauletta, DE Kerry Wynn, DB Tony Lippett, S Kamrin Moore, C Evan Brown, WR Jawill Davis, and DT John Jenkins inactive for Week 12 against the Eagles.

impact: It's the rookie's first time being active this season, usurping Alex Tanney as Eli Manning's backup.  It wouldn't be surprising to see Lauletta get snaps at some point over the final five weeks of another lost season for the G-Men.  Inactive for the Giants are Tanney, S Kamrin Moore , OLB Lorenzo Carter, C Evan Brown, TE Evan Engram, DT John Jenkins, and LB B.J. Goodson.
report: Giants fourth-round QB Kyle Lauletta is active for Week 13 against the Bears.

impact: More definitively, SNY's Ralph Vacchiano reported Monday the Giants "intend to play (Lauletta) at some point this season."  Eli Manning's utter lack of atheticism has been a disastrous combination with New York's leaky line, while Manning's arm strength is on par with a peashooter.  Ben McAdoo was fired after two seasons as Giants coach in large part for benching Manning and upsetting the fanbase.  The Giants are just now realizing McAdoo was right.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur left the door open Monday for fourth-round rookie QB Kyle Lauletta to see late-season playing time.

impact: Prosise is buried on the running back depth chart and played just six snaps in the opener, seeing the bulk of those on the Seahawks' final couple possessions when they were in catchup mode.  All three of Chris Carson, Rashaad Penny, and Mike Davis are ahead of Prosise for carries.  With Doug Baldwin's latest knee injury, the Seahawks could use some warm bodies out wide.  Prosise is a catch-first weapon who has some receiver experience from his days at Notre Dame.
report: Coach Pete Carroll says the Seahawks "have been talking about" moving C.J. Prosise to receiver.

impact: It's only notable with Chris Carson (hip) a game-time decision. Prosise didn't practice all week and doesn't look close to returning. Mike Davis will remain Seattle's No. 3 back.
report: C.J. Prosise (core) is doubtful for Week 4 against the Cardinals.

impact: Prosise had a core-muscle injury last week, but he was not listed on the injury report coming into this game. There was just no room with Chris Carson back healthy and Mike Davis emerging last weekend. Seattle also declared WR Keenan Reynolds, S T.J. Green, LB K.J. Wright (knee), DE Rasheem Green (ankle), OG Ethan Pocic (ankle), and NT Nazair Jones inactive for Week 5.
report: Seahawks declared C.J. Prosise inactive for Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: Greg Olsen exited early with a foot injury, which allowed McCaffrey to flourish even more in Carolina's passing game. His nine targets and 45 receiving yards were both team-highs. It's still concerning that Cam Newton used his towering 6'5" 245-pound frame to bowl over defenders inside the five-yard line, essentially robbing CMC of a goal line score. It's also an issue for McCaffrey's future outlook that he handled only three more carries (10) than C.J. Anderson (7). His floor is safe due to his involvement as a receiver, but at least through Week 1, McCaffrey isn't being used like the bell-cow coach Ron Rivera promised he'd be.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 10 times for 50 yards and caught 6-of-9 targets for 45 yards in the Panthers' Week 1 victory over the Cowboys.

impact: McCaffrey touched the ball "just" 16 times in Week 1. Speaking Thursday, OC Norv Turner characterized it was a "week-to-week deal." McCaffrey himself said his day would have been bigger had Cam Newton not kept it on so many read options. That, of course, is going to be a common occurrence. Even if he's getting the ball "just" 16-18 times per game, McCaffrey is going to be in the RB1 mix.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera would still like Christian McCaffrey to rush 15-20 times per game while catching "6-10 passes."

impact: McCaffrey clearly did very little as a rusher and was unable to convert his one inside-the-10-yard-line carry, picking up one yard from the six before Jarius Wright then caught a five-yard score.  However, McCaffrey was easily Cam Newton's lone reliable target, setting a new career-high with his 14 grabs.  He was targeted on 33% of Newton's passes.  Still, a touchdown would have been nice, but McCaffrey did well for his PPR owners in a predictable spot against the Deion Jones-less Falcons.  McCaffrey will be an RB1 next week in Cincinnati.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed eight times for 37 yards and caught 14-of-15 targets for 102 yards in the Panthers' 31-24, Week 2 loss to the Falcons.

impact: The Panthers' coaching staff must have spotted something it liked about attacking Cincinnati's interior defense on tape, because they did it over and over and over again with such dominance McCaffrey more than doubled his previous single-game high for rushing yards.  As Carolina needed only 15 pass completions to win, McCaffrey's receiving usage took a corresponding hit.  He'll rest his legs during the Panthers' Week 4 bye.  McCaffrey's weekly touch counts three games in are 16 > 22 > 30.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 28 times for 184 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for ten yards in the Panthers' Week 3 win over the Bengals.

impact: McCaffrey's usage in the passing game, or lack thereof, was somewhat of a disappointment, though he salvaged the afternoon for fantasy owners by scoring a late touchdown on a screen from Cam Newton. The 18-yard score from Newton marked C-Mac's first end-zone since Week 15 of last season. McCaffrey dominated the backfield work as usual, out-touching veteran bruiser C.J. Anderson by an enormous 22-4 margin. The talented 22-year-old will remain an upper-echelon fantasy option when he takes the field next week at Washington.
report: Christian McCaffrey earned 58 yards on 17 carries while also securing five targets for 35 yards and a touchdown on six targets Sunday in Carolina’s Week 5 win over the Giants.

impact: McCaffrey was finding nice holes on the ground in the early going, but the Panthers quickly abandoned the run after a pair of D.J. Moore turnovers had them playing from behind. McCaffrey probably should have had a few more catches, but Cam Newton didn't see him on a few wide-open looks. McCaffrey will enter next week's game with the Eagles averaging 117 yards from scrimmage.
report: Christian McCaffrey caught 7-of-8 targets for 46 yards in the Panthers' Week 6 loss to the Redskins, adding eight carries for 20 additional yards.

impact: McCaffrey’s touches were a season low because the Panthers fell behind 17-0 at the half. CMC did play a big role in the comeback victory on a 22-yard reception down the left sideline, but he was tackled inside the five-yard line before Greg Olsen’s game winner. McCaffrey was essentially vultured by Curtis Samuel from 14 yards out on an end-around earlier in the game where McCaffrey operated as a decoy. Even against a tough Ravens defense in Week 8, McCaffrey’s passing-game involvement will keep him in the low-end RB1 hunt.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed seven times for 29 yards and caught 6-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Panthers' Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: The yards are nothing to write home about, but McCaffrey scored for the first time since Week 5, with both coming in the red zone.  His first was an 11-yard run where McCaffrey was nearly bottled up in the backfield for a loss.  His second touchdown was a fluke pass intended for Devin Funchess at the goal line that Eric Weddle batted into the air before McCaffrey skied in to catch it in the end zone.  McCaffrey will be an RB1 next week at home against the Bucs.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 14 times for 45 yards and one touchdown and caught 4-of-6 targets for 11 yards in the Panthers' Week 8 win over the Ravens.

impact: McCaffrey's 157 yards from scrimmage were his second most of the season. The second-year pro had little trouble finding huge cushions against the Bucs' pathetic defense, notching gains of 32, 35, 14 and 20 yards. He also notched three carries inside the Bucs' five-yard line, converting two of them for scores. It was what McCaffrey should have done against the Bucs' embarrassingly-bad defense. The sledding will be tougher against the Steelers on Thursday Night Football in Week 10.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 17 times for 79 yards and two touchdowns in the Panthers' Week 9 win over the Bucs, adding five receptions for 78 additional yards.

impact: McCaffrey rolled up 60 yards on the Panthers' opening drive, capping it off with a silky smooth 20-yard touchdown reception. His 25-yarder from Cam Newton one quarter later was almost as pretty. McCaffrey's third score was a fantasy gift, as he punched in a goal line carry with the Panthers losing 52-14 late in the fourth quarter. The No. 8 overall pick of last year's draft now has seven touchdowns over his past three games. That's Todd Gurley/Kareem Hunt-level production. For Week 11, CMC gets a Lions run defense that's been soft.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 14 times for 77 yards and a touchdown in the Panthers' Week 10 loss to the Steelers, adding five receptions for 61 yards and two additional scores.

impact: McCaffrey finished the game with 110 total yards, but it was a bit of a quiet day for the star back. He did not make many impact plays outside of a 34-yard catch in the fourth quarter, and he was shockingly easy to tackle on several of his opportunities in the open field. His fantasy day could have been much better, but he was tackled inside the five on two different drives. McCaffrey will remain a solid RB1 next week against the Seahawks.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 13 times for 53 yards and hauled in 6-of-8 targets for 57 yards in the Panthers' Week 11 loss to the Lions.

impact: The Panthers struggled in the red zone on Sunday, which ultimately cost them the game, but they marched up and down the field in part because of McCaffrey’s work in the passing game. He caught eight of Cam Newton’s 14 passes in the first half for 79 yards, and he just kept on eating in the second half. After Seattle took the lead, McCaffrey helped set up his own one-yard touchdown run with a 23-yard catch on a screen pass, a play which put him over 100 yards through the air. He made it happen on the ground the next drive, bursting through a hole for 59 yards on the opening play. He almost lost a fumble at the goal line a couple plays later, but he finished off the series with a two-yard touchdown catch. This is the first 100/100 game of McCaffrey's career, and he is just the 31st player in NFL history to manage the feat. McCaffrey will be a high-end RB1 next week against the Bucs.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 17 times for 125 yards and a touchdown and hauled in all 11 of his targets for 112 yards and another score in the Panthers' Week 12 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: McCaffrey was Carolina's entire offense with Greg Olsen leaving early and Devin Funchess at less than 100 percent. He set up his TD catch after a 53-yard run that put the Panthers inside the red-zone. McCaffrey has been locked in down the stretch and leads the league with 10 touchdowns over the last six weeks. He'll remain a high-end RB1 for Week 13 against the Browns.
report: Christian McCaffrey had 10 carries for 106 yards and caught 9-of-10 targets for 55 yards and a touchdown in Week 13 against the Bucs.

impact: Newton shook off a dreadful first half to complete 21-of-30 passes for 245 yards and two touchdowns in the final two quarters, finding Devin Funchess for an 18-yard score and Greg Olsen for the game winner at the goal line as Carolina overcame a 17-0 deficit for the 21-17 victory.  Newton's second-half performance was truly heroic, particularly a fourth-down completion to Torrey Smith for 35 yards.  Newton gets a tougher Week 8 matchup against Baltimore, but he has been a high-floor, high-ceiling fantasy quarterback all year regardless of opponents.
report: Cam Newton completed 25-of-39 passes for 269 yards and two touchdowns and rushed seven times for 49 yards in the Panthers' Week 7 upset win over Philadelphia.

impact: It's his right (throwing) shoulder.  Coach Ron Rivera said Newton is "sore" and a little "tired" after last week's fourth-quarter comeback.  It doesn't sound serious.  We'd expect Cam out there against the Ravens this week.
report: Cam Newton (shoulder) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: There was some concern after beat reporters noticed Newton wasn't throwing during the open portion of Thursday's practice, though apparently he got some reps in once the media left. OC Norv Turner admitted that Cam is dealing with "soreness" in his throwing shoulder but expects him to be "fine" for Sunday's matchup with Baltimore. Newton is No. 10 in our Week 8 quarterback rankings.
report: Cam Newton (shoulder) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Newton has seen limited practice reps this week while working through a sore shoulder but he'll be out there when it matters on Sunday. It's not an ideal matchup for Cam, though the former MVP will still be a QB1 consideration in all formats.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera said there's "no doubt" Cam Newton (shoulder) will play against the Ravens in Week 8.

impact: Newton was limited for the third consecutive practice on Friday, but his activity was reportedly scaled back for "maintenance" reasons to be sure he's healthy come Sunday. Coach Ron Rivera said "there is no doubt" Newton suits up against the Ravens. He's a QB1 for his rushing floor alone despite playing in an unfavorable matchup in Week 8.
report: Cam Newton (shoulder) wasn't listed on Carolina's Week 8 injury report against the Ravens.

impact: His 52 rushing yards led the team.  Newton was cooking with rookie D.J. Moore in the first half, hooking up with the first-round pick five times for 90 yards, including a 33-yard seam shot to set up an eventual Christian McCaffrey touchdown catch from six yards out on a ball intended for Devin Funchess at the goal line that was batted into the air.  Newton was lucky to not be picked on the play.  His other score went to Greg Olsen from 11 yards away.  Newton has multiple touchdown passes in six straight games, and he gets the brutal Bucs' defense at home in Week 9.
report: Cam Newton completed 21-of-29 passes for 219 yards and two touchdowns in the Panthers' 36-21, Week 8 win over the Ravens, adding 52 rushing and a third touchdown on 10 attempts.

impact: This is Cam's weekly routine. He'll be ready to go Sunday against Tampa Bay. Consider him a locked-in QB1 for that matchup.
report: Cam Newton (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Newton has not been throwing early in the week, and he opted out of a Hail Mary before halftime against the Ravens. That has raised concerns about his previously injured shoulder, but the Panthers and Newton have downplayed the issue, calling his practice participation the "new normal." Newton did not look any worse for wear last week against a tough Ravens defense, and he gets a golden matchup with the Bucs this Sunday. He will be a high-end QB1 in that spot.
report: Cam Newton said his surgically-repaired shoulder "feels great."

impact: Newton is in the mix for No. 1 overall status in the Week 9 rankings against the Bucs' league-worst defense.
report: Cam Newton (shoulder) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: A dominant real-life performance did not quite translate to fantasy as Newton lost yardage to Curtis Samuel and D.J. Moore trick/motion plays. The Panthers were also content to let Christian McCaffrey do work at the goal line. Newton did have a rushing score, but it got called back by an illegal motion penalty. Cooking with gas for a while now, Newton gets the Steelers' improving defense on Thursday Night Football for Week 10.
report: Cam Newton completed 19-of-25 passes for 247 yards and two touchdowns in the Panthers' 42-28, Week 9 win over the Bucs, adding 10 carries for 34 additional yards.

impact: Newton rushed just twice for 10 yards. The Panthers marched down the field on their opening drive for a 7-0 lead, but that would prove to be the highlight of the night for Newton and company. The Steelers immediately tied the game with a 75-yard JuJu Smith-Schuster score and Newton answered with one of the worst throws of his career. Trying to avoid a safety on a botched screen, Newton blindly heaved what turned into a pick six to ILB Vince Williams. Newton later never felt T.J. Watt's pressure on what was nearly a lost fumble. Newton was shaken up after the monster hit but stayed in the game. He has 10 days to get healthy for a Week 11 matchup with the Lions.
report: Cam Newton completed 23-of-29 passes for 193 yards, two touchdowns and an interception in the Panthers' 52-21, Week 10 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Cam easily led the Panthers down the field on the opening drive, completing 5-of-6 passes for 80 yards and a score, but it was mostly a struggle for the rest of the first half. Aside from an 82-yard connection with D.J. Moore in which the rookie did most of the work, Newton did not have much more success in the third quarter, and he suffered an injury scare when a couple defenders fell on the back of his leg. The injury seemed to spark him. He led a quick touchdown drive to tie the game the next series. Following a Lions touchdown, he marched the Panthers back down the field for another score in the closing moments. Instead of kicking the possible game-tying extra point, the Panthers put the ball in Newton's hands for the possible win. It ended up being a bad decision. Despite a lifetime in the pocket, Newton overthrew an open receiver in the end zone. It is a disappointing loss, but Newton once again had a nice fantasy day. He will be a locked-in QB1 next week against the Seahawks.
report: Cam Newton completed 25-of-37 passes for 357 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Panthers' Week 11 loss to the Lions.

impact: Newton started this game hot, completing all 14 of his first-half passes, but the Panthers consistently left points on the board in the red zone. Newton was stuffed on fourth down on the opening drive, and another good drive bogged down in the red zone later in the first quarter. The Panthers finally found the end zone when Newton hit Curtis Samuel with a seven-yard strike midway through the second quarter, but it was not the start of a trend. Carolina had to settle for a field goal at the end of the first half, and Newton threw an interception on the first drive of the second half. The Panthers scored touchdowns on back-to-back drives from there, but those missed opportunities along with a missed field goal allowed the Seahawks to steal the win. Coming off two games they should not have lost, Newton will try to get things back on track in a great matchup against the Bucs next week.
report: Cam Newton completed 25-of-30 passes for 256 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Panthers' Week 12 loss to the Seahawks, adding 63 yards on the ground.

impact: Newton got off to a fast start with a first quarter touchdown to Christian McCaffrey.  He went off the rails in the second half, stalling the Panthers' drives with interceptions. It's a letdown against a Bucs secondary that was playing without their top three corners, though Newton salvaged his fantasy day with 33 rushing yards and a late TD to Devin Funchess. Newton will try to rebound with a Week 14 matchup against the Browns.
report: Cam Newton completed 28-of-41 passes for 300 yards with two touchdowns and four interceptions in the Panthers' Week 13 loss to the Bucs.

impact: Newton was pulled for the final play of last week's game in favor of Taylor Heinicke due to his shoulder injury. He isn't in danger of sitting, but he's likely not going to be 100 percent. Newton is a low-end QB1 for a matchup with the Browns.
report: Cam Newton (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He added two catches for 22 yards on six targets. The rookie had absolutely nowhere to run for most of this game, gaining just 37 yards on his first 16 carries. He showed why he was the No. 2 overall pick on the 17th. He broke a tackle in the hole, broke another to bounce it outside, beat everyone to the corner, and then sprinted down the sideline for a 68-yard touchdown. Barkley could have some frustrating outings behind a questionable offensive line, but he has the ability to change a game in one play. He will hopefully be better utilized in the passing game next week – he did get going a bit in the screen game in the second half after not being targeted in the first – but he will be a solid RB1 against the Cowboys regardless.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 18 times for 106 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Barkley couldn't get anything going with the Giants getting dominated up front. His pass game usage was encouraging after getting held to two catches last week, but it was a product of bad offensive line play. Barkley has lived up to his draft status, going over 100 total yards in his first two games. He's a mid-range RB1 for a matchup against a solid Houston run defense in Week 3.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 11 times for 28 yards and caught 14-of-16 targets for 80 yards in the Giants' Week 2 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Barkley remained the offensive centerpiece, but didn't get his first catch until the third quarter. He made one of his signature cutbacks behind the line before stiff-arming his way into the end-zone on his 15-yard touchdown. Barkley missed a few snaps with a knee bruise, but it's a non-issue for his Week 4 status. Barkley now has over 100 total yards in all three games this season. He's a locked-in RB1 for a matchup with the Saints.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 17 times for 82 yards and a touchdown and caught five passes for 35 yards in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: Barkley added 56 yards receiving while catching 6-of-8 targets.  Barkley went to the half with 28 yards on six touches but was able to find the end zone late.  It's going to be a struggle every week behind this horrendous offensive line, but Barkley is churning out enough numbers as a locked-in RB1.  Things won't be any easier next week on the road against the Panthers.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 10 times for 44 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' 33-18, Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: The Giants' sluggish start continued with a heart-breaking, walk-off loss to Carolina in Week 5, but Barkley shouldn't be to blame. The second overall pick was his usual, productive self on Sunday, topping 100 yards from scrimmage for the fifth time in five games. Saquon delivered his first touchdown of the afternoon on a 57-yard pass from Odell Beckham, of all people. It was the easiest touchdown he'll ever score as there was nobody within 20 yards of him. Barkley found pay-dirt again in the fourth quarter, taking a 15-yard screen to the house to give New York a one-point lead with 1:08 remaining. The rookie came down awkwardly after hurdling a defender at the goal line but didn't seem to be showing any ill effects on the sideline. Barkley will remain in play as an RB1 when the Giants host Philadelphia on Thursday night.
report: Saquon Barkley went for 48 yards on 15 carries while adding four catches for 81 yards and two touchdowns on four targets Sunday in the Giants’ Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: At the very end of last week's game, Barkley dove into the end zone after hurdling a defender which resulted in an awkward landing. The rookie was slow to get up because of a "random back spasm." ESPN NFL Nation's Jordan Raanan said there is nothing more to it, so Barkley owners can feel comfortable plugging him in as a RB1 against the Eagles on Thursday night.
report: Saquon Barkley did not need any special treatment this week after taking an awkward fall at the end of the Giants' Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: On a dismal night for the G-Men, Barkley was a bright spot, putting defenders on skates and routinely looking cannon shot as he hit the hole or found the edge. His score was a 50-yarder where he made a nimble cutback before exploding through the hole untouched. He fell just one yard shy of becoming the first Giants back to tally both 100 yards rushing and receiving in a game. Barkley has a gear few NFL players have, especially running backs. The Giants' line and passing game struggles haven't prevented Barkley from clearing 100 yards from scrimmage in each of his first six games. He's forcing himself into weekly top-three consideration. The burnable Falcons are on deck for Week 7.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 13 times for 130 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' Week 6 loss to the Eagles, adding nine receptions for 99 additional yards.

impact: It's the first time this season Barkley has been held to fewer than 100 yards from scrimmage, but he made up for it with a boat load of catches, the short touchdown, and a two-point conversion at the end of the game.  Barkley just did not have much room to work with on the ground behind this pitiful offensive line and against a defense that got DT Grady Jarrett back from injury.  Barkley still remains an elite RB1 no matter the matchup and will get the Redskins in Week 8.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 14 times for 43 yards and one touchdown and caught 9-of-10 targets for 51 yards in the Giants' 23-20, Week 7 loss to the Falcons on Monday night.

impact: Washington entered this game playing elite run defense, and that remained the case as Barkley was bottled up on the ground.  He survived with 111 total yards and scored over 20 points in PPR leagues with heavy receiving involvement.  Barkley now gets to rest his rookie legs during New York's Week 9 bye.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 13 times for 38 yards and caught 9-of-10 targets for 73 yards in the Giants' Week 8 loss to Washington.

impact: It's Barkley's eighth 100-yard game in nine contests as a pro.  There wasn't much running room to be found, and Barkley's biggest play was a 23-yard catch across the middle on a third down on the final game-winning drive with the Giants still down 23-20.  Bigger days are ahead obviously, and the Giants will head home on a short week to face the Bucs' bottom-barrel defense in Week 11.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 20 times for 67 yards and caught 4-of-5 targets for 33 yards in the Giants' Week 10 win over the 49ers.

impact: Even Barkley's lack of involvement in the passing game can't be knocked since one of his three targets on the day resulted in a touchdown. A big outing was expected given that the Bucs were without stud defenders Kwon Alexander (torn ACL), Vinny Curry (ankle), and Lavonte David (knee), but Barkley exceeded all expectations in hitting season-high marks in carries, rushing yards, and touchdowns. The generational talent is now remarkably on pace for 253/1,164/11 on the ground and 102/864/5 receiving. He's obviously a matchup-proof commodity that should close the year in elite company.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 27 times for a season-high 142 yards and two touchdowns, tacking on another receiving touchdown for good measure in the Giants' Week 11 victory over the Bucs.

impact: Barkley did all of his damage in the first half, curiously receiving just four carries and five touches total after the break.  He wasn't injured, but the Giants sat him out the second series of the third quarter, and the offense never moved the ball the rest of the way.  Barkley started out hot with a 13-yard touchdown catch on a screen before then breaking off a 51-yard rushing score late in the second quarter to stake the G-Men to a 19-3 lead they'd eventually blow.  The 13 carries were Barkley's fewest since Week 4.  He'll get a tough draw against the Bears next week.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 13 times for 101 yards and one touchdown and caught 7-of-8 targets for 41 yards and an additional touchdown in the Giants' 25-22, Week 12 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Barkley got off to an extremely slow start with the Bears defense keying on him and the Giants going three-and-out on four of their first five possessions with the other one ending in an interception.  Barkley, however, was able to break off a 22-yard run on 3rd-and-23 at the end of the half to set up a 57-yard field goal.  He later started OT with a 29-yarder to set up the eventual winning kick.  Barkley did leave the game at one point with a shoulder injury but later returned.  He may miss some practice reps ahead of next week at the Redskins.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 24 times for 126 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 21 yards in the Giants' Week 13 overtime win over the Bears.

impact: There was a brief moment Sunday where Barkley appeared to be seriously hurt, but he quickly shook it off. Barkley could miss some practice reps this week, but he will be good to go versus the Redskins for the first week of the fantasy playoffs.
report: Speaking Monday, Saquon Barkley said his shoulder felt "fine."

impact: With Chris Carson healthy and Mike Davis serving as the No. 2, Penny's only involvement against the Rams was on one special teams play. Penny can safely be dropped in redraft formats.
report: Rashaad Penny did not play a snap on offense in Week 5.

impact: This comes after Penny, the Seahawks' first-round pick in April's draft, didn't play a single offensive snap in Week 5. "He’s looking for his opportunities and it’s going to come," said Schottenheimer "It’s about the little details for him and when you’re not getting the reps or you’re not playing in the game, can you stay in the game focused?" Penny missed a chunk of training camp due to a broken finger, which likely made his learning curve even steeper. With Chris Carson and Mike Davis operating as the Seahawks' main backs, Penny can be safely ignored in redraft leagues.
report: Seahawks OC Brian Schottenheimer said the team isn't going to "force" Rashaad Penny into the team's running back rotation.

impact: Penny was used early in the game on a 24-yard reception, although the majority of his carries came as the game got out of hand.  The Seahawks wound up smashing Oakland 27-3.  Penny's role remains uncertain entering Seattle's Week 7 bye, but he is worth rostering in 14- and 16-team leagues.  Chris Carson had 14 touches in Sunday's victory.  Mike Davis surprisingly only logged seven.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed nine times for 43 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for 27 yards in the Seahawks' Week 6 win over the Raiders.

impact: Penny missed time with a broken finger over the summer and may have aggravated it. The 22-year-old is third in Seattle's backfield pecking order behind Chris Carson and Mike Davis.
report: Rashaad Penny (finger) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Penny's zero-touch day was somewhat surprising one week after he got the ball 11 times against the Raiders. Chris Carson had 27 handles in Detroit, while Mike Davis had 11. Penny will be off the radar for Week 9 against the Chargers.
report: Rashaad Penny did not touch the ball on offense in Seattle's Week 8 win over the Lions.

impact: It is the second time in three games Penny has failed to see the field on offense -- he did get two snaps on special teams. Penny saw 11 touches in the blowout win before the bye, but almost all of those came on the final drive deep into garbage time. He is well behind both Chris Carson and Mike Davis in the pecking order.
report: Rashaad Penny did not play an offensive snap Week 8 against the Lions.

impact: Penny surprisingly touched the ball on the Seahawks' opening drive. More surprisingly, he was barely involved in the second half even though Chris Carson was missing with a thigh injury. It was all No. 2 Mike Davis for the Seahawks. If Carson cannot get cleared for Week 10 against the Rams, Penny would be a risky FLEX with a little bit of upside for what could be a high-scoring affair.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed four times for 11 yards in the Seahawks' Week 9 loss to the Chargers, adding three receptions for 13 additional yards.

impact: Penny was not targeted in the passing game, but he ended up out-carrying and out-gaining Mike Davis in Chris Carson's absence even though Davis won the touch battle (15-12). A struggler for much of the season, Penny looked like a player with a different gear today. His touchdown was an explosive 18-yarder on a read option. With the Seahawks playing on Thursday Night Football in Week 11, Penny will have major FLEX upside if Carson can't get cleared to face the Packers.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed 12 times for 108 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 10 loss to the Rams.

impact: Penny exploded for 108 yards and a touchdown on just 12 carries against the Rams after amassing 146 yards on the first 42 carries of his career. "Today he busted out," Carroll said. "I thought today he needed it so badly. He knows he’s a great player. He just hasn’t been able to demonstrate it." Penny had been firmly behind both Chris Carson and Mike Davis on the depth chart, but this performance will almost certainly lead to more work for the first rounder. Penny should be added in all formats to see how things shake out.
report: Talking about Rashaad Penny's breakout performance on Sunday, Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said, "He looked just like the guy we thought he would look like when we drafted him."

impact: "He’s still a young player," Schottenheimer said. "He still has those times in the meetings where it’s like, Rashaad, are you listening? The season is long. I think it was really good for his confidence to go out there and do what he did." Penny went off for 108 yards and a touchdown on the Rams with Chris Carson sidelined, but he's still behind Carson for lead duties. Penny's Week 10 breakout may be enough to move him ahead of Mike Davis as the No. 2 back.
report: Seahawks OC Brian Schottenheimer said Rashaad Penny is still struggling to pick up the offense.

impact: "When everybody’s healthy, not everybody’s going to get the ball," Carroll said. "That’s just the way it goes. Chris [Carson] is going to be healthy this week." This throws shade on Penny forcing his way into a timeshare. Penny's blowup Week 10 has earned him a few more reps after getting buried the last few games, but this is still Carson's backfield.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll suggested Rashaad Penny may not have much of a Week 11 role.

impact: 30 of Penny's yards came on a jaw-dropping first quarter carry when he ran into a dead end on the right side of the line of scrimmage before completely reversing fields to make something out of nothing. Unfortunately, he tweaked his ankle on the play. Penny returned to play through a "questionable" tag but never looked quite the same. Chris Carson once again operated as the Seahawks' clear-cut feature back. Penny will be a risky FLEX for Week 12 against the Panthers.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed eight times for 46 yards in the Seahawks' Week 11 win over the Packers.

impact: With Chris Carson working as the clear lead back, Penny did not get many opportunities in this one. He finished the first half with just two carries for three yards, and he did even worse after the break. With Carson working as the clear lead back, Penny is just a handcuff at this point.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed four times for four yards in the Seahawks' Week 12 win over the Panthers.

impact: "I expect that [Penny] will play well this weekend," Schottenheimer said. "Expect that we need to get the running game back going again and I think he’ll be a big part of that." This is purely speculative coach-speak as Penny has been an afterthought since Chris Carson returned from injury two weeks ago. During that stint, Carson has played 47% of snaps and out-touched Penny 35-12. Best case scenario is that the rookie steals reps from Mike Davis, who's received 10 touches on 27 total snaps since Week 11. Carson is clearly the back to roll out as a confident RB2 against the Niners on Sunday.
report: Seahawks OC Brian Schottenheimer expects Rashaad Penny to have a "bigger role" in Week 13 against the 49ers.

impact: Penny still worked as the clear No. 2 to Chris Carson for most of this game, but he had several explosive runs including a 20-yard touchdown on the opening play of the second half – Tyler Lockett set up the offense with a long kickoff return. It is notable, however, that Carson left this game in the fourth quarter with a finger injury. Coach Pete Carroll said Carson should be fine, but if he is forced to miss time, Penny will be on the RB2 map.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed seven times for 65 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 13 win over the 49ers.

impact: Drawing the start for the injured Chris Carson, Davis dominated the Seattle backfield on Sunday, handling 25-of-34 backfield touches. Davis gave Seattle the lead with a 20-yard touchdown in the 1st quarter and then scored their second and final touchdown on a 1-yard plunge in the 3rd quarter. Davis' fantasy viability will be contingent on the availability of Carson in Week against the Rams.
report: Mike Davis rushed 21 times for 101 yards and two touchdowns while catching four passes for 23 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: That "rotation" figures to feature Davis and Chris Carson, with a sprinkling of Rashaad Penny, who Carroll hinted will focus on kick return duties now with Davis and Carson outplaying him.  This is a backfield to totally avoid until we get some clarity on the situation when everyone is healthy.  If one of Carson or Davis ever sits, the other would be an RB2.  Davis went 21-101-2 in Week 4.
report: Coach Pete Carroll said Mike Davis earned a spot in the Seahawks' running back "rotation" moving forward.

impact: Davis ceded the starting job and many of the early carries to Chris Carson, but his role in the offense grew as the game went along. Most importantly, he received the most valuable carry of the afternoon. After Carson drove the offense down the field with some big runs, Davis took over, converted a third-and-two, and then scored from six yards out on the next play. Davis looks like he is the No. 2 option in the backfield -- Carson ended with 20 touches to 14 for Davis -- but the Seahawks' running game has been good enough to support multiple fantasy players the last several weeks. His workload could prove shaky, but Davis will be worth a look in FLEX spots next week against the Raiders in London.
report: Mike Davis rushed 12 times for 68 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: It was surprising to see Davis handle only seven touches while Rashaad Penny came back to life for 11, although the blowout nature of the game skewed usage a bit, and it was an opportunity for the Seahawks' coaching staff to give Penny more chances.  Davis is worth rostering as an RB4/5, but he won't become a consistent flex option barring injury to Carson and/or Penny.
report: Mike Davis rushed six times for 21 yards and caught 1-of-3 targets for five yards in Seattle's Week 6 London win over Oakland.

impact: Davis re-established himself as the Seahawks' clear No. 2 back on an afternoon where Rashaad Penny did not touch the ball on offense. He still got out-touched 27-11 by Chris Carson. Davis is seeing a lot of work for a backup running back, but it's still not enough for standalone FLEX value.
report: Mike Davis rushed 10 times for 33 yards in the Seahawks' Week 8 win over the Lions, adding a two-yard reception.

impact: Davis took over as lead back after a thigh issue knocked out Chris Carson in the second quarter. It was all Davis after Carson went down, as he out-touched Rashaad Penny 22-7 on the day. The Seahawks stayed with the run even as they were playing from behind. Davis will need that to remain the case for Week 10 if Carson remains sidelined, as negative game script will be a distinct possibility against the Rams.
report: Mike Davis rushed 15 times for 62 yards in the Seahawks' Week 9 loss to the Chargers, adding seven receptions for 45 additional yards.

impact: Davis got the start in Chris Carson's absence, ripping a 12-yard gain on the Seahawks' first play from scrimmage. He quickly gave way to a committee with Rashaad Penny, however, and the rookie back stole the show with explosive running. Davis was out-carried 12-11, though he narrowly won the touch battle 15-12. If Carson can't get cleared to face the Packers for Thursday Night Football, Davis will be an uncertain FLEX option with Penny showing so well in Los Angeles.
report: Mike Davis rushed 11 times for 58 yards in the Seahawks' Week 10 loss to the Rams, adding four receptions for 22 additional yards and a touchdown.

impact: Playing primarily third downs, Davis' six touches were third in the Seahawks' backfield behind Chris Carson and Rashaad Penny. Carson returned from his thigh/hip injuries to operate as the clear lead back, with Penny offering an explosive change of pace. Davis has shown well when give the opportunity this season, but he can't be trusted as a FLEX option when both Carson and Penny are healthy.
report: Mike Davis rushed four times for 26 yards in the Seahawks' Week 11 win over the Packers, adding two receptions for 24 additional yards.

impact: He got nicked up against the Packers last week, though the injury isn't thought to be serious. Even if Davis suits up Sunday at Carolina, he'll just be fighting for scraps behind second-year bell-cow Chris Carson.
report: Mike Davis (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Davis continued to work as the passing-down option in this one, but he was actually out-targeted 2-to-1 by Chris Carson. With Rashaad Penny also getting touches, Davis can be left on the wire.
report: Mike Davis rushed four times for 14 yards in the Seahawks' Week 12 win over the Panthers.

impact: Carson is believed to be battling a new thigh issue after having his leg wrapped following his exit from Sunday's loss to the Chargers.  He was previously said to have a hip or groin problem.  Either way, it sounds like Carson will be looking at a questionable tag for Week 10 against the Rams in L.A.
report: Coach Pete Carroll said Chris Carson (thigh, hip) is "sore" and won't "do much" at practice this week.

impact: This was fully expected. The Seahawks don't plan to give Carson many practice reps this week. Carson is trending toward another game-time decision for Week 10.
report: Chris Carson (thigh, hip) won't practice Wednesday.

impact: "We’re trying to figure out how to manage their way through it and then find out nearer to game time if they can play for us, so we’re still waiting and seeing," coach Pete Carroll said on Seattle's three iffy players. Mike Davis would undoubtedly work as the team's primary back if Carson is ruled out. With this game kicking off late in the afternoon, owners need be on standby with Davis ready to roll in the event Carson is officially declared inactive close to kick-off.
report: Chris Carson (questionable, hip) is a game-time decision for Week 10 against the Rams.

impact: The Seahawks held Carson out of practice this week. He's going to be another game-time decision after playing through his questionable tag in Week 9. Carson's status should be known early Sunday.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Chris Carson (questionable, hip) "has been getting better" throughout the week.

impact: The Seahawks plan to take Carson's status into pre-game warmups, but he's on the wrong side of questionable after not practicing all week. Carson has been battling setbacks with his hip injury all season. Seattle will go with Mike Davis as their lead back if Carson sits.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Seahawks aren't expecting Chris Carson (questionable, hip) to play in Week 10 against the Rams.

impact: Mike Davis will carry the load, with Rashaad Penny and C.J. Prosise changing the pace. Davis can be safely fired up as an RB2. Inactive for the Seahawks are CB Neiko Thorpe, CB Kalan Reed, C Joey Hunt, OG D.J. Fluker, DT Nazair Jones and DE Branden Jackson.
report: Chris Carson (hip) is officially inactive for Week 10 against the Rams.

impact: Thus, Seattle plans on having Carson, Mike Davis, and Rashaad Penny ready to roll against Green Bay, creating a muddy backfield picture.  Carroll was noncommittal on each back's role, emphasizing that all three runners can't get the ball frequently in the same game when everyone is available.  Carson, Davis, and Penny will all be high-risk flex options in Thursday night's game.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Monday that Chris Carson (hip) will play on Thursday Night Football against Green Bay.
