impact: The starting role was never in doubt, but there's some uncertainity over Carson's workload after sitting out Week 10. Carson was a bellcow before his injury, getting 20-plus touches in three of the six games he's stayed healthy for. Mike Davis and Rashaad Penny may be more involved on a short week, but it's not a huge concern for Carson's carries.
report: Seahawks OC Brian Schottenheimer confirmed Chris Carson (hip) will start Week 11 against the Packers.

impact: This was expected after Carson practiced fully. Carson will start, but there's some concern over his workload coming off injury on a short week. He's a high-upside RB2/FLEX against a Packers defense that allows 121 rush yards per game.
report: Chris Carson (hip) was removed from the Week 11 injury report.

impact: Carson was removed from the injury report on Thursday and will start. It's anyone's guess as to how Rashaad Penny and Mike Davis will mix in. Inactive for the Seahawks are LB K.J. Wright, RB C.J. Prosise, CB Neiko Thorpe, G/C Ethan Pocic, S Delano Hill, DE Dion Jordan and DT Poona Ford.
report: Chris Carson (hip) is active for Week 11 against the Packers.

impact: Carson's night got off to the worst possible start after he lost a fumble at the Seahawks' own 29-yard on the first play scrimmage. Thankfully for fantasy owners, coach Pete Carroll stuck with him and he delivered with another solid performance. Carson ceded "only" 14 combined touches to Rashaad Penny and Mike Davis. That would be a lot in a normal offense, but not the Seahawks' run-heavy attack. Operating as a legitimate RB2, Carson has 10 days to rest up for the Panthers in Week 12.
report: Chris Carson rushed 17 times for 83 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 11 win over the Packers.

impact: Carson opened Seattle’s second drive with a 16-yard run, but he was mostly bottled up early in this one. He also fumbled in the second quarter, but the ball ended up going out of bounds. It was a great break for Carson. Following that fumble, Russell Wilson marched the offense right down the field, and Carson capped the long drive with a one-yard score. He opened the second half with a 15-yard run in which he went flipping through the air after trying to hurdle the tackler, eventually landing on his feet and gaining a couple more yards, and opened the next drive with a 12-yard run. He was mostly bottled up from there, but Carson once again dominated the backfield work. The workhorse on a run-first offense, Carson will be a solid RB2 next week against the 49ers.
report: Chris Carson rushed 16 times for 55 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 12 win over the Panthers.

impact: Carson appeared to suffer the injury at the end of a 23-yard run in the fourth quarter. He was taken to the locker room for X-rays. Officially questionable, it would be surprising if Carson returns to the blowout. Carson racked up 108 total yards before exiting, but he would have had a much nicer fantasy day if he could have converted one of his goal-line attempts.
report: Chris Carson exited Week 13 against the 49ers with a finger injury.

impact: Carson never returned to the game after leaving in the fourth quarter, but the blowout likely had something to do with that. Carroll injury updates cannot be taken as gospel, but the coach said Carson "should be OK." As of now, it looks like Carson will be ready to face the Vikings next Monday night.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Chris Carson suffered a dislocated finger Week 13 against the 49ers.

impact: Carson exited Week 13 with a dislocated finger, but there never appeared to be much concern. "He came out fine in the game other than his finger, and it should be OK," Carroll said. "He should be able to play." Even in a tough matchup, Carson will be a back-end RB2 on Monday night.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll expects Chris Carson (finger) to play this week against the Vikings.

impact: It was a frustrating yet familiar day for Wilson. His offensive line struggled to protect him, and his receivers struggled to get open. Even so, he managed to create several big plays and keep Seattle in the game until the end. Wilson could face a similar script next week against the Bears and Khalil Mack, but he will remain a solid QB1.
report: Russell Wilson completed 19-of-33 passes for 298 yards, three touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: He rushed for just 17 yards and fumbled twice, losing one.  Wilson entered the fourth quarter with 69 passing yards and went into halftime with 68 through the air.  He took six sacks for the second-straight week to open the season and continues to hold onto the ball far too long in an attempt to create offense for a talentless unit that also can't block.  Wilson had far fewer than 200 pass yards before the meaningless final drive with under a minute left where the Bears played no defense, allowing a short Will Dissly touchdown at the end.  Wilson is an incredible quarterback but is being suffocated in Seattle under OC Brian Schottenheimer, playing behind a peewee league offensive line, along with a running game that still does nothing.  Wilson gets the Cowboys at home in Week 3.  Good luck to fantasy owners.  Wilson finished just ahead of Blaine Gabbert and Josh Allen in the Week 2 fantasy standings at quarterback.
report: Russell Wilson completed 22-of-36 passes for 226 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the Seahawks' 24-17, Week 2 loss to the Bears on Monday night.

impact: This injury isn't a concern, but it's another reason to shy away from Wilson in Week 3. Wilson has 524 yards and a 5:3 TD/INT ratio through the first two games.
report: Russell Wilson (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 3 against the Cowboys.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of 10 yards. Playing without top receiver Doug Baldwin for the second straight week, Wilson was a game manager on Sunday, spending most of his afternoon handing off to running back Chris Carson. It was a workmanlike effort for Wilson, though he did supply one big play, uncorking a 52-yard touchdown to Tyler Lockett late in the second quarter. Wilson gets the winless Cardinals on the road in Week 4.
report: Russell Wilson completed 16-of-26 passes for 192 yards and a pair of touchdowns while losing a yard on two carries Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Wilson added 21 yards on four rushes on the ground. Wilson played a clean game, but once again failed to add much fantasy production. He has now finished in the bottom-half of quarterback scoring in three consecutive games since opening the season as QB1 on the road. Wilson will enter Week 2 as a high-QB2 option Week 5 at home against the Rams.
report: Russell Wilson completed 19-of-26 passes for 172 yards with no touchdowns or interceptions in Sundays Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Wilson was also listed in Week 3 with the same injury. It's not a concern to his playing status, but hamstring issues can linger. Wilson has a shy-away matchup with the Rams in Week 5.
report: Russell Wilson (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: The Seahawks continue to lean on the running game, limiting Wilson to just 73 attempts in the last three games, but the quarterback was able to help his fantasy backers out with big plays and touchdowns. Wilson found Tyler Lockett for two long plays including a touchdown, and he hit David Moore for 30-yard and three-yard scores. The three-yarder was vintage as Wilson created time in the backfield and found Moore in the back of the end zone just before going out of bounds. Wilson has a great matchup next week against the Raiders in London, but he will be nothing more than a low-end QB1 because of his attempt concerns.
report: Russell Wilson completed 13-of-21 passes for 198 yards and three touchdowns in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Traditionally known as one of the league's more mobile quarterbacks, Wilson has mostly avoided running the year, logging just 11 carries over his first five games. That will probably remain the case as he continues to work through hamstring issues. Wilson will be a borderline QB1 against the Raiders in Week 6. That game will be played at Wembley Stadium in London.
report: Russell Wilson (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 6 against the Raiders.

impact: Wilson rushed six times for 20 yards, but he looked relatively sluggish on his carries while dealing with a hamstring injury.  The good news is Wilson got it done through the air, and Seattle has a forthcoming Week 7 bye for Wilson to rest his ailing leg.  Even while missing his early-season dual threat due to the hamstring, Wilson has flirted with QB1 production.  It would not be surprising if Wilson delivered one of his trademark second-half explosions.
report: Russell Wilson completed 17-of-23 passes for 222 yards, three touchdowns, and one interception in the Seahawks' Week 6 drubbing of the Raiders.

impact: The Seahawks were decking the Lions with the run and jump balls, so Wilson needed to throw even less than usual. He entered the break 11-of-12 for 151 yards and all three of his scores. It was Wilson's first game with fewer than 20 attempts since Nov. 9, 2014. David Moore owned Teez Tabor's soul, making life easy for his quarterback. Wilson has been providing fantasy owners with 2-3 touchdowns every week, but his lack of volume makes him a risky QB1. Working in his roto favor is what should be a high-scoring game with the Chargers in Week 9.
report: Russell Wilson completed 14-of-17 passes for 248 yards and three touchdowns in the Seahawks' 28-14, Week 8 win over the Lions.

impact: Today was the first time since Week 2 Wilson attempted more than 30 throws. He should have had a third touchdown on the game's final play, but a lightly-tipped ball clanged off David Moore's hands in the end zone. The Seahawks would have still needed a two-point conversion to tie. Wilson was under a ton of pressure in this one and made some highly-questionable decisions in the face of it, none more so than a late dump-off with time ticking away. His interception was also a pick six, his second of 2018 but just the third of his career. Although it won't be the Seahawks' preference, Wilson will undoubtedly blow by 30 attempts again in Week 10 as the Seahawks try to keep up with the Rams. He will be in the QB1 mix.
report: Russell Wilson completed 26-of-39 passes for 235 yards, two touchdowns and one interception in the Seahawks' 25-17, Week 9 loss to the Chargers.

impact: The 92 rushing yards were Wilson's most since Nov. 2014. With the Rams declining to spy, Wilson was tucking and running often in the second half. It nearly propelled the Seahawks to a road upset, but Wilson could not convert a potential game-winning drive. Wilson's lack of passing volume was surprising in a see-saw, back-and-forth game but not in the context of his 2018 usage. This is who the Seahawks are now. Thankfully for fantasy owners, Wilson continues to supply a bonkers touchdown rate. That's not sustainable, of course. The Seahawks host the Packers for Thursday Night Football in Week 11.
report: Russell Wilson completed 17-of-26 passes for 176 yards and three touchdowns in the Seahawks' 36-31, Week 10 loss to the Rams, adding nine carries for 92 additional yards.

impact: Wilson added five carries for 17 additional yards. It never felt like the Seahawks were playing particularly well, but the Packers proved to be even more mistake prone. It was a shaky effort from Wilson, who badly missed a gimme 21-yard touchdown to Doug Baldwin in the first quarter and made some awful decisions — including a Matthew Stafford-style lateral that killed a drive near the end of the first half — with the ball in his hands outside the pocket. Thankfully none of them turned into disasters like his Week 9 pick six against the Chargers. Wilson is oscillating between game manager and playmaker for an offense coach Pete Carroll is obsessed with funneling through the run game. The Seahawks head to Carolina for Week 12.
report: Russell Wilson completed 21-of-31 passes for 225 yards and two touchdowns in the Seahawks' 27-24, Week 11 win over the Packers.

impact: With the running game scuffling early, the Seahawks put the ball in Wilson’s hands on the third drive, and he quickly marched them down the field, although he did miss a wide-open Doug Baldwin in the end zone. Wilson did even better a couple drives later, leading a 75-yard touchdown march in which he accounted for 68 of them. After halftime, Wilson led another 80-yard touchdown drive, 54 of those coming on a long pass to David Moore, which he capped with a 12-yard strike to Tyler Lockett. His best throw of the afternoon was a 35-yard touchdown to Moore on 4th-and-three to tie the game late in the fourth quarter, and he found Lockett for a 43-yard gain to set up the game-winning field goal. Wilson still is not throwing much, but he has multiple touchdowns in all but one game this season. He will be a great option next week against the 49ers.
report: Russell Wilson completed 22-of-31 passes for 339 yards and two touchdowns in the Seahawks' Week 12 win over the Panthers.

impact: Wilson only threw six passes in the first half, but he made them count. The first found a wide open Jaron Brown for a 45-yard gain, and after a lifetime in the pocket, he found Brown again for a four-yard score to end that drive. He followed that up with a 52-yard touchdown to Tyler Lockett on the next drive, and he found Doug Baldwin from one yard out just before halftime. Wilson did not have much more to do in the second half, but he was able to tack on yet another score with an 18-yard strike to Brown in the fourth quarter. Wilson now has multiple touchdowns in all but one game this season and is easily on pace to set a new career-high in touchdowns. He will remain a solid QB1 next week against the Vikings on Monday night.
report: Russell Wilson completed 11-of-17 passes for 185 yards and four touchdowns in the Seahawks' Week 13 win over the 49ers.

impact: Driskel also added nine rushing yards and a touchdown on the ground after taking over for Andy Dalton early in the third quarter. Entering the game down 35-7, Driskel found Cleveland coasting to win, passing for just 5.3 yards per pass attempt despite the lofty volume. Dalton's Week 13 status will surely be up in the air to start Week 13, but Driskel will only be a lower-end QB2 option with no teams on bye if he is forced into a starting job against the Broncos.
report: Jeff Driskel completed 17-of-29 passes for 155 yards with one touchdown in Sunday's Week 12 loss to the Browns.

impact: Lewis reportedly noted there were limits for Mixon due to his conditioning taking a hit during the rehab process. Without backup Giovani Bernard (knee) Sunday, fourth-round rookie Mark Walton could shoulder a few more snaps than initially expected. "I think that was a little shock to [Walton's] system. Since he’s gotten an opportunity to suit up and play he’s really taken advantage," Lewis said. "We have a comfort level with him." Mixon will still undoubtedly out-carry Walton as he did with Bernard behind him in Week 1. Confidently consider him an RB2 against the Fins.
report: Coach Marvin Lewis reportedly "doesn't expect to fully unleash" Joe Mixon in Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: This backs up comments from Marvin Lewis earlier in the week. Mixon doesn't look ready for a full workload after sitting the last two games. This is different from Week 3  when Lewis promised to get Mark Walton involved, as Mixon is coming off surgery and not in great conditioning. Mixon will still see the bulk of carries, but he comes with some Week 5 risk.
report: ESPN's Dianna Russini reports Joe Mixon isn't expected to have an every-down role in Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: Mixon's status was never in doubt, but there's some concern over his workload coming off knee surgery. With Giovani Bernard out, the Bengals plan to get Mark Walton more carries this week. Cincinnati's inactives are WR John Ross, WR Auden Tate, LB Malik Jefferson, OL Billy Price, OL Cedric Ogbuehi, and DT Josh Tupou.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) is active for Week 5 against Miami.

impact: Mixon was held in check on the ground before ripping a 31-yard fourth quarter run. He caught an underthrown red-zone pass from Andy Dalton for the Bengals' only offensive touchdown. Mixon played a near every-down role despite concern over his workload and looked fully healthy. He'll remain an RB2 for Week 6 against the Steelers.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 22 times for 93 yards and caught 3-of-4 passes for 22 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 5 win over the Dolphins.

impact: He nabbed 4-of-7 targets for 20 yards in the pass game.  Mixon was cooking in the first half with 40 yards on five carries but just didn't get enough work.  The Bengals probably should have put the ball in his belly more instead of having Andy Dalton throw it 42 times at a 5.5 YPA clip while facing plenty of pressure.  Mixon did score a late touchdown from four yards out to save his fantasy day.  Mixon and the Bengals will be involved in a potential Week 7 shootout at Kansas City.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 11 times for 64 yards and one touchdown in the Bengals' Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Mixon continued to rarely leave the field with Giovanni Bernard sidelined. He fell victim to gameflow with the Bengals playing from behind but still managed a solid per-carry average. Mixon had some of his better runs called back on penalties. With Bernard likely at least another week away, Mixon is locked into another heavy workload in Week 8 against the Bucs.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 13 times for 50 yards in Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: Mixon's highlight play was a 43-yard run where he basically made every single Bucs defender miss.  Being utilized as a true workhorse under OC Bill Lazor, Mixon has earned every-week RB1 treatment.  He shouldn't lose many touches even with Giovani Bernard (knee) probable to return after the Bengals' Week 9 bye.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 21 times for 123 yards and two touchdowns and caught 3-of-4 targets for 15 yards in the Bengals' Week 8 win over the Bucs.

impact: Mixon started the day hot, touching the ball five times on the opening drive of the game for 42 total yards, then was hardly heard from again. The 13 touches for Mixon were his fewest in a game on the season as the Bengals worked Giovani Bernard back into the lineup and then let the game get completely away from them. Mixon will look for a better day in Week 11, but will run into a tough task on the road in Baltimore.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 11 times for 61 yards while catching two passes for 24 yards in Sunday's Week 10 loss to the Saints.

impact: He was not listed on Wednesday's injury report. Mixon may have aggravated a knee injury he suffered earlier this year. It's too early to speculate on his status for Sunday's game in Baltimore, though late-week additions to the injury report are never a good sign.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) was limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Deep breath.  It sounds like Mixon's limited Thursday and addition to the injury report was more precautionary than anything.  We'll await the Bengals' final injury report, but it appears Mixon will be out there vs. Baltimore.
report: The Cincinnati Enquirer's Paul Dehner reports Joe Mixon (knee) "looks all systems go" at Friday's practice.

impact: Mixon was limited on Thursday but practiced in full Friday and is ready to roll as an RB2 on the road.  It's a tough draw, but Mixon should be the focal point.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) was removed from the Week 11 injury report and will play against the Ravens.

impact: Fantasy owners were lucky to come away with Mixon's goal-line score, set up by his own 28-yard reception on a screen pass.  Because the Bengals' running game was completely bottled up by the Ravens, and Cincinnati unsuccessfully leaned toward the pass with a 37-to-16 pass-to-run ratio.  Mixon will have a stronger outlook as a fringe RB1/2 at home versus the Browns next week.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 12 times for 14 yards and a touchdown and caught 3-of-3 targets for 38 yards in the Bengals' Week 11 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Mixon's 155 yards were his most in a game in three weeks and his seven catches and 66 yards were a season-high. Even trailing by 28 points early, Mixon remained the bellcow, never coming off the field, something he had struggled with in previous Bengals losses. Mixon will enter Week 13 as a lower-end RB1 at home against the Broncos.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 14 times for 89 yards while catching all seven of his targets for 66 yards in Sunday's Week 12 loss to the Browns.

impact: It was an efficient day for Mixon (6.8 YPC), but he was ultimately game-scripted out of play as the Broncos took possession after possession and milked the clock behind Phillip Lindsay's breakout 19/157/2 performance. Unlike previous weeks, though, the second-year pro actually did lose touches down the stretch to Giovani Bernard, who finished tied with Tyler Boyd for the team-lead in targets (8). The Bengals will have to run the ball if they stand any chance at competing with the Chargers next week, keeping Mixon a low-end usage-based RB1 despite Jeff Driskel's shortcomings.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 12 times for 82 yards in the Bengals' Week 13 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It's a new injury for Mixon, so this is something to watch the remainder of the week.  It's possible he was injured in Wednesday's practice.  If Mixon were to miss the Chargers game, Giovani Bernard would be an RB2 play.
report: Joe Mixon (foot) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: The Lions ended Stafford's suffering with 8:15 left in the fourth quarter with the team trailing 48-17.  Stafford did not play well at all, but he didn't get a lot of help, with his offensive line whiffing on blocks, receivers dropping passes, and the running game again doing nothing.  Two of Stafford's picks went to ILB Darron Lee, and one of them was returned for a touchdown.  Stafford put together one impressive drive, marching 80 yards right down the field in 1:50 on four passes on the first drive of the third quarter, finishing it with a 24-yard touchdown to Golden Tate.  Stafford appeared to injure his left knee at one point, limping badly, and then also got the wind knocked out of him.  He missed one play.  Stafford will look to bounce back next week at the 49ers.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 27-of-46 passes for 286 yards, one touchdown, and four interceptions in the Lions' Week 1 loss to the Jets on Monday night.

impact: He injured his shin after colliding with teammate Taylor Decker in Monday night's loss to the Jets. Stafford was noticeably hobbled but kept playing until the fourth quarter when the game was out of hand. The former No. 1 pick hasn't missed a start since 2010. That streak should continue against the Niners in Week 2.
report: Matthew Stafford (shin) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the 49ers.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of 18 yards and also lost a fumble. For Stafford, this was a much better game than his previous outing, a four-interception nightmare against the Jets on Monday Night Football. Though the numbers don’t really reflect it, Stafford still looked a tad off, continually airmailing deep balls downfield including one to a wide-open Marvin Jones that should have gone for an easy touchdown. Stafford did throw a touchdown to Jones later in the game, finding him for a five-yard score with 8:36 remaining in the fourth quarter. Stafford added another touchdown later in the fourth on a 15-yard end-zone heave to tight end Michael Roberts. The Lions made a valiant comeback in the second half but fell just short with Stafford’s fourth-down incompletion sealing the game with 14 seconds remaining. Stafford and the Lions will try to avoid falling to 0-3 next week against New England.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 34-of-53 passes for 347 yards and three touchdowns while adding one rush for eight yards Sunday in the Lions’ Week 2 loss to the 49ers.

impact: Stafford was sharp in this one, completing 12 of his first 13 passes. He played keep-away from the Patriots with clock killing drives. Stafford made a sidearm throw to Kenny Golladay in the red-zone for his first TD before hitting a wide open Marvin Jones from 33 yards out on his second. His only blunder was an interception on the opening drive of the second half. Stafford has rebounded from his rough Week 1 to post consecutive multi-TD games. He'll get a matchup with the Cowboys in Week 4.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 27-of-36 passes for 262 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in Detroit's Week 3 win over the Patriots.

impact: Stafford was dropped three times for a loss of 21 yards. Playing in his hometown of Dallas, the former first overall pick impressed by going over the 300-yard barrier for the second time this season. Stafford made use of all his receivers but had his most success throwing to Golden Tate, who absorbed all eight of his targets for 132 yards and two touchdowns. His second score gave Detroit a one-point lead with a little over two minutes left in the fourth quarter, though the Cowboys wound up winning on a walk-off field goal by Brett Maher. Stafford and the Lions will hope to avoid falling to 1-4 when they face the Packers next week at Ford Field.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 24-of-30 passes for 307 yards and two touchdowns while adding five yards on two carries Sunday in the Lions’ Week 4 loss to Dallas.

impact: Detroit shocked Green Bay and jumped out to a big 24-0 halftime lead, so Stafford didn't have to do much of anything in the second half despite the Packers threatening a comeback before losing by eight.  Stafford threw just 11 second-half passes and watched LeGarrette Blount score a pair of short touchdowns before the break.  Kenny Golladay also had a 47-yard touchdown called back on a penalty, while Marvin Jones was unable to complete a diving catch on a 42-yard score.  The day could have been a lot bigger for Stafford.  The Lions are now on their bye week.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 14-of-26 passes for 183 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: The Dolphins' secondary erased Stafford's elite receiver trio, but he compensated in fantasy by finding TE Michael Roberts for a pair of scores. The Lions rode their running game. No pass catcher drew more than six targets or posted more than 48 yards. Having a quiet roto campaign, Stafford will be a QB2 for Week 8 against the Seahawks' still-feisty defense.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 18-of-22 passes for 217 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' 32-21, Week 7 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Stafford also lost a fumble. Attempting to climb the pocket, the ball got knocked out from behind. Stafford's pick was an awful decision in the red zone, though the game was already in hand for the Seahawks. Stafford simply did not see Justin Coleman. Stafford's score was a dime to Marvin Jones after he seemed to be going down for a sack. The 40-attempt day was Stafford's first since Week 2. It was a product of the Lions playing from behind all afternoon. Detroit is headed to Minnesota for Week 9.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 27-of-40 passes for 310 yards, two touchdowns and an interception in the Lions' 28-14, Week 8 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Stafford took a career-high 10 sacks in this one and also lost a fumble on a flat-out dumb improvised pitch to Kerryon Johnson, who wasn't expecting the ball; the Vikings scooped it and returned it for a touchdown to put the game well out of reach.  The Lions were especially terrible in the red zone in this one, settling for a trio of short-ish Matt Prater field goals for their only points.  The trade of Golden Tate really hurt this offense on third down.  Stafford will not be a fantasy play in one-quarterback leagues next week at the Bears.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 25-of-36 passes for 199 scoreless yards in the Lions' 24-9, Week 9 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Dalton was mostly sharp, keeping his eyes downfield when pressured and hitting A.J. Green and John Ross for scores.  Green's TD came from 38 yards out on a bomb, and Ross' from three yards away on an end-zone fade.  This is the best supporting cast Dalton has been surrounded by since the 2015 season, when he finished as a top-seven quarterback in fantasy points per game.  Dalton will be a mid-range QB2 in a tough Week 2 matchup with Baltimore, however.
report: Andy Dalton completed 21-of-28 passes for 243 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: It was one of the shakiest four-touchdown performances you will ever see. Dalton was excellent in the first half, piling up all four of his scores. After the break, he could barely get a first down and was lucky to escape without a turnover. Dalton relentlessly worked his connection with A.J. Green, finding him for three of his four TDs. Dalton also displayed strong chemistry with Tyler Boyd, a welcome development as the Bengals try to deepen their weapons arsenal. The Bengals head on the road to Carolina for Week 3.
report: Andy Dalton completed 24-of-42 passes for 265 yards and four touchdowns in the Bengals' 34-23, Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: The four picks make Dalton's game look worse than it was; one was tipped high into the air on a target Josh Malone couldn't haul in, and Dalton's fourth INT came on what amounted to a last-gasp Hail Mary heave.  Of more concern are the Bengals' mounting injuries; after Joe Mixon had his knee scoped in Week 2, A.J. Green left Sunday's loss with a groin pull and did not return.  Dalton's Week 4 fantasy upside at Atlanta will hinge largely on Green's availability.
report: Andy Dalton completed 29-of-46 passes for 352 yards, two touchdowns, and four interceptions in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to Carolina.

impact: Dalton was exceptional throughout this game -- he completed 14-of-16 passes for 211 yards and two touchdowns in the first half -- but he made his money with the win in the balance late in the fourth quarter. Down five, Dalton led a 16-play, 75-yard touchdown drive in which he found Tyler Boyd for two fourth-down conversions. The touchdown was a great throw to A.J. Green in the end zone. Dalton now has multiple touchdowns in every game and has topped 335 yards each of the last two weeks. He will be a back-end QB1 next week against the Dolphins.
report: Andy Dalton completed 29-of-41 passes for 337 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Bengals' Week 4 win over the Falcons.

impact: He was sacked six times for a loss of 45 yards. Stafford salvaged the day somewhat, at least for fantasy purposes, by slinging a pair of fourth-quarter touchdowns, one to Kenny Golladay and another to rookie Kerryon Johnson. Just as he was last week against the Vikings, Stafford spent most of the day running for his life as Chicago's stout pass rush overwhelmed Detroit's nonexistent offensive line. Stafford's first interception wasn't his fault—Marvin Jones fell down on the play, allowing Bryce Callahan to swoop in for an easy pick. He had no one to blame but himself for the second interception, which was essentially an arm punt to Prince Amukamara. Playing on the road against one of the league's toughest defenses, Stafford just didn't have it on Sunday. With Golden Tate gone and Marvin Jones (knee) banged up, the former No. 1 pick will have his work cut out for him when the Panthers come to town in Week 11.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 25-of-42 passes for 274 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while adding nine yards on two carries Sunday in the Lions’ Week 10 loss to Chicago.

impact: Stafford had about as nondescript a first half as possible. He threw for just 64 yards on 20 attempts, and the success the Lions found on offense came down to Kerryon Johnson. Stafford should have thrown an interception, but Kenny Golladay was able to wrestle the ball away from the corner. It was much of the same for Stafford in the second half, but he made a couple big plays when it mattered most. The biggest was a beautifully placed throw which Golladay was able to bring in for what amounted to the game-winning score. The Lions might have to lean on Stafford more with Johnson injured -- he left the game in the third quarter -- but he still will not be an exciting fantasy option against the Bears on Thanksgiving.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 23-of-37 passes for 220 yards and a touchdown in the Lions' Week 11 win over the Panthers.

impact: Missing Marvin Jones and Kerryon Johnson, the Lions played unwatchable football, running a horizontal offense that treated Stafford like Sam Darnold. Of course, Stafford uncorked two awful picks, the first of which was housed for a touchdown by Eddie Jackson. Forced into a "hot" throw, Stafford never saw Jackson, who was jumping the route all the way. Stafford's second interception was essentially a game ender to a confused Michael Roberts in the end zone. Playing genuinely bad football for the Lions' retrograde offense, Stafford is barely even a QB2 right now.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 28-of-38 passes for 236 yards, zero touchdowns and two interceptions in the Lions' 23-16 Thanksgiving loss to the Bears.

impact: Stafford was sacked four times for 37 yards and was also charged with a lost fumble. This was probably as much as fantasy owners could have hoped for given the Lions' concerning lack of offensive weaponry (their leading receiver on Sunday was blocking tight end Levine Toilolo). Stafford's lone touchdown came on a trick play where he threw to offensive lineman Taylor Decker, who was announced as an eligible receiver. Aaron Donald was a thorn in his side all day, dropping him for two sacks while also forcing a fumble, which the Rams recovered deep in Detroit territory. Stafford will aim to get back on track next week when the Lions travel to Arizona for Week 14.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 20-of-33 passes for 245 yards with a touchdown and an interception while also tacking on a two-yard carry Sunday in the Lions’ Week 13 loss to Los Angeles.

impact: Dalton's only touchdown was a broken play where he hit Joe Mixon in the end-zone on a back-shoulder throw. He was picked trying to force a pass in the red-zone, but otherwise managed the game effectively. It's a disappointing game from Dalton against a Miami pass rush that was missing multiple starters. Dalton has another plus matchup with the Steelers in Week 6.
report: Andy Dalton completed 20-of-30 passes for 248 yards with a touchdown and an interception in the Bengals' Week 5 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Dalton averaged a pitiful 5.5 yards per attempt and took three sacks.  He needed to play much better for the Bengals but was also hurt bad by a couple drops.  Dalton just didn't seem to be on his A-game in this one, misfiring on a couple throws.  Tyler Boyd had to make a pair of shoe-string, diving catches, with one coming on a two-yard touchdown.  Dalton's now had back-to-back mediocre outings ahead of a ripe Week 7 spot against the Chiefs.
report: Andy Dalton completed 26-of-42 passes for 229 yards and two touchdowns in the Bengals' Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Evidently Dalton hurt his back during Sunday's loss to Pittsburgh but obviously the injury isn't serious. Dalton wasn't at his best last week, but he should bounce back against a lackluster Chiefs secondary on Sunday night.
report: Andy Dalton (back) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: The Bengals got off to a sluggish start, but Dalton managed a first-quarter touchdown to C.J. Uzomah. He telegraphed a pick-six on the first drive of second half and couldn’t get anything going after that. It’s one of the worst starts of the season for Dalton, who’s had multiple TDs in 5-of-7 games. Dalton has a rebound matchup with the Bucs in Week 8
report: Andy Dalton completed 15-of-29 passes for 148 yards with a touchdown and an interception in Week 7 against Kansas City.

impact: He rushed three times for ten yards.  Dalton dominated in the first half with scoring throws to A.J. Green (17 yards) and Tyler Boyd (7 yards), then went in the tank in the final two quarters as Tampa Bay rallied back before Bengals K Randy Bullock clinched the win with a last-second field goal.  Dalton will come out of the Bengals' Week 9 bye as a streamer option but not a locked-in QB1.
report: Andy Dalton completed 21-of-34 passes for 280 yards and two touchdowns in the Bengals' Week 8 win over the Bucs.

impact: Stafford got knocked around by Aaron Donald on Sunday and is probably still feeling it. The former No. 1 pick has been one of the more durable players in the league throughout his Lions tenure, starting every game since 2011. Clayton Kershaw's former high school teammate should be a go for Week 14 at Arizona.
report: Matthew Stafford (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Without A.J. Green, the Bengals next to nothing on offense on Sunday in a blowout loss. Dalton's lone highlight was a 2-yard touchdown pass to John Ross in the first quarter. Dalton threw a crucial interception right before the first half that turned into a Saints touchdown and closed the door on the afternoon. Things don't get much better for Dalton in Week 11 when the Bengals head to Baltimore.
report: Andy Dalton completed 12-of-20 passes for 153 yards with one touchdown and two interceptions in Sunday's Week 10 loss to the Saints.

impact: Dalton took only one sack and five hits, but he is playing against a loaded deck without A.J. Green and Tyler Eifert.  His touchdowns on Sunday went to third-string TE Matt Lengel and John Ross, who managed 27 yards on seven targets in the game.  There is some hope that Green (toe) will return for Week 12 against the Browns, but either way Dalton is a mere two-quarterback-league option.
report: Andy Dalton completed 19-of-36 passes for 211 yards and two touchdowns and rushed twice for 29 yards in the Bengals' Week 11 loss to Baltimore.

impact: Dalton was injured attempting to dive on the ball after a bad snap that went over his head. The injury was to his throwing hand. Dalton was 10-of-17 passing for 100 yards with a touchdown and interception prior to injury. Dalton missed time in 2015 with a broken thumb. The Bengals host the Broncos in Week 13.
report: Andy Dalton was forced from Sunday's Week 12 game versus the Browns with a thumb injury and will not return.

impact: It's the best possible news after Dalton departed Sunday's loss early, but his Week 13 status remains unclear. Even a sprain could keep a quarterback out multiple games. The Bengals may also not be in a hurry after Jeff Driskel looked competent against the Browns. Dalton's status will be updated no later than Wednesday, when the Bengals return to practice.
report: Andy Dalton has been diagnosed with a sprained thumb and is day to day.

impact: The Bengals' waiver claim of Tom Savage looked like a bad sign for Dalton's chances of playing in Week 13.  But he's not going to play for the rest of the season now.  Jeff Driskel will close out 2018 as Cincinnati's starter.  Dalton, who turned 31 last month, finished the year with a 21:11 TD-to-INT ratio and averaged 7.0 yards per attempt, reasserting himself as a mid-range to below-average NFL starter.  The Bengals can save $16.2 million in cap space by releasing Dalton in the offseason with zero dead money.  That, of course, would require them to start over at the quarterback position, an approach Marvin Lewis and owner Mike Brown have been loath in recent years to take.
report: Bengals placed QB Andy Dalton on injured reserve with torn ligaments in his thumb, ending his season.

impact: The Bengals can save $16.2 million in cap space with zero dead money by releasing Dalton this offseason, but that was never a realistic option. Dalton was on his way to a 30-plus touchdown season before a downgraded supporting cast and injuries derailed his 2018. He'll return as the starter next year, though the Bengals may make changes to their coaching staff.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Andy Dalton is expected to remain with the Bengals next season.

impact: It's a concern with Detroit coming off their bye. Riddick is looking questionable for Week 7 against Miami.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Riddick also sat out Wednesday, so it looks unlikely he will be ready to face the Dolphins this week. Riddick sitting would finally force the Lions to move Kerryon Johnson into a more featured role.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Riddick couldn't practice this week due to a knee injury. Kerryon Johnson should see more passing-game work in his absence.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) is out for Week 7 against the Dolphins.

impact: Riddick is week to week. It stands to reason that Kerryon Johnson will pick up most of Riddick's lost passing-game work, though Ameer Abdullah could also emergence for a few catches. Johnson is a strong RB2.
report: Lions declared RB Theo Riddick, DE Ziggy Ansah, DE Kerry Hyder, WR Brandon Powell, OG Joe Dahl, OT Andrew Donnal and CB Lenzy Pipkins inactive against the Dolphins for Week 7.

impact: Riddick hasn't seen the field since Week 5. If he misses another game Sunday, it will open up passing-down reps for lead back Kerryon Johnson.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Riddick also sat out Wednesday's session. It appears as if Kerryon Johnson and LeGarrette Blount will once again carry the load against the Seahawks.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Riddick didn't practice all week and doesn't appear close to returning. Kerryon Johnson should see more involvement in the passing game with Riddick sidelined. Even with LeGarrette Blount a threat to vulture him on the goal-line, Johnson should be treated as a high-end RB2 in all fantasy formats.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Seahawks.

impact: It's his first practice since Week 5. The veteran receiving back will aim to return Sunday at Minnesota. If Riddick gets the green light, it would be a slight downgrade for Kerryon Johnson.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Riddick is on track to play this week after sitting out the past two games with a knee injury. He'll put a dent in Kerryon Johnson's passing-down usage, though Riddick remains little more than a last-gasp flex in PPR leagues.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Kerryon Johnson has benefitted immensely without Riddick the past two games, hitting season-high marks in carries, targets, and routes run. With Riddick back, it's likely coach Matt Patricia and the offense go back to their ways of old and keep the third-down back heavily involved out of the backfield. Johnson's athleticism is enough to overcome decreased usage, but he'll still need to be downgraded to an RB3/FLEX option in Week 9.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) will play in Week 9 against the Vikings.

impact: Riddick missed the previous two games with a knee injury but came back to tie for the team lead in targets with Marvin Jones.  He didn't rush the ball, as Kerryon Johnson stayed the lead back with 15 touches.  Riddick essentially took over Golden Tate's role as the third receiver.  Those targets will put him on the map for desperate PPR owners, but there's little upside and a low floor.
report: Theo Riddick caught 7-of-8 targets for 36 yards in the Lions' Week 9 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Predictably, Riddick did almost all of his damage with Detroit trailing in the second half. Five of his six grabs came after halftime. The Lions aren't even pretending to use him as a running back anymore as evidenced by the zero carries he's logged over his last two games. Riddick's receiving usage gives him a reasonable PPR floor but his lack of touchdowns—he's yet to find the end zone in 2018—makes him a risky fantasy bet. He'll be back at it against the Panthers in Week 11.
report: Theo Riddick compiled six catches for 60 yards on seven targets Sunday in Detroit’s Week 10 loss to Chicago.

impact: Riddick has consistently been involved as a receiver since Golden Tate was traded, and that continued on Sunday. He did not do anything with the work in the first half, finishing with negative-five yards, but he opened the second by cooking Thomas Davis on an 18-yard catch.  He added another 17 on a shovel pass in the fourth to help spark the game-winning touchdown drive. With Kerryon Johnson's status uncertain, Riddick could play a big role against the Bears on Thanksgiving.
report: Theo Riddick hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 30 yards in the Lions' Week 11 win over the Panthers.

impact: The seven-catch performance was Riddick's third of the season. Even if Kerryon Johnson (knee) is cleared to return for Week 13, Riddick will have some PPR FLEX appeal against the Rams in a game where the Lions are going to have to throw more than they want to.
report: Theo Riddick caught 7-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Lions' Thanksgiving loss to the Bears, adding two rushes for 12 additional yards.

impact: The eight carries for Riddick were his most since week 16 of last season, though obviously he didn't do much with them. Even with the Lions in catch-up mode late, which is generally when he thrives, Riddick failed to make his presence felt. Riddick did draw a red-zone target in Sunday's defeat, though Matthew Stafford was hit as he threw, resulting in an incompletion. The six-year vet will look to end his 12-game touchdown drought when the Lions visit Arizona in Week 14.
report: Theo Riddick produced 32 yards on eight carries while also totaling three grabs for 26 yards on four targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 13 loss to the Rams.

impact: Lions will roll with rookie Kerryon Johnson, LeGarrette Blount, and Theo Riddick handling all backfield duties. It's likely to be a common theme for Abdullah unless one of the aforementioned trio gets hurt.
report: Lions declared RB Ameer Abdullah, DT A’Shawn Robinson, G Joe Dahl, OL Andrew Donnal, DE Romeo Okwara, WR Brandon Powell, and CB Dee Virgin inactive for Week 1 against the Jets.

impact: It's been a long time coming for Abdullah, who surprisingly kept his roster spot behind Kerryon Johnson, LeGarrette Blount and Theo Riddick coming out of training camp. The No. 54 overall pick of the 2015 draft had been active just three times this season, touching the ball three times on offense. Abdullah has had a difficult time staying healthy as a pro and averaged just 3.82 yards per carry on 327 career totes. 2018 is his age-25 season. There is a chance Abdullah gets claimed off waivers.
report: Lions waived RB Ameer Abdullah.

impact: Roc Thomas was let go in the corresponding move. It took the 2015 second-rounder roughly 24 hours to resurface after being let go by Detroit on Tuesday. Abdullah has appeared in just three games this year, recording 19 yards on three touches during that span. In Minnesota, the former Nebraska Cornhusker will just be a depth piece behind injury-prone starter Dalvin Cook and goal-line vulture Latavius Murray.
report: Vikings claimed RB Ameer Abdullah off waivers from the Lions.

impact: It's a new injury for Johnson, though his presence at Wednesday's session, albeit in a limited capacity, suggests it's nothing serious. Johnson has fallen off a bit since his breakout Week 7 (179 yards on 21 touches against Miami), but the rookie still belongs in the RB2 mix for Sunday's divisional tilt in the Windy City.
report: Kerryon Johnson (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Johnson has taken it easy in practice this week, but should be ready for Sunday's game in Chicago. He's slumped recently, managing just 59 yards on 20 carries (2.95 yards per attempt) over his last two games.
report: Kerryon Johnson (ankle) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Johnson's been limited in practice all week, though we expect he'll play. If the rookie's absent, LeGarrette Blount would receive a few more carries. It's also possible the Lions mix in Zach Zenner in a lesser role to keep all fresh. Riddick would benefit the most as he remains the only back additionally involved in the team's passing game.
report: Kerryon Johnson (ankle) is questionable for Week 10 against the Bears.

impact: Kerryon was only able to get in limited practice reps this week, but he was never in danger of missing Sunday's game at Soldier Field. The rookie has averaged a meager 2.95 yards per carry with no touchdowns over his last two games, though he's out-touched teammate LeGarrette Blount 29-10 during that span. Playing on the road against an elite Bears defense, Johnson will be a lower-end RB2 this week.
report: Kerryon Johnson (questionable, ankle) is expected to play Week 10 against the Bears.

impact: Johnson had been questionable with an ankle injury. He'll lead the backfield with power back LeGarrette Blount mixing in as a change-of-pace option. Theo Riddick will also get reps as a pass-catcher out of the backfield. OT Andrew Donnal, WR Bruce Ellington, LB Eli Harold, OG T.J. Lang, LB Jalen Reeves-Maybin, CB Darius Slay and TE Luke Willson round out Detroit's inactives for Week 10.
report: Kerryon Johnson (ankle) is active for Week 10 against the Bears.

impact: Sunday was a day of peaks and valleys for Johnson, who scored by leaping over the pile for a one-yard, goal-line touchdown with 1:05 remaining in the first half. Prince Amukamara stripped Johnson in the third quarter, resulting in Detroit's second turnover of the afternoon. That was a costly mistake for Kerryon, though the rookie redeemed himself by scoring a late touchdown on a 13-yard screen pass from Matthew Stafford. The 21-year-old was checked for a left ankle injury in the fourth quarter but only missed a handful of snaps. Johnson ceded some passing-down work to Theo Riddick but out-touched fading veteran LeGarrette Blount by an overwhelming 20-6 margin. Johnson and the struggling Lions will try to erase a three-game losing skid next week against a Panthers squad that was thoroughly whooped by Pittsburgh on Thursday night.
report: Kerryon Johnson produced 51 yards and a touchdown on 14 carries while also snaring six catches for 38 yards and another touchdown on six targets Sunday in Detroit’s Week 10 loss to the Bears.

impact: Johnson came down hard on his left knee at the end of a run in the third quarter. He was looked at on the sidelines before limping into the locker room. Johnson was on fire before leaving, gaining 87 yards and a touchdown on 15 carries. LeGarrette Blount and Theo Riddick will handle the backfield work while Johnson is out.
report: Kerryon Johnson exited Week 11 against the Panthers with a left knee injury.

impact: He'll have an MRI on Monday to confirm the injury. It's not terrible news, but Johnson could still miss multiple games if he's dealing with MCL damage. With Detroit playing on thanksgiving, Johnson is almost certainly out for Week 12. The Lions will go with a committee of LeGarrette Blount and Theo Riddick in his place.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Kerryon Johnson suffered a knee sprain in Week 11 against the Panthers.

impact: Ian Rapoport reported the sprained knee on Sunday night, but this gives something of a timetable. It would be a shock if Johnson is ready to face the Bears on Thanksgiving, but he could return after that. LeGarrette Blount, Theo Riddick, and Zach Zenner should handle backfield duties while Johnson is sidelined. Riddick is the only interesting fantasy play of that bunch.
report: Pro Football Talk reports Kerryon Johnson is week to week with a sprained knee.

impact: The short week does Johnson no favors.  Johnson is not expected to require surgery, but he is in danger of missing multiple games.  The Lions will resort to some combination of LeGarrette Blount, Theo Riddick, and perhaps Zach Zenner in the backfield for Thursday's early game against the Bears.
report: The Detroit Free Press confirms Kerryon Johnson (knee) is not expected to play on Thanksgiving.

impact: As expected.  Johnson avoided serious damage but is going to miss at least one game.  Expect a rotation between LeGarrette Blount, Theo Riddick, and Zach Zenner, making none of the three attractive in fantasy.
report: Kerryon Johnson (knee) is out for Week 12 against the Bears.

impact: Johnson missed last week against the Bears and is said to be dealing with a multi-game issue.  Expect Johnson to be out against the Rams, with LeGarrette Blount getting the first crack at carries after his 19-88-2 day in Week 12.
report: Kerryon Johnson (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Johnson was always expected to miss a couple weeks with his knee injury. LeGarrette Blount and Theo Riddick should handle the backfield work while Johnson is sidelined.
report: Kerryon Johnson (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Without Johnson and FB Nick Bellore (ankle, out) Sunday, the Lions will be down to LeGarrette Blount, Theo Riddick, and Zach Zenner in their backfield. Matt Patricia-favorite Blount notably led the group in snaps (33, 50%) and carries (19) on Thanksgiving. Assuming he again carries the load, Sunday makes for another sneaky-good matchup for Blount against the Rams' No. 29 rush defense DVOA.
report: Kerryon Johnson (knee) is out for Week 13 against the Rams.

impact: Johnson's knee is still bothering him. He hasn't played since injuring it in Week 11 and seems unlikely to return Sunday at Arizona. Assuming that's the case, LeGarrette Blount will again work as the lead back with Theo Riddick mixing in on passing downs.
report: Kerryon Johnson (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: There wasn’t a lot of rushing work to go around on Sunday as the Lions logged just 20 carries, but it’s still baffling that Blount saw nearly the same workload as impressive rookie Kerryon Johnson. Blount has value as a short-yardage grinder but Johnson is more versatile and should be playing close to an every-down role. Known for his scoring prowess, the 31-year-old has yet to find the end zone in 2018. Blount won’t be an appealing fantasy option next week against Green Bay.
report: LeGarrette Blount managed just seven yards on 12 carries Sunday in the Lions’ Week 4 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: It's barely worth mentioning as the Lions are obviously just being cautious with their veteran. Kerryon Johnson has been far more effective than Blount this season, though it appears the two will continue to split carries. Blount will be a last-ditch flex option against the Packers in Week 5.
report: LeGarrette Blount (illness) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: He was just sick on Wednesday. He will be ready to vulture touches from Kerryon Johnson against the Packers.
report: LeGarrette Blount (illness) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Blount was upgraded to full participation at Friday's practice after being limited by an illness earlier in the week. Detroit's backfield has been close to an even split, though rookie Kerryon Johnson has been far more effective than Blount, who has averaged a dismal 2.7 yards per carry with no touchdowns this year. The 31-year-old power back shouldn't be in any fantasy lineups this week or going forward.
report: LeGarrette Blount (illness) wasn't listed on the Lions' final injury report for Week 5 against the Packers.

impact: Blount was the ultimate vulture in this one, scoring a pair of one-yard touchdown runs in the opening quarter.  The 12 carries were Blount's second-most of the season and matched Kerryon Johnson for the team lead; Johnson later had to leave with an ankle injury.  Blount looks just about done with the tank coming close to empty, but he remains a goal-line threat as the Lions head into their bye.  Blount doesn't need to be owned in most formats outside of standard leagues.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed 12 times for 22 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: Blount was not targeted in the passing game. Blount was untouched on his two-yard touchdown run in the second quarter. Kerryon Johnson was running wild, but coach Matt Patricia insisted on continuing to feed Blount. Johnson is playing extremely well, but Blount is not going away as a fantasy troll/vulture.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed 10 times for 50 yards and a touchdown in the Lions' Week 7 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Blount's reception came on a screen. Blount's four touches were his fewest since Week 1. It was game flow related, as the Lions spent most of the afternoon playing from behind. Blount won't be a recommended FLEX for Week 9 against the Vikings.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed three times for three yards in the Lions' Week 8 loss to the Seahawks, adding a 23-yard reception.

impact: He caught one ball for two yards.  Blount is useless when he's not scoring short TDs.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed five times for eight yards in the Lions' Week 9 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Blount wasn't on last week's report, so this would appear to be a new injury. Regardless, it shouldn't impact his availability for Sunday's game in Chicago. The 31-year-old has been one of the least productive ball-carriers in football this year, averaging a tepid 2.7 yards per carry on 65 rushing attempts. He's not someone fantasy owners should be pursuing.
report: LeGarrette Blount (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Despite the injury, there's not much concern about his status for Sunday's game in Chicago. Blount's 2.7 yards per carry average is dead-last among qualified rushers. Needless to say, he's not a fantasy option.
report: LeGarrette Blount (knee) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Blount started as a limited practice participant but closed out the week with a full session on Friday. After splitting work with Kerryon Johnson early in the year, Blount has taken a backseat over his last two games, logging only eight carries during that span. He's not fantasy relevant at this juncture.
report: LeGarrette Blount (knee) wasn't listed on the Lions' final injury report for Week 10 against the Bears.

impact: As usual, he had no involvement in the passing game. Blount got the first crack at goal-line work with Detroit driving in the second quarter but was stuffed on both of his attempts. Kerryon Johnson spelled Blount on third down and scored from a yard out. The 31-year-old has bottomed out during the Lions' three-game losing streak, averaging a pathetic 1.07 yards per carry with no touchdowns during that span. With Johnson emerging as the Lions' bell cow, Blount no longer carries any fantasy significance.
report: LeGarrette Blount delivered just four yards on six carries Sunday in the Lions’ Week 10 loss to Chicago.

impact: Even with Kerryon Johnson going down in this game, there is little reason to expect much fantasy value out of Blount, especially with the Bears up next. The Lions might be better off giving Zach Zenner carries.
report: LeGarrette Blount gained one yard on seven carries in the Lions' Week 11 win over the Panthers.

impact: Happy Thanksgiving. The ultimate fantasy troll was in rare form today, running in straight lines but dragging tacklers in the process. It was a classic "gets better as the game goes on" performance against the Bears' otherwise swarming defense. Blount will be a touchdown-based FLEX for Week 13 against the Rams if Kerryon Johnson (knee) misses another game.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed 19 times for 88 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' Week 12 loss to the Bears, adding a 15-yard reception.

impact: Predictably, Blount dropped his lone target. That one really hurt as Blount was wide open on a screen pass that surely would have gone for a big gain. Blount snoozed through the first half (11 yards on six carries) but livened up after halftime, rolling to 50 yards on 10 second-half totes. With Kerryon Johnson (knee) still not practicing, Blount could be in for another start next week when the Lions travel to Arizona.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed for 61 yards on 16 carries and was unable to reel in his lone target Sunday in Detroit’s Week 13 loss to Los Angeles.

impact: Relentlessly hyped all offseason, Mahomes came out and made a statement against the Chargers' Joey Bosa-less defense. His third pass was a 58-yard touchdown strike to Tyreek Hill. Mahomes found Hill a silly seven times for 169 yards and a pair of TDs. Two of Mahomes' four scores were goal line shovel passes. In addition to the passing, Mahomes was used frequently as a runner, both on traditional and read options. Mahomes looked like a born playmaker in just his second NFL start. There are going to be growing pains with any young player, but Mahomes could rapidly become an every-week QB1. He gets the Steelers in Pittsburgh for Week 2.
report: Patrick Mahomes competed 15-of-27 passes for 256 yards and four touchdowns in the Chiefs' 38-28, Week 1 win over the Chargers, adding five rushes for 21 additional yards.

impact: With 10 touchdowns, Mahomes now owns the record for the most scores through the first two weeks of the season. Mahomes was just reaving souls, ripping chunk plays whenever and wherever he wanted. Unlike last week's Tyreek Hill-dominated affair, Mahomes got everyone involved, finding each of Hill, Travis Kelce and Sammy Watkins for at least 90 yards. Mahomes was throwing lasers into tight coverage in the red zone, finding Kelce and Chris Conley for impressive scores. Mahomes is the real deal and could not have a better setup on a videogame. He will look to stay scorching as an elite QB1 in Week 3 against the 49ers.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 23-of-28 passes for 326 yards and six touchdowns in the Chiefs' 42-37, Week 2 win over the Steelers.

impact: The three scores give Mahomes the record for most touchdown passes (13) in the first three games of a season, and he could have had more. He missed a couple throws in the first half including what should have been a touchdown to Tyreek Hill, and the Chiefs attempted just 13 passes in the second half of the easy win. Leading what looks like an unstoppable offense, blowouts might be the only thing which can stop Mahomes from putting up massive fantasy days. A trip to Denver next Monday night might look daunting, but the Broncos' defense has struggled a bit early in the season. Mahomes will be the top overall quarterback next week.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 24-of-38 passes for 314 yards and three touchdowns in the Chiefs' Week 3 win over the 49ers.

impact: He also rushed for an eight-yard touchdown, his first score on the ground this season.  Mahomes got off to a real rough start, heading into halftime with just 65 yards passing.  The Broncos were coming at him from all angles, and Mahomes was running for his life most of the night.  His 192 yards passing outside the pocket, according to ESPN, are the most in the last decade.  The Chiefs were down by 10 with just over 12 minutes left, and Mahomes ended up engineering an incredible comeback, creating plays with his legs, throwing darts on the run, and even completing a pass left-handed to Tyreek Hill while running for his life on third down.  He also overcame a 2nd-and-30 situation in the fourth quarter with pass plays of 23 and 35 yards.  The box-score numbers don't tell the whole story.  Mahomes is a star and gets a tough Jaguars defense in K.C. for Week 5.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 28-of-45 passes for 304 yards and one touchdown in the Chiefs' 27-23, Week 4 win over the Broncos on Monday night.

impact: This was the toughest test of Mahomes' young career, and he passed with flying colors. He was extremely sharp early, spreading the ball around in his trademark fashion, and capped the opening drive with a four-yard rushing score off a bootleg. He did throw his first interception on the season in the second quarter on a high pass across the middle, but that was the only time Kansas City's offense was stopped in the first half. He did not have much to do in the second half, but Mahomes answered a Jacksonville touchdown drive with one of his own in which he hit Tyreek Hill with a great pass for 36 yards up the sideline. He threw another careless interception in the fourth, but it did not ultimately matter. The fantasy stats were not spectacular, but Mahomes has proven he is matchup-proof. He will be a high-end play next week in New England.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 22-of-38 passes for 313 yards and two interceptions and rushed four times for 13 yards and a touchdown in the Chiefs' Week 5 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Mahomes struggled in the first half before exploding over the final two quarters.  He hit Kareem Hunt for a 67-yard touchdown on the opening drive of second half, with all three of his other TDs going to Tyreek Hill. Mahomes got some help from a Patriots secondary that let Hill get past them for huge gains with broken coverages. The Chiefs lost on a last second field goal, but this was another strong showing from Mahomes after leading the Chiefs to a win over Jacksonville last week. Mahomes will be a top-three quarterback play against the Bengals in Week 7.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 23-of-36 passes for 352 yards with four touchdowns and two interceptions in Kansas City's Week 6 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Mahomes’ first two touchdowns were dumpoffs to Kareem Hunt. He hit a wide open Demetrius Harris and Tyreek Hill in the red-zone for his other scores. Mahomes underthrew Hill on a deep shot for his interception but was otherwise flawless in the blowout win. Mahomes is playing at an MVP level with a 22:5 TD/INT ratio through seven games. Even in a tough matchup with Denver, he's a top-five quarterback play for Week 8.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 28-of-39 passes for 358 yards with four touchdowns and an interception in the Chiefs' Week 7 win over the Bengals, adding four rushes for 45 yards.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of 12 yards. After Sunday's win, Mahomes is now 3-0 in his career against Denver. Sunday also extended the 23-year-old's streak of 300-yard games to seven. Mahomes had his most success throwing to Sammy Watkins, who exploded for 107 yards and two touchdowns on a season-high eight catches. The second-year stud threw an ugly interception in the second half on a pass he forced to Travis Kelce, but that was his lone blemish in an otherwise stellar outing. The current MVP front-runner will look to stay hot next week when the 7-1 Chiefs travel to Cleveland.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 24-of-34 passes for 303 yards with four touchdowns and one interception while losing one yard on two carries Sunday in the Chiefs’ Week 8 win over the Broncos.

impact: Mahomes also added 18 yards rushing on two carries. The 375 passing yards were a new career-high and were the eighth straight game in which Mahomes surpassed 300-yards passing, just the fourth player to have such a streak in NFL history. He'll gun to tie the all-time record of nine straight games done by Drew Brees twice. Mahomes threw a 50-yard touchdown on a screen pass to Kareem Hunt on the opening drive and then 11 and 13-yard strikes to Travis Kelce for scores. The Chiefs host the Cardinals in Week 10.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 23-of-32 passes for 375 yards with three touchdowns and one interception in Sunday's Week 9 win over the Browns.

impact: It's the first time in the last four weeks Mahomes has been held under 300-plus yards and three touchdowns. Mahomes threw both of his TDs to Tyreek Hill, who accounted for half of his yards. He faced a stronger than expected Cardinals pass rush, taking five sacks. Mahomes made some plays outside of the pocket with 21 yards on four carries. Mahomes is now up to a league best 31 touchdowns through 10 games. The Chiefs get the Rams for a likely Monday night shootout in Week 11.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 21-of-28 passes for 249 yards and two touchdowns in Week 10 against the Cardinals.

impact: The field is in "serious disrepair" after a Saturday concert. It is a turf/grass combination, and sod replacements were being made on Tuesday. "We are working closely with the field manager at Azteca Stadium and others to ensure that we have an NFL quality surface for our game, and we are looking forward to kicking off in Mexico City on Monday night," a league spokesman said. It would be very un-NFL to move the game. Short of truly catastrophic playing conditions, we expect the league to keep the game in Mexico.
report: Poor field conditions at Mexico City's Azteca Stadium has the NFL considering moving Monday's game between the Rams and Chiefs to Los Angeles.

impact: It's surprising but absolutely the right call based on pictures and videos circulating on social media. ESPN's Adam Schefter reported earlier Tuesday that some players were considering boycotting the game they were so concerned. Although moving the game was the right thing to do, it's an utter fiasco for the NFL, which continues to be confoundingly bad at ensuring neutral-site fields are in proper condition. The move has zero ramifications for fantasy.
report: Monday's Rams/Chiefs game has been moved from Mexico City back to Los Angeles due to poor field conditions at Azteca Stadium.

impact: Mahomes had previously avoided the injury report this season. The "full" designation means it will not be an issue for Week 11. Mahomes is the top fantasy quarterback of the week in a game that had a gaudy 63.5-point over/under as of Thursday afternoon.
report: Patrick Mahomes is listed on the Week 11 injury report with a foot issue but is practicing in full.

impact: A game for the ages.  Simple as that.  This may end up being the true "Super Bowl" of the season, and we can only hope to see this matchup again in February for pure entertainment purposes.  Mahomes turned the ball over five times, losing a pair of fumbles, setting up two Rams touchdowns, but two of his picks were last-ditch heaves in the fourth quarter with the Chiefs chasing three points.  The guy is just incredible, and he and Jared Goff combined for 925 total yards and 11 touchdowns in a battle of MVP hopefuls.  Mahomes' scores went to Tyreek Hill (two), Chris Conley (two), Travis Kelce, and Kareem Hunt.  Both teams earned their Week 12 byes.  Mahomes will get the Raiders in Week 13.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 33-of-46 passes for 478 yards, six touchdowns, and three interceptions in the Chiefs' 54-51, Week 11 loss to the Rams on Monday night.

impact: Mahomes was not particularly crisp today — he struggled to get on the same page with Tyreek Hill and nearly broke some of Travis Kelce's ribs with a hospital ball — but he still managed to cruise by 40 touchdowns on the season. His 41 scores are already tied for ninth all time. Mahomes has arguably been a little too frisky with the ball of late, risking unnecessary turnovers, but his play-making ability is simply out of this world. He should be considered the frontrunner for MVP honors. The Ravens' elite defense is on deck for Week 14.
report: Patrick Mahomes completed 23-of-38 passes for 295 yards and four touchdowns in the Chiefs' 40-33, Week 13 win over the Raiders, adding nine carries for 52 additional yards.

impact: Hunt had one of the highlights of the year in this one, breaking multiple tackles and hurdling over a defender on a play that set up his first receiving touchdown. On his second, he took a red-zone dumpoff down the right sideline and extended over the pylon before going out of bounds. Hunt converted a goal-line carry for his rushing score on the Chiefs first drive of the second half. It's the second straight week Hunt's had an expanded pass game role after going over 100 yards receiving against the Patriots. Hunt has been on fire with a touchdown in five straight weeks. He'll remain a locked-in RB1 for Week 8 against Denver.
report: Kareem Hunt had 15 carries for 86 yards and a touchdown and caught 5-of-6 passes for 55 yards and two touchdowns in Week 7 against the Bengals.

impact: The 50 rushing yards were his fewest since Week 3. Hunt scored in thrilling fashion, nabbing a fourth-down shovel pass from Patrick Mahomes and hurdling a defender on his way to the end zone for a 23-yard touchdown. That extended Hunt's touchdown streak to seven games. The 23-year-old was scarcely used in the passing game early on, but he's quickly become one of Mahomes' favorite targets, delivering four touchdown receptions over his last three games. Last year's NFL rushing leader should be in for another big fantasy performance when the Chiefs travel to Cleveland in Week 9.
report: Kareem Hunt went for 50 yards on 16 carries while also contributing five catches for 36 yards and a touchdown on six targets Sunday in Kansas City’s Week 8 win over the Broncos.

impact: Hunt got the day started with a 50-yard screen pass for a touchdown on the opening drive of the game and then added rushing scores of one and 10 yards. That was Hunt's second three-touchdown game over his past three weeks and he has now has scored a touchdown in eight straight games. Hunt gets a juicy matchup against the soft Arizona run defense at home in Week 10.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 17 times for 91 yards and two touchdowns with one catch for 50 yards and a touchdown in Sundays Week 9 win over the Browns.

impact: Hunt finished just under 100 total yards. It's also the first time since Week 1 he was held out of the end-zone. Spencer Ware vultured Hunt's best chance to score at the three-yard line. There just wasn't much room for Hunt to do anything against a Cardinals defense that did a good job of limiting Kansas City's run game. Hunt should rebound in a Week 11 matchup against the Rams.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 16 times for 71 yards and caught two passes for 25 yards in Week 10 against the Cardinals.

impact: The running backs were afterthoughts for the most part in this high-flying shootout that saw the teams combine for 1,001 yards and 14 touchdowns.  Hunt scored his on a 21-yard catch-and-run,  but this game quickly turned into a haymaker-for-haymaker slobber-knocker via the air.  Hunt was still able to get "his", while Todd Gurley mustered just 94 scoreless yards on the other side.  Hunt will get a Week 12 breather before taking on the hapless Raiders in Week 13.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 14 times for 70 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 41 yards and one touchdown in the Chiefs' 54-51, Week 11 loss to the Rams.

impact: In the video, Hunt was shown arguing and shoving a 19-year-old woman outside his hotel room on February 10 at 3:22 AM ET. The conflict escalated quickly after that with Hunt lunging at the woman and later kicking her while on the ground. Police took statements but no charges were filed. The footage, which you can see in the link below, is extremely troubling. This is a terrible look for both the Kansas City organization (remember the Chiefs took a major PR hit two years ago when they drafted Tyreek Hill following his domestic violence arrest) and the NFL, particularly in the wake of Rueben Foster's arrest and subsequent waiver claim by Washington. The wheels of the NFL move slowly, but we imagine Hunt will be facing a lengthy suspension once this gets sorted out.
report: In footage released by TMZ, Kareem Hunt was shown getting into a physical altercation with a 19-year-old woman at a Cleveland hotel in February.

impact: Hunt addressed reports of this particular altercation back in August, stating he had "learned from it" and was focused on football. Chiefs owner Clark Hunt said in August that he didn't expect Hunt to be disciplined by the league. The franchise is now acting upon the release of the video to the public. ESPN's Dan Graziano suggests the most likely short-term solution is for Hunt to make the commissioner's exempt list, which would keep him from practicing or attending games until a final decision is made. Hunt could also be facing a six-game suspension under the league's Domestic Violence Policy.
report: The Chiefs sent Kareem Hunt home from their practice facility Friday.

impact: This was expected after the Chiefs sent Hunt home from practice Friday. Hunt will be on paid leave while on the exempt list, meaning he'll make his weekly salary but can't play in any games. The Chiefs have been aware of the domestic violence allegations against Hunt since February, but it wasn't until the release of a TMZ video that the league was forced to step in. Hunt could miss the rest of the regular season and playoffs while the NFL looks into the incident. Spencer Ware will take over as Kansas City's feature back.
report: NFL placed Kareem Hunt on the Commissioner Exempt List.

impact: It's a zero tolerance statement on domestic violence from the Chiefs after a leaked video involving Hunt surfaced on TMZ. The Chiefs say Hunt lied to the team when they spoke to him back in February about the incident. Hunt was likely going to miss the rest of the season on the Commissioner Exempt List, but Kansas City is cutting ties amid media backlash. A 2017 third-rounder, Hunt led the league in rushing as a rookie and was on his way to another Pro Bowl this year. Giving up on a cost controlled superstar is a bold move from the AFC-leading Chiefs, who will turn to Spencer Ware as their feature back. Hunt is facing a lengthy suspension whenever the league hands down discipline, but his talent is good enough to get him a second chance.
report: Chiefs waived RB Kareem Hunt.

impact: Hunt is facing a lengthy suspension under the Personal Conduct Policy, but his release from the Chiefs was trust-related after he lied to the team back in February. Unlike Ray Rice, Hunt's a cost controlled superstar in the prime of his career that's going to be cleared to play at some point. Signed through 2020, there's upside in stashing Hunt for teams that are willing to take the PR hit. Hunt has Ohio ties and was drafted by Browns GM John Dorsey in Kansas City. Washington, Baltimore, and Tampa are all running back needy teams that could also have interest.
report: ProFootballTalk's Mike Florio considers the Eagles a candidate to claim Kareem Hunt off waivers.

impact: The NFL's investigation into Hunt won't be concluded until the offseason. He'll spend the rest of this year either out of the league or on the Commissioner Exempt List if he gets claimed off waivers. The optics of Hunt's situation have him in a bad spot with teams. Hunt may have to wait for the league to hand down discipline, but we expect him to resurface.
report: The Athletic's Nate Taylor reports Kareem Hunt is expected to be suspended the first six games of the 2019 season.

impact: The NFL has been looking into another incident involving Hunt at an Ohio resort in June. He's facing two separate suspensions, putting him at risk for more than just the baseline six games. Hunt is considering "admitting his wrongdoing" and serving his suspension as soon as possible, allowing him to avoid closing out the year on the Commissioner Exempt List. There's still a lot of moving parts, but there's a chance Hunt's league discipline will be handed down before the offseason.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Kareem Hunt is likely to get more than a six-game suspension for violating the league's Personal Conduct Policy.
