impact: "You can't really explain it," Hunt said. "The video shows it. I was in the wrong. I'm not that type of person. I'm really disappointed and embarrassed in myself." Hunt continued to insist that is not who he is as a person, though as ESPN's Sam Ponder pointed out, that's certainly who he was on the night in question. It's still more contrition than some NFL players have offered up in past instances of violence against women. Teams have until Monday afternoon to claim Hunt off waivers. We doubt it will happen, but he will likely be back in the league in 2019.
report: In a live Sunday morning interview with ESPN's Lisa Salters, ex-Chiefs RB Kareem Hunt admitted guilt in his February assault of a woman and confirmed he lied to the Chiefs about the incident.

impact: He is now technically free to sign with any team but will remain on the NFL's commissioner exempt list indefinitely, making Hunt ineligible to play until Roger Goodell clears him to come off of it.  And that won't happen this year.  It speaks to the Washington Redskins' lack of integrity that they claimed ex-49ers LB Reuben Foster off waivers after his latest domestic violence accusation, but not a single NFL team claimed Hunt.  It also speaks to the power of video evidence; Hunt was caught on tape beating up a woman, while Foster never was.
report: Ex-Chiefs RB Kareem Hunt passed through waivers unclaimed.

impact: The NFL is investigating Hunt's February altercation with a woman that led to his release from the Chiefs as well as a June incident with a man and a previously undisclosed incident from January. Per Graziano, the January and June incidents are the "types of aggravating factors that can lead the league to impose a suspension longer than the six-game baseline." Hunt's 2018 suspension is going to spill over deep into 2019.
report: ESPN's Dan Graziano reports the NFL is taking into account three separate off-the-field incidents as it considers how long free agent Kareem Hunt's suspension will be.

impact: The sixth-round rookie entered the evening with four grabs on the year. He was only featured because Ryan Griffin (illness) was sidelined. With Griffin's status uncertain and Will Fuller and Keke Coutee both banged up, Thomas could have Week 9 TE2 appeal against the Broncos, who have struggled up the seam.
report: TE Jordan Thomas caught 4-of-4 targets for 29 yards and two touchdowns in the Texans' Week 8 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Thomas now has three touchdowns in two weeks. Without Keke Coutee (hamstring) available in the slot, the Texans primarily leaned on multiple tight end sets, allowing Thomas to stay on the field with Ryan Griffin. Thomas still only saw one target on the day, though, so he need not be considered a viable option unless Griffin sits out again.
report: TE Jordan Thomas hauled in his only target for a touchdown in the Texans' Week 9 win over the Broncos.

impact: His 11-yard touchdown was the lone offensive touchdown for the Texans on the day and the fourth touchdown that Thomas has scored on the season. The rookie tight end  has stepped up as one of the team's top red zone options over the past five weeks, but is still a touchdown dependent fantasy option, catching more than two passes in just two games on the season. The Texans host the Colts in Week 14.
report: Jordan Thomas caught all three of his targets for 32 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 13 win over the Browns.

impact: It's the firs time Griffin has been on the injury report this season. This shouldn't impact his availability for Sunday's game. Griffin has just one catch through two weeks.
report: Texans TE Ryan Griffin (hip) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Griffin is not fantasy-relevant in an offense that doesn't feature its tight ends.
report: Ryan Griffin caught his lone target for 12 yards in the Texans' Week 4 win over the Colts.

impact: It was one of his better games of the season. Griffin should've had a touchdown, but dropped a pass thrown slightly behind him in the end-zone. The Texans rarely use their tight end, so Griffin remains off the fantasy radar.
report: Ryan Griffin caught 6-of-9 passes for 65 yards in Houston's Week 5 win over Dallas.

impact: Griffin must have picked up the injury in last week's win over Dallas, though it doesn't appear to be anything serious. The former UConn Husky saw his biggest workload of the year in that game, drawing nine targets from quarterback Deshaun Watson. Still, he's just a last-ditch TE2 in fantasy and won't be a recommended streaming option Sunday against Buffalo.
report: Ryan Griffin (toe) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Griffin tweaked his toe in Week 5 but it looks like he's going to gut it out Sunday against Buffalo. Even at a thin position, Griffin isn't of much fantasy interest.
report: Ryan Griffin (toe) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Griffin "exploded" for six catches and 65 yards against Dallas last week, but he could not build on the breakout here. It is unlikely he fares much better next week in Jacksonville.
report: Ryan Griffin did not catch any of his five targets Week 6 against the Bills.

impact: Griffin came down with an illness late in the week and won't be available for Sunday's game in Jacksonville. Tight end responsibilities will be shared between Jordan Akins and Jordan Thomas in Week 7.
report: Ryan Griffin (illness) is out for Week 7 against the Jaguars.

impact: Griffin is still battling an illness he picked up last week. This will be his second straight absence. Tight end responsibilities will fall with Jordan Akins and Jordan Thomas on Thursday Night Football.
report: Ryan Griffin (illness) is out for Week 8 against the Dolphins.

impact: Griffin missed the previous two games.  Jordan Thomas played at least 85% of the snaps in the two games Griffin sat and caught two touchdowns last week.  Griffin is returning to take back a large chunk of that playing time.
report: Ryan Griffin (illness) will play Week 9 against the Broncos.

impact: Griffin is back after missing the past two games with an undisclosed illness. He won't be an appealing streamer against Denver.
report: Ryan Griffin (illness) is practicing in full for Week 9 against the Broncos.

impact: It confirms he's a game-time decision. We're expecting Coutee to play coming off Houston's bye, but he's a Week 11 fade at less than 100 percent.
report: Keke Coutee (questionable, hamstring) traveled with the team to Washington.

impact: This was the likeliest outcome considering Coutee traveled with the team to Washington. With the Texans barely throwing and Demaryius Thomas in the picture, Coutee is not an exciting fantasy option.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Keke Coutee (hamstring) is expected to play Week 11 against the Redskins.

impact: The Texans' wideout corps is fully intact with Demaryius Thomas having one game and the Week 10 bye under his belt and Coutee back in the slot.  The Texans' Week 11 inactives are CB Aaron Colvin, WR Vyncint Smith, DLs Joel Heath and Carlos Watkins, LBs Duke Ejiofor and Zach Cunningham, and CB Deante Burton.
report: Keke Coutee is active for Week 11 against the Redskins.

impact: Coutee showed no ill effects from his months-long hamstring injury and severely out-targeted Demaryius Thomas, 9 to 1.  Coutee is likely to remain up and down as a complementary receiver on a run-first team, but at least we can say he is healthy again.  He'll be a high-risk WR3/flex in Week 12 against Tennessee.
report: Keke Coutee caught 5-of-9 targets for 77 yards in the Texans' Week 11 win over the Redskins.

impact: It's his second straight limited practice after returning last week. The Texans are managing Coutee's reps, but he should see his normal snaps for Monday night's matchup with Tennessee.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) was limited at Friday's practice.

impact: There's no doubt over Coutee's status after a full practice Saturday. Coutee saw more targets than Demaryius Thomas in his return from his hamstring injury last week. He's a WR3 in a plus matchup with Tennessee's secondary.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) has been removed from the Week 12 injury report.

impact: Coutee had nine targets last week but was a total non-factor the entire night before pulling his hamstring again in the third quarter.  He's been battling the hammy ever since getting drafted in April.  Coutee again will be week to week heading into Week 13 against the Browns.  Demaryius Thomas saw five targets and converted them into 4-38-2 behind DeAndre Hopkins.  Coutee can be dropped in all formats, even without knowing the severity of his latest injury.
report: Keke Coutee caught both of his targets for 14 yards in the Texans' Week 12 win over the Titans before he exited with a second-half hamstring injury.

impact: Coutee suffered the injury in the third quarter of Monday night's win. This is the third time Coutee has injured his hamstring already this season, and it is likely this setback again forces him to miss time.
report: Keke Coutee said it is "hard to tell" if his latest hamstring injury is as serious as the ones which have caused him to miss games this season.

impact: Coutee sounded less sure after the game on Monday night, but it sounds like initial tests have been positive. That said, Coutee is now dealing with his third hamstring injury already this season. He is not a lock to play this week.
report: Texans coach Bill O'Brien said Keke Coutee (hamstring) is "trending toward" playing Week 13 against the Browns.

impact: This is a good sign after Coutee aggravated his hamstring injury in the third quarter of Monday night's win. Coach Bill O'Brien said Coutee is trending toward playing, but he'll be hard to trust at less than 100 percent.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Time for our daily update on Coutee, who has seemingly been hurt since the moment he arrived in Houston. The rookie slot man suffered his latest setback in Monday night's win over Tennessee. We're guessing he'll be active against the Browns this week, though hopefully you have better options at wide receiver.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Coutee isn't a fantasy option even if he does play in this one, but his availability could impact the outlook of Demaryius Thomas behind DeAndre Hopkins.  Coutee has been limited in practice all week and is truly questionable.
report: Coach Bill O'Brien said Keke Coutee (questionable, hamstring) will be a game-time decision Week 13 against the Browns.

impact: Nothing has really changed with Coutee's status as coach Bill O'Brien said earlier in the week he'd be a game-time decision. The rookie has shown flashes when healthy, though persistent hamstring woes have limited him to just six games this season. Even if he suits up, Coutee won't be an enticing option for the final week of the fantasy regular season.
report: Keke Coutee (questionable, hamstring) will work out pre-game to determine his status for Week 13 against the Browns.

impact: Coutee aggravated his on-and-off hamstring injury a week ago on Monday Night which caused him to play just 27 snaps and was unable to go after testing the injury out prior to Sunday's game. With Coutee in and out of the game, Demaryius Thomas received five targets, the most he's had in three games played with Houston. Even with the absence of Coutee, Thomas is only a lower-end fantasy option.
report: Texans declared WR Keke Coutee, WR Vyncint Smith, CB Natrell Jamerson, CB Deante Burton, OLB Duke Ejiofor, DE Carlos Watkins and DE Joel Heath inactive for Sunday's Week 13 game versus the Browns.

impact: Coutee was held out as a game-time decision in Week 13. He should be closer to play this week, but his status can't be taken for granted. Coutee shouldn't be in fantasy lineups at less than 100 percent if he plays.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Dallas kept Gathers on the 53-man roster following his arrest for drug possession but will oddly make him inactive on game day. CB Chidobe Awuzie is available and will start on the opposite side of Byron Jones.
report: Cowboys declared TE Rico Gathers, QB Mike White, S Xavier Woods, DT Datone Jones, LB Chris Covington, C Adam Redmond, and C Travis Frederick inactive for Week 1 against the Panthers.

impact: Gathers will make his regular season debut after being a healthy scratch last week. The Cowboys will be without DE Randy Gregory (concussion), but are mostly healthy on defense. Also inactive are QB Mike White, S Xavier Woods, DE Datone Jones, C Travis Frederick, OG Xavier Su’a-Filo, and TE Dalton Schultz.
report: Cowboys TE Rico Gathers is active for Week 2 against the Giants.

impact: Geoff Swaim broke his wrist last week, opening a hole at tight end.  Gathers still can't get involved for some reason.  He played 15-of-70 snaps but wasn't targeted and played behind both Blake Jarwin and rookie Dalton Schultz.  Gathers hasn't been targeted since Week 7.  He's miles away from fantasy relevance.  Jarwin led the tight ends with two catches for 25 yards.
report: Rico Gathers wasn't targeted in the Cowboys' Week 12 win over the Redskins.

impact: Most of his production including four of his five catches came in the second half. The seven targets were a career-high for Swaim, who entered Sunday’s action having caught just 12 passes over 30 career games. Despite his recent emergence, Swaim is not worth pursuing in fantasy.
report: Geoff Swaim contributed five catches for a team-high 47 yards on seven targets Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 3 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Swaim’s third-quarter touchdown, a one-yarder off a play-action pass from Dak Prescott, was the first of his career. The 25-year-old seems to have emerged as the Cowboys’ top receiving tight end—neither Blake Jarwin or Rico Gathers have caught a pass this year—but for streaming purposes, he’s still not someone fantasy owners should be looking at.
report: Geoff Swaim corralled three-of-five targets for 39 yards and a touchdown Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 4 victory over Detroit.

impact: He was the Cowboys' leading receiver. Swaim had a breakout game last week and should remain the top tight end option moving forward. He's just a low-end TE2 for Week 6 against Jacksonville.
report: Geoff Swaim caught three passes for 55 yards in Week 5 against the Texans.

impact: Swaim didn't move the needle much in this one. He's been the Cowboys' most productive tight end this year, though that's not exactly a high bar to clear. Swaim won't be an appealing streamer against the Redskins next week.
report: Geoff Swaim delivered two catches for 21 yards on two targets Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 6 win over Jacksonville.

impact: Rookie Dalton Schultz was additionally active for the first time all year, giving the Cowboys four active tight ends on game day. Swaim led the group with 25 receiving yards, but all saw at least one target. If you hadn't streamed Swaim to this point, that ship's sailed.
report: Geoff Swaim clenched all three of his targets for 25 yards in the Cowboys' Week 7 loss to Washington.

impact: Coach Jason Garrett is "hopeful" it will be a short-term injury, but an MRI is never a good sign. The 2015 seventh-rounder has 19 grabs in seven games after entering 2018 with nine career catches.
report: Cowboys TE Geoff Swaim is undergoing an MRI for a knee injury and will not practice during the team's Week 8 bye.

impact: The Cowboys had been hopeful Swain would be ready for Week 9 coming off their bye, but that is looking unlikely now. If Swaim can't go against the Titans, some combination of Blake Jarwin, Dalton Schultz and Rico Gathers will attempt to catch passes.
report: Updating an earlier item, Cowboys TE Geoff Swaim has been diagnosed with a sprained MCL following an MRI.

impact: He was diagnosed with a sprained MCL during the bye week. It is not a great start, but Swaim has yet to be ruled out for Monday night. The Cowboys would turn to a committee of Blake Jarwin, Dalton Schultz and Rico Gathers is Swaim cannot play.
report: Cowboys TE Geoff Swaim (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: He has a sprained MCL.  Swaim seems doubtful at best to face the Titans.
report: Geoff Swaim (knee) did not practice Friday.

impact: Swaim's played 90% of the Cowboys' offensive snaps this season. His likely absence leaves more opportunity for Blake Jarwin, Dalton Schultz, and Rico Gathers, though none should be used in any format outside of single-game DFS slates.
report: Geoff Swaim (knee) is doubtful for Week 9 against the Titans.

impact: Swaim missed Monday night's game with a sprained MCL. He got in some reps in a padless practice, but he's not a lock to return this week. Blake Jarwin and Dalton Schultz will handle tight end duties if Swaim remains out.
report: Geoff Swaim (knee) returned to practice Wednesday.

impact: Swaim got in another limited practice on Friday, suggesting he'll be ready for Sunday night's showdown against the Eagles. The fourth-year tight end carries very little fantasy significance.
report: Geoff Swaim (knee) is questionable for Week 10 against the Eagles.

impact: Swaim returns after a one game absence. He'll slot back in as Dallas' No. 1 tight end. The Cowboys inactives are QB Mike White, WR Tavon Austin, LB Joe Thomas. LB Sean Lee, OL Connor Williams, DL David Irving, and DE Taco Charlton.
report: Geoff Swaim (knee) is active for Week 10 against the Eagles.

impact: Standard day at the office for the tight end.  Swaim has topped 50 yards just once this season and has only one score.  He's not on the fantasy radar.
report: Geoff Swaim caught 4-of-5 targets for 24 yards in the Cowboys' Week 11 win over the Falcons.

impact: It's unclear if he'll be sidelined even longer or will try to play with some sort of cast, but we wouldn't be surprised if Swaim's season is over.  Swaim has 26 catches for 242 yards and one touchdown after catching 11 balls 2015-2017.
report: Cowboys TE Geoff Swaim will undergo surgery for a broken wrist and is out for Week 12 against the Redskins.

impact: Beasley was questionable for Week 3 with the same injury but still suited up. He recorded three catches for 46 yards. With Dallas' offense continuing to sink and feature 5-6 receivers to no avail, Beasley should be off fantasy radars until further notice.
report: Cole Beasley (ankle) is questionable for Week 4 against the Lions.

impact: Beasley also played through his ankle injury last week. His status was never in much doubt. Beasley isn't on the Week 4 fantasy radar.
report: Cole Beasley (questionable, ankle) is expected to play in Week 4 against the Lions.

impact: Beasley was non-existent in the first half (one catch for 12 yards), but he fared much better after the break. He made a clutch grab on third-and-long in the third quarter, setting Dallas up with a fourth-and-one opportunity at the three-yard line, which Ezekiel Elliott converted for a first down. Beasley has drawn five or fewer targets in three of four games this year and with Dallas committing to a run-first offense, his workload is unlikely to increase. He shouldn’t be in any fantasy lineups for next week’s Sunday night matchup against Houston.
report: Cole Beasley brought in four catches for 55 yards on five targets Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 4 win over Detroit.

impact: Beasley has been playing through his ankle injury the last few weeks. He's not going to get in many practice reps but his Week 5 status isn't in doubt.
report: Cole Beasley (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Beasley has been bothered by an ankle injury for a few weeks now, though it hasn't cost him any game action yet. He should be out there Sunday night at Houston, though his fantasy prospects for that game are minimal at best.
report: Cole Beasley (ankle) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Beasley didn’t have a catch going into overtime. His three targets were behind Ezekiel Elliott and Deonte Thompson. Even as the Cowboys' No. 1 wideout, Beasley remains well off the fantasy radar.
report: Cole Beasley caught one pass for eight yards in Week 5 against  the Texans.

impact: The first of Beasley's two touchdowns came on a play where he was left inexplicably wide open, taking it to the house for a 17-yard score in the second quarter. He followed that up with a nine-yarder just before halftime. Sunday's breakout ended a 12-game touchdown drought for Beasley. It was also the 29-year-old's first 100-yard receiving game in almost three years. Despite his success against Jacksonville, Beasley won't be of much fantasy interest next week at Washington.
report: Cole Beasley racked up nine catches for 101 yards and two touchdowns on 11 targets Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 6 victory over the Jaguars.

impact: Beasley came crashing back to Earth following his outta-nowhere 9/101/2 performance against the Jaguars last week, catching his typical seven passes for a median amount of yards versus the Redskins. He reverted back into a possession receiver used strictly over the middle or near the sidelines, helping move the ball rather than erupt for explosive over-the-top plays. Expect a similar performance once the Cowboys return and face the Titans following next week's bye.
report: Cole Beasley recorded seven receptions on a team-high eight targets for 56 yards in the Cowboys' Week 7 heart-breaking loss to the Redskins.

impact: Beasley didn't see his first target until there was less than five minutes left in the game; he also threw a pass to Dak Prescott that was a hilarious fail in the red zone.  In Amari Cooper's debut with the team, Beasley went back to No. 3 duties as the slot man, playing fewer snaps than both Cooper and Michael Gallup.  Beasley will have popup games that will be totally unpredictable.
report: Cole Beasley caught 3-of-4 targets for 16 yards in the Cowboys' Week 9 loss to the Titans.

impact: Beasley continued to see fewer snaps than Michael Gallup, but his five targets were second behind Amari Cooper. This was one of his better games of the year. Beasley won't be a streaming option despite a plus Week 11 matchup with the Falcons.
report: Cole Beasley caught 4-of-5 targets for 37 yards in Week 10 against the Eagles.

impact: Beasley's seven targets were second on the team to Ezekiel Elliott's eight.  Beasley committed an unusual drop in the end zone in the first half, botching a should-be four-yard touchdown.  This was still his best day since the Amari Cooper trade.  Beasley will be a WR4/5 for Week 12 vs. Washington.
report: Cole Beasley caught 5-of-7 targets for 51 yards in the Cowboys' Week 11 win over the Falcons.

impact: Since the acquisition of Amari Cooper, Beasley has just 13 grabs for 109 scoreless yards in four games.  Beasley has taken a big step back and is no longer worth rostering in redraft formats ahead of Week 13 against the Saints.
report: Cole Beasley caught 1-of-2 targets for five yards in the Cowboys' Week 12 win over the Redskins.

impact: One of Beasley's catches was a huge fourth quarter first down that was actually just a miserably-bad spot. The Saints were out of challenges. Beasley's already limited fantasy value has been fading to black since Amari Cooper's arrival.
report: Cole Beasley caught 2-of-3 targets for nine yards in the Cowboys' Week 13 win over the Saints.

impact: Beasley was injured late in Thursday night's win. The Cowboys have a mini-bye, but Beasley is looking at a potential multi-game absence. Amari Cooper and Michael Gallup's will see increased target shares if Beasley misses time.
report: Cole Beasley suffered a sprained foot in Week 13 against the Saints.

impact: Beasley came away with a sprained foot in Week 13 but is optimistic about his status for Sunday's game against Philadelphia. "They kind of worried me more than I was worried myself," said Beasley in reference to the Cowboys' medical staff. "But I'll be fine." The seventh-year slot receiver was listed as a limited participant at Wednesday's practice.
report: Cole Beasley (foot) said he could "play today" if he had to.

impact: EVP Stephen Jones said Austin would receive "a dozen to two dozen" touches per game immediately after acquiring him. That was a real quote. We assume that statement was an anagram for "one carry and no targets." Cole Beasley is currently the Cowboys' leading receiver after hauling in 7-of-8 targets for 73 yards Sunday.
report: Tavon Austin rushed one time for one yard in the Cowboys' Week 1 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Austin burned the Giants for a 64-yard TD on the third play of the night. He had one catch after that, but added 15 yards on a reverse. Austin's touchdown was his first since 2016. Despite the big game, Austin should remain limited to a gadget role moving forward.
report: Tavon Austin caught two passes for 79 yards and a touchdown in Week 2 against the Giants.

impact: Incredibly, Austin has been on the receiving end of both of Dak Prescott's touchdown passes this year. Of course, we use the word "pass" very loosely as Prescott merely underhanded it to Austin for a three-yard pickup during garbage time. The 28-year-old has speed for days and can still be an entertaining gadget player, though he remains miles away from fantasy relevance.
report: Tavon Austin delivered three catches for two yards and a touchdown while gaining 18 yards on his lone carry Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 3 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Austin came down hard after dropping what should have been a touchdown early in the second quarter. That drop was his only target prior to exiting. Austin's injury shouldn't have much impact on fantasy owners.
report: Tavon Austin left Sunday's Week 4 game against the Lions with a right shoulder injury and is questionable to return.

impact: He was in and out of the game after coming down with a first-half shoulder injury. Austin seems to be okay, though obviously he wasn’t a factor on Sunday. The 28-year-old beat Darius Slay down the field on his lone target but dropped what should have been a relatively easy touchdown. Six years into his career, Austin still doesn’t have a real position. He’ll break off a big play here and there, but he’s not someone fantasy owners can count on for consistent production.
report: Tavon Austin failed to haul in his only target while adding a single carry for seven yards Sunday in Dallas’ Week 4 win over the Lions.

impact: Austin was having a quiet night before making a 44-yard catch on a broken play late in the fourth quarter. He had three targets, but dropped a pass that led to one of Dak Prescott’s interceptions. Austin can continue to be ignored in fantasy leagues.
report: Tavon Austin caught one pass for 44 yards in Week 5 against the Texans.

impact: Austin suffered a groin injury at the end of a third-quarter run and never returned. He is questionable for Week 7.
report: Tavon Austin corralled his only target for a five-yard gain while adding a pair of carries for 14 yards Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 6 win over the Jags.

impact: Jones hinted Austin is dealing with a multi-week injury. Austin did not have much fantasy value of his own, but his absence could solidify Michael Gallup's snap share.
report: Jerry Jones said Tavon Austin (groin) is "not looking good" for Week 7.

impact: There could be a distinct lack of Cowboys jet sweeps against the Redskins.
report: Tavon Austin (groin) is out for Week 7.

impact: Perhaps the most surprising development for the Cowboys is that rookie TE Dalton Schultz isn't among the team's inactives for the first time all year. Dallas will therefore enter Sunday with four active tight ends (Geoff Swaim, Blake Jarwin, Rico Gathers, Schultz). Ross is among the only noteworthy players missing on the Cowboys' D-line.
report: Cowboys declare WR Tavon Austin, QB Mike White, LB Joe Thomas, OL Xavier Su'a-Filo, DE Daniel Ross, LB Chris Covington, and DT Caraun Reid inactive for Week 7 against the Redskins.

impact: Five of the eight are injured.  Austin remains sidelined with a groin issue.
report: Cowboys declared WR Tavon Austin, QB Mike White, LB Sean Lee, DE Daniel Ross, DT David Irving, DE Taco Charlton, and DT Antwaun Woods inactive for Week 11 against the Falcons.

impact: Gerald Everett also got his first catch of the season in this one, taking a late target 17 yards. Despite Sean McVay's history, the tight end position has simply not been a focal point of the Rams' passing game. Neither player is worth rostering in redraft formats.
report: Tyler Higbee hauled in 1-of-2 targets for three yards and a touchdown in the Rams' Week 2 win over the Cardinals.

impact: The Rams other tight end Gerald Everett also had two targets against the Chargers. Higbee found the end zone last week against the Cardinals, but he's not worthy of a roster spot with just four targets on the year. Sean McVay will continue to ride Gurley, Cooks, Woods, and Kupp.
report: Tyler Higbee caught both of his targets for 35 yards in the Rams' Week 3 win over the Chargers.

impact: Higbee returned to practice Friday, putting him on track to play this week. He's not on the Week 5 streaming radar.
report: Tyler Higbee (knee) is questionable for Week 5 against the Seahawks.

impact: Higbee only practiced once this week, but he will give it a go on a bad knee. The Rams do not use their tight ends enough for Higbee to have any fantasy value. Los Angeles declared K Greg Zuerlein, KR/PR JoJo Natson, RB John Kelly, OLB Trevon Young, DT Sebastian Joseph-Day, and DT Tanzel Smart inactive for Week 5.
report: Rams TE Tyler Higbee (knee) is active for Week 5 against the Seahawks.

impact: One of Higbee's catches bounced off Cooper Kupp and into his hands for a 17-yard gain. He added another grab in the second quarter, but Gerald Everett was the tight end of choice in the second half. Normally the Rams do not heavily utilize Higbee's position, but that could change with both Brandin Cooks and Kupp dealing with concussions. Even so, Higbee is not even a good desperation option in standard formats.
report: Tyler Higbee hauled in 2-of-4 targets for 26 yards in the Rams' Week 5 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Higbee is not usually a big part of the offense, but he opened this game with a big 33-yard gain to help set up the Rams’ first touchdown. He almost came up with another big play on the opening drive of the second half, but he dropped what should have been a touchdown. Despite the solid outing, Higbee is not a fantasy option.
report: Tyler Higbee caught 2-of-4 targets for 40 yards in the Rams' Week 9 loss to the Saints.

impact: Higbee has suddenly cleared three targets and 25 yards in back-to-back games. It might actually remain a theme if Cooper Kupp (knee) is facing an extended absence. Higbee will have dart throw TE2 appeal for Week 11 against the Chiefs.
report: Tyler Higbee caught 3-of-3 targets for 25 yards and a touchdown in the Rams' Week 10 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Higbee set new season-highs across the board, and his 63 yards were the second-most of his three-year career while the six grabs are the new high bar for him.  He and Gerald Everett combined to see 11 targets, turning them into a 9-112-2 line.  Josh Reynolds went 6-80-1 on eight looks.  All three performed exceptionally well in the absence of Cooper Kupp (knee), but it'll be difficult to really pin down who will benefit week to week.  Reynolds and Everett are higher on the add list at the moment with the Rams going on bye before Week 13 in Detroit.
report: Tyler Higbee caught 6-of-7 targets for 63 yards in the Rams' Week 11 win over the Chiefs.

impact: Keke Coutee is also active after being a game-time decision. Inactive for Houston are WR Vyncint Smith, CB Aaron Colvin, LB Brian Peters, DE Christian Covington, OT David Sharpe, DE Carlos Watkins, and LB Daeshon Hall
report: Will Fuller (hamstring) is active for Week 5 against the Cowboys.

impact: It was the first time Fuller was held under 100 yards in a game he wasn't injured in this season. Fuller came into Sunday night questionable with a hamstring setback, so he may not have been 100 percent. This should go down as one of Fuller's worst games. Fuller gets a matchup with Buffalo in Week 6.
report: Will Fuller caught 2-of-3 passes for 15 yards in Week 5 against Dallas.

impact: The Texans have been listing Fuller with a hamstring injury for weeks, though he hasn't missed a game since the opener. Fuller got off to a booming start with 100-plus yards in each of his first two games this year but has slowed down the past two weeks, totaling just six catches for 64 yards during that span. He'll be a WR2/3 for Sunday's home matchup against Buffalo.
report: Will Fuller (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Fuller will play, but it is unclear how healthy he is. He struggled in Week 5 as Keke Coutee once again soaked up targets. Fuller is on the WR2/3 borderline for Week 6.
report: Will Fuller (hamstring) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: It is the second down game in a row for Fuller, who did not have his first catch until the fourth quarter and whose biggest contribution was drawing a DPI deep down the field to set up a game-tying field goal. He should have had a long touchdown before those plays, but Deshaun Watson just missed him. The duo will hit on those plays eventually, but it might not happen next week in Jacksonville. Fuller will be more of a WR3 in that spot.
report: Will Fuller hauled in 2-of-3 targets for 33 yards in the Texans' Week 6 win over the Bills.

impact: Fuller was listed with a hip injury after dealing with hamstring issues the last few weeks. This doesn't look like a concern for his Week 7 status.
report: Will Fuller (hip) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The Texans have been managing Fuller's practice reps all season. He's been quiet since the arrival of rookie Keke Coutee and could be in for another slow week against Jacksonville's elite secondary.
report: Will Fuller (hip) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Fuller was limited at all three practices this week, though there was never much concern about his status for Week 7. In a tough road matchup, Fuller is best viewed as a low-end WR3.
report: Will Fuller (hip) wasn't listed on the Texans' final injury report for Week 7 against the Jaguars.

impact: Fuller led the team in receiving and tied DeAndre Hopkins for the team lead in targets, a good sign after Fuller spent the last two weeks effectively running wind sprints as a decoy with three targets in each game. Hopefully, finally over his longstanding hamstring injury, Fuller should resume WR2/3 treatment when the Texans face the Dolphins on Thursday Night Football next. Keke Coutee (hamstring) won’t play, freeing up a few extra targets for Fuller.
report: Will Fuller caught 6-of-8 targets for 68 yards in the Texans’ Week 7 win over the Jaguars.

impact: It's notable for Week 8 because Coutee is not expected to play after aggravating his hamstring in last week's win.  Whereas Fuller has finished below 70 yards in each of Coutee’s four appearances, Fuller’s stat lines with Coutee on the shelf are 8/113/1 and 5/101/1. Fuller also led the Texans in Week 7 receiving yards as Coutee didn't play the full game.  You can read more stats and analysis like this in Evan Silva's Dolphins-Texans writeup at the link below.
report: Will Fuller has significant production splits with and without Keke Coutee on the field.

impact: Fuller should be close to 100 percent after playing through a hip injury last week. With Keke Coutee (hamstring) sidelined and DeAndre Hoping getting shadowed by Xavien Howard, Fuller has a great Week 8 matchup.
report: Will Fuller (hip) isn't listed on the Week 8 injury report.

impact: Fuller was injured on a fourth quarter play where he was getting mugged in the end zone. Fuller went down and immediately massaged his knee. He was helped to the sideline and quickly ruled out. The Texans were routing the Dolphins at the time, but a quick rule out is never a good sign, especially for a player with Fuller's injury history. Fuller had feasted before going down, catching 5-of-6 targets for 124 yards and a 73-yard touchdown. Hilariously, Fuller was left wide open on his score when Bobby McCain incorrectly thought he had safety help.
report: Will Fuller was forced from Thursday's game against the Dolphins with a right knee injury and will not return.

impact: Friday testing will confirm, but it certainly appears Fuller's age-24 campaign is over. It's a crushing blow to a Texans offense that has flirted with dominate at times this season. When healthy, Fuller has lid-lifting speed that few can match, clearing space for DeAndre Hopkins. If Fuller is indeed done, rookie Keke Coutee will have to carry an enormous load opposite Hopkins. Fuller is a special talent, but it is possible he heads into 2019 having appeared in just 31-of-48 possible career games.
report: The Houston Chronicle reports the Texans fear Will Fuller suffered a torn right ACL in Thursday's win over the Dolphins.

impact: Just brutal.  Fuller exploded for a 5-124-1 night against the Dolphins before tearing the ACL on a deep shot late in the blowout win.  The Texans are now headed into a mini-bye and need to figure out their receiving corps.  Keke Coutee (hamstring) wasn't close to playing Thursday night.  Bruce Ellington (hamstring) remains on I.R. and can't return until Week 12 at the earliest.  Vyncint Smith was next man up against Miami, playing eight late snaps.  He's the in-house favorite for the No. 2 role at the moment, but Houston will almost certainly add some help.
report: Coach Bill O'Brien confirmed Will Fuller suffered a torn ACL in the Week 8 win over the Dolphins and is done for the season.

impact: Fuller will be sidelined 6-9 months. His timetable has him returning at some point in training camp if he avoids setbacks. Fuller has been one of the most injury prone wideouts in the league the last three seasons, playing in 31-of-48 career games. The Texans will need to make a decision on his fifth-year option this offseason.
report: Will Fuller (knee) will undergo surgery this week.

impact: The Rams' tight ends are not usually involved in the offense, but that changed after both Brandin Cooks and Cooper Kupp left this game with concussions. Everett recorded all of his catches after Cooks left the game, and two of them came with Kupp out. He was also tackled at the one in the third quarter. If Cooks and Kupp are forced to sit, he could be a streaming option in deep two-tight end formats.
report: Gerald Everett hauled in all three of his targets for 24 yards in the Rams' Week 5 win over the Seahawks.

impact: The Rams do not utilize their tight ends much, but both Everett and Tyler Higbee had solid games. Everett caught two passes to help set up a field goal just before halftime, and he converted a two-pointer to tie the game in the fourth quarter. This was Everett's first game with more than 25 yards this season. He is still only rosterable in Dynasty formats.
report: Gerald Everett hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 48 yards and a two-point conversion in the Rams' Week 9 loss to the Saints.

impact: The score was Everett's first of the year after he posted a season-high 48 yards in Week 9. He was actually out-produced by Tyler Higbee against the Seahawks. With Cooper Kupp (knee) potentially lost for the season, but Rams tight ends could be staring at bigger usage down the stretch.
report: Gerald Everett caught 2-of-2 targets for 15 yards and a touchdown in the Rams' Week 10 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Everett now has three touchdowns and a two-point conversion over his last three games and is seeing increased reps in the absence of Cooper Kupp, who is out for the year with a torn ACL.  Everett scored a seven-yard touchdown midway through the fourth quarter to put the Rams up 47-44, and then he caught a 40-yard bomb down the right sideline less than eight minutes later to put the Rams back on top 54-51.  His four targets were fifth on the team, but he's become a red-zone presence and will be a fringe TE1 streamer Week 13 at the Lions after the bye.
report: Gerald Everett caught 3-of-4 targets for 49 yards and two touchdowns in the Rams' Week 11 win over the Chiefs.

impact: It's the last thing the Texans' top-heavy receiver corps needs. Although not effective, Ellington had already soaked up 131 snaps this season. That's despite leaving after just three in Week 3. The Texans really need rookie slot man Keke Coutee (hamstring) to get healthy. Ellington will be a candidate to return after eight weeks.
report: Texans placed WR Bruce Ellington on injured reserve with a hamstring injury.

impact: Ellington (again) pulled his hamstring in Week 3 and was eligible to return in Week 12.  With the addition of Demaryius Thomas and Keke Coutee coming back from a hammy issue of his own, Houston no longer needs Ellington.  Still 27, he could draw some looks from receiver-needy clubs.
report: Texans waived WR Bruce Ellington with an injury settlement.

impact: Ellington was released from Houston with an injury settlement. Detroit has been looking at veteran slot options after trading Golden Tate, also visiting with Jeremy Kerley. 27-year-old Ellington is a good bet to resurface over the next few weeks.
report: Free agent Bruce Ellington worked out for the Lions.

impact: The Lions must not have liked what they saw out of T.J. Jones in Week 9. Another rumored Golden Tate replacement in the slot, Brandon Powell, didn't play a snap on offense against the Vikings. A fifth-year pro, Ellington caught a career-high 29 passes for the Texans last season. He had eight grabs in three games this year. He will not be PPR relevant in Detroit.
report: Lions signed WR Bruce Ellington.

impact: Signed earlier this month, this will be Ellington's first game action with his new team. With Golden Tate now in Philadelphia and Marvin Jones (knee) out, Ellington could end up with a surprising target total. He is a name to watch in deeper leagues.
report: Lions WR Bruce Ellington is active for Week 11 against the Panthers.

impact: Active for the first time as a Lion, Ellington was involved early, catching two passes in the first quarter, but that was it for him in the first half. He took a big hit to the back on a target just before halftime, but he returned following the break. He started fast again following the half, catching two quick passes including a nice 21 yarder to help set up a field goal, and he finished the game second on the team in targets. With Marvin Jones’ availability uncertain, Ellington could have a big role on Thanksgiving against the Bears. He is worth a look in deeper leagues.
report: Bruce Ellington hauled in 6-of-9 targets for 52 yards in the Lions' Week 11 win over the Panthers.

impact: Making his Lions debut last week, Ellington caught 6-of-9 targets for 52 yards and played 51% of the snaps.  He practiced on a limited basis all week and should be fine for Thursday.  Ellington is a WR4 in PPR leagues.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) is questionable for Week 12 against the Bears.

impact: With Marvin Jones and Kerryon Johnson on the inactive list, the Lions need as much help as they can get on offense. Coming off a nine target game against the Panthers, Ellington will be a volume-based WR4 despite a tough matchup. In addition to Jones and Johnson, the Lions declared LB Jalen Reeves-Maybin, CB Teez Tabor, DE Kerry Hyder, OT Andrew Donnal, and WR Brandon Powell inactive for Week 12.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) is active for Week 12 against the Bears.

impact: For some reason, Ellington also added a two-yard rush. Ellington now has 12 catches on 16 targets in two games as a Lions. We suppose that will play in PPR for Week 13 against the Rams if Marvin Jones (knee) can't get cleared.
report: Bruce Ellington caught 6-of-7 targets for 28 yards in the Lions' Week 12 loss to the Bears.

impact: Ellington appeared healthy in last week's loss to Chicago, so his limited activity Wednesday may have been for maintenance purposes. With Golden Tate gone and Marvin Jones (knee) on I.R., the fifth-year slot receiver should see a heavy workload down the stretch. He's already drawn 16 targets in only two games since joining the Lions earlier this month.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ellington played through the same injury last week, so we're not worried about his status for Week 13. He'll be needed down the stretch with Marvin Jones (knee) out for the season.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ellington fought through the same injury last week, hauling in 6-of-7 targets for 28 yards. He's already drawn 16 targets in just two games with the Lions and remains a high-floor/low-ceiling option in the slot against the Rams this week.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) is questionable for Week 13 against the Rams.

impact: Ellington will play through his back injury. He should see a heavy workload with Detroit short-handed at wide receiver. LB Trevor Bates, FB Nick Bellore, DE Kerry Hyder, RB Kerryon Johnson, WR Brandon Powell, TE Michael Roberts and CB Teez Tabor round out Detroit's inactives for Sunday.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) is active for Week 13 against the Rams.

impact: He also threw an incomplete pass. Working as the Lions' slot receiver—a role once occupied by target monster Golden Tate—Ellington again saw huge usage but did nothing with it. The fifth-year vet has logged 19 catches in three games since joining the Lions last month but somehow has just 115 yards to show for it. Ellington's volume keeps him in play as a cheap DFS lineup-filler, though he shouldn't be counted on in season-long leagues. The Lions are in Arizona next week.
report: Bruce Ellington absorbed seven-of-10 targets for 35 yards Sunday in the Lions’ Week 13 loss to Los Angeles.

impact: Ellington was listed with the same injury and played his usual snaps. Taking over the Golden Tate as the Lions' main slot receiver, Ellington has drawn 26 targets over his last three games, though he's managed just 115 yards on 19 catches during that span (6.1 yards per reception). His use is strictly limited to PPR leagues.
report: Bruce Ellington (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Herndon contributed two big plays; a 24-yard gain and a 32-yard touchdown where Sam Darnold easily found him en route to a pay dirt on a beautiful play design by OC Jeremy Bates.  The Jets' tight end situation could become worth monitoring if Quincy Enunwa's ankle injury costs him significant time.
report: Jets rookie TE Chris Herndon caught 2-of-2 targets for 56 yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Colts.

impact: Herndon is emerging as one Sam Darnold's favorite targets with touchdowns in back-to-back games.  He nearly had a second score on Sunday, but it was called back as Herndon stepped out of bounds just before reaching the pylon.  Herndon is very much a streaming option moving forward at a weak tight end position.  The Jets will travel to face the Bears in Week 8.
report: Chris Herndon caught 4-of-7 targets for 42 yards and one touchdown in the Jets' Week 7 loss to the Vikings.

impact: He finished with two targets. There wasn't much opportunity for Herndon in a game Sam Darnold completed 14 passes, but he managed to find the end-zone for the third game in a row. With Robby Anderson and Quincy Enunwa dealing with ankle injuries, Herndon is worth a TE2 flyer.
report: Chris Herndon caught a 16-yard touchdown in Week 8 against Chicago.

impact: Herndon was one of the rare bright spots for the Jets in the first half. His 28-yard catch was the longest play of the half by either team, and he added two more grabs to bring his halftime yardage total to 41. Unfortunately, the Jets appeared to forget about Herndon in the second half, and his only catch after the break came on the failed final drive. This was the first time since Week 5 he did not score, but he still managed a solid game. Herndon will be a last-gasp streaming option next week against the Bills.
report: Chris Herndon hauled in all four of his targets for 62 yards in the Jets' Week 9 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Josh McCown pathetically managed 4.0 yards per attempt and 135 passing yards overall, ensuring no one in the Jets' passing game had a good Week 10 box score.  Herndon has led the team in receiving yards in consecutive weeks, however.  He will stay on the low-end streamer radar after New York's Week 11 bye.
report: Chris Herndon caught 3-of-4 targets for 34 yards in the Jets' Week 10 loss to the Bills.

impact: The targets and catches were both new season highs while the yards were Herndon's second most. He's averaging five looks over his past three games. That's enough to keep Herndon in the mid-range TE2 mix going forward.
report: Chris Herndon caught 7-of-8 targets for 57 yards in the Jets' Week 12 loss to the Patriots.

impact: His six targets were second on the team, but Josh McCown threw for just 128 yards.  Herndon hasn't scored since Week 8.  He's a bottom-barrel TE2.
report: Chris Herndon caught 2-of-6 targets for 31 yards in the Jets' Week 13 loss to the Titans.

impact: Hopkins was the only reliable part of the Texans' attack on Sunday. Even with Deshaun Watson struggling behind an overmatched offensive line, he comfortably won his battle with Tre'Davious White. He drew two holding penalties on the young corner in the first half, and he out-muscled him for his touchdown in the first quarter. He slowed down with the rest of the offense in the second half, but he did chip in a 24-yard catch after the break. Hopkins faces a tough matchup with the Jaguars next week, but he is a must-start option no matter the matchup.
report: DeAndre Hopkins hauled in 5-of-6 targets for 63 yards and a touchdown in the Texans' Week 6 win over the Bills.

impact: Hopkins hasn't practiced fully in weeks. He's in no danger of sitting out Sunday's game.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It's likely just a form of rep management, though DNPs always need to be taken seriously. Hopkins also had by far his quietest game of the season in Week 7. His Friday status will be key. Provided Hopkins does play, he will be hobbled and squaring off with Jalen Ramsey. He's shaping up as a back-end WR1 for Week 7.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) was downgraded to "DNP" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Hopkins worried us a little with Thursday's DNP, though it looks like he was just getting a maintenance day. Nuk draws a tough matchup against Jalen Ramsey this week, though obviously benching him in season-long leagues is not an option.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) wasn't listed on the Texans' final injury report for Week 7 against the Jaguars.

impact: As expected.  Hopkins missed practice time with a foot injury this week, but he was not listed on the final injury report.  The Texans' Week 7 inactives are WR Vyncint Smith, CB Aaron Colvin, TE Ryan Griffin, DE Joel Heath, OG Zach Fulton, LB Brian Peters, and CB Shareece Wright.
report: DeAndre Hopkins is active for Week 7 against the Jaguars.

impact: Hopkins scored an early touchdown, and that was about all the Texans needed to take down the Jags in a smooth-sailing 20-7 victory. Hopkins has eight or more targets in 7-of-7 games. A matchup-agnostic WR1, Hopkins can expect to tangle with Xavien Howard’s shadow coverage on Thursday Night Football next.
report: DeAndre Hopkins caught 3-of-8 targets for 50 yards and a touchdown in the Texans’ Week 7 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Hopkins was limited in practice all week, but his status was never in doubt. Even with Hopkins facing shadow coverage from Xavien Howard, he remains a locked-in WR1.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) was removed from the Week 8 injury report.

impact: It was an easy night at the office for Hopkins and company. The superstar wideout was left completely uncovered on his 49-yard touchdown to begin the fourth quarter. He literally had time to stop and wait for the ball before taking it untouched to the end zone. Score No. 2 came later in the period against Xavien Howard. Hopkins got free and corralled a perfectly thrown two-yarder near the back line. Hopkins and Howard exchanged words during the week. Hopkins got the final word, though is worth noting that he lost a long reception to OPI. The dubious call negated a bonkers one-handed catch. Look up the replay. The Broncos are on deck for Week 9. If Will Fuller (knee) is sidelined, 10 targets will be Hopkins' bare minimum in Denver.
report: DeAndre Hopkins caught 6-of-7 targets for 82 yards and two touchdowns in the Texans' Week 8 win over the Dolphins.

impact: It's maintenance for Hopkins, who's been listed with his foot injury since Week 6. Hopkins is a locked-in WR1 for Sunday's matchup with Denver.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Hopkins is almost always limited at practice but never misses games. He'll be a top-shelf receiver play Sunday against Denver.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Nuk is good to go after getting in a limited week of practice. With Keke Coutee (hamstring) questionable and Demaryius Thomas new to the offense after arriving at Tuesday's trade deadline, Hopkins should see as many targets as he can handle against Denver. He's an elite WR1 for Week 9.
report: DeAndre Hopkins (foot) wasn't listed on the Texans' final injury report for Week 9 against the Broncos.

impact: A 50% target share is unfathomable, but with Will Fuller (torn ACL) and Keke Coutee (hamstring) unavailable, Deshaun Watson foreseeably honed-in on Hopkins on half of his passing attempts. It's the third time this season Hopkins has seen at least 12 targets, and the sixth time he's recorded double-digit looks. No other receiver, including newcomer Demaryius Thomas, saw more than three targets on the day. Coutee will likely be healthy after the team's Week 10 bye, but if he misses further action, Hopkins' usage and apparently untapped ceiling are something to keep in mind. He's an elite matchup-proof WR1 regardless.
report: DeAndre Hopkins caught 10-of-12 targets for 105 yards and one touchdown in the Texans' Week 9 victory over the Broncos.

impact: The Texans completed only 16 passes as a team and Deshaun Watson threw for just 208 yards, so Hopkins' fantasy owners were lucky to come away with this productive a stat line.  Hopkins was shadowed by Josh Norman for most of the game.  He will get a softer Week 12 matchup on Monday Night Football against Titans perimeter CBs Adoree Jackson and Malcolm Butler.
report: DeAndre Hopkins caught 5-of-6 targets for 56 yards and a touchdown in the Texans' Week 11 win over the Redskins.

impact: Hopkins came into Monday night having registered 100 yards and/or one touchdown in seven-straight games and 8-of-10 times on the year.  His six targets still led the team on a night Deshaun Watson again attempted fewer than 25 passes.  Watson has attempted 25-or-fewer passes in six-straight games.  Hopkins was the target on a deep ball into the end zone from 47 yards out, but Adoree Jackson covered it well.  Demaryius Thomas was the red-zone beneficiary tonight with 12- and 10-yard scores.  Hopkins will get Denzel Ward of the Browns next week.
report: DeAndre Hopkins caught 5-of-6 targets for 74 yards in the Texans' 34-17, Week 12 win over the Titans on Monday night.

impact: Hopkins was once again the most-targeted player in the Houston passing game, turning in his typical game of making contested catches with multiple toe-dragging receptions. Hopkins has now cleared 100-yards just once over his past seven games, but remains a high-end WR1 option in Week 14 at home against the Colts.
report: DeAndre Hopkins caught 7-of-12 targets for 91 yards in Sunday's Week 13 win over the Browns.

impact: Andrews got his day started with a 30-yard catch in the first quarter in which he hurdled a defender, and he had another long catch in the third. Andrews is not getting enough work in the Ravens' tight end committee, but he could become a fantasy option if that changes.
report: Mark Andrews caught 2-of-3 targets for 59 yards in the Ravens' Week 3 win over the Broncos.

impact: Andrews led all Ravens tight ends with five targets, but fellow rookie Hayden Hurst caught a late garbage-time touchdown from Lamar Jackson.  Andrews is a bottom-barrel TE2 heading into Week 9 against the Steelers.
report: Mark Andrews caught 4-of-5 targets for 31 yards in the Ravens' Week 8 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Even with Hayden Hurst back from injury, Andrews has kept his role. The former Oklahoma Sooner—and college teammate of Baker Mayfield—has now drawn 11 targets over his last two contests. He's not quite on the streaming radar yet, but perhaps he'll get there by the end of the season.
report: Mark Andrews collected three catches for 50 yards on six targets Sunday in Baltimore’s Week 9 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Andrews made the most of his one target, producing the Ravens' longest play of the season with a 74-yard grab on a deep bomb from Lamar Jackson early in the second quarter. The third-round rookie has quietly emerged as Baltimore's top receiving tight end, though the former Oklahoma Sooner remains well off the fantasy radar. Andrews and the Ravens will take a two-game winning streak into next week's matchup with the struggling Falcons.
report: Mark Andrews converted his lone target for a 74-yard gain Sunday in the Ravens’ Week 12 victory over Oakland.

impact: The No. 86 overall pick has emerged as the top dog of the Ravens' pass-catching tight ends, but it is not translating to fantasy value. He will remain off the re-draft radar for the remainder of 2018.
report: Mark Andrews caught 3-of-3 targets for 47 yards in the Ravens' Week 13 win over the Falcons.

impact: Hurst is hoping to make his NFL debut Sunday night against Pittsburgh after sitting out the first three games with a stress fracture in his foot. In his absence, the Ravens have used a committee approach at tight end, allotting snaps to Maxx Williams, Nick Boyle and third-round rookie Mark Andrews.
report: Ravens TE Hayden Hurst (foot) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Hurst is trending in the right direction but it may be another week before the Ravens deem him game-ready. Even if he does suit up, it will be hard for fantasy owners to wait out his status with Baltimore playing in the Sunday night game this week. The first-round tight end is coming back from foot surgery.
report: Ravens TE Hayden Hurst (foot) is questionable for Week 4 against the Steelers.

impact: Hurst returned to practice this week but he was always a long shot to suit up. The Ravens saw enough from him to list him as questionable, so he has a good chance to return in Week 5.  Also inactive for Baltimore are QB Robert Griffin III, OL Hroniss Grasu, DL Zach Sieler, WR Jordan Lasley, CB Anthony Averett and DT Willie Henry.
report: Ravens TE Hayden Hurst (foot) is inactive for Week 4 against the Steelers.

impact: Hurst resumed practicing last week. The Ravens want to see him out there in full this week. The Ravens need Hurst's pass-catching threat, but he will be returning to a sprawling committee at tight end. He's a name to keep an eye on at an injury-ravaged fantasy position, but he is unlikely to pay immediate dividends.
report: Speaking Monday, Ravens coach John Harbaugh said there's a "good chance" TE Hayden Hurst (foot) makes his NFL debut in Week 5.

impact: Hurst returned to limited practice last week but couldn't get cleared. Coach John Harbaugh said there's a "good chance" he'll make his debut Sunday. Hurst figures to be on a snap count in his first game back.
report: Hayden Hurst (foot) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: So far, Hurst is on the same track he was last week. Hurst could not get cleared to face the Steelers. We should have a good idea of his Week 5 status by Friday. Hurst will immediately enter the TE2 conversation but would not be a recommended streamer against the Browns in his NFL debut.
report: Hayden Hurst (foot) remained limited in Thursday's practice.

impact: Hurst has been practicing on a limited basis the last two weeks. He looks to have a realistic chance at making his debut Sunday. Hurst may be on a snap count, but he's the favorite for targets in Baltimore's tight end committee.
report: Hayden Hurst (foot) is questionable for Week 5 against the Browns.

impact: The rookie is finally ready to debut after missing the first four games of the year while recovering from foot surgery. Hurst is worth rostering at a thin fantasy position but a wait-and-see approach is probably best, especially given how many other tight ends Baltimore employs.
report: Ravens TE Hayden Hurst (questionable, foot) is expected to play Week 5 against the Browns.

impact: The Ravens first-round pick has missed all four games to begin the season recovering from a stress fracture in his foot that he suffered at the end of August. After a promising start to the preseason, Hurst returns to situation that has made the most of their depth chart in his absence. Baltimore tight ends have 24 percent of the team targets on the season and have accounted for 5-of-12 passing targets inside of the 10-yard line this season. Hurst is only a deep play in his first week back in the lineup, but should be added on teams that are thin at the tight end position.
report: Ravens TE Hayden Hurst (foot) is active for Sunday's Week 5 game versus the Browns.

impact: Hurst got in the action early, catching a seven-yard pass on the second drive of the game, but failed to reel in another pass on the day. Tight ends Mark Andrews (three targets) and Nick Boyle (two) each were involved as much as Hurst. This is likely going to be a frustrating split for the short term until Hurst claims a grasp on the job, leaving him as a TE2 Week 6 against the Titans.
report: Hayden Hurst caught 1-of-2 targets for seven yards in Sunday's Week 5 loss to the Browns.

impact: "He was knocking a little bit of rust off last week, and then, man I was excited, because he practiced really well (Wednesday)," Mornhinweg said. Mornhinweg characterized Hurst as "on the rise." Hurst played just 21-of-87 snaps in his Week 5 debut. He might need to double that number before becoming a legitimate TE2.
report: Ravens OC Marty Mornhinweg talked up Hayden Hurst on Thursday.

impact: Hurst has just one catch on five targets since returning from a foot injury in Week 5. "He’s a first-round pick, talented guy. He’s practicing really well. He’s a rookie –- that’s the other side of it -- and he missed a significant portion," Harbaugh said of Hurst's slow start. "It’s important for us to have him rolling in our offense." Hurst is not a usable fantasy option right now, but he is a stash in Dynasty leagues and deep TE premium formats.
report: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said it is "important" to get first-round TE Hayden Hurst "involved going forward."

impact: This could maybe be construed as a revenge game for Hurst, who spent two years in the Pittsburgh Pirates organization before reigniting his football career at South Carolina. Obviously that narrative, though fascinating, had no bearing on Sunday's outcome. With Baltimore's offense falling apart at the seams, the first-round rookie can't be counted on for fantasy purposes.
report: Hayden Hurst finished with one catch for 21 yards on two targets Sunday in the Ravens’ Week 9 loss to the Steelers.

impact: The rotational rookie has no fantasy value in Baltimore's run-first attack.
report: Hayden Hurst was held catch-less in the Ravens' Week 11 win.

impact: He logged a career-high in targets despite being in on just 19 of the Ravens' 70 offensive snaps. That was one more than fellow rookie Mark Andrews and 32 fewer than blocking tight end Nick Boyle. The 2018 first-rounder has yet to clear 30 yards receiving in a game this year and won't be a recommended streamer next week, even against the Falcons' anemic secondary.
report: Hayden Hurst compiled three catches for 25 yards on four targets Sunday in Baltimore’s Week 12 victory over the Raiders.

impact: It's another disappointing target share for Gallup after one catch in the season opener. The Cowboys have played Gallup behind journeyman Deonte Thompson despite his strong preseason, and re-signed Brice Butler this week, further muddling their receivers. Gallup remains a strong hold in dynasty, but it may take an injury for Dallas to realize his potential.
report: Michael Gallup caught 1-of-2 targets for five yards in Week 2 against the Giants.

impact: The rookie bobbled a ball that eventually found its way into the hands of Earl Thomas. That was one of two interceptions for Thomas, who may have been auditioning to be Gallup’s teammate in Dallas. Even in a wide-open pass-catching corps, the third-rounder has failed to make a difference. He’s managed just three catches over his first three NFL appearances.
report: Michael Gallup pulled in one-of-four targets for 17 yards Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 3 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Gallup skied over Nevin Lawson for an impressive 37-yard catch in the first quarter. That’s more yards than he had in his previous three games combined. The rookie drew an end-zone target from Dak Prescott later on that same drive but the two couldn’t connect. For all his talent, Gallup has managed to haul in just five-of-12 targets this year. Maybe his day will come but right now, the Colorado State alum is miles off the fantasy radar.
report: Michael Gallup pulled in two catches for 45 yards on five targets Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 4 win over the Lions.

impact: Gallup was a non-factor despite coming off one of his better games. The Cowboys pass offense continues to be a disaster under Dak Prescott this season. Gallup has shown flashes when given touches, but there's been no signs of his role expanding. It's shaping as a lost year for Gallup.
report: Michael Gallup caught 1-of-3 passes for six yards in Week 5 against Houston.

impact: Gallup nearly made a brilliant touchdown catch in double coverage during the first half but he didn't get both of his feet in bounds. The rookie has shown flashes here and there but not enough for him to warrant redraft consideration.
report: Michael Gallup chipped in with one catch for 27 yards on two targets Sunday in Dallas’ Week 6 win over the Jaguars.

impact: With Tavon Austin inactive, Gallup was afforded additional opportunity and delivered with a team- and career-high 81 receiving yards. 49 yards came on a deep-ball over the top in which Gallup simply beat the defense and found himself wide open near the sideline. Dallas' leading receiver seems to rotate weekly, but this is a great development for the rookie in the event Austin misses any further time. The Cowboys are on bye next week.
report: Michael Gallup hauled in 3-of-5 targets for a team-high 81 yards and one score in Dallas' Week 7 loss to the Redskins.

impact: It is a season-high for the rookie a week after he played 81 percent of the offensive snaps. Gallup also set new season marks with three catches for 81 yards and his first touchdown. With Dallas finally committing to him and the passing game showing signs of life, Gallup is suddenly an interesting bench stash even with the Cowboys on bye this week.
report: Michael Gallup played 56-of-66 snaps (85 percent) Week 7 against Washington.

impact: Gallup ran as the clear No. 2 wideout alongside new No. 1 Amari Cooper, and the rookie's six targets were second on the team to Cooper's eight.  Gallup is playing a solid snap share, but this pass offense is one of the worst in the league.  With byes coming to an end, Gallup is WR5 material.
report: Michael Gallup caught 3-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Cowboys' Week 9 loss to the Titans.

impact: Gallup started in three-wide sets over Allen Hurns. His snaps have been up the last couple weeks as the clear No. 2 opposite Amari Cooper. The Cowboys pass offense can't support more than one wideout, but Gallup's dynasty stock is on the rise.
report: Michael Gallup caught 2-of-3 passes for 34 yards in Week 10 against the Eagles.

impact: In three games since the Amari Cooper trade, Gallup has receiving lines of 3-51, 2-34, and 1-10 with no touchdowns.  He's not a redraft fantasy asset.
report: Michael Gallup caught 1-of-5 targets for 10 yards in the Cowboys' Week 11 win over the Falcons.

impact: "We just found out after the ballgame that his brother had committed suicide, and just want to leave it at that," coach Jason Garrett said.  "Obviously a very personal matter.  We’re all behind Michael and supporting him and his family."  No one should be surprised if Gallup misses Thursday's game against the Redskins while addressing more important situations in his and his family's life.
report: Cowboys rookie WR Michael Gallup is away from the team after being informed his brother took his own life.

impact: Informed of his brother's suicide after the Cowboys' win on Sunday, Gallup stayed in Atlanta to be with his family, and he has yet to rejoin the team. Not a soul would question Gallup if he decided to sit out Thursday's game, but the rookie will apparently suit up.
report: The Dallas Morning News' Brandon George reports Michael Gallup plans to play on Thanksgiving.

impact: Gallup was away from the team for a few days following the death of his brother, but flew back to Dallas Tuesday night and was present for the Cowboys' walkthrough on Wednesday. The rookie has been hit or miss this year, securing just 16-of-36 targets for 285 yards and a touchdown. He won't be a viable fantasy option for Thursday's Thanksgiving showdown with Washington.
report: Jon Machota of the Dallas Morning News confirms Michael Gallup will play Week 12 against the Redskins.

impact: Gallup's brother committed suicide on Sunday, but he somehow was able to play today ahead of the funeral on Friday.  His six targets tied Ezekiel Elliott for second on the team.  This offense can really only support Zeke and Amari Cooper.
report: Michael Gallup caught 2-of-6 targets for 19 yards in the Cowboys' Week 12 win over the Redskins.

impact: The 76 yards were Gallup's second most of the season. The rookie should have had an even-bigger night, but Dak Prescott flat missed him on what would have been a guaranteed 55-yard touchdown. Gallup left Eli Apple in the dust with a double move. With some of the pressure removed, Gallup has actually been more productive since Amari Cooper's acquisition. He will have some low-end WR4 appeal for Week 13 against the Eagles.
report: Michael Gallup caught 5-of-7 targets for 76 yards in the Cowboys' Week 13 win over the Saints.

impact: That was a fairly-typical line for Hooper last season. Hooper will have occasional outbursts, but the Falcons' continual red zone woes make him hard to get excited about as a TE2 streamer.
report: Austin Hooper caught 3-of-4 targets for 24 yards in the Falcons' Week 1 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Cornerbacks Brian Poole (ankle) and Isaiah Oliver (ankle) were also limited at Wednesday's session. Hooper looked fine in last week's opener, nabbing three catches for 24 yards over 59 offensive snaps. We anticipate he'll be ready for Week 2 against the Panthers, though the 23-year-old only merits back-end TE2 consideration.
report: Austin Hooper (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Hooper was limited on Wednesday, but he was a full participant the rest of the week. The knee is not a concern, but the matchup and Hooper's track record are. There are better TE2 options.
report: Austin Hooper (knee) was not listed on the final injury report.

impact: The only difference from Hooper's normal day is he caught a touchdown.  Otherwise, the yards and five targets are par for the course for him.  Hooper's score came from eight yards out.  When he scores, he's an obvious fantasy difference-maker, but those touchdowns are hard to predict.  For now, Hooper will remain a TE2 most weeks but has streamer appeal Week 3 against the Saints.
report: Austin Hooper caught all five of his targets for 59 yards and one touchdown in the Falcons' Week 2 win over the Panthers.

impact: It was a quiet afternoon for the Falcons tight end, though he did chip in with a two-point conversion following Tevin Coleman’s touchdown early in the fourth quarter. Hooper has only topped 30 yards once this season and won’t be an appealing streamer against the Bengals in Week 4.
report: Austin Hooper turned in three catches for 23 yards on four targets Sunday in Atlanta’s Week 3 loss to the Saints.

impact: Hooper went for 59 yards and a touchdown in Week 2, but he has predictably scuffled since, catching just four passes for 42 yards in two games. He did have an end-zone target in this game, and that usage makes him a touchdown-or-bust fantasy option.
report: Austin Hooper hauled in 1-of-2 targets for 19 yards in the Falcons' Week 4 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Under constant pressure, Matt Ryan was constantly checking down. That includes a first half "Hail Mary." The receptions were a new personal best while the yards were the third most of Hooper's career. Hooper might actually stay hot for Week 6, where the Falcons host the Bucs. No team has allowed more fantasy points to opposing tight ends.
report: Austin Hooper caught 9-of-12 targets for 77 yards in the Falcons' Week 5 loss to the Steelers.

impact: It is Hooper's second game in a row with nine catches after failing to top seven in any of his first 34 games. His touchdown came on a delay route where he was left wide open in the flat and stiffed armed a corner to the ground on his way into the end zone. He also came up with a big third-down conversion on the Falcons' final drive to help set up a field goal. With Calvin Ridley (ankle) and Mohamed Sanu (hip) questionable, Hooper will be a back-end TE1 next week.
report: Austin Hooper hauled in 9-of-10 targets for 71 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 6 win over the Bucs.

impact: It was a fall back to earth for the tight end after totaling 18 catches for 145 yards and a touchdown the previous two weeks.  Hooper made a big 36-yard catch in this one.  He maybe should have had a 22-yard touchdown as well, but Matt Ryan threw it behind him at the goal line in the first half.  Hooper will remain a TE1 going forward coming out of the bye in Week 9 against the Skins.
report: Austin Hooper caught 3-of-4 targets for 48 yards in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: Hooper has two games of double-digit targets and five or fewer in the other six.  In a crowded Falcons pass-catcher corps, Hooper will remain a high-variance, low-end TE1 open when Atlanta visits Cleveland in Week 10.
report: Austin Hooper caught 3-of-3 targets for 41 yards in Atlanta's Week 9 win at Washington.

impact: After two games where he combined for just seven targets, Hooper drew more than 10 looks for the third five in five contests. Hooper is heavily involved any time Matt Ryan is compelled to check down. Hooper's touchdown came on a broken play fourth down late in the fourth quarter. He will be on the TE1 borderline for Week 11 against the Cowboys.
report: Austin Hooper caught 10-of-11 targets for 56 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 10 loss to the Browns.

impact: He was getting peppered with targets early, seeing seven of his looks in the first half.  Hooper will be a TE1 on Thursday night against the Saints.  Hooper had three grabs for 23 scoreless yards against the Saints in Week 3.
report: Austin Hooper caught 4-of-8 targets for 27 yards in the Falcons' Week 11 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Even though the Falcons were in catchup-mode for three quarters, Hooper's elite on-field usage again returned minimal production. He's undeniably a boom-or-bust usage-based option ROS, with no real way to predict when those booms occur. He's considered a dicey TE1 in Week 13 against Baltimore's dominating secondary.
report: Austin Hooper hauled in all five of his targets for 31 yards in the Falcons' Week 12 loss to the Saints.

impact: Matt Ryan seeded a ball through a tight window for Hooper's one-yard score in the fourth quarter. The touchdown was Hooper's fourth of the season. Reliably catching 4-5 weekly passes, Hooper has settled in as a borderline TE1. Blowup weeks will be rare, but the same is true of zeros. The Falcons are headed to Green Bay for Week 14.
report: Austin Hooper caught 5-of-5 targets for 44 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 13 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Both targets came with Dallas playing from behind in the second half. The fact that Thompson, a 29-year-old, undrafted journeyman, is playing significant snaps shows how desperate the Cowboys are for pass-catching help. Thompson can be left on the waiver wire for next week’s matchup against the Lions.
report: Deonte Thompson nabbed both of his targets for 23 yards Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 3 loss to Seattle.

impact: With Amari Cooper, Michael Gallup, Cole Beasley, and Tavon Austin (when healthy) locked in atop their position, the Cowboys no longer had a need for Deonte Thompson. Special teams standout Noah Brown and WR Lance Lenoir will reportedly be activated and moved to the active roster prior to Sunday. Thompson, a 29-year-old journeyman, will likely find a home as depth soon.
report: Cowboys waived WR Deonte Thompson.

impact: Thompson had an eight game stint in Dallas after spending time in Buffalo last year. He takes the spot of Terrelle Pryor.
report: Bills signed WR Deonte Thompson to a one-year contract.

impact: "Most likely he probably will miss this game," McVay said.  "And then dependent on how he responds it will just kind of be on a week-to-week basis."  The Rams will turn to sophomores Gerald Everett and Josh Reynolds in Kupp's absence.  Both will be deep down the totem pole for targets behind Robert Woods, Brandin Cooks, and Todd Gurley.  Kupp shouldn't miss much time.
report: Coach Sean McVay expects Cooper Kupp (knee) to miss Week 7 against the 49ers.

impact: Kupp's knee injury looked much worse than it was, though he's still dealing with an MCL sprain, which is usually a multi-week injury. The second-year slot man has played well this season but the Rams still have plenty of receiving weapons to surround Jared Goff including Todd Gurley, Robert Woods and Brandin Cooks. Consider Kupp week to week.
report: Rams coach Sean McVay confirmed Cooper Kupp (knee) is out for Week 7 against the 49ers.

impact: The Rams have not ruled Kupp out for next week, but it is likely he ends up missing multiple games. DB Darious Williams, RB Justin Davis, RB John Kelly, OL Brian Allen, DL Sebastian Joseph-Day, and DL Tanzel Smart are also out.
report: Rams declared Cooper Kupp (knee) inactive for Week 7 against the 49ers.

impact: Kupp is said to be making "good progress" in his recovery from an MCL sprain, but he was never likely to play this week. Brandin Cooks and Robert Woods should see more looks in his absence.
report: Rams coach Sean McVay said Cooper Kupp (knee) is doubtful for Week 8 against the Packers.

impact: There are no surprises for the Rams heading into what the fantasy community hopes is a shootout with the Packers.
report: Rams declared WR Cooper Kupp, DB Darious Williams, RB Justin Davis, RB John Kelly, OLB Trevon Young, DT Sebastian Joseph-Day and TE Johnny Mundt inactive for Week 8 against the Packers.

impact: Kupp has missed the past 2.5 games after getting hurt in the second quarter of Week 6 in Denver.
