impact: "He’s playing hurt," coach Bill O’Brien conceded after the game. Watson is believed to be dealing with lung and ribs injuries, which are why he’s been listed with a "chest" ailment on weekly injury reports. The Texans committed to their rushing attack in Sunday’s victory rather than leaning on Watson to drop back to pass against Jacksonville’s talented-if-underachieving front. Watson now has a quick turnaround in Week 8 against the Dolphins on Thursday Night Football. Due to the injuries, Watson has become an increasingly risky fantasy bet coming off consecutive sub-par box-score games.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 12-of-24 passes for 139 yards and a touchdown and rushed seven times for 13 yards in the Texans’ Week 7 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Watson added a 14-yard scramble. As you can see, Watson had more touchdowns than incompletions against a truly embarrassing Dolphins defense. Matt Burke's unit was leaving star players like DeAndre Hopkins and Will Fuller completely uncovered for touchdowns, while little-featured rookie TE Jordan Thomas was able to break free for two scores. Watson was extending plays all night with his legs. Watson and the Texans have now won five straight after opening the year 0-3. The Broncos are on tap for Week 9. A concern for Watson is Fuller's health after he left Thursday's game with a knee issue.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 16-of-20 passes for 239 yards and five touchdowns in the Texans' 42-23, Week 8 win over the Dolphins.

impact: A couple weeks ago, Watson's chest injury was bad enough that the Texans wouldn't let him on a plane, instead sending him on a 12-hour bus ride to Jacksonville. Obviously he's feeling much better now. Coming off a game where he threw more touchdowns (five) than incompletions (four), Watson will be a no-brainer QB1 for Sunday's matchup in the Mile High City.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) is practicing in full for Week 9 against the Broncos.

impact: Without Will Fuller (torn ACL) and Keke Coutee (hamstring) available, Watson pressed half of his throws in DeAndre Hopkins' direction. The Texans' play-caller may have been efficient again, but it was the fourth consecutive outing he's attempted fewer than 26 passes and, in turn, recorded less than 240 passing yards. He practiced in full all week, but It's a wonder whether or not he's still battling a collapsed lung given his consistent lack of volume. Consider this a warning as he should be fully healed when the Texans return from extended rest and face the Redskins in Week 11.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 17-of-24 passes for 213 yards and two touchdowns in the Texans' Week 9 win over the Broncos.

impact: The Texans won their seventh straight game despite a rough day for Watson, who managed seven yards on three rushing attempts and failed to engineer a sustained passing game.  Houston plays its next game on Monday Night Football against the Titans, who got shredded by Andrew Luck on Sunday but have otherwise played stout pass defense this year.  On lowered volume with the Texans leaning on their defense for wins, Watson will be a mid-range to low-end QB1 play.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 16-of-24 passes for 208 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in Houston's Week 11 win over Washington.

impact: Watson's 70 rushing yards marked a new season-best, and he scored on the ground for the first time since Week 4.  His 24 attempts was also the sixth-straight game he's thrown the ball 25 times or fewer.  Watson needs the rushing output at that low passing volume for fantasy purposes, and he was able to get it tonight, scoring on a designed run from 15 yards away.  His two air scores were 12- and 10-yard connections with Demaryius Thomas.  Watson gets the Browns in Week 13.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 19-of-24 passes for 210 yards and two touchdowns in the Texans' 34-17, Week 12 win over the Titans on Monday night, adding 70 yards and a third touchdown on the ground.

impact: Watson added 30 yards rushing on seven attempts. He started the day off on fire, connecting on his first 11 passes of the game. He then went on to complete 17-of-22 passes in the first half for 191 yards, including an 11-yard touchdown to Jordan Thomas. With the Texans up 23-0 at the half, they took their foot off the gas and cruised the remainder of the game. Watson has now thrown for 239 yards or fewer in seven straight games, but has still offered upside with his legs and efficiency at times, making him an up and down fantasy option despite his strong play overall. The Texans will host a soft Colts defense in Week 14.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 22-of-31 passes for 224 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 13 win over the Browns.

impact: This is likely rep management from the Texans. Watson should be fine for a Week 14 matchup with the Colts.
report: Deshaun Watson (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It's a disappointing game after Burton's strong preseason. Burton saw the second most targets behind Allen Robinson but didn't look on the same page with Mitchell Trubisky. Chicago should do a better job of getting him involved moving forward. Burton is a back-end TE1 for Week 2 against Seattle.
report: Trey Burton caught 1-of-6 targets for 16 yards in Week 1 against the Packers.

impact: He caught his first target for a three-yard score on a shovel pass to kick off the scoring in this one.  Other than that, it was another quiet night for Burton, who has 36 yards and the score on 10 targets through two games.  Allen Robinson has 21 targets in that span as the Bears' clear No. 1 pass-game option.  Burton will remain a TE1 next week in Arizona only because of positional weakness.  The good news is the Cardinals have surrendered a TD to a TE each of the first two games.
report: Trey Burton caught all four of his targets for 20 yards and one touchdown in the Bears' Week 2 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Burton had caught just five passes for 35 yards through two weeks, so this could be considered an explosion by the marks he set through the first two weeks. Through three weeks, Burton has just nine catches for 90 yards and a touchdown as Mitchell Trubisky has struggled to generate little tangible production for the pass catchers in this offense. Despite his down production, Burton will still be in the TE1 mix at a dreadful fantasy position Week 4 when the Bears host the Buccaneers.
report: Trey Burton caught 4-of-5 passes for 55 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Cardinals.

impact: After plodding through subpar performances during Chicago's first three games, Burton went as Mitchell Trubisky went, corralling one of the second-year pro's career-high six touchdowns on the day. To this point, Burton had merely posted a season-high of 55 yards and had yet to get into the end zone. Burton's lone touchdown on the day admittedly occurred during a complete breakdown in the Bucs' hapless secondary. It won't always be this easy for the Bears' offense, but it was good to see Burton finally get off the schneid and flash the rapport he showed with Trubisky in the preseason. He'll remain a low-end TE1 moving forward given the position's dreadful drop-off from years past.
report: Trey Burton hauled in 2-of-4 passes for 86 yards and one score in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Bucs.

impact: It was a quiet afternoon for Burton, though he salvaged the day somewhat by turning a Mitchell Trubisky shovel pass into a nine-yard touchdown during the third quarter. Burton has now scored in three of his last four games while catching 14-of-17 targets (82.4 percent) during that span. The 26-year-old will remain a borderline TE1 when he faces the Patriots in Week 7. Burton was involved in one of the most iconic plays in NFL history—the Philly Special—the last time he squared off against New England in Super Bowl LII.
report: Trey Burton handled all four of his targets for 23 yards and a touchdown Sunday in Chicago’s Week 6 loss to Miami.

impact: Burton was the only player Mitchell Trubisky could trust early in this game. He was the target on four of the quarterback’s eight first-half completions including a fourth-down conversion on a second-quarter touchdown drive. He kept it going after the break, catching five more passes for another 70 yards and a late touchdown. Although he has scored in four of the last five games, this was easily Burton’s best outing of the season, and he did it with Tarik Cohen the only other player making plays in the passing game. He will remain a back-end TE1 next week against the Jets.
report: Trey Burton hauled in 9-of-11 targets for 126 yards and a touchdown in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: It's a letdown game for Burton, who saw fewer targets than Anthony Miller and Taylor Gabriel. Burton got all of his yards on one catch, with his other receptions coming at the line of scrimmage. Burton had at least 50 yards or a touchdown in five straight games going into Sunday. He has a rebound matchup with Buffalo in Week 9.
report: Trey Burton caught 3-of-4 targets for 18 yards in Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: Mitchell Trubisky needed to complete only 12 passes in Sunday's easy win, so no individual Chicago pass catcher so much as reached 50 yards.  Burton was lucky to escape with a fourth-quarter touchdown deep in garbage time.  Expect Burton to see more targets when the Bears host the Lions next.
report: Trey Burton caught 2-of-3 targets for 28 yards and a touchdown in the Bears' Week 9 win over the Bills.

impact: Burton did what was asked of him on a day where the Bears received giant contributions from both Allen Robinson (6-133-2) and Anthony Miller (5-122-1). The 27-year-old has mostly been held in check since his breakout Week 7 against New England (9-126-1), averaging a lethargic 28.7 yards with one touchdown over his last three games. Despite his lack of recent contributions, Burton will still be worthy of TE1 consideration next week when the Bears do battle with Minnesota on Sunday Night Football.
report: Trey Burton chipped in with four catches for 40 yards on four targets Sunday in the Bears’ Week 10 win over Detroit.

impact: Burton has now been held under 40 yards in five of the last six games. He'll take a 34/420/5 line into Week 12 against the Lions.
report: Trey Burton was held to one catch for nine yards in Week 11 against the Vikings.

impact: In addition to the sluggish stat line, Burton lost a fumble and committed a costly offensive pass interference penalty. In Burton's defense, the fumble call seemed borderline. Burton is occasionally blowing up but mostly producing as a fringe TE1. The Bears are headed to New Jersey to take on the Giants in Week 13.
report: Trey Burton caught 4-of-7 targets for 28 yards in the Bears' Week 12 win over the Lions.

impact: The Giants came into Week 13 giving up the seventh-most catches for the seventh-most yards to tight ends.  Burton was nowhere to be found as Adam Shaheen came off I.R. and scored a two-yard TD on his lone target.  Burton has been extremely boom-bust year one in Chicago.  He has five touchdowns, but Burton hasn't topped 40 yard since Week 7 and has just one score in that span.  Burton will again be on the TE1 borderline next week at home against the Rams.
report: Trey Burton failed to catch his lone target in the Bears' Week 13, 30-27 overtime loss to the Giants.

impact: Sanu has been managing his hip injury for weeks. He's not in any danger of sitting out coming off Atlanta's bye. Sanu is a WR4 for Sunday's matchup with Washington.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It's a mild concern but likely some form of rep management from the Falcons. Sanu barely practiced last week before suiting up against the Giants. Sanu will be a fringe WR4 if he gives it a go against the Redskins.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) was downgraded to "DNP" on Thursday.

impact: Sanu should be able to go on Sunday against the Redskins, though it's a tough matchup on the road outdoors for the Falcons who have scored 12 and 17 points in their two outdoor road games this season.  Sanu is a WR4.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) returned to practice Friday.

impact: Sanu was upgraded to limited participation and taken off Atlanta's injury report on Friday. Whereas Washington can be exploited on the ground, its secondary has held its own against opposing play-callers this season. It's still a good spot for Julio Jones and Sanu, the latter who's a viable low-end WR3 on a six-team bye week.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) will play in Week 9 against the Redskins.

impact: Sanu was seen blocking on highlight reels far more often than making the big plays himself. He did score an 11-yard fourth-quarter TD, only for the play to be negated by a holding penalty.  In a crowded Falcons pass-catcher corps, Sanu will remain a touchdown-reliant WR4/flex in Week 10 at Cleveland.
report: Mohamed Sanu caught 4-of-5 targets for 45 yards in the Falcons' Week 9 win over Washington.

impact: The hip has been bothering Sanu for a couple weeks now, but he's been playing through it despite missing practices.  We expect the same this week against the Browns where Sanu will be a WR3/4 on the road.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: The injury has hampered him for a few weeks, though it's yet to cost him any games. We imagine that will be the case again Sunday when the Falcons travel to Cleveland. Sanu is RotoPat's No. 36 wide receiver for Week 10.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Sanu has followed the same practice cycle for weeks now — limited availability, cleared on Friday, work as the team's No. 2. Sanu is RotoPat's No. 36 wide receiver for Week 10.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) will play in Week 10 against the Browns.

impact: Sanu also lost an extremely soft fumble. Sanu has exceeded 50 yards twice in nine games. He provides zero upside as a WR4.
report: Mohamed Sanu caught 6-of-8 targets for 47 yards in the Falcons' Week 10 loss to the Browns.

impact: The Falcons have managed Sanu's practice reps all year. He's in no danger of sitting out Week 11.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Sanu will be ready to go as a WR4/5 against the Cowboys.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) returned to Falcons practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: He was scrapped from the injury report after returning to full participation at Friday's practice. Even with six teams on bye this week, Sanu won't have much fantasy appeal against Dallas. He's No. 44 in our receiver rankings this week.
report: Mohamed Sanu (hip) wasn't listed on the Falcons' final injury report for Week 11 against the Cowboys.

impact: Sanu's 56 yards were his most since Week 5.  He also hasn't scored since Week 6.  Sanu will get a nice draw against the Saints on Thanksgiving night as a WR4.  He went 4-36-1 versus New Orleans in Week 3.
report: Mohamed Sanu caught 4-of-6 targets for 56 yards in the Falcons' Week 11 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: It was Ridley who ended up benefitting opposite Julio Jones, as the rookie pasted incumbent slot corner P.J. Williams for 8/93/1. In high-scoring affairs, though, Sanu has continued to come through time and time again. Week 13 against Baltimore likely won't be a high-scoring matchup.
report: Mohamed Sanu caught all four of his targets for 74 yards in the Falcons' Week 12 loss to the Saints.

impact: Sanu now has at least three catches in five-straight games but has not scored or cleared 75 yards in the process. He's producing as a standard "No. 3 receiver in a high-volume passing offense." He's a WR5 for fantasy purposes.
report: Mohamed Sanu caught 3-of-4 targets for 37 yards in the Falcons' Week 13 loss to the Ravens.

impact: The seven targets were easily second-most on the team but a distant second to Allen Robinson's 14.  Gabriel has nine grabs for a meager 55 yards through two games.  He's well off the fantasy map ahead of Week 3 at Arizona.
report: Taylor Gabriel caught 4-of-7 targets for 30 yards in the Bears' Week 2 win over the Seahawks.

impact: It's the third consecutive game that Gabriel's seen at least seven targets. He even out-shined perennial No. 1 Allen Robinson (2-23-1) on Mitchell Trubisky's career six-score day. The Bears' offense has quietly developed and thus progressively improved in every outing so far this season, slowly raising Gabriel's stock with every passing game. He'll come out of Chicago's Week 5 bye as a strong FLEX option against the Dolphins.
report: Taylor Gabriel brought in all seven of his targets for a career-high 104 yards and two touchdowns in the Bears' Week 4 win over the Bucs.

impact: Make that two 100-yard receiving games in a row for Gabriel, who went off for 104 yards against Tampa Bay prior to the Bears' bye week. Gabriel didn't find the end zone in this one but he still made his presence felt with a number of big plays, the first of those coming on a 47-yard deep bomb from Mitchell Trubisky during the second quarter. He bettered that with a 54-yarder in the third quarter, again dusting overmatched corner Torry McTyer for a huge gain. The speedy 27-year-old has quickly emerged as Trubisky's preferred deep threat. He'll look to keep it going against New England in Week 7.
report: Taylor Gabriel snagged all five of his targets for 110 yards while adding a nine-yard rush Sunday in the Bears’ Week 6 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: With Mitchell Trubisky struggling early, Gabriel caught just one pass in the first half for seven yards. He did get a carry inside the 10-yard line in the third quarter and drew a long defensive pass interference on the next series, but this was a big letdown after back-to-back 100-yard games. He will look to get back on track next week against the Jets.
report: Taylor Gabriel hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 26 yards in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: It's a disappointing game for Gabriel with Allen Robinson sidelined. He was out-targeted by Anthony Miller, and couldn't get anything going downfield with Mitchell Trubisky. Gabriel has been trending down the last two since posting consecutive 100-yard games. Even if Robinson doesn't return next week, he's just a WR4 option.
report: Taylor Gabriel caught 4-of-6 passes for 52 yards in Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: Gabriel did not get any kind of playing time boost despite Allen Robinson sitting out, although he did finish second on the team with six targets and 52 yards. He posted back-to-back 100-yard games in Weeks 4 and 6, but Gabriel has failed to make much of a fantasy dent in his other five outings. He is not a must-hold in shallower leagues.
report: Taylor Gabriel played 44-of-66 snaps (67 percent) Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: This is a new injury for Gabriel. Any knee issue is a concern, but this doesn't look like it will keep him out. With Allen Robinson not a lock to return this week, Gabriel could see an uptick in targets.
report: Taylor Gabriel (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Gabriel was limited at practice on Wednesday, but he is fully on track to play in Buffalo on Sunday. With Allen Robinson missing two straight practices, Gabriel should be in line for a similar workload as last week.
report: Taylor Gabriel (knee) was a full participant at practice on Thursday.

impact: Gabriel got on the board for 30 yards and two catches early, but the Bears wound up not even needing their passing game with two defensive touchdowns and two Jordan Howard scores against a Bills team that scored nine points.  Gabriel will continue to be a high-variance fringe WR3 in Week 10 against the Lions.
report: Taylor Gabriel caught 3-of-5 targets for 45 yards in the Bears' Week 9 win over the Bills.

impact: Gabriel was limited to start last week before playing through the discomfort.  He should be fine for Week 10 against the Lions.  Gabriel hasn't done much at all since amassing 214 yards and two scores on 12 grabs against the Bucs and Dolphins in Weeks 4 and 6 around the bye.  He's a WR4.
report: Taylor Gabriel (knee) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Gabriel was limited to start the week but was upgraded to full participation on Thursday. The fifth-year deep threat delivered back-to-back 100-yard games earlier this year but has slowed down since then, contributing just 123 yards (41 per game) with no touchdowns over his last three contests. He's a middle-of-the-road WR4 for fantasy purposes.
report: Taylor Gabriel (knee) will play Week 10 against the Lions.

impact: He was a non-factor in Allen Robinson's return from injury. Gabriel had a productive stretch earlier this year but that seems to have come and gone. The 27-year-old deep threat won't be of much fantasy interest next week against the Vikings.
report: Taylor Gabriel came up empty on his three targets Sunday in the Bears’ Week 10 victory over Detroit.

impact: Gabriel was involved early with 40 total yards on the first drive. He didn't do much after that but still led Chicago with a team-high nine targets. Gabriel's usage has been all over the place this year. He's not a Week 12 fantasy option.
report: Taylor Gabriel caught 7-of-9 targets for 52 yards in Week 11 against the Vikings.

impact: It was the second week in a row Gabriel matched a season high with seven catches. Gabriel will lack WR3 upside for however long Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is sidelined. There does seem to be a decent chance that Trubisky is back for Week 13 against the Giants.
report: Taylor Gabriel caught 7-of-8 targets for 49 yards in the Bears' Week 12 win over the Lions.

impact: Gabriel lost a critical fumble inside his own 15-yard line to set up an Aldrick Rosas field goal to put the Giants up by 10 with less than two minutes to play.  The Bears were able to force overtime later, but Gabriel's day was one to forget.  Gabriel will be a big-play WR4 next week against the Rams.
report: Taylor Gabriel caught 3-of-7 targets for 17 yards in the Bears' Week 13 loss to the Giants.

impact: It's unknown if Ridley, who was limited on Friday, was a full participant on Saturday. Either way, it's tremendous progress and puts him on pace to play Monday night against the Giants. Teammate Mohamed Sanu (hip) was also seen running routes and participating in drills. Coach Dan Quinn will have a status update on both following the team's practice.
report: Calvin Ridley (ankle) participated in his second consecutive practice on Saturday.

impact: The Falcons also removed Mohamed Sanu (hip) from the injury report. Both wideouts were limited in Saturday's practice. It's a best case scenario with Atlanta playing on Monday night. We like Ridley at an upside FLEX against the Giants.
report: Calvin Ridley (ankle) wasn't listed on the Week 7 injury report.

impact: Both players looked good in pregame warmups and are ready to roll after not being listed on the final injury report.  Inactive for the Falcons are K Matt Bryant, RB Brian Hill, CB Blidi Wreh-Wilson, DE Steven Means, OG Zac Kerin, OT Matt Gono, and DT Michael Bennett.  Ridley is a fine WR2/3.
report: Calvin Ridley (ankle) and Mohamed Sanu (hip) are both active for Week 7 against the Giants on Monday night.

impact: Ridley's ankle didn't seem to be a problem at all.  His six targets were second-most on the team to Julio Jones' 12, but Ridley was unable to do anything big with them.  Ridley will get the bye week to get back to 100 percent ahead of a Week 9 road date with the Redskins where he'll again be a WR2/3.
report: Calvin Ridley caught 5-of-6 targets for 43 yards in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: Ridley got checked for a concussion late in the game, but returned.  His touchdown came on a crossing route from 40 yards out with multiple big downfield blocks via Mohamed Sanu.  Ridley's week-to-week target volume has not been bankable, but he has clearly passed Sanu as Atlanta's No. 2 passing-game option.  Keep Ridley rolling as a WR2/3 in Week 10 at Cleveland.
report: Calvin Ridley caught 6-of-9 targets for 71 yards and a touchdown in Atlanta's Week 9 win at Washington.

impact: The five targets were a major disappointment on a day where Matt Ryan attempted 52 passes. Through nine games, Ridley is still averaging just five weekly looks. That would barely be WR3 usable if not for Ridley's red zone usage. The Falcons are hosting the Cowboys for Week 11.
report: Calvin Ridley caught 3-of-5 targets for 37 yards in the Falcons' Week 10 loss to the Browns, adding a three-yard rush.

impact: The one missed connection was a drop by Ridley that popped into the air for an interception deep in Atlanta territory that led to a Cowboys touchdown.  Ridley has just one touchdown since September and has topped 50 yards only once since Week 4.  Ridley gets the Saints in a likely shootout on Thanksgiving.  Ridley eviscerated the Saints in Week 3 for a 7-146-3 line.
report: Calvin Ridley caught 3-of-4 targets for 32 yards in the Falcons' Week 11 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Ridley is frequently limited in practice but has yet to miss a game. He will remain an upside WR3 for Thursday night's likely shootout with the Saints.
report: Calvin Ridley (thigh) remained "limited" in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Ridley's was limited early in the week but there wasn't any doubt over his status. In a likely shootout with the Saints, Ridley is a high-upside WR3
report: Calvin Ridley (thigh) was removed from the Week 12 injury report.

impact: With Eli Apple shadowing Julio Jones, Mohamed Sanu and Ridley took turns beating both P.J. Williams and Marshon Lattimore (who plays better on the outside) down the middle of the field. His 13 targets were second only to Jones' 14 Thursday. On the year, he's produced 15/249/4 in two games against the Saints and 32/386/4 in nine games against the rest of the league. He'll be a boom-or-bust WR4 against Baltimore's sluggish possession-sucking offense in Week 13.
report: Calvin Ridley vacuumed 8-of-13 targets for 93 yards and one score in the Falcons' Week 12 loss to the Saints.

impact: Both are new injuries for Ridley, though he dealt with ankle issues earlier this year. The limited practice suggests it shouldn't keep him out. Ridley has a shy away matchup with Baltimore this week.
report: Calvin Ridley (ankle, elbow) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ridley has had a surprising amount of limited practices for a rookie, but his Week 13 status is not in doubt. He's a WR3 with a tough matchup in the Ravens.
report: Calvin Ridley (ankle, elbow) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Ridley's status was was never in doubt despite being limited all week. He's our No. 26 ranked receiver for Week 13.
report: Calvin Ridley (ankle, elbow) was removed from the Week 13 injury report.

impact: Ridley appeared to score a fluky 14-yard touchdown on a batted ball in the fourth quarter, but the play was called back by penalty. The 22 yards were Ridley's fewest since Week 1. The Falcons simply could not get anything going against the Ravens' elite defense. A bounce back should be in order for Week 14 against the Packers.
report: Calvin Ridley caught 3-of-5 targets for 22 yards in the Falcons' Week 13 loss to the Ravens.

impact: This is the new normal for Ridley. Ridley was held to 22 scorless yards last week but is in a rebound spot with a matchup against the Packers secondary.
report: Calvin Ridley (hand, elbow) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: With Devonta Freeman (knee) out, Smith was part of the game plan behind Tevin Coleman.  Coleman essentially took Freeman's role, with Smith elevated into Coleman's normal one.  Smith's best series was one where he piled up 31 yards on back-to-back carries to set up a Matt Ryan one-yard touchdown run.  Smith added one catch for eight yards on his lone target.  He'll play the same role next week against the Saints with Freeman still likely to be out.
report: Falcons fourth-round RB Ito Smith rushed nine times for 46 yards in the Week 2 win over the Panthers.

impact: Smith was bottled up on the ground but peppered in a few nice gains on screen passes from Matt Ryan. Tevin Coleman out-touched Smith by a commanding 17-5 margin on Sunday. Assuming Devonta Freeman (knee) remains sidelined, we’d expect a similar distribution next week against the Bengals.
report: Ito Smith lost six yards on two carries while snaring three-of-four targets for 41 receiving yards Sunday in Atlanta’s Week 3 loss to the Saints.

impact: This injury shouldn't affect his availability for Week 4. Smith struggled as a ball-carrier in last week's loss to New Orleans (two carries for -6 yards), but made up for it somewhat by contributing three catches for 41 yards. He'll continue to work in a change-of-pace role behind Tevin Coleman, who has been filling in for an injured Devonta Freeman (knee).
report: Ito Smith (ribs) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He's good to go for Sunday's Saints matchup. With Devonta Freeman (knee) out at least another week, Smith will continue to see change-of-pace touches behind Tevin Coleman.
report: Ito Smith (ribs) was removed from the Week 4 injury report.

impact: He added another 13 yards on three catches. A week after touching the ball just five times, Smith took 10 touches away from Tevin Coleman including what turned into a seven-yard touchdown run on the opening drive. With Devonta Freeman looking likely to return next week, Smith should return to the No. 3 job, but he has shown well when given the opportunity. He should be rostered in all Dynasty formats.
report: Ito Smith rushed seven times for 35 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 4 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Smith added a five-yard reception. #AsExpected, Smith was third on the depth chart with Devonta Freeman (knee) back in the mix, but he still played 12 snaps by Pro Football Focus' count. Smith will be without re-draft value for however long Freeman and Tevin Coleman stay healthy, but he's a nice stash in Dynasty leagues.
report: Ito Smith rushed three times for five yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 5 loss to the Steelers.

impact: He "added" negative-one yard on two catches. Smith mostly went backward against Tampa, but he got loose on a wonderfully blocked play for a 14-yard touchdown in the second quarter. He now has three touchdowns in as many games. He will be in the FLEX conversation next week if Devonta Freeman sits.
report: Ito Smith rushed 11 times for 22 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 6 win over the Bucs.

impact: He added two catches for 29 yards on two targets and was out-touched 13-9 by Tevin Coleman, who amassed 82 yards and scored a touchdown.  Smith's biggest play was a 20-yard catch on a blitz-beater.  Smith will remain on the FLEX map as Coleman's 1B coming out of the bye in Week 9.
report: Ito Smith rushed seven times for 16 yards in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: Smith scored the Falcons' lone rushing touchdown; their other four TDs came in the air with two to Tevin Coleman, one to Calvin Ridley, and one to Julio Jones.  Coleman out-touched Smith 18 to 11, but Smith ran physically inside the tackles and hurdled a defender on his 12-yard rushing score.  Smith will remain a workable flex play on 9-13 touches when Atlanta visits Cleveland next.
report: Ito Smith rushed 10 times for 60 yards and a touchdown and caught 1-of-2 targets for four yards in Atlanta's Week 9 win at Washington.

impact: Smith's 26 yards were his fewest in four games. Smith is mixing in for 8-12 touches on a weekly basis but has proven to be little more than a low-end FLEX option. He gets the Cowboys for Week 11.
report: Ito Smith rushed four times for 11 yards in the Falcons' Week 10 loss to the Browns, adding four receptions for 15 additional yards.

impact: Smith lucks into a touchdown here and there but has otherwise been a disappointment while stealing touches from Tevin Coleman.  Smith is averaging a pitiful 3.4 YPC on the year.  He's a TD-or -bust RB3/4.
report: Ito Smith rushed six times for 10 yards and caught both of his targets for 12 yards in the Falcons' Week 11 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Smith and Tevin Coleman combined for a miserable six yards on 12 carries Thursday. Not only were the Falcons unable to establish the run (despite stubbornly trying to), the team fell behind early and were inevitably forced to lean on Julio Jones and Calvin Ridley the rest of the way. Judge Ito's luck-boxed his way into a few touchdowns since taking over for Devonta Freeman, and that appears to be the only way he produces in fantasy. Find a better option next week against Baltimore.
report: Ito Smith went nowhere in a hurry Thursday, rushing four times for zero yards in the Falcons' Week 12 loss to the Saints.

impact: Smith out-touched Tevin Coleman 8-7. One of his carries was a thundering stuff on an early fourth down. The Falcons' running game has been bordering on nonfunctional for some time now. Smith will be off the fantasy radar for Week 14 against the Packers.
report: Ito Smith rushed seven times for 22 yards in the Falcons' Week 13 loss to the Ravens, "adding" a zero-yard reception.

impact: This isn't a surprise despite Kearse getting in limited practice this week. The Jets will go with Robby Anderson, Quincy Enunwa, and Terrelle Pryor as their starting wideouts. Kearse looks on track for a Week 2 return.
report: Jermaine Kearse (abdomen) is doubtful for Monday night's Week 1 game against the Lions.

impact: As expected. Kearse got in limited practice throughout the week but was listed as doubtful over the weekend. The Jets will start Robby Anderson and Terrelle Pryor on the outside with Quincy Enunwa being featured as a hybrid slot/tight end receiver over the middle.
report: Jets declared WR Jermaine Kearse, OL Ben Braden, G Dakota Dozier, DL Foley Fatukasi, CB Derrick Jones, S Marcus Maye, and OLB Josh Martin inactive for Week 1 against the Lions.

impact: It puts Kearse on track to play after sitting out the opener. His return further muddles Sam Darnold's target distribution after spreading it out in Week 1. Kearse's presence should demote Terrelle Pryor to four-wide sets.
report: Jermaine Kearse (abdomen) is practicing in full for Week 2.

impact: Kearse's return figures to cut into Terrelle Pryor's playing time after Pryor operated as Gang Green's No. 3 receiver last week.  Quincy Enunwa and Robby Anderson are locked in as the Nos. 1 and 2.  The Jets' Week 2 inactives are CB Derrick Jones, FS Marcus Maye, CB Juston Burris, OG Dakota Dozier, OLB Josh Martin, TE Jordan Leggett, and DL Folo Fatukasi.
report: Jermaine Kearse is active for Week 2 against the Dolphins.

impact: Kearse worked as the Jets' No. 4 receiver behind Quincy Enunwa, Robby Anderson, and Terrelle Pryor.  He only saw two targets and lacks fantasy value.
report: Jermaine Kearse netted -1 yard in the Jets' Week 2 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: This will be about Kearse's ceiling for as long as the Jets are holding Sam Darnold's hand on offense.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 3-of-6 targets for 35 yards in the Jets' Week 3 loss to the Browns.

impact: Kearse didn't make his first catch until deep in the third quarter. He's a non-factor in a Jets offense that can't support more than one wideout.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 2-of-5 passes for 23 yards in Week 4 against the Jagaurs.

impact: Kearse would likely need Quincy Enunwa to miss time to become a fantasy factor.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 1-of-4 targets for 14 yards in the Jets' Week 5 win.

impact: Kearse's stock was pointing up after taking over as Gang Green's slot receiver in Week 5, and he made good on increased playing time following Quincy Enunwa's second-quarter ankle injury.  Enunwa did not return, and Kearse went to work on the interior of Indianapolis' defense with crisp routes and chunk gains on slants.  There are indications Enunwa's injury could be severe.  Kearse will be worth grabbing in 12- and 14-team PPR leagues this week.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 9-of-10 targets for 94 yards in the Jets' Week 6 win over the Colts.

impact: Sam Darnold was horrendous in this one, throwing three interceptions, and completing just 40.5% of his passes, doing a lot of work on the final meaningless possession with dump-offs to Trenton Cannon out of the backfield.  Kearse was a hot name in fantasy this week after he caught 9-of-10 targets for 94 yards against the Colts last week.  He was expected to play a major role with Quincy Enunwa (ankle) and Terrelle Pryor (groin) both out.  He wasn't targeted in the second half and had no chance on his two first-half ones.  Kearse will be tough to get behind next week on the road in Chicago.
report: Jermaine Kearse failed to catch either of his two targets in the Jets' 37-17, Week 7 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Kearse got all his yards early before getting shutout in the second half. It's the second straight week Kearse has been a non-factor despite his expanded role. With Robby Anderson and Quincy Enunwa candidates to return in Week 9, Kearse isn't worth rostering in fantasy leagues.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 3-of-10 passes for 30 yards in Week 8 against Chicago.

impact: Even with Quincy Enunwa and Robby Anderson back in the lineup, Kearse led the team with eight targets. As has been the case recently, he did not do much with the work, and the Jets’ struggling passing game is unlikely to create much fantasy value moving forward. Kearse can be left on the wire.
report: Jermaine Kearse hauled in 3-of-8 targets for 20 yards in the Jets' Week 9 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Pedestrian slot man Kearse is safe to drop entering the Jets' Week 11 bye.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 2-of-4 targets for 16 yards in the Jets' Week 10 loss to Buffalo.

impact: Kearse's 66 yards were his most since Week 6 while the targets were a new season high. The Titans' secondary allows a healthy amount of receiver yardage, but Kearse will not be a recommended WR4 for Week 13.
report: Jermaine Kearse caught 6-of-12 targets for 66 yards and a touchdown in the Jets' Week 12 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Kearse just had his best game of the season with a 6-66-1 day on 12 targets against the Patriots last Sunday.  He's now had two big games this season to follow them up with goose eggs.  Kearse is wholly unreliable in fantasy.
report: Jermaine Kearse wasn't targeted in the Jets' Week 13 loss to the Titans.

impact: Josh McCown will start at quarterback.  Jermaine Kearse and Quincy Enunwa will start at wide receiver.  Jonotthan Harrison will start for Long at center.
report: Jets declared WR Robby Anderson, C Spencer Long, QB Sam Darnold, WR Deontay Burnett, CB Rashard Robinson, CB Derrick Jones, and DL Folo Fatukasi inactive for Week 10 against the Bills.

impact: It is not a great sign for Anderson's availability coming out of the bye week. Quincy Enunwa, who did practice Monday, would serve as the No. 1 if Anderson cannot play this week.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) did not practice Monday.

impact: Anderson still isn't healthy coming out of the bye week.  If Anderson is unable to go, the Jets will have to rely on Quincy Enunwa, Jermaine Kearse, Chris Herndon, and Elijah McGuire as the main pass catcher vs. New England.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He also sat out Wednesday, making it highly unlikely he will return this week. Quincy Enunwa, Jermaine Kearse, and Chris Herndon will serve as the Jets' top pass catchers against the Patriots.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Anderson was upgraded to limited availability Friday, indicating there's a chance he returns to the lineup this week against the Patriots. It would be a tremendous help for Josh McCown, who's slated to make his second straight start in place of Sam Darnold (foot, out). Anderson and McCown boomed together last season, and could make noise against a struggling Pats secondary if he's deemed healthy enough to go Sunday.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) is questionable for Week 12 against the Patriots.

impact: Anderson only got in one practice this week, so he's not a lock to play. He isn't going to have an every-down role if active, potentially seeing limited snaps as a decoy. Quincy Enunwa, Jermaine Kearse, and Chris Herndon are all better Week 12 fantasy bets.
report: ESPN New York expects Robby Anderson (questionable, ankle) to have a limited role in Week 12 against the Patriots.

impact: Anderson is expected to have a limited role at less than 100 percent. He may be looking at decoy status, making him someone to avoid despite a good matchup. Quincy Enunwa and Chris Herndon are better plays this week.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport confirms Robby Anderson (questionable, ankle) is expected to play Week 12 against the Patriots.

impact: Anderson has a better rapport with Josh McCown than Sam Darnold but is expected to be on a pitch count at less than 100 percent. He's a risky WR5. Inactive for the Jets are QB Sam Darnold, WR Deontay Burnett, S Marcus Maye, CB Derrick Jones, LB Jeremiah Attaochu, OG James Carpenter and WR Rishard Matthews.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) is active for Week 12 against the Patriots.

impact: Anderson was making just his second appearance since Week 7. He was supposedly going to be on a snap count, but Pro Football Focus charted him as taking the field for 48-of-64 plays. Anderson was the intended target on Josh McCown's arm punt interception. Anderson had good chemistry with McCown in 2018, but he will not be a viable WR3 if McCown makes another start in Week 13 against the Titans. He will offer big-play WR4 upside.
report: Robby Anderson caught 2-of-5 targets for 22 yards in the Jets' Week 12 loss to the Patriots.

impact: He played through the injury last week and should be fine for Sunday's game in Tennessee. Anderson has failed to build off last year's sophomore breakout, struggling to an underwhelming 23-368-3 receiving line in his nine games this season.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Anderson sat out Wednesday's session, but it always looked like a maintenance day. He was officially "limited" on Thursday. After playing through the injury last week, Anderson should be good to go against the Titans, but he will not be anything more than a desperation WR4.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: The Eagles ended up acquiring Golden Tate instead. Anderson would have been a better fit for what the Eagles' offense has lacked this season. As for Anderson, he will be a restricted free agent at season's end. Struggling through an injury-marred campaign after an offseason littered with off-the-field issues, Anderson probably is not going to get a multi-year offer from Gang Green.
report: The New York Daily News reports the Jets turned down a fourth-round pick from the Eagles in exchange for Robby Anderson before last month's trade deadline.

impact: He'll be fine for Sunday as a WR4 play.  Anderson has been gutting out the injury for weeks and had two grabs for 22 yards last week.  It's his new normal.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) is questionable for Week 13 against the Titans.

impact: Sam Darnold (foot) is out.  Anderson was never in much doubt.  He's a WR4 for this likely snoozer in Tennessee.  Anderson has done very little this season.
report: Robby Anderson (ankle) is active for Week 13 against the Titans.

impact: Anderson led the team in receiving on a day Josh McCown threw for just 128 scoreless yards.  Anderson has long been off the redraft map at wideout.
report: Robby Anderson caught 4-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Jets' Week 13 loss to the Titans.

impact: It was not the most efficient day, but Sutton showed off his talent on two 20-plus yard catches and worked as the clear No. 3 receiver. He could struggle for consistent targets behind Emmanuel Sanders and Demaryius Thomas, but Sutton offers some deep-league value already and would be a plug-and-play starter if anything happened to the top-two receivers.
report: Courtland Sutton hauled in 2-of-5 targets for 45 yards in the Broncos' Week 1 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Sutton's lowly line was due to two near-misses as he has a 14-yard touchdown called back when he stepped out of bounds as well as another potential 35-yard gain when he failed to catch a pass cleanly down the sideline. The rookie has a promising 11 targets through two games, but has managed just three receptions for 54 yards. He is only a bench stash at this juncture of the season as the Broncos head to Baltimore in Week 3.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 1-of-6 targets for nine yards in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Raiders.

impact: Both of his catches went for big gains, and one converted a third-and-long. Sutton continues to look good when he gets an opportunity, but he has now failed to top two catches in each of the first three games. He is just a bench stash.
report: Courtland Sutton hauled in 2-of-3 targets for 37 yards in the Broncos' Week 3 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Sutton's two big plays were a 42-yard grab deep down the right sideline in the first half then a lengthy defensive pass interference call to set up Phillip Lindsay's eventual one-yard touchdown run.  Sutton has arguably been better than Demaryius Thomas through four games but remains just a stash.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 3-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Broncos' Week 4 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Sutton caught an early eight-yard touchdown and drew another end-zone target later on, only to hobble off the field with a leg injury in the second half.  Sutton's status for Week 6 against the Rams is unclear.  His injury led to more playing time for DaeSean Hamilton, who caught three balls for 44 yards.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 2-of-6 targets for 18 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 5 loss to the Jets.

impact: The injury doesn't sound like anything major. Sutton scored his first career touchdown in last week's loss to the Jets, but he's only cleared 50 receiving yards in one of his first five games. The second-round rookie is a solid dynasty stash, but he doesn't have much redraft value at the moment.
report: Courtland Sutton (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Sutton was also called for a down-field blocking penalty that cost the Broncos a potential touchdown in the fourth quarter. 41 of Sutton's yards came on an underthrown pass from Case Keenum. His 58 yards were a new season/career-high, which tells you most of what you need to know about Sutton's re-draft value as Keenum's No. 3 wideout.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 3-of-4 targets for 58 yards in the Broncos' Week 6 loss to the Rams.

impact: Sutton's touchdown came on a first quarter trick play. Emmanuel Sanders took a toss on a reverse and found a wide-open Sutton. Sanders nearly overthrew the pass, but Sutton laid out to make a spectacular catch. The rookie has now scored in 2-of-3 games. Although his limited usage is mostly keeping him off the fantasy radar, Sutton will have WR4 appeal against the Chiefs in Week 8.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 1-of-3 targets for a 28-yard touchdown in the Broncos' Week 7 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Sutton led the team with his 78 yards, which was also a career-high for the rookie. The 23-year-old continues to make his living off big plays. His longest catch Sunday came on a 42-yard missile from Case Keenum on the closing drive of the first half. Sutton's volume is still lacking—he's caught just 17 passes all year—but the second-round SMU alum certainly offers breakout potential. He's someone to keep an eye on, especially as rumors swirl of the Broncos potentially dealing Emmanuel Sanders and Demaryius Thomas ahead of Tuesday's trade deadline.
report: Courtland Sutton delivered three catches for 78 yards on four targets Sunday in Denver’s Week 8 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Sutton was one of the biggest winners of trade deadline day, if not the biggest winner of them all.  He figures to solidify himself into Thomas' old role as an every-down player next to Emmanuel Sanders with fellow rookie DaeSean Hamilton working in as the third wideout.  Sutton has routinely come up with big plays the first eight weeks and was second on the team in air yards the last two weeks.  Sutton is the top add of the week on waivers as an upside WR2 the rest of the way.
report: Speaking after the Demaryius Thomas trade, GM John Elway said it gives Courtland Sutton a "chance to get out there and play more and be a bigger part of it because we think he’s ready to go."

impact: He nearly hauled in a deep throw for a touchdown from Case Keenum, but the ball was slapped out of his grasp the moment he tried tucking it in. All in all the rookie was used as expected in the team's first game without Demaryius Thomas, leading the team in air yards (67) as the primary downfield threat. TE Jeff Heuerman turned out to be the biggest beneficiary sans Thomas, seeing a team-high 11 targets. Sutton will still struggle with consistent fantasy production (but keep a high ceiling) if he doesn't start seeing more targets moving forward.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 3-of-5 targets for 57 yards in the Broncos' Week 9 loss to the Texans.

impact: As he has throughout the year, Sutton made his living off big plays. The rookie aided a touchdown drive with a 39-yard grab to open the fourth quarter, then made his biggest contribution of the afternoon by pulling in a 30-yard pass from Case Keenum on the Broncos' final possession. That put Denver in field goal range with 20 seconds left in regulation. The 78 yards matched a career-high for Sutton, who has now cleared 50 yards receiving in four of his last five contests. Sutton will try to make it five out of six when he takes the field next week against the Steelers.
report: Courtland Sutton absorbed three of six targets for 78 yards Sunday in the Broncos’ Week 11 win over Los Angeles.

impact: Sutton was held without a catch in the first quarter, but he made a great grab with a defender on his back early in the second. Unfortunately, that was it for the rookie despite three more targets, one of which he dropped, in the second half. Sutton has not seen the big target boost most expected following the Demaryius Thomas trade, but this was his first really bad fantasy game. He is worth keeping around for a great matchup against the Bengals next week.
report: Courtland Sutton hauled in 1-of-4 targets for 14 yards in the Broncos' Week 12 win over the Steelers.

impact: The story of Sutton's season had been drops, overthrown targets, and downfield DPIs. It all finally came out in the wash Sunday as he maneuvered his burly 6'3", 218-pound frame for several deep receptions, including a 30-yard jump-ball that hit pay dirt. Despite having an extremely volatile floor, Sutton's boom-or-bust style of play is tolerable if he continues seeing a team-high share of targets. Unfortunately, he'll be a dicey option in Week 14 on the outside against the Niners and stud corner Richard Sherman.
report: Courtland Sutton hauled in 4-of-7 targets for a season-high 85 yards and one score in the Broncos' Week 13 win over the Bengals.

impact: Miller is still feeling the effects of a dislocated shoulder suffered in Sunday's win at Arizona. With Mitchell Trubisky as his quarterback, Miller faces an uphill climb in his quest for fantasy relevance.
report: Anthony Miller (shoulder) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: That is great news, but Miller did not practice Wednesday and does not seem particularly likely to play this week after suffering a dislocated shoulder on Sunday. Behind Taylor Gabriel in the pecking order even when healthy, Miller is a weak bench stash in redraft leagues at this point.
report: Bears coach Matt Nagy said he does not expect Anthony Miller (shoulder) to need surgery.

impact: The Bears consider him week-to-week, though Miller's dislocated shoulder will not require surgery. Kevin White and Josh Bellamy will see more run in his absence.
report: Anthony Miller (shoulder) is out for Week 4 against the Buccaneers.

impact: Miller is considered week-to-week with a dislocated shoulder. Preseason standout and jump-ball specialist WR Javon Wims is active in Miller's stead for the first time all season. Coach Matt Nagy noted that Josh Bellamy would still start at slot receiver, with Allen Robinson mixing in throughout. S DeAndre Houston-Carson will also make his regular season debut. Although the Bears will take the field thin at corner, their daunting pass rush should be enough to force Ryan Fitzpatrick into costly turnovers.
report: Bears declared WR Anthony Miller, CB Prince Amukamara, CB Marcus Cooper, LB Isaiah Irving, LB Kylie Fitts, OL Rashaad Coward, and DT Nick Williams inactive for Week 4 against the Bucs.

impact: Miller is back after sitting out Week 4 with a dislocated shoulder. Because of Chicago's early bye, the injury only cost him one game. It will be interesting to see how the Bears use Miller following Taylor Gabriel's two-touchdown breakout in Week 4.
report: Anthony Miller (shoulder) is practicing in full for Week 6 against the Dolphins.

impact: Miller was out prior to the Bears' bye but practiced in full on both Thursday and Friday. Coach Matt Nagy said he'll play. Expect Josh Bellamy to return to the sideline, with Allen Robinson and Taylor Gabriel running a majority of their routes from the outside. Miller's a fringe WR4 in his first game back.
report: Anthony Miller (shoulder) will play in Week 6 against the Dolphins.

impact: Miller only missed one game with his dislocated shoulder. CB Prince Amukamara (hamstring) is also good to go. FB Michael Burton, CB Marcus Cooper, OT Rashaad Coward, OLB Kylie Fitts, DT Nick Williams, WR Javon Wims and OT Bryan Witzmann round out the Bears' inactives for Week 6.
report: Anthony Miller (shoulder) is active for Week 6 against the Dolphins.

impact: This was the rookie's first game back from a dislocated shoulder. Miller's day, at least for fantasy purposes, would have been a lot different had he pulled in a Mitchell Trubisky deep bomb in the first quarter. He was wide open but Trubisky badly overthrew him. Miller did visit the end zone later on, snagging a 29-yard touchdown grab to put Chicago back ahead (at least briefly) in the fourth quarter. The second-round pick has scored in two of his past three outings, though he's averaged just 25 receiving yards per game during that span. Miller will remain off the fantasy radar next week against New England.
report: Anthony Miller secured one-of-four targets for 29 yards and a touchdown Sunday in the Bears’ Week 6 loss to Miami.

impact: Miller earned an end-zone target in the first half, but he failed to haul it in. He came back with an important third-down conversion late in the third quarter and added a catch on the final drive, but that was it despite seven targets, although Mitchell Trubisky's play certainly did not help. Miller is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Anthony Miller hauled in 2-of-7 targets for 35 yards in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Miller led the team in targets with Allen Robinson out. He got open on a back shoulder corner route for his TD, but didn't do much with his expanded role. Miller would be the preferred play over Taylor Gabriel if Robinson misses another week.
report: Anthony Miller caught 3-of-7 passes for 37 yards and a touchdown in Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: He led the team in catches, receiving yards, and targets in a game where Mitchell Trubisky needed only complete 12 passes in a smooth-sailing win.  Bears Week 10 opponent Detroit has been getting lit up by slot receivers, so Miller will stay in the WR4/flex discussion in Chicago's next game.
report: Anthony Miller caught 5-of-6 targets for 49 yards in the Bears' Week 9 win over the Bills.

impact: The 122 yards were more than Miller had in his previous three games combined. The rookie out of Memphis made his living off long plays. He was the recipient of a 45-yard touchdown strike—his fourth of the season—from Mitchell Trubisky early in the second quarter and later broke free for a 55-yard catch-and-run on Chicago's opening drive of the second half. Detroit's secondary showed little resistance without Darius Slay (knee), leading to the biggest game of Miller's young career. The 24-year-old will try to build off Sunday's breakout next week when the Bears host division-rival Minnesota on Sunday Night Football.
report: Anthony Miller cruised to five catches for 122 yards and a touchdown on six targets Sunday in the Bears’ Week 10 victory over the Lions.

impact: Miller was left open on an underthrown pass from Mitchell Trubisky from 18 yards out for his touchdown. It was his only notable play, but Miller has been trending up with at least five catches or a touchdown in four straight games. Miller will get another difficult matchup against the Lions secondary in Week 12.
report: Anthony Miller caught 2-of-3 targets for 25 yards and a touchdown in Chicago's Week 11 win over the Vikings.

impact: Miller now has just seven targets over his past two games. He will still offer some WR4 appeal for Week 13 against the Giants if Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) can get cleared.
report: Anthony Miller caught 3-of-4 targets for 41 yards in the Bears' Week 12 win over the Lions.

impact: Miller made his catch count by securing the one-yard score on a trick play from Tarik Cohen as time expired in regulation to tie the game at 27-27 and force overtime.  Miller will be a WR4/5 next week against the Rams.
report: Anthony Miller caught a one-yard touchdown on two targets in the Bears' Week 13 loss to the Giants.

impact: Cooks beat the absolute pants off Trae Waynes with a sparkling 47-yard touchdown grab late in the first half on a beautifully-placed deep ball by Jared Goff, who was throwing dimes all night. The 25-year-old later clowned Xavier Rhodes for a 23-yard pickup in the fourth quarter. Cooks did cough up the football in the red zone after getting laid out by Mike Hughes, though the Rams were able to fall on it. Playing on his third team in as many years, Cooks has made a seamless transition to Sean McVay’s offense, eclipsing 80 yards in each of his four contests this season. He’ll remain a rock-solid WR2 next week when the undefeated Rams visit Seattle.
report: Brandin Cooks racked up seven catches for 116 yards and a touchdown on eight targets while adding a 10-yard rush Thursday in the Rams’ Week 4 victory over Minnesota.

impact: Cooks took a scary hit to the head at the end of a catch in the two-minute drill. He was down on the field for a couple minutes before walking off on his own. He was taken straight into the locker room, and it would be a shock if he returns to this game. The catch on which he was injured was called back on a penalty -- astoundingly not for the hit -- so Cooks exited the game without recording a catch.
report: Brandin Cooks exited Week 5 against the Seahawks after taking a big helmet-to-helmet hit at the end of the second quarter.

impact: He said the same of Cooper Kupp, who is also dealing with a concussion. "They felt good today. They didn’t have any symptoms or things like that," McVay said. "We’ll go through the standard operating procedure, and if everything checks out...then we’re hopeful to get those guys this week." Neither player is out of the woods yet, but optimism is better than the alternative. Josh Reynolds will fill in if either player is forced to sit.
report: Rams coach Sean McVay is "hopeful" Brandin Cooks (concussion) will be cleared to play this week.

impact: The Rams listed him as a DNP, though he's trending in the right direction for Week 6. Cooks' concussion is more of a concern than Cooper Kupp's, but both are expected to suit up against the Broncos. Josh Reynolds is the next man up if Cooks sits.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) was cleared for Wednesday's walkthrough.

impact: As did Cooper Kupp (concussion). Per coach Sean McVay, both will be "full" on Friday if they escape Thursday's session symptom free. That would mean they will be good to go against the Broncos. It's looking good.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) practiced again on Thursday.

impact: Same goes for Cooper Kupp. Both were full participants in practice Friday and are expected to be cleared from the league's protocol on Saturday. The Rams are looking good to have their full arsenal of weapons on hand in Denver.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) is expected to play in Week 6 against the Broncos.

impact: Cooks and Kupp were both full participants in practice on Friday and were cleared Saturday morning, as expected. The Rams will have their full arsenal of weapons on hand in what projects as a sneaky shootout against the Broncos. Expect no limitations for both Kupp and Cooks.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) and Cooper Kupp (concussion) will both play in Week 6 against the Broncos.

impact: As is Cooper Kupp (concussion). After it initially looked like they might be short-handed on offense, the Rams will be full strength as they play in a blustery Denver. Inactive for the Rams are K Greg Zuerlein, DB Darious Williams, RB John Kelly, OLB Trevon Young, C Brian Allen, DT Sebastian Joseph-Day and DT Tanzel Smart.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) is active for Week 6 against the Broncos.

impact: Cooks caught a 44-yard pass on the Rams' third play from scrimmage and went into witness protection thereafter. The Rams' passing attack never really got in gear as it dealt with injury to Cooper Kupp and watched Todd Gurley go bonkers on the ground. Cooks should bounce back as a high-end WR2 for Week 7 against the 49ers.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 2-of-6 targets for 53 yards in the Rams' Week 6 win over the Broncos.

impact: The Rams' passing game did not have to do much in this one, but Cooks still had a good day. His best play was a 19-yard touchdown in the second quarter in which he ran a great route to get open. The offense should have more to do next week against the Packers, and Cooks will be a borderline WR1 in that good matchup.
report: Brandin Cooks hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 64 yards and a touchdown in the Rams' Week 7 win over the 49ers.

impact: Both the targets and yards were Cooks' most in four games, but he found himself dealing with some sticky coverage from Packers rookie CB Jaire Alexander. Cooks has not cleared 100 yards since September, but there has been nothing concerning about his usage. He's just dealing with the typical statistical ups and downs of a fantasy season. Especially with six teams on bye, Cooks will remain in the WR1 mix for next week's showdown with the Saints.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 3-of-8 targets for 74 yards in the Rams' Week 8 win over the Packers.

impact: Cooks’ "revenge" game could not have started much better. After coming up with a 48-yard catch to help spark the second drive, Cooks finished it off with a grab in the back of the end zone for a four-yard score, his third of the season. He opened up the second half with a 15-yard catch on the opening scoring drive, made a great diving catch on a tipped pass the next series, and had another 15-yard gain to top 100 yards on a game-tying touchdown drive in the fourth. The Rams offense sputtered from there, but it was still a good outing for Cooks. He will be a borderline WR1 next week against the Seahawks.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 6-of-8 targets for 114 yards and a touchdown in the Rams' Week 9 loss to the Saints.

impact: Cooks' rushing score came on a jet sweep. The Rams spent the better part of four quarters setting it up. Both the targets and catches were new season highs. Cooks could begin seeing 10 looks with greater regularity if Cooper Kupp (knee) is lost for the season. He will be a WR1 for next Monday's guaranteed shootout with the Rams in Mexico City.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 10-of-12 targets for 100 yards in the Rams' Week 10 win over the Seahawks, adding a nine-yard rushing touchdown.

impact: Cooks' 12 targets led the team in the first game without Cooper Kupp (knee), while Robert Woods had 11 looks and scored a touchdown.  The only thing missing from Cooks' line was a trip to the end zone, but the Rams were getting the ball in his hands deep down the field and also close to the line of scrimmage, allowing him to showcase his speed.  He had one pass knocked out of his hands on what would have been a 45-yard completion, and Jared Goff also short-hopped him on two deep middle crosses, so Cooks could have had a much bigger night.  Still, he's topped 100 yards in three-straight games and gets the bye before a Week 13 date at the Lions.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 8-of-12 targets for 107 yards in the Rams' 54-51, Week 11 win over the Chiefs on Monday night.

impact: It was a relatively quiet week for Cooks, but he still reached an impressive milestone, going over 1,000 yards for the fourth time in his career. In doing so, Cooks became the first player in league history to top 1,000 yards receiving three straight years for three different teams. Cooks was going against Matt Patricia on Sunday (both former Patriots), which may explain why the Lions were able to contain him. Cooks and the Rams will be featured against the Bears on Sunday Night Football in Week 14.
report: Brandin Cooks corralled four-of-six targets for 62 yards Sunday in the Rams’ Week 13 win over Detroit.

impact: White had not caught a pass coming into this game, but he got a bit more run with Allen Robinson hobbled by a groin injury. That playing time almost led to a spectacular moment when White came down with the potential game-tying Hail Mary on the final play of the game, but he made the catch just short of the goal line and was pushed back by a group of defenders. Despite the big play and Robinson's injury, White is not a fantasy option.
report: Kevin White hauled in both of his targets for 64 yards in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: It's not looking good for Robinson to suit up against the Jets. That would enhance each of Taylor Gabriel, Tarik Cohen and Trey Burton's outlooks. It's possible Robinson comes down to a game-time decision but hopefully the Bears make his status clear on Friday.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Both Robinson and Khalil Mack (ankle) are expected to go through warmups Sunday morning to determine their final statuses. Both returned to practice Friday, making them true question marks for Week 8's matchup against the Jets. If Robinson is unable to play, Josh Bellamy would receive more run on the outside with Taylor Gabriel and slot wideout Anthony Miller seeing an increase in targets against New York's hobbled secondary.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) is questionable for Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: Robinson returned to a limited practice on Friday but he was always on the wrong side of questionable. A-Rob's likely absence would open up targets for Trey Burton, Taylor Gabriel and receiving back Tarik Cohen. It's a missed opportunity for Robinson, who could have had a big week against a depleted Jets secondary.
report: Allen Robinson (groin, questionable) is not expected to play in Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: Robinson wasn't expected to play after getting in only one limited practice this week. His absence opens up targets for Taylor Gabriel and Trey Burton, with Kevin White and Josh Bellamy also likely to have an expanded roles. The rest of Chicago's inactives are RB Michael Burton, CB Marcus Cooper, OL Eric Kush, OT Rashaad Coward and DL Nick Williams.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) is inactive for Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: It's not a promising sign for his Week 9 outlook. More will be asked of Taylor Gabriel and Trey Burton if A-Rob can't get clearance for Sunday's game in Buffalo. Receiving back Tarik Cohen could also see a bump in targets.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Robinson didn't practice on Wednesday either after missing Week 8. With two missed practices in a row, he's not trending in the right direction for Sunday's game against the Bills. If he's unable to play, Taylor Gabriel, Anthony Miller, Trey Burton, and Tarik Cohen will have more on their plates.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) remained sidelined at practice on Thursday.

impact: Robinson got in a limited practice on Friday, giving him at least a chance to suit up Sunday in Buffalo. If A-Rob is able to get the green light, he'll face a tough matchup against shutdown corner Tre'Davious White.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) is questionable for Week 9 against the Bills.

impact: The rest of Chicago's inactives are OLB Khalil Mack, WR Kevin White, CB Marcus Cooper, OL Rashaad Coward, DL Bilal Nichols, and TE Ben Braunecker.  Mack (ankle) and Robinson are both missing their second straight games.  In Week 8, Josh Bellamy started for Robinson with Anthony Miller and Taylor Gabriel rounding out the Bears' three-receiver set.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) is inactive for Week 9 against the Bills.

impact: Robinson has missed the last two games but should be ready to roll for the home date against the division rival Lions.  Robinson wasn't doing much before he went down and will be a mere WR3 for the likely low-scoring game.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) is practicing in full for Week 10.

impact: Robinson resumed full practice on Wednesday, putting him on track to play Sunday against Detroit. He'll be returning from a two-game absence. A-Rob hasn't made a huge impact in his debut season with the Bears, though his high-volume role (7.2 targets per game) keeps him in the weekly WR3 conversation.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) declared himself 100 percent.

impact: Robinson was a full participant at practice all week. Barring an unforeseen setback, he'll be back in the fold Sunday against Detroit. Coming off a two-game absence, A-Rob is ranked as our No. 45 wide receiver for Week 10.
report: Rich Campbell of the Chicago Tribune confirms Allen Robinson (groin) will play Week 10 against the Lions.

impact: A-Rob absolutely roasted the Lions in his return from a two-game absence (he had been out with a groin injury), contributing his first multi-touchdown game since Week 3 of 2016 back when he was still a member of the Jaguars. Robinson did most of his damage before halftime, hanging 99 first-half yards on the visiting Lions. Robinson made DeShawn Shead his first victim, beating him for a 36-yard touchdown with time winding down in the first quarter. He made another end-zone cameo in the third quarter, this time breaking off a 24-yard catch-and-run to put the Bears ahead 32-10. Detroit’s secondary looked shot without stud corner Darius Slay (knee) and Robinson took full advantage on Sunday. We’ll see what he does for an encore next week against the Vikings.
report: Allen Robinson nabbed six catches for 133 yards and two touchdowns on eight targets Sunday in Chicago’s Week 10 victory over Detroit.

impact: It's a letdown for Robinson coming off last week's 6/133/2 line. Robinson finished behind only Taylor Gabriel in targets but wasn't much of a factor with Mitchell Trubisky checking down all night. Robinson has been highly inconsistent, with six games under 70 yards. He's a WR4 for a tough Week 12 matchup against Detroit.
report: Allen Robinson caught 3-of-7 targets for 39 yards in Week 12 against the Vikings.

impact: 29 of Robinson's yards came on a tough grab against sticky Darius Slay coverage, but backup quarterback Chase Daniel simply was not looking his way. Trying to avoid mistakes, Daniel was staying underneath. Robinson will be an upside WR3 for Week 13 against the Giants if Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) can get cleared.
report: Allen Robinson caught 2-of-4 targets for 37 yards in the Bears' Week 12 win over the Lions.

impact: Robinson's big plays were a 30-yard grab off the helmet of CB B.W. Webb and then a catch on 4th-and-7 in traffic to extend the game late.  Robinson hasn't scored since his two-score Week 10.  He'll be a WR3 next week against the Rams.
report: Allen Robinson caught 5-of-9 targets for 79 yards in the Bears' Week 13 loss to the Giants.

impact: Elliott has been spotted limping around the field sporadically over the last two weeks, and Garrett confirmed he has a minor ankle sprain and bursitis in his knee. Zeke has played 89% of Dallas' 2018 offensive snaps. Garrett did state the Cowboys are "optimistic" Elliott will play in Week 5 against the Texans.  In the meantime, Rod Smith should be added in all fantasy leagues.
report: Cowboys coach Jason Garrett revealed Monday that Ezekiel Elliott is playing through knee and ankle injuries.

impact: Coach Jason Garrett revealed Monday Elliott is playing through knee and ankle injuries after the running back was spotted limping around the field against the Lions. It always seemed like much ado about nothing. Even so, adding Rod Smith makes some sense for those with Elliott on their roster.
report: Jerry Jones expects Ezekiel Elliott (knee, ankle) to play Week 5 against the Texans.

impact: Elliott is practicing in full.  The NFL's leading rusher is a locked-in RB1.
report: Ezekiel Elliott (ankle, knee) said he's "good" for Week 5 against the Texans.

impact: Elliott couldn't get anything going against a tough Texans front-seven. The entire Cowboys offense was stuck in reverse and couldn't sustain drives with Dak Prescott throwing two interceptions. Elliott took a helmet to the knee in overtime and didn’t look fully healthy. He's likely going to miss practice time this week.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 20 times for 54 yards and caught seven passes for 30 yards in the Cowboys' Week 5 loss to the Texans.

impact: Coming off a brutal outing against Houston in Week 5 (54 yards on 21 carries), Zeke was much better Sunday, shredding the Jags for 61 rushing yards in the second half. Elliott tallied his fourth touchdown of the year on a 15-yard scamper early in the fourth quarter. The Cowboys' offense isn't what it was a few years ago but Elliott has remained productive, leading the NFL with 586 rushing yards through six games. Even with his clunker against the Texans, Zeke has still cleared 100 yards rushing in three of his last four contests. He'll look to make it four out of five when he takes on the Redskins in Week 7.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rumbled to 106 yards and a touchdown on 24 carries while gaining 11 yards on his lone catch Sunday in Dallas’ Week 6 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Washington's defense kept Elliott bottled at the line of scrimmage, permitting just 2.2 YPC. He was in position to score on the goal line late in the fourth quarter, but Dak Prescott kept the ball and scampered over the middle and crossed the plain himself instead. Although his six targets were encouraging, it's the second straight week Zeke has been held under 12 yards receiving, and already the fourth time he's failed to reach that mark this season. His on-field usage and involvement remains that of a true bell-cow, though, keeping him as a weekly top-five option despite porous results in Dallas' passing game. The Cowboys are on bye in Week 8.
report: Ezekiel Elliott handled 15 carries for 34 yards, tacking on two catches for the nine yards in the Cowboys' Week 7 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Assistant OL coach Marc Colombo has been promoted. Legendary OL coach Hudson Houck has also been hired as an adviser. Injuries are mostly to blame, but the Cowboys have been far less effective up front this season. We can't imagine the change will have much effect on Ezekiel Elliott and company.
report: Cowboys fired OL coach Paul Alexander.

impact: Elliott was the lone bright spot of the offense and was cooking early, running through gaping holes.  He also made things happen in the pass game with a 37-yard pickup on a screen down to the four-yard line to set up Amari Cooper's score in the first quarter.  The Cowboys got away from Elliott in the second half, though, and they didn't score a single point after the break.  Elliott will again be a locked-in RB1 next week on the road in a tough date against the Eagles.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 17 times for 61 yards and caught 4-of-5 targets for 51 yards in the Cowboys' 28-14, Week 9 loss to the Titans on Monday night.

impact: It was a monster game for Elliott, who provided most of the Cowboys' offense. Elliott had the highlight of the night on a 32-yard run when he hurdled over Tre Sullivan -- his second-longest run of the season. He later converted a goal-line carry for his rushing touchdown, with his receiving touchdown coming on a third down red-zone pass from Dak Prescott. Elliott looks to have benefitted from the Dallas firing their offensive line coach during their bye. He's a locked-in top-10 running back play against Atlanta in Week 11.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 19 times for 151 yards and a touchdown and caught 6-of-7 targets for 36 yards and a touchdown in the Cowboys' Week 10 win over the Eagles.

impact: He put the offense on his back, scoring from 23 yards out in the fourth quarter to put the Cowboys up 19-9.  Atlanta came back to tie it, but Elliott muscled up for chunk yards on the final drive to put Brett Maher in position for the winning 42-yard field goal as time expired.  Elliott also led the team in receiving on a day Dak Prescott had just 208 passing yards.  Since the Week 8 bye, Elliott has three straight games of 100-plus total yards, amassing 500 yards and three scores in that span against the Titans, Eagles, and Falcons.  He gets the Redskins on Thanksgiving.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 23 times for 122 yards and one touchdown in the Cowboys' 22-19, Week 11 win over the Falcons, adding seven catches for 79 yards on eight targets.

impact: He added five catches for 22 yards on six targets.  Elliott waltzed through a gaping hole untouched into the end zone for his 16-yard rushing score.  The Cowboys later bungled a first-and-goal from the four-yard line situation by not giving it to Elliott and then settling for a field goal.  Elliott has 643 yards and four touchdowns over his last four games since the bye, three resulting in Cowboys wins, who are now first in the NFC East.  Elliott will get the Saints next Thursday night.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed for 121 yards and one touchdown on 26 carries in the Cowboys' 31-23, Week 12 win over the Redskins on Thanksgiving.

impact: Elliott sat out Sunday's practice -- the Cowboys are on an odd schedule playing two Thursday games in a row -- but that absence was apparently just a maintenance day. Elliott will be ready to face the Saints on Thursday night.
report: Ezekiel Elliott returned to practice Monday.

impact: "His hips were bothering him, so that’s why we kept him out of practice yesterday," coach Jason Garrett said Monday. "He looks better this morning." Dealing with typically massive workloads, it is not a surprise Elliott is entering the stretch run a little banged up. His status for Thursday's game against the Saints is not in doubt. He's a locked-in top-three RB1 for what will be a shootout.
report: The injury that kept Ezekiel Elliott out of Sunday's practice was hip soreness.

impact: He was held out of Sunday's practice following Dallas' Thanksgiving win over the Redskins.  Zeke will be all systems go Thursday night versus the Saints.
report: Ezekiel Elliott (hip) practiced fully on Monday.

impact: It was not an efficient night for Elliott against the Saints' elite run defense, but he made up for it with sheer volume. He already had 18 touches at halftime.
