Elliott's score was a perfectly-delivered 16-yarder on a screen. It was his third receiving touchdown of the season, which is a new career high. Elliott has now caught at least five passes in four-straight games. The workload monster will remain a top-four RB1 for Week 14 against the Eagles.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 23 times for 76 yards in the Cowboys' Week 13 win over the Saints, adding six receptions for 60 additional yards and a touchdown.

impact: Filling in for Brandin Cooks and Cooper Kupp, who both left the game with concussions, Reynolds came out hot following halftime. He had a 22-yard catch on the second offensive play of the half, a 17-yard grab the next play, and he rushed for 10 yards the play after that. He did not touch the ball again the rest of the game, but Reynolds is a talented young receiver who might be forced into playing time with Cooks and Kupp questionable. He should be added in most formats.
report: Josh Reynolds hauled in 2-of-3 targets for 39 yards and rushed once for 10 yards in the Rams' Week 5 win over the Seahawks.

impact: The story of Reynolds' Week 6 was Cooper Kupp's knee injury. It appeared Kupp's season was over before he miraculously returned for the second half (and barely played). Provided Kupp continues to get good news, Reynolds will remain on the outside looking in of fantasy value for Week 7 against the 49ers.
report: Josh Reynolds caught 1-of-2 targets for -2 yards in the Rams' Week 6 win over the Broncos.

impact: Reynolds isn't a player we blurb about often but he's someone to monitor this week with Cooper Kupp sidelined by a knee injury. The limited tag suggests Reynolds will be active against the Niners in Week 7. The 23-year-old could be an interesting dart throw in DFS if he gets the green light.
report: Josh Reynolds (hand) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Reynolds will be running as the Rams' No. 3 receiver for however long Cooper Kupp (knee) is sidelined. He could see a decent amount of Richard Sherman in Week 7 but is an intriguing, bottom-dollar dart throw in DFS.
report: Rams WR Josh Reynolds (hand) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Even with Cooper Kupp sidelined, Reynolds did not see a big boost. He did set up a touchdown with a 19-yard catch down to the one-yard line in the third quarter, but that was his only involvement. Even with uncertainty about Kupp’s availability, Reynolds can be sent back to the wire.
report: Josh Reynolds caught his only target for 19 yards in the Rams' Week 7 win over the 49ers.

impact: With the Packers doing an excellent job on Brandin Cooks and Robert Woods, Reynolds was open at critical moments. The scores were just the second and third of Reynolds' career, and first of 2018. Even if Cooper Kupp (knee) remains sidelined for Week 9, Reynolds won't be a recommended fill-in option against the Saints.
report: Josh Reynolds caught 3-of-5 targets for 42 yards and two touchdowns in the Rams' Week 8 win over the Packers.

impact: Starting in place of Cooper Kupp (torn ACL), Reynolds was third on the team in targets and nearly had a second touchdown but was unable to keep his big toe in bounds in the end zone.  His first score came from four yards out, and he, Tyler Higbee, and Gerald Everett all had big games to make up for the loss of Kupp.  Reynolds will be hit or miss down the stretch but obviously needs to be added everywhere he's available playing in this high-octane offense.
report: Josh Reynolds caught 6-of-8 targets for 80 yards and one touchdown in the Rams' 54-51, Week 11 win over the Chiefs.

impact: The Ravens used a "hot-hand" approach and settled on featuring Edwards after Alex Collins struggled to create early-game yardage on his own.  Buck Allen had one touch, and Ty Montgomery didn't touch the ball at all.  Edwards now has a chance to become Baltimore's lead back ahead of their Week 12 date with the Raiders.  A plus-sized bulldozer type, Edwards never so much as ran for 750 yards in a college season, but opportunity is trending toward his favor ahead of one of the softest stretch-run rush-defense schedules in the league.
report: Undrafted rookie Gus Edwards rushed 17 times for 115 yards and a touchdown in the Ravens' Week 11 win over the Bengals.

impact: Edwards entered Sunday with just 64 yards on 15 carries to his name in the NFL, but he left it in position to earn meaningful carries down the stretch. "To give us that type of a back is very important," Harbaugh said of Edwards' bruising style. "He gives us that back that we probably didn’t have earlier in the year. We’ve got four different guys who have different styles. I think that’s a plus for us." It remains unclear if this was a blip or the start of Edwards taking over the starting job from Alex Collins, but he is worth adding in all leagues to see what happens, especially given the Ravens' schedule down the stretch.
report: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said Gus Edwards "took the bull by the horns" with his 115-yard performance against the Bengals on Sunday.

impact: Edwards went ballistic against Oakland, bull-dozing his way to a new career-high in yards while Alex Collins (foot) watched in street clothes. Gus the Bus crushed it in the second half, blowing up for 65 yards on 15 carries after the break. Edwards had to be thinking end zone when Baltimore advanced to the Raiders' three-yard-line early in the fourth quarter, but a false start pushed the Ravens back five yards, costing the undrafted rookie a chance at a goal-line touchdown. He wasn't a factor in the passing game, ceding most of those opportunities to newcomer Ty Montgomery. The impressive rookie is closing in on must-start territory and will be employable as an RB2 next week in Atlanta, even if Collins returns from injury.
report: Gus Edwards rumbled to 118 yards on 23 carries Sunday in Baltimore’s Week 12 win over the Raiders.

impact: Alex Collins (foot) is day to day and unlikely to practice Wednesday.  Frankly, the Ravens have no reason to rush Collins with Edwards stringing together back-to-back 100-yard rushing games while averaging 5.4 YPC.  Edwards should again flirt with 15-plus carries in Atlanta as an upside RB2 play.
report: ESPN Ravens reporter Jamison Hensley expects Gus Edwards to "continue to carry the load at running back" for Baltimore.

impact: Well this is an interesting development. Edwards appeared fine in last week's win over Oakland, so the Ravens may just be giving him a breather. However, if the injury is legit, it could put Baltimore in a very tough spot for Sunday's game in Atlanta. With Alex Collins (foot) also banged up, all the Ravens have behind Edwards is Ty Montgomery and Javorius Allen, neither of whom are equipped for workhorse usage. It's not time to panic yet, though this will obviously be a situation to monitor throughout the week.
report: Gus Edwards (ankle) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: There was some concern after Edwards sat out Wednesday's session, but this practice puts him on track to play. Alex Collins (foot) also practiced Thursday, raising at least some concern Edwards could lose carries to the former starter, but The Gus Bus should handle most of the work against the Falcons. He is a solid RB2.
report: Gus Edwards (ankle) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: As is Alex Collins (foot). With both backs ailing, coach John Harbaugh mentioned the team potentially moving RB Kenneth Dixon to the active roster prior to Sunday. If so, the Ravens could have up to four backs active in Atlanta. Edwards is still our pick to lead the team in carries as a serviceable RB2 in Week 13.
report: Gus Edwards (ankle) is questionable for Week 13 against the Falcons.

impact: This was already assumed after Edwards was upgraded to full participation at Friday's practice. Coming off back-to-back 100-yard rushing games, Edwards will be in another great spot this week playing indoors against a Falcons team that has bled yards to opposing running backs this year. With Alex Collins (foot) now on injured reserve, Ty Montgomery, Javorius Allen and Kenneth Dixon will be fighting for scraps behind Edwards.
report: Gus Edwards (questionable, ankle) is expected to play Week 13 against the Falcons.

impact: With Alex Collins (foot) on injured reserve, Edwards will have early downs to himself. He's a mid-range RB2 for the final week of the fantasy regular season.
report: Gus Edwards (ankle) is active for Week 13 against the Falcons.

impact: Edwards was not targeted in the passing game. Edwards, who entered the game battling an ankle issue, also limped off late but was never announced with an injury. Coach John Harbaugh did not mention it during his post-game presser. A returning Kenneth Dixon stole eight carries, but it remained Edwards' backfield. There is every reason to believe Edwards will remain a volume-based RB2 for next week's game against the Chiefs, though his lack of pass-catching prowess will make him a little more volatile in what could turn into a track meet.
report: Gus Edwards rushed 21 times for 82 yards in the Ravens' Week 13 win over the Falcons.

impact: Edwards entered last week with an ankle injury but handled 21 carries, turning them into 82 scoreless yards.  He limped off late in the game but was never announced with an injury.  It sounds like it was a minor aggravation of the same ankle.  Edwards will be a TD-dependent RB2 at the Chiefs.
report: Gus Edwards (ankle) expects to play Week 14 against the Chiefs.

impact: Klis says it's a "good bet" Thomas finishes the season in Denver.  The soon-to-be 31-year-old (in December) is signed through 2019 at a $14 million salary next year.  We'd say it's a "good bet" this is Thomas' last year with the team, at least on that contract.  He's likely to be cut or dealt in the offseason.
report: 9 News Denver's Mike Klis reports the Broncos will not trade and are not shopping Demaryius Thomas ahead of next Tuesday's trade deadline.

impact: Thomas must have picked up the injury last week at Arizona. Regardless, he'll be all systems go for Sunday's divisional game against the Chiefs. Thomas posted a sluggish 4-24-0 line when he faced Kansas City earlier this month.
report: Demaryius Thomas (wrist) is practicing in full for Week 8 against the Chiefs.

impact: It was another silent week for Thomas, who has been held under 70 yards in every game but one this season. Thomas was the intended receiver on Case Keenum's lone interception, which occurred during the fourth quarter. It was a poor throw but Thomas probably could have done more to prevent the interception. The long-time Bronco has drawn trade interest recently and could be moved ahead of Tuesday's trade deadline. If Denver holds onto him, he'll face the Texans at home in Week 9.
report: Demaryius Thomas pulled in three of seven targets for 30 yards Sunday in the Broncos’ Week 8 loss to Kansas City.

impact: In rebuild mode, it makes sense for the Broncos to offload their aging receivers, especially the rapidly declining Thomas. Finding a suitor could be difficult, though, considering Thomas is owed $14 million in 2019, the final year of his contract. With uncertainty about both Thomas' and Emmanuel Sanders' futures, Courtland Sutton should be stashed in all formats.
report: Demaryius Thomas believes there is a "50-50" chance he is traded before Tuesday's deadline.

impact: Fellow NFL Network media man Ian Rapoport adds the Patriots are also "particularly interested" in Golden Tate, in addition to Thomas.  Thomas, of course, was drafted by Josh McDaniels in Denver and may need a change of scenery.  He's been relatively brutal in Denver this season, pacing the league in dropped passes and checking in at 70th among WRs in catch rate.  With Josh Gordon suddenly on thinner ice due to tardiness problems, the Patriots may be in the market for outside WR help.  Tate is the better player at this stage.
report: NFL Network's Michael Giardi reports the Patriots have "discussed" acquiring Demaryius Thomas ahead of Tuesday afternoon's trade deadline.

impact: Renck reports the Broncos are looking for a third-round pick, which seems unlikely given Thomas' contract and recent performance. Denver is motivated to move Thomas with Courtland Sutton waiting in the wings, so perhaps they will be willing to take less. Thomas is owed $14 million in 2019, the final year of his contract.
report: Denver 7's Troy Renck believes it is "more likely" Demaryius Thomas is traded on Tuesday than not.

impact: The deal is not done yet, but Houston is expected to send a mid-round pick. If it happens, this trade will have far-reaching fantasy implications, especially on the waiver wire. For Thomas, the better offense offers a slight upgrade, but DeAndre Hopkins should continue to dominate targets. The move is a big issue for Keke Coutee, who stood to benefit the most from Will Fuller's season-ending injury but is now back in a similar situation as he was before last week. Finally, Courtland Sutton is now locked into the at worst No. 2 job in Denver's offense, making him a must add in all formats.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports the Texans are "closing in" on a deal for Demaryius Thomas.

impact: The teams are also swapping seventh-rounders. That's not bad compensation for a 30-year-old in what's essentially a contract year. Thomas has been in steady decline since the Broncos' Super Bowl 2015 season, but he remains durable and reasonably effective. He will certainly be an upgrade for the Texans in three-receiver sets after they lost Will Fuller (knee) for the season. Thomas will also have a much improved quarterback situation. He should be a more bankable WR3 than he was with Case Keenum. His arrival puts a dent in Keke Coutee's WR3 outlook. Courtland Sutton, meanwhile, could flirt with WR2 value in Denver. Amazingly, the Texans are traveling to Denver for Week 9.
report: Texans acquired WR Demaryius Thomas from the Broncos in exchange for a fourth-round pick.

impact: Thomas has only had a few days to learn the offense after arriving in a deadline-deal trade, but rather than being eased in, he'll jump right into the fire Sunday against his former team. He won't be going in blind, however, as Thomas received a playbook crash course from DeAndre Hopkins, who has worked hard to get his new teammate up to speed. Demaryius will be worthy of WR3 consideration in his Texans debut Sunday at Mile High.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Demaryius Thomas will start Week 9 against the Broncos.

impact: All three of his catches came in the first quarter and he wasn't heard from again for the rest of the afternoon. In his defense, the Texans' target tree was dwindled completely without Will Fuller (torn ACL) and Keke Coutee (hamstring), allowing DeAndre Hopkins to run away with the team-lead in targets (12). It still bodes well for Thomas that the Texans decidedly featured him as their No. 2 receiver over Tyler Ervin and Vyncint Smith, both who have been with the team all year. He'll stay a WR3 in Week 11 when the Texans face the Redskins post-bye.
report: Demaryius Thomas hauled in all three of his targets for 61 yards in the Texans' Week 9 victory over the Broncos.

impact: He drew one target and has not so much as caught a pass since the first quarter of Week 9 against Denver.  Keke Coutee returned from his hamstring injury for nine targets in Sunday's win.  As a complementary receiver on a run-first team, Thomas will be difficult to trust as a fantasy starter going forward.
report: Demaryius Thomas was held catch-less in Week 11 against Washington.

impact: Thomas saw three quick targets against his former team in Week 9, but he has been blanked since. "I have to do a better job of getting him more involved," O'Brien said. "He’s working hard, he’s a good pro and we need to do a better job of getting him the ball a little more." Despite these promising comments, it will be tough to trust Thomas in fantasy lineups this week.
report: Texans coach Bill O'Brien blames himself for Demaryius Thomas' slow start.

impact: The touchdowns were Thomas' first two with the Texans in his third game with the team.  It was a much-needed breakout for the veteran after combining for three catches and 61 scoreless yards on four targets across his first two games.  Thomas scored from 12 yards out in the first quarter, beating Adoree Jackson, and added a 10-yard score in the fourth quarter to put the game out of reach.  Thomas' volume is still real low, but he'll be a WR3 next week vs. Cleveland.
report: Demaryius Thomas caught 4-of-5 targets for 38 yards and two touchdowns in the Texans' 34-17, Week 12 win over the Titans on Monday night.

impact: It's a new injury for Thomas, though his presence at Wednesday's practice suggests it's nothing serious. Demaryius scored a pair of touchdowns in Monday's win over Tennessee, though he still finished the night with just four catches for 38 yards. The ex-Bronco will be in play as a WR3 against Cleveland in Week 13.
report: Demaryius Thomas (wrist) is practicing in full for Week 13 against the Browns.

impact: Even with Keke Coutee sidelined, Thomas still only managed four targets Sunday, which was third on the team. In four games with the Texans, Thomas has received just 13 total targets, catching 10 for 131 yards and two touchdowns. Thomas is not a viable fantasy option to close the season.
report: Demaryius Thomas caught 3-of-4 targets for 32 yards in Sunday's Week 13 win over the Browns.

impact: The move comes as Devonta Freeman spends the week rehabbing his knee tweak. Freeman is tentatively expected to be good to go for Week 2.
report: Falcons promoted RB Brian Hill from the practice squad.

impact: A fourth-round rookie, Hamilton got rolled into on a return. It did not look good.
report: Broncos PR DaeSean Hamilton was forced from Thursday's game against the Cardinals with a knee injury and will not return.

impact: He suffered the injury in last Thursday night's win over Arizona.  Hamilton is Denver's No. 4 wideout behind Emmanuel Sanders, Demaryius Thomas, and Courtland Sutton.  Tim Patrick will move up the depth chart.
report: Broncos rookie WR DaeSean Hamilton has a sprained MCL.

impact: Sanders set season highs in catches and yards in a game where the Broncos were forced to abandon the running game after falling behind.  Sanders also saw his first red-zone target of the season.  In a Week 6 matchup with the Rams, Sanders' outlook will be improved by the game's shootout potential.  Sanders has earned every-week WR3 treatment but will be a legit WR2 against Los Angeles.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 9-of-14 targets for 72 yards in the Broncos' Week 5 loss to the Jets.

impact: Sanders nearly had a two-score day but got ruled down at the one-yard line on a 43-yard grab in the first quarter. Celebrating what he thought was a touchdown, Sanders was then called for taunting, pushing the Broncos back to the 16-yard line for 1st-and-goal. They had to settle for a field goal in a game they went on to lose 23-20. Sanders has come alive over the past two weeks even as Case Keenum continues to struggle, catching 16 passes for 187 yards and a touchdown. He could have a hard time staying hot in Week 7, as the Broncos will be traveling to Arizona on a short week. The Cardinals have held receiver fantasy production reasonably in check thus far.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 7-of-10 targets for 115 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 6 loss to the Rams.

impact: Sanders nearly overthrew Courtland Sutton on his wide-open touchdown throw in the first quarter, but the rookie was able to extend and make the catch. Sanders was left completely wide open on his 64-yard receiving score in the second quarter, as reserve S Rudy Ford seemed to have no idea what was going on. Sanders has now cleared 100 yards receiving in back-to-back games and 3-of-7 on the year. Case Keenum's play has often been ugly, but he has no qualms about looking Sanders' way. The Chiefs' burnable defense is on deck for a mouthwatering Week 8 matchup.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 6-of-7 targets for 102 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 7 win over the Cardinals, adding a 28-yard touchdown pass.

impact: Sanders tweaked his ankle late in Thursday's win at Arizona, though the veteran believes he would have re-entered the game had the score been closer. He'll have nine days to rest up before next week's game in Kansas City.
report: Broncos coach Vance Joseph said Emmanuel Sanders' ankle is "fine."

impact: Sanders has been drawing trade buzz since the offseason and with Denver approaching a rebuilding phase, it wouldn't be a surprise if the Broncos moved him at next week's trade deadline. Demaryius Thomas may also be available though Sanders has been more productive and costs less money. Whether Denver decides to trade Sanders, Chris Harris, Bradley Roby or all of the above, there's a good chance the Broncos will look much different by 4 PM ET on October 30.
report: According to Jason La Canfora of CBS Sports, "several teams" have shown trade interest in Emmanuel Sanders.

impact: Sanders came down with a 49-yard catch on the opening drive but wasn't heard from much after that. The veteran exited with a right shoulder injury early in the second half but only missed a few snaps. There have been rumblings that Sanders could be dealt ahead of Tuesday's trade deadline, so this could potentially be the last game of his Broncos tenure. If not, he'll be in the WR2/3 mix when the Broncos host Houston in Week 9.
report: Emmanuel Sanders snagged four catches for 66 yards on four targets while losing six yards on his lone carry Sunday in Denver’s Week 8 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Only Jeff Heuerman (10/83/1) saw more targets than Sanders in Denver's first game without Demaryius Thomas. Unfortunately, his nine targets amounted to just 47 yards on the day. Courtland Sutton totaled 3/57 on six fewer catches than Sanders. It was an underwhelming outing given the surrounding situation, but owners need not lose hope in him yet. Sanders will stay a WR2/3 when the Broncos return in Week 11 against the Chargers.
report: Emmanuel Sanders corralled 6-of-9 targets for 47 yards in the Broncos' Week 9 loss to the Texans.

impact: L.A.'s elite secondary showed little resistance early on, limiting the Broncos' star receiver to a single first-half catch. Sanders livened up in the second half, delivering a pivotal 38-yard catch on Denver's game-winning drive. The nine-year vet initially lost a fumble after taking a monster hit from Casey Hayward during the fourth quarter, though the play was later changed to an incompletion on review. Fantasy owners were hoping Sanders would see a boost from Demaryius Thomas' departure, but that hasn't exactly been the case as the 31-year-old has totaled just 10 catches for 103 yards and no touchdowns in his two games without Demaryius. He'll try to reverse that trend next week against his former team, the Steelers.
report: Emmanuel Sanders pulled in four catches for 56 yards on six targets Sunday in Denver’s Week 11 victory over the Chargers.

impact: Sanders was the focus of the passing game against his former team, recording six targets in the first half. He did not do much with the work, but he was just a hair away from a long catch early in the second quarter. His fortunes changed in the second half. Following a Steelers interception, Case Keenum found Sanders for a 38-yard catch and then hit him again the very next play for a five-yard score. The score was Sanders’ first since Week 7 and just his fourth of the season. He will be a decent bet to add to that total in a great matchup against the Bengals next week.
report: Emmanuel Sanders hauled in 7-of-12 targets for 86 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 12 win over the Steelers.

impact: Mid-week additions are never what you would want to see, but we would guess the Broncos are just being cautious. If Sanders can go, he will have a mouthwatering matchup in the Bengals' collapsed defense.
report: Emmanuel Sanders was added to the Broncos' injury report with a heel issue on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Sanders popped up on the report with a heel issue on Thursday, but he was able to practice on a limited basis Friday and looks ready to face the Bengals. He will be an upside WR2 in a great matchup.
report: Emmanuel Sanders (heel) was not listed on the final injury report.

impact: With Courtland Sutton bullying his coverage (and, in turn, hogging targets) on the outside, Sanders fell victim to low volume as the Broncos laid waste to the Bengals behind Phillip Lindsay's 19/157/2 breakout day. There's nothing to see here considering Case Keenum only threw the ball 21 times Sunday. Sanders will be a tremendous bounce-back candidate (and DFS buy-low option) as he'll likely avoid Richard Sherman by staying in the slot against the Niners in Week 14.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 4-of-6 targets for 19 yards in the Broncos' Week 13 win over the Bengals.

impact: Sanders reportedly slipped, rolled his ankle, and had to be helped off the field by training staff, unable to bear any weight on his left leg.  It doesn't sound good.  He was added to the injury report with a heel problem last week.  For now, we'd be surprised if Sanders is able to play Week 14 at the Niners.
report: Emmanuel Sanders was injured in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Sanders popped up on the injury report with a heel issue last week, so perhaps this has something to do with that.  Sanders went down in a heap at Wednesday's practice while making a cut against air. As 32-year-old, a torn Achilles' would make Sanders a candidate to open next year on reserve/PUP.  In the meantime, Courtland Sutton will take over as the No. 1 receiver.
report: The Broncos fear Emmanuel Sanders suffered a torn Achilles' in Wednesday's practice.

impact: An MRI confirmed Sanders has a torn Achilles. Sanders will be nine months removed from surgery for Week 1, making him a candidate to open the season on reserve/PUP. Entering a contract year, the Broncos can save $10.2 million from releasing Sanders this offseason, but his injury guarantees will likely keep him in Denver. Courtland Sutton, Tim Patrick, and DaeSean Hamilton will close out the year as the Broncos' top three wideouts.
report: Broncos placed WR Emmanuel Sanders (Achilles) on injured reserve.

impact: He added five carries for 19 yards on the ground. Prescott didn't turn the ball over, but he also didn't throw a single touchdown. It's the seventh time in his last nine games that Prescott has failed to eclipse the 200-yard mark. Although Dak shoulders the blame as quarterback, rookie LG Connor Williams was as advertised (and not in a good way) in pass-protection and OC Scott Linehan could not have taken a more vanilla approach to Sunday's gameplan. It's early, but Prescott's ceiling may be lower than initially thought if slot receiver Cole Beasley continues being his clear-cut target in the flats.
report: Dak Prescott completed 19-of-29 passes for 170 yards in the Cowboys' Week 1 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Prescott was listed with an ankle injury, which he must have picked up in last week's loss to Carolina. Regardless, he should be ready to roll against the Giants on Sunday Night Football. With the offensive line struggling and limited weapons in the Cowboys' receiving corps, Prescott can't be trusted as anything more than a back-end QB2 in fantasy.
report: Dak Prescott (ankle) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the Giants.

impact: Prescott wasn't asked to do much with the Cowboys defense shutting down the Giants. His touchdown was a 64-yard catch and run by Tavon Austin on the third play of the night. Prescott managed the game after that, but he added 45 yards on seven rushes. Through two weeks, Prescott has looked like the quarterback he was in the second half of last year. He gets a matchup with Seattle in Week 3.
report: Dak Prescott completed 16-of-25 passes for 160 yards and a touchdown in Week 2 against the Giants.

impact: Dak took five sacks for a loss of 31 yards. Plagued by a patchwork receiving corps and a declining offensive line, Prescott limped to just 40 yards on 6-of-13 passing in the first half. He was only marginally better after the break and spent much of his day trying to escape Frank Clark, who dominated up front for Seattle. Prescott’s lone touchdown "pass" came on a shovel throw to Tavon Austin with 7:11 left in the fourth quarter. Any chance of a late comeback ended when Earl Thomas pulled in his second interception of the day on a pass intended for Blake Jarwin. Perhaps Prescott will fare better against an attackable Lions defense at home next week, but with the Cowboys’ offense struggling in all facets, Dak will be little more than a back-end QB2 in fantasy.
report: Dak Prescott completed 19-of-34 passes for 168 yards with a touchdown and two interceptions while adding 21 yards on two carries Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 3 loss to Seattle.

impact: Prescott lost 24 yards on three sacks in the victory. Sunday marked Dak's first 200-yard passing game since Week 15 of last season. He spread the wealth, targeting eight different receivers including Ezekiel Elliott, who led the way with 88 yards and a touchdown on four catches. Prescott's first touchdown of the afternoon came on a screen to Zeke, who took it 38 yards to the house late in the second quarter. Dak later found tight end Geoff Swaim for a one-yard touchdown off a play-action pass, which stretched the Cowboys lead to 10 with under three minutes to go in the third quarter. That lead would evaporate but Dak kept his poise down the stretch, leading a late-scoring drive keyed by a 34-yard completion to Elliott down the right sideline. This was easily Prescott's best outing of 2018, which admittedly wasn't a high bar to clear after struggling mightily in his first three games. We'll see if he can build off this performance next week at Houston.
report: Dak Prescott completed 17-of-27 passes for 255 yards and two touchdowns while adding two yards on three carries Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 4 victory over the Lions.

impact: Prescott’s struggles resurfaced coming off his best game in Week 5. Both of his interceptions were on dropped passes, but Prescott was off the mark on the throws.  Prescott somewhat salvaged his night with 36 yards rushing. He doesn't have much of a supporting cast, but it's clear Prescott has regressed from last year. Prescott will be a back-end QB2 for a tough Week 6 matchup with Jacksonville.
report: Dak Prescott completed 18-of-29 passes for 208 yards with a touchdown and two interceptions in the Cowboys' Week 5 loss to the Texans.

impact: He lost 11 yards on three sacks in the victory. Going against arguably the league's toughest defense, Dak didn't blink, making Jacksonville pay for ignoring slot receiver Cole Beasley (nine catches for 101 yards and two touchdowns). Prescott also had a good day running the football, breaking out for a career-high 82 yards with a long gain of 28 yards. He probably would have had a bigger day had the score been closer but with Dallas winning big, Prescott only attempted nine passes after halftime. Next the Cowboys head to Washington for a division showdown against the Redskins in Week 7.
report: Dak Prescott completed 17-of-27 passes for 183 yards and two touchdowns while adding 82 yards and another touchdown on 11 rushes Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 6 victory over Jacksonville.

impact: Prescott ate a shoulder pad directly to his helmet while sliding near the sideline early in the first half, which forced Dallas' training staff to bring out the blue medical tent. He was cleared soon after with what was comically declared as a 'hand' injury. Prescott did encouragingly keep to his running ways, though, recording six carries for the third consecutive game. He's now averaged 7.6 rushes, 49.6 rushing yards, and 0.6 rushing touchdowns in the last three games for Dallas. Prescott will return from the Cowboys' Week 8 bye as a sneaky streaming QB2 versus the Titans.
report: Dak Prescott completed 22-of-35 passes for 273 yards and one touchdown, chipping in another 33 yards and one score on the ground in the Cowboys' Week 7 loss to the Redskins.

impact: He rushed just twice for 11 yards.  The 243 yards passing were actually Prescott's third-most of the season, and it was just his fourth game with multiple touchdown passes.  The rushing numbers were disappointing, however, after Prescott had averaged over seven rushing attempts per game over the last three weeks.  He also lost a fumble on Monday night.  The Cowboys came out hot, as Prescott hit Amari Cooper for a four-yard score in the first quarter.  But Prescott then tried to force one to Cooper in the end zone later in the quarter and threw a horrible interception.  His other score was a 23-yarder to Allen Hurns, who roasted Malcolm Butler.  Prescott will be a middling QB2 next week when the Cowboys go on the road to Philly.
report: Dak Prescott completed 21-of-31 passes for 243 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the Cowboys' Week 9 loss to the Titans.

impact: "Dak is the quarterback of the Dallas Cowboys," Jones said in his weekly radio spot. "He’s young, and he’s going to get extended." There is no ambiguity there despite Prescott's struggles over the last year. If Dallas wants Prescott to succeed long-term, they need to get him a better coaching staff.
report: Jerry Jones confirmed the Cowboys still view Dak Prescott as the quarterback of the future.

impact: He added nine yards on six carries, including a one-yard touchdown on a sneak before halftime. Prescott did enough to keep the Cowboys' playoff hopes alive in a must-win game. His only passing touchdown went to Ezekiel Elliott on a short red-zone throw, but Prescott continued to show good rapport with Amari Cooper, who had a team high 10 targets. Prescott has been trending up since the Cooper trade. He's on the streaming radar against the Falcons' bottom of the league secondary in Week 11.
report: Dak Prescott completed 26-of-36 passes for 270 yards and a touchdown in the Cowboys' Week 10 win over the Eagles.

impact: After not scoring a rushing touchdown the first five weeks, Prescott has four of them over the last five games.  His four-yard scamper was the first touchdown of the afternoon.  Ezekiel Elliott later added a 23-yarder and led the Cowboys with a 7-79 receiving line en route to 201 total yards.  Prescott gets the Redskins on Thanksgiving.  In Week 7, Prescott had 306 total yards and two scores in a road loss against Washington.  He'll be a borderline QB1 play.
report: Dak Prescott completed 22-of-32 passes for 208 scoreless yards in the Cowboys' Week 11 win over the Falcons, adding a four-yard rushing touchdown.

impact: Prescott added 18 yards and a third touchdown on the ground.  His five-yard rushing score was a thing of magic, escaping two sacks deep in the backfield close to the 20-yard line and then front-flipping into the end zone.  His two passing scores were 40- and 90-yard strikes to Amari Cooper, who went for 180 yards.  The 289 pass yards is a new season-high for Prescott, and he's topped 200 yards passing in all four games with Cooper after failing to reach that mark several times before the deal.  Prescott will be a borderline QB1 next Thursday versus the Saints.
report: Dak Prescott completed 22-of-31 passes for 289 yards and two touchdowns in the Cowboys' 31-23, Week 12 win over the Redskins.

impact: Dallas has set aside cap space to extend Prescott and Amari Cooper. The Cowboys believe in Prescott as their franchise quarterback despite a career trajectory that's trended down since his rookie season. Prescott is likely going to command at least the $18 million AAV Case Keenum got last offseason.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports the Cowboys plan to extend Dak Prescott this offseason.

impact: Prescott added five rushes for 22 yards. He also fumbled twice, losing one. It was a horrible red zone mistake late in the fourth quarter, but Drew Brees ended up "answering" just moments later with an even worse interception. One of Prescott's four incompletions was a should-have-been 55-yard touchdown to Michael Gallup, who was wide open after putting a double move on Eli Apple. Prescott just missed him. Otherwise, Prescott played excellent ball as the Cowboys sprung the massive home upset. He now has 10 days to rest up for a critical divisional matchup with the Eagles.
report: Dak Prescott completed 24-of-28 passes for 248 yards and a touchdown in the Cowboys' 13-10, Week 13 win over the Saints.

impact: Dixon was injured late in the Ravens' embarrassment of the Bills. Although it was partly garbage time fueled, Dixon had a surprisingly big role, out-touching Alex Collins 13-8. Part of it appeared to be punishment for Collins fumbling. As it is, Dixon is once again hurt, once again to his knee. Javorius Allen will serve as Collins' clear-cut backup/change of pace while Dixon is on the shelf.
report: Kenneth Dixon (knee) is expected to miss "some time."

impact: Dixon has missed 20 of a possible 33 games at the NFL level to injuries and suspension.  He managed a 13-44-1 garbage time-fueled rushing line against the Bills in Week 1.  It'll be Alex Collins and Buck Allen as the Ravens' main backs moving forward.  Baltimore has three backs on its practice squad.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Kenneth Dixon (knee) will be sidelined "several weeks."

impact: Dixon has missed 20-of-33 games at the NFL level and can add at least another eight to the list, as Dixon won't be eligible to come off I.R. until Week 11 at the earliest against the Bengals.  RB De'Lance Turner has been added to the 53.
report: Ravens placed RB Kenneth Dixon on injured reserve with a knee injury.

impact: Dixon will first be eligible to return in Week 11. Alex Collins is the Ravens' lead back with Buck Allen serving in a change-of-pace role. It's not one of the league's deeper backfields.
report: Ravens coach John Harbaugh has confirmed RB Kenneth Dixon (knee, injured reserve) will be a candidate for return.

impact: It sounds like Dixon is facing another suspension, but that is just reading between the lines. Speaking Monday, coach John Harbaugh made it sound like Dixon was healthy enough to resume practicing. With Ty Montgomery now a Raven, there's not a glaring need for Dixon to return.
report: Kenneth Dixon (knee, injured reserve) has yet to be cleared to resume practicing because of "issues" beyond the Ravens' control.

impact: Dixon resumed practicing two weeks ago, opening a 21-day window for him to be activated off injured reserve. That did not seem likely at the time given Baltimore's glut at the position, but injuries to both Edwards and Alex Collins could prompt a move. Dixon is certainly a name to watch in deeper leagues.
report: The Athletic's Jeff Zrebiec speculated Gus Edwards' ankle injury could prompt the Ravens to activate Kenneth Dixon (knee, injured reserve).

impact: The team would have to make that move by 4:00 pm EST on Saturday. Dixon profiles as a pass-catcher, but could handle a fair amount of carries pending Gus Edwards' (ankle) health. Ravens are also expected to have Alex Collins and Ty Montgomery active. Dixon can be stashed as a speculative add for the fantasy playoffs, but he'll be hard pressed to separate from the rest of this group if active.
report: Ravens are considering adding Kenneth Dixon to the active roster prior to Week 13 against the Falcons.

impact: With Gus Edwards (ankle) hobbled and Alex Collins (foot, injured reserve) done for the year, the Ravens will look to Dixon to soak up reps alongside Ty Montgomery. We expect Edwards plays and leads the team in carries, but Dixon ensures the team bring 3-4 active backs into their final five games. He's worth a speculative stash for the fantasy playoffs.
report: Ravens activated RB Kenneth Dixon (knee) from injured reserve.

impact: Dixon was the Ravens' clear-cut No. 2 back, though a distant No. 2 to Gus Edwards, who ran the ball 21 times. Ty Montgomery also mixed in for five catches. Barring missed time for Edwards, who seemed to tweak his ankle late in Atlanta, Dixon will lack Week 14 fantasy value against the Chiefs.
report: Making his first appearance since Week 1, Ravens RB Kenneth Dixon rushed eight times for 37 yards in Baltimore's Week 13 win over the Falcons, adding a six-yard reception.

impact: We knew Allen would be more involved following Kenneth Dixon's knee injury, but the extent was surprising. Allen received the Ravens' first goal-line touch over Alex Collins, converting a one-yard attempt midway through the second quarter. FOX's Troy Aikman matter of factly referred to Allen as the Ravens' goal-line back. Collins failed on an attempt of his own later in the period. Collins was the more impressive player, showing far more wiggle and tackle-breaking ability. Collins is still the player to own. Allen should not be an RB4 consideration against the Broncos in Week 3.
report: Javorius Allen rushed six times for eight yards and a touchdown in the Ravens' Week 2 loss to the Bengals, adding five receptions for 36 additional yards.

impact: Allen continues to struggle to produce positive yardage -- he now has 32 yards on 16 carries this season -- but he also continues to find the end zone. His first score came on a 12-yard pass in which he was able to get the corner and dive for the pylon, and he added a one-yard rushing touchdown in the third quarter. He is going to offer next to nothing when he fails to score, but Allen is a weekly FLEX consideration because of his red-zone role.
report: Javorius Allen rushed six times for seven yards and a touchdown and caught three passes for 19 yards and another score in the Ravens' Week 3 win over the Broncos.

impact: Allen played ahead of Alex Collins for most of the second quarter after Collins lost a goal-line fumble. He didn't have any highlights, but his workloads have been trending up. Allen will be a touchdown-dependent FLEX for Week 5 against the Browns.
report: Javorius Allen rushed 10 times for 30 yards and caught two passes for 17 yards in Week 4 against the Steelers.

impact: Allen also lost a fumble on one his six catches. He out-touched Alex Collins 14-to-13 and once again entered the game for goal line opportunities, though he failed to convert. Allen has at worst forced a committee with Collins and has a firm grasp on receiving work in the Baltimore offense. He's arguably a safer fantasy option at this stage since he is siphoning goal line snaps. Allen will enter Week 6 as an RB2/FLEX option against the Titans with a larger boost in PPR formats.
report: Javorius Allen rushed eight times for 34 yards while catching 6-of-8 targets for 44 yards in Sunday's Week 5 loss to the Browns.

impact: He out-snapped Alex Collins by 23 and won the touch battle 14-to-13 including six catches. Getting work at the goal line and in the passing game, Allen might be the safer fantasy option of the pair moving forward despite being the inferior talent. He will be a FLEX option next week against the Titans.
report: Javorius Allen played 50-of-87 snaps (57 percent) Week 5 against the Browns.

impact: Only one week after out-touching (14-13) and out-snapping (50-27) teammate Alex Collins, Allen fell victim to Baltimore's early lead and ensuing run-heavy game script. Collins inevitably out-carried Buck 19-1 on the day. In a closer game, perhaps Allen would've been used more, but his week-to-week usage is a legitimate dice roll at this point given coach Jon Harbaugh's recent statement about just "keeping Collins fresh." Allen has a higher floor (and will be needed) as the team's only pass-catching back in Week 7 against the Saints.
report: Javorius Allen rushed just one time for one yard and caught all three of his targets for 18 yards in the Ravens' Week 6 mauling of the Titans.

impact: Allen has four carries for four yards over his past two games. Alex Collins is hardly setting the world on fire, but Allen is not making a meaningful push for more work. Allen is a bottom-of-the-barrel, bye week fill-in RB3. The Ravens get the Panthers in Week 8.
report: Javorius Allen rushed three times for three yards in the Ravens' Week 7 loss to the Saints, adding three receptions for 21 additional yards.

impact: He didn't record a carry and was out-touched 13-3 by Alex Collins, who ran the ball 11 times for 49 yards and a score.  Collins lost a fumble again, but the coaches stuck by him.  Allen has registered touch counts of four, six, and three the last three weeks.  Allen is no longer a reliable fantasy option.
report: Javorius Allen caught 3-of-5 targets for 18 yards and one touchdown in the Ravens' Week 8 loss to the Panthers.

impact: The Ravens all but abandoned their running game in the second half, which obviously limited Allen's rushing opportunities. With Ty Montgomery likely to debut after the Ravens' bye week, Allen's days of being a relevant fantasy producer could be coming to an end. Outside of deeper leagues, it's probably time to cut bait.
report: Javorius Allen rushed once for a six-yard pick-up while snaring five catches for nine yards on five targets Sunday in Baltimore’s Week 9 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Allen was demoted to the Ravens' No. 3 back behind Gus Edwards and Alex Collins and can be dropped beyond the deepest of PPR leagues.
report: Javorius Allen rushed once for two yards in the Ravens' Week 11 win over the Bengals.

impact: Even with Alex Collins (foot) absent, Allen was barely heard from, seeing the field on just one of the Ravens' 70 offensive snaps. Allen was used extensively as a receiving back early in the year, but that role is currently being filled by newcomer Ty Montgomery. With Gus Edwards, Collins and Montgomery all working ahead of him, Allen could end up being a healthy scratch when the Ravens travel to Atlanta for Week 13.
report: Javorius Allen rushed once for two yards Sunday in Baltimore’s Week 12 win over the Raiders.

impact: He'll be filling in for Sam Darnold, who is out with a "significant" foot sprain. McCown hasn't seen the field yet in 2018, though he was serviceable as a starter last year, completing over 67 percent of his passes with 18 touchdowns and only nine interceptions. He'll be worthy of streaming consideration Sunday against a Bills team that can't get out of its own way.
report: According to SNY's Ralph Vacchiano, Josh McCown will start Week 10 against the Bills.

impact: Sam Darnold (foot) is doubtful. It remains possible the rookie is active as an emergency option, but McCown will get the nod. McCown was a surprisingly good fantasy option at times last season, but the matchup against Buffalo is too tough to rely on him as a streaming option.
report: Josh McCown is expected to start Week 10 against the Bills.

impact: He averaged a pathetic 4.0 yards per attempt, and not a single Jets pass catcher reached 35 yards.  McCown was not the savior for Gang Green's broken offense, which has been decimated by injuries and poor line play.  Sam Darnold (foot) figures to resume starting when the Jets come out of their Week 11 bye.
report: Josh McCown completed just 17-of-34 passes for 135 yards and two interceptions in the Jets' Week 10 blowout loss to the Bills.

impact: McCown's touchdown was a 16-yarder to Jermaine Kearse on a quick snap. His interception was a deep ball arm punt into Stephon Gilmore's coverage. McCown was hurt by a few drops but was in full game-manager mode. A bizarrely-constructed offense is spinning its wheels with McCown under center. Hopefully Sam Darnold (foot) can finally return for Week 13 against the Titans' tough defense.
report: Josh McCown completed 26-of-45 passes for 276 yards, one touchdown and an interception in the Jets' 27-13, Week 12 loss to the Patriots.

impact: McCown likely wakes up sore all the time at his advanced age.  Ultimately, we'd expected him to be fine for Week 13 against the Titans if Sam Darnold (foot) isn't able to return.  Darnold returned to a limited practice Wednesday.
report: Josh McCown (back, hand) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Neither injury is thought to be serious. Sam Darnold (foot) resumed practicing this week, though it's unclear if he'll suit up Sunday at Tennessee. McCown hasn't shown much in his two starts this year, producing a lackluster 57.5 quarterback rating in losses to the Bills and Patriots.
report: Josh McCown (back, hand) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Though Sam Darnold (foot) is questionable, we expect McCown to get the start in Tennessee, giving the rookie another week to get fully healthy.  McCown will be a bottom-barrel QB2 in a tougher matchup on the road.
report: Josh McCown (back, hand) was removed from the Week 13 injury report and will play against the Titans.

impact: This is how it was trending after Sam Darnold (questionable, foot) was limited in practice all week. McCown starting will continue to downgrade the entire Jets offense. He's not a streaming option against Tennessee's top-10 secondary.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, the Jets are planning to start Josh McCown against the Titans in Week 13.

impact: Sam Darnold (foot) is inactive and needs another week.  He'll likely be back for Week 14.  McCown is a last-ditch QB2 play in two-quarterback leagues.
report: Josh McCown will start Week 13 against the Titans.

impact: The Jets didn't score an offensive touchdown, instead settling for five Jason Myers field goals and a pick-six from Trumaine Johnson for their points.  McCown will head back to the bench in Week 14 with Sam Darnold expected back to face the Bills after missing the last three games with a foot injury.
report: Josh McCown completed 17-of-30 passes for 128 scoreless yards and an interception in the Jets' Week 13 loss to the Titans.

impact: With Devonta Freeman battling a knee issue, Coleman was the Falcons' primary back after the team's opening drive. It didn't amount to much on an evening where OC Steve Sarkisian neither committed to the run nor called a good passing game. If Freeman can't go for Week 2, Coleman will offer serious upside as an RB2 against the Panthers.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed nine times for 19 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 1 loss to the Eagles, adding a 26-yard reception.

impact: He caught all four of his targets for 18 additional yards.  With Devonta Freeman (knee) out, Coleman got his 20 touches, while rookie RB Ito Smith chipped in with 55 yards on 10 touches.  Coleman's bug run went for 36 yards, and he also had a 19-yarder that was very close to going to the house for a long touchdown.  Coleman was unable to convert his run inside the 10-yard line for a score, getting it down to the one before Matt Ryan scored on a sneak the next play.  With Freeman expected to miss at least another game, Coleman will be an upside RB2 next week against New Orleans.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 16 times for 107 yards in the Falcons' 31-24, Week 2 win over the Panthers.

impact: Starting for the second straight week, Coleman spent most of the afternoon running into brick walls, though he salvaged the day for fantasy owners with a late receiving touchdown. Coleman broke through for a 15-yard gain on his first touch of the second half but averaged a pathetic 1.29 yards on his other 14 carries. The 25-year-old also committed a costly mistake on the Falcons’ final drive, failing to pick up a blitz that resulted in a Matt Ryan incompletion on third down. He’ll look to redeem himself next week against Cincinnati.
report: Tevin Coleman netted just 33 yards on 15 carries while delivering two catches for 14 yards and a touchdown on three targets Sunday in the Falcons’ Week 3 loss to New Orleans.

impact: Coleman looked good when he got the touches in this game and appeared on the cusp of breaking a few long gains. Unfortunately, he ceded 10 touches to Ito Smith including what became a seven-yard touchdown on the opening drive. With Devonta Freeman looking likely to return next week, Coleman will return to the RB3/FLEX mix against the Steelers.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 14 times for 51 yards and hauled in all three of his targets for 26 yards in the Falcons' Week 4 loss to the Bengals.

impact: The injury shouldn't keep him from playing Sunday at Pittsburgh, though he'll likely see a reduced workload with Devonta Freeman (knee) due back from a month-long absence. Assuming that's the case, Coleman will revert to flex/RB3 status in fantasy leagues.
report: Tevin Coleman (shin) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Coleman was limited to start the week but got in full practices on both Thursday and Friday. His status for Sunday's game in Pittsburgh was never in doubt. With Devonta Freeman (knee) back from a three-game absence, Coleman will just be an RB3 this week.
report: Tevin Coleman (shin) wasn't listed on the Falcons' final injury report for Week 5 against the Steelers.

impact: Devonta Freeman started and won the touch battle, but Coleman played just one fewer snap. Ito Smith was also involved as the No. 3 back. Despite the disappointing day and the Falcons' increasingly crowded backfield, Coleman will have Week 6 FLEX appeal against the Bucs' horrific defense.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed seven times for 15 yards in the Falcons' Week 5 loss to the Steelers, adding two receptions for 15 additional yards.

impact: Coleman looked like he was going to disappoint fantasy players for most of this game. He failed to create any big plays on the ground, and he lost 11 carries and a touchdown to Ito Smith. Thankfully, he saved his fantasy day with a six-yard touchdown catch in the fourth quarter. Coleman remains a starter any time Freeman sits, but Smith's involvement means he will be more of an RB2 moving forward.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 10 times for 35 yards and hauled in 1-of-2 targets for six yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 6 win over the Bucs.

impact: He added 32 yards through the air by catching both of his targets.  Coleman started the night off with a 14-yard run and ended it with a 30-yard touchdown run where he went untouched through the right side.  He lives off big plays and hasn't been making many of them this season.  But Coleman out-played Ito Smith by a wide margin, out-gaining him 82-45 on four more touches.  Coleman gets a bye and will remain an RB2 in Week 9 against the Redskins.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 11 times for 50 yards and one touchdown in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: OC Steve Sarkisian made arrow and wheel routes to the perimeter a huge part of Atlanta's Week 9 plan, and Coleman exploited plus matchups against linebackers and safeties relentlessly while out-touching Ito Smith 18 to 11.  The Redskins came in playing elite run defense over the last month, yet the Falcons' offensive line won battles in the trenches all day.  Coleman will remain a volatile RB2 with big-play potential in Week 10 at Cleveland.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 13 times for 88 yards and caught 5-of-7 targets for 68 yards and two touchdowns in the Falcons' Week 9 win over Washington.

impact: Four of Coleman's carries came inside the Browns' five-yard line, but he could not find the end zone. It was a disappointing afternoon one week after Coleman totaled 156 yards against the Redskins. Coleman has yet to have a 100-yard day on the ground and has not cleared 13 carries since September. With Ito Smith mixing in liberally, Coleman is a high-risk RB2 despite his big-play ability.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 11 times for 44 yards in the Falcons' Week 10 loss to the Browns, adding three receptions for 19 additional yards.

impact: He ceded eight touches to Ito Smith, who did little with his.  Coleman is much better than Smith, but he can't shake loose as a true lead back, settling in as a 12-15 touches player, keeping him as a back-end RB2.  Coleman will get the Saints on Thanksgiving.  He had 47 yards against them Week 3.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed eight times for 58 yards and caught all three of his targets for 27 yards in the Falcons' Week 11 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Coleman and Ito Smith were completely shut down by New Orleans all night, rushing for an abysmal six combined yards on 12 carries. Matt Ryan comically led the Falcons in rushing. It's the second straight game Coleman's handled eight carries, though, as he continues to be used in a 1A-1B timeshare with Smith. With all byes done in Week 13, Coleman will revert back to an RB3/FLEX against Baltimore's front-seven.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed eight times for six yards, salvaging his day with a last-second touchdown catch in the Falcons' Week 12 loss to the Saints.

impact: Ito Smith was not any better. The Falcons barely bothered with the running game against the Ravens' elite defense. Coleman has just 18 touches for 34 yards over his past two games. He is averaging 4.01 yards per carry on the season. Barely even a FLEX in fantasy over the past month, Coleman will be a risky play for the first week of the fantasy playoffs in Green Bay.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed six times for eight yards in the Falcons' Week 13 loss to the Ravens, adding a three-yard reception.

impact: Powell got the start for the Jets, playing the first six snaps before ceding work to Isaiah Crowell, who answered in a big way with a 10-102-2 rushing line.  The two figure to split work pretty evenly for much of the season, but Powell would seem to be the favorite anytime the Jets are chasing points.  That wasn't the case tonight with New York winning by 31.  Powell will be on the RB3/FLEX map next week in the home opener against the Dolphins.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 12 times for 60 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for five yards in the Jets' Week 1 win over the Lions.

impact: Powell finished the game with 13 touches and 65 total yards. Isaiah Crowell also played 24 snaps and turned his 10 touches into 102 yards and two scores, although a 62-yard run buoyed those numbers. With the backfield looking like a clean split, neither Powell nor Crowell can be considered anything more than FLEX options.
report: Bilal Powell played 24-of-60 (40 percent) snaps Week 1 against the Lions.

impact: Powell was out-touched 14 to 10 by Isaiah Crowell in this one, but Powell's superior versatility resulted in a far superior fantasy day.  Crowell struggled as a rusher (12/35/0) and was targeted just three times in the passing game.  In a near-even timeshare, both backs will be Week 3 flex options at Cleveland.
report: Bilal Powell rushed five times for six yards, but caught 5-of-6 targets for 74 yards and a touchdown in the Jets' Week 2 loss to Miami.

impact: Powell failed to corral his lone target in the passing game. Powell managed to out-rush Isaiah Crowell 73-34 on two fewer carries, though Crowell converted a pair of goal-line looks for scores. There just isn't much separation here right now. Powell will be the preferred play against the Jaguars' daunting defense in Week 4 as the Jets look to counteract the Jags' pass rush with short throws.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 14 times for 73 yards in the Jets' Week 3 loss to the Browns.

impact: Powell continued to start over Isaiah Crowell and finished with more touches. The Jets abandoned the run early, so there wasn't much of a chance for him to get going on the ground. Powell's pass-game role has made him more matchup-proof than Crowell through the first month of the season. He's a low-end FLEX for Week 5's matchup with the Broncos.
report: Bilal Powell rushed eight times for 26 yards and caught 4-of-7 passes for 26 yards in Week 4 against the Jaguars.

impact: He out-touched Isaiah Crowell 20 to 16, although Crowell had a monster day with 231 yards from scrimmage and a touchdown.  The Jets remain committed to a near-even backfield committee.  Powell will be a decent RB2/flex option when Gang Green draws a plus matchup at home versus Indianapolis next.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 20 times for 99 yards in the Jets' Week 5 win over Denver.

impact: Powell out-touched Isaiah Crowell 16 to 15 in what remains a near-even backfield, although Powell had multiple chunk-yardage gains negated by penalties. Powell does have double-digit touches in 6-of-6 games.  He will be a low-end flex option when the Jets host the Vikings next.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 16 times for 59 yards and missed his lone target in the Jets' Week 6 win over the Colts.

impact: Powell left early in the second quarter.  Before exiting, he managed 20 yards on five carries and caught his lone target for a five-yard gain.  With Powell out, it'll be all Isaiah Crowell and Trenton Cannon in the backfield.
report: Bilal Powell exited Week 7 against the Vikings with a neck injury and will not return.

impact: Powell was injured in the first half of last week's loss to the Vikings.  In his absence, rookie RB Trenton Cannon led the Jets in receiving with 69 yards on four catches.  It'll be Isaiah Crowell carrying the mail on early downs this week in Chicago, with Cannon operating as the change-of-pace.  With the Jets as heavy 'dogs, Cannon is worth a speculative add in deeper leagues.
report: Jets placed RB Bilal Powell on injured reserve with a neck injury.

impact: Coach Todd Bowles said Powell's career is in jeopardy. An impending free agent, it's going to be hard for 30-year-old Powell to find a team willing to clear him. The Jets are moving forward with rookie Trenton Cannon as their pass-down back until Elijah McGuire is ready, possibly as soon as next week.
report: Bilal Powell (neck, IR) will undergo season-ending surgery.

impact: It comes one day after Bowles said Powell's career was in jeopardy. Powell has the same injury Quincy Enunwa had in 2017. It's the best-possible news for the versatile, soon-to-be 30-year-old back. Powell is headed to free agency. Despite the "full recovery" declaration, his health figures to complicate his standing on the open market.
report: Speaking Thursday, Jets coach Todd Bowles said Bilal Powell (neck surgery) is expected to make a "full recovery."

impact: McGuire cannot be activated until next week, but returning to practice when first eligible is a great sign for his health. With Bilal Powell's availability in question because of a neck injury, McGuire could return to a significant role behind Isaiah Crowell. He is worth a look in deep leagues.
report: Jets RB Elijah McGuire (foot, injured reserve) returned to practice last week.

impact: McGuire broke his foot early on in training camp but resumed practicing two weeks ago. The Jets could use him to take some of the pressure off Isaiah Crowell, who has assumed a workhorse role since Bilal Powell was lost to a season-ending neck injury.
report: Brian Costello of the New York Post expects the Jets to activate RB Elijah McGuire (foot, I.R.) for Week 9 against the Dolphins.

impact: McGuire is expected to make his season debut against the Dolphins this week, which will send rookie Trenton Cannon back to reserve and special teams duties.  McGuire should operate as the changeup specialist to early-down banger Isaiah Crowell.  McGuire is worth an add in 12-14 team leagues.
report: Jets activated RB Elijah McGuire (foot) from injured reserve.

impact: As expected, McGuire immediately took over as the No. 2 running back behind Isaiah Crowell. He only had two carries heading into the two-minute drive in the second quarter, but he jump-started that series with a 20-yard catch on the first play. With the offense chasing the game in the fourth, McGuire added a few touches and yards, but he was never going to have a big game with the offense struggling. That could be a concern moving forward, but he looks like at worst a bench stash worth picking up even in shallow leagues.
report: Elijah McGuire carried the ball seven times for 30 yards and hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 37 yards in the Jets' Week 9 loss to the Dolphins

impact: He outgained Isaiah Crowell 57 to 37, although Crowell put up more fantasy points due to his five-yard rushing TD in what amounted to garbage time.  McGuire has looked like Gang Green's best back since coming off IR/return two games ago.  The Jets should consider increasing McGuire's stretch-run workload after their Week 11 bye.  McGuire is a hold in 12- and 14-team PPR leagues.
report: Elijah McGuire rushed six times for 30 yards and caught 3-of-6 targets for 27 yards in the Jets' Week 10 loss to Buffalo.

impact: McGuire could have had a second reception but committed an awful drop. McGuire was out-touched and out-gained by Isaiah Crowell but was charted as out-snapping his backfield mate 35-26. McGuire has slid seamlessly into Bilal Powell's old role but has yet to turn it into viable FLEX numbers.
report: Elijah McGuire rushed six times for 19 yards in the Jets' Week 12 loss to the Patriots, adding a seven-yard reception.

impact: With Bilal Powell suffering a first-half neck injury, Cannon was elevated to Isaiah Crowell's change-of-pace.  Cannon's 73 yards led the team while his 69 yards receiving were also a team-best.  He did a bit of work on the final meaningless drive.  But if Powell remains out, Cannon could play a bigger role next week in Chicago.  He won't be a recommended fantasy play.
report: Jets rookie RB Trenton Cannon rushed two times for four yards and caught 4-of-5 targets for 69 yards in the Week 7 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Cannon played the Bilal Powell role but wasn't a factor after totaling 73 yards in relief of Powell last week. Now Cannon faces the specter of Elijah McGuire returning this week. The Jets play Miami in Week 9.
report: Trenton Cannon rushed six times for 12 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 12 yards in Week 9 against Chicago.

impact: He got out-touched by Bilal Powell 16 to 15.  Crowell seemed to be missing a step after suffering an ankle injury last week and barely practicing.  Crowell has been a boom-bust weekly performer reliant on long runs and/or short TDs.  He will remain a high-variance RB2/flex option in Week 7 against the Vikings.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed 13 times for 40 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for 12 yards in the Jets' Week 6 win over the Colts.

impact: Crowell was listed with an ankle injury last week, so this could be a new issue for the running back.  Crowell played through whatever he was dealing with against the Colts, and we initially expect him to do the same this week.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: This is an improvement for Crowell, who sat out both Wednesday and Thursday last week before suiting up against the Colts. He looks on track to play against the Vikings, but he will be nothing more than a low-end RB3 in a tough matchup.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: The assembled media thought Crowell was practicing, but he did not do enough to earn a "limited" tag. His Week 7 status against the Vikings is genuinely uncertain. A limited day on Friday would have Crowell on track to suit up.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) was officially "DNP" on Thursday.

impact: Crowell was unable to practice Wednesday and Thursday, but followed essentially the same routine last week before eventually playing against the Colts.  Even if he does play, Crowell is a tough RB3 sell in a difficult matchup.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) is questionable for Week 7 against the Vikings.

impact: Crowell followed the same practice schedule as last week, getting in a limited session on Friday before eventually suiting up against the Colts. He'll again play through his questionable tag in a much tougher matchup against the Vikings' nightmarish front-seven. Crowell has been a boom-bust weekly performer reliant of long runs and/or short TDs, and that won't change in Week 7.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) is expected to play against the Vikings in Week 7.

impact: Crowell has been dealing with an ankle injury, but he was always expected to play after handling 15 touches in Week 6.  The Jets' Week 7 inactives are WR Quincy Enunwa, DL Folo Fatukasi, CB Derrick Jones, CB Trumaine Johnson, FS Marcus Maye, LB Kevin Pierre-Louis, and CB Buster Skrine.
report: Isaiah Crowell is active for Week 7 against the Vikings.

impact: He caught a 21-yard pass on three targets while committing a bad drop on another pass.  Crowell has been battling ankle and foot issues in recent weeks but had to carry the load in this one with Bilal Powell leaving early in the first half with a neck injury.  Crowell gets the Bears on the road in Week 8.  Assuming he's healthy for it, Crowell will be a tough sell as an RB2/FLEX.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed 11 times for 29 yards in the Jets' Week 7 loss to the Vikings.

impact: It's his first full practice in three weeks. The Jets need Crowell more than ever with Bilal Powell (neck) on injured reserve. He'll be an RB2 against the Bears in Week 8.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) is practicing in full for Week 8 against the Bears.

impact: He added one catch for 13 yards. It was a negative gamescript for Crowell with the Jets trailing the entire game. They abandoned the run in the second half, leading to more work for Trenton Cannon. Crowell's ROS outlook is rising with Bilal Powell out for the year, but he's prone to bad games whenever the Jets play from behind.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed 13 times for 25 yards in Week 9 against Chicago.

impact: Miami has struggled to stop the run all season, but Crowell could not get anything going as the Jets went nowhere early in the game. He finished the first half with just 16 yards on five carries. Crowell found more running room after the break, but he did not have much of a chance with the offense floundering. Crowell will be in a similar spot next week against the Bills, a lackluster run defense which does not have the offense to force the Jets into negative game script, but he will be tough to trust as more than a low-end RB2 with Sam Darnold struggling.
report: Isaiah Crowell carried the ball 13 times for 49 yards and caught one pass for 11 yards in the Jets' Week 9 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: His five-yard bunny score didn't occur until the Jets were already down by 30-plus points.  It was the team's lone touchdown all game in New York's embarrassing 41-10 home loss.  Behind one of the NFL's worst offensive lines, Gang Green's running game has gone in the absolute tank.  Crowell will remain a touchdown-or-bust flex option when the Jets return from their Week 11 bye.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed seven times for 19 yards and a touchdown and caught 2-of-2 targets for 18 yards in the Jets' Week 10 loss to the Bills.

impact: The game was tied 13-13 late in the third quarter, but the Jets never got their run game in order, instead letting backup quarterback Josh McCown attempt 45 passes. Crowell won the touch and yardage battles with Elijah McGuire but got out-snapped 35-26 (via Pro Football Focus). Crowell will have a shot at positive game script in Week 13 against the Titans but is unlikely to have an RB2 day against a strong defense.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed six times for 30 yards in the Jets' Week 12 loss to the Patriots, adding three receptions for 30 additional yards.

impact: He added four catches for  nine yards on five targets, finishing fourth on the team in looks from Josh McCown.  Crowell had been struggling badly for the better part of two months before this one.  The 21 carries marked a new season-high for Crowell and his 98 rushing yards were his most since Week 5.  Crowell should have a chance to get volume again next week against the Bills.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed 21 times for 98 yards in the Jets' Week 13 loss to the Titans.

impact: Crowell has been battling different lower-body injuries for much of the past two months.  We should have a better idea on his status after Thursday's practice.
report: Isaiah Crowell (toe) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Cohen had a scaled back role behind workhorse Jordan Howard. He's still Chicago's primary pass-game back, but Howard is the centerpiece of the offense and playing more third downs this season. Cohen should be treated as a low-end PPR FLEX for Week 2's matchup with Seattle.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed five times for 25 yards and caught 3-of-4 passes for 16 yards in Chicago's Week 1 loss to the Packers.

impact: Cohen exited late in the fourth quarter with an ankle injury.  The severity is unknown.  Cohen was talked up as a "Tyreek Hill" type player over the summer but has been anything but through two games, logging eight touches for 41 yards in Week 1 and the five for 25 yards in this one.  He has no business being in fantasy lineups at the moment.  Not until he shows to have a bigger role.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed four times for eight yards and caught a 17-yard pass on his lone target in the Bears' Week 2 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Cohen left Monday night's game in the fourth quarter, but Nagy said he was dancing in the locker room after the win. He should be ready to face the Cardinals in Week 3. Unfortunately, he has a disappointing 13 touches through two weeks.
report: Bears coach Matt Nagy said Tarik Cohen's ankle injury is not a concern.

impact: This was Cohen's best game of the season after he posted just 66 total yards on 14 touches through the opening two games. The downside is that Cohen is still just being used a spell-back and not a player the Bears are scheming as a large part of their offense. With Jordan Howard as a true workhorse, Cohen needs more consistent passing-game involvement to be considered a fantasy option moving forward.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed five times for 53 yards while catching all three of his targets for 15 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Cardinals.

impact: This type of performance was always in Cohen's range of outcomes. What really stood out, though, was that Cohen out-touched Jordan Howard 20-11 and was involved early and often in the Bears' offensive game plan. Not only did he lead the club in targets, Cohen also led Chicago's backfield in carries, getting involved well before the offense erupted for a 38-3 lead heading into the half. It was admittedly a day where everything just went right for the Bears, led by Mitchell Trubisky's career-high six touchdown tosses. Everything seems to be clicking for Chicago heading into the team's Week 5 bye, and better days seem to be ahead for Cohen if kept involved. If you were thinking about dropping him, that's no longer an option.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed 13 times for 53 yards while corralling 7-of-8 targets for 121 yards and one touchdown in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Bucs.

impact: He saw two fewer touches than backfield-mate Jordan Howard (14-12) but out-gained him by over 50 yards. Cohen flashed his signature speed with a number of big plays including a 21-yard touchdown burst during the third quarter. He added a 50-yard catch-and-run later in the half and nearly scored a second touchdown, but it was called back on offensive pass interference. Cohen did hit a few rough patches, getting stuffed on a fourth-and-one opportunity and also losing a fumble in Bears territory late in the second half. After playing second fiddle early in the year, Cohen has pulled even with Howard in Chicago's backfield pecking order. Look for their timeshare to continue next week against New England.
report: Tarik Cohen contributed 31 yards and a touchdown on five carries while adding seven catches for 90 yards on nine targets Sunday in the Bears’ Week 6 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Following a disappointing start to the season, Cohen has established himself as a big part of Chicago’s offense, and that continued in this one. Cohen finished the first half with just one fewer touch than Jordan Howard, although that total was boosted by two catches with less than 10 seconds left in the half, and dominated work after the break. He started strong in the second half, catching a six-yard touchdown on the opening drive, and he added six more catches to his total after halftime. He now has at least seven catches in each of his last three games. He will be a great PPR option and an RB3/FLEX in standard formats next week against the Jets.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed six times for 14 yards and hauled in 8-of-12 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Cohen went untouched on a screen for his touchdown in the first quarter. The Jets sold out on an all-out blitz, leaving Cohen wide open. He had a quiet second half, but it was another solid game for Cohen, who's went over 60 yards receiving in four straight games. Cohen is a strong PPR FLEX, but he's startable in all formats for Week 9 against Buffalo.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed five times for 40 yards and caught a 70-yard touchdown in Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: Cohen flopped in fantasy almost entirely due to game script, which wound up going much more in the favor of Jordan Howard as Buffalo could muster zero resistance offensively, while Chicago's defense scored twice.  Expect Cohen to bounce back quickly when the Bears host the Lions next.  Cohen is still leading the Bears in targets over their last five games (34).
report: Tarik Cohen rushed six times for five yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for eight yards in the Bears' Week 9 win at Buffalo.

impact: Cohen was featured early on, out-touching back-field mate Jordan Howard by a noticeable 11-2 margin during the first half. Obviously the 23-year-old didn't find much running room on Sunday (2.14 yards per carry) but he helped his fantasy cause nonetheless by punching in a goal-line touchdown. Cohen has cooled off some since his hot start, but he's still been a helpful fantasy presence by hitting pay-dirt in five of his last six games. He'll try to keep the touchdowns coming next week when the Bears host Minnesota on SNF.
report: Tarik Cohen tallied 15 yards and a touchdown on seven carries while snagging six-of-seven targets for an additional 29 yards Sunday in the Bears’ Week 10 win over Detroit.

impact: Cohen got the start with Chicago opening in a pass formation. This wasn't of his better games, finishing with 50 total yards and a late fourth-quarter fumble.  Cohen has been held under 30 yards receiving the last three weeks. He's a FLEX play against Detroit on Thanksgiving.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed seven times for 27 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 23 yards in Week 11 against the Vikings.

impact: Cohen's missed connection was a should-have-been touchdown on a wheel route. Chase Daniel missed the throw. Daniel then atoned on a subsequent wheel route, finding Cohen for a 14-yard score in the fourth quarter. Cohen has just 166 yards from scrimmage over his past four games but has scored twice in the process. He will be in the RB2/FLEX mix for Week 13 against the Giants.
report: Tarik Cohen caught 7-of-8 targets for 45 yards and a touchdown in the Bears' Thanksgiving victory over the Lions, adding three rushes for 14 additional yards.

impact: Jordan Howard was the offense's focal point in the first half, rushing for 68 yards, but Howard had just eight yards after the break while Cohen simply took the game over for Chicago.  His 14 targets were five more than Allen Robinson for the team lead.  Cohen was called upon with the Bears down 27-20 on 4th-and-goal from the one-yard line with three seconds left in the fourth quarter to throw a one-yard touchdown to Anthony Miller and send the game to OT.  Cohen will be a borderline RB1/2 next week in a showdown at home against the Rams.
