report: Matt Ryan completed 31-of-41 passes for 354 yards and three touchdowns in the Falcons' Week 6 win over the Bucs.

impact: Ryan took three first-half sacks but wasn't sacked after the break; anytime he had time to throw, Ryan was dicing up this defense with relative ease.  He hit deep reserve WR Marvin Hall for a 47-yard touchdown over the top.  Ryan should have had a 60-yard touchdown to Julio Jones on top of that but underthrew the ball as he hit his hand on a helmet on the follow-through.  Atlanta had to settle for a trio of Giorgio Tavecchio field goals tonight.  Ryan and the Falcons are going into their bye week ahead of a road date with the Redskins in Week 9.
report: Matt Ryan completed 31-of-39 passes for 379 yards and one touchdown in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: Atlanta's pass protection was a major problem before their Week 8 bye, but Ryan had clean pockets all day with only two sacks and four hits absorbed among 40 dropbacks.  He hit Tevin Coleman twice for scores, Calvin Ridley for a 40-yard TD on a crossing route, and Julio Jones on a 35-yard screen pass for touchdown No. 4.  Ryan will continue to offer elite QB1 upside in Week 10 at Cleveland, whose secondary has been decimated by injuries.
report: Matt Ryan completed 26-of-38 passes for 350 yards and four touchdowns in Atlanta's Week 9 win at Washington.

impact: With the game already in hand late, Ryan lost a fumble. Ryan could have had a bigger day, but the Falcons had some dysfunction in the red zone after weeks of red-hot play inside the 20. Ryan did manage to find Julio Jones for a score for the second time in as many games. This time it was a Jones bubble screen from the one. It wasn't a bad day for Ryan, it was just a better day for Baker Mayfield and the Browns. Ryan gets the Cowboys at home for Week 11.
report: Matt Ryan completed 38-of-52 passes for 330 yards and two touchdowns in the Falcons' 28-16, Week 10 loss to the Browns.

impact: It was Ryan's first sub-300 yards day since Week 5.  The Falcons didn't get into the red zone until the second half as the teams traded field goals the first three quarters.  Ryan's interception was a drop by Calvin Ridley that clanged up into the air for Leighton Vander Esch.  His one touchdown was a 34-yard strike to Julio Jones down the right sideline to tie the game at 19-19 late in the fourth quarter.  Ryan will battle the Saints on Thanksgiving.  He had 374 yards and five touchdowns against the Saints in Week 3.
report: Matt Ryan completed 24-of-34 passes for 291 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Falcons' Week 11 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Ryan crushed between the 20's, averaging 8.0 YPA and completing 74.4% of his passes throughout the evening. The story of the night was still Atlanta's dreadful lack of urgency and play-calling as New Orleans' defense dominated with six sacks, five forced fumbles, and just 26 yards on the ground. To sum it all up, just know Ryan comically led the Falcons with 16 rushing yards. Atlanta's three lost fumbles in the red zone didn't help matters, either. Now sitting at 4-7, it wouldn't be shocking to hear OC Steve Sarkisian's name thrown around as a potential free agent at the end of the season. Despite his continued fantasy production, Ryan will be a mid-tier QB1 in Week 13 against Baltimore's nightmarish secondary.
report: Matt Ryan completed 35-of-47 passes for 377 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the Falcons' Week 12 loss to the Saints.

impact: Ryan also lost a fumble that was housed for a game-sealing, 12-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter. The Ravens blitzed on first down and Ryan was not expecting it. With zero running game and Julio Jones battling a hand injury, the Falcons could not sustain drives against the Ravens' elite defense. It was Ryan's worst showing since his miserable Week 1 in Philadelphia. He will have an excellent chance at bouncing back against the folding Packers in Week 14.
report: Matt Ryan completed 16-of-26 passes for 131 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' 26-16, Week 13 loss to the Ravens.

impact: The good news is Darnold was not wearing a walking boot on his injured foot, but he was still in street clothes for the Jets' first practice following the bye. Darnold reportedly "has a shot" to play this week, but he probably needs to return to practice by Thursday for that to happen.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) did not practice Monday.

impact: Well that clears it up. The Jets' Darnold timeline has been consistently shifting. He did not practice Monday. His Wednesday status will be all important. If Darnold turns in another "DNP," it's hard to see him returning against the Patriots.
report: Speaking Monday, Jets coach Todd Bowles called Sam Darnold (foot) "day to day, week to week."

impact: Darnold did not practice Monday, but he was not wearing a boot as he watched from the sidelines. "The foot is really good," said Darnold. "I feel really good. Like I said last week, I'm just following protocol right now." Coach Todd Bowles offered a non-answer when asked about Darnold on Monday, but it sounds like he at least has a shot to suit up. He likely needs to return to practice on Wednesday to make that happen.
report: Sam Darnold said his injured foot "feels great."

impact: It sounds like Darnold isn't going to play at less than 100% against the Patriots.  It'll likely be Josh McCown again out of the bye.  This offense is a disaster.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: For the second day in a row, Darnold suited up but did not practice. It would be a surprise if Darnold plays this week. Josh McCown will once again get the start.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Darnold's foot is still bothering him. With New York's season going down in flames, there's no need for Darnold to rush back. Veteran Josh McCown will get another chance to lead the offense Sunday against New England. Fantasy owners should treat him as a last-ditch QB2.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) is out for Week 12 against the Patriots.

impact: Darnold hasn't made much progress since injuring his foot in Week 9. Rapoport concedes that the rookie "could" return for next week's game at Tennessee, though at this point, it seems unlikely. It will be hard to gauge Darnold's status until he resumes practicing. Sixteen-year vet Josh McCown will continue to fill in at QB for the struggling Jets.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Sam Darnold (foot) is more likely to return in Week 14 than next week against the Titans.

impact: Josh McCown (back, hand) was also limited Wednesday.  Darnold is making steady progress after not practicing at all last week.  The Jets could choose to give him another week to get to 100% before throwing him out there.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) returned to a limited practice Wednesday.

impact: Darnold practiced for the first time since Week 9 on Wednesday. "Coming back after today and actually practicing on it, being on it today and cutting and doing my drops, it’ll be interesting to see how it feels [Thursday]," Darnold said. "I’m pretty optimistic about it though." The Jets will likely play it safe with the rookie, but there is at least a chance he returns to the starting lineup this week.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) said he is "hopeful" he will play this week.

impact: Darnold said earlier in the week he was "hopeful" of playing Sunday against Tennessee, though obviously the Jets have no reason to rush him back in the midst of a lost season. Josh McCown (back, hand), who has started the last two games, was also limited at Thursday's session.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Josh McCown practiced in full on Friday and would presumably be the starter one more week before Darnold likely gets back in the saddle Week 14.  The Jets want Darnold as healthy as possible before throwing him back out there.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) is questionable for Week 13 against the Titans.

impact: Josh McCown will make another start.  Darnold should be back Week 14.
report: Jets declared QB Sam Darnold, CB Derrick Jones, DB Jeremy Clark, OLB Jeremiah Attaochu, OL Ben Braden, WR Rishard Matthews, and DL Folorunso Fatukasi inactive for Week 13 against the Titans.

impact: On Monday, coach Todd Bowles indicated Darnold was healthy enough to play in last week's loss to Tennessee, but the Jets wanted to get him more practice reps ahead of this week's start.  After a hot beginning, Gang Green's offense has fallen into a state of brokenness Josh McCown failed to fix.  Darnold will be thrown back to the wolves in chilly Buffalo to face an underrated Bills defense.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) is expected to resume starting in Week 14 at Buffalo.

impact: Darnold is expected to be back under center for Gang Green after missing the last three games.  The Bills' defense remains one of the better streamers.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) is practicing in full for Week 14 against the Bills.

impact: We assumed as much after the Jets upgraded Darnold to full participation at Wednesday's practice. "The plan for me, personally, is to play," said the third overall pick. "Barring something catastrophic, I feel like I'm ready to go." Reports suggest Darnold was healthy enough to play in Week 13, though the Jets opted to play it safe by giving him another week. His return pushes veteran Josh McCown back to the bench.
report: Sam Darnold (foot) confirmed he plans to play Week 14 against the Bills.

impact: Trubisky is dealing with a bruised shoulder, and RapSheet says if it were a Sunday game, he'd likely be able to play.  But on an ultra-short week with a Thursday morning game after a Sunday nighter, it simply isn't enough time for Trubisky.  Injury designations will be official later Wednesday afternoon.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports it's "more likely" Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) sits in favor of Chase Daniel for Thursday's Week 12 game against the Lions.

impact: This has been the way it's been moving the last 24 hours; Trubisky isn't going to play Thursday, and it will be Chase Daniel making the start with Tyler Bray likely to back him up.  Trubisky is said to have a sprained AC joint, but the Bears expect him to be able to return Week 13 against the Giants.
report: Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is doubtful for Week 12 against the Lions.

impact: Rapoport described the issue as a "one-week injury" and claimed Trubisky likely would have been able to play if Chicago's game would have been on Sunday. Chase Daniel will get the nod against the Lions with Trubisky sidelined.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is expected to return in Week 13.

impact: Chase Daniel will get the start this week, but there is some hope Trubisky will be ready to go following the mini-bye. Chicago also declared FB Michael Burton, OL Rashaad Coward, WR Javon Wims, TE Adam Shaheen (concussion), DT Nick Williams, and OLB Aaron Lynch (concussion) inactive for Week 12.
report: Bears declared Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) inactive for Week 12 against the Lions.

impact: According to ESPN's Adam Schefter, Trubisky is "hopeful" of suiting up next week in East Rutherford, though his availability remains uncertain. If Trubisky can't go against the G-Men, he'd likely return the following week for Chicago's Sunday Night showdown against the Rams. Chase Daniel led the offense in Thursday's Thanksgiving victory over the Lions and would do so again if Trubisky can't get the green light for Week 13.
report: Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is not a lock to return against the Giants in Week 13.

impact: Coach Matt Nagy said Trubisky is feeling better after missing the Thanksgiving Day game against the Lions.  The two weeks off should help him out, and we expect him to be out there Sunday against the Giants after it was reported last week that he likely would have played had Week 12 fallen on a Sunday.
report: Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) will not practice Wednesday.

impact: An earlier report had Trubisky as a DNP but apparently he got in a limited session. Coach Matt Nagy said Trubisky's status for Week 13 could go down to the wire. "If he starts feeling better and we feel like we need to make a decision earlier, we'll do that," said the first-year head coach. "It could end up being a game-time thing." Chase Daniel would draw another start if Trubisky can't go Sunday against the Giants.
report: Updating an earlier report, Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: This is despite Trubisky getting in a limited practice on Wednesday. According to Garafolo, Trubisky could play right now, but the Bears want to play it safe. It makes sense with big games against the Rams and Vikings over the final four weeks. Chase Daniel will once again get the start.
report: NFL Network's Mike Garafolo reports Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) will not play Week 13 against the Giants.

impact: Trubisky was "limited" during Wednesday's practice and is expected to be the same on Thursday, but he is obviously not close to returning. Chase Daniel is expected to start again this week.
report: Bears coach Matt Nagy said Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is still not throwing.

impact: Trubisky was cleared to throw (and did so) at practice Friday but is still listed as doubtful. With Chase Daniel expected to start, all Bears receivers need be downgraded across the board. Daniel targeted Chicago's running backs at the fifth-highest rate (35%) in Week 12, keeping Tarik Cohen as a viable PPR RB2/FLEX option.
report: Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is doubtful for Week 13 against the Giants.

impact: Trubisky reportedly looked "fantastic" throwing on the field prior to Sunday's game and should return from his bruised shoulder next week against the Rams. Coming off a sluggish rookie season in 2017, the UNC alum has come into his own this year, breaking out for 20 touchdown passes while also contributing 363 yards and an additional three touchdowns with his legs. With Trubisky out again this week, Chase Daniel will draw another start Sunday against the Giants.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Mitchell Trubisky (doubtful, shoulder) is expected to return Week 14 against the Rams.

impact: Trubisky was doubtful, so this was fully expected.  Chase Daniel gets the start.
report: Bears declared QB Mitchell Trubisky, WR Kevin White, CB Sherrick McManis, RB Benny Cunningham, OT Rashaad Coward, WR Javon Wims, and DE Nick Williams inactive for Week 13 against the Giants.

impact: Reports have put Trubisky on track to return this week, but Nagy would not say if he expected the quarterback to practice let alone play. "We just keep seeing him throw and we see how he feels and then he tells us," Nagy said. "And if we feel like it’s an opportunity for him to go out there and he’s going to be good and safe and our team is good and safe with him in there, then that’s what we’ll do." With an important game against the Rams up next, the Bears will likely send Trubisky out there if he is even close to 100 percent.
report: Bears coach Matt Nagy said Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is "getting better and he’s feeling better."

impact: "But I’ve got to see more," Nagy continued.  Trubisky is expected to practice Wednesday.  We'd be surprised if Trubisky wasn't out there Sunday night in an NFC showdown.  Chase Daniel was bad for most of Week 13's loss to the Giants.
report: Coach Matt Nagy said he "feels strong" that Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) will play Week 14 against the Rams.

impact: It puts Trubisky on track to return Sunday night, which has been the Bears' plan for him all along. Among the league leaders in rushing yards among quarterbacks, the second-year signal-caller will be in play as a QB1 in all fantasy leagues.
report: Mitchell Trubisky (shoulder) is practicing in full for Week 14 against the Rams.

impact: There are no surprises on this list. The Broncos are healthy heading into Week 1.
report: Broncos declared QB Kevin Hogan, LB Alexander Johnson, C Sam Jones, WR Isaiah McKenzie, DE DeMarcus Walker, OT Elijah Wilkinson, and CB Isaac Yiadom inactive for Week 1 against the Seahawks.

impact: With no injuries a week ago, these are the exact same inactives that Denver had in Week 1.
report: Broncos declared QB Kevin Hogan, G/C Sam Jones, LB Alexander Johnson, S Shamarko Thomas, DE DeMarcus Walker, T Elijah Wilkinson, and CB Isaac Yiadom inactive for Sunday's Week 2 game versus the Raiders.

impact: Keenum added 16 yards rushing and a touchdown on the ground. After a quiet first half in which he completed just 5-of-11 passes for 38 yards, Keenum bounced back in the second half to complete 14-of-24 passes for 184 yards and lead the Broncos on four scoring drives. Keenum will be a lower-end QB2 for fantasy in Week 3 on the road versus the Ravens.
report: Case Keenum completed 19-of-35 passes for 222 yards with an interception in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Raiders.

impact: 9 News Denver's Mike Klis reports the DNP is "precautionary," and Keenum is expected to practice Thursday and play Sunday in Baltimore.  Keenum guided a late Week 2 comeback in the win over the Raiders but is a low QB2.
report: Case Keenum (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: He was "full." Keenum's absence was always believed to be precautionary. It's unideal that Keenum already needs his practice reps rationed, but he will be out there for a tough matchup with the Ravens. Keenum is a fringe Week 3 starter in two-quarterback leagues.
report: Case Keenum (knee) resumed practicing on Thursday.

impact: Keenum did not practice Wednesday, but there was never any real concern about his availability. He will be a back-end QB2 in a tough matchup against the Ravens this week.
report: Case Keenum (knee) was left off the final injury report for Week 3.

impact: Keenum was not good in this one. Consistently settling for the short pass amid pressure, Keenum had just 104 yards heading into the fourth quarter. After two touchdowns to open the game -- one set up by a blocked punt -- the Broncos punted seven straight times. The next play ended when Keenum was picked off on second-and-goal from the 15, and the final drive ended on fourth down deep in Baltimore territory. The good news is Keenum will get to face the Chiefs' defense at home next Monday night.
report: Case Keenum completed 22-of-34 passes for 192 yards, zero touchdowns, and an interception in the Broncos' Week 3 loss to the Ravens.

impact: The Broncos held what looked like a pretty commanding 23-13 lead with just over 12 minutes left, but then Patrick Mahomes happened and led an incredible comeback as Keenum simultaneously collapsed.  This was as good of an on-paper matchup as Keenum is going to see this season.  The Chiefs were playing the worst pass defense in the league entering Week 4, and Keenum was unable to attack it.  He had one big shot to Courtland Sutton early for 42 yards, but that was about it.  Keenum then missed a wide-open Demaryius Thomas with less than a minute to play on what should have been a walk-in 28-yard touchdown.  Keenum has been dreadful four weeks into his Broncos career, tossing six picks to three touchdowns.  He hasn't thrown for a score since Week 1 and won't be a fantasy option next week at the Jets.
report: Case Keenum completed 21-of-33 passes for 245 yards, no touchdowns, and one interception in the Broncos' 27-23, Week 4 loss to the Chiefs on Monday night.

impact: There is a major gap between reality and Keenum's stat line; he was dreadfully inaccurate when this game was in doubt, took four sacks, fumbled twice, and was a major part of the problem in the Broncos' 34-16 loss.  Keenum padded his stats with a garbage-time 42-yard touchdown to Demaryius Thomas.  Still not yet the subject of benching rumors, Keenum will be a two-quarterback-league play in next week's potential shootout against the Rams.
report: Case Keenum completed 35-of-51 passes for 377 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Broncos' Week 5 loss to the Jets.

impact: It was Keenum's second-straight 300-yard game, though he hardly looked good doing it. A huge chunk of Keenum's yards came on a pair of underthrown deep balls to Demaryius Thomas and Courtland Sutton. Keenum's arm appeared limited all afternoon. Keenum briefly checked out at the end of the first half as he was evaluated for a concussion, but he thankfully cleared. With just eight total touchdowns through six games, Keenum is barely staying on the QB2 radar. He gets the Cardinals on Thursday Night Football for Week 7.
report: Case Keenum completed 25-of-41 passes for 322 yards, two touchdowns and an interception in the Broncos' 23-20, Week 6 loss to the Rams.

impact: "Case is our quarterback," Joseph said after yet another Broncos loss on Sunday.  Keenum was checked for a concussion at the end of the first half, and sophomore Chad Kelly came into a standing ovation from Broncos fans to kneel it out on the final play of the second quarter.  Kelly was also tremendous in the preseason.  Keenum hasn't been the worst of the Broncos' problems, but his play also leaves the rest of the team zero margin for error since he's simply unable to deliver anything more than mediocre quarterbacking.  There haven't been more than a couple worse starting quarterbacks in the league through six weeks.  Keenum is tied for the league lead with eight interceptions, and only Josh Allen and Marcus Mariota have worse passer ratings.  Joseph and Keenum will go down with arms linked.
report: Coach Vance Joseph remains committed to Case Keenum as the Broncos' starting quarterback.

impact: Keenum added four carries for four yards. They're disappointing numbers considering the lopsided nature of the score, though five Cardinals turnovers kept setting the Broncos up with gorgeous field position, limiting Keenum's yardage opportunities. The Broncos' defense also housed a pair of pick sixes. Lastly, Emmanuel Sanders threw a 28-yard touchdown on a trick play. Keenum has been barely playable in two-quarterback leagues this season, but he will be a top-18 option against the Chiefs' barely-there defense in Week 8.
report: Case Keenum completed 14-of-21 passes for 161 yards, one touchdown and an interception in the Broncos' 45-10, Week 7 win over the Cardinals.

impact: He lost 40 yards on five sacks. Keenum had his deep ball working, especially when he uncorked a 49-yard bomb to Emmanuel Sanders on the opening drive. He also connected on a 42-yard heave to Courtland Sutton later in the afternoon. The 30-year-old slung a couple of touchdowns as well—one to Jeff Heuerman and another to undrafted receiver Tim Patrick—but fantasy owners likely could have done without his two turnovers. Both miscues—a fumble on a Dee Ford strip-sack and an interception off a flea-flicker to Demaryius Thomas—came with Denver trailing in the fourth quarter. Keenum has now thrown 10 touchdowns against 11 picks this season. The 3-5 Broncos will look to bounce back when they return home to face Houston in Week 9.
report: Case Keenum completed 22-of-32 passes for 262 yards with two touchdowns and one interception while adding a nine-yard carry Sunday in the Broncos’ Week 8 loss to Kansas City.

impact: It was a shrug-inducing day for Keenum, who at least notched the one score to make his outing semi-respectable. He ultimately missed a few downfield throws (as he's one to do) and wasn't helped any on a deep touchdown-drop by rookie Courtland Sutton. Demaryius Thomas' absence didn't seem to faze him any, though, as he instead locked in on TE Jeff Heuerman (10/83/1) for a team-high 11 targets. Keenum's now thrown an even number of touchdowns and picks (11) this season. He'll again be a viable streamer when the Broncos return from their bye and face the Chargers in Week 11.
report: Case Keenum completed 26-of-42 passes for 290 yards and one touchdown in the Broncos' Week 9 loss to the Texans.

impact: Keenum faced pressure from Joey Bosa all day, but was never sacked. The 30-year-old got off to a sluggish start, completing just nine of 17 throws for 56 scoreless yards in the first half. Keenum found a little more daylight after halftime, however, reviving Emmanuel Sanders after he was invisible for much of the first three quarters. The first-year Bronco was money on the final drive, converting five of six passes (the lone incompletion came when he spiked it to stop the clock with three seconds remaining) for 86 yards as the Broncos walked it off on a game-winning field goal by Brandon McManus. Keenum and the 4-6 Broncos host Pittsburgh in Week 12.
report: Case Keenum completed 19-of-32 passes for 205 yards Sunday in the Broncos’ Week 11 victory over the Chargers.

impact: Keenum did not have much success early in this one and missed Emmanuel Sanders on what should have been a big gain, but he was able to find Matt LaCosse on back-to-back throws late in the second quarter for the Broncos first touchdown of the game. Following a slow start in the second half, Keenum made the most of his defense gifting him a short field off an interception, hitting Sanders for a 38-yard catch before finding him one play later for a five-yard touchdown. Following another Pittsburgh turnover, Keenum led a long scoring drive to give the Broncos the lead in the fourth quarter. He did not have to do much, but he did enough to secure an important win. With the Bengals on deck next week, Keenum will be a viable streaming option.
report: Case Keenum completed 15-of-28 passes for 197 yards and two touchdowns in the Broncos' Week 12 win over the Steelers.

impact: Despite being in a plus matchup against Cincinnati's injury-riddled secondary, Keenum ultimately wasn't asked to do much as the Broncos rode Phillip Lindsay (19/157/2) and Royce Freeman (12/48) to victory. Keenum didn't even look to Emmanuel Sanders (4/19) all too often, instead chunking high-upside grenades to explosive rookie Courtland Sutton (4/85/1) down the sidelines and into the end zone. Keenum has another tasty matchup against San Francisco's secondary next week, but it's clear the Broncos prefer to take the weight off his shoulders and back Lindsay as they continue to push for the postseason. Keenum is merely a borderline QB2 in 2-QB leagues in Week 14.
report: Case Keenum completed 12-of-21 passes for 151 yards and one score as the Broncos defeated the Bengals handily in Week 13.

impact: Edelman earned his early touchdown, making a man miss and going through a couple others on his way to a nine-yard score on a screen pass on the opening drive of the game. He was not able to build on his hot start, however. He was targeted just once after halftime, and he did not record a catch in the second half. He has yet to top 57 yards since returning. Edelman will always be a touchdown threat in this offense, but there is at least some reason for concern, especially with Rob Gronkowski expected back next week.
report: Julian Edelman hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 36 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 7 win over the Bears.

impact: It was Edelman's first 100-yard game of the season since returning four weeks ago.  The targets and catches are also new season-bests.  He was dominating the middle of the field, as both Edelman and James White seemingly couldn't be stopped by the Bills.  The only thing missing was pass-game touchdowns.  Tom Brady didn't throw one.  Edelman will be a solid WR2 next week against the Packers at home with obvious big upside in a likely shootout.
report: Julian Edelman caught 9-of-10 targets for 104 yards in the Patriots' 25-6, Week 8 win over the Bills on Monday night.

impact: This is likely more illness related than concern for his ankle. Edelman set season highs playing through a heel injury last week. He should be fine for a likely Week 9 shootout with the Packers.
report: Julian Edelman (ankle, illness) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: His absence on Wednesday always seemed like it had more to do with the illness than the ankle, and a quick return suggests that was the case. Edelman should be ready to face the Packers on Sunday Night Football.
report: Julian Edelman (illness, ankle) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Edelman got in limited practices Thursday and Friday.  There hasn't been any concern from beat writers about his availability for Sunday night.  He's one of 13 Patriots listed questionable.  Ultimately, we expect Edelman to be out there playing his normal snaps coming off a 100-yard game.
report: Julian Edelman (ankle) is questionable for Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: Edelman got most of his yards in the first half. He had just two catches for 18 yards after halftime. Edelman has benefitted from Rob Gronkowski missing two of the last three games, but with Josh Gordon trending up, his rest of season outlook could take a hit. Edelman will be a high-floor WR2 against the Titans in Week 10.
report: Julian Edelman caught 6-of-10 targets for 71 yards in Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: Edelman was limited all last week before playing through a questionable tag and catch six balls for 71 yards against the Packers.  He's a fine WR2.
report: Julian Edelman (ankle) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Edelman isn't injured. He will be out there as a WR2 against the Titans.
report: Julian Edelman (ankle) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Edelman played through his ankle injury last week, so it was never a concern. He's a WR2 against the Titans.
report: Julian Edelman (ankle) wasn't listed on the Patriots' final injury report for Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: Edelman entered the game with an ankle injury.  In the fourth quarter, he may have aggravated the injury, went to the sideline, and eventually the locker room at the end of New England's blowout loss.  Edelman took an unruly number of shots over the middle from physical Titans CB Logan Ryan.  Edelman was able to walk on his own power.  We suspect he'll be good to go after the Pats' Week 11 bye.
report: Julian Edelman caught 9-of-12 targets for 104 yards in the Patriots' Week 10 loss to Tennessee.

impact: It's not surprising.  Edelman did enter last week's game managing a foot/ankle issue, but his injury did not appear significant on the field.  Edelman left in the fourth quarter with the game already out of hand.  The Patriots are now on their Week 11 bye.  We fully expect to see Edelman starting in Week 12.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the outlook for Julian Edelman (foot) is "positive," and New England's slot receiver "is not expected to miss much, if any time."

impact: He tweaked his foot in Week 10 but had the bye to heal up. Edelman has drawn 10-plus targets in each of his last three games and should be in for another big workload Sunday at MetLife Stadium. He's safe to fire up as a WR2 in all formats.
report: Julian Edelman (foot) is practicing in full for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: Edelman started out wide open on his 21-yard touchdown but had to fight for the final few yards near the goal line. There was a scary moment in the first half where Edelman landed extremely hard on his right elbow/shoulder. He spent a few moments shaking it out on the field and did not appear to miss any plays. Edelman has now gone over 70 yards in four-straight games. He's a high-floor WR2.
report: Julian Edelman caught 4-of-5 targets for 84 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 12 win over the Jets.

impact: Edelman injured his foot before the Patriots' bye week. He showed no ill effects Sunday against the Jets, corralling four-of-five targets for 84 yards and a touchdown. The veteran slot man will be employable as a WR2 when the Patriots host Minnesota in Week 13.
report: Julian Edelman (foot) is practicing in full for Week 13 against the Vikings.

impact: His afternoon included a pair of drops with both of them coming on crucial third downs. The 25 yards were a season-low for Edelman, though he made up for his lack of receiving success with a pair of long runs. The 10th-year slot man will look to redeem himself next week when the Patriots face Miami. He was suspended for the Patriots' first meeting with the Dolphins back in Week 4.
report: Julian Edelman collected three catches for 25 yards on eight targets while adding two carries for 35 yards Sunday in the Patriots’ Week 13 win over the Vikings.

impact: Wouldn't you know it, the Patriots are about to play Anderson's former team Houston. A 2016 UDFA, Anderson had some 2017 fantasy relevance for the Texans' banged up tight end group, catching 25 passes for 342 yards. He will probably end up making regular season appearances this year, either in New England or elsewhere.
report: Patriots signed TE Stephen Anderson to the practice squad.

impact: Gresham continues to make progress, though it's unclear if he'll be ready for Sunday's opener against Washington. His absence would open up more playing time for second-year tight end Ricky Seals-Jones.
report: Cardinals TE Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Gresham practiced on a limited basis this week but might need more time after missing the entirety of training camp while recovering from last season's torn Achilles. Even if he plays, Gresham will mostly be used as a blocker and shouldn't warrant fantasy consideration.
report: Cardinals TE Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) is questionable for Week 1 against the Redskins.

impact: Gresham was able to practice this week but is still working back from a torn Achilles. He may have a chance to return in Week 2. DT Robert Nkemdiche (foot) and DT Olsen Pierre (toe) are both good to go after being listed as questionable.
report: Cardinals declared TE Jermaine Gresham, OL Korey Cunningham, QB Mike Glennon, DE Markus Golden, RB T.J. Logan, CB Deatrick Nichols and OL Jeremy Vujnovich inactive for Week 1 against the Redskins.

impact: He got in limited practice all week. That was also the case in Week 1, though Gresham was inactive for Arizona's opener against Washington. Coming off a torn Achilles, he might not be game-ready yet. Ricky Seals-Jones would play close to an every-down role at tight end if Gresham can't go against the Rams.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) is questionable for Week 2 against the Rams.

impact: Gresham has been limited the last two weeks but has yet to get in a full practice. He's getting close to returning, but the Cardinals should hold him out another game. Gresham not playing would lock Ricky Seals-Jones into an every-down role.
report: Jermaine Gresham (questionable, Achilles) isn't expected to play in Week 2 against the Rams.

impact: Gresham got in three limited practices this week, but he is still not ready to return from last year's Achilles' tear. Ricky Seals-Jones will retain his every-down role for at least another week.
report: Cardinals declared TE Jermaine Gresham (Achilles') inactive for Week 2 against the Rams.

impact: Gresham didn't play through questionable tags the first two weeks. He finally looks over last year's torn Achilles and should play Sunday. Gresham's return is going to cut into Ricky Seals-Jones' snaps.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) is practicing in full for Week 3.

impact: He's coming off a torn Achilles but should be good to go after putting in a full week of practice. Gresham's return would put a damper on Ricky Seals-Jones' fantasy outlook.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) is questionable for Week 3 against the Bears.

impact: It's standard practice-reps management. Gresham will be fine for his normal snaps in Week 5.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He was able to get in a full session to close out the week after being limited on Wednesday and Thursday. Gresham has mostly functioned as a blocker this year (though not a good one), seeing just two targets over 50 offensive snaps since coming back from a torn Achilles. Even at a thin fantasy position, Gresham isn't relevant.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) wasn't listed on the Cardinals' final injury report for Week 5 against the 49ers.

impact: Gresham has been practicing on a limited basis since returning in Week 3. This looks to be rest related. Gresham should play against the Vikings.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: He's good to go for Sunday's game with the Vikings. Gresham has just three targets since returing in Week 3.
report: Jermaine Gresham (Achilles) was removed from the Week 6 injury report.

impact: Gresham was a late addition to the injury report after a limited practice Friday. This looks related to his Achilles injury. Ricky Seals-Jones would have an every-down role if Gresham sits.
report: Jermaine Gresham (heel) is questionable for Week 8 against the 49ers.

impact: Gresham should play after getting in a full practice Friday. He'll continue to split time Ricky Seals-Jones.
report: Jermaine Gresham (back) is questionable for Week 10 against the Chiefs.

impact: It's a slight downgrade for Ricky Seals-Jones. The Cardinals are also getting Tre Boston back this week. Inactive for Arizona are WR Chad Williams, WR Kendall Wright, S Eddie Pleasant, OL Zack Golditch, OG Mike Iupati, OL Colby Gossett, and DT Robert Nkemdiche.
report: Jermaine Gresham (back) is active for Week 10 against Kansas City.

impact: The Pats were dialing up some exotic runs but predictably could not get Patterson going as a pass catcher. No one can. Patterson isn't going to make a realistic push for fantasy value the final three weeks of Julian Edelman's suspension.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson rushed three times for 13 yards in the Patriots' Week 1 win over the Texans, adding a six-yard reception.

impact: Patterson set up the Bears’ first touchdown with a fumble on a kickoff return, but he made up for it in the second quarter. With the Patriots down 17-7, Patterson took a kickoff 95 yards to the house to close the deficit and turn the game around. Despite the big special teams play, he has no value in standard fantasy leagues.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson recorded a 95-yard kick-return touchdown in the Patriots' Week 7 win over the Bears.

impact: With Sony Michel (knee) out and featherweights James White and Kenjon Barner as the only other true running backs on the roster, Patterson actually got the start in the backfield and led the team with his 10 carries and 38 yards on the ground.  Patterson was heavily involved in the backfield in his college days and is a natural with the ball in his hands.  He got a couple carries from inside the 10-yard line on the second series but looked a little out of sorts.  This was likely just a one-week deal unless Michel is unable to go next Sunday against the Packers.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson started at running back in the Week 8 win over the Bills and rushed 10 times for 38 yards.

impact: He was limited in practice all week. Neck injuries are tricky, so Patterson isn't a lock to play. Patterson started at running back last week but won't have much of a Week 9 role if Sony Michel (questionable, knee) returns.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson (neck) is questionable for Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: Patterson was limited all week with a neck issue. With Sony Michel out, he should start and see carries in a committee with James White. The Patriots inactives are TE Rob Gronkowski, TE Jake Hollister, Nicholas Grigsby, OL Brian Schwenke, OG Shaq Mason, and OL Cole Croston.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson (neck) is active for Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: Patterson had a five carry, 50-yard drive after James White left with a leg injury. He didn't start but had just one fewer carry than White. Patterson has looked good at running back with Sony Michel out the last two weeks. He could have a Ty Montgomery role even when Michel returns.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson rushed 11 times for 61 yards and a touchdown and caught one pass for seven yards in the Patriots' Week 9 win over the Packers.

impact: Patterson played through the issue last week, toting the rock 11 times for 61 yards and a score against the Packers.  With Sony Michel (knee) back this week, Patterson's running back role should fade to nothing.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson (neck) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Patterson is going to suit up against the Titans, but Sony Michel's (knee) return means Patterson will revert to irrelevance in fantasy leagues.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson (neck) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Patterson is healthy, but he's not going to have much of a role wiith Sony Michel (knee) due back. He's droppable in redraft leagues.
report: Cordarrelle Patterson (neck) wasn't listed on the Patriots' final injury report for Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: All of his catches came after halftime as the Cardinals were forced to air it out trailing by 21. Seals-Jones was the intended receiver on Sam Bradford’s interception in the second half, which seemed to be a miscommunication. He also dropped a would-be touchdown in the fourth quarter, though Bradford could have placed the ball better. It was a rough opener for the second-year tight end, though his workload was somewhat encouraging. RSJ should probably be avoided next week in a difficult matchup against the Rams.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones chipped in with three catches for 19 yards on six targets Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 1 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Seals-Jones disappointed by catching just 3-of-6 targets for 19 yards and dropping what should have been a touchdown, but his snap share is exactly what upside hunters were hoping to see. Perhaps he loses snaps when Jermaine Gresham (Achilles') is able to return, but he should be a streaming option in good matchups all season. Unfortunately, he gets the Rams next week.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones played 49-of-53 (92 percent) snaps Week 1.

impact: It is a disappointing line for Seals-Jones, but it is not his fault. Arizona's passing game is comatose with Sam Bradford under center. Unfortunately, Seals-Jones will not be a fantasy option until that changes, especially with Jermaine Gresham on the way back.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones hauled in 4-of-6 targets for 17 yards in the Cardinals' Week 2 loss to the Rams.

impact: Seals-Jones made his presence felt early with a 35-yard score down the left side where he was left all alone by the Chicago defense and walked into the end zone. His failed to convert his other two targets for receptions. Jermaine Gresham made a return on Sunday and drew a pair of targets as he will cut into a small portion of Seals-Jones' opportunity, which wasn't exactly strong to begin with. Seals-Jones now has eight catches for 61 yards through three games.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 1-of-3 targets for 35 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Bears.

impact: The highlight of his day came on a 31-yard catch down the right sideline in which Josh Rosen put right on the money. It was second consecutive game in which Seals-Jones had a 30-yard reception. Through four weeks, Seals-Jones has reeled in 10-of-19 targets for 123 yards and a touchdowns. He will enter Week 5 as a TE2 option against the 49ers.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 2-of-4 targets for 52 yards in Sunday's Week 4 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Just brutal. RSJ still carries mild streaming appeal at an injury-ravaged fantasy position, though obviously the early returns for him have not been encouraging. The second-year tight end will look to rebound from Sunday's 0-for next time out against the Vikings.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones didn’t catch any of his six targets Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 5 win over San Francisco.

impact: It's a solid rebound after Jones was held without a catch on six targets last week. He did almost all of his damage early before the Cardinals offense stalled out in the second half. Seals-Jones' highlight was a jump ball over Harrison Smith for 40 yards. He's a TE2 for Thursday night's matchup against the Broncos.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 5-of-6 passes for 69 yards in Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: The story of Seals-Jones' night was his apparent arm break in the second half, though he said after the game he escaped with a bruise. Although Josh Rosen went all the way off the rails this evening, RSJ will remain a low-end TE2 for Week 8 if he can get cleared.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 2-of-4 targets for 12 yards in the Cardinals' Week 7 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It confirms he avoided what looked like a serious injury on Thursday night. With Josh Rosen struggling, Seals-Jones isn't a Week 8 streaming option.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones (forearm) is practicing fully for Week 8.

impact: New OC Byron Leftwich's scheme benefitted nearly everyone except Seals-Jones, who stayed splitting time with incumbent starter Jermaine Gresham. To add insult to injury, Gresham even out-gained RSJ 22-12 on the day. Unless Gresham is ruled out, Seals-Jones can't be trusted as a starting tight end moving forward.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 2-of-4 targets for 12 yards in the Cardinals' Week 8 victory over the Niners.

impact: Seals-Jones took on a larger role with Chad Williams out. His nine targets were behind only Larry Fitzgerald. Williams looks likely to miss another week, so Seals-Jones will be on the Week 11 streaming radar against the Raiders.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 5-of-9 targets for 51 yards in Week 10 against the Chiefs.

impact: It was a rough game for the 23-year-old converted wideout, as he dropped a pass and committed a devastating holding penalty that nullified a late 57-yard David Johnson touchdown. The five yards were his second fewest of the season, though he's been held below 15 in 3-of-4. RSJ will be a high-risk TE2 for Week 12 against the Chargers.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 1-of-3 targets for five yards in the Cardinals' Week 11 loss to the Raiders.

impact: He had just two targets. Seals-Jones continued to have a low-volume role despite Chad Williams missing another game. He's droppable in fantasy leagues.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught one pass for five yards in Week 12 against the Chargers.

impact: Seals-Jones has been too inefficient this season for fantasy usefulness.
report: Ricky Seals-Jones caught 1-of-3 targets for 10 yards in Week 13.

impact: "I’m excited to see where we’re going," Brady added. Gordon had a few hiccups against the Bears, but he responded with a great, leaping catch on fourth down and a 55-yard catch-and-run to help set up a touchdown. He also played 95 percent of the snaps, besting the season-high of 81 percent he set the week before. The arrow is squarely pointing up for Gordon.
report: Tom Brady said his "confidence" in Josh Gordon is "growing and growing and growing."

impact: This is Gordon's normal routine with the Patriots. Playing ever more snaps and gaining Tom Brady's trust, Gordon has locked himself in as an every-week WR2.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) was "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Gordon has yet to get in a full practice since joining the Patriots. He's in no danger of missing Monday night's game in Buffalo. Coming off a season-high 100 yards in last week's victory over the Bears, Gordon can once again be trusted as an every-week starter in fantasy.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Gordon is fully healthy. He's our No. 22-ranked wideout this week.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) is questionable for Week 8 against Buffalo.

impact: Per RapSheet, Gordon will be benched for "several series -- about a quarter."  He is expected to resume normal playing time thereafter.  The Patriots likely have Gordon on a zero-tolerance policy, so he's lucky he wasn't outright released.  Accountability has been a recurring issue throughout Gordon's career.  Tom Brady has gone out of his way to take Gordon under his wing.  The Athletic's Jeff Howe reported Gordon showed up late on Sunday before the team departed Gillette Stadium for Buffalo.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports the Patriots will keep Josh Gordon off the field for roughly a quarter on Monday night due to tardiness.

impact: The Athletic's Jeff Howe earlier reported Gordon was late for the Patriots' Sunday trip to Buffalo, and Kevin Duffy of the Boston Herald reported Gordon "showed up late to a meeting last week."  Things suddenly seem to be trending in a bad direction for Gordon.  These reports come one week after Tom Brady effusively praised Gordon for his football IQ and mastery of the playbook.
report: Josh Gordon was reportedly tardy at least twice this past week leading up to Monday night's game in Buffalo.

impact: Rob Gronkowski (back) is also good to go after both were listed questionable.  However, Gordon will reportedly be disciplined in the first half after being late to a meeting and then the team bus from Foxboro on Sunday.  Word is he should play his normal snap share in the second half.  He's a WR4.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) is active for Week 8 against the Bills on Monday night.

impact: Supposedly expected to not start, see limited reps early in the game, and be disciplined for tardiness, Gordon did the exact opposite of all that, getting the start, playing 19-of-20 snaps on the first two series, and being involved throughout the night.  His six targets were fourth on the team behind obvious main veins James White, Julian Edelman, and Rob Gronkowski, so it was a standard night at the office for Gordon.  When asked about the report after the game, coach Bill Belichick insinuated it was made up, saying, "You have to talk to whoever wrote that.  I have no idea."  The Patriots didn't have to score offensive points to beat the Bills.  Gordon will be an upside WR3 next week against the Packers.
report: Josh Gordon caught 4-of-6 targets for 42 yards in the Patriots' Week 8 win over the Bills.

impact: This is Gordon's routine. The Patriots will likely list Gordon as questionable again this week, but his status isn't in doubt.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: We'd ignore the questionable tag as Gordon's hamstring hasn't been a problem for weeks. Gordon has been a bit boom or bust since joining the Pats, but in a likely shootout against the Packers on Sunday night, he'll be worthy of WR2 consideration in all formats.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) is questionable for Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: Gordon had an expanded role with Rob Gronkowski sidelined. He was left wide open and only had to break an arm tackle on a 55-yard catch and run for his touchdown. It's the second 100-yard game for Gordon in the last three weeks. Gordon tied Julian Edelman for a team-high 10 targets and should continue to see his target share rise. He's an upside WR2 for Week 10 against Tennessee.
report: Josh Gordon caught 5-of-10 targets for 130 yards and a touchdown in Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: It's the first time Gordon hasn't been listed on the injury report since his acquisition from the Browns, suggesting he's at 100% heading into Week 10 against the Titans.  Coming off 130 yards and a score, Gordon is a WR2.
report: Josh Gordon (hamstring) has been removed from the Patriots' injury report.

impact: The Patriots went out of their way to try to attack Tennessee's previously vulnerable secondary, and Gordon delivered a 44-yard gain on their opening drive.  Unfortunately, he wound up losing too many one-on-one battles with Titans CB Adoree Jackson, while New England's offensive line struggled to protect Tom Brady against the Titans' blitzes.  The Patriots now have a Week 11 bye to sort out their offensive issues.  Gordon will remain an every-week WR2 when he comes back from the open date.
report: Josh Gordon managed four catches for 81 yards on 12 targets in the Patriots' Week 10 loss to the Titans.

impact: Gordon's five targets were his fewest in six games. They were a result of the Patriots going run heavy. Gordon has now cleared 70 yards in three of his past four games, though he has not caught more than five passes in the process. The WR2 should see plenty of Xavier Rhodes when the Patriots host the Vikings in Week 13.
report: Josh Gordon caught 5-of-5 targets for 70 yards in the Patriots' Week 12 win over the Jets.

impact: Gordon didn't see any looks from Tom Brady during the first half, but he came alive with 58 yards after the break with 48 of them coming on one drive. Brady found Gordon wide-open for a 24-yard touchdown, breaking a 10-10 tie with 0:35 remaining in the third quarter. Gordon's workload has taken a hit since Rob Gronkowski's return from back and ankle injuries, though the 27-year-old will still have his fair share of big games. He'll need to bring his A-game next week against Dolphins shutdown corner Xavien Howard.
report: Josh Gordon corralled three balls for 58 yards and a touchdown on three targets Sunday in New England’s Week 13 victory over the Vikings.

impact: Rapsheet confirmed what The Boston Herald's Kevin Duffy reported early Saturday morning. With the Patriots' bye merely one week out, the team is taking the longterm approach with Gronk and hoping 27 days is enough to get the prolific playmaker back to full health for a late season run. The Patriots will face the Jets in Week 12.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) is out for Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: This conflicts with previous reports. Gronkowski isn't expected to play, but he hasn't been officially ruled out. The Patriots plan to rest Gronk through their Week 11 bye to get him fully healthy.
report: ESPN Boston's Mike Reiss reports Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) traveled with the team and remains questionable for Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: He remains week to week with New England's Week 11 bye on the horizon.  The rest of the Patriots' inactives are DB Keion Crossen, RG Shaq Mason, S Obi Melifonwu, OL Matt Tobin, DE Derek Rivers, and RB Kenjon Barner.
report: Rob Gronkowski (back) is inactive for Week 10 at Tennessee.

impact: Gronkowski has missed New England's last two games with back and ankle injuries but had the bye to heal up. The injury-prone 29-year-old has disappointed this year, going six straight games without either a touchdown or 100 yards receiving. Gronk could be at risk of an in-game setback, though obviously the future Hall of Famer remains a must-start in all formats.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Rob Gronkowski (back) is expected to return for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: Gronkowski is on track to return this week after sitting out the last two games with back and ankle injuries. The five-time Pro Bowler has been a relative disappointment this year, averaging his fewest yards per game (64.0) since 2010. Despite his struggles, Gronk remains a must-start in all fantasy leagues.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: "Good to go and excited to get back out there with the team," Gronkowski said in a Friday press conference. "Excited to get back out there on Sundays and play some ball." His status comes from his mouth, so we'll have something more official on his availability once the Pats release their injury report Friday afternoon. It's been 27 days since Gronkowski last took the field, so he's presumably healthy enough to return to dominant form Sunday against the Jets.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) said he's "good to go" for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: He's listed as questionable, but Gronk said he's "good to go" in a press conference Friday afternoon. After sitting out the past 27 days, we expect he's out there on Sunday. Tom Brady (knee, illness) is questionable but reportedly "expected to play," too. Brady has notably struggled against the blitz this season, so he's best suited to be utilized against the Jets' blitz-happy scheme in season-long formats (rather than in DFS lineups) Sunday.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) is officially questionable for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: He had the bye week to heal his injured back. Gronk hasn't looked the same this year, averaging his fewest receiving yards per game since his rookie year in 2010. Injuries have clearly taken a toll on the future Hall of Famer, though he remains a must-start at a thin fantasy position. The five-time Pro Bowler will take a career-worst six-game touchdown drought into Sunday's action.
report: Rob Gronkowski (questionable, ankle/back) will play Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: As is Sony Michel (knee). Gronk has missed three of the Patriots' past four games but had the Week 11 bye to heal up. He can immediately be reinserted as a top-five tight end. Inactive for the Patriots DE Keionta Davis, DE Derek Rivers, OT Matt Tobin, OL James Ferentz, CB Duke Dawson, TE Dwayne Allen and S Nate Ebner.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) is active for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: Gronk's first target was a third down hospital ball from Tom Brady on the Pats' opening possession. The quarterback atoned one series later, delivering a perfect 34-yard touchdown strike as Gronk split two-deep coverage. Gronk still did not seem to be moving terribly well. It's going to be a gut-it-out stretch run for the 29-year-old All-Pro. The Vikings are on deck for Week 13.
report: Rob Gronkowski caught 3-of-7 targets for 56 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 12 win over the Jets.

impact: The Patriots removed him from the injury report. Gronk looked fully healthy in his return off the bye last week. He's a top-five tight end for Sunday's matchup with the Vikings.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) is practicing fully for Week 13.

impact: Gronk's absence from Wednesday's report was always too good to be true. We would assume this is a standard part of Gronk's rep management. He's a top-five option for Sunday's home game against the Vikings.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) was added back to the Patriots' injury report on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Gronkowski is about as healthy as he's going to be at this point. The 29-year-old doesn't move like he used to, though he still belongs in all fantasy lineups. He snapped a six-game touchdown drought by scoring in last week's win over the Jets.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) wasn't listed on the Patriots' final injury report for Week 13 against the Vikings.

impact: His longest gain of the afternoon came on a 15-yard dart from Tom Brady, which keyed a Patriots scoring drive late in the third quarter. We knew injuries would catch up to Gronk sooner or later and it seems his decline has finally begun. The 29-year-old doesn't move well and can't create separation liked he used to. Despite his struggles, Gronk remains an every-week starter at a thin fantasy position. We'll see what he can muster against the Dolphins in Week 14.
report: Rob Gronkowski came down with three grabs for 26 yards on four targets Sunday in the Patriots’ Week 13 victory over Minnesota.

impact: Gronk wasn't much use to fantasy owners last week (three catches for 26 yards), though he seemed healthy, playing all but offensive snap. He should be out there when the Patriots visit Miami in Week 14. Gronkowski nabbed four-of-seven targets for 44 scoreless yards when he faced the Fins in Week 4.
report: Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He was rear-ended on the highway by a woman who attempted to hit and run, though Kirk followed her and took down her license plate number. Kirk doesn't appear to be hurt and should be fine for Week 3 against the Bears. The rookie remains off the re-draft radar.
report: Christian Kirk (back) was held out of Thursday's practice as a precaution after getting in a car accident on Wednesday.

impact: Kirk sat out Thursday's practice after getting into a minor car accident on Wednesday, but there was never much concern about his status for Sunday's game. Until the Cardinals make a change at quarterback, the second-round rookie won't be of any use to fantasy owners.
report: Christian Kirk (back) returned to practice on Friday.

impact: Krik missed some practice time for precautionay reasons after getting into a traffic accident. He's fine for Sunday's matchup with Chicago. Kirk saw more targets than Chad Williams last week, but his early season role remains limited.
report: Christian Kirk (back) was removed from the Cardinals' injury report.

impact: After catching 5-of-7 targets for 31 yards over the first two games of the season, Kirk lead the Cardinals across the board in targets, catches and yards on Sunday. His highlight on the day was a 32-yard catch in the 4th quarter from Sam Bradford. Kirk was then Josh Rosen's favorite target, seeing three targets on the two possessions that Rosen helmed. For now, Kirk is still only a speculation add at best as the Arizona offense is not one to expect a lot of consistent production from for their best players, let alone an ancillary option.
report: Christian Kirk caught 7-of-8 targets for 90 yards in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Bears.

impact: Kirk trailed on Larry Fitzgerald in targets, but failed to produce much in Josh Rosen's first career start. Kirk was wide open for a potential touchdown in the 1st quarter, but Rosen went elsewhere with the football. Kirk is only worth a stash in deep leagues with Arizona's offense struggling to prop up any fantasy options at all at the moment.
report: Christian Kirk caught 4-of-5 passes for 28 yards in Sunday's Week 4 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Kirk broke loose for a 75-yard touchdown on the Cardinals' first play from scrimmage. That was Arizona's longest play from scrimmage this year. It also marked his first career touchdown. The rookie's involvement dwindled after that as the Cardinals got ahead and rode David Johnson to the finish line. The 21-year-old has easily been the Cardinals' most productive receiver this year, leading the team in yards two of the past three weeks. He's not a must-own by any means but Kirk has certainly showed promise in the early going. We'll see if he can keep it up next week when the Cardinals head to Minnesota.
report: Christian Kirk corralled three-of-four targets for 85 yards and a touchdown Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 5 win over the Niners.

impact: It's the second straight week Kirk's led the Cardinals in receiving. Kirk has been Josh Rosen's go-to target, with his seven targets finishing behind only Larry Fitzgerald (8). Kirk had 44 yards on the first two series before the Cardinals offense stalled out. His ROS outlook is on the rise with Rosen. Kirk is a WR3/FLEX for Week 7 against the Broncos.
report: Christian Kirk caught 6-of-7 passes for 77 yards in Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: Kirk will run most of his Thursday night routes against Broncos RCB Bradley Roby, who's allowed the fourth-most yards in the league. The Cardinals should feature Kirk with Larry Fitzgerald facing Chris Harris in the slot. Kirk has been Josh Rosen's top target since taking over for Sam Bradford. We like him as an upside FLEX this week.
report: Christian Kirk has run 59 percent of his routes on the outside this season.

impact: Both Josh Rosen and OC Mike McCoy seemed to lose track of Kirk for long stretches of time. He still ended up clearing 50 yards for the third-straight game, and fourth in five. Producing ahead of Larry Fitzgerald for most of the season, Kirk's WR4 appeal for Week 8 will be enhanced if the Cardinals fire McCoy, as is looking likely.
report: Christian Kirk caught 3-of-6 targets for 57 yards in the Cardinals' Week 7 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It was the third consecutive game the rookie's seen at least seven targets, scoring in two of said three performances. Kirk took a backseat to Fitzgerald (for at least one game) in OC Byron Leftwich's play-calling debut, watching the old timer erupt for 8/102/1. It was still a massively successful outing for Kirk, whose touchdown turned out to be the game-winner with just 0:34 left to play. With no realistic options to take serious in the team's passing game outside of Fitzgerald and, to a lesser extent, David Johnson, Kirk is locked-in as Arizona's No. 2 wideout (and an ensuing FLEX option) when the Cards return and play the Chiefs post-bye.
report: Christian Kirk caught 3-of-7 targets for 42 yards and one touchdown in the Cardinals' Week 8 victory over the Niners.

impact: It's a quiet game for Kirk coming off his Week 8 heroics. Kirk's longest catch was called back on a holding penalty. His snaps were up with Chad Williams out, but the Cardinals went run heavy in a game they kept closer than expected. Kirk has rebound matchup against Oakland in Week 11.
report: Christian Kirk caught 2-of-6 targets for eight yards in Week 10 against Kansas City.

impact: Kirk made the play of the day for the Cardinals in the first quarter, catching a screen in heavy traffic before shaking the entire defense to house a 59-yard score. He later made a critical red zone grab on a Josh Rosen pass that was delivered late. Kirk has routinely looked explosive but is having trouble in the box score department because of Rosen's shaky play. He will be an upside WR4 for Week 12 against the Chargers.
report: Christian Kirk caught 3-of-4 targets for 77 yards and a touchdown in the Cardinals' Week 11 loss to the Raiders.

impact: Kirk led the Cardinals in receiving, but there wasn't much he could do in a game Josh Rosen threw for only 105 yards. He also had the team high in targets. Kirk is having a solid rookie year despite league worst quarterback play. He'll be on the FLEX radar for Week 13.
report: Christian Kirk caught 4-of-6 targets for 41 yards in Week 12 against the Chargers.

impact: He added a 23-yard gain on the ground.  Kirk has shown promise as a rookie wideout and punt returner, but Arizona's passing game isn't capable of supporting much fantasy-caliber production in the air.  Kirk will be a WR4/flex option when the Cardinals square off with Darius Slay's Lions in Week 14.
report: Christian Kirk caught 3-of-8 targets for 54 yards in the Cardinals' Week 13 upset win over Green Bay.

impact: It's a brutal loss for a dispiriting Cardinals team, as rookie Kirk has been their most consistent playmaker. His absence for the season's final four games is going to make life even more difficult for struggling first-year signal caller Josh Rosen. Going forward, foot injuries are some of the most prone to setbacks, so hopefully Kirk's break is not a complex one. As it is, he should be ready well ahead of next summer's training camp. Kirk closes the book on his first NFL campaign with 43 catches for 590 yards and three touchdowns. He is an exciting hold in Dynasty leagues.
report: Cardinals placed WR Christian Kirk on injured reserve with a broken foot, ending his season.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of eight yards. Bradford’s Cardinals career couldn’t have gotten off to a worse start. His first half was an utter disaster as the former first overall pick completed just three passes for 11 yards. Bradford averaged a pathetic 4.5 yards per attempt while showing little in the way of accuracy. His interception was the result of a miscommunication with tight end Ricky Seals-Jones. The only receiver he showed any measure of chemistry with was Larry Fitzgerald, which was probably to be expected. Cardinals fans could be calling for Josh Rosen to start if Bradford endures another poor outing next week against the Rams.
report: Sam Bradford completed 20-of-34 passes for 153 yards with an interception and a lost fumble while adding seven yards on two carries Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 1 loss to the Redskins.

impact: This was a second dreadful showing from Sam Bradford in a row. He averaged 3.3 yards per attempt, and the Cardinals did not cross midfield until the second-to-last play of the game. At least able to put the ball on target in the past, Bradford has not even been accurate this season, and the offense is going absolutely nowhere with him at quarterback. He probably should not have started this game, and the Cardinals are simply wasting time if they put him under center next week against the Bears.
report: Sam Bradford completed 17-of-27 passes for 90 yards and an interception in the Cardinals' 34-0 loss to the Rams in Week 2.

impact: The idea is a simpler play sheet will help the struggling offense get on the same page. "I think the thought is just allow everyone to go out there and play faster," Bradford said, "simplify everything a little bit and hopefully it shows up in the speed in which we play." Bradford is averaging four yards per attempt so far this season and has struggled to get the offense past midfield let alone to the end zone. Perhaps this strategy will help, but Arizona should make the switch to Josh Rosen sooner than later.
report: Sam Bradford said the Cardinals are scaling back their offense this week.

impact: Bradford's had a rough first two weeks, but the Cardinals have stayed with him to this point. He'll start Sunday, but is at risk of an in-game benching. Josh Rosen got some first-team practice reps this week and could see the field if the offense continues to struggle. The Cardinals can save $4 million in roster bonuses if they move on from Bradford after this week.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports "there are some around the league" who believe the Cardinals are thinking of benching Sam Bradford.

impact: This conflicts with some previous speculation. The entire Cardinals offense has been a disaster, so there's no rush to put Josh Rosen in a bad situation. Arizona believes Bradford is still their best quarterback despite his early year struggles.  Bradford looks to have at least a couple weeks of leash before the Cardinals consider turning to Rosen.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports the Cardinals plan on sticking with Sam Bradford.

impact: Things started off well for Bradford as he completed 4-of-5 passes for 92 yards and two touchdowns in the 1st quarter, but then things quickly deteriorated. For the remainder of his time of the field, Bradford completed 9-of-14 passes for 65 yards with two interceptions and a lost fumble as the Cardinals have surrendered a 14-0 lead at home. It remains to be seen if this is truly the end for Bradford as the Cardinals starting quarterback or just a one-week relief appearance, but Bradford is on his last life as an starting NFL quarterback.
report: Arizona has pulled Sam Bradford in favor of Josh Rosen with 4:31 left in the Sunday's Week 3 game versus the Bears, trailing 16-14.

impact: Wilks plans to watch tape before determining the starter against Seattle. Bradford was benched in the fourth quarter after three turnovers, but Josh Rosen struggled in relief — throwing an interception and pick-six that was called back. The Cardinals should announce their decision early next week.
report: Cardinals coach Steve Wilks wouldn't commit to Sam Bradford starting in Week 4.

impact: He'll be a healthy scratch. It's a cost-saving move for the Cardinals as Bradford is due a $312,500 roster bonus for each week he's active. Mike Glennon will back up Josh Rosen on Sunday and likely for the foreseeable future.
report: Sam Bradford will be inactive for Week 4 against the Seahawks.

impact: Bradford looked like he was hoping to retire in the first 11-plus quarters of the season, and he is now Arizona's third-stringer behind Josh Rosen and new-backup Mike Glennon.  The Cards signed Bradford to a two-year, $40 million contract in the offseason.  He is making $20 million in salary and bonuses this year and will cost $5 million against Arizona's 2019 cap even after he gets cut.
report: Coach Steve Wilks confirmed Monday that Sam Bradford will remain the Cardinals' third-string quarterback going forward.

impact: Cardinals are essentially all systems go in their divisional matchup versus the Niners Sunday. With Josh Rosen and Larry Fitzgerald both removed from the team's injury report, it will be interesting to watch how new OC Byron Leftwich uses his full arsenal of offensive weapons. Jermaine Gresham (heel) is also active, downgrading Ricky Seals-Jones another week.
report: Cardinals declare QB Sam Bradford, WR Trent Sherfield, S Tre Boston, G Justin Pugh, OL Jeremy Vujnovich, OL Korey Cunningham and DT Corey Peters inactive for Week 8 against the 49ers.

impact: Hard to fathom Bradford signed a two-year, $40 million contact with the Cardinals in March. At the end of the day, the team paid Bradford his $10 million signing bonus and roughly $3.5 million in base salary and playtime incentives — a total of $13.5 million for three games. By waiving Bradford prior to Week 10, Arizona also gains a 2019 sixth-round compensatory pick. The Vikings lose a 2019 third-round compensatory pick. Bradford completed 50-of-80 passes for 400 yards, two touchdowns, and four picks in his illustrious tenure with Arizona. Mike Glennon will continue to backup rookie Josh Rosen.
report: Cardinals waived Sam Bradford.

impact: Well, they should.
report: Giants reportedly have "no interest" in bringing in free agent Sam Bradford.

impact: The main reason Bradford was not claimed by any teams on waivers Monday was because of his massive salary.  Lower down the list but still relevant is the fact that Bradford's long-bothersome knee has become "bone on bone" with no cartilage after two ACL surgeries.  We'd be surprised if Bradford played again.
report: Free agent Sam Bradford was unable to practice for his final five weeks on the Cardinals' roster.

impact: All of his work came in the second half. It was an encouraging debut for the fourth-rounder, though it’s doubtful he’ll see enough work to really register in the fantasy realm. It would probably take an injury to David Johnson for him to be relevant.
report: Chase Edmonds rushed four times for 24 yards while also pulling in four catches for 24 yards on four targets Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 1 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Coach Steve Wilks expressed optimism Edmonds would suit up despite missing consecutive practices earlier in the week. He was notably limited on Friday. Edmonds has been the only back to handle any amount of touches behind David Johnson this season. If out, Wilks would (finally) be forced to play Johnson on every snap.
report: Chase Edmonds (back) is questionable for Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: Edmonds missed some practice time early this week, but it wasn't enough to keep him out. He should see his nomal change-up role behind David Johnson.
report: Chase Edmonds (back) is active for Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: Edmonds came into the game questionable with a back injury. He looked healthy, but it's possible the Cardinals scaled his snaps back at less than 100 percent. Edmonds didn't have any setbacks. He'll be fine for his change-up role in Week 7.
report: Chase Edmonds had one carry for four yards in Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: Edmonds was out-touched by David Johnson 21 to 7, but Edmonds was more effective in scoring position with eight- and six-yard touchdown runs.  Johnson also blew an early-game blitz pickup to get Josh Rosen sacked, which may have contributed to Edmonds' increased playing time.  Edmonds still won't be a fantasy option when Arizona returns home to face the reeling Lions in Week 14.
report: Chase Edmonds rushed five times for 53 yards and two touchdowns and caught 2-of-2 targets for 13 yards in the Cardinals' Week 13 upset of Green Bay.

impact: This has been Fitzgerald's routine the last couple weeks. Fitzgerald's production has taken a hit playing through injuries and bad quarterback play. He's a low-end FLEX for Week 6.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring, back) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Fitzgerald will be out there against the Vikings but has not produced with either Sam Bradford or Josh Rosen this season. He's a low-upside WR4 until he puts a good fantasy game or two in the can.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring, back) returned to Cardinals practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Fitzgerald has been playing through injuries the last few weeks. He was never in danger of sitting Sunday, but bad quarterback play has made him just a low-end FLEX.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring, back) was removed from the Week 6 injury report.

impact: Fitzgerald's targets were up after getting held to five catches over the last two weeks.  He didn't have any red-zone chances, but it's a step in the right direction. Fitzgerald has taken a backseat to Christian Kirk since Josh Rosen took over. He's hard to trust as a FLEX for Week 7 against the Broncos.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 5-of-8 passes for 39 yards in Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: The Cardinals limited Fitzgerald on a short week, but he was always expected to play. Fitzgerald's targets have been up, but Christian Kirk is Josh Rosen's go-to option. Fitzgerald should be avoided for a shy-away matchup with Broncos slot CB Chris Harris.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: Shamefully, the score was Fitzgerald's first of the season. He's been hamstrung by nagging injuries and awful quarterback play. Fitzgerald got lit up on a fourth quarter hospital ball but was thankfully able to stay in the game. With Josh Rosen playing as bad as possible this evening, Fitz won't be on the WR4 radar for Week 8 against the 49ers. Fitzgerald hasn't posted more than 40 yards since Week 1.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 4-of-8 targets for 40 yards and a touchdown in the Cardinals' Week 7 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It's maintenance for Fitzgerald, who rarely practices early in the week. Fitzgerald is coming off his best game of the season and should benefit from the Cardinals firing OC McCoy. He's a low-end FLEX against a bottom-ten 49ers' secondary.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Fitz will be ready to rock for new OC Byron Leftwich's debut against the 49ers. Although he's shown some signs of life the past two weeks, Fitz remains a back-end WR4.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) returned to Cardinals practice on Thursday.

impact: "The plays are still there in him," Leftwich said. "I don’t think he’s dead yet." Although it included just 79 yards, Fitzgerald did post his best two-game stretch before the Cardinals' post-Thursday Night Football mini bye. Leftwich replacing Mike McCoy is a classic "it could not get any worse" situation. Leftwich could end up reviving Fitz, but he's just a low-end WR4 for Week 8.
report: New Cardinals OC Byron Leftwich wants to get Larry Fitzgerald more involved.

impact: There was never doubt over his status. New Cardinals OC Byron Leftwich plans to get Fitzgerald more involved, but he's hard to trust as a FLEX with Josh Rosen tanking.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) was removed from the Week 8 injury report.

impact: Fitzgerald's targets, catches, and receiving yards were all season-highs in his first game under new OC Byron Leftwich. Prior to Sunday, Fitzgerald hadn't exceeded 40 receiving yards since Week 1. Josh Rosen attempted a season-high 40 passing attempts, too, instilling life into a formerly lifeless aerial attack. With Fitzgerald now the focus of an assumed-to-be developing offense, there's suddenly reason to hold onto him moving forward. Consider him a confident WR3 against the Chiefs when the Cardinals return from their bye in Week 10.
report: Larry Fitzgerald hauled in 8-of-12 targets for a season-high 102 yards and one score in the Cardinals' Week 8 win over the 49ers.
