impact: It's a step back after Fitzgerald had touchdowns the last two weeks. Fitzgerald led the team in targets, but the Cardinals' offense struggled to maintain drives with Josh Rosen facing constant pressures. Chad Williams is looking at a potential multi-game absence, so Fitzgerald's target share will have him in the WR3 mix against the Raiders in Week 11.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 6-of-10 targets for 50 yards in Week 10 against Kansas City.

impact: That's efficiency, though Fitz obviously deserved more looks. Rookie QB Josh Rosen could complete just nine passes against the Raiders' league-worst defense. Fitz's first score was delivered on a rope into the end zone. For the second, he inside-outed CB Rashaan Melvin. Fitz's usage had not been a recent concern. He should bounce back in the target department for Week 12 against the Chargers.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 2-of-4 targets for 23 yards and two touchdowns in the Cardinals' Week 11 loss to the Raiders.

impact: They were his only two targets. Fitzgerald scored a 25-yard touchdown on the Cardinals opening drive and caught a five-yard pass on the final play of the game. After a slow start, he's now up to five touchdowns in the last five weeks. Fitzgerald will be a WR3 for Week 13 against the Packers.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught two passes for 30 yards and a touchdown in Week 12 against the Chargers.

impact: It was a quiet game for Fitzgerald, who finally made his mark on a highlight-reel fourth-quarter 32-yard catch that set up Zane Gonzalez's game-winning 44-yard field goal.  Fitzgerald will be a better WR3 play in Week 14 against the Lions, who get smashed by slot receivers constantly.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 3-of-6 targets for 48 yards in the Cardinals' Week 13 upset of the Packers.

impact: Hogan's first score came on Jalen Ramsey in man-to-man coverage in the end zone. He got free as a diving Ramsey couldn't find him. TD2 came as Tom Brady got the Jags to bite on a short fake and hit Hogan over the middle of the field. Hogan did the rest of the work on the 29-yard grab. Hogan has just four catches through two games, but that's a number he should at least double in Week 3 against the Lions, especially if CB Darius Slay (concussion) is sidelined.
report: Chris Hogan caught 3-of-5 targets for 42 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' Week 2 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Hogan was invisible on a night Tom Brady threw for only 133 yards. He saw fewer targets than both Rob Gronkowski and Phillip Dorsett. Hogan's ROS outlook is trending down after the Patriots' trade for Josh Gordon. New England also gets Julien Edelman back in Week 5.
report: Chris Hogan caught 3-of-4 passes for 31 yards in Week 3 against the Lions.

impact: Hogan's baffling downward trend continues. Today was the first time all season he drew fewer than four looks. Josh Gordon returned, but he played just 18 snaps. Hogan has not been on the same page with Tom Brady over the middle, and Brady is struggling mightily deep. With Julian Edelman set to return for Week 5, a Hogan breakout will get that much more difficult. Sitting on 8/109/2 for the season, Hogan can't be trusted as a WR4 until he shows something more.
report: Chris Hogan caught 1-of-1 targets for 25 yards in the Patriots' 38-7, Week 4 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Hogan's missed connection was an awful muff that resulted in a Tom Brady "interception." Hogan is sitting on 143 yards while he has yet to draw more than five targets in a game. Especially with Julian Edelman back in the mix, Hogan is hard to justify holding at this point. It is worth noting that he still led the Patriots' receiver corps in snaps this evening.
report: Chris Hogan caught 3-of-4 targets for 34 yards in the Patriots' Week 5 win over the Colts.

impact: Hogan's thigh injury looks to be minor. He hasn't been a factor this year and now that Julian Edelman is back from suspension, Hogan is barely worth roster consideration in fantasy leagues.
report: Chris Hogan (thigh) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Hogan is now headed in the wrong direction for Sunday night's game against the Chiefs. Although he's yet to clear 42 yards this season, Hogan's absence would free up snaps and targets for Josh Gordon.
report: Chris Hogan (thigh) was downgraded to "DNP" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Hogan sat out Thursday but is back on track to play Sunday night against the Chiefs.  Hogan has been unplayable in fantasy through five weeks.  He's behind at least Julian Edelman, Rob Gronkowski, and James White for looks.
report: Chris Hogan (thigh) returned to practice Friday.

impact: Hogan should play despite a mid-week downgrade. Even in a plus matchup, Hogan doesn't have enough target share to warrant fantasy consideration.
report: Chris Hogan (thigh) is questionable for Week 6 against the Chiefs.

impact: He showed up on the injury report with a thigh issue this week, though there's never been much concern about his status for Sunday night's game. Hogan has mostly been invisible this year, managing just 11 catches for 143 yards and two touchdowns across five games. With Josh Gordon's workload on the rise and Julian Edelman back from suspension, Hogan can probably be abandoned in most fantasy formats.
report: Chris Hogan (questionable, thigh) is expected to play Week 6 against the Chiefs.

impact: Hogan was a non-factor before a 45-yard catch late in the fourth quarter. This ended up being one of his better games, but Hogan is no higher than the No. 4 pass-game option. Hogan shouldn’t be in Week 7 fantasy lineups.
report: Chris Hogan caught four passes for 78 yards in Week 6 against the Chiefs.

impact: Hogan appeared to suffer a leg injury on the opening drive, but he quickly returned to the game. He was not heavily involved early, catching his first pass midway through the second quarter, but he surprisingly notched three quick catches in the third quarter and added a 19-yard grab on a fourth-quarter touchdown drive. He now has two solid games in a row, but it will be tough for him to build on this mini-breakout with Rob Gronkowski expected back next week. That said, it was still a step in the correct direction.
report: Chris Hogan hauled in 6-of-7 targets for 63 yards in the Patriots' Week 7 win over the Bears.

impact: The two targets were as many as FB James Develin.  Hogan at least made them count with a couple big pickups, but he's deep down the totem pole in New England.  It could only get worse if the Patriots acquire a receiver ahead of the deadline Tuesday.  They've been linked to Demaryius Thomas.
report: Chris Hogan caught both of his targets for 49 yards in the Week 8 win over the Bills.

impact: Hogan had been trending up, but he had just one target despite Rob Gronkowski not playing. There's not much upside in keeping Hogan rostered in re-draft leagues.
report: Chris Hogan was held without a catch in Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: Hogan also appeared to draw the ire of Tom Brady following an in-game miscue.  Catch-less in back-to-back contests, Hogan can safely be sent to the waiver wire with New England entering its Week 11 bye.
report: Chris Hogan was held catch-less on one target in Week 10 at Tennessee.

impact: A trendy WR3 selection in fantasy leagues over the summer, Hogan has been among this year's biggest disappointments. He's seen a combined 10 targets over his last five games and hasn't scored a touchdown since Week 2. Even in deeper leagues, Hogan remains glued to the waiver wire.
report: Chris Hogan produced two catches for 20 yards on two targets Sunday in the Patriots’ Week 13 win over the Vikings.

impact: Hill took a helmet to his right knee early in the third quarter and was immediately ruled out for the remainder of the game. That is never a good sign. Hill was involved on both offense and special teams before going down, blocking a punt and rushing the ball four times for 25 yards. He added a six-yard reception. A long-term loss would increase the need for Sony Michel (knee) to get cleared.
report: Patriots RB Jeremy Hill was forced from Sunday's game against the Patriots with a knee injury and will not return.

impact: He will not undergo ACL surgery until early November, however.  Hill touched the ball five times in Sunday's win before going down. He took a helmet to the knee. Hill had also made an impact on special teams before his injury, blocking a punt. His absence will only clarify matters in the Patriots' backfield until Sony Michel returns, which could be as soon as Week 2. Hill turns 26 next month. He could have enough time to get healthy before training camp next summer. Hill is playing on a one-year deal.
report: Patriots placed RB Jeremy Hill on injured reserve with a torn right ACL, ending his season.

impact: Johnson figures to get slapped with another "limited" tag. Per in-house writer Darren Urban, Johnson was "hitting the blocking sled plenty hard." The issue could explain why Johnson barely saw the field in the second half of last week's blowout loss to the Redskins. There has been little indication it will be a concern for Week 2 against the Rams.
report: David Johnson (back) practiced again on Thursday.

impact: Johnson said he feels "100 percent" and his participation level on Friday would seem to support that claim. Negative game script limited Johnson to just 14 touches in Week 1 and while that concern does exist for Week 2, DJ's pass-catching role should keep him in the RB1 discussion against the Rams.
report: David Johnson (back) was upgraded to a full practice on Friday and was not listed on the Cardinals' final injury report for Week 2 against the Rams.

impact: He was shockingly not targeted in the first half, and he finished the game with just one catch, although he had another called back by a penalty. Benching Sam Bradford is the first order of business, but the Cardinals have to better utilize Johnson if they want to have any success on offense, especially with Larry Fitzgerald dealing with a hamstring issue. Johnson will be more of an RB2 in a tough matchup with the Bears next week.
report: David Johnson rushed 13 times for 48 yards and hauled in 1-of-2 targets for three yards in the Cardinals' Week 2 loss to the Rams.

impact: Johnson's Weeks 1-2 usage under first-year OC Mike McCoy has been one of the most disappointing developments of the 2018 fantasy season thus far.  He has been used more as a ground-and-pound grinder than space back, running between the tackles and seeing diminished passing-game usage until pass-heavy comeback mode.  Wilks promised Monday that will change, and gave McCoy a vote of confidence.   "I have total confidence," said Wilks.  (We don't.)
report: Cardinals coach Steve Wilks promised Monday that David Johnson will run more routes in the slot going forward.

impact: The bright spot was a 21-yard touchdown catch in the 1st quarter off a play action where Johnson dusted a linebacker in coverage for an easy pitch and catch. A week after promising to get Johnson more usage split out as a receiver, that was not the case on Sunday. Johnson has now found the end zone in two of the first three games, but has now rushed 34 times for 116 yards (3.4 YPC) with 10 catches for 63 yards. With the Cardinals potentially turning to Josh Rosen as their starting quarterback things may begin to shift for Johnson moving forward, but he will only be a RB2 option next week against the Seahawks due to his floor potential when he fails to find the end zone.
report: David Johnson rushed 12 times for 31 yards while catching 4-of-4 targets for 30 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Bears.

impact: Despite coming off the field for multiple passing situations, Johnson managed to have his best game of the early season Sunday. Johnson broke off a long run of 21 yards and a long catch of 30 yards as Arizona finally fed him the ball for the first time in a game this season. He scored a 1-yard touchdown in the 2nd quarter after a pass interference in the end zone. Despite his slow start, Johnson has still managed to find the end zone in three of the first four games. Johnson will be in the lower-RB1 mix Week 5 against the 49ers.
report: David Johnson rushed 21 times for 71 yards and a touchdown while catching 3-of-4 targets for 41 yards in Sunday's Week 4 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Johnson averaged a thoroughly underwhelming 3.1 yards per carry against the Niners but for fantasy purposes, all that matters is that he scored two touchdowns. Both were of the goal-line variety. That gives Johnson four touchdowns in his last three games and five for the year. After seeing a bizarrely light workload early on, the Cardinals have shown a renewed commitment to Johnson, feeding him 45 touches over the last two weeks. D.J. has been alarmingly inefficient this year but now that his volume is on the rise, Johnson can safely be reinserted as a weekly RB1 in all fantasy formats. His next test will come against the Vikings in Week 6.
report: David Johnson collected 55 yards and two touchdowns on 18 carries while snagging two catches for 16 yards on three targets Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 5 victory over San Francisco.

impact: Johnson's struggles continued, but he managed to salvage his game with a late one-yard TD. He dropped a red-zone target, lost a fumble, and was stuffed on fourth-and-goal from the one-yard line before his touchdown. Johnson's pass game role remained small, finishing with just two catches for 15 yards. Johnson has looked nothing like the back he was in 2016. Despite a lackluster season to this point, Johnson will be a must-start against a Broncos defense which has given up back-to-back 200-yard rushers.
report: David Johnson rushed 18 times for 55 yards and a touchdown in Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: If you were watching, you know how infuriating this was. The Cardinals' clueless coaching staff continued to run Johnson right up the middle, only looking to get him into space deep into garbage time in the fourth quarter. It was play-calling so bad it had to be seen to be believed. That's been a theme all season, of course. It appears tonight's disaster could cost OC Mike McCoy his job. Even if it does, Johnson will have a hard time hitting RB1 value against the 49ers' middle-of-the-road run defense in Week 8. There is shockingly little talent around him.
report: David Johnson rushed 14 times for 39 yards in the Cardinals' Week 7 loss to the Broncos, adding three receptions for 31 additional yards.

impact: "Everything," was Leftwich's response when asked what he wanted to replicate from Arians' Johnson approach. "I sat shoulder to shoulder with B.A. every day I was here. There have been a lot of long nights sitting next to him, us nodding off together." That means no more slamming Johnson between the tackles every play and much more extensive usage as a receiver/space back. That's what made Johnson a superstar in 2016. The lack of talent around Johnson remains a major concern, but his 2018 fantasy arrow is pointed back upward.
report: New Cardinals OC Byron Leftwich wants to emulate ex-coach Bruce Arians' usage of David Johnson.

impact: It was a 20-touch, 100-yard day for Johnson, but his usage wasn't as encouraging as the box score indicates. All four of his targets came on underwhelming screens to the flats, forcing the all-world talent to create his own yardage starting from behind the line of scrimmage. Even his 59 yards rushing and -13 air yards were similar to his per game averages (47.9, 3.8). Josh Rosen attempted a season-high 40 passes, at least showing some evolution in the Cardinals' offense, but there's still undeniably a lot to be desired with how Johnson's being used on a weekly basis. Hopefully the bye week allows enough time to re-think and creatively unleash him against the Chiefs' poor rush defense in Week 10.
report: David Johnson rushed 16 times for 59 yards, tacking on four catches for 41 yards in the Cardinals' Week 8 victory over the Niners.

impact: It's easily the best game of the year for Johnson, who saw a season-high 28 touches. Both of his touchdowns came in the red-zone -- scoring on a nine-yard strike from Josh Rosen in the first quarter and capping off the Cardinals' opening drive of the second half with a goal-line TD. Johnson has been more involved since OC Byron Leftwich took over playcalling in Week 8. He'll be in the RB1 mix for Week 11 against the Raiders.
report: David Johnson rushed 21 times for 98 yards and a touchdown and caught 7-of-9 targets for 85 yards and a receiving touchdown.

impact: Johnson was penalty away from a much bigger day, as a Ricky Seals-Jones holding call nullified a late 57-yard score. Johnson's biggest play that counted was a 53-yard fourth quarter rumble where he put Raiders S Marcus Gilchrist on skates. The 100-yard day on the ground was Johnson's first of the season, though he has now piled up 337 yards from scrimmage over the past two weeks, re-establishing himself as a mid-range RB1. The Chargers are on deck for Week 12.
report: David Johnson rushed 25 times for 137 yards in the Cardinals' Week 11 loss to the Raiders, adding a 17-yard reception.

impact: Johnson's volume was terrible in a game the Cardinals played behind in the second half, but he didn't do much with his touches. It's the first time in the last four weeks Johnson has been held either under 100 total yards or a touchdown. Johnson has a good rebound spot against the Packers in Week 13.
report: David Johnson rushed 17 times for 63 yards and caught two passes for 16 yards in Week 12 against the Chargers.

impact: This was an incredibly frustrating game if you had any fantasy exposure to Johnson at all.  In a game where the Cardinals rushed for 182 yards and two touchdowns as a team, Johnson was held scoreless while rookie backup Chase Edmonds scored twice inside the ten-yard line.  Johnson's lack of passing-game usage was also befuddling.  Johnson did blow a blitz protection to get Josh Rosen sacked in the first quarter.  Returning home for Week 14 against the Lions, Johnson will remain a high-volatility RB2 play.
report: David Johnson rushed 20 times for 69 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for three yards in Arizona's Week 13 win over Green Bay.

impact: His status still can't be taken for granted, but Michel is looking likely to return after missing only one game. This being the Patriots, we might not know for sure until Sunday, which is bad news since the Pats are playing on Sunday Night Football. If Michel returns, he will be on the RB1/2 borderline against the Packers.
report: Sony Michel (knee) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: He attended practice on a limited basis this week. There's added risk with New England playing in primetime but all signs point to Michel suiting up for Sunday night's showdown with Green Bay. Michel's return shouldn't have much impact on James White, who does most of his damage as a pass-catcher out of the backfield.
report: Sony Michel (knee) is questionable for Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: The Patriots will test out Michel in pre-game warmups, but this throws shade on his status. Michel had been trending toward playing after practicing on a limited basis all week. Owners need to have backup plans in place with New England playing on Sunday night. The Patriots would go with a committee of Cordarrelle Patterson (questionable, neck) and James White if Michel sits.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports "there's concern" Sony Michel (questionable, knee) won't be able to return this week.

impact: The Patriots are also without Rob Gronkowski (back, ankle). Michel got in a limited week of practice but couldn't get cleared after pre-game warmups. He looks on track for a Week 10 return. Cordarrelle Patterson and James White will continue to form a committee in Michel's place.
report: Sony Michel (knee) is inactive for Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: It was a surprise Michel sat out the matchup with the Packers, so it would be an even bigger one if he remains sidelined this week. Barring any setbacks, he should be safe to put back in fantasy lineups.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Sony Michel (knee) is "likely to return" this week against the Titans.

impact: Michel has missed the last 2.5 games but is fully expected to return this Sunday against the Titans.  Michel's return will impact James White's workload while sending Cordarrelle Patterson back to a gadget-player wideout.
report: Sony Michel (knee) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Michel remains on track to return against the Titans. Emerging as an RB1 before going down, Michel can be fired up as an upside RB2 for Week 10.
report: Sony Michel (knee) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Michel is expected to give it a go after missing New England's last two games with a knee injury. If he suits up against Tennessee, it would likely come at the expense of James White, who has blown up for five touchdowns over his last three outings.
report: Sony Michel (knee) is questionable for Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: Michel will give it a go after missing the past two games with a knee injury. He'll return to his usual role as New England's lead ball-carrier with James White handling the bulk of passing-down responsibilities. Both are viable RB2s in fantasy.
report: Sony Michel (questionable, knee) is expected to play Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: This has been the expectation since early in the week. Michel carries some risk coming off a two-week absence, but he also has as much touchdown upside as any back this side of Todd Gurley, Kareem Hunt, and Alvin Kamara. He should be put right back into fantasy lineups.
report: Sony Michel (knee) is active for Week 10 against the Titans.

impact: The Patriots got nothing going on the ground early, then fell behind by multiple scores.  That's a perfect recipe for Michel to be a fantasy bust.  Michel will have New England's Week 11 bye to work through any lingering effects of his recurring knee woes.  He still offers RB2 upside for the stretch run.
report: Sony Michel managed 31 yards on 11 carries in New England's Week 10 loss to the Titans.

impact: Michel should be fully healthy after the Week 11 bye to rest up. He's a must-start RB2 for Sunday's matchup with the Jets.
report: Sony Michel (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Michel's status was not in doubt. He's an upside RB2 for Week 12.
report: Sony Michel (knee) is active for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: The 133 yards on the ground were a new career high. Michel almost didn't get there after tweaking his back early in the third quarter. He remained down for several moments before walking very gingerly to the sidelines. He never popped into the medical tent, however, and ended up missing only one series. Michel could have had an even-bigger game but had 25- and 15-yard runs called back by penalty. He also had a touchdown overturned on review but managed to punch it in one play later. Michel will remain a volume-based RB2 for Week 13 against the Vikings.
report: Sony Michel rushed 21 times for 133 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 12 win over the Jets, adding two receptions for 12 additional yards.

impact: Michel spent much of the first half running into brick walls, contributing just 19 yards on seven carries before the break. He had somewhat better luck in the second half, though Michel's day (at least in fantasy) was ruined by fullback James Develin, who trolled fantasy owners by vulturing a pair of touchdowns. Michel still worked as the lead back, but ceded seven carries to Rex Burkhead, who returned from an eight-game absence on Sunday. With Burkhead back in the rotation and James White occupying his usual role on passing-downs, Michel will be a risky RB2 when the Patriots visit Miami in Week 14.
report: Sony Michel racked up 63 yards on 17 carries while converting his lone target for a seven-yard pickup Sunday in the Patriots’ Week 13 win over Minnesota.

impact: Burkhead wasn't checked for a concussion in Week 1, so this comes as a surprise. This may be from the hit he took on his second-quarter fumble. Burkhead has four days to get cleared for Sunday's Jacksonville matchup. With Jeremy Hill on IR and Sony Michel (knee) questionable, the Patriots could be down to Kenjon Barner and James White at running back.
report: Rex Burkhead is in the concussion protocol.

impact: Burkhead was listed as a DNP because of a concussion on the official injury report. The fact he was already in pads and participating suggests he is close to being cleared. His participation on Thursday should tell the story.
report: NBC Sports Boston's Phil Perry reports Rex Burkhead (concussion) was in pads and participated in individual drills during Wednesday's practice.

impact: He was officially limited, though Jim McBride of the Boston Globe called him "limited at best." Already without Jeremy Hill (torn ACL), New England's ground game will be on life support if neither Burkhead nor Sony Michel (knee) can get cleared to face the Jaguars. James White is going to see a lot of targets either way.
report: Rex Burkhead (concussion) was seen practicing on Thursday.

impact: First-round rookie RB Sony Michel (knee) is also questionable for Week 2. Both Burkhead and Michel were limited in practice throughout the week but have been prepping as if they'll play. Without Jeremy Hill (torn ACL) in the mix, New England's ground game would come to a complete halt if neither Burkhead nor Michel could suit up Sunday. Either way, James White projects to finish among the Pats' leaders in targets against Jacksonville.
report: Rex Burkhead (concussion) is questionable for Week 2 against the Jaguars.

impact: Burkhead remains in the concussion protocol, but this puts him on track to be cleared. Most reports suggest he'll play after a limited week of practice. The Patriots could also get back Sony Michel (questionable, knee) for Sunday's game.
report: Rex Burkhead (questionable, concussion) traveled with the Patriots to Jacksonville.

impact: If Burkhead indeed gets cleared, he will be a low-end RB2/FLEX, even with Sony Michel (knee) expected to make his NFL debut. The Pats will need to have the short-passing game cranking against the Jaguars' elite front seven. We should get Burkhead's official status a little before 3PM ET.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Rex Burkhead (concussion) is expected to suit up against the Jaguars but "needs to clear pre-game warmups without any setbacks."

impact: As is Sony Michel (knee), though Burkhead is expected to lead the Patriots' ground attack in carries. Burkhead is an RB2/FLEX in one of the toughest matchups he will have all year. Inactive for the Patriots are G/C Brian Schwenke, CB J.C. Jackson, WR Corey Coleman, DE Derek Rivers, RB Kenjon Barner, RT Marcus Cannon and CB Keion Crossen.
report: Rex Burkhead (concussion) is active for Week 2 against the Jaguars.

impact: Burkhead wasn't targeted in the passing game. Bafflingly, Burkhead "started" but then touched the ball zero times in the second or third quarter. Sony Michel was the only show in town on early downs with James White taking the lead in passing situations. It's possible Burkhead's multiple recent injuries played a part. Through two games, Burkhead has touched the ball just 25 times, with 19 of those coming in Week 1. With Michel healthy, Burkhead's RB2 status is up in the air. The Pats play the Lions in Week 3. The Lions have gotten mauled by pass-catching running backs early on.
report: Rex Burkhead rushed six times for 22 yards in the Patriots' Week 2 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Sony Michel only managed 13 while James White got in 34. That suggests Burkhead's usage was game-plan specific, but it is still concerning he disappeared for most of the second and third quarters, especially with Michel back in the fold. That said, this could be a buying opportunity. New England has averaged 17.7 rushing touchdowns over the last six seasons, but they have zero through two games. That should change in a hurry, and Burkhead is the most likely recipient of those scores.
report: Rex Burkhead played 15-of-61 (25 percent) snaps Week 2 against the Jaguars.

impact: Burkhead went down with the injury in the fourth quarter. He didn't have a carry behind Sony Michel, but led the Patriots' backs in receiving with two catches for 26 yards. Burkhead is going to be in a race to get cleared for Week 4.
report: Rex Burkhead suffered a neck injury in Week 3 against the Lions.

impact: The Patriots tipped this move after re-signing Kenjon Barner. Neck injuries can be serious, so it's possible Burkhead is shut down for the season. Sony Michel was playing ahead of Burkhead before he went down and is locked into the lead back role. James White will also have pass downs to himself with Burkhead out.
report: Patriots placed RB Rex Burkhead (neck) on injured reserve.

impact: This opens his 21-day window as one of the Patriots' two designated for return players.  Burkhead is eligible to first play Week 13 against the Vikings.  As long as Sony Michel and James White stay healthy, Burkhead shouldn't be a fantasy factor, but he could obviously have huge value if one of them goes down the next three weeks.  Burkhead is worth an add where he can be squeezed in.
report: Rex Burkhead (neck, I.R.) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: He's eligible to play in Week 13 against the Vikings.  Burkhead suffered the neck injury in Week 3 and spent the ensuing two and a half months on I.R.  The Pats' decision to designate him as their I.R./return player shows how much they value his versatility.  Burkhead can also play special teams.  His return poses some threat to Sony Michel and James White's workloads down the stretch.
report: Patriots activated RB Rex Burkhead (neck) off injured reserve.

impact: It's Burkhead's first game action since Week 3. The Patriots enter Sunday's action as healthy as they've been all year. TE Dwayne Allen, CB Keion Crossen, DE Keionta Davis, CB Duke Dawson, C James Ferentz, DE Derek Rivers and DT Danny Shelton round out New England's inactives for Week 13.
report: Rex Burkhead (neck) is active for Week 13 against the Vikings.

impact: Making his return from an eight-game absence, Burkhead was in on 17 of New England's 74 offensive snaps. With Sony Michel entrenched as New England's lead back and James White continuing his superb work on passing downs, Burkhead will probably be limited to change-of-pace duties down the stretch. The Dolphins are up next for the 9-3 Patriots.
report: Rex Burkhead chipped in with 20 yards on seven carries while also contributing two catches for 21 yards on two targets Sunday in the Patriots’ Week 13 victory over the Vikings.

impact: Rosen was thrown into the game 4:31 left in the game and the Cardinals trailing by two points. Things started off positively as the Cardinals moved the ball into Bears territory, but then Rosen threw an interception in which he was late and behind Christian Kirk on an out route down the right sideline. This was a tough spot to place Rosen in for his first game action, but with Sam Bradford turning the ball over three more times Sunday, Rosen should finally get a look to start next week at home versus the Seahawks.
report: Josh Rosen completed 4-of-7 passes for 36 yards with an interception in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Bears.

impact: Sam Bradford looked ready for retirement in Weeks 1-3 and was benched with 4:34 left in the fourth quarter of Sunday's loss to Chicago.  Rosen flashed some ability to move the offense on quick throws before his game-ending pick.  Rosen will make his first NFL start in Week 4 versus Seattle.  He could become an option in two-quarterback leagues but won't be a QB1 streamer anytime soon.
report: Cardinals coach Steve Wilks announced Monday that Josh Rosen will start at quarterback going forward.

impact: Rosen played well enough to win and lost multiple touchdowns on the day as Larry Fitzgerald and J.J. Nelson each dropped touchdown passes on the day. Rosen's first touchdown pass of his career came on a 22-yard pass to Chad Williams which he managed the pocket and tied the game in the 4th quarter. Despite the positive start, Rosen will not be an option Week 5 against the 49ers outside of deeper 2-QB leagues.
report: Josh Rosen completed 15-of-27 passes for 180 yards and one touchdown in Sunday's Week 4 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: He was sacked once for a loss of six yards. Rosen got his first win as an NFL starter in this one, though he wasn't asked to do very much and even when he did, the rookie was rarely on the same page with his receivers. The 21-year-old got his highlight out of the way early, hitting the mark on a 75-yard deep bomb to Christian Kirk on the Cardinals' very first play from scrimmage. He essentially took the rest of afternoon off, though he was also done in by a number of bad drops. Rosen will have his work cut out for him next week in a tough road matchup against the Vikings.
report: Josh Rosen completed 10-of-25 passes for 170 yards and a touchdown while losing three yards on his three carries Sunday in the Cardinals’ Week 5 win over the 49ers.

impact: Rosen had some success early but flatlined in the second half. He was under constant pressures, taking four sacks. Rosen continued to lock on to Christian Kirk, who led the Cardinals with 77 yards. It was a tough spot for Rosen on the road against the Vikings. He'll get another tough matchup with the Broncos on Thursday night.
report: Josh Rosen completed 21-of-31 passes for 240 yards with an interception in the Cardinals' Week 6 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Two of Rosen's picks were housed for scores. Rosen also tweaked his toe on the final play of the game but said he was "fine." This was one of the worst starts you will ever see from an NFL quarterback. Although he was getting zero help from his play-calling, Rosen was inexcusably bad, delivering passes late and not feeling pressure. He was lucky to escape with "only" five turnovers. Rosen does not have the biggest arm for a first-round quarterback, and it showed this evening. Which brings us back to the play-calling. OC Mike McCoy seems to have zero awareness of Rosen's strengths and weaknesses, dialing up one sideline out after another while all but ignoring play action. There's a strong chance he's fired during the Cardinals' "mini bye" and replaced by QBs coach Byron Leftwich.
report: Josh Rosen completed 21-of-39 passes for 194 yards, one touchdown and three interceptions in the Cardinals' 45-10, Week 7 loss to the Broncos, also losing two fumbles.

impact: Rosen is also headed for an MRI.  The injury occurred on the Cardinals' final offensive play as Rosen was getting sacked.  His toe appeared to get stuck in the turf a bit.  Afterwards, Rosen said he was "fine" and admitted he was being "soft."  Once the doctor takes a look, we should know more.
report: Josh Rosen injured his toe late in Thursday night's loss to the Broncos and is in a walking boot.

impact: It's good news after what looked like a serious injury. There was some concern with Rosen in a walking boot on Friday. Rosen's practice reps may be scaled back next week, but with the Cardinals on a mini-bye, he shouldn't be in danger of sitting out Week 8.
report: Cardinals coach Steve Wilks doesn't expect Josh Rosen (toe) to miss any time.

impact: Coach Steve Wilks has said Rosen won't miss any time, but his Week 8 is off on the wrong foot. The Cardinals do not have to issue an injury report until Wednesday. A "limited" session would have Rosen on track to suit up against the 49ers.
report: Josh Rosen (toe) was held out of Monday's practice.

impact: As expected.  Rosen injured his toe on the final play of last Thursday night's blowout against the Broncos, but he's fine for this week against the Niners.
report: Josh Rosen (toe) returned to a limited practice Wednesday.

impact: Rosen's passing yards and attempts both qualified as season-highs, an encouraging sign in OC Byron Leftwich's new offensive scheme. Rosen fired the game-winner with just 0:34 left over the middle to fellow rookie Christian Kirk (3/42/1), helping secure the Cardinals' second win of the season. With Larry Fitzgerald (8/102/1) additionally honed in on throughout the afternoon, there's suddenly reason to believe in Rosen and the Cardinals' passing attack as a whole. The offense will get its second test in Kansas City following the team's Week 9 bye.
report: Josh Rosen completed 23-of-40 passes for 252 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the Cardinals' Week 8 win over the 49ers.

impact: This was another small step forward for Rosen, but he continued to take too many sacks. Rosen's only touchdown was a red-zone strike to David Johnson. The Cardinals have looked better under OC Byron Leftwich, but they're still a bottom-tier offense. Rosen has an attackable matchup with Oakland in Week 11.
report: Josh Rosen completed 22-of-39 passes for 208 yards with a touchdown and two interceptions in Week 10 against the Chiefs.

impact: If you were forced to start Rosen in a two-quarterback league in a week with six teams on bye you are not complaining, but he struggled mightily in this one. Both of Rosen's picks were terrible decisions into crowded areas, and he was consistently a beat or two slow with his decision making. Even a critical late completion to Christian Kirk to set up a touchdown should have been intercepted. Rosen's biggest play was a 59-yard screen score where Kirk did all the work. Having difficulty adjusting to NFL game speed with a thin supporting cast, Rosen will not be stuffing any stat sheets down the stretch. The Cardinals are headed on the road to Los Angeles to face the Chargers in Week 12.
report: Josh Rosen completed 9-of-20 passes for 136 yards, three touchdowns and two interceptions in the Cardinals' 23-21, Week 11 loss to the Raiders.

impact: It was another dismal game from Rosen, who failed to move the offense outside of an opening drive touchdown. Rosen's pass attempts have been down since OC Byron Leftwich took over playing calling and he has the lowest completion percentage in the league. He'll be a low-end QB2 for Week 13 against Packers.
report: Josh Rosen completed 12-of-19 passes for 105 with a touchdown and an interception in Week 12 against the Chargers.

impact: One of his best plays was a 33-yard scramble.  The Cardinals' pass catchers struggle to get open and their offensive line is missing multiple starters, so weak box scores have become the norm for their rookie quarterback.  Rosen did make a handful of impressive throws, notably to "Trent Sherfield" for a 21-yard gain and Larry Fitzgerald for 32 yards on what amounted to Arizona's game-winning drive.  Rosen will remain a two-quarterback-league play only in Week 14 versus Detroit.
report: Josh Rosen completed 11-of-26 passes for 149 yards in the Cardinals' Week 13 win over the Packers.

impact: Focusing on the short-passing game, Brady peppered his running backs and Julian Edelman with targets on his way to an opening touchdown drive. Edelman caught that touchdown, and he found James White for his other two scores -- a short pass into the flats in the second quarter and a shovel pass on a jet sweep in the fourth. He did push the ball down the field later in the game, finding Josh Gordon with a tight-window pass for 20 yards on the final play of the first quarter and then hitting the receiver again for a fourth-down conversion. He found Gordon again for a 55-yard gain in the second half to set up his third touchdown. Brady now has three touchdowns in three of his last four games, and he has topped 300 yards in two of those. He will be a high-end QB1 in Buffalo next Monday night.
report: Tom Brady completed 25-of-36 passes for 277 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Patriots' Week 7 win over the Bears.

impact: Brady was fine; the offense just stalled multiple times on the Bills' side of the field and had to settled for a trio of field goals.  They finally put one in the end zone late in the fourth quarter with a James White one-yard run.  The fantasy numbers will look bad for Brady, but he should be in line for a bounce-back next week at home against the Packers in a must-see showdown.
report: Tom Brady completed 29-of-45 passes for 324 yards and no touchdowns in the Week 8 win over the Bills.

impact: This was another game-managing night from Brady, who had 121 scoreless at half. Brady’s only TD was a wide open 55-yard catch and run from Josh Gordon. He’s now had one or fewer touchdowns in three of the last four weeks, though he's been playing without a full supporting cast. Brady will be a lower end QB1 for Week 10 against the Titans.
report: Tom Brady completed 22-of-35 passes for 294 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 9 win over the Packers.

impact: The Pats threw in the towel with over six minutes left, sitting Brady in favor of Brian Hoyer.  Brady faced constant duress as multiple offensive linemen were in and out of the game, but he didn't help them by holding the ball for too long in the pocket.  Tennessee's defense was simply dominant, winning with a high blitz frequency and contesting everything to Brady's pass catchers.  The Patriots have a Week 11 bye to get healthy and things figured out.
report: Tom Brady completed 21-of-41 passes for 254 scoreless yards in the Patriots' Week 10 loss to the Titans.

impact: It's a surprise with the Patriots coming off their bye, though it's possible this explains why Brady was rested for the final six minutes of their Week 10 loss. We haven't see any concern over over Brady's status. He should be fine for Sunday's game with Jets.
report: Tom Brady (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: RapSheet reports Brady hurt his knee diving for a pass as a receiver against the Titans. That play will likely be retired, but Brady should be fine. He will be a solid QB1 this week against the Jets.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Tom Brady's knee injury is "not a major deal."

impact: It would be a concern if it were most any other player, but 41-year-old Brady doesn't need to practice to play on Sunday.  His knee injury isn't believed to be anything serious.  Brady should be out there against the Jets.
report: Tom Brady (knee) is not practicing on Friday.

impact: His 'illness' designation is a new addition to Friday's injury report. Brady was actually downgraded Friday, having sat out after being limited earlier in the week. Even so, we fully expect both he and Rob Gronkowski (various, questionable) to play. Brady's a better season-long option than viable DFS play if under center.
report: Tom Brady (knee, illness) is questionable for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: He missed Friday's practice with an illness but his absence was apparently precautionary. Brady hasn't missed a game due to injury since 2008 and that streak will continue Sunday in East Rutherford. He'll be employable as a QB1 against the struggling Jets.
report: Tom Brady (questionable, knee/illness) will play Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: Brady has not missed a game with injury since 2008.
report: Tom Brady (knee, illness) is active for Week 12 against the Jets.

impact: Going by the "eye test," Brady did not look great, throwing some turf missiles and an early third down hospital ball. Nevertheless, the box score was solid, producing Brady's first multi-score game in four starts. His best throw was his 34-yard first quarter touchdown strike to Rob Gronkowski, where the gargantuan tight end split two-deep coverage. Brady has just four scores over his past four games heading into a tough Week 13 matchup with the Vikings.
report: Tom Brady completed 20-of-31 passes for 283 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' 27-13, Week 12 win over the Jets.

impact: We can't remember the last time Brady was a full participant at practice. He's not in danger of missing Sunday's showdown with Minnesota. It's not an ideal matchup for Brady, though he'll still be in play as a lower-end QB1 for the final week of the fantasy regular season.
report: Tom Brady (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Neither was Rob Gronkowski (ankle, back). As usual, Brady was a limited participant at practice this week. The reigning MVP will have his work cut out for him in a tough matching against the Vikings' stout defense. He's RotoPat's 17th-ranked quarterback for Week 13.
report: Tom Brady (knee) wasn't listed on the Patriots' final injury report for Week 13 against the Vikings.

impact: Brady wasn't sacked in this one. Touchdown Tom spent the bulk of his afternoon dishing out screen passes to running back James White, though he did find time to hit Josh Gordon for a wide-open 24-yard touchdown, which broke a 10-all tie with 35 seconds left in the third quarter. Brady's interception, his eighth of the year, came in the fourth quarter on a play where he was hit by blitzing safety Harrison Smith. The 41-year-old achieved two more milestones on Sunday, tying Brett Favre for third on the NFL's all-time touchdown list while also reaching 1,000 yards rushing for his career. It only took him 265 games to climb that mountain. The Pats will take a 9-3 record into next week's game in Miami, a place where Brady has struggled throughout his career.
report: Tom Brady completed 24-of-32 passes for 311 yards with a touchdown and an interception while adding five yards on two rushes Sunday in New England’s Week 13 win over the Vikings.

impact: This has basically been Brady's routine all year. He'll be fine for Sunday's game in Miami, though Brady has struggled there throughout his career. Consider him a fringe QB1 for the first round of the fantasy playoffs.
report: Tom Brady (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: White actually led the Patriots in targets, though he predictably got out-carried 18-5 by Rex Burkhead. He had a free release on his 12-yard touchdown catch in the second quarter, getting left completely unaccounted for. White is going to feature in games where the Patriots feel they need to get the ball out quickly. That should definitely be the case in Week 2 against the Jaguars' elite defense.
report: James White caught 4-of-9 targets for 38 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 1 win over the Texans, adding five rushes for 18 yards.

impact: Unsurprisingly, White led the Patriots in targets as they looked to counteract the Jaguars' pass rush. White now has 11 grabs through two games. Great for the Patriots but replacement-level in fantasy football. White does have a solid Week 3 matchup in the Lions, but he is ideally treated as a bye week fill-in.
report: James White caught 7-of-8 targets for 73 yards in the Patriots' Week 2 loss to the Jaguars, adding four rushes for 11 additional yards.

impact: White scored his touchdown on a perfect throw from Tom Brady in the third quarter. He split passing reps with Rex Burkhead and was limited to third downs behind feature back Sony Michel. White got most of his rushing yardage against prevent coverage on the final drive of the game. With Burkhead dealing with a neck injury, White could have passing downs to himself in Week 4.
report: James White rushed four times for 37 yards and caught three passes for 14 yards and a touchdown in Week 3 against the Lions.

impact: The carries, rushing yards and receptions were all new season highs. With Rex Burkhead (neck) on injured reserve, White's fantasy production will be more bankable. He is a legitimate FLEX option in every format of fantasy.
report: James White caught 8-of-10 targets for 68 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 4 win over the Dolphins, adding eight carries for 44 yards and an additional score.

impact: Now that's how you PPR. Even with Julian Edelman back in the lineup, White drew five more targets than any other Patriot. He's now 18-of-24 for 145 yards and two scores as a receiver since Tom Brady talked him up before Week 4. The Pats dressed only two running backs this evening. White will be an RB2 for Week 6's likely shootout with the Chiefs.
report: James White caught 10-of-14 targets for 77 yards and a touchdown in the Patriots' Week 5 win over the Colts, gaining zero yards on two carries.

impact: White's seven targets were behind only Josh Gordon (9). He benefitted from a run-heavy approach from the Patriots and had a larger role in the run game than normal. White was held out of the end-zone for the first time since Week 3, but he continues to have a bankable floor. He's and RB2/FLEX for Week 7 against Chicago.
report: James White rushed six times for 39 yards and caught 5-of-7 passes for 53 yards in Week 6 against the Chiefs.

impact: Already being heavily utilized, it did not seem like White had much room to grow in this offense, but that changed when Sony Michel exited with a knee injury in the second quarter. Kenjon Barner mixed in, but White was the primary back the rest of the way. He parlayed that role into yet another receiving touchdown in the second quarter, cooking an overmatched Leonard Floyd to get wide open near the goal line, and he found the end zone again in the fourth quarter on a jet flip in which he beat the defense to the corner. He now has six receiving scores on the season. Most impressively, he was able to grind out two first downs to help kill the clock in the fourth quarter. With Michel looking likely to miss some time, White could return RB1 value the next several weeks.
report: James White rushed 11 times for 40 yards and hauled in 8-of-10 targets for 57 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' Week 7 win over the Bears.

impact: White's 13 targets led the team as he was again the offensive focal point with Sony Michel (knee) sitting this one out.  It was all White and Julian Edelman, who amassed 117 yards on 11 touches, including nine grabs of his own.  White is likely to see a dip in usage once Michel is back, but he's going to remain an RB1 the remainder of the way, making a killing in the short passing game.  White is second to only Saquon Barkley in catches among running backs.  Giddy up for next Sunday night when the Patriots host the Packers at Foxboro.
report: James White rushed eight times for 15 yards and one touchdown and caught 10-of-13 targets for 79 yards in the Patriots' 25-6, Week 8 win over the Bills on Monday night.

impact: White scored on a eight-yard toss on the opening drive of the game. He missed seven plays with a leg injury, but returned after halftime. White got most of his receiving yards on a gadget screen pass from Julian Edelman. He was stuffed on multiple goal-line chances, but finally converted from the one-yard line in the fourth quarter. White's usage has been up with Sony Michel sidelined, but his value is going to take a hit if Michel returns next week.
report: James White rushed 12 times for 31 yards and two touchdowns and caught 6-of-7 targets for 72 yards in Week 9 against the Packers.

impact: The Patriots forced the issue unsuccessfully with Sony Michel early, then got nothing going offensively against Tennessee's blitz-heavy pressure after falling behind.  This was easily White's weakest fantasy performance all season.  Fantasy owners need to keep their trust in White following New England's Week 11 bye.  He has flirted with every-week RB1 viability all season.
report: James White rushed once for a loss of five yards and caught 5-of-8 targets for 31 yards in the Patriots' Week 10 loss to the Titans.

impact: The 73 yards rushing were a new season high by 29. Tom Brady completed a modest 20 passes as the Pats ran the ball 36 times, leading to White's quiet day through the air. White entered Week 12 having caught at least five passes in seven-straight games. The Vikings have done a solid job of limiting running back receiver production, but White should still bounce back across the board as an RB2 for Week 13.
report: James White rushed nine times for 73 yards in the Patriots' Week 12 win over the Jets, adding a five-yard reception.

impact: White had a phenomenal first half, coming down with five grabs for 80 yards before the break. On a day when Rob Gronkowski (3-26-0) and Julian Edelman (3-25-0) were non-existent, White filled the void, feasting off screens from Tom Brady. This was the fourth time White has led the Patriots in receiving yards this year. Next up are the Dolphins, who White demolished for 112 yards and two touchdowns back in Week 4.
report: James White carried the ball six times for 26 yards while snagging seven-of-nine targets for a team-leading 92 receiving yards Sunday in the Patriots’ Week 13 win over the Vikings.

impact: Gesicki played a ton, but he's not yet on the same page as Ryan Tannehill.  As Miami heads to face the Jets, look elsewhere for Week 2 tight end streamers.
report: Mike Gesicki caught 1-of-2 targets for 11 yards in the Dolphins' Week 1 win over the Titans.

impact: Gesicki has a world of talent, but he's simply not a big part of Miami's passing game yet.  He has played behind AJ Derby in each of the Dolphins' first two games and doesn't warrant a roster spot outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Mike Gesicki was not targeted in the Dolphins' Week 2 win over the Jets.

impact: Even with starter AJ Derby sitting, Gesicki was invisible. The No. 42 overall pick has five grabs through four games. He's on pace for 204 yards.
report: Mike Gesicki caught 1-of-2 targets for nine yards in the Dolphins' Week 4 loss to the Patriots.

impact: It's one of his better games of the season. With AJ Derby out, Gesicki's role has been trending up, but the Dolphins need to get him more involved in an offense that lacks playmakers. Gesicki has a matchup with Chicago in Week 6.
report: Mike Gesicki caught 3-of-5 passes for 23 yards in Week 5 against the Bengals.

impact: The rookie took a backseat to Nick O’Leary, who outgained him by nearly 40 yards. Despite his immense athleticism, the Penn State alum has yet to become a factor in the fantasy realm. He’ll be off the streaming radar against Detroit in Week 7.
report: Mike Gesicki corralled one-of-two targets for 11 yards Sunday in the Dolphins’ Week 6 win over Chicago.

impact: Gesicki was also evaluated for a concussion but thankfully cleared. The 44 yards were a new career high. He could break that number again in Week 8 if neither Albert Wilson (hip) nor Kenny Stills (leg) can get cleared for Thursday Night Football against the Texans. That being said, Gesicki will remain a last-gasp TE2.
report: Mike Gesicki caught 3-of-3 targets for 44 yards in the Dolphins' Week 7 loss to the Lions.

impact: The rookie was upgraded to full practice on Wednesday after being a limited participant early in the week. Gesicki should be ready for Thursday night's game in Houston, though his fantasy prospects are minimal at best.
report: Mike Gesicki (shoulder) is questionable for Week 8 against the Texans.

impact: With Kenny Stills (groin) and Albert Wilson (hip) sidelined, Gesicki could be needed for a bigger role one week after setting a new yardage high. Also inactive for the Dolphins are QB Ryan Tannehill, CB Torry McTyer, DE Cameron Malveaux, OT Sam Young, TE A.J. Derby and DE Charles Harris.
report: Dolphins TE Mike Gesicki (shoulder) is active for Week 8 against the Texans.

impact: The catches and targets were both new season highs, though the story of Gesicki's night was the two huge hits he took. Gesicki has shown a tendency to let himself get blown up early in his career. It's resulted in a shoulder injury and Week 7 concussion evaluation. Even with the Dolphins majorly banged up at receiver, Gesicki barely has any TE2 value.
report: Mike Gesicki caught 4-of-5 targets for 14 yards in the Dolphins' Week 8 loss to the Texans.

impact: Gesicki saw five targets last week against the Texans, but he slipped back into a low-usage role in this one. His only target came well into the second half. He is only rosterable in Dynasty formats.
report: Mike Gesicki failed to corral his only target Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Derby suffered the injury in Sunday's win against Oakland. He had been playing 56 percent of snaps, so this is good for Mike Gesicki's playing time. The Dolphins would likely promote Nick O'Leary from the practice squad if Derby's ruled out this week.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) isn't practicing Wednesday.

impact: Derby hurt his foot in the Dolphins' Week 3 win against the Raiders. The injury kept him out of practice Wednesday and Thursday, which doesn't bode well for his availability Sunday. Derby has played 56.6 percent of snaps this season, so if he misses the game, it could open up snaps for second-round pick Mike Gesicki.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) missed another practice Thursday.

impact: This was expected after Derby missed practice all week. The early rule out suggests this may be a multi-game absence. It's great news for Mike Gesicki, who's played just 49 percent of snaps. Gesicki should be have an every-down role against the Raiders.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) has been ruled out for Week 4.

impact: He's looking at a multi-game abesence after sitting out last week. Mike Gesicki played 84 percent of snaps against the Patriots with Derby out.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He'll miss his second straight game. With Derby out, Mike Gesicki is locked into a near every-down role.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) is out for Week 5.

impact: Derby returned to limited practice after sitting out the last two games. This is only notable for Mike Gesicki's playing time. Gesicki has had a near every-down role with Derby out.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) is questionable for Week 6 against Chicago.

impact: It puts him on track to play after sitting the last three weeks. Derby returning could cut into Mike Gesicki's snaps.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) practiced fully on Wednesday.

impact: Derby was downgraded to limited after practicing fully the last two days. He's looking like a game-time decision. Derby sitting would lock Mike Gesicki into an every-down role.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) is questionable for Week 7 against Detroit.

impact: Derby looks on the wrong side of questionable after only getting in one limited practice. Mike Gesicki (shoulder) is also questionable but is expected to play.
report: Dolphins TE AJ Derby (foot) is questionable for Week 8 against the Texans.

impact: He beat Buster Skrine for a 29-yard score but was otherwise quiet.  Operating as Miami's No. 3/4 receiver in a rotation with Danny Amendola, Kenny Stills, and Jakeem Grant, Wilson has drawn 4 and 5 targets through two weeks.  The Dolphins' low-volume passing offense limits the upside of all its members.  Wilson led the team in receiving yards with just 37 on Sunday.
report: Albert Wilson caught 3-of-5 targets for 37 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 2 win over the Jets.

impact: For the passing touchdown, Wilson got the ball on a double reverse then delivered a perfect strike down the right sideline to Jakeem Grant. For the receiving, Wilson took a shovel pass from Ryan Tannehill, found the edge, hit the hole and exploded through the Raiders' entire defense for a 74-yard score. Electrifying stuff. Of course, Wilson has just eight grabs through three games. He will make big plays in the Dolphins' creative offense, but the road to re-draft value is too long and winding.
report: Albert Wilson caught 2-of-2 targets for 74 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 3 win over the Raiders, adding a 52-yard touchdown pass.

impact: Wilson how has five touches in 3-of-4 games, though he's on pace for a modest 712 yards from scrimmage. Wilson seems like a classic "better in real life than fantasy" player.
report: Albert Wilson caught 4-of-6 targets for 19 yards in the Dolphins' Week 4 loss to the Patriots, adding a two-yard rush.

impact: This was only the second 100-yard receiving game of Wilson's career. The first-year Dolphin did nearly all of his damage in the second half, blowing up for 150 yards after the break. Wilson showed game-breaking speed in the fourth quarter by turning a simple dump-off from Brock Osweiler into a 43-yard touchdown. He bettered that with a 75-yard touchdown later in the quarter, which tied the game at 28 with just over three minutes remaining. With so many mouths to feed in Miami, Wilson won't be someone fantasy owners can consistently rely on, though his touchdown prowess—he's now visited the end zone four times this season—puts him in play as a bye-week fill-in/DFS dart throw. We'll see what he does for an encore next week against the Lions.
report: Albert Wilson delivered six catches for 155 yards and two touchdowns on nine targets Sunday in Miami’s Week 6 victory over the Bears.

impact: Wilson had his knee looked at on the sideline before limping to the locker room. Wilson was injured after taking an awkward step evading a tackle at the end of a 24-yard reception. He was soaking up targets before departing. If Wilson is done for the day, the Dolphins will be down to three active receivers.
report: Albert Wilson was forced from Sunday's game against the Lions with a right leg injury and is questionable to return.

impact: The exact nature of Wilson's injury remains unclear. The Dolphins will finish the game with just three active receivers.
report: Albert Wilson (leg) has been ruled out for the second half of the Dolphins' Week 7 game against the Lions.

impact: Wilson was previously listed with a leg injury. He'll undergo an MRI to determine the severity, but with Miami playing on Thursday night, he's likely out this week. The Dolphins may be forced to hold on to DeVante Parker if Wilson misses extended time.
report: The Miami Herald confirms Albert Wilson is dealing with a hip injury.

impact: "The best-case scenario is that he would miss a few weeks," Rosenhaus added. NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Wilson is dealing with a labral issue in his hip. With Kenny Stills also injured, the Dolphins are down to Danny Amendola, Jakeem Grant, and a disgruntled DeVante Parker at receiver.
report: Agent Drew Rosenhaus said Albert Wilson's hip injury could cost him the season.

impact: All we really know is that Wilson is going to miss multiple games. Even if it's not a season-ending issue, Wilson will probably be sent to injured reserve to heal. He's droppable in all formats of fantasy.
report: Albert Wilson (hip) is visiting a specialist to determine the severity of his injury.

impact: Kenny Stills (groin) has also been ruled out, leaving Danny Amendola and Jakeem Grant as the Dolphins' top-two wideouts. DeVante Parker should also be active after his recent de facto healthy scratches.
report: Albert Wilson (hip) has been ruled out for Week 8 against the Texans.

impact: Wilson doesn't need hip surgery, but the Dolphins want to give him time to recover correctly, so he will hit the injured reserve. Wilson, who can't return once he's placed on IR since the Fins already designated two players to return this season, is still only 26 years old and will be back with the Dolphins next season. With Kenny Stills ruled out for Week 8, the Dolphins will trot out Danny Amendola, Jakeem Grant, and DeVante Parker.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Dolphins will "most likely" place Albert Wilson (hip) on injured reserve.

impact: This was fully expected. The Dolphins already designated two players to return this season, so Wilson won't be back this year. The good news is he doesn't need surgery. Wilson should be 100 percent for the start of OTAs.
report: Dolphins placed WR Albert Wilson (hip) on injured reserve.

impact: He should be good to go for Week 1. Grant could have a bigger role on offense this season, but it is unlikely he becomes a fantasy factor.
report: Dolphins WR Jakeem Grant has cleared the concussion protocol.

impact: The Dolphins appear to be using a three-way rotation behind Kenny Stills, with Grant, Albert Wilson, and Danny Amendola vying for targets.  It's a tough situation to bank on from a fantasy football standpoint.
report: Jakeem Grant caught 5-of-7 targets for 38 yards in the Dolphins' Week 1 win over the Titans.

impact: Grant led the Dolphins in Week 1 targets with 7, then took a backseat against the Jets.  He is the No. 4 receiver behind Kenny Stills, Danny Amendola, and Albert Wilson, and DeVante Parker could be activated at any time.
report: Jakeem Grant caught 2-of-4 targets for 37 yards in the Dolphins' Week 2 win over the Jets.

impact: That's maximizing your opportunities. The highlight was a 52-yard score Grant caught from
report: Jakeem Grant caught 2-of-3 targets for 70 yards and two touchdowns in the Dolphins' Week 3 win over the Raiders.

impact: Even with DeVante Parker (quad) sidelined, gadget player Grant was invisible. He has 12 touches through four games. Grant offers rare burst and explosion, but his production will be too scattershot to predict in the Dolphins' low-volume offense.
report: Jakeem Grant caught 2-of-2 targets for 17 yards in the Dolphins' Week 4 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Grant's targets have been in steady decline the last two weeks. He managed a 71-yard punt return touchdown, but he doesn't have much of a role on offense.
report: Jakeem Grant was held without a catch in Week 5 against the Bengals.

impact: Grant got in a full practice Friday, putting him on track to play. Even if DeVante Parker (quad) doesn't return this week, Grant has been a non-factor on offense.
report: Jakeem Grant (shoulder) is questionable for Week 6 against Chicago.

impact: Grant was questionable for this game after battling a shoulder injury throughout the week. The injury didn't seem to bother him, though obviously he wasn’t a big factor in this one. Grant won’t be a fantasy option against Detroit in Week 7.
report: Jakeem Grant brought in three-of-four targets for 32 yards Sunday in the Dolphins’ Week 6 win over the Bears.

impact: Grant has just 84 yards receiving over his past four games but will likely be needed for a bigger role in Week 8. Both Albert Wilson and Kenny Stills got banged up against the Lions, and the Dolphins are headed on a short week for Thursday Night Football. Grant is a waiver wire add to keep in mind.
report: Jakeem Grant caught 2-of-2 targets for 32 yards in the Dolphins' Week 7 loss to the Lions.

impact: The eight targets were a new season high in Albert Wilson and Kenny Stills' absence, though Grant had his thunder stolen by a resurgent DeVante Parker. That was quite literally true in the third quarter when Grant let a potential long grab get knocked out of his hands for a 46-yard Parker reception on a fluke play. Grant will be a risk/reward WR4 for Week 9 against the Jets.
report: Jakeem Grant caught 4-of-8 targets for 36 yards in the Dolphins' Week 8 loss to the Texans.

impact: Grant was limited all week. He should play Sunday, though the Dolphins may want to hold him out through their Week 11 bye. With Kenny Stills healthy, Grant is just a deep threat.
report: Jakeem Grant (Achilles) is questionable for Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: There was some concern Grant could be held out through Miami's Week 11 bye, but he should play after practicing on a limited basis all week. Grant will serve as a deep threat behind DeVante Parker and Kenny Stills.
report: Jakeem Grant (Achilles) is expected to play in Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: Grant was limited throughout the week with an Achilles injury, and it seemed to be re-aggravated late into the third quarter Sunday. If it's as serious as a cart usually entails, Grant's season is likely done.
report: Jakeem Grant (Achilles) was carted off the field in Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: It is great news after Grant was carted off the field on Sunday. Rapoport reports Grant still "may miss time," but it does not sound like a season-ending injury. Miami is on bye this week.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Dolphins WR Jakeem Grant did not tear his Achilles' Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: Grant reportedly avoided an Achilles' rupture, but he still needs surgery to repair the issue. Beasley reports Grant will be ready for the start of the 2019 season. Newly-signed Brice Butler will provide depth behind DeVante Parker, Kenny Stills, and Danny Amendola with Grant sidelined.
report: The Miami Herald's Adam Beasley reports Jakeem Grant is undergoing "season-ending lower leg surgery."

impact: Dolphins beat writers said Stills was practicing earlier because he had full pads and a helmet on, but he eventually went to a side field with the training staff.  Coach Adam Gase said Stills is pushing to play, but admitted it'll be tough due to the high risk of aggravation.  Stills is truly questionable Week 9.
report: Updating a previous item, Kenny Stills (groin) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: He also sat out Wednesday. Stills looks on his way to a second missed game in a row. DeVante Parker will be an upside WR3 if Stills sits.
report: Kenny Stills (groin) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Stills returned to a limited practice on Friday, giving him at least a chance to suit up against New York in Week 9. If he plays, it would be a downgrade for DeVante Parker, who drew a team-high nine targets in last week's loss to Houston.
report: Kenny Stills (groin) is questionable for Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Stills returned to the practice field Friday but didn't show enough to get the green light. His likely absence should put more work on DeVante Parker's plate. Coming off a career-high 134 yards in last week's loss to Houston, Parker makes sense as a cheap wide receiver play on DFS sites like DraftKings and FanDuel.
report: Kenny Stills (questionable, groin) is not expected to play Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Stills was always a long shot to play despite his questionable listing. His absence should give a boost to DeVante Parker, who garnered a team-high nine targets in last week's loss to Houston. Now that he's resumed practicing, Stills should have a chance to return for next week's game in Green Bay.
report: Updating an earlier report, Kenny Stills (groin) is out for Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: This negates a report from Adam Schefter, who reported the receiver would sit. Rapoport reports Stills had a good pre-game warmup, however, and the Dolphins will let him play. We will know for sure in about five minutes.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Kenny Stills (groin) is expected to be active Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Stills was originally expected to sit, but he apparently showed well enough in pre-game warmups to get the green light. Coming off an injury and on a downward turn even before he was hurt, Stills is a risky fantasy option this week.
report: Kenny Stills (groin) is active for Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Stills did not appear limited in his return from injury, but he was not targeted at all in the first half. He did get on the board early in the third quarter, converting a third down with a 19-yard catch-and-run, but that ended up being his only catch. In a struggling pass offense and with a lot of competition for targets, Stills will not be a recommended fantasy option next week in Green Bay.
report: Kenny Stills caught his only target for 19 yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: Stills was held to one catch in his return last week. He should be fully healthy for Sunday's game with the Packers.
report: Kenny Stills (groin) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Stills returned from a groin injury last week, converting his lone target for 19 yards in a win over the Jets. He only played 28 snaps in that game but should see his closer to his usual workload Sunday at Green Bay. The 26-year-old started the year hot with three touchdowns in his first games, but he's only scored once since then.
report: Kenny Stills (groin) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Stills got in a full practice session on Friday, prompting the Fins to take him off their injury report. Stills was limited to 28 snaps in his return from a groin injury last week. We're guessing he'll see closer to his usual workload Sunday at Lambeau Field.
report: Kenny Stills (groin) wasn't listed on the Dolphins' final injury report for Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: He's been removed from the team's injury report in back-to-back weeks, but Stills is obviously still limited by an ailing groin (and shoddy play under center). He's totaled just five catches over the last four games, averaging 2.2 targets in that span. If Stills has any hope of turning back the clock to his performance through the first quarter of the season, he'll need to fully heal over the bye. Hopefully Ryan Tannehill, who showed rapport with Stills, returns fully healed, too.
report: Kenny Stills clenched 2-of-3 targets for 26 yards in the Dolphins' Week 10 give-up to the Packers.

impact: Stills has been held to one catch in four of his past five games. The sixth-year pro deserves better than this, but he is safely droppable in coach Adam Gase's conservative offense.
report: Kenny Stills caught 1-of-4 targets for six yards in the Dolphins' Week 12 loss to the Colts.

impact: Stunningly, Stills has just six catches in five games since Ryan Tannehill was injured in Week 5. "I couldn't tell you exactly why I'm not getting more targets. I can tell you I'm getting open," Stills said. "There are other guys open on plays, too, that aren't getting hit. ... I can't throw the ball to myself." We agree with Stills' frustration. He is one of the best deep threats in the game and can also do work in the short-to-intermediate areas. A season of his prime is being wasted by the Dolphins' abominable quarterback play. Hopefully his squeaky wheel gets some grease against the Bills, but he's still too volatile to be considered a WR4 right now.
report: Kenny Stills expressed frustration with his recent usage on Thursday.

impact: Despite complaining about his target total during the week, Stills was on his way to another disappointing game heading into the fourth quarter. He saved his best for last, however. With the Dolphins down, Stills made a great play on the ball to turn what probably should have been a Ryan Tannehill interception into the game-winning touchdown. If Danny Amendola sits out again next week, Stills will be a WR4 option against the Patriots.
report: Kenny Stills hauled in 4-of-6 targets for 37 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 13 win over the Bills.

impact: Ballage has been a healthy inactive for each of his first two NFL games.
report: Dolphins declared RB Kalen Ballage, WR DeVante Parker, QB Luke Falk, QB David Fales, OT Zach Sterup, and CB Cordrea Tankersley inactive for Week 2 against the Jets.

impact: With the offense struggling to move the ball, Miami introduced some wildcat looks featuring Ballage. His longest gain was called back by a penalty, however, and the plays did not amount to much. Despite this surprising usage, Ballage is only rosterable in Dynasty formats barring an injury to Frank Gore or Kenyan Drake.
report: Kalen Ballage rushed once for negative-two yards and caught both of his targets for 17 yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: Suddenly a Dolphin a few weeks ago, O'Leary now has five catches over his past two games. He should stay involved for the Dolphins' Week 8 Thursday night game, as both Albert Wilson (hip) and Kenny Stills (leg) are banged up.
report: Nick O'Leary caught 2-of-3 targets for 23 yards in the Dolphins' Week 7 loss to the Lions.

impact: Amendola has been Brock Osweiler's favorite receiver through two starts, and he is on track to be an underrated WR3 play in PPR leagues on Thursday Night Football against the Texans.  His injury status is still worth monitoring, though.
report: Danny Amendola was listed as a limited participant in Monday's practice.

impact: There does not seem to be any concern about Amendola's Thursday night status. With Kenny Stills and Albert Wilson out, Amendola will be in the WR3 mix.
report: Danny Amendola (shoulder) remained "limited" on Tuesday.

impact: In Brock Osweiler's two starts, Amendola has 14 catches for 143 yards and a touchdown on 18 targets.  He's in the WR3 mix this week with Kenny Stills (groin) out and Albert Wilson (hip) sent to injured reserve.
report: Danny Amendola (shoulder) has been removed from the Week 8 injury report and will play Thursday night against the Texans.

impact: The highlight was Amendola's touchdown throw in the third quarter. He showed feathery ball placement on a cross-field pass to Kenyan Drake. The five receptions were a mild disappointment on a night where both Albert Wilson and Kenny Stills were sidelined, though Amendola now has 19 grabs over his past three games after entering Week 6 with just 16 on the year. Amendola should not have trouble finding space against the Jets' banged up secondary in Week 9.
report: Danny Amendola caught 5-of-6 targets for 43 yards in the Dolphins' Week 8 loss to the Texans, adding a 28-yard touchdown pass.

impact: It was a bit of a frustrating fantasy day for Amendola. He did open the game with a 26-yard catch, but Brock Osweiler badly overthrew him on what should have been a long gain later in the first half. He did keep a drive alive with a fourth-down conversion and easily led the team in receiving, but there was not much room for fantasy success with the offense struggling to move the ball. Amendola will once again be a low-upside option next week against the Packers.
report: Danny Amendola hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 47 yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: Amendola picked up a large chunk of his yards on a 39-yard catch-and-run over the middle of the field in the second quarter. His team-high 72 yards were certainly encouraging, but Amendola's ultimately nothing more than a desperate PPR floor play given that he has yet to eclipse 90 yards in any outing this season. He's actually averaged 8.2 targets since Brock Osweiler took over, so his dwindling value would only plummet further if Ryan Tannehill is able to return in Week 12 after Miami's bye.
report: Danny Amendola vacuumed 7-of-10 targets for a team-high 72 yards in the Dolphins' Week 10 loss to the Packers.

impact: It's a new injury for Amendola, who has been notoriously injury-prone in his career.  He's yet to miss a game this season, and the Dolphins are coming off their bye.  Perhaps he was hurt in Wednesday's practice.  Amendola has a plum matchup against the Colts as a floor-play WR3 if available.
report: Danny Amendola (hamstring) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: DeVante Parker (shoulder) is also questionable, though both are expected to play.  Amendola is the preferred fantasy play, especially in PPR formats.  Kenny Stills will round out the three-wide set for a plus matchup in Indy.
report: Danny Amendola (hamstring) is questionable for Week 12 against the Colts.

impact: Amendola will surely be the target of plenty of checkdowns from a returning Ryan Tannehill.
report: Danny Amendola (hamstring) is active for Week 12 against the Colts.

impact: Amendola ended up barely playing after injuring his knee early. He spent a ton of time in the medical tent before ultimately being cleared to return. Return he did not, however, as it appeared he was only available on an emergency basis. Amendola entered Week 12 battling a hamstring issue. He will be genuinely questionable for next Sunday's game against the Bills.
report: Danny Amendola caught 1-of-1 targets for 13 yards in the Dolphins' Week 12 loss to the Colts.
