impact: Amendola caught just one pass on one target for 13 yards last week against the Colts while getting hurt early.  He played just 14 snaps.  The Dolphins promoted WR Isaiah Ford from the practice squad on Wednesday.
report: Danny Amendola (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Amendola also sat out Wednesday after picking up a knee injury against the Colts on Sunday. He is looking unlikely to play this week against the Bills.
report: Danny Amendola (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Amenolda isn't going to play this week after a round of DNPs; we'll wait for official word to come down the chute in the next hour or so.  With Amendola out, maybe Kenny Still can get back involved in the passing game.
report: Danny Amendola (knee) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: He wasn't able to practice this week and will almost certainly sit out against Buffalo. His likely absence will open up looks for Kenny Stills and DeVante Parker.
report: Danny Amendola (knee) is doubtful for Week 13 against the Bills.

impact: Amendola sat out last week's game with a knee injury but appears to be on the mend. He's hoping to return for Sunday's #RevengeGame against the Patriots.
report: Danny Amendola (knee) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: A de facto healthy scratch the past few weeks, Parker was only forced into the lineup because of injuries to Albert Wilson and Kenny Stills. He responded by dominating targets and posting the most yards of his four-year career. 46 of them came on a fluke ball that hit off of Jakeem Grant's hands and then a helmet, but Parker was feasting even before that. It's now looking extremely unlikely that Parker is dealt ahead of next week's trade deadline. The Dolphins will be facing the Jets' banged up secondary in Week 9.
report: DeVante Parker caught 6-of-9 targets for 134 yards in the Dolphins' Week 8 loss to the Texans.

impact: This could just be bluster from the coach, but it does make some sense to keep the receiver around. The Dolphins are suddenly thin at receiver, and Parker is coming off a career performance. A trade to a better and more voluminous passing attack would be better for Parker's fantasy outlook, but he is still worth adding in all leagues.
report: Dolphins coach Adam Gase is confident DeVante Parker will not be traded ahead of Tuesday's deadline.

impact: Even with Kenny Stills back, Parker remained involved and could have had a better fantasy day. He had a solid gain on a screen pass brought back on a penalty, and Brock Osweiler threw behind him on what should have been a long gain. That said, this passing game is not very good, and he is now competing with another player for targets. Parker will be a risky FLEX option next week in Green Bay.
report: DeVante Parker hauled in 1-of-2 targets for eight yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: To make matters worse, Jakeem Grant (leg) was carted off at the end of the third quarter. With the Packers holding on to a commanding 28-12 lead in the fourth, it wouldn't be shocking if Parker's day is done.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) is questionable to return for Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: Jakeem Grant (leg) noticeably struggled throughout the game with a limp before being carted off, opening the door for Parker to stick in three-wide sets with Danny Amendola (7/72) and Kenny Stills (2/26). Parker saw a team-high 11 targets, but managed to grasp only five thrown his way. Miami's offense inevitably appeared to finally hit a wall with Brock Osweiler under center. Parker will be an interesting second-half candidate if Ryan Tannehill is able to suit up once the Dolphins return from their bye in Week 12.
report: DeVante Parker hauled in 5-of-11 targets for 43 yards in Miami's Week 10 destruction from the Packers.

impact: "Week to week" typically means a player will miss the forthcoming game, then be evaluated on a day-by-day basis thereafter.  The good news Miami has a Week 11 bye.  Parker should have a great chance to return for Week 12.
report: DeVante Parker is "week to week" with a sprained AC joint in his shoulder.

impact: Parker was given a "week to week" label after injuring his shoulder in Week 10, but he has had the bye week to heal up. With Jakeem Grant (lower leg) out for the season, the Dolphins need Parker healthy.
report: Dolphins coach Adam Gase said DeVante Parker (shoulder) has a chance to play this week.

impact: Parker suffered a sprained AC joint in the Week 10 loss to the Packers but had last week's bye to rest.  A limited practice to start the week is good news for his prognosis for Sunday against the Colts.  Parker will be a WR3/4.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Parker got in a round of limited practices this week and should be ready to go coming off the bye.  Parker will be a WR3/4 in a plus spot on the road.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) is questionable for Week 12 against the Colts.

impact: As is Danny Amendola (hamstring). Inactive for the Dolphins are QB David Fales, WR Jakeem Grant, OG Isaac Asiata, C Wesley Johnson, OT Zach Sterup, DE Jonathan Woodard and TE A.J. Derby.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) is active for Week 12 against the Colts.

impact: Never exactly known for his chemistry with Ryan Tannehill, Parker was invisible as coach Adam Gase employed a smoke-and-mirrors game plan for his quarterback's return. Although he's had two nine-target games over his past four contests, Parker has showed few signs of becoming a reliable WR4. He figures to see plenty of Tre'Davious White in Week 13 against the Bills.
report: DeVante Parker caught 3-of-3 targets for 10 yards in the Dolphins' Week 12 loss to the Colts.

impact: Like teammate Kenyan Drake, Parker has been dealing with a shoulder problem for weeks and continues to play through it.  Parker turned three catches into 10 yards last week at the Colts and won't be a fantasy play against the Bills.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Parker has been dealing with the same shoulder injury for weeks but has managed to fight through. With Danny Amendola (knee) doubtful, the Dolphins could potentially be down to just Kenny Stills, Leonte Carroo, and Parker in three-wide sets against what is arguably the league's best pass defense.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) is questionable for Week 13 against the Bills.

impact: Parker only logged three targets last week playing through the same shoulder injury, but he could get more work with Danny Amendola (knee) sidelined this week. Miami also declared TE A.J. Derby (knee), QB David Fales, C Travis Swanson (ankle), OG Isaac Asiata, OT Zach Sterup, and DE Jonathan Woodard inactive.
report: DeVante Parker (shoulder) is active Week 13 against the Bills.

impact: Parker struggled playing through a shoulder injury last week, but he started out this game on the right foot. He capped a good opening drive from the Dolphins with an 18-yard touchdown, taking a big hit and still holding onto the ball at the goal line. It was his first touchdown since September of 2017. He almost scored again in the second quarter, but he was stopped at the three-yard line. He was held without a catch in the second half with the Dolphins struggling to move the ball, but this was still a solid performance. Assuming Danny Amendola continues to sit, Parker will be a WR4 option next week against the Patriots.
report: DeVante Parker hauled in 4-of-7 targets for 43 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 13 win over the Bills.

impact: Coach Adam Gase said Tannehill is "close to throwing."  There's a chance Tannehill returns in Week 9, but the Dolphins don't want to risk a setback. We should have a better read on Tannehill's status when Miami returns to practice next week. Brock Osweiler will make another start if Tannehill doesn't get cleared.
report: ESPN's Cameron Wolfe doesn't expect Ryan Tannehill to play in Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Gase added he would like to know by Wednesday if Tannehill will be able to suit up this week, but this update is not very promising. It seems likely Brock Osweiler gets another start this week against the Jets.
report: Dolphins coach Adam Gase said Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) is throwing, but there remains "a question of how much power he can put behind the ball."

impact: Tannehill is dealing with a capsule injury in his shoulder. He resumed throwing with trainers this week but didn't practice. Brock Osweiler will start Sunday and looks likely to remain the starter through Week 10. The Dolphins don't have a timetable for Tannehill but expect him back this season.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) is at least two weeks from returning.

impact: Tannehill has apparently been "inconsistent throwing with trainers." He is having "good days and bad days," as is the cliché. Tannehill sounds far from certain to return after the Dolphins' Week 11 bye. He probably should have been placed on injured reserve when first hurt.
report: Speaking about Ryan Tannehill's (shoulder) health on Monday, coach Adam Gase classified the situation as "weird."

impact: Tannehill was never expected to play. There hasn't been much progress with Tannehill's shoulder injury. He remains out indefinitely.
report: Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) has been ruled out for Week 10.

impact: Tannehill was already ruled out for Sunday. The Dolphins are on bye next week, so there's hope he'll be back after that. Tannehill has resumed throwing with trainers, but there hasn't been much progress with his capsule injury. This is the first real timetable the Dolphins have given on Tannehill since he's been sidelined. It's far from a lock Tannehill's ready to return in Week 12.
report: Coach Adam Gase said the Dolphins are targeting Week 12 for Ryan Tannehill's (shoulder) return.

impact: It was the first time Tannehill has thrown in a week. "It seemed like it went well," Gase said. "It’s not like he’s out there throwing 60-yard throws. They have a progression of how they want to do it. They said it was a good first step and he felt good. So that’s a positive." Miami reportedly hopes Tannehill is able to return following the bye, but that is anything but a given.
report: Dolphins coach Adam Gase said Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) threw without pain on Sunday.

impact: Coach Adam Gase said Tannehill made five- to fifty-yard stationary target throws during the bye week and looked normal doing it. Still, Gase would not commit to Tannehill playing or even practicing this week. Facing off against the Colts in a game which shockingly has playoff ramifications, the Dolphins would get a big boost if Tannehill is ready to go.
report: Ryan Tannehill ramped up his throwing program during the bye week.

impact: Tannehill did an extensive amount of throwing during Tuesday's practice. Coach Adam Gase is expected to update his status Tuesday afternoon. Brock Osweiler has predictably gone all the way off the rails in Tannehill's absence. Tannehill will be returning to an injury-depleted supporting cast but will still be a sizable upgrade.
report: The Miami Herald believes the "smart money" is on Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) returning for Week 12.

impact: It will be Tannehill's first start since Week 5. The Dolphins have lost Albert Wilson and Jakeem Grant in the interim but regained DeVante Parker. Brock Osweiler's play has predictably fallen off a cliff after some initial competence, so Tannehill's return will be quite welcome as the Dolphins try to stay alive in the AFC playoff race. Managing games before going down, Tannehill will be a fringe QB2 with his banged up supporting cast.
report: Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) will return as Dolphins starter for Week 12 against the Colts.

impact: "I feel really good," Tannehill claimed. "Not quite 100 percent, but I feel confident and have made all the throws I’m going to need to make over the course of a game." It doesn't sound like Tannehill is particularly close to 100 percent after experiencing a setback a few weeks ago, but the Dolphins are desperate to move on from Brock Osweiler and keep their faint playoff hopes alive. Tannehill will be a barely-there QB2 against the Colts.
report: Ryan Tannehill admits he is still experiencing pain in his shoulder but believes he can make "all the throws."

impact: Tannehill is still dealing with some soreness, but he's going to start Sunday's game with the Colts. Tannehill's return isn't much of an upgrade to Miami's offense.
report: Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Tannehill will be back under center this week after missing the last five games with a right shoulder injury. His return pushes Brock Osweiler back to the bench. Tannehill is best viewed as a back-end QB2 against Indy.
report: Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) wasn't listed on the Dolphins' final injury report for Week 12 against the Colts.

impact: Making his first start since Week 5, Tannehill added three rushes for 14 additional yards. The good news is that Tannehill's 33-yard first quarter strike to Kenyan Drake was the Dolphins' first offensive touchdown in 27 possessions. The bad news is, coach Adam Gase treated Tannehill like he was Sam Darnold in crunch time, calling unimaginative, horizontal plays as the Dolphins watched a 24-14 lead disappear. Tannehill's second score was a 74-yard jump ball against CB Pierre Desir where Leonte Carroo did most of the work. Although better than Brock Osweiler, Tannehill is one of the league's most limited regular starters. He will struggle for QB2 value in Week 13 against the Bills.
report: Ryan Tannehill completed 17-of-25 passes for 204 yards and two touchdowns in the Dolphins' 27-24, Week 12 loss to the Colts.

impact: Despite taking some big hits, Tannehill started out this game hot, completing 4-of-5 passes for 43 yards and a touchdown on the opening drive. He mostly struggled the rest of the first half, but he was able to take advantage of a Bills turnover just before the break, finding Kenyan Drake in the flat for a three-yard score. Miami’s offense did absolutely nothing in the third quarter, and Tannehill followed up a Josh Allen interception with one of his own. He quickly bounced back, however, leading a touchdown drive to give Miami the lead. He capped that march with a dangerous throw to the back of the end zone, but Kenny Stills bailed him out with a great play. This was not a great game from Tannehill, but he did enough for the win. He will be a weak two-quarterback league option next week against the Patriots.
report: Ryan Tannehill completed 16-of-24 passes for 137 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Dolphins' Week 13 win over the Bills.

impact: He averaged 6.8 yards per carry compared to Kenyan Drake's 3.4 YPC clip.  Gore dominated one first-half drive that resulted in Kenny Stills' ten-yard TD, parlaying three carries into 38 yards on that possession alone.  Gore lacks standalone value behind Drake, but he's going to remain a thorn on Drake's fantasy side.  Gore is worthy of an RB5/6 roster spot in 12-team leagues.
report: Frank Gore rushed nine times for 61 yards in the Dolphins' Week 1 win over the Titans.

impact: He remained the second portion of Miami's RBBC, logging 10 touches to Kenyan Drake's 15.  Gore did handle heavy work in crunchtime as the Fins worked to maintain a fourth-quarter one-score lead.  Gore is a low-upside flex option, but his role is secure.  He should get 8-12 touches in Week 3 versus Oakland.
report: Frank Gore rushed nine times for 25 yards and caught his lone target for a gain of 19 in the Dolphins' Week 2 win over the Jets.

impact: Gore got the "start." That's about all he did as the Dolphins needed just 39 total plays to rip the Raiders. Most of the action came through the air. Gore has been heavily involved through the Dolphins' first three games but has done little to suggest he's going to threaten Kenyan Drake's touch superiority.
report: Frank Gore rushed six times for 12 yards in the Dolphins' Week 3 win over the Raiders.

impact: Gore started and then bizarrely closed out the game with the Dolphins trailing 38-0. That was the score when Gore found the end zone for his first touchdown of the season. The 35-year-old back is on pace for 696 yards from scrimmage as he averages 4.81 yards per carry. With Kenyan Drake clearly not impressing the coaching staff, perhaps Gore might actually force his way into bye week FLEX consideration. We would still steer clear in Week 5 against the Bengals.
report: Frank Gore rushed 11 times for 41 yards in the Dolphins' Week 4 loss to the Patriots, adding two receptions for 16 yards and a touchdown.

impact: Gore started and continued to out-carry Kenyan Drake, who got most of his work in the fourth quarter. He was effective on the ground, but fell out of the gameplan with the Dolphins trailing late. Miami has been committed to using Gore in as the front man in a committee with Drake. He should remain the slight touch favorite for Week 6 against Chicago.
report: Frank Gore rushed 12 times for 63 yards in Week 5 against the Bengals.

impact: Gore, the NFL's oldest running back, is the first player to rush for 100 yards against Chicago this year. Go figure. The veteran brought the hammer in overtime, cruising to 47 yards during the extra period. He broke off a 32-yard run in overtime, which marked his longest rushing play in almost three years. Gore looked gassed after that run and was soon replaced by Kenyan Drake, who proceeded to lose a goal-line fumble. Miami's backfield remained a near even split on Sunday with Drake out-touching Gore 17-16. Those two will continue to work in tandem next week against the Lions.
report: Frank Gore registered 101 yards on 15 carries while turning his lone target into an 18-yard catch Sunday in the Dolphins’ Week 6 victory over the Bears.

impact: Gore out-touched Kenyan Drake 11-10 but got out-gained 87-33. It was Gore's least-productive game since Week 3. Coach Adam Gase has made it clear his backfield usage is not going to change. Gore will be a low-upside RB3 for Week 8's Thursday night game against the Texans.
report: Frank Gore rushed 10 times for 29 yards in the Dolphins' Week 7 loss to the Lions, adding a four-yard reception.

impact: It was another workmanlike effort for the ageless 35-year-old veteran. Gore is helping to move the sticks for the Dolphins, but it is not translating to meaningful fantasy value. He is averaging 56 yards from scrimmage and has one total touchdown. The Dolphins need to give Kenyan Drake a longer look in the second half of the season.
report: Frank Gore rushed 12 times for 53 yards in the Dolphins' Week 8 loss to the Texans, adding a five-yard reception.

impact: Gore was the focal point of the offense in this game. He saw eight carries in the first quarter, 11 in the first half, and finished the game with 20 of the Dolphins’ 26 carries. He managed just 53 yards on those attempts, but that total was enough for him to pass Barry Sanders on the all-time yards from scrimmage list. It does not make sense for the Dolphins to keep using Gore ahead of Kenyan Drake, but that looks like exactly what will happen. That will keep Gore as a low-upside but high-floor fantasy option in deeper leagues.
report: Frank Gore carried the ball 20 times for 53 yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: Gore topped 500 yards rushing for a 14th straight season, putting him atop the record books as the only player to do so. Kenyan Drake (shoulder) was forced to exit for a brief stint in the second quarter, but Gore had out-touched him 10-4 to that point, anyhow. Coach Adam Gase has made it clear he wants to keep Gore involved on early downs, simultaneously (and somehow) keeping Drake featured in the Fins' lackluster passing game. It's ultimately resulted in Gore out-touching Drake 36-17 over the last two games. Gore remains a low-upside usage-based play in deeper leagues until further notice.
report: Frank Gore rushed 13 times for 90 yards, adding two catches for 12 yards in the Dolphins' Week 10 loss to the Packers.

impact: Coming off a 90-yard game against the Packers, Gore's 67 yards rushing were his third most of the season. The ageless back is now averaging 4.54 yards per carry but has found the end zone just one time all year. He's a low-upside FLEX in the Dolphins' pop-gun offense.
report: Frank Gore rushed 14 times for 67 yards in the Dolphins' Week 12 loss to the Colts, adding a 10-yard reception.

impact: It was a wholly nondescript game from Gore. He did enter the medical tent to get his ankle looked at in the third quarter, but it did not affect his stat line. Still without a rushing touchdown this season, Gore will be a low-upside FLEX next week against the Patriots.
report: Frank Gore rushed eight times for 21 yards and hauled in his only target for 10 yards in the Dolphins' Week 13 win over the Bills.

impact: He out-touched Frank Gore (barely) but was significantly out-gained by the veteran. Drake was near tears after losing a goal-line fumble in overtime but he redeemed himself later by gaining 22 yards on the Dolphins' game-winning drive. This marked Drake's largest workload of the season both in terms of carries and total touches. He'll look to build off Sunday's performance next week against the Lions.
report: Kenyan Drake totaled 57 yards on 13 carries while adding four catches for 21 yards on six targets Sunday in Miami’s Week 6 win over the Bears.

impact: 62 percent of Drake's yardage came on his 54-yard touchdown in the third quarter. Drake exploded through the hole and was not touched until he shed some tackles near the goal line. Although he got out-touched 11-10 by Frank Gore, Drake out-gained his backfield mate 87-33. Everyone knows Drake is the more explosive player, but Gore isn't going anywhere. Drake will remain a risk/reward FLEX for Week 8's Thursday night tilt with the Texans.
report: Kenyan Drake rushed six times for 72 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 7 loss to the Lions, adding four receptions for 15 additional yards.

impact: The touchdowns were Drake's second and third in the past five days. His rushing score was a 12-yarder where he found the edge with lightning quickness. He did so despite RT Ja'Wuan James running the wrong play. Drake's receiving score was a trick play 28-yarder from Danny Amendola. Drake can't stop making plays, but he has exceeded 15 touches just once since Week 2. The wheels are coming off for Adam Gase's tenure in Miami. Drake will be a risk/reward RB2 for Week 9 against the Jets.
report: Kenyan Drake rushed 12 times for 58 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 8 loss to the Texans, adding two receptions for 37 yards and an additional score.

impact: Drake’s frustrating usage continued in this game. He did not see his first carry until the second quarter, at which point Frank Gore already had eight attempts, and he did not register a carry in the second half. Meanwhile, Frank Gore finished with just 53 yards on 20 carries. Drake did do good work in the passing game including a fourth-down conversion in the second quarter, but he was targeted just once in the second half. Drake could certainly bounce back next week in Green Bay, but Miami's offensive ineptitude and insistence on using Gore will keep him a risky fantasy option.
report: Kenyan Drake rushed three times for nine yards and caught 4-of-6 targets for 26 yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: Drake's shoulder isn't a problem, though his workload is after seeing just seven touches in last week's victory over the Jets. For whatever reason, coach Adam Gase can't seem to quit Frank Gore. Gase's loyalty to Gore doesn't make much sense—Drake is very clearly the superior player—but it doesn't look like the veteran is going away anytime soon. That limits Drake to RB3/flex status in most leagues.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) is practicing in full for Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: Drake was listed with a shoulder injury earlier in the week despite practicing in full. It eventually caught up with him after he lowered his shoulder on impact in the second quarter. He was getting out-touched 10-4 by Frank Gore at the time of his exit.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) is questionable to return for Week 10 against the Packers.

impact: Drake exited early with a shoulder injury, but had only received four touches to Gore's 10 to that point. It obviously doesn't make sense for the Dolphins to keep using Gore on early downs over the younger and more athletic Drake, but that's clearly coach Adam Gase's intention moving forward. Drake isn't anything more than a hold-your-nose FLEX unless Gore misses time.
report: Kenyan Drake received eight carries for 27 yards, additionally hauling in two catches for 11 yards in the Dolphins' Week 10 loss to the Packers.

impact: It's not a new issue, so Drake should be fine for his 1B role to Frank Gore's 1A against the Colts.  Drake is a low-floor RB3/FLEX play on his minimal touches.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Drake was limited earlier in the week but is ready to roll as the 1B to Frank Gore, who has taken over as the Dolphins' lead back on early downs.  Drake should see 8-12 touches, but will have to score to pay off in fantasy.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) was removed from the Week 12 injury report and will play against the Colts.

impact: Drake's 33-yard receiving score on a free play first quarter screen was the Dolphins' first offensive touchdown in 27 possessions. He was barely touched on his 14-yard ground score in the fourth quarter. It was the fourth where Drake went down in a heap of pain at the end of a negative run. It appeared he had maybe broken his arm. He was announced with a shoulder injury before returning for the Dolphins' final series. Although Drake returned in Indy, his practice status will be worth monitoring ahead of next Sunday's game against the Bills.
report: Kenyan Drake caught 5-of-6 targets for 64 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 12 loss to the Colts, adding eight carries for 32 yards and an additional score.

impact: Drake missed time late against the Colts after aggravating the shoulder injury he has struggled with for a couple weeks. Drake was also no-contact in practice last week before ultimately playing, so it is likely he follows the same blueprint this week. Drake will continue to be a boom-or-bust RB3 as the 1B to Frank Gore.
report: Dolphins coach Adam Gase said Kenyan Drake (shoulder) will be no-contact in practice this week.

impact: Drake has been battling a shoulder issue for a couple weeks and aggravated it during his two-touchdown barrage of the Colts on Sunday.  He's in a no-contact practice jersey and should play against the Bills this week.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Drake aggravated a shoulder injury last week in a loss to Indianapolis, though obviously it wasn't a major stumbling block. He was a limited participant at all three practices this week, prompting the Dolphins to remove him from the final injury report. Drake will again split carries with Frank Gore.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) wasn't listed on the Dolphins' final injury report for Week 13 against the Bills.

impact: Drake is still behind Frank Gore in the pecking order and Miami is using Kalen Ballage in Wildcat formations, but touchdowns have kept him in the fantasy conversation this season. That continued in this game. Just before the half, Drake was left alone in the flat, and Ryan Tannehill hit him for a three-yard score. It was his eighth touchdown of the season. Drake added a 20-yard run on what ended up being the game-winning drive. He will be a volatile FLEX option next week against the Patriots.
report: Kenyan Drake rushed seven times for 31 yards and hauled in 2-of-4 targets for 13 yards and a touchdown in the Dolphins' Week 13 win over the Bills.

impact: Drake played through his shoulder injury last week. Miami is likely managing his reps.
report: Kenyan Drake (shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Osweiler was not sacked. Making his first start for the Dolphins in place of an injured Ryan Tannehill, Osweiler was his usual head-scratching self in the first half but woke up by contributing 266 yards on 16-of-25 passing after the break. Brock had his most success throwing to Albert Wilson, who erupted for a pair of second-half touchdowns including a 75-yarder to tie the game with time winding down in the fourth quarter. Osweiler is now 3-0 against the Bears for his career. He's the first Dolphins signal-caller to reach the 300-yard mark in passing yards since Jay Cutler reached that threshold in Week 9 last season. If Tannehill's shoulder is still an issue, Osweiler could see the field again next week against the Lions.
report: Brock Osweiler completed 28-of-44 passes for a career-high 380 yards with three touchdowns and two interceptions while adding eight yards on two carries Sunday in the Dolphins’ Week 6 win over the Bears.

impact: Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) has been ruled out.  Osweiler surprisingly went 28-of-44 for a career-best 380 yards and three touchdowns in the overtime win against the Bears last week.  He tossed a couple picks, but that's the nature of the beast with him.  The Lions don't present as tough of a matchup on paper as the Bears, but Osweiler is by no means a recommended fantasy play.
report: Brock Osweiler will start Week 7 against the Lions.

impact: The two-score day was Osweiler's second straight in place of Ryan Tannehill. Frankly, Osweiler has looked better than Tannehill. Both his scores were dimes delivered into the end zone. With the Dolphins playing on Thursday Night Football in Week 8, Tannehill seems unlikely to get cleared. Despite his good play — relatively speaking — Osweiler will remain a last-gasp QB2, especially since the Dolphins will likely be without Albert Wilson (hip). Wilson went down in the first half Sunday.
report: Brock Osweiler completed 22-of-31 passes for 239 yards and two touchdowns in the Dolphins' 32-21, Week 7 loss to the Lions.

impact: Ryan Tannehill remains week to week with a shoulder injury.  Osweiler has held his own through two weeks and was not the reason for the Dolphins' Week 7 loss.  He'll get his shot at a "revenge" game Thursday night against the Texans.
report: Coach Adam Gase confirmed Monday that Brock Osweiler will start in Week 8 against Houston.

impact: Osweiler stepped into a few nice throws but was otherwise awful. Osweiler's pick was a high pass on the first play of the second quarter where the Texans arguably got away with a penalty, but he was extremely lucky to escape with only one turnover. The Texans flat dropped another pick a few minutes later and Osweiler tried to commit one of the worst fumbles you will ever see with time running out before the break. Cutting a throw off in the face of pressure, Osweiler brought the ball back into his body and had it knocked out for a 55-yard fumble six. Thankfully for him, replay revealed just enough of a "pass" attempt. If Ryan Tannehill cannot return for Week 9, Osweiler will be a last-gasp QB2 despite an attackable matchup in the Jets.
report: Brock Osweiler completed 21-of-37 passes for 241 yards, zero touchdowns and an interception in the Dolphins' 42-23, Week 8 loss to the Texans.

impact: Ryan Tannehill (shoulder) has been ruled out.  This will be Osweiler's fourth straight start.  He's 1-2 after surprising against the Bears in Week 6 before bottoming out against the Texans last Thursday night.  Osweiler will be a bottom-of-the-barrel option in two-quarterback leagues in a home game.
report: Brock Osweiler will start Week 9 against the Jets.

impact: Osweiler was not sharp in this game. He did start off with a 26-yard gain to Danny Amendola, but he missed Amendola for what would have been a long gain later in the first quarter and threw behind DeVante Parker on what would have been another long play in the second. Miami finished the first half with just six points. Osweiler did even less after the break, but the defense bailed him out with a pick-six to essentially ice the game. With a trip to Green Bay up next, Osweiler will have to do more next week if the Dolphins hope to walk away with a win.
report: Brock Osweiler completed 15-of-24 passes for 139 yards in the Dolphins' Week 9 win over the Jets.

impact: In his defense, Miami was without starting tackles Laremy Tunsil and Ja'Wuan James, as well as starting LG Ted Larsen. Even so, Osweiler looked miserable under center and inevitably failed to throw a touchdown for the third consecutive game. Perhaps the Dolphins gets healthy and opt to open up the playbook over their upcoming bye, but the most likely scenario is David Fales taking reps if Ryan Tannehill is unable to return. Miami will again face an uphill battle in Week 12 against the Colts' unwavering pass attack.
report: Brock Osweiler completed 23-of-37 passes for 213 yards and one pick in Miami's dreadful Week 10 loss to the Packers.

impact: Josh Allen did most of his damage scrambling for his life outside of the pocket, and thus Benjamin wasn't looked to downfield much. He still leads the Bills' skill players in target share, but hasn't caught more than three passes or eclipsed the 30-yard mark in any game this season. He's droppable in all formats.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 3-of-5 targets for 29 yards in the Bills' Week 3 win over the Vikings.

impact: As inefficient as you've come to expect. Benjamin was also checked for a concussion but thankfully cleared the protocol. On pace for just 368 yards in the Bills' dysfunctional offense, Benjamin is miles from fantasy relevance.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 1-of-6 targets for 34 yards in the Bills' Week 4 loss to the Packers.

impact: Josh Allen hasn't helped him, but Benjamin has been atrocious this year.  He has shown no ability to separate from defensive backs or so much as win contested catches. Benjamin has finished below 40 yards in each of the Bills' first five games and is averaging under four yards per target.  Benjamin will not be a fantasy option in Week 6 at Houston.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 1-of-5 targets for 11 yards in the Bills' Week 5 win over the Titans.

impact: Benjamin was predictably quiet for most of this game, but he showed up with a couple big plays in the third quarter. The first was negated by an illegal formation penalty, but he came back on the next drive with a 39-yard catch. That catch went for more yards than he did in any of the first five games this season. He regressed right back to expectations after that, dropping a pass a couple plays later. He will not be an option next week against the Colts.
report: Kelvin Benjamin hauled in 2-of-6 targets for 43 yards in the Bills' Week 6 loss to the Texans.

impact: The Cowboys have also checked in on DeVante Parker and continue to do their "due diligence" on Amari Cooper. Dallas is in desperate need of receiving weapons and it's likely the Cowboys address that issue by adding a pass-catcher at the trade deadline. Hopefully the Cowboys can do a bit better than Benjamin, who has been a non-factor in Buffalo this year. Meanwhile Parker can't even get on the field in Miami.
report: According to ESPN's Dan Graziano, the Cowboys are "monitoring" Kelvin Benjamin ahead of next week's trade deadline.

impact: The 71 yards represented a new season-high for Benjamin, who made the most of his limited workload. He was the only receiver who showed anything resembling chemistry with Derek Anderson, who was making his first start in nearly two years. Despite a decent showing Sunday, it's still been a brutal year for the former first-round pick, who has converted just 37.8 percent of his targets this season. He'll take a five-game scoreless drought into next week's matchup against the Patriots.
report: Kelvin Benjamin secured four of his five targets for 71 yards Sunday in the Bills’ Week 7 loss to Indianapolis.

impact: A supposed jump-ball specialist, Benjamin routinely loses contested catch situations.  His one big play was a 40-yarder down the left side.  Benjamin would be best-suited for a change of scenery outside of Buffalo.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 2-of-7 targets for 45 yards in the Week 8 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Nathan Peterman's insertion did not spark Benjamin despite his team high in targets.  Benjamin ran lackadaisical routes as usual and appeared to give up on an end-zone target where he strangely flopped to the ground despite not even being pushed.  At least until Derek Anderson (concussion) gets cleared, Benjamin will have no business in fantasy football lineups in Week 10 at the Jets.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 4-of-9 targets for 40 yards in the Bills' Week 9 loss to the Bears.

impact: Benjamin has enjoyed a mostly injury-free 2018, though obviously he hasn't been very effective, managing just 302 receiving yards on 20 catches for the 2-7 Bills. A healthy Josh Allen (shoulder) would be an improvement for Benjamin's fantasy outlook.
report: Kelvin Benjamin (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: As we suspected, Benjamin's knee injury wasn't anything serious. He'll see his usual snaps Sunday in East Rutherford, though we wouldn't pursue him for fantasy purposes. Buffalo's offense has been almost nonexistent this year.
report: Kelvin Benjamin (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Benjamin's status earlier in the week now appears as if it was simply precautionary. He'll play as the team's primary deep threat Sunday, but shouldn't be used for fantasy purposes no matter who lines up under center for the Bills.
report: Kelvin Benjamin (knee) wasn't listed on the Bills' final injury report for Week 10 against the Jets.

impact: His lone reception came in the first quarter on a wobbly egg beater as Josh Allen took a hit in the pocket.  Benjamin has not been a fantasy factor in Buffalo's run-heavy attack and will be a low-floor WR4 in Week 13 at Miami.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 1-of-2 targets for 32 yards in the Bills' Week 12 win.

impact: Benjamin could have had a touchdown, but he flashed his patented lack of effort when he let a catchable pass go through his hands at the goal line in the second quarter. There was some contact, but it was a play he should make. He did catch a pass on third down in the second quarter, but he ran the route two yards short of the sticks. Benjamin is not an option in any fantasy format.
report: Kelvin Benjamin caught 2-of-4 targets for 20 yards in the Bills' Week 13 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: It was an overdue move. A complete liability on the field, Benjamin notoriously refused to work on routes with rookie QB Josh Allen before a game earlier this season. Sunday, Benjamin at one point appeared surprised to be targeted. As the Miami Herald's Armando Salguero pointed out, it was an unusual reaction for, you know, a wide receiver. A one-dimensional player who has not been good at his dimension for some time, Benjamin scored two touchdowns in 18 games as a Bill. Going on 28, his phone is not going to be ringing off the hook.
report: Bills waived WR Kelvin Benjamin.

impact: Benjamin was never going to get claimed for the remainder of his $8-plus million salary. ESPN's Adam Schefter expects Benjamin to resurface quickly. An underachiever in Buffalo, Benjamin should land a veteran minimum deal.
report: Free agent WR Kelvin Benjamin went unclaimed on waivers.

impact: Peterman was a disaster in his third career start, leading the Bills to no scoring drives and zero first downs in the first half. He threw for just 24 yards before getting pulled. Peterman looked completely lost, throwing both of his interceptions directly to the Ravens and taking three sacks. Josh Allen replaced Peterman in the third quarter and should remain the starter going forward.
report: Nathan Peterman was benched in the third quarter of Sunday's Week 1 game against Baltimore.

impact: Things started well for Peterman. Following a Texans fumble, Peterman led a touchdown drive he capped with a nice throw to Zay Jones in the back corner of the end zone to give the Bills the lead. It went downhill from there, however. After the Texans tied the game with under two minutes left, Peterman threw a horrific pick-six which gave Houston the lead. He followed that up with another bad interception on the next drive to end the game. If Allen is forced to miss time, Buffalo probably would be suited going with newly-signed Derek Anderson next week against the Colts.
report: Playing in relief of Josh Allen, Nathan Peterman completed 6-of-12 passes for 61 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the Bills' Week 6 loss to the Texans.

impact: Un. Leash. The. Peter. Man. Peterman has attempted 81 career passes. According to Pro Football Reference's Play Index, Peterman's 11.11 interception percentage is ninth-worst all time for a player with at least that number of throws. It's the worst INT rate since "Randy Hedberg" for the 1977 Bucs. Peterman is historically bad, but the Bills keep leaving him on the roster and in turn keep getting forced into starting him by injuries. Peterman will be facing Khalil Mack's Bears on Sunday. Our thoughts are with him.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Nathan Peterman is expected to be the Bills' Week 9 starter at quarterback after Derek Anderson suffered a concussion against the Patriots.

impact: He took four sacks and was pick-sixed by Bears OLB Leonard Floyd on a deflected pass that wasn't necessarily Peterman's fault.  Peterman still wasn't any good.  He failed to move the ball before garbage time, where Peterman snuck in a one-yard touchdown to end the Bills' streak of 39 straight possessions without a TD.  Maybe the Bills will give Matt Barkley a look in Week 10 at the Jets.
report: Nathan Peterman completed 31-of-49 passes for 189 yards and three interceptions in the Bills' Week 9 loss to the Bears.

impact: If Allen is ruled out, Matt Barkley is the club's only other option. It's worth noting all three of Allen, Peterman, and Barkley split first-team reps at practice Friday. No matter who's under center at kick-off, the Jets' defense should feast as the week's top streamer.
report: Bills coach Sean McDermott did not commit to Nathan Peterman starting Sunday if Josh Allen (elbow) is ruled out.

impact: We are not. It will be a dark day for the Bills franchise if Peterman is forced into another start this season.
report: Speaking Monday, Bills coach Sean McDermott said he is "still confident" in Nathan Peterman.

impact: It comes the same day coach Sean McDermott said he was "still confident" in Peterman.  The 171st pick in last year's draft, Peterman was dubbed a sleeper pick at the time but went on to be anything but competent in his brief time in Buffalo.  The 24-year-old made eight appearances in 1.5 seasons with the Bills, starting four games, going 1-3 with a historically-bad 3:12 TD:INT mark, throwing an interception on 9.2% of his passes.  It's pretty telling that longtime borderline NFLer Matt Barkley joined the Bills less than two weeks ago and immediately looked like a Hall of Famer compared to Peterman.  We'd bet he eventually gets another shot and a much needed change of scenery.  He'll never develop into a starter with long odds of becoming even a No. 2.
report: Bills waived QB Nathan Peterman.

impact: It's the first interest in Peterman since his Buffalo release. Despite starting experience, Peterman is likely going to have to settle for third-string offers. He isn't a lock to resurface.
report: Free agent Nathan Peterman worked out for the Lions.

impact: Peterman, unleashed. It will be the ex-Bills interception thrower's second workout since he was cut by Buffalo earlier this month. Peterman visited the Lions two weeks ago. Peterman is trying to latch on as the No. 3 somewhere.
report: New York Upstate reports free agent Nathan Peterman will work out for the Broncos next week.

impact: That doubled Clay's season production, which is all you need to know about his fantasy value.
report: Charles Clay caught 4-of-6 targets for 40 yards in the Bills' Week 4 loss to the Packers.

impact: The Bills did this last week, though Clay was listed with his shoulder and hip. We would guess it's just rep management. Although the Bills are as target starved as any team in the league, Clay has featured close to zero fantasy value this season.
report: Charles Clay (ankle) was downgraded to "DNP" on Thursday.

impact: He led Buffalo in receiving in a game they only managed 107 yards. Jones saw more targets than Jeremy Kerley, but he remains off the fantasy radar.
report: Zay Jones caught 3-of-6 passes for 36 yards in Buffalo's Week 1 game against Baltimore.

impact: It's the second straight week Jones has led Buffalo in receiving. Jones got most of his yards on a 57-yard bomb from Josh Allen, but his role is trending up. Jones is worth an end-of-roster stash in dynasty leagues.
report: Zay Jones caught 2-of-3 passes for 63 yards in Buffalo's Week 2 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Clay was limited to start the week, downgraded to DNP at Thursday's practice, then got in a full session on Friday. Regardless, it looks like he'll be out there Sunday against Tennessee. Clay hasn't done anything to warrant fantasy attention this year, though with the tight end position ravaged by injuries, almost any healthy player is worth streaming consideration.
report: Charles Clay (ankle) is questionable for Week 5 against the Titans.

impact: Battling injuries and his quarterback's ineffectiveness, Clay has been a total fantasy non-factor and will likely remain such in Week 6 at Houston.
report: Charles Clay caught his lone target for a 12-yard gain in Week 5.

impact: Clay came out of the gates "hot," catching all four of his passes in the first half. That was it for the low-upside tight end, who will remain just that next week against the Colts.
report: Charles Clay hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 20 yards in the Bills' Week 6 loss to the Texans.

impact: The 38 yards were Jones' second most of the season. The sophomore is on pace for 40/576/0. With Kelvin Benjamin fading toward oblivion, Jones could take on a bigger role the final 12 games of the season.
report: Zay Jones caught 4-of-7 targets for 38 yards in the Bills' Week 4 loss to the Packers.

impact: Jones had Buffalo's biggest play of the game when he got open in the back of the end zone for a touchdown which gave the Bills the lead, but that was about it for the second-round sophomore. This game aside, Jones has been more efficient this season, but there is no fantasy value to find in this passing game.
report: Zay Jones hauled in 3-of-8 targets for 35 yards and a touchdown in the Bills' Week 6 loss to the Texans.

impact: It was another quiet week for Jones and the Bills' destitute offense. The 2017 second-rounder has cleared 40 yards receiving in just one of his seven outings this year. Even with a favorable matchup next week against a soft Patriots secondary, the 23-year-old won't be a fantasy consideration.
report: Zay Jones snagged three catches for 27 yards on four targets Sunday in Buffalo’s Week 7 loss to the Colts.

impact: The six grabs matched a career-high.  Jones has still never hit the 70-yards mark in a game since being a second-round pick last year.  That tells you all you really need to know.  Jones is not a redraft option.
report: Zay Jones caught 6-of-8 targets for 55 yards in the Bills' Week 8 loss to the Patriots.

impact: He also lost a fumble. Clay never had a chance in this one with Derek Anderson at QB. Even at a laughably thin fantasy position, Clay has made little noise this year, eclipsing 30 yards receiving in just one of seven games. He hasn't scored a touchdown since Week 3 of 2017. Needless to say, Clay belongs nowhere near a fantasy lineup right now.
report: Charles Clay corralled three-of-five targets for 14 yards Sunday in the Bills’ Week 7 loss to Indianapolis.

impact: The 36 yards were Clay's most since Week 4.  He remains a total fantasy non-factor, however.  Clay doesn't score touchdowns in this putrid offense.
report: Charles Clay caught 3-of-6 targets for 36 yards in the Bills' Week 8 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Clay suffered a hamstring injury and was barely heard from, while the rest of Buffalo's tight ends combined for ten catches.  In the NFL's most-dysfunctional offense, Clay has been drop worthy in fantasy leagues for weeks now.
report: Charles Clay was held catch-less in Week 9 against the Bears.

impact: This is a coaches decision. UDFA Cam Phillips will pick up McCloud's snaps.
report: Bills WR Ray-Ray McCloud won't play in Week 7 against the Colts.

impact: Jones plays a lot of snaps in Buffalo's offense but lacks fantasy value.
report: Zay Jones caught 4-of-6 targets for 18 yards in the Bills' Week 9 loss.

impact: You read that right.  Jones erupted with Matt Barkley quarterbacking, getting open at will against the Jets' leaky secondary and catching a pinpoint tight-window throw from Barkley on his red-zone score.  Unfortunately, the Bills are likely to turn back to erratic rookie Josh Allen (shoulder) following their Week 11 bye.  Jones isn't worth grabbing in 12- or 14-team leagues.
report: Zay Jones caught 8-of-11 targets for 93 yards and a touchdown in the Bills' Week 10 blowout win over the Jets.

impact: It's easy to forget that Jones caught eight balls for 93 yards and a touchdown in the Bills' Week 10 blowout win over the Jets.  That came with Matt Barkley at quarterback.  Jones has been a non-factor with Josh Allen under center.
report: Zay Jones went catch-less on one target in the Bills' Week 12 win.

impact: It means he's likely to miss multiple weeks.  Clay hasn't been a fantasy factor, but backup Logan Thomas was on Sunday with seven receptions for 40 yards.  Thomas will be on the Week 10 tight end streamer radar against the Jets.
report: Charles Clay is week to week with a hamstring injury.

impact: Clay has been a total non-factor this year.  Logan Thomas and Jason Croom will soak up the snaps at tight end if Clay can't go against the Jaguars.
report: Charles Clay (hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Clay was injured in Week 9 and still isn't ready coming off the bye.  Jason Croom and Logan Thomas will soak up the snaps at tight end for Buffalo.
report: Charles Clay (hamstring) is doubtful for Week 12 against the Jaguars.

impact: The Bills will roll with Jason Croom and Logan Thomas at tight end.
report: Bills declared TE Charles Clay, QB Derek Anderson,  WR Ray-Ray McCloud, OL Conor McDermott, OL Vlad Ducasse, OL Ike Boettger, and CB Ryan Lewis inactive for Week 12 against the Jaguars.

impact: Clay is aiming to return this week after sitting out the past two games with a hamstring injury. Even in a #RevengeGame, Clay won't be an appealing steamer Sunday against Miami.
report: Charles Clay (hamstring) was limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Following his zero-catch performance last week, Jones had a slightly better day on Sunday. He started it off by getting open in the back of the end zone in the second quarter for a 15-yard touchdown from a scrambling Josh Allen. Jones was wide open again in the end zone on the first drive of the third quarter, but Allen expected him to break off his route and threw behind him. Allen was able to find him along the sideline on the next drive, and Jones scored for the second time when Allen threaded a pass to him in coverage in the fourth quarter. He followed up that touchdown with a two-point conversion. Jones appeared to set the Bills up with first-and-goal late in the fourth, but the catch was reversed on review. Jones has now posted two great fantasy games in his last three, but he sandwiched those around a zero-catch effort. In an inconsistent passing attack, Jones is still not a fantasy option.
report: Zay Jones hauled in 4-of-9 targets for 67 yards and two touchdowns in the Bills' Week 13 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Clay has been out since suffering a hamstring injury in Week 9. Perhaps he will have some #RevengeGame juice, but Clay is not an enticing fantasy option. Buffalo declared Derek Anderson (concussion), OG John Miller (oblique), TE Logan Thomas, WR Ray-Ray McCloud, OG Vlad Ducasse, OT Conor McDermott, and CB Ryan Lewis inactive.
report: Charles Clay (hamstring) is active for Week 13 against the Dolphins.

impact: This was Clay's first game since Week 9, and he probably wishes he had not returned, especially against his former team. After seeing just one target all game, Clay found himself wide open in the end zone on fourth down with time running out, but he dropped what would have been the game-winning touchdown. Josh Allen did not put enough on it as he scrambled around, but it was a catchable pass. Clay is not a fantasy option.
report: Charles Clay caught 1-of-2 targets for nine yards in the Bills' Week 13 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Anderson upgrades the Bills' backup situation behind Josh Allen, although the team is also keeping Nathan Peterman around on the active roster. S Dean Marlowe was cut in a corresponding move.
report: Bills signed QB Derek Anderson.

impact: Signed earlier this week, Anderson is just a veteran mentor for Josh Allen. He could eventually replace Nathan Peterman on the game-day roster, but it is not a given. Buffalo also declared RB Marcus Murphy, OT Conor McDermott, OG Ike Boettger, OG Wyatt Teller, LB Julian Stanford, and CB Ryan Lewis inactive for Week 6.
report: Bills declared QB Derek Anderson inactive for Week 6 against the Texans.

impact: Anderson was just signed eight days ago and was inactive for Week 6 against the Texans, but Josh Allen injured his elbow in Houston and Nathan Peterman again pooped the bed in relief.  Anderson obviously is not a fantasy option, but it's arguable he may actually be the team's best chance at a win.
report: The Bills named Derek Anderson the Week 7 starter against the Colts.

impact: Anderson took two sacks for a loss of seven yards. The 35-year-old looked like he'd rather be on a golf course somewhere than playing football, committing as many turnovers (four) as Andrew Luck had touchdown passes. Anderson mostly kept it together in the first half, completing 11-of-14 throws for 90 yards and an interception. He went into self-destruct mode after that, however, continually forcing difficult throws into tight windows. That's an ill-advised strategy when your best receivers are a noticeably checked-out Kelvin Benjamin and draft bust Zay Jones. The fact that Anderson, a street free agent who barely knows the playbook, seemed like a markedly better option than Nathan Peterman shows just how bleak Buffalo's quarterback situation has gotten. With Josh Allen's elbow still healing, Anderson could draw another start next week against the Patriots, winners of four straight, on Monday Night Football.
report: Derek Anderson completed 20-of-31 passes for 175 yards with no touchdowns, three interceptions and one lost fumble Sunday in the Bills’ Week 7 loss to the Colts.

impact: Anderson turned the ball over four times in Sunday's loss to the Colts and will be an excellent target for the Patriots' D/ST as a streamer.  Over the last ten seasons, 35-year-old journeyman Anderson has a 17:28 TD-to-INT ratio.
report: Coach Sean McDermott confirmed the Bills will start Derek Anderson in Week 8 against the Patriots.

impact: Anderson was nightmarishly bad in Week 7 against the Colts, but the Bills have already said he will be out there against Tom Brady and the Patriots on Monday. That's how bad Nathan Peterman is. There's always a chance injury or performance sends 35-year-old Anderson to the bench on Monday. He's not two-quarterback league viable.
report: Listed with back and calf issues, Bills QB Derek Anderson was "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: While he remains in the protocol, a practice this early in the week great sign for McCoy's availability on Monday night. Barring any setbacks, he should be cleared ahead of Monday night's game against the Patriots.
report: Bills coach Sean McDermott said LeSean McCoy will practice Thursday but remains in the concussion protocol.

impact: Anderson, who still plays in the NFL somehow, has been battling back and calf injuries. He's already been announced as the Bills' Week 8 starter despite a dreadful performance last week at Indianapolis. Buffalo's offense was in dire straights even before Josh Allen got hurt. Now that Anderson is running the show, the situation is bordering on catastrophic.
report: Derek Anderson (back, calf) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Anderson got in a full practice Saturday after being limited the last two days. He was already announced as the Week 8 starter, so there was no doubt over his status. Even in what projects as a pass heavy game for Buffalo, Anderson isn't a two-quarterback league option.
report: Derek Anderson (back, calf) was removed from the Week 8 injury report.

impact: It was an improvement from last week when Anderson tossed no touchdowns with three picks against the Colts.  Unfortunately, his pick this week was a long pick-six by Devin McCourty late in the game with the Bills threatening to cover the 14-point spread.  Anderson then got pulverized with a hit to the midsection on his final drive and had to leave for the locker room before Nathan Peterman came on to throw the final two passes.  This offense hasn't scored a touchdown in weeks.  They'll get the Bears at home next Sunday.  Who knows who will be under center.
report: Derek Anderson completed 22-of-39 passes for 290 yards, no touchdowns, and one interception in the Bills' 25-6, Week 8 loss to the Patriots on Monday.

impact: Anderson took a thundering hit near the end of Monday night's beatdown loss to the Patriots. Lured out of retirement by the Bills, Anderson has been greeted by huge hits and even worse football. He has thrown four picks and zero touchdowns. The 35-year-old has to be wondering what he has gotten himself into.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Bills QB Derek Anderson is expected to miss Week 9 with a concussion.

impact: Anderson was expected to sit out this week and probably still will, though it's interesting that the Bills have yet to officially rule him out. The veteran was concussed in Monday's loss to New England and hasn't practiced since. Despite his questionable listing, we're betting Nathan Peterman will be under center Sunday when the Bills host Chicago.
report: Derek Anderson (concussion) is questionable for Week 9 against the Bears.

impact: McCoy got in a second straight practice Friday but has yet to clear the league's concussion protocol. He's still on track to play (and get cleared) assuming another limited session on Saturday. Although he'll likely be thrown into a negative game script against the Patriots, McCoy's floor would be safer (making him a more confident option) if Chris Ivory (limited, hamstring) were unexpectedly ruled out. Stay tuned.
report: LeSean McCoy (concussion) has yet to clear the league's protocol.

impact: When asked about McCoy's status for Monday, coach Sean McDermott responded "we'll see" and "we'll just take it one day at a time right now." Players are ordinarily cleared on Saturday to play Sunday, so McCoy is at least allotted  the extra 24 hours before a decision has to be made. He's a true question mark at this time. Chris Ivory (hamstring) is on track to play.
report: LeSean McCoy (concussion) remains in the league's concussion protocol.

impact: McCoy was limited in practice all week. He remains in the concussion protocol but is on track to suit up. The Bills play on Monday night, so McCoy may not get cleared until Sunday. With gamescript likely working against him, McCoy is just a Week 8 FLEX.
report: LeSean McCoy (concussion) is questionable for Week 8 against the Patriots.

impact: McCoy has yet to officially clear the concussion protocol, though it sounds like that will happen sometime in the next 24 hours. He was a limited participant at all three practices this week. Playing in one of the league's worst offenses, McCoy hasn't moved the needle much this year, averaging a lethargic 54.8 yards from scrimmage with no touchdowns over his first six outings. Chris Ivory won't be a fantasy option with Shady on track to suit up Monday against New England.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports LeSean McCoy (questionable, concussion) is expected to play in Week 8 against the Patriots.

impact: Buffalo has "spoken to at least three teams," but there hasn't been anyone willing to meet their asking price. McCoy (3.9 YPC) has struggled while playing through injuries this year and still has a looming off-field situation, so it's hard to see the Bills getting enough in return to trade him. Buffalo may be better suited to wait until the offseason if they want to move McCoy, who's signed through 2019.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Bills are unlikely to trade LeSean McCoy before Tuesday's deadline.

impact: Anderson wasn't expected to play this week since he's been unable to practice after being concussed Monday night. Nathan Peterman will make his second start of the season, with only Matt Barkley (signed Wednesday) backing him up. The Bears D/ST will probably score more points than the Bills' offense.
report: Derek Anderson (concussion) won't play in Week 9 against the Bears.

impact: Anderson has to get his own clearance, of course, but this was McDermott reiterating the 35-year-old journeyman is ahead of Nathan Peterman on the depth chart.  Peterman threw three more interceptions on Sunday, including a pick six.  If Anderson does play, it would be good news for Kelvin Benjamin against the Jets.
report: Coach Sean McDermott said Monday that Derek Anderson (concussion) will start in Week 10 if Josh Allen (shoulder) can't get cleared.

impact: There never seemed to be much hope Anderson would return this week. Josh Allen, who will be limited on Friday, at least has a shot to play. If he cannot, the Bills will have to stick with Nathan Peterman. Fire up the Jets DST.
report: Bills ruled out Derek Anderson (concussion) for Week 10 against the Jets.

impact: This was always the expectation after he was able to practice on Thursday. The Bills have scored 31 points total the last four games, so McCoy does not carry much fantasy upside, but he should be the focal point of the offense in a pretty good spot. That keeps him in the RB2 conversation.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports LeSean McCoy has cleared the concussion protocol.

impact: He cleared the concussion protocol over the weekend.  Inactive for Buffalo are QB Josh Allen, RB Taiwan Jones, CB Dontae Johnson, OG Ike Boettger, OT Conor McDermott, OG Wyatt Teller, and DE Trent Murphy.
report: LeSean McCoy (concussion) is active for Week 8 against the Patriots.

impact: McCoy gained 12 yards on one run, so the other 12 gained a total of one.  He saved his fantasy week by leading the Bills in both catches and yards while tying Zay Jones for the team-high in targets.  It's been a real struggle for McCoy as a runner in an offense that has zero threat at quarterback and routinely gets blown out on the scoreboard.  A Tuesday trade would be best for McCoy.  If he stays in Buffalo, a date with the Bears looms next.  He'd be an RB3 in that spot.
report: LeSean McCoy rushed 12 times for 13 yards and caught 6-of-8 targets for 82 yards in the Week 8 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Darlington reports "several teams reached out," but the Bills did not really pursue the matter. The Bills seem to be in the same sort of situation the Browns were with Joe Thomas in 2017. Trading McCoy makes sense on paper but how much worse can they make the team as they try to develop a rookie quarterback? McCoy was also not going to fetch more than a late-round pick. It's not surprising he's staying in Buffalo.
report: ESPN's Jeff Darlington reports LeSean McCoy is not expected to be traded ahead of Tuesday's deadline.

impact: It is his first practice since suffering a concussion in Week 8. With Josh Allen trending toward playing, Anderson will be the No. 2 at best if he is able to get cleared.
report: Derek Anderson (concussion) returned to practice Tuesday.

impact: "LeSean is still a very good player," Beane told the Buffalo News. "We like what he brings, to the point we'll have him back in 2019." McCoy (3.4 YPC) has looked washed behind a bad offensive line this year, setting career lows through seven weeks. The Bills fielded McCoy offers at the deadline but ultimately didn't trade him. McCoy is going to be a walk year 31-year-old back owed $9 million in 2019 with declined production and questionable off-field baggage. Buffalo can save $6.4 million if they move on from McCoy this offseason.
report: Bills GM Brandon Beane expects LeSean McCoy to "definitely" be in the team's plans for next season.

impact: McCoy has 23 yards on 22 carries over the past two weeks, and it's through no fault of his own.  The Bills' offense can't move the ball, and the offensive line isn't opening any holes.  Chris Ivory did exit Sunday's loss with a shoulder injury, potentially raising McCoy's workload projection ahead of a Week 10 date with the Jets.  McCoy will remain a low-floor RB2/flex in that game.
report: LeSean McCoy rushed ten times for ten yards and caught 4-of-4 targets for 19 yards in the Bills' Week 9 loss to Chicago.

impact: The Bills embarrassed the Jets 41-10 in a game that will likely seal Todd Bowles' fate in New York.  A colossal Weeks 1-9 fantasy bust, McCoy roared on Sunday against a Jets run defense that has fallen apart since a strong start.  Matt Barkley gave Buffalo its most competent quarterback play all season, although the Bills will likely turn back to top-ten pick Josh Allen after their Week 11 bye.  McCoy will remain a volatile RB2 option down the stretch.
report: LeSean McCoy rushed 26 times for 113 yards and two touchdowns and caught his lone target for five yards in the Bills' Week 10 win over the Jets.

impact: The touches were there, but Josh Allen's dominant rushing day (12/100/1) ate into McCoy's production, and Buffalo's porous interior run blocking did him no favors. McCoy had touchdown opportunities in clock-killing mode, but Allen opted for multiple quarterback keepers, and McCoy never got a goal-line chance.  McCoy will remain a volatile RB2 option when Buffalo visits Miami next.
report: LeSean McCoy rushed 17 times for 46 yards and caught his lone target for a gain of seven in Buffalo's Week 12 win over Jacksonville.

impact: There was not much to like about McCoy’s first quarter, but he ended it with a great move in the backfield to shake a safety and pick up a third down, helping spark a touchdown drive. He also finished the second quarter with a flourish, gaining 18 yards to give the Bills a chance for points before the half. McCoy was mostly shut down in the second half before adding a couple catches on Buffalo's failed final drive. McCoy continues to see good volume, but he has struggled to produce. He will be just an RB3/FLEX option next week against the Jets.
report: LeSean McCoy rushed 15 times for 52 yards and caught all four of his targets for 12 yards in the Bills' Week 13 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Virtually every Ivory touch is a wasted one, but he's a favorite of the coaching staff for whatever reason.  His longest run of the season is nine yards.  Ivory is LeSean McCoy's handcuff but nothing more.
report: Chris Ivory rushed 14 times for 43 yards in the Bills' Week 5 win over the Titans.

impact: With LeSean McCoy back and dominating work, Ivory took a backseat in this one. He has some stash value in deeper leagues in case the Bills trade LeSean McCoy, but that is looking unlikely at this point.
report: Chris Ivory rushed six times for five yards and caught his only target for four yards in the Bills' Week 6 loss to the Texans.

impact: He came on in relief of LeSean McCoy, who left with a head injury early in the first quarter. Ivory handled most of the Bills' backfield responsibilities after that, though he did leave briefly during the third quarter after Colts cornerback Pierre Desir came down awkwardly on his left foot. The nine-year vet broke off a couple big runs for Buffalo including a 21-yard burst in the second quarter, though he never came close to finding the end zone. Ivory would lead the backfield again if McCoy can’t go next week when the Bills host New England on Monday Night Football. That makes him a worthy roster add in all formats.
report: Chris Ivory delivered 81 yards on 16 carries while adding three catches for 25 yards on six targets Sunday in Buffalo’s Week 7 loss to the Colts.

impact: Ivory had a productive game with LeSean McCoy concussed in Week 7, though Shady practiced on Thursday and is trending toward playing Monday night against New England. In the off-chance that McCoy can't clear the protocol, Ivory would make for an acceptable, albeit volume-based RB2 in Week 8.
report: Chris Ivory (hamstring) was limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ivory tweaked his hamstring at Thursday's practice, though it shouldn't keep him from playing Monday night against New England. He could be in the RB2/flex conversation, depending on the health of LeSean McCoy, who remains in the league's concussion protocol.
report: Chris Ivory (hamstring) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Ivory's hamstring injury was worth monitoring since it cropped up mid-week, but he seems on track to play. LeSean McCoy (concussion), on the other hand, has yet to clear the league's protocol. We expect McCoy plays given the additional 24 hours he has to be cleared, but his status need be monitored up to the minute. Ivory's floor as an every-down back would be increased without McCoy in an otherwise terrible matchup.
report: Chris Ivory (hamstring) is expected to play in Week 8 against the Patriots.

impact: With LeSean McCoy cleared from his concussion, Ivory went back to his No. 2 duties while McCoy piled up 95 yards on 18 touches.  Ivory's 34 yards on the ground led the team, though, as McCoy mustered up just 13 on 12 totes.  Ivory is nothing more than a low-upside handcuff for McCoy, but if McCoy is traded ahead of Tuesday's deadline, Ivory would become the starter.
report: Chris Ivory rushed six times for 34 yards in the Bills' Week 8 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Ivory took a massive hit on a fourth-quarter goal-line carry that didn't reach pay dirt.  He finished with seven carries for 36 yards and 20 yards on three receptions.  The Bills' No. 3 running back is scatback Marcus Murphy.
report: Chris Ivory is done for the day in Week 9 with a shoulder injury.

impact: Ivory took a big hit late in last week's blowout loss to the Bears.  Marcus Murphy will be LeSean McCoy's backup if Ivory can't play this week.
report: Chris Ivory (shoulder) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Ivory sat out Wednesday's session after injuring his shoulder in last week's loss to Chicago. His presence at Thursday's practice, albeit in a limited capacity, is an indicator he'll be ready for Week 10 against the Jets. The veteran carries little fantasy significance.
report: Chris Ivory (shoulder) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: He returned to a limited session on Thursday after injuring his shoulder in last week's loss. Two practices in a row suggests he will be available to change-the-pace behind LeSean McCoy against the Jets.
report: Chris Ivory (shoulder) was limited during Friday's practice.

impact: Ivory started the week as a spectator but was upgraded to limited participation for Thursday and Friday's sessions. We're guessing he'll be active for Sunday's game in East Rutherford, though the veteran carries little fantasy weight.
report: Chris Ivory (shoulder) is questionable for Week 10 against the Jets.

impact: It leaves only two active running backs for Buffalo: LeSean McCoy and Marcus Murphy, which should solidify McCoy's workload projection in a favorable matchup.
report: Chris Ivory (shoulder) is inactive for Week 10 at the Jets.

impact: A second opinion on his elbow from Dr. James Andrews confirmed that Allen has UCL damage to his throwing arm, but he will not need Tommy John surgery. Instead Allen will rest and rehab with the hope that he can return in about one month. With Allen out, the Bills can either start Nathan Peterman or Derek Anderson, who they signed just last week. Streaming defenses against this Bills offense is an attractive strategy.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) will miss at least the next two or three games and will be week to week after that.

impact: Ivory sat out Week 10 but had the bye to rest his injured shoulder. He was a full participant at all three practices this week. Ivory will handle of change-of-pace duties behind lead back LeSean McCoy Sunday versus Jacksonville.
report: Chris Ivory (shoulder) wasn't listed on the Bills' final injury report for Week 12 against the Jaguars.

impact: Ivory’s most notable play was when he tripped on a blade of grass and fumbled in the second quarter. He is not even an exciting handcuff.
report: Chris Ivory rushed six times for four yards in the Bills' Week 13 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Allen is out with a UCL injury in his right (throwing) elbow. He's facing at least a 2-3 week absence. With Allen shelved, veteran Derek Anderson will draw the start Sunday at Indianapolis. It will be his first start since 2016. OG Vladimir Ducasse (knee) and DE Trent Murphy (ankle) are both active for Buffalo.
report: Bills declared QB Josh Allen, OG Ike Boettger, RB Taiwan Jones, CB Ryan Lewis, WR Ray-Ray McCloud, OT Conor McDermott and OG Wyatt Teller inactive for Week 7 against the Colts.

impact: Allen is supposedly "making good progress." With Derek Anderson concussed, Nathan Peterman is somehow being forced into another start. This time, he will be thrown to the wolves against the Bears. This many Peterman games is reaching "cancel the season" territory.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) has been ruled out for Week 9 against the Bears and has yet to resume throwing.

impact: His exact words were that Allen is "not too far off" from throwing. That's an encouraging sign, though with Buffalo's season already a lost cause, there's no rush for him to come back. The Bills will roll with Nathan Peterman Sunday against Chicago. That one could get ugly.
report: Bills coach Sean McDermott implied Josh Allen (elbow) will resume throwing soon.

impact: Allen was also limited last Friday but didn't do much in practice. He's nearing a return and could potentially start Sunday if he avoids setbacks. The Bills have been a disaster without Allen, losing four straight games. Allen's presence would upgrade the entire Buffalo offense.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: ABC Buffalo's Joe Buscaglia believes Allen has seen enough team reps in practice this week that there is a chance he returns against the Jets. Allen has missed the past three games. Derek Anderson (concussion) has yet to be cleared, meaning the Bills would be in danger of another Nathan Peterman clown show start if Allen is out again.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Allen will get in another limited practice Friday, suggesting he is on track to play, but McDermott stopped short of saying the rookie will start. Derek Anderson (concussion) has already been ruled out, so Nathan Peterman will get the nod if Allen cannot play.
report: Bills coach Sean McDermott said Josh Allen (elbow) is "progressing well."

impact: He was able to get in another limited practice on Friday. Allen will be the starter if healthy, otherwise it will be either Nathan Peterman or the newly-signed Matt Barkley. Regardless of who starts, New York's defense is sure to be a popular streamer this week.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) is questionable for Week 10 against the Jets.

impact: Allen got in a limited week of practice but still isn't comfortable enough to throw in a live setting. The Bills will start Matt Barkley, who's been on the roster less than two weeks, over Nathan Peterman. Allen is getting close to returning after missing the last three games. He should be back after Buffalo's Week 11 bye.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) has been ruled out for Week 10 against the Jets.

impact: He'll be back in the saddle for Week 12 against Jacksonville. Allen resumed practicing this week in hopes of suiting up for Sunday's game against the Jets, but the Bills, who have little to play for at this point, decided to err on the side of caution by keeping him out through the bye week. Matt Barkley will get the nod for Buffalo Sunday in East Rutherford. He's the fourth quarterback to start for the Bills this year.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Josh Allen (elbow) is expected to return after the Bills' upcoming bye week.

impact: The coach would not commit to Allen playing against the Jaguars on Sunday, but this practice puts him on track. Even after his shocking performance against the Jets before the bye, Matt Barkley should be headed back to the bench.
report: Bills coach Sean McDermott said Josh Allen (elbow) will practice in full Monday.

impact: The Bills did not actually practice, but Allen has been a full participant all week. It would be a surprise if he is not ready to go on Sunday. Even so, he is not a fantasy option against the Jaguars.
report: Josh Allen (elbow) was listed as a full participant on Thursday.

impact: He's been practicing in full this week and is over the elbow injury that has shelved him since Week 6.  Matt Barkley filled in admirably two weeks back against the Jets and will be the backup.  Allen obviously isn't a redraft asset.
report: Josh Allen will start Week 12 against the Jaguars.

impact: Allen was far from perfect as a passer, but he hit Robert Foster for a 75-yard touchdown bomb and was dynamic on the ground, nearly scoring another touchdown late in the game during clock-killing mode.  Allen's week-to-week consistency has been all over the place in his rookie campaign, but he has certainly "flashed" when well protected and put in comfortable situations.  Allen will be a two-quarterback-league starter in Week 13 at Miami.
report: Josh Allen completed 8-of-19 passes for 160 yards and a touchdown and rushed 12 times for 100 yards and an additional score in the Bills' Week 12 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Following a slow start, Allen got the offense moving in the second quarter with his legs, a weapon he used to great effect each of the last two games, before escaping the pocket to the right and hitting Zay Jones at the back of the end zone for a 15-yard touchdown. He had Jones wide open in the end zone again on the first drive of the third quarter, but he threw behind him on what looked like a miscommunication. He made up for it with a great throw on the run in his own end zone to pick up a third down on the next drive, and he briefly gave Buffalo the lead by threading a pass to Jones for a 25-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter. Following a Dolphins score, Allen led what should have been a game-winning drive, but Charles Clay dropped an underthrown pass in the end zone to end the game. The rookie did have a bad interception in the second half – his other pick came on a Hail Mary just before halftime – but this was a solid performance. He will be a two-QB option next week.
