impact: Carr played tentatively for the entire 2017 season, but it was widely chalked up to a back injury.  He continued to play tentatively bordering on afraid in Monday night's loss to the Rams, and Gruden called out Carr for not pulling the trigger to open wide receivers.  "(Amari) Cooper was open deep, he was open a couple times," Gruden said after watching the All-22 tape.  "For whatever reason, we didn't go there."  This is a head coach publicly criticizing his quarterback, not a common occurrence in today's league.  If Carr doesn't improve Sunday in Denver, his leash may begin to shorten.
report: Raiders coach Jon Gruden called out Derek Carr explicitly for turning down open throws.

impact: Carr was borderline flawless all afternoon, throwing just one incompletion in the first half and just three all game while averaging 8.3 yards per pass attempt. His lone touchdown was a 20-yard touchdown strike to Seth Roberts that put the Raiders up 19-7 in the 3rd quarter. Carr's Week 2 game was a big step forward after a lackluster open to the season, but will remain in the QB2 mix as Oakland heads to Miami in Week 3.
report: Derek Carr completed 29-of-32 passes for 288 yards and one touchdown in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Carr was awful in Week 1, solid in Week 2 and adequate today. His first interception was an end zone arm punt on a play where he had a miscommunication with Amari Cooper. His second was an inadvisable throw to a blanketed Martavis Bryant in the end zone late. Carr would have had a bigger fantasy day, but a Jared Cook touchdown came off the board when it was revealed he was down at the one-yard line. Cooper also committed an inexplicable drop. It has not been elite stuff from Carr, but he has put his brutal opener behind him. He's playing solid enough football. The Raiders just don't have much talent. The Browns will be a tough Week 4 opponent.
report: Derek Carr completed 27-of-39 passes for 345 yards, one touchdown and two interceptions in the Raiders' 28-20, Week 3 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Carr made a questionable decision to target Martavis Bryant in the end zone late in the game, and Xavien Howard came away with the interception. "I think at times he is trying too hard," Gruden said of his quarterback. "I’m really excited about the way he has played and improved and mastered this offense. We are getting closer. That was a painful turnover. We will address that, and we will make the corrections." Carr has quietly played well the last couple weeks, but he has just two touchdowns and two interceptions to show for it in those games.
report: Raiders coach Jon Gruden thinks Derek Carr was "too aggressive" late against the Dolphins.

impact: In a barnburning 45-42 shootout, Carr turned in his best game of the Jon Gruden era with red-zone scores to Amari Cooper, Jared Cook (two), and Jordy Nelson as Oakland shredded Cleveland's previously-stingy pass defense.  Carr has thrown for at least 288 yards in each of the Raiders' first four games, although this was his first big-time fantasy performance.  The Raiders go on the road to face the Chargers in Week 5.  In another potential shootout, Carr will be a solid two-quarterback league play with some low-end QB1 streamer appeal for fantasy leaguers in bye-week binds.
report: Derek Carr completed 35-of-58 passes for 437 yards, four touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Raiders' Week 4 overtime win over the Browns.

impact: Carr had less than 200 yards and one pick with 10 minutes remaining in the fourth quarter. A 47-yard completion to Martavis Bryant (3-91) and eventual touchdown toss to a wide-open Jordy Nelson (due to a complete breakdown in the Chargers' secondary) allowed Carr to turn an outright miserable day into one that was simply miserable. Carr has undoubtedly been poor in engineering coach Jon Gruden's otherwise efficient offense this season, but his weekly fantasy finishes are still that of a low-end QB2 with QB1 streaming appeal. The Raiders host the Seahawks in Week 6.
report: Derek Carr managed to complete 24-of-33 passes for 268 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Raiders' Week 5 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Carr took six sacks and lost two fumbles, and he suffered an apparent left-arm injury in the fourth quarter.  The Raiders opted to let A.J. McCarron finish out the game down 27-3.  Carr has had one productive fantasy performance out of six so far this year while repeatedly earning the ire of first-year coach Jon Gruden.  As the Raiders head into their Week 7 bye, Carr has long been droppable in 14- and even 16-team fantasy leagues.
report: Derek Carr completed 23-of-31 passes for 142 yards and rushed four times for 31 yards in the Raiders' Week 6 loss to Seattle.

impact: It's not surprising.  Carr's injury was never feared to be severe, and the Raiders have a Week 7 bye forthcoming.  It will be at least a few weeks before we see A.J. McCarron replacing Carr as Oakland's gunshy checkdown specialist.
report: Despite leaving Sunday's loss in London early with an arm injury, NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Derek Carr is not in danger of missing time.

impact: "He is the strength of this football team," Gruden said. "He is on my watch. I said it when I got here, if he doesn't play well, I've failed." This goes beyond a normal coachspeak vote of confidence. Gruden seems completely sincere. Plus, the Raiders don't have a legitimate option behind Carr. Gruden has actually managed to dramatically increase both Carr's completion percentage and yards per attempt, but Carr has been a turnover machine and seemed to lack confidence at times. He was unspeakably bad in the Raiders' London loss to the Seahawks. The duo has two weeks to draw something up for the Colts in Week 8.
report: Speaking Tuesday, Jon Gruden gave Derek Carr a vote of confidence as the Raiders' quarterback.

impact: With Khalil Mack and now Amari Cooper out the door, there have been rumblings the Raiders want to move on from Carr as well, and Thompson reports Carr's play and a perceived lack of toughness -- an absurd notion given how quickly he returned from a transverse fracture in his back -- have cost him the locker room. "The belief in him has deteriorated, perhaps to irreparable levels," Thompson writes. "It’s hard to see how Carr can lead this team again." Carr has four years left on a five-year, $125 million extension, but the Raiders can get out with a relatively minor cap hit after this season.
report: The Athletic's Marcus Thompson reports Derek Carr has a "fractured relationship" with his teammates.

impact: Wallace did manage to draw a defensive pass interference penalty. He also didn't quite deserve the doughnut, but a putrid Nick Foles couldn't find him on a gimme deep ball in the second half. Wallace will have a decent shot at getting going against the Bucs' rippable defense in Week 2, but he is little more than a WR5 for fantasy purposes.
report: Mike Wallace was held without a catch on three targets in the Eagles' Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: Wallace was held without a catch in Week 1. He got open on a few deep shots but couldn't get on the same page with Foles. Wallace should see more the three targets he had against the Falcons this week, but he's not going to have a high-volume role behind Nelson Agholor and Zach Ertz.
report: Nick Foles said he wants to get Mike Wallace more involved.

impact: He was quickly ruled out for the rest of the game.  Wallace caught one pass for no gain and appeared to suffer a potentially severe injury on the play.  Wallace had a towel over his head and appeared distraught as he made his way on the cart to the locker room.  The Eagles are already without Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) and Mack Hollins (groin, I.R.).  They're down to Nelson Agholor, DeAndre Carter, Shelton Gibson, and Kamar Aiken at wideout.
report: Mike Wallace was carted off in the first quarter of Sunday's Week 2 game with an ankle injury.

impact: It seemed like he was dealing with a serious injury after being quickly ruled out on Sunday, and this confirms it. It would not be a surprise if he heads to injured reserve. With Mack Hollins (groin) already there and Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) still at least a week away, the Eagles are dangerously thin at receiver.
report: NFL Network's Mike Garafolo reports Mike Wallace (ankle) will be out for "a while."

impact: Wallace will not be placed on injured reserve at this point, meaning the Eagles expect him back in the next eight weeks. Even so, he is going to miss at least the next several games. With Alshon Jeffery looking unlikely to return this week, the Eagles are extremely thin at receiver.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson said Mike Wallace suffered a fractured fibula Week 2 against the Bucs.

impact: Wallace went down early in the loss to the Bucs, forcing the Eagles to roll with Kamar Aiken, Shelton Gibson, and TE Josh Perkins as the top options behind Nelson Agholor and Zach Ertz.  Wallace didn't catch a single pass in his game-plus of action for Philly and turned 32 last month.  There's a chance Wallace could return late in the year.  Jordan Matthews takes his roster spot.
report: Eagles placed WR Mike Wallace on injured reserve with a broken fibula.

impact: "Hopefully, Mike's progressing and we get a chance to get him back here this season," Groh said. Wallace suffered a fractured fibula in Week 2 and was placed on injured reserve. He is not eligible to return until Week 11, and it is unlikely he is even ready to go then. Wallace can be left on the wire.
report: Eagles OC Mike Groh hopes to get Mike Wallace (broken leg, IR) back this season.

impact: Agholor was holding Jarvis Landry's beer in this one, though he did add a 15-yard pass to Nick Foles. As a passer, Foles seemed incapable of thinking vertically, with his long pass for the night checking in at 18 yards. It's encouraging for Agholor's fantasy outlook that he was Foles' primary safety valve. With Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) expected to miss another game, Agholor will be a solid WR3 against the Bucs in Week 2.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 8-of-10 targets for 33 yards in the Eagles' Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: Agholor has double-digit targets in each of the first two weeks, and there is some belief Carson Wentz (knee) could return for Week 3 versus Indianapolis.  With Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) slated to miss at least one more game, Agholor will remain a volume monster.  He's earned WR2 treatment for the foreseeable future.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 8-of-12 targets for 95 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 2 loss at Tampa Bay.

impact: For the second time in three games, Agholor received all of his targets near the line of scrimmage and failed totally tangible receiving yardage. Through three games, Agholor has 20 receptions for a 145 yards (7.3 yards per reception). With Alshon Jefferey nearing a return, Agholor may quickly find himself third in line for targets. As for now, Agholor is a WR3/FLEX option in PPR formats in Week 4 against the Titans.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 4-of-5 targets for 24 yards in Sunday's Week 4 game versus the Colts.

impact: It was a day to forget for Agholor. He dropped at least two passes including one which would have converted a third-and-long, and he committed a bad fumble which luckily for him rolled out of bounds. On the bright side, he still saw 12 targets in Alshon Jeffery's first game back and had a couple chances at big plays. He will look to bounce back against a scuffling Vikings defense next week.
report: Nelson Agholor hauled in 5-of-12 targets for 22 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: The four targets were a new season low. Agholor is sitting on one touchdown and has cleared 50 yards once in five games. Since Carson Wentz's return, he is averaging seven targets. Agholor will be a low-end WR3 for Thursday night's game against the Giants.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 4-of-4 targets for 45 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: The yards were Agholor's most of the season but came in fluky fashion. His first catch was a 32-yarder that came on a batted ball. His second was a 58-yarder where the defense failed to account for him as he kept running a route as Carson Wentz escaped pressure. The three grabs were Agholor's fewest of the season, while he's now drawn five or fewer looks in 3-of-4 Wentz starts. Agholor will be a low-floor WR3 for Week 7 against the Panthers.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 3-of-5 targets for 91 yards in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: This is what happens when you start the game with -1 yard on your first four targets. Quick hitters to Agholor simply did not work in this one, as the Panthers’ speedy linebackers tracked him down quickly each time. As a slot receiver, Agholor will theoretically have the Eagles’ best Week 8 pass-catcher matchup against Jacksonville, but his usage and production warrant WR4 treatment at this point.
report: Nelson Agholor caught 6-of-7 targets for 20 yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Hollins is recovering from sports-hernia surgery. It's a disappointing development for a second-year pro who could have had a bigger role while Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) is sidelined. As it is, Hollins will be a candidate to return in the second half of the season. He remains worth holding onto in Dynasty leagues, but his star is dimming. The Eagles are suddenly very thin at wideout.
report: Eagles placed WR Mack Hollins (groin) on injured reserve.

impact: Pederson said Jeffery is getting closer, but he obviously needs to be cleared for contact before he can return to the field. After being listed as questionable last week, it would not be a surprise if he gets the green light in the next few days.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson said Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) has still not been cleared for contact.

impact: He's practicing fully. It's a big hurdle for Jeffery after being limited the first three weeks. Coach Doug Peterson wouldn't commit to Jeffery playing Sunday, but he's trending in the right direction. Sidelined since February, Jeffery will likely be on a snap count if he plays in Week 4.
report: Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) has been cleared for contact.

impact: It's a bad sign after Jeffery was "full" on Wednesday but perhaps he's getting a rest day or seeing the doctor. Friday, as always, will be the critical day. If Jeffery does suit up, he will slot in as a WR3 who is likely to be on a snap count.
report: Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) was absent from Eagles practice on Thursday.

impact: It means there's still a chance Jeffery makes his 2018 debut after he was cleared for contact on Wednesday. We should get a good idea of his status from Friday's injury report. If Jeffery suits up against the Titans, he will be an upside WR3.
report: Alshon Jeffery's Thursday practice absence was due to an illness.

impact: Jeffery was cleared for contact earlier in the week and didn't practice the last two days solely because of an illness. He's expected to play. Assuming Jeffery's return, first-round TE Dallas Goedert (7-73-1 in Week 3) should revert to his 22.5% snap rate through Week 2 as Philadelphia will suddenly be rich at receiver depth with Nelson Agholor, Jordan Matthews, and Jeffery available.
report: Alshon Jeffery (shoulder, illness) is questionable for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery had been expected to play this week after finally being cleared for contact, and there's a still possibility that he will, though an illness has slowed his progress. Considering he only practiced once this week, the Eagles may play it safe by waiting until Week 5 to unleash their star wideout. Another absence for Jeffery would be good news for slot receiver Nelson Agholor, who has drawn 27 targets in the early going.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Alshon Jeffery (questionable, shoulder/illness) will be a game-time decision Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery's shoulder is fine, but he was a game-time decision after battling an illness all week. At less than 100 percent and coming off an extended layoff, the Eagles may ease him back with situational and red-zone snaps. Owners should wait another week before inserting Jeffery into lineups.
report: Alshon Jeffery (questionable, shoulder/illness) will play in Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery missed time late in the week with an illness, but he was always expected to make his season debut this week. Coming off a long-term injury against a team which has played better defense since Week 1, Jeffery is a risky WR3 option.
report: Alshon Jeffery (shoulder) is active for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Jeffery's first catch did not come until the second quarter, and he appeared gassed after the 31-yard gain in his first game action this season. Tired or not, that was just the start of a big game. He had a great box-out catch on third-and-goal for his touchdown, and he earned a first down on a late game-tying drive with a catch-and-run on a screen. Now healthy and with his quarterback rounding into form, Jeffery should be considered a back-end WR2 in a suddenly promising matchup against the Vikings next week.
report: Alshon Jeffery hauled in 8-of-9 targets for 105 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Reports out of Philly are the injury is "nothing serious."  Jeffery just played his first game in nearly eight months last week and went 8-105-1 on nine targets.  He's ready to roll as a WR2 this week against the Vikings.
report: Alshon Jeffery (chest) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Jeffery's status is not in doubt for Week 5. Set to square off with shadow corner Xavier Rhodes, Jeffery will be a boom/bust WR3. Rhodes has gotten off to a shaky start by his standards.
report: Alshon Jeffery (chest) returned to Eagles practice Thursday.

impact: Alshon got a maintenance day on Wednesday before returning to full practice on both Thursday and Friday. Jeffery impressed with 105 yards and a touchdown in his season debut last week at Tennessee, though he'll have his work cut out for him Sunday against All-Pro corner Xavier Rhodes. He's RotoPat's No. 26 wide receiver for Week 5.
report: Alshon Jeffery (chest) wasn't listed on the Eagles' final injury report for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Jeffery nearly had a third catch on a late third down but could not hold on after taking a colossal shot to the back. It did not feel like Jeffery was getting erased by Xavier Rhodes, but the box score certainly reflects that. Jeffery figures to see more shadow treatment (Janoris Jenkins) in Week 6 when the Eagles venture to New York to take on the Giants for Thursday Night Football. He'll be on the WR2/3 borderline for that one. Jenkins is having a tough year.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 2-of-8 targets for 39 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: It was an easy night at the office for Jeffery, who benefitted from Carson Wentz's play-making ability on the run. Jeffery had few issues with Janoris Jenkins' coverage. The Eagles' No. 1 receiver is up to three scores in three games since making his 2018 debut. He'll be a back-end WR2 for next week's date with the Panthers.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 8-of-12 targets for 74 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: Through no fault of Jeffery’s, the Eagles wound up losing this game despite building a 17-0 halftime lead. Jeffery dominated his matchup against Panthers CB James Bradberry, frequently looking like a man among boys and whipping Bradberry for an early 11-yard touchdown on an inside move. Alshon has been an elite producer since returning from his shoulder injury. He will face a talented but downward-spiraling Jaguars defense next.
report: Alshon Jeffery caught 7-of-10 targets for 88 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to Carolina.

impact: He added a two-point conversion, but it was another disappointing fantasy day for Kittle. He made a couple big plays including one in which he ran over a defensive back in the third quarter, but he dropped what would have been a big gain in the first quarter and had a touchdown called back on a questionable offensive pass interference call. Even worse, it looks like Jimmy Garoppolo is dealing with a season-ending knee injury. If that turns out to be the case, Kittle will be downgraded to a low-end TE1 option moving forward.
report: George Kittle hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 79 yards in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: C.J. Beathard showered Kittle with a team-high eight targets in the first 49ers game post-Garoppolo. Kittle was being held in check until he escaped over the middle for an 82-yard touchdown late in the third quarter. The 49ers were without receivers Marquise Goodwin and Dante Pettis for much of the game after they suffered leg injuries, and Kittle would get a bump if they miss next week's game against the Cardinals. Kittle is still in the TE1 mix even with Garoppolo out for the season.
report: George Kittle caught six passes for 125 yards and one touchdown in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Kittle was responsible for San Francisco's longest play of the afternoon, breaking off a 45-yard catch-and-run down the right sideline with a little under 10 minutes to go in the fourth quarter. Garbage time was Kittle's ally on Sunday as the tight end went for 62 yards on three catches with the Niners playing from behind in the second half. Kittle has shown a strong rapport with quarterback C.J. Beathard, which is nothing new since the two were college teammates together at Iowa. The 24-year-old has given fantasy owners a surprisingly consistent floor this year, eclipsing 75 yards in four of five games. He'll look to make it five out of six next week at Green Bay.
report: George Kittle earned five catches for 83 yards on seven targets Sunday in the 49ers’ Week 5 loss to Arizona.

impact: Kittle was seen limping during Sunday's game against the Cardinals, but wound up playing 87-of-98 offensive snaps. We're guessing he'll be good to go for Monday night's primetime game in Green Bay, though obviously Kittle's status will need be monitored throughout the week. The former Iowa Hawkeye has had a breakout year, ranking third among tight ends with 399 receiving yards.
report: George Kittle (knee) didn't practice on Thursday.

impact: Coach Kyle Shanahan said Kittle would not practice, but he evidently did enough to earn a limited tag. We fully expect Kittle to be out there for Monday night's game against the Packers.
report: Updating an earlier item, George Kittle (knee) was officially "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: There was some early week concern over Kittle's status, but he's now practiced on consecutive days. We expect Kittle to play in Monday night's matchup with the Packers.
report: George Kittle (knee) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Kittle is expected to play after a limited week of practice. With the 49ers down Trent Taylor and Pierre Garcon at less than 100 percent, Kittle is going to see a high target share in a game the 49ers should be playing from behind.
report: George Kittle (knee) is questionable for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Maiocco is simply reading the tea leaves.  But it makes sense.  Either that or the Niners are just protecting themselves in case Kittle proves in pregame warmups that he's not going to be able to play.  Kittle got in a week of limited practices, suggesting he should be able to gut it out.  Inactives for this one should be out around 6:45 PM ET.  Kittle owners may need a backup plan.
report: NBC Bay Area's Matt Maiocco believes the promotion of TE Ross Dwelley from the practice squad suggests George Kittle (knee) may be inactive Monday night against the Packers.

impact: The Niners promoted TE Ross Dwelley from the practice squad on Monday, causing a bit of concern about Kittle's status for Week 6.  But it sounds like he's good to go after a week of limited practices.  Perhaps the Niners will dial back Kittle's snaps some and give Garrett Celek a bit more run.  Schefter adds both Matt Breida (ankle) and Pierre Garcon (shoulder) are also expected to play.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports George Kittle (knee) is expected to play Monday night against the Packers.

impact: Matt Breida (ankle) and Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) are also active.  Kittle could have his snaps scaled back some but remains a lock-and-load TE1.
report: George Kittle (knee) is active for Week 6 against the Packers on Monday night.

impact: The targets actually tied Pierre Garcon for the team lead on a night C.J. Beathard attempted just 23 passes but was dropping dimes over the top of the defense to Marquise Goodwin (4-126-2) while averaging a robust 10.7 YPA.  Provided he didn't suffer any setbacks with his knee on a short week, Kittle will be a TE1 next week at home against a leaky Rams defense.
report: George Kittle caught 4-of-6 targets for 30 yards in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers.

impact: Kittle was legitimately questionable for Monday's game in Green Bay, but he played and didn't show any ill effects, seeing the field on 53 of the Niners' 57 offensive snaps. Among tight ends, only Zach Ertz and Travis Kelce have gone for more yards than Kittle this year. The second-year Iowa product will be safe to employ as a TE1 Sunday when the 49ers host the undefeated Rams.
report: George Kittle (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The 49ers are managing Kittle's reps. He's proven to be a high-end TE1 regardless of who is at quarterback.
report: George Kittle (knee) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Kittle played through a questionable tag in Week 6. There's no concern over his status this week. Kittle is a top-five tight end play against the Rams.
report: George Kittle (knee) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: Kittle was the offense for most of this game. He sparked the only scoring drive of the first half with a 23-yard gain in the second quarter and finished the drive with a 10-yard touchdown catch. He had 77 of C.J. Beathard’s 106 yards at the break. The offense's futility limited him in the second half, but he still got loose for a 21-yard gain in the third quarter. Kittle has now topped 75 yards in five of seven games and has two touchdowns in his last four. He will be a high-end TE1 next week in Arizona.
report: George Kittle hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 98 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: James started and was on the field for 24 snaps last week. With Trent Taylor out, he'll move to the slot after playing the X-role for in place of Marquise Goodwin. James could have some staying power given Taylor's history of back issues. His dynasty stock is trending up.
report: NBC Bay Area's Matt Maiocco expects Richie James to have an expanded role this week.

impact: Westbrook did not get the start, but he looked like Blake Bortles' No. 1 option for stretches of this game including on back-to-back big catches in the second quarter. Westbrook's six targets were the second-most on the team and the most among the receiving corps. It is only a matter of time before he jumps Donte Moncrief on the depth chart.
report: Dede Westbrook hauled in 5-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: Westbrook also lost six yards on a rush. It would have been a lost day for Westbrook, but he managed to turn a fourth quarter dumpoff into a 61-yard touchdown. Westbrook shed a tackle, found the sideline and was off to the races. Those are the kinds of plays he's capable of. Westbrook's upside is tantalizing, but the Jags' receiver rotation currently has him stuck in WR4 land for fantasy purposes.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 4-of-5 targets for 83 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: Westbrook has been expectedly inconsistent in the early going as a rotational receiver on a run-first team.  He will get a better matchup in Week 4 against the Jets, who have struggled mightly to contain slot receivers.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 3-of-4 targets for 31 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Westbrook started fast, racking up six catches for 89 yards in the first half. He led Jacksonville in targets, ahead of both Keelan Cole (3) and Donte Moncrief (5). Westbrook did most of his damage on short passes but was explosive in the open field and picked up most of his yards after the catch. He's now went over 80 yards in two of his last three games. Westbrook will be a WR3/FLEX for Week 5 against the Chiefs.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 9-of-13 targets for 130 yards in Jacksonville's Week 4 win over the Jets.

impact: Held off the box score in the first half, Westbrook opened the third quarter with a 30-yard catch and converted a third down with a great 23-yard grab on the next drive. That was about it for the receiver, however, who still served as the No. 3 despite his breakout game last week. Westbrook will be a weak WR4 dart throw next week in Dallas.
report: Dede Westbrook hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 55 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Like the rest of Jacksonville's sluggish offense, Westbrook was mostly held in check, though he did find an opening in the Cowboys' defense during the third quarter when he scored on a 34-yard touchdown pass from Blake Bortles. Even with Sunday's clunker thrown in, the second-year wideout is still on pace for over 1,000 yards receiving. He'll get the Texans at home in Week 7.
report: Dede Westbrook secured three catches for 38 yards and a touchdown on five targets Sunday in the Jaguars’ Week 6 loss to Dallas.

impact: Westbrook got loose for no big plays as the Jaguars switched quarterbacks, benching Blake Bortles for Cody Kessler early in the third quarter. Donte Moncrief, T.J. Yeldon, Keelan Cole, and rookie D.J. Chark all drew more targets than Westbrook, who will be a dicey WR4/flex option when the Jaguars head to London to face the Eagles next.
report: Dede Westbrook caught 4-of-4 targets for 17 yards in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: The 49ers' slot receiver, Taylor's six targets were tied with Pierre Garcon for second on the team behind George Kittle (9).  However, Taylor is more of a Cole Beasley type who will have a big game here or there but isn't fantasy-relevant outside of deep PPR leagues.  Leave Taylor on the wire.
report: Trent Taylor caught 4-of-6 targets for 28 yards in the 49ers' Week 1 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Even with Marquise Goodwin (quad) on the shelf, the second-year slot man failed to make an impact. Taylor had his moments as a rookie but is off to a quiet start this year with just four catches for 28 yards on eight targets. Outside of dynasty leagues, Taylor doesn’t offer much fantasy appeal.
report: Trent Taylor came up empty on both of his targets Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 2 win over the Lions.

impact: Two words: garbage time. Taylor snoozed through the first half, securing his lone target for a two-yard pickup. But with San Francisco behind in the second half, the young slot receiver feasted with six catches including four on the Niners' final drive. Taylor was also the recipient of a one-yard touchdown, which capped a 14-play, 82-yard drive in the fourth quarter. That play came on a successful fourth-down conversion. Taylor entered Sunday's action with 64 yards all SEASON, so this isn't something fantasy owners should grow accustomed to. The second-year La Tech alum gets the Packers on the road in Week 6.
report: Trent Taylor delivered seven catches for 61 yards and a touchdown on eight targets Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Hopefully the 49ers are just managing Taylor's reps ahead of their Monday night game with the Packers. They can ill afford any more receiver injuries.
report: Trent Taylor (back) was held out of 49ers practice on Thursday.

impact: Taylor and Pierre Garcon have been held out the last two days. It's possible the 49ers are resting them given their wideout depth. Kendrick Bourne and Richie James are next up if one of Taylor or Garcon sits.
report: Trent Taylor (back) didn't practice Friday.

impact: Taylor hasn't practiced this week, but there was hope the 49ers were managing his reps. He's now looking on the wrong side of questionable for Monday night. Richie James will play the slot if Taylor sits.
report: NBC Bay Area's Matt Maiocco "would be very surprised" if Trent Taylor (back) plays in Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Taylor missed practice all week with his back injury. He's coming off season highs in Week 5, but it's not a huge loss. Taylor had offseason back surgery so this could be more than a one-game absence. Richie James will pick up Taylor's slot snaps.
report: Trent Taylor (back) is doubtful for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Taylor was doubtful to play because of a back injury.  Pettis has a knee issue.
report: 49ers declared WR Trent Taylor, WR Dante Pettis, OT Shon Coleman, OG Josh Garnett, DT Julian Taylor, TE Cole Wick, and DL D.J. Jones inactive Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Taylor missed Monday night's game with a minor back injury, though his presence at Wednesday's practice would suggest he's on track to return this week. The second-year slot receiver has yet to make a dent in fantasy, totaling just 16 grabs for 125 yards and one touchdown this season.
report: Trent Taylor (back) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Taylor has a chance to play after getting in limited practice. His back injury is likely going to be an issue all year.
report: Trent Taylor (back) is questionable for Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: The 49ers were stuck with just three active receivers for much of the game with Marquise Goodwin and Dante Pettis both leaving the game early with knee injuries. Garcon was still unable to do much with the extra looks, as has been the case all year. Through four weeks, Garcon has 14 receptions for 156 scoreless yards, and he's has failed to score 10 PPR points in a game despite Goodwin being in-and-out of the lineup.
report: Pierre Garcon caught 4-of-7 targets for 52 scoreless yards in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: He dropped at least two of those targets. This was easily Garcon's biggest workload of 2018, though obviously he wasn't able to take advantage. Even with Marquise Goodwin injured, Garcon has done next to nothing, reeling in just 16-of-33 targets (48.5 percent) for 188 scoreless yards this season. The 32-year-old will take a 16-game touchdown drought into next week's matchup at Green Bay.
report: Pierre Garcon managed five catches for 47 yards on 12 targets Sunday in the Niners’ Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: We would guess the 49ers are simply managing Garcon's reps ahead of Monday night's game against the Packers, but his status will be worth keeping tabs on over the next 48 hours. If Garcon does play, he will be a low-ceiling WR4.
report: Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) was absent from 49ers practice on Thursday.

impact: It's a concern after Garcon missed Thursday's practice. We should get a better read on Garcon's status when the 49ers release their injury report. Dante Pettis (knee) and Trent Taylor (back) are also in danger of sitting this week.
report: Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) didn't practice Friday.

impact: Garcon didn't do much at practice this week. He's not going to be 100 percent, but he's healthy enough to play. The 49ers ruled out Trent Taylor, but will have Marquise Goodwin (hamstring/quad) back after sitting out Week 5.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan expects Pierre Garcon (questionable, shoulder/knee) to play in Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Garcon isn't 100 percent after barely practicing this week, but he's going to gut it out.  With the Niners likely to be playing catchup most of the night, Garcon has some WR4 appeal in deeper leagues.
report: Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) is active Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: His targets tied George Kittle (4-30) for the team lead, but it was Marquise Goodwin making all the plays, with four grabs for 126 yards and a pair of touchdowns.  Garcon has been useless for fantasy throughout the season.
report: Pierre Garcon caught 4-of-6 targets for 37 yards in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers.

impact: This is probably just a veteran's day for Garcon. He was listed with the same injuries last week and wound up seeing his usual workload in a loss to Green Bay. The 33-year-old hasn't shown much this year, delivering just 225 yards across six appearances. He hasn't scored a touchdown since 2016.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee, shoulder) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Garcon will be a WR4 against the Rams.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee, shoulder) returned to 49ers practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Garcon got a breather on Wednesday coming off the Monday night game in Green Bay, but he resumed practicing a day later and should be fine for Sunday's home matchup against the division-rival Rams. Even against a suddenly leaky Rams secondary, Garcon won't be an appealing fantasy option this week.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee, shoulder) is questionable for Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: There wasn't much doubt over his status. Garcon should see a few more targets with Trent Taylor (back) questionable. He's our No. 54-ranked wideout this week.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee, shoulder) is expected to play in Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: With C.J. Beathard struggling, Garcon never had a chance. He has still failed to top 60 yards in any game this season, and he has scored a touchdown since Week 14 of the 2016 season. He can be left on the wire.
report: Pierre Garcon took his only target five yards in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: Coach Kyle Shanahan said Garcon will be doubtful for Week 8 against Arizona.  That'll leave Marquise Goodwin, Trent Taylor, Kendrick Bourne, and perhaps Dante Pettis at wideout, if Pettis is over his knee injury.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Garcon is expected to miss Sunday's game against the Cardinals. Especially if Dante Pettis (knee) cannot return, the Niners will be dangerously thin at wideout.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: This was expected after coach Kyle Shanahan said Garcon wouldn't play early in the week. The 49ers are getting Dante Pettis (knee) back, but not having Garcon is a downgrade to pass offense. Marquise Goodwin should see more targets with Garcon sidelined.
report: Pierre Garcon (knee) is doubtful for Week 8 against the Cardinals.

impact: Moncrief got the start and actually saw one more target than Keelan Cole, but he was easily the least productive member of the receiving corps. Moncrief should remain involved because of his red-zone ability, but it would not be surprising if Dede Westbrook jumped him on the depth chart.
report: Donte Moncrief hauled in 1-of-5 targets for 14 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: There's a Moncrief line if we've ever seen one. Moncrief's four-yard score was a nice grab against tight Stephon Gilmore coverage in the end zone. Moncrief was announced with a knee injury in the second half but ended up playing through it. Despite the team-leading nine targets, Moncrief was fourth in yardage. He's a touchdown-or-bust WR4 for fantasy purposes.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 4-of-9 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: Moncrief is a rotational receiver on a run-first team with a highly inconsistent quarterback.  He is barely roster worthy in 12-team leagues.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 2-of-3 targets for 16 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Moncrief got behind Jets CB Trumaine Johnson for a 67-yard TD. It was his only real highlight, though Moncrief saw the second most targets behind Dede Westbrook. Moncrief didn't have more than 34 yards in any game prior to this week. This will likely go down as one of his best games.
report: Donte Moncrief caught five passes for 109 yards and a touchdowin in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Moncrief led the team in receiving, but there was nothing particularly impactful about his performance. He had 15 yards at the half, and 25 of his yards came on a meaningless catch deep into garbage time. That said, he remains at worst the No. 2 option in a passing game which has created a lot of yardage with Leonard Fournette sidelined. He will be on the desperation WR4 map next week in Dallas.
report: Donte Moncrief hauled in 6-of-15 targets for 76 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Moncrief entered Week 6 with 11 catches for 185 yards and a touchdown over his previous two outings, but that all went out the window against Dallas. The ex-Colt blew a fourth-down conversion with an ugly drop in the fourth quarter, not that it mattered much with Jacksonville getting boat-raced. Moncrief's goose egg Sunday serves as a reminder that he'll always be a boom-or-bust fantasy player. We'll see how he fares against Houston in Week 7.
report: Donte Moncrief came up empty on his three targets Sunday in Jacksonville’s Week 6 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Moncrief led the team in targets and receiving in a game where Blake Bortles was benched for losing multiple fumbles, and Cody Kessler wound up attempting 30 passes in a half as the Jaguars played from behind. The week before, Moncrief went catch-less on three targets. Although Week 8 against the Eagles poses a favorable matchup, Moncrief’s wild week-to-week inconsistency will render him a boom-bust WR3/flex option.
report: Donte Moncrief caught 7-of-10 targets for 76 yards in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: Moncrief took a commercial flight across the Atlantic and was on the practice field Friday.  It doesn't sound, at this point, like there will be any repercussions for Moncrief,  but it's notable in case the Jaguars "punish" him for the mishap.  Moncrief is on the WR3/4 map this week in an exploitable matchup.  He's cleared 75 yards in 3-of-4 games and leads the team in air yards.
report: Donte Moncrief missed the Jaguars' team flight to London due to a "passport mishap" but rejoined the team on Friday.

impact: Cole got off to a great start with a 31-yard catch on the second play of the game, but he was mostly quiet as Blake Bortles struggled the rest of the way. He did lead the Jaguars with 54 yards, but Dede Westbrook paced the receivers with 6 targets. Cole will remain an upside WR4 play next week against the Patriots.
report: Keelan Cole hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 54 yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: After a quiet Week 1, Cole delivered on his summer hype, giving him three 100-yard games over his past five regular season contests. The highlights were in the first quarter, where Cole made a one-handed, Odell Beckham-esque 22-yard catch on Eric Rowe down the sideline. He finished the job by dismantling Rowe for a 24-yard score three plays later. Cole is simply a born playmaker down the field. The Jags' receiver rotation will make him uneven in fantasy, but he's earned the right to be treated as an every-week WR3.
report: Keelan Cole caught 7-of-8 targets for 116 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots.

impact: Cole led the Jags in targets, but Blake Bortles' wild inaccuracies returned, and Jacksonville got nothing going in the downfield passing game.  Cole has an abundance of talent, but this offense is simply not worthy of trust for him to be viewed as anything more than a volatile WR3/flex option in Week 4 versus the Jets.
report: Keelan Cole caught 5-of-9 targets for 40 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: It was a quiet game for Cole with Dede Westbrook and Donte Moncrief both going over 100 yards. Cole made both of his catches in the first quarter and was a non-factor in the second half. He's now been held under 40 yards in back to back games. The Jagaurs spread it out offense is going to be dificult to predict on a week to week basis. Cole will just be a low-end WR3 for Week 5.
report: Keelan Cole caught 2-of-3 passes for 15 yards in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Cole played a big role in the Jaguars' only good drive of the game, hauling in a 32-yard pass to help set up a touchdown on the next play. He also drew a deep target at the end of the first half, but it was a non-descript game for Jacksonville's 1A receiver. He will be just a WR4 play next week in Dallas.
report: Keelan Cole hauled in 4-of-10 targets for 70 yards in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Three of his grabs came with Jacksonville down big in the second half. Cole was stripped by Jaylen Smith in the third quarter, resulting in a turnover. It's been a quiet stretch for the second-year wideout, who has topped 50 yards just once during his current four-game touchdown drought. Cole is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Keelan Cole collected four catches for 41 yards on five targets Sunday in the Jags’ Week 6 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: It was an inefficient day for Cole as the Jaguars benched Blake Bortles and turned to game-manager backup Cody Kessler for 30 second-half pass attempts. Even in a favorable matchup, Cole will be a low-floor WR4 option as the Jaguars head to London for Week 8 to face the Eagles.
report: Keelan Cole caught 2-of-7 targets for 21 yards in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: Ginn's knee injury may explain why he played just over half of the Saints' snaps against the Browns. It's not a threat to Ginn's Week 3 status, but this is a situation to monitor going forward. The Saints have exciting rookie Tre'Quan Smith behind Ginn.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ginn was a limited participant at Wednesday's practice and that may very well be the case again today. An absence, however, would signal a setback and could threaten his availability for Week 3. Ginn played through the injury last week, totaling 55 yards in a win over Cleveland.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) wasn't seen during the open portion of Thursday's practice.

impact: Ginn has been limited in practice, but the 33-year-old was adamant he'll be out there come Sunday. Ginn has gotten off to a productive start this season, delivering nine catches for 123 yards and a touchdown through two games.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) told reporters Thursday that he expects to play Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: G Andrus Peat and OT Terron Armstead were also removed from New Orleans' injury report. Although Ginn appears healthy and will start on the outside, Cameron Meredith is expected to be active against the Falcons. Tre'Quan Smith notably started in Week 2 but still ran fewer routes (and logged fewer snaps) than Austin Carr. All could rotate around Michael Thomas.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) wasn't listed on the Saints' final injury report for Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: Hopefully you took the over in this game, because it was a slugfest. Ginn got off to a strong start, capping the Saints’ opening drive with a four-yard touchdown on a play-action pass from Drew Brees. Aside from that play and a 20-yard rush on an end-around in the fourth quarter, the veteran was mostly held in check. Ginn dropped a pair of passes in the first half, which may explain why he wasn’t targeted after halftime. He’ll look to get back on track next week when the Saints travel to East Rutherford for a date with the 1-2 Giants.
report: Ted Ginn absorbed three-of-six targets for 12 yards and a touchdown while amassing 20 yards on his lone rushing attempt Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: Ginn has been battling knee issues the last two weeks. The missed practice time hasn't stopped him from playing. Ginn should be fine for his normal snaps against the Giants.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: We imagine he'll be removed from the injury report altogether on Friday. Ginn has scored in two of his first three games while contributing 12 catches for 135 yards on 19 targets. He's RotoPat's No. 48 wide receiver for Sunday's matchup against the Giants.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: He rushed one time for one yard.  Ginn almost had the Saints in serious hot water late in the fourth quarter when he botched a kickoff ahead by eight points, setting the offense up at their own three-yard line.  But Alvin Kamara ended up scoring from 49 yards out to alleviate any concerns.  Ginn is a boom-or-bust WR4.
report: Ted Ginn failed to catch any of his three targets in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: The Saints have been managing Ginn's reps of late. He will be active for Monday Night Football against the Redskins. Ginn has 12 yards over his past two games.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) was held out of Thursday's practice.

impact: It's the second straight missed practice for Ginn. The Saints have been limiting his reps, so it's not yet a cause for concern. We'll know Ginn's official status Saturday.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) didn't practice Friday.

impact: Ginn has been playing through knee issues the past few games. He didn't practice all week, so it sounds like there's something more serious going on. It's possible the Saints' Week 6 bye played a role in Ginn sitting. Ginn's absence will open up targets for Tre'Quan Smith and Cameron Meredith behind Michael Thomas.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) has been ruled out for Week 5 against the Redskins.

impact: Ginn was already previously ruled out with a knee injury.  Cameron Meredith, Tre'Quan Smith, and Austin Carr will gobble up snaps behind Michael Thomas.
report: Saints declared WR Ted Ginn, CB Demetri Goodson, LB Manti Te'o, C Cameron Tom, C Will Clapp, DE Mitchell Loewen, and DE Trey Hendrickson inactive Week 5 against the Redskins.

impact: Ginn missed the Week 5 win over the Redskins before the bye and still isn't ready.  Tre'Quan Smith filled in admirably in Ginn's place, catching a pair of long touchdowns, including Drew Brees' 67-yard record-setting score.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ginn hasn't played or practiced since injuring his knee in Week 4. A missed practice Friday would likely signal another absence for the veteran. If Ginn sits Sunday at Baltimore, it would open up snaps for rookie Tre'Quan Smith.
report: Ted Ginn (knee) remained sidelined at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ginn injured his knee in Week 4 and apparently did not make enough progress during the Saints' Week 6 bye for the team to stick it out. We would assume the 33-year-old deep threat will be a candidate for return after missing the required eight weeks. In the interim, third-rounder Tre'Quan Smith is going to be the main beneficiary. Smith already rained hellfire on the Redskins in Ginn's Week 5 absence. He's worth a flier in all leagues where he remains unowned.
report: Saints placed WR Ted Ginn (knee) on injured reserve.

impact: Montgomery played close to the same amount of snaps as Jamaal Williams but saw 11 fewer touches. He wasn't higher than the No. 5 pass game option, with Geronimo Allison out targeting him. Montgomery could have some big weeks when the Packers are playing from behind, but he's hard to trust as a weekly fantasy option.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed two times for seven yards and caught 2-of-3 passes for 21 yards in Week 1 against Chicago.

impact: It was an improvement on the four touches Montgomery saw in Week 1, but he still has been mostly uninvolved through two weeks. More worryingly, Aaron Jones is due back from suspension in Week 3. Montgomery is not a must-roster player in standard scoring.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed five times for 31 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for nine yards in the Packers' Week 2 tie with the Vikings.

impact: With Aaron Rodgers' receivers struggling to make big plays, TyMont finally got involved as a pass catcher/outlet. Both his 10 touches and 64 yards led the Packers' three-man backfield. Especially with Randall Cobb struggling, the Pack figure to work on getting Montgomery more involved on a weekly basis. The Bills are an appetizing Week 4 matchup.
report: Ty Montgomery caught 6-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins, adding four carries for 16 additional yards.

impact: Most of Montgomery's yardage came when he got a free release down the left sideline for a 43-yard catch in the first quarter. The Pack's backfield remained a three-man rotation this afternoon, with Aaron Jones winning both the touch and yardage battles. Montgomery will continue to struggle for value outside of PPR leagues.
report: Ty Montgomery caught 2-of-3 targets for 56 yards in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills, adding five rushes for 18 additional yards.

impact: Montgomery got a ton of playing time in the second half with the Packers in catchup mode.  He has no fantasy value outside of deeper PPR leagues.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed four times for 15 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions, adding a 23-yard catch on three targets.

impact: He added two catches for 10 yards on three targets.  Montgomery capped the opening drive with a two-yard touchdown that originally credited as a passing score but later ruled a lateral.  Therefore, Montgomery got the "rushing" score.  Montgomery doesn't belong on fantasy rosters right now.
report: Ty Montgomery rushed four times for 12 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Njoku saw the second-most targets on the team, but had a hard time converting them into anything tangible. He had two drops in the third quarter on back-to-back plays that thwarted a Cleveland drive. Njoku remains an upside option for fantasy in Week 2 versus the Saints, but is far from established as a entrenched fantasy starter at this stage.
report: Browns TE David Njoku caught 3-of-7 targets for 13 yards in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Steelers.

impact: Njoku disappointed with just three catches for 13 yards, but he played a healthy snap share and finished second on the team with seven targets. If that kind of usage continues, he will be a TE1 more often than not. He will be worth a look in all leagues against the Saints' suddenly questionable defense next week.
report: David Njoku played 78-of-89 (88 percent) snaps Week 1 against the Steelers.

impact: Njoku matched a team-high seven targets, but was a letdown for the second consecutive week for fantasy purposes. Through two weeks, he's now secured just 7-of-14 targets for 33 yards. Despite the back-to-back down games, his target volume is still tangible for a depressed fantasy position. Until he starts to turn that into production however, Njoku is only a TE2 option in Week 3 versus the Jets.
report: David Njoku caught 4-of-7 targets for 20 yards in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: Both the targets and grabs were season lows, but the real story was Baker Mayfield's insertion under center. Mayfield's entrance into the starting lineup is going to solidify Njoku's floor while dramatically increasing his ceiling. Frustrated owners need to keep the faith. The Raiders are an appealing Week 4 matchup.
report: David Njoku caught 2-of-2 targets for 36 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: It could have been a bigger day if not for Njoku committing his third drop of the season in the second half.  Nevertheless, Baker Mayfield has helped Njoku immensely after the high-upside tight end managed 33 scoreless yards on 12 targets from Tyrod Taylor in the first 2 1/2 games of the season.  Since Mayfield took over the offense, Njoku has caught seven of the rookie quarterback's nine targets for 88 yards.  Njoku will stay on the TE1 fringe when the Browns host the Ravens next.
report: David Njoku caught 5-of-7 targets for 52 yards in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: Njoku set season-highs across the board in targets, catches and yards on Sunday. As good as his game was, he could've had much more as he suffered two dropped passes in the game. The move to Baker Mayfield has energized Njoku  as he now has 11 catches for 111 yards on 18 targets the past two weeks after nine catches for 69 yards through the opening three weeks. Despite failing to score on the season, Njoku will be a starting option at a depressed tight end position Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: David Njoku caught 6-of-11 targets for 69 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Njoku had a season-high 11 targets last week. With Rashard Higgins sidelined, his pass-game role should continue to grow. Njoku has 111 yards in Baker Mayfield's two starts this year. He's a back-end TE1 for Week 6.
report: ESPN Cleveland expects David Njoku to see more targets this week.

impact: Njoku found the end zone for the first time this season in the 4th quarter on a 1-yard touchdown pass with the game way out of hand. It was Njoku's first red zone target on the season. After a season-high 11 targets last week, Njoku received 12 more looks on Sunday, giving him 30 total targets over Baker Mayfield's three starts. Njoku is in a dream spot next week against a Tampa Bay defense that has allowed the most receiving yards per game to opposing tight ends to begin the season.
report: David Njoku caught 7-of-12 targets for 55 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Njoku was held without a catch in the first half on Sunday, dropping his lone target over the opening two quarters. In the second half, he got the Browns going right away, catching a 15-yard touchdown over Adarius Taylor to get the Browns within a score. Njoku has now established himself firmly as the number two option behind Jarvis Landry in the Cleveland offense. Since Baker Mayfield has taken over, Njoku has reeled in 22-of-35 targets for 228 yards and two touchdowns. Njoku draws another positive matchup in Week 8 against the Steelers.
report: David Njoku caught 4-of-6 targets for 52 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: It's the first time Njoku has been on the injury report this season.  We doubt it's anything serious.  Njoku will be a TE1 this week against the Steelers.  Njoku has topped 50 yards each of the last four games with a touchdown in back-to-back contests.  He saw seven targets Week 1 against Pittsburgh.
report: David Njoku (knee) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: The Browns are just managing Njoku's reps. He has cleared 50 yards in all four of Baker Mayfield's starts.
report: David Njoku (knee) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: He was limited in practice all week, but Njoku was never in doubt for Sunday.  An elite TE1, Njoku has cleared 50 yards in all four of Baker Mayfield's starts and has found pay dirt in back-to-back games.
report: David Njoku (knee) was removed from the Week 8 injury report and will play against the Steelers.

impact: The Browns' No. 3 receiver now has nine catches for 117 yards through three games. Baker Mayfield's insertion under center could make Higgins worth a second look in deeper (14-team) PPR leagues.
report: Rashard Higgins caught 3-of-3 targets for 32 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: Higgins led Cleveland in receiving yards in a game where Baker Mayfield spread the ball around.  David Njoku's five catches led the team.  Higgins has a secure role in three-receiver sets alongside Jarvis Landry and Antonio Callaway but lacks fantasy value outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Rashard Higgins caught 4-of-5 targets for 61 yards in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: Higgins was having a productive day, catching 3-of-4 targets for 66 yards and a touchdown. His 19-yard touchdown before the first half put the Browns up 6-3 at the half.
report: Rishard Higgins suffered a knee injury in Sunday's Week 5 game versus the Ravens and his return is doubtful.

impact: Higgins was on his way to a good game against the Ravens before going down, catching 3-of-4 targets for 66 yards and a touchdown. With Antonio Callaway struggling, the Browns are suddenly shaky behind Jarvis Landry. Derrick Willies and Rod Streater should be the next guys up, but someone like Dez Bryant or Rishard Matthews could be signed to help out.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson said Rashard Higgins is week-to-week with an MCL sprain.

impact: It means he will miss games against the Chargers and Bucs. The Browns host the Steelers in Week 8. The Dawg Pound needs reinforcements at receiver.
report: Rashard Higgins (sprained MCL) is expected to miss at least two games.

impact: He's working off to the side with the training staff.  Higgins sprained his MCL in Week 5 and should be nearing a return.  The Browns could use him with Damion Ratley and Antonio Callaway not offering much behind Jarvis Landry.  Callaway in particular has been a colossal disappointment thus far.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He needs a third game off with a sprained MCL.  The Browns will continue to roll with Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, and Damion Ratley in three-wide.
report: Rashard Higgins (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Steelers.

impact: "He's a guy that's just gotten better as training camp went along," said Carmichael. "He's young, but I feel pretty good about him." Smith had a standout preseason, leading the Saints in catches (15) and yards (189).  He's done nothing but confirm the star playmaker he was at UCF. With Cameron Meredith trending down, Smith could get the Week 1 start in three-wide sets.
report: Saints OC Pete Carmichael isn't concerned with Tre'Quan Smith's grasp of the playbook.

impact: Smith started, but caught his only target for 18 yards. Despite the low target share, it's an encouraging sign Smith started over Austin Carr. A college producer, Smith crushed the preseason and should see his role grow as the year progresses. Smith has blowup upside if there's an injury to one of the Saints' top wideouts.
report: Tre'Quan Smith played 24-of-66 snaps (36 percent) of snaps Week 2 against the Browns.

impact: "We've got to find ways to get him more touches. He's handling our installation. And I think he's ready to prove that," Payton told reporters at Wednesday's media session. Smith got the start over Austin Carr last week, but played only 36 percent of snaps. That should rise with Ted Ginn battling a knee injury and Carr a non-factor. Smith's grasp of the playbook limited him the first two games, but he has impact potential now that he's playing in three-wide sets.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton plans to get Tre'Quan Smith more touches.

impact: The Saints ruled out Ted Ginn (knee), leaving Smith and Cameron Meredith as the next up behind Michael Thomas. Smith outsnapped Meredith last week and is the more exciting option in what projects as a high-scoring game. It's a potential breakout spot for Smith after a quiet first month. New Orleans is on a Week 6 bye, so Ginn's absence may be short lived.
report: Tre'Quan Smith is expected to see a larger role in Week 5 against the Redskins.

impact: With Ted Ginn (knee) out, Smith saw an increased role and made the most of his three looks.  He scored the 62-yard touchdown where he was literally wide open with no defender within 10 yards of him.  It was the pass play that Brees became the NFL's all-time passing yards leader, passing Peyton Manning.  Smith wasn't done, though, as he reeled in a total dime from Brees for a 35-yard score in the third quarter.  Smith is an exciting Dynasty prospect but figures to play a low-volume role when Ginn is back healthy.  There are just so many mouths to feed.
report: Tre'Quan Smith caught all three of his targets for 111 yards and two touchdowns in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins on Monday night.

impact: Smith almost made a one-handed catch in the end zone in the first quarter but couldn't haul it in. It was a quiet day thereafter, though Smith made an excellent sideline grab. He has six receptions on nine targets in two contests with Ted Ginn sidelined. Drew Brees is averaging just 30 attempts in two games since Mark Ingram's return, and the Saints are headed on the road to take on the Vikings' tough defense in Week 8. It could be a minute before Smith becomes a legitimate WR4.
report: Tre'Quan Smith caught 3-of-6 targets for 44 yards in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: Smith was always the most likely option to take over for Ted Ginn, and that is exactly what happened as Cameron Meredith was limited to just 18 snaps and zero targets. Smith only managed 44 yards on three catches in the tough matchup, but his rest-of-season outlook is strong. He needs to be rostered in all formats.
report: Tre'Quan Smith played 52-of-71 snaps (73 percent) Week 7 against the Ravens.

impact: He didn't practice all week. Allison remains in the protocol, but coach Mike McCarthy said there's hope he can still get cleared. With Davante Adams (questionable, calf) looking on track to play, Marquez Valdes-Scantling is in line to serve as the Packers' No. 2 wideout this week.
report: Geronimo Allison (concussion) is questionable for Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: The Packers have tried to sell the idea of Allison playing this week, but we never bought it. In addition to his concussion, Allison is also dealing with a hamstring injury. With Randall Cobb (hamstring) already ruled out and Allison likely to follow suit, Davante Adams and Jimmy Graham should see as much work as they can handle against the Lions on Sunday. Allison's absence also makes rookie receiver Marquez Valdes-Scantling an interesting bargain play on DFS.
report: Geronimo Allison (questionable, concussion/hamstring) remained sidelined at Saturday's practice.

impact: This isn't a surprise after Allison missed practice all week. He's still in the concussion protocol and is dealing with a hamstring injury. With Randall Cobb out, Allison's absence locks Marquez Valdes-Scantling into two-wide sets. Jimmy Graham should also see increased targets.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Geronimo Allison (questionable, concussion/hamstring) isn't expected to play in Week 5 against the Redskins.

impact: The Packers are pretty banged up; Allison has a concussion, Cobb a hamstring pull, Alexander a groin strain, and Breeland a hammy strain of his own.  Marquez Valdes-Scantling is expected to start at receiver.
report: Packers declared WR Geronimo Allison, WR Randall Cobb, QB Tim Boyle, CB Jaire Alexander, CB Bashaud Breeland, S Jermaine Whitehead, and OL Alex Light inactive Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: This is not a surprise since Allison was listed with a hamstring injury last week, but it is concerning he is still not able to suit up. He looks legitimately questionable for Monday night. With Randall Cobb (hamstring) looking unlikely to play, Marquez Valdes-Scantling could spend another week as the No. 2 receiver.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Geronimo Allison has cleared the concussion protocol but will not practice Thursday because of a hamstring issue.

impact: As did Randall Cobb (hamstring). Both were limited. It gives both a shot at returning for Monday night's game against the 49ers. Even with both sidelined in Week 5, Aaron Rodgers threw for the second-most yards of his career. Allison and Cobb's return would kill Marquez Valdes-Scantling's WR4 appeal. We should know Allison's status by Saturday.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) returned to Packers practice on Thursday.

impact: That would suggest they'll be limited at best on the practice report.  While it's encouraging both are working on the field, it doesn't sound all that promising for their Monday night status against the 49ers.  The good news is they have an extra day this week.  We'll know more about both Saturday.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy said Geronimo Allison (hamstring) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) will again work off to the side with the rehab group at Friday's practice.

impact: Coach Mike McCarthy said he'll give Allison (hamstring) and teammate Randall Cobb (hamstring) "right up until Monday's pre-game workouts" before officially declaring their statuses. McCarthy is reportedly "leaving the door open" for both to play, but it's not a certainty either will be ready by Monday night. If both are out, rookies Marquez Valdes-Scantling (7/68/1 Sunday) and Equanimeous St. Brown (3/89) will again be used in full-time roles, with MVS entering the conversation as a strong WR3. If just Allison is out, it's possible St. Brown is used more on the outside given that Valdes-Scantling has primarily been used in the slot (67%) sans Cobb the past two weeks. Both receivers are true game-time decisions.
report: Geronimo Allison (questionable, hamstring) is a game-time decision for Week 6 against the 49ers.

impact: It means Marquez Valdes-Scantling, Equanimeous St. Brown and J'Mon Moore will ride again behind Davante Adams. The absence will be Allison's second straight. The Packers are on bye for Week 7, so hopefully Allison will be ready to roll against the Rams in Week 8. Valdes-Scantling is a plug-and-play WR3 for Week 6.
report: ESPN's Lisa Salters reports Geronimo Allison (hamstring) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) are expected to remain sidelined for Monday's game against the 49ers.

impact: Allison figured to have the best chance to return this week, but he shed his concussion only to come down with a hamstring issue.  With both vets out, it'll again be rookies Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Equanimeous St. Brown likely benefitting most in three-wide sets behind Davante Adams.  Both rookies have been well ahead of fellow rookie J'Mon Moore on the depth chart.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) are inactive for Week 6 against the 49ers on Monday night.

impact: Allison appeared close to playing before the bye, so it is not a surprise he is ready to practice following the off week. Barring any setbacks, he should be ready to face the Rams on Sunday.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Geronimo Allison (hamstring) will practice Tuesday.

impact: It puts Allison on track to return coming off the Packers' bye, though he'll likely need to get in a full practice to play. Randall Cobb (hamstring) also returned to limited practice.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is also expected back. Allison was able to produce even with Cobb active early in the season, but that production came on a limited target share. He will be a risky WR3/FLEX play this week.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy believes Geronimo Allison (hamstring) will play Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: As did Randall Cobb (hamstring), putting both on track to return following the Packers' Week 7 bye. Allison has cleared 60 yards in all four of his 2018 appearances. He's in the WR3/4 mix for what should be a high-scoring contest with the Rams.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Note that Randall Cobb (hamstring) still came out of the bye listed as questionable for Sunday. If he's ruled out, rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling would stay running from the slot with Davante Adams and Allison on the outside. All including Cobb (pending health) are tremendous options against the Rams' struggling secondary Sunday.
report: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) will play in Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: Payton said Meredith still needed to work on the timing of the offense.  It remains to be seen if Meredith will be up and active this week against Cleveland, but he obviously cannot be trusted in fantasy at the moment.  Austin Carr made the start and remains ahead of Meredith at wide receiver.
report: Coach Sean Payton said Cameron Meredith was a healthy Week 1 inactive because he missed so much time at training camp.

impact: Meredith has been a full participant at practice all week, but apparently he still has a ways to go in learning the intricacies of Sean Payton's offense. The ex-Bear sat out all of last season with a torn ACL and missed reps during training camp this summer with an undisclosed injury. Even if he plays Sunday against the Browns, which is not a given after being a healthy scratch in Week 1, Meredith can't be trusted for fantasy purposes.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said Cameron Meredith is "still getting up to speed."

impact: Meredith has still yet to make it up to speed after being inactive for the Saints season opener a week ago. Meredith missed reps during training camp this summer as he continues to recover from a torn ACL that forced him to miss all of the 2017 season. Austin Carr will once again fill his position at WR in Week 2.
report: Saints declared WR Cameron Meredith, DE Trey Hendrickson, C Will Clapp, WR Dan Arnold, CB Arthur Maulet, C Cameron Tom, DT Tyeler Davison inactive for SUnday's Week 2 game versus the Browns.

impact: After missing time during camp, Meredith was a healthy scratch the first two weeks of the season. Payton said New Orleans will see if they can get him in the game plan this week. It is not a ringing endorsement, and Meredith obviously should not be in any fantasy lineups. Still, it is a step in the correct direction.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said Cameron Meredith could be active this week.

impact: The Saints plan to work Meredith into their gameplan after making him a healthy scratch the first two weeks. It's hard to see Meredith having much of a role, but this is a step in the right direction. Meredith will push Tre'Quan Smith and Austin Carr for snaps.
report: Cameron Meredith is active for Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: Active for the first time this season, Meredith made the most of his lone target. Meredith’s 11-yarder staked New Orleans to a 23-21 lead with just over six minutes remaining in the third quarter. The 26-year-old cleared one hurdle by recording his first catch in over 20 months, but he’s still not worthy of fantasy consideration. Meredith will try to take another step forward against the Giants in Week 4.
report: Cameron Meredith registered an 11-yard touchdown on his lone target Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: It was his first game on the active roster, but that did not stop Meredith from out-snapping Tre'Quan Smith (26) and Austin Carr (13). Despite a touchdown on his only target Sunday, it is questionable how large a role Meredith can carve out behind Michael Thomas and Ted Ginn, but it looks like he is on his way to the No. 3 job. He is a fine speculative add.
report: Cameron Meredith played 34-of-79 snaps (43 percent) Week 3 against the Falcons.

impact: The Saints may just be managing Meredith's reps after he made his season debut last week. Meredith outsnapped Tre'Quan Smith and scored a touchdown on his only target against the Falcons, but the Saints' No. 3 job looks like a week to week role.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Meredith caught his lone target for an 11-yard touchdown in his Saints debut last week against Atlanta. Until his volume increases, Meredith won't be much more than a deep-league bench stash.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Meredith caught his lone target for an 11-yard score in his 2018 debut last week and was more involved this Sunday.  The stat line isn't sexy, but Meredith should continue to push for heavy snaps behind Michael Thomas.  He'll again be on the WR4/5 map next week at home against the Redskins.
report: Cameron Meredith caught 3-of-4 targets for 32 yards in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: He caught all five of his passes in the first half when Drew Brees threw for 250 of his 363 yards.  Meredith has steadily improved his numbers each of the last three weeks after missing the first two games.  He's been a mainstay in three-wide sets and should only keep getting better after the Week 6 bye.  Meredith will have up-and-down games but needs to be owned as a WR4.
report: Cameron Meredith caught all five of his targets for 71 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: Meredith had the bye week to heal his injured knee. He should be all systems go for Sunday's game in Baltimore. Meredith hasn't made his fantasy presence felt yet in 2018, but he still warrants ownership in most formats.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Meredith was limited Wednesday coming off the Saints' bye week but he was back to full work on Thursday. Obviously he'll be ready for Sunday's game in Baltimore. Meredith hasn't made much fantasy noise yet but that could change now that Ted Ginn (knee) is on I.R.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Meredith practiced fully the last two days. He's healthy coming off the Saints' bye and is in line for an expanded role with Ted Ginn on IR. Tre'Quan Smith will start opposite Michael Thomas, but Meredith should see snaps in three-wide sets.
report: Cameron Meredith (knee) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: It's a step back for Meredith after he went 5-of-5 for 71 yards in Week 5. Drew Brees' volume has been down during that span — coinciding with Mark Ingram's return — and Tre'Quan Smith has looked like the biggest beneficiary of Ted Ginn's absence. Meredith isn't much of a WR5 for the time being.
report: Cameron Meredith was not targeted in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: It was a balanced effort for Thomas, who recorded exactly eight catches for 90 yards in both halves. Thomas capped the second quarter with a six-yard touchdown grab on a play where the Bucs left him completely open. He nearly scored again in the fourth quarter, but was stopped just short of the goal line. Even at full strength the Bucs would have had a hard time defending Thomas, but with Brent Grimes (groin) out and Vernon Hargreaves exiting in the second half, Tampa Bay’s weakened secondary didn’t have a prayer. The third-year stud should stuff the stat sheet again in next week’s home matchup against the Browns.
report: Michael Thomas delivered a team-record 16 catches for 180 yards and a touchdown on 17 targets Sunday in the Saints’ Week 1 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Thomas is feeling a bit under the weather, though this shouldn't affect his status for Week 2 against Cleveland. The third-year wideout erupted for 180 yards on a team-record 16 catches in last week's opener.
report: Michael Thomas (illness) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Thomas was sick yesterday but his illness was never a long-term concern. Fresh off a monster game in Week 1 (16 catches for 180 yards and a touchdown), Thomas will be ready to roll Sunday against Cleveland. He's RotoPat's No. 4 wide receiver for Week 2.
report: Michael Thomas (illness) returned to a full practice on Thursday.

impact: Thomas was never in danger of sitting out this week. Coming off a 16-catch season opener, he's a locked-in WR1 for Sunday's Browns matchup.
report: Michael Thomas (illness) has been removed from the Saints' injury report.

impact: Thomas did lose a fumble for the second straight game, but that was his only blemish on a nearly perfect day.
