Thomas scored both of the Saints' touchdowns, catching a 2-yard score in the third quarter to pull the Saints within a score and then catching a 5-yard touchdown over Denzel Ward to give New Orleans a lead with 2:40 left in the fourth quarter. Thomas now has reeled in 28 receptions through two weeks, which is the most for any player through two weeks in NFL history. Thomas will be a set and forget WR1 option next week when the Saints head to Atlanta.
report: Michael Thomas caught 12-of-13 targets for 89 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Browns.

impact: Thomas set the tone with a 35-yard gain on the Saints’ first play from scrimmage. He never managed to find the end zone but was always there when Drew Brees needed him. Thomas played a pivotal role in overtime, moving the chains with three catches for 38 yards on the game-clinching drive. Sunday’s 10-spot gives Thomas 38 catches for the year, an NFL record through the first three games. He’s also been incredibly efficient, absorbing an impossible 95 percent of his targets this year. Even with Janoris Jenkins likely to shadow him in Week 4, the red-hot Thomas will remain an appealing WR1 against the Giants.
report: Michael Thomas pulled in all 10 of his targets for 129 receiving yards Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 victory over Atlanta.

impact: Thomas tallied at least 10 catches and/or one touchdown in each of the first three games entering Sunday.  His four targets were tied with Cameron Meredith for second on the team behind Alvin Kamara's nine, and Drew Brees didn't throw a single touchdown as Kamara rushed for three.  Thomas should bounce back no problem back at home against the Redskins in Week 5.
report: Michael Thomas caught all four of his targets for 47 yards in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: After seeing 40 combined targets Weeks 1-3, Thomas has been targeted a total of nine times the past two weeks and hasn't scored in either game.  He was obviously never going to continue at that ridiculous three-week pace, but there are so many talented players in this offense with the emergence of Tre'Quan Smith (3-111-2 tonight) and return of Mark Ingram that the Saints can spread the ball around.  Thomas will get a difficult matchup on the road against the Ravens in Week 7 when the Saints come off their bye.
report: Michael Thomas caught 4-of-5 targets for 74 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: The catches were Thomas' most since Week 3, while the score was his first since Week 2. Surprisingly, Thomas has failed to clear 10 targets or 75 yards in each of his past three games. He has a tough Week 8 matchup in Xavier Rhodes and the Vikings, though Rhodes could end up missing the game with an ankle injury.
report: Michael Thomas caught 7-of-9 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: With Marquise Goodwin going down very early in the second quarter with a quad injury, Pettis was the next man up opposite Pierre Garcon with Trent Taylor in the slot.  Pettis scored the Niners' lone touchdown, making an over-the-shoulder catch from 22 yards out on an escape maneuver by Jimmy Garoppolo outside the pocket.  Pettis will be on the fantasy map if Goodwin misses time.
report: Dante Pettis caught 2-of-5 targets for 61 yards and one touchdown in the 49ers' Week 1 loss to the Vikings.

impact: It is not a bold prediction considering Pettis served as the No. 2 receiver after Goodwin exited the season opener, playing 72.7 percent of the snaps and catching two passes for 61 yards and a touchdown on five targets. With a prime matchup against the Lions on deck, Pettis will be in the WR3 conversation if Goodwin is forced to miss. He is a great speculative add.
report: 49ers.com's Joe Fann believes Dante Pettis "would have a huge role" if Marquise Goodwin (quad) sits out Week 2 against the Lions.

impact: Pettis dusted Teez Tabor for a 35-yard gain in the first quarter but wasn’t heard from again. The rookie was expected to play an important role with Marquise Goodwin (quad) sidelined this week, but obviously that didn’t come to fruition. Even with a likely shootout on tap next week at Kansas City, the rookie will be difficult to trust in fantasy.
report: Dante Pettis was limited to one catch for 35 yards on two targets Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 2 win over the Lions.

impact: With Marquise Goodwin healthy, Pettis disappeared from the game plan. He can be dropped in redraft leagues.
report: Dante Pettis was not targeted in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Pettis was met by multiple Chargers directly after catching a punt, but he quickly went down in an odd play that left Pettis without one of his cleats. The 49ers training staff checked the stability of his knee on the field before taking him to the sideline. With Marquise Goodwin healthy, Pettis was not targeted last week.
report: Dante Pettis suffered a left knee injury in the 49ers' Week 4 game against the Chargers and is questionable to return.

impact: Pettis suffered a knee injury on a punt return and he needed assistance from the training staff to get off the field. The timing of the injury is bad with Marquise Goodwin (leg) in the locker room. The 49ers only have Pierre Garcon, Trent Taylor, and Kendrick Bourne at receiver at the moment. The 49ers have also ruled out LT Joe Staley (knee) for the remainder of the game. Finally, RT Mike McGlinchey is questionable to return.
report: Dante Pettis has been ruled out for the remainder of the 49ers' Week 4 game against the Chargers.

impact: Pettis was forced from Week 4 after suffering a knee injury on a punt return. He needed assistance to get off the field, but Maiocco reports he did not suffer any damage to his ACL. Even so, the receiver could still be looking at a multi-game absence. We will know more after his MRI on Monday.
report: NBC Sports Bay Area's Matt Maiocco reports Dante Pettis' knee injury is not believed to be serious.

impact: Coach Kyle Shanahan said Pettis will be week to week after the game against Arizona.  Pettis was hurt on Sunday against the Chargers on a punt return.  He can safely be dropped in any redraft formats where he's owned.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) has been ruled out for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: Being ruled out this early in the week once again doesn't bode well for Pettis' immediate future.  He's possibly looking at missing a number of more games.  The Niners' receiver corps is really banged up with Marquise Goodwin (hamstring) missing Week 5.  Pierre Garcon hasn't scored in 16 games.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) has been ruled out for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Pettis has missed the last two games with a knee injury, but this limited practice gives him a good shot to return this week. Behind at least Marquise Goodwin, George Kittle, and Pierre Garcon in the pecking order, Pettis is just a Dynasty stash right now.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) got in a limited practice Wednesday.

impact: Pettis' Wednesday return must not have gone well. If he sits against the Rams, it will be his third-straight absence.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) was downgraded to "DNP" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Pettis was able to return to practice Wednesday, but he apparently suffered a setback and missed the rest of the week. He is only a hold in Dynasty formats.
report: 49ers declared Dante Pettis (knee) inactive for Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: Pettis is trying to get back from a three-week absence. With Pierre Garcon (shoulder, knee) expected to sit, Pettis would see serious snaps against the Cardinals if he can get cleared.
report: 49ers Dante Pettis (knee) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Pettis will return after missing the last three games. With Pierre Garcon doubtful, he's in the mix for three-wide snaps with Richie James and Kendrick Bourne. Pettis isn't on the Week 8 streaming radar.
report: Dante Pettis (knee) was removed from the Week 8 injury report.

impact: Goodwin has at least a chance to play after getting in a limited week of practice, though coach Kyle Shanahan still considers him a game-time call. If Goodwin can't get the green light, it would open up targets for Pierre Garcon, George Kittle and to a lesser extent, Dante Pettis.
report: Marquise Goodwin (quad) is questionable for Week 3 against the Chiefs.

impact: Goodwin was put through a workout before the game, so he apparently showed enough to be active. There is still some concern he will be used less than usual after missing last week, but the matchup could not be better. Goodwin should be in fantasy lineups.
report: Marquise Goodwin (quad) is active for Week 3 against the Chiefs.

impact: Goodwin entered the game questionable with a quad injury, but he did not look hampered on the field. His touchdown came when he was left wide open in the third quarter, and Jimmy Garoppolo found him for an 11-yard score. Unfortunately, Garoppolo suffered what appears to be a season-ending injury in the fourth quarter. That is a concern for Goodwin, who broke out with Garoppolo under center late last season, but he also had some big games with C.J. Beathard on the field. He should stick in the WR3 tier.
report: Marquise Goodwin hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 30 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Goodwin looked fine playing through his hamstring injury last week. He's healthy, but his ROS outlook takes a hit with Jimmy Garoppolo out for the year. C.J. Beathard downgrades Goodwin to WR3 status.
report: Marquise Goodwin (quad) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Goodwin will be out there against the Chargers. The question is how he will fare with backup C.J. Beathard taking over at quarterback. An exciting preseason sleeper, Goodwin is best treated as a boom/bust WR4 until we see him healthy and productive for a few games with Beathard at the controls.
report: Marquise Goodwin (quad) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Goodwin practiced fully the last two days. He's healthy but needs to be downgraded playing in a C.J. Beathard offense. Goodwin is outside our top-50 receivers this week.
report: Marquise Goodwin (quad) was removed from the Week 4 injury report.

impact: Goodwin might have re-injured his quad but that's unconfirmed. He was taken into the locker room after reaching for his leg on a late second quarter play. Goodwin's direct replacement Dante Pettis (knee) left the game earlier and his return is questionable. The 49ers wide receiver depth is being tested in Los Angeles.
report: Marquise Goodwin exited from the 49ers' Week 4 game against the Chargers with a leg injury.

impact: He added a four-yard carry. It was a muted effort for Goodwin, who was limited to 37 snaps by a leg injury. He was able to finish the game, but he did not make any catches in the second half. His practice status will be one to watch this week.
report: Marquise Goodwin hauled in 2-of-4 targets for 24 yards in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Goodwin was injured in last week's loss to the Chargers in the second half.  Goodwin was able to return, but he didn't catch a ball after the break.  Kendrick Bourne would be in line for heavy snaps should Goodwin miss time.
report: Marquise Goodwin (hamstring, quad) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Goodwin is now on track to play against the Chargers. He's a low-floor WR4.
report: Marquise Goodwin (hamstring, quad) returned to 49ers practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Goodwin re-injured his quad last week but looks on track to play. The 49ers may continue to scale his snaps at less than 100 percent. Playing with C.J. Beathard and not fully healthy, Goodwin is a low-floor WR4.
report: Marquise Goodwin (questionable, hamstring/quad) is a game-time decision for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: Goodwin is out after re-injurying his hamstring in last week's loss to Seattle. His absence will open up targets for Pierre Garcon and tight end George Kittle. Matt Breida (shoulder), OT Mike McGlinchey (knee), C Weston Richburg (knee), Richard Sherman (calf) and OT Joe Staley (knee) are all active for the Niners.
report: 49ers declared WR Marquise Goodwin, OT Shon Coleman, OG Josh Garnett, DT D.J. Jones, WR Dante Pettis, DT Juliann Taylor, CB Jimmie Ward inactive for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: It appears the Niners will have their deep threat back for Monday Night Football. Hamstring and quad injuries have limited Goodwin to just three games this year. Fantasy owners would be wise to use a "wait-and-see" approach before slotting the 27-year-old back into lineups.
report: Marquise Goodwin (hamstring/quad) is practicing in full for Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Battling quad and hamstring issues much of the first five weeks, Goodwin entered Monday with a combined five catches for 54 yards and one score in three games played.  This game came out of nowhere, but Goodwin can do this anytime he steps on the field when healthy.  He ran right by CB Kentrell Brice for a 67-yard touchdown in the first quarter before then beating veteran Tramon Williams for a 30-yard score nine minutes later.  Where Goodwin was dropped in fantasy, he needs to be picked up immediately.  He'll be a WR3/4 next week against the Rams.
report: Marquise Goodwin caught 4-of-5 targets for 126 yards and two touchdowns in the 49ers' 33-30, Week 6 loss to the Packers on Monday night.

impact: Goodwin left the game briefly with a lower-leg injury, but he was able to return and catch two passes deep into garbage time. It was a disappointing follow up to his 126-yard, two-touchdown explosion on Monday night, but it is promising he easily led the receivers with five targets. The matchup next week in Arizona is not great, but Goodwin will be worth a look as a WR3.
report: Marquise Goodwin hauled in 2-of-5 targets for 24 yards in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: The Packers reportedly shopped Davis before final cuts. He played zero offensive snaps in the opener. He should be cut loose with an injury settlement once he gets healthy.
report: Packers placed WR Trevor Davis on injured reserve with a hamstring injury.

impact: Even with Leonard Fournette leaving with an injury, Grant did not see much action against the Giants. Perhaps that changes if Fournette is forced to miss time, but T.J. Yeldon is the back to add.
report: Corey Grant rushed once for three yards in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: Despite Leonard Fournette leaving with an injury, Grant only received one touch in the season opener, but that could change if Fournette is forced to sit out this week. "I think if we knew that early in the week [we'd be without Fournette], during the course of the game I think that’s a little bit different scenario for us," Marrone said. "At the end of the day, looking back we should have gotten him in there a little bit more." Marrone did caution it would not have been "much more," but the comment is still a bit of a concern for T.J. Yeldon's workhorse chances, especially since Grant caught three passes for 59 yards when he faced the Patriots in the playoffs.
report: Jaguars coach Doug Marrone said he wants to use Corey Grant more moving forward.

impact: Grant ended up forming a near-even committee with T.J. Yeldon in Leonard Fournette's absence. The Jags worked hard to exploit Grant's play-making ability as a pass catcher. He was a spark plug who picked up a number of key first downs. Despite his big-play ability, Grant will be a low-end RB3/FLEX if Fournette remains sidelined for Week 3 against the Titans.
report: Corey Grant caught 6-of-7 targets for 56 yards in the Jaguars' Week 2 win over the Patriots, adding four rushes for 13 additional yards.

impact: Grant started the game in place of Leonard Fournette (hamstring), but the Jags wound up going with T.J. Yeldon because Grant was so ineffective.  Grant was barely even seen in the second half, while Yeldon finished with 13 touches to Grant's 7.  All in all, it was an abysmal offensive effort from a Jaguars team that played so well versus New England the week prior.  Fournette was close to playing and figures to return in Week 4 against the Jets.
report: Corey Grant rushed six times for 11 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for a combined loss of one yard in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Grant had his lower leg caught underneath a tackler at the end of a second-quarter run. He was not able to put weight on his left leg as he was helped off the field, and he was pretty quickly ruled out. With Leonard Fournette inactive, T.J. Yeldon should get as much work as he can handle against the Chiefs. Brandon Wilds is Jacksonville's other active running back.
report: Corey Grant exited Week 5 against the Chiefs with a foot injury.

impact: Grant had to be carted off the field Sunday.  He was hyped up over the summer as someone the Jaguars wanted to get more involved in the offense, but it never really happened as Grant got 13 carries and turned them into 40 scoreless yards.  Grant nabbed nine catches for 67 yards.  He'll be a 27-year-old free agent next March coming off one of the most serious foot injuries.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Corey Grant suffered a Lisfranc injury Week 5 against the Chiefs and is expected to miss the remainder of the season.

impact: Grant suffered a Lisfranc injury against the Chiefs in Week 5 and is done for the season. He should be healthy once free agency opens next spring.
report: Jaguars placed Corey Grant (foot) on injured reserve.

impact: The second-year UDFA was sprung into extra snaps with Marquise Goodwin and Dante Pettis both leaving the game with leg injuries. Bourne was able to convert the extra looks into a two-yard touchdown for his second touchdown of the year. He will return to his backup role once Goodwin and Pettis return to action.
report: Kendrick Bourne caught 3-of-4 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Yeldon has been a limited participant the past two days after sitting out Wednesday's practice. Even if he plays, Yeldon won't have much fantasy significance this week with workhorse Leonard Fournette due back from his hamstring injury.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) is questionable for Week 3 against the Titans.

impact: Yeldon will play through his ankle injury and figures to carry the load Sunday with workhorse Leonard Fournette (hamstring) headed for another absence. Tennessee's run defense doesn't pose much of a threat as the Titans have yielded the seventh-most rushing yards per game this season. Yeldon is worth firing up as a borderline RB2 in all fantasy leagues this week.
report: T.J. Yeldon (questionable, ankle) is expected to play Week 3 against the Titans.

impact: The Jaguars started Corey Grant, but he managed 10 yards on seven touches and Yeldon showed the hotter hand.  In a game where Jacksonville's passing attack was almost entirely nonexistent, Yeldon led the team in receiving yards.  Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is tentatively due back for Week 4 against the Jets, which would render Yeldon and Grant useless as fantasy options.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed seven times for 44 yards and caught 6-of-7 targets for 46 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to Tennessee.

impact: Yeldon made it though Sunday's game, so the Jaguars may be resting him. With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) expected back, Yeldon should revert back to change-of-pace duties this week.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is also practicing Thursday, but he did the same last week before sitting out the game. Yeldon should play this week, but his fantasy value is squarely tied to Fournette's health.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) is expected to return to practice Thursday.

impact: Yeldon was a DNP Wednesday but practiced the last two days. With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) not a lock to return this week, he could be in line for another start. Yeldon would be a FLEX play against the Jets if Fournette is held out.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) was removed from the Week 4 injury report.

impact: Yeldon replaced an injured Leonard Fournette in the second quarter.  He went untouched on a 31-yard screen for his first touchdown, and added a one-yard goal-line TD in mopup time. With Fournette dealing with a setback, Yeldon could be in line for another start this week. He'll be a plug-and-play RB2 if Fournette sits.
report: T.J. Yeldon had 18 carries for 52 yards and a touchdown and caught three passes for 48 yards and a receiving touchdown in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Yeldon was limited on both Wednesday and Thursday before being upgraded to full participation on Friday. He might cede some passing-down work to Corey Grant, but otherwise Yeldon should see close to a full complement of snaps Sunday at Arrowhead. Leonard Fournette's injury keeps Yeldon in the weekly RB2 mix.
report: T.J. Yeldon (ankle) wasn't listed on the Jaguars' final injury report for Week 5 against the Chiefs.

impact: With Corey Grant exiting early, it was all Yeldon in this one. He looked great early in the game, consistently gaining big yardage on the ground. That stopped with the Jaguars down big in the second half, but he kept things going in the passing game. He caught Blake Bortles' only touchdown pass when he easily beat a linebacker on a wheel route from 14 yards out. With Leonard Fournette looking doubtful for Week 6, Yeldon will be a high-end RB2 against the Cowboys.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed 10 times for 53 yards and hauled in 8-of-10 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: The Jaguars did some shuffling in their backfield since the Week 5 loss to the Chiefs, losing Corey Grant (foot) to I.R., waiving Brandon Wilds, signing David Williams off the Broncos' practice squad, and then inking Jamaal Charles on Tuesday.  Yeldon remains the constant and is probably the only one with any real idea what the offense is, leaving him a strong RB2 this week in Dallas.
report: NFL Network's Tom Pelissero reports T.J. Yeldon will remain "the guy" in the Jaguars' backfield while Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is out.

impact: Yeldon never had a chance with Jacksonville playing from behind almost the entire game. With the Jags in catch-up mode, Yeldon saw just three carries in the second half. The 25-year-old has served as Jacksonville's workhorse during Leonard Fournette's absence. If Fournette (hamstring) can't get the green light in Week 7, Yeldon would draw another start against Houston.
report: T.J. Yeldon contributed just 41 yards on eight carries while turning five targets into three catches for 29 yards Sunday in Jacksonville’s Week 6 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is also idle on Wednesday.  Yeldon touched the ball just 11 times last week in the blowout loss to the Cowboys and had previously been listed with an ankle issue back in Week 4.  The foot thing is new.  Jamaal Charles and David Williams are the Jaguars' healthy backs.
report: T.J. Yeldon (foot, ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Wednesday was likely just rep management. Like the rest of the Jaguars' offense, Yeldon gets a mulligan on last week's disaster against the Cowboys. He will be an RB2 against the Texans.
report: T.J. Yeldon (foot, ankle) returned to Jaguars practice Thursday.

impact: With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) still out, Yeldon will be a volume-based RB2.
report: T.J. Yeldon (foot, ankle) was removed from the Week 7 injury report and will play against the Texans.

impact: Yeldon operated as Jacksonville’s feature back for one last week; Carlos Hyde will likely take over as the Jags’ primary ball carrier in Week 8 against the Eagles in London. Yeldon should continue to dominate passing-game work until Leonard Fournette (hamstring) returns, but he has devolved from an every-week RB2 to a low-end flex option going forward.
report: T.J. Yeldon rushed 12 times for 28 yards and caught 5-of-7 targets for 40 yards and a touchdown in the Jaguars’ Week 7 loss to Houston.

impact: Perriman worked out for the Bills and Jets last week, but he did not find a deal. The Eagles could use some receiver help with Alshon Jeffery still sidelined, but they are likely just doing their due diligence on the former first-round pick. Philly is also working out Kamar Aiken.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports free agent WR Breshad Perriman is working out for the Eagles.

impact: Perriman has visited the Jets, Bills, and Eagles already, and there were reports he had a visit scheduled with the Giants. It is possible he is looking for a 53-man roster spot which is just not available.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports free agent Breshad Perriman is working out for the Redskins on Monday.

impact: It's a no-risk flyer pickup as the Redskins look to add speed to the perimeter of their offense, where Paul Richardson and Josh Doctson have struggled to get open.  The 26th overall pick in the 2015 draft, Perriman flamed out in Baltimore due to injuries and persistent drops.  He's a long shot to make any noise.
report: Redskins signed WR Breshad Perriman, formerly of the Ravens.

impact: Paul Richardson (shoulder, knee) remains questionable for Sunday, but even that wasn't enough to keep Perriman in Washington. The Redskins took a no-risk flier on him just last week that clearly didn't work out. We expect he'll still find a home elsewhere soon.
report: Redskins waived WR Breshad Perriman.

impact: With both Rashard Higgins (knee) and depth wideout Derrick Willies (shoulder) out Sunday, the Browns had no choice but to add a veteran off the streets. The No. 26 overall pick in the 2015 draft, Perriman never found success with the Ravens due to nagging injuries and consistent drops. It's unclear if he'll be active Sunday. Cleveland will have Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, Rod Streater, Damion Ratley, and Perriman available in Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: Browns signed WR Breshad Perriman, formerly of the Ravens.

impact: Perriman was signed on Saturday after the Browns lost Rishard Higgins for a few weeks due to a sprained MCL and placed Derek Willies on injured reserve with a shoulder injury. The Browns will enter Sunday with Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, Rod Streater and Damion Ratley available in Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: Browns declared WR Breshad Perriman, QB Drew Stanton, CB Tavierre Thomas, LB Tanner Vallejo (concussion), OL Earl Watford, WR Rashard Higgins (knee) and DL Carl Davis inactive for Sunday's Week 6 game versus the Chargers.

impact: Perriman will make his Browns debut with Rishard Higgins (MCL) still sidelined. He'll be at best the No. 4 wideout behind Jarvis Landry, Antonio Callaway, and Damion Ratley. Inactive for Cleveland are QB Drew Stanton, WR Da’Mari Scott, CB E.J. Gaines, MLB Joe Schobert, and DL Carl Davis.
report: Breshad Perriman is active for Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: Washington was cut by the Lions ahead of Week 1 after spending two seasons with the team as a seventh-rounder.  He can help on special teams.
report: Saints signed RB Dwayne Washington off their practice squad.

impact: Signed on Sunday, Gates practiced for the first time this year on Wednesday, but he is still hopeful he can suit up against the Chiefs. "I think I'm well aware of the preparation that needs to be put in throughout the week to go play a game at the highest level possible," Gates said. "It just depends on how I feel leading up to Sunday." Even if he is active, it will be tough to trust Gates in a fantasy lineup this week.
report: Antonio Gates is "optimistic" he will play in the season opener.

impact: Pro Football Focus charted Gates as playing 33-of-82 snaps. His production was identical to Virgil Green's. Gates will be on the TE2 radar for Week 2 against a Bills defense that struggled to defend the middle of the field last season.
report: Antonio Gates caught 2-of-3 passes for 16 yards in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: He had just one target. Gates has been an afterthought in the Chargers' offense after two catches in the season opener. He's droppable in fantasy leagues.
report: Antonio Gates was held without a catch in Week 2 against Buffalo.

impact: Gates is feeling a little under the weather, but he should be fine for Sunday's showdown against the Rams. The 38-year-old has been a non-factor with just two catches for 16 yards through his first two games.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Gates played just 11-of-56 snaps in Week 2. It's fair to wonder if he makes it through the entire season on the Chargers' 53-man roster.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) remained sidelined Thursday.

impact: Travis Benjamin (foot) is also questionable for Sunday. Players rarely sit out because of an illness, so it would be surprising if Gates does not play. That said, he played only 11 snaps at full health in Week 2, so he'll make little impact for Los Angeles whether he's available or not. Virgil Green was notably in on 41-of-56 snaps.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) is questionable for Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: Gates missed practice time this week due to an illness but he's going to gut it out on Sunday. The veteran has played limited snaps this year and is unlikely to be a factor against the Rams' elite secondary. The 38-year-old no longer carries any fantasy significance.
report: Antonio Gates (questionable, illness) is expected to play Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: The Chargers inactive list confirms Adam Schefter's report that Gates is available to play against the Rams. The Chargers, however, will be without WR Travis Benjamin (foot), LB Emmanuel Ellerbee, C Cole Toner, RT Joe Barksdale, G Forrest Lamp, DT T.Y. McGill, and DE Joey Bosa, who is expected to miss multiple weeks.
report: Antonio Gates (illness) is officially active for Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: The five targets are a season-high for the veteran tight end. Gates' red zone ability could lead him to a few touchdowns this year, but the 38-year-old is off the fantasy radar with how little volume he has seen.
report: Antonio Gates caught 3-of-5 targets for 45 yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: That's back-to-back games with five targets, but he was able to score a touchdown this time around when he escaped to the corner of the end zone without a defender in sight. Gates is a touchdown-dependent TE2, but there should be a couple touchdown opportunities next week against the Raiders.
report: Antonio Gates caught 2-of-5 targets for 26 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Gates remains a touchdown-dependent streamer as he's posted just 7-90-1 in the Chargers' last three games. With his weekly snaps continuously getting eaten into by fellow tight end Virgil Green (1-13-1), Gates can stay on the wire until the utmost perfect matchup presents itself.
report: Antonio Gates caught both of his targets for 19 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 win over the Raiders.

impact: St. Brown made the start as the No. 3 wideout with Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison out.  He made a sliding 17-yard grab for his first NFL catch and had a late 54-yard pickup to pad the stats.  St. Brown will head back to the bench when Cobb and/or Allison come back, maybe as soon as Week 6.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown caught 3-of-5 targets for 89 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: He made the target count by making a critical sideline grab on the game-winning field goal drive at the end of the fourth quarter.  With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison expected back after the bye, ESB will go back to the bench.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown caught his lone target for 19 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: It's a surprise with the Packers coming off a bye. With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison likely to return this week, St. Brown isn't a lock to be active even if healthy.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He was limited in practice all week. With Geronimo Allison back and Randall Cobb (hamstring) questionable, St. Brown won't have a role even if he's active.
report: Equanimeous St. Brown (knee) is questionable for Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: Callaway replaces Josh Gordon opposite Jarvis Landry. The Browns surprisingly gave Rashard Higgins more snaps than Callaway in Week 1, but with Gordon gone, Callaway will take over in two-wide sets. Callaway has a tough matchup against Marshon Lattimore this week, but his season outlook is on the rise.
report: Antonio Callaway is starting Week 2 against the Saints.

impact: Starting for Josh Gordon, Callaway failed to draw a target in the first half Sunday, but made his presence felt in the second half when he had catches of 18, 47 and 16 yards. The highlight of his day was reeling in a 47-yard vertical shot on 4th down to tie the game late in the 4th quarter. Callaway will provide uneven production moving forward as a secondary option in the Cleveland passing game, but his season is trending upwards with the Browns moving on from Josh Gordon and should be looked at in deeper leagues. The Browns will host the Jets on Thursday Night in Week 3.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 3-of-4 targets for 81 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: It was a sharp turnaround from Week 1 when he played well behind Rashard Higgins. Higgins still saw three more targets than the rookie, but Callaway put his stamp on the game with a 47-yard touchdown to tie it late in the fourth quarter. As talented as they come and looking at a big role, Callaway needs to be rostered in all formats.
report: Antonio Callaway played 50-of-62 (81 percent) snaps Week 2 against the Saints.

impact: "We were not trying to push him too fast, not give him too much," Jackson said on Callaway’s role in the season opener. "Now, he has to take it all. It’s time." Callaway played 82 percent of Week 2 snaps. He led the Browns in receiving and was clocked at 21 MPH on his touchdown — the second fastest route run behind only Tyreek Hill this year. With target-hog Jarvis Landry (knee) questionable for Thursday night, Callaway needs to be rostered in all formats.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson confirmed Antonio Callaway has an every-down role.

impact: Callaway should have had a much bigger night, but Tyrod Taylor missed him on a gimme 75-yard touchdown in the first half. He also committed a few drops and quit on a route that might have resulted in a catch. It was a decidedly mixed effort from the Browns' new starting wideout, but his easy speed was on prominent display. With Baker Mayfield taking over at quarterback, Callaway could quickly push for WR3 status in fantasy leagues.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 4-of-10 targets for 20 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: It was an eventful day at the office for Callaway, who committed several drops and nearly lost a fumble on a fourth-quarter punt return, but Cleveland recovered.  Callaway nearly hit pay dirt on a 51-yard reception, only to be tackled down at the one-yard line before Carlos Hyde punched it in.  The good news is Callaway has commanded nine and ten targets in the last two games; the bad news is he has only 74 scoreless yards to show for it.  Callaway will remain an exciting-if-volatile WR4/flex option in Week 5 against the Ravens, who are getting back suspended top CB Jimmy Smith.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 3-of-9 targets for 54 yards in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: The case is not expected to be heard for several weeks. One of the charges is marijuana possession, which could have Callaway eventually looking at a league-mandated suspension. Callaway failed a drug test at the Combine.
report: Antonio Callaway has pled not guilty to two charges stemming from his August citation on traffic and marijuana charges.

impact: "Maybe not playing  as many  plays as he plays in a game will help him get to step back, take a look, take a blow come back and do it again," Jackson said. "I like him. Obviously, he needs to start faster in games." Callaway has been extraordinarily mistake prone thus far this season, catching just 10-of-24 targets and committing a host of blunders. His speed has been as advertised, but Callaway simply has not been polished. We would still expect him to play plenty of snaps, as the Browns need his big-play threat. Rod Streater or Damion Ratley would be two candidates to see more outside snaps if Callaway's are curtailed.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson said Antonio Callaway's playing time could be dialed back.

impact: It's the first time this season Callaway has been listed on the injury report.  He was off to the side riding a stationary bike on Wednesday.  The Browns have talked about dialing back his snaps potentially due to a number of miscues and drops.  We'll see if he's back on the field on Thursday.
report: Antonio Callaway (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Callaway was injured on what should have been a 59-yard touchdown last week. The Browns held him out of Wednesday's practice, but it sounds like that was on the precautionary side. There's been talk Callaway's snaps could be scaled back after struggling with drops, but it's hard to see him losing much playing time. We should get more clarity on Callaway's injury status Thursday.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson has a "great level of optimism" Antonio Callaway (knee) will play in Week 5 against the Ravens.

impact: He was officially "limited." Callaway was unable to practice on Wednesday, but coach Hue Jackson expressed confidence the rookie would suit up this week. This practice seems to back that up. Callaway will be an upside WR4/FLEX play against the Ravens.
report: Antonio Callaway (knee) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: Callaway had a rough Weeks 3 and 4 and may have his snaps dialed back due to his mistakes.  He can't be trusted as anything more than a WR4.
report: Antonio Callaway (knee) was removed from the Week 5 injury report and will play against the Ravens.

impact: After a dreadful performance a week ago, Callaway once again struggled on Sunday, dropping a crucial pass. Callaway entered the week dealing with a knee issue and the coaching staff mentioned dialing back his workload, which they did after he received nine and 11 targets over the two games prior. Callaway now has four or fewer receptions in every game this season and is still only a bench stash at this stage of the season. The Browns host the Chargers in Week 6.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 3-of-5 targets for 22 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Callaway once again struggled with missed opportunities as he lost a potential 45-yard touchdown in the sun in the first quarter and then had another straight drop on a potential long-gainer in the second half. He did secure a two-point conversion after the Browns' lone touchdown on the day. Callaway will continue to be force-fed targets as Cleveland has limited healthy bodies available at the wide receiver position, but he has caught just 8-of-24 targets over the past three weeks for 85 yards. Callaway will be an all-or-nothing option against a giving Tampa Bay defense in Week 7.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 2-of-10 targets for nine yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: The two targets were the fewest that Callaway has received in a game since Week 1. He now has three or fewer receptions in every game on the season but one. Callaway has now reeled in just 9-of-23 targets for 99 yards over Baker Mayfield's four starts. Callaway is not a fantasy option heading into Week 8 against the Steelers.
report: Antonio Callaway caught 1-of-2 targets for 14 yards in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: The sixth-round pick from Texas A&M was forced to step up into a large role in the Cleveland passing game with all of the injuries the Browns have sustained at the wide receiver position. His productive game came in game in which Jarvis Landry caught just two passes, so it should be taken with some degree of salt. That said, the Browns will still be without Rishard Higgins for a the short term and Antonio Callaway has proven to be an unreliable option. Ratley is only an option in the deepest of leagues, but the Browns face a terrible Tampa Bay defense on the road in Week 7 for those that must dig that deep.
report: Damion Ratley caught 6-of-8 targets for 82 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Willies was a late addition to the injury report after landing awkwardly on the shoulder on Friday.  An UDFA rookie out of Texas Tech, Willies was thrust into duty last week after Rashard Higgins left with a sprained MCL.  He played 26 snaps, catching 3-of-5 targets for 61 yards.  If Willies has to sit with Higgins already out, the Browns will be down to Rod Streater as their third wideout.
report: Browns WR Derrick Willies (shoulder) is questionable for Week 6 against the Chargers.

impact: Willies fractured his collarbone in Friday's practice. He's likely headed to injured reserve. The Browns are also down Rashard Higgins this week, locking Jarvis Landry and Antonio Callaway into a heavy target share.
report: Browns WR Derrick Willies (shoulder) is out for Week 6 against the Chargers.

impact: The team signed WR Breshad Perriman Saturday morning and were forced to make a corresponding move. With Willies out the picture and Rishard Higgins additionally out for Sunday, Cleveland will enter their matchup against the Chargers with Jarvis Landry, Rod Streater, Antonio Callaway, and Perriman as the primary receivers.
report: Browns placed WR Derrick Willies (shoulder) on injured reserve.

impact: Apparently Landry suffered a minor thigh injury against the Steelers, though it looks like he'll be fine for Week 2. Landry nabbed seven-of-15 targets in his Browns debut last week and should be a solid WR2 Sunday versus a New Orleans secondary that just yielded over 400 passing yards to Ryan Fitzpatrick.
report: Jarvis Landry (thigh) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the Saints.

impact: After 15 targets in Week 1, we expected Landry to come to close to that number once again with the Browns shelving Josh Gordon, but that was not the case on Sunday. He still managed five receptions, the 19th consecutive game in which he's had at least five or more catches, the longest streak in the league. Landry will remain a strong WR2 asset Week 3 against the Jets.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 5-of-7 targets for 69 yards in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: It's a new issue for Landry, but we're not overly concerned.  The Browns square off with the Jets on Thursday night this week.  Landry should be out there.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) was limited in Monday's practice.

impact: Landry was also limited on Monday. It seems like the Browns are just taking it easy on Landry in a short week. It would be a surprise if he is not ready to face the Jets on Thursday night.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) was limited during Tuesday's practice.

impact: Landry was limited all week on a short week ahead of Thursday night's tilt.  It's mildly concerning, but we'd expect Landry to be out there against Gang Green.  It's contagious!  If Landry were to sit, the Browns would be left with a rag-tag group of Antonio Callaway, Rashard Higgins, and then Duke Johnson.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is questionable for Week 3 against the Jets.

impact: Landry was limited all week in practice, but it always seemed like he was just getting some rest on a short week. Certain to get targets in a good matchup, Landry is a solid WR2.
report: ESPN's Dianna Russini reports Jarvis Landry (knee) is expected to play Thursday night against the Jets.

impact: Landry just needed some maintenance during the week. He will be his usual, highly-targeted WR2 self against the Jets. Inactive for the Browns are QB Drew Stanton, WR Rod Streater, LB Christian Kirksey, TE Seth DeValve, DL Emmanuel Ogbah, DL Ifeadi Odenigb and DL Devaroe Lawrence.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is active for Week 3 against the Jets.

impact: Landry committed a drop but was helping Baker Mayfield move the chains for the Browns' transformed offense after Tyrod Taylor (concussion) was forced from the game. Landry was the lone Brown getting his numbers while Taylor was under center, but his fantasy fortunes should improve with Mayfield taking over. Landry has a soft Week 4 matchup in the Raiders.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 8-of-15 targets for 103 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: Landry's ten targets led the team, but he was part of the problem in Cleveland's drop-pass fest and failed to get loose for any big plays.  Finishing with four catches snapped Landry's streak of catching five or more balls in 20 straight games.  Still, Landry has been targeted 18 times in roughly six quarters by Baker Mayfield, by far most on the team.  Keep rolling him out there in Week 5 against a Ravens defense struggling to slow slot receivers.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 4-of-10 targets for 34 yards and a touchdown in the Browns' Week 4 loss to Oakland.

impact: Landry was on the injury report with a knee issue in Week 3 and has played through it since then; we wouldn't expect any different this week.  Landry should be back on the practice filed Thursday and Friday at the latest.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: He was officially limited. It appears as if Wednesday was just a maintenance day for the Browns' No. 1 receiver. He should be fine to face the Ravens on Sunday.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: Antonio Callaway (knee) was also taken off the injury report.  Both are good to go for a tough home matchup against the Ravens.  Landry will be a borderline WR1/2 who obviously gets a bigger boost in PPR leagues.
report: Jarvis Landry (knee) is not listed on the final Week 5 injury report and will play against the Ravens.

impact: Landry was held in check by a Baltimore secondary. He had just one catch for 10 yards in the first half and needed receptions of 27 and 17 yards on the final three drives of the game to turn in a respectable line. Landry has had two 100-yard game surrounding three lackluster games, but is averaging a career-high 13.0 yards per catch with at double-digit targets in four of the first five games. He is strong WR2 in Week 6 against the Chargers.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 5-of-10 targets for 69 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Landry was stymied by the Chargers secondary all afternoon. His two receptions were the fewest he's had in a game since Week 14 of the 2015 season. Landry has struggled in the transition over to Baker Mayfield catching 11-of-29 targets for 114 yards over Mayfield's three starts. Despite those lowly numbers, Landry will be  in a spot to bounce back against a giving Tampa Bay secondary in Week 7.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 2-of-9 targets for 11 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: After just 11 catches for 114 yards over Baker Mayfield's first three starts, Landry had a season-high 10 catches on Sunday. Things started slowly as Landry had just four catches for 23 yards at the break, but then came on strong in the second half, securing 6-of-8 targets for 73 yards and a score. Landry found the end zone for the second time this season, a 16-yard score in which he made a diving catch and extended the ball over the goal line on his way to the ground to tie the game with 2:28 left in regulation. Landry has double-digit targets in every game this season and heads to Pittsburgh in Week 8 after already having a 100-yard game versus the Steelers in Week 1.
report: Jarvis Landry caught 10-of-15 targets for 97 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Valdes-Scantling was a preseason leader after some early training camp struggles. He's behind Geronimo Allison in three-wide sets, and with Trevor Davis returning kicks, there's not a ton of snaps for him. We like Valdes-Scantling as a sleeper to overtake Allison this year. The Packers may also continue to shop Randall Cobb leading up to the Week 8 trade deadline.
report: The Wisconsin State Journal doesn't expect Marquez Valdes-Scantling to have a Week 1 role.

impact: He's replacing Randall Cobb (hamstring) in three-wide sets. Cobb was playing 90 percent of snaps before going down, so Valdes-Scantling is going to get some serious run.  With Cobb potentially looking at a multi-game absence, Valdes-Scantling's dynasty stock is on the rise.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling will start in Week 4 against Buffalo.

impact: McCarthy said he has "great confidence" in the other rookie WRs J'Mon Moore and Equanimeous St. Brown, but Valdes-Scantling will "have a role" and was named by the coach.  It's been pretty clear through four weeks fifth-rounder Valdes-Scantling is ahead of the other two rookies.  MVS played 54-of-76 snaps last week as the starting slot man, catching a 38-yard pass on three targets.  He'll be in line for a bigger role if Cobb and Allison are unable to play.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy singled out rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling as the next man up at receiver should Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) sit Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: With Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) inactive, Valdes-Scantling and fellow rookie Equanimeous St. Brown got the starts next to Davante Adams. MVS scored a three-yard touchdown on the opening drive of the third quarter after the Packers were shut out in the first two frames, and he had a second touchdown called back as it was ruled he was down at the half-yard line. Lance Kendricks scored the next play.  Valdes-Scantling's 10 targets were third on the team behind Adams (12) and Jimmy Graham (11).  Allison will likely be back Week 6, but Cobb may have a multi-week injury.  Once both are back, MVS will be irrelevant in redraft leagues.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 7-of-10 targets for 68 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison out again, MVS made another start and was third on the team in targets behind Davante Adams (16) and Jimmy Graham (9).  Valdes-Scantling started the Packers' night off with a 60-yard catch-and-run as he was left wide open down the left side.  Ty Montgomery eventually scored three plays later.  With the Packers going on a bye, MVS is likely to head back to No. 3 or 4 duties with Allison and Cobb likely to return versus the Rams.
report: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught 3-of-6 targets for 103 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Hyde added three yards on one catch. He ran just nine times for 26 yards in the first half before having a positive drive in the 3rd quarter where he carried four times for 30 yards a touchdown. The Browns offensive line appears to be a real problem for generating consistent yardage, but Hyde handled 22-of-30 Cleveland rushing attempts to open the season. Hyde will be an RB2 option next week on the road versus the Saints.
report: Browns RB Carlos Hyde rushed 22 times for 62 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Steelers.

impact: Hyde added one catch for seven yards in the passing game. It was the second-consecutive game where Hyde struggled on the ground, but was bailed out by a 1-yard rushing score, this time following a pass interference in the end zone. Hyde has now rushed 38 times for 108 yards through two games. He will remain a fringe RB2 in Week 3 versus the Jets.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 16 times for 43 yards and touchdown in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: Aka, Hyde is going to have a police escort to the stadium. Hyde's significant other was reportedly induced last night, so it has been a long day for the Browns' feature back. As any new parent can attest, the adrenaline should be enough to get him through the game against the Jets. We are not adjusting his Week 3 rank.
report: NFL Network's Omar Ruiz reports Carlos Hyde is awaiting the birth of his child on Thursday evening but is expected to make it to FirstEnergy Stadium just before kickoff.

impact: He added two receptions for five yards. No joke: Hyde then had to rush to the hospital for the birth of his child. Best wishes to the Hyde family. As for the game, nearly all of Hyde's damage, including both his scores, came after Baker Mayfield checked in for Tyrod Taylor (concussion). The Browns' offense looked reborn with Mayfield under center, complicating the defense's thinking and freeing up running lanes. Hyde took advantage with his trademark power running. Hyde will be an upside RB2 for a tasty Week 4 matchup with the Raiders.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 23 times for 98 yards and two touchdowns in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: He has at least 17 touches in all four games and 22 or more in three of them.  Hyde's touchdown came from a yard out following Antonio Callaway's 51-yard catch.  Hyde drew just one target, however, and Nick Chubb broke off 63- and 41-yard touchdown sprints, potentially earning the explosive rookie more work.  Until the Browns make a tangible playing-time adjustment in the backfield, however, Hyde will remain a high-volume RB2 play.  Cleveland hosts Baltimore next.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 22 times for 82 yards and a touchdown in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: Hyde found little to no room against a strong Baltimore defense. He had a 17-yard run early in the game but was still held to 3.7 yards per rush on the day. Hyde has been living off of touchdown production early in the season, but still has amassed 17 or more touches in every game this season. That kind of usage is nothing to scoff at, making Hyde a volume-based RB2 in a better matchup Week 6 at home against the Chargers.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 17 times for 63 yards while catching 2-of-3 targets for 14 yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Hyde has now failed to score in back-to-back games and it has exposed the low floor he carries weekly. Hyde has rushed for 4.0 yards per carry in just once game this season and has rushed 31 times for 97 yards over the past two weeks. His biggest obstacle for maintaining a fantasy floor is he has just six catches on the season and was not even targeted in the passing game on Sunday. Hyde will enter Week 7 as a touchdown-dependent RB2 option in Week 7 on the road in Tampa Bay.
report: Carlos Hyde rushed 14 times for 34 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: And just like that, trade season has begun. With Leonard Fournette's recovery from a hamstring injury taking much longer than expected, the Jaguars decided they simply couldn't wait any longer. Once he learns the playbook, Hyde should fill a committee role alongside T.J. Yeldon, who has filled in throughout Fournette's absence. With Hyde out of the equation, second-round rookie Nick Chubb should immediately slot in as the Browns' lead ball-carrier, though Duke Johnson will continue to be involved on passing downs. Obviously Chubb needs to be picked up in all fantasy formats.
report: Jaguars acquired RB Carlos Hyde from the Browns in exchange for a fifth-round pick in 2019.

impact: Hyde has only two days to learn Jacksonville's playbook. His presence shouldn't impact T.J. Yeldon's role much this week even if he's active. With Leonard Fournette (hamstring) expected back after the Week 9 bye, the Jaguars are taking on a lot of salary with Hyde for what could be a one-game cameo as the team's featured back. Hyde is going to struggle for snaps when Fournette returns.
report: Carlos Hyde isn't expected to play in Week 7 against the Texans.

impact: It's been a whirlwind 48 hours for Hyde, who arrived in Jacksonville around midnight on Friday, passed his physical Saturday morning, then attended the team's walkthrough later that afternoon. Hyde reportedly got a "crash course" on the team's playbook, though obviously if he sees the field Sunday it won't be for more than a handful of snaps. T.J. Yeldon is still safe to fire up as a borderline RB1 in all formats.
report: According to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport, Carlos Hyde has a "chance" to make his Jaguars debut against the Texans in Week 7.

impact: Despite Sunday morning reports to the contrary, Hyde was never going to suit up two days after being traded from Cleveland.  T.J. Yeldon will remain the Jaguars' bellcow back against Houston.
report: Carlos Hyde is inactive for Week 7 against the Texans.

impact: Ingram is eligible to return from his four-game suspension today, and he did not want to waste any time. Alvin Kamara will continue to command a large workload, especially in the passing game, but Ingram returning is a concern for both his carry total and red-zone work. Even so, Kamara will remain a locked-in RB1 moving forward while Ingram could develop into a top-24 option.
report: NBC Sports' Peter King reports Mark Ingram met the Saints at the airport early Monday morning.

impact: "It'll be good for us offensively to have (Ingram) back," Payton said. Although not very expansive, they are Payton's first comments on the matter since Ingram's return. Kamara has been the No. 1 overall fantasy running back through the season's first four weeks. Ingram is going to cut into his workload but probably not to the degree he did in 2017. Ingram averaged 18 touches per game last season. He might start out more in the 10-14 range in 2018. He's best treated as a low-end RB2 for Week 5.
report: Speaking Tuesday, Saints coach Sean Payton said "we'll figure out the balance" between Alvin Kamara and a returning Mark Ingram.

impact: Making his 2018 debut after serving a four-game suspension to open the season, Ingram got the start and out-touched Alvin Kamara 18-9, adding two catches for 20 yards on three targets.  It was evident right from the get-go that coach Sean Payton wanted to get Ingram involved and keep him involved after sitting out the first four weeks.  It was also an opportunity for Kamara to get some extra rest heading into the bye.  Moving forward, we expect Kamara to be used much more than he was tonight, but there's obviously some serious concern here with all the weapons and mouths in the New Orleans offense.  Kamara is unlikely to match his 22.75 touches per game mark from Weeks 1-4.  He's going to need big plays to maintain elite RB1 status while Ingram is very much a mid-to-high RB2 the rest of the way.  The Saints get the Ravens on the road in Week 7.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 16 times for 53 yards and two touchdowns in the Saints' 43-19, Week 5 rout of the Redskins on Monday night.

impact: Ingram out-touched Kamara 18-9 in his Week 5 debut, but Kamara had a 19-14 upper hand in Baltimore. Ingram received carries from the Ravens' six- and five-yard line but could not cash either in. Kamara found the end zone from two yards out in the fourth quarter. This is more how we were expecting the Saints' backfield to look following Ingram's return but nothing is settled after only two games. Ingram will be a touchdown-dependent RB2 for Week 8 against the Vikings.
report: Mark Ingram rushed 12 times for 32 scoreless yards in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens, adding two catches for 10 additional yards.

impact: Geronimo Allison (concussion) was also DNP on Wednesday.  Cobb said earlier this week that he wasn't close to playing Week 4 after pulling his hamstring last Thursday.  He's extremely doubtful to face the Lions this week.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Cobb is extremely unlikely to suit up this week, which is a big concern for a Packers offense which could also be without Davante Adams (calf) and Geronimo Allison (concussion). Marquez Valdes-Scantling needs to be added everywhere.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) will not practice Thursday.

impact: Coach Mike McCarthy said Davante Adams (calf) will practice Saturday, and there's still "hope" for Geronimo Allison (concussion) to get cleared.  Cobb was never expected to play after pulling his hammy last Thursday.  The Packers' wideout situation is one of the top storylines heading into the weekend.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is out for Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: Cobb was not close to playing last week, and he has started this one off on the wrong foot. With the bye in Week 7, the Packers may decide to play it safe with their No. 2 receiver. Geronimo Allison (hamstring) is also a question mark for Monday night, meaning Marquez Valdes-Scantling could once again find himself in a big role.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) will not practice Thursday.

impact: He was limited. Geronimo Allison (concussion) was also present for team drills at Thursday's session. The Packers don't play until Monday night this week, which gives Cobb an extra day of recovery time. If Cobb and Allison are given the green light against San Francisco, Marquez Valdes-Scantling would see his workload scaled back significantly.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) returned to practice on Thursday.

impact: Cobb was officially limited on Thursday and will likely draw the same designation Friday.  He's inching closer to a return but is truly up in the air at the moment.  We should know more about Cobb after Saturday's practice.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) will work with the rehab group again at Friday's practice.

impact: McCarthy is reportedly "leaving the door open" for both to play, but it's not a certainty either will be ready by Monday night. If both are out, rookies Marquez Valdes-Scantling (7/68/1 Sunday) and Equanimeous St. Brown (3/89) will again be thrusted into full-time roles, with MVS entering the conversation as a strong WR3. If just Allison is out, it's possible St. Brown is used more given Valdes-Scantling's recent 67% slot rate the past two weeks (which Cobb would return and shore up on his own). Either way, both need be monitored prior to inactives being pushed out Monday night.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy said he'll give WRs Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (hamstring) "right up until Monday's pre-game workouts" before declaring their statuses.

impact: Geronimo Allison (hamstring) is also questionable. Coach Mike McCarthy called both receivers game-time decisions. Green Bay has a Week 7 bye, so it's possible the Packers will go on the conservative side and hold them out. Marquez Valdes-Scantling would make another start if one of Cobb or Allison sits.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is questionable for Monday night's Week 6 game against the 49ers.

impact: With Geronimo Allison also expected to sit, it means Marquez Valdes-Scantling, Equanimeous St. Brown and J'Mon Moore will once again back up Davante Adams. This will be Cobb's third-straight absence. He was playing poorly before going down. The Pack are on bye for Week 7. We would assume Cobb will finally be ready to return against the Rams in Week 8.
report: ESPN's Lisa Salters reports Randall Cobb (hamstring) is expected to be inactive for Monday's game against the 49ers.

impact: The Packers are really banged up.  All three of Allison, Cobb, and Breeland have hamstring injuries, while No. 1 CB Alexander remains out with a groin issue.
report: Packers declared WR Randall Cobb, WR Geronimo Allison, CB Jaire Alexander, CB Bashaud Breeland, QB Tim Boyle, OG Alex Light, and OT Jason Spriggs inactive Week 6 against the 49ers.

impact: Cobb was a game-time decision before the bye, so it is not a surprise he is ready to go following a week off. Barring a setback, Cobb should be ready to face the Rams on Sunday.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy said Randall Cobb (hamstring) will practice Tuesday.

impact: The return to practice puts Cobb on track to play after getting the bye week to rest up. The Packers could also get Geronimo Allison (hamstring) back for Sunday's game with the Rams.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He said the same of Geronimo Allison after watching the pair practice on Wednesday. With both Cobb and Allison expected back, Aaron Rodgers will have a healthy receiving corps for the first time since Week 3.
report: Packers coach Mike McCarthy believes Randall Cobb (hamstring) will play Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: Despite the limited tags, Cobb's back-to-back practices have him on track to finally return. Having a mixed season before going down, Cobb will be a risk/reward WR4 for a likely shootout with the Rams.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Even coming out of the team's bye, Cobb remains questionable to suit up Sunday. Geronimo Allison (hamstring), on the other hand, was removed from the injury report and will play against the Rams. Rookie Marquez Valdes-Scantling will continue manning the slot if Cobb is ruled out. Slated with the highest total of the weekend, Sunday's matchup in Los Angeles makes for an eruption spot for all of Green Bay's wideouts given the Rams' recent secondary struggles.
report: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is questionable for Week 8 against the Rams.

impact: It was not a good performance from Bortles, who struggled to move the ball without Leonard Fournette. Jacksonville had three long scoring drives in the first half including a touchdown drive after Fournette exited, but their longest play of the second half lasted just six plays. They punted seven times after the break. With Fournette looking questionable, Bortles will have to show more next week against the Patriots.
report: Blake Bortles completed 18-of-33 passes for 176 yards, a touchdown, and an interception in the Jaguars' Week 1 win over the Giants.

impact: The 377 yards passing were the third most of Bortles' career. Aside from a second half pick on a questionable but not egregious decision, Bortles was as poised as he's ever been. He "took what the defense was giving him," alternating some big throws down the field with lots of checkdowns to his playmakers. Dede Westbrook turned one such play into a 61-yard touchdown, while RB Corey Grant was eating up yards on short targets. Bortles did not take a single sack. He will look to stay hot against the Titans' soft defense in Week 3.
report: Blake Bortles completed 29-of-45 passes for 377 yards, four touchdowns and an interception in the Jaguars' 31-20, Week 2 win over the Patriots, adding five rushes for 25 additional yards.

impact: After shredding New England for 377 yards and four touchdowns in last week's win, Bortles got nothing going beyond checkdowns in Sunday's ugly 9-6 home-game loss.  Tennessee got to Bortles three times for sacks, but his throws to the outside were too often off the mark, and the Leonard Fournette-less running game was nearly nonexistent.  Fournette figures to return from his hamstring injury for Week 4 versus the Jets.  Bortles will continue to be a high-variance QB2.
report: Blake Bortles went 20-of-33 passing for 158 yards and rushed five times for 27 yards in the Jaguars' Week 3 loss to the Titans.

impact: Bortles was sharp in this one, completing 15 of his first 16 passes. He put good touch on a 67-yard touchdown to Donte Moncrief, with his other TD a screen to T.J. Yeldon. Bortles has started to heat up with 300-plus yards and multiple touchdowns in two of his last three weeks. He has a streamable Week 5 matchup with the Chiefs.
report: Blake Bortles completed 29-of-38 passes for 388 yards with two touchdowns and an interception in Week 4 against the Jets.

impact: Bortles had a first half to forget. Despite some good throws down the field including a 36-yard pass to D.J. Chark, the early part of his game was marred by turnovers. He lost a fumble the play after the defense picked off Patrick Mahomes, had a horrific pick-six on an attempted screen pass the next drive, and threw an end-zone interception off his lineman's helmet. He made several great throws on a touchdown drive in the third quarter, but he came back with a bad interception overthrown to a double-covered tight end on the next drive. He added another meaningless interception at the end of the game. On the bright side, he threw for 430 yards and added a long rushing score deep in garbage time to pad his fantasy stats. Always a threat for a big game when Leonard Fournette is sidelined, Bortles will be on the streaming map next week in Dallas.
report: Blake Bortles completed 33-of-61 passes for 430 yards, a touchdown, and four interceptions in the Jaguars' Week 5 loss to the Chiefs, adding four carries for 34 yards and a touchdown.

impact: He took three sacks for a loss of 10 yards. Bortles threw for just 35 yards in the first half, which may explain why the Jags went into halftime with a 24-point deficit. Even with the benefit of garbage time, Bortles never got anything going, struggling all day against an underrated Cowboys defense. His lone touchdown came on a 34-yard bomb to Dede Westbrook early in the third quarter. Bortles has thrown five interceptions over his last two outings with both resulting in losses. He'll try to do better next time out against Houston.
report: Blake Bortles completed 15-of-26 passes for 149 yards with one touchdown and one interception while adding 22 yards on four carries Sunday in the Jaguars’ Week 6 loss to Dallas.

impact: The Jaguars made a splash by acquiring Carlos Hyde from Cleveland on Friday but it doesn't sound like they're interested in bringing in a quarterback to compete with Blake Bortles. Nick Foles, Eli Manning and Tyrod Taylor have all been linked to Jacksonville at different points in time, though the Jaguars have yet to pursue any of those options. Bortles has fallen on hard times recently, throwing five interceptions with  just two touchdowns over his last two outings.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports the Jaguars have no plans to acquire a quarterback at next week's trade deadline.

impact: Bortles failed to move the ball at all, completing just 6-of-12 passes for 61 yards with two lost fumbles that directly led to Texans touchdowns.  Put simply, it was time.  Bortles has been as erratic as ever this season, showing no signs of progression, taking too many sacks, and turning the ball over far too often.  Kessler is a weak-armed game manager, but he is a better option under center for the Jaguars at this point.
report: Losing 20-0, the Jaguars benched Blake Bortles for Cody Kessler in the second half of Sunday's Week 7 game against the Texans.

impact: This should mean the Jags are making the switch to Cody Kessler, as you do not draw out the process if you're sticking with the usual starter. It's certainly time. The Blake Bortles era has run its course. Bortles has been worse than ever this year, giving the Jags little shot on offense.
report: Jaguars coach Doug Marrone said he has decided on his Week 8 quarterback but is not ready to make a public announcement.

impact: The Jags benched Bortles early in the third quarter of Sunday's loss to Houston after he lost two fumbles and failed to move the offense.  Cody Kessler didn't separate himself, however, leading just one second-half touchdown drive and averaging 5.2 yards per attempt.  The Jags face the Eagles this week in London.  Bortles will remain at risk of performance-related, in-game benchings.
report: Coach Doug Marrone announced Monday the Jaguars will turn back to Blake Bortles as their starting quarterback.

impact: With Jay Ajayi (back) also sidelined, the stars align for Corey Clement to be featured Sunday against the Colts. The Eagles signed rookie Josh Adams from their practice squad to mix-in with Wendell Smallwood in a backup role. Clement is currently ranked as Roto Pat's No. 18 running back in Week 3.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: This will be his second straight absence. The Eagles' backfield will be at much less than full strength this week with Sproles and Jay Ajayi (back) both sidelined. Look for second-year back Corey Clement to see as much work as he can handle against the Colts.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is out for Week 3 against the Colts.

impact: The coach originally said he expected Sproles and Jay Ajayi (back) to return this week, but he clarified he just meant practice. Even so, any practice time would be a good sign for Sproles' availability for Week 4.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson expects Darren Sproles (hamstring) to return to practice this week.

impact: The Eagles also listed Jay Ajayi as not practicing. Both have a chance at returning this week, but Thursday will be a better indicator of their status.  Corey Clement would start if neither can make if back.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Unless Sproles can get in a limited session on Friday, he'll be ruled for a third consecutive week. Injuries have been an issue for the Eagles this year, though at least it looks like Jay Ajayi (back) will be back Sunday after sitting out last week's game with a back issue.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) remained sidelined at Thursday's practice.

impact: Pederson says Sproles "just isn't ready."  He'll now have missed two games in a row.  The Eagles will roll with Jay Ajayi, Corey Clement, and Wendell Smallwood against Tennessee.  It'll likely be some sort of rotational committee.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Darren Sproles (hamstring) is out for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Coach Doug Pederson continues to label Sproles day to day.  He hasn't played in three weeks.  The Eagles have been going with Wendell Smallwood as the complement to Jay Ajayi with Sproles and Corey Clement (quad) out.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: This will be his fourth straight absence. Sproles still isn't practicing and doesn't appear close to a return. With Corey Clement's status also in question for Sunday's game, Wendell Smallwood could see more snaps this week behind starter Jay Ajayi.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is out for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Sproles has missed the last four games and looks unlikely to play Thursday night against the Giants on a short week.  He should be closing in on a return.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) did not practice Monday.

impact: He also was listed as a "DNP" for Monday's session. It does not appear as if Sproles will return this week.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) did not practice Tuesday.

impact: The short week was too much for Sproles to overcome.  Perhaps he'll be ready to go in Week 7 off a mini-bye.  Sproles is worth an add where he's available, as he figures to have a role if the Eagles don't trade for a back.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is out for Week 6 against the Giants.

impact: Coach Doug Pederson says Sproles remains day to day.  His return will deal a blow to both Wendell Smallwood and Corey Clement's fantasy outlooks.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It'll be another week of Corey Clement and Wendell Smallwood. Sproles has yet to practice since going down in the season opener. There's no timetable for his return.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) has been ruled out for Week 7.

impact: Sproles has been out for well over a month.  He should be getting close, but Sproles has still yet to practice in weeks.  With Wendell Smallwood also having an injury, it could be Corey Clement and Josh Adams against the Jaguars.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He won't be making the trip to London. Sproles hasn't played or practiced since injuring his hamstring in the season opener. In the absence of Sproles, the Eagles will continue to employ a backfield committee featuring Corey Clement and Wendell Smallwood.
report: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is out for Week 8 against the Jaguars.

impact: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Fournette seems likely to miss "at least" two games after he sat out Weeks 2 and 3 with his initial pull. The Jags appear to — correctly — believe they brought back Fournette too soon. Fournette will miss Week 5 against the high-flying Chiefs before the Jags get the ground-and-pound Cowboys in Week 6. Next up are the Texans and Eagles. T.J. Yeldon will lead a committee in Fournette's place with Corey Grant changing the pace. Yeldon has usually been an RB2 during Fournette's previous absences.
report: Jaguars coach Doug Marrone is uncertain when Leonard Fournette (hamstring) will be ready to return.

impact: As expected.  Fournette is looking at a likely multi-week re-injury.  T.J. Yeldon is battling a bit of an ankle issue but will be a strong RB2 this week at K.C.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: As expected.  Fournette is week to week with his latest hamstring pull and seems very likely to miss multiple games.  T.J. Yeldon and Corey Grant will continue to fill the void, while Blake Bortles will be tasked with more responsibility to move the offense.  They get the Chiefs on a short week after an emotional come-from-behind divisional win.  Bortles has some sneaky Week 5 upside.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is out for Week 5 against the Chiefs.

impact: Per Rapsheet, Fournette's injured hamstring is back where it was "a couple weeks ago." The Jaguars didn't even wait until Friday to rule Fournette out for Sunday's game in Kansas City and at this point, it wouldn't be a surprise if he missed next week's game as well. The 23-year-old shed weight this offseason in hopes of improving his durability, but obviously it's had little effect. T.J. Yeldon will continue to fill in for the injury-prone power back.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Leonard Fournette (hamstring) could miss Week 6 against the Cowboys.

impact: Fournette was ruled out early this week, and he reportedly could miss Week 6 as well. T.J. Yeldon should handle most of the work as long as Fournette is sidelined, but Corey Grant will get some run as well. Jacksonville also declared CB D.J. Hayden (toe), CB Tre Herndon, DT Eli Ankou, OL Chris Reed, OL Will Richardson, and DE Dawuane Smoot inactive.
report: Jacksonville declared Leonard Fournette (hamstring) inactive for Week 5 against the Chiefs.

impact: This was the belief all along after Fournette re-injured his hamstring in Week 4. With Corey Grant (foot) on injured reserve, Brandon Wilds seems likely to back up T.J. Yeldon. Yeldon is a locked-in, high-end RB2. Fournette should be considered questionable at best to return for Week 7 against the Texans.
report: NFL.com's Ian Rapoport reports Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is expected to remain sidelined for Week 6 against the Cowboys.

impact: Coach Doug Marrone made the announcement before Wednesday's practice.  Fournette has been unable to finish both games he's appeared in this season and hasn't played since Week 4.  He has 20 carries for 71 scoreless yards.  T.J. Yeldon will remain the workhorse for however long Fournette is out.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is out for Week 6 against the Cowboys.

impact: Fournette has been ruled out very early in the week the past two weeks and hasn't practiced at all since re-injuring his hamstring in Week 4.
