Jacksonville is in Dallas this week, which Fournette has already been ruled out for, and then hosts the Texans in Week 7 before going to London for a date with the Eagles in Week 8.  The Jaguars then have their bye.  It may make the most sense to let Fournette rest through the open date and have him for the stretch run.
report: Florida Football Insiders reports a "source having knowledge of the Jaguars' thinking" expects the team to sit Leonard Fournette (hamstring) through the Week 9 bye.

impact: Coach Doug Marrone said Fournette has a "chance" to play Week 7 against the Texans.  Fournette is already out for this week in Dallas.  A report surfaced earlier in the week that Jacksonville could hold Fournette out through the Week 9 bye, so playing Week 7 or 8 would be viewed as a great sign.
report: Loenard Fournette (hamstring) ran on a side field at Friday's practice.

impact: Fournette is still nursing a hamstring injury, though reports suggest he could return as soon as next week. With Corey Grant (foot) also hurt, T.J. Yeldon will carry the load Sunday at Jerry's World. DE Calais Campbell (ankle), DT Malik Jackson (back), C Brandon Linder (knee), DE Yannick Ngakoue (shoulder), OG Andrew Norwell (foot), OT Jermey Parnell (knee) and CB Jalen Ramsey (knee) are all active for Jacksonville.
report: Jaguars declared RB Leonard Fournette, DT Eli Ankou, OT Ereck Flowers, CB D.J. Hayden, CB Tre Herndon, OL Chris Reed and DE Dawuane Smoot inactive for Week 6 against the Cowboys.

impact: It's progress, however.  The past two weeks, Fournette has been ruled out very early in the week before we even get to Wednesday.  Fournette was on a side field last Friday when coach Doug Marrone said he had a "chance" to play Week 7 against Houston.  We ultimately consider him doubtful.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Fournette also sat out Wednesday. Two missed practices to start the week all but ensures Fournette will miss another game. The Jaguars head to London in Week 8 before going on bye in Week 9. It is possible Fournette is out through the off week.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) will not practice Thursday.

impact: Fournette has been getting some side work in at practice but he's still not close to returning. T.J. Yeldon will draw another start Sunday against Houston. The Jaguars play the Eagles in London next week before going on bye.
report: Leonard Fournette (hamstring) is out for Week 7 against the Texans.

impact: There was speculation Fournette may be headed to IR after Jacksonville traded for Carlos Hyde. The Jaguars view Hyde as insurance in case Fournette suffers another setback, but this doesn't change his timetable. Fournette looks on track for a Week 10 return.
report: ESPN Radio's Hays Carlyon expects Leonard Fournette (hamstring) to return after Jacksonville's Week 9 bye.

impact: Fournette's return date is still up in the air, though we know for sure that he won't be available Sunday when the Jags host Houston or next week when Jacksonville travels to London for a game against the Eagles. After that, the Jaguars will have a bye in Week 9. Jacksonville's recent trade for Carlos Hyde is an ominous sign for Fournette's recovery, though there's still optimism he'll be back at some point this season. The 2017 first-rounder hasn't played a full game yet this year.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirms Leonard Fournette (hamstring) will sit out through the Jaguars' bye week.

impact: Adams played through his shoulder injury in Sunday night's win. He was limited in practice the last two days, but we're not expecting him to sit out. Matched up with Xavier Rhodes at less than 100 percent, Adams could be looking at a down week.
report: Davante Adams (shoulder) is listed as questionable for Week 2 against the Vikings.

impact: He and teammate Aaron Rodgers (knee) will both be available for Sunday's divisional tilt at Lambeau. Adams shined with five catches for 88 yards and a touchdown in last week's opener but gets a much tougher draw this week going against Vikings All-Pro corner Xavier Rhodes. RotoPat has Adams as his No. 14 wide receiver for Week 2.
report: Davante Adams (questionable, shoulder) is expected to play Week 2 against the Vikings.

impact: He was always expected to play. The problem is he is less than 100 percent, Aaron Rodgers seems at risk for an in-game setback, and Xavier Rhodes is likely to shadow him most of the day. Adams needs to be downgraded a bit. Green Bay declared S Josh Jones (ankle), LB Oren Burks (shoulder), WR Equanimeous St. Brown, WR J'Mon Moore, S Raven Greene, CB Deante Burton, and OL Alex Light inactive for Week 2.
report: Davante Adams (shoulder) is active for Week 2 against the Vikings.

impact: Despite shadow coverage from Xavier Rhodes, Adams was able to consistently get open on Sunday. His touchdown came on a quick out in which he was able to cut back and beat a couple defenders to the goal line. Unfortunately, he dropped one of his targets, had a long catch called back on a spurious offensive pass interference call, and had a touchdown knocked out of his hands, but he still put together a solid fantasy day in one of his toughest matchups of the season. Assuming Aaron Rodgers’ knee continues to cooperate, Adams will be a solid WR1 next week in Washington.
report: Davante Adams hauled in 8-of-12 targets for 64 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 2 tie with the Vikings.

impact: Adams also drew a 21-yard DPI. Adams has yet to have a 90-yard game this season — he's averaging 68 — but has scored all three times out. He's the preferred red zone weapon for the best quarterback in football. Adams will have a good shot at making it 4-of-4 on TDs in Week 4 against the Bills.
report: Davante Adams caught 7-of-9 targets for 52 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins.

impact: Adams was dealing with Tre'Davious White but aside from not finding the end zone, he had his typical game. With 25 percent of the season in the books, Adams is on pace for 112/1,140/12. That's certainly within his range of outcomes. Adams will remain a back-end WR1 for Week 5 against the Lions.
report: Davante Adams caught 8-of-14 targets for 81 yards in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills.

impact: It's a new injury for Adams. The Packers like to rest their veterans early in the week, so this doesn't look serious. Adams is a locked-in WR1 for Week 5 against the Lions.
report: Davante Adams (calf) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Mid-week injuries are always a concern, and they are even more worrying when followed by a missed practice. It is possible Adams returns Friday and is ready to face the Lions this weekend, but he has to be considered questionable at best. It is not the news the Packers need with Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) looking unlikely to play. Green Bay's rookie trio of Marquez Valdes-Scantling, J'Mon Moore, and Equanimeous St. Brown could be forced into action this week.
report: Davante Adams will not practice Thursday because of a calf injury he suffered during Wednesday's session.

impact: Randall Cobb (hamstring) is out, and coach Mike McCarthy said there is "hope" Geronimo Allison (concussion) can play.  Adams seems the most likely to play of the three, but it's still entirely possible none of the three vets play against Detroit.  It's a situation to monitor into the weekend.
report: Davante Adams (calf) will practice on Saturday.

impact: Adams got in a limited practice Friday and is expected to practice Saturday. He looks likely to play after some early-week concern over his status. With Randall Cobb (hamstring) out and Geronimo Allison (questionable, concussion) still not cleared, Marquez Valdes-Scantling is the next man up opposite Adams.
report: Davante Adams (calf) is questionable for Week 5 against Detroit.

impact: No surprise here.  Adams suffered a minor calf pull in practice this week, but he will be out there against Darius Slay.  Adams is coming off back-to-back eight-catch games against Xavier Rhodes and Tre'Davious White.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter confirmed Saturday night that Davante Adams (calf, questionable) is expected to play in Week 5.

impact: As expected.  Geronimo Allison (concussion) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) are both out, so it'll be Adams, Marquez Valdes-Scantling, and a combo of fellow rookies J'Mon Moore and Equanimeous St. Brown filling the void.  Adams, despite the balky calf, is a locked-in WR1 as a big-time target hog.
report: Davante Adams (calf) is active for Week 5 against the Lions.

impact: What calf injury?  Adams was a late addition to the injury report during the week but looked no worse for the wear as he chewed up chunk gains all day against Darius Slay and others.  The 12 targets led the team on a day Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison were out and injured.  Adams seemed to be the only target Aaron Rodgers could trust fully on a day he attempted 52 passes.  Adams should work over Richard Sherman and the Niners next Monday night.
report: Davante Adams caught 9-of-12 targets for 140 yards and one touchdown in the Packers' 31-23, Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: Adams made a quick recovery. He will be a high-end WR1 for a gorgeous matchup with the 49ers.
report: Davante Adams (calf) is absent from the Week 6 injury report.

impact: Adams has been on a tear the past couple weeks with Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison sidelined with injuries.  In the two games, Adams has reeled in 19-of-28 targets for 272 yards and three touchdowns against the Lions and Niners.  Things didn't really pop off for him until the second half when Adams scored a 16-yard touchdown to tie the game at 30-30 with 1:55 left.  He then made multiple catches on the final drive to get the Packers into field goal range for the win.  This all came after he caught a nine-yard TD in the first quarter.  Cobb and Allison should be back after the Week 7 bye, but Adams will remain an obvious WR1 the rest of the way.
report: Davante Adams caught 10-of-16 targets for 132 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' come-from-behind 33-30, Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Pederson said Sproles' recovery might take a "little longer," but it doesn't sound like Ajay has yet to be considered out or even a long shot for Week 3.  We'll continue to keep a close eye on this situation the rest of the week.  The Eagles promoted UDFA rookie Josh Adams from the practice squad.
report: Coach Doug Pederson labeled both Jay Ajayi (back) and Darren Sproles (hamstring) as day to day.

impact: Neither did Darren Sproles (hamstring), leaving Corey Clement, Wendell Smallwood, and Josh Adams as the team's healthy running backs.  Coach Doug Pederson labeled Ajayi as day to day in his media session Wednesday.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: Ajayi will probably have to get in at least a limited practice Friday in order to suit up Sunday against Indianapolis. With Ajayi (back) and Darren Sproles (hamstring) looking questionable at best for Week 3, Corey Clement needs to be picked up in all formats.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) remained sidelined at Thursday's practice.

impact: Ajayi hasn't practiced all week. He'll likely have to be a limited participant Friday to have even a chance to suit up against the Colts in Week 3. With Ajayi and Darren Sproles (hamstring) looking highly doubtful to play, Corey Clement needs to be picked up across all formats.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) is still day to day.

impact: Ajayi has been sidelined throughout the week, making it highly doubtful he plays Sunday against the Colts. The Eagles signed rookie Josh Adams from their practice squad, but Corey Clement should receive a bulk of the work with Wendell Smallwood mixing-in as backup. Clement is Roto Pat's No. 18 running back.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) remained sidelined at Friday's practice.

impact: This was the expected outcome after Ajayi was unable to practice this week. With Darren Sproles (hamstring) also out, the Eagles will turn to Corey Clement as their workhorse. Clement is a plug-and-play RB2 in all formats.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) is out for Week 3 against the Colts.

impact: Pederson originally said he expected Ajayi to play this week, but he clarified he was actually talking about practice. Even so, Ajayi will almost certainly return to the field if he is able to get in even a limited practice on Wednesday.
report: Eagles coach Doug Pederson expects Jay Ajayi (back) to return to practice this week.

impact: Ajayi has been shut down since picking up his back injury in Week 2. Coach Doug Pederson expects Ajayi to practice this week, but he's not off to a good start. Darren Sproles (hamstring) was also held out Wednesday.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: That doesn't necessarily mean Ajayi will officially be labeled a participant, but it is a step in the right direction. Ajayi's practice usage hasn't always been instructive as to his Sunday status. "Game-time decision" would be an unsurprising designation for Sunday's 1PM ET tilt with the Titans.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) was spotted in uniform and stretching at the beginning of Eagles practice on Thursday.

impact: He seems to be over the back injury that kept him out last week against the Colts. Corey Clement will revert to backup status with Ajayi likely to return Sunday at Tennessee.
report: Jay Ajayi (back) was a full participant at Thursday's practice.

impact: The injury hampered him in Week 2 and led to his absence last week against the Colts. Despite this, Ajayi returned to full practice on Thursday and expects to suit up for Week 4. Ajayi said playing with his ailing back will come down to "pain tolerance." None of it sounds promising and Ajayi will certainly be at risk of re-injury when he takes the field Sunday at Tennessee. With that in mind, he'll be difficult to employ as anything more than a back-end RB2 this week.
report: Jay Ajayi said he's been dealing with a back fracture.

impact: The Eagles removed him from the injury report on Friday. Ajayi is coming back from a back fracture suffered early in Week 2.  He missed roughly 1.5 games with the injury but is ready to roll.  However, it's tough to gauge how much Ajayi is going to be able to handle.  There's still pain there, and the Eagles have Wendell Smallwood coming off a strong game as insurance.  Perhaps they scale back Ajayi's snaps, making him a risky RB2.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Jay Ajayi (back) is "good to go" for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Ajayi did not show any ill effects from his back injury in this one, running hard and consistently creating yards after contact. He did briefly leave the game with trainers in the fourth quarter, but he was back on the field after a couple plays. His health will remain a concern, but Ajayi will be an RB2 as long as he is healthy.
report: Jay Ajayi rushed 15 times for 70 yards and hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 11 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Ajayi also lost a goal line fumble early in the third quarter as the Eagles were trying to get back into a 17-3 affair. To top it all off, he was announced as questionable with a knee injury, though he did remain in the game. Wendell Smallwood out-gained Ajayi 71-34 on the afternoon. Yet to see truly elite usage or eclipse 81 yards from scrimmage, Ajayi is settling in as a low-end RB2. His health will be worth monitoring for Week 6, as the Eagles are playing in the Thursday night game.
report: Jay Ajayi rushed eight times for 29 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings, adding a five-yard reception.

impact: The injury came almost entirely out of thin air; Ajayi missed a few snaps with a knee injury on Sunday but returned to the game.  It's possible he played on a torn ACL in the second half.  The Eagles' backfield is all sorts of banged up; Corey Clement has missed two weeks with a quad strain, and Darren Sproles has been out with a hamstring injury.  It's possible Wendell Smallwood will have to carry the bulk of the load in Thursday night's game against the Giants.  UDFA Josh Adams is the Eagles' only healthy alternative.
report: Eagles placed RB Jay Ajayi on injured reserve with a torn ACL, ending his season.

impact: Adams had a good preseason, but he just missed out on making the initial 53-man roster. His signing could mean concern for Jay Ajayi, who missed most of the first half on Sunday because of a back injury, although he was able to return in the second half. It also could mean other teams were sniffing around and the Eagles did not want to lose Adams.
report: Eagles signed RB Josh Adams off their practice squad.

impact: Smallwood's usage increased because Jay Ajayi missed almost the entire first half and Darren Sproles (hamstring) was out.  Unfortunately, Smallwood lost a fumble and Ajayi returned.  Smallwood shouldn't have a Week 3 role versus the Colts.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed seven times for 28 yards and caught his lone target for a gain of two in the Eagles' Week 2 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Smallwood drew the start and out-gained Corey Clement despite receiving just 13 touches. His 4-yard touchdown rush with 3:02 left in the 4th quarter put the Eagles up for good. If both Jay Ajayi and Darren Sproles remained sidelined in Week 4, Smallwood will be in the mix as a FLEX option next week against the Titans.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed 10 times for 56 yards and a touchdown while catching 3-of-5 targets for 35 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Colts.

impact: With both Corey Clement and Darren Sproles sidelined, Smallwood served as the No. 2 back behind Jay Ajayi. It was not always pretty -- he missed a blitz pickup in the two-minute drill -- but he was able to provide a couple nice runs. With Clement's and Sproles' availability up in the air, Smallwood is worth a look in deeper leagues.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed five times for 39 yards and hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 15 yards in the Eagles' Week 4 loss to the Titans.

impact: Corey Clement (quad) was announced as active but ended up playing zero snaps. Smallwood drew Jay Ajayi to a playing time standstill and out-gained him 71-34. He did have a first half lowlight with a red zone drop. Smallwood has shown signs of life the past three weeks but is still an uninspiring FLEX option in PPR leagues. He's a bye week "if you must" play.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed three times for 27 yards in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings, adding three catches for 44 additional yards and a touchdown.

impact: NJ.com's Mike Kaye expects the same thing but for it to "favor" Clement due to his "red-zone upside and receiving ability."  Both backs have been good when given their chances this season, but we tend to also lean in preferring Clement to Smallwood.  Both players need to be added in all formats.
report: The Philadelphia Inquirer's Zach Berman expects a Wendell Smallwood-Corey Clement "mix" Week 6 against the Giants on Thursday night.

impact: Smallwood failed to record a gain on his lone reception. He also fumbled but managed to recover it. Smallwood got the start and out-touched Corey Clement 19-14, but Clement out-gained him 69-51. Clement also tallied the Eagles' lone backfield score. Clement certainly looked like the better player. Smallwood won't be much of a FLEX when the Eagles host the Panthers in Week 7.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed 18 times for 51 yards in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants.

impact: Smallwood’s 11 touches led the Eagles’ backfield; Corey Clement logged 10 and Josh Adams 4. Smallwood had multiple big plays nullified by penalties, including a monster screen pass of 50-plus yards that came about partly because of RG Brandon Brooks’ holding flag. Entrenched in a three-man backfield, Smallwood will be a sub-par Week 8 flex option against the Jags.
report: Wendell Smallwood rushed nine times for 32 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for five yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: The 19 touches were the most Clement has had in a game over his first two seasons, but he was out-gained by Wendell Smallwood 91-to-75 on the afternoon while Smallwood was the back who got the short yardage rushing opportunity. Clement's Week 4 fantasy status is largely dependent on the availability of Jay Ajayi and Darren Sproles Week 4 against the Titans.
report: Corey Clement rushed 16 times for 56 yards while catching 3-of-4 targets for 19 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Colts.

impact: It's a recurrence of last week's issue. It comes as Jay Ajayi was upgraded to "full" on Thursday. We would expect Clement to play. If he does and Ajayi is active, Clement will be a low-end FLEX play against the Titans.
report: Corey Clement (quad) was added to the Eagles' injury report on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: On top of that, Darren Sproles (hamstring) will miss his third consecutive game. Jay Ajayi (back) was removed from the team's injury report. With the latter healthy, Clement would return to a rotational role even if he is declared active for game day. He's a low-end FLEX play against the Titans.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is questionable for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Clement was questionable with a quad injury, but this is still a bit of a surprise. Clement will be joined on the sidelines by Darren Sproles, who was ruled out on Friday. With both down, Jay Ajayi and Wendell Smallwood should carry the load. Philly also declared OT Jordan Mailata, OT Matt Pryor, OL Chance Warmack, QB Nate Sudfeld, and DE Josh Sweat inactive for Week 4.
report: Eagles declared Corey Clement (quad) inactive for Week 4 against the Titans.

impact: Darren Sproles (hamstring) is also still sidelined.  Both players were inactive last week against the Titans.  The Eagles rolled with Jay Ajayi, Wendell Smallwood, and Josh Adams in the backfield.  Clement is day to day.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Clement is hurdling toward his second-straight inactive. Wendell Smallwood did not do enough behind Jay Ajayi in Week 4 to earn Week 5 FLEX consideration.
report: Corey Clement (quad) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Clement didn't practice all week and is likely headed for another absence. Assuming that's the case, Wendell Smallwood would fill the void behind starter Jay Ajayi.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is questionable for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Clement did not practice all week but will be up as Jay Ajayi's change-of-pace. Even in what should be a high-scoring affair, Clement is not a compelling FLEX option. Inactive for the Eagles are DE Derek Barnett, RB Darren Sproles, DT Haloti Ngata, OT Jordan Mailata, OL OL Matt Pryor, OG Chance Warmack and QB Nate Sudfeld.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is active for Week 5 against the Vikings.

impact: Playing through a quad injury, Clement was announced as "active," but it was evidently only on an emergency basis. Clement will enter Thursday night's game against the Giants having not touched the ball since Week 3. Wendell Smallwood has been holding down the fort in his absence. Clement will need Jay Ajayi to go down to become truly fantasy relevant.
report: Corey Clement played zero snaps in the Eagles' Week 5 loss to the Vikings.

impact: The Eagles play the Giants on Thursday night, and Philly just lost Jay Ajayi to a season-ending ACL tear, putting Clement and Wendell Smallwood squarely in the crosshairs of fantasy owners.  Clement should be back this week.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is practicing in full for Week 6.

impact: It is not a surprise considering he was listed as a full participant on Monday. He will likely be listed the same on Tuesday's report and be ready to face the Giants on Thursday. He will be a FLEX play in that matchup.
report: Corey Clement (quad) is participating in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Clement has missed the past two games but is coming back at the right time with the Eagles down another body after losing Jay Ajayi to a torn ACL.  The Eagles figure to have a split committee backfield approach between Clement and Wendell Smallwood, but Clement is our favorite and worth a play as an RB2.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Corey Clement (quad) is "100 percent, good to go" for Thursday night's Week 6 game against the Giants.

impact: Rosenblatt notes the Eagles have already played a game without Jay Ajayi this season, and Clement played 55 percent of the snaps while finishing with 16 carries. Wendell Smallwood played just 35 percent of the snaps on his way to 10 carries, but he did score a touchdown. Clement has been sidelined since that game, so it is possible Smallwood gets a little more work Thursday night. Even so, Clement is the better fantasy bet. Both are worth a look as an RB3/FLEX.
report: NJ Advance Media's Zack Rosenblatt expects Corey Clement to lead the Eagles' backfield Thursday night against the Giants.

impact: Coming off the bench behind Wendell Smallwood, Clement got out-touched and out-snapped but out-gained Smallwood 69-51. Clement continued to look like the better player. The Eagles' backfield usage might have better reflected that had Clement's health been more certain. Now having avoided setbacks with his troublesome quad issue, Clement has 10 days to heal up for the Eagles' Week 7 matchup with the Panthers. He will be the preferred fantasy play over Smallwood.
report: Corey Clement rushed 11 times for 43 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 6 win over the Giants, adding three receptions for 26 additional yards.

impact: He finished second on the team in touches behind Wendell Smallwood’s 11, and Josh Adams mixed in for 4. Clement’s on-field play has been wildly inconsistent this year, and his usage isn’t much more bankable in a three-man backfield that could soon add Darren Sproles (hamstring) to the mix. Against the Jaguars in Week 8, Clement will be a low-end flex option.
report: Corey Clement rushed eight times for six yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for 16 yards in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Juszczyk was on the field for 68 of San Francisco's 98 offensive snaps. He showed well as a receiver, nabbing three catches for a team-leading 56 yards in the first half. This game was sort of a perfect storm for Juszczyk with Matt Breida (ankle) injured and the Niners playing from behind. Fullbacks have grown almost extinct in today's NFL but Juszczyk continues to play a prominent role both as a blocker and a pass-catcher. In fact, he may be the best receiving back the Niners have at the moment.
report: Kyle Juszczyk nabbed six catches for 75 yards on seven targets while adding one rush for 12 yards Sunday in San Francisco’s Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: He didn't carry the ball on the ground and lost a fumble at the end of a 21-yard catch.  Juszczyk doesn't have any business being owned in fantasy.
report: Kyle Juszczyk caught all three of his targets for 30 yards in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers.

impact: Morris was cooking in the first half before stalling in the red zone when he had four carries from the five-yard line and in before losing a critical fumble on the fourth attempt at the two-yard line.  Morris looked to have a strong grip on ball-carrying duties before halftime, but with the Niners chasing in the second half, Matt Breida was the main back.  At the end of the day, Morris posted as 12-38 rushing line to Breida's 11-46 line while adding a five-yard catch.  Morris wasn't targeted in the pass game.  This figures to be a timeshare most weeks, though Morris should have chances for big workloads in games the Niners hold the lead.  The Lions come to town in Week 2.
report: Alfred Morris rushed 12 times for 38 yards in the 49ers' Week 1 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Morris held a slight edge in touches (16-14) but Matt Breida out-gained the veteran by a convincing margin. Not usually known for his pass-catching prowess, Alf logged his most receiving yards in a game since 2014. Morris took much better care of the ball this week after fumbling twice in last week’s opener. Averaging a mere 3.31 yards per carry through two games, the 29-year-old will just be an RB3 for next week’s game in KC.
report: Alfred Morris soaked up 48 yards on 14 carries while nabbing both of his targets for 32 yards Sunday in the 49ers’ Week 2 victory over the Lions.

impact: Morris only had four yards on three carries in the first half as the 49ers' offense was sabotaged by penalties, but he helped jump-start things in the second half with steady, consistent gains. He also confirmed his goal-line status with a three-yard score in the third quarter. Unfortunately, touchdowns might be more difficult to come by moving forward with Jimmy Garoppolo dealing with a potential ACL tear.
report: Alfred Morris rushed 14 times for 67 yards and a touchdown in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Morris' addition comes as Matt Breida (knee) was upgraded to "full." We, obviously, don't like mid-week additions, but it's probably just maintenance for the veteran Morris. He will be in the RB3/FLEX mix if he's active against the Chargers.
report: Alfred Morris was added to the 49ers' injury report on Thursday, getting in a limited session with a knee issue.

impact: Because he was added to the injury report mid-week, Morris would seem to be in greater danger of missing Week 4 than teammate Matt Breida (knee), who was upgraded to full practice on Thursday. However, as of now, both are expected to be available for Sunday's game in Los Angeles. Morris and Breida have been used in roughly equal capacity this year, though obviously Breida has been more productive than Alf. The 29-year-old will be a low-end flex if he suits up.
report: Alfred Morris (knee) is questionable for Week 4 against the Chargers.

impact: Matt Breida (knee) is also expected to play. Added the injury report mid-week, there was some real concern Morris would sit out. He will apparently give it a go, however. A somewhat touchdown-reliant fantasy asset in an offense likely to scuffle without Jimmy Garoppolo, Morris is shaping up as a low-end FLEX option.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Alfred Morris (knee) is expected to play Week 4 against the Chargers.

impact: Morris was added to the injury report mid-week, but he's going to play through his knee injury. Morris will be a low-end FLEX option with C.J. Beathard starting at quarterback and Matt Breida (knee) active as well.
report: Alfred Morris (knee) is officially active for Week 4's game against the Chargers.

impact: Even though it didn't show up in the stat sheet, Morris was subbed in for Matt Breida on the goal line early in the game, but he failed to convert it for a touchdown. The Butler will need to convert his goal line opportunities if he's to have any fantasy value moving forward. Those opportunities could be few and far between with C.J. Beathard as the quarterback. Morris' fantasy owners are only hoping for a touchdown against the Cardinals next week.
report: Alfred Morris rushed four times for 14 scoreless yards in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Morris came out of Week 4 without a setback. What was once a 50/50 backfield split is now moving more toward Matt Breida, who has vastly outplayed Morris through the first four weeks. At this point, Alf would probably need Breida to get hurt to have any real fantasy significance and even then, he'd likely lose passing-down work to fullback Kyle Juszczyk.
report: Alfred Morris (knee) is practicing in full for Week 5 against the Cardinals.

impact: Morris took over as the lead ball-carrier after Matt Breida left with a sprained ankle. Alf didn't do anything particularly notable, though the five targets were surprising as the 29-year-old has never been much of a pass-catcher. Breida's ankle injury doesn't appear serious, though it could keep him from suiting up next week at Green Bay. Morris would be a volume-based RB2 if Breida can't get the green light.
report: Alfred Morris went for 61 yards on 18 carries while also securing three-of-five targets for 30 yards Sunday in the 49ers’ Week 5 loss to Arizona.

impact: Morris played one offensive snap.  When he did touch the ball, Morris had an eight-yard run called back on a hold.  He remained stationed on the sideline as the Niners went with a Matt Breida-Raheem Mostert tandem in the backfield.  And those two shredded the Green Bay defense, combining for 148 yards and a score on 26 carries.  Mostert led the way with 87 yards on 12 carries (7.25 YPC) and likely stole Morris' job in doing so.  The offense was just so much more explosive with speed guys Breida and Mostert rather than slug Morris slowing the unit down with his three yards and a cloud of dust.  Morris can be dropped in all formats.
report: Alfred Morris didn't touch the ball in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers on Monday night.

impact: Even with Raheem Mostert once again stacking big gains, Morris led the team with nine carries as Matt Breida struggled with his ankle injury. Mostert would seem to have earned an even bigger role moving forward, especially if Breida is forced to miss time, but it does not seem like Morris is going away. Even so, he is not a fantasy option right now.
report: Alfred Morris rushed nine times for 25 yards in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: Ace beat reporter Matt Maiocco had a slip of the Twitter tongue. It would seem to confirm Breida avoided a high-ankle sprain and might actually have a chance to play on Monday night against the Packers. Breida did not practice on Thursday. Another DNP on Friday would have him close to "out."
report: Updating an earlier item, NBC Sports Bay Area reports Matt Breida (ankle) was walking without a noticeable limp on Thursday.

impact: The 49ers haven't ruled Brieda out, but it would be a shock if he played this week. Breida is likely dealing with a high-ankle sprain despite coach Kyle Shanahan's comments. Alfed Morris is in line to start on Monday night.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) didn't practice Friday.

impact: Breida got in a limited practice Saturday after sitting the last two days. It gives him a chance to play this week, but he's on the wrong side of questionable. Alfred Morris is in line to start and get the bulk of the carries if Breida sits.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Matt Breida (questionable, ankle) is a game-time decision for Monday night against the Packers.

impact: It would be surprising to see Breida on the field after he managed just one limited practice this week, but he has made a habit of playing through injuries so far this season. Alfred Morris' value would take a hit if Breida suits up.
report: NFL Network's Tom Pelissero reports Matt Breida (ankle) is "pushing to play" Monday night against the Packers.

impact: It's a bit of a shocking development.  Breida managed to squeeze in one limited practice this week after getting hurt in Week 5 with a sprained ankle.  The extra day of rest apparently did him some wonders.  We're curious how much Breida will actually play.  Neither he nor Alfred Morris is an attractive fantasy bet.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Matt Breida (ankle) is expected to play Monday night against the Packers.

impact: Breida was injured last week but made a quick recovery despite practicing on a limited basis just once this week.  He's impossible to trust in fantasy.
report: Matt Breida (ankle, shoulder) is active Week 6 against the Packers.

impact: Surprisingly playing through ankle and shoulder injuries, Breida started the game, led the team in carries, and scored from three yards out on the opening drive.  It was evident the injuries were bothering him, as Breida had to get worked on on the sidelines throughout the night, but Raheem Mostert provided a fine complement with a 12-87 rushing line with Alfred Morris benched.  Breida will now be on a short week ahead of a Week 7 date with the Rams.
report: Matt Breida rushed 14 times for 61 yards and one touchdown in the 49ers' Week 6 loss to the Packers.

impact: He played through his sprained ankle on Monday night, though he did cede 12 carries to Raheem Mostert. Breida has had a breakout year for the Niners, leading the league in yards per carry (6.8). He'll be on the RB2 map Sunday against the Rams.
report: Matt Breida (ankle, shoulder) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The 49ers are just managing Breida's reps after he was surprisingly active for Week 6. Breida will be in the RB2/FLEX mix against the Rams.
report: Matt Breida (shoulder, ankle) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Breida was upgraded to a full practice Friday after the 49ers managed his early-week reps. He's an RB2 for Sunday's game with the Rams.
report: Matt Breida (shoulder, ankle) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: As has become too common, Breida aggravated his ankle injury early in this game. He quickly came back after getting re-taped, but he limped off the field again during the two-minute touchdown drive at the end of the first half and did not touch the ball again. Perhaps the 49ers were just playing it safe in the blowout loss. Breida has a great matchup next week against the Cardinals, but his injury history will make him a risky play even if he is able to suit up.
report: Matt Breida rushed five times for 15 yards in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: Breida aggravated his ankle injury on the first carry of the game. He came back in for four more plays before limping off again at the end of the first half. With Raheem Mostert showing well, it might be time for Breida to sit out a few games to rest his troublesome ankle.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) played just five snaps Week 7 against the Rams.

impact: Coach Kyle Shanahan said Breida is doing better, however, after playing just five snaps and aggravating his sprained ankle last week against the Rams.  The Niners really just need to give him some time off to get right.  If Breida sits, Raheem Mostert would be the play over Alfred Morris.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Breida is looking more doubtful than questionable for Sunday's game against the Cardinals. That would leave Raheem Mostert, Alfred Morris and Kyle Juszczyk to form a committee against the Birds' awful run defense.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Breida was limited Friday after missing the last two days. The return to practice gives him a chance to play this week, but he's on the wrong side of questionable. Raheem Mostert would lead the 49ers in carries if Breida sits.
report: Matt Breida (ankle) is questionable for Week 8 against the Cardinals.

impact: This marks Garoppolo's first career loss after opening 7-0 as a starter.  Garoppolo tried to lead a comeback with the Vikings up by 18 deep into the third quarter, but the red-zone offense left a lot to be desired Sunday.  Garoppolo missed a wide-open George Kittle on a would-be four-yard touchdown and earlier overshot Kittle on a deep ball after he beat Harrison Smith.  Garoppolo also had a possible 80-yard TD dropped by Kittle.  His touchdown was a beautiful 22-yard hookup with rookie Dante Pettis after Garoppolo spun out of a sack.  He missed too many throws in this one, however, though it was a very tough road date with one of the league's best defenses.  The Niners will host the Lions in their home opener next Sunday.  Garoppolo will be a back-end QB1.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo completed just 15-of-33 passes for 261 yards, one touchdown, and three interceptions in the 49ers' 24-16, Week 1 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Jimmy G also took six sacks for a loss of 50 yards. Garoppolo dialed up a sideline pass to a wide-open Kendrick Bourne for his first touchdown of the day early in the second quarter. He added to his touchdown tally with another score in the third quarter, this time connecting with tight end Garrett Celek for 11 yards. Garoppolo narrowly avoided disaster in the fourth as a Tracy Walker interception was negated by a holding call on Quandre Diggs. That interception would have set the Lions up with first-and-goal and a chance to take the lead with just over two minutes remaining. As his six sacks would attest to, Garoppolo often held on to the ball too long, though all in all, Sunday was a much better performance than his last one against the Vikings in Week 1. Now 8-1 as an NFL starting quarterback, Handsome Jimmy will head to KC next week for a shootout with Patrick Mahomes and the 2-0 Chiefs.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo completed 18-of-26 passes for 206 yards and two touchdowns while contributing four yards on three carries Sunday in the 49ers’ Week 2 win over the Lions.

impact: Garoppolo decided to stay in bounds at the end of a fourth-quarter run and ended up taking a big hit on the sideline. Trainers appeared to be examining his left leg -- not his head -- on the sidelines, and that leg was extended straight out in front of him on the cart. Garoppolo had an up-and-down game before exiting, but he led the 49ers back in the second half. He finished the day with 251 yards and two scores.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo was carted to the locker room with a knee injury late in the fourth quarter Week 3 against the Chiefs.

impact: Garoppolo took a big hit along the sidelines late in the fourth quarter of San Francisco's Week 3 loss. It originally seemed like he could be dealing with a concussion, but he ended up being carted to the locker room with his left leg extended straight in front of him. If it is actually an ACL, Garoppolo will be the second offensive star the 49ers lose to an ACL tear after Jerick McKinnon suffered the same injury in the preseason. Brutal.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said the team is "fearing" an ACL tear for Jimmy Garoppolo.

impact: It is the same thing coach Kyle Shanahan said after the game. "Our [medical] guys say they’ve been wrong before and so they need to do the MRI, obviously," Lynch added, but it would be a shock if Garoppolo is dealing with anything less than a season-ending injury. C.J. Beathard should be the 49ers' starter the rest of the way.
report: 49ers GM John Lynch told NBC Sports' Peter King "all indications" suggest Jimmy Garoppolo suffered a torn ACL.

impact: Garoppolo is also believed to have MCL damage, but that's yet to be confirmed. That would threaten to delay his surgery. It's the worst news the 49ers could have gotten this season. Garoppolo's play was a little shakier than it was in 2017, but he was still performing at a high level with obvious room for improvement. His loss essentially pauses the 49ers' rebuild. 2018 is going to have a hard time not feeling like a wasted year in San Francisco. 2017 third-rounder C.J. Beathard will finish the year under center. When he's next in the huddle, Garoppolo will be 27 years old with just 10 career starts.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports an MRI has confirmed Jimmy Garoppolo's initial diagnosis of a torn left ACL.

impact: Garoppolo tore his left ACL late in the Niners' Week 3 loss to Kansas City. He'll miss the rest of the year but should be back for the start of next season. With Garoppolo out of commission, quarterback duties in San Francisco will fall to 2017 third-rounder C.J. Beathard.
report: Jimmy Garoppolo underwent surgery to repair a torn ACL on Wednesday.

impact: "I’m hoping he’ll get into OTAs and do some non-contact stuff," Shanahan said. "It’s always a little bit better when you’re dealing with a quarterback as opposed to other positions because you can get them in 7-on-7 drills, which helps those guys get involved a lot faster." Garoppolo tore his ACL in Week 3. He'll be eight months removed from surgery for the start of OTAs. The 49ers will move Garoppolo slowly, but barring setbacks, he should have a chance at getting in some limited offseason reps.
report: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan thinks Jimmy Garoppolo (knee) could be ready for OTAs.

impact: Kessler replaced Blake Bortles a little after halftime following Bortles’ second lost fumble. A weak-armed game manager, Kessler engineered just one touchdown drive. Kessler’s pick came on a dropped pass, which deflected to Texans S Tyrann Mathieu. Kessler will presumably get the Week 8 start against Philadelphia in London, although he won’t be more than a low-end two-quarterback-league play.
report: Cody Kessler completed 21-of-30 passes for 156 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Jaguars' Week 7 loss to the Texans.

impact: It's clear Bortles is going to be on a short leash after his Week 7 third-quarter benching following two lost fumbles.  The Jaguars want their quarterbacks to stop turning the ball over, and if Bortles continues to do so Kessler would enter Sunday's game against the Eagles in London.
report: Despite turning back to Blake Bortles as their Week 8 starter, the Jaguars will give Cody Kessler practice reps with the first-team offense.

impact: The Chargers removed Williams from the injury report early in the week but held him out of practice the last two days. He should play his normal snaps opposite Keenan Allen. Williams doesn't project for a ton of targets but has an exploitable matchup against Kansas City's banged-up secondary.
report: Tyrell Williams (foot) practiced fully Friday and will play in Week 1 against the Chiefs.

impact: One of Williams' missed connections was a dropped 39-yard touchdown in the end zone. There was no one in Williams' area code and he simply put the ball on the ground. It was a bad moment in a game full of them for the Chargers' offense. Rotating with Travis Benjamin and Mike Williams behind Keenan Allen, Williams doesn't have much of a WR5 case right now.
report: Tyrell Williams caught 2-of-5 targets for eight yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: He'll be ready to go on Sunday despite a minor groin injury. Williams scored a touchdown in last week's opener but also committed a bad drop. Outside of deeper formats, Williams isn't on the fantasy radar right now.
report: Tyrell Williams (groin) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the Bills.

impact: It was a quiet game for Williams, though he improved on his eight yards for Week 1. Williams has been dealing with a groin injury, but looked fully healthy. The Chargers' deep threat remains off the fantasy radar.
report: Tyrell Williams caught three passes for 48 yards in Week 2 against Buffalo.

impact: Williams' grip as the Chargers No. 2 receiver is really loosening with Mike Williams taking a second-year leap. Mike Williams had as many touchdown grabs (2) today as Tyrell Williams had receptions. Tyrell Williams is just a deep threat for Rivers and is off the fantasy radar.
report: Tyrell Williams caught two passes for 22 yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Williams had more targets than Mike Williams in a game where Travis Benjamin (foot) left in the first quarter. Tyrell can bring in an occasional long touchdown for Rivers, but his weekly floor is really low since he's averaging just four targets per game. Williams will look for his first 50+ yard game next week against the burnable Raiders.
report: Tyrell Williams caught 3-of-5 targets for 48 scoreless yards in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: None of his catches resulted in a touchdown, of course. It was the third time this season that Williams has seen just three targets, which now puts him at just 19 on the year. If searching for positives, it was his first 50-plus yard outing of the year and he did manage to finish second on the team in receiving yards. At this point, The Gazelle should only be owned in deeper leagues.
report: Tyrell Williams hauled in all three of his targets for 66 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 victory over the Raiders.

impact: Williams did all of his damage in the first half. His day got started on a two-play, 85-yard drive in which he caught a 40-yard pass over the top of the defense and then a 45-yard touchdown pass in which he took the ball from Damarious Randall on a simultaneous reception in the end zone. Williams then added a 29-yard touchdown strike with 51 seconds remaining in the first half to put the Chargers ahead 21-6 at the half. Williams entered Sunday with 192 yards and one touchdown, so he won't be an option next week when the Chargers head to London to face the Titans.
report: Tyrell Williams caught 3-of-4 targets for 118 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Williams roasted Logan Ryan for a 75-yard touchdown on the Chargers’ first play. He had a quiet second half with the Chargers losing the time-of-possesion battle. Williams is a one-trick deep threat, but he's had a high floor this season, with at least 40 yards or a touchdown in 6-of-7 games. Williams gets a matchup with Seattle in Week 9.
report: Tyrell Williams caught four passes for 118 yards and a touchdown in Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Johnson was a clear ancillary option in the Browns offense behind Carlos Hyde. Johnson managed six targets, but converted just one for a reception. With Tyrod Taylor's rushing mentality, Johnson may find opportunity hard to come by after catching at least 50 passes in each of his first three seasons and is only a fringe FLEX option next week versus the Saints.
report: Browns RB Duke Johnson rushed five times for 17 yards and caught 1-of-6 targets for eight yards in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Steelers.

impact: Johnson had his second disappointing game in a row to start the year as he managed just five touches, his fewest in a game since Week 1 of last season. Through two games, Johnson has totaled just 35 yards on just 11 touches. He's not even worth consideration in fantasy at this stage until his opportunity expands heading into a Week 3 matchup versus the Jets.
report: Duke Johnson rushed three times for three yards and caught two passes for seven yards in Sunday's Week 2 loss to the Saints.

impact: Johnson has touched the ball just 11 times on offense through two games. Jackson said the running back is one of their best playmakers and needs to touch the ball more, but it is tough to trust that will happen. Johnson needs to be relegated to fantasy benches for the time being.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson said Duke Johnson needs to get more touches moving forward.

impact: Coach Hue Jackson said Johnson needed the ball more, but his four touches were actually a season low. Johnson's next hope for improved fortunes is Baker Mayfield's insertion under center. If Johnson has been dropped in your PPR league, he's not a bad flier ahead of a Week 4 matchup with the Raiders.
report: Duke Johnson caught 2-of-2 targets for 24 yards in the Browns' Week 3 win over the Jets, adding two rushes for nine additional yards.

impact: Coach Hue Jackson said Johnson needs to get more touches, but responded by handing him a season-low four touches for 33 total yards. Carlos Hyde was in on 45-of-77 (58 percent) snaps with rookie Nick Chubb (5, six percent) continuing to see minimal work. There's still hope for Duke in PPR leagues assuming Baker Mayfield is named starter for the rest of the season. Pick Johnson up if he's been dropped.
report: Duke Johnson played 29-of-77 (38 percent) snaps Week 3 against the Jets.

impact: He has finished with six touches or fewer in each of Cleveland's first four games.  Johnson did convert a two-point conversion on run around the edge of Oakland's defense, but he also dropped a pass and was out-touched by Carlos Hyde 22 to 6.  Johnson is waiver-wire material outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Duke Johnson rushed twice for 11 yards and caught 4-of-6 targets for 45 yards in the Browns' Week 4 loss to Oakland.

impact: Johnson was again was a non-factor in the offensive game plan for the Browns. After averaging 4.6 receptions a year ago, Johnson now has 10 receptions on the season through five games. He is not worth holding onto in fantasy formats outside of Dynasty leagues.
report: Duke Johnson rushed five times for 35 yards while catching one pass for seven yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Johnson had to receive a pep talk from Tyrod Taylor on Wednesday. "He told me to just be more positive," Johnson said. For his part, Johnson said he is not going to formally lodge a complaint. "I've just never been a big fan of going up to coaches and demanding the ball." Johnson is right to be frustrated. Even with the Browns hurting for weapons, Johnson is averaging just five touches per game after that number was 10 in 2017. OC Todd Haley needs to find a way to get his playmaking change-of-pace back more involved.
report: The Cleveland Plain Dealer reports Duke Johnson is "frustrated by his lack of chances."

impact: This was by far Johnson's best game of the season, adding three plays of over 20 yards on the day with the highlight being a 32-yard catch and run. Despite the big day in producing yardage, Johnson still only managed six touches, giving him six or fewer touches in every game this season. Johnson is a risky-FLEX play Week 7 against the Buccaneers with his current volume levels.
report: Duke Johnson rushed twice for 36 yards while catching 4-of-5 targets for 73 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: We wouldn't read much into this. Johnson is listed ahead of Chubb out of seniority but may not start depending on what formation the Browns open in. Chubb remains the favorite to lead Cleveland in Week 7 carries.
report: Duke Johnson is listed as the starter for Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: With hopes that Johnson would gain usage after the trade of Carlos Hyde, things remained the same as always for Johnson as he was out-touched by rookie Nick Chubb 18-to-5. The touch total is especially discouraging as the Browns trailed the entire game. Johnson now has six or fewer touches in every game this season and is not a fantasy option until usage truly changes.
report: Duke Johnson rushed one time for -4 yards while catching all four of his targets for 23 yards in the Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Nearly all of Williams' production came with the Chargers in fourth quarter comeback mode. That was also after Tyrell Williams and Travis Benjamin burned the team with horrible drops. If nothing else, the Chargers are going to need Williams in the red zone. Today did nothing to change his status as an upside WR5 you can start in a pinch. Hopefully that pinch comes later in the season.
report: Mike Williams caught 5-of-6 targets for 81 yards in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: He finished with fewer snaps than both Travis Benjamin (47) and Tyrell Williams (62). On the bright side, he did not drop clear touchdowns like each of them did, and he was much more efficient with his work, turning six targets into five catches for 81 yards. It would not be surprising if he saw more work next week in Buffalo. He remains a stash in redraft leagues.
report: Mike Williams played 44-of-82 (54 percent) snaps Week 1 against the Chiefs.

impact: Williams stayed involved on offense after playing 54 percent of snaps in the season opener. His touchdown came on an opening drive red-zone strike from Philip Rivers, but he faded over the second half. With Travis Benjamin dealing with a foot injury, Williams should continue to see his role grow.
report: Mike Williams caught two passes for 27 yards and a touchdown Week 2 against Buffalo.

impact: Williams took advantage of Travis Benjamin's absence by securing two touchdown grabs. The first score came on a beautiful 42-yard diving catch in the end zone where he showed why the Chargers selected him with the No. 7 overall pick in 2017. Williams appears to be over his back issues that plagued him all last year and his role should continue to grow. Even if Benjamin returns next week, Williams has earned WR3/4 status with his performance today.
report: Mike Williams caught 4-of-7 targets for 81 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Williams came crashing down back to earth after a career-best game last week. He tied for the sixth-most targets on the team even with Travis Benjamin (foot) exiting the game early in the first quarter. The No. 7 overall pick will have his ups-and-downs, but the talent is there if he can put it all together. Williams has a golden matchup against the Raiders next week, but he is just an upside WR4 until his usage levels out.
report: Mike Williams caught 1-of-3 targets for 15 scoreless yards in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: After flourishing through the first three weeks of the season, Williams has recorded just 4-60 and no touchdowns on seven targets in his last two games. There will be better days ahead, but Philip Rivers' touchdowns tosses have seemingly been spread out this year due to the added layer of Melvin Gordon's and Austin Ekeler's usage in the passing game. Williams will remain a WR3 in Week 6 versus the Browns.
report: Mike Williams caught 3-of-4 targets for 45 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 win over the Raiders.

impact: Williams added one rush for 10 yards Philip Rivers missed Williams wide open on his first two targets and then he was hardly involved afterwards. Despite having three touchdowns on the season, Williams is a clear ancillary option in the Charger passing attack. He has totaled five catches for 64 yards over the past three weeks on 11 targets. He is a touchdown-dependent WR4 next week versus the Titans.
report: Mike Williams caught 1-of-4 targets for four yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Williams scored his touchdown on the Chargers' first drive of the second half. He had two end-zone targets, but couldn't come up with either of them. Williams briefly exited after getting shaken up late in the fourth quarter but didn't miss any time. He'll have the Chargers' Week 8 bye to get healthy.
report: Mike Williams caught a 55-yard touchdown in Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Taylor added 77 yards and a touchdown rushing on eight carries to make up for a nondescript passing performance in the heavy rain. His fantasy day is a reminder that even when Taylor is a lackluster passing option, he's still a high-floor fantasy option due to his rushing ability. Taylor will be a popular streaming option Week 2 against the Saints.
report: Browns QB Tyrod Taylor completed 15-of-40 passes for 197 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Sunday's Week 1 game versus the Steelers.

impact: Taylor added 26 yards rushing on four attempts. Taylor was largely nondescript for the majority of Sunday, but connected on a 47-yard bomb to Antonio Callaway that tied the game on 4th down with 1:16 left in the game. Taylor will still remain a high-floor streaming option Week 3 when the Browns host the Jets on Thursday.
report: Tyrod Taylor completed 22-of-30 passes for 246 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Sunday's Week 2 loss versus the Saints.

impact: It will be hard to do this one justice in a blurb, but Taylor's night went as poorly as possible even before he was evaluated for a head injury. With the Jets showing zero respect for his arm, they teed off on the box, making life miserable for Taylor as the crowd chanted for Baker Mayfield. Taylor was one for his first seven, and things never got better. He took three sacks, all three coming on first down. He missed Antonio Callaway on what should have been a wide-open 75-yard touchdown and committee intentional grounding in the end zone. It was painful to watch. Even if Taylor gets cleared, Mayfield will finish the game under center.
report: Tyrod Taylor completed 4-of-14 passes for 19 yards in the Browns' Week 3 game against the Jets before leaving with a potential concussion.

impact: It makes for a cruel end to an extremely ugly night. Especially with the Browns having 10 days to prepare for Week 4, they will go ahead and make the switch at quarterback. Baker Mayfield will start against the Raiders with Taylor backing him up. That's if he can clear the concussion protocol in time. Taylor was going to be benched regardless of his health. His play was that poor through his first 2.5 starts.
report: Tyrod Taylor has been diagnosed with a concussion and is week to week.

impact: It looks like Taylor will be healthy enough to play against Oakland next week, though it would be a surprise and likely a mistake if he drew the start. First overall pick Baker Mayfield dominated against the Jets on Thursday night and gives the Browns a much better chance to win than Tyrod, who was dreadful prior to exiting Week 3. Handing the reins to Baker should be an easy choice, though we can't take anything for granted with Hue Jackson calling the shots in Cleveland.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Tyrod Taylor is expected to clear the concussion protocol this week.

impact: Taylor is expected to be cleared before this weekend, but he will not be returning to a starting job. Baker Mayfield is fully expected to be named the starter Monday afternoon.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion) did not practice Monday.

impact: He remains in the concussion protocol. Drew Stanton will back up Baker Mayfield if Taylor doesn't get cleared for Week 4.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion, back) didn't practice Wedneday.

impact: Baker Mayfield will start at quarterback for the Browns this week. Taylor is reportedly dealing with a back injury as well, but he appears on track to dress and back up the rookie this weekend.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion, back) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Taylor was limited in practice all week. He's still in the concussion protocol, but coach Hue Jackson expects him to be available behind Baker Mayfield. Drew Stanton will back up Mayfield if Taylor doesn't get cleared.
report: Tyrod Taylor (concussion, back) is questionable for Week 4 against the Raiders.

impact: Tyrod Taylor has cleared the concussion protocol, but he's still feeling the effects of a back injury. Taylor practiced, albeit in a limited capacity, throughout the week, suggesting he'll be active for next week's game against the Ravens. Coming off a masterful debut in Week 3, Mayfield will be the Browns' starter until further notice.
report: Drew Stanton will back up Baker Mayfield against the Raiders in Week 4.

impact: Taylor cleared the concussion protocol but is still bothered by a back injury. Without him, the Browns will turn to Drew Stanton as the backup to Baker Mayfield. FS Damarious Randall, who had been questionable with a heel injury, is active for Sunday's tilt in Oakland.
report: Browns declared QB Tyrod Taylor, LB James Burgess, OG Austin Corbett, TE Seth Devalve, DT Devaroe Lawrence, WR Damion Ratley and CB Tavierre Thomas inactive for Week 4 against the Raiders.

impact: Taylor is over the back injury he suffered in Week 3 but with Baker Mayfield installed as the Browns' starter, he no longer carries any fantasy relevance. He'll hold the clipboard for Mayfield Sunday against Baltimore.
report: Tyrod Taylor (back) is practicing in full for Week 5 against the Ravens.

impact: At least not yet. Taylor acknowledged the possibility of being dealt prior to the October 30 trade deadline, but it doesn't sound like an opportunity he's actively pursuing. "There’s nothing to be angry about," said Taylor when asked about being benched for No. 1 pick Baker Mayfield. "Right now, I’m focusing on getting healthy and continue to keep getting better and what I can do for the team, and that’ll do it." Despite being passed over on the QB depth chart, coach Hue Jackson insists Taylor "isn't going anywhere." Headed for free agency after this season, the 29-year-old will surely be playing elsewhere in 2019.
report: According to ESPN's Tony Grossi, Tyrod Taylor has not asked for a trade.

impact: Benjamin's health takes on increased importance with Keenan Allen (knee) turning in back-to-back DNPs. Even if Allen sits, Benjamin will be little more than a WR5 dart throw against the 49ers. That's if he himself manages to get cleared. Benjamin sat in Week 3.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) remained limited in Thursday's practice.

impact: Benjamin would seem to have a better chance of suiting this week after getting in limited practice time. If he sits, it would obviously come as great news to Mike Williams, who has been a monster with Benjamin sidelined the past two weeks.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is questionable for Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin has been a game-time decision the last two weeks. He’s yet to get in a full  practice, so he’s not a lock to return. Even if he plays, Benjamin is behind Keenan Allen (questionable, knee), Tyrell Williams, and Mike Williams for targets.
report: Chargers coach Anthony Lynn said Travis Benjamin (questionable, foot) is a game-time decision for Week 4.

impact: Benjamin has sat the last two weeks as a game-time decision. He's made enough progress to play, but his snaps figure to be limited. Benjamin will be returning behind Mike Williams in three-wide sets.
report: Travis Benjamin (questionable, foot) is expected to play Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin lasted ten minutes before the training staff had to take another look at him. He had been testing his foot the last couple weeks in pregame warmups but wasn't able to see game action until today. Even if he's healthy, Benjamin has been passed up by Mike Williams.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is questionable to return in the Chargers' Week 4 game against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin left the game just minutes after kickoff after hauling in his first target of the game. He slammed his helmet on the sideline in frustration, as he knew he re-injured his nagging foot injury. Benjamin can be safely dropped with his foot injury and Mike Williams working against him.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) has been ruled for the remainder of the Chargers' Week 4 game against the 49ers.

impact: Benjamin first suffered the injury in Week 1.  He missed Weeks 2-3, then returned against the 49ers and went down again.  Benjamin's absence locks in Keenan Allen, Mike Williams, and Tyrell Williams as the Chargers' top-three wideouts.
report: Travis Benjamin aggravated his foot injury in Week 4 and is out indefinitely.

impact: Benjamin is likely to miss multiple weeks after aggravating his foot injury in Week 4. Mike Williams and Tyrell Williams will continue to see the majority of targets behind Keenan Allen.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Benjamin aggravated an ongoing foot issue in Week 4. The field-stretching role player could end up being sidelined beyond the Bolts' Week 8 bye.
report: NFL.com's Ian Rapoport reports Travis Benjamin (foot) will be sidelined 2-3 weeks.

impact: Benjamin remains week-to-week and is likely out beyond the Chargers' Week 8 bye. Los Angeles will also be without both starting tackles against the Raiders in Week 5. UDFA Trent Scott is expected to play a large role, as will Sam Tevi. OL Forrest Lamp, the Chargers' second-round pick in 2017, is active for the first time this season and could be tasked to fill in at times.
report: Chargers declared Travis Benjamin, LB Kyzir White C Cole Toner RT Joe Barksdale, LT Russell Okung, WR J.J. Jones, and Joey Bosa for Week 5 against the Raiders.

impact: Benjamin hasn't played since aggravating a foot issue in Week 4.  Benjamin is part of the fight for targets behind Keenan Allen and Melvin Gordon.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: He also got in a limited session Wednesday, putting him on track to return this week. Benjamin's return could put a dent into Mike Williams' and Tyrell Williams' target shares.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) was limited in Thursday's practice.

impact: Benjamin practiced in full Friday, so we'd expect him to return this week in London after missing the previous two games.  Benjamin is off the fantasy map.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is questionable for Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Benjamin hasn't played since re-aggravating his foot in Week 4. Although he's off the fantasy radar, his presence alone plummets Mike Williams' usage. Williams played just 53% of the Chargers' offensive snaps in Week 1, but hasn't played less than 63% since Benjamin's been out. Williams is a boom-bust WR4 in this particular matchup against the Titans' secondary.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is expected to play against the Titans in Week 7.

impact: Benjamin will make his first appearance since Week 4. He's unlikely to have much of a role, but it's a hit to Mike Williams' playing time. The Chargers inactives are RB Melvin Gordon, K Caleb Sturgis, LB Kyzir White, C Cole Toner, OT Trent Scott, OG Forrest Lamp, and DE Joey Bosa.
report: Travis Benjamin (foot) is active for Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Standard operating procedure for one of the league's truly elite wide receivers. Allen is so quick in and out of his breaks and spent much of the afternoon toying with the Chiefs' replacement-level defensive backs. For Week 2 he gets a Bills secondary that got ripped by the Ravens on Sunday.
report: Keenan Allen caught 8-of-11 targets for 108 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Allen led the Chargers in receiving in a spread-it-out game from Philip Rivers. The Chargers got up big early and didn't need to pass much in the second half, so Allen didn't get a ton of chances to exploit Buffalo's secondary. Allen is averaging seven catches and 88 yards through two games. He gets a matchup with the Rams in Week 3.
report: Keenan Allen caught 6-of-8 passes for 67 yards in the Chargers' Week 2 win over Buffalo.

impact: Allen was bottled up by the Rams defense despite Marcus Peters and Aqib Talib leaving the game early with injuries. Instead it was Mike Williams -- he also had seven targets -- who did the damage for the Chargers. Near the end of the game, Allen limped over to the sideline in some pain, but it appeared to not be very serious. Assuming the injury is minor, Allen will be a WR1/2 in a home matchup against the Garoppolo-less 49ers.
report: Keenan Allen caught 3-of-7 targets for 44 yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Allen suffered the injury late in Sunday's loss to the Rams. We're guessing the Bolts are just being cautious with their star receiver, though obviously Allen's health status will need to be monitored throughout the week. If he plays, the 26-year-old will have an exploitable matchup against the Niners, who will be playing without star cornerback Richard Sherman (calf). In the off-chance that Allen sits, his absence would open up looks for Mike and Tyrell Williams.
report: Keenan Allen (knee) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: It's possible the Chargers are just being cautious with their No. 1 receiver, but back-to-back DNPs are never a good sign, especially for a player with a history of knee issues. For what it's worth, coach Anthony Lynn did indeed say the team is "being cautious." Fantasy owners should consider their WR1 genuinely questionable for Sunday's game with the 49ers. Mike Williams would be a plug-and-play WR3 were Allen to sit.
report: Keenan Allen (knee) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: It was always plausible Allen was held out from practice for precautionary reasons. It's still worth monitoring his official status on the Chargers' injury report given his back-to-back DNP's Wednesday and Thursday. Assuming he suits up, it's a terrific spot for Allen and Los Angeles' offense, who are favored by a whopping 10 points at home over the 49ers Sunday. Mike Williams is still considered a strong WR3/FLEX play with Allen available.
report: Keenan Allen (knee) returned to practice Friday.

impact: Allen got in just one limited practice this week, though we're guessing he'll give it a go against San Francisco. An already vulnerably Niners secondary will be in even worse shape this week with Richard Sherman (calf) sitting. It's a potential smash spot for Allen, though the injury risk lowers him to back-end WR1 status. RotoPat has him at No. 10 in his Week 4 receiver rankings.
report: Keenan Allen (knee, tooth) is questionable for Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: Allen got in just one limited practice this week but it doesn't sound like it'll matter for his availability. The Niners will quietly be without both Richard Sherman (calf) and starting S Jaquiski Tartt (shoulder), essentially becoming vulnerable against the Chargers' explosive pass and rushing attacks. He's undoubtedly a low-end WR1 in this matchup. Although Allen will play, second-year pro Mike Williams should carry over his sudden rapport with Philip Rivers and be considered a confident WR3/4 at home. Travis Benjamin (foot) remains questionable.
report: Keenan Allen (knee, tooth) is expected to play in Week 4 against the 49ers.

impact: That means Keenan Allen (knee, tooth) and Travis Benjamin (foot) are officially active. The matchup for Allen is fantastic with Richard Sherman (calf) and S Jaquiski Tartt (shoulder) both inactive for the 49ers. Travis Benjamin's usage will be something to watch with Mike Williams breaking out for the Chargers. Joey Bosa (foot) is expected to be sidelined until the second half of the season.
report: Chargers declare LB Kyzir White, C Cole Toner, T Joe Barksdale, G Forrest Lamp, WR JJ Jones, DT T.Y. McGill, and DE Joey Bosa inactive for Week 4's game against the 49ers.

impact: Allen missed some practice time this week with knee and tooth soreness, but he was able to play through it. The 49ers were down two starting players in the secondary, but Allen was held in check in a game that featured Melvin Gordon. Allen is still on pace for a 96-1,128-4 season receiving line on 144 targets despite three straight average games. Look for Allen to return to low-end WR1 form against the Raiders next Sunday.
report: Keenan Allen caught 7-of-10 targets for 63 scoreless yards in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Allen has now seen at least seven targets in every game, and at least nine in three-of-five. Although he's recorded just one touchdown on the year, his massive volume (nine targets per game) will inevitably lead to more fireworks-style outings for owners in the near future. His red zone usage has admittedly taken a hit with Melvin Gordon so heavily involved out of the backfield this year, but Allen's weekly floor still makes him one of the safest plays going in fantasy. He's on pace for a usage-hog 102-1,190-3 season, and remains a safe WR1 in Week 6 against the Browns.
report: Keenan Allen vacuumed 8-of-9 targets for 90 yards in the Chargers' Week 5 rout over the Raiders.

impact: Allen got his day started off strong with two catches for 33 yards on the opening drive of the game. The Chargers took the air out of the ball in the second half, but his rushing performance made his day a respectable one as his four carries were a career-high. In fact, for his career, Allen had just three rushes for 11 yards entering Sunday's game. Allen hasn't been the WR1 fantasy owners drafted to begin the season, but got off to a slow statistical start a year ago before turning it on over the back half of the year. Allen will be a high-end WR2 option Week 7 when the Chargers face the Titans in London.
report: Keenan Allen caught 4-of-6 targets for 62 yards while rushing four times for 41 yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Allen didn't get a ton of volume with Philip Rivers only attempting 26 passes. He had an on-field outburst after not getting targeted in the end-zone late in the fourth quarter. Allen has hit his floor all year but has only one touchdown. He's due for some positive regression in the second half.
report: Keenan Allen caught five passes for 72 yards in the Chargers' Week 7 win over the Titans.

impact: Brees was sacked once for a seven-yard loss. Even though it came in a losing effort, the 39-year-old was absolutely brilliant, slinging touchdowns to Michael Thomas, Ted Ginn and Alvin Kamara in Sunday’s slugfest. Brees and Thomas were nearly unstoppable together, connecting 16 times for an incredible 180 yards. Neither defense showed up on Sunday as the two teams combined for an insane 1,004 yards of total offense. We’ll see what the future Hall of Famer does for an encore when he faces the Browns in Week 2.
report: Drew Brees completed 37-of-45 passes for 439 yards with three touchdowns and no interceptions Sunday in the Saints’ Week 1 loss to Tampa Bay.

impact: Despite completing 80 percent of his passes, Brees got off to a slow start in the first when he rushed a throw to a wide open Ben Watson in the end zone and underthrew a wide open Ted Ginn for potential scores. He bounced back in the second half to connect for two touchdowns to Michael Thomas and lead back-to-back drives for scores to give the Saints the lead in the 4th quarter. Brees will have his first road game in Week 3 visiting Atlanta, but will remain in the QB1 mix for fantasy.
report: Drew Brees completed 28-of-35 passes for 243 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Browns.

impact: He lost five yards on his lone sack. Brees got off to a blistering start, completing all four of his passes for 55 yards and a touchdown to Ted Ginn on the opening drive. He never took his foot off the gas, connecting on all 10 of his throws to Michael Thomas while also completing an exhausting 15 passes to running back Alvin Kamara. As he often does, Brees saved his best for last. The 39-year-old tied the game on a rare rushing touchdown, beating two defenders on a spin move for a seven-yard score with 1:15 left in the fourth quarter. He sealed the game in overtime with another rushing TD, leaping over the pile on a QB keeper. Brees passed Brett Favre Sunday to become the NFL’s all-time completion leader. He should keep the train rolling next week against a burnable Giants secondary.
report: Drew Brees completed 39-of-49 passes for 396 yards and three touchdowns while also adding three carries for seven yards and another two touchdowns Sunday in New Orleans’ Week 3 win over the Falcons.

impact: It was the Saints' first game outside of a dome this season, and we've seen this pass offense struggle in these outdoor environments over the years.  It continued on Sunday, but Brees being removed at certain times in the red zone in favor of gadget QB Taysom Hill was mind-boggling.  There's no reason Hill should be playing over Brees in those situations, and the Saints did it more than once.  At the end of the day, they still won easily.  Brees will head back home next week for a date with the Redskins on Monday night.
report: Drew Brees completed 18-of-32 passes for 217 yards and no touchdowns in the Saints' Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: Brees entered the night in third place on the league's all-time passing yards list.  He quickly passed Brett Favre for the No. 2 spot and then eclipsed Peyton Manning at No. 1 with a 62-yard touchdown pass to Tre'Quan Smith late in the second quarter.  There was nobody within 10 yards of Smith on a blown coverage, and Brees picked apart this little-league pass defense all night, as evidenced by just the three incompletions and 12.5 YPA average.  Brees' other two scores went to Josh Hill and a second to Smith.  The Saints are now heading into their bye before traveling to Baltimore in Week 7.
report: Drew Brees completed 26-of-29 passes for 363 yards and three touchdowns in the Saints' 43-19, Week 5 blowout win over the Redskins on Monday night.
