impact: The scores were Nos. 500 and 501 of Brees' Hall-of-Fame career. He is just the fourth member of the 500-touchdown club. The Saints were methodical in the road victory, rushing 39 times while trying to gobble up clock. No. 2 quarterback Taysom Hill remained extremely involved as a red zone gadget player. Hill is little more than a nuisance, though he is curbing both Brees and Alvin Kamara's ultimate upside. The Saints are headed on the road to Minnesota's dome for Week 8.
report: Drew Brees completed 22-of-30 passes for 212 yards and two touchdowns in the Saints' 24-23, Week 7 win over the Ravens.

impact: An UDFA out of Tulane, Hilliard rushed 30 times for 82 yards (2.73 YPC) during the preseason. If he sees the field, it will be on special teams.
report: Browns promoted RB Dontrell Hilliard from the practice squad.

impact: He was not targeted in the passing game and got out-touched by Carlos Hyde 22 to 3, but Chubb made his workload count with two monster touchdown runs from 63 and 41 yards out.  Plays like that are capable of earning Chubb more playing time going forward, although Chubb's to-date usage keeps him out of the flex-starter discussion. The Browns have stayed very committed to Hyde as their bellcow.  Chubb is a handcuff until further notice.
report: Nick Chubb rushed three times for 105 yards and two touchdowns in the Browns' Week 4 loss to the Raiders.

impact: "(Carlos) Hyde is playing well, but this guy is scoring touchdowns from long ways away," Jackson said. "We have good backs. We know that. Sometimes it is going to be hit and miss where some other guy is making it happen and then the other guy goes in and does it." Chubb is a freak athlete big-play threat who could certainly change the pace for the better in the Browns' offense. It's still extremely unlikely he comes into standalone fantasy value as long as Hyde is healthy. Hyde, of course, has an extensive injury history. Chubb is a must stash in all formats.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson said Nick Chubb "has to get some."

impact: After the Cleveland staff spent most of the week suggesting Chubb's role would expand after turning three carries into 105 yards a week ago, he remained an afterthought in the game plan. Chubb is only a bench stash as Carlos Hyde has dominated backfield touches in Cleveland.
report: Nick Chubb rushed three times for two yards in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Chubb once again showed off his explosion with a 19-yard scamper which would have been longer had there not been a holding downfield, but once again the Browns failed to use him in the game. Chubb has now carried the ball three times or less in every game this season. He is only a bench stash at this point and needs an injury to have fantasy relevancy.
report: Nick Chubb rushed three times for 25 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: "We do need to get Nick Chubb more carries," was Jackson's exact quote. He said the same thing two weeks away and has proceeded to give Chubb the ball six times over the past two games. With Carlos Hyde averaging just 3.35 yards per carry, perhaps Jackson means it this time. Chubb remains worth holding in 12-team leagues.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson once again claimed he would work to get Nick Chubb more carries.

impact: With Carlos Hyde traded to Jacksonville, Chubb takes over as Cleveland's early-down back. This should be an upgrade for the Browns' run game, as Hyde was averaging just 3.4 YPC. Chubb has a blowup ROS outlook in a Baker Mayfield offense. He's an RB2 against a Bucs defense that will be without DT Gerald McCoy this week.
report: Nick Chubb will start Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: With the trade of Carlos Hyde on Friday, Chubb drew the start and out-touched Duke Johnson 18-to-5. Chubb saw two targets in the pass game, but neither one was catchable. After just 24 yards on eight carries in the first half, Chubb ran 10 times for 54 yards after the break. His touchdown was a 1-yard plunge after a pass interference in the end zone.  Chubb is now firmly on the radar as an RB2 option for fantasy next week against the Steelers, but he will still be a touchdown dependent option most weeks just as Hyde was.
report: Nick Chubb rushed 18 times for 80 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: He also converted a pair of two-point conversions. Kamara erupted in the first half, dominating the Bucs for 114 yards (29 rushing, 85 receiving) on 10 touches. The highlights included a mesmerizing 35-yard catch off a screen pass and a five-yard touchdown scamper to cap the Saints’ opening drive. Kamara was mostly stymied in the second half—he managed just 27 yards on seven touches—though he did vulture a pair of touchdowns including a seven-yard receiving score that closed the gap to eight with 3:31 remaining in the fourth quarter. The reigning Rookie of the Year received workhorse usage, out-touching backup Mike Gillislee 17-3 while outgaining him by over 100 yards. Kamara remains one of the most unique weapons in football and should be in for another obscene stat line next time out against Cleveland.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed eight times for 29 yards and two touchdowns while also nabbing nine catches for 112 yards and another touchdown on 12 targets Sunday in the Saints’ Week 1 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: Kamara also added a 2-point conversion in the 4th quarter. Out of the gates, Kamara has struggled to gain yardage on the ground, rushing 21 times for just 75 yards (3.6 YPC) but has been electric in the receiving game, catching 15-of-18 targets for 165 yards. His pass catching ability should once again be a major asset in Week 3 when he faces an Atlanta defense that has struggled to defend backs in the passing game over the past three seasons.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 13 times for 46 yards and caught all six of his targets for 53 yards in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Browns.

impact: Kamara had a busy opening drive, surging to 36 yards on four touches with 17 coming on his first carry. That would be a sign of things to come as the reigning Offensive Rookie of the Year was a focal point of the Saints’ offense all afternoon. The only thing missing was a touchdown. Kamara was stuffed on third-and-goal from the half-yard line in the fourth quarter and was later vultured by fullback Zach Line, who caught a one-yard touchdown on the very next play. He tortured fantasy owners again in overtime by having a walk-off touchdown overturned on replay. Predictably, Drew Brees punched it on the following play. Kamara has averaged a slightly underwhelming 3.81 yards per carry this year, but his weekly touchdown upside and monster workload in the passing game will continue to keep him in the RB1 conversation. Look for him to put up another silly stat line next week against the Giants.
report: Alvin Kamara totaled 66 yards on 16 carries while corralling 15-of-20 targets for an additional 124 yards Sunday in the Saints’ Week 3 victory over the Falcons.

impact: It's a new injury for Kamara. He played into overtime last week, so we're not sure when it happened. Kamara's status will be updated when the Saints return to practice Thursday.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Kamara was limited to start the week but obviously his knee issue is nothing serious. Coming off a career-high 15-catch performance in Week 3, Kamara should be in for another monster game Sunday in the Meadowlands.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: Kamara was limited Friday after being a full participant at Thursday's practice, though his light workload today was probably just for maintenance purposes. The reigning Offensive Rookie of the Year saw an exhausting 31 touches in last week's win over the Falcons and should be in for another huge game Sunday in East Rutherford.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) wasn't listed on the Saints' final injury report for Week 4 against the Giants.

impact: He added five catches for 47 yards on a team-high nine targets.  What else more is there to say?  Kamara and Todd Gurley are head and shoulders above the rest of the pack as the elite fantasy players.  They do it week in and week out without skipping beats.  New Orleans settled for four first-half field goals before Kamara took over after the break, scoring nine-, four-, and 49-yard touchdowns, with the 49-yarder sealing the win.  The Redskins are next in Week 5.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 19 times for 134 yards and three touchdowns in the Saints' 33-18, Week 4 win over the Giants.

impact: This was Kamara's routine last week. He will likely be removed from the injury report on Saturday. The Saints play on Monday Night Football. Even with Mark Ingram coming off suspension, Kamara is a no-brainer top-three RB1.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) was limited in Thursday's practice.

impact: The Saints are just rationing his practice reps. Kamara has been spectacular this year, totaling 611 yards from scrimmage with six touchdowns in the early going. He remains a top-three option in all formats, even with Mark Ingram due back from suspension this week.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) remained limited at Friday's practice.

impact: Kamara was limited for the second straight week, but the Saints are just managing his practice reps. With Mark Ingram back, Kamara's touches are going to take a hit, but he's still a locked-in RB1.
report: Alvin Kamara (knee) was removed from the Week 5 injury report.

impact: Mark Ingram returned from his four-week suspension to make his 2018 debut and made the start for the Saints.  He went on his way to out-carry Kamara 16-6 and out-touch him 18-9 overall.  Ingram also scored two goal-line plunge touchdowns in the first half.  Kamara owners are going to be seriously concerned after this one.  Kamara averaged 22.75 touches per game Weeks 1-4 but took a major back seat to Ingram tonight.  Perhaps coach Sean Payton was just overworking Ingram to get him up to speed and possibly getting Kamara some extra rest after the big workloads the first four weeks with the Saints now heading into their bye.  But Kamara is highly unlikely to come close to his Weeks 1-4 usage the rest of the way.  He's going to need big plays to maintain elite RB1 status, and those didn't come Monday night.  The Ravens are up next in Week 7.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed just six times for 24 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 15 yards in the Saints' Week 5 win over the Redskins.

impact: Kamara took a backseat to Mark Ingram in the latter's first game of the season, touching the ball just nine times. Payton said Kamara was meant to have more touches, but big plays and a Taysom Hill keeper changed the game flow. "It just changes how the game unfolds. Alvin’s nine touches, I think is a little bit of byproduct of a 60-yard scoring strike, another 40," Payton said. "Those change kind of the pitch count, if you will." Kamara should be more involved coming out of the bye in Baltimore, but Ingram's presence is a real threat to his high-end RB1 status.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said long plays were to blame for Alvin Kamara's limited touches Week 5.

impact: Kamara got the start and out-touched Mark Ingram 19-14 one game after Ingram out-touched Kamara 18-9 in his 2018 debut. Both players received goal line looks, but only Kamara cashed his in. We would expect today's touch distribution to be closer to the norm than Week 5's going forward. With Taysom Hill emerging as a bigger nuisance, however, Kamara will remain a mid-range to low-end RB1 for Week 8 in Minnesota.
report: Alvin Kamara rushed 17 times for 64 yards and a touchdown in the Saints' Week 7 win over the Ravens, adding two catches for 11 additional yards.

impact: Mark Ingram played just four fewer snaps but was out-touched 19-to-14 by Kamara a week after winning the touch battle 18-to-9. The usage against the Ravens is more in line with expectations, but it is too early to draw any firm conclusions. Kamara will be a mid-range RB1 this week against the Vikings while Ingram will be in the RB2 group.
report: Alvin Kamara played 39-of-71 snaps (55 percent) Week 7 against the Ravens.

impact: Acquired in late August, Bridgewater has already learned the offense well enough to be the top option behind Drew Brees. "He's a quick study," Payton said. "I think right away, you can tell he got comfortable with what we're calling things, protections." Brees has missed two games since joining the Saints, but having someone like Bridgewater ready behind him is good insurance.
report: Saints coach Sean Payton said Teddy Bridgewater is the No. 2 quarterback.

impact: The 49ers had enough faith in Mullens to carry only two quarterbacks for a few weeks after Jimmy Garoppolo's injury, but they signed Tom Savage (lol) this week. It's apparently just an emergency measure. Mullens completed 31-of-43 (72 percent) for 396 yards (9.21 YPA), one touchdown and three interceptions during the preseason.
report: Second-year UDFA Nick Mullens remains the 49ers' No. 2 quarterback following the signing of Tom Savage.

impact: The Packers will have to make a move to get him on the active roster, but it would be a surprise if he is not on the field Sunday. That is a concern for Jamaal Williams, who has operated as the clear lead back the first two games, but Williams is more reliable in the passing game and has a two-week headstart. Jones is just a bench stash at this point.
report: Aaron Jones is eligible to return from his two-game suspension this week.

impact: "Jamaal and Ty have played good football," McCarthy said.  "I know what Aaron gives us, but his role will be secondary.  Jamaal and Ty will be in the first slot."  Jones is off a two-game ban and will not be handed anything off the bat.  He's not a fantasy starter right now and remains nothing more than a bench stash.  Jones is long on talent, but Williams and Montgomery have reliability.
report: Coach Mike McCarthy said Aaron Jones will play behind both Jamaal Williams and Ty Montgomery in his return from suspension this week against the Redskins.

impact: Jones didn't see the field until late in the first quarter, but he immediately piled up 18 yards on back-to-back carries. The sophomore back led the Pack's three-man backfield in both carries and rushing yards. He is clearly going to be a factor. If Jones can improve his pass protection, he could make a decisive move ahead of Jamaal Williams. He needs to be 100 percent owned in fantasy.
report: Making his 2018 debut, Aaron Jones rushed six times for 42 yards in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins, adding a five-yard reception.

impact: "He's definitely got some explosiveness, some twitch and some play-making ability," was Philbin's exact quote. "There were a couple runs where he definitely made some things happen on his own." Philbin's assessment of Jones' Week 3 play is accurate. He provided the Packers' running game with a badly-needed spark. Now a full-blown three-man committee, the Packers' backfield is tough to forecast for fantasy. We would give Jamaal Williams the slightest of Week 4 edges over Jones.
report: Speaking Thursday, Packers OC Joe Philbin praised Aaron Jones' "explosiveness."

impact: Jones once again came off the bench behind Jamaal Williams. His first touch did not come until the final play of the first quarter, but Jones proceeded to easily out-gain Williams 82-27 while out-touching him 12-11. It was Jones who scored the Pack's lone ground touchdown, running over a defensive back at the goal line. Jones has now out-produced Williams in each of his 2018 appearances. Each of Jones, Williams and Ty Montgomery will continue to see work, but only Jones is currently worth FLEX consideration. The Pack travel to Detroit for Week 5. The Lions have been getting destroyed on the ground.
report: Aaron Jones rushed 11 times for 65 yards and a touchdown in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills, adding a 17-yard reception.

impact: He also caught two balls for 19 yards.  Jones didn't get a second-half touch until there was less than 30 second left in the game.  He fought hard for extra yards on his seven carries, but Jones was mothballed with the Packers in catchup mode.  It was pretty much all Ty Montgomery in the backfield after the break.  Jones should get more work next week against the Niners as an RB3.
report: Aaron Jones rushed seven times for 40 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: "He's dynamic with the ball in his hands," McCarthy said. "But there's more to the position than just running the football. We have diversity in our attack with three guys. All have excellent attributes." The fantasy community continues to be more in love with Jones than his coaching staff. Jones has run circles around Jamaal Williams the past two seasons, but McCarthy is obsessed with Williams' "little things" skills. Per Pro Football Focus, Jones has been called on to pass block on just four of his 68 snaps. Jones' usage limits him to FLEX status for the time being, though the Niners are an appealing Week 6 matchup.
report: Speaking Monday, Packers coach Mike McCarthy said he would "love" to get Aaron Jones more work but that "there's more to the position than just running the football."

impact: The good news is Jones started for the Packers.  His first run was a 16-yard scamper on the game's second play that was initially ruled a 17-yard touchdown before getting reversed.  Jones got the call from the one-yard line on the next play but was stuffed for a one-yard loss before Ty Montgomery then scored on second down.  Jones was targeted once in the pass game but dropped it, leading to more frustration for him.  He's not going to get more looks in the pass game if he does that.  Jamaal Williams rushed six times for 29 yards as this thing remains a total timeshare.  Jones simply isn't getting enough carries and isn't taking advantage of pass-game spots to be trusted in fantasy lineups ahead of the Packers' Week 8 game against the Rams after the bye.
report: Aaron Jones rushed eight times for 41 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: It was a nondescript night for Williams. He had a long run of 11 yards and fell out of the gameplan with the Packers airing it out in the second half. Williams is locked in as Green Bay's featured back for at least another week with Aaron Jones suspended, but he's going to face competition for carries when Jones returns.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed 15 times for 47 yards in Sunday night's Week 1 win over Chicago.

impact: Williams did not get much going against a tough defense, but he once again worked as the clear lead back ahead of Ty Montgomery. That could change moving forward, however, with Aaron Jones due back from suspension. Williams is a more reliable option in the passing game who had a two-week headstart on Jones, so he will likely retain the lead job. Even so, he will be a risky FLEX play next week in Washington.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed 16 times for 59 yards and hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 12 yards in the Packers' Week 2 tie with the Vikings.

impact: Williams got the start, but Aaron Jones drew as many touches in his 2018 debut. Jones out-gained Williams 47-45. Ty Montgomery out-produced both (64). Jones looked cannon shot whenever he was asked to change the pace. Williams' pass protection is going to keep him on the field, but the Packers — who need play-making targets — figure to start looking Jones and Ty Montgomery's way more and more. Williams' RB2 candidacy is on thin ice. The Pack host the Bills in Week 4.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed five times for 29 yards in the Packers' Week 3 loss to the Redskins, adding two receptions for 16 additional yards.

impact: Williams wasn't targeted in the passing game. Williams once again got the "start," but was once again out-gained by Aaron Jones, this time handily (82-27). Jones scored the Packers' lone ground touchdown. Williams is now averaging 3.44 yards per carry compared to 6.29 for Jones. The Pack like Williams' pass protection, but that production gulf can only go on for so long. Williams won't be a recommended FLEX against the Lions in Week 5.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed 11 times for 27 yards in the Packers' Week 4 win over the Bills.

impact: He added two catches for 19 yards on four targets.  Williams and Aaron Jones (seven carries, two catches) essentially split the run-down work, but the Packers fell behind big on the scoreboard and were down 24-0 at halftime.  It was mostly Ty Montgomery after the break.  Williams has been a big disappointment through five weeks.  Jones should get more chances to earn increased snaps moving forward.  Williams will be a low-upside RB3 next week against the 49ers.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed six times for 33 yards in the Packers' Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: He caught a 10-yard pass on three targets.  Pedestrian as they come, Williams is good for a handful of carries for about 30-40 yards per week.  Nothing more, nothing less.  He's averaged 29.5 yards with no touchdowns the last four games and shouldn't be owned in any format.  Aaron Jones started in this one but didn't set the world on fire with his eight carries for 41 yards.
report: Jamaal Williams rushed six times for 29 yards in the Packers' Week 6 win over the 49ers.

impact: Foles fumbled, but the Eagles recovered. He also caught a 15-yard pass in a sequel to the Super Bowl's "Philly Special." Beyond that, Foles was completely unwatchable, but the Eagles somehow eked out a victory. Foles had no one to throw to but undershot a few deep balls. His interception was a late pass Dallas Goedert couldn't hold onto as he was immediately hit. Foles looked disturbingly similar to the pumpkin he was down the stretch last season before suddenly morphing into Steve Young for the NFC Championship Game and Super Bowl. With Carson Wentz (knee) looking unlikely to be cleared for Week 2, Foles will have an easier matchup in the Bucs.
report: Nick Foles completed 19-of-34 passes for 117 yards, zero touchdowns and an interception in the Eagles' 18-12, Week 1 win over the Falcons.

impact: OC Mike Groh said the team has already made their decision, and most reporters expect Nick Foles to once again get the nod. Foles struggled in the opener, throwing for just 117 yards while completing 56 percent of his throws, but he gets an easier matchup this week in Tampa Bay.
report: Eagles will announce their Week 2 starter at quarterback on Wednesday.

impact: Not a surprise at all, as Carson Wentz (knee) still has yet to be cleared for contact.  Foles was dreadful in the opener, going 19-of-34 for a measly 117 yards and an interceptions, but the Eagles still escaped with a win.  This is a good on-paper matchup, but Foles can't be trusted as more than a QB2.
report: Coach Doug Pederson confirmed Nick Foles will start Week 2 against the Bucs.

impact: Foles' efficiency looks decent on paper, but he gripped the ball too long in the pocket, took six sacks, and needed an entire half to get the offense moving against a bad defense.  Foles remains a high-end NFL backup, but he's obviously a severe downgrade from Carson Wentz.  ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Sunday that Wentz will have a real chance to return for Week 3 against the Colts.
report: Nick Foles completed 35-of-48 passes for 334 yards and a touchdown in the Eagles' Week 2 loss at Tampa Bay.

impact: Per RapSheet, Wentz could be sidelined until October. Wentz reportedly looked great in pre-game warmups on Thursday, but the Eagles are intent on being as thorough and cautious as possible with their franchise player. RapSheet reports that had Wentz just torn his ACL he would have already been back by now. It's his LCL damage that has prolonged his recovery. Nick Foles, despite his playoff heroics, looked dreadful in the preseason. Foles' early play could certainly have an effect on Wentz's timeline.
report: NFL.com's Ian Rapoport reports Carson Wentz (knee) is expected to be sidelined "several more weeks."

impact: According to the Philly Voice's Jimmy Kempski, Mortensen said Wentz has yet to be cleared, but he is trending that direction. "He has reached that threshold in being able to protect himself," Mortensen continued. "So, sooner than later on Carson Wentz." Kempski doubts the Eagles will risk Wentz against a Bucs team they should be able to handle in Week 2, but it would not be surprising if he is ready to go Week 3.
report: ESPN's Chris Mortensen reports Carson Wentz (knee) "hasn’t been ruled out for Week 2."

impact: Wentz seems to be making good progress in his recovery from last year's torn ACL and being cleared for contact would obviously be a step in the right direction. However, it might still be "a few weeks" before he's ready for game action. The Eagles aren't interested in bringing Wentz back at less than 100 percent and will continue to start Super Bowl MVP Nick Foles in his absence.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Carson Wentz (knee) could be cleared for contact as early as this week.

impact: Wentz is expected to be cleared for contact this week. He's reportedly looked great at practice, but the Eagles have stuck to their plan to move him slowly. Wentz is nine months removed from tearing two knee ligaments and has reached the point where he can protect himself. The Eagles may limit Wentz's exposure in his first game since last Week 14, but his return is an upgrade to Philly's pass offense.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Carson Wentz (knee) is on track to return for Week 3 against the Colts.

impact: This was the expectation over the weekend, but it is now official. It is always a risk to use a player coming off a long injury layoff, and the Eagles have serious questions at receiver. Even so, it will be difficult to sit Wentz in a great matchup against the Colts. Wentz threw for 3,296 yards and 33 touchdowns in 13 games last season.
report: Carson Wentz (knee) has been cleared and will start Week 3 against the Colts.

impact: Playing in his first game since Week 14 of last season, Wentz worked with a skeleton crew on offense in the driving rain. Wentz battled through enormous pressure, getting sacked five times, losing a fumble on one for his second turnover deep in Eagles territory. His day started off strong, completing 5-of-7 passes for 48 yards on his first possession, capped by a 13-yard touchdown strike to Dallas Goedert. The Eagles may get Alshon Jeffery back soon for Wentz, but their offense has struggled out of the gates to open the season as a byproduct of all their injuries. Wentz will enter Week 4 as a high-QB2 option on the road against the Titans.
report: Carson Wentz completed 25-of-37 passes for 255 yards with one touchdown and one interception while rushing three times for 10 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Colts.

impact: It was a disappointing loss for the Eagles, but Wentz performed well in his second game back despite his receivers letting him down a few times. He consistently threw lasers from the pocket including on Alshon Jeffery's touchdown catch and looked healthy when on the move. With Minnesota's defense scuffling, Wentz will be in the QB1 conversation next week.
report: Carson Wentz completed 33-of-50 passes for 348 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles' Week 4, overtime loss to the Titans.

impact: The Eagles have opened the season slowly including a loss to the Titans in Wentz's second start last week, but the quarterback does not blame his surgically-repaired knee. "Physically, I feel great," Wentz said. "I feel I'm picking up [where I left off] on the field last year." Wentz did play extremely well in the loss, and he connected several times in that game with Alshon Jeffery, who was making his season debut. With those two healthy, the Eagles' offense will be just fine.
report: Carson Wentz said the "knee thing" is behind him.

impact: Wentz added five carries for 26 additional yards. Wentz's second quarter fumble provided the difference in the score, as a scarily-fast Linval Joseph housed it for a 64-yard touchdown. Otherwise, Wentz took another incremental step into the season, producing 300 yards and two scores for the second-straight game while posting an 8.89 YPA after entering the week with a 6.93 mark. Wentz could have had a better day but was hurt by some drops. Wentz is passing both the eye and box score tests. He will be a borderline QB1 for Thursday night's game with the Giants.
report: Carson Wentz completed 24-of-35 passes for 311 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles' 23-21, Week 5 loss to the Vikings, also losing a fumble.

impact: This one was an extended scrimmage for the Eagles, who dominated an overmatched Giants team from the opening whistle. The three-score effort was Wentz's first in four 2018 starts. Wentz showed excellent mobility, especially on his first touchdown. Wentz vacated the pocket and rolled to his right before throwing across his body to Alshon Jeffery in the end zone. After some rusty play in Weeks 3 and 4, Wentz has started to resemble his would-have-been-if-not-for-injury 2017 MVP self over the past two weeks. He has 10 days to rest up for a Week 7 matchup with the Panthers.
report: Carson Wentz completed 26-of-36 passes for 278 yards, three touchdowns and zero interceptions in the Eagles' 34-13, Week 6 demolition of the Giants.

impact: Wentz is working through a back injury, though it shouldn't prevent him from playing Sunday when the Eagles host Carolina. Coming off ACL surgery in 2017, the third-year signal-caller has played well this season, topping 300 yards passing in two of his last three games. He's worth firing up as a QB1 in Week 7.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Wentz was limited by a back injury to start the week but returned to full participation only a day later. He'll be in the QB1 discussion Sunday against Carolina.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was upgraded to full practice on Thursday.

impact: Wentz was very nearly perfect, but Cam Newton could not be stopped in the second half, and Philadelphia’s defense melted down after Doug Pederson’s offense built a 17-0 first-half lead. Wentz has played at a QB1-level in four straight games. Although his Week 8 matchup looks difficult on paper against Jacksonville in London, the Jaguars appear to be a crumbling team. Wentz will be a fringe fantasy starter.
report: Carson Wentz completed 30-of-37 passes for 310 yards and two touchdowns in the Eagles’ Week 7 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Wentz followed the same routine last week. He'll be fine for Sunday's game in London. Wentz will be in play as a back-end QB1 against Jacksonville.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Wentz was limited to start the week but he was back to full work at Thursday's session. Going against a suddenly vulnerable Jacksonville defense, Wentz will be in the QB1 discussion Sunday at Wembley Stadium.
report: Carson Wentz (back) was upgraded to full participation at Thursday's practice.

impact: A dream fantasy scenario unfolded once the Chargers fell behind 14-3 in the first quarter. Rivers is a legendary comeback-mode predator. He did not disappoint despite the best efforts of his receivers, who committed some truly horrifying drops. Tyrell Williams and Travis Benjamin both bungled certain touchdowns, while Rivers missed Benjamin on another. It was a thoroughly Chargers game, from the mistakes to the garbage time. Rivers gets the Bills on the road in Week 2. That's a long road trip.
report: Philip Rivers completed 34-of-51 passes for 424 yards, three touchdowns and an interception in the Chargers' 38-28, Week 1 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: It was a near-perfect game from Rivers, who didn't face any resistance from an injured Buffalo secondary. Rivers threw a touchdown to Mike Williams on the opening drive, with his other two coming on checkdowns to Melvin Gordon. This was another cupcake matchup for Rivers after shredding the Chiefs in the opener, but he's been locked in to start the year. The Chargers have a matchup with the Rams in Week 3.
report: Philip Rivers completed 23-of-27 passes for 256 yards and three touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 2 win over Buffalo.

impact: Coming off a three touchdown performance against the Bills, Rivers had a tougher matchup with the Rams this week, but he was still able to put together a respectable fantasy performance. Both touchdown passes went to Mike Williams who appears to have taken a second-year leap after being sidelined with injuries as a rookie. Rivers and the Chargers have an opportunity to get back in the win column next Sunday at home against the 49ers.
report: Philip Rivers completed 18-of-30 passes for 226 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Rivers passed John Elway for the eighth-most career passing yards in league history during the close home win. All three of his touchdown passes went to non-receivers, which will frustrate Keenan Allen and Mike Williams' fantasy owners, but Melvin Gordon and Austin Ekeler's receiving production is helping Rivers fill the stat sheet. Through four games, Rivers is averaging 289 passing yards and 2.75 touchdowns. He will be a QB1 next week against the Raiders.
report: Philip Rivers completed 25-of-39 passes for 250 yards, three touchdowns, and one interception in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: It was an extremely efficient afternoon for Rivers, who totaled just five incompletions en route to his second 300-plus yard performance on the year. Both scores came on throws out to the flats, including one in which he bobbled the snap, quickly regrouped, and side-armed a laser in the direction of Austin Ekeler (7-59-1), who shuffled his way past two defenders and into the end zone. Keenan Allen's touchdown toll has taken a hit this season, but Rivers has still stood upright as a strong QB1 due in part to the added involvement of both Melvin Gordon and Ekeler in Los Angeles' passing attack. Rivers is currently averaging 299 yards and 2.6 touchdowns through five games this season. He'll be a strong QB1 again in Week 6 against the Browns.
report: Philip Rivers completed 22-of-27 passes for 339 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 5 victory over the Raiders.

impact: The 11 completions were the fewest in a game for Rivers since Week 16 of 2012. With the Chargers up big, he just wasn't needed as he attempted just five total passes in the second half on Sunday. Both of Rivers' scores went to Tyrell Williams in the second quarter. Rivers is having a tremendous start to the season with 15 touchdown passes to just three interceptions and will be in the lower-end QB1 mix next week in London versus the Titans.
report: Philip Rivers completed 11-of-20 passes for 207 yards with two touchdowns and one interception in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Rivers hit Tyrell Williams on a 75-yard bomb on the Chargers’ first play from scrimmage. Both of his touchdowns were 50-plus yards, with Mike Williams beating the Titans deep to open the second half. Rivers attempted only 26 passes but he's been a lot more efficient this year with a 17:3 TD/INT ratio. The Chargers are on bye next week, but Rivers will be in the lower-end QB1 mix against Seattle in Week 9.
report: Philip Rivers completed 19-of-26 passes for 306 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 7 win over the Titans.

impact: The Niners are grasping at straws after losing Jimmy Garoppolo (ACL).   One of the least-mobile quarterbacks in modern NFL history, Savage failed to make the Saints' 53-man roster in training camp.  C.J. Beathard will be the 49ers' starter for the foreseeable future, unless of course he plays his way out of it.
report: The 49ers are working out free agent Tom Savage.

impact: The 49ers were already working out Savage, so this isn't too surprising. Garafolo and NFL Media's Jim Trotter believe a veteran quarterback won't be signed this week, however, because the 49ers need the roster spots to fill other positions. Whoever ends up signing will be C.J. Beathard's backup to start. Savage has more career interceptions than touchdowns and has a 5.7 adjusted YPA. There's no way that Savage is the best free agent quarterback available.
report: According to NFL Network's Mike Garafolo, free agent Tom Savage is considered the "favorite" of veteran quarterbacks to sign with the 49ers.

impact: C.J. Beathard has played well since taking over the starting job, but the 49ers would like some more insurance behind him with Nick Mullens currently filling the No. 2 spot. According to Maiocco, Tom Savage is the favorite for the job, but Matt Simms is also in the mix.
report: NBC Sports Bay Area's Matt Maiocco reports the 49ers want to add a third quarterback to the roster.

impact: The NFL's "meritocracy" strikes again. The 49ers have wanted to add a third quarterback since Jimmy Garoppolo was lost for the season. For some reason they have settled on Savage, one of the worst quarterbacks we have ever seen take regular snaps in the NFL. Savage has zero movement skills or accuracy. It would be pure cataclysm for the 49ers were he forced into a game behind C.J. Beathard. Considering the reckless nature of Beathard's game, Savage could certainly see snaps. Second-year UDFA Nick Mullens is the other quarterback on the roster.
report: 49ers signed QB Tom Savage.

impact: Savage lasted four days with the 49ers. It's possible he'll be re-signed after this week. With Jimmie Ward (hamstring) doubtful, the 49ers promoted DB Tyvis Powell to the active roster.
report: 49ers waived QB Tom Savage.

impact: Savage returns as depth behind C.J. Beathard.
report: 49ers re-signed QB Tom Savage.

impact: It suggests Melvin Gordon (hamstring) is on the wrong side of questionable. Newsome would be the No. 3 back behind Austin Ekeler and Justin Jackson if Gordon is ruled out.
report: Chargers signed RB Detrez Newsome from the practice squad.

impact: Beathard did not officially record a stat, but he threw a beautiful pass to George Kittle in the end zone which was negated by a spurious offensive pass interference call. With Garoppolo likely looking at an ACL tear, Beathard is in line to take over the 49ers' starting job. He averaged 237 yards with three touchdowns and five interceptions in five starts last season.
report: C.J. Beathard replaced Jimmy Garoppolo (knee) in the 49ers' Week 3 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Beathard wasn't so bad in the game with Kyle Shanahan only asking his quarterback to attempt two passes 20+ yards down the field. The 49ers might be able to dink-and-dunk their way down the field like they did today, but it's tough to imagine this offense being explosive with Beathard and a below average receiving group. He averaged 237 yards and only had three total touchdowns in five starts last season.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 23-of-37 passes for 298 yards, two touchdowns, and two interceptions in the 49ers' Week 4 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Beathard was also sacked four times for a loss of 49 yards. After playing surprisingly well in last week's loss to the Chargers, Beathard took a noticeable step back against the Cardinals. He was a turnover machine, throwing a pair of interceptions while also losing two fumbles. One of those fumbles was returned for a 23-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter, which essentially sealed the victory for Arizona. The 24-year-old benefited from garbage time, logging over 200 passing yards with San Francisco trailing in the second half. His lone rushing score came on a one-yard QB sneak. Outside of two-quarterback leagues, Beathard won't be someone fantasy owners can rely on next week at Green Bay.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 34-of-54 passes for 349 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while adding two carries for seven yards and another touchdown Sunday in the Niners’ Week 5 loss to the Cardinals.

impact: Beathard played so well for 58 minutes of this one.  He had a near-perfect passer rating and was carving up a banged-up Packers secondary, but a late interception with 1:07 left and the game tied at 30-30 set Aaron Rodgers up at his own 10-yard line.  The magic then happened, as Rodgers dropped dimes for 46 yards passing with a 21-yard scramble to finish the comeback.  Beathard's game can't go overlooked, though.  He threw 67- and 30-yard touchdowns to Marquise Goodwin, who roasted Kentrell Brice and Tramon Williams on each.  Beathard also showed big guts and toughness with 21 rushing yards, diving headfirst for first downs.  This was one of the most entertaining games of the year.  Beathard will do battle with the Rams in Santa Clara in Week 7.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 16-of-23 passes for 245 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the 49ers' 33-30, Week 6 loss to the Packers on Monday night.

impact: Beathard had a rough first half, turning the ball over twice including a lost fumble and failing to complete a pass to a receiver. He did find George Kittle for several big plays, however, including a 10-yard touchdown with just 10 seconds left to at least give the 49ers a chance. Unfortunately for San Francisco, he could not build on that drive in the second half, and he tossed another interception on a pass thrown slightly behind Kittle in the third quarter. Beathard has to take some blame for the showing, but he was constantly under pressure and ended up taking seven sacks. The road will not get any easier in Arizona against an underrated defense next week.
report: C.J. Beathard completed 15-of-27 passes for 170 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the 49ers' Week 7 loss to the Rams.

impact: The Chargers were committed to exploiting the Chiefs' awful inside linebackers with Gordon and Austin Ekeler's receiving. Gordon's receptions matched a career high while the 100-yard day through the air was the first of his career. Whether it was via land or sky, Gordon was looking smooth and powerful, albeit against one of the league's worst defenses. Gordon did serious damage after first contact. Gordon will have a chance to get a hot streak going against the pathetic Bills in Week 2.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 15 times for 64 yards in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs, adding a ridiculous nine receptions for 102 additional yards.

impact: Gordon did all of his damage in the first half. He went untouched on 20-yard run for his first score before beating the Bills for two red-zone TDs. Gordon was held in check on the ground, but his pass game usage continues to be encouraging. The Chargers rested Gordon most of the fourth quarter after picking up a minor injury. Gordon will remain a locked-in RB1 for Week 3 against the Rams.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed nine times for 28 yards and a touchdown and caught 6-of-7 passes for 38 yards and two touchdowns in the Chargers' Week 2 win over Buffalo.

impact: Gordon suffered the injury late in Sunday's win at Buffalo, though obviously it was nothing serious. Coming off last week's three-touchdown performance, Gordon belongs in the RB1 discussion for Week 3, even in a tough matchup against the 2-0 Rams.
report: Melvin Gordon (neck) is practicing in full for Week 3 against the Rams.

impact: Gordon was fine on the ground -- 5.3 YPC and had an 11-yard touchdown -- but his receiving volume took an unexpected hit, even with the Chargers trailing for most of the game. Gordon had 15 receptions in his first two games, but only hauled in two passes against the Rams. Chargers coach Anthony Lynn has made it public that he wants to use Gordon as a receiver, so expect his receiving volume to rebound next Sunday against the 49ers. Gordon remains a locked-in RB1.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 15 times for 80 yards and one touchdown and caught 2-of-4 targets for four yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: Gordon broke 100 rushing yards for the first time since Week 8 of 2017, but it's his workload as a receiver that makes Gordon so valuable. Gordon is essentially matching Keenan Allen's receiving production -- they both have 24 receptions on the year -- on top of his rushing stats. Gordon is averaging 118.75 total yards, 1.25 total touchdowns, and six receptions per game with the season 25 percent over. Gordon will be an elite RB1 next Sunday against the Raiders, who are currently getting shredded by Nick Chubb and Carlos Hyde.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 15 times for 104 yards, and also added seven receptions for 55 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Gordon's across-the-board usage continued into Sunday as he hauled in all four of his targets for 62 yards. It wasn't pretty, but Gordon also mustered 58 yards rushing on a team-high 19 carries, out-touching teammate Austin Ekeler 23-7 on the day. With the Chargers leading big in the fourth quarter, Los Angeles rested Gordon on the team's final drive. Arguably the club's No. 2 receiver at this time, Gordon's weekly floor makes him as safe as any top option. He's now averaging 14.6 carries, 7.6 targets, and 119 total yards through five games this year. He'll remain an RB1 in Cleveland in Week 6.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 19 times for 58 yards and one touchdown, adding four catches for 62 yards in the Chargers' week 5 victory over the Raiders.

impact: Gordon started the day with a 4-yard touchdown run on the Chargers' first possession of the game that got the ball rolling and the offense never looked back. He added touchdowns runs of 10 and 11 yards in the second half to bury the game. Gordon is off the best start of his career, rushing for 5.1 yards per carry through six games with nine total touchdowns. Gordon will be a set-and-forget option when the Chargers head to London in Week 7 versus the Titans.
report: Melvin Gordon rushed 18 times for 132 yards with three touchdowns while catching 2-of-4 targets for 18 yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Gordon was limited in Friday's practice but has no injury designation for Sunday's game. Chargers coach Anthony Lynn said Gordon was dealing with some cramping issues. He'll be an RB1 against the Titans in London.
report: Melvin Gordon (hamstring) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: Gordon was limited in Friday's practice but the Chargers didn't list him on the injury report. It sounds like his hamstring issue is more than just cramping. Late week downgrades are never good, so this is a legitimate concern. With the Chargers playing in London, we'll know Gordon's status early Sunday.
report: Melvin Gordon (hamstring) has been downgraded to questionable for Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: Gordon was downgraded to questionable Saturday after his hamstring injury was more serious than initially thought. His status was tipped when Detrez Newsome was promoted from the practice squad. Hamstring injuries can linger, but Gordon has a bye next week to get healthy. Austin Ekeler will start for Gordon and is a plug-and-play RB2, with Justin Jackson backing him up.
report: Melvin Gordon (hamstring) has been ruled out for Week 7 against the Titans.

impact: They cut Detrez Newsome in a corresponding move.  The Bolts will move forward with seventh-round rookie Jackson and Austin Ekeler behind Melvin Gordon.
report: Chargers promoted RB Justin Jackson from their practice squad.

impact: The 126 yards from scrimmage were a new career high. The Chargers were intent on featuring Ekeler and Melvin Gordon as pass catchers against the Chiefs' suspect linebacker corps. The mission was accomplished. Ekeler is still little more than an RB5/handcuff for fantasy purposes, though he would be an instant RB2 were Gordon to go down with injury.
report: Austin Ekeler caught 5-of-5 targets for 87 yards and a touchdown in the Chargers' Week 1 loss to the Chiefs, adding five carries for 39 additional yards.

impact: Ekeler was heavily involved for the second straight week. His touches were inflated with Melvin Gordon checking out with an injury in the fourth quarter, but it's becoming clear the Chargers have a role for Ekeler in their weekly gameplan. Ekeler is on the radar as a PPR FLEX for Week 3 against the Rams.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed 11 times for 77 yards and caught three passes for 21 yards in Week 2 against Buffalo.

impact: The Chargers have given Ekeler a small, defined role in the offense, and he is certainly making the most of his opportunities. Through three games, the change-of-pace back is averaging 8.15 yards per carry and 12 yards per reception. Ekeler is a weak PPR FLEX for Week 4 against the 49ers, but he would be an instant RB2 if Gordon ever misses time.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed four times for 44 yards and caught all three of his targets for 24 yards in the Chargers' Week 3 loss to the Rams.

impact: The Chargers have been giving Ekeler some looks every week behind Melvin Gordon, and he's been able to make the most of them. Today, Ekeler hauled in a 22-yard touchdown on a beautiful pass from Philip Rivers to save his fantasy day. It's nothing special, but Ekeler is a low-end FLEX option during the bye week season in 12-team leagues.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed eight times for 25 yards but caught 2-of-3 targets for 31 yards and touchdown in the Chargers' Week 4 win over the 49ers.

impact: Ekeler continued his 70-30 timeshare with teammate Melvin Gordon Sunday, being out-touched 23-7 on the day. Ekeler's carries primarily occurred in the team's final drive with the game already put to bed. His lone score was a terrific effort from both he and Philip Rivers, the latter who quickly recouped after bobbling the initial snap, looked to his right, and fired a laser to Ekeler, who broke ankles on his way into the end zone, in the flats. This performance puts Ekeler on pace for a standalone valuable 108-649 rushing and 44-662-9 receiving year.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed six times for 15 yards, additionally scampering for a 44-yard touchdown catch in the Chargers' Week 5 win over the Raiders.

impact: This was the first game in which Ekeler wasn't targeted in the passing game, but the Chargers threw just five passes in the second half. Ekeler is now averaging a gaudy 6.4 yards per carry now on the season in relief of Melvin Gordon. He will enter Week 7 as a FLEX option when the Chargers face the Titans in London.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed seven times for 60 yards in Sunday's Week 6 win over the Browns.

impact: Ekeler got the start with Melvin Gordon out. This was one of his worse games of the year despite the expanded role. The Chargers scored both of their touchdowns on deep shots, so there wasn't a ton of red-zone opportunities for Ekeler. With Los Angeles on a bye, Ekeler looks destined to resume a change-up role in Week 9.
report: Austin Ekeler rushed 12 times for 42 yards and caught 5-of-7 passes for 26 yards in the  Chargers' Week 7 win over the Titans.

impact: It was the Browns' first victory in 635 days. Unfathomable. With all due respect to Taylor, Mayfield looked like he was playing a different sport. Quick and decisive where Taylor was methodical and inaccurate, Mayfield was firing lasers. His numbers would have been even better if not for a few drops, though he was also lucky to escape without an interception. There will be some rookie growing pains, but Mayfield is going to transform an offense that was close to unwatchable throughout its first 2.5 games. His insertion under center will vault David Njoku back into TE1 consideration while putting Antonio Callaway on the WR3 map.
report: On in relief of an injured Tyrod Taylor (concussion), Baker Mayfield completed 17-of-23 passes for 201 yards, zero touchdowns and zero interceptions in the Browns' 21-17, Week 3 win over the Jets.

impact: The tape will tell Jackson to start Mayfield, and the No. 1 overall pick will be under center against the Raiders.
report: Speaking after Thursday's win over the Jets, Browns coach Hue Jackson said he would have to "watch the tape" before naming his Week 4 starter.

impact: His decision will be Baker Mayfield.
report: Coach Hue Jackson will meet with the team Monday to announce his decision on the Browns' starting quarterback.

impact: This has been the expectation all along. The decision for coach Hue Jackson was a fairly easy one as the reigning Heisman Trophy winner looked miles better than Tyrod Taylor in Thursday's victory over the Jets. It appears Taylor will be able to clear the concussion protocol in time for next week's game at Oakland but he'll be holding the clipboard for Mayfield. The No. 1 overall pick is ready to slot in as an every-week starter in two-quarterback leagues, with room to grow in standard.
report: Mary Kay Cabot of the Cleveland Plain Dealer reports Baker Mayfield will be named the Browns' starting quarterback on Monday.

impact: "Baker understands there's still a lot of work to do," Jackson said. "But I think he can handle it. He's demonstrated that." He would have been able to handle it Week 1, but better late than never. Mayfield getting the nod is a big upgrade for the entire passing game. Tyrod Taylor (concussion) will serve as the backup once he is healthy.
report: Browns coach Hue Jackson named Baker Mayfield the starting quarterback.

impact: He added four rushes for ten yards.  One of Mayfield's picks was innocous, getting inercepted by Raiders S Reggie Nelson at the end of regulation.  Otherwise, Mayfield consistently kept Cleveland's offense on the move despite getting very little help from his pass catchers.  Antonio Callaway committed multiple drops, and Jarvis Landry, David Njoku, and Duke Johnson all dropped passes as well.  Mayfield will be a two-QB-league starter in Week 5 against the Ravens.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 21-of-41 passes for 295 yards, two touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Browns' Week 4 loss to Oakland.

impact: Mayfield added 23 yards rushing on two attempts. He connected with Rashard Higgins for a 19-yard touchdown with 40 seconds left in the first half for the only touchdown of the game. Mayfield was at his best in overtime, connecting on 4-of-7 passes for 80 yards, including a 39-yard catch and run by Derrick Willies to set up the game-winning field goal. Mayfield has brought excitement to the Browns organization, leading the team two wins over the past the three weeks, but those real-life results have not translated to major fantasy success. Mayfield will enter Week 6 as a lower-end QB2 when the Browns host the Chargers.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 25-of-43 passes for 342 yards with one touchdown and one interception in Sunday's Week 5 win over the Ravens.

impact: Mayfield added eight yards rushing on two carries. Sunday was the first game in which Mayfield looked like a rookie as he threw two interceptions on late throws. He was under constant pressure, taking five sacks in the game and was constantly moved off his spot by the Charger pass rush. Mayfield's lone touchdown came on a 1-yard cosmetic score to David Njoku in garbage time. Despite his struggles today, Mayfield will be a popular streaming option Week 7 on the road versus the Buccaneers.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 22-of-46 passes for 238 yards with one touchdown and two interceptions in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Chargers.

impact: Mayfield suffered a nasty looking ankle injury against the Chargers, but he played through it the rest of the game. He will need "treatment" this week, but he is expected to be fine for Sunday. In a great matchup against the Bucs, Mayfield will be a back-end QB1.
report: Baker Mayfield (ankle) is expected to play Week 7 against the Bucs.

impact: "Baker's fine," Jackson said. Mayfield could get a "limited" tag or two in practice, but he will be out there for his dream Week 7 matchup with the Bucs. The problem is not Mayfield's health but his supporting cast. Mayfield has precious few weapons to throw the ball to. Even still, he's very much on the streaming radar this week.
report: Speaking Monday, Browns coach Hue Jackson confirmed Baker Mayfield's ankle injury won't affect his Week 7 status.

impact: Mayfield added a season-high 43 rushing yards on four carries on the ground. The day overall was a disappointment for fantasy owners as the Bucs had allowed a 300-yard passer in every game to date prior to Sunday. Mayfield and the Browns were invisible in the first half as he threw for just 62 yards through the opening two quarters. In the second half, Mayfield found David Njoku for a 15-yard score to open the half and then connected with Jarvis Landry for a 16-yard score to tie the game with 2:28 left in regulation. Mayfield was under constant duress once again, taking five sacks, the third straight game in which he was sacked at least five times. His one blemish on the day was when he rushed for a clear first down deep in Tampa Bay territory on fourth down, but then fumbled the ball backwards out of bounds behind the sticks, costing the Browns at least a field goal attempt. Mayfield will only be a QB2 option Week 8 when the Browns head to Pittsburgh.
report: Baker Mayfield completed 23-of-34 passes for 215 yards and two touchdowns in Sunday's Week 7 loss to the Buccaneers.

impact: The long buzzed-about ex-basketball player was active in Week 1, catching one pass. The Colts just haven't seen the development they need, and snaps and targets were going to be sparse behind Jack Doyle and Eric Ebron. Now 26, Swoope might not be a candidate for the practice squad. DT Jihad Ward has been promoted from the practice squad in a corresponding roster move.
report: Colts waived TE Erik Swoope.

impact: The Colts will have Eric Ebron, Swoope, and Ryan Hewitt (primarily a blocking tight end) available Sunday with Jack Doyle (hip) out. Swoope’s 2017 campaign was derailed due to a nagging knee injury, but he finished top-five among all tight ends in yards per catch (19.8) when healthy the year prior. Sunday still sets up terrifically for Ebron, who should seamlessly replace Doyle in a full-time role. Doyle has quietly run the most routes (81) among all tight ends so far this year, giving Ebron a high floor (if only for his inevitable usage), as well.
report: Colts added TE Erik Swoope from their practice squad.

impact: Even with Jack Doyle (hip) absent last week, Swoope was targeted just once on eight snaps in the loss to Philadelphia. With Swoope out of the picture, the Colts will go with Ryan Hewitt behind Eric Ebron, who will draw another start at tight end with Doyle out for the second week in a row.
report: Colts waived TE Erik Swoope.

impact: Swoope nearly had a second score in the dying moments of garbage time but was ruled down at the one-yard line. Yo-yoing on and off the 53-man roster, Swoope is miles from fantasy relevance.
report: Erik Swoope caught 3-of-3 targets for 44 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Swoope played behind Mo Alie-Cox in the Colts' backup tight end timeshare with Eric Ebron out in front.  Swoope is a Dynasty stash but nothing more.
report: Erik Swoope caught 1-of-2 targets for a two-yard touchdown in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: This is only notable with Jack Doyle sidelined. Mo Alie-Cox will handle No. 2 tight end duties if Swoope is held out.
report: Colts TE Erik Swoope (knee) is questionable for Week 7 against Buffalo.

impact: Swoope was questionable for this game with a knee injury and may have aggravated it. He caught his lone target for a 17-yard touchdown off a play-action pass from Andrew Luck before exiting in the second quarter. With Swoope banged up and Jack Doyle (hip) inactive, the Colts are looking thin at tight end behind Eric Ebron.
report: Colts TE Erik Swoope (knee) left Sunday's Week 7 game against the Bills and is questionable to return.

impact: He wasn't able to practice this week after injuring his knee in Sunday's win over Buffalo. With Eric Ebron playing well and Jack Doyle back from his hip injury, Swoope doesn't carry any fantasy significance.
report: Erik Swoope (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: This is a big step in the correct direction after Rodgers was only able to practice on Saturday each of the last two weeks. It is unlikely he does much of anything in practice, but the activity suggests his knee is getting better. Rodgers will be a solid QB1 against the Bills this Sunday.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) is expected to practice Thursday.

impact: Rodgers is still feeling the effects of a knee injury he suffered in Week 1, but he's played through it the last two weeks and will likely do so again in Week 4. He should be in all fantasy lineups for Sunday's matchup against Buffalo.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Rodgers got in a pair of limited practices this week, which is the most practice work we've seen him get since injuring his knee in Week 1. He'll be out there Sunday in a great spot against Buffalo. Rodgers is RotoPat's second-ranked quarterback for Week 4.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) is questionable for Week 4 against the Bills.

impact: It was a dreary, dull affair against an overmatched Bills team. Rodgers was steamed in his post-game press conference about the Packers' lack of production. A positive was Rodgers' increased mobility. Although still nowhere close to 100 percent, Rodgers did look healthier and more willing to run. Rodgers' pick was a tip drill from Jimmy Graham, who also caught Rodgers' score. It was the duo's first end zone connection. The Packers venture to Detroit for Week 5.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 22-of-40 passes for 298 yards, one touchdown and an interception in the Packers' 22-0, Week 4 win over the Bills, adding five carries for 31 additional yards.

impact: This isn't a surprise.  Rodgers is still recovering from his Week 1 knee issue and is with the rehab group.  He's expected to practice Thursday and Saturday and play Sunday against Detroit as an unquestioned elite QB1.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: It's a sign that he'll be ready for Week 5, not that there was ever much doubt about his availability for Sunday's game in Detroit. The bigger issue for Rodgers will be his receiving corps as Davante Adams (calf), Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion) have all been absent from practice this week. If none of them can suit up, Rodgers would have to be reduced to back-end QB1 status.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) returned to practice on Thursday.

impact: Rodgers figures to still get slapped with "limited" tags on Wednesdays, but it's another positive step forward in his recovery. Although still clearly not 100 percent healthy, Rodgers looked more mobile in Week 4. His concern for Week 5 is the potential absence of his top-three receivers. If each of Davante Adams (calf), Geronimo Allison (concussion) and Randall Cobb (hamstring) sits against the Lions, Rodgers will be a back-end QB1.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) has resumed practicing in full.

impact: It's not a surprise after Rodgers practiced in full this week. Rodgers is healthy, but his supporting cast is shaky going into Week 5. He's more of a back-end QB1 against the Lions.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) has been removed from the Packers' injury report.

impact: Rodgers has been critical of the Packers' offense this year, calling the team's play in last week's win over Buffalo "not acceptable." There have been rumblings of a rift between Rodgers and his head coach, but Murphy isn't buying it. "I think they've had a great relationship," said Murphy. "The most important thing, they both want the same thing—they want us to win and obviously score as many points as possible." Part of the problem for Green Bay is that their receiving corps has been running on fumes with injuries to Randall Cobb (hamstring) and Geronimo Allison (concussion, hamstring), among others. Luckily Rodgers' health has improved significantly as the two-time MVP was finally removed from the injury report this week after struggling with knee issues early in the year.
report: Packers CEO and president Mark Murphy downplayed the tension between Aaron Rodgers and coach Mike McCarthy.

impact: He added 10 rushing yards on three attempts and also lost a pair of fumbles on strip-sacks.  The Packers fell in a huge hole early in the game and pretty much had to abandon the run game by the second quarter.  With Randall Cobb and Geronimo Allison out and injured for this one, Rodgers was working with Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Equanimeous St. Brown behind Davante Adams.  The rookies had some trouble getting open and staying on the same page with Rodgers, who was visibly frustrated at times.  Adams piled up 140 yards and a touchdown as the lead dog.  Rodgers gets to feast on the 49ers at Lambeau Field next Monday night.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 32-of-52 passes for 442 yards and three touchdowns in the Packers' 31-23, Week 5 loss to the Lions.

impact: The Pack are resting Rodgers as much as possible. He will be an elite QB1 against the 49ers.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) was held out of Thursday's practice.

impact: Rodgers had a setback with his knee injury, but it was never going to keep him out this week. He's one of the top quarterback plays for a matchup with the 49ers.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) was upgraded to a full practice Friday.

impact: To borrow the words from ESPN analyst Jason Witten, Rodgers pulled a "rabbit out of his head" in the incredible fourth-quarter comeback.  (Yes, Witten said head.)  Rodgers and the Packers came out piping hot to open the game, with 60- and 54-yard completions to Marquez Valdes-Scantling and Jimmy Graham, respectively.  49ers DC Robert Saleh started dialing up the blitzes the rest of the way, causing Rodgers serious problems much of the second, third, and fourth quarters, but Rodgers turned it up and absolutely diced the Niners in the final two-plus minutes with a 16-yard touchdown strike to Davante Adams to tie the game at 30-30.  (Witten used the rabbit reference here.)  Rodgers then got the ball back at his own 10-yard line with 1:07 left and threw for 46 yards and added a 21-yard run to give Mason Crosby a walkoff 27-yard field goal for the win.  The Packers are now on their bye ahead of a gargantuan Week 8 date in L.A. with the Rams.
report: Aaron Rodgers completed 25-of-46 passes for 425 yards and two touchdowns in the Packers' 33-30, Week 6 comeback win over the 49ers on Monday night.

impact: Rodgers came up a bit slowly after one sack on Monday night, but he otherwise has not looked troubled by his injured knee the last couple games, suggesting he is nearing full health. The brace has not been a hindrance for Rodgers, who has thrown for 867 yards with five touchdowns and zero interceptions the last two games.
report: Aaron Rodgers told reporters he hopes to shed his knee brace following the bye week.

impact: Rodgers is as healthy as he's been all year. He's a top-three quarterback play for Sunday's projected shootout with the Rams.
report: Aaron Rodgers (knee) is practicing in full for Week 8.

impact: He had one catch for 19 yards before leaving. Engram was quickly ruled out, so it's not a great sign for his status. The good news is Engram stayed on the sidelines and wasn't carted off. Rhett Ellison will pick up Engram's snaps.
report: Evan Engram suffered a knee injury in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: Engram was walking around with a brace on his knee after the game. He told reporters he expects to be "fine." It sounds like Engram avoided a serious injury, but he may still be looking at MCL damage. More will be known after Monday's MRI.
report: Evan Engram (knee) will undergo an MRI on Monday.

impact: It is ultimately good news after he was quickly ruled out on Sunday, but it is still likely Engram will miss some time. Rhett Ellison caught three passes for 39 yards and a touchdown against the Texans, but he is more of a blocking option. Fantasy players should look elsewhere for a replacement.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Evan Engram is "week to week" with a sprained MCL.

impact: This falls in line with what was expected. Engram will miss at least one game, and retuning in two weeks would be a best case scenario. It's still good news given how quickly Engram was ruled out Sunday. Rhett Ellison will step into an every-down role with Engram sidelined, with Garrett Dickerson a candidate to play in pass situations.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports Evan Engram (MCL sprain) is expected to miss 2-4 weeks.

impact: Engram will miss his second consecutive game after spraining his MCL in Week 3.  His timeline was reported at 2-4 weeks.  Rhett Ellison will get another start but isn't a fantasy option, even at a ransacked tight end spot.
report: Evan Engram (knee) is out for Week 5 against the Panthers.

impact: It's notable progress for Engram, who hasn't been able to participate in team activities since spraining his MCL two weeks ago. This update entails his return isn't too far off. Given time restraints, Engram will likely sit out in the Giants' upcoming short week against the Eagles on Thursday night, but could potentially be active in the club's following game.
report: Evan Engram (knee) was seen running and doing some light-cutting off to the side of practice Saturday.

impact: Engram is still nursing a sprained MCL. He's week-to-week. CB Eli Apple (groin), LB Connor Barwin (knee), CB Antonio Hamilton (groin), DT Damon Harrison (knee), WR Cody Latimer (knee) and WR Sterling Shepard (back) are all ready to roll.
report: Giants declared TE Evan Engram, C Evan Brown, DT John Jenkins, CB Mike Jordan, QB Kyle Lauletta, S Kamrin Moore and LB Olivier Vernon inactive for Week 5 against the Panthers.

impact: It still seems like a long shot, but the news is at very least notable for Engram's chances of returning by Week 7.  When Engram sprained his MCL on September 23, he was given a 2-4 week timetable.  It's been 16 days since his injury.  Blocker Rhett Ellison has been filling in as the Giants' primary tight end.
report: Coach Pat Shurmur said Monday that Evan Engram (MCL) has a "shot" to play on Thursday night against the Eagles.

impact: Shurmur said Engram had a "shot" to play this week during his press conference on Monday, and getting in a full practice on Tuesday would suggest his chances are even better than that. Even coming off an injury and in a tough matchup, Engram would be a locked-in TE1 if he is ready to go Thursday.
report: Giants coach Pat Shurmur said Evan Engram (knee) will be "full speed" during Tuesday's practice.

impact: Coach Pat Shurmur has said he's "hopeful" Engram returns to face the Eagles on Thursday night. More important than Engram's "limited" designation was the fact that Shurmur said he would be "full speed" on Tuesday. Engram is probably on the right side of questionable. If he suits up, he will be a low-end TE1. He's coming off injury for a dysfunctional offense.
report: Evan Engram (knee) was officially "limited" in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Engram returned to practice this week, but the short week with a Thursday night game wasn't enough time for him to return from his sprained MCL.  Engram should be good to go next week against the Falcons.
report: Evan Engram (knee) is out for Week 6 against the Eagles.

impact: Engram appeared close to playing last Thursday, so it is not a surprise he is back on the practice field early this week. Engram said he is very optimistic about playing Monday night against the Falcons.
report: Evan Engram (knee) participated in Tuesday's practice.

impact: Engram appeared close to a Week 6 return, so we fully expect him to be out there for Monday Night Football after 11 additional days of rest. Engram will be returning to a crowded, dysfunctional offense. Sterling Shepard and Saquon Barkley have been soaking up checkdowns from a washed Eli Manning. Hopefully Engram can get back in on the action. He will be a low-end TE1 for Week 7.
report: Evan Engram (knee) is practicing in full for Week 7.

impact: This was expected after Engram practiced fully. He was close to playing in Week 6, so he should be close to 100 percent coming off a mini-bye. Engram is in a great spot against a bottom-three Falcons pass defense that gave up touchdowns to O.J. Howard and Cameron Brate last week.
report: Evan Engram (knee) has been removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: It was Engram's first game back from a sprained MCL suffered in Week 3.  His four targets were a distant fourth on the team behind Odell Beckham (11), Saquon Barkley (10), and Sterling Shepard (8).  Engram has better days ahead and will remain a default TE1 next week against the Redskins.
report: Evan Engram caught 2-of-4 targets for 16 yards in the Giants' Week 7 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Grant led the team in receptions as a major part of Indianapolis' new short-passing offense, which doesn't stretch the field but allows Andrew Luck to pick apart defenses on quick throws.  Grant's possession-receiver game fits this style of play.  He'll be a PPR-specific WR4/flex in Week 2 at Washington.
report: Ryan Grant caught 8-of-9 targets for 59 yards in the Colts' Week 1 loss to the Bengals.

impact: He'll be fine to face his former team in Week 2. Grant set a career-high with eight catches in Sunday's opener.
report: Ryan Grant (chest) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the Redskins.

impact: So much for Grant’s #RevengeGame. He wasn’t even targeted until the fourth quarter. A week after securing a career-high eight catches, Grant was pretty much an afterthought in this one, drawing fewer targets than teammates T.Y. Hilton, Jack Doyle, Eric Ebron and Chester Rogers. Grant can be avoided in a tough matchup next week at Philadelphia.
report: Ryan Grant delivered two catches for 30 yards on two targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 2 victory over Washington.

impact: Grant scored the lone touchdown for the Colts and 5-yard fade route which he won a contested catch. After receiving nine targets in the season opener, Grant has totaled just six targets over the past two weeks despite finding the end zone Sunday. Grant now has 13 catches for 124 yards and a touchdown through three games.
report: Ryan Grant caught 3-of-4 targets for 35 yards and a touchdown in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Grant also dropped a couple balls on quick slants.  His seven targets were fifth-most on the team as he's far down the totem pole in Indy.  Grant will not be a recommended fantasy play Week 5 on the road against the Patriots, though he'll be forced to play a ton with T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) likely to sit.
report: Ryan Grant caught 5-of-7 targets for 64 yards in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: With T.Y. Hilton sidelined, Grant matched his season high for targets, though Eric Ebron and Chester Rogers both drew more looks. Averaging 49 yards, Grant's usage has been consistent, but it is not translating to anything more than WR5 fantasy value.
report: Ryan Grant caught 6-of-9 targets for 58 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: He had two catches for 25 yards on five targets before exiting in the second half.  The Colts are already missing T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) and Jack Doyle (hip), so they're leaning heavily on Eric Ebron, Zach Pascal, Chester Rogers, Erik Swoope, and Marcus Johnson in the passing game.
report: Ryan Grant left Sunday's Week 6 game against the Jets with an ankle injury and will not return.

impact: Grant had to leave in the second half last week after catching a pair of balls for 25 yards.  The good news is T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is pushing to return.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: He's still feeling the effects of an ankle injury he suffered in Week 6. With Grant shelved, look for Chester Rogers and Zach Pascal to see more involvement this week.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is out for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: Grant missed Week 7 against the Bills.  With Jack Doyle (hip) nearing a return, T.Y. Hilton healthy, and the rest of the Colts' skill players on the field, Grant is no longer a fantasy option even if he was healthy and practicing.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is not practicing Wednesday.

impact: Robert Turbin (shoulder) isn't expected back until Week 10 and was also quickly ruled out. The good news is that the Colts are expecting Jack Doyle (hip) to suit up for the first time since Week 2 against the Redskins. T.Y. Hilton, Eric Ebron, Chester Rogers, Zach Pascal, and Doyle will work as the Colts' top receiving options against the Raiders' lowly secondary on Sunday.
report: Ryan Grant (ankle) is out for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: Ebron saw five targets and got loose for a 26-yard touchdown in the second quarter, but he was used like a part-time player. Perhaps that will be enough to return TE2 fantasy value in what appears to be a pass-heavy attack, but the limited snap share should lead to up-and-down weeks.
report: Eric Ebron played 37-of-82 (45 percent) snaps Week 1 against the Bengals.

impact: Ebron did most of his damage on the opening possession, snaring two grabs for 20 yards including a seven-yard touchdown strike from Andrew Luck on third-and-three. He put up a goose egg after halftime, failing to reel in his lone second-half target. That play could have been called for pass interference on Montae Nicholson, but the refs let it slide. Ebron’s Lions tenure was mostly a disappointment, but he’s gotten off to a strong start in Indy with a touchdown in each of his first two contests. He’ll look to keep that streak going next week against Philadelphia.
report: Eric Ebron corralled three-of-four targets for 26 yards and a touchdown Sunday in the Colts’ Week 2 win over the Redskins.

impact: With Jack Doyle out of the lineup, Ebron led the Colts in targets, but was able to turn them into just pedestrian yardage. His afternoon was filled near misses, failing to reel in any of his three end zone targets. Ebron will be the lower-TE1 mix if Doyle remains sidelined next week against the Texans.
report: Eric Ebron caught 5-of-11 targets for 33 yards in Sunday's Week 3 loss to the Eagles.

impact: With Jack Doyle (hip) also banged up, an injury to Ebron is the last thing Indy needs right now. Ebron was targeted a team-high 11 times in last week's loss to Philadelphia. If Doyle and Ebron can't go for Week 4, the Colts would likely turn to Erik Swoope at tight end.
report: Eric Ebron (knee, shoulder) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Wednesday was a maintenance day. With Jack Doyle (hip) expected to remain sidelined, Ebron will be a plug-and-play TE1 against the Texans.
report: Eric Ebron (shoulder, knee) returned to Colts practice on Thursday, getting in a full session.

impact: His Week 4 status was never in question. Ebron led Indy with 11 targets last week at Philadelphia and should be in for another big workload with Jack Doyle (hip) sidelined again on Sunday.
report: Eric Ebron (shoulder, knee) wasn't listed on the Colts' final injury report for Week 4 against the Texans.

impact: Ebron has been a steady presence in the red zone for the Colts, catching three touchdowns through four games.  His one on Sunday was a five-yarder where the Texans simply forgot to cover him outside.  With the Colts throwing so much and Ebron catching touchdowns, he's on the TE1 map moving forward.  The Patriots are up next in Week 5.  Expect plenty of Ebron in a likely blowout.
report: Eric Ebron caught 5-of-10 targets for 40 yards and one touchdown in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.
