impact: Operating as the No. 1 receiver for the Colts' epically banged up offense — to say nothing of the hollowed-out defense — Ebron posted a new career high for targets while notching his first 100-yard game. True to form, Ebron also committed a drop or two, but he was finding space against the second and third levels of the Patriots' defense. His Week 6 fantasy status against the Jets will depend on Jack Doyle and T.Y. Hilton's health.
report: Eric Ebron caught 9-of-15 targets for 105 yards and two touchdowns in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: This is probably just a maintenance day for Ebron, who exploded for a career-high 105 yards and two touchdowns in last week's loss to New England. Despite a laundry list of ailments, we expect him to be out there against the Jets in Week 6. Ebron leads the tight end position with five touchdown catches this year and should remain an every-week starter in fantasy, at least for the duration of Jack Doyle's absence.
report: Eric Ebron (shin, quad, ankle, knee) did not practice on Wednesday.

impact: We would like to think the Colts are just managing Ebron's reps, but any time you are listed with four different injuries and post back-to-back DNPs, it's not exactly a good sign. That's especially true since the Colts are on their "mini" bye after last week's Thursday night game. We would ultimately still consider Ebron on the right side of questionable. He has missed a lot of practice this year. We will have a good idea by Friday.
report: Eric Ebron (shin, quad, ankle, knee) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Might have been easier to list what Ebron isn't listed with on the injury report.  But this is good news after he sat Wednesday and Thursday.  Expect Ebron to be out there teaming with Chester Rogers and Nyheim Hines as the Colts' offensive playmakers.  Ebron is a locked-in elite TE1 play while Jack Doyle (hip) sits.
report: Eric Ebron (shin, quad, ankle, knee) returned to practice Friday.

impact: Ebron was a full participant in practice Friday but is still listed as questionable due to the numerous injuries still ailing him. The Colts did suspiciously sign TE Mo Alie-Cox from their practice squad, hinting that Ebron could be limited even if active. If he suits up, he's still a strong TE1 given the (lack of) landscape at his position.
report: Eric Ebron (shin, quad, ankle, knee) is questionable for Week 6 against the Jets.

impact: Ebron barely practiced, but Colts beat writers expected him to be a go all along.  He leads all NFL tight ends with 36 targets over the last three weeks.
report: Eric Ebron is active for Week 6 against the Jets.

impact: Ebron wasn't targeted quite as heavily as usual in this one -- he came in averaging 12 per game over the previous three weeks -- but he hit pay dirt for the sixth time in six games and continues to produce as top-five fantasy TE1.  Ebron's hot stretch will be threatened whenever Jack Doyle (hip) returns, but there are no indications Doyle is close.  The Colts host the Bills next.
report: Eric Ebron caught 4-of-7 targets for 71 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: Sunday erased a three-game touchdown streak for Ebron, who also tallied his fewest receiving yards since Week 2, which was the last time he shared the field with Jack Doyle. Ebron wasn't really needed in this one as the Colts got ahead early and coasted to an easy win behind a career day from running back Marlon Mack. Despite Sunday's clunker, Ebron should remain in play as a TE1 next week in Oakland, assuming Doyle remains sidelined.
report: Eric Ebron absorbed three-of-seven targets for 31 yards Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 win over the Bills.

impact: We will give you a second to look him up. A fourth-round rookie, Dissly was expected to be more of a blocker in the NFL, but he opened the scoring with a 15-yard touchdown on play action and bounced off several defenders on a 66-yard catch-and-run to end the first quarter. He did not do much damage after that, and it is likely this is easily his biggest game of the season. Still, he is worth a look in deeper TE premium leagues with Ed Dickson out at least five more weeks.
report: Will Dissly hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 105 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Dissly did most of his damage and caught his short touchdown on the meaningless stat-padding final drive.  But, hey, they all count the same in fantasy.  He's now turned 10 targets into a 6-147-2 line through two games.  Dissly is locked in as the Seahawks' top pass-catching tight end for the foreseeable future and gets a decent matchup at home with the Cowboys in Week 3.
report: Will Dissly caught 3-of-5 targets for 42 yards and one touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: The rookie has predictably come back to Earth, managing a mere four catches for 46 yards in the two games since his breakout Week 1. Even against the lowly Cardinals, Dissly makes for a poor streamer in Week 4.
report: Will Dissly secured one-of-three targets for four yards Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 victory over Dallas.

impact: Dissly suffered an injury to his right knee on a 5-yard catch. The injury appeared to potentially serious as he needed to be taken off the field. The rookie has had a promising start to the season, catching 8-of-14 targets for 156 yards and two touchdowns.
report: Seahawks TE Will Dissly suffered a knee injury and has exited Sunday's Week 4 game versus the Cardinals.

impact: Dissly's rookie season comes to an end catching 8-of-14 targets for 156 yards and two touchdowns in just three-plus game's worth of action. Nick Vannett will take over as the lead tight end for the Seahawks for the remainder of the season.
report: Seahawks TE Will Dissly suffered a torn patella tendon in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: It's one of the most serious injuries a football player can suffer. Dissly should be considered questionable for Week 1 2019. Although he's still only 22, Dissly can be safely dropped in Dynasty leagues.
report: Seahawks placed TE Will Dissly on injured reserve with a torn patella tendon, ending his season.

impact: Rogers entered Sunday with eight catches for 49 yards on 10 targets.  He was far more active in this one after T.Y. Hilton had to leave multiple times with chest and hamstring injuries.  Rogers' 11 targets matched Nyheim Hines for the team lead on a day Andrew Luck attempted 62 passes.  With Hilton expected to miss Thursday night's Week 5 game against the Patriots, Rogers will again be relied upon.  He may have some WR5 appeal in deeper leagues in a likely catchup-mode game.
report: Chester Rogers caught 8-of-11 targets for 85 yards in the Colts' Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: Both the targets and catches matched new career highs Rogers set four days ago. Rogers also had a lowlight with a bad third quarter drop. Rogers' uptick in usage has coincided with T.Y. Hilton's hamstring injury. Hilton is looking no better than 50-50 to return in Week 6 against the Jets.
report: Chester Rogers caught 8-of-11 targets for 66 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Rogers got off to an excruciating start with multiple dropped passes.  He salvaged his fantasy bottom line on a 17-yard garbage-time touchdown with Indianapolis down multiple scores.  Nevertheless, Rogers is suddenly in prime fantasy position as the Colts lost several more pass catchers to injury on Sunday, including Ryan Grant (ankle).  With double-digit targets in three straight games, Rogers will be a fantasy starter in Week 7 versus Buffalo.
report: Chester Rogers caught 4-of-10 targets for 55 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: The bulk of his yards came on one catch, a 29-yard grab on a play where the defense forgot about him during the second quarter. That was the Colts' longest play from scrimmage. Rogers couldn't take advantage of Ryan Grant's absence, though that was mostly because the Colts stopped throwing after getting ahead early. The 25-year-old could be in play as a DFS dart throw if Grant remains sidelined for Week 8 against the Raiders.
report: Chester Rogers came down with four catches for 40 yards on four targets Sunday in Indianapolis’ Week 7 win over the Bills.

impact: Barring a surprise Friday return, Doyle will miss his second-straight game against the Texans. Eric Ebron is a fill-in TE1.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Eric Ebron was either absent or limited in practice earlier in the week but appears good to go for another spot-start in place of Doyle. Ebron saw 11 targets in Week 3 against the Eagles, but hauled in 'only' five of them for a pedestrian 33 yards. His usage and routes run still makes him a streaming TE1.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) is out for Week 4 against the Texans.

impact: The Colts didn't actually hold a practice, but the league requires teams playing on Thursday night to issue would-be injury reports on Mondays.  T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) was also listed as a non-parcipant.  If Doyle misses his third straight game, Eric Ebron will remain a top-eight TE1 option against New England.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) was listed as a non-participant in Colts practice Monday.

impact: Doyle is going to miss the Colts' short-week tilt with the Pats, his third-straight missed game. Eric Ebron is a fill-in TE1 in Doyle's absence.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained sidelined on Tuesday.

impact: As are T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) and Marlon Mack (hamstring).  The Colts will roll with Eric Ebron and Erik Swoope at tight end, with Nyheim Hines and Jordan Wilkins in the backfield.  Ebron is very much on the TE1 radar.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) is out for Week 5 against the Patriots.

impact: It doesn't sound promising for Doyle's Week 6 prospects against the Jets.  The good news is Eric Ebron has been terrific this season, turning 12 red-zone targets into four touchdowns and being one of the top fantasy tight ends.
report: Coach Frank Reich said Jack Doyle (hip) remains week to week.

impact: Doyle hasn't seen the field since Week 2 and doesn't seem particularly close to returning. Eric Ebron has settled in as an every-week fantasy starter in his absence.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Doyle and T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring) have both been ruled out for Week 6. Barring any setbacks, both LT Anthony Castonzo and Marlon Mack are expected to return Sunday. Without Doyle, Eric Ebron should remain an every-down player and top-shelf TE1. Erik Swoope will fill-in behind him in multiple tight end sets.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) is out for Week 6 against the Jets.

impact: Doyle hasn't played since Week 2 and doesn't seem close to a return.  Eric Ebron has been dominant in his absence, leading all tight ends in red-zone targets.  Ryan Grant (ankle) also missed Wednesday's session.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He'll miss his fifth straight game. Eric Ebron will continue to dominate snaps with Doyle out, with Mo Alie-Cox and Erik Swoope splitting time in two tight end sets.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) is out for Week 7 against Buffalo.

impact: This will be Doyle's fifth straight absence. He remains week-to-week with a hip injury. Eric Ebron will again start in his place. TE Erik Swoope (knee), WR T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring), DT Margus Hunt (knee), LB Darius Leonard (ankle) and CB Chris Milton (hamstring) are all active for Sunday's game in Indy.
report: Colts declared TE Jack Doyle, DT Denico Autry, S Clayton Geathers, OT Denzelle Good, WR Ryan Grant, CB Arthur Maulet and RB Robert Turbin inactive for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: Coach Frank Reich said Doyle will have a chance to play this week in Oakland.  Doyle hasn't played since Week 2.  In the meantime, Eric Ebron leads all tight ends in red-zone targets and have developed into a very useful fantasy asset.  Doyle's return would pose a bit of a drain on Ebron's usage, though he would still be heavily involved in the scoring area as a big body.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) returned to a limited practice on Wednesday.

impact: Coach Frank Reich has said Doyle has a "chance" to return against the Raiders. It's possible the Colts are easing Doyle back in with an eye toward having him return following the team's Week 9 bye. We should have a good idea as to Doyle's status by Friday afternoon. He would not be fantasy viable, though he would downgrade Eric Ebron.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: Doyle resumed practicing on a limited basis this week and should be on the field Sunday when the Colts travel to Oakland. His return is bad news for Eric Ebron, who was dominating in Doyle's absence.
report: Colts coach Frank Reich expects Jack Doyle (hip) to play against the Raiders in Week 8.

impact: We assumed this would be the case after he was upgraded to full participation at Friday's practice. Doyle is ready to make his return after sitting out the past five games with a hip injury. A wait-and-see approach might be the best course of action with Doyle coming off a long absence. His return is an obvious downgrade for Eric Ebron, who has already totaled a career-high six touchdowns this year.
report: Jack Doyle (hip) wasn't listed on the Colts' final injury report for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: It's the last thing the Bengals need after losing Tyler Eifert. Kroft's absence locks C.J. Uzomah into an every-down role.
report: Bengals TE Tyler Kroft left Week 5 against Miami with a foot injury and is questionable to return.

impact: Kroft's absence forced the Bengals to sign Matt Lengel off the Texans' practice squad.  He'll back up C.J. Uzomah, who should play 90% or more of the snaps and is very much on the streaming radar for fantasy.
report: Tyler Kroft (foot) is out for Week 6 against the Steelers.

impact: It's odd wording from coach Marvin Lewis, as Kroft has not been placed on injured reserve. It would appear Kroft is more "out indefinitely" than week to week. C.J. Uzomah is holding down the fort in Kroft and Tyler Eifert's absence.
report: The Bengals expect Tyler Kroft (foot) to return this season.

impact: Olsen will not return for Week 5, but he more or less admitted he is eyeing Week 6. Olsen will be at extreme risk of re-injury, but he's a no-brainer add in the leagues where he was cut loose when it appeared he was dealing with an indefinite injury.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) was officially "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Olsen is out for Sunday but got in some limited practice this week. Barring setbacks, he's on track to return just five weeks after re-fracturing his surgically-repaired foot. Olsen is going to be at a strong risk of re-injury, so it won't be surprising if his snaps are scaled back. A less than 100 percent Olsen is still one of the better tight ends in the league.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport reports "there's confidence" Greg Olsen (foot) will play in Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: Olsen resumed practicing this week but was never expected to play. He's shooting for a return in Week 6. DT Vernon Butler (shoulder), WR Damiere Byrd (knee), WR Curtis Samuel (illness) and OG Trai Turner (concussion) are all active for Week 5.
report: Panthers declared TE Greg Olsen, RB Cameron Artis-Payne, DE Bryan Cox Jr., CB Corn Elder, DE Marquis Haynes, OG Brendan Mahon and LB Jared Norris inactive for Week 5 against the Giants.

impact: The coach said Olsen still has one more check-up but will "hopefully" be ready to practice on Wednesday and play against Washington. Olsen started slowly when he returned from his foot injury last season, but the tight end position is too thin to keep him out of the top-12 if he suits up. Olsen should be added everywhere he was dropped.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera is hopeful Greg Olsen (foot) returns this week.

impact: It speaks to how tenuous Olsen's health is. Unable to keep his right foot healthy since last season, Olsen should be considered a week-to-week proposition for fantasy owners. Any contribution will be a bonus.
report: Speaking Monday, Greg Olsen (foot) confirmed he is expected to return for Week 6 but said he expects to require surgery at season's end.

impact: As expected.  Olsen is preparing to play this week after missing the past four weeks (three games) following a foot fracture in Week 1.  It'll be a nice boost to the fantasy position, which has been ravaged by injuries, but owners will have to take Olsen week by week.  He's a threat to re-injure the foot.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Barring a setback, Olsen will be out there for the first time since Week 1. Considering his extreme risk of re-injury, Olsen should be considered a fringe TE1 until he demonstrates the ability to stay on the field this season.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Olsen got in a few more reps Friday and is looking closer to probable. Coach Ron Rivera said he "likes [Olsen's] chances" of playing Sunday. There's a severe risk Olsen re-injures himself given the nature of his foot (and injury history the past two seasons), but the Pro-Bowler is still considered a fringe TE1 if active. Devin Funchess should be slightly downgraded given his lesser productivity with Olsen in the lineup.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) is questionable for Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: This backs up Ron Rivera's comments on Olsen's status. Olsen hasn't had any setbacks and remains on track to start after missing the last three games. He's a huge setback risk, but Olsen is a back-end TE1 for Week 6.
report: NFL Network's Tiffany Blackmon reports Greg Olsen (foot) will play in Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: Olsen will be at extreme risk of re-injury, but he's worth a roll of the dice for tight end desperados in an awful year for the position. Inactive for the Panthers are DE Marquis Haynes, CB Corn Elder, WR Damiere Byrd, LB Andre Smith, OG Brendan Mahon, DE Bryan Cox and RB Cameron Artis-Payne.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) is active for Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: Making his first appearance since Week 1, Olsen appeared to be an every-snap player. He looked no worse for the wear, finding plenty of cushion in the Redskins' defense. Olsen will be at risk of re-injury going forward but acing today's test was a huge step in the right direction toward earning every-week fantasy trust. He does have a tough matchup for Week 7. The Eagles have been vulnerable to the pass but stout up the seam.
report: Greg Olsen caught 4-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Panthers' Week 6 loss to the Redskins.

impact: It was Olsen's first game since reinjuring his foot in Week 1, but the Panthers did not take it easy on him. He also notched seven targets on the day. He will be at risk of an in-game setback all season, but he will be a solid TE1 when he is healthy.
report: Greg Olsen played 59-of-60 snaps (98 percent) Week 6 against the Redskins.

impact: The Panthers limited Olsen in his first practice since his return last week. He made it through Sunday setback-free but Olsen remains a second half injury risk. Olsen should have a near every-down role for his Week 7 matchup with the Eagles.
report: Coach Ron Rivera said the Panthers plan to manage Greg Olsen's (foot) practice reps all season.

impact: Panthers coach Ron Rivera recently said the team would manage Olsen's practice reps all season. The veteran played 98 percent of Carolina's offensive snaps in last week's loss to Washington. Olsen is RotoPat's No. 8 tight end for Week 7 against the Eagles.
report: Greg Olsen (foot) remained limited at Thursday's practice

impact: Olsen got lost in a brutal first half by Cam Newton, who went 4-of-9 passing for 24 yards in the first two quarters. Devin Funchess and Torrey Smith did the second-half heavy lifting until Olsen’s goal-line score that proved the game winner. Week 8 opponent Baltimore has shown vulnerability in the middle of the field, so Olsen will have a better matchup next week than Carolina’s wideouts.
report: Greg Olsen caught 2-of-5 targets for five yards and a touchdown in the Panthers’ Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: Nothing has been confirmed, but Greg Olsen (foot) is believed to be dealing with a serious injury. If that is the case, Thomas should be the next man up at tight end. While he cannot be expected to command the same target share as Olsen, Thomas earned nothing but praise for his work during training camp. He is worth a look in deeper leagues.
report: Fourth-round TE Ian Thomas is expected to replace Greg Olsen (foot).

impact: Olsen has yet to be officially ruled out, but he appears likely to miss significant time. If that happens, Thomas would be the next man up. "There are some things obviously that he still has to learn," Rivera cautioned, "and he’s got a long ways to go in terms of that natural feel that Greg has, having that rapport that Greg has, so we’ll see." With the Falcons up this week, Thomas could provide immediate fantasy value in deeper leagues.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera said rookie TE Ian Thomas is "pretty well prepared" to replace Greg Olsen (foot).

impact: Thomas and Chris Manhertz split tight end duties without Greg Olsen (foot) in the lineup.  Thomas' lone misconnection was a brutal drop of a would-be 17-yard touchdown.  He rebounded to catch a ball on third down on the same series to set up Torrey Smith's three-yard score.  Thomas is not a fantasy starter.
report: Ian Thomas caught 2-of-3 targets for 10 yards in the Panthers' Week 2 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Thomas continued to play a ton of snaps in Greg Olsen's (foot) absence, but still isn't doing much with them.  Over the last two weeks, Thomas has 30 scoreless yards on eight targets.  He is a TE2/3 entering Carolina's Week 4 bye.
report: Ian Thomas caught 3-of-5 targets for 20 yards in the Panthers' Week 3 win over the Bengals.

impact: Penny was on the Cardinals' practice squad. ESPN Giants reporter Jordan Raanan hints Penny will be taking FB Shane Smith's roster spot outright after Smith struggled against the Cowboys. Judging from how the Giants looked on Sunday night, switching fullbacks will be tantamount to re-arranging deck chairs on the Titanic.
report: Giants signed FB Elijhaa Penny.

impact: This was fully expected with Samuel recovering from a heart procedure. Samuel hasn't been cleared to practice, but it's possible he only misses one week. Christian McCaffrey should see more checkdown targets with Samuel out.
report: The Panthers ruled out Curtis Samuel for Week 1 against Dallas.

impact: Samuel has not played or practiced since being diagnosed with an irregular heartbeat prior to Week 1. Rivera said, "So far, so good" when asked about Samuel's recovery, though it doesn't sound like the second-year wideout is close to returning. With Samuel and Greg Olsen (foot) both sidelined, expect Devin Funchess and Christian McCaffrey to continue racking up targets.
report: Panthers coach Ron Rivera said there's no timetable for Curtis Samuel's return.

impact: Samuel remains without a timetable for return after a heart procedure.  Olsen is still out with a broken foot, and Turner is sidelined with a concussion.
report: Panthers declared WR Curtis Samuel, TE Greg Olsen, RG Trai Turner, WR Damier Byrd, DE Bryan Cox, DE Efe Obada, and LB Andre Smith inactive Week 2 against the Falcons.

impact: Samuel remains out indefinitely with an irregular heartbeat.  Olsen is "month to month" after breaking his foot for the second time in the last two years.
report: Panthers declared WRs Curtis Samuel and Damiere Byrd, TE Greg Olsen, RT Trai Turner, LT Matt Kalil, DE Marquis Haynes, and CB Lorenzo Doss inactive for Week 3 against the Bengals.

impact: Samuel underwent a procedure to correct an irregular heartbeat prior to Week 1 and has been sidelined ever since. It is not a given he will be able to return this week, but practicing on Monday is a great sign.
report: Curtis Samuel (heart) is practicing on Monday.

impact: Samuel turned a simple Cam Newton screen into a 25-yard touchdown, which gave Carolina its first points of the afternoon with 4:38 left in the first quarter. He broke multiple tackles on his way to the end zone and also got a great block from teammate Devin Funchess, who leveled Janoris Jenkins at the line of scrimmage. That play marked the first touchdown of Samuel’s two-year career. The 22-year-old was making his season debut after missing the Panthers’ first three games with an irregular heartbeat. Samuel isn’t in the fantasy discussion yet, but he’ll be a name to monitor on the waiver wire throughout the season.
report: Curtis Samuel grabbed two catches for 37 yards and a touchdown on four targets Sunday in Carolina’s Week 5 win over the Giants.

impact: He scored a 14-yard touchdown on an end-around, but lost five yards on his other rushing attempt and was only targeted once. A low-volume gadget player, Samuel’s fantasy value is limited to deeper Dynasty leagues.
report: Curtis Samuel rushed twice for nine yards and a touchdown and caught a 16-yard pass in the Panthers’ Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: With Jawill Davis (concussion) and Cody Latimer (hamstring, injured reserve) already ruled out, Giants will likely make a corresponding move even if Shepard suits up. If Shepard is ruled out, WR/KR Quadree Henderson or recent practice squad signee Corey Coleman could get the nod as the team's third wideout behind Odell Beckham and Sterling Shepard.
report: Giants WR Russell Shepard (neck) is questionable for Week 7 against the Falcons.

impact: Golladay did most of his work well before this one got out of hand in the third quarter.  At one point, he was leading the Lions with eight targets before Golden Tate ended the night with 15 and a touchdown.  Golladay also made one of the best plays of the night for the Lions, decking CB Trumaine Johnson after an interception, forcing a fumble and recovering it on his own in Jets territory.  Unfortunately, the Lions did nothing with it.  Golladay played a career-high 65 snaps (hat tip to PFF's Nathan Jahnke) and needs to be added where he's available.  Golladay will head into Week 2 at San Francisco as a big-play threat WR3/4.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 7-of-12 targets for 114 yards in the Lions' 48-17, Week 1 loss to the Jets on Monday night.

impact: He caught Ahkello Witherspoon napping on his 30-yard touchdown in the first quarter, which accounted for the Lions’ first points of the afternoon. Golladay didn’t score again but he was a consistent presence in the Lions’ passing game, just as he was a week ago when he registered a career-high 114 yards in a loss to the Jets. The 24-year-old showed flashes as a rookie but struggled to stay healthy. Now he’s in the midst of a sophomore breakout and has risen to must-start status in all formats. Look for Golladay to keep the train rolling next week against New England.
report: Kenny Golladay finished with six catches for 89 yards and a touchdown on nine targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 2 loss to San Francisco.

impact: Golladay continued to start over Golden Tate in two-wide sets. He scored the Lions' first touchdown of the game, extending the ball across the goal-line on a play where he was tackled at the one-yard line. Golladay has at least 100 yards or a touchdown in every game this season. He's a WR2 for Week 4's matchup with the Cowboys.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 6-of-7 passes for 53 yards and a touchdown in the Lions' Week 3 win over the Patriots.

impact: Even with Golladay seeing his lowest target total of the season, the second-year wideout was still reasonably productive in the loss to Dallas. While Golladay’s shrinking volume is somewhat concerning, the 24-year-old has established a nice floor for himself, topping 50 yards in all four games this year after reaching that mark just five times all of last season. He’ll be safe to employ as a WR3/flex against the Packers in Week 5.
report: Kenny Golladay came down with four catches for 74 yards on four targets Sunday in Detroit’s Week 4 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Golladay caught a 47-yard touchdown in the first quarter, but it was called back on an illegal hands to the face penalty.  He then went 60 yards down the sideline on his first official catch, stiff-arming a defender to the ground before being tackled inside the 10-yard line only to see LeGarrette Blount score a couple plays later.  Golladay eventually found the end zone from five yards away in the second half, and his nine targets led the team on a day Matthew Stafford attempted just 26 passes with the Lions holding a commanding lead much of the afternoon.  Golladay has seen at least nine targets in 3-of-5 games and is a locked-in WR2 heading into the bye.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 4-of-9 targets for 98 yards and one touchdown in the Lions' 31-23, Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: Golladay also drew a 15-yard DPI. Golladay drew zero first half targets in what ended up a nightmare fantasy day. Golladay nearly saved it with a 13-yard score in the second half, but it was called back by a Lions penalty. The Dolphins' secondary did an excellent job on each of the Lions' "big three." Golladay now has just 10 catches over his past three games. He will look to heat back up in Week 8 against the Seahawks.
report: Kenny Golladay caught 2-of-2 targets for 37 yards in the Lions' Week 7 win over the Dolphins.

impact: He's week to week. Latimer has three catches for 56 yards as the Giants' No. 3 receiver this year. Jawill Davis was promoted from the practice squad with Latimer out.
report: Cody Latimer (knee) has been ruled out for Week 4.

impact: Latimer was active last week against the Panthers, but he didn't play a single snap because of his knee injury. After getting in a full practice today, the Giants' No. 3 receiver should get back to his typical 45 snaps on Thursday night against the Eagles.
report: Cody Latimer (knee) was a full participant at practice on Tuesday and will play in Week 6's game against the Eagles.

impact: Latimer was injured covering a fourth quarter punt. The Giants' No. 3 receiver had caught 3-of-4 targets for 52 yards before going down. With Nos. 1 and 2 tight ends Evan Engram and Rhett Ellison sidelined, Latimer set a new season-high for yardage in his three quarters of play.
report: Giants WR Cody Latimer was forced from Thursday's game against the Eagles with a hamstring injury and will not return.

impact: Latimer suffered the injury covering a punt in Thursday's loss. Latimer opened the season as the No. 3 receiver, but he caught just six passes for 108 yards in four games. He will be a free agent in the spring. Bennie Fowler was added in his place.
report: Giants placed WR Cody Latimer (hamstring) on injured reserve.

impact: His 10 targets were tied with Eric Ebron for third on the team behind Nyheim Hines and Chester Rogers, who each had 11, on a day Andrew Luck attempted a career-high 62 throws.  Pascal got the scoring started for Indy, beating CB Shareece Wright for a four-yard touchdown.  The second-year UDFA out of Old Dominion played heavy snaps early and late after T.Y. Hilton had to leave with chest and hamstring injuries.  With Hilton sitting Week 5 this Thursday night against the Patriots, Pascal should again get plenty of run in three-wide sets.  At 6'2/219, he's a big body in the red zone for Luck.
report: Colts WR Zach Pascal caught 6-of-10 targets for 56 yards and one touchdown in the Week 4 loss to the Texans.

impact: A second-year UDFA, Pascal was solid in Week 4 but a liability this evening. He committed a comical fourth quarter drop that resulted in an Andrew Luck "interception." It was the sort of play you usually only see in the preseason. Even if T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) remains sidelined for Week 6, Pascal will not be a recommended dart throw in either re-draft or DFS.
report: Zach Pascal caught 1-of-7 targets for 12 yards in the Colts' Week 5 loss to the Patriots.

impact: His seven targets tied for second most on the team.  Pascal's on-field play has been poor, but he has a real chance at a huge role in Week 7 versus Buffalo.  T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) and Jack Doyle (chest) haven't seemed close to returning, while Ryan Grant (ankle) and Marcus Johnson (undisclosed) exited Sunday's loss injured.  Pascal has seven or more targets in three straight games.
report: Colts WR Zach Pascal caught 5-of-7 targets for 35 yards in Sunday's Week 6 loss to the Jets.

impact: Pascal only got in a limited practice Friday. The Colts are listing him with a head injury and not a concussion. With Ryan Grant out, Pascal should see a decent target share if he plays.
report: Zach Pascal (head) is questionable for Week 8 against the Raiders.

impact: Shepard looked on his way to a good game with four catches for 38 yards at the half, but he only managed one reception after the break. Odell Beckham is going to dominate targets in this offense -- he had 15 in this game -- but Shepard should find more success in easier matchups. He gets one next week in Dallas.
report: Sterling Shepard hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 48 yards in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: He should be fine for Week 2 against the Cowboys.  Shepard hauled in 5-of-7 targets for 48 yards in Week 1 and doesn't jump off the page as anything more than a WR4.  However, this is a good matchup after facing the Jaguars.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Shepard was limited on Wednesday after his back tightened up, but there never appeared to be any real concern. He will be ready to face the Cowboys on Sunday night.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) expects to get in a full practice Thursday.

impact: Shepard was limited Wednesday but practiced fully the last two days.  He was held to 48 yards in a tough opening day matchup with Jacksonville. Shepard is our No. 46 receiver play for Week 2.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) wasn't listed on the Giants' Week 2 injury report.

impact: Shepard was removed from the injury report Friday, so his status wasn't in doubt. The Giants inactives are LB Olivier Vernon, QB Kyle Lauletta, S Kamrin Moore, CB Michael Jordan, LB Tae Davis, C Evan Brown, and C Spencer Pulley
report: Sterling Shepard (back) is active for Week 2 against the Cowboys.

impact: Shepard finished behind Odell Beckham, Evan Engram, and Saquon Barkley in targets. He missed some time this week with a back injury, but it wasn't a factor in his quiet night. Shepard won't be more than a WR4 for next week's game against the Texans.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 3-of-5 passes for 24 yards in Week 2 against the Cowboys.

impact: It's a nice rebound after a down Week 2. The Giants got better pass protection from their offensive line with RT Ereck Flowers benched, allowing Shepard and Odell Beckham to get open. Shepard's touchdown came late on a short seven-yard pass in the fourth quarter. His red-zone role could be expanded if Even Engram misses time with a knee injury. Shepard is a WR3 for Week 4's matchup with the Saints.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 6-of-7 yards for 80 yards and a touchdown in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: He also nabbed a two-point conversion following a Saquon Barkley touchdown run.  Shepard beat CB Ken Crawley with ease on his short touchdown in the first quarter.  This was a prime spot for Shepard, and he answered with his best game of September.  Shepard has touchdowns in back-to-back games but will find tougher sledding next week on the road against the Panthers.
report: Sterling Shepard caught all 10 targets for 77 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: Shepard had a cyst removed from his back on Tuesday, and coach Pat Shurmur expects him to be back on the practice field Thursday.  As of now, the full expectation is Shepard will play Week 5 against the Panthers.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: We won't know his participation level until the Giants release their injury report later this afternoon, though ESPN's Jordan Raanan noted that Shepard appeared to be practicing "in some capacity." Getting in a limited session Thursday would bode well for his Week 5 status. Shepard will take a two-game touchdown streak into Sunday's matchup with Carolina.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) appeared to be practicing on Thursday.

impact: Shepard's Week 5 status is no longer in doubt. Shepard took advantage of Eli Manning's check-down tendencies and a plus matchup to post 10/77/1 in Week 4. The Panthers won't be as forgiving. Shepard is a mid-range WR3.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) was officially "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: As expected.  Shepard's status was never in doubt after he needed to miss practice Wednesday after having a cyst removed from his back.  He brings a two-game touchdown streak into Week 5 and will be a WR3 for this one.
report: Sterling Shepard (back) was removed from the Week 5 injury report and will play against the Panthers.

impact: The bulk of his yards (54 of his 75) came with New York trailing in the second half. Shepard was visibly frustrated on Sunday, throwing a trash can in anger during a third-quarter sideline tantrum. It’s just been that kind of year for the Giants, who have now dropped four of five including two straight. Shepard has done his part, however, eclipsing 70 yards in each of his last three contests. He’ll be in play as a WR3 Thursday against the Eagles’ funnel defense.
report: Sterling Shepard contributed four catches for 75 yards on seven targets Sunday in the Giants’ Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: It was a disappointing night for Shepard in a game where the Giants did not have a legitimate tight end and Eagles slot CB Sidney Jones departed early with an ankle issue. Of course, none of the Giants' pass catchers had much of a chance at a big game with Eli Manning once again lowering the bar under center. Shepard has a better outlook for Week 7, when the G-Men will be taking on the Falcons' injury-ravaged defense on Monday Night Football.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 3-of-7 targets for 37 yards in the Giants' Week 6 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Shepard had monster gains of 53 and 58 to aid his huge evening against this porous defense.  It was Shepard's first 100-yard game of the season and the most of his career after topping 100 yards just four times his first two seasons.  Shepard will be a solid if unspectacular WR3 next week against the Skins.
report: Sterling Shepard caught 5-of-8 targets for 167 yards in the Giants' Week 7 loss to the Falcons.

impact: Extremely thin at receiver, New England also added Corey Coleman on Tuesday. It is unlikely Fowler earns redraft fantasy value this season.
report: Patriots signed WR Bennie Fowler.

impact: The Patriots need the roster spot with RT Marcus Cannon (calf) questionable. Cole Croston was promoted from the practice squad as Cannon insurance.
report: Patriots released WR Bennie Fowler.

impact: Beckham could have had a much bigger day despite facing Jalen Ramsey on most of his snaps, but Eli Manning overthrew him twice in the end zone. Beckham made his presence known in the fourth quarter, however, getting loose for two long catches. Unfortunately, that drive ended on a failed fourth down, and a special teams turnover prevented the Giants from mounting another drive. Nevertheless, Beckham looked as good as ever in the season opener, and it is only a matter of time before he turns one of the many short catches he will see in this offense into a big play. He is going to be a fantasy monster all season long.
report: Odell Beckham hauled in 11-of-15 targets for 111 yards in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Beckham was held in check with two catches in the first half. He added some yards late with the Giants airing it out, but pass protection issues prevented Beckham from getting anything going downfield with Eli Manning. The Giants offensive line is a concern for Beckham's week to week consistency, but there's not much reason to downgrade his ROS outlook. Beckham will match up with Texans CB Johnathan Joseph in Week 3.
report: Odell Beckham caught 4-of-9 targets for 51 yards in the Giants' Week 2 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: The Giants got Beckham involved early with five of his catches coming in the first half. He wasn't needed with the Giants protecting a lead late, and added just 34 yards over the final two quarters. With Even Engram dealing with a knee injury, Beckham could see his target share rise in the coming weeks. He has a blowup matchup with the Saints in Week 4.
report: Odell Beckham caught 9-of-10 passes for 109 yards in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: Beckham has yet to score a touchdown this season in an offense really struggling through the air.  Beckham went into halftime on Sunday with two catches for -4 yards on five targets.  He also rushed one time for 10 yards and had numerous sideline flare-ups as frustration might be mounting for the star receiver.  OBJ will be a WR1 next week on the road against the Panthers.
report: Odell Beckham caught 7-of-11 targets for 60 yards in the Giants' Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: "How come we can’t throw the ball for more than 20 yards?," Beckham wondered aloud.  "How come we don’t attempt or try to throw the ball for more than 20 yards?  Those are questions that we have to figure out."  Eli Manning's longest pass play last week in the first half against a miserable Saints defense went for 11 yards, and he missed a wide-open OBJ on a couple occasions.  OBJ didn't stop there.  "A lot of it has to do with the energy that we have, that we don’t bring every single day," he continued.  "And you know me, I’m a passionate, energetic person.  We just need to play with some heart."  Frustration is mounting and started to boil over on the field a bit last week as OBJ remains without a touchdown and the Giants sitting at 1-3.
report: Odell Beckham voiced numerous concerns with the offense and the Giants' "energy" as a whole.

impact: It was a day of peaks and valleys for Beckham, who committed a brutal drop on fourth-and-three in the first quarter, then botched a punt that led to a fumble recovery and a Carolina touchdown (OBJ was attempting a block when the ball caromed off his leg, leading to a scrum in the end zone). Beckham shrugged off those mistakes later in the first half when he unfurled a 57-yard touchdown pass to a wide-open Saquon Barkley. That stands as the Giants' longest pass play of the season through five games. Odell added another touchdown in the fourth quarter, beating James Bradberry on a 33-yard deep heave by Eli Manning. In doing so, Beckham became the first Giant to both throw and catch a touchdown pass in the same game since Hall of Famer Frank Gifford in 1959. That was OBJ's first receiving score since Week 5 of last season. Beckham and the Giants will take a 1-4 record into Thursday's NFC East showdown against the Eagles.
report: Odell Beckham pulled in eight-of-14 targets for 131 yards and a touchdown while also throwing for a 57-yard touchdown Sunday in New York’s Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Visibly frustrated all evening, Beckham left the field before the first half was over. He was in the locker room as the G-Men lined up for what would have typically been a Hail Mary attempt.  Instead, they threw a screen. Speaking after the game, coach Pat Shurmur claimed Beckham needed an IV. Beckham was amongst the last out of the locker room for the second half, and was soon spotted screaming at a cooling machine. The reason for his frustration was evident to anyone watching the game. Eli Manning simply could not get him the ball on anything but the shortest of passes. The one time Manning tried to find Beckham down the sideline he laughably under-threw the ball. Beckham will look to take out his anger on the Falcons' bottom-tier defense in Week 7.
report: Odell Beckham caught 6-of-10 passes for 44 yards in the Giants' Week 6 loss to the Eagles.

impact: "I wish he would create the headlines by his play on the field as opposed to what he says and what he does off the field," Mara added. It is good Mara has identified Beckham as the Giants' real problem and not Eli Manning's ever deteriorating skill set.
report: Giants owner John Mara thinks Odell Beckham "needs to do a little more playing and a little less talking."

impact: Beckham had a relatively quiet first half with three catches for 57 yards, but he beat the defense for a 51-yard strike on a double-move in the third quarter then caught a pair of sideline passes in the fourth quarter to set up a Saquon Barkley touchdown run.  With the Giants then trailing 23-12 with five seconds left in the game, Beckham caught a meaningless-to-the-game one-yard touchdown.  But that score likely swung a lot of fantasy matchups and also allowed the Giants to backdoor the +4 spread for bettors.  OBJ has four 100-yard games this year and gets the Redskins at home in Week 8.
report: Odell Beckham caught 8-of-11 targets for 143 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' 23-20, Week 7 loss to the Falcons on Monday night.

impact: Marshall served as the No. 1 target after Doug Baldwin left with a knee injury, pacing the team in targets and getting several chances in the end zone. He was flagged for offensive pass interference on one of those targets, but he was able to come down with a beautiful throw from Russell Wilson for a 20-yard touchdown. With Baldwin looking at best questionable for Week 2, Marshall needs to be added in most leagues.
report: Brandon Marshall hauled in 3-of-6 targets for 46 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: He saw all of his targets in the first half.  Marshall was really the only one to produce any offense for the Seahawks before the break, accounting for 44 of Russell Wilson's 68 pass yards.  Marshall is going to need touchdowns to be a fantasy producer.  He has 90 yards receiving through two games.  Marshall will be a TD-or-bust WR4/5 next week at home against the lowly Cowboys.
report: Brandon Marshall caught 4-of-6 targets for 44 yards in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: Marshall tied for the team lead with six targets but obviously he didn’t make the most of it. He beat Chidobe Awuzie for a 27-yard grab in the third quarter, then celebrated by doing pushups. Even with Doug Baldwin sidelined the past two games, Marshall has yet to establish himself as anything more than a deep bench stash in fantasy.
report: Brandon Marshall snagged two-of-six targets for 30 yards Sunday in Seattle’s Week 3 win over the Cowboys.

impact: With Doug Baldwin returning to action, Marshall was relegated to an ancillary option in the offense. He now has 10 catches for 125 yards on the season. He is not worth rostering in fantasy leagues moving forward. Seattle hosts the Rams in Week 5.
report: Brandon Marshall caught 1-of-3 targets for 5 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Carroll said Moore will be "mixing in" more.  Marshall has dropped four passes over the last two games and has shown very little on the stat sheet, catching a total of three balls for 35 yards the last two weeks.  He's yet to top 50 yards on the year.  Moore is long on talent and deserves a closer look.
report: Coach Pete Carroll hinted Brandon Marshall's playing time may be cut in favor of sophomore WR David Moore.

impact: Marshall's lone target came on a deep shot down the sideline in the second quarter. Quickly falling behind David Moore on the depth chart, Marshall can be dropped.
report: Brandon Marshall failed to catch his only target in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Marshall played fewer snaps than Doug Baldwin, Tyler Lockett, David Moore, and Jaron Brown. He can safely be dropped in all formats.
report: Brandon Marshall played 7-of-60 snaps (12 percent) Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: Dickson sat out all of training camp with a quad strain, but it was still a surprise when he landed on the reserve/NFI list to open the season. With Will Dissly (knee) out for the season, the Seahawks need him back, and it sounds like he will be ready to go once the Seahawks return from their bye in Week 8. He could provide some much-needed fantasy depth at tight end once he gets up to speed.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll expects Ed Dickson (quad, NFI) to return when first eligible in Week 8.

impact: Speaking Tuesday, coach Pete Carroll apparently sounded more optimistic about Dickson's status than K.J. Wright's. With Nick Vannett dealing with a bulky back, Dickson's return would be a boost for the Seahawks' undermanned offense. Dickson would start out as a low-end TE2 in fantasy.
report: Ed Dickson (quad, NFI) will practice when the Seahawks come off their bye in Week 8 and could return against the Lions.

impact: Dickson is fully expected to be activated to make his Seahawks debut this week.  Coach Pete Carroll says Dickson has a chance to play "quite a bit" in his return.  Dickson could become a streaming option at a weak position.  With Will Dissly (knee) out for the year, Dickson's competition is Nick Vannett.
report: Ed Dickson (groin, NFI) returned to practice Monday.

impact: It puts Dickson on track for his Week 8 return. Coach Pete Carroll expects Dickson to have a significant role despite missing the last seven weeks. Dickson is on the TE2 radar in deeper leagues.
report: Ed Dickson (groin, NFI) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: It means Dickson is on track to make his 2018 debut. Dickson could immediately be in line for 3-4 receptions, putting him on the TE2 radar.
report: Ed Dickson (groin) was upgraded to "full" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Dickson was removed from Friday's injury report and will make his season debut against Detroit this Sunday. The Seahawks have been clamoring for more inline help since the team lost Will Dissly to start the year. He'll likely morph into a deep-league TE2 given the team's lack of competition at that position.
report: Ed Dickson (groin) will play in Week 8 against the Lions.

impact: Lockett did not do much in this game, but he was able to get open deep where Russell Wilson hit him for a 51-yard touchdown. That kind of play makes Lockett an interesting dart throw every week, but he needs to produce more consistently to be a reliable fantasy option. With Doug Baldwin dealing with a knee injury, he might get his chance moving forward. Lockett should be added in most leagues.
report: Tyler Lockett hauled in 3-of-4 targets for 59 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: Lockett now has 3-59-1 and 5-60-1 lines to open the season.  Both touchdowns took big plays to score, as Lockett made a near-impossible grab draped in CB Kyle Fuller's coverage in the back corner of the end zone from 19 yards out in this one.  Fuller should have been flagged for interference but it didn't matter.  Lockett is very boom-or-bust-ish but gets a tasty date with the Cowboys at home in Week 3.  He'll be on the WR4 radar for that one.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 5-of-7 targets for 60 yards and one touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: He did most of his damage on one play, breaking off a 52-yard touchdown late in the first half on a play where Kavon Frazier blew his assignment. That was about it for Lockett, though the long touchdown may have been enough to push fantasy owners over the top. Lockett should remain Russell Wilson’s top receiving weapon in Doug Baldwin’s absence, though a tough matchup against Cardinals All-Pro corner Patrick Peterson awaits him in Week 4.
report: Tyler Lockett collected four catches for 77 yards and a touchdown on six targets Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Lockett was second on the team in targets with Doug Baldwin returning to action, but led the team in receiving yardage on Sunday. After scoring in the opening three weeks of the season, Lockett failed to reach the end zone for the first time this season. With Baldwin returning, Lockett will be a WR3/FLEX option Week 5 when the Seahawks host the Rams.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 5-of-6 targets for 53 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Lockett made the most of his opportunities in a game Russell Wilson completed just 13 passes. His touchdown was a 39-yarder on which he ran right past Marcus Peters, and he ran a great route to get the safety turned around on a 44-yard gain in the fourth quarter. With the Seahawks running a run-heavy, deep-shot offense, Lockett might end up being their most valuable fantasy receiver. He will have a good shot at some more big plays next week against the Raiders in London.
report: Tyler Lockett hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 98 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Lockett has now scored in 5-of-6 games.  Unfortunately, he was otherwise quiet in a game where the Seahawks leaned heavily on their rushing attack, and Doug Baldwin was Seattle's lone player to exceed four targets.  The Seahawks have a Week 7 bye forthcoming.  Lockett has earned every-week WR3/flex treatment.
report: Tyler Lockett caught 3-of-4 targets for 13 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 6 blowout win over the Raiders.

impact: The Colts are calling Hilton questionable to return after he was flattened at the end of a 40-yard catch-and-run on the opening drive.  Trainers had to come get him off the field and took Hilton directly back to the locker room.
report: T.Y. Hilton exited Week 4 with a chest injury.

impact: Hilton was injured after a 40-yard catch on the opening series.  He was quickly escorted to the locker room where X-rays presumably showed no damage.  Hilton returned with a little less than two minutes left in the first quarter.
report: T.Y. Hilton (chest) returned to Week 4 against the Texans.

impact: Hilton has been banged up in this one.  He missed a good chunk of the first quarter with a chest injury before returning and then grabbed at his hamstring while running a route in the middle of the fourth quarter and has been ruled out for the day.  Before leaving, Hilton caught 4-of-6 targets for 115 yards, including a pair of passes for 40-plus yards.  Consider him day to day for now.
report: T.Y. Hilton exited Week 4 against the Texans with a hamstring injury and will not return.

impact: The Colts have a quick turnaround against the Patriots on Thursday night, so this isn't really a surprise.  With Jack Doyle (hip) also injured, the Colts may have to go into Foxboro with a collection of Nyheim Hines, Chester Rogers, Ryan Grant, Zach Pascal, and Eric Ebron.  Not a recipe for a win.
report: Coach Frank Reich said T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is unlikely to play Week 5 against the Patriots.

impact: Speaking afterward, coach Frank Reich all but ruled Hilton out for Thursday night's game against the Patriots. The Colts will be forced to go with Ryan Grant, Chester Rogers and Zach Pascal as their top three wideouts in prime time. Even though it's a short week, Hilton's quick rule out has him looking questionable to return in Week 6.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) was absent from Colts practice Tuesday.

impact: Hilton injured his chest in the first quarter last week and then pulled his hamstring in the fourth frame.  The hamstring is the more serious issue and could cost him more than this game.  In his absence, the Colts will roll with a receiver trio of Chester Rogers, Ryan Grant, and Zach Pascal.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is out for Week 5 against the Patriots.

impact: The Indianapolis Star's Zak Keefer got the vibe that it "doesn't sound like" either will play this week against the Jets.  Hilton is dealing with a significant hamstring strain.  The Colts' receivers struggled badly with drops in Week 5 against the Patriots in Hilton's absence.  Chester Rogers remains the best bet of the bunch after seeing a combined 22 targets the last two games sans Hilton.
report: Coach Frank Reich said T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) and Jack Doyle (hip) remain week to week.

impact: Coach Frank Reich has labeled Hilton "week to week" with chest and hamstring injuries. Even with the mini bye following last week's Thursday night game in Foxboro, Hilton is a long shot to play Sunday against the Jets. His absence would open up more looks for Ryan Grant, Eric Ebron and perhaps pass-catching back Nyheim Hines.
report: T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: "Today and tomorrow will tell me everything I need to know," Hilton said.  ""My less (than 100 percent) is better than a lot of people."  The Colts' rag-tag receiver group has struggled badly with drops the last two weeks and could really use Hilton's return to the lineup.  We'll know more Friday.
report: T.Y. Hilton said he will test his injured hamstring on Wednesday and Thursday.

impact: Hilton appears to be over the hamstring injury that has sidelined him the past two weeks. His return is great news for Andrew Luck, who has had to make do with a depleted receiving corps the past two weeks. Hilton will return to a tough matchup against Bills corner Tre'Davious White, but he'll still be worthy of WR2 consideration.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: Hilton said his hamstring responded well after a full session on Wednesday. "Feeling good," Hilton said. "Taking it one day at a time. There's no need to rush it." Hilton looks on track to face the Bills.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) is expected to practice Thursday.

impact: Despite the downgrade, both Hilton and the media were positive on his Thursday participation. It's sounding like Hilton will be full go against the Bills after missing Weeks 5 and 6. Hilton's main concern for Week 7 is likely shadow coverage from Buffalo's Tre'Davious White. Hilton is an upside WR2 for his return.
report: T.Y. Hilton (hamstring) was downgraded to "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: Hilton had a mid-week downgrade but remains on track to return after missing the last two games. It's an upgrade for Andrew Luck and a Colts offense that's been getting by with a weak supporting cast. Coming off injury, Hilton is a Week 7 fade in a shy-away matchup with Tre'Davious White.
report: Colts coach Frank Reich is "optimistic" T.Y. Hilton (questionable, hamstring) will play in Week 7 against Buffalo.

impact: Hilton returned to full practice on Friday, prompting the Colts to remove him from the injury report. He'll tangle with Bills corner Tre'Davious White in his first game back from a two-week hamstring injury. Hilton is RotoPat's No. 25 wide receiver for Week 7.
report: T.Y. Hilton (chest, hamstring) wasn't listed on the Colts' final injury report for Week 7 against the Bills.

impact: This was Hilton's first game back after missing the previous two weeks with hamstring and chest injuries. CBS analyst Adam Archuleta may have put it best when he said Tre'Davious White was on Hilton like a pair of skinny jeans. Despite the tough matchup, Hilton still gave fantasy owners a lift with his two touchdowns including a five-yarder with time winding down in the second quarter. His other touchdown was even shorter, coming on a one-yard strike from Andrew Luck with Indy up big in the fourth quarter. Sunday marked the 28-year-old's first multi-touchdown game since Week 9 of last season. Hilton will try to keep the train rolling next week against a leaky Raiders secondary.
report: T.Y. Hilton contributed four catches for 25 yards and two touchdowns on four targets Sunday in the Colts’ Week 7 victory over the Bills.

impact: He out-targeted John Ross 5 to 2.  Boyd is unlikely to be a fantasy factor behind A.J. Green, Joe Mixon, and Tyler Eifert, but he has a more secure role than the Bengals' hyped sophomore wideout as Cincy's locked-in slot man.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 3-of-5 targets for 26 yards in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: The 91 yards tied a career high, as did the targets. Running comfortably ahead of John Ross behind A.J. Green, Boyd was creating cushion for his catches. He now has nine grabs for 117 yards and a score through the Bengals' first two games. He could be coming onto the WR5 radar in fantasy.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 6-of-9 targets for 91 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: "He understands running routes," Dalton said. "He’s versatile. You can move him around. He’s had a lot of production in the slot and we’ve been able to move him around too." Boyd is having quite the turnaround after a lost 2017. He's already halfway to last year's yardage total. He's miles ahead of John Ross on the depth chart. Boyd could have some WR4 appeal once bye weeks kick in.
report: Speaking Thursday, Andy Dalton said third-year receiver Tyler Boyd is "so good."

impact: Boyd was a monster in Week 2 against the Ravens, and he stepped up to become Andy Dalton's favorite target on Sunday as A.J. Green (groin) exited early in the third quarter and never returned.  Dalton hit Boyd for a spectacular 27-yard rollout touchdown, then found Boyd open off a broken play in the second half for a 49-yard gain.  Dalton is looking for Boyd when he's in trouble.  Boyd has earned WR3 treatment entering Week 4 at Atlanta, and could push for WR2 value if Green can't play.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 6-of-7 targets for 132 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to Carolina.

impact: An established factor in Cincinnati's offense at this point, Boyd was one of Andy Dalton's favorite targets all game, but he was spectacular on the game-winning touchdown drive, converting a third down and two fourth downs. He now has two 100-yard games in a row after zero in the first 28 games of his career. With Dalton playing great and Tyler Eifert likely out for the year, Boyd should return at worst WR3 value the rest of the way.
report: Tyler Boyd hauled in 11-of-15 targets for 100 yards in the Bengals' Week 4 win over the Falcons.

impact: It's a step back after Boyd went over 90 yards the last three weeks. The Bengals went run heavy against Miami, leaving just seven targets for Boyd behind A.J. Green. With Tyler Eifert on IR, there's a lot to like with Boyd's ROS outlook. He'll be a WR3 for a plus Week 6 matchup with the Steelers.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 4-of-7 passes for 44 yards in Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: His nine looks were second on the team to A.J. Green's dozen.  Boyd was the recipient of both of Andy Dalton's touchdowns, from two and 14 yards out, and Boyd had to make a diving catch on the two-yarder.  He made a number of difficult grabs in this one on a day Dalton was off the mark.  Boyd has been a steady WR2 for weeks and will stay that way next week against the Chiefs.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 7-of-9 targets for 62 yards and two touchdowns in the Bengals' 28-21, Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Boyd was invisible in the first half, getting held without a catch. He managed to get some targets late with the Bengals airing it out, but it's a disappointing game. Boyd has been held under 50 yards in two of the last three weeks. He'll be a low-end WR2 for Week 8 against the Bucs.
report: Tyler Boyd caught 2-of-4 passes for 27 yards in Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: He was used as a part-time player, but it was nice to see him out there nonetheless considering his injury history.  Eifert's playing time figures to rise as he shows the coaching staff he can be trusted from a durability standpoint.  Eifert will be a touchdown-or-bust streamer in Week 2 versus Baltimore.
report: Tyler Eifert caught 3-of-3 targets for 44 yards in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: Eifert had an uneventful game on a night where Andy Dalton tossed four first half scores. Eifert got out-gained 45-23 by reserve TE C.J. Uzomah, though he did draw an end zone DPI, setting the Bengals up at the one-yard line. Eifert now has just five catches for 67 scoreless yards through two games as the Bengals stick to their pledge of rationing his snaps. There's still massive touchdown upside here, but Eifert is appearing best treated as a touchdown-or-bust, low-end TE1.
report: Tyler Eifert caught 2-of-4 targets for 23 yards in the Bengals' Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: After drawing only three and four targets in the first two games, Eifert was a much bigger factor in this one, making his trademark tough catches in traffic and helping Andy Dalton move the sticks on third down.  A.J. Green (groin) went down at the start of the third quarter and never returned.  If Green can't play in Week 4 at Atlanta, Eifert's passing-game role will further expand.
report: Tyler Eifert caught 6-of-8 targets for 74 yards in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to Carolina.

impact: The injury appeared to be a gruesome leg break, and trainers quickly put an air cast on Eifert's right leg. It would be shocking if the news is anything but a broken right leg or ankle. It is terrible luck for a player who had just fully returned to form following a series of back injuries. Eifert had four catches for 38 yards and a touchdown before exiting. Tyler Kroft and C.J. Uzomah will look to replace him.
report: Tyler Eifert exited Week 4 against the Falcons with a lower leg injury.

impact: That is exactly what it looked like on the field. It is terrible luck for a player who had just rounded back into form after losing two seasons to back issues. He should be placed on injured reserve this week. Tyler Kroft and C.J. Uzomah will handle the majority of the tight end snaps moving forward.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Tyler Eifert suffered a broken ankle Week 4 against the Falcons.

impact: Vontaze Burfict, who is back from a four-game suspension, was activated in the corresponding move. Eifert broke his ankle in devastating fashion last week against the Falcons. It's been a frustrating few years for Eifert, who has logged just 14 appearances since his breakout 2015 campaign. C.J. Uzoma will likely serve as the lead tight end in his absence, though Tyler Kroft will also see snaps.
report: Bengals placed TE Tyler Eifert (ankle) on injured reserve.

impact: The Chiefs romped, but Kelce continued his recent trend of quiet games against the Bolts. He has just two catches in two career games in "StubHub Center." The Chiefs have so many weapons that down weeks are bound to happen for Kelce, but he will be back out there as a top-three TE1 against the Steelers in Week 2. Patrick Mahomes has the looks of a quarterback who is going to get all of his studs big plays.
report: Travis Kelce caught just 1-of-6 targets for six yards in the Chiefs' Week 1 win over the Chargers.

impact: One week after he was held to one catch against the Chargers, Kelce erupted for just the third two-touchdown game of his career. Kelce split CB Cameron Sutton and LB Jon Bostic on his first score, corralling an absolute laser from Patrick Mahomes. For the second, he caught a low throw near the goal line for a 25-yarder. Kelce will get the 49ers in what could be a high-scoring Week 3 affair.
report: Travis Kelce caught 7-of-10 targets for 109 yards and two touchdowns in the Chiefs' Week 2 win over the Steelers.

impact: Patrick Mahomes spread the ball around in this one, but he kept coming back to Kelce, who was seemingly open on every play. The tight end finished the first half with 93 yards including a great one-handed grab in the two-minute drill, and he could have had a bigger day if the Chiefs were forced to throw more in the second half. He will remain a top-two tight end option next week in Denver.
report: Travis Kelce hauled in 8-of-10 targets for 114 yards in the Chiefs' Week 3 win over the 49ers.

impact: Kelce went catch-less on three targets in the first half but became Patrick Mahomes' go-to option after the break.  His touchdown came on a short pop pass to the right from two yards out in the fourth quarter.  Later in the same quarter, Kelce was drilled in the stomach and ribs area on an end-zone target and buckled to the ground before leaving the field with trainers.  It's possible he simply had the wind knocked out of him.  After catching one pass for six yards in the opener, Kelce has 22 catches for 301 yards and three touchdowns the last three weeks.  He gets the Jaguars in Week 5.
report: Travis Kelce caught 7-of-12 targets for 78 yards and one touchdown in the Chiefs' Week 4 win over the Broncos on Monday night.

impact: Kelce continued to look like the best tight end in the league in this one. He shook Telvin Smith to get open for a 15-yard catch on the opening drive, and he left Barry Church in the dust when he put on the brakes and changed direction on his 40-yard catch-and-run in the second quarter. He should have had a touchdown on that drive, but he dropped the pass. Kelce now has at least 100 yards in three of his last four games. He will be the top option at tight end next week in New England.
report: Travis Kelce hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 100 yards in the Chiefs' Week 5 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Kelce did all his damage early in this one. He was held without a catch in the second half with Tyreek Hill putting on a show. The Patriots took away Kelce on third downs and in red-zone situations. Kelce will remain a locked-in TE1 for a potential Week 7 shootout with the Bengals.
report: Travis Kelce caught 5-of-9 passes for 61 yards in Week 6 against the Patriots.

impact: Kelce got most of his yards on a 44-yard third down catch in the first quarter. He led the Chiefs in receiving, but was faded in the red-zone in favor of Kareem Hunt and Demetrius Harris. Kelce has been held out of the end-zone in three straight weeks. He's due for some positive regression in Week 8 against Denver.
report: Travis Kelce caught five passes for 95 yards in Week 7 against the Bengals.

impact: His yardage totals through three games are 3, 8, and 16.  Two of Andy Dalton's four interceptions on Sunday came on throws directed at Ross.  Ross has a ton of straight-line speed, but he is a work in progress as a route runner and catcher of the ball.  Even if A.J. Green (groin) can't play in Week 4 at Atlanta, Ross will be a high-risk WR4/flex option at best.
report: John Ross caught 3-of-7 targets for 16 yards in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to the Panthers.

impact: He did end up with seven targets, but he played two fewer snaps than A.J. Green, who exited early with an injury, and just two more than Josh Malone. Through three games, Ross has five catches for 27 yards. It is tough to justify spending a redraft bench spot on him at this point.
report: John Ross played 31-of-65 snaps (48 percent) Week 3 against the Panthers.

impact: Ross' touchdown was a 39 yarder in which Andy Dalton put the ball just out of reach from the safety down the seam. Unfortunately, Ross appeared to suffer a pulled hamstring or groin on that play, and while he was able to keep playing into the second half -- he had a nice sideline catch in the third quarter -- that injury eventually forced him from the game. He should be considered questionable to face the Dolphins next week.
report: John Ross hauled in 2-of-2 targets for 52 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 4 win over the Falcons.

impact: Ross came up limping on his 39-yard touchdown last week but was able to finish the game.  A limited practice puts him on track to play Week 5.
report: John Ross (groin) was limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Ross got in a limited practice Wednesday. It is possible he could be listed that way again, but he was not doing much of anything outside of riding the stationary bike in the part of practice open to the media. He is looking truly questionable to face the Dolphins.
report: John Ross (groin) is not practicing Thursday.

impact: Ross came up gimpy after catching a 39-yard touchdown last week in Atlanta.  He was able to play through it but isn't able to go this week.  Tyler Boyd will remain a high-volume WR2.  Josh Malone and Alex Erickson are next up.
report: John Ross (groin) is out for Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: Ross was limited last Wednesday before being listed as a DNP on Thursday, so we're not going to pen him in for a return yet.  But being limited to start the week is typically a good sign for a player returning from injury.
report: John Ross (groin) returned to a limited practice Wednesday.

impact: Ross is tentatively on track to return after missing Week 5, but the sophomore has not developed into a fantasy option this season.
report: John Ross (groin) remained "limited" on Thursday.

impact: We'd expect Ross to be back this week after sitting Week 5.  He's not a fantasy option, but Ross' presence helps open up more for other playmakers.
report: John Ross (groin) is questionable for Week 6 against the Steelers.

impact: Ross returned to limited practice after being a mid-week downgrade in Week 5. The Bengals will take him to game-time but he may be held out another game. Alex Erickson will play in three-wide sets if Ross is ruled out.
report: ESPN's Katherine Terrell doesn't expect John Ross (questionable, groin) to play this week.

impact: Ross got in limited practice this week but it looks like he still needs more time to recover from his groin injury. Without him, the Bengals will employ Alex Erickson in three-wide sets against the Steelers. With Ross out and A.J. Green likely to match up with Joe Haden, Tyler Boyd will be in a good spot this week.
report: NFL Network's Ian Rapoport confirms John Ross (questionable, groin) is not expected to play Week 6 against the Steelers.

impact: Ross got in a round of limited practices this week but will miss his second straight game.  Alex Erickson will continue to pick up more snaps as the third wideout.  Also inactive for the Bengals are RB Giovani Bernard (knee), OT Cedric Ogbuehi (wrist), WR Auden Tate, C Billy Price (foot), TE Tyler Kroft (foot), and DT Adolphus Washington.  C.J. Uzomah will start at tight end.
report: John Ross (groin) is inactive for Week 6 against the Steelers.

impact: Ross was limited at last week's practices before sitting out against Pittsburgh. He should be available this week, though the 2017 first-rounder isn't someone fantasy owners can count on yet.
report: John Ross (groin) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: This is the same injury that sidelined Ross the last two games. Ross is likely to miss more time with his latest setback.
report: John Ross left Week 7 against the Chiefs with a groin injury.

impact: Ross aggravated an existing groin ailment in Week 7. The No. 9 overall pick of the 2017 draft simply cannot stay healthy. Ross has seven career catches.
report: NFL.com's Mike Garofolo reports John Ross (groin) will be sidelined "a few weeks."

impact: Erickson buoyed his stellar play on special teams into a two-year extension with Cincinnati. Unfortunately for fantasy, he remains buried behind Josh Malone, Tyler Boyd, and other young standouts. He's now signed through the 2020 season.
report: Bengals signed WR Alex Erickson to a two-year, $4.68 million extension.

impact: Wright went 3-23 on five targets in Week 1 and seems to have carved out the slot job for the Panthers.  Cam Newton really had an affinity for him on third down, especially with no Greg Olsen (foot) in the lineup.  Wright's touchdown came on third down from five yards out.  There are worse players to roster in deep PPR leagues.  The Panthers get the Bengals in Week 3.
report: Jarius Wright caught 5-of-7 targets for 62 yards and one touchdown in the Panthers' Week 2 loss to the Falcons.

impact: He led the team in targets and got loose for a 38-yard touchdown bomb over the top of Indy's defense with two Colts DBs in trail position.  This is Green's age-30 season, but he has shown no signs of slippage.  He will remain a mid-range WR1 play in Week 2 against the Jimmy Smith-less Baltimore secondary.
report: A.J. Green caught 6-of-8 targets for 92 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: Coupled with his score from Week 1, Green is now halfway to his 2017 touchdown total five days into the season. Green's first three catches all went for scores. The second was the highlight. Green caught a quick slant, shed a few tackles and was off to the races for 32 yards. The third was just too easy as Marlon Humphrey played laughably soft coverage in the end zone. Green will do battle with the Panthers' zone defense in Week 3.
report: A.J. Green caught 5-of-9 targets for 69 yards and three touchdowns in the Bengals' Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: He had five catches for 58 yards on eight targets before departing.  Green went down in a ton of pain on the Bengals' first drive of the second half.  Trainers stretched him out on the sideline and he was able to walk on his own power, but was clearly still hobbled.  We're guessing Green is done for the day.
report: A.J. Green is questionable to return to Sunday's Week 3 game at Carolina due to a groin injury.

impact: Green went down on the first drive of the second half and never made it back. The Bengals initially listed him as probable to return before holding him out. Green's practice reps figure to be limited this week, but this doesn't look like anything that will keep him sidelined.
report: A.J. Green (groin) expects to play in Week 4.

impact: Lewis was apparently in a foul mood when he addressed the media. For his part, Green has said he expects to play in Week 4. Players are always optimistic about playing through injury. We seem unlikely to get a real clue as to Green's status before Wednesday's practice report.
report: Bengals coach Marvin Lewis declined to update A.J. Green's (groin) status at his Monday press conference.

impact: Green's groin issue is an aggravation of a college injury. He was officially limited on Wednesday. There hasn't been much concern from the Bengals on Green, who was at one point considered probable to return last week. Barring setbacks, Green looks like a good bet to play Sunday.
report: Bengals coach Marvin Lewis is "very optimistic" on A.J. Green's (pelvis) Week 4 status.

impact: Green said his injury was minor after the game last Sunday, and he has now backed that up with two practices in a row to start the week. He will likely be limited again on Thursday, but he should be ready to face the Falcons this weekend.
report: A.J. Green (pelvis) is practicing Thursday.

impact: Green was "full" on Thursday. Barring a Friday setback, Green will be ready to rock against the Falcons' injury-ravaged defense.
report: Speaking after Thursday's practice, A.J. Green (pelvis) said he felt "great."

impact: He's ready to roll as a WR1 in a potential shootout against the Falcons.
report: A.J. Green (pelvis) was removed from the Week 4 injury report.

impact: It was a bit of a frustrating fantasy game for Green, who just missed a long catch, had a touchdown called back on an offensive line penalty, and had a catch negated by an accepted defensive pass interference penalty. He made up for all of that on the final drive, however, getting open in the front corner of the end zone and coming down with a sliding catch for the game-winning score. With Andy Dalton cooking, Green will be a locked-in WR1 next week against the Dolphins.
report: A.J. Green hauled in 4-of-8 targets for 78 yards and the game-winning touchdown in the Bengals' Week 4 win over the Falcons.
