impact: McCaffrey clearly did very little as a rusher and was unable to convert his one inside-the-10-yard-line carry, picking up one yard from the six before Jarius Wright then caught a five-yard score.  However, McCaffrey was easily Cam Newton's lone reliable target, setting a new career-high with his 14 grabs.  He was targeted on 33% of Newton's passes.  Still, a touchdown would have been nice, but McCaffrey did well for his PPR owners in a predictable spot against the Deion Jones-less Falcons.  McCaffrey will be an RB1 next week in Cincinnati.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed eight times for 37 yards and caught 14-of-15 targets for 102 yards in the Panthers' 31-24, Week 2 loss to the Falcons.

impact: The Panthers' coaching staff must have spotted something it liked about attacking Cincinnati's interior defense on tape, because they did it over and over and over again with such dominance McCaffrey more than doubled his previous single-game high for rushing yards.  As Carolina needed only 15 pass completions to win, McCaffrey's receiving usage took a corresponding hit.  He'll rest his legs during the Panthers' Week 4 bye.  McCaffrey's weekly touch counts three games in are 16 > 22 > 30.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed 28 times for 184 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for ten yards in the Panthers' Week 3 win over the Bengals.

impact: McCaffrey's usage in the passing game, or lack thereof, was somewhat of a disappointment, though he salvaged the afternoon for fantasy owners by scoring a late touchdown on a screen from Cam Newton. The 18-yard score from Newton marked C-Mac's first end-zone since Week 15 of last season. McCaffrey dominated the backfield work as usual, out-touching veteran bruiser C.J. Anderson by an enormous 22-4 margin. The talented 22-year-old will remain an upper-echelon fantasy option when he takes the field next week at Washington.
report: Christian McCaffrey earned 58 yards on 17 carries while also securing five targets for 35 yards and a touchdown on six targets Sunday in Carolina’s Week 5 win over the Giants.

impact: McCaffrey was finding nice holes on the ground in the early going, but the Panthers quickly abandoned the run after a pair of D.J. Moore turnovers had them playing from behind. McCaffrey probably should have had a few more catches, but Cam Newton didn't see him on a few wide-open looks. McCaffrey will enter next week's game with the Eagles averaging 117 yards from scrimmage.
report: Christian McCaffrey caught 7-of-8 targets for 46 yards in the Panthers' Week 6 loss to the Redskins, adding eight carries for 20 additional yards.

impact: McCaffrey’s touches were a season low because the Panthers fell behind 17-0 at the half. CMC did play a big role in the comeback victory on a 22-yard reception down the left sideline, but he was tackled inside the five-yard line before Greg Olsen’s game winner. McCaffrey was essentially vultured by Curtis Samuel from 14 yards out on an end-around earlier in the game where McCaffrey operated as a decoy. Even against a tough Ravens defense in Week 8, McCaffrey’s passing-game involvement will keep him in the low-end RB1 hunt.
report: Christian McCaffrey rushed seven times for 29 yards and caught 6-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Panthers' Week 7 win over the Eagles.

impact: He added two catches for 22 yards on six targets. The rookie had absolutely nowhere to run for most of this game, gaining just 37 yards on his first 16 carries. He showed why he was the No. 2 overall pick on the 17th. He broke a tackle in the hole, broke another to bounce it outside, beat everyone to the corner, and then sprinted down the sideline for a 68-yard touchdown. Barkley could have some frustrating outings behind a questionable offensive line, but he has the ability to change a game in one play. He will hopefully be better utilized in the passing game next week – he did get going a bit in the screen game in the second half after not being targeted in the first – but he will be a solid RB1 against the Cowboys regardless.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 18 times for 106 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Barkley couldn't get anything going with the Giants getting dominated up front. His pass game usage was encouraging after getting held to two catches last week, but it was a product of bad offensive line play. Barkley has lived up to his draft status, going over 100 total yards in his first two games. He's a mid-range RB1 for a matchup against a solid Houston run defense in Week 3.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 11 times for 28 yards and caught 14-of-16 targets for 80 yards in the Giants' Week 2 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: Barkley remained the offensive centerpiece, but didn't get his first catch until the third quarter. He made one of his signature cutbacks behind the line before stiff-arming his way into the end-zone on his 15-yard touchdown. Barkley missed a few snaps with a knee bruise, but it's a non-issue for his Week 4 status. Barkley now has over 100 total yards in all three games this season. He's a locked-in RB1 for a matchup with the Saints.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 17 times for 82 yards and a touchdown and caught five passes for 35 yards in Week 3 against the Texans.

impact: Barkley added 56 yards receiving while catching 6-of-8 targets.  Barkley went to the half with 28 yards on six touches but was able to find the end zone late.  It's going to be a struggle every week behind this horrendous offensive line, but Barkley is churning out enough numbers as a locked-in RB1.  Things won't be any easier next week on the road against the Panthers.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 10 times for 44 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' 33-18, Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: The Giants' sluggish start continued with a heart-breaking, walk-off loss to Carolina in Week 5, but Barkley shouldn't be to blame. The second overall pick was his usual, productive self on Sunday, topping 100 yards from scrimmage for the fifth time in five games. Saquon delivered his first touchdown of the afternoon on a 57-yard pass from Odell Beckham, of all people. It was the easiest touchdown he'll ever score as there was nobody within 20 yards of him. Barkley found pay-dirt again in the fourth quarter, taking a 15-yard screen to the house to give New York a one-point lead with 1:08 remaining. The rookie came down awkwardly after hurdling a defender at the goal line but didn't seem to be showing any ill effects on the sideline. Barkley will remain in play as an RB1 when the Giants host Philadelphia on Thursday night.
report: Saquon Barkley went for 48 yards on 15 carries while adding four catches for 81 yards and two touchdowns on four targets Sunday in the Giants’ Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: At the very end of last week's game, Barkley dove into the end zone after hurdling a defender which resulted in an awkward landing. The rookie was slow to get up because of a "random back spasm." ESPN NFL Nation's Jordan Raanan said there is nothing more to it, so Barkley owners can feel comfortable plugging him in as a RB1 against the Eagles on Thursday night.
report: Saquon Barkley did not need any special treatment this week after taking an awkward fall at the end of the Giants' Week 5 loss to the Panthers.

impact: On a dismal night for the G-Men, Barkley was a bright spot, putting defenders on skates and routinely looking cannon shot as he hit the hole or found the edge. His score was a 50-yarder where he made a nimble cutback before exploding through the hole untouched. He fell just one yard shy of becoming the first Giants back to tally both 100 yards rushing and receiving in a game. Barkley has a gear few NFL players have, especially running backs. The Giants' line and passing game struggles haven't prevented Barkley from clearing 100 yards from scrimmage in each of his first six games. He's forcing himself into weekly top-three consideration. The burnable Falcons are on deck for Week 7.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 13 times for 130 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' Week 6 loss to the Eagles, adding nine receptions for 99 additional yards.

impact: It's the first time this season Barkley has been held to fewer than 100 yards from scrimmage, but he made up for it with a boat load of catches, the short touchdown, and a two-point conversion at the end of the game.  Barkley just did not have much room to work with on the ground behind this pitiful offensive line and against a defense that got DT Grady Jarrett back from injury.  Barkley still remains an elite RB1 no matter the matchup and will get the Redskins in Week 8.
report: Saquon Barkley rushed 14 times for 43 yards and one touchdown and caught 9-of-10 targets for 51 yards in the Giants' 23-20, Week 7 loss to the Falcons on Monday night.

impact: Drawing the start for the injured Chris Carson, Davis dominated the Seattle backfield on Sunday, handling 25-of-34 backfield touches. Davis gave Seattle the lead with a 20-yard touchdown in the 1st quarter and then scored their second and final touchdown on a 1-yard plunge in the 3rd quarter. Davis' fantasy viability will be contingent on the availability of Carson in Week against the Rams.
report: Mike Davis rushed 21 times for 101 yards and two touchdowns while catching four passes for 23 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: That "rotation" figures to feature Davis and Chris Carson, with a sprinkling of Rashaad Penny, who Carroll hinted will focus on kick return duties now with Davis and Carson outplaying him.  This is a backfield to totally avoid until we get some clarity on the situation when everyone is healthy.  If one of Carson or Davis ever sits, the other would be an RB2.  Davis went 21-101-2 in Week 4.
report: Coach Pete Carroll said Mike Davis earned a spot in the Seahawks' running back "rotation" moving forward.

impact: Davis ceded the starting job and many of the early carries to Chris Carson, but his role in the offense grew as the game went along. Most importantly, he received the most valuable carry of the afternoon. After Carson drove the offense down the field with some big runs, Davis took over, converted a third-and-two, and then scored from six yards out on the next play. Davis looks like he is the No. 2 option in the backfield -- Carson ended with 20 touches to 14 for Davis -- but the Seahawks' running game has been good enough to support multiple fantasy players the last several weeks. His workload could prove shaky, but Davis will be worth a look in FLEX spots next week against the Raiders in London.
report: Mike Davis rushed 12 times for 68 yards and a touchdown in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: It was surprising to see Davis handle only seven touches while Rashaad Penny came back to life for 11, although the blowout nature of the game skewed usage a bit, and it was an opportunity for the Seahawks' coaching staff to give Penny more chances.  Davis is worth rostering as an RB4/5, but he won't become a consistent flex option barring injury to Carson and/or Penny.
report: Mike Davis rushed six times for 21 yards and caught 1-of-3 targets for five yards in Seattle's Week 6 London win over Oakland.

impact: All four of Vernon, Apple, Latimer, and Engram are hurt and were previously ruled out.
report: Giants declared OLB Olivier Vernon, CB Eli Apple, WR Cody Latimer, TE Evan Engram, QB Kyle Lauletta, CB Antonio Hamilton, and C Evan Brown inactive Week 4 against the Saints.

impact: No surprises here.  Davis, Omameh, and Shepard are all injured.
report: Giants declared QB Kyle Lauletta, OG Patrick Omameh, WR Jawill Davis, S Kamrin Moore, WR Russell Shepard, CB Mike Jordan, and DT John Jenkins inactive for Week 7 against the Falcons.

impact: The stat line is not bad, but Manning sailed a few key throws including missing Odell Beckham on what should have been two touchdowns and too often checked down underneath the coverage. To be fair, the pass rush had something to do with that – Ereck Flowers was basically a turnstile on his interception. He did get things going on a potential game-winning drive in the fourth quarter, but that series ended on fourth down. Even with an easier matchup against the Cowboys next week, Manning will only be an option in two-quarterback formats.
report: Eli Manning completed 22-of-37 passes for 224 yards and an interception in the Giants' Week 1 loss to the Jaguars.

impact: Manning was under countless pressures, getting sacked six times. He was a statue in the pocket, holding on to the ball too long and failing to extend plays. Manning's touchdown came to a wide-open Evan Engram in garbage time. It's another concerning game coming off last week's zero touchdown effort. Manning won't be a streaming option for Week 3's matchup with Houston.
report: Eli Manning completed 33-of-44 passes for 279 yards and a touchdown in the Giants' Week 2 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: It's a needed rebound after a rough two-week stretch for Manning. The Giants' offensive line stepped up with  RT Ereck Flowers benched, allowing Manning to completed 86 percent of his passes. Manning's touchdowns went to Sterling Shepard and Rhett Ellison in the red-zone. It's a small step for Manning, but he remains one of the shakiest quarterbacks in the league. Even with a plus Saints matchup, Manning will be hard to trust as a Week 4 streamer.
report: Eli Manning completed 25-of-29 passes for 297 yards and two touchdowns in the Giants' Week 3 win over the Texans.

impact: Manning played it safe all day, as evidenced by his horrid yards per attempt.  The Saints have been getting torched over the top of their defense all year, but Manning opted not to challenge them deep, instead opting for short, chain-moving passes that never threatened this defense.  His longest pass of the first half went for 11 yards.  Manning is barely even a two-quarterback league fantasy option heading into a road date with the Panthers in Week 5.
report: Eli Manning completed 31-of-41 passes for 255 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 4 loss to the Saints.

impact: Manning lost a yard on his lone sack. Eli got off to a painfully slow start, completing just 12-of-20 passes for 119 scoreless yards in the first half. He didn't fare much better after the break, at least initially. Manning threw a costly interception in the third quarter on a pass intended for Odell Beckham, then committed another pick on his very next pass (Mike Adams got him both times). The 37-year-old rebounded nicely after that, however, leading a pair of late touchdown drives to give the Giants a one-point lead with 1:08 remaining. His best throw of the day came on a 33-yard deep strike to Odell Beckham, which was caught for a touchdown. Despite their efforts, the Giants eventually lost on a 63-yard, walk-off field goal by Graham Gano. New York will look to improve on its 1-4 record Thursday night against the Eagles.
report: Eli Manning completed 22-of-36 passes for 326 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions while adding one yard on his only carry Sunday in the Giants’ Week 5 loss to Carolina.

impact: Manning stunk the joint up, with the vast majority of his yardage either being tacked on after the catch by Saquon Barkley or coming in garbage time. His pick was an inexcusable force to a blanketed "Scott Simonson." Manning, of course, was under siege behind the Giants' putrid offensive line, though the zero-mobility 37-year-old line probably makes his line look even worse than it actually is. Manning's play has become a dispiriting series of quick outs and check downs. Amazingly/hilariously, coach Pat Shurmur called a screen on what should have been a first half Hail Mary. For all his struggles, Manning will have an attackable Week 7 matchup in the Falcons' hollowed-out defense.
report: Eli Manning completed 24-of-43 passes for 281 yards, zero touchdowns and an interception in the Giants' 31-13, Week 6 loss to the Eagles.

impact: Manning had a huge second half, but the offense really struggled in the red zone.  Manning didn't throw his touchdown until he heaved a prayer for a one-yard score to Odell Beckham with five seconds left on the clock after Manning failed to score on consecutive QB sneaks from the one-yard line.  Earlier in the game, he missed OBJ on an open nine-yard touchdown before the Giants had to settle for a field goal.  Manning's 399 yards mark a season-best, but this offense is still broken.  Manning won't be a recommended play next week against the Redskins.
report: Eli Manning completed 27-of-38 passes for 399 yards and one touchdown in the Giants' Week 7 loss to the Falcons.

impact: In other words, even though they are tanking, the G-Men won't bench their quarterback. Of course, you could easily argue leaving Manning in augments the tank. Coming off his best game of the season, Manning will be a low-end QB2 against the Redskins. Washington likes to dominate time of possession and keep the opposing offense off the field, limiting plays.
report: Speaking following the Giants' trade of CB Eli Apple, coach Pat Shurmur said the team has no plans to bench Eli Manning.

impact: It was a frustrating yet familiar day for Wilson. His offensive line struggled to protect him, and his receivers struggled to get open. Even so, he managed to create several big plays and keep Seattle in the game until the end. Wilson could face a similar script next week against the Bears and Khalil Mack, but he will remain a solid QB1.
report: Russell Wilson completed 19-of-33 passes for 298 yards, three touchdowns, and two interceptions in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: He rushed for just 17 yards and fumbled twice, losing one.  Wilson entered the fourth quarter with 69 passing yards and went into halftime with 68 through the air.  He took six sacks for the second-straight week to open the season and continues to hold onto the ball far too long in an attempt to create offense for a talentless unit that also can't block.  Wilson had far fewer than 200 pass yards before the meaningless final drive with under a minute left where the Bears played no defense, allowing a short Will Dissly touchdown at the end.  Wilson is an incredible quarterback but is being suffocated in Seattle under OC Brian Schottenheimer, playing behind a peewee league offensive line, along with a running game that still does nothing.  Wilson gets the Cowboys at home in Week 3.  Good luck to fantasy owners.  Wilson finished just ahead of Blaine Gabbert and Josh Allen in the Week 2 fantasy standings at quarterback.
report: Russell Wilson completed 22-of-36 passes for 226 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception in the Seahawks' 24-17, Week 2 loss to the Bears on Monday night.

impact: This injury isn't a concern, but it's another reason to shy away from Wilson in Week 3. Wilson has 524 yards and a 5:3 TD/INT ratio through the first two games.
report: Russell Wilson (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 3 against the Cowboys.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of 10 yards. Playing without top receiver Doug Baldwin for the second straight week, Wilson was a game manager on Sunday, spending most of his afternoon handing off to running back Chris Carson. It was a workmanlike effort for Wilson, though he did supply one big play, uncorking a 52-yard touchdown to Tyler Lockett late in the second quarter. Wilson gets the winless Cardinals on the road in Week 4.
report: Russell Wilson completed 16-of-26 passes for 192 yards and a pair of touchdowns while losing a yard on two carries Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 win over the Cowboys.

impact: Wilson added 21 yards on four rushes on the ground. Wilson played a clean game, but once again failed to add much fantasy production. He has now finished in the bottom-half of quarterback scoring in three consecutive games since opening the season as QB1 on the road. Wilson will enter Week 2 as a high-QB2 option Week 5 at home against the Rams.
report: Russell Wilson completed 19-of-26 passes for 172 yards with no touchdowns or interceptions in Sundays Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Wilson was also listed in Week 3 with the same injury. It's not a concern to his playing status, but hamstring issues can linger. Wilson has a shy-away matchup with the Rams in Week 5.
report: Russell Wilson (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: The Seahawks continue to lean on the running game, limiting Wilson to just 73 attempts in the last three games, but the quarterback was able to help his fantasy backers out with big plays and touchdowns. Wilson found Tyler Lockett for two long plays including a touchdown, and he hit David Moore for 30-yard and three-yard scores. The three-yarder was vintage as Wilson created time in the backfield and found Moore in the back of the end zone just before going out of bounds. Wilson has a great matchup next week against the Raiders in London, but he will be nothing more than a low-end QB1 because of his attempt concerns.
report: Russell Wilson completed 13-of-21 passes for 198 yards and three touchdowns in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Traditionally known as one of the league's more mobile quarterbacks, Wilson has mostly avoided running the year, logging just 11 carries over his first five games. That will probably remain the case as he continues to work through hamstring issues. Wilson will be a borderline QB1 against the Raiders in Week 6. That game will be played at Wembley Stadium in London.
report: Russell Wilson (hamstring) is practicing in full for Week 6 against the Raiders.

impact: Wilson rushed six times for 20 yards, but he looked relatively sluggish on his carries while dealing with a hamstring injury.  The good news is Wilson got it done through the air, and Seattle has a forthcoming Week 7 bye for Wilson to rest his ailing leg.  Even while missing his early-season dual threat due to the hamstring, Wilson has flirted with QB1 production.  It would not be surprising if Wilson delivered one of his trademark second-half explosions.
report: Russell Wilson completed 17-of-23 passes for 222 yards, three touchdowns, and one interception in the Seahawks' Week 6 drubbing of the Raiders.

impact: Prosise is buried on the running back depth chart and played just six snaps in the opener, seeing the bulk of those on the Seahawks' final couple possessions when they were in catchup mode.  All three of Chris Carson, Rashaad Penny, and Mike Davis are ahead of Prosise for carries.  With Doug Baldwin's latest knee injury, the Seahawks could use some warm bodies out wide.  Prosise is a catch-first weapon who has some receiver experience from his days at Notre Dame.
report: Coach Pete Carroll says the Seahawks "have been talking about" moving C.J. Prosise to receiver.

impact: It's only notable with Chris Carson (hip) a game-time decision. Prosise didn't practice all week and doesn't look close to returning. Mike Davis will remain Seattle's No. 3 back.
report: C.J. Prosise (core) is doubtful for Week 4 against the Cardinals.

impact: Prosise had a core-muscle injury last week, but he was not listed on the injury report coming into this game. There was just no room with Chris Carson back healthy and Mike Davis emerging last weekend. Seattle also declared WR Keenan Reynolds, S T.J. Green, LB K.J. Wright (knee), DE Rasheem Green (ankle), OG Ethan Pocic (ankle), and NT Nazair Jones inactive for Week 5.
report: Seahawks declared C.J. Prosise inactive for Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: "We don't necessarily have, 'OK, gotta get this guy so many carries, gotta get this guy so many touches,'" Schottenheimer said. "We'll just kind of see how the flow of the game goes." Schottenheimer did say he was anxious to get all his running backs work against the Broncos, but signs continue to point toward Chris Carson being the clear-cut No. 1.
report: Seahawks OC Brian Schottenheimer won't force touches to No. 2 RB Rashaad Penny.

impact: Penny practiced fully all week, so there wasn't much doubt over his status. His role is the bigger concern coming off a lost preseason. Penny may get a few series, but he's the clear backup to Chris Carson going into Week 1.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll confirmed Rashaad Penny (hand) will play in the season opener against the Broncos.

impact: Chris Carson got the start, but Penny ended up with the same number of carries and targets. He was much less efficient with his work, gaining just 43 total yards while Carson went for 79. Carson looks like the best option in the backfield right now, but it seems like the Seahawks will keep Penny involved. Even so, he cannot be trusted in fantasy lineups next week against the Bears.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed seven times for eight yards and hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 35 yards in the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the Broncos.

impact: That rushing line led the team.  Penny's 10 carries were four more than Chris Carson and the 30 yards were six more than Carson.  Carson didn't touch the ball in the second half.  As a receiver, Penny wasn't any better on two targets, dropping one and being the target on a game-clinching pick-six on the other.  Penny has been dreadful through two games, rushing 17 times for 38 yards (2.24 YPC) behind an atrocious offensive line.  This rushing game is a clear avoid heading into Week 3 at home against the Cowboys.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed 10 times for 30 yards in the Seahawks' Week 2 loss to the Bears.

impact: The rookie botched a handoff from Russell Wilson during the first half, though luckily, he was able to fall on it. After sharing backfield work with Chris Carson in Weeks 1 and 2, Penny took a backseat in this one, seeing just three touches to Carson’s 34. All three of his carries came in the first half, which would suggest Pete Carroll was punishing Penny for his earlier fumble. With Carson emerging as the Seahawks’ workhorse, Penny can be avoided next week, even in a favorable matchup against the Cardinals.
report: Rashaad Penny managed just three yards on five carries Sunday in Seattle’s Week 3 victory over the Cowboys.

impact: Penny's conditioning was an early-season concern after he ballooned to the 240s in training camp. He's now back closer to his Combine weigh-in, but it hasn't done much for him on the field. Penny has struggled with ball security and is averaging just 2.2 YPC.  He's firmly behind workhorse Chris Carson for touches.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Rashaad Penny is down to 228-pounds.

impact: Penny played behind Mike Davis was out-touched by Davis 25-to-9. Penny ran well with his opportunities, breaking of a long gain of 15 yards, but clearly has not gained the trust of the staff. Penny is at bet a bench stash at this stage of the season. The Seahawks host the Rams in Week 5.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed nine times for 49 yards in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Even with Chris Carson inactive, Penny took a backseat to Mike Davis, who out-snapped him 47-to-16 and out-touched him 25-to-9. Perhaps Penny remains roster worthy because of Carson's injury, but Sunday's game suggests he is not going to be a fantasy option even if Carson is forced to miss more time.
report: Rashaad Penny played 16-of-66 snaps (24 percent) Week 4 against the Cardinals.

impact: With Chris Carson healthy and Mike Davis serving as the No. 2, Penny's only involvement against the Rams was on one special teams play. Penny can safely be dropped in redraft formats.
report: Rashaad Penny did not play a snap on offense in Week 5.

impact: This comes after Penny, the Seahawks' first-round pick in April's draft, didn't play a single offensive snap in Week 5. "He’s looking for his opportunities and it’s going to come," said Schottenheimer "It’s about the little details for him and when you’re not getting the reps or you’re not playing in the game, can you stay in the game focused?" Penny missed a chunk of training camp due to a broken finger, which likely made his learning curve even steeper. With Chris Carson and Mike Davis operating as the Seahawks' main backs, Penny can be safely ignored in redraft leagues.
report: Seahawks OC Brian Schottenheimer said the team isn't going to "force" Rashaad Penny into the team's running back rotation.

impact: Penny was used early in the game on a 24-yard reception, although the majority of his carries came as the game got out of hand.  The Seahawks wound up smashing Oakland 27-3.  Penny's role remains uncertain entering Seattle's Week 7 bye, but he is worth rostering in 14- and 16-team leagues.  Chris Carson had 14 touches in Sunday's victory.  Mike Davis surprisingly only logged seven.
report: Rashaad Penny rushed nine times for 43 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for 27 yards in the Seahawks' Week 6 win over the Raiders.

impact: Penny missed time with a broken finger over the summer and may have aggravated it. The 22-year-old is third in Seattle's backfield pecking order behind Chris Carson and Mike Davis.
report: Rashaad Penny (finger) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Okay.  Maybe don't play your best running back on special teams then.  Anyway, Carroll added he wanted to see what rookie Rashaad Penny could do with a bigger workload.  The answer to that question?  Not much.  Penny was even worse, rushing 10 times for 30 yards, while dropping a pass and catching none.  Meanwhile, Carson averaged a respectable 4.0 YPC in the first half only to never see the ball again.  The Seahawks are a mess, especially on offense.
report: Speaking after the Week 2 loss to the Bears, coach Pete Carroll said Chris Carson didn't get any second-half touches because he was "gassed" from playing special teams.

impact: "Gassed" from playing special teams — really (at least according to coach Pete Carroll) — Carson did not touch the ball in the second half of Monday's dispiriting loss to the Bears. Any time Carroll opens his mouth, he sings Carson's praises, but the usage has not matched the verbiage so far this season. Carson will be a risky, low-end FLEX play for Week 3 against the Cowboys.
report: Chris Carson remains atop the Seahawks' running back depth chart for Week 3.

impact: Not a bad day at the office for Carson, who out-touched backfield-mate Rashaad Penny by an overwhelming 34-3 margin. Penny found himself in Pete Carroll’s doghouse after botching a handoff in the first half and Carson took full advantage of the opportunity, becoming the first Seahawk to rush for 100 yards in a regular season game since Thomas Rawls in Week 13 of 2016. The 24-year-old scored his first career rushing touchdown on a five-yard scamper early in the fourth quarter. Obviously, Carson wasn’t very efficient on Sunday—he averaged a mere 3.2 yards per carry—though the 24-year-old remains ahead of Penny in the Seahawks' backfield pecking order. He should be in play as a back-end RB2 next week against the Cardinals.
report: Chris Carson tallied 102 yards and a touchdown on 32 carries while also earning two catches for 22 yards on two targets Sunday in the Seahawks’ Week 3 win over Dallas.

impact: Carson came out of Sunday's game with a hip injury, though his participation on Wednesday, albeit in a limited capacity, would suggest it's only a minor setback. The second-year ball-carrier took control of the Seahawks' backfield in Week 3, out-touching teammate Rashaad Penny by a lopsided 34-3 margin. Assuming he can shake off this hip injury, Carson will be an acceptable, volume-based RB2 against the Cardinals in Week 4.
report: Chris Carson (hip) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: There's no concern over Carson's Week 4 status as it appears the Seahawks are just managing his practice reps. Carson logged an exhausting 34 touches in last week's win over Dallas and should see another massive workload Sunday against the Cardinals. With Carson emerging as Seattle's workhorse, Rashaad Penny is no longer a must-own in fantasy leagues.
report: Chris Carson (hip) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Carson's practice reps were managed coming off last week's 34 touches. Despite the questionable tag, coach Pete Carroll said Carson plans to play. Carson is in a blowup spot in what projects as a run-heavy gamescript.
report: Chris Carson (hip) is listed as questionable for Week 4 against the Cardinals.

impact: This comes after coach Pete Carroll called Carson a game-time decision. Carson's limited practice week was more than maintenance, but all signs point to him playing. In a matchup with a positive gameflow script, Carson's in a good spot to build off his 34-touch breakout in Week 4.
report: Chris Carson (questionable, hip) is expected to be "fine" for Sunday's game with the Cardinals.

impact: One week after a career-high 34 touches, Carson was unable to make it through a full week of practice with a hip injury and will be held out Sunday's game. Rookie first-round Rashaad Penny will draw the start and share the backfield with C.J. Prosise and Mike Davis against an Arizona defense that faces the most rushing attempts (31.0) and touches (37.0) to opposing backfields to begin the season.
report: Seahawks declared RB Chris Carson, WE Keenan Reyndolds, LB K.J. Wright, DE Dion Jordan, OL Ethan Pocic, DE Rasheem Green and SS Shalom Luani inactive for Sunday's Week 4 game versus the Cardinals.

impact: Carroll injury updates should always be taken with a grain of salt, but it was a shock Carson was inactive on Sunday, so he should be good to go following another week of recovery. That said, it still makes sense to add Mike Davis off the wire to see how this shakes out.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll expects Chris Carson (hip) to return Week 5.

impact: It's not a good start to the week, though coach Pete Carroll remains optimistic (when is he not?) that Carson will return Sunday against the Rams. Mike Davis dominated the backfield work in Carson's absence last week, rumbling to 124 yards (101 rushing, 23 receiving) and two touchdowns in a win at Arizona. Davis will likely have some role even if Carson suits up this week.
report: Chris Carson (hip) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: Carson is actually behind last week's pace, where he started off limited/limited before eventually shockingly sitting out against the Cardinals. Talks-a-lot coach Pete Carroll has claimed he's optimistic about Carson's Week 5 status. We'll see. Seahawks/Rams kicks off at 4:25 PM ET.
report: Chris Carson (hip) returned to Seahawks practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: This has been the expectation all along, though it's good to get confirmation from Carroll after the Seahawks blindsnighted fantasy owners last week by making Carson a surprise inactive. Carson seems to be over his hip injury, though his workload is up for debate with Mike Davis coming off a big game at Arizona (124 yards, two touchdowns). RotoPat has Carson as his No. 26 running back for Week 5.
report: Seahawks coach Pete Carroll confirmed Chris Carson (hip) will return for Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: Carson surprised us all by being inactive last week but that won't happen this time around. He'll form a committee with Mike Davis, who went off for 124 yards and two touchdowns in Carson's absence last week. Disappointing rookie Rashaad Penny will be fighting for scraps behind both of them.
report: Chris Carson (hip) wasn't listed on the Seahawks' final injury report for Week 5 against the Rams.

impact: Carson started and operated as the lead back, but he lost key carries including a touchdown opportunity to Mike Davis. Even with the split, Carson rewarded his fantasy backers with 127 yards from scrimmage as he consistently gashed the Rams' defense for big gains on the ground. Carson has now topped 120 yards from scrimmage each of his last two games. Even with concerns about his workload, he will be a RB3 next week against the Raiders in London.
report: Chris Carson rushed 19 times for 116 yards and caught his only target for 11 yards in the Seahawks' Week 5 loss to the Rams.

impact: Carson was Seattle's backfield leader, but Mike Davis mixed in for seven touches, and Rashaad Penny even contributed 11 touches as the Seahawks nursed a comfortable lead for three-plus quarters.  Still, the possibility of a three-way RBBC will loom during Seattle's Week 7 bye.  Carson is an RB2 hold, albeit a shaky one.
report: Chris Carson rushed 14 times for 59 yards in Seattle's Week 6 victory.

impact: Dalton was mostly sharp, keeping his eyes downfield when pressured and hitting A.J. Green and John Ross for scores.  Green's TD came from 38 yards out on a bomb, and Ross' from three yards away on an end-zone fade.  This is the best supporting cast Dalton has been surrounded by since the 2015 season, when he finished as a top-seven quarterback in fantasy points per game.  Dalton will be a mid-range QB2 in a tough Week 2 matchup with Baltimore, however.
report: Andy Dalton completed 21-of-28 passes for 243 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Bengals' Week 1 win over the Colts.

impact: It was one of the shakiest four-touchdown performances you will ever see. Dalton was excellent in the first half, piling up all four of his scores. After the break, he could barely get a first down and was lucky to escape without a turnover. Dalton relentlessly worked his connection with A.J. Green, finding him for three of his four TDs. Dalton also displayed strong chemistry with Tyler Boyd, a welcome development as the Bengals try to deepen their weapons arsenal. The Bengals head on the road to Carolina for Week 3.
report: Andy Dalton completed 24-of-42 passes for 265 yards and four touchdowns in the Bengals' 34-23, Week 2 win over the Ravens.

impact: The four picks make Dalton's game look worse than it was; one was tipped high into the air on a target Josh Malone couldn't haul in, and Dalton's fourth INT came on what amounted to a last-gasp Hail Mary heave.  Of more concern are the Bengals' mounting injuries; after Joe Mixon had his knee scoped in Week 2, A.J. Green left Sunday's loss with a groin pull and did not return.  Dalton's Week 4 fantasy upside at Atlanta will hinge largely on Green's availability.
report: Andy Dalton completed 29-of-46 passes for 352 yards, two touchdowns, and four interceptions in the Bengals' Week 3 loss to Carolina.

impact: Dalton was exceptional throughout this game -- he completed 14-of-16 passes for 211 yards and two touchdowns in the first half -- but he made his money with the win in the balance late in the fourth quarter. Down five, Dalton led a 16-play, 75-yard touchdown drive in which he found Tyler Boyd for two fourth-down conversions. The touchdown was a great throw to A.J. Green in the end zone. Dalton now has multiple touchdowns in every game and has topped 335 yards each of the last two weeks. He will be a back-end QB1 next week against the Dolphins.
report: Andy Dalton completed 29-of-41 passes for 337 yards, three touchdowns, and an interception in the Bengals' Week 4 win over the Falcons.

impact: Dalton's only touchdown was a broken play where he hit Joe Mixon in the end-zone on a back-shoulder throw. He was picked trying to force a pass in the red-zone, but otherwise managed the game effectively. It's a disappointing game from Dalton against a Miami pass rush that was missing multiple starters. Dalton has another plus matchup with the Steelers in Week 6.
report: Andy Dalton completed 20-of-30 passes for 248 yards with a touchdown and an interception in the Bengals' Week 5 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Dalton averaged a pitiful 5.5 yards per attempt and took three sacks.  He needed to play much better for the Bengals but was also hurt bad by a couple drops.  Dalton just didn't seem to be on his A-game in this one, misfiring on a couple throws.  Tyler Boyd had to make a pair of shoe-string, diving catches, with one coming on a two-yard touchdown.  Dalton's now had back-to-back mediocre outings ahead of a ripe Week 7 spot against the Chiefs.
report: Andy Dalton completed 26-of-42 passes for 229 yards and two touchdowns in the Bengals' Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Evidently Dalton hurt his back during Sunday's loss to Pittsburgh but obviously the injury isn't serious. Dalton wasn't at his best last week, but he should bounce back against a lackluster Chiefs secondary on Sunday night.
report: Andy Dalton (back) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: The Bengals got off to a sluggish start, but Dalton managed a first-quarter touchdown to C.J. Uzomah. He telegraphed a pick-six on the first drive of second half and couldn’t get anything going after that. It’s one of the worst starts of the season for Dalton, who’s had multiple TDs in 5-of-7 games. Dalton has a rebound matchup with the Bucs in Week 8
report: Andy Dalton completed 15-of-29 passes for 148 yards with a touchdown and an interception in Week 7 against Kansas City.

impact: Mixon was back on the side fields at practice this week, progressing to running and cutting.  But Giovani Bernard will get another start in the backfield and is a surefire RB1 play in a potential dome shootout in Atlanta.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) is out for Week 4 against the Falcons.

impact: Mixon was running and cutting on the side fields at practice this week, and he was put through a workout on the field ahead of the game Sunday. He is looking likely to return next week against the Dolphins. Cincinnati also declared C Billy Price (foot), WR Auden Tate, RB Thomas Rawls, OL Cedric Ogbuehi, TE Mason Schreck, and DT Adolphus Washington inactive for Week 4.
report: Bengals declared Joe Mixon (knee) inactive for Week 4 against the Falcons.

impact: Mixon was slapped with a 2-4 week timeline when he went under the knife following the Bengals' Week 2 Thursday night game. Giovani Bernard has been running hot in Mixon's absence, so the Bengals don't feel the need to rush him back. If Mixon can get cleared for Week 5, he would be returning to a plus matchup with the Dolphins. Of course, it would also likely be a more traditional committee after Mixon dominated work in Weeks 1 and 2.
report: Asked Monday if Joe Mixon (knee surgery) will return for Week 5, Bengals coach Marvin Lewis said "that's an emphatic 'we'll see'."

impact: Mixon did say he hopes to eventually gain clearance this week, but if not, he will "for sure" play Week 6 against the Steelers.  Odds now are Giovani Bernard will have one more week as the lead dog and a locked-in RB1 against Miami before Mixon returns.  Bernard has earned more work, even when Mixon is back, so this will be a situation to watch once Mixon does gain clearance.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) has yet to be cleared for Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: Mixon himself said he's yet to be cleared, but coach Marvin Lewis said "the sun is up" on Mixon, and both Dehner and Geoff Hobson of the Bengals' official website expect Mixon back this Sunday.  If true, it's uncertain how this backfield will shake out.  Giovani Bernard has been awesome in Mixon's absence and deserves more looks than he was getting prior to Mixon's injury.
report: The Cincinnati Enquirer's Paul Dehner expects Joe Mixon (knee) to play Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: Mixon is in full pads, while Giovani Bernard (thigh?) is not practicing and is off to the side on the rehab field.  He was listed with a thigh issue last week before being removed from the injury report.  Perhaps it's a bit of a rest day.  But Mixon being in full pads is the bigger story.  He looks on track for a Week 5 return against the Dolphins.  Mixon would reenter the RB2 discussion.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) is practicing Wednesday.

impact: Mixon remains on track to return after a two-game absence.  He was reportedly in full pads Wednesday but has still yet to gain clearance.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) was officially limited in Wednesday's practice.

impact: Mixon was limited on Wednesday and could be again today, but he appears on track to return this weekend. It is good news for the Bengals, who appear likely to be without Giovani Bernard (knee). Mixon will be a back-end RB1 if he plays against the Dolphins.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) is practicing Thursday.

impact: With Giovani Bernard (knee) now out, Mixon will step right back into his old role as the workhorse in the backfield.  Fire him up as a surefire RB1 in fantasy.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) was removed from the Week 5 injury report and will play against the Dolphins.

impact: Lewis reportedly noted there were limits for Mixon due to his conditioning taking a hit during the rehab process. Without backup Giovani Bernard (knee) Sunday, fourth-round rookie Mark Walton could shoulder a few more snaps than initially expected. "I think that was a little shock to [Walton's] system. Since he’s gotten an opportunity to suit up and play he’s really taken advantage," Lewis said. "We have a comfort level with him." Mixon will still undoubtedly out-carry Walton as he did with Bernard behind him in Week 1. Confidently consider him an RB2 against the Fins.
report: Coach Marvin Lewis reportedly "doesn't expect to fully unleash" Joe Mixon in Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: This backs up comments from Marvin Lewis earlier in the week. Mixon doesn't look ready for a full workload after sitting the last two games. This is different from Week 3  when Lewis promised to get Mark Walton involved, as Mixon is coming off surgery and not in great conditioning. Mixon will still see the bulk of carries, but he comes with some Week 5 risk.
report: ESPN's Dianna Russini reports Joe Mixon isn't expected to have an every-down role in Week 5 against the Dolphins.

impact: Mixon's status was never in doubt, but there's some concern over his workload coming off knee surgery. With Giovani Bernard out, the Bengals plan to get Mark Walton more carries this week. Cincinnati's inactives are WR John Ross, WR Auden Tate, LB Malik Jefferson, OL Billy Price, OL Cedric Ogbuehi, and DT Josh Tupou.
report: Joe Mixon (knee) is active for Week 5 against Miami.

impact: Mixon was held in check on the ground before ripping a 31-yard fourth quarter run. He caught an underthrown red-zone pass from Andy Dalton for the Bengals' only offensive touchdown. Mixon played a near every-down role despite concern over his workload and looked fully healthy. He'll remain an RB2 for Week 6 against the Steelers.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 22 times for 93 yards and caught 3-of-4 passes for 22 yards and a touchdown in the Bengals' Week 5 win over the Dolphins.

impact: He nabbed 4-of-7 targets for 20 yards in the pass game.  Mixon was cooking in the first half with 40 yards on five carries but just didn't get enough work.  The Bengals probably should have put the ball in his belly more instead of having Andy Dalton throw it 42 times at a 5.5 YPA clip while facing plenty of pressure.  Mixon did score a late touchdown from four yards out to save his fantasy day.  Mixon and the Bengals will be involved in a potential Week 7 shootout at Kansas City.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 11 times for 64 yards and one touchdown in the Bengals' Week 6 loss to the Steelers.

impact: Mixon continued to rarely leave the field with Giovanni Bernard sidelined. He fell victim to gameflow with the Bengals playing from behind but still managed a solid per-carry average. Mixon had some of his better runs called back on penalties. With Bernard likely at least another week away, Mixon is locked into another heavy workload in Week 8 against the Bucs.
report: Joe Mixon rushed 13 times for 50 yards in Week 7 against the Chiefs.

impact: LeGarrette Blount started, and Theo Riddick was the clear pass-down back, but whenever Johnson was in the game he was clearly the team's best playmaker in the backfield.  Blount hurt his knee in the second half, so perhaps that will open up more work for Johnson next week at San Francisco.
report: Kerryon Johnson rushed five times for 17 yards and caught all three of his targets for 20 yards in the Lions' Week 1 loss to the Jets.

impact: Johnson was the most impressive of Detroit’s three ball-carriers on Sunday, though game script dictated a pass-heavy approach with the Lions playing from behind most of the afternoon. The rookie led Detroit’s backfield with 13 touches, which is five more than he saw against the Jets in Week 1. It’s likely Johnson will eventually emerge as the Lions’ lead back but for the moment, he remains locked in a timeshare with power back LeGarrette Blount and pass-catcher Theo Riddick. Until that changes, the rookie will be tough to employ for fantasy purposes. We’ll see what he can muster next week against New England.
report: Kerryon Johnson rolled to 43 yards on eight carries while adding five catches for 23 yards on six targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 2 loss to San Francisco.

impact: Johnson is the first Lions' running back to run for 100 yards since 2013. He continued to have to hot hand over LeGarrette Blount, though both ended up with 16 carries. Johnson has separated himself from Blount through the first three games, and should emerge as the lead back moving forward. He's on the FLEX radar against the Cowboys in Week 4.
report: Kerryon Johnson had 16 carries for 101 yards in Detroit's Week 3 win over the Patriots.

impact: Coming off a 101-yard breakout in Week 3, Johnson got off to a booming start in this one, shredding the Cowboys for 32 yards on the first play from scrimmage. Unfortunately his involvement dwindled after that, particularly after halftime as the rookie was limited to just three second-half touches. The Auburn alum salvaged the day for fantasy owners by punching in an eight-yard touchdown early in the fourth quarter. Despite soundly outperforming LeGarrette Blount for the second straight week, Johnson out-touched the veteran by a slim 10-7 margin while only seeing six more snaps. With Blount continuing to eat into Johnson's workload, the 21-year-old will just be a back-end RB2 for next week's home game against the Packers.
report: Kerryon Johnson delivered 55 yards and a touchdown on nine carries while converting his lone target for a one-yard gain Sunday in Detroit’s Week 4 loss to the Lions.

impact: That makes one of us. Despite starting the game with a massive run and looking explosive when he touched the ball, Johnson played just 20 snaps against the Cowboys, five fewer than Theo Riddick and just six more than LeGarrette Blount, who also was given only two fewer carries. Patricia called that workload "quite a bit of reps" while extolling the virtues of a committee. "We feel that we have a really good strong running-back group," Patricia said. "They’re all outstanding players and we’re just going to continue to try to improve them just like we are every position." His play warrants more work, but it does not sound like Johnson will be able to escape this committee anytime soon.
report: Lions coach Matt Patricia believes Kerryon Johnson is getting enough work.

impact: Johnson was injured at the end of a 24-yard run to set up Kenny Golladay's short touchdown catch.  Prior to leaving, Johnson amassed 70 yards on 12 carries and caught a pair of passes for 15 yards on two targets.  He watched LeGarrette Blount vulture two short rushing touchdowns.  Johnson was trying to walk the injury off on the sideline but eventually had to go to the locker room.
report: Kerryon Johnson exited Week 5 against the Packers with an ankle injury.

impact: Johnson had to leave after his 12th carry resulted in a 24-yard gain.  He landed awkwardly as he went out of bounds and finished the day with 85 total yards.  The Lions' bye week comes at the perfect time for Johnson to get healthy ahead of Week 7 in Miami.  Johnson remains an RB2/3 for now.
report: Kerryon Johnson (ankle) said after the Week 5 win over the Packers that he's "fine."

impact: Johnson suffered a minor ankle injury in his last game, but he had the bye week to heal up. He'll continue to split carries with LeGarrette Blount.
report: Kerryon Johnson (ankle) is practicing in full for Week 7 against the Dolphins.

impact: Johnson found the edge for 24 yards on the Lions' first play from scrimmage and never looked back. The Lions' 248 yards rushing were their most since the Barry Sanders era in 1997. Continually ripping chunk gains, Johnson's longest was a 71-yarder to begin the second quarter. Untouched through the hole, Johnson found the sideline. Johnson's YPC is now a ridiculous 6.43 through 69 carries. His 19 totes today were a new season high. LeGarrette Blount remained involved, but Johnson is forcing the Lions' hand. He's a locked-in, upside RB2.
report: Kerryon Johnson rushed 19 times for 158 yards in the Lions' Week 7 win over the Dolphins, adding two receptions for 21 additional yards.

impact: Lions will roll with rookie Kerryon Johnson, LeGarrette Blount, and Theo Riddick handling all backfield duties. It's likely to be a common theme for Abdullah unless one of the aforementioned trio gets hurt.
report: Lions declared RB Ameer Abdullah, DT A’Shawn Robinson, G Joe Dahl, OL Andrew Donnal, DE Romeo Okwara, WR Brandon Powell, and CB Dee Virgin inactive for Week 1 against the Jets.

impact: Riddick led all Lions running backs playing 40 snaps with Detroit getting annihilated on the scoreboard and playing catchup most of the night.  Riddick still did nothing with his looks despite seeing a goal-line carry, where he was predictably stonewalled.  Riddick isn't fantasy starter material outside of deep PPR leagues where he'll have some bye-week value.
report: Theo Riddick rushed four times for 20 yards and caught 5-of-7 targets for 15 yards in the Lions' Week 1 loss to the Jets.

impact: He didn’t see any chances as a ball-carrier but was targeted heavily in the passing game with the Lions playing from behind in the second half. Riddick may not sleep well tonight after dropping a third-down pass from Matthew Stafford with the Lions driving late in the fourth quarter. Stafford went right back to Riddick, who was wide-open on the following play, but his pass fell incomplete. That ended Detroit’s comeback bid with 14 seconds remaining. Though he technically plays running back, Riddick is really more of a wide receiver. He gets the Patriots at home next week.
report: Theo Riddick secured nine-of-12 targets for 47 yards Sunday in Detroit’s Week 2 loss to the 49ers.

impact: As usual, Riddick worked mostly as a pass-catcher, seeing just one carry in the loss. All five of his touches came before halftime. With Kerryon Johnson and LeGarrette Blount getting most of the backfield work for Detroit, Riddick is just a bench stash in PPR leagues. He’ll get the Packers at home in Week 5.
report: Theo Riddick gained seven yards on his lone carry while nabbing four catches for 20 yards on five targets Sunday in the Lions’ Week 4 loss to Dallas.

impact: Since the Lions were the ones with a commanding lead, Riddick wasn't needed for his normal comeback mode role as the check-down option.  Matthew Stafford attempted just 26 passes on the day.  Riddick remains a basement-level RB3 in deeper PPR leagues as the Lions head into their bye.
report: Theo Riddick rushed three times for three yards and caught 2-of-3 targets for 20 yards in the Lions' Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: It's a concern with Detroit coming off their bye. Riddick is looking questionable for Week 7 against Miami.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Riddick also sat out Wednesday, so it looks unlikely he will be ready to face the Dolphins this week. Riddick sitting would finally force the Lions to move Kerryon Johnson into a more featured role.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Riddick couldn't practice this week due to a knee injury. Kerryon Johnson should see more passing-game work in his absence.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) is out for Week 7 against the Dolphins.

impact: Riddick is week to week. It stands to reason that Kerryon Johnson will pick up most of Riddick's lost passing-game work, though Ameer Abdullah could also emergence for a few catches. Johnson is a strong RB2.
report: Lions declared RB Theo Riddick, DE Ziggy Ansah, DE Kerry Hyder, WR Brandon Powell, OG Joe Dahl, OT Andrew Donnal and CB Lenzy Pipkins inactive against the Dolphins for Week 7.

impact: Riddick hasn't seen the field since Week 5. If he misses another game Sunday, it will open up passing-down reps for lead back Kerryon Johnson.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) remained sidelined at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Riddick also sat out Wednesday's session. It appears as if Kerryon Johnson and LeGarrette Blount will once again carry the load against the Seahawks.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) did not practice Thursday.

impact: Riddick didn't practice all week and doesn't appear close to returning. Kerryon Johnson should see more involvement in the passing game with Riddick sidelined. Even with LeGarrette Blount a threat to vulture him on the goal-line, Johnson should be treated as a high-end RB2 in all fantasy formats.
report: Theo Riddick (knee) is out for Week 8 against the Seahawks.

impact: It was a Lions debut to forget for Blount, who lost seven yards on his first carry and injured his knee on his last one.  The 31-year-old played just 13 snaps, trailing both Theo Riddick and Kerryon Johnson.  Blount might score some touchdowns, but he doesn't need to be owned in most spots.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed four times for -3 yards in the Lions' Week 1 loss to the Jets.

impact: He's practicing in full. This is actually good news, as it looked like a knee injury on Monday night. Blount's Lions debut was rough even before going down, getting outsnapped by both Kerryon Johnson and Theo Riddick. He'll have an easier matchup against the 49ers in Week 2.
report: LeGarrette Blount is listed on the Week 2 injury report with a shoulder injury.

impact: Blount avoided what looked like a serious injury on Monday night. He practiced fully early in the week, but it is a small concern he was limited on Friday. After getting out-snapped by Kerryon Johnson and Theo Riddick, Blount can't be trusted in fantasy lineups even if he suits up.
report: LeGarrette Blount (shoulder) is listed as questionable for Week 2 against the 49ers.

impact: Blount practiced fully most of the week, though he got in only a limited session on Friday. Regardless, he'll be out there against the Niners on Sunday. Blount is hoping for better results after finishing with negative yardage in his Lions debut last week. He's currently in a timeshare with rookie Kerryon Johnson and pass-catcher Theo Riddick.
report: LeGarrette Blount (questionable, shoulder) is expected to play Week 2 against the 49ers.

impact: Blount came to the defense of Matthew Stafford after it appeared Lee hit him when he was already out of bounds early in the fourth quarter. The running back was flagged for unnecessary roughness and promptly tossed for shoving Lee to the ground. Blount fared better than he did in last week's opener, finishing the afternoon with 38 yards on eight carries while catching his lone target for a loss of three yards. With the Lions in catch-up mode, Blount's absence is unlikely to be felt.
report: LeGarrette Blount was ejected from the Lions' Week 2 game for shoving 49ers LB Elijah Lee.

impact: Blount had his best game of the season after getting injured in Week 1 and ejected last week. He started, but rotated with Kerryon Johnson and Theo Riddick. Blount had gameflow working in his favor with Detroit milking the clock in the second half. With Johnson breaking out for over 100 yards, Blount should see his workload scaled back in Week 4.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed 16 times for 48 yards in Week 3 against the Patriots.

impact: There wasn’t a lot of rushing work to go around on Sunday as the Lions logged just 20 carries, but it’s still baffling that Blount saw nearly the same workload as impressive rookie Kerryon Johnson. Blount has value as a short-yardage grinder but Johnson is more versatile and should be playing close to an every-down role. Known for his scoring prowess, the 31-year-old has yet to find the end zone in 2018. Blount won’t be an appealing fantasy option next week against Green Bay.
report: LeGarrette Blount managed just seven yards on 12 carries Sunday in the Lions’ Week 4 loss to the Cowboys.

impact: It's barely worth mentioning as the Lions are obviously just being cautious with their veteran. Kerryon Johnson has been far more effective than Blount this season, though it appears the two will continue to split carries. Blount will be a last-ditch flex option against the Packers in Week 5.
report: LeGarrette Blount (illness) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: He was just sick on Wednesday. He will be ready to vulture touches from Kerryon Johnson against the Packers.
report: LeGarrette Blount (illness) returned to a limited practice on Thursday.

impact: Blount was upgraded to full participation at Friday's practice after being limited by an illness earlier in the week. Detroit's backfield has been close to an even split, though rookie Kerryon Johnson has been far more effective than Blount, who has averaged a dismal 2.7 yards per carry with no touchdowns this year. The 31-year-old power back shouldn't be in any fantasy lineups this week or going forward.
report: LeGarrette Blount (illness) wasn't listed on the Lions' final injury report for Week 5 against the Packers.

impact: Blount was the ultimate vulture in this one, scoring a pair of one-yard touchdown runs in the opening quarter.  The 12 carries were Blount's second-most of the season and matched Kerryon Johnson for the team lead; Johnson later had to leave with an ankle injury.  Blount looks just about done with the tank coming close to empty, but he remains a goal-line threat as the Lions head into their bye.  Blount doesn't need to be owned in most formats outside of standard leagues.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed 12 times for 22 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: Blount was not targeted in the passing game. Blount was untouched on his two-yard touchdown run in the second quarter. Kerryon Johnson was running wild, but coach Matt Patricia insisted on continuing to feed Blount. Johnson is playing extremely well, but Blount is not going away as a fantasy troll/vulture.
report: LeGarrette Blount rushed 10 times for 50 yards and a touchdown in the Lions' Week 7 win over the Dolphins.

impact: The Lions ended Stafford's suffering with 8:15 left in the fourth quarter with the team trailing 48-17.  Stafford did not play well at all, but he didn't get a lot of help, with his offensive line whiffing on blocks, receivers dropping passes, and the running game again doing nothing.  Two of Stafford's picks went to ILB Darron Lee, and one of them was returned for a touchdown.  Stafford put together one impressive drive, marching 80 yards right down the field in 1:50 on four passes on the first drive of the third quarter, finishing it with a 24-yard touchdown to Golden Tate.  Stafford appeared to injure his left knee at one point, limping badly, and then also got the wind knocked out of him.  He missed one play.  Stafford will look to bounce back next week at the 49ers.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 27-of-46 passes for 286 yards, one touchdown, and four interceptions in the Lions' Week 1 loss to the Jets on Monday night.

impact: He injured his shin after colliding with teammate Taylor Decker in Monday night's loss to the Jets. Stafford was noticeably hobbled but kept playing until the fourth quarter when the game was out of hand. The former No. 1 pick hasn't missed a start since 2010. That streak should continue against the Niners in Week 2.
report: Matthew Stafford (shin) is practicing in full for Week 2 against the 49ers.

impact: He was sacked twice for a loss of 18 yards and also lost a fumble. For Stafford, this was a much better game than his previous outing, a four-interception nightmare against the Jets on Monday Night Football. Though the numbers don’t really reflect it, Stafford still looked a tad off, continually airmailing deep balls downfield including one to a wide-open Marvin Jones that should have gone for an easy touchdown. Stafford did throw a touchdown to Jones later in the game, finding him for a five-yard score with 8:36 remaining in the fourth quarter. Stafford added another touchdown later in the fourth on a 15-yard end-zone heave to tight end Michael Roberts. The Lions made a valiant comeback in the second half but fell just short with Stafford’s fourth-down incompletion sealing the game with 14 seconds remaining. Stafford and the Lions will try to avoid falling to 0-3 next week against New England.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 34-of-53 passes for 347 yards and three touchdowns while adding one rush for eight yards Sunday in the Lions’ Week 2 loss to the 49ers.

impact: Stafford was sharp in this one, completing 12 of his first 13 passes. He played keep-away from the Patriots with clock killing drives. Stafford made a sidearm throw to Kenny Golladay in the red-zone for his first TD before hitting a wide open Marvin Jones from 33 yards out on his second. His only blunder was an interception on the opening drive of the second half. Stafford has rebounded from his rough Week 1 to post consecutive multi-TD games. He'll get a matchup with the Cowboys in Week 4.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 27-of-36 passes for 262 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in Detroit's Week 3 win over the Patriots.

impact: Stafford was dropped three times for a loss of 21 yards. Playing in his hometown of Dallas, the former first overall pick impressed by going over the 300-yard barrier for the second time this season. Stafford made use of all his receivers but had his most success throwing to Golden Tate, who absorbed all eight of his targets for 132 yards and two touchdowns. His second score gave Detroit a one-point lead with a little over two minutes left in the fourth quarter, though the Cowboys wound up winning on a walk-off field goal by Brett Maher. Stafford and the Lions will hope to avoid falling to 1-4 when they face the Packers next week at Ford Field.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 24-of-30 passes for 307 yards and two touchdowns while adding five yards on two carries Sunday in the Lions’ Week 4 loss to Dallas.

impact: Detroit shocked Green Bay and jumped out to a big 24-0 halftime lead, so Stafford didn't have to do much of anything in the second half despite the Packers threatening a comeback before losing by eight.  Stafford threw just 11 second-half passes and watched LeGarrette Blount score a pair of short touchdowns before the break.  Kenny Golladay also had a 47-yard touchdown called back on a penalty, while Marvin Jones was unable to complete a diving catch on a 42-yard score.  The day could have been a lot bigger for Stafford.  The Lions are now on their bye week.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 14-of-26 passes for 183 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' Week 5 win over the Packers.

impact: The Dolphins' secondary erased Stafford's elite receiver trio, but he compensated in fantasy by finding TE Michael Roberts for a pair of scores. The Lions rode their running game. No pass catcher drew more than six targets or posted more than 48 yards. Having a quiet roto campaign, Stafford will be a QB2 for Week 8 against the Seahawks' still-feisty defense.
report: Matthew Stafford completed 18-of-22 passes for 217 yards and two touchdowns in the Lions' 32-21, Week 7 win over the Dolphins.

impact: The sixth-round rookie entered the evening with four grabs on the year. He was only featured because Ryan Griffin (illness) was sidelined. With Griffin's status uncertain and Will Fuller and Keke Coutee both banged up, Thomas could have Week 9 TE2 appeal against the Broncos, who have struggled up the seam.
report: TE Jordan Thomas caught 4-of-4 targets for 29 yards and two touchdowns in the Texans' Week 8 win over the Dolphins.

impact: There's been zero indication Coutee's hamstring is threatening his Week 5 availability. With Will Fuller (hamstring) appearing likely to suit up, Coutee is a low-end WR4.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) remained "limited" at Thursday's practice.

impact: He's fully expected to play after returning last week. With Will Fuller (questionable, hamstring) also looking likely to suit up, Coutee's streaming appeal takes a hit.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) is questionable for Week 5 against Dallas.

impact: Coutee impressed in his NFL debut last week but may have aggravated his hamstring injury. If he suits up this week, he'll be playing "in pain," according to NFL Network's Ian Rapoport. With Houston playing in the Sunday night game, fantasy owners relying on Coutee may want to make other arrangements.
report: Keke Coutee (questionable, hamstring) will be a game-time decision Week 5 against the Cowboys.

impact: Coutee scored Houston's only touchdown on a goal-line shovel pass. He briefly left in the second quarter to get check for a concussion after taking a huge hit, but was cleared to return. Coutee proved his blowup debut wasn't a fluke, but it's going to be hard for him to have week-to-week consistency. He'll be a WR3/FLEX for Week 6 against Buffalo.
report: Keke Coutee caught 6-of-7 passes for 51 yards and a touchdown in Week 5 against Dallas.

impact: Coutee was a game-time decision in Week 5 but ended up playing and having a strong game, pulling in six grabs for 51 yards and a touchdown in a win over Dallas. He'll be on the WR3 map for this week's tilt with Buffalo.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Coutee's hamstring may not be 100 percent, but he'll surely be out there against the Bills in Week 6. The rookie has had a phenomenal start to his career, pulling in 17 catches for 160 yards and a touchdown over his first two games. He could have some flex appeal in deeper leagues, especially with Detroit and New Orleans on bye this week.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Coutee was removed from the team's injury report despite getting in limited work throughout the week. Will Fuller (hamstring) and DeAndre Hopkins (foot) were removed, too. Although Deshaun Watson (chest) is questionable, he's fully expected to suit up and thrive with all his receivers healthy at home against the Bills.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) will play in Week 6 against the Bills.

impact: Coutee came out of the gates quickly, catching two passes in the first quarter. He had another target in that quarter which should have been a long catch-and-run touchdown, but it was thrown behind him and broken up. Unfortunately, he only caught one more pass the rest of the game as Deshaun Watson struggled. That could happen a lot next week against the Jaguars, making Coutee a risky FLEX option.
report: Keke Coutee hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 33 yards in the Texans' Week 6 win over the Bills.

impact: The Texans also limited DeAndre Hopkins (foot) and Will Fuller (hip). Coutee was a game-time decision last week but played his normal snaps. He's on track for Sunday's Jacksonville matchup.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) was limited at Wedneday's practice.

impact: Coutee was out with a hamstring issue early in the year but he's over it now. The rookie slot receiver should be a go for Sunday's game in Jacksonville.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Coutee was limited at practice this week, though his status for Sunday's game in Jacksonville was never in doubt. Even with four teams on bye, Coutee won't be of much use to fantasy owners this week in a tough matchup.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) wasn't listed on the Texans' final injury report for Week 7 against the Jaguars.

impact: Coutee has been battling hamstring problems for months and was listed as questionable on this week's injury report.  He had one catch for three yards before departing.  Coutee was ruled out to begin the second half.
report: Keke Coutee left Sunday's Week 7 game after aggravating his hamstring injury.

impact: Coutee had a setback with his hamstring Sunday. It shouldn't keep him out the three games it cost him earlier this year, but he's not going to be ready with the Texans playing on a short week. The Texans will go with Vyncint Smith in three-wide sets with Coutee out.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) doesn't expect to play in Week 8 against Miami.

impact: It was Coutee who said he's probably going to miss the Texans' short-week matchup with the Dolphins. Coutee battled hamstring woes from early August through late September, so a minor aggravation is a bullet dodged for the Texans. Vyncint Smith will re-join DeAndre Hopkins and Will Fuller in three-receiver sets in the interim.
report: NFL.com's Ian Rapoport confirms Keke Coutee's hamstring aggravation is "not considered serious," but that he's expected to miss Week 8.

impact: This was fully expected after Coutee had a Week 7 setback with his hamstring. His absence will open up more targets for Will Fuller, who's went over 100 yards in both games Coutee missed earlier this year. Vyncint Smith will replace Coutee in three-wide sets.
report: Keke Coutee (hamstring) has been ruled out for Week 8.

impact: It's the firs time Griffin has been on the injury report this season. This shouldn't impact his availability for Sunday's game. Griffin has just one catch through two weeks.
report: Texans TE Ryan Griffin (hip) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Griffin is not fantasy-relevant in an offense that doesn't feature its tight ends.
report: Ryan Griffin caught his lone target for 12 yards in the Texans' Week 4 win over the Colts.

impact: It was one of his better games of the season. Griffin should've had a touchdown, but dropped a pass thrown slightly behind him in the end-zone. The Texans rarely use their tight end, so Griffin remains off the fantasy radar.
report: Ryan Griffin caught 6-of-9 passes for 65 yards in Houston's Week 5 win over Dallas.

impact: Griffin must have picked up the injury in last week's win over Dallas, though it doesn't appear to be anything serious. The former UConn Husky saw his biggest workload of the year in that game, drawing nine targets from quarterback Deshaun Watson. Still, he's just a last-ditch TE2 in fantasy and won't be a recommended streaming option Sunday against Buffalo.
report: Ryan Griffin (toe) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Griffin tweaked his toe in Week 5 but it looks like he's going to gut it out Sunday against Buffalo. Even at a thin position, Griffin isn't of much fantasy interest.
report: Ryan Griffin (toe) remained limited at Thursday's practice.

impact: Griffin "exploded" for six catches and 65 yards against Dallas last week, but he could not build on the breakout here. It is unlikely he fares much better next week in Jacksonville.
report: Ryan Griffin did not catch any of his five targets Week 6 against the Bills.

impact: Griffin came down with an illness late in the week and won't be available for Sunday's game in Jacksonville. Tight end responsibilities will be shared between Jordan Akins and Jordan Thomas in Week 7.
report: Ryan Griffin (illness) is out for Week 7 against the Jaguars.

impact: Griffin is still battling an illness he picked up last week. This will be his second straight absence. Tight end responsibilities will fall with Jordan Akins and Jordan Thomas on Thursday Night Football.
report: Ryan Griffin (illness) is out for Week 8 against the Dolphins.

impact: For the first time in a full game, Hunt was held without a reception. The Chiefs were playing from ahead but got dominated in time of possession and kept making big plays through the air. Hunt simply was not needed on the ground. Spencer Ware was involved behind him but only to the tune of four touches. Hunt should have a bounce-back effort in Week 2 against a Steelers run defense that has not been the same since Ryan Shazier went down.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 16 times for 49 yards in the Chiefs' Week 1 win over the Chargers.

impact: Hunt was running with power, but he simply wasn't needed for a monster workload with Patrick Mahomes getting whatever he wanted through the air. The aggressive Mahomes has now found Hunt for just one catch through two games after Hunt averaged 3.5 receptions (throwing out a Week 17 cameo) last season. Hunt's ceiling remains sky-high in the Chiefs' high-voltage offense, but his weekly floor is going to be a little lower than it was as a rookie.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 18 times for 75 yards in the Chiefs' Week 2 win over the Steelers, adding a five-yard touchdown reception.

impact: Hunt eased the minds of worried fantasy players with two one-yard touchdown runs in the first quarter, and he buoyed his fantasy game with 22 yards on a close-out drive in the fourth. There are still reasons for concern, however. He saw just one target, did not catch that pass, and sat out the two-minute drill at the end of the first half. He now has one catch through three games. Being attached to the best offense in the league should offer plenty of scoring chances, but the lack of receiving usage gives Hunt a concerning floor moving forward.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 18 times for 44 yards and two touchdowns in the Chiefs' Week 3 win over the 49ers.

impact: Hunt added three catches for 54 yards on four targets.  In the first half, he was the focal point of the offense, as the Broncos' pass-rush and backend coverage made things difficult on Patrick Mahomes.  It's Hunt's first 100-yard rushing game of the season after six as a rookie.  Hunt was stuffed a couple times inside the five-yard line early before later cashing one in from four yards out late in the fourth quarter to cap the comeback and give the Chiefs a 26-23 lead.  Hunt will be a borderline RB1 next week at home against the stout Jaguars.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 19 times for 121 yards and one touchdown in the Chiefs' 27-23, Week 4 win over the Broncos on Monday night.

impact: He added seven yards on one catch. Hunt understandably struggled to gain consistent yardage against a tough front, but he got loose for a 24-yard gain in the third quarter -- he cost the offense 15 yards with an unsportsmanlike penalty at the end of that carry -- and sealed the game with a four-yard touchdown run on the first play of the fourth. He padded his stats with 31 yards including a 15-yard gain on a drive deep into garbage time. Hunt now has five touchdowns in his last four games. He will be a solid RB1 next week in New England.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 22 times for 87 yards and a touchdown in the Chiefs' Week 5 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Hunt lost some snaps to Spencer Ware with the Chiefs playing from behind early, but the Chiefs went back to him in the second half. He was left wide open on a third-and-short for a 67-yard TD to start the third quarter. Hunt should’ve had another touchdown but was stopped at the goal-line. After a slow start, Hunt’s been on fire over the last month, with at least 100 total yards or a touchdown in three straight games. He'll be an RB1 in Week 7 against the Bengals.
report: Kareem Hunt rushed 10 times for 80 yards and caught 5-of-6 passes for 105 yards and a touchdown in Week 6 against the Patriots.

impact: Hunt had one of the highlights of the year in this one, breaking multiple tackles and hurdling over a defender on a play that set up his first receiving touchdown. On his second, he took a red-zone dumpoff down the right sideline and extended over the pylon before going out of bounds.
