His only catch of the first half went for just four yards, and he was somehow worse in the second half. He was targeted just once in the third quarter – an errant end-zone target – and he was not heard from after that. It is possible he aggravated his groin injury in the second half, but the Bears never announced an injury. The Jets are a good matchup next week, but Robinson’s health and Mitchell Trubisky’s play are concerns moving forward.
report: Allen Robinson hauled in 1-of-5 targets for four yards in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Robinson may have aggravated his groin injury in last week's loss to New England. He never looked right on Sunday, managing just one catch for four yards. If A-Rob can't go against the Jets this week, it would open up targets for Taylor Gabriel, Trey Burton and Tarik Cohen.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) didn't practice on Wednesday.

impact: It's not looking good for Robinson to suit up against the Jets. That would enhance each of Taylor Gabriel, Tarik Cohen and Trey Burton's outlooks. It's possible Robinson comes down to a game-time decision but hopefully the Bears make his status clear on Friday.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) remained sidelined on Thursday.

impact: Both Robinson and Khalil Mack (ankle) are expected to go through warmups Sunday morning to determine their final statuses. Both returned to practice Friday, making them true question marks for Week 8's matchup against the Jets. If Robinson is unable to play, Josh Bellamy would receive more run on the outside with Taylor Gabriel and slot wideout Anthony Miller seeing an increase in targets against New York's hobbled secondary.
report: Allen Robinson (groin) is questionable for Week 8 against the Jets.

impact: His total rushing yards were nice, but Zeke ultimately fell victim to OC Scott Linehan's mundane early-down rushing scheme behind an offensive line missing C Travis Frederick in the middle. He handled 15 of Dallas' 17 backfield carries, though, reassuring his bell-cow status. Zeke will have to overcome loaded boxes with all the touches he's bound to receive if he's going to finish as a top-three back.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed for 69 yards and one score on 15 carries while adding three catches for 17 yards on four targets in the Cowboys’ Week 1 loss to the Panthers.

impact: Elliott had a quiet night before scoring a six-yard fourth quarter touchdown. He was the Cowboys entire offense aside from a 64-yard Tavon Austin touchdown on the third play of the night. Despite playing behind an offensive line missing Travis Frederick, Elliott has managed 80 total yards and a touchdown in both games to start the year. He'll remain a locked-in top-five option for Week 3 against Seattle.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 17 times for 78 yards and a touchdown and caught 5-of-6 passes for nine yards in the Cowboys' Week 2 win over the Giants on Sunday night.

impact: After opening the year with a pair of so-so games, Elliott played legitimately well on Sunday, particularly in the second half when he broke loose for 76 yards on only seven carries. Zeke’s longest gain came on a 26-yard burst in the fourth quarter, though Bradley McDougald spoiled it by stripping him at the end of his run, resulting in a turnover. Elliott has averaged 16 carries per game this year, which is well below the 24.2 he averaged last season. We’ll see what the 23-year-old can cobble up next week against the Lions.
report: Ezekiel Elliott totaled 127 yards on 16 carries while securing three-of-eight targets for 11 yards Sunday in the Cowboys’ Week 3 loss to the Seahawks.

impact: Zeke's 240 yards from scrimmage—140 of which came after halftime—set a career-high. Elliott was, for large stretches of the afternoon, the Cowboys' only source of offense. The third-year back got to stepping with a 38-yard touchdown off a screen pass late in the second quarter. He rumbled to a 41-yard run, his longest of the game, in the third quarter. Elliott made arguably his biggest contribution when he hauled in a 34-yard deep bomb from Dak Prescott, putting the Cowboys in field-goal range with under two minutes left in the fourth quarter. The Cowboys' offensive line has mostly struggled this year, but they went all out for Zeke in Week 4. Elliott, who currently leads the NFL with 426 rushing yards, will look to stay hot when he faces the Texans next week on Sunday Night Football.
report: Ezekiel Elliott exploded for 152 yards on 25 carries while also contributing four catches for a team-high 88 yards and a touchdown Sunday in Dallas’ Week 4 win over the Lions.

impact: Elliott has been spotted limping around the field sporadically over the last two weeks, and Garrett confirmed he has a minor ankle sprain and bursitis in his knee. Zeke has played 89% of Dallas' 2018 offensive snaps. Garrett did state the Cowboys are "optimistic" Elliott will play in Week 5 against the Texans.  In the meantime, Rod Smith should be added in all fantasy leagues.
report: Cowboys coach Jason Garrett revealed Monday that Ezekiel Elliott is playing through knee and ankle injuries.

impact: Coach Jason Garrett revealed Monday Elliott is playing through knee and ankle injuries after the running back was spotted limping around the field against the Lions. It always seemed like much ado about nothing. Even so, adding Rod Smith makes some sense for those with Elliott on their roster.
report: Jerry Jones expects Ezekiel Elliott (knee, ankle) to play Week 5 against the Texans.

impact: Elliott is practicing in full.  The NFL's leading rusher is a locked-in RB1.
report: Ezekiel Elliott (ankle, knee) said he's "good" for Week 5 against the Texans.

impact: Elliott couldn't get anything going against a tough Texans front-seven. The entire Cowboys offense was stuck in reverse and couldn't sustain drives with Dak Prescott throwing two interceptions. Elliott took a helmet to the knee in overtime and didn’t look fully healthy. He's likely going to miss practice time this week.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rushed 20 times for 54 yards and caught seven passes for 30 yards in the Cowboys' Week 5 loss to the Texans.

impact: Coming off a brutal outing against Houston in Week 5 (54 yards on 21 carries), Zeke was much better Sunday, shredding the Jags for 61 rushing yards in the second half. Elliott tallied his fourth touchdown of the year on a 15-yard scamper early in the fourth quarter. The Cowboys' offense isn't what it was a few years ago but Elliott has remained productive, leading the NFL with 586 rushing yards through six games. Even with his clunker against the Texans, Zeke has still cleared 100 yards rushing in three of his last four contests. He'll look to make it four out of five when he takes on the Redskins in Week 7.
report: Ezekiel Elliott rumbled to 106 yards and a touchdown on 24 carries while gaining 11 yards on his lone catch Sunday in Dallas’ Week 6 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Washington's defense kept Elliott bottled at the line of scrimmage, permitting just 2.2 YPC. He was in position to score on the goal line late in the fourth quarter, but Dak Prescott kept the ball and scampered over the middle and crossed the plain himself instead. Although his six targets were encouraging, it's the second straight week Zeke has been held under 12 yards receiving, and already the fourth time he's failed to reach that mark this season. His on-field usage and involvement remains that of a true bell-cow, though, keeping him as a weekly top-five option despite porous results in Dallas' passing game. The Cowboys are on bye in Week 8.
report: Ezekiel Elliott handled 15 carries for 34 yards, tacking on two catches for the nine yards in the Cowboys' Week 7 loss to the Redskins.

impact: We knew Allen would be more involved following Kenneth Dixon's knee injury, but the extent was surprising. Allen received the Ravens' first goal-line touch over Alex Collins, converting a one-yard attempt midway through the second quarter. FOX's Troy Aikman matter of factly referred to Allen as the Ravens' goal-line back. Collins failed on an attempt of his own later in the period. Collins was the more impressive player, showing far more wiggle and tackle-breaking ability. Collins is still the player to own. Allen should not be an RB4 consideration against the Broncos in Week 3.
report: Javorius Allen rushed six times for eight yards and a touchdown in the Ravens' Week 2 loss to the Bengals, adding five receptions for 36 additional yards.

impact: Allen continues to struggle to produce positive yardage -- he now has 32 yards on 16 carries this season -- but he also continues to find the end zone. His first score came on a 12-yard pass in which he was able to get the corner and dive for the pylon, and he added a one-yard rushing touchdown in the third quarter. He is going to offer next to nothing when he fails to score, but Allen is a weekly FLEX consideration because of his red-zone role.
report: Javorius Allen rushed six times for seven yards and a touchdown and caught three passes for 19 yards and another score in the Ravens' Week 3 win over the Broncos.

impact: Allen played ahead of Alex Collins for most of the second quarter after Collins lost a goal-line fumble. He didn't have any highlights, but his workloads have been trending up. Allen will be a touchdown-dependent FLEX for Week 5 against the Browns.
report: Javorius Allen rushed 10 times for 30 yards and caught two passes for 17 yards in Week 4 against the Steelers.

impact: Allen also lost a fumble on one his six catches. He out-touched Alex Collins 14-to-13 and once again entered the game for goal line opportunities, though he failed to convert. Allen has at worst forced a committee with Collins and has a firm grasp on receiving work in the Baltimore offense. He's arguably a safer fantasy option at this stage since he is siphoning goal line snaps. Allen will enter Week 6 as an RB2/FLEX option against the Titans with a larger boost in PPR formats.
report: Javorius Allen rushed eight times for 34 yards while catching 6-of-8 targets for 44 yards in Sunday's Week 5 loss to the Browns.

impact: He out-snapped Alex Collins by 23 and won the touch battle 14-to-13 including six catches. Getting work at the goal line and in the passing game, Allen might be the safer fantasy option of the pair moving forward despite being the inferior talent. He will be a FLEX option next week against the Titans.
report: Javorius Allen played 50-of-87 snaps (57 percent) Week 5 against the Browns.

impact: Only one week after out-touching (14-13) and out-snapping (50-27) teammate Alex Collins, Allen fell victim to Baltimore's early lead and ensuing run-heavy game script. Collins inevitably out-carried Buck 19-1 on the day. In a closer game, perhaps Allen would've been used more, but his week-to-week usage is a legitimate dice roll at this point given coach Jon Harbaugh's recent statement about just "keeping Collins fresh." Allen has a higher floor (and will be needed) as the team's only pass-catching back in Week 7 against the Saints.
report: Javorius Allen rushed just one time for one yard and caught all three of his targets for 18 yards in the Ravens' Week 6 mauling of the Titans.

impact: Allen has four carries for four yards over his past two games. Alex Collins is hardly setting the world on fire, but Allen is not making a meaningful push for more work. Allen is a bottom-of-the-barrel, bye week fill-in RB3. The Ravens get the Panthers in Week 8.
report: Javorius Allen rushed three times for three yards in the Ravens' Week 7 loss to the Saints, adding three receptions for 21 additional yards.

impact: It was not the most efficient day, but Sutton showed off his talent on two 20-plus yard catches and worked as the clear No. 3 receiver. He could struggle for consistent targets behind Emmanuel Sanders and Demaryius Thomas, but Sutton offers some deep-league value already and would be a plug-and-play starter if anything happened to the top-two receivers.
report: Courtland Sutton hauled in 2-of-5 targets for 45 yards in the Broncos' Week 1 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Sutton's lowly line was due to two near-misses as he has a 14-yard touchdown called back when he stepped out of bounds as well as another potential 35-yard gain when he failed to catch a pass cleanly down the sideline. The rookie has a promising 11 targets through two games, but has managed just three receptions for 54 yards. He is only a bench stash at this juncture of the season as the Broncos head to Baltimore in Week 3.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 1-of-6 targets for nine yards in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Raiders.

impact: Both of his catches went for big gains, and one converted a third-and-long. Sutton continues to look good when he gets an opportunity, but he has now failed to top two catches in each of the first three games. He is just a bench stash.
report: Courtland Sutton hauled in 2-of-3 targets for 37 yards in the Broncos' Week 3 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Sutton's two big plays were a 42-yard grab deep down the right sideline in the first half then a lengthy defensive pass interference call to set up Phillip Lindsay's eventual one-yard touchdown run.  Sutton has arguably been better than Demaryius Thomas through four games but remains just a stash.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 3-of-6 targets for 51 yards in the Broncos' Week 4 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Sutton caught an early eight-yard touchdown and drew another end-zone target later on, only to hobble off the field with a leg injury in the second half.  Sutton's status for Week 6 against the Rams is unclear.  His injury led to more playing time for DaeSean Hamilton, who caught three balls for 44 yards.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 2-of-6 targets for 18 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 5 loss to the Jets.

impact: The injury doesn't sound like anything major. Sutton scored his first career touchdown in last week's loss to the Jets, but he's only cleared 50 receiving yards in one of his first five games. The second-round rookie is a solid dynasty stash, but he doesn't have much redraft value at the moment.
report: Courtland Sutton (ankle) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Sutton was also called for a down-field blocking penalty that cost the Broncos a potential touchdown in the fourth quarter. 41 of Sutton's yards came on an underthrown pass from Case Keenum. His 58 yards were a new season/career-high, which tells you most of what you need to know about Sutton's re-draft value as Keenum's No. 3 wideout.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 3-of-4 targets for 58 yards in the Broncos' Week 6 loss to the Rams.

impact: Sutton's touchdown came on a first quarter trick play. Emmanuel Sanders took a toss on a reverse and found a wide-open Sutton. Sanders nearly overthrew the pass, but Sutton laid out to make a spectacular catch. The rookie has now scored in 2-of-3 games. Although his limited usage is mostly keeping him off the fantasy radar, Sutton will have WR4 appeal against the Chiefs in Week 8.
report: Courtland Sutton caught 1-of-3 targets for a 28-yard touchdown in the Broncos' Week 7 win over the Cardinals.

impact: 87 yards is a respectable line in its own right, but Cooks made an impact outside of the box score, too. The speedster got behind the defense twice, drawing two deep pass interferences that allowed the Rams' offense to cross into Oakland's territory. Cooper Kupp (9-5-52-1) and Robert Woods (9-3-37) led Los Angeles' offense with nine targets each, but Cooks' ceiling remains the highest given his explosive play-making ability.
report: Brandin Cooks hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 87 yards in the Rams' Week 1 win over the Raiders.

impact: Cooks seems to be perfectly comfortable in Los Angeles. After going for 87 yards in the season opener, he was even better in this game. He probably should have had a long touchdown, but Jared Goff underthrew him, forcing him to come back to the ball and the defender. Cooks made another big play in the fourth quarter, going high for a catch to convert a third down. The Rams should have a tougher time against the Chargers next week, but Cooks will be a top-20 option all season.
report: Brandin Cooks hauled in 7-of-9 targets for 159 yards in the Rams' Week 2 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Cooks fell just one foot short of his first touchdown in a Rams uniform when he pulled in a tightly covered target across the middle. Despite not having a touchdown yet, Cooks looks very comfortable with Jared Goff and coach Sean McVay is crafting up a lot of plays to get Cooks involved. The speedster will look to find the end zone next Thursday against the Vikings as a WR2.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 7-of-8 targets for 90 yards in the Rams' Week 3 win over the Chargers.

impact: Cooks beat the absolute pants off Trae Waynes with a sparkling 47-yard touchdown grab late in the first half on a beautifully-placed deep ball by Jared Goff, who was throwing dimes all night. The 25-year-old later clowned Xavier Rhodes for a 23-yard pickup in the fourth quarter. Cooks did cough up the football in the red zone after getting laid out by Mike Hughes, though the Rams were able to fall on it. Playing on his third team in as many years, Cooks has made a seamless transition to Sean McVay’s offense, eclipsing 80 yards in each of his four contests this season. He’ll remain a rock-solid WR2 next week when the undefeated Rams visit Seattle.
report: Brandin Cooks racked up seven catches for 116 yards and a touchdown on eight targets while adding a 10-yard rush Thursday in the Rams’ Week 4 victory over Minnesota.

impact: Cooks took a scary hit to the head at the end of a catch in the two-minute drill. He was down on the field for a couple minutes before walking off on his own. He was taken straight into the locker room, and it would be a shock if he returns to this game. The catch on which he was injured was called back on a penalty -- astoundingly not for the hit -- so Cooks exited the game without recording a catch.
report: Brandin Cooks exited Week 5 against the Seahawks after taking a big helmet-to-helmet hit at the end of the second quarter.

impact: He said the same of Cooper Kupp, who is also dealing with a concussion. "They felt good today. They didn’t have any symptoms or things like that," McVay said. "We’ll go through the standard operating procedure, and if everything checks out...then we’re hopeful to get those guys this week." Neither player is out of the woods yet, but optimism is better than the alternative. Josh Reynolds will fill in if either player is forced to sit.
report: Rams coach Sean McVay is "hopeful" Brandin Cooks (concussion) will be cleared to play this week.

impact: The Rams listed him as a DNP, though he's trending in the right direction for Week 6. Cooks' concussion is more of a concern than Cooper Kupp's, but both are expected to suit up against the Broncos. Josh Reynolds is the next man up if Cooks sits.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) was cleared for Wednesday's walkthrough.

impact: As did Cooper Kupp (concussion). Per coach Sean McVay, both will be "full" on Friday if they escape Thursday's session symptom free. That would mean they will be good to go against the Broncos. It's looking good.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) practiced again on Thursday.

impact: Same goes for Cooper Kupp. Both were full participants in practice Friday and are expected to be cleared from the league's protocol on Saturday. The Rams are looking good to have their full arsenal of weapons on hand in Denver.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) is expected to play in Week 6 against the Broncos.

impact: Cooks and Kupp were both full participants in practice on Friday and were cleared Saturday morning, as expected. The Rams will have their full arsenal of weapons on hand in what projects as a sneaky shootout against the Broncos. Expect no limitations for both Kupp and Cooks.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) and Cooper Kupp (concussion) will both play in Week 6 against the Broncos.

impact: As is Cooper Kupp (concussion). After it initially looked like they might be short-handed on offense, the Rams will be full strength as they play in a blustery Denver. Inactive for the Rams are K Greg Zuerlein, DB Darious Williams, RB John Kelly, OLB Trevon Young, C Brian Allen, DT Sebastian Joseph-Day and DT Tanzel Smart.
report: Brandin Cooks (concussion) is active for Week 6 against the Broncos.

impact: Cooks caught a 44-yard pass on the Rams' third play from scrimmage and went into witness protection thereafter. The Rams' passing attack never really got in gear as it dealt with injury to Cooper Kupp and watched Todd Gurley go bonkers on the ground. Cooks should bounce back as a high-end WR2 for Week 7 against the 49ers.
report: Brandin Cooks caught 2-of-6 targets for 53 yards in the Rams' Week 6 win over the Broncos.

impact: The Rams' passing game did not have to do much in this one, but Cooks still had a good day. His best play was a 19-yard touchdown in the second quarter in which he ran a great route to get open. The offense should have more to do next week against the Packers, and Cooks will be a borderline WR1 in that good matchup.
report: Brandin Cooks hauled in 4-of-5 targets for 64 yards and a touchdown in the Rams' Week 7 win over the 49ers.

impact: Watson had an ugly first half, but salvaged his game with two late scoring drives. Both his touchdowns were on dumpoffs, with his second one not coming until the final play. Watson added a team-leading 36 rushing yards on five carries. After a shaky Week 1, Watson has 300-plus total yards in consecutive games. He'll be a top-five option for a matchup with the Colts next week.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 24-of-40 passes for 385 yards, two touchdowns, and an interception in the Texans' Week 3 loss to the Giants.

impact: Watson rushed six times for an additional 41 yards and a third touchdown.  This was a true up-and-down shootout that kind of lulled through the first half before exploding after the break.  The Texans blew a 28-10 lead and had to go to overtime for the win.  Watson's two touchdowns were three- and five-yard hookups to Will Fuller and DeAndre Hopkins, respectively, and his rushing score was a five-yard scamper to cap a 15-play drive.  Watson has now topped 300 yards passing in three-straight games ahead of a Week 5 date with the Cowboys where he'll remain a QB1.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 29-of-42 passes for 375 yards, two touchdowns, and one interceptions in the Texans' Week 4 win over the Colts.

impact: It was an uneven game from Watson, but he bounced back from a late fourth-quarter interception to rally the Texans to an overtime win.  Watson had a larger role in the running game with Alfred Blue sidelined, rushing for 40 yards on 10 carries. He took some huge hits and was stuffed on multiple goal-line runs, but managed to avoid injury. After a slow start, Watson has looked much closer to the quarterback he was in 2017. He gets a plus matchup with Buffalo in Week 6.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 33-of-44 passes for 375 yards with a touchdown and an interception in Houston's Week 5 win over Dallas.

impact: Watson took some big hits against the Cowboys on Sunday night and was clearly less than 100 percent at the end of the game. He was able to finish the win, however, and a day-to-day designation suggests he has a good shot to suit up this week. That said, it is worth noting several sportsbooks have stopped taking bets on Houston's game this week against the Bills, so perhaps there is something more going on. Brandon Weeden is Houston's backup.
report: The Houston Chronicle's Aaron Wilson reports Deshaun Watson is "day to day with a chest injury."

impact: Playing #CompetitiveAdvantage mind games, O'Brien wouldn't get into it any further, saying he'd "let the injury report speak for itself" as to where Watson's health is at.  Watson took a number of thundering hits as a runner last Sunday night against Dallas and was seen getting his chest/ribs examined on the sideline at times.  We'd guess Watson will be out there against Buffalo.
report: When asked if there's a chance Deshaun Watson (chest) would play Week 6 against the Bills, coach Bill O'Brien responded, "Oh yeah."

impact: That answer was more clear than coach Bill O'Brien's, who said he'd let the injury report tell the story.  The 2-3 Texans need wins, and Watson being on the field instead of Brandon Weeden exponentially increased their chances of earning a win.  Watson will be a lock-and-load QB1 Sunday.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) said he "for sure" expects to play Week 6 against the Bills.

impact: Watson took a beating in Sunday's win over Dallas but insists he'll be fine for Week 6. The second-year signal-caller has been an absolute stud this season, topping 300 yards passing in four straight games while also leading all quarterbacks with 201 rushing yards. He'll be a no-brainer QB1 against Buffalo.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: The Texans are just managing Watson's reps. The quarterback has expressed zero concern about his Week 6 status. He will be an elite QB1 against the Bills.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) remained "limited" in Thursday's practice.

impact: There's no doubt over Watson's status despite the questionable tag. Watson has been on fire since a shaky Week 1, throwing for over 300 yards in four straight games. He's our fifth-ranked quarterback for Sunday's matchup with Buffalo.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) is questionable for Week 6 against Buffalo.

impact: There never appeared to be much doubt about his availability, but it is still good to get some confirmation. Watson's faces an understatedly tough matchup against the Bills, but he remains a solid QB1.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Deshaun Watson (chest) is expected to play Week 6 against the Bills.

impact: There was never much doubt about his status despite a lingering chest injury. Watson is a locked-in QB1 this week. Houston declared CB Aaron Colvin (ankle), WR Vyncint Smith, ILB Brian Peters (ankle), OLB Deashon Hall, OT David Sharpe, DE Carlos Watkins, and DE Christian Covington inactive for Week 6.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) is active for Week 6 against the Bills.

impact: Watson also fumbled three times, losing one, and was sacked seven times in a game he almost certainly wants to forget. Things started out perfectly for the quarterback, who was five-for-five with 62 yards and a touchdown to start the game, but it all went downhill from there. Houston's only meaningful offense in the second half came when Will Fuller drew a defensive pass interference play in the end zone. Houston could not get convert that into a touchdown, but the defense bailed them out with a pick-six to close out the game. Watson can point to a tough matchup, but the road will not get any easier next week in Jacksonville. He will be just a borderline QB1 in that matchup.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 15-of-25 passes for 177 yards, one touchdown, and two interceptions in the Texans' Week 6 win over the Bills.

impact: Watson played at less than 100 percent last week, but it was never more than a pain-tolerance issue. He has another tough matchup with Jacksonville after Buffalo held him to one touchdown. We like Watson as a back-end QB1 for Week 7.
report: Deshaun Watson (chest) is practicing in full for Week 7.

impact: "He’s playing hurt," coach Bill O’Brien conceded after the game. Watson is believed to be dealing with lung and ribs injuries, which are why he’s been listed with a "chest" ailment on weekly injury reports. The Texans committed to their rushing attack in Sunday’s victory rather than leaning on Watson to drop back to pass against Jacksonville’s talented-if-underachieving front. Watson now has a quick turnaround in Week 8 against the Dolphins on Thursday Night Football. Due to the injuries, Watson has become an increasingly risky fantasy bet coming off consecutive sub-par box-score games.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 12-of-24 passes for 139 yards and a touchdown and rushed seven times for 13 yards in the Texans’ Week 7 win over the Jaguars.

impact: Watson added a 14-yard scramble. As you can see, Watson had more touchdowns than incompletions against a truly embarrassing Dolphins defense. Matt Burke's unit was leaving star players like DeAndre Hopkins and Will Fuller completely uncovered for touchdowns, while little-featured rookie TE Jordan Thomas was able to break free for two scores. Watson was extending plays all night with his legs. Watson and the Texans have now won five straight after opening the year 0-3. The Broncos are on tap for Week 9. A concern for Watson is Fuller's health after he left Thursday's game with a knee issue.
report: Deshaun Watson completed 16-of-20 passes for 239 yards and five touchdowns in the Texans' 42-23, Week 8 win over the Dolphins.

impact: Powell got the start for the Jets, playing the first six snaps before ceding work to Isaiah Crowell, who answered in a big way with a 10-102-2 rushing line.  The two figure to split work pretty evenly for much of the season, but Powell would seem to be the favorite anytime the Jets are chasing points.  That wasn't the case tonight with New York winning by 31.  Powell will be on the RB3/FLEX map next week in the home opener against the Dolphins.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 12 times for 60 yards and caught 1-of-2 targets for five yards in the Jets' Week 1 win over the Lions.

impact: Powell finished the game with 13 touches and 65 total yards. Isaiah Crowell also played 24 snaps and turned his 10 touches into 102 yards and two scores, although a 62-yard run buoyed those numbers. With the backfield looking like a clean split, neither Powell nor Crowell can be considered anything more than FLEX options.
report: Bilal Powell played 24-of-60 (40 percent) snaps Week 1 against the Lions.

impact: Powell was out-touched 14 to 10 by Isaiah Crowell in this one, but Powell's superior versatility resulted in a far superior fantasy day.  Crowell struggled as a rusher (12/35/0) and was targeted just three times in the passing game.  In a near-even timeshare, both backs will be Week 3 flex options at Cleveland.
report: Bilal Powell rushed five times for six yards, but caught 5-of-6 targets for 74 yards and a touchdown in the Jets' Week 2 loss to Miami.

impact: Powell failed to corral his lone target in the passing game. Powell managed to out-rush Isaiah Crowell 73-34 on two fewer carries, though Crowell converted a pair of goal-line looks for scores. There just isn't much separation here right now. Powell will be the preferred play against the Jaguars' daunting defense in Week 4 as the Jets look to counteract the Jags' pass rush with short throws.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 14 times for 73 yards in the Jets' Week 3 loss to the Browns.

impact: A fourth-round rookie, Hamilton got rolled into on a return. It did not look good.
report: Broncos PR DaeSean Hamilton was forced from Thursday's game against the Cardinals with a knee injury and will not return.

impact: He suffered the injury in last Thursday night's win over Arizona.  Hamilton is Denver's No. 4 wideout behind Emmanuel Sanders, Demaryius Thomas, and Courtland Sutton.  Tim Patrick will move up the depth chart.
report: Broncos rookie WR DaeSean Hamilton has a sprained MCL.

impact: Powell continued to start over Isaiah Crowell and finished with more touches. The Jets abandoned the run early, so there wasn't much of a chance for him to get going on the ground. Powell's pass-game role has made him more matchup-proof than Crowell through the first month of the season. He's a low-end FLEX for Week 5's matchup with the Broncos.
report: Bilal Powell rushed eight times for 26 yards and caught 4-of-7 passes for 26 yards in Week 4 against the Jaguars.

impact: He out-touched Isaiah Crowell 20 to 16, although Crowell had a monster day with 231 yards from scrimmage and a touchdown.  The Jets remain committed to a near-even backfield committee.  Powell will be a decent RB2/flex option when Gang Green draws a plus matchup at home versus Indianapolis next.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 20 times for 99 yards in the Jets' Week 5 win over Denver.

impact: Powell out-touched Isaiah Crowell 16 to 15 in what remains a near-even backfield, although Powell had multiple chunk-yardage gains negated by penalties. Powell does have double-digit touches in 6-of-6 games.  He will be a low-end flex option when the Jets host the Vikings next.
report: Bilal Powell rushed 16 times for 59 yards and missed his lone target in the Jets' Week 6 win over the Colts.

impact: Powell left early in the second quarter.  Before exiting, he managed 20 yards on five carries and caught his lone target for a five-yard gain.  With Powell out, it'll be all Isaiah Crowell and Trenton Cannon in the backfield.
report: Bilal Powell exited Week 7 against the Vikings with a neck injury and will not return.

impact: Powell was injured in the first half of last week's loss to the Vikings.  In his absence, rookie RB Trenton Cannon led the Jets in receiving with 69 yards on four catches.  It'll be Isaiah Crowell carrying the mail on early downs this week in Chicago, with Cannon operating as the change-of-pace.  With the Jets as heavy 'dogs, Cannon is worth a speculative add in deeper leagues.
report: Jets placed RB Bilal Powell on injured reserve with a neck injury.

impact: It looked like Sanders would be Case Keenum’s favorite target during the preseason, and that is exactly what happened in Week 1. Sanders was involved early, but he really made his presence known on a 43-yard, catch-and-run touchdown in the second quarter. He finished the first half with 115 yards and that score on seven catches. He was quieter after the break, but he still consistently got open. With the Raiders up next, Sanders will be a clear top-20 receiver in Week 2.
report: Emmanuel Sanders hauled in 10-of-11 targets for 135 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 1 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Sanders wasn't even targeted in the first half as Oakland played keep away, but still almost hit the century mark in yardage after the break. Sanders now has 231 yards receiving yards through two weeks compared to 81 yards for Demaryius Thomas. Sanders will be a WR2 option in Week 2 when the Raiders head to Baltimore.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 4-of-4 targets for 96 yards in Sunday's Week 2 win over the Raiders.

impact: Sanders struggled to get much going through the air, but he saved his fantasy day with a 35-yard touchdown on an end around in the first quarter. Despite the down receiving day, he still led the team in targets and tied for the team lead in catches. He should bounce back next week against the Chiefs.
report: Emmanuel Sanders hauled in 5-of-8 targets for 38 yards and rushed once for a 35-yard touchdown in the Broncos' Week 3 loss to the Ravens.

impact: Sanders made a huge catch on 4th-and-11 on the final drive with the Broncos trailing by four points, but the offense later stalled and ran out of time.  Sanders also had an 18-yard carry on an end-around.  Case Keenum hasn't been getting the job done of late, putting Sanders on the WR3 map next week for a road date with the Jets.  Sanders, however, has been Denver's best wideout.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 5-of-7 targets for 45 yards in the Broncos' Week 4 loss to the Chiefs.

impact: Coach Todd Bowles said Powell's career is in jeopardy. An impending free agent, it's going to be hard for 30-year-old Powell to find a team willing to clear him. The Jets are moving forward with rookie Trenton Cannon as their pass-down back until Elijah McGuire is ready, possibly as soon as next week.
report: Bilal Powell (neck, IR) will undergo season-ending surgery.

impact: It comes one day after Bowles said Powell's career was in jeopardy. Powell has the same injury Quincy Enunwa had in 2017. It's the best-possible news for the versatile, soon-to-be 30-year-old back. Powell is headed to free agency. Despite the "full recovery" declaration, his health figures to complicate his standing on the open market.
report: Speaking Thursday, Jets coach Todd Bowles said Bilal Powell (neck surgery) is expected to make a "full recovery."

impact: Sanders set season highs in catches and yards in a game where the Broncos were forced to abandon the running game after falling behind.  Sanders also saw his first red-zone target of the season.  In a Week 6 matchup with the Rams, Sanders' outlook will be improved by the game's shootout potential.  Sanders has earned every-week WR3 treatment but will be a legit WR2 against Los Angeles.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 9-of-14 targets for 72 yards in the Broncos' Week 5 loss to the Jets.

impact: Sanders nearly had a two-score day but got ruled down at the one-yard line on a 43-yard grab in the first quarter. Celebrating what he thought was a touchdown, Sanders was then called for taunting, pushing the Broncos back to the 16-yard line for 1st-and-goal. They had to settle for a field goal in a game they went on to lose 23-20. Sanders has come alive over the past two weeks even as Case Keenum continues to struggle, catching 16 passes for 187 yards and a touchdown. He could have a hard time staying hot in Week 7, as the Broncos will be traveling to Arizona on a short week. The Cardinals have held receiver fantasy production reasonably in check thus far.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 7-of-10 targets for 115 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 6 loss to the Rams.

impact: Sanders nearly overthrew Courtland Sutton on his wide-open touchdown throw in the first quarter, but the rookie was able to extend and make the catch. Sanders was left completely wide open on his 64-yard receiving score in the second quarter, as reserve S Rudy Ford seemed to have no idea what was going on. Sanders has now cleared 100 yards receiving in back-to-back games and 3-of-7 on the year. Case Keenum's play has often been ugly, but he has no qualms about looking Sanders' way. The Chiefs' burnable defense is on deck for a mouthwatering Week 8 matchup.
report: Emmanuel Sanders caught 6-of-7 targets for 102 yards and a touchdown in the Broncos' Week 7 win over the Cardinals, adding a 28-yard touchdown pass.

impact: Sanders tweaked his ankle late in Thursday's win at Arizona, though the veteran believes he would have re-entered the game had the score been closer. He'll have nine days to rest up before next week's game in Kansas City.
report: Broncos coach Vance Joseph said Emmanuel Sanders' ankle is "fine."

impact: Sanders has been drawing trade buzz since the offseason and with Denver approaching a rebuilding phase, it wouldn't be a surprise if the Broncos moved him at next week's trade deadline. Demaryius Thomas may also be available though Sanders has been more productive and costs less money. Whether Denver decides to trade Sanders, Chris Harris, Bradley Roby or all of the above, there's a good chance the Broncos will look much different by 4 PM ET on October 30.
report: According to Jason La Canfora of CBS Sports, "several teams" have shown trade interest in Emmanuel Sanders.

impact: With Devonta Freeman battling a knee issue, Coleman was the Falcons' primary back after the team's opening drive. It didn't amount to much on an evening where OC Steve Sarkisian neither committed to the run nor called a good passing game. If Freeman can't go for Week 2, Coleman will offer serious upside as an RB2 against the Panthers.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed nine times for 19 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 1 loss to the Eagles, adding a 26-yard reception.

impact: He caught all four of his targets for 18 additional yards.  With Devonta Freeman (knee) out, Coleman got his 20 touches, while rookie RB Ito Smith chipped in with 55 yards on 10 touches.  Coleman's bug run went for 36 yards, and he also had a 19-yarder that was very close to going to the house for a long touchdown.  Coleman was unable to convert his run inside the 10-yard line for a score, getting it down to the one before Matt Ryan scored on a sneak the next play.  With Freeman expected to miss at least another game, Coleman will be an upside RB2 next week against New Orleans.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 16 times for 107 yards in the Falcons' 31-24, Week 2 win over the Panthers.

impact: Starting for the second straight week, Coleman spent most of the afternoon running into brick walls, though he salvaged the day for fantasy owners with a late receiving touchdown. Coleman broke through for a 15-yard gain on his first touch of the second half but averaged a pathetic 1.29 yards on his other 14 carries. The 25-year-old also committed a costly mistake on the Falcons’ final drive, failing to pick up a blitz that resulted in a Matt Ryan incompletion on third down. He’ll look to redeem himself next week against Cincinnati.
report: Tevin Coleman netted just 33 yards on 15 carries while delivering two catches for 14 yards and a touchdown on three targets Sunday in the Falcons’ Week 3 loss to New Orleans.

impact: Coleman looked good when he got the touches in this game and appeared on the cusp of breaking a few long gains. Unfortunately, he ceded 10 touches to Ito Smith including what became a seven-yard touchdown on the opening drive. With Devonta Freeman looking likely to return next week, Coleman will return to the RB3/FLEX mix against the Steelers.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 14 times for 51 yards and hauled in all three of his targets for 26 yards in the Falcons' Week 4 loss to the Bengals.

impact: The injury shouldn't keep him from playing Sunday at Pittsburgh, though he'll likely see a reduced workload with Devonta Freeman (knee) due back from a month-long absence. Assuming that's the case, Coleman will revert to flex/RB3 status in fantasy leagues.
report: Tevin Coleman (shin) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: Coleman was limited to start the week but got in full practices on both Thursday and Friday. His status for Sunday's game in Pittsburgh was never in doubt. With Devonta Freeman (knee) back from a three-game absence, Coleman will just be an RB3 this week.
report: Tevin Coleman (shin) wasn't listed on the Falcons' final injury report for Week 5 against the Steelers.

impact: Devonta Freeman started and won the touch battle, but Coleman played just one fewer snap. Ito Smith was also involved as the No. 3 back. Despite the disappointing day and the Falcons' increasingly crowded backfield, Coleman will have Week 6 FLEX appeal against the Bucs' horrific defense.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed seven times for 15 yards in the Falcons' Week 5 loss to the Steelers, adding two receptions for 15 additional yards.

impact: Coleman looked like he was going to disappoint fantasy players for most of this game. He failed to create any big plays on the ground, and he lost 11 carries and a touchdown to Ito Smith. Thankfully, he saved his fantasy day with a six-yard touchdown catch in the fourth quarter. Coleman remains a starter any time Freeman sits, but Smith's involvement means he will be more of an RB2 moving forward.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 10 times for 35 yards and hauled in 1-of-2 targets for six yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 6 win over the Bucs.

impact: He added 32 yards through the air by catching both of his targets.  Coleman started the night off with a 14-yard run and ended it with a 30-yard touchdown run where he went untouched through the right side.  He lives off big plays and hasn't been making many of them this season.  But Coleman out-played Ito Smith by a wide margin, out-gaining him 82-45 on four more touches.  Coleman gets a bye and will remain an RB2 in Week 9 against the Redskins.
report: Tevin Coleman rushed 11 times for 50 yards and one touchdown in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: The move comes as Devonta Freeman spends the week rehabbing his knee tweak. Freeman is tentatively expected to be good to go for Week 2.
report: Falcons promoted RB Brian Hill from the practice squad.

impact: Fitz's status is not in doubt for Sunday's game against the 49ers. Currently well outside the top 50 in scoring, Fitz is a risky WR4 in fantasy.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (back, hamstring) returned to Cardinals practice on Thursday.

impact: Fitzgerald has played through questionable tags the last two games. He was limited in practice again this week but should be closer to fully healthy. Fitzgerald is in a rebound spot with a favorable matchup against the 49ers' banged up secondary. He's a WR3/FLEX.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (back, hamstring) is listed as questionable for Week 5 against the 49ers.

impact: This was expected despite Fitzgerald not practicing much. Fitzgerald looked close to full healthy in Week 4 and has a strong track record against the 49ers. We like Fitz as a WR3/FLEX this week.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Larry Fitzgerald (questionable, hamstring/back) will play in Week 5 against the 49ers.

impact: Fitzgerald had been questionable with back and hamstring injuries, though his status was never in much doubt. QB Sam Bradford, T Blaine Clausell, OT Korey Cunningham, DE Markus Golden, RB T.J. Logan, DT Robert Nkemdiche and OG Jeremy Vujnovich round out the Cardinals' Week 5 inactives.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (back, hamstring) is active for Week 5 against the 49ers.

impact: Fitzgerald is still a big name but he's not playing like one right now. For the first time in 15 NFL seasons, Fitzgerald will enter Week 6 without a touchdown. The Cardinals completed just 10 passes all afternoon but somehow they won anyway against the injury-depleted Niners. Fitzgerald has shown up on the injury report with hamstring and back ailments the past few weeks and is clearly operating at less than 100 percent. He'll be difficult to trust next week against his home-town Vikings.
report: Larry Fitzgerald chipped in with two catches for 35 yards on three targets Sunday in Arizona’s Week 5 win over the 49ers.

impact: This has been Fitzgerald's routine the last couple weeks. Fitzgerald's production has taken a hit playing through injuries and bad quarterback play. He's a low-end FLEX for Week 6.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring, back) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Fitzgerald will be out there against the Vikings but has not produced with either Sam Bradford or Josh Rosen this season. He's a low-upside WR4 until he puts a good fantasy game or two in the can.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring, back) returned to Cardinals practice on Thursday, getting in a limited session.

impact: Fitzgerald has been playing through injuries the last few weeks. He was never in danger of sitting Sunday, but bad quarterback play has made him just a low-end FLEX.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring, back) was removed from the Week 6 injury report.

impact: Fitzgerald's targets were up after getting held to five catches over the last two weeks.  He didn't have any red-zone chances, but it's a step in the right direction. Fitzgerald has taken a backseat to Christian Kirk since Josh Rosen took over. He's hard to trust as a FLEX for Week 7 against the Broncos.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 5-of-8 passes for 39 yards in Week 6 against the Vikings.

impact: The Cardinals limited Fitzgerald on a short week, but he was always expected to play. Fitzgerald's targets have been up, but Christian Kirk is Josh Rosen's go-to option. Fitzgerald should be avoided for a shy-away matchup with Broncos slot CB Chris Harris.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) was removed from the Week 7 injury report.

impact: Shamefully, the score was Fitzgerald's first of the season. He's been hamstrung by nagging injuries and awful quarterback play. Fitzgerald got lit up on a fourth quarter hospital ball but was thankfully able to stay in the game. With Josh Rosen playing as bad as possible this evening, Fitz won't be on the WR4 radar for Week 8 against the 49ers. Fitzgerald hasn't posted more than 40 yards since Week 1.
report: Larry Fitzgerald caught 4-of-8 targets for 40 yards and a touchdown in the Cardinals' Week 7 loss to the Broncos.

impact: It's maintenance for Fitzgerald, who rarely practices early in the week. Fitzgerald is coming off his best game of the season and should benefit from the Cardinals firing OC McCoy. He's a low-end FLEX against a bottom-ten 49ers' secondary.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) didn't practice Wednesday.

impact: Fitz will be ready to rock for new OC Byron Leftwich's debut against the 49ers. Although he's shown some signs of life the past two weeks, Fitz remains a back-end WR4.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) returned to Cardinals practice on Thursday.

impact: "The plays are still there in him," Leftwich said. "I don’t think he’s dead yet." Although it included just 79 yards, Fitzgerald did post his best two-game stretch before the Cardinals' post-Thursday Night Football mini bye. Leftwich replacing Mike McCoy is a classic "it could not get any worse" situation. Leftwich could end up reviving Fitz, but he's just a low-end WR4 for Week 8.
report: New Cardinals OC Byron Leftwich wants to get Larry Fitzgerald more involved.

impact: There was never doubt over his status. New Cardinals OC Byron Leftwich plans to get Fitzgerald more involved, but he's hard to trust as a FLEX with Josh Rosen tanking.
report: Larry Fitzgerald (hamstring) was removed from the Week 8 injury report.

impact: With Devonta Freeman (knee) out, Smith was part of the game plan behind Tevin Coleman.  Coleman essentially took Freeman's role, with Smith elevated into Coleman's normal one.  Smith's best series was one where he piled up 31 yards on back-to-back carries to set up a Matt Ryan one-yard touchdown run.  Smith added one catch for eight yards on his lone target.  He'll play the same role next week against the Saints with Freeman still likely to be out.
report: Falcons fourth-round RB Ito Smith rushed nine times for 46 yards in the Week 2 win over the Panthers.

impact: Smith was bottled up on the ground but peppered in a few nice gains on screen passes from Matt Ryan. Tevin Coleman out-touched Smith by a commanding 17-5 margin on Sunday. Assuming Devonta Freeman (knee) remains sidelined, we’d expect a similar distribution next week against the Bengals.
report: Ito Smith lost six yards on two carries while snaring three-of-four targets for 41 receiving yards Sunday in Atlanta’s Week 3 loss to the Saints.

impact: This injury shouldn't affect his availability for Week 4. Smith struggled as a ball-carrier in last week's loss to New Orleans (two carries for -6 yards), but made up for it somewhat by contributing three catches for 41 yards. He'll continue to work in a change-of-pace role behind Tevin Coleman, who has been filling in for an injured Devonta Freeman (knee).
report: Ito Smith (ribs) was limited at Wednesday's practice.

impact: He's good to go for Sunday's Saints matchup. With Devonta Freeman (knee) out at least another week, Smith will continue to see change-of-pace touches behind Tevin Coleman.
report: Ito Smith (ribs) was removed from the Week 4 injury report.

impact: He added another 13 yards on three catches. A week after touching the ball just five times, Smith took 10 touches away from Tevin Coleman including what turned into a seven-yard touchdown run on the opening drive. With Devonta Freeman looking likely to return next week, Smith should return to the No. 3 job, but he has shown well when given the opportunity. He should be rostered in all Dynasty formats.
report: Ito Smith rushed seven times for 35 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 4 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Smith added a five-yard reception. #AsExpected, Smith was third on the depth chart with Devonta Freeman (knee) back in the mix, but he still played 12 snaps by Pro Football Focus' count. Smith will be without re-draft value for however long Freeman and Tevin Coleman stay healthy, but he's a nice stash in Dynasty leagues.
report: Ito Smith rushed three times for five yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 5 loss to the Steelers.

impact: He "added" negative-one yard on two catches. Smith mostly went backward against Tampa, but he got loose on a wonderfully blocked play for a 14-yard touchdown in the second quarter. He now has three touchdowns in as many games. He will be in the FLEX conversation next week if Devonta Freeman sits.
report: Ito Smith rushed 11 times for 22 yards and a touchdown in the Falcons' Week 6 win over the Bucs.

impact: He added two catches for 29 yards on two targets and was out-touched 13-9 by Tevin Coleman, who amassed 82 yards and scored a touchdown.  Smith's biggest play was a 20-yard catch on a blitz-beater.  Smith will remain on the FLEX map as Coleman's 1B coming out of the bye in Week 9.
report: Ito Smith rushed seven times for 16 yards in the Falcons' Week 7 win over the Giants.

impact: McGuire cannot be activated until next week, but returning to practice when first eligible is a great sign for his health. With Bilal Powell's availability in question because of a neck injury, McGuire could return to a significant role behind Isaiah Crowell. He is worth a look in deep leagues.
report: Jets RB Elijah McGuire (foot, injured reserve) returned to practice last week.

impact: Howard was the focal point on offense, out touching Tarik Cohen (five carries, three catches) by a wide margin. He put Chicago in position to win late, but their defense couldn't hold on. Howard had a larger third-down role than last year, but still ceded pass game snaps to Cohen. He'll remain a high-floor RB2 for Week 2 against Seattle.
report: Jordan Howard had 15 carries for 82 yards and caught five passes for 25 yards in Week 1 against the Packers.

impact: Howard is averaging 19 touches per game through two weeks but has yet to find the end zone and had a long run of just seven yards Monday night.  He continues to be the clear backfield focal point over Tarik Cohen, who touched the ball just five times in this one after eight times in Week 1.  Howard will look to find pay dirt next week in a soft road date against the Cardinals.
report: Jordan Howard rushed 14 times for 35 yards and caught 3-of-4 targets for 33 yards in the Bears' Week 2 win over the Seahawks.

impact: When speaking about Howard's limited fourth quarter workload -- he received just two carries and one target in Monday's fourth quarter -- Nagy said, "I think probably a few more carries is probably the answer to that." The coach also mentioned that the Bears need to be playing with a lead for Howard to get the "typical 8-10 fourth quarter carries." Howard is already averaging 19 touches per game, but a few more carries would certainly help his fantasy value.
report: Bears coach Matt Nagy said Jordan Howard needs "probably a few more carries."

impact: Howard found little room to operate on the ground for the second straight week, but was able to get into the end zone on a 1-yard plunge for the Bears' lone touchdown of the game. After a strong 15-82 rushing line to start the season in Week 1, Howard has now carried 38 times for 96 yards the past two weeks. Howard will remain a strong volume-based fantasy Week 4 at home against the Buccaneers coming off a short week.
report: Jordan Howard rushed 24 times for 61 yards and a touchdown while catching 2-of-2 targets for 20 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Chicago led 38-3 at the half, which would usually make for terrific game script for Howard to go out and ice the rest of the game. But it was Tarik Cohen who stayed involved from kick-off to the final whistle, leading the Bears in both targets and carries. Howard failed to haul in his only target Sunday, too. The argument to start Howard has been strictly usage-based to this point as he has yet to eclipse the 100-yard mark despite averaging 16 carries per game. If Cohen continues cutting into his playing time, it will be time for owners to rethink their position on him. This timeshare will be worth monitoring when the Bears return from their bye in Week 6.
report: Jordan Howard rushed 11 times for 25 yards in the Bears' Week 4 victory over the Bucs.

impact: The Bears had easily their best day of the season on offense, but Howard was left out of the fun, rushing just 11 times for 25 yards despite what seemed like his perfect gamescript. On Monday, coach Matt Nagy made it sound like Howard's lack of involvement was game-plan specific. "He has a big-time role. But if it’s an advantage to us to go a different direction for that game or for that play or that series, we’re going to do that," Nagy said. "And Jordan is good with that. He understands it." It sounds like Howard will return to the No. 1 role against the Dolphins this week, but it might not be a coincidence the offense looked its best with Tarik Cohen as the main back. Howard's rest-of-season workload is now at least a question mark.
report: Jordan Howard said he "wasn’t frustrated" by his role Week 4 against the Bucs.

impact: Howard contributed a handful of big runs but was again out-shined by backfield-mate Tarik Cohen, who impressed with 121 yards from scrimmage. Despite assurances from coach Matt Nagy that Howard would play a bigger role in the passing game this year, he's mostly been a non-factor in that area, just as he's been throughout his career. Howard had a chance for a touchdown in the first half but coughed it up on the goal line, resulting in a turnover. With Cohen's workload on the rise, Howard is looking like a fringe RB2, which isn't what fantasy owners thought they were getting when they drafted him in August. We'll see how Chicago's backfield distribution shakes out next week against New England.
report: Jordan Howard logged 69 yards on 14 carries while failing to reel in his lone target Sunday in Chicago’s Week 6 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: He added nine yards on one catch. Howard continued to split carries with Tarik Cohen even when the game was close and struggled to find consistent success on the ground, but he helped out his fantasy backers with a two-yard touchdown in the second quarter. He appeared to have another score on the first drive of the second half, but the play was negated by an illegal formation penalty. He did surprise with a twisting catch on his only target, but Howard mostly took a backseat from that point on with the Bears trailing. He now has 14 or fewer touches in each of his last three games. Howard will be an RB3/FLEX option next week against the Jets.
report: Jordan Howard rushed 12 times for 39 yards and a touchdown in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Crowell is coming off 231 total yards and one touchdown last week against the Broncos.  Perhaps this is a bit of a rest day for the bruising back.  He was on the field at practice; he just didn't have his helmet and didn't participate.
report: Isaiah Crowell (ankle) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: This is now his second missed practice in a row, raising serious concerns about his availability against the Colts. He will need to get in at least a limited session on Friday. Bilal Powell would handle the bulk of the backfield work if Crowell is forced to sit.
report: Isaiah Crowell (ankle) did not practice Thursday.

impact: He's expected to be a game-time decision.  The good news is this an early 1 PM ET kickoff, so we'll know Crowell's status before lineups lock.  If Crowell sits, Bilal Powell will become a strong RB2 play with bankable volume.
report: Isaiah Crowell (ankle) is questionable for Week 6 against the Colts.

impact: ESPN New York's Rich Cimini expects Crowell to play through his questionable tag. Crowell got in a limited practice Friday after missing the last two days. At less than 100 percent, Crowell is going to have workload concerns if he's active. Bilal Powell is the better Week 6 play.
report: Jets coach Todd Bowles said Isaiah Crowell (questionable, ankle) will be a game-time decision for Week 6 against the Colts.

impact: ESPN's Rich Cimini reported the same on Friday. Crowell's only practice of the week was a limited session on Friday, but he is healthy enough to go in a good spot against the Colts. Coming off a breakout performance, Crowell is an upside RB2 this week.
report: ESPN's Adam Schefter reports Isaiah Crowell (ankle) is expected to play Week 6 against the Colts.

impact: Beat writers seem confident Crowell will be available for his normal workload despite hardly practicing this week due to an ankle injury.  He has logged 14 or more touches in three of the last four games.  The Jets' Week 6 inactives are CB Trumaine Johnson, CB Buster Skrine, LB Kevin Pierre-Louis, WR Charone Peake, LB Tarell Basham, DL Folorunso Fatukasi, and C Derrick Jones.
report: Isaiah Crowell is active for Week 6 against the Colts.

impact: He got out-touched by Bilal Powell 16 to 15.  Crowell seemed to be missing a step after suffering an ankle injury last week and barely practicing.  Crowell has been a boom-bust weekly performer reliant on long runs and/or short TDs.  He will remain a high-variance RB2/flex option in Week 7 against the Vikings.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed 13 times for 40 yards and caught 2-of-2 targets for 12 yards in the Jets' Week 6 win over the Colts.

impact: Crowell was listed with an ankle injury last week, so this could be a new issue for the running back.  Crowell played through whatever he was dealing with against the Colts, and we initially expect him to do the same this week.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) did not practice Wednesday.

impact: This is an improvement for Crowell, who sat out both Wednesday and Thursday last week before suiting up against the Colts. He looks on track to play against the Vikings, but he will be nothing more than a low-end RB3 in a tough matchup.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) returned to practice Thursday.

impact: The assembled media thought Crowell was practicing, but he did not do enough to earn a "limited" tag. His Week 7 status against the Vikings is genuinely uncertain. A limited day on Friday would have Crowell on track to suit up.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) was officially "DNP" on Thursday.

impact: Crowell was unable to practice Wednesday and Thursday, but followed essentially the same routine last week before eventually playing against the Colts.  Even if he does play, Crowell is a tough RB3 sell in a difficult matchup.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) is questionable for Week 7 against the Vikings.

impact: Crowell followed the same practice schedule as last week, getting in a limited session on Friday before eventually suiting up against the Colts. He'll again play through his questionable tag in a much tougher matchup against the Vikings' nightmarish front-seven. Crowell has been a boom-bust weekly performer reliant of long runs and/or short TDs, and that won't change in Week 7.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) is expected to play against the Vikings in Week 7.

impact: Crowell has been dealing with an ankle injury, but he was always expected to play after handling 15 touches in Week 6.  The Jets' Week 7 inactives are WR Quincy Enunwa, DL Folo Fatukasi, CB Derrick Jones, CB Trumaine Johnson, FS Marcus Maye, LB Kevin Pierre-Louis, and CB Buster Skrine.
report: Isaiah Crowell is active for Week 7 against the Vikings.

impact: He caught a 21-yard pass on three targets while committing a bad drop on another pass.  Crowell has been battling ankle and foot issues in recent weeks but had to carry the load in this one with Bilal Powell leaving early in the first half with a neck injury.  Crowell gets the Bears on the road in Week 8.  Assuming he's healthy for it, Crowell will be a tough sell as an RB2/FLEX.
report: Isaiah Crowell rushed 11 times for 29 yards in the Jets' Week 7 loss to the Vikings.

impact: It's his first full practice in three weeks. The Jets need Crowell more than ever with Bilal Powell (neck) on injured reserve. He'll be an RB2 against the Bears in Week 8.
report: Isaiah Crowell (foot) is practicing in full for Week 8 against the Bears.

impact: With Bilal Powell suffering a first-half neck injury, Cannon was elevated to Isaiah Crowell's change-of-pace.  Cannon's 73 yards led the team while his 69 yards receiving were also a team-best.  He did a bit of work on the final meaningless drive.  But if Powell remains out, Cannon could play a bigger role next week in Chicago.  He won't be a recommended fantasy play.
report: Jets rookie RB Trenton Cannon rushed two times for four yards and caught 4-of-5 targets for 69 yards in the Week 7 loss to the Vikings.

impact: Todd Gurley was dealing with cramps, so Brown got all the work in the fourth quarter. He played well and seems like he would be a reliable starter if something were to happen to Gurley. The Rams also have rookie John Kelly, who has been inactive the first two weeks.
report: Malcolm Brown rushed 12 times for 46 yards in the Rams' Week 2 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Rookie John Kelly was a healthy scratch for the third straight week meaning Malcolm Brown is the handcuff to Todd Gurley. With Gurley healthy, Brown is solely a change-of-pace back for the Rams, and he can't be started in fantasy.
report: Malcolm Brown rushed five times for 42 yards in the Rams' Week 3 win over the Chargers.

impact: Cohen had a scaled back role behind workhorse Jordan Howard. He's still Chicago's primary pass-game back, but Howard is the centerpiece of the offense and playing more third downs this season. Cohen should be treated as a low-end PPR FLEX for Week 2's matchup with Seattle.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed five times for 25 yards and caught 3-of-4 passes for 16 yards in Chicago's Week 1 loss to the Packers.

impact: Cohen exited late in the fourth quarter with an ankle injury.  The severity is unknown.  Cohen was talked up as a "Tyreek Hill" type player over the summer but has been anything but through two games, logging eight touches for 41 yards in Week 1 and the five for 25 yards in this one.  He has no business being in fantasy lineups at the moment.  Not until he shows to have a bigger role.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed four times for eight yards and caught a 17-yard pass on his lone target in the Bears' Week 2 win over the Seahawks.

impact: Cohen left Monday night's game in the fourth quarter, but Nagy said he was dancing in the locker room after the win. He should be ready to face the Cardinals in Week 3. Unfortunately, he has a disappointing 13 touches through two weeks.
report: Bears coach Matt Nagy said Tarik Cohen's ankle injury is not a concern.

impact: This was Cohen's best game of the season after he posted just 66 total yards on 14 touches through the opening two games. The downside is that Cohen is still just being used a spell-back and not a player the Bears are scheming as a large part of their offense. With Jordan Howard as a true workhorse, Cohen needs more consistent passing-game involvement to be considered a fantasy option moving forward.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed five times for 53 yards while catching all three of his targets for 15 yards in Sunday's Week 3 win over the Cardinals.

impact: This type of performance was always in Cohen's range of outcomes. What really stood out, though, was that Cohen out-touched Jordan Howard 20-11 and was involved early and often in the Bears' offensive game plan. Not only did he lead the club in targets, Cohen also led Chicago's backfield in carries, getting involved well before the offense erupted for a 38-3 lead heading into the half. It was admittedly a day where everything just went right for the Bears, led by Mitchell Trubisky's career-high six touchdown tosses. Everything seems to be clicking for Chicago heading into the team's Week 5 bye, and better days seem to be ahead for Cohen if kept involved. If you were thinking about dropping him, that's no longer an option.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed 13 times for 53 yards while corralling 7-of-8 targets for 121 yards and one touchdown in Sunday's Week 4 win over the Bucs.

impact: He saw two fewer touches than backfield-mate Jordan Howard (14-12) but out-gained him by over 50 yards. Cohen flashed his signature speed with a number of big plays including a 21-yard touchdown burst during the third quarter. He added a 50-yard catch-and-run later in the half and nearly scored a second touchdown, but it was called back on offensive pass interference. Cohen did hit a few rough patches, getting stuffed on a fourth-and-one opportunity and also losing a fumble in Bears territory late in the second half. After playing second fiddle early in the year, Cohen has pulled even with Howard in Chicago's backfield pecking order. Look for their timeshare to continue next week against New England.
report: Tarik Cohen contributed 31 yards and a touchdown on five carries while adding seven catches for 90 yards on nine targets Sunday in the Bears’ Week 6 loss to the Dolphins.

impact: Following a disappointing start to the season, Cohen has established himself as a big part of Chicago’s offense, and that continued in this one. Cohen finished the first half with just one fewer touch than Jordan Howard, although that total was boosted by two catches with less than 10 seconds left in the half, and dominated work after the break. He started strong in the second half, catching a six-yard touchdown on the opening drive, and he added six more catches to his total after halftime. He now has at least seven catches in each of his last three games. He will be a great PPR option and an RB3/FLEX in standard formats next week against the Jets.
report: Tarik Cohen rushed six times for 14 yards and hauled in 8-of-12 targets for 69 yards and a touchdown in the Bears' Week 7 loss to the Patriots.

impact: Kelly was the star of the Rams' preseason as a sixth-round rookie.  The Rams routinely only had two running backs active on game days last season.  Malcolm Brown is Todd Gurley's backup.  Barron has an ankle injury.
report: Rams declared RB John Kelly, QB Brandon Allen, ILB Mark Barron, RB Justin Davis, LB Trevon Young, DL Sebastian Joseph-Day, and DL Tanzel Smart inactive for Week 1 against the Raiders.

impact: It is the second healthy scratch in a row for the rookie. Malcolm Brown looks like the handcuff to roster behind Todd Gurley.
report: Rams declared RB John Kelly inactive for Week 2 against the Cardinals.

impact: This is the third healthy scratch in a row for the rookie who is behind Malcolm Brown as Todd Gurley's handcuff. The rest of the Rams inactives are LB Mark Barron, K Greg Zuerlein, OL Brian Allen, DT Sebastian Joseph-Day, DT Tanzel Smart, and OLB Trevon Young. Zuerlein is expected to be out "at least a few weeks."
report: Rams declared RB John Kelly inactive for Week 3 against the Chargers.

impact: Flacco carried his strong preseason into Week 1. He threw all his touchdowns in the first three quarters before getting rested in a blowout. Flacco has had an Alex Smith fire lit under him after the Ravens drafted Lamar Jackson and looks primed for a rebound with an improved supporting cast. He'll get the Bengals on Thursday Night Football in Week 2.
report: Joe Flacco completed 25-of-34 passes for 236 yards and three touchdowns in Baltimore's Week 1 game against Buffalo.

impact: Flacco also lost a fumble that essentially sealed the game in the fourth quarter. Utterly failing to feel the pressure as he rolled out to the sideline, Flacco got thunderously tomahawked from behind as he attempted to wind up for a bomb. It's the kind of mistake he's made far too often in his career. His first pick was an inexcusable throw into triple coverage. The second, a lame duck he tossed while getting hit. The biggest positive was Flacco's connection with speedster/deep threat John Brown, whom Flacco targeted 10 times. The Ravens host the Broncos in Week 3.
report: Joe Flacco completed 32-of-55 passes for 377 yards, two touchdowns and two interceptions in the Ravens' 34-23, Week 2 loss to the Bengals.

impact: Flacco bounced back from his rough performance last Thursday night. He made a couple nice throws to John Brown down the sidelines, one of which Brown caught for a 44-yard gain in the second quarter, and consistently found Michael Crabtree when he needed a completion. With a great matchup against the Steelers up next, Flacco will be a streaming option.
report: Joe Flacco completed 25-of-40 passes for 277 yards and a touchdown in the Ravens' Week 3 win over the Broncos.

impact: Flacco hit John Brown on a 33-yard touchdown to open the game. He added a goal-line TD to Alex Collins after a Steelers first quarter turnover and connected on a number of deep shots. It's a solid rebound for Flacco after two straight middling games. Fueled by the Ravens trading up for Lamar Jackson, Flacco is on pace for 5,012 yards and a 32:8 TD/INT ratio through four weeks. Baltimore has another division game with the Browns in Week 5.
report: Joe Flacco completed 28-of-42 passes for 363 yards and two touchdowns in the Ravens' Week 4 win over the Steelers.

impact: Flacco wasn't at his best Sunday, but suffered from multiple dropped passes from his receivers in the rain. It was the first time that he failed to throw a touchdown pass since Week 12 of last season. Flacco's lone turnover came on tipped pass at the goal line in which he was targeted Nick Boyle in the end zone. Flacco will enter Week 6 as a middling QB2 option on the road against the Titans.
report: Joe Flacco completed 29-of-56 passes for 298 yards with an interception in Sunday's Week 5 loss to the Browns.

impact: Flacco wasn't needed as the Ravens took a 14-0 lead into the half and never looked back. Baltimore's defense sacked Marcus Mariota a whopping 11 times on the day, inevitably allowing Flacco to stand around and handoff to Alex Collins (19/54/2) until the final whistle. The Titans quietly boast an efficient pass rush, so an outing such as this was expected. Have no fear in turning right around and starting/streaming Flacco everywhere across all formats in Week 7 against the Saints.
report: Joe Flacco completed 25-of-37 passes for 238 yards, one touchdown, and one pick in the Ravens' big Week 6 win over the Titans.

impact: A standard day at Flacco's 2018 office. Flacco has not surpassed two scores since Week 1. Today's touchdowns went to Mark Andrews and John Brown. Flacco lost another potential score when Lamar Jackson cashed in a gadget look. Flacco continues to seem thrilled every time he is split out wide for Jackson to run a play. The Ravens are headed to Charlotte for Week 8.
report: Joe Flacco completed 23-of-39 passes for 279 yards and two touchdowns in the Ravens' 24-23, Week 7 loss to the Saints.

impact: The Rams' offense understandably started slow as no starters played at any point in the preseason. Gurley still found a way to produce, catching a 19-yard shovel pass from Jared Goff in the first quarter for his only score of the night. Los Angeles eventually fed him down the stretch, constantly putting the rock in his belly and allowing him to ice the game. With rookie John Kelly inactive, backup RB Malcolm Brown (1-5) was the only other running back to see even a single carry. It's a tremendous start for those who drafted Gurley No. 1 overall.
report: Todd Gurley rushed for 108 yards on 23 carries and hauled in 3-of-5 targets for 39 yards and one touchdown in the Rams' Week 1 win over the Raiders.

impact: Despite sitting out all of the fourth quarter due to cramps, Gurley did his fantasy backers right in the blowout win. He scored three times from short distance, and he backed up two of those scores with two-point conversions. Completely healthy -- Gurley was walking around the sidelines in the fourth and almost certainly would have reentered the game if not for the score -- Gurley will be the top overall running back option next week against the Chargers.
report: Todd Gurley rushed 19 times for 42 yards and three touchdowns and caught all three of his targets for 31 yards in the Rams' Week 2 win over the Cardinals.

impact: Gurley now has at least 19 carries in all three games. As he usually does, Gurley converted a goal line carry for his fourth touchdown of the year. With a 28-13 lead in the third quarter, Gurley was fed carries and the Chargers were unable to stop him. Through three games, Gurley is averaging 25.5 PPR points and will remain an elite RB1 against the Vikings on Thursday night.
report: Todd Gurley rushed 23 times for 105 yards and one touchdown and caught five passes for 51 yards in the Rams' Week 3 win over the Chargers.

impact: Gurley got his touchdown out of the way early, beating linebacker Anthony Barr (who was victimized on three of the Rams’ five touchdowns) on a wheel route for an eight-yard score late in the first quarter. The reigning NFL Offensive Player of the Year did more damage in the second half, breaking off a 56-yard catch-and-run on a play that probably should have been waved off (Rodger Saffold was initially called for a block in the back, but the referee inexplicably picked up his flag). Gurley poured salt in the wound with a 10-yard gallop late in the fourth quarter, getting the first down to seal the game for Los Angeles. The 24-year-old will bring a four-game touchdown streak into next week’s matchup against the Seahawks.
report: Todd Gurley delivered 83 yards on 17 carries while snagging four-of-six targets for 73 yards and a touchdown Thursday in L.A.’s Week 4 win over the Vikings.

impact: Gurley averaged just 3.5 yards per carry, but that does not matter on a day he scores three times. The first two came from two yards out, and the third was a five-yarder in the fourth quarter. Gurley almost had a fourth score, but he was ruled down at the one and then stuffed at the goal line on the next play in the second quarter. Gurley now had at least one score in every game and two three-touchdown performances in just five games. He will remain the overall RB1 next week in Denver.
report: Todd Gurley rushed 22 times for 77 yards and three touchdowns while catching 4-of-5 targets for 36 yards in the Rams' Week 5 win over the Seahawks.

impact: One week after Isaiah Crowell demolished the Broncos' crumbling run defense, Gurley wrecked it for a new career high in rushing yards. Gurley was ripping chunk gains essentially every time he touched the ball, averaging 7.42 yards per carry. For the season, Gurley's YPC now rests at 4.82, while he's scored 11 total touchdowns, putting him on pace for 29. Gurley should run all over the 49ers, who will be playing on a short week, in Week 7.
report: Todd Gurley rushed 28 times for 208 yards and a pair of touchdowns in the Rams' Week 6 win over the Broncos, adding two receptions for 17 additional yards.

impact: He scored a touchdown because that is what he does, but Gurley was mostly held in check in the first half. That changed in the third quarter when he went for nine and 18 yards on back-to-back carries, and he managed to find the end zone again from one yard out later that quarter. Following a long punt return, he ended his day and any doubt about the outcome of the game with a 12-yard touchdown catch on a screen pass in the fourth. That score gave Gurley 14 for the season and tied him with Priest Holmes for the most touchdowns through seven games in NFL history. He now has three games with three touchdowns this season and eight total the last three weeks. He will look to keep things going next week against the Packers.
report: Todd Gurley rushed 15 times for 63 yards and two touchdowns and caught 4-of-5 targets for 23 yards and another score in the Rams' Week 7 win over the 49ers.
